hebrew: בְּרֵאשִׁ֖ית בָּרָ֣א אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֵ֥ת הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וְאֵ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: b'reshiyt bara elohiym et hashamayim v'et haaretz
translation: When God began to createaOthers “In the beginning God created.” heaven and earth—

hebrew: וְהָאָ֗רֶץ הָיְתָ֥ה תֹ֙הוּ֙ וָבֹ֔הוּ וְחֹ֖שֶׁךְ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י תְה֑וֹם וְר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֔ים מְרַחֶ֖פֶת עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'haaretz hay'tah tohv vavohv v'choshekh' 'al-p'ney t'hvom v'rvcha elohiym m'rachefet 'al-p'ney hamayim
translation: the earth being unformed and void, with darkness over the surface of the deep and a wind frombOthers “the spirit of.” God sweeping over the water—

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֖ים יְהִ֣י א֑וֹר וַֽיְהִי־אֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym y'hiy vor vay'hiy-vor
translation: God said, “Let there be light”; and there was light.

hebrew: וַיַּ֧רְא אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הָא֖וֹר כִּי־ט֑וֹב וַיַּבְדֵּ֣ל אֱלֹהִ֔ים בֵּ֥ין הָא֖וֹר וּבֵ֥ין הַחֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
transliteration: vayar' elohiym et-havor kiy-tvov vayav'del elohiym beyn havor vveyn hachoshekh'
translation: God saw that the light was good, and God separated the light from the darkness.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ לָאוֹר֙ י֔וֹם וְלַחֹ֖שֶׁךְ קָ֣רָא לָ֑יְלָה וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם אֶחָֽד׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayik'ra elohiym  lavor yvom v'lachoshekh' kara lay'lah vay'hiy-'erev vay'hiy-voker yvom echad (f)
translation: God called the light Day, and the darkness He called Night. And there was evening and there was morning, a first day.cOthers “one day.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֔ים יְהִ֥י רָקִ֖יעַ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַמָּ֑יִם וִיהִ֣י מַבְדִּ֔יל בֵּ֥ין מַ֖יִם לָמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym y'hiy rakiy'a b'tvokh' hamayim viyhiy mav'diyl beyn mayim lamayim
translation: God said, “Let there be an expanse in the midst of the water, that it may separate water from water.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ אֱלֹהִים֮ אֶת־הָרָקִיעַ֒ וַיַּבְדֵּ֗ל בֵּ֤ין הַמַּ֙יִם֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ מִתַּ֣חַת לָרָקִ֔יעַ וּבֵ֣ין הַמַּ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֖ר מֵעַ֣ל לָרָקִ֑יעַ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
transliteration: vaya'as elohiym et-harakiy'a vayav'del beyn hamayim asher mitachat larakiy'a vveyn hamayim asher me'al larakiy'a vay'hiy-khen
translation: God made the expanse, and it separated the water which was below the expanse from the water which was above the expanse. And it was so.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֧א אֱלֹהִ֛ים לָֽרָקִ֖יעַ שָׁמָ֑יִם וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם שֵׁנִֽי׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayik'ra elohiym larakiy'a shamayim vay'hiy-'erev vay'hiy-voker yvom sheniy (f)
translation: God called the expanse Sky. And there was evening and there was morning, a second day.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים יִקָּו֨וּ הַמַּ֜יִם מִתַּ֤חַת הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ אֶל־מָק֣וֹם אֶחָ֔ד וְתֵרָאֶ֖ה הַיַּבָּשָׁ֑ה וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym yikavv hamayim mitachat hashamayim el-makvom echad v'teraeh hayabashah vay'hiy-khen
translation: God said, “Let the water below the sky be gathered into one area, that the dry land may appear.” And it was so.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ לַיַּבָּשָׁה֙ אֶ֔רֶץ וּלְמִקְוֵ֥ה הַמַּ֖יִם קָרָ֣א יַמִּ֑ים וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
transliteration: vayik'ra elohiym  layabashah eretz vl'mik'veh hamayim kara yamiym vayar' elohiym kiy-tvov
translation: God called the dry land Earth, and the gathering of waters He called Seas. And God saw that this was good.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים תַּֽדְשֵׁ֤א הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ דֶּ֔שֶׁא עֵ֚שֶׂב מַזְרִ֣יעַ זֶ֔רַע עֵ֣ץ פְּרִ֞י עֹ֤שֶׂה פְּרִי֙ לְמִינ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר זַרְעוֹ־ב֖וֹ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym tad'she haaretz deshe 'esev maz'riy'a zera' 'etz p'riy 'oseh p'riy l'miynvo asher zar'vo-vvo 'al-haaretz vay'hiy-khen
translation: And God said, “Let the earth sprout vegetation: seed-bearing plants, fruit trees of every kind on earth that bear fruit with the seed in it.” And it was so.

hebrew: וַתּוֹצֵ֨א הָאָ֜רֶץ דֶּ֠שֶׁא עֵ֣שֶׂב מַזְרִ֤יעַ זֶ֙רַע֙ לְמִינֵ֔הוּ וְעֵ֧ץ עֹֽשֶׂה־פְּרִ֛י אֲשֶׁ֥ר זַרְעוֹ־ב֖וֹ לְמִינֵ֑הוּ וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
transliteration: vatvotze haaretz deshe 'esev maz'riy'a zera' l'miynehv v'etz 'oseh-p'riy asher zar'vo-vvo l'miynehv vayar' elohiym kiy-tvov
translation: The earth brought forth vegetation: seed-bearing plants of every kind, and trees of every kind bearing fruit with the seed in it. And God saw that this was good.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם שְׁלִישִֽׁי׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'hiy-'erev vay'hiy-voker yvom sh'liyshiy (f)
translation: And there was evening and there was morning, a third day.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים יְהִ֤י מְאֹרֹת֙ בִּרְקִ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם לְהַבְדִּ֕יל בֵּ֥ין הַיּ֖וֹם וּבֵ֣ין הַלָּ֑יְלָה וְהָי֤וּ לְאֹתֹת֙ וּלְמ֣וֹעֲדִ֔ים וּלְיָמִ֖ים וְשָׁנִֽים׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym y'hiy m'orot bir'kiy'a hashamayim l'hav'diyl beyn hayvom vveyn halay'lah v'hayv l'otot vl'mvo'adiym vl'yamiym v'shaniym
translation: God said, “Let there be lights in the expanse of the sky to separate day from night; they shall serve as signs for the set times—the days and the years;

hebrew: וְהָי֤וּ לִמְאוֹרֹת֙ בִּרְקִ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם לְהָאִ֖יר עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'hayv lim'vorot bir'kiy'a hashamayim l'haiyr 'al-haaretz vay'hiy-khen
translation: and they shall serve as lights in the expanse of the sky to shine upon the earth.” And it was so.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶת־שְׁנֵ֥י הַמְּאֹרֹ֖ת הַגְּדֹלִ֑ים אֶת־הַמָּא֤וֹר הַגָּדֹל֙ לְמֶמְשֶׁ֣לֶת הַיּ֔וֹם וְאֶת־הַמָּא֤וֹר הַקָּטֹן֙ לְמֶמְשֶׁ֣לֶת הַלַּ֔יְלָה וְאֵ֖ת הַכּוֹכָבִֽים׃
transliteration: vaya'as elohiym et-sh'ney ham'orot hag'doliym et-hamavor hagadol l'mem'shelet hayvom v'et-hamavor hakaton l'mem'shelet halay'lah v'et hakvokhaviym
translation: God made the two great lights, the greater light to dominate the day and the lesser light to dominate the night, and the stars.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים בִּרְקִ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם לְהָאִ֖יר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vayiten otam elohiym bir'kiy'a hashamayim l'haiyr 'al-haaretz
translation: And God set them in the expanse of the sky to shine upon the earth,

hebrew: וְלִמְשֹׁל֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם וּבַלַּ֔יְלָה וּֽלֲהַבְדִּ֔יל בֵּ֥ין הָא֖וֹר וּבֵ֣ין הַחֹ֑שֶׁךְ וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
transliteration: v'lim'shol bayvom vvalay'lah vlahav'diyl beyn havor vveyn hachoshekh' vayar' elohiym kiy-tvov
translation: to dominate the day and the night, and to separate light from darkness. And God saw that this was good.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם רְבִיעִֽי׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'hiy-'erev vay'hiy-voker yvom r'viy'iy (f)
translation: And there was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֔ים יִשְׁרְצ֣וּ הַמַּ֔יִם שֶׁ֖רֶץ נֶ֣פֶשׁ חַיָּ֑ה וְעוֹף֙ יְעוֹפֵ֣ף עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ עַל־פְּנֵ֖י רְקִ֥יעַ הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym yish'r'tzv hamayim sheretz nefesh chayah v'vof y'vofef 'al-haaretz 'al-p'ney r'kiy'a hashamayim
translation: God said, “Let the waters bring forth swarms of living creatures, and birds that fly above the earth across the expanse of the sky.”

hebrew: וַיִּבְרָ֣א אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶת־הַתַּנִּינִ֖ם הַגְּדֹלִ֑ים וְאֵ֣ת כָּל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ הַֽחַיָּ֣ה ׀ הָֽרֹמֶ֡שֶׂת אֲשֶׁר֩ שָׁרְצ֨וּ הַמַּ֜יִם לְמִֽינֵהֶ֗ם וְאֵ֨ת כָּל־ע֤וֹף כָּנָף֙ לְמִינֵ֔הוּ וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
transliteration: vayiv'ra elohiym et-hataniynim hag'doliym v'et kal-nefesh hachayah  haromeset asher shar'tzv hamayim l'miynehem v'et kal-'vof kanaf l'miynehv vayar' elohiym kiy-tvov
translation: God created the great sea monsters, and all the living creatures of every kind that creep, which the waters brought forth in swarms, and all the winged birds of every kind. And God saw that this was good.

hebrew: וַיְבָ֧רֶךְ אֹתָ֛ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֵאמֹ֑ר פְּר֣וּ וּרְב֗וּ וּמִלְא֤וּ אֶת־הַמַּ֙יִם֙ בַּיַּמִּ֔ים וְהָע֖וֹף יִ֥רֶב בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vay'varekh' otam elohiym lemor p'rv vr'vv vmil'v et-hamayim bayamiym v'ha'vof yirev baaretz
translation: God blessed them, saying, “Be fertile and increase, fill the waters in the seas, and let the birds increase on the earth.”

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם חֲמִישִֽׁי׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'hiy-'erev vay'hiy-voker yvom chamiyshiy (f)
translation: And there was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים תּוֹצֵ֨א הָאָ֜רֶץ נֶ֤פֶשׁ חַיָּה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ בְּהֵמָ֥ה וָרֶ֛מֶשׂ וְחַֽיְתוֹ־אֶ֖רֶץ לְמִינָ֑הּ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym tvotze haaretz nefesh chayah l'miynah b'hemah varemes v'chay'tvo-eretz l'miynah vay'hiy-khen
translation: God said, “Let the earth bring forth every kind of living creature: cattle, creeping things, and wild beasts of every kind.” And it was so.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ אֱלֹהִים֩ אֶת־חַיַּ֨ת הָאָ֜רֶץ לְמִינָ֗הּ וְאֶת־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ וְאֵ֛ת כָּל־רֶ֥מֶשׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֖ה לְמִינֵ֑הוּ וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
transliteration: vaya'as elohiym et-chayat haaretz l'miynah v'et-hab'hemah l'miynah v'et kal-remes haadamah l'miynehv vayar' elohiym kiy-tvov
translation: God made wild beasts of every kind and cattle of every kind, and all kinds of creeping things of the earth. And God saw that this was good.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֔ים נַֽעֲשֶׂ֥ה אָדָ֛ם בְּצַלְמֵ֖נוּ כִּדְמוּתֵ֑נוּ וְיִרְדּוּ֩ בִדְגַ֨ת הַיָּ֜ם וּבְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם וּבַבְּהֵמָה֙ וּבְכָל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וּבְכָל־הָרֶ֖מֶשׂ הָֽרֹמֵ֥שׂ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym na'aseh adam b'tzal'menv kid'mvtenv v'yir'dv vid'gat hayam vv'vof hashamayim vvab'hemah vv'khal-haaretz vv'khal-haremes haromes 'al-haaretz
translation: And God said, “Let us make man in our image, after our likeness. They shall rule the fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, the cattle, the whole earth, and all the creeping things that creep on earth.”

hebrew: וַיִּבְרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ אֶת־הָֽאָדָם֙ בְּצַלְמ֔וֹ בְּצֶ֥לֶם אֱלֹהִ֖ים בָּרָ֣א אֹת֑וֹ זָכָ֥ר וּנְקֵבָ֖ה בָּרָ֥א אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayiv'ra elohiym  et-haadam b'tzal'mvo b'tzelem elohiym bara otvo zakhar vn'kevah bara otam
translation: And God created man in His image, in the image of God He created him; male and female He created them.

hebrew: וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹתָם֮ אֱלֹהִים֒ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לָהֶ֜ם אֱלֹהִ֗ים פְּר֥וּ וּרְב֛וּ וּמִלְא֥וּ אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְכִבְשֻׁ֑הָ וּרְד֞וּ בִּדְגַ֤ת הַיָּם֙ וּבְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּבְכָל־חַיָּ֖ה הָֽרֹמֶ֥שֶׂת עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vay'varekh' otam elohiym vayomer lahem elohiym p'rv vr'vv vmil'v et-haaretz v'khiv'shuha vr'dv bid'gat hayam vv'vof hashamayim vv'khal-chayah haromeset 'al-haaretz
translation: God blessed them and God said to them, “Be fertile and increase, fill the earth and master it; and rule the fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, and all the living things that creep on earth.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים הִנֵּה֩ נָתַ֨תִּי לָכֶ֜ם אֶת־כָּל־עֵ֣שֶׂב ׀ זֹרֵ֣עַ זֶ֗רַע אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כָל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְאֶת־כָּל־הָעֵ֛ץ אֲשֶׁר־בּ֥וֹ פְרִי־עֵ֖ץ זֹרֵ֣עַ זָ֑רַע לָכֶ֥ם יִֽהְיֶ֖ה לְאָכְלָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym hineh natatiy lakhem et-kal-'esev  zore'a zera' asher 'al-p'ney khal-haaretz v'et-kal-ha'etz asher-bvo f'riy-'etz zore'a zara' lakhem yih'yeh l'akh'lah
translation: God said, “See, I give you every seed-bearing plant that is upon all the earth, and every tree that has seed-bearing fruit; they shall be yours for food.

hebrew: וּֽלְכָל־חַיַּ֣ת הָ֠אָרֶץ וּלְכָל־ע֨וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֜יִם וּלְכֹ֣ל ׀ רוֹמֵ֣שׂ עַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־בּוֹ֙ נֶ֣פֶשׁ חַיָּ֔ה אֶת־כָּל־יֶ֥רֶק עֵ֖שֶׂב לְאָכְלָ֑ה וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
transliteration: vl'khal-chayat haaretz vl'khal-'vof hashamayim vl'khol  rvomes 'al-haaretz asher-bvo nefesh chayah et-kal-yerek 'esev l'akh'lah vay'hiy-khen
translation: And to all the animals on land, to all the birds of the sky, and to everything that creeps on earth, in which there is the breath of life, [I give] all the green plants for food.” And it was so.

hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה וְהִנֵּה־ט֖וֹב מְאֹ֑ד וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם הַשִּׁשִּֽׁי׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayar' elohiym et-kal-asher 'asah v'hineh-tvov m'od vay'hiy-'erev vay'hiy-voker yvom hashishiy (f)
translation: And God saw all that He had made, and found it very good. And there was evening and there was morning, the sixth day.

hebrew: וַיְכֻלּ֛וּ הַשָּׁמַ֥יִם וְהָאָ֖רֶץ וְכָל־צְבָאָֽם׃
transliteration: vay'khulv hashamayim v'haaretz v'khal-tz'vaam
translation: The heaven and the earth were finished, and all their array.

hebrew: וַיְכַ֤ל אֱלֹהִים֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י מְלַאכְתּ֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה וַיִּשְׁבֹּת֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י מִכָּל־מְלַאכְתּ֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
transliteration: vay'khal elohiym bayvom hash'viy'iy m'lakh'tvo asher 'asah vayish'bot bayvom hash'viy'iy mikal-m'lakh'tvo asher 'asah
translation: On the seventh day God finished the work that He had been doing, and He ceasedaOr “rested.” on the seventh day from all the work that He had done.

hebrew: וַיְבָ֤רֶךְ אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־י֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י וַיְקַדֵּ֖שׁ אֹת֑וֹ כִּ֣י ב֤וֹ שָׁבַת֙ מִכָּל־מְלַאכְתּ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁר־בָּרָ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'varekh' elohiym et-yvom hash'viy'iy vay'kadesh otvo kiy vvo shavat mikal-m'lakh'tvo asher-bara elohiym la'asvot (f)
translation: And God blessed the seventh day and declared it holy, because on it God ceased from all the work of creation that He had done.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה תוֹלְד֧וֹת הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם וְהָאָ֖רֶץ בְּהִבָּֽרְאָ֑ם בְּי֗וֹם עֲשׂ֛וֹת יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶ֥רֶץ וְשָׁמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: eleh tvol'dvot hashamayim v'haaretz b'hibar'am b'yvom 'asvot y'hvah elohiym eretz v'shamayim
translation:
Such is the story of heaven and earth when they were created.
When the LORD God made earth and heaven—

hebrew: וְכֹ֣ל ׀ שִׂ֣יחַ הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה טֶ֚רֶם יִֽהְיֶ֣ה בָאָ֔רֶץ וְכָל־עֵ֥שֶׂב הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה טֶ֣רֶם יִצְמָ֑ח כִּי֩ לֹ֨א הִמְטִ֜יר יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְאָדָ֣ם אַ֔יִן לַֽעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
transliteration: v'khol  siycha hasadeh terem yih'yeh vaaretz v'khal-'esev hasadeh terem yitz'mach kiy lo him'tiyr y'hvah elohiym 'al-haaretz v'adam ayin la'avod et-haadamah
translation: when no shrub of the field was yet on earth and no grasses of the field had yet sprouted, because the L<small>ORD</small> God had not sent rain upon the earth and there was no man to till the soil,

hebrew: וְאֵ֖ד יַֽעֲלֶ֣ה מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהִשְׁקָ֖ה אֶֽת־כָּל־פְּנֵֽי־הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
transliteration: v'ed ya'aleh min-haaretz v'hish'kah et-kal-p'ney-haadamah
translation: but a flow would well up from the ground and water the whole surface of the earth—

hebrew: וַיִּיצֶר֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֗ם עָפָר֙ מִן־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה וַיִּפַּ֥ח בְּאַפָּ֖יו נִשְׁמַ֣ת חַיִּ֑ים וַֽיְהִ֥י הָֽאָדָ֖ם לְנֶ֥פֶשׁ חַיָּֽה׃
transliteration: vayiytzer y'hvah elohiym et-haadam 'afar min-haadamah vayipach b'apayv nish'mat chayiym vay'hiy haadam l'nefesh chayah
translation: the LORD God formed manbHeb. ’adam. from the dust of the earth.cHeb. ’adamah. He blew into his nostrils the breath of life, and man became a living being.

hebrew: וַיִּטַּ֞ע יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהִ֛ים גַּן־בְעֵ֖דֶן מִקֶּ֑דֶם וַיָּ֣שֶׂם שָׁ֔ם אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָצָֽר׃
transliteration: vayita' y'hvah elohiym gan-v'eden mikedem vayasem sham et-haadam asher yatzar
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> God planted a garden in Eden, in the east, and placed there the man whom He had formed.

hebrew: וַיַּצְמַ֞ח יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ מִן־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה כָּל־עֵ֛ץ נֶחְמָ֥ד לְמַרְאֶ֖ה וְט֣וֹב לְמַאֲכָ֑ל וְעֵ֤ץ הַֽחַיִּים֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַגָּ֔ן וְעֵ֕ץ הַדַּ֖עַת ט֥וֹב וָרָֽע׃
transliteration: vayatz'mach y'hvah elohiym min-haadamah kal-'etz nech'mad l'mar'eh v'tvov l'maakhal v'etz hachayiym b'tvokh' hagan v'etz hada'at tvov vara'
translation: And from the ground the L<small>ORD</small> God caused to grow every tree that was pleasing to the sight and good for food, with the tree of life in the middle of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and bad.

hebrew: וְנָהָר֙ יֹצֵ֣א מֵעֵ֔דֶן לְהַשְׁק֖וֹת אֶת־הַגָּ֑ן וּמִשָּׁם֙ יִפָּרֵ֔ד וְהָיָ֖ה לְאַרְבָּעָ֥ה רָאשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: v'nahar yotze me'eden l'hash'kvot et-hagan vmisham yipared v'hayah l'ar'ba'ah rashiym
translation: A river issues from Eden to water the garden, and it then divides and becomes four branches.

hebrew: שֵׁ֥ם הָֽאֶחָ֖ד פִּישׁ֑וֹן ה֣וּא הַסֹּבֵ֗ב אֵ֚ת כָּל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽחֲוִילָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם הַזָּהָֽב׃
transliteration: shem haechad piyshvon hv hasovev et kal-eretz hachaviylah asher-sham hazahav
translation: The name of the first is Pishon, the one that winds through the whole land of Havilah, where the gold is.

hebrew: וּֽזֲהַ֛ב הָאָ֥רֶץ הַהִ֖וא ט֑וֹב שָׁ֥ם הַבְּדֹ֖לַח וְאֶ֥בֶן הַשֹּֽׁהַם׃
transliteration: vzahav haaretz hahiv tvov sham hab'dolach v'even hashoham
translation: (The gold of that land is good; bdellium is there, and lapis lazuli.dOthers “onyx”; meaning of Heb. shoham uncertain.)

hebrew: וְשֵֽׁם־הַנָּהָ֥ר הַשֵּׁנִ֖י גִּיח֑וֹן ה֣וּא הַסּוֹבֵ֔ב אֵ֖ת כָּל־אֶ֥רֶץ כּֽוּשׁ׃
transliteration: v'shem-hanahar hasheniy giychvon hv hasvovev et kal-eretz kvsh
translation: The name of the second river is Gihon, the one that winds through the whole land of Cush.

hebrew: וְשֵׁ֨ם הַנָּהָ֤ר הַשְּׁלִישִׁי֙ חִדֶּ֔קֶל ה֥וּא הַֽהֹלֵ֖ךְ קִדְמַ֣ת אַשּׁ֑וּר וְהַנָּהָ֥ר הָֽרְבִיעִ֖י ה֥וּא פְרָֽת׃
transliteration: v'shem hanahar hash'liyshiy chidekel hv haholekh' kid'mat ashvr v'hanahar har'viy'iy hv f'rat
translation: The name of the third river is Tigris, the one that flows east of Asshur. And the fourth river is the Euphrates.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֛ח יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיַּנִּחֵ֣הוּ בְגַן־עֵ֔דֶן לְעָבְדָ֖הּ וּלְשָׁמְרָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayikach y'hvah elohiym et-haadam vayanichehv v'gan-'eden l'av'dah vl'sham'rah
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> God took the man and placed him in the garden of Eden, to till it and tend it.

hebrew: וַיְצַו֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֔ים עַל־הָֽאָדָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר מִכֹּ֥ל עֵֽץ־הַגָּ֖ן אָכֹ֥ל תֹּאכֵֽל׃
transliteration: vay'tzav y'hvah elohiym 'al-haadam lemor mikol 'etz-hagan akhol tokhel
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> God commanded the man, saying, “Of every tree of the garden you are free to eat;

hebrew: וּמֵעֵ֗ץ הַדַּ֙עַת֙ ט֣וֹב וָרָ֔ע לֹ֥א תֹאכַ֖ל מִמֶּ֑נּוּ כִּ֗י בְּי֛וֹם אֲכָלְךָ֥ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ מ֥וֹת תָּמֽוּת׃
transliteration: vme'etz hada'at tvov vara' lo tokhal mimenv kiy b'yvom akhal'kha mimenv mvot tamvt
translation: but as for the tree of knowledge of good and bad, you must not eat of it; for as soon as you eat of it, you shall die.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֔ים לֹא־ט֛וֹב הֱי֥וֹת הָֽאָדָ֖ם לְבַדּ֑וֹ אֶֽעֱשֶׂהּ־לּ֥וֹ עֵ֖זֶר כְּנֶגְדּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elohiym lo-tvov heyvot haadam l'vadvo e'eseh-lvo 'ezer k'neg'dvo
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> God said, “It is not good for man to be alone; I will make a fitting helper for him.”

hebrew: וַיִּצֶר֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים מִן־הָֽאֲדָמָ֗ה כָּל־חַיַּ֤ת הַשָּׂדֶה֙ וְאֵת֙ כָּל־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיָּבֵא֙ אֶל־הָ֣אָדָ֔ם לִרְא֖וֹת מַה־יִּקְרָא־ל֑וֹ וְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִקְרָא־ל֧וֹ הָֽאָדָ֛ם נֶ֥פֶשׁ חַיָּ֖ה ה֥וּא שְׁמֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayitzer y'hvah elohiym min-haadamah kal-chayat hasadeh v'et kal-'vof hashamayim vayave el-haadam lir'vot mah-yik'ra-lvo v'khol asher yik'ra-lvo haadam nefesh chayah hv sh'mvo
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> God formed out of the earth all the wild beasts and all the birds of the sky, and brought them to the man to see what he would call them; and whatever the man called each living creature, that would be its name.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א הָֽאָדָ֜ם שֵׁמ֗וֹת לְכָל־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ וּלְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּלְכֹ֖ל חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וּלְאָדָ֕ם לֹֽא־מָצָ֥א עֵ֖זֶר כְּנֶגְדּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayik'ra haadam shemvot l'khal-hab'hemah vl'vof hashamayim vl'khol chayat hasadeh vl'adam lo-matza 'ezer k'neg'dvo
translation: And the man gave names to all the cattle and to the birds of the sky and to all the wild beasts; but for Adam no fitting helper was found.

hebrew: וַיַּפֵּל֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֧ים ׀ תַּרְדֵּמָ֛ה עַל־הָאָדָ֖ם וַיִּישָׁ֑ן וַיִּקַּ֗ח אַחַת֙ מִצַּלְעֹתָ֔יו וַיִּסְגֹּ֥ר בָּשָׂ֖ר תַּחְתֶּֽנָּה׃
transliteration: vayapel y'hvah elohiym  tar'demah 'al-haadam vayiyshan vayikach achat mitzal'otayv vayis'gor basar tach'tenah
translation: So the L<small>ORD</small> God cast a deep sleep upon the man; and, while he slept, He took one of his ribs and closed up the flesh at that spot.

hebrew: וַיִּבֶן֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֧ים ׀ אֶֽת־הַצֵּלָ֛ע אֲשֶׁר־לָקַ֥ח מִן־הָֽאָדָ֖ם לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיְבִאֶ֖הָ אֶל־הָֽאָדָֽם׃
transliteration: vayiven y'hvah elohiym  et-hatzela' asher-lakach min-haadam l'ishah vay'vieha el-haadam
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> God fashioned the rib that He had taken from the man into a woman; and He brought her to the man.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֮ הָֽאָדָם֒ זֹ֣את הַפַּ֗עַם עֶ֚צֶם מֵֽעֲצָמַ֔י וּבָשָׂ֖ר מִבְּשָׂרִ֑י לְזֹאת֙ יִקָּרֵ֣א אִשָּׁ֔ה כִּ֥י מֵאִ֖ישׁ לֻֽקֳחָה־זֹּֽאת׃
transliteration: vayomer haadam zot hapa'am 'etzem me'atzamay vvasar mib'sariy l'zot yikare ishah kiy meiysh lukochah-zot
translation:
Then the man said,
“This one at last
Is bone of my bones
And flesh of my flesh.
This one shall be called Woman,eHeb. ’ishshah.
For from manfHeb. ’ish. was she taken.”

hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֙ יַֽעֲזָב־אִ֔ישׁ אֶת־אָבִ֖יו וְאֶת־אִמּ֑וֹ וְדָבַ֣ק בְּאִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וְהָי֖וּ לְבָשָׂ֥ר אֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: 'al-ken ya'azav-iysh et-aviyv v'et-imvo v'davak b'ish'tvo v'hayv l'vasar echad
translation: Hence a man leaves his father and mother and clings to his wife, so that they become one flesh.

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֤וּ שְׁנֵיהֶם֙ עֲרוּמִּ֔ים הָֽאָדָ֖ם וְאִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וְלֹ֖א יִתְבֹּשָֽׁשׁוּ׃
transliteration: vayih'yv sh'neyhem 'arvmiym haadam v'ish'tvo v'lo yit'boshashv
translation:
The two of them were naked,gHeb. ‘arummim, play on ‘arum “shrewd” in 3.1. the man and
his wife, yet they felt no shame.

hebrew: וְהַנָּחָשׁ֙ הָיָ֣ה עָר֔וּם מִכֹּל֙ חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־הָ֣אִשָּׁ֔ה אַ֚ף כִּֽי־אָמַ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֔ים לֹ֣א תֹֽאכְל֔וּ מִכֹּ֖ל עֵ֥ץ הַגָּֽן׃
transliteration: v'hanachash hayah 'arvm mikol chayat hasadeh asher 'asah y'hvah elohiym vayomer el-haishah af kiy-amar elohiym lo tokh'lv mikol 'etz hagan
translation: Now the serpent was the shrewdest of all the wild beasts that the L<small>ORD</small> God had made. He said to the woman, “Did God really say: You shall not eat of any tree of the garden?”

hebrew: וַתֹּ֥אמֶר הָֽאִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־הַנָּחָ֑שׁ מִפְּרִ֥י עֵֽץ־הַגָּ֖ן נֹאכֵֽל׃
transliteration: vatomer haishah el-hanachash mip'riy 'etz-hagan nokhel
translation: The woman replied to the serpent, “We may eat of the fruit of the other trees of the garden.

hebrew: וּמִפְּרִ֣י הָעֵץ֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּתוֹךְ־הַגָּן֒ אָמַ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים לֹ֤א תֹֽאכְלוּ֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְלֹ֥א תִגְּע֖וּ בּ֑וֹ פֶּן־תְּמֻתֽוּן׃
transliteration: vmip'riy ha'etz asher b'tvokh'-hagan amar elohiym lo tokh'lv mimenv v'lo tig'v bvo pen-t'mutvn
translation: It is only about fruit of the tree in the middle of the garden that God said: ‘You shall not eat of it or touch it, lest you die.’”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַנָּחָ֖שׁ אֶל־הָֽאִשָּׁ֑ה לֹֽא־מ֖וֹת תְּמֻתֽוּן׃
transliteration: vayomer hanachash el-haishah lo-mvot t'mutvn
translation: And the serpent said to the woman, “You are not going to die,

hebrew: כִּ֚י יֹדֵ֣עַ אֱלֹהִ֔ים כִּ֗י בְּיוֹם֙ אֲכָלְכֶ֣ם מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְנִפְקְח֖וּ עֵֽינֵיכֶ֑ם וִהְיִיתֶם֙ כֵּֽאלֹהִ֔ים יֹדְעֵ֖י ט֥וֹב וָרָֽע׃
transliteration: kiy yode'a elohiym kiy b'yvom akhal'khem mimenv v'nif'k'chv 'eyneykhem vih'yiytem kelohiym yod'ey tvov vara'
translation: but God knows that as soon as you eat of it your eyes will be opened and you will be like aOthers “God, who knows.”divine beings who know-a good and bad.”

hebrew: וַתֵּ֣רֶא הָֽאִשָּׁ֡ה כִּ֣י טוֹב֩ הָעֵ֨ץ לְמַאֲכָ֜ל וְכִ֧י תַֽאֲוָה־ה֣וּא לָעֵינַ֗יִם וְנֶחְמָ֤ד הָעֵץ֙ לְהַשְׂכִּ֔יל וַתִּקַּ֥ח מִפִּרְי֖וֹ וַתֹּאכַ֑ל וַתִּתֵּ֧ן גַּם־לְאִישָׁ֛הּ עִמָּ֖הּ וַיֹּאכַֽל׃
transliteration: vatere haishah kiy tvov ha'etz l'maakhal v'khiy taavah-hv la'eynayim v'nech'mad ha'etz l'has'kiyl vatikach mipir'yvo vatokhal vatiten gam-l'iyshah 'imah vayokhal
translation: When the woman saw that the tree was good for eating and a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was desirable as a source of wisdom, she took of its fruit and ate. She also gave some to her husband, and he ate.

hebrew: וַתִּפָּקַ֙חְנָה֙ עֵינֵ֣י שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיֵּ֣דְע֔וּ כִּ֥י עֵֽירֻמִּ֖ם הֵ֑ם וַֽיִּתְפְּרוּ֙ עֲלֵ֣ה תְאֵנָ֔ה וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם חֲגֹרֹֽת׃
transliteration: vatipakach'nah 'eyney sh'neyhem vayed'v kiy 'eyrumim hem vayit'p'rv 'aleh t'enah vaya'asv lahem chagorot
translation: Then the eyes of both of them were opened and they perceived that they were naked; and they sewed together fig leaves and made themselves loincloths.

hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֞וּ אֶת־ק֨וֹל יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהִ֛ים מִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בַּגָּ֖ן לְר֣וּחַ הַיּ֑וֹם וַיִּתְחַבֵּ֨א הָֽאָדָ֜ם וְאִשְׁתּ֗וֹ מִפְּנֵי֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֔ים בְּת֖וֹךְ עֵ֥ץ הַגָּֽן׃
transliteration: vayish'm'v et-kvol y'hvah elohiym mit'halekh' bagan l'rvcha hayvom vayit'chabe haadam v'ish'tvo mip'ney y'hvah elohiym b'tvokh' 'etz hagan
translation: They heard the sound of the L<small>ORD</small> God moving about in the garden at the breezy time of day; and the man and his wife hid from the L<small>ORD</small> God among the trees of the garden.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֛א יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹ אַיֶּֽכָּה׃
transliteration: vayik'ra y'hvah elohiym el-haadam vayomer lvo ayekah
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> God called out to the man and said to him, “Where are you?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אֶת־קֹלְךָ֥ שָׁמַ֖עְתִּי בַּגָּ֑ן וָאִירָ֛א כִּֽי־עֵירֹ֥ם אָנֹ֖כִי וָאֵחָבֵֽא׃
transliteration: vayomer et-kol'kha shama'tiy bagan vaiyra kiy-'eyrom anokhiy vaechave
translation: He replied, “I heard the sound of You in the garden, and I was afraid because I was naked, so I hid.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מִ֚י הִגִּ֣יד לְךָ֔ כִּ֥י עֵירֹ֖ם אָ֑תָּה הֲמִן־הָעֵ֗ץ אֲשֶׁ֧ר צִוִּיתִ֛יךָ לְבִלְתִּ֥י אֲכָל־מִמֶּ֖נּוּ אָכָֽלְתָּ׃
transliteration: vayomer miy higiyd l'kha kiy 'eyrom atah hamin-ha'etz asher tziviytiykha l'vil'tiy akhal-mimenv akhal'ta
translation: Then He asked, “Who told you that you were naked? Did you eat of the tree from which I had forbidden you to eat?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הָֽאָדָ֑ם הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַ֣תָּה עִמָּדִ֔י הִ֛וא נָֽתְנָה־לִּ֥י מִן־הָעֵ֖ץ וָאֹכֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayomer haadam haishah asher natatah 'imadiy hiv nat'nah-liy min-ha'etz vaokhel
translation: The man said, “The woman You put at my side—she gave me of the tree, and I ate.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהִ֛ים לָאִשָּׁ֖ה מַה־זֹּ֣את עָשִׂ֑ית וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה הַנָּחָ֥שׁ הִשִּׁיאַ֖נִי וָאֹכֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elohiym laishah mah-zot 'asiyt vatomer haishah hanachash hishiyaniy vaokhel
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> God said to the woman, “What is this you have done!” The woman replied, “The serpent duped me, and I ate.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֥ים ׀ אֶֽל־הַנָּחָשׁ֮ כִּ֣י עָשִׂ֣יתָ זֹּאת֒ אָר֤וּר אַתָּה֙ מִכָּל־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה וּמִכֹּ֖ל חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה עַל־גְּחֹנְךָ֣ תֵלֵ֔ךְ וְעָפָ֥ר תֹּאכַ֖ל כָּל־יְמֵ֥י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hovah elohiym  el-hanachash kiy 'asiyta zot arvr atah mikal-hab'hemah vmikol chayat hasadeh 'al-g'chon'kha telekh' v'afar tokhal kal-y'mey chayeykha
translation:
Then the LORD God said to the serpent,
“Because you did this,
More cursed shall you be
Than all cattle
And all the wild beasts:
On your belly shall you crawl
And dirt shall you eat
All the days of your life.

hebrew: וְאֵיבָ֣ה ׀ אָשִׁ֗ית בֵּֽינְךָ֙ וּבֵ֣ין הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וּבֵ֥ין זַרְעֲךָ֖ וּבֵ֣ין זַרְעָ֑הּ ה֚וּא יְשׁוּפְךָ֣ רֹ֔אשׁ וְאַתָּ֖ה תְּשׁוּפֶ֥נּוּ עָקֵֽב׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'eyvah  ashiyt beyn'kha vveyn haishah vveyn zar'akha vveyn zar'ah hv y'shvf'kha rosh v'atah t'shvfenv 'akev (s)
translation:
I will put enmity
Between you and the woman,
And between your offspring and hers;
They shall strike at your head,
And you shall strike at their heel.”

hebrew: אֶֽל־הָאִשָּׁ֣ה אָמַ֗ר הַרְבָּ֤ה אַרְבֶּה֙ עִצְּבוֹנֵ֣ךְ וְהֵֽרֹנֵ֔ךְ בְּעֶ֖צֶב תֵּֽלְדִ֣י בָנִ֑ים וְאֶל־אִישֵׁךְ֙ תְּשׁ֣וּקָתֵ֔ךְ וְה֖וּא יִמְשָׁל־בָּֽךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: el-haishah amar har'bah ar'beh 'itz'vvonekh' v'heronekh' b'etzev tel'diy vaniym v'el-iyshekh' t'shvkatekh' v'hv yim'shal-bakh' (s)
translation:
And to the woman He said,
“I will make most severe
Your pangs in childbearing;
In pain shall you bear children.
Yet your urge shall be for your husband,
And he shall rule over you.”

hebrew: וּלְאָדָ֣ם אָמַ֗ר כִּֽי־שָׁמַעְתָּ֮ לְק֣וֹל אִשְׁתֶּךָ֒ וַתֹּ֙אכַל֙ מִן־הָעֵ֔ץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר צִוִּיתִ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֥א תֹאכַ֖ל מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אֲרוּרָ֤ה הָֽאֲדָמָה֙ בַּֽעֲבוּרֶ֔ךָ בְּעִצָּבוֹן֙ תֹּֽאכֲלֶ֔נָּה כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vl'adam amar kiy-shama'ta l'kvol ish'tekha vatokhal min-ha'etz asher tziviytiykha lemor lo tokhal mimenv arvrah haadamah ba'avvrekha b'itzavvon tokhalenah kol y'mey chayeykha
translation:
To Adam He said, “Because you did as your wife said and ate of the tree about which I commanded you, ‘You shall not eat of it,’
Cursed be the ground because of you;
By toil shall you eat of it
All the days of your life:

hebrew: וְק֥וֹץ וְדַרְדַּ֖ר תַּצְמִ֣יחַֽ לָ֑ךְ וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ אֶת־עֵ֥שֶׂב הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'kvotz v'dar'dar tatz'miycha lakh' v'akhal'ta et-'esev hasadeh
translation:
Thorns and thistles shall it sprout for you.
But your food shall be the grasses of the field;

hebrew: בְּזֵעַ֤ת אַפֶּ֙יךָ֙ תֹּ֣אכַל לֶ֔חֶם עַ֤ד שֽׁוּבְךָ֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה כִּ֥י מִמֶּ֖נָּה לֻקָּ֑חְתָּ כִּֽי־עָפָ֣ר אַ֔תָּה וְאֶל־עָפָ֖ר תָּשֽׁוּב׃
transliteration: b'ze'at apeykha tokhal lechem 'ad shvv'kha el-haadamah kiy mimenah lukach'ta kiy-'afar atah v'el-'afar tashvv
translation:
By the sweat of your brow
Shall you get bread to eat,
Until you return to the ground—
For from it you were taken.
For dust you are,
And to dust you shall return.”

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֧א הָֽאָדָ֛ם שֵׁ֥ם אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ חַוָּ֑ה כִּ֛י הִ֥וא הָֽיְתָ֖ה אֵ֥ם כָּל־חָֽי׃
transliteration: vayik'ra haadam shem ish'tvo chavah kiy hiv hay'tah em kal-chay
translation: The man named his wife Eve,bHeb. ḥawwah. because she was the mother of all the living.cHeb. ḥay.

hebrew: וַיַּעַשׂ֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים לְאָדָ֧ם וּלְאִשְׁתּ֛וֹ כָּתְנ֥וֹת ע֖וֹר וַיַּלְבִּשֵֽׁם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vaya'as y'hvah elohiym l'adam vl'ish'tvo kat'nvot 'vor vayal'bishem (f)
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> God made garments of skins for Adam and his wife, and clothed them.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֗ים הֵ֤ן הָֽאָדָם֙ הָיָה֙ כְּאַחַ֣ד מִמֶּ֔נּוּ לָדַ֖עַת ט֣וֹב וָרָ֑ע וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ פֶּן־יִשְׁלַ֣ח יָד֗וֹ וְלָקַח֙ גַּ֚ם מֵעֵ֣ץ הַֽחַיִּ֔ים וְאָכַ֖ל וָחַ֥י לְעֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer  y'hvah elohiym hen haadam hayah k'achad mimenv lada'at tvov vara' v'atah  pen-yish'lach yadvo v'lakach gam me'etz hachayiym v'akhal vachay l'olam
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> God said, “Now that the man has become like one of us, knowing good and bad, what if he should stretch out his hand and take also from the tree of life and eat, and live forever!”

hebrew: וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֛הוּ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים מִגַּן־עֵ֑דֶן לַֽעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֻקַּ֖ח מִשָּֽׁם׃
transliteration: vay'shal'chehv y'hvah elohiym migan-'eden la'avod et-haadamah asher lukach misham
translation: So the L<small>ORD</small> God banished him from the garden of Eden, to till the soil from which he was taken.

hebrew: וַיְגָ֖רֶשׁ אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיַּשְׁכֵּן֩ מִקֶּ֨דֶם לְגַן־עֵ֜דֶן אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֗ים וְאֵ֨ת לַ֤הַט הַחֶ֙רֶב֙ הַמִּתְהַפֶּ֔כֶת לִשְׁמֹ֕ר אֶת־דֶּ֖רֶךְ עֵ֥ץ הַֽחַיִּֽים׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'garesh et-haadam vayash'ken mikedem l'gan-'eden et-hak'ruviym v'et lahat hacherev hamit'hapekhet lish'mor et-derekh' 'etz hachayiym (s)
translation: He drove the man out, and stationed east of the garden of Eden the cherubim and the fiery ever-turning sword, to guard the way to the tree of life.

hebrew: וְהָ֣אָדָ֔ם יָדַ֖ע אֶת־חַוָּ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וַתַּ֙הַר֙ וַתֵּ֣לֶד אֶת־קַ֔יִן וַתֹּ֕אמֶר קָנִ֥יתִי אִ֖ישׁ אֶת־יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'haadam yada' et-chavah ish'tvo vatahar vateled et-kayin vatomer kaniytiy iysh et-y'hvah
translation: Now the man knewaHeb. yada‘, often in a sexual sense. his wife Eve, and she conceived and bore Cain, saying, “I have gainedbHeb. qanithi, connected with “Cain.” a male child with the help of the LORD.”

hebrew: וַתֹּ֣סֶף לָלֶ֔דֶת אֶת־אָחִ֖יו אֶת־הָ֑בֶל וַֽיְהִי־הֶ֙בֶל֙ רֹ֣עֵה צֹ֔אן וְקַ֕יִן הָיָ֖ה עֹבֵ֥ד אֲדָמָֽה׃
transliteration: vatosef laledet et-achiyv et-havel vay'hiy-hevel ro'eh tzon v'kayin hayah 'oved adamah
translation: She then bore his brother Abel. Abel became a keeper of sheep, and Cain became a tiller of the soil.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֖י מִקֵּ֣ץ יָמִ֑ים וַיָּבֵ֨א קַ֜יִן מִפְּרִ֧י הָֽאֲדָמָ֛ה מִנְחָ֖ה לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy miketz yamiym vayave kayin mip'riy haadamah min'chah layhvah
translation: In the course of time, Cain brought an offering to the L<small>ORD</small> from the fruit of the soil;

hebrew: וְהֶ֨בֶל הֵבִ֥יא גַם־ה֛וּא מִבְּכֹר֥וֹת צֹאנ֖וֹ וּמֵֽחֶלְבֵהֶ֑ן וַיִּ֣שַׁע יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־הֶ֖בֶל וְאֶל־מִנְחָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'hevel heviy gam-hv mib'khorvot tzonvo vmechel'vehen vayisha' y'hvah el-hevel v'el-min'chatvo
translation: and Abel, for his part, brought the choicest of the firstlings of his flock. The L<small>ORD</small> paid heed to Abel and his offering,

hebrew: וְאֶל־קַ֥יִן וְאֶל־מִנְחָת֖וֹ לֹ֣א שָׁעָ֑ה וַיִּ֤חַר לְקַ֙יִן֙ מְאֹ֔ד וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ פָּנָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'el-kayin v'el-min'chatvo lo sha'ah vayichar l'kayin m'od vayip'lv panayv
translation: but to Cain and his offering He paid no heed. Cain was much distressed and his face fell.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־קָ֑יִן לָ֚מָּה חָ֣רָה לָ֔ךְ וְלָ֖מָּה נָפְל֥וּ פָנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-kayin lamah charah lakh' v'lamah naf'lv faneykha
translation:
And the LORD said to Cain,
“Why are you distressed,
And why is your face fallen?

hebrew: הֲל֤וֹא אִם־תֵּיטִיב֙ שְׂאֵ֔ת וְאִם֙ לֹ֣א תֵיטִ֔יב לַפֶּ֖תַח חַטָּ֣את רֹבֵ֑ץ וְאֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ תְּשׁ֣וּקָת֔וֹ וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּמְשָׁל־בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: halvo im-teytiyv s'et v'im lo teytiyv lapetach chatat rovetz v'eleykha t'shvkatvo v'atah tim'shal-bvo
translation:
cMeaning of verse uncertain.Surely, if you do right,
There is uplift.
But if you do not do right
Sin couches at the door;
Its urge is toward you,
Yet you can be its master.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר קַ֖יִן אֶל־הֶ֣בֶל אָחִ֑יו וַֽיְהִי֙ בִּהְיוֹתָ֣ם בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה וַיָּ֥קָם קַ֛יִן אֶל־הֶ֥בֶל אָחִ֖יו וַיַּהַרְגֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer kayin el-hevel achiyv vay'hiy bih'yvotam basadeh vayakam kayin el-hevel achiyv vayahar'gehv
translation: Cain said to his brother AbeldAncient versions, including the Targum, read “Come, let us go out into the field.” … and when they were in the field, Cain set upon his brother Abel and killed him.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־קַ֔יִן אֵ֖י הֶ֣בֶל אָחִ֑יךָ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי הֲשֹׁמֵ֥ר אָחִ֖י אָנֹֽכִי׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-kayin ey hevel achiykha vayomer lo yada'tiy hashomer achiy anokhiy
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Cain, “Where is your brother Abel?” And he said, “I do not know. Am I my brother’s keeper?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֑יתָ ק֚וֹל דְּמֵ֣י אָחִ֔יךָ צֹעֲקִ֥ים אֵלַ֖י מִן־הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer meh 'asiyta kvol d'mey achiykha tzo'akiym elay min-haadamah
translation: Then He said, “What have you done? Hark, your brother’s blood cries out to Me from the ground!

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה אָר֣וּר אָ֑תָּה מִן־הָֽאֲדָמָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּצְתָ֣ה אֶת־פִּ֔יהָ לָקַ֛חַת אֶת־דְּמֵ֥י אָחִ֖יךָ מִיָּדֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'atah arvr atah min-haadamah asher patz'tah et-piyha lakachat et-d'mey achiykha miyadekha
translation: Therefore, you shall be more cursed than the ground,eSee 3.17. which opened its mouth to receive your brother’s blood from your hand.

hebrew: כִּ֤י תַֽעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה לֹֽא־תֹסֵ֥ף תֵּת־כֹּחָ֖הּ לָ֑ךְ נָ֥ע וָנָ֖ד תִּֽהְיֶ֥ה בָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: kiy ta'avod et-haadamah lo-tosef tet-kochah lakh' na' vanad tih'yeh vaaretz
translation: If you till the soil, it shall no longer yield its strength to you. You shall become a ceaseless wanderer on earth.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר קַ֖יִן אֶל־יְהוָ֑ה גָּד֥וֹל עֲוֺנִ֖י מִנְּשֹֽׂא׃
transliteration: vayomer kayin el-y'hvah gadvol 'avoniy min'so
translation: Cain said to the L<small>ORD</small>, “My punishment is too great to bear!

hebrew: הֵן֩ גֵּרַ֨שְׁתָּ אֹתִ֜י הַיּ֗וֹם מֵעַל֙ פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה וּמִפָּנֶ֖יךָ אֶסָּתֵ֑ר וְהָיִ֜יתִי נָ֤ע וָנָד֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ וְהָיָ֥ה כָל־מֹצְאִ֖י יַֽהַרְגֵֽנִי׃
transliteration: hen gerash'ta otiy hayvom me'al p'ney haadamah vmipaneykha esater v'hayiytiy na' vanad baaretz v'hayah khal-motz'iy yahar'geniy
translation: Since You have banished me this day from the soil, and I must avoid Your presence and become a restless wanderer on earth—anyone who meets me may kill me!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר ל֣וֹ יְהוָ֗ה לָכֵן֙ כָּל־הֹרֵ֣ג קַ֔יִן שִׁבְעָתַ֖יִם יֻקָּ֑ם וַיָּ֨שֶׂם יְהוָ֤ה לְקַ֙יִן֙ א֔וֹת לְבִלְתִּ֥י הַכּוֹת־אֹת֖וֹ כָּל־מֹצְאֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer lvo y'hvah lakhen kal-horeg kayin shiv'atayim yukam vayasem y'hvah l'kayin vot l'vil'tiy hakvot-otvo kal-motz'vo
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to him, “I promise, if anyone kills Cain, sevenfold vengeance shall be taken on him.” And the L<small>ORD</small> put a mark on Cain, lest anyone who met him should kill him.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥צֵא קַ֖יִן מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב בְּאֶֽרֶץ־נ֖וֹד קִדְמַת־עֵֽדֶן׃
transliteration: vayetze kayin milif'ney y'hvah vayeshev b'eretz-nvod kid'mat-'eden
translation: Cain left the presence of the L<small>ORD</small> and settled in the land of Nod, east of Eden.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֤דַע קַ֙יִן֙ אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַתַּ֖הַר וַתֵּ֣לֶד אֶת־חֲנ֑וֹךְ וַֽיְהִי֙ בֹּ֣נֶה עִ֔יר וַיִּקְרָא֙ שֵׁ֣ם הָעִ֔יר כְּשֵׁ֖ם בְּנ֥וֹ חֲנֽוֹךְ׃
transliteration: vayeda' kayin et-ish'tvo vatahar vateled et-chanvokh' vay'hiy boneh 'iyr vayik'ra shem ha'iyr k'shem b'nvo chanvokh'
translation: Cain knew his wife, and she conceived and bore Enoch. And he then founded a city, and named the city after his son Enoch.

hebrew: וַיִּוָּלֵ֤ד לַֽחֲנוֹךְ֙ אֶת־עִירָ֔ד וְעִירָ֕ד יָלַ֖ד אֶת־מְחֽוּיָאֵ֑ל וּמְחִיּיָאֵ֗ל יָלַד֙ אֶת־מְת֣וּשָׁאֵ֔ל וּמְתוּשָׁאֵ֖ל יָלַ֥ד אֶת־לָֽמֶךְ׃
transliteration: vayivaled lachanvokh' et-'iyrad v'iyrad yalad et-m'chvyael vm'chiyyael yalad et-m'tvshael vm'tvshael yalad et-lamekh'
translation: To Enoch was born Irad, and Irad begot Mehujael, and MehujaelfHeb. Meḥijael. begot Methusael, and Methusael begot Lamech.

hebrew: וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֥וֹ לֶ֖מֶךְ שְׁתֵּ֣י נָשִׁ֑ים שֵׁ֤ם הָֽאַחַת֙ עָדָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית צִלָּֽה׃
transliteration: vayikach-lvo lemekh' sh'tey nashiym shem haachat 'adah v'shem hasheniyt tzilah
translation: Lamech took to himself two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other was Zillah.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֥לֶד עָדָ֖ה אֶת־יָבָ֑ל ה֣וּא הָיָ֔ה אֲבִ֕י יֹשֵׁ֥ב אֹ֖הֶל וּמִקְנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vateled 'adah et-yaval hv hayah aviy yoshev ohel vmik'neh
translation: Adah bore Jabal; he was the ancestor of those who dwell in tents and amidst herds.

hebrew: וְשֵׁ֥ם אָחִ֖יו יוּבָ֑ל ה֣וּא הָיָ֔ה אֲבִ֕י כָּל־תֹּפֵ֥שׂ כִּנּ֖וֹר וְעוּגָֽב׃
transliteration: v'shem achiyv yvval hv hayah aviy kal-tofes kinvor v'vgav
translation: And the name of his brother was Jubal; he was the ancestor of all who play the lyre and the pipe.

hebrew: וְצִלָּ֣ה גַם־הִ֗וא יָֽלְדָה֙ אֶת־תּ֣וּבַל קַ֔יִן לֹטֵ֕שׁ כָּל־חֹרֵ֥שׁ נְחֹ֖שֶׁת וּבַרְזֶ֑ל וַֽאֲח֥וֹת תּֽוּבַל־קַ֖יִן נַֽעֲמָֽה׃
transliteration: v'tzilah gam-hiv yal'dah et-tvval kayin lotesh kal-choresh n'choshet vvar'zel vaachvot tvval-kayin na'amah
translation: As for Zillah, she bore Tubal-cain, who forged all implements of copper and iron. And the sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לֶ֜מֶךְ לְנָשָׁ֗יו עָדָ֤ה וְצִלָּה֙ שְׁמַ֣עַן קוֹלִ֔י נְשֵׁ֣י לֶ֔מֶךְ הַאְזֵ֖נָּה אִמְרָתִ֑י כִּ֣י אִ֤ישׁ הָרַ֙גְתִּי֙ לְפִצְעִ֔י וְיֶ֖לֶד לְחַבֻּרָתִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer lemekh' l'nashayv 'adah v'tzilah sh'ma'an kvoliy n'shey lemekh' ha'zenah im'ratiy kiy iysh harag'tiy l'fitz'iy v'yeled l'chaburatiy
translation:
And Lamech said to his wives,
“Adah and Zillah, hear my voice;
O wives of Lamech, give ear to my speech.
I have slain a man for wounding me,
And a lad for bruising me.

hebrew: כִּ֥י שִׁבְעָתַ֖יִם יֻקַּם־קָ֑יִן וְלֶ֖מֶךְ שִׁבְעִ֥ים וְשִׁבְעָֽה׃
transliteration: kiy shiv'atayim yukam-kayin v'lemekh' shiv'iym v'shiv'ah
translation:
If Cain is avenged sevenfold,
Then Lamech seventy-sevenfold.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨דַע אָדָ֥ם עוֹד֙ אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ שֵׁ֑ת כִּ֣י שָֽׁת־לִ֤י אֱלֹהִים֙ זֶ֣רַע אַחֵ֔ר תַּ֣חַת הֶ֔בֶל כִּ֥י הֲרָג֖וֹ קָֽיִן׃
transliteration: vayeda' adam 'vod et-ish'tvo vateled ben vatik'ra et-sh'mvo shet kiy shat-liy elohiym zera' acher tachat hevel kiy haragvo kayin
translation: Adam knew his wife again, and she bore a son and named him Seth, meaning, “God has gOr “established for me”; Heb. shath, connected with “Seth.”provided me with-g another offspring in place of Abel,” for Cain had killed him.

hebrew: וּלְשֵׁ֤ת גַּם־הוּא֙ יֻלַּד־בֵּ֔ן וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ אֱנ֑וֹשׁ אָ֣ז הוּחַ֔ל לִקְרֹ֖א בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vl'shet gam-hv yulad-ben vayik'ra et-sh'mvo envosh az hvchal lik'ro b'shem y'hvah (f)
translation: And to Seth, in turn, a son was born, and he named him Enosh. It was then that men began to invoke the L<small>ORD</small> by name.

hebrew: זֶ֣ה סֵ֔פֶר תּוֹלְדֹ֖ת אָדָ֑ם בְּי֗וֹם בְּרֹ֤א אֱלֹהִים֙ אָדָ֔ם בִּדְמ֥וּת אֱלֹהִ֖ים עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: zeh sefer tvol'dot adam b'yvom b'ro elohiym adam bid'mvt elohiym 'asah otvo
translation: This is the record of Adam’s line.—When God created man, He made him in the likeness of God;

hebrew: זָכָ֥ר וּנְקֵבָ֖ה בְּרָאָ֑ם וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹתָ֗ם וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֶת־שְׁמָם֙ אָדָ֔ם בְּי֖וֹם הִבָּֽרְאָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: zakhar vn'kevah b'raam vay'varekh' otam vayik'ra et-sh'mam adam b'yvom hibar'am (s)
translation: male and female He created them. And when they were created, He blessed them and called them Man.—

hebrew: וַֽיְחִ֣י אָדָ֗ם שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וּמְאַת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בִּדְמוּת֖וֹ כְּצַלְמ֑וֹ וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ שֵֽׁת׃
transliteration: vay'chiy adam sh'loshiym vm'at shanah vayvoled bid'mvtvo k'tzal'mvo vayik'ra et-sh'mvo shet
translation: When Adam had lived 130 years, he begot a son in his likeness after his image, and he named him Seth.

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֣וּ יְמֵי־אָדָ֗ם אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־שֵׁ֔ת שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵאֹ֖ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayih'yv y'mey-adam acharey hvoliydvo et-shet sh'moneh meot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot
translation: After the birth of Seth, Adam lived 800 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֞וּ כָּל־יְמֵ֤י אָדָם֙ אֲשֶׁר־חַ֔י תְּשַׁ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayih'yv kal-y'mey adam asher-chay t'sha' mevot shanah vsh'loshiym shanah vayamot (s)
translation: All the days that Adam lived came to 930 years; then he died.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־שֵׁ֕ת חָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־אֱנֽוֹשׁ׃
transliteration: vay'chiy-shet chamesh shaniym vm'at shanah vayvoled et-envosh
translation: When Seth had lived 105 years, he begot Enosh.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־שֵׁ֗ת אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־אֱנ֔וֹשׁ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֔ים וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vay'chiy-shet acharey hvoliydvo et-envosh sheva' shaniym vsh'moneh mevot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot
translation: After the birth of Enosh, Seth lived 807 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כָּל־יְמֵי־שֵׁ֔ת שְׁתֵּ֤ים עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayih'yv kal-y'mey-shet sh'teym 'es'reh shanah vt'sha' mevot shanah vayamot (s)
translation: All the days of Seth came to 912 years; then he died.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִ֥י אֱנ֖וֹשׁ תִּשְׁעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־קֵינָֽן׃
transliteration: vay'chiy envosh tish'iym shanah vayvoled et-keynan
translation: When Enosh had lived 90 years, he begot Kenan.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִ֣י אֱנ֗וֹשׁ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־קֵינָ֔ן חֲמֵ֤שׁ עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vay'chiy envosh acharey hvoliydvo et-keynan chamesh 'es'reh shanah vsh'moneh mevot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot
translation: After the birth of Kenan, Enosh lived 815 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כָּל־יְמֵ֣י אֱנ֔וֹשׁ חָמֵ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayih'yv kal-y'mey envosh chamesh shaniym vt'sha' mevot shanah vayamot (s)
translation: All the days of Enosh came to 905 years; then he died.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִ֥י קֵינָ֖ן שִׁבְעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־מַֽהֲלַלְאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vay'chiy keynan shiv'iym shanah vayvoled et-mahalal'el
translation: When Kenan had lived 70 years, he begot Mahalalel.

hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י קֵינָ֗ן אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־מַֽהֲלַלְאֵ֔ל אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vay'chiy keynan acharey hvoliydvo et-mahalal'el ar'ba'iym shanah vsh'moneh mevot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot
translation: After the birth of Mahalalel, Kenan lived 840 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כָּל־יְמֵ֣י קֵינָ֔ן עֶ֣שֶׂר שָׁנִ֔ים וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayih'yv kal-y'mey keynan 'eser shaniym vt'sha' mevot shanah vayamot (s)
translation: All the days of Kenan came to 910 years; then he died.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִ֣י מַֽהֲלַלְאֵ֔ל חָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים וְשִׁשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־יָֽרֶד׃
transliteration: vay'chiy mahalal'el chamesh shaniym v'shishiym shanah vayvoled et-yared
translation: When Mahalalel had lived 65 years, he begot Jared.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִ֣י מַֽהֲלַלְאֵ֗ל אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־יֶ֔רֶד שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vay'chiy mahalal'el acharey hvoliydvo et-yered sh'loshiym shanah vsh'moneh mevot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot
translation: After the birth of Jared, Mahalalel lived 830 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַיִּהְיוּ֙ כָּל־יְמֵ֣י מַהֲלַלְאֵ֔ל חָמֵ֤שׁ וְתִשְׁעִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayih'yv kal-y'mey mahalal'el chamesh v'tish'iym shanah vsh'moneh mevot shanah vayamot (s)
translation: All the days of Mahalalel came to 895 years; then he died.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־יֶ֕רֶד שְׁתַּ֧יִם וְשִׁשִּׁ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־חֲנֽוֹךְ׃
transliteration: vay'chiy-yered sh'tayim v'shishiym shanah vm'at shanah vayvoled et-chanvokh'
translation: When Jared had lived 162 years, he begot Enoch.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־יֶ֗רֶד אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־חֲנ֔וֹךְ שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vay'chiy-yered acharey hvoliydvo et-chanvokh' sh'moneh mevot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot
translation: After the birth of Enoch, Jared lived 800 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כָּל־יְמֵי־יֶ֔רֶד שְׁתַּ֤יִם וְשִׁשִּׁים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayih'yv kal-y'mey-yered sh'tayim v'shishiym shanah vt'sha' mevot shanah vayamot (f)
translation: All the days of Jared came to 962 years; then he died.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִ֣י חֲנ֔וֹךְ חָמֵ֥שׁ וְשִׁשִּׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־מְתוּשָֽׁלַח׃
transliteration: vay'chiy chanvokh' chamesh v'shishiym shanah vayvoled et-m'tvshalach
translation: When Enoch had lived 65 years, he begot Methuselah.

hebrew: וַיִּתְהַלֵּ֨ךְ חֲנ֜וֹךְ אֶת־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֗ים אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־מְתוּשֶׁ֔לַח שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayit'halekh' chanvokh' et-haelohiym acharey hvoliydvo et-m'tvshelach sh'losh mevot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot
translation: After the birth of Methuselah, Enoch walked with God 300 years; and he begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י כָּל־יְמֵ֣י חֲנ֑וֹךְ חָמֵ֤שׁ וְשִׁשִּׁים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kal-y'mey chanvokh' chamesh v'shishiym shanah vsh'losh mevot shanah
translation: All the days of Enoch came to 365 years.

hebrew: וַיִּתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ חֲנ֖וֹךְ אֶת־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְאֵינֶ֕נּוּ כִּֽי־לָקַ֥ח אֹת֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayit'halekh' chanvokh' et-haelohiym v'eynenv kiy-lakach otvo elohiym (f)
translation: Enoch walked with God; then he was no more, for God took him.

hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י מְתוּשֶׁ֔לַח שֶׁ֧בַע וּשְׁמֹנִ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־לָֽמֶךְ׃
transliteration: vay'chiy m'tvshelach sheva' vsh'moniym shanah vm'at shanah vayvoled et-lamekh'
translation: When Methuselah had lived 187 years, he begot Lamech.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִ֣י מְתוּשֶׁ֗לַח אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־לֶ֔מֶךְ שְׁתַּ֤יִם וּשְׁמוֹנִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vay'chiy m'tvshelach acharey hvoliydvo et-lemekh' sh'tayim vsh'mvoniym shanah vsh'va' mevot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot
translation: After the birth of Lamech, Methuselah lived 782 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַיִּהְיוּ֙ כָּל־יְמֵ֣י מְתוּשֶׁ֔לַח תֵּ֤שַׁע וְשִׁשִּׁים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayih'yv kal-y'mey m'tvshelach tesha' v'shishiym shanah vt'sha' mevot shanah vayamot (f)
translation: All the days of Methuselah came to 969 years; then he died.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־לֶ֕מֶךְ שְׁתַּ֧יִם וּשְׁמֹנִ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד בֵּֽן׃
transliteration: vay'chiy-lemekh' sh'tayim vsh'moniym shanah vm'at shanah vayvoled ben
translation: When Lamech had lived 182 years, he begot a son.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֧א אֶת־שְׁמ֛וֹ נֹ֖חַ לֵאמֹ֑ר זֶ֠ה יְנַחֲמֵ֤נוּ מִֽמַּעֲשֵׂ֙נוּ֙ וּמֵעִצְּב֣וֹן יָדֵ֔ינוּ מִן־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵֽרְרָ֖הּ יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayik'ra et-sh'mvo nocha lemor zeh y'nachamenv mima'asenv vme'itz'vvon yadeynv min-haadamah asher er'rah y'hvah
translation: And he named him Noah, saying, “This one will provide us reliefaConnecting Noah with Heb. niḥam “to comfort”; cf. 9.20 ff. from our work and from the toil of our hands, out of the very soil which the LORD placed under a curse.”

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־לֶ֗מֶךְ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־נֹ֔חַ חָמֵ֤שׁ וְתִשְׁעִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֹ֖ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vay'chiy-lemekh' acharey hvoliydvo et-nocha chamesh v'tish'iym shanah vachamesh meot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot
translation: After the birth of Noah, Lamech lived 595 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כָּל־יְמֵי־לֶ֔מֶךְ שֶׁ֤בַע וְשִׁבְעִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'hiy kal-y'mey-lemekh' sheva' v'shiv'iym shanah vsh'va' mevot shanah vayamot (s)
translation: All the days of Lamech came to 777 years; then he died.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־נֹ֕חַ בֶּן־חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֣וֹלֶד נֹ֔חַ אֶת־שֵׁ֖ם אֶת־חָ֥ם וְאֶת־יָֽפֶת׃
transliteration: vay'hiy-nocha ben-chamesh mevot shanah vayvoled nocha et-shem et-cham v'et-yafet
translation: When Noah had lived 500 years, Noah begot Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּֽי־הֵחֵ֣ל הָֽאָדָ֔ם לָרֹ֖ב עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֑ה וּבָנ֖וֹת יֻלְּד֥וּ לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kiy-hechel haadam larov 'al-p'ney haadamah vvanvot yul'dv lahem
translation: When men began to increase on earth and daughters were born to them,

hebrew: וַיִּרְא֤וּ בְנֵי־הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־בְּנ֣וֹת הָֽאָדָ֔ם כִּ֥י טֹבֹ֖ת הֵ֑נָּה וַיִּקְח֤וּ לָהֶם֙ נָשִׁ֔ים מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּחָֽרוּ׃
transliteration: vayir'v v'ney-haelohiym et-b'nvot haadam kiy tovot henah vayik'chv lahem nashiym mikol asher bacharv
translation: the divine beingsaOthers “the sons of God.” saw how beautiful the daughters of men were and took wives from among those that pleased them.—

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָ֗ה לֹֽא־יָד֨וֹן רוּחִ֤י בָֽאָדָם֙ לְעֹלָ֔ם בְּשַׁגַּ֖ם ה֣וּא בָשָׂ֑ר וְהָי֣וּ יָמָ֔יו מֵאָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah lo-yadvon rvchiy vaadam l'olam b'shagam hv vasar v'hayv yamayv meah v'es'riym shanah
translation: The LORD said, “My breath shall not abidebMeaning of Heb. uncertain. in man forever, since he too is flesh; let the days allowed him be one hundred and twenty years.”—

hebrew: הַנְּפִלִ֞ים הָי֣וּ בָאָרֶץ֮ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵם֒ וְגַ֣ם אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָבֹ֜אוּ בְּנֵ֤י הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־בְּנ֣וֹת הָֽאָדָ֔ם וְיָלְד֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם הֵ֧מָּה הַגִּבֹּרִ֛ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר מֵעוֹלָ֖ם אַנְשֵׁ֥י הַשֵּֽׁם׃ (פ)
transliteration: han'filiym hayv vaaretz bayamiym hahem v'gam acharey-khen asher yavov b'ney haelohiym el-b'nvot haadam v'yal'dv lahem hemah hagiboriym asher me'volam an'shey hashem (f)
translation: It was then, and later too, that the Nephilim appeared on earth—when the divine beings cohabited with the daughters of men, who bore them offspring. They were the heroes of old, the men of renown.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא יְהוָ֔ה כִּ֥י רַבָּ֛ה רָעַ֥ת הָאָדָ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְכָל־יֵ֙צֶר֙ מַחְשְׁבֹ֣ת לִבּ֔וֹ רַ֥ק רַ֖ע כָּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayar' y'hvah kiy rabah ra'at haadam baaretz v'khal-yetzer mach'sh'vot libvo rak ra' kal-hayvom
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> saw how great was man’s wickedness on earth, and how every plan devised by his mind was nothing but evil all the time.

hebrew: וַיִּנָּ֣חֶם יְהוָ֔ה כִּֽי־עָשָׂ֥ה אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּתְעַצֵּ֖ב אֶל־לִבּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayinachem y'hvah kiy-'asah et-haadam baaretz vayit'atzev el-libvo
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> regretted that He had made man on earth, and His heart was saddened.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָ֗ה אֶמְחֶ֨ה אֶת־הָאָדָ֤ם אֲשֶׁר־בָּרָ֙אתִי֙ מֵעַל֙ פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה מֵֽאָדָם֙ עַד־בְּהֵמָ֔ה עַד־רֶ֖מֶשׂ וְעַד־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כִּ֥י נִחַ֖מְתִּי כִּ֥י עֲשִׂיתִֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah em'cheh et-haadam asher-baratiy me'al p'ney haadamah meadam 'ad-b'hemah 'ad-remes v'ad-'vof hashamayim kiy nicham'tiy kiy 'asiytim
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said, “I will blot out from the earth the men whom I created—men together with beasts, creeping things, and birds of the sky; for I regret that I made them.”

hebrew: וְנֹ֕חַ מָ֥צָא חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'nocha matza chen b'eyney y'hvah (f)
translation: But Noah found favor with the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת נֹ֔חַ נֹ֗חַ אִ֥ישׁ צַדִּ֛יק תָּמִ֥ים הָיָ֖ה בְּדֹֽרֹתָ֑יו אֶת־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֖ים הִֽתְהַלֶּךְ־נֹֽחַ׃
transliteration: eleh tvol'dot nocha nocha iysh tzadiyk tamiym hayah b'dorotayv et-haelohiym hit'halekh'-nocha
translation: This is the line of Noah.—Noah was a righteous man; he was blameless in his age; Noah walked with God.—

hebrew: וַיּ֥וֹלֶד נֹ֖חַ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה בָנִ֑ים אֶת־שֵׁ֖ם אֶת־חָ֥ם וְאֶת־יָֽפֶת׃
transliteration: vayvoled nocha sh'loshah vaniym et-shem et-cham v'et-yafet
translation: Noah begot three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

hebrew: וַתִּשָּׁחֵ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ לִפְנֵ֣י הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַתִּמָּלֵ֥א הָאָ֖רֶץ חָמָֽס׃
transliteration: vatishachet haaretz lif'ney haelohiym vatimale haaretz chamas
translation: The earth became corrupt before God; the earth was filled with lawlessness.

hebrew: וַיַּ֧רְא אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְהִנֵּ֣ה נִשְׁחָ֑תָה כִּֽי־הִשְׁחִ֧ית כָּל־בָּשָׂ֛ר אֶת־דַּרְכּ֖וֹ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayar' elohiym et-haaretz v'hineh nish'chatah kiy-hish'chiyt kal-basar et-dar'kvo 'al-haaretz (s)
translation: When God saw how corrupt the earth was, for all flesh had corrupted its ways on earth,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֜ים לְנֹ֗חַ קֵ֤ץ כָּל־בָּשָׂר֙ בָּ֣א לְפָנַ֔י כִּֽי־מָלְאָ֥ה הָאָ֛רֶץ חָמָ֖ס מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וְהִנְנִ֥י מַשְׁחִיתָ֖ם אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym l'nocha ketz kal-basar ba l'fanay kiy-mal'ah haaretz chamas mip'neyhem v'hin'niy mash'chiytam et-haaretz
translation: God said to Noah, “I have decided to put an end to all flesh, for the earth is filled with lawlessness because of them: I am about to destroy them with the earth.

hebrew: עֲשֵׂ֤ה לְךָ֙ תֵּבַ֣ת עֲצֵי־גֹ֔פֶר קִנִּ֖ים תַּֽעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֶת־הַתֵּבָ֑ה וְכָֽפַרְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֛הּ מִבַּ֥יִת וּמִח֖וּץ בַּכֹּֽפֶר׃
transliteration: 'aseh l'kha tevat 'atzey-gofer kiniym ta'aseh et-hatevah v'khafar'ta otah mibayit vmichvtz bakofer
translation: Make yourself an ark of gopher wood; make it an ark with compartments, and cover it inside and out with pitch.

hebrew: וְזֶ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּֽעֲשֶׂ֖ה אֹתָ֑הּ שְׁלֹ֧שׁ מֵא֣וֹת אַמָּ֗ה אֹ֚רֶךְ הַתֵּבָ֔ה חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים אַמָּה֙ רָחְבָּ֔הּ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אַמָּ֖ה קוֹמָתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'zeh asher ta'aseh otah sh'losh mevot amah orekh' hatevah chamishiym amah rach'bah vsh'loshiym amah kvomatah
translation: This is how you shall make it: the length of the ark shall be three hundred cubits, its width fifty cubits, and its height thirty cubits.

hebrew: צֹ֣הַר ׀ תַּֽעֲשֶׂ֣ה לַתֵּבָ֗ה וְאֶל־אַמָּה֙ תְּכַלֶ֣נָּה מִלְמַ֔עְלָה וּפֶ֥תַח הַתֵּבָ֖ה בְּצִדָּ֣הּ תָּשִׂ֑ים תַּחְתִּיִּ֛ם שְׁנִיִּ֥ם וּשְׁלִשִׁ֖ים תַּֽעֲשֶֽׂהָ׃
transliteration: tzohar  ta'aseh latevah v'el-amah t'khalenah mil'ma'lah vfetach hatevah b'tzidah tasiym tach'tiyim sh'niyim vsh'lishiym ta'aseha
translation: Make an opening for daylight in the ark, and cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.terminate it within a cubit of the top.-c Put the entrance to the ark in its side; make it with bottom, second, and third decks.

hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י הִנְנִי֩ מֵבִ֨יא אֶת־הַמַּבּ֥וּל מַ֙יִם֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ לְשַׁחֵ֣ת כָּל־בָּשָׂ֗ר אֲשֶׁר־בּוֹ֙ ר֣וּחַ חַיִּ֔ים מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־בָּאָ֖רֶץ יִגְוָֽע׃
transliteration: vaaniy hin'niy meviy et-hamabvl mayim 'al-haaretz l'shachet kal-basar asher-bvo rvcha chayiym mitachat hashamayim kol asher-baaretz yig'va'
translation: “For My part, I am about to bring the Flood—waters upon the earth—to destroy all flesh under the sky in which there is breath of life; everything on earth shall perish.

hebrew: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֥י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אִתָּ֑ךְ וּבָאתָ֙ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֔ה אַתָּ֕ה וּבָנֶ֛יךָ וְאִשְׁתְּךָ֥ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנֶ֖יךָ אִתָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: vahakimotiy et-b'riytiy itakh' vvata el-hatevah atah vvaneykha v'ish't'kha vn'shey-vaneykha itakh'
translation: But I will establish My covenant with you, and you shall enter the ark, with your sons, your wife, and your sons’ wives.

hebrew: וּמִכָּל־הָ֠חַי מִֽכָּל־בָּשָׂ֞ר שְׁנַ֧יִם מִכֹּ֛ל תָּבִ֥יא אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֖ה לְהַחֲיֹ֣ת אִתָּ֑ךְ זָכָ֥ר וּנְקֵבָ֖ה יִֽהְיֽוּ׃
transliteration: vmikal-hachay mikal-basar sh'nayim mikol taviy el-hatevah l'hachayot itakh' zakhar vn'kevah yih'yv
translation: And of all that lives, of all flesh, you shall take two of each into the ark to keep alive with you; they shall be male and female.

hebrew: מֵהָע֣וֹף לְמִינֵ֗הוּ וּמִן־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ מִכֹּ֛ל רֶ֥מֶשׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֖ה לְמִינֵ֑הוּ שְׁנַ֧יִם מִכֹּ֛ל יָבֹ֥אוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ לְהַֽחֲיֽוֹת׃
transliteration: meha'vof l'miynehv vmin-hab'hemah l'miynah mikol remes haadamah l'miynehv sh'nayim mikol yavov eleykha l'hachayvot
translation: From birds of every kind, cattle of every kind, every kind of creeping thing on earth, two of each shall come to you to stay alive.

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה קַח־לְךָ֗ מִכָּל־מַֽאֲכָל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵֽאָכֵ֔ל וְאָסַפְתָּ֖ אֵלֶ֑יךָ וְהָיָ֥ה לְךָ֛ וְלָהֶ֖ם לְאָכְלָֽה׃
transliteration: v'atah kach-l'kha mikal-maakhal asher yeakhel v'asaf'ta eleykha v'hayah l'kha v'lahem l'akh'lah
translation: For your part, take of everything that is eaten and store it away, to serve as food for you and for them.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ נֹ֑חַ כְּ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֥ה אֹת֛וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים כֵּ֥ן עָשָֽׂה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vaya'as nocha k'khol asher tzivah otvo elohiym ken 'asah (s)
translation: Noah did so; just as God commanded him, so he did.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ לְנֹ֔חַ בֹּֽא־אַתָּ֥ה וְכָל־בֵּיתְךָ֖ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֑ה כִּֽי־אֹתְךָ֥ רָאִ֛יתִי צַדִּ֥יק לְפָנַ֖י בַּדּ֥וֹר הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah l'nocha bo-atah v'khal-beyt'kha el-hatevah kiy-ot'kha raiytiy tzadiyk l'fanay badvor hazeh
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Noah, “Go into the ark, with all your household, for you alone have I found righteous before Me in this generation.

hebrew: מִכֹּ֣ל ׀ הַבְּהֵמָ֣ה הַטְּהוֹרָ֗ה תִּֽקַּח־לְךָ֛ שִׁבְעָ֥ה שִׁבְעָ֖ה אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וּמִן־הַבְּהֵמָ֡ה אֲ֠שֶׁר לֹ֣א טְהֹרָ֥ה הִ֛וא שְׁנַ֖יִם אִ֥ישׁ וְאִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: mikol  hab'hemah hat'hvorah tikach-l'kha shiv'ah shiv'ah iysh v'ish'tvo vmin-hab'hemah asher lo t'horah hiv sh'nayim iysh v'ish'tvo
translation: Of every clean animal you shall take seven pairs, males and their mates, and of every animal that is not clean, two, a male and its mate;

hebrew: גַּ֣ם מֵע֧וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם שִׁבְעָ֥ה שִׁבְעָ֖ה זָכָ֣ר וּנְקֵבָ֑ה לְחַיּ֥וֹת זֶ֖רַע עַל־פְּנֵ֥י כָל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: gam me'vof hashamayim shiv'ah shiv'ah zakhar vn'kevah l'chayvot zera' 'al-p'ney khal-haaretz
translation: of the birds of the sky also, seven pairs, male and female, to keep seed alive upon all the earth.

hebrew: כִּי֩ לְיָמִ֨ים ע֜וֹד שִׁבְעָ֗ה אָֽנֹכִי֙ מַמְטִ֣יר עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָ֑יְלָה וּמָחִ֗יתִי אֶֽת־כָּל־הַיְקוּם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔יתִי מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֥י הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
transliteration: kiy l'yamiym 'vod shiv'ah anokhiy mam'tiyr 'al-haaretz ar'ba'iym yvom v'ar'ba'iym lay'lah vmachiytiy et-kal-hay'kvm asher 'asiytiy me'al p'ney haadamah
translation: For in seven days’ time I will make it rain upon the earth, forty days and forty nights, and I will blot out from the earth all existence that I created.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ נֹ֑חַ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖הוּ יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'as nocha k'khol asher-tzivahv y'hvah
translation: And Noah did just as the L<small>ORD</small> commanded him.

hebrew: וְנֹ֕חַ בֶּן־שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וְהַמַּבּ֣וּל הָיָ֔ה מַ֖יִם עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'nocha ben-shesh mevot shanah v'hamabvl hayah mayim 'al-haaretz
translation: Noah was six hundred years old when the Flood came, waters upon the earth.

hebrew: וַיָּ֣בֹא נֹ֗חַ וּ֠בָנָיו וְאִשְׁתּ֧וֹ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנָ֛יו אִתּ֖וֹ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֑ה מִפְּנֵ֖י מֵ֥י הַמַּבּֽוּל׃
transliteration: vayavo nocha vvanayv v'ish'tvo vn'shey-vanayv itvo el-hatevah mip'ney mey hamabvl
translation: Noah, with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives, went into the ark because of the waters of the Flood.

hebrew: מִן־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ הַטְּהוֹרָ֔ה וּמִן־הַ֨בְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵינֶ֖נָּה טְהֹרָ֑ה וּמִ֨ן־הָע֔וֹף וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־רֹמֵ֖שׂ עַל־הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
transliteration: min-hab'hemah hat'hvorah vmin-hab'hemah asher eynenah t'horah vmin-ha'vof v'khol asher-romes 'al-haadamah
translation: Of the clean animals, of the animals that are not clean, of the birds, and of everything that creeps on the ground,

hebrew: שְׁנַ֨יִם שְׁנַ֜יִם בָּ֧אוּ אֶל־נֹ֛חַ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֖ה זָכָ֣ר וּנְקֵבָ֑ה כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־נֹֽחַ׃
transliteration: sh'nayim sh'nayim bav el-nocha el-hatevah zakhar vn'kevah kaasher tzivah elohiym et-nocha
translation: two of each, male and female, came to Noah into the ark, as God had commanded Noah.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֖י לְשִׁבְעַ֣ת הַיָּמִ֑ים וּמֵ֣י הַמַּבּ֔וּל הָי֖וּ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy l'shiv'at hayamiym vmey hamabvl hayv 'al-haaretz
translation: And on the seventh day the waters of the Flood came upon the earth.

hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֤וֹת שָׁנָה֙ לְחַיֵּי־נֹ֔חַ בַּחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י בְּשִׁבְעָֽה־עָשָׂ֥ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה נִבְקְעוּ֙ כָּֽל־מַעְיְנֹת֙ תְּה֣וֹם רַבָּ֔ה וַאֲרֻבֹּ֥ת הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם נִפְתָּֽחוּ׃
transliteration: bish'nat shesh-mevot shanah l'chayey-nocha bachodesh hasheniy b'shiv'ah-'asar yvom lachodesh bayvom hazeh niv'k'v kal-ma'y'not t'hvom rabah vaarubot hashamayim nif'tachv
translation:
In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on that day
All the fountains of the great deep burst apart,
And the floodgates of the sky broke open.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֥י הַגֶּ֖שֶׁם עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָֽיְלָה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy hageshem 'al-haaretz ar'ba'iym yvom v'ar'ba'iym lay'lah
translation: (The rain fell on the earth forty days and forty nights.)

hebrew: בְּעֶ֨צֶם הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ בָּ֣א נֹ֔חַ וְשֵׁם־וְחָ֥ם וָיֶ֖פֶת בְּנֵי־נֹ֑חַ וְאֵ֣שֶׁת נֹ֗חַ וּשְׁלֹ֧שֶׁת נְשֵֽׁי־בָנָ֛יו אִתָּ֖ם אֶל־הַתֵּבָֽה׃
transliteration: b'etzem hayvom hazeh ba nocha v'shem-v'cham vayefet b'ney-nocha v'eshet nocha vsh'loshet n'shey-vanayv itam el-hatevah
translation: That same day Noah and Noah’s sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth, went into the ark, with Noah’s wife and the three wives of his sons—

hebrew: הֵ֜מָּה וְכָל־הַֽחַיָּ֣ה לְמִינָ֗הּ וְכָל־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ וְכָל־הָרֶ֛מֶשׂ הָרֹמֵ֥שׂ עַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ לְמִינֵ֑הוּ וְכָל־הָע֣וֹף לְמִינֵ֔הוּ כֹּ֖ל צִפּ֥וֹר כָּל־כָּנָֽף׃
transliteration: hemah v'khal-hachayah l'miynah v'khal-hab'hemah l'miynah v'khal-haremes haromes 'al-haaretz l'miynehv v'khal-ha'vof l'miynehv kol tzipvor kal-kanaf
translation: they and all beasts of every kind, all cattle of every kind, all creatures of every kind that creep on the earth, and all birds of every kind, every bird, every winged thing.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ אֶל־נֹ֖חַ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֑ה שְׁנַ֤יִם שְׁנַ֙יִם֙ מִכָּל־הַבָּשָׂ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ ר֥וּחַ חַיִּֽים׃
transliteration: vayavov el-nocha el-hatevah sh'nayim sh'nayim mikal-habasar asher-bvo rvcha chayiym
translation: They came to Noah into the ark, two each of all flesh in which there was breath of life.

hebrew: וְהַבָּאִ֗ים זָכָ֨ר וּנְקֵבָ֤ה מִכָּל־בָּשָׂר֙ בָּ֔אוּ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּסְגֹּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה בַּֽעֲדֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'habaiym zakhar vn'kevah mikal-basar bav kaasher tzivah otvo elohiym vayis'gor y'hvah ba'advo
translation: Thus they that entered comprised male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him. And the L<small>ORD</small> shut him in.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֧י הַמַּבּ֛וּל אַרְבָּעִ֥ים י֖וֹם עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּרְבּ֣וּ הַמַּ֗יִם וַיִּשְׂאוּ֙ אֶת־הַתֵּבָ֔ה וַתָּ֖רָם מֵעַ֥ל הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy hamabvl ar'ba'iym yvom 'al-haaretz vayir'bv hamayim vayis'v et-hatevah vataram me'al haaretz
translation: The Flood continued forty days on the earth, and the waters increased and raised the ark so that it rose above the earth.

hebrew: וַיִּגְבְּר֥וּ הַמַּ֛יִם וַיִּרְבּ֥וּ מְאֹ֖ד עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַתֵּ֥לֶךְ הַתֵּבָ֖ה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayig'b'rv hamayim vayir'bv m'od 'al-haaretz vatelekh' hatevah 'al-p'ney hamayim
translation: The waters swelled and increased greatly upon the earth, and the ark drifted upon the waters.

hebrew: וְהַמַּ֗יִם גָּֽבְר֛וּ מְאֹ֥ד מְאֹ֖ד עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיְכֻסּ֗וּ כָּל־הֶֽהָרִים֙ הַגְּבֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־תַּ֖חַת כָּל־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'hamayim gav'rv m'od m'od 'al-haaretz vay'khusv kal-hehariym hag'vohiym asher-tachat kal-hashamayim
translation: When the waters had swelled much more upon the earth, all the highest mountains everywhere under the sky were covered.

hebrew: חֲמֵ֨שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה אַמָּה֙ מִלְמַ֔עְלָה גָּבְר֖וּ הַמָּ֑יִם וַיְכֻסּ֖וּ הֶהָרִֽים׃
transliteration: chamesh 'es'reh amah mil'ma'lah gav'rv hamayim vay'khusv hehariym
translation: Fifteen cubits higher did the waters swell, as the mountains were covered.

hebrew: וַיִּגְוַ֞ע כָּל־בָּשָׂ֣ר ׀ הָרֹמֵ֣שׂ עַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ בָּע֤וֹף וּבַבְּהֵמָה֙ וּבַ֣חַיָּ֔ה וּבְכָל־הַשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵ֣ץ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְכֹ֖ל הָאָדָֽם׃
transliteration: vayig'va' kal-basar  haromes 'al-haaretz ba'vof vvab'hemah vvachayah vv'khal-hasheretz hashoretz 'al-haaretz v'khol haadam
translation: And all flesh that stirred on earth perished—birds, cattle, beasts, and all the things that swarmed upon the earth, and all mankind.

hebrew: כֹּ֡ל אֲשֶׁר֩ נִשְׁמַת־ר֨וּחַ חַיִּ֜ים בְּאַפָּ֗יו מִכֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֶּחָֽרָבָ֖ה מֵֽתוּ׃
transliteration: kol asher nish'mat-rvcha chayiym b'apayv mikol asher becharavah metv
translation: All in whose nostrils was the merest breath of life, all that was on dry land, died.

hebrew: וַיִּ֜מַח אֶֽת־כָּל־הַיְק֣וּם ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֗ה מֵאָדָ֤ם עַד־בְּהֵמָה֙ עַד־רֶ֙מֶשׂ֙ וְעַד־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיִּמָּח֖וּ מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִשָּׁ֧אֶר אַךְ־נֹ֛חַ וַֽאֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ בַּתֵּבָֽה׃
transliteration: vayimach et-kal-hay'kvm  asher  'al-p'ney haadamah meadam 'ad-b'hemah 'ad-remes v'ad-'vof hashamayim vayimachv min-haaretz vayishaer akh'-nocha vaasher itvo batevah
translation: All existence on earth was blotted out—man, cattle, creeping things, and birds of the sky; they were blotted out from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those with him in the ark.

hebrew: וַיִּגְבְּר֥וּ הַמַּ֖יִם עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמְאַ֖ת יֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayig'b'rv hamayim 'al-haaretz chamishiym vm'at yvom
translation: And when the waters had swelled on the earth one hundred and fifty days,

hebrew: וַיִּזְכֹּ֤ר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־נֹ֔חַ וְאֵ֤ת כָּל־הַֽחַיָּה֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ בַּתֵּבָ֑ה וַיַּעֲבֵ֨ר אֱלֹהִ֥ים ר֙וּחַ֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וַיָּשֹׁ֖כּוּ הַמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayiz'kor elohiym et-nocha v'et kal-hachayah v'et-kal-hab'hemah asher itvo batevah vaya'aver elohiym rvcha 'al-haaretz vayashokv hamayim
translation: God remembered Noah and all the beasts and all the cattle that were with him in the ark, and God caused a wind to blow across the earth, and the waters subsided.

hebrew: וַיִּסָּֽכְרוּ֙ מַעְיְנֹ֣ת תְּה֔וֹם וַֽאֲרֻבֹּ֖ת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַיִּכָּלֵ֥א הַגֶּ֖שֶׁם מִן־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayisakh'rv ma'y'not t'hvom vaarubot hashamayim vayikale hageshem min-hashamayim
translation: The fountains of the deep and the floodgates of the sky were stopped up, and the rain from the sky was held back;

hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֧בוּ הַמַּ֛יִם מֵעַ֥ל הָאָ֖רֶץ הָל֣וֹךְ וָשׁ֑וֹב וַיַּחְסְר֣וּ הַמַּ֔יִם מִקְצֵ֕ה חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמְאַ֖ת יֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayashuvv hamayim me'al haaretz halvokh' vashvov vayach's'rv hamayim mik'tzeh chamishiym vm'at yvom
translation: the waters then receded steadily from the earth. At the end of one hundred and fifty days the waters diminished,

hebrew: וַתָּ֤נַח הַתֵּבָה֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י בְּשִׁבְעָה־עָשָׂ֥ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ עַ֖ל הָרֵ֥י אֲרָרָֽט׃
transliteration: vatanach hatevah bachodesh hash'viy'iy b'shiv'ah-'asar yvom lachodesh 'al harey ararat
translation: so that in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat.

hebrew: וְהַמַּ֗יִם הָיוּ֙ הָל֣וֹךְ וְחָס֔וֹר עַ֖ד הַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽעֲשִׂירִ֑י בָּֽעֲשִׂירִי֙ בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ נִרְא֖וּ רָאשֵׁ֥י הֶֽהָרִֽים׃
transliteration: v'hamayim hayv halvokh' v'chasvor 'ad hachodesh ha'asiyriy ba'asiyriy b'echad lachodesh nir'v rashey hehariym
translation: The waters went on diminishing until the tenth month; in the tenth month, on the first of the month, the tops of the mountains became visible.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֕י מִקֵּ֖ץ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֑וֹם וַיִּפְתַּ֣ח נֹ֔חַ אֶת־חַלּ֥וֹן הַתֵּבָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy miketz ar'ba'iym yvom vayif'tach nocha et-chalvon hatevah asher 'asah
translation: At the end of forty days, Noah opened the window of the ark that he had made

hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־הָֽעֹרֵ֑ב וַיֵּצֵ֤א יָצוֹא֙ וָשׁ֔וֹב עַד־יְבֹ֥שֶׁת הַמַּ֖יִם מֵעַ֥ל הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vay'shalach et-ha'orev vayetze yatzvo vashvov 'ad-y'voshet hamayim me'al haaretz
translation: and sent out the raven; it went to and fro until the waters had dried up from the earth.

hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־הַיּוֹנָ֖ה מֵאִתּ֑וֹ לִרְאוֹת֙ הֲקַ֣לּוּ הַמַּ֔יִם מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֥י הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'shalach et-hayvonah meitvo lir'vot hakalv hamayim me'al p'ney haadamah
translation: Then he sent out the dove to see whether the waters had decreased from the surface of the ground.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־מָצְאָה֩ הַיּוֹנָ֨ה מָנ֜וֹחַ לְכַף־רַגְלָ֗הּ וַתָּ֤שָׁב אֵלָיו֙ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֔ה כִּי־מַ֖יִם עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כָל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יָדוֹ֙ וַיִּקָּחֶ֔הָ וַיָּבֵ֥א אֹתָ֛הּ אֵלָ֖יו אֶל־הַתֵּבָֽה׃
transliteration: v'lo-matz'ah hayvonah manvocha l'khaf-rag'lah vatashav elayv el-hatevah kiy-mayim 'al-p'ney khal-haaretz vayish'lach yadvo vayikacheha vayave otah elayv el-hatevah
translation: But the dove could not find a resting place for its foot, and returned to him to the ark, for there was water over all the earth. So putting out his hand, he took it into the ark with him.

hebrew: וַיָּ֣חֶל ע֔וֹד שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וַיֹּ֛סֶף שַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־הַיּוֹנָ֖ה מִן־הַתֵּבָֽה׃
transliteration: vayachel 'vod shiv'at yamiym acheriym vayosef shalach et-hayvonah min-hatevah
translation: He waited another seven days, and again sent out the dove from the ark.

hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֨א אֵלָ֤יו הַיּוֹנָה֙ לְעֵ֣ת עֶ֔רֶב וְהִנֵּ֥ה עֲלֵה־זַ֖יִת טָרָ֣ף בְּפִ֑יהָ וַיֵּ֣דַע נֹ֔חַ כִּי־קַ֥לּוּ הַמַּ֖יִם מֵעַ֥ל הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vatavo elayv hayvonah l'et 'erev v'hineh 'aleh-zayit taraf b'fiyha vayeda' nocha kiy-kalv hamayim me'al haaretz
translation: The dove came back to him toward evening, and there in its bill was a plucked-off olive leaf! Then Noah knew that the waters had decreased on the earth.

hebrew: וַיִּיָּ֣חֶל ע֔וֹד שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וַיְשַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־הַיּוֹנָ֔ה וְלֹֽא־יָסְפָ֥ה שׁוּב־אֵלָ֖יו עֽוֹד׃
transliteration: vayiyachel 'vod shiv'at yamiym acheriym vay'shalach et-hayvonah v'lo-yas'fah shvv-elayv 'vod
translation: He waited still another seven days and sent the dove forth; and it did not return to him any more.

hebrew: וַֽ֠יְהִי בְּאַחַ֨ת וְשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֜וֹת שָׁנָ֗ה בָּֽרִאשׁוֹן֙ בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ חָֽרְב֥וּ הַמַּ֖יִם מֵעַ֣ל הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיָּ֤סַר נֹ֙חַ֙ אֶת־מִכְסֵ֣ה הַתֵּבָ֔ה וַיַּ֕רְא וְהִנֵּ֥ה חָֽרְב֖וּ פְּנֵ֥י הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy b'achat v'shesh-mevot shanah barishvon b'echad lachodesh char'vv hamayim me'al haaretz vayasar nocha et-mikh'seh hatevah vayar' v'hineh char'vv p'ney haadamah
translation: In the six hundred and first year, in the first month, on the first of the month, the waters began to dry from the earth; and when Noah removed the covering of the ark, he saw that the surface of the ground was drying.

hebrew: וּבַחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י בְּשִׁבְעָ֧ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים י֖וֹם לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ יָבְשָׁ֖ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vvachodesh hasheniy b'shiv'ah v'es'riym yvom lachodesh yav'shah haaretz (s)
translation: And in the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dry.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־נֹ֥חַ לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber elohiym el-nocha lemor
translation: God spoke to Noah, saying,

hebrew: צֵ֖א מִן־הַתֵּבָ֑ה אַתָּ֕ה וְאִשְׁתְּךָ֛ וּבָנֶ֥יךָ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנֶ֖יךָ אִתָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: tze min-hatevah atah v'ish't'kha vvaneykha vn'shey-vaneykha itakh'
translation: “Come out of the ark, together with your wife, your sons, and your sons’ wives.

hebrew: כָּל־הַחַיָּ֨ה אֲשֶֽׁר־אִתְּךָ֜ מִכָּל־בָּשָׂ֗ר בָּע֧וֹף וּבַבְּהֵמָ֛ה וּבְכָל־הָרֶ֛מֶשׂ הָרֹמֵ֥שׂ עַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ הוצא [הַיְצֵ֣א] אִתָּ֑ךְ וְשָֽׁרְצ֣וּ בָאָ֔רֶץ וּפָר֥וּ וְרָב֖וּ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: kal-hachayah asher-it'kha mikal-basar ba'vof vvab'hemah vv'khal-haremes haromes 'al-haaretz hvtz [hay'tze] itakh' v'shar'tzv vaaretz vfarv v'ravv 'al-haaretz
translation: Bring out with you every living thing of all flesh that is with you: birds, animals, and everything that creeps on earth; and let them swarm on the earth and be fertile and increase on earth.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֖צֵא־נֹ֑חַ וּבָנָ֛יו וְאִשְׁתּ֥וֹ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayetze-nocha vvanayv v'ish'tvo vn'shey-vanayv itvo
translation: So Noah came out, together with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives.

hebrew: כָּל־הַֽחַיָּ֗ה כָּל־הָרֶ֙מֶשׂ֙ וְכָל־הָע֔וֹף כֹּ֖ל רוֹמֵ֣שׂ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם יָצְא֖וּ מִן־הַתֵּבָֽה׃
transliteration: kal-hachayah kal-haremes v'khal-ha'vof kol rvomes 'al-haaretz l'mish'p'choteyhem yatz'v min-hatevah
translation: Every animal, every creeping thing, and every bird, everything that stirs on earth came out of the ark by families.

hebrew: וַיִּ֥בֶן נֹ֛חַ מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לַֽיהוָ֑ה וַיִּקַּ֞ח מִכֹּ֣ל ׀ הַבְּהֵמָ֣ה הַטְּהוֹרָ֗ה וּמִכֹּל֙ הָע֣וֹף הַטָּהֹ֔ר וַיַּ֥עַל עֹלֹ֖ת בַּמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: vayiven nocha miz'becha layhvah vayikach mikol  hab'hemah hat'hvorah vmikol ha'vof hatahor vaya'al 'olot bamiz'becha
translation: Then Noah built an altar to the L<small>ORD</small> and, taking of every clean animal and of every clean bird, he offered burnt offerings on the altar.

hebrew: וַיָּ֣רַח יְהוָה֮ אֶת־רֵ֣יחַ הַנִּיחֹחַ֒ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־לִבּ֗וֹ לֹֽא־אֹ֠סִף לְקַלֵּ֨ל ע֤וֹד אֶת־הָֽאֲדָמָה֙ בַּעֲב֣וּר הָֽאָדָ֔ם כִּ֠י יֵ֣צֶר לֵ֧ב הָאָדָ֛ם רַ֖ע מִנְּעֻרָ֑יו וְלֹֽא־אֹסִ֥ף ע֛וֹד לְהַכּ֥וֹת אֶת־כָּל־חַ֖י כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִֽׂיתִי׃
transliteration: vayarach y'hvah et-reycha haniychocha vayomer y'hvah el-libvo lo-osif l'kalel 'vod et-haadamah ba'avvr haadam kiy yetzer lev haadam ra' min'urayv v'lo-osif 'vod l'hakvot et-kal-chay kaasher 'asiytiy
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> smelled the pleasing odor, and the L<small>ORD</small> said to Himself: “Never again will I doom the earth because of man, since the devisings of man’s mind are evil from his youth; nor will I ever again destroy every living being, as I have done.

hebrew: עֹ֖ד כָּל־יְמֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ זֶ֡רַע וְ֠קָצִיר וְקֹ֨ר וָחֹ֜ם וְקַ֧יִץ וָחֹ֛רֶף וְי֥וֹם וָלַ֖יְלָה לֹ֥א יִשְׁבֹּֽתוּ׃
transliteration: 'od kal-y'mey haaretz zera' v'katziyr v'kor vachom v'kayitz vachoref v'yvom valay'lah lo yish'botv
translation:
So long as the earth endures,
Seedtime and harvest,
Cold and heat,
Summer and winter,
Day and night
Shall not cease.”

hebrew: וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶת־נֹ֖חַ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֑יו וַיֹּ֧אמֶר לָהֶ֛ם פְּר֥וּ וּרְב֖וּ וּמִלְא֥וּ אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vay'varekh' elohiym et-nocha v'et-banayv vayomer lahem p'rv vr'vv vmil'v et-haaretz
translation: God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, “Be fertile and increase, and fill the earth.

hebrew: וּמוֹרַאֲכֶ֤ם וְחִתְּכֶם֙ יִֽהְיֶ֔ה עַ֚ל כָּל־חַיַּ֣ת הָאָ֔רֶץ וְעַ֖ל כָּל־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם בְּכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּרְמֹ֧שׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֛ה וּֽבְכָל־דְּגֵ֥י הַיָּ֖ם בְּיֶדְכֶ֥ם נִתָּֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vmvoraakhem v'chit'khem yih'yeh 'al kal-chayat haaretz v'al kal-'vof hashamayim b'khol asher tir'mos haadamah vv'khal-d'gey hayam b'yed'khem nitanv
translation: The fear and the dread of you shall be upon all the beasts of the earth and upon all the birds of the sky—everything with which the earth is astir—and upon all the fish of the sea; they are given into your hand.

hebrew: כָּל־רֶ֙מֶשׂ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הוּא־חַ֔י לָכֶ֥ם יִהְיֶ֖ה לְאָכְלָ֑ה כְּיֶ֣רֶק עֵ֔שֶׂב נָתַ֥תִּי לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־כֹּֽל׃
transliteration: kal-remes asher hv-chay lakhem yih'yeh l'akh'lah k'yerek 'esev natatiy lakhem et-kol
translation: Every creature that lives shall be yours to eat; as with the green grasses, I give you all these.

hebrew: אַךְ־בָּשָׂ֕ר בְּנַפְשׁ֥וֹ דָמ֖וֹ לֹ֥א תֹאכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: akh'-basar b'naf'shvo damvo lo tokhelv
translation: You must not, however, eat flesh with its life-blood in it.

hebrew: וְאַ֨ךְ אֶת־דִּמְכֶ֤ם לְנַפְשֹֽׁתֵיכֶם֙ אֶדְרֹ֔שׁ מִיַּ֥ד כָּל־חַיָּ֖ה אֶדְרְשֶׁ֑נּוּ וּמִיַּ֣ד הָֽאָדָ֗ם מִיַּד֙ אִ֣ישׁ אָחִ֔יו אֶדְרֹ֖שׁ אֶת־נֶ֥פֶשׁ הָֽאָדָֽם׃
transliteration: v'akh' et-dim'khem l'naf'shoteykhem ed'rosh miyad kal-chayah ed'r'shenv vmiyad haadam miyad iysh achiyv ed'rosh et-nefesh haadam
translation: But for your own life-blood I will require a reckoning: I will require it of every beast; of man, too, will I require a reckoning for human life, of every man for that of his fellow man!

hebrew: שֹׁפֵךְ֙ דַּ֣ם הָֽאָדָ֔ם בָּֽאָדָ֖ם דָּמ֣וֹ יִשָּׁפֵ֑ךְ כִּ֚י בְּצֶ֣לֶם אֱלֹהִ֔ים עָשָׂ֖ה אֶת־הָאָדָֽם׃
transliteration: shofekh' dam haadam baadam damvo yishafekh' kiy b'tzelem elohiym 'asah et-haadam
translation:
Whoever sheds the blood of man,
By man shall his blood be shed;
For in His image
Did God make man.

hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֖ם פְּר֣וּ וּרְב֑וּ שִׁרְצ֥וּ בָאָ֖רֶץ וּרְבוּ־בָֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'atem p'rv vr'vv shir'tzv vaaretz vr'vv-vah (s)
translation: Be fertile, then, and increase; abound on the earth and increase on it.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־נֹ֔חַ וְאֶל־בָּנָ֥יו אִתּ֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym el-nocha v'el-banayv itvo lemor
translation: And God said to Noah and to his sons with him,

hebrew: וַאֲנִ֕י הִנְנִ֥י מֵקִ֛ים אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אִתְּכֶ֑ם וְאֶֽת־זַרְעֲכֶ֖ם אַֽחֲרֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vaaniy hin'niy mekiym et-b'riytiy it'khem v'et-zar'akhem achareykhem
translation: “I now establish My covenant with you and your offspring to come,

hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת כָּל־נֶ֤פֶשׁ הַֽחַיָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתְּכֶ֔ם בָּע֧וֹף בַּבְּהֵמָ֛ה וּֽבְכָל־חַיַּ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ אִתְּכֶ֑ם מִכֹּל֙ יֹצְאֵ֣י הַתֵּבָ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל חַיַּ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
