transliteration: v'et kal-nefesh hachayah asher it'khem ba'vof bab'hemah vv'khal-chayat haaretz it'khem mikol yotz'ey hatevah l'khol chayat haaretz
translation: and with every living thing that is with you—birds, cattle, and every wild beast as well—all that have come out of the ark, every living thing on earth.

hebrew: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֤י אֶת־בְּרִיתִי֙ אִתְּכֶ֔ם וְלֹֽא־יִכָּרֵ֧ת כָּל־בָּשָׂ֛ר ע֖וֹד מִמֵּ֣י הַמַּבּ֑וּל וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֥ה ע֛וֹד מַבּ֖וּל לְשַׁחֵ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vahakimotiy et-b'riytiy it'khem v'lo-yikaret kal-basar 'vod mimey hamabvl v'lo-yih'yeh 'vod mabvl l'shachet haaretz
translation: I will maintain My covenant with you: never again shall all flesh be cut off by the waters of a flood, and never again shall there be a flood to destroy the earth.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים זֹ֤את אֽוֹת־הַבְּרִית֙ אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֣י נֹתֵ֗ן בֵּינִי֙ וּבֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵ֛ין כָּל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ חַיָּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתְּכֶ֑ם לְדֹרֹ֖ת עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym zot vot-hab'riyt asher-aniy noten beyniy vveyneykhem vveyn kal-nefesh chayah asher it'khem l'dorot 'volam
translation: God further said, “This is the sign that I set for the covenant between Me and you, and every living creature with you, for all ages to come.

hebrew: אֶת־קַשְׁתִּ֕י נָתַ֖תִּי בֶּֽעָנָ֑ן וְהָֽיְתָה֙ לְא֣וֹת בְּרִ֔ית בֵּינִ֖י וּבֵ֥ין הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: et-kash'tiy natatiy be'anan v'hay'tah l'vot b'riyt beyniy vveyn haaretz
translation: I have set My bow in the clouds, and it shall serve as a sign of the covenant between Me and the earth.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֕ה בְּעַֽנְנִ֥י עָנָ֖ן עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְנִרְאֲתָ֥ה הַקֶּ֖שֶׁת בֶּעָנָֽן׃
transliteration: v'hayah b'an'niy 'anan 'al-haaretz v'nir'atah hakeshet be'anan
translation: When I bring clouds over the earth, and the bow appears in the clouds,

hebrew: וְזָכַרְתִּ֣י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֤ר בֵּינִי֙ וּבֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵ֛ין כָּל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ חַיָּ֖ה בְּכָל־בָּשָׂ֑ר וְלֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֨ה ע֤וֹד הַמַּ֙יִם֙ לְמַבּ֔וּל לְשַׁחֵ֖ת כָּל־בָּשָֽׂר׃
transliteration: v'zakhar'tiy et-b'riytiy asher beyniy vveyneykhem vveyn kal-nefesh chayah b'khal-basar v'lo-yih'yeh 'vod hamayim l'mabvl l'shachet kal-basar
translation: I will remember My covenant between Me and you and every living creature among all flesh, so that the waters shall never again become a flood to destroy all flesh.

hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֥ה הַקֶּ֖שֶׁת בֶּֽעָנָ֑ן וּרְאִיתִ֗יהָ לִזְכֹּר֙ בְּרִ֣ית עוֹלָ֔ם בֵּ֣ין אֱלֹהִ֔ים וּבֵין֙ כָּל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ חַיָּ֔ה בְּכָל־בָּשָׂ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'hay'tah hakeshet be'anan vr'iytiyha liz'kor b'riyt 'volam beyn elohiym vveyn kal-nefesh chayah b'khal-basar asher 'al-haaretz
translation: When the bow is in the clouds, I will see it and remember the everlasting covenant between God and all living creatures, all flesh that is on earth.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־נֹ֑חַ זֹ֤את אֽוֹת־הַבְּרִית֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֲקִמֹ֔תִי בֵּינִ֕י וּבֵ֥ין כָּל־בָּשָׂ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayomer elohiym el-nocha zot vot-hab'riyt asher hakimotiy beyniy vveyn kal-basar asher 'al-haaretz (f)
translation: That,” God said to Noah, “shall be the sign of the covenant that I have established between Me and all flesh that is on earth.”

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֣וּ בְנֵי־נֹ֗חַ הַיֹּֽצְאִים֙ מִן־הַתֵּבָ֔ה שֵׁ֖ם וְחָ֣ם וָיָ֑פֶת וְחָ֕ם ה֖וּא אֲבִ֥י כְנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: vayih'yv v'ney-nocha hayotz'iym min-hatevah shem v'cham vayafet v'cham hv aviy kh'na'an
translation: The sons of Noah who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth—Ham being the father of Canaan.

hebrew: שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵי־נֹ֑חַ וּמֵאֵ֖לֶּה נָֽפְצָ֥ה כָל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: sh'loshah eleh b'ney-nocha vmeeleh naf'tzah khal-haaretz
translation: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these the whole world branched out.

hebrew: וַיָּ֥חֶל נֹ֖חַ אִ֣ישׁ הָֽאֲדָמָ֑ה וַיִּטַּ֖ע כָּֽרֶם׃
transliteration: vayachel nocha iysh haadamah vayita' karem
translation: Noah, the tiller of the soil, was the first to plant a vineyard.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥שְׁתְּ מִן־הַיַּ֖יִן וַיִּשְׁכָּ֑ר וַיִּתְגַּ֖ל בְּת֥וֹךְ אָהֳלֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayesh't' min-hayayin vayish'kar vayit'gal b'tvokh' aholoh
translation: He drank of the wine and became drunk, and he uncovered himself within his tent.

hebrew: וַיַּ֗רְא חָ֚ם אֲבִ֣י כְנַ֔עַן אֵ֖ת עֶרְוַ֣ת אָבִ֑יו וַיַּגֵּ֥ד לִשְׁנֵֽי־אֶחָ֖יו בַּחֽוּץ׃
transliteration: vayar' cham aviy kh'na'an et 'er'vat aviyv vayaged lish'ney-echayv bachvtz
translation: Ham, the father of Canaan, saw his father’s nakedness and told his two brothers outside.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֩ שֵׁ֨ם וָיֶ֜פֶת אֶת־הַשִּׂמְלָ֗ה וַיָּשִׂ֙ימוּ֙ עַל־שְׁכֶ֣ם שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ אֲחֹ֣רַנִּ֔ית וַיְכַסּ֕וּ אֵ֖ת עֶרְוַ֣ת אֲבִיהֶ֑ם וּפְנֵיהֶם֙ אֲחֹ֣רַנִּ֔ית וְעֶרְוַ֥ת אֲבִיהֶ֖ם לֹ֥א רָאֽוּ׃
transliteration: vayikach shem vayefet et-hasim'lah vayasiymv 'al-sh'khem sh'neyhem vayel'khv achoraniyt vay'khasv et 'er'vat aviyhem vf'neyhem achoraniyt v'er'vat aviyhem lo rav
translation: But Shem and Japheth took a cloth, placed it against both their backs and, walking backward, they covered their father’s nakedness; their faces were turned the other way, so that they did not see their father’s nakedness.

hebrew: וַיִּ֥יקֶץ נֹ֖חַ מִיֵּינ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֕דַע אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־עָ֥שָׂה־ל֖וֹ בְּנ֥וֹ הַקָּטָֽן׃
transliteration: vayiyketz nocha miyeynvo vayeda' et asher-'asah-lvo b'nvo hakatan
translation: When Noah woke up from his wine and learned what his youngest son had done to him,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָר֣וּר כְּנָ֑עַן עֶ֥בֶד עֲבָדִ֖ים יִֽהְיֶ֥ה לְאֶחָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayomer arvr k'na'an 'eved 'avadiym yih'yeh l'echayv
translation:
he said,
“Cursed be Canaan;
The lowest of slaves
Shall he be to his brothers.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בָּר֥וּךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹ֣הֵי שֵׁ֑ם וִיהִ֥י כְנַ֖עַן עֶ֥בֶד לָֽמוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer barvkh' y'hovah elohey shem viyhiy kh'na'an 'eved lamvo
translation:
And he said,
“Blessed be the LORD,
The God of Shem;
Let Canaan be a slave to them.

hebrew: יַ֤פְתְּ אֱלֹהִים֙ לְיֶ֔פֶת וְיִשְׁכֹּ֖ן בְּאָֽהֳלֵי־שֵׁ֑ם וִיהִ֥י כְנַ֖עַן עֶ֥בֶד לָֽמוֹ׃
transliteration: yaf't' elohiym l'yefet v'yish'kon b'aholey-shem viyhiy kh'na'an 'eved lamvo
translation:
May God enlargeaHeb. yapht, play on Heb. yepheth “Japheth.” Japheth,
And let him dwell in the tents of Shem;
And let Canaan be a slave to them.”

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־נֹ֖חַ אַחַ֣ר הַמַּבּ֑וּל שְׁלֹ֤שׁ מֵאוֹת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וַֽחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'chiy-nocha achar hamabvl sh'losh mevot shanah vachamishiym shanah
translation: Noah lived after the Flood 350 years.

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כָּל־יְמֵי־נֹ֔חַ תְּשַׁ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayih'yv kal-y'mey-nocha t'sha' mevot shanah vachamishiym shanah vayamot (f)
translation: And all the days of Noah came to 950 years; then he died.

hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת בְּנֵי־נֹ֔חַ שֵׁ֖ם חָ֣ם וָיָ֑פֶת וַיִּוָּלְד֥וּ לָהֶ֛ם בָּנִ֖ים אַחַ֥ר הַמַּבּֽוּל׃
transliteration: v'eleh tvol'dot b'ney-nocha shem cham vayafet vayival'dv lahem baniym achar hamabvl
translation: These are the lines of Shem, Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah: sons were born to them after the Flood.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י יֶ֔פֶת גֹּ֣מֶר וּמָג֔וֹג וּמָדַ֖י וְיָוָ֣ן וְתֻבָ֑ל וּמֶ֖שֶׁךְ וְתִירָֽס׃
transliteration: b'ney yefet gomer vmagvog vmaday v'yavan v'tuval vmeshekh' v'tiyras
translation: The descendants of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י גֹּ֑מֶר אַשְׁכֲּנַ֥ז וְרִיפַ֖ת וְתֹגַרְמָֽה׃
transliteration: vv'ney gomer ash'kanaz v'riyfat v'togar'mah
translation: The descendants of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י יָוָ֖ן אֱלִישָׁ֣ה וְתַרְשִׁ֑ישׁ כִּתִּ֖ים וְדֹדָנִֽים׃
transliteration: vv'ney yavan eliyshah v'tar'shiysh kitiym v'dodaniym
translation: The descendants of Javan: Elishah and Tarshish, the Kittim and the Dodanim.aSeptuagint and 1 Chron. 1.7 “Rodanim.”

hebrew: מֵ֠אֵלֶּה נִפְרְד֞וּ אִיֵּ֤י הַגּוֹיִם֙ בְּאַרְצֹתָ֔ם אִ֖ישׁ לִלְשֹׁנ֑וֹ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם בְּגוֹיֵהֶֽם׃
transliteration: meeleh nif'r'dv iyey hagvoyim b'ar'tzotam iysh lil'shonvo l'mish'p'chotam b'gvoyehem
translation: From these the maritime nations branched out. [These are the descendants of Japheth]bCf. vv. 20 and 31. by their lands—each with its language—their clans and their nations.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י חָ֑ם כּ֥וּשׁ וּמִצְרַ֖יִם וּפ֥וּט וּכְנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: vv'ney cham kvsh vmitz'rayim vfvt vkh'na'an
translation: The descendants of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י כ֔וּשׁ סְבָא֙ וַֽחֲוִילָ֔ה וְסַבְתָּ֥ה וְרַעְמָ֖ה וְסַבְתְּכָ֑א וּבְנֵ֥י רַעְמָ֖ה שְׁבָ֥א וּדְדָֽן׃
transliteration: vv'ney khvsh s'va vachaviylah v'sav'tah v'ra'mah v'sav't'kha vv'ney ra'mah sh'va vd'dan
translation: The descendants of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The descendants of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.

hebrew: וְכ֖וּשׁ יָלַ֣ד אֶת־נִמְרֹ֑ד ה֣וּא הֵחֵ֔ל לִֽהְי֥וֹת גִּבֹּ֖ר בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'khvsh yalad et-nim'rod hv hechel lih'yvot gibor baaretz
translation: Cush also begot Nimrod, who was the first man of might on earth.

hebrew: הֽוּא־הָיָ֥ה גִבֹּֽר־צַ֖יִד לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה עַל־כֵּן֙ יֵֽאָמַ֔ר כְּנִמְרֹ֛ד גִּבּ֥וֹר צַ֖יִד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: hv-hayah gibor-tzayid lif'ney y'hvah 'al-ken yeamar k'nim'rod gibvor tzayid lif'ney y'hvah
translation: He was a mighty hunter by the grace of the L<small>ORD</small>; hence the saying, “Like Nimrod a mighty hunter by the grace of the L<small>ORD</small>.”

hebrew: וַתְּהִ֨י רֵאשִׁ֤ית מַמְלַכְתּוֹ֙ בָּבֶ֔ל וְאֶ֖רֶךְ וְאַכַּ֣ד וְכַלְנֵ֑ה בְּאֶ֖רֶץ שִׁנְעָֽר׃
transliteration: vat'hiy reshiyt mam'lakh'tvo bavel v'erekh' v'akad v'khal'neh b'eretz shin'ar
translation: The mainstays of his kingdom were Babylon, Erech, Accad, and CalnehcHeb. we-khalneh, better vocalized we-khullanah “all of them being.” in the land of Shinar.

hebrew: מִן־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַהִ֖וא יָצָ֣א אַשּׁ֑וּר וַיִּ֙בֶן֙ אֶת־נִ֣ינְוֵ֔ה וְאֶת־רְחֹבֹ֥ת עִ֖יר וְאֶת־כָּֽלַח׃
transliteration: min-haaretz hahiv yatza ashvr vayiven et-niyn'veh v'et-r'chovot 'iyr v'et-kalach
translation: From that land Asshur went forth and built Nineveh, Rehoboth-ir, Calah,

hebrew: וְֽאֶת־רֶ֔סֶן בֵּ֥ין נִֽינְוֵ֖ה וּבֵ֣ין כָּ֑לַח הִ֖וא הָעִ֥יר הַגְּדֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: v'et-resen beyn niyn'veh vveyn kalach hiv ha'iyr hag'dolah
translation: and Resen between Nineveh and Calah, that is the great city.

hebrew: וּמִצְרַ֡יִם יָלַ֞ד אֶת־לוּדִ֧ים וְאֶת־עֲנָמִ֛ים וְאֶת־לְהָבִ֖ים וְאֶת־נַפְתֻּחִֽים׃
transliteration: vmitz'rayim yalad et-lvdiym v'et-'anamiym v'et-l'haviym v'et-naf'tuchiym
translation: And Mizraim begot the Ludim, the Anamim, the Lehabim, the Naphtuhim,

hebrew: וְֽאֶת־פַּתְרֻסִ֞ים וְאֶת־כַּסְלֻחִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצְא֥וּ מִשָּׁ֛ם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים וְאֶת־כַּפְתֹּרִֽים׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'et-pat'rusiym v'et-kas'luchiym asher yatz'v misham p'lish'tiym v'et-kaf'toriym (s)
translation: the Pathrusim, the Casluhim, and the Caphtorim,dI.e., the Cretans; moved up for the sake of clarity; cf. Amos 9.7. whence the Philistines came forth.

hebrew: וּכְנַ֗עַן יָלַ֛ד אֶת־צִידֹ֥ן בְּכֹר֖וֹ וְאֶת־חֵֽת׃
transliteration: vkh'na'an yalad et-tziydon b'khorvo v'et-chet
translation: Canaan begot Sidon, his first-born, and Heth;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַיְבוּסִי֙ וְאֶת־הָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י וְאֵ֖ת הַגִּרְגָּשִֽׁי׃
transliteration: v'et-hay'vvsiy v'et-haemoriy v'et hagir'gashiy
translation: and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַֽחִוִּ֥י וְאֶת־הַֽעַרְקִ֖י וְאֶת־הַסִּינִֽי׃
transliteration: v'et-hachiviy v'et-ha'ar'kiy v'et-hasiyniy
translation: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,

hebrew: וְאֶת־הָֽאַרְוָדִ֥י וְאֶת־הַצְּמָרִ֖י וְאֶת־הַֽחֲמָתִ֑י וְאַחַ֣ר נָפֹ֔צוּ מִשְׁפְּח֖וֹת הַֽכְּנַעֲנִֽי׃
transliteration: v'et-haar'vadiy v'et-hatz'mariy v'et-hachamatiy v'achar nafotzv mish'p'chvot hak'na'aniy
translation: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. Afterward the clans of the Canaanites spread out.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֞י גְּב֤וּל הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ מִצִּידֹ֔ן בֹּאֲכָ֥ה גְרָ֖רָה עַד־עַזָּ֑ה בֹּאֲכָ֞ה סְדֹ֧מָה וַעֲמֹרָ֛ה וְאַדְמָ֥ה וּצְבֹיִ֖ם עַד־לָֽשַׁע׃
transliteration: vay'hiy g'vvl hak'na'aniy mitziydon boakhah g'rarah 'ad-'azah boakhah s'domah va'amorah v'ad'mah vtz'voyim 'ad-lasha'
translation: (The [original] Canaanite territory extended from Sidon as far as Gerar, near Gaza, and as far as Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, near Lasha.)

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה בְנֵי־חָ֔ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לִלְשֹֽׁנֹתָ֑ם בְּאַרְצֹתָ֖ם בְּגוֹיֵהֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh v'ney-cham l'mish'p'chotam lil'shonotam b'ar'tzotam b'gvoyehem (s)
translation: These are the descendants of Ham, according to their clans and languages, by their lands and nations.

hebrew: וּלְשֵׁ֥ם יֻלַּ֖ד גַּם־ה֑וּא אֲבִי֙ כָּל־בְּנֵי־עֵ֔בֶר אֲחִ֖י יֶ֥פֶת הַגָּדֽוֹל׃
transliteration: vl'shem yulad gam-hv aviy kal-b'ney-'ever achiy yefet hagadvol
translation: Sons were also born to Shem, ancestor of all the descendants of Eber and older brother of Japheth.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י שֵׁ֖ם עֵילָ֣ם וְאַשּׁ֑וּר וְאַרְפַּכְשַׁ֖ד וְל֥וּד וַֽאֲרָֽם׃
transliteration: b'ney shem 'eylam v'ashvr v'ar'pakh'shad v'lvd vaaram
translation: The descendants of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י אֲרָ֑ם ע֥וּץ וְח֖וּל וְגֶ֥תֶר וָמַֽשׁ׃
transliteration: vv'ney aram 'vtz v'chvl v'geter vamash
translation: The descendants of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.

hebrew: וְאַרְפַּכְשַׁ֖ד יָלַ֣ד אֶת־שָׁ֑לַח וְשֶׁ֖לַח יָלַ֥ד אֶת־עֵֽבֶר׃
transliteration: v'ar'pakh'shad yalad et-shalach v'shelach yalad et-'ever
translation: Arpachshad begot Shelah, and Shelah begot Eber.

hebrew: וּלְעֵ֥בֶר יֻלַּ֖ד שְׁנֵ֣י בָנִ֑ים שֵׁ֣ם הָֽאֶחָ֞ד פֶּ֗לֶג כִּ֤י בְיָמָיו֙ נִפְלְגָ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ וְשֵׁ֥ם אָחִ֖יו יָקְטָֽן׃
transliteration: vl'ever yulad sh'ney vaniym shem haechad peleg kiy v'yamayv nif'l'gah haaretz v'shem achiyv yak'tan
translation: Two sons were born to Eber: the name of the first was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided;eHeb. niphlegah, play on “Peleg.” and the name of his brother was Joktan.

hebrew: וְיָקְטָ֣ן יָלַ֔ד אֶת־אַלְמוֹדָ֖ד וְאֶת־שָׁ֑לֶף וְאֶת־חֲצַרְמָ֖וֶת וְאֶת־יָֽרַח׃
transliteration: v'yak'tan yalad et-al'mvodad v'et-shalef v'et-chatzar'mavet v'et-yarach
translation: Joktan begot Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

hebrew: וְאֶת־הֲדוֹרָ֥ם וְאֶת־אוּזָ֖ל וְאֶת־דִּקְלָֽה׃
transliteration: v'et-hadvoram v'et-vzal v'et-dik'lah
translation: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

hebrew: וְאֶת־עוֹבָ֥ל וְאֶת־אֲבִֽימָאֵ֖ל וְאֶת־שְׁבָֽא׃
transliteration: v'et-'voval v'et-aviymael v'et-sh'va
translation: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

hebrew: וְאֶת־אוֹפִ֥ר וְאֶת־חֲוִילָ֖ה וְאֶת־יוֹבָ֑ב כָּל־אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י יָקְטָֽן׃
transliteration: v'et-vofir v'et-chaviylah v'et-yvovav kal-eleh b'ney yak'tan
translation: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab; all these were the descendants of Joktan.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֥י מוֹשָׁבָ֖ם מִמֵּשָׁ֑א בֹּאֲכָ֥ה סְפָ֖רָה הַ֥ר הַקֶּֽדֶם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy mvoshavam mimesha boakhah s'farah har hakedem
translation: Their settlements extended from Mesha as far as Sephar, the hill country to the east.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה בְנֵי־שֵׁ֔ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לִלְשֹׁנֹתָ֑ם בְּאַרְצֹתָ֖ם לְגוֹיֵהֶֽם׃
transliteration: eleh v'ney-shem l'mish'p'chotam lil'shonotam b'ar'tzotam l'gvoyehem
translation: These are the descendants of Shem according to their clans and languages, by their lands, according to their nations.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֧ת בְּנֵי־נֹ֛חַ לְתוֹלְדֹתָ֖ם בְּגוֹיֵהֶ֑ם וּמֵאֵ֜לֶּה נִפְרְד֧וּ הַגּוֹיִ֛ם בָּאָ֖רֶץ אַחַ֥ר הַמַּבּֽוּל׃ (פ)
transliteration: eleh mish'p'chot b'ney-nocha l'tvol'dotam b'gvoyehem vmeeleh nif'r'dv hagvoyim baaretz achar hamabvl (f)
translation: These are the groupings of Noah’s descendants, according to their origins, by their nations; and from these the nations branched out over the earth after the Flood.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֥י כָל־הָאָ֖רֶץ שָׂפָ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת וּדְבָרִ֖ים אֲחָדִֽים׃
transliteration: vay'hiy khal-haaretz safah echat vd'variym achadiym
translation: Everyone on earth had the same language and the same words.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֖י בְּנָסְעָ֣ם מִקֶּ֑דֶם וַֽיִּמְצְא֥וּ בִקְעָ֛ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ שִׁנְעָ֖ר וַיֵּ֥שְׁבוּ שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy b'nas'am mikedem vayim'tz'v vik'ah b'eretz shin'ar vayesh'vv sham
translation: And as they migrated from the east, they came upon a valley in the land of Shinar and settled there.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֗הוּ הָ֚בָה נִלְבְּנָ֣ה לְבֵנִ֔ים וְנִשְׂרְפָ֖ה לִשְׂרֵפָ֑ה וַתְּהִ֨י לָהֶ֤ם הַלְּבֵנָה֙ לְאָ֔בֶן וְהַ֣חֵמָ֔ר הָיָ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם לַחֹֽמֶר׃
transliteration: vayom'rv iysh el-re'ehv havah nil'b'nah l'veniym v'nis'r'fah lis'refah vat'hiy lahem hal'venah l'aven v'hachemar hayah lahem lachomer
translation: They said to one another, “Come, let us make bricks and burn them hard.”—Brick served them as stone, and bitumen served them as mortar.—

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ הָ֣בָה ׀ נִבְנֶה־לָּ֣נוּ עִ֗יר וּמִגְדָּל֙ וְרֹאשׁ֣וֹ בַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְנַֽעֲשֶׂה־לָּ֖נוּ שֵׁ֑ם פֶּן־נָפ֖וּץ עַל־פְּנֵ֥י כָל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vayom'rv havah  niv'neh-lanv 'iyr vmig'dal v'roshvo vashamayim v'na'aseh-lanv shem pen-nafvtz 'al-p'ney khal-haaretz
translation: And they said, “Come, let us build us a city, and a tower with its top in the sky, to make a name for ourselves; else we shall be scattered all over the world.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֣רֶד יְהוָ֔ה לִרְאֹ֥ת אֶת־הָעִ֖יר וְאֶת־הַמִּגְדָּ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנ֖וּ בְּנֵ֥י הָאָדָֽם׃
transliteration: vayered y'hvah lir'ot et-ha'iyr v'et-hamig'dal asher banv b'ney haadam
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> came down to look at the city and tower that man had built,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָ֗ה הֵ֣ן עַ֤ם אֶחָד֙ וְשָׂפָ֤ה אַחַת֙ לְכֻלָּ֔ם וְזֶ֖ה הַחִלָּ֣ם לַעֲשׂ֑וֹת וְעַתָּה֙ לֹֽא־יִבָּצֵ֣ר מֵהֶ֔ם כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָזְמ֖וּ לַֽעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah hen 'am echad v'safah achat l'khulam v'zeh hachilam la'asvot v'atah lo-yibatzer mehem kol asher yaz'mv la'asvot
translation: and the L<small>ORD</small> said, “If, as one people with one language for all, this is how they have begun to act, then nothing that they may propose to do will be out of their reach.

hebrew: הָ֚בָה נֵֽרְדָ֔ה וְנָבְלָ֥ה שָׁ֖ם שְׂפָתָ֑ם אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יִשְׁמְע֔וּ אִ֖ישׁ שְׂפַ֥ת רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: havah ner'dah v'nav'lah sham s'fatam asher lo yish'm'v iysh s'fat re'ehv
translation: Let us, then, go down and confound their speech there, so that they shall not understand one another’s speech.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֨פֶץ יְהוָ֥ה אֹתָ֛ם מִשָּׁ֖ם עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כָל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַֽיַּחְדְּל֖וּ לִבְנֹ֥ת הָעִֽיר׃
transliteration: vayafetz y'hvah otam misham 'al-p'ney khal-haaretz vayach'd'lv liv'not ha'iyr
translation: Thus the L<small>ORD</small> scattered them from there over the face of the whole earth; and they stopped building the city.

hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֞ן קָרָ֤א שְׁמָהּ֙ בָּבֶ֔ל כִּי־שָׁ֛ם בָּלַ֥ל יְהוָ֖ה שְׂפַ֣ת כָּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וּמִשָּׁם֙ הֱפִיצָ֣ם יְהוָ֔ה עַל־פְּנֵ֖י כָּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ (פ)
transliteration: 'al-ken kara sh'mah bavel kiy-sham balal y'hvah s'fat kal-haaretz vmisham hefiytzam y'hvah 'al-p'ney kal-haaretz (f)
translation: That is why it was called Babel,aI.e., “Babylon.” because there the LORD confoundedbHeb. balal “confound,” play on “Babel.” the speech of the whole earth; and from there the LORD scattered them over the face of the whole earth.

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת שֵׁ֔ם שֵׁ֚ם בֶּן־מְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֔ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־אַרְפַּכְשָׁ֑ד שְׁנָתַ֖יִם אַחַ֥ר הַמַּבּֽוּל׃
transliteration: eleh tvol'dot shem shem ben-m'at shanah vayvoled et-ar'pakh'shad sh'natayim achar hamabvl
translation: This is the line of Shem. Shem was 100 years old when he begot Arpachshad, two years after the Flood.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־שֵׁ֗ם אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־אַרְפַּכְשָׁ֔ד חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'chiy-shem acharey hvoliydvo et-ar'pakh'shad chamesh mevot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot (s)
translation: After the birth ofcLit. “After he begot,” and so throughout. Arpachshad, Shem lived 500 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וְאַרְפַּכְשַׁ֣ד חַ֔י חָמֵ֥שׁ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־שָֽׁלַח׃
transliteration: v'ar'pakh'shad chay chamesh vsh'loshiym shanah vayvoled et-shalach
translation: When Arpachshad had lived 35 years, he begot Shelah.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִ֣י אַרְפַּכְשַׁ֗ד אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־שֶׁ֔לַח שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'chiy ar'pakh'shad acharey hvoliydvo et-shelach shalosh shaniym v'ar'ba' mevot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot (s)
translation: After the birth of Shelah, Arpachshad lived 403 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וְשֶׁ֥לַח חַ֖י שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־עֵֽבֶר׃
transliteration: v'shelach chay sh'loshiym shanah vayvoled et-'ever
translation: When Shelah had lived 30 years, he begot Eber.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־שֶׁ֗לַח אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־עֵ֔בֶר שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'chiy-shelach acharey hvoliydvo et-'ever shalosh shaniym v'ar'ba' mevot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot (s)
translation: After the birth of Eber, Shelah lived 403 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־עֵ֕בֶר אַרְבַּ֥ע וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־פָּֽלֶג׃
transliteration: vay'chiy-'ever ar'ba' vsh'loshiym shanah vayvoled et-paleg
translation: When Eber had lived 34 years, he begot Peleg.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־עֵ֗בֶר אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־פֶּ֔לֶג שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'chiy-'ever acharey hvoliydvo et-peleg sh'loshiym shanah v'ar'ba' mevot shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot (s)
translation: After the birth of Peleg, Eber lived 430 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־פֶ֖לֶג שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־רְעֽוּ׃
transliteration: vay'chiy-feleg sh'loshiym shanah vayvoled et-r'v
translation: When Peleg had lived 30 years, he begot Reu.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־פֶ֗לֶג אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־רְע֔וּ תֵּ֥שַׁע שָׁנִ֖ים וּמָאתַ֣יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'chiy-feleg acharey hvoliydvo et-r'v tesha' shaniym vmatayim shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot (s)
translation: After the birth of Reu, Peleg lived 209 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י רְע֔וּ שְׁתַּ֥יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־שְׂרֽוּג׃
transliteration: vay'chiy r'v sh'tayim vsh'loshiym shanah vayvoled et-s'rvg
translation: When Reu had lived 32 years, he begot Serug.

hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י רְע֗וּ אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־שְׂר֔וּג שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים וּמָאתַ֣יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'chiy r'v acharey hvoliydvo et-s'rvg sheva' shaniym vmatayim shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot (s)
translation: After the birth of Serug, Reu lived 207 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַיְחִ֥י שְׂר֖וּג שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־נָחֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vay'chiy s'rvg sh'loshiym shanah vayvoled et-nachvor
translation: When Serug had lived 30 years, he begot Nahor.

hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י שְׂר֗וּג אַחֲרֵ֛י הוֹלִיד֥וֹ אֶת־נָח֖וֹר מָאתַ֣יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'chiy s'rvg acharey hvoliydvo et-nachvor matayim shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot (s)
translation: After the birth of Nahor, Serug lived 200 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י נָח֔וֹר תֵּ֥שַׁע וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־תָּֽרַח׃
transliteration: vay'chiy nachvor tesha' v'es'riym shanah vayvoled et-tarach
translation: When Nahor had lived 29 years, he begot Terah.

hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י נָח֗וֹר אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־תֶּ֔רַח תְּשַֽׁע־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה שָׁנָ֖ה וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'chiy nachvor acharey hvoliydvo et-terach t'sha'-'es'reh shanah vm'at shanah vayvoled baniym vvanvot (s)
translation: After the birth of Terah, Nahor lived 119 years and begot sons and daughters.

hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־תֶ֖רַח שִׁבְעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֙וֹלֶד֙ אֶת־אַבְרָ֔ם אֶת־נָח֖וֹר וְאֶת־הָרָֽן׃
transliteration: vay'chiy-terach shiv'iym shanah vayvoled et-av'ram et-nachvor v'et-haran
translation: When Terah had lived 70 years, he begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת תֶּ֔רַח תֶּ֚רַח הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־אַבְרָ֔ם אֶת־נָח֖וֹר וְאֶת־הָרָ֑ן וְהָרָ֖ן הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־לֽוֹט׃
transliteration: v'eleh tvol'dot terach terach hvoliyd et-av'ram et-nachvor v'et-haran v'haran hvoliyd et-lvot
translation: Now this is the line of Terah: Terah begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begot Lot.

hebrew: וַיָּ֣מָת הָרָ֔ן עַל־פְּנֵ֖י תֶּ֣רַח אָבִ֑יו בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מוֹלַדְתּ֖וֹ בְּא֥וּר כַּשְׂדִּֽים׃
transliteration: vayamat haran 'al-p'ney terach aviyv b'eretz mvolad'tvo b'vr kas'diym
translation: Haran died in the lifetime of his father Terah, in his native land, Ur of the Chaldeans.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַבְרָ֧ם וְנָח֛וֹר לָהֶ֖ם נָשִׁ֑ים שֵׁ֤ם אֵֽשֶׁת־אַבְרָם֙ שָׂרָ֔י וְשֵׁ֤ם אֵֽשֶׁת־נָחוֹר֙ מִלְכָּ֔ה בַּת־הָרָ֥ן אֲבִֽי־מִלְכָּ֖ה וַֽאֲבִ֥י יִסְכָּֽה׃
transliteration: vayikach av'ram v'nachvor lahem nashiym shem eshet-av'ram saray v'shem eshet-nachvor mil'kah bat-haran aviy-mil'kah vaaviy yis'kah
translation: Abram and Nahor took to themselves wives, the name of Abram’s wife being Sarai and that of Nahor’s wife Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah and Iscah.

hebrew: וַתְּהִ֥י שָׂרַ֖י עֲקָרָ֑ה אֵ֥ין לָ֖הּ וָלָֽד׃
transliteration: vat'hiy saray 'akarah eyn lah valad
translation: Now Sarai was barren, she had no child.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח תֶּ֜רַח אֶת־אַבְרָ֣ם בְּנ֗וֹ וְאֶת־ל֤וֹט בֶּן־הָרָן֙ בֶּן־בְּנ֔וֹ וְאֵת֙ שָׂרַ֣י כַּלָּת֔וֹ אֵ֖שֶׁת אַבְרָ֣ם בְּנ֑וֹ וַיֵּצְא֨וּ אִתָּ֜ם מֵא֣וּר כַּשְׂדִּ֗ים לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ אַ֣רְצָה כְּנַ֔עַן וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ עַד־חָרָ֖ן וַיֵּ֥שְׁבוּ שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayikach terach et-av'ram b'nvo v'et-lvot ben-haran ben-b'nvo v'et saray kalatvo eshet av'ram b'nvo vayetz'v itam mevr kas'diym lalekhet ar'tzah k'na'an vayavov 'ad-charan vayesh'vv sham
translation: Terah took his son Abram, his grandson Lot the son of Haran, and his daughter-in-law Sarai, the wife of his son Abram, and they set out together from Ur of the Chaldeans for the land of Canaan; but when they had come as far as Haran, they settled there.

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ יְמֵי־תֶ֔רַח חָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים וּמָאתַ֣יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּ֥מָת תֶּ֖רַח בְּחָרָֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayih'yv y'mey-terach chamesh shaniym vmatayim shanah vayamat terach b'charan (s)
translation: The days of Terah came to 205 years; and Terah died in Haran.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־אַבְרָ֔ם לֶךְ־לְךָ֛ מֵאַרְצְךָ֥ וּמִמּֽוֹלַדְתְּךָ֖ וּמִבֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑יךָ אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַרְאֶֽךָּ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-av'ram lekh'-l'kha mear'tz'kha vmimvolad't'kha vmibeyt aviykha el-haaretz asher ar'eka
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Abram, “Go forth from your native land and from your father’s house to the land that I will show you.

hebrew: וְאֶֽעֶשְׂךָ֙ לְג֣וֹי גָּד֔וֹל וַאֲבָ֣רֶכְךָ֔ וַאֲגַדְּלָ֖ה שְׁמֶ֑ךָ וֶהְיֵ֖ה בְּרָכָֽה׃
transliteration: v'e'es'kha l'gvoy gadvol vaavarekh'kha vaagad'lah sh'mekha veh'yeh b'rakhah
translation:
I will make of you a great nation,
And I will bless you;
I will make your name great,
And you shall be a blessing.aI.e., a standard by which blessing is invoked; cf. v. 3 end.

hebrew: וַאֲבָֽרֲכָה֙ מְבָ֣רְכֶ֔יךָ וּמְקַלֶּלְךָ֖ אָאֹ֑ר וְנִבְרְכ֣וּ בְךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
transliteration: vaavarakhah m'var'kheykha vm'kalel'kha aor v'niv'r'khv v'kha kol mish'p'chot haadamah
translation:
I will bless those who bless you
And curse him that curses you;
And all the families of the earth
Shall bless themselves by you.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ אַבְרָ֗ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר אֵלָיו֙ יְהוָ֔ה וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ אִתּ֖וֹ ל֑וֹט וְאַבְרָ֗ם בֶּן־חָמֵ֤שׁ שָׁנִים֙ וְשִׁבְעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּצֵאת֖וֹ מֵחָרָֽן׃
transliteration: vayelekh' av'ram kaasher diber elayv y'hvah vayelekh' itvo lvot v'av'ram ben-chamesh shaniym v'shiv'iym shanah b'tzetvo mecharan
translation: Abram went forth as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded him, and Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he left Haran.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח אַבְרָם֩ אֶת־שָׂרַ֨י אִשְׁתּ֜וֹ וְאֶת־ל֣וֹט בֶּן־אָחִ֗יו וְאֶת־כָּל־רְכוּשָׁם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָכָ֔שׁוּ וְאֶת־הַנֶּ֖פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֣וּ בְחָרָ֑ן וַיֵּצְא֗וּ לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ אַ֣רְצָה כְּנַ֔עַן וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אַ֥רְצָה כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: vayikach av'ram et-saray ish'tvo v'et-lvot ben-achiyv v'et-kal-r'khvsham asher rakhashv v'et-hanefesh asher-'asv v'charan vayetz'v lalekhet ar'tzah k'na'an vayavov ar'tzah k'na'an
translation: Abram took his wife Sarai and his brother’s son Lot, and all the wealth that they had amassed, and the persons that they had acquired in Haran; and they set out for the land of Canaan. When they arrived in the land of Canaan,

hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ר אַבְרָם֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ עַ֚ד מְק֣וֹם שְׁכֶ֔ם עַ֖ד אֵל֣וֹן מוֹרֶ֑ה וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י אָ֥ז בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vaya'avor av'ram baaretz 'ad m'kvom sh'khem 'ad elvon mvoreh v'hak'na'aniy az baaretz
translation: Abram passed through the land as far as the site of Shechem, at the terebinth of Moreh. The Canaanites were then in the land.

hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֤א יְהוָה֙ אֶל־אַבְרָ֔ם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לְזַ֨רְעֲךָ֔ אֶתֵּ֖ן אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את וַיִּ֤בֶן שָׁם֙ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ לַיהוָ֖ה הַנִּרְאֶ֥ה אֵלָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayera y'hvah el-av'ram vayomer l'zar'akha eten et-haaretz hazot vayiven sham miz'becha layhvah hanir'eh elayv
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> appeared to Abram and said, “I will assign this land to your offspring.” And he built an altar there to the L<small>ORD</small> who had appeared to him.

hebrew: וַיַּעְתֵּ֨ק מִשָּׁ֜ם הָהָ֗רָה מִקֶּ֛דֶם לְבֵֽית־אֵ֖ל וַיֵּ֣ט אָהֳלֹ֑ה בֵּֽית־אֵ֤ל מִיָּם֙ וְהָעַ֣י מִקֶּ֔דֶם וַיִּֽבֶן־שָׁ֤ם מִזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה וַיִּקְרָ֖א בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'tek misham haharah mikedem l'veyt-el vayet aholoh beyt-el miyam v'ha'ay mikedem vayiven-sham miz'becha layhvah vayik'ra b'shem y'hvah
translation: From there he moved on to the hill country east of Bethel and pitched his tent, with Bethel on the west and Ai on the east; and he built there an altar to the L<small>ORD</small> and invoked the L<small>ORD</small> by name.

hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֣ע אַבְרָ֔ם הָל֥וֹךְ וְנָס֖וֹעַ הַנֶּֽגְבָּה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayisa' av'ram halvokh' v'nasvo'a haneg'bah (f)
translation: Then Abram journeyed by stages toward the Negeb.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י רָעָ֖ב בָּאָ֑רֶץ וַיֵּ֨רֶד אַבְרָ֤ם מִצְרַ֙יְמָה֙ לָג֣וּר שָׁ֔ם כִּֽי־כָבֵ֥ד הָרָעָ֖ב בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy ra'av baaretz vayered av'ram mitz'ray'mah lagvr sham kiy-khaved hara'av baaretz
translation: There was a famine in the land, and Abram went down to Egypt to sojourn there, for the famine was severe in the land.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הִקְרִ֖יב לָב֣וֹא מִצְרָ֑יְמָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־שָׂרַ֣י אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ הִנֵּה־נָ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֛י אִשָּׁ֥ה יְפַת־מַרְאֶ֖ה אָֽתְּ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kaasher hik'riyv lavvo mitz'ray'mah vayomer el-saray ish'tvo hineh-na yada'tiy kiy ishah y'fat-mar'eh at'
translation: As he was about to enter Egypt, he said to his wife Sarai, “IbOr “You”; cf. the second person feminine form -ti in Judg. 5.7; Jer. 2.20; Mic. 4.13, etc. know what a beautiful woman you are.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּֽי־יִרְא֤וּ אֹתָךְ֙ הַמִּצְרִ֔ים וְאָמְר֖וּ אִשְׁתּ֣וֹ זֹ֑את וְהָרְג֥וּ אֹתִ֖י וְאֹתָ֥ךְ יְחַיּֽוּ׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy-yir'v otakh' hamitz'riym v'am'rv ish'tvo zot v'har'gv otiy v'otakh' y'chayv
translation: If the Egyptians see you, and think, ‘She is his wife,’ they will kill me and let you live.

hebrew: אִמְרִי־נָ֖א אֲחֹ֣תִי אָ֑תְּ לְמַ֙עַן֙ יִֽיטַב־לִ֣י בַעֲבוּרֵ֔ךְ וְחָיְתָ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֖י בִּגְלָלֵֽךְ׃
transliteration: im'riy-na achotiy at' l'ma'an yiytav-liy va'avvrekh' v'chay'tah naf'shiy big'lalekh'
translation: Please say that you are my sister, that it may go well with me because of you, and that I may remain alive thanks to you.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כְּב֥וֹא אַבְרָ֖ם מִצְרָ֑יְמָה וַיִּרְא֤וּ הַמִּצְרִים֙ אֶת־הָ֣אִשָּׁ֔ה כִּֽי־יָפָ֥ה הִ֖וא מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: vay'hiy k'vvo av'ram mitz'ray'mah vayir'v hamitz'riym et-haishah kiy-yafah hiv m'od
translation: When Abram entered Egypt, the Egyptians saw how very beautiful the woman was.

hebrew: וַיִּרְא֤וּ אֹתָהּ֙ שָׂרֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וַיְהַֽלְל֥וּ אֹתָ֖הּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַתֻּקַּ֥ח הָאִשָּׁ֖ה בֵּ֥ית פַּרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayir'v otah sarey far'oh vay'hal'lv otah el-par'oh vatukach haishah beyt par'oh
translation: Pharaoh’s courtiers saw her and praised her to Pharaoh, and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s palace.

hebrew: וּלְאַבְרָ֥ם הֵיטִ֖יב בַּעֲבוּרָ֑הּ וַֽיְהִי־ל֤וֹ צֹאן־וּבָקָר֙ וַחֲמֹרִ֔ים וַעֲבָדִים֙ וּשְׁפָחֹ֔ת וַאֲתֹנֹ֖ת וּגְמַלִּֽים׃
transliteration: vl'av'ram heytiyv ba'avvrah vay'hiy-lvo tzon-vvakar vachamoriym va'avadiym vsh'fachot vaatonot vg'maliym
translation: And because of her, it went well with Abram; he acquired sheep, oxen, asses, male and female slaves, she-asses, and camels.

hebrew: וַיְנַגַּ֨ע יְהוָ֧ה ׀ אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֛ה נְגָעִ֥ים גְּדֹלִ֖ים וְאֶת־בֵּית֑וֹ עַל־דְּבַ֥ר שָׂרַ֖י אֵ֥שֶׁת אַבְרָֽם׃
transliteration: vay'naga' y'hvah  et-par'oh n'ga'iym g'doliym v'et-beytvo 'al-d'var saray eshet av'ram
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> afflicted Pharaoh and his household with mighty plagues on account of Sarai, the wife of Abram.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א פַרְעֹה֙ לְאַבְרָ֔ם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מַה־זֹּ֖את עָשִׂ֣יתָ לִּ֑י לָ֚מָּה לֹא־הִגַּ֣דְתָּ לִּ֔י כִּ֥י אִשְׁתְּךָ֖ הִֽוא׃
transliteration: vayik'ra far'oh l'av'ram vayomer mah-zot 'asiyta liy lamah lo-higad'ta liy kiy ish't'kha hiv
translation: Pharaoh sent for Abram and said, “What is this you have done to me! Why did you not tell me that she was your wife?

hebrew: לָמָ֤ה אָמַ֙רְתָּ֙ אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֔וא וָאֶקַּ֥ח אֹתָ֛הּ לִ֖י לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וְעַתָּ֕ה הִנֵּ֥ה אִשְׁתְּךָ֖ קַ֥ח וָלֵֽךְ׃
transliteration: lamah amar'ta achotiy hiv vaekach otah liy l'ishah v'atah hineh ish't'kha kach valekh'
translation: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister,’ so that I took her as my wife? Now, here is your wife; take her and begone!”

hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ו עָלָ֛יו פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וַֽיְשַׁלְּח֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ וְאֶת־אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ וְאֶת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vay'tzav 'alayv par'oh anashiym vay'shal'chv otvo v'et-ish'tvo v'et-kal-asher-lvo
translation: And Pharaoh put men in charge of him, and they sent him off with his wife and all that he possessed.

hebrew: וַיַּעַל֩ אַבְרָ֨ם מִמִּצְרַ֜יִם ה֠וּא וְאִשְׁתּ֧וֹ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֛וֹ וְל֥וֹט עִמּ֖וֹ הַנֶּֽגְבָּה׃
transliteration: vaya'al av'ram mimitz'rayim hv v'ish'tvo v'khal-asher-lvo v'lvot 'imvo haneg'bah
translation: From Egypt, Abram went up into the Negeb, with his wife and all that he possessed, together with Lot.

hebrew: וְאַבְרָ֖ם כָּבֵ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד בַּמִּקְנֶ֕ה בַּכֶּ֖סֶף וּבַזָּהָֽב׃
transliteration: v'av'ram kaved m'od bamik'neh bakesef vvazahav
translation: Now Abram was very rich in cattle, silver, and gold.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ לְמַסָּעָ֔יו מִנֶּ֖גֶב וְעַד־בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל עַד־הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁר־הָ֨יָה שָׁ֤ם אהלה [אָֽהֳלוֹ֙] בַּתְּחִלָּ֔ה בֵּ֥ין בֵּֽית־אֵ֖ל וּבֵ֥ין הָעָֽי׃
transliteration: vayelekh' l'masa'ayv minegev v'ad-beyt-el 'ad-hamakvom asher-hayah sham hlh [aholvo] bat'chilah beyn beyt-el vveyn ha'ay
translation: And he proceeded by stages from the Negeb as far as Bethel, to the place where his tent had been formerly, between Bethel and Ai,

hebrew: אֶל־מְקוֹם֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ אֲשֶׁר־עָ֥שָׂה שָׁ֖ם בָּרִאשֹׁנָ֑ה וַיִּקְרָ֥א שָׁ֛ם אַבְרָ֖ם בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: el-m'kvom hamiz'becha asher-'asah sham barishonah vayik'ra sham av'ram b'shem y'hvah
translation: the site of the altar that he had built there at first; and there Abram invoked the L<small>ORD</small> by name.

hebrew: וְגַם־לְל֔וֹט הַהֹלֵ֖ךְ אֶת־אַבְרָ֑ם הָיָ֥ה צֹאן־וּבָקָ֖ר וְאֹהָלִֽים׃
transliteration: v'gam-l'lvot haholekh' et-av'ram hayah tzon-vvakar v'ohaliym
translation: Lot, who went with Abram, also had flocks and herds and tents,

hebrew: וְלֹא־נָשָׂ֥א אֹתָ֛ם הָאָ֖רֶץ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת יַחְדָּ֑ו כִּֽי־הָיָ֤ה רְכוּשָׁם֙ רָ֔ב וְלֹ֥א יָֽכְל֖וּ לָשֶׁ֥בֶת יַחְדָּֽו׃
transliteration: v'lo-nasa otam haaretz lashevet yach'dav kiy-hayah r'khvsham rav v'lo yakh'lv lashevet yach'dav
translation: so that the land could not support them staying together; for their possessions were so great that they could not remain together.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־רִ֗יב בֵּ֚ין רֹעֵ֣י מִקְנֵֽה־אַבְרָ֔ם וּבֵ֖ין רֹעֵ֣י מִקְנֵה־ל֑וֹט וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י אָ֖ז יֹשֵׁ֥ב בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy-riyv beyn ro'ey mik'neh-av'ram vveyn ro'ey mik'neh-lvot v'hak'na'aniy v'hap'riziy az yoshev baaretz
translation: And there was quarreling between the herdsmen of Abram’s cattle and those of Lot’s cattle.—The Canaanites and Perizzites were then dwelling in the land.—

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אַבְרָ֜ם אֶל־ל֗וֹט אַל־נָ֨א תְהִ֤י מְרִיבָה֙ בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֔יךָ וּבֵ֥ין רֹעַ֖י וּבֵ֣ין רֹעֶ֑יךָ כִּֽי־אֲנָשִׁ֥ים אַחִ֖ים אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer av'ram el-lvot al-na t'hiy m'riyvah beyniy vveyneykha vveyn ro'ay vveyn ro'eykha kiy-anashiym achiym anach'nv
translation: Abram said to Lot, “Let there be no strife between you and me, between my herdsmen and yours, for we are kinsmen.

hebrew: הֲלֹ֤א כָל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ הִפָּ֥רֶד נָ֖א מֵעָלָ֑י אִם־הַשְּׂמֹ֣אל וְאֵימִ֔נָה וְאִם־הַיָּמִ֖ין וְאַשְׂמְאִֽילָה׃
transliteration: halo khal-haaretz l'faneykha hipared na me'alay im-has'mol v'eyminah v'im-hayamiyn v'as'm'iylah
translation: Is not the whole land before you? Let us separate:aLit. “Please separate from me.” if you go north, I will go south; and if you go south, I will go north.”

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂא־ל֣וֹט אֶת־עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־כָּל־כִּכַּ֣ר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן כִּ֥י כֻלָּ֖הּ מַשְׁקֶ֑ה לִפְנֵ֣י ׀ שַׁחֵ֣ת יְהוָ֗ה אֶת־סְדֹם֙ וְאֶת־עֲמֹרָ֔ה כְּגַן־יְהוָה֙ כְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בֹּאֲכָ֖ה צֹֽעַר׃
transliteration: vayisa-lvot et-'eynayv vayar' et-kal-kikar hayar'den kiy khulah mash'keh lif'ney  shachet y'hvah et-s'dom v'et-'amorah k'gan-y'hvah k'eretz mitz'rayim boakhah tzo'ar
translation: Lot looked about him and saw how well watered was the whole plain of the Jordan, all of it—this was before the L<small>ORD</small> had destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah—all the way to Zoar, like the garden of the L<small>ORD</small>, like the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וַיִּבְחַר־ל֣וֹ ל֗וֹט אֵ֚ת כָּל־כִּכַּ֣ר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וַיִּסַּ֥ע ל֖וֹט מִקֶּ֑דֶם וַיִּפָּ֣רְד֔וּ אִ֖ישׁ מֵעַ֥ל אָחִֽיו׃
transliteration: vayiv'char-lvo lvot et kal-kikar hayar'den vayisa' lvot mikedem vayipar'dv iysh me'al achiyv
translation: So Lot chose for himself the whole plain of the Jordan, and Lot journeyed eastward. Thus they parted from each other;

hebrew: אַבְרָ֖ם יָשַׁ֣ב בְּאֶֽרֶץ־כְּנָ֑עַן וְל֗וֹט יָשַׁב֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י הַכִּכָּ֔ר וַיֶּאֱהַ֖ל עַד־סְדֹֽם׃
transliteration: av'ram yashav b'eretz-k'na'an v'lvot yashav b'arey hakikar vayeehal 'ad-s'dom
translation: Abram remained in the land of Canaan, while Lot settled in the cities of the Plain, pitching his tents near Sodom.

hebrew: וְאַנְשֵׁ֣י סְדֹ֔ם רָעִ֖ים וְחַטָּאִ֑ים לַיהוָ֖ה מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: v'an'shey s'dom ra'iym v'chataiym layhvah m'od
translation: Now the inhabitants of Sodom were very wicked sinners against the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַֽיהוָ֞ה אָמַ֣ר אֶל־אַבְרָ֗ם אַחֲרֵי֙ הִפָּֽרֶד־ל֣וֹט מֵֽעִמּ֔וֹ שָׂ֣א נָ֤א עֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ וּרְאֵ֔ה מִן־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֣ה שָׁ֑ם צָפֹ֥נָה וָנֶ֖גְבָּה וָקֵ֥דְמָה וָיָֽמָּה׃
transliteration: vayhvah amar el-av'ram acharey hipared-lvot me'imvo sa na 'eyneykha vr'eh min-hamakvom asher-atah sham tzafonah vaneg'bah vaked'mah vayamah
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Abram, after Lot had parted from him, “Raise your eyes and look out from where you are, to the north and south, to the east and west,

hebrew: כִּ֧י אֶת־כָּל־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה רֹאֶ֖ה לְךָ֣ אֶתְּנֶ֑נָּה וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֖ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: kiy et-kal-haaretz asher-atah roeh l'kha et'nenah vl'zar'akha 'ad-'volam
translation: for I give all the land that you see to you and your offspring forever.

hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֥י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֖ כַּעֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ אִם־יוּכַ֣ל אִ֗ישׁ לִמְנוֹת֙ אֶת־עֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֔רֶץ גַּֽם־זַרְעֲךָ֖ יִמָּנֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'sam'tiy et-zar'akha ka'afar haaretz asher  im-yvkhal iysh lim'nvot et-'afar haaretz gam-zar'akha yimaneh
translation: I will make your offspring as the dust of the earth, so that if one can count the dust of the earth, then your offspring too can be counted.

hebrew: ק֚וּם הִתְהַלֵּ֣ךְ בָּאָ֔רֶץ לְאָרְכָּ֖הּ וּלְרָחְבָּ֑הּ כִּ֥י לְךָ֖ אֶתְּנֶֽנָּה׃
transliteration: kvm hit'halekh' baaretz l'ar'kah vl'rach'bah kiy l'kha et'nenah
translation: Up, walk about the land, through its length and its breadth, for I give it to you.”

hebrew: וַיֶּאֱהַ֣ל אַבְרָ֗ם וַיָּבֹ֛א וַיֵּ֛שֶׁב בְּאֵלֹנֵ֥י מַמְרֵ֖א אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּחֶבְר֑וֹן וַיִּֽבֶן־שָׁ֥ם מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לַֽיהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayeehal av'ram vayavo vayeshev b'eloney mam're asher b'chev'rvon vayiven-sham miz'becha layhvah (f)
translation: And Abram moved his tent, and came to dwell at the terebinths of Mamre, which are in Hebron; and he built an altar there to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בִּימֵי֙ אַמְרָפֶ֣ל מֶֽלֶךְ־שִׁנְעָ֔ר אַרְי֖וֹךְ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֶלָּסָ֑ר כְּדָרְלָעֹ֙מֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ עֵילָ֔ם וְתִדְעָ֖ל מֶ֥לֶךְ גּוֹיִֽם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy biymey am'rafel melekh'-shin'ar ar'yvokh' melekh' elasar k'dar'la'omer melekh' 'eylam v'tid'al melekh' gvoyim
translation: Now, when King Amraphel of Shinar, King Arioch of Ellasar, King Chedorlaomer of Elam, and King Tidal of Goiim

hebrew: עָשׂ֣וּ מִלְחָמָ֗ה אֶת־בֶּ֙רַע֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ סְדֹ֔ם וְאֶת־בִּרְשַׁ֖ע מֶ֣לֶךְ עֲמֹרָ֑ה שִׁנְאָ֣ב ׀ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַדְמָ֗ה וְשֶׁמְאֵ֙בֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ צביים [צְבוֹיִ֔ים] וּמֶ֥לֶךְ בֶּ֖לַע הִיא־צֹֽעַר׃
transliteration: 'asv mil'chamah et-bera' melekh' s'dom v'et-bir'sha' melekh' 'amorah shin'av  melekh' ad'mah v'shem'ever melekh' tzvyym [tz'vvoyiym] vmelekh' bela' hiy-tzo'ar
translation: made war on King Bera of Sodom, King Birsha of Gomorrah, King Shinab of Admah, King Shemeber of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar,

hebrew: כָּל־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ חָֽבְר֔וּ אֶל־עֵ֖מֶק הַשִּׂדִּ֑ים ה֖וּא יָ֥ם הַמֶּֽלַח׃
transliteration: kal-eleh chav'rv el-'emek hasidiym hv yam hamelach
translation: all the latter joined forces at the Valley of Siddim, now the Dead Sea.aHeb. “Salt Sea.”

hebrew: שְׁתֵּ֤ים עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה עָבְד֖וּ אֶת־כְּדָרְלָעֹ֑מֶר וּשְׁלֹשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה שָׁנָ֖ה מָרָֽדוּ׃
transliteration: sh'teym 'es'reh shanah 'av'dv et-k'dar'la'omer vsh'losh-'es'reh shanah maradv
translation: Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled.

hebrew: וּבְאַרְבַּע֩ עֶשְׂרֵ֨ה שָׁנָ֜ה בָּ֣א כְדָרְלָעֹ֗מֶר וְהַמְּלָכִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ וַיַּכּ֤וּ אֶת־רְפָאִים֙ בְּעַשְׁתְּרֹ֣ת קַרְנַ֔יִם וְאֶת־הַזּוּזִ֖ים בְּהָ֑ם וְאֵת֙ הָֽאֵימִ֔ים בְּשָׁוֵ֖ה קִרְיָתָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vv'ar'ba' 'es'reh shanah ba kh'dar'la'omer v'ham'lakhiym asher itvo vayakv et-r'faiym b'ash't'rot kar'nayim v'et-hazvziym b'ham v'et haeymiym b'shaveh kir'yatayim
translation: In the fourteenth year Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him came and defeated the Rephaim at Ashteroth-karnaim, the Zuzim at Ham, the Emim at Shaveh-kiriathaim,

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַחֹרִ֖י בְּהַרְרָ֣ם שֵׂעִ֑יר עַ֚ד אֵ֣יל פָּארָ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
transliteration: v'et-hachoriy b'har'ram se'iyr 'ad eyl paran asher 'al-hamid'bar
translation: and the Horites in their hill country of Seir as far as El-paran, which is by the wilderness.

hebrew: וַ֠יָּשֻׁבוּ וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ אֶל־עֵ֤ין מִשְׁפָּט֙ הִ֣וא קָדֵ֔שׁ וַיַּכּ֕וּ אֶֽת־כָּל־שְׂדֵ֖ה הָעֲמָלֵקִ֑י וְגַם֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י הַיֹּשֵׁ֖ב בְּחַֽצְצֹ֥ן תָּמָֽר׃
transliteration: vayashuvv vayavov el-'eyn mish'pat hiv kadesh vayakv et-kal-s'deh ha'amalekiy v'gam et-haemoriy hayoshev b'chatz'tzon tamar
translation: On their way back they came to En-mishpat, which is Kadesh, and subdued all the territory of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites who dwelt in Hazazon-tamar.

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א מֶֽלֶךְ־סְדֹ֜ם וּמֶ֣לֶךְ עֲמֹרָ֗ה וּמֶ֤לֶךְ אַדְמָה֙ וּמֶ֣לֶךְ צביים [צְבוֹיִ֔ם] וּמֶ֥לֶךְ בֶּ֖לַע הִוא־צֹ֑עַר וַיַּֽעַרְכ֤וּ אִתָּם֙ מִלְחָמָ֔ה בְּעֵ֖מֶק הַשִּׂדִּֽים׃
transliteration: vayetze melekh'-s'dom vmelekh' 'amorah vmelekh' ad'mah vmelekh' tzvyym [tz'vvoyim] vmelekh' bela' hiv-tzo'ar vaya'ar'khv itam mil'chamah b'emek hasidiym
translation: Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar, went forth and engaged them in battle in the Valley of Siddim:

hebrew: אֵ֣ת כְּדָרְלָעֹ֜מֶר מֶ֣לֶךְ עֵילָ֗ם וְתִדְעָל֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ גּוֹיִ֔ם וְאַמְרָפֶל֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ שִׁנְעָ֔ר וְאַרְי֖וֹךְ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֶלָּסָ֑ר אַרְבָּעָ֥ה מְלָכִ֖ים אֶת־הַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: et k'dar'la'omer melekh' 'eylam v'tid'al melekh' gvoyim v'am'rafel melekh' shin'ar v'ar'yvokh' melekh' elasar ar'ba'ah m'lakhiym et-hachamishah
translation: King Chedorlaomer of Elam, King Tidal of Goiim, King Amraphel of Shinar, and King Arioch of Ellasar—four kings against those five.

hebrew: וְעֵ֣מֶק הַשִׂדִּ֗ים בֶּֽאֱרֹ֤ת בֶּאֱרֹת֙ חֵמָ֔ר וַיָּנֻ֛סוּ מֶֽלֶךְ־סְדֹ֥ם וַעֲמֹרָ֖ה וַיִּפְּלוּ־שָׁ֑מָּה וְהַנִּשְׁאָרִ֖ים הֶ֥רָה נָּֽסוּ׃
transliteration: v'emek hasidiym beerot beerot chemar vayanusv melekh'-s'dom va'amorah vayip'lv-shamah v'hanish'ariym herah nasv
translation: Now the Valley of Siddim was dotted with bitumen pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah, in their flight, threw themselves into them, while the rest escaped to the hill country.

hebrew: וַ֠יִּקְחוּ אֶת־כָּל־רְכֻ֨שׁ סְדֹ֧ם וַעֲמֹרָ֛ה וְאֶת־כָּל־אָכְלָ֖ם וַיֵּלֵֽכוּ׃
transliteration: vayik'chv et-kal-r'khush s'dom va'amorah v'et-kal-akh'lam vayelekhv
translation: [The invaders] seized all the wealth of Sodom and Gomorrah and all their provisions, and went their way.

hebrew: וַיִּקְח֨וּ אֶת־ל֧וֹט וְאֶת־רְכֻשׁ֛וֹ בֶּן־אֲחִ֥י אַבְרָ֖ם וַיֵּלֵ֑כוּ וְה֥וּא יֹשֵׁ֖ב בִּסְדֹֽם׃
transliteration: vayik'chv et-lvot v'et-r'khushvo ben-achiy av'ram vayelekhv v'hv yoshev bis'dom
translation: They also took Lot, the son of Abram’s brother, and his possessions, and departed; for he had settled in Sodom.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ הַפָּלִ֔יט וַיַּגֵּ֖ד לְאַבְרָ֣ם הָעִבְרִ֑י וְהוּא֩ שֹׁכֵ֨ן בְּאֵֽלֹנֵ֜י מַמְרֵ֣א הָאֱמֹרִ֗י אֲחִ֤י אֶשְׁכֹּל֙ וַאֲחִ֣י עָנֵ֔ר וְהֵ֖ם בַּעֲלֵ֥י בְרִית־אַבְרָֽם׃
transliteration: vayavo hapaliyt vayaged l'av'ram ha'iv'riy v'hv shokhen b'eloney mam're haemoriy achiy esh'kol vaachiy 'aner v'hem ba'aley v'riyt-av'ram
translation: A fugitive brought the news to Abram the Hebrew, who was dwelling at the terebinths of Mamre the Amorite, kinsman of Eshkol and Aner, these being Abram’s allies.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע אַבְרָ֔ם כִּ֥י נִשְׁבָּ֖ה אָחִ֑יו וַיָּ֨רֶק אֶת־חֲנִיכָ֜יו יְלִידֵ֣י בֵית֗וֹ שְׁמֹנָ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ וּשְׁלֹ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת וַיִּרְדֹּ֖ף עַד־דָּֽן׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' av'ram kiy nish'bah achiyv vayarek et-chaniykhayv y'liydey veytvo sh'monah 'asar vsh'losh mevot vayir'dof 'ad-dan
translation: When Abram heard that his kinsman had been taken captive, he mustered his retainers,bMeaning of Heb. ḥanikh uncertain. born into his household, numbering three hundred and eighteen, and went in pursuit as far as Dan.

hebrew: וַיֵּחָלֵ֨ק עֲלֵיהֶ֧ם ׀ לַ֛יְלָה ה֥וּא וַעֲבָדָ֖יו וַיַּכֵּ֑ם וַֽיִּרְדְּפֵם֙ עַד־חוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִשְּׂמֹ֖אל לְדַמָּֽשֶׂק׃
transliteration: vayechalek 'aleyhem  lay'lah hv va'avadayv vayakem vayir'd'fem 'ad-chvovah asher mis'mol l'damasek
translation: At night, he and his servants deployed against them and defeated them; and he pursued them as far as Hobah, which is north of Damascus.

hebrew: וַיָּ֕שֶׁב אֵ֖ת כָּל־הָרְכֻ֑שׁ וְגַם֩ אֶת־ל֨וֹט אָחִ֤יו וּרְכֻשׁוֹ֙ הֵשִׁ֔יב וְגַ֥ם אֶת־הַנָּשִׁ֖ים וְאֶת־הָעָֽם׃
transliteration: vayashev et kal-har'khush v'gam et-lvot achiyv vr'khushvo heshiyv v'gam et-hanashiym v'et-ha'am
translation: He brought back all the possessions; he also brought back his kinsman Lot and his possessions, and the women and the rest of the people.

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֣א מֶֽלֶךְ־סְדֹם֮ לִקְרָאתוֹ֒ אַחֲרֵ֣י שׁוּב֗וֹ מֵֽהַכּוֹת֙ אֶת־כְּדָרלָעֹ֔מֶר וְאֶת־הַמְּלָכִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֑וֹ אֶל־עֵ֣מֶק שָׁוֵ֔ה ה֖וּא עֵ֥מֶק הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
transliteration: vayetze melekh'-s'dom lik'ratvo acharey shvvvo mehakvot et-k'darla'omer v'et-ham'lakhiym asher itvo el-'emek shaveh hv 'emek hamelekh'
translation: When he returned from defeating Chedorlaomer and the kings with him, the king of Sodom came out to meet him in the Valley of Shaveh, which is the Valley of the King.

hebrew: וּמַלְכִּי־צֶ֙דֶק֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ שָׁלֵ֔ם הוֹצִ֖יא לֶ֣חֶם וָיָ֑יִן וְה֥וּא כֹהֵ֖ן לְאֵ֥ל עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
transliteration: vmal'kiy-tzedek melekh' shalem hvotziy lechem vayayin v'hv khohen l'el 'el'yvon
translation: And King Melchizedek of Salem brought out bread and wine; he was a priest of God Most High.cHeb. El ‘Elyon.

hebrew: וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֖הוּ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר בָּר֤וּךְ אַבְרָם֙ לְאֵ֣ל עֶלְי֔וֹן קֹנֵ֖ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vay'var'khehv vayomar barvkh' av'ram l'el 'el'yvon koneh shamayim vaaretz
translation:
He blessed him, saying,
“Blessed be Abram of God Most High,
Creator of heaven and earth.

hebrew: וּבָרוּךְ֙ אֵ֣ל עֶלְי֔וֹן אֲשֶׁר־מִגֵּ֥ן צָרֶ֖יךָ בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וַיִּתֶּן־ל֥וֹ מַעֲשֵׂ֖ר מִכֹּֽל׃
transliteration: vvarvkh' el 'el'yvon asher-migen tzareykha b'yadekha vayiten-lvo ma'aser mikol
translation:
And blessed be God Most High,
Who has delivered your foes into your hand.”
And [Abram] gave him a tenth of everything.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֶֽלֶךְ־סְדֹ֖ם אֶל־אַבְרָ֑ם תֶּן־לִ֣י הַנֶּ֔פֶשׁ וְהָרְכֻ֖שׁ קַֽח־לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer melekh'-s'dom el-av'ram ten-liy hanefesh v'har'khush kach-lakh'
translation: Then the king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the persons, and take the possessions for yourself.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אַבְרָ֖ם אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ סְדֹ֑ם הֲרִימֹ֨תִי יָדִ֤י אֶל־יְהוָה֙ אֵ֣ל עֶלְי֔וֹן קֹנֵ֖ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vayomer av'ram el-melekh' s'dom hariymotiy yadiy el-y'hvah el 'el'yvon koneh shamayim vaaretz
translation: But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I sweardLit. “lift up my hand.” to the LORD, God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth:

hebrew: אִם־מִחוּט֙ וְעַ֣ד שְׂרֽוֹךְ־נַ֔עַל וְאִם־אֶקַּ֖ח מִכָּל־אֲשֶׁר־לָ֑ךְ וְלֹ֣א תֹאמַ֔ר אֲנִ֖י הֶעֱשַׁ֥רְתִּי אֶת־אַבְרָֽם׃
transliteration: im-michvt v'ad s'rvokh'-na'al v'im-ekach mikal-asher-lakh' v'lo tomar aniy he'eshar'tiy et-av'ram
translation: I will not take so much as a thread or a sandal strap of what is yours; you shall not say, ‘It is I who made Abram rich.’

hebrew: בִּלְעָדַ֗י רַ֚ק אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָֽכְל֣וּ הַנְּעָרִ֔ים וְחֵ֙לֶק֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלְכ֖וּ אִתִּ֑י עָנֵר֙ אֶשְׁכֹּ֣ל וּמַמְרֵ֔א הֵ֖ם יִקְח֥וּ חֶלְקָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: bil'aday rak asher akh'lv han'ariym v'chelek haanashiym asher hal'khv itiy 'aner esh'kol vmam're hem yik'chv chel'kam (s)
translation: For me, nothing but what my servants have used up; as for the share of the men who went with me—Aner, Eshkol, and Mamre—let them take their share.”

hebrew: אַחַ֣ר ׀ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה הָיָ֤ה דְבַר־יְהוָה֙ אֶל־אַבְרָ֔ם בַּֽמַּחֲזֶ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר אַל־תִּירָ֣א אַבְרָ֗ם אָנֹכִי֙ מָגֵ֣ן לָ֔ךְ שְׂכָרְךָ֖ הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: achar  had'variym haeleh hayah d'var-y'hvah el-av'ram bamachazeh lemor al-tiyra av'ram anokhiy magen lakh' s'khar'kha har'beh m'od
translation:
Some time later, the word of the LORD came to Abram in a vision. He said,
“Fear not, Abram,
I am a shield to you;
Your reward shall be very great.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַבְרָ֗ם אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהוִה֙ מַה־תִּתֶּן־לִ֔י וְאָנֹכִ֖י הוֹלֵ֣ךְ עֲרִירִ֑י וּבֶן־מֶ֣שֶׁק בֵּיתִ֔י ה֖וּא דַּמֶּ֥שֶׂק אֱלִיעֶֽזֶר׃
transliteration: vayomer av'ram adonay yehvih mah-titen-liy v'anokhiy hvolekh' 'ariyriy vven-meshek beytiy hv damesek eliy'ezer
translation: But Abram said, “O Lord GOD, what can You give me, seeing that I shall die childless, aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.and the one in charge of my household is Dammesek Eliezer!”-a

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַבְרָ֔ם הֵ֣ן לִ֔י לֹ֥א נָתַ֖תָּה זָ֑רַע וְהִנֵּ֥ה בֶן־בֵּיתִ֖י יוֹרֵ֥שׁ אֹתִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer av'ram hen liy lo natatah zara' v'hineh ven-beytiy yvoresh otiy
translation: Abram said further, “Since You have granted me no offspring, my steward will be my heir.”

hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה דְבַר־יְהוָ֤ה אֵלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֥א יִֽירָשְׁךָ֖ זֶ֑ה כִּי־אִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵצֵ֣א מִמֵּעֶ֔יךָ ה֖וּא יִֽירָשֶֽׁךָ׃
transliteration: v'hineh d'var-y'hvah elayv lemor lo yiyrash'kha zeh kiy-im asher yetze mime'eykha hv yiyrashekha
translation: The word of the L<small>ORD</small> came to him in reply, “That one shall not be your heir; none but your very own issue shall be your heir.”

hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵ֨א אֹת֜וֹ הַח֗וּצָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַבֶּט־נָ֣א הַשָּׁמַ֗יְמָה וּסְפֹר֙ הַכּ֣וֹכָבִ֔ים אִם־תּוּכַ֖ל לִסְפֹּ֣ר אֹתָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ כֹּ֥ה יִהְיֶ֖ה זַרְעֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayvotze otvo hachvtzah vayomer habet-na hashamay'mah vs'for hakvokhaviym im-tvkhal lis'por otam vayomer lvo koh yih'yeh zar'ekha
translation: He took him outside and said, “Look toward heaven and count the stars, if you are able to count them.” And He added, “So shall your offspring be.”

hebrew: וְהֶאֱמִ֖ן בַּֽיהוָ֑ה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶ֥הָ לּ֖וֹ צְדָקָֽה׃
transliteration: v'heemin bayhvah vayach'sh'veha lvo tz'dakah
translation: And because he put his trust in the L<small>ORD</small>, He reckoned it to his merit.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑יו אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר הוֹצֵאתִ֙יךָ֙ מֵא֣וּר כַּשְׂדִּ֔ים לָ֧תֶת לְךָ֛ אֶת־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּ֖את לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv aniy y'hvah asher hvotzetiykha mevr kas'diym latet l'kha et-haaretz hazot l'rish'tah
translation: Then He said to him, “I am the L<small>ORD</small> who brought you out from Ur of the Chaldeans to assign this land to you as a possession.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהוִ֔ה בַּמָּ֥ה אֵדַ֖ע כִּ֥י אִֽירָשֶֽׁנָּה׃
transliteration: vayomar adonay yehvih bamah eda' kiy iyrashenah
translation: And he said, “O Lord GOD, how shall I know that I am to possess it?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו קְחָ֥ה לִי֙ עֶגְלָ֣ה מְשֻׁלֶּ֔שֶׁת וְעֵ֥ז מְשֻׁלֶּ֖שֶׁת וְאַ֣יִל מְשֻׁלָּ֑שׁ וְתֹ֖ר וְגוֹזָֽל׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv k'chah liy 'eg'lah m'shuleshet v'ez m'shuleshet v'ayil m'shulash v'tor v'gvozal
translation: He answered, “Bring Me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old she-goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtledove, and a young bird.”

hebrew: וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֣וֹ אֶת־כָּל־אֵ֗לֶּה וַיְבַתֵּ֤ר אֹתָם֙ בַּתָּ֔וֶךְ וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אִישׁ־בִּתְר֖וֹ לִקְרַ֣את רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְאֶת־הַצִפֹּ֖ר לֹ֥א בָתָֽר׃
transliteration: vayikach-lvo et-kal-eleh vay'vater otam batavekh' vayiten iysh-bit'rvo lik'rat re'ehv v'et-hatzipor lo vatar
translation: He brought Him all these and cut them in two, placing each half opposite the other; but he did not cut up the bird.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥רֶד הָעַ֖יִט עַל־הַפְּגָרִ֑ים וַיַּשֵּׁ֥ב אֹתָ֖ם אַבְרָֽם׃
transliteration: vayered ha'ayit 'al-hap'gariym vayashev otam av'ram
translation: Birds of prey came down upon the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י הַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ לָב֔וֹא וְתַרְדֵּמָ֖ה נָפְלָ֣ה עַל־אַבְרָ֑ם וְהִנֵּ֥ה אֵימָ֛ה חֲשֵׁכָ֥ה גְדֹלָ֖ה נֹפֶ֥לֶת עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: vay'hiy hashemesh lavvo v'tar'demah naf'lah 'al-av'ram v'hineh eymah chashekhah g'dolah nofelet 'alayv
translation: As the sun was about to set, a deep sleep fell upon Abram, and a great dark dread descended upon him.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְאַבְרָ֗ם יָדֹ֨עַ תֵּדַ֜ע כִּי־גֵ֣ר ׀ יִהְיֶ֣ה זַרְעֲךָ֗ בְּאֶ֙רֶץ֙ לֹ֣א לָהֶ֔ם וַעֲבָד֖וּם וְעִנּ֣וּ אֹתָ֑ם אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer l'av'ram yado'a teda' kiy-ger  yih'yeh zar'akha b'eretz lo lahem va'avadvm v'inv otam ar'ba' mevot shanah
translation: And He said to Abram, “Know well that your offspring shall be strangers in a land not theirs, and they shall be enslaved and oppressed four hundred years;

hebrew: וְגַ֧ם אֶת־הַגּ֛וֹי אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲבֹ֖דוּ דָּ֣ן אָנֹ֑כִי וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֥ן יֵצְא֖וּ בִּרְכֻ֥שׁ גָּדֽוֹל׃
transliteration: v'gam et-hagvoy asher ya'avodv dan anokhiy v'acharey-khen yetz'v bir'khush gadvol
translation: but I will execute judgment on the nation they shall serve, and in the end they shall go free with great wealth.

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֛ה תָּב֥וֹא אֶל־אֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ בְּשָׁל֑וֹם תִּקָּבֵ֖ר בְּשֵׂיבָ֥ה טוֹבָֽה׃
transliteration: v'atah tavvo el-avoteykha b'shalvom tikaver b'seyvah tvovah
translation:
As for you,
You shall go to your fathers in peace;
You shall be buried at a ripe old age.

hebrew: וְד֥וֹר רְבִיעִ֖י יָשׁ֣וּבוּ הֵ֑נָּה כִּ֧י לֹא־שָׁלֵ֛ם עֲוֺ֥ן הָאֱמֹרִ֖י עַד־הֵֽנָּה׃
transliteration: v'dvor r'viy'iy yashvvv henah kiy lo-shalem 'avon haemoriy 'ad-henah
translation: And they shall return here in the fourth generation, for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet complete.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י הַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ בָּ֔אָה וַעֲלָטָ֖ה הָיָ֑ה וְהִנֵּ֨ה תַנּ֤וּר עָשָׁן֙ וְלַפִּ֣יד אֵ֔שׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָבַ֔ר בֵּ֖ין הַגְּזָרִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy hashemesh baah va'alatah hayah v'hineh tanvr 'ashan v'lapiyd esh asher 'avar beyn hag'zariym haeleh
translation: When the sun set and it was very dark, there appeared a smoking oven, and a flaming torch which passed between those pieces.

hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא כָּרַ֧ת יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־אַבְרָ֖ם בְּרִ֣ית לֵאמֹ֑ר לְזַרְעֲךָ֗ נָתַ֙תִּי֙ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את מִנְּהַ֣ר מִצְרַ֔יִם עַד־הַנָּהָ֥ר הַגָּדֹ֖ל נְהַר־פְּרָֽת׃
transliteration: bayvom hahv karat y'hvah et-av'ram b'riyt lemor l'zar'akha natatiy et-haaretz hazot min'har mitz'rayim 'ad-hanahar hagadol n'har-p'rat
translation: On that day the L<small>ORD</small> made a covenant with Abram, saying, “To your offspring I assign this land, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the river Euphrates:

hebrew: אֶת־הַקֵּינִי֙ וְאֶת־הַקְּנִזִּ֔י וְאֵ֖ת הַקַּדְמֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: et-hakeyniy v'et-hak'niziy v'et hakad'moniy
translation: the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַחִתִּ֥י וְאֶת־הַפְּרִזִּ֖י וְאֶת־הָרְפָאִֽים׃
transliteration: v'et-hachitiy v'et-hap'riziy v'et-har'faiym
translation: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,

hebrew: וְאֶת־הָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְאֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י וְאֶת־הַגִּרְגָּשִׁ֖י וְאֶת־הַיְבוּסִֽי׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'et-haemoriy v'et-hak'na'aniy v'et-hagir'gashiy v'et-hay'vvsiy (s)
translation: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.”

hebrew: וְשָׂרַי֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת אַבְרָ֔ם לֹ֥א יָלְדָ֖ה ל֑וֹ וְלָ֛הּ שִׁפְחָ֥ה מִצְרִ֖ית וּשְׁמָ֥הּ הָגָֽר׃
transliteration: v'saray eshet av'ram lo yal'dah lvo v'lah shif'chah mitz'riyt vsh'mah hagar
translation: Sarai, Abram’s wife, had borne him no children. She had an Egyptian maidservant whose name was Hagar.

hebrew: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר שָׂרַ֜י אֶל־אַבְרָ֗ם הִנֵּה־נָ֞א עֲצָרַ֤נִי יְהוָה֙ מִלֶּ֔דֶת בֹּא־נָא֙ אֶל־שִׁפְחָתִ֔י אוּלַ֥י אִבָּנֶ֖ה מִמֶּ֑נָּה וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע אַבְרָ֖ם לְק֥וֹל שָׂרָֽי׃
transliteration: vatomer saray el-av'ram hineh-na 'atzaraniy y'hvah miledet bo-na el-shif'chatiy vlay ibaneh mimenah vayish'ma' av'ram l'kvol saray
translation: And Sarai said to Abram, “Look, the LORD has kept me from bearing. Consort with my maid; perhaps I shall have a sonaLit. “be built up,” play on ben “son” and banah “build up.” through her.” And Abram heeded Sarai’s request.

hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֞ח שָׂרַ֣י אֵֽשֶׁת־אַבְרָ֗ם אֶת־הָגָ֤ר הַמִּצְרִית֙ שִׁפְחָתָ֔הּ מִקֵּץ֙ עֶ֣שֶׂר שָׁנִ֔ים לְשֶׁ֥בֶת אַבְרָ֖ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַתִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛הּ לְאַבְרָ֥ם אִישָׁ֖הּ ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vatikach saray eshet-av'ram et-hagar hamitz'riyt shif'chatah miketz 'eser shaniym l'shevet av'ram b'eretz k'na'an vatiten otah l'av'ram iyshah lvo l'ishah
translation: So Sarai, Abram’s wife, took her maid, Hagar the Egyptian—after Abram had dwelt in the land of Canaan ten years—and gave her to her husband Abram as concubine.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א אֶל־הָגָ֖ר וַתַּ֑הַר וַתֵּ֙רֶא֙ כִּ֣י הָרָ֔תָה וַתֵּקַ֥ל גְּבִרְתָּ֖הּ בְּעֵינֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayavo el-hagar vatahar vatere kiy haratah vatekal g'vir'tah b'eyneyha
translation: He cohabited with Hagar and she conceived; and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was lowered in her esteem.

hebrew: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר שָׂרַ֣י אֶל־אַבְרָם֮ חֲמָסִ֣י עָלֶיךָ֒ אָנֹכִ֗י נָתַ֤תִּי שִׁפְחָתִי֙ בְּחֵיקֶ֔ךָ וַתֵּ֙רֶא֙ כִּ֣י הָרָ֔תָה וָאֵקַ֖ל בְּעֵינֶ֑יהָ יִשְׁפֹּ֥ט יְהוָ֖ה בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽיׄךָ׃
transliteration: vatomer saray el-av'ram chamasiy 'aleykha anokhiy natatiy shif'chatiy b'cheykekha vatere kiy haratah vaekal b'eyneyha yish'pot y'hvah beyniy vveyneykha
translation: And Sarai said to Abram, “The wrong done me is your fault! I myself put my maid in your bosom; now that she sees that she is pregnant, I am lowered in her esteem. The L<small>ORD</small> decide between you and me!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אַבְרָ֜ם אֶל־שָׂרַ֗י הִנֵּ֤ה שִׁפְחָתֵךְ֙ בְּיָדֵ֔ךְ עֲשִׂי־לָ֖הּ הַטּ֣וֹב בְּעֵינָ֑יִךְ וַתְּעַנֶּ֣הָ שָׂרַ֔י וַתִּבְרַ֖ח מִפָּנֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayomer av'ram el-saray hineh shif'chatekh' b'yadekh' 'asiy-lah hatvov b'eynayikh' vat'aneha saray vativ'rach mipaneyha
translation: Abram said to Sarai, “Your maid is in your hands. Deal with her as you think right.” Then Sarai treated her harshly, and she ran away from her.

hebrew: וַֽיִּמְצָאָ֞הּ מַלְאַ֧ךְ יְהוָ֛ה עַל־עֵ֥ין הַמַּ֖יִם בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר עַל־הָעַ֖יִן בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ שֽׁוּר׃
transliteration: vayim'tzaah mal'akh' y'hvah 'al-'eyn hamayim bamid'bar 'al-ha'ayin b'derekh' shvr
translation: An angel of the L<small>ORD</small> found her by a spring of water in the wilderness, the spring on the road to Shur,

hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֗ר הָגָ֞ר שִׁפְחַ֥ת שָׂרַ֛י אֵֽי־מִזֶּ֥ה בָ֖את וְאָ֣נָה תֵלֵ֑כִי וַתֹּ֕אמֶר מִפְּנֵי֙ שָׂרַ֣י גְּבִרְתִּ֔י אָנֹכִ֖י בֹּרַֽחַת׃
transliteration: vayomar hagar shif'chat saray ey-mizeh vat v'anah telekhiy vatomer mip'ney saray g'vir'tiy anokhiy borachat
translation: and said, “Hagar, slave of Sarai, where have you come from, and where are you going?” And she said, “I am running away from my mistress Sarai.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהּ֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהוָ֔ה שׁ֖וּבִי אֶל־גְּבִרְתֵּ֑ךְ וְהִתְעַנִּ֖י תַּ֥חַת יָדֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayomer lah mal'akh' y'hvah shvviy el-g'vir'tekh' v'hit'aniy tachat yadeyha
translation: And the angel of the L<small>ORD</small> said to her, “Go back to your mistress, and submit to her harsh treatment.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהּ֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהוָ֔ה הַרְבָּ֥ה אַרְבֶּ֖ה אֶת־זַרְעֵ֑ךְ וְלֹ֥א יִסָּפֵ֖ר מֵרֹֽב׃
transliteration: vayomer lah mal'akh' y'hvah har'bah ar'beh et-zar'ekh' v'lo yisafer merov
translation:
And the angel of the LORD said to her,
“I will greatly increase your offspring,
And they shall be too many to count.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהּ֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהוָ֔ה הִנָּ֥ךְ הָרָ֖ה וְיֹלַ֣דְתְּ בֵּ֑ן וְקָרָ֤את שְׁמוֹ֙ יִשְׁמָעֵ֔אל כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֥ע יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־עָנְיֵֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer lah mal'akh' y'hvah hinakh' harah v'yolad't' ben v'karat sh'mvo yish'ma'el kiy-shama' y'hvah el-'an'yekh'
translation:
The angel of the LORD said to her further,
“Behold, you are with child
And shall bear a son;
You shall call him Ishmael,bI.e., “God heeds.”
For the LORD has paid heed to your suffering.

hebrew: וְה֤וּא יִהְיֶה֙ פֶּ֣רֶא אָדָ֔ם יָד֣וֹ בַכֹּ֔ל וְיַ֥ד כֹּ֖ל בּ֑וֹ וְעַל־פְּנֵ֥י כָל־אֶחָ֖יו יִשְׁכֹּֽן׃
transliteration: v'hv yih'yeh pere adam yadvo vakol v'yad kol bvo v'al-p'ney khal-echayv yish'kon
translation:
He shall be a wild ass of a man;
His hand against everyone,
And everyone’s hand against him;
He shall dwell alongside of all his kinsmen.”

hebrew: וַתִּקְרָ֤א שֵׁם־יְהוָה֙ הַדֹּבֵ֣ר אֵלֶ֔יהָ אַתָּ֖ה אֵ֣ל רֳאִ֑י כִּ֣י אָֽמְרָ֗ה הֲגַ֥ם הֲלֹ֛ם רָאִ֖יתִי אַחֲרֵ֥י רֹאִֽי׃
transliteration: vatik'ra shem-y'hvah hadover eleyha atah el roiy kiy am'rah hagam halom raiytiy acharey roiy
translation: And she called the LORD who spoke to her, “You Are El-roi,”cApparently “God of Seeing.” by which she meant, dMeaning of Heb. uncertain.“Have I not gone on seeing after He saw me!”-d

hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֙ קָרָ֣א לַבְּאֵ֔ר בְּאֵ֥ר לַחַ֖י רֹאִ֑י הִנֵּ֥ה בֵין־קָדֵ֖שׁ וּבֵ֥ין בָּֽרֶד׃
transliteration: 'al-ken kara lab'er b'er lachay roiy hineh veyn-kadesh vveyn bared
translation: Therefore the well was called Beer-lahai-roi;eApparently “the Well of the Living One Who sees me.” it is between Kadesh and Bered.—

hebrew: וַתֵּ֧לֶד הָגָ֛ר לְאַבְרָ֖ם בֵּ֑ן וַיִּקְרָ֨א אַבְרָ֧ם שֶׁם־בְּנ֛וֹ אֲשֶׁר־יָלְדָ֥ה הָגָ֖ר יִשְׁמָעֵֽאל׃
transliteration: vateled hagar l'av'ram ben vayik'ra av'ram shem-b'nvo asher-yal'dah hagar yish'ma'el
translation: Hagar bore a son to Abram, and Abram gave the son that Hagar bore him the name Ishmael.

hebrew: וְאַבְרָ֕ם בֶּן־שְׁמֹנִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְשֵׁ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֑ים בְּלֶֽדֶת־הָגָ֥ר אֶת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל לְאַבְרָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'av'ram ben-sh'moniym shanah v'shesh shaniym b'ledet-hagar et-yish'ma'el l'av'ram (s)
translation: Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י אַבְרָ֔ם בֶּן־תִּשְׁעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְתֵ֣שַׁע שָׁנִ֑ים וַיֵּרָ֨א יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־אַבְרָ֗ם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ אֲנִי־אֵ֣ל שַׁדַּ֔י הִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ לְפָנַ֖י וֶהְיֵ֥ה תָמִֽים׃
transliteration: vay'hiy av'ram ben-tish'iym shanah v'tesha' shaniym vayera y'hvah el-av'ram vayomer elayv aniy-el shaday hit'halekh' l'fanay veh'yeh tamiym
translation: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the LORD appeared to Abram and said to him, “I am El Shaddai.aTraditionally rendered “God Almighty.” Walk in My ways and be blameless.

hebrew: וְאֶתְּנָ֥ה בְרִיתִ֖י בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֑ךָ וְאַרְבֶּ֥ה אוֹתְךָ֖ בִּמְאֹ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: v'et'nah v'riytiy beyniy vveynekha v'ar'beh vot'kha bim'od m'od
translation: I will establish My covenant between Me and you, and I will make you exceedingly numerous.”

hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֥ל אַבְרָ֖ם עַל־פָּנָ֑יו וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתּ֛וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayipol av'ram 'al-panayv vay'daber itvo elohiym lemor
translation: Abram threw himself on his face; and God spoke to him further,

hebrew: אֲנִ֕י הִנֵּ֥ה בְרִיתִ֖י אִתָּ֑ךְ וְהָיִ֕יתָ לְאַ֖ב הֲמ֥וֹן גּוֹיִֽם׃
transliteration: aniy hineh v'riytiy itakh' v'hayiyta l'av hamvon gvoyim
translation: “As for Me, this is My covenant with you: You shall be the father of a multitude of nations.

hebrew: וְלֹא־יִקָּרֵ֥א ע֛וֹד אֶת־שִׁמְךָ֖ אַבְרָ֑ם וְהָיָ֤ה שִׁמְךָ֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם כִּ֛י אַב־הֲמ֥וֹן גּוֹיִ֖ם נְתַתִּֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'lo-yikare 'vod et-shim'kha av'ram v'hayah shim'kha av'raham kiy av-hamvon gvoyim n'tatiykha
translation: And you shall no longer be called Abram, but your name shall be Abraham,bUnderstood as “father of a multitude.” for I make you the father of a multitude of nations.

hebrew: וְהִפְרֵתִ֤י אֹֽתְךָ֙ בִּמְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֔ד וּנְתַתִּ֖יךָ לְגוֹיִ֑ם וּמְלָכִ֖ים מִמְּךָ֥ יֵצֵֽאוּ׃
transliteration: v'hif'retiy ot'kha bim'od m'od vn'tatiykha l'gvoyim vm'lakhiym mim'kha yetzev
translation: I will make you exceedingly fertile, and make nations of you; and kings shall come forth from you.

hebrew: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֨י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֜י בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֗ךָ וּבֵ֨ין זַרְעֲךָ֧ אַחֲרֶ֛יךָ לְדֹרֹתָ֖ם לִבְרִ֣ית עוֹלָ֑ם לִהְי֤וֹת לְךָ֙ לֵֽאלֹהִ֔ים וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֖ אַחֲרֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vahakimotiy et-b'riytiy beyniy vveynekha vveyn zar'akha achareykha l'dorotam liv'riyt 'volam lih'yvot l'kha lelohiym vl'zar'akha achareykha
translation: I will maintain My covenant between Me and you, and your offspring to come, as an everlasting covenant throughout the ages, to be God to you and to your offspring to come.

hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֣י לְ֠ךָ וּלְזַרְעֲךָ֨ אַחֲרֶ֜יךָ אֵ֣ת ׀ אֶ֣רֶץ מְגֻרֶ֗יךָ אֵ֚ת כָּל־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן לַאֲחֻזַּ֖ת עוֹלָ֑ם וְהָיִ֥יתִי לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: v'natatiy l'kha vl'zar'akha achareykha et  eretz m'gureykha et kal-eretz k'na'an laachuzat 'volam v'hayiytiy lahem lelohiym
translation: I assign the land you sojourn in to you and your offspring to come, all the land of Canaan, as an everlasting holding. I will be their God.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֔ם וְאַתָּ֖ה אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֣י תִשְׁמֹ֑ר אַתָּ֛ה וְזַרְעֲךָ֥ אַֽחֲרֶ֖יךָ לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym el-av'raham v'atah et-b'riytiy tish'mor atah v'zar'akha achareykha l'dorotam
translation: God further said to Abraham, “As for you, you and your offspring to come throughout the ages shall keep My covenant.

hebrew: זֹ֣את בְּרִיתִ֞י אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּשְׁמְר֗וּ בֵּינִי֙ וּבֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵ֥ין זַרְעֲךָ֖ אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ הִמּ֥וֹל לָכֶ֖ם כָּל־זָכָֽר׃
transliteration: zot b'riytiy asher tish'm'rv beyniy vveyneykhem vveyn zar'akha achareykha himvol lakhem kal-zakhar
translation: Such shall be the covenant between Me and you and your offspring to follow which you shall keep: every male among you shall be circumcised.

hebrew: וּנְמַלְתֶּ֕ם אֵ֖ת בְּשַׂ֣ר עָרְלַתְכֶ֑ם וְהָיָה֙ לְא֣וֹת בְּרִ֔ית בֵּינִ֖י וּבֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vn'mal'tem et b'sar 'ar'lat'khem v'hayah l'vot b'riyt beyniy vveyneykhem
translation: You shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin, and that shall be the sign of the covenant between Me and you.

hebrew: וּבֶן־שְׁמֹנַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים יִמּ֥וֹל לָכֶ֛ם כָּל־זָכָ֖ר לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶ֑ם יְלִ֣יד בָּ֔יִת וּמִקְנַת־כֶּ֙סֶף֙ מִכֹּ֣ל בֶּן־נֵכָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹ֥א מִֽזַּרְעֲךָ֖ הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vven-sh'monat yamiym yimvol lakhem kal-zakhar l'doroteykhem y'liyd bayit vmik'nat-kesef mikol ben-nekhar asher lo mizar'akha hv
translation: And throughout the generations, every male among you shall be circumcised at the age of eight days. As for the homeborn slave and the one bought from an outsider who is not of your offspring,

hebrew: הִמּ֧וֹל ׀ יִמּ֛וֹל יְלִ֥יד בֵּֽיתְךָ֖ וּמִקְנַ֣ת כַּסְפֶּ֑ךָ וְהָיְתָ֧ה בְרִיתִ֛י בִּבְשַׂרְכֶ֖ם לִבְרִ֥ית עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: himvol  yimvol y'liyd beyt'kha vmik'nat kas'pekha v'hay'tah v'riytiy biv'sar'khem liv'riyt 'volam
translation: they must be circumcised, homeborn and purchased alike. Thus shall My covenant be marked in your flesh as an everlasting pact.

hebrew: וְעָרֵ֣ל ׀ זָכָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יִמּוֹל֙ אֶת־בְּשַׂ֣ר עָרְלָת֔וֹ וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵעַמֶּ֑יהָ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י הֵפַֽר׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'arel  zakhar asher lo-yimvol et-b'sar 'ar'latvo v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv me'ameyha et-b'riytiy hefar (s)
translation: And if any male who is uncircumcised fails to circumcise the flesh of his foreskin, that person shall be cut off from his kin; he has broken My covenant.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֔ם שָׂרַ֣י אִשְׁתְּךָ֔ לֹא־תִקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמָ֖הּ שָׂרָ֑י כִּ֥י שָׂרָ֖ה שְׁמָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym el-av'raham saray ish't'kha lo-tik'ra et-sh'mah saray kiy sarah sh'mah
translation: And God said to Abraham, “As for your wife Sarai, you shall not call her Sarai, but her name shall be Sarah.cI.e., “princess.”

hebrew: וּבֵרַכְתִּ֣י אֹתָ֔הּ וְגַ֨ם נָתַ֧תִּי מִמֶּ֛נָּה לְךָ֖ בֵּ֑ן וּבֵֽרַכְתִּ֙יהָ֙ וְהָֽיְתָ֣ה לְגוֹיִ֔ם מַלְכֵ֥י עַמִּ֖ים מִמֶּ֥נָּה יִהְיֽוּ׃
transliteration: vverakh'tiy otah v'gam natatiy mimenah l'kha ben vverakh'tiyha v'hay'tah l'gvoyim mal'khey 'amiym mimenah yih'yv
translation: I will bless her; indeed, I will give you a son by her. I will bless her so that she shall give rise to nations; rulers of peoples shall issue from her.”

hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֧ל אַבְרָהָ֛ם עַל־פָּנָ֖יו וַיִּצְחָ֑ק וַיֹּ֣אמֶר בְּלִבּ֗וֹ הַלְּבֶ֤ן מֵאָֽה־שָׁנָה֙ יִוָּלֵ֔ד וְאִ֨ם־שָׂרָ֔ה הֲבַת־תִּשְׁעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה תֵּלֵֽד׃
transliteration: vayipol av'raham 'al-panayv vayitz'chak vayomer b'libvo hal'ven meah-shanah yivaled v'im-sarah havat-tish'iym shanah teled
translation: Abraham threw himself on his face and laughed, as he said to himself, “Can a child be born to a man a hundred years old, or can Sarah bear a child at ninety?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶל־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים ל֥וּ יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל יִחְיֶ֥ה לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer av'raham el-haelohiym lv yish'ma'el yich'yeh l'faneykha
translation: And Abraham said to God, “O that Ishmael might live by Your favor!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים אֲבָל֙ שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתְּךָ֗ יֹלֶ֤דֶת לְךָ֙ בֵּ֔ן וְקָרָ֥אתָ אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ יִצְחָ֑ק וַהֲקִמֹתִ֨י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֥י אִתּ֛וֹ לִבְרִ֥ית עוֹלָ֖ם לְזַרְע֥וֹ אַחֲרָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym aval sarah ish't'kha yoledet l'kha ben v'karata et-sh'mvo yitz'chak vahakimotiy et-b'riytiy itvo liv'riyt 'volam l'zar'vo acharayv
translation: God said, “Nevertheless, Sarah your wife shall bear you a son, and you shall name him Isaac;dHeb. Yiṣḥaq, from ṣaḥaq, “laugh.” and I will maintain My covenant with him as an everlasting covenant for his offspring to come.

hebrew: וּֽלְיִשְׁמָעֵ֘אל שְׁמַעְתִּיךָ֒ הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ בֵּרַ֣כְתִּי אֹת֗וֹ וְהִפְרֵיתִ֥י אֹת֛וֹ וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֥י אֹת֖וֹ בִּמְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֤ר נְשִׂיאִם֙ יוֹלִ֔יד וּנְתַתִּ֖יו לְג֥וֹי גָּדֽוֹל׃
transliteration: vl'yish'ma'el sh'ma'tiykha hineh  berakh'tiy otvo v'hif'reytiy otvo v'hir'beytiy otvo bim'od m'od sh'neym-'asar n'siyim yvoliyd vn'tatiyv l'gvoy gadvol
translation: As for Ishmael, I have heeded you.eHeb. shema‘tikha, play on “Ishmael.” I hereby bless him. I will make him fertile and exceedingly numerous. He shall be the father of twelve chieftains, and I will make of him a great nation.

hebrew: וְאֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אָקִ֣ים אֶת־יִצְחָ֑ק אֲשֶׁר֩ תֵּלֵ֨ד לְךָ֤ שָׂרָה֙ לַמּוֹעֵ֣ד הַזֶּ֔ה בַּשָּׁנָ֖ה הָאַחֶֽרֶת׃
transliteration: v'et-b'riytiy akiym et-yitz'chak asher teled l'kha sarah lamvo'ed hazeh bashanah haacheret
translation: But My covenant I will maintain with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear to you at this season next year.”

hebrew: וַיְכַ֖ל לְדַבֵּ֣ר אִתּ֑וֹ וַיַּ֣עַל אֱלֹהִ֔ים מֵעַ֖ל אַבְרָהָֽם׃
transliteration: vay'khal l'daber itvo vaya'al elohiym me'al av'raham
translation: And when He was done speaking with him, God was gone from Abraham.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בְּנ֗וֹ וְאֵ֨ת כָּל־יְלִידֵ֤י בֵיתוֹ֙ וְאֵת֙ כָּל־מִקְנַ֣ת כַּסְפּ֔וֹ כָּל־זָכָ֕ר בְּאַנְשֵׁ֖י בֵּ֣ית אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיָּ֜מָל אֶת־בְּשַׂ֣ר עָרְלָתָ֗ם בְּעֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: vayikach av'raham et-yish'ma'el b'nvo v'et kal-y'liydey veytvo v'et kal-mik'nat kas'pvo kal-zakhar b'an'shey beyt av'raham vayamal et-b'sar 'ar'latam b'etzem hayvom hazeh kaasher diber itvo elohiym
translation: Then Abraham took his son Ishmael, and all his homeborn slaves and all those he had bought, every male in Abraham’s household, and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskins on that very day, as God had spoken to him.

hebrew: וְאַ֨בְרָהָ֔ם בֶּן־תִּשְׁעִ֥ים וָתֵ֖שַׁע שָׁנָ֑ה בְּהִמֹּל֖וֹ בְּשַׂ֥ר עָרְלָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'av'raham ben-tish'iym vatesha' shanah b'himolvo b'sar 'ar'latvo
translation: Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he circumcised the flesh of his foreskin,

hebrew: וְיִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בְּנ֔וֹ בֶּן־שְׁלֹ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָ֑ה בְּהִ֨מֹּל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת בְּשַׂ֥ר עָרְלָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'yish'ma'el b'nvo ben-sh'losh 'es'reh shanah b'himolvo et b'sar 'ar'latvo
translation: and his son Ishmael was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

hebrew: בְּעֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה נִמּ֖וֹל אַבְרָהָ֑ם וְיִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל בְּנֽוֹ׃
transliteration: b'etzem hayvom hazeh nimvol av'raham v'yish'ma'el b'nvo
translation: Thus Abraham and his son Ishmael were circumcised on that very day;

hebrew: וְכָל־אַנְשֵׁ֤י בֵיתוֹ֙ יְלִ֣יד בָּ֔יִת וּמִקְנַת־כֶּ֖סֶף מֵאֵ֣ת בֶּן־נֵכָ֑ר נִמֹּ֖לוּ אִתּֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'khal-an'shey veytvo y'liyd bayit vmik'nat-kesef meet ben-nekhar nimolv itvo (f)
translation: and all his household, his homeborn slaves and those that had been bought from outsiders, were circumcised with him.

hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֤א אֵלָיו֙ יְהוָ֔ה בְּאֵלֹנֵ֖י מַמְרֵ֑א וְה֛וּא יֹשֵׁ֥ב פֶּֽתַח־הָאֹ֖הֶל כְּחֹ֥ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayera elayv y'hvah b'eloney mam're v'hv yoshev petach-haohel k'chom hayvom
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> appeared to him by the terebinths of Mamre; he was sitting at the entrance of the tent as the day grew hot.

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֤א עֵינָיו֙ וַיַּ֔רְא וְהִנֵּה֙ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה אֲנָשִׁ֔ים נִצָּבִ֖ים עָלָ֑יו וַיַּ֗רְא וַיָּ֤רָץ לִקְרָאתָם֙ מִפֶּ֣תַח הָאֹ֔הֶל וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ אָֽרְצָה׃
transliteration: vayisa 'eynayv vayar' v'hineh sh'loshah anashiym nitzaviym 'alayv vayar' vayaratz lik'ratam mipetach haohel vayish'tachv ar'tzah
translation: Looking up, he saw three men standing near him. As soon as he saw them, he ran from the entrance of the tent to greet them and, bowing to the ground,

hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנָ֗י אִם־נָ֨א מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ אַל־נָ֥א תַעֲבֹ֖ר מֵעַ֥ל עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomar adonay im-na matzatiy chen b'eyneykha al-na ta'avor me'al 'av'dekha
translation: he said, “My lords,aOr “My Lord.” if it please you, do not go on past your servant.

hebrew: יֻקַּֽח־נָ֣א מְעַט־מַ֔יִם וְרַחֲצ֖וּ רַגְלֵיכֶ֑ם וְהִֽשָּׁעֲנ֖וּ תַּ֥חַת הָעֵֽץ׃
transliteration: yukach-na m'at-mayim v'rachatzv rag'leykhem v'hisha'anv tachat ha'etz
translation: Let a little water be brought; bathe your feet and recline under the tree.

hebrew: וְאֶקְחָ֨ה פַת־לֶ֜חֶם וְסַעֲד֤וּ לִבְּכֶם֙ אַחַ֣ר תַּעֲבֹ֔רוּ כִּֽי־עַל־כֵּ֥ן עֲבַרְתֶּ֖ם עַֽל־עַבְדְּכֶ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כֵּ֥ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתָּ׃
transliteration: v'ek'chah fat-lechem v'sa'adv lib'khem achar ta'avorv kiy-'al-ken 'avar'tem 'al-'av'd'khem vayom'rv ken ta'aseh kaasher dibar'ta
translation: And let me fetch a morsel of bread that you may refresh yourselves; then go on—seeing that you have come your servant’s way.” They replied, “Do as you have said.”

hebrew: וַיְמַהֵ֧ר אַבְרָהָ֛ם הָאֹ֖הֱלָה אֶל־שָׂרָ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מַהֲרִ֞י שְׁלֹ֤שׁ סְאִים֙ קֶ֣מַח סֹ֔לֶת ל֖וּשִׁי וַעֲשִׂ֥י עֻגֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vay'maher av'raham haohelah el-sarah vayomer mahariy sh'losh s'iym kemach solet lvshiy va'asiy 'ugvot
translation: Abraham hastened into the tent to Sarah, and said, “Quick, three seahs of choice flour! Knead and make cakes!”

hebrew: וְאֶל־הַבָּקָ֖ר רָ֣ץ אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיִּקַּ֨ח בֶּן־בָּקָ֜ר רַ֤ךְ וָטוֹב֙ וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֶל־הַנַּ֔עַר וַיְמַהֵ֖ר לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'el-habakar ratz av'raham vayikach ben-bakar rakh' vatvov vayiten el-hana'ar vay'maher la'asvot otvo
translation: Then Abraham ran to the herd, took a calf, tender and choice, and gave it to a servant-boy, who hastened to prepare it.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח חֶמְאָ֜ה וְחָלָ֗ב וּבֶן־הַבָּקָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה וַיִּתֵּ֖ן לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם וְהֽוּא־עֹמֵ֧ד עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם תַּ֥חַת הָעֵ֖ץ וַיֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: vayikach chem'ah v'chalav vven-habakar asher 'asah vayiten lif'neyhem v'hv-'omed 'aleyhem tachat ha'etz vayokhelv
translation: He took curds and milk and the calf that had been prepared and set these before them; and he waited on them under the tree as they ate.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵׄלָׄ֔יׄוׄ אַיֵּ֖ה שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתֶּ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֵּ֥ה בָאֹֽהֶל׃
transliteration: vayom'rv elayv ayeh sarah ish'tekha vayomer hineh vaohel
translation: They said to him, “Where is your wife Sarah?” And he replied, “There, in the tent.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר שׁ֣וֹב אָשׁ֤וּב אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ כָּעֵ֣ת חַיָּ֔ה וְהִנֵּה־בֵ֖ן לְשָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתֶּ֑ךָ וְשָׂרָ֥ה שֹׁמַ֛עַת פֶּ֥תַח הָאֹ֖הֶל וְה֥וּא אַחֲרָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayomer shvov ashvv eleykha ka'et chayah v'hineh-ven l'sarah ish'tekha v'sarah shoma'at petach haohel v'hv acharayv
translation: Then one said, “I will return to you next year,bCf. Gen. 17.21; 2 Kings 4.16–17. and your wife Sarah shall have a son!” Sarah was listening at the entrance of the tent, which was behind him.

hebrew: וְאַבְרָהָ֤ם וְשָׂרָה֙ זְקֵנִ֔ים בָּאִ֖ים בַּיָּמִ֑ים חָדַל֙ לִהְי֣וֹת לְשָׂרָ֔ה אֹ֖רַח כַּנָּשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: v'av'raham v'sarah z'keniym baiym bayamiym chadal lih'yvot l'sarah orach kanashiym
translation: Now Abraham and Sarah were old, advanced in years; Sarah had stopped having the periods of women.

hebrew: וַתִּצְחַ֥ק שָׂרָ֖ה בְּקִרְבָּ֣הּ לֵאמֹ֑ר אַחֲרֵ֤י בְלֹתִי֙ הָֽיְתָה־לִּ֣י עֶדְנָ֔ה וַֽאדֹנִ֖י זָקֵֽן׃
transliteration: vatitz'chak sarah b'kir'bah lemor acharey v'lotiy hay'tah-liy 'ed'nah vadoniy zaken
translation: And Sarah laughed to herself, saying, “Now that I am withered, am I to have enjoyment—with my husband so old?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם לָ֣מָּה זֶּה֩ צָחֲקָ֨ה שָׂרָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר הַאַ֥ף אֻמְנָ֛ם אֵלֵ֖ד וַאֲנִ֥י זָקַֽנְתִּי׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-av'raham lamah zeh tzachakah sarah lemor haaf um'nam eled vaaniy zakan'tiy
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh, saying, ‘Shall I in truth bear a child, old as I am?’

hebrew: הֲיִפָּלֵ֥א מֵיְהוָ֖ה דָּבָ֑ר לַמּוֹעֵ֞ד אָשׁ֥וּב אֵלֶ֛יךָ כָּעֵ֥ת חַיָּ֖ה וּלְשָׂרָ֥ה בֵֽן׃
transliteration: hayipale mey'hvah davar lamvo'ed ashvv eleykha ka'et chayah vl'sarah ven
translation: Is anything too wondrous for the L<small>ORD</small>? I will return to you at the same season next year, and Sarah shall have a son.”

hebrew: וַתְּכַחֵ֨שׁ שָׂרָ֧ה ׀ לֵאמֹ֛ר לֹ֥א צָחַ֖קְתִּי כִּ֣י ׀ יָרֵ֑אָה וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ׀ לֹ֖א כִּ֥י צָחָֽקְתְּ׃
