transliteration: vat'khachesh sarah  lemor lo tzachak'tiy kiy  yareah vayomer  lo kiy tzachak't'
translation: Sarah lied, saying, “I did not laugh,” for she was frightened. But He replied, “You did laugh.”

hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֤מוּ מִשָּׁם֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיַּשְׁקִ֖פוּ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י סְדֹ֑ם וְאַ֨בְרָהָ֔ם הֹלֵ֥ךְ עִמָּ֖ם לְשַׁלְּחָֽם׃
transliteration: vayakumv misham haanashiym vayash'kifv 'al-p'ney s'dom v'av'raham holekh' 'imam l'shal'cham
translation: The men set out from there and looked down toward Sodom, Abraham walking with them to see them off.

hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָ֖ה אָמָ֑ר הַֽמְכַסֶּ֤ה אֲנִי֙ מֵֽאַבְרָהָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֲנִ֥י עֹשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: vayhovah amar ham'khaseh aniy meav'raham asher aniy 'oseh
translation: Now the L<small>ORD</small> had said, “Shall I hide from Abraham what I am about to do,

hebrew: וְאַ֨בְרָהָ֔ם הָי֧וֹ יִֽהְיֶ֛ה לְג֥וֹי גָּד֖וֹל וְעָצ֑וּם וְנִ֨בְרְכוּ ב֔וֹ כֹּ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'av'raham hayvo yih'yeh l'gvoy gadvol v'atzvm v'niv'r'khv vvo kol gvoyey haaretz
translation: since Abraham is to become a great and populous nation and all the nations of the earth are to bless themselves by him?

hebrew: כִּ֣י יְדַעְתִּ֗יו לְמַעַן֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְצַוֶּ֜ה אֶת־בָּנָ֤יו וְאֶת־בֵּיתוֹ֙ אַחֲרָ֔יו וְשָֽׁמְרוּ֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יְהוָ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת צְדָקָ֖ה וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט לְמַ֗עַן הָבִ֤יא יְהוָה֙ עַל־אַבְרָהָ֔ם אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֖ר עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: kiy y'da'tiyv l'ma'an asher y'tzaveh et-banayv v'et-beytvo acharayv v'sham'rv derekh' y'hvah la'asvot tz'dakah vmish'pat l'ma'an haviy y'hvah 'al-av'raham et asher-diber 'alayv
translation: For I have singled him out, that he may instruct his children and his posterity to keep the way of the L<small>ORD</small> by doing what is just and right, in order that the L<small>ORD</small> may bring about for Abraham what He has promised him.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָ֔ה זַעֲקַ֛ת סְדֹ֥ם וַעֲמֹרָ֖ה כִּי־רָ֑בָּה וְחַ֨טָּאתָ֔ם כִּ֥י כָבְדָ֖ה מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah za'akat s'dom va'amorah kiy-rabah v'chatatam kiy khav'dah m'od
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said, “The outrage of Sodom and Gomorrah is so great, and their sin so grave!

hebrew: אֵֽרֲדָה־נָּ֣א וְאֶרְאֶ֔ה הַכְּצַעֲקָתָ֛הּ הַבָּ֥אָה אֵלַ֖י עָשׂ֣וּ ׀ כָּלָ֑ה וְאִם־לֹ֖א אֵדָֽעָה׃
transliteration: eradah-na v'er'eh hak'tza'akatah habaah elay 'asv  kalah v'im-lo eda'ah
translation: I will go down to see whether they have acted altogether according to the outcry that has reached Me; if not, I will take note.”

hebrew: וַיִּפְנ֤וּ מִשָּׁם֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ סְדֹ֑מָה וְאַ֨בְרָהָ֔ם עוֹדֶ֥נּוּ עֹמֵ֖ד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayif'nv misham haanashiym vayel'khv s'domah v'av'raham 'vodenv 'omed lif'ney y'hvah
translation: The men went on from there to Sodom, while Abraham remained standing before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֥שׁ אַבְרָהָ֖ם וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַאַ֣ף תִּסְפֶּ֔ה צַדִּ֖יק עִם־רָשָֽׁע׃
transliteration: vayigash av'raham vayomar haaf tis'peh tzadiyk 'im-rasha'
translation: Abraham came forward and said, “Will You sweep away the innocent along with the guilty?

hebrew: אוּלַ֥י יֵ֛שׁ חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים צַדִּיקִ֖ם בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעִ֑יר הַאַ֤ף תִּסְפֶּה֙ וְלֹא־תִשָּׂ֣א לַמָּק֔וֹם לְמַ֛עַן חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים הַצַּדִּיקִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּקִרְבָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vlay yesh chamishiym tzadiykim b'tvokh' ha'iyr haaf tis'peh v'lo-tisa lamakvom l'ma'an chamishiym hatzadiykim asher b'kir'bah
translation: What if there should be fifty innocent within the city; will You then wipe out the place and not forgive it for the sake of the innocent fifty who are in it?

hebrew: חָלִ֨לָה לְּךָ֜ מֵעֲשֹׂ֣ת ׀ כַּדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה לְהָמִ֤ית צַדִּיק֙ עִם־רָשָׁ֔ע וְהָיָ֥ה כַצַּדִּ֖יק כָּרָשָׁ֑ע חָלִ֣לָה לָּ֔ךְ הֲשֹׁפֵט֙ כָּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ לֹ֥א יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
transliteration: chalilah l'kha me'asot  kadavar hazeh l'hamiyt tzadiyk 'im-rasha' v'hayah khatzadiyk karasha' chalilah lakh' hashofet kal-haaretz lo ya'aseh mish'pat
translation: Far be it from You to do such a thing, to bring death upon the innocent as well as the guilty, so that innocent and guilty fare alike. Far be it from You! Shall not the Judge of all the earth deal justly?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָ֔ה אִם־אֶמְצָ֥א בִסְדֹ֛ם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים צַדִּיקִ֖ם בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעִ֑יר וְנָשָׂ֥אתִי לְכָל־הַמָּק֖וֹם בַּעֲבוּרָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah im-em'tza vis'dom chamishiym tzadiykim b'tvokh' ha'iyr v'nasatiy l'khal-hamakvom ba'avvram
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> answered, “If I find within the city of Sodom fifty innocent ones, I will forgive the whole place for their sake.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אַבְרָהָ֖ם וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הִנֵּה־נָ֤א הוֹאַ֙לְתִּי֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֔י וְאָנֹכִ֖י עָפָ֥ר וָאֵֽפֶר׃
transliteration: vaya'an av'raham vayomar hineh-na hvoal'tiy l'daber el-adonay v'anokhiy 'afar vaefer
translation: Abraham spoke up, saying, “Here I venture to speak to my Lord, I who am but dust and ashes:

hebrew: א֠וּלַי יַחְסְר֞וּן חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים הַצַּדִּיקִם֙ חֲמִשָּׁ֔ה הֲתַשְׁחִ֥ית בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֖ה אֶת־כָּל־הָעִ֑יר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אַשְׁחִ֔ית אִם־אֶמְצָ֣א שָׁ֔ם אַרְבָּעִ֖ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vlay yach's'rvn chamishiym hatzadiykim chamishah hatash'chiyt bachamishah et-kal-ha'iyr vayomer lo ash'chiyt im-em'tza sham ar'ba'iym vachamishah
translation: What if the fifty innocent should lack five? Will You destroy the whole city for want of the five?” And He answered, “I will not destroy if I find forty-five there.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨סֶף ע֜וֹד לְדַבֵּ֤ר אֵלָיו֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר אוּלַ֛י יִמָּצְא֥וּן שָׁ֖ם אַרְבָּעִ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֔ה בַּעֲב֖וּר הָאַרְבָּעִֽים׃
transliteration: vayosef 'vod l'daber elayv vayomar vlay yimatz'vn sham ar'ba'iym vayomer lo e'eseh ba'avvr haar'ba'iym
translation: But he spoke to Him again, and said, “What if forty should be found there?” And He answered, “I will not do it, for the sake of the forty.”

hebrew: וַ֠יֹּאמֶר אַל־נָ֞א יִ֤חַר לַֽאדֹנָי֙ וַאֲדַבֵּ֔רָה אוּלַ֛י יִמָּצְא֥וּן שָׁ֖ם שְׁלֹשִׁ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֔ה אִם־אֶמְצָ֥א שָׁ֖ם שְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: vayomer al-na yichar ladonay vaadaberah vlay yimatz'vn sham sh'loshiym vayomer lo e'eseh im-em'tza sham sh'loshiym
translation: And he said, “Let not my Lord be angry if I go on: What if thirty should be found there?” And He answered, “I will not do it if I find thirty there.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּֽה־נָ֤א הוֹאַ֙לְתִּי֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֔י אוּלַ֛י יִמָּצְא֥וּן שָׁ֖ם עֶשְׂרִ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אַשְׁחִ֔ית בַּעֲב֖וּר הָֽעֶשְׂרִֽים׃
transliteration: vayomer hineh-na hvoal'tiy l'daber el-adonay vlay yimatz'vn sham 'es'riym vayomer lo ash'chiyt ba'avvr ha'es'riym
translation: And he said, “I venture again to speak to my Lord: What if twenty should be found there?” And He answered, “I will not destroy, for the sake of the twenty.”

hebrew: וַ֠יֹּאמֶר אַל־נָ֞א יִ֤חַר לַֽאדֹנָי֙ וַאֲדַבְּרָ֣ה אַךְ־הַפַּ֔עַם אוּלַ֛י יִמָּצְא֥וּן שָׁ֖ם עֲשָׂרָ֑ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אַשְׁחִ֔ית בַּעֲב֖וּר הָעֲשָׂרָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer al-na yichar ladonay vaadab'rah akh'-hapa'am vlay yimatz'vn sham 'asarah vayomer lo ash'chiyt ba'avvr ha'asarah
translation: And he said, “Let not my Lord be angry if I speak but this last time: What if ten should be found there?” And He answered, “I will not destroy, for the sake of the ten.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ יְהוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר כִּלָּ֔ה לְדַבֵּ֖ר אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם וְאַבְרָהָ֖ם שָׁ֥ב לִמְקֹמֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayelekh' y'hvah kaasher kilah l'daber el-av'raham v'av'raham shav lim'komvo
translation: When the L<small>ORD</small> had finished speaking to Abraham, He departed; and Abraham returned to his place.

hebrew: וַ֠יָּבֹאוּ שְׁנֵ֨י הַמַּלְאָכִ֤ים סְדֹ֙מָה֙ בָּעֶ֔רֶב וְל֖וֹט יֹשֵׁ֣ב בְּשַֽׁעַר־סְדֹ֑ם וַיַּרְא־לוֹט֙ וַיָּ֣קָם לִקְרָאתָ֔ם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ אַפַּ֖יִם אָֽרְצָה׃
transliteration: vayavov sh'ney hamal'akhiym s'domah ba'erev v'lvot yoshev b'sha'ar-s'dom vayar'-lvot vayakam lik'ratam vayish'tachv apayim ar'tzah
translation: The two angels arrived in Sodom in the evening, as Lot was sitting in the gate of Sodom. When Lot saw them, he rose to greet them and, bowing low with his face to the ground,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֜אמֶר הִנֶּ֣ה נָּא־אֲדֹנַ֗י ס֣וּרוּ נָ֠א אֶל־בֵּ֨ית עַבְדְּכֶ֤ם וְלִ֙ינוּ֙ וְרַחֲצ֣וּ רַגְלֵיכֶ֔ם וְהִשְׁכַּמְתֶּ֖ם וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֣ם לְדַרְכְּכֶ֑ם וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לֹּ֔א כִּ֥י בָרְח֖וֹב נָלִֽין׃
transliteration: vayomer hineh na-adonay svrv na el-beyt 'av'd'khem v'liynv v'rachatzv rag'leykhem v'hish'kam'tem vahalakh'tem l'dar'k'khem vayom'rv lo kiy var'chvov naliyn
translation: he said, “Please, my lords, turn aside to your servant’s house to spend the night, and bathe your feet; then you may be on your way early.” But they said, “No, we will spend the night in the square.”

hebrew: וַיִּפְצַר־בָּ֣ם מְאֹ֔ד וַיָּסֻ֣רוּ אֵלָ֔יו וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אֶל־בֵּית֑וֹ וַיַּ֤עַשׂ לָהֶם֙ מִשְׁתֶּ֔ה וּמַצּ֥וֹת אָפָ֖ה וַיֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: vayif'tzar-bam m'od vayasurv elayv vayavov el-beytvo vaya'as lahem mish'teh vmatzvot afah vayokhelv
translation: But he urged them strongly, so they turned his way and entered his house. He prepared a feast for them and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.

hebrew: טֶרֶם֮ יִשְׁכָּבוּ֒ וְאַנְשֵׁ֨י הָעִ֜יר אַנְשֵׁ֤י סְדֹם֙ נָסַ֣בּוּ עַל־הַבַּ֔יִת מִנַּ֖עַר וְעַד־זָקֵ֑ן כָּל־הָעָ֖ם מִקָּצֶֽה׃
transliteration: terem yish'kavv v'an'shey ha'iyr an'shey s'dom nasabv 'al-habayit mina'ar v'ad-zaken kal-ha'am mikatzeh
translation: They had not yet lain down, when the townspeople, the men of Sodom, young and old—all the people to the last man—gathered about the house.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרְא֤וּ אֶל־לוֹט֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ ל֔וֹ אַיֵּ֧ה הָאֲנָשִׁ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥אוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ הַלָּ֑יְלָה הוֹצִיאֵ֣ם אֵלֵ֔ינוּ וְנֵדְעָ֖ה אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayik'r'v el-lvot vayom'rv lvo ayeh haanashiym asher-bav eleykha halay'lah hvotziyem eleynv v'ned'ah otam
translation: And they shouted to Lot and said to him, “Where are the men who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us, that we may be intimate with them.”

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֧א אֲלֵהֶ֛ם ל֖וֹט הַפֶּ֑תְחָה וְהַדֶּ֖לֶת סָגַ֥ר אַחֲרָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayetze alehem lvot hapet'chah v'hadelet sagar acharayv
translation: So Lot went out to them to the entrance, shut the door behind him,

hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אַל־נָ֥א אַחַ֖י תָּרֵֽעוּ׃
transliteration: vayomar al-na achay tare'v
translation: and said, “I beg you, my friends, do not commit such a wrong.

hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֨א לִ֜י שְׁתֵּ֣י בָנ֗וֹת אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יָדְעוּ֙ אִ֔ישׁ אוֹצִֽיאָה־נָּ֤א אֶתְהֶן֙ אֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וַעֲשׂ֣וּ לָהֶ֔ן כַּטּ֖וֹב בְּעֵינֵיכֶ֑ם רַ֠ק לָֽאֲנָשִׁ֤ים הָאֵל֙ אַל־תַּעֲשׂ֣וּ דָבָ֔ר כִּֽי־עַל־כֵּ֥ן בָּ֖אוּ בְּצֵ֥ל קֹרָתִֽי׃
transliteration: hineh-na liy sh'tey vanvot asher lo-yad'v iysh votziyah-na et'hen aleykhem va'asv lahen katvov b'eyneykhem rak laanashiym hael al-ta'asv davar kiy-'al-ken bav b'tzel koratiy
translation: Look, I have two daughters who have not known a man. Let me bring them out to you, and you may do to them as you please; but do not do anything to these men, since they have come under the shelter of my roof.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ ׀ גֶּשׁ־הָ֗לְאָה וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ הָאֶחָ֤ד בָּֽא־לָגוּר֙ וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֣ט שָׁפ֔וֹט עַתָּ֕ה נָרַ֥ע לְךָ֖ מֵהֶ֑ם וַיִּפְצְר֨וּ בָאִ֤ישׁ בְּלוֹט֙ מְאֹ֔ד וַֽיִּגְּשׁ֖וּ לִשְׁבֹּ֥ר הַדָּֽלֶת׃
transliteration: vayom'rv  gesh-hal'ah vayom'rv haechad ba-lagvr vayish'pot shafvot 'atah nara' l'kha mehem vayif'tz'rv vaiysh b'lvot m'od vayig'shv lish'bor hadalet
translation: But they said, “Stand back! The fellow,” they said, “came here as an alien, and already he acts the ruler! Now we will deal worse with you than with them.” And they pressed hard against the person of Lot, and moved forward to break the door.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלְח֤וּ הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ אֶת־יָדָ֔ם וַיָּבִ֧יאוּ אֶת־ל֛וֹט אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם הַבָּ֑יְתָה וְאֶת־הַדֶּ֖לֶת סָגָֽרוּ׃
transliteration: vayish'l'chv haanashiym et-yadam vayaviyv et-lvot aleyhem habay'tah v'et-hadelet sagarv
translation: But the men stretched out their hands and pulled Lot into the house with them, and shut the door.

hebrew: וְֽאֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֞ים אֲשֶׁר־פֶּ֣תַח הַבַּ֗יִת הִכּוּ֙ בַּסַּנְוֵרִ֔ים מִקָּטֹ֖ן וְעַד־גָּד֑וֹל וַיִּלְא֖וּ לִמְצֹ֥א הַפָּֽתַח׃
transliteration: v'et-haanashiym asher-petach habayit hikv basan'veriym mikaton v'ad-gadvol vayil'v lim'tzo hapatach
translation: And the people who were at the entrance of the house, young and old, they struck with blinding light, so that they were helpless to find the entrance.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֜ים אֶל־ל֗וֹט עֹ֚ד מִֽי־לְךָ֣ פֹ֔ה חָתָן֙ וּבָנֶ֣יךָ וּבְנֹתֶ֔יךָ וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־לְךָ֖ בָּעִ֑יר הוֹצֵ֖א מִן־הַמָּקֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayom'rv haanashiym el-lvot 'od miy-l'kha foh chatan vvaneykha vv'noteykha v'khol asher-l'kha ba'iyr hvotze min-hamakvom
translation: Then the men said to Lot, “Whom else have you here? Sons-in-law, your sons and daughters, or anyone else that you have in the city—bring them out of the place.

hebrew: כִּֽי־מַשְׁחִתִ֣ים אֲנַ֔חְנוּ אֶת־הַמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּֽי־גָֽדְלָ֤ה צַעֲקָתָם֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וַיְשַׁלְּחֵ֥נוּ יְהוָ֖ה לְשַׁחֲתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: kiy-mash'chitiym anach'nv et-hamakvom hazeh kiy-gad'lah tza'akatam et-p'ney y'hvah vay'shal'chenv y'hvah l'shachatah
translation: For we are about to destroy this place; because the outcry against them before the L<small>ORD</small> has become so great that the L<small>ORD</small> has sent us to destroy it.”

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א ל֜וֹט וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר ׀ אֶל־חֲתָנָ֣יו ׀ לֹקְחֵ֣י בְנֹתָ֗יו וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ ק֤וּמוּ צְּאוּ֙ מִן־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה כִּֽי־מַשְׁחִ֥ית יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־הָעִ֑יר וַיְהִ֥י כִמְצַחֵ֖ק בְּעֵינֵ֥י חֲתָנָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayetze lvot vay'daber  el-chatanayv  lok'chey v'notayv vayomer kvmv tz'v min-hamakvom hazeh kiy-mash'chiyt y'hvah et-ha'iyr vay'hiy khim'tzachek b'eyney chatanayv
translation: So Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law, who had married his daughters, and said, “Up, get out of this place, for the L<small>ORD</small> is about to destroy the city.” But he seemed to his sons-in-law as one who jests.

hebrew: וּכְמוֹ֙ הַשַּׁ֣חַר עָלָ֔ה וַיָּאִ֥יצוּ הַמַּלְאָכִ֖ים בְּל֣וֹט לֵאמֹ֑ר קוּם֩ קַ֨ח אֶֽת־אִשְׁתְּךָ֜ וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֤י בְנֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ הַנִּמְצָאֹ֔ת פֶּן־תִּסָּפֶ֖ה בַּעֲוֺ֥ן הָעִֽיר׃
transliteration: vkh'mvo hashachar 'alah vayaiytzv hamal'akhiym b'lvot lemor kvm kach et-ish't'kha v'et-sh'tey v'noteykha hanim'tzaot pen-tisafeh ba'avon ha'iyr
translation: As dawn broke, the angels urged Lot on, saying, “Up, take your wife and your two remaining daughters, lest you be swept away because of the iniquity of the city.”

hebrew: וַֽיִּתְמַהְמָ֓הּ ׀ וַיַּחֲזִ֨קוּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֜ים בְּיָד֣וֹ וּבְיַד־אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ וּבְיַד֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י בְנֹתָ֔יו בְּחֶמְלַ֥ת יְהוָ֖ה עָלָ֑יו וַיֹּצִאֻ֥הוּ וַיַּנִּחֻ֖הוּ מִח֥וּץ לָעִֽיר׃
transliteration: vayit'mah'mah  vayachazikv haanashiym b'yadvo vv'yad-ish'tvo vv'yad sh'tey v'notayv b'chem'lat y'hvah 'alayv vayotziuhv vayanichuhv michvtz la'iyr
translation: Still he delayed. So the men seized his hand, and the hands of his wife and his two daughters—in the L<small>ORD</small>’s mercy on him—and brought him out and left him outside the city.

hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כְהוֹצִיאָ֨ם אֹתָ֜ם הַח֗וּצָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הִמָּלֵ֣ט עַל־נַפְשֶׁ֔ךָ אַל־תַּבִּ֣יט אַחֲרֶ֔יךָ וְאַֽל־תַּעֲמֹ֖ד בְּכָל־הַכִּכָּ֑ר הָהָ֥רָה הִמָּלֵ֖ט פֶּן־תִּסָּפֶֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kh'hvotziyam otam hachvtzah vayomer himalet 'al-naf'shekha al-tabiyt achareykha v'al-ta'amod b'khal-hakikar haharah himalet pen-tisafeh
translation: When they had brought them outside, one said, “Flee for your life! Do not look behind you, nor stop anywhere in the Plain; flee to the hills, lest you be swept away.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹט אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אַל־נָ֖א אֲדֹנָֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer lvot alehem al-na adonay
translation: But Lot said to them, “Oh no, my lord!

hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֠א מָצָ֨א עַבְדְּךָ֣ חֵן֮ בְּעֵינֶיךָ֒ וַתַּגְדֵּ֣ל חַסְדְּךָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ עִמָּדִ֔י לְהַחֲי֖וֹת אֶת־נַפְשִׁ֑י וְאָנֹכִ֗י לֹ֤א אוּכַל֙ לְהִמָּלֵ֣ט הָהָ֔רָה פֶּן־תִּדְבָּקַ֥נִי הָרָעָ֖ה וָמַֽתִּי׃
transliteration: hineh-na matza 'av'd'kha chen b'eyneykha vatag'del chas'd'kha asher 'asiyta 'imadiy l'hachayvot et-naf'shiy v'anokhiy lo vkhal l'himalet haharah pen-tid'bakaniy hara'ah vamatiy
translation: You have been so gracious to your servant, and have already shown me so much kindness in order to save my life; but I cannot flee to the hills, lest the disaster overtake me and I die.

hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֠א הָעִ֨יר הַזֹּ֧את קְרֹבָ֛ה לָנ֥וּס שָׁ֖מָּה וְהִ֣יא מִצְעָ֑ר אִמָּלְטָ֨ה נָּ֜א שָׁ֗מָּה הֲלֹ֥א מִצְעָ֛ר הִ֖וא וּתְחִ֥י נַפְשִֽׁי׃
transliteration: hineh-na ha'iyr hazot k'rovah lanvs shamah v'hiy mitz'ar imal'tah na shamah halo mitz'ar hiv vt'chiy naf'shiy
translation: Look, that town there is near enough to flee to; it is such a little place! Let me flee there—it is such a little place—and let my life be saved.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו הִנֵּה֙ נָשָׂ֣אתִי פָנֶ֔יךָ גַּ֖ם לַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה לְבִלְתִּ֛י הָפְכִּ֥י אֶת־הָעִ֖יר אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתָּ׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv hineh nasatiy faneykha gam ladavar hazeh l'vil'tiy haf'kiy et-ha'iyr asher dibar'ta
translation: He replied, “Very well, I will grant you this favor too, and I will not annihilate the town of which you have spoken.

hebrew: מַהֵר֙ הִמָּלֵ֣ט שָׁ֔מָּה כִּ֣י לֹ֤א אוּכַל֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת דָּבָ֔ר עַד־בֹּאֲךָ֖ שָׁ֑מָּה עַל־כֵּ֛ן קָרָ֥א שֵׁם־הָעִ֖יר צֽוֹעַר׃
transliteration: maher himalet shamah kiy lo vkhal la'asvot davar 'ad-boakha shamah 'al-ken kara shem-ha'iyr tzvo'ar
translation: Hurry, flee there, for I cannot do anything until you arrive there.” Hence the town came to be called Zoar.aConnected with miṣ‘ar “a little place,” v. 20.

hebrew: הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ יָצָ֣א עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְל֖וֹט בָּ֥א צֹֽעֲרָה׃
transliteration: hashemesh yatza 'al-haaretz v'lvot ba tzo'arah
translation: As the sun rose upon the earth and Lot entered Zoar,

hebrew: וַֽיהוָ֗ה הִמְטִ֧יר עַל־סְדֹ֛ם וְעַל־עֲמֹרָ֖ה גָּפְרִ֣ית וָאֵ֑שׁ מֵאֵ֥ת יְהוָ֖ה מִן־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayhvah him'tiyr 'al-s'dom v'al-'amorah gaf'riyt vaesh meet y'hvah min-hashamayim
translation: the L<small>ORD</small> rained upon Sodom and Gomorrah sulfurous fire from the L<small>ORD</small> out of heaven.

hebrew: וַֽיַּהֲפֹךְ֙ אֶת־הֶעָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔ל וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־הַכִּכָּ֑ר וְאֵת֙ כָּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הֶעָרִ֔ים וְצֶ֖מַח הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
transliteration: vayahafokh' et-he'ariym hael v'et kal-hakikar v'et kal-yosh'vey he'ariym v'tzemach haadamah
translation: He annihilated those cities and the entire Plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities and the vegetation of the ground.

hebrew: וַתַּבֵּ֥ט אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ מֵאַחֲרָ֑יו וַתְּהִ֖י נְצִ֥יב מֶֽלַח׃
transliteration: vatabet ish'tvo meacharayv vat'hiy n'tziyv melach
translation: Lot’sbLit. “His.” wife looked back,cLit. “behind him.” and she thereupon turned into a pillar of salt.

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֥ם אַבְרָהָ֖ם בַּבֹּ֑קֶר אֶל־הַ֨מָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁר־עָ֥מַד שָׁ֖ם אֶת־פְּנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayash'kem av'raham baboker el-hamakvom asher-'amad sham et-p'ney y'hvah
translation: Next morning, Abraham hurried to the place where he had stood before the L<small>ORD</small>,

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁקֵ֗ף עַל־פְּנֵ֤י סְדֹם֙ וַעֲמֹרָ֔ה וְעַֽל־כָּל־פְּנֵ֖י אֶ֣רֶץ הַכִּכָּ֑ר וַיַּ֗רְא וְהִנֵּ֤ה עָלָה֙ קִיטֹ֣ר הָאָ֔רֶץ כְּקִיטֹ֖ר הַכִּבְשָֽׁן׃
transliteration: vayash'kef 'al-p'ney s'dom va'amorah v'al-kal-p'ney eretz hakikar vayar' v'hineh 'alah kiytor haaretz k'kiytor hakiv'shan
translation: and, looking down toward Sodom and Gomorrah and all the land of the Plain, he saw the smoke of the land rising like the smoke of a kiln.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּשַׁחֵ֤ת אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־עָרֵ֣י הַכִּכָּ֔ר וַיִּזְכֹּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיְשַׁלַּ֤ח אֶת־לוֹט֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַהֲפֵכָ֔ה בַּהֲפֹךְ֙ אֶת־הֶ֣עָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־יָשַׁ֥ב בָּהֵ֖ן לֽוֹט׃
transliteration: vay'hiy b'shachet elohiym et-'arey hakikar vayiz'kor elohiym et-av'raham vay'shalach et-lvot mitvokh' hahafekhah bahafokh' et-he'ariym asher-yashav bahen lvot
translation: Thus it was that, when God destroyed the cities of the Plain and annihilated the cities where Lot dwelt, God was mindful of Abraham and removed Lot from the midst of the upheaval.

hebrew: וַיַּעַל֩ ל֨וֹט מִצּ֜וֹעַר וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב בָּהָ֗ר וּשְׁתֵּ֤י בְנֹתָיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י יָרֵ֖א לָשֶׁ֣בֶת בְּצ֑וֹעַר וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ בַּמְּעָרָ֔ה ה֖וּא וּשְׁתֵּ֥י בְנֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: vaya'al lvot mitzvo'ar vayeshev bahar vsh'tey v'notayv 'imvo kiy yare lashevet b'tzvo'ar vayeshev bam'arah hv vsh'tey v'notayv
translation: Lot went up from Zoar and settled in the hill country with his two daughters, for he was afraid to dwell in Zoar; and he and his two daughters lived in a cave.

hebrew: וַתֹּ֧אמֶר הַבְּכִירָ֛ה אֶל־הַצְּעִירָ֖ה אָבִ֣ינוּ זָקֵ֑ן וְאִ֨ישׁ אֵ֤ין בָּאָ֙רֶץ֙ לָב֣וֹא עָלֵ֔ינוּ כְּדֶ֖רֶךְ כָּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vatomer hab'khiyrah el-hatz'iyrah aviynv zaken v'iysh eyn baaretz lavvo 'aleynv k'derekh' kal-haaretz
translation: And the older one said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is not a man on earth to consort with us in the way of all the world.

hebrew: לְכָ֨ה נַשְׁקֶ֧ה אֶת־אָבִ֛ינוּ יַ֖יִן וְנִשְׁכְּבָ֣ה עִמּ֑וֹ וּנְחַיֶּ֥ה מֵאָבִ֖ינוּ זָֽרַע׃
transliteration: l'khah nash'keh et-aviynv yayin v'nish'k'vah 'imvo vn'chayeh meaviynv zara'
translation: Come, let us make our father drink wine, and let us lie with him, that we may maintain life through our father.”

hebrew: וַתַּשְׁקֶ֧יןָ אֶת־אֲבִיהֶ֛ן יַ֖יִן בַּלַּ֣יְלָה ה֑וּא וַתָּבֹ֤א הַבְּכִירָה֙ וַתִּשְׁכַּ֣ב אֶת־אָבִ֔יהָ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֥ע בְּשִׁכְבָ֖הּ וּבְקׄוּמָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vatash'keyna et-aviyhen yayin balay'lah hv vatavo hab'khiyrah vatish'kav et-aviyha v'lo-yada' b'shikh'vah vv'kvmah
translation: That night they made their father drink wine, and the older one went in and lay with her father; he did not know when she lay down or when she rose.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִֽמָּחֳרָ֔ת וַתֹּ֤אמֶר הַבְּכִירָה֙ אֶל־הַצְּעִירָ֔ה הֵן־שָׁכַ֥בְתִּי אֶ֖מֶשׁ אֶת־אָבִ֑י נַשְׁקֶ֨נּוּ יַ֜יִן גַּם־הַלַּ֗יְלָה וּבֹ֙אִי֙ שִׁכְבִ֣י עִמּ֔וֹ וּנְחַיֶּ֥ה מֵאָבִ֖ינוּ זָֽרַע׃
transliteration: vay'hiy mimachorat vatomer hab'khiyrah el-hatz'iyrah hen-shakhav'tiy emesh et-aviy nash'kenv yayin gam-halay'lah vvoiy shikh'viy 'imvo vn'chayeh meaviynv zara'
translation: The next day the older one said to the younger, “See, I lay with Father last night; let us make him drink wine tonight also, and you go and lie with him, that we may maintain life through our father.”

hebrew: וַתַּשְׁקֶ֜יןָ גַּ֣ם בַּלַּ֧יְלָה הַה֛וּא אֶת־אֲבִיהֶ֖ן יָ֑יִן וַתָּ֤קָם הַצְּעִירָה֙ וַתִּשְׁכַּ֣ב עִמּ֔וֹ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֥ע בְּשִׁכְבָ֖הּ וּבְקֻמָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vatash'keyna gam balay'lah hahv et-aviyhen yayin vatakam hatz'iyrah vatish'kav 'imvo v'lo-yada' b'shikh'vah vv'kumah
translation: That night also they made their father drink wine, and the younger one went and lay with him; he did not know when she lay down or when she rose.

hebrew: וַֽתַּהֲרֶ֛יןָ שְׁתֵּ֥י בְנֽוֹת־ל֖וֹט מֵאֲבִיהֶֽן׃
transliteration: vatahareyna sh'tey v'nvot-lvot meaviyhen
translation: Thus the two daughters of Lot came to be with child by their father.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֤לֶד הַבְּכִירָה֙ בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ מוֹאָ֑ב ה֥וּא אֲבִֽי־מוֹאָ֖ב עַד־הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vateled hab'khiyrah ben vatik'ra sh'mvo mvoav hv aviy-mvoav 'ad-hayvom
translation: The older one bore a son and named him Moab;dAs though me-’ab “from (my) father.” he is the father of the Moabites of today.

hebrew: וְהַצְּעִירָ֤ה גַם־הִוא֙ יָ֣לְדָה בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ בֶּן־עַמִּ֑י ה֛וּא אֲבִ֥י בְנֵֽי־עַמּ֖וֹן עַד־הַיּֽוֹם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hatz'iyrah gam-hiv yal'dah ben vatik'ra sh'mvo ben-'amiy hv aviy v'ney-'amvon 'ad-hayvom (s)
translation: And the younger also bore a son, and she called him Ben-ammi;eAs though “son of my (paternal) kindred.” he is the father of the Ammonites of today.

hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֨ע מִשָּׁ֤ם אַבְרָהָם֙ אַ֣רְצָה הַנֶּ֔גֶב וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב בֵּין־קָדֵ֖שׁ וּבֵ֣ין שׁ֑וּר וַיָּ֖גָר בִּגְרָֽר׃
transliteration: vayisa' misham av'raham ar'tzah hanegev vayeshev beyn-kadesh vveyn shvr vayagar big'rar
translation: Abraham journeyed from there to the region of the Negeb and settled between Kadesh and Shur. While he was sojourning in Gerar,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֶל־שָׂרָ֥ה אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֑וא וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח אֲבִימֶ֙לֶךְ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ גְּרָ֔ר וַיִּקַּ֖ח אֶת־שָׂרָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer av'raham el-sarah ish'tvo achotiy hiv vayish'lach aviymelekh' melekh' g'rar vayikach et-sarah
translation: Abraham said of Sarah his wife, “She is my sister.” So King Abimelech of Gerar had Sarah brought to him.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֧א אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶל־אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ בַּחֲל֣וֹם הַלָּ֑יְלָה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ הִנְּךָ֥ מֵת֙ עַל־הָאִשָּׁ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־לָקַ֔חְתָּ וְהִ֖וא בְּעֻ֥לַת בָּֽעַל׃
transliteration: vayavo elohiym el-aviymelekh' bachalvom halay'lah vayomer lvo hin'kha met 'al-haishah asher-lakach'ta v'hiv b'ulat ba'al
translation: But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night and said to him, “You are to die because of the woman that you have taken, for she is a married woman.”

hebrew: וַאֲבִימֶ֕לֶךְ לֹ֥א קָרַ֖ב אֵלֶ֑יהָ וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אֲדֹנָ֕י הֲג֥וֹי גַּם־צַדִּ֖יק תַּהֲרֹֽג׃
transliteration: vaaviymelekh' lo karav eleyha vayomar adonay hagvoy gam-tzadiyk taharog
translation: Now Abimelech had not approached her. He said, “O Lord, will You slay people even though innocent?

hebrew: הֲלֹ֨א ה֤וּא אָֽמַר־לִי֙ אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֔וא וְהִֽיא־גַם־הִ֥וא אָֽמְרָ֖ה אָחִ֣י ה֑וּא בְּתָם־לְבָבִ֛י וּבְנִקְיֹ֥ן כַּפַּ֖י עָשִׂ֥יתִי זֹֽאת׃
transliteration: halo hv amar-liy achotiy hiv v'hiy-gam-hiv am'rah achiy hv b'tam-l'vaviy vv'nik'yon kapay 'asiytiy zot
translation: He himself said to me, ‘She is my sister’! And she also said, ‘He is my brother.’ When I did this, my heart was blameless and my hands were clean.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֩ אֵלָ֨יו הָֽאֱלֹהִ֜ים בַּחֲלֹ֗ם גַּ֣ם אָנֹכִ֤י יָדַ֙עְתִּי֙ כִּ֤י בְתָם־לְבָבְךָ֙ עָשִׂ֣יתָ זֹּ֔את וָאֶחְשֹׂ֧ךְ גַּם־אָנֹכִ֛י אֽוֹתְךָ֖ מֵחֲטוֹ־לִ֑י עַל־כֵּ֥ן לֹא־נְתַתִּ֖יךָ לִנְגֹּ֥עַ אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv haelohiym bachalom gam anokhiy yada'tiy kiy v'tam-l'vav'kha 'asiyta zot vaech'sokh' gam-anokhiy vot'kha mechatvo-liy 'al-ken lo-n'tatiykha lin'go'a eleyha
translation: And God said to him in the dream, “I knew that you did this with a blameless heart, and so I kept you from sinning against Me. That was why I did not let you touch her.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הָשֵׁ֤ב אֵֽשֶׁת־הָאִישׁ֙ כִּֽי־נָבִ֣יא ה֔וּא וְיִתְפַּלֵּ֥ל בַּֽעַדְךָ֖ וֶֽחְיֵ֑ה וְאִם־אֵֽינְךָ֣ מֵשִׁ֗יב דַּ֚ע כִּי־מ֣וֹת תָּמ֔וּת אַתָּ֖ה וְכָל־אֲשֶׁר־לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'atah hashev eshet-haiysh kiy-naviy hv v'yit'palel ba'ad'kha vech'yeh v'im-eyn'kha meshiyv da' kiy-mvot tamvt atah v'khal-asher-lakh'
translation: Therefore, restore the man’s wife—since he is a prophet, he will intercede for you—to save your life. If you fail to restore her, know that you shall die, you and all that are yours.”

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיִּקְרָא֙ לְכָל־עֲבָדָ֔יו וַיְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה בְּאָזְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּֽירְא֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: vayash'kem aviymelekh' baboker vayik'ra l'khal-'avadayv vay'daber et-kal-had'variym haeleh b'az'neyhem vayiyr'v haanashiym m'od
translation: Early next morning, Abimelech called his servants and told them all that had happened; and the men were greatly frightened.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ לְאַבְרָהָ֗ם וַיֹּ֨אמֶר ל֜וֹ מֶֽה־עָשִׂ֤יתָ לָּ֙נוּ֙ וּמֶֽה־חָטָ֣אתִי לָ֔ךְ כִּֽי־הֵבֵ֧אתָ עָלַ֛י וְעַל־מַמְלַכְתִּ֖י חֲטָאָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֑ה מַעֲשִׂים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יֵֽעָשׂ֔וּ עָשִׂ֖יתָ עִמָּדִֽי׃
transliteration: vayik'ra aviymelekh' l'av'raham vayomer lvo meh-'asiyta lanv vmeh-chatatiy lakh' kiy-heveta 'alay v'al-mam'lakh'tiy chataah g'dolah ma'asiym asher lo-ye'asv 'asiyta 'imadiy
translation: Then Abimelech summoned Abraham and said to him, “What have you done to us? What wrong have I done that you should bring so great a guilt upon me and my kingdom? You have done to me things that ought not to be done.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם מָ֣ה רָאִ֔יתָ כִּ֥י עָשִׂ֖יתָ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer aviymelekh' el-av'raham mah raiyta kiy 'asiyta et-hadavar hazeh
translation: What, then,” Abimelech demanded of Abraham, “was your purpose in doing this thing?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם כִּ֣י אָמַ֗רְתִּי רַ֚ק אֵין־יִרְאַ֣ת אֱלֹהִ֔ים בַּמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַהֲרָג֖וּנִי עַל־דְּבַ֥ר אִשְׁתִּֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer av'raham kiy amar'tiy rak eyn-yir'at elohiym bamakvom hazeh vaharagvniy 'al-d'var ish'tiy
translation: “I thought,” said Abraham, “surely there is no fear of God in this place, and they will kill me because of my wife.

hebrew: וְגַם־אָמְנָ֗ה אֲחֹתִ֤י בַת־אָבִי֙ הִ֔וא אַ֖ךְ לֹ֣א בַת־אִמִּ֑י וַתְּהִי־לִ֖י לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'gam-am'nah achotiy vat-aviy hiv akh' lo vat-imiy vat'hiy-liy l'ishah
translation: And besides, she is in truth my sister, my father’s daughter though not my mother’s; and she became my wife.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כַּאֲשֶׁ֧ר הִתְע֣וּ אֹתִ֗י אֱלֹהִים֮ מִבֵּ֣ית אָבִי֒ וָאֹמַ֣ר לָ֔הּ זֶ֣ה חַסְדֵּ֔ךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשִׂ֖י עִמָּדִ֑י אֶ֤ל כָּל־הַמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָב֣וֹא שָׁ֔מָּה אִמְרִי־לִ֖י אָחִ֥י הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kaasher hit'v otiy elohiym mibeyt aviy vaomar lah zeh chas'dekh' asher ta'asiy 'imadiy el kal-hamakvom asher navvo shamah im'riy-liy achiy hv
translation: So when God made me wander from my father’s house, I said to her, ‘Let this be the kindness that you shall do me: whatever place we come to, say there of me: He is my brother.’”

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ צֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֗ר וַעֲבָדִים֙ וּשְׁפָחֹ֔ת וַיִּתֵּ֖ן לְאַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיָּ֣שֶׁב ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת שָׂרָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayikach aviymelekh' tzon vvakar va'avadiym vsh'fachot vayiten l'av'raham vayashev lvo et sarah ish'tvo
translation: Abimelech took sheep and oxen, and male and female slaves, and gave them to Abraham; and he restored his wife Sarah to him.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ הִנֵּ֥ה אַרְצִ֖י לְפָנֶ֑יךָ בַּטּ֥וֹב בְּעֵינֶ֖יךָ שֵֽׁב׃
transliteration: vayomer aviymelekh' hineh ar'tziy l'faneykha batvov b'eyneykha shev
translation: And Abimelech said, “Here, my land is before you; settle wherever you please.”

hebrew: וּלְשָׂרָ֣ה אָמַ֗ר הִנֵּ֨ה נָתַ֜תִּי אֶ֤לֶף כֶּ֙סֶף֙ לְאָחִ֔יךְ הִנֵּ֤ה הוּא־לָךְ֙ כְּס֣וּת עֵינַ֔יִם לְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתָּ֑ךְ וְאֵ֥ת כֹּ֖ל וְנֹכָֽחַת׃
transliteration: vl'sarah amar hineh natatiy elef kesef l'achiykh' hineh hv-lakh' k'svt 'eynayim l'khol asher itakh' v'et kol v'nokhachat
translation: And to Sarah he said, “I herewith give your brother a thousand pieces of silver; this will serve you as vindicationaLit. “a covering of the eyes”; meaning of latter half of verse uncertain. before all who are with you, and you are cleared before everyone.”

hebrew: וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֥ל אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּרְפָּ֨א אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶת־אֲבִימֶ֧לֶךְ וְאֶת־אִשְׁתּ֛וֹ וְאַמְהֹתָ֖יו וַיֵּלֵֽדוּ׃
transliteration: vayit'palel av'raham el-haelohiym vayir'pa elohiym et-aviymelekh' v'et-ish'tvo v'am'hotayv vayeledv
translation: Abraham then prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech and his wife and his slave girls, so that they bore children;

hebrew: כִּֽי־עָצֹ֤ר עָצַר֙ יְהוָ֔ה בְּעַ֥ד כָּל־רֶ֖חֶם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ עַל־דְּבַ֥ר שָׂרָ֖ה אֵ֥שֶׁת אַבְרָהָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy-'atzor 'atzar y'hvah b'ad kal-rechem l'veyt aviymelekh' 'al-d'var sarah eshet av'raham (s)
translation: for the L<small>ORD</small> had closed fast every womb of the household of Abimelech because of Sarah, the wife of Abraham.

hebrew: וַֽיהוָ֛ה פָּקַ֥ד אֶת־שָׂרָ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמָ֑ר וַיַּ֧עַשׂ יְהוָ֛ה לְשָׂרָ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃
transliteration: vayhvah pakad et-sarah kaasher amar vaya'as y'hvah l'sarah kaasher diber
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> took note of Sarah as He had promised, and the L<small>ORD</small> did for Sarah as He had spoken.

hebrew: וַתַּהַר֩ וַתֵּ֨לֶד שָׂרָ֧ה לְאַבְרָהָ֛ם בֵּ֖ן לִזְקֻנָ֑יו לַמּוֹעֵ֕ד אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אֹת֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: vatahar vateled sarah l'av'raham ben liz'kunayv lamvo'ed asher-diber otvo elohiym
translation: Sarah conceived and bore a son to Abraham in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶֽת־שֶׁם־בְּנ֧וֹ הַנּֽוֹלַד־ל֛וֹ אֲשֶׁר־יָלְדָה־לּ֥וֹ שָׂרָ֖ה יִצְחָֽק׃
transliteration: vayik'ra av'raham et-shem-b'nvo hanvolad-lvo asher-yal'dah-lvo sarah yitz'chak
translation: Abraham gave his newborn son, whom Sarah had borne him, the name of Isaac.

hebrew: וַיָּ֤מָל אַבְרָהָם֙ אֶת־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֔וֹ בֶּן־שְׁמֹנַ֖ת יָמִ֑ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: vayamal av'raham et-yitz'chak b'nvo ben-sh'monat yamiym kaasher tzivah otvo elohiym
translation: And when his son Isaac was eight days old, Abraham circumcised him, as God had commanded him.

hebrew: וְאַבְרָהָ֖ם בֶּן־מְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה בְּהִוָּ֣לֶד ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת יִצְחָ֥ק בְּנֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'av'raham ben-m'at shanah b'hivaled lvo et yitz'chak b'nvo
translation: Now Abraham was a hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.

hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר שָׂרָ֔ה צְחֹ֕ק עָ֥שָׂה לִ֖י אֱלֹהִ֑ים כָּל־הַשֹּׁמֵ֖עַ יִֽצְחַק־לִֽי׃
transliteration: vatomer sarah tz'chok 'asah liy elohiym kal-hashome'a yitz'chak-liy
translation: Sarah said, “God has brought me laughter; everyone who hears will laugh withaLit. “for.” me.”

hebrew: וַתֹּ֗אמֶר מִ֤י מִלֵּל֙ לְאַבְרָהָ֔ם הֵינִ֥יקָה בָנִ֖ים שָׂרָ֑ה כִּֽי־יָלַ֥דְתִּי בֵ֖ן לִזְקֻנָֽיו׃
transliteration: vatomer miy milel l'av'raham heyniykah vaniym sarah kiy-yalad'tiy ven liz'kunayv
translation:
And she added,
“Who would have said to Abraham
That Sarah would suckle children!
Yet I have borne a son in his old age.”

hebrew: וַיִּגְדַּ֥ל הַיֶּ֖לֶד וַיִּגָּמַ֑ל וַיַּ֤עַשׂ אַבְרָהָם֙ מִשְׁתֶּ֣ה גָד֔וֹל בְּי֖וֹם הִגָּמֵ֥ל אֶת־יִצְחָֽק׃
transliteration: vayig'dal hayeled vayigamal vaya'as av'raham mish'teh gadvol b'yvom higamel et-yitz'chak
translation: The child grew up and was weaned, and Abraham held a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֨רֶא שָׂרָ֜ה אֶֽת־בֶּן־הָגָ֧ר הַמִּצְרִ֛ית אֲשֶׁר־יָלְדָ֥ה לְאַבְרָהָ֖ם מְצַחֵֽק׃
transliteration: vatere sarah et-ben-hagar hamitz'riyt asher-yal'dah l'av'raham m'tzachek
translation: Sarah saw the son whom Hagar the Egyptian had borne to Abraham playing.

hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לְאַבְרָהָ֔ם גָּרֵ֛שׁ הָאָמָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את וְאֶת־בְּנָ֑הּ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יִירַשׁ֙ בֶּן־הָאָמָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את עִם־בְּנִ֖י עִם־יִצְחָֽק׃
transliteration: vatomer l'av'raham garesh haamah hazot v'et-b'nah kiy lo yiyrash ben-haamah hazot 'im-b'niy 'im-yitz'chak
translation: She said to Abraham, “Cast out that slave-woman and her son, for the son of that slave shall not share in the inheritance with my son Isaac.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֧רַע הַדָּבָ֛ר מְאֹ֖ד בְּעֵינֵ֣י אַבְרָהָ֑ם עַ֖ל אוֹדֹ֥ת בְּנֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayera' hadavar m'od b'eyney av'raham 'al vodot b'nvo
translation: The matter distressed Abraham greatly, for it concerned a son of his.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֗ם אַל־יֵרַ֤ע בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ עַל־הַנַּ֣עַר וְעַל־אֲמָתֶ֔ךָ כֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תֹּאמַ֥ר אֵלֶ֛יךָ שָׂרָ֖ה שְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹלָ֑הּ כִּ֣י בְיִצְחָ֔ק יִקָּרֵ֥א לְךָ֖ זָֽרַע׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym el-av'raham al-yera' b'eyneykha 'al-hana'ar v'al-amatekha kol asher tomar eleykha sarah sh'ma' b'kolah kiy v'yitz'chak yikare l'kha zara'
translation: But God said to Abraham, “Do not be distressed over the boy or your slave; whatever Sarah tells you, do as she says, for it is through Isaac that offspring shall be continuedbLit. “called.” for you.

hebrew: וְגַ֥ם אֶת־בֶּן־הָאָמָ֖ה לְג֣וֹי אֲשִׂימֶ֑נּוּ כִּ֥י זַרְעֲךָ֖ הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'gam et-ben-haamah l'gvoy asiymenv kiy zar'akha hv
translation: As for the son of the slave-woman, I will make a nation of him, too, for he is your seed.”

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֣ם אַבְרָהָ֣ם ׀ בַּבֹּ֡קֶר וַיִּֽקַּֽח־לֶחֶם֩ וְחֵ֨מַת מַ֜יִם וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֶל־הָ֠גָר שָׂ֧ם עַל־שִׁכְמָ֛הּ וְאֶת־הַיֶּ֖לֶד וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֶ֑הָ וַתֵּ֣לֶךְ וַתֵּ֔תַע בְּמִדְבַּ֖ר בְּאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃
transliteration: vayash'kem av'raham  baboker vayikach-lechem v'chemat mayim vayiten el-hagar sam 'al-shikh'mah v'et-hayeled vay'shal'cheha vatelekh' vateta' b'mid'bar b'er shava'
translation: Early next morning Abraham took some bread and a skin of water, and gave them to Hagar. He placed them over her shoulder, together with the child, and sent her away. And she wandered about in the wilderness of Beer-sheba.

hebrew: וַיִּכְל֥וּ הַמַּ֖יִם מִן־הַחֵ֑מֶת וַתַּשְׁלֵ֣ךְ אֶת־הַיֶּ֔לֶד תַּ֖חַת אַחַ֥ד הַשִּׂיחִֽם׃
transliteration: vayikh'lv hamayim min-hachemet vatash'lekh' et-hayeled tachat achad hasiychim
translation: When the water was gone from the skin, she left the child under one of the bushes,

hebrew: וַתֵּלֶךְ֩ וַתֵּ֨שֶׁב לָ֜הּ מִנֶּ֗גֶד הַרְחֵק֙ כִּמְטַחֲוֵ֣י קֶ֔שֶׁת כִּ֣י אָֽמְרָ֔ה אַל־אֶרְאֶ֖ה בְּמ֣וֹת הַיָּ֑לֶד וַתֵּ֣שֶׁב מִנֶּ֔גֶד וַתִּשָּׂ֥א אֶת־קֹלָ֖הּ וַתֵּֽבְךְּ׃
transliteration: vatelekh' vateshev lah mineged har'chek kim'tachavey keshet kiy am'rah al-er'eh b'mvot hayaled vateshev mineged vatisa et-kolah vatev'k'
translation: and went and sat down at a distance, a bowshot away; for she thought, “Let me not look on as the child dies.” And sitting thus afar, she burst into tears.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע אֱלֹהִים֮ אֶת־ק֣וֹל הַנַּעַר֒ וַיִּקְרָא֩ מַלְאַ֨ךְ אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ אֶל־הָגָר֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָ֖הּ מַה־לָּ֣ךְ הָגָ֑ר אַל־תִּ֣ירְאִ֔י כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֧ע אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶל־ק֥וֹל הַנַּ֖עַר בַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הוּא־שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' elohiym et-kvol hana'ar vayik'ra mal'akh' elohiym  el-hagar min-hashamayim vayomer lah mah-lakh' hagar al-tiyr'iy kiy-shama' elohiym el-kvol hana'ar baasher hv-sham
translation: God heard the cry of the boy, and an angel of God called to Hagar from heaven and said to her, “What troubles you, Hagar? Fear not, for God has heeded the cry of the boy where he is.

hebrew: ק֚וּמִי שְׂאִ֣י אֶת־הַנַּ֔עַר וְהַחֲזִ֥יקִי אֶת־יָדֵ֖ךְ בּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־לְג֥וֹי גָּד֖וֹל אֲשִׂימֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: kvmiy s'iy et-hana'ar v'hachaziykiy et-yadekh' bvo kiy-l'gvoy gadvol asiymenv
translation: Come, lift up the boy and hold him by the hand, for I will make a great nation of him.”

hebrew: וַיִּפְקַ֤ח אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־עֵינֶ֔יהָ וַתֵּ֖רֶא בְּאֵ֣ר מָ֑יִם וַתֵּ֜לֶךְ וַתְּמַלֵּ֤א אֶת־הַחֵ֙מֶת֙ מַ֔יִם וַתַּ֖שְׁקְ אֶת־הַנָּֽעַר׃
transliteration: vayif'kach elohiym et-'eyneyha vatere b'er mayim vatelekh' vat'male et-hachemet mayim vatash'k' et-hana'ar
translation: Then God opened her eyes and she saw a well of water. She went and filled the skin with water, and let the boy drink.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֧י אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הַנַּ֖עַר וַיִּגְדָּ֑ל וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר וַיְהִ֖י רֹבֶ֥ה קַשָּֽׁת׃
transliteration: vay'hiy elohiym et-hana'ar vayig'dal vayeshev bamid'bar vay'hiy roveh kashat
translation: God was with the boy and he grew up; he dwelt in the wilderness and became a bowman.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בְּמִדְבַּ֣ר פָּארָ֑ן וַתִּֽקַּֽח־ל֥וֹ אִמּ֛וֹ אִשָּׁ֖ה מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayeshev b'mid'bar paran vatikach-lvo imvo ishah meeretz mitz'rayim (f)
translation: He lived in the wilderness of Paran; and his mother got a wife for him from the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֗לֶךְ וּפִיכֹל֙ שַׂר־צְבָא֔וֹ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר אֱלֹהִ֣ים עִמְּךָ֔ בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֖ה עֹשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy ba'et hahiv vayomer aviymelekh' vfiykhol sar-tz'vavo el-av'raham lemor elohiym 'im'kha b'khol asher-atah 'oseh
translation: At that time Abimelech and Phicol, chief of his troops, said to Abraham, “God is with you in everything that you do.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הִשָּׁ֨בְעָה לִּ֤י בֵֽאלֹהִים֙ הֵ֔נָּה אִם־תִּשְׁקֹ֣ר לִ֔י וּלְנִינִ֖י וּלְנֶכְדִּ֑י כַּחֶ֜סֶד אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֤יתִי עִמְּךָ֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה עִמָּדִ֔י וְעִם־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־גַּ֥רְתָּה בָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'atah hishav'ah liy velohiym henah im-tish'kor liy vl'niyniy vl'nekh'diy kachesed asher-'asiytiy 'im'kha ta'aseh 'imadiy v'im-haaretz asher-gar'tah bah
translation: Therefore swear to me here by God that you will not deal falsely with me or with my kith and kin, but will deal with me and with the land in which you have sojourned as loyally as I have dealt with you.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם אָנֹכִ֖י אִשָּׁבֵֽעַ׃
transliteration: vayomer av'raham anokhiy ishave'a
translation: And Abraham said, “I swear it.”

hebrew: וְהוֹכִ֥חַ אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶת־אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ עַל־אֹדוֹת֙ בְּאֵ֣ר הַמַּ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר גָּזְל֖וּ עַבְדֵ֥י אֲבִימֶֽלֶךְ׃
transliteration: v'hvokhicha av'raham et-aviymelekh' 'al-odvot b'er hamayim asher gaz'lv 'av'dey aviymelekh'
translation: Then Abraham reproached Abimelech for the well of water which the servants of Abimelech had seized.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי מִ֥י עָשָׂ֖ה אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וְגַם־אַתָּ֞ה לֹא־הִגַּ֣דְתָּ לִּ֗י וְגַ֧ם אָנֹכִ֛י לֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖עְתִּי בִּלְתִּ֥י הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayomer aviymelekh' lo yada'tiy miy 'asah et-hadavar hazeh v'gam-atah lo-higad'ta liy v'gam anokhiy lo shama'tiy bil'tiy hayvom
translation: But Abimelech said, “I do not know who did this; you did not tell me, nor have I heard of it until today.”

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח אַבְרָהָם֙ צֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֔ר וַיִּתֵּ֖ן לַאֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ וַיִּכְרְת֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם בְּרִֽית׃
transliteration: vayikach av'raham tzon vvakar vayiten laaviymelekh' vayikh'r'tv sh'neyhem b'riyt
translation: Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them to Abimelech, and the two of them made a pact.

hebrew: וַיַּצֵּ֣ב אַבְרָהָ֗ם אֶת־שֶׁ֛בַע כִּבְשֹׂ֥ת הַצֹּ֖אן לְבַדְּהֶֽן׃
transliteration: vayatzev av'raham et-sheva' kiv'sot hatzon l'vad'hen
translation: Abraham then set seven ewes of the flock by themselves,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם מָ֣ה הֵ֗נָּה שֶׁ֤בַע כְּבָשֹׂת֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִצַּ֖בְתָּ לְבַדָּֽנָה׃
transliteration: vayomer aviymelekh' el-av'raham mah henah sheva' k'vasot haeleh asher hitzav'ta l'vadanah
translation: and Abimelech said to Abraham, “What mean these seven ewes which you have set apart?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֚י אֶת־שֶׁ֣בַע כְּבָשֹׂ֔ת תִּקַּ֖ח מִיָּדִ֑י בַּעֲבוּר֙ תִּֽהְיֶה־לִּ֣י לְעֵדָ֔ה כִּ֥י חָפַ֖רְתִּי אֶת־הַבְּאֵ֥ר הַזֹּֽאת׃
transliteration: vayomer kiy et-sheva' k'vasot tikach miyadiy ba'avvr tih'yeh-liy l'edah kiy chafar'tiy et-hab'er hazot
translation: He replied, “You are to accept these seven ewes from me as proof that I dug this well.”

hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֗ן קָרָ֛א לַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא בְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע כִּ֛י שָׁ֥ם נִשְׁבְּע֖וּ שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: 'al-ken kara lamakvom hahv b'er shava' kiy sham nish'b'v sh'neyhem
translation: Hence that place was called Beer-sheba,cI.e., “well of seven” or “well of oath.” for there the two of them swore an oath.

hebrew: וַיִּכְרְת֥וּ בְרִ֖ית בִּבְאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיָּ֣קָם אֲבִימֶ֗לֶךְ וּפִיכֹל֙ שַׂר־צְבָא֔וֹ וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
transliteration: vayikh'r'tv v'riyt biv'er shava' vayakam aviymelekh' vfiykhol sar-tz'vavo vayashuvv el-eretz p'lish'tiym
translation: When they had concluded the pact at Beer-sheba, Abimelech and Phicol, chief of his troops, departed and returned to the land of the Philistines.

hebrew: וַיִּטַּ֥ע אֶ֖שֶׁל בִּבְאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיִּ֨קְרָא־שָׁ֔ם בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהוָ֖ה אֵ֥ל עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: vayita' eshel biv'er shava' vayik'ra-sham b'shem y'hvah el 'volam
translation: [Abraham] planted a tamarisk at Beer-sheba, and invoked there the name of the L<small>ORD</small>, the Everlasting God.

hebrew: וַיָּ֧גָר אַבְרָהָ֛ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים יָמִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayagar av'raham b'eretz p'lish'tiym yamiym rabiym (f)
translation: And Abraham resided in the land of the Philistines a long time.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחַר֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וְהָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים נִסָּ֖ה אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו אַבְרָהָ֖ם וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
transliteration: vay'hiy achar had'variym haeleh v'haelohiym nisah et-av'raham vayomer elayv av'raham vayomer hineniy
translation: Some time afterward, God put Abraham to the test. He said to him, “Abraham,” and he answered, “Here I am.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר קַח־נָ֠א אֶת־בִּנְךָ֨ אֶת־יְחִֽידְךָ֤ אֲשֶׁר־אָהַ֙בְתָּ֙ אֶת־יִצְחָ֔ק וְלֶךְ־לְךָ֔ אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ הַמֹּרִיָּ֑ה וְהַעֲלֵ֤הוּ שָׁם֙ לְעֹלָ֔ה עַ֚ל אַחַ֣ד הֶֽהָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֹמַ֥ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer kach-na et-bin'kha et-y'chiyd'kha asher-ahav'ta et-yitz'chak v'lekh'-l'kha el-eretz hamoriyah v'ha'alehv sham l'olah 'al achad hehariym asher omar eleykha
translation: And He said, “Take your son, your favored one, Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the heights that I will point out to you.”

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם אַבְרָהָ֜ם בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַֽיַּחֲבֹשׁ֙ אֶת־חֲמֹר֔וֹ וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־שְׁנֵ֤י נְעָרָיו֙ אִתּ֔וֹ וְאֵ֖ת יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֑וֹ וַיְבַקַּע֙ עֲצֵ֣י עֹלָ֔ה וַיָּ֣קָם וַיֵּ֔לֶךְ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־אָֽמַר־ל֥וֹ הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: vayash'kem av'raham baboker vayachavosh et-chamorvo vayikach et-sh'ney n'arayv itvo v'et yitz'chak b'nvo vay'vaka' 'atzey 'olah vayakam vayelekh' el-hamakvom asher-amar-lvo haelohiym
translation: So early next morning, Abraham saddled his ass and took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. He split the wood for the burnt offering, and he set out for the place of which God had told him.

hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֗י וַיִּשָּׂ֨א אַבְרָהָ֧ם אֶת־עֵינָ֛יו וַיַּ֥רְא אֶת־הַמָּק֖וֹם מֵרָחֹֽק׃
transliteration: bayvom hash'liyshiy vayisa av'raham et-'eynayv vayar' et-hamakvom merachok
translation: On the third day Abraham looked up and saw the place from afar.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶל־נְעָרָ֗יו שְׁבוּ־לָכֶ֥ם פֹּה֙ עִֽם־הַחֲמ֔וֹר וַאֲנִ֣י וְהַנַּ֔עַר נֵלְכָ֖ה עַד־כֹּ֑ה וְנִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה וְנָשׁ֥וּבָה אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer av'raham el-n'arayv sh'vv-lakhem poh 'im-hachamvor vaaniy v'hana'ar nel'khah 'ad-koh v'nish'tachaveh v'nashvvah aleykhem
translation: Then Abraham said to his servants, “You stay here with the ass. The boy and I will go up there; we will worship and we will return to you.”

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־עֲצֵ֣י הָעֹלָ֗ה וַיָּ֙שֶׂם֙ עַל־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֔וֹ וַיִּקַּ֣ח בְּיָד֔וֹ אֶת־הָאֵ֖שׁ וְאֶת־הַֽמַּאֲכֶ֑לֶת וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם יַחְדָּֽו׃
transliteration: vayikach av'raham et-'atzey ha'olah vayasem 'al-yitz'chak b'nvo vayikach b'yadvo et-haesh v'et-hamaakhelet vayel'khv sh'neyhem yach'dav
translation: Abraham took the wood for the burnt offering and put it on his son Isaac. He himself took the firestoneaLit. “fire.” and the knife; and the two walked off together.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יִצְחָ֜ק אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֤ם אָבִיו֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אָבִ֔י וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֶּ֣נִּֽי בְנִ֑י וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֤ה הָאֵשׁ֙ וְהָ֣עֵצִ֔ים וְאַיֵּ֥ה הַשֶּׂ֖ה לְעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer yitz'chak el-av'raham aviyv vayomer aviy vayomer hineniy v'niy vayomer hineh haesh v'ha'etziym v'ayeh haseh l'olah
translation: Then Isaac said to his father Abraham, “Father!” And he answered, “Yes, my son.” And he said, “Here are the firestone and the wood; but where is the sheep for the burnt offering?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם אֱלֹהִ֞ים יִרְאֶה־לּ֥וֹ הַשֶּׂ֛ה לְעֹלָ֖ה בְּנִ֑י וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם יַחְדָּֽו׃
transliteration: vayomer av'raham elohiym yir'eh-lvo haseh l'olah b'niy vayel'khv sh'neyhem yach'dav
translation: And Abraham said, “God will see to the sheep for His burnt offering, my son.” And the two of them walked on together.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ אֶֽל־הַמָּקוֹם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָֽמַר־ל֣וֹ הָאֱלֹהִים֒ וַיִּ֨בֶן שָׁ֤ם אַבְרָהָם֙ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וַֽיַּעֲרֹ֖ךְ אֶת־הָעֵצִ֑ים וַֽיַּעֲקֹד֙ אֶת־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֔וֹ וַיָּ֤שֶׂם אֹתוֹ֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ מִמַּ֖עַל לָעֵצִֽים׃
transliteration: vayavov el-hamakvom asher amar-lvo haelohiym vayiven sham av'raham et-hamiz'becha vaya'arokh' et-ha'etziym vaya'akod et-yitz'chak b'nvo vayasem otvo 'al-hamiz'becha mima'al la'etziym
translation: They arrived at the place of which God had told him. Abraham built an altar there; he laid out the wood; he bound his son Isaac; he laid him on the altar, on top of the wood.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח אַבְרָהָם֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ וַיִּקַּ֖ח אֶת־הַֽמַּאֲכֶ֑לֶת לִשְׁחֹ֖ט אֶת־בְּנֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayish'lach av'raham et-yadvo vayikach et-hamaakhelet lish'chot et-b'nvo
translation: And Abraham picked up the knife to slay his son.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֵלָ֜יו מַלְאַ֤ךְ יְהוָה֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֣ם ׀ אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayik'ra elayv mal'akh' y'hvah min-hashamayim vayomer av'raham  av'raham vayomer hineniy
translation: Then an angel of the L<small>ORD</small> called to him from heaven: “Abraham! Abraham!” And he answered, “Here I am.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אַל־תִּשְׁלַ֤ח יָֽדְךָ֙ אֶל־הַנַּ֔עַר וְאַל־תַּ֥עַשׂ ל֖וֹ מְא֑וּמָּה כִּ֣י ׀ עַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֗עְתִּי כִּֽי־יְרֵ֤א אֱלֹהִים֙ אַ֔תָּה וְלֹ֥א חָשַׂ֛כְתָּ אֶת־בִּנְךָ֥ אֶת־יְחִידְךָ֖ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
transliteration: vayomer al-tish'lach yad'kha el-hana'ar v'al-ta'as lvo m'vmah kiy  'atah yada'tiy kiy-y're elohiym atah v'lo chasakh'ta et-bin'kha et-y'chiyd'kha mimeniy
translation: And he said, “Do not raise your hand against the boy, or do anything to him. For now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your son, your favored one, from Me.”

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּרְא֙ וְהִנֵּה־אַ֔יִל אַחַ֕ר נֶאֱחַ֥ז בַּסְּבַ֖ךְ בְּקַרְנָ֑יו וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ אַבְרָהָם֙ וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־הָאַ֔יִל וַיַּעֲלֵ֥הוּ לְעֹלָ֖ה תַּ֥חַת בְּנֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayisa av'raham et-'eynayv vayar' v'hineh-ayil achar neechaz bas'vakh' b'kar'nayv vayelekh' av'raham vayikach et-haayil vaya'alehv l'olah tachat b'nvo
translation: When Abraham looked up, his eye fell upon abReading ’eḥad with many Heb. mss. and ancient versions; text ’aḥar “after.” ram, caught in the thicket by its horns. So Abraham went and took the ram and offered it up as a burnt offering in place of his son.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֧א אַבְרָהָ֛ם שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא יְהוָ֣ה ׀ יִרְאֶ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֙ יֵאָמֵ֣ר הַיּ֔וֹם בְּהַ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה יֵרָאֶֽה׃
transliteration: vayik'ra av'raham shem-hamakvom hahv y'hvah  yir'eh asher yeamer hayvom b'har y'hvah yeraeh
translation: And Abraham named that site Adonai-yireh,cI.e., “the Lord will see”; cf. v. 8. whence the present saying, “On the mount of the LORD there is vision.”dHeb. Behar Adonai yera’eh.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֛א מַלְאַ֥ךְ יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם שֵׁנִ֖ית מִן־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayik'ra mal'akh' y'hvah el-av'raham sheniyt min-hashamayim
translation: The angel of the L<small>ORD</small> called to Abraham a second time from heaven,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בִּ֥י נִשְׁבַּ֖עְתִּי נְאֻם־יְהוָ֑ה כִּ֗י יַ֚עַן אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה וְלֹ֥א חָשַׂ֖כְתָּ אֶת־בִּנְךָ֥ אֶת־יְחִידֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer biy nish'ba'tiy n'um-y'hvah kiy ya'an asher 'asiyta et-hadavar hazeh v'lo chasakh'ta et-bin'kha et-y'chiydekha
translation: and said, “By Myself I swear, the L<small>ORD</small> declares: Because you have done this and have not withheld your son, your favored one,

hebrew: כִּֽי־בָרֵ֣ךְ אֲבָרֶכְךָ֗ וְהַרְבָּ֨ה אַרְבֶּ֤ה אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ כְּכוֹכְבֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְכַח֕וֹל אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־שְׂפַ֣ת הַיָּ֑ם וְיִרַ֣שׁ זַרְעֲךָ֔ אֵ֖ת שַׁ֥עַר אֹיְבָֽיו׃
transliteration: kiy-varekh' avarekh'kha v'har'bah ar'beh et-zar'akha k'khvokh'vey hashamayim v'khachvol asher 'al-s'fat hayam v'yirash zar'akha et sha'ar oy'vayv
translation: I will bestow My blessing upon you and make your descendants as numerous as the stars of heaven and the sands on the seashore; and your descendants shall seize the gates of their foes.

hebrew: וְהִתְבָּרֲכ֣וּ בְזַרְעֲךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ עֵ֕קֶב אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמַ֖עְתָּ בְּקֹלִֽי׃
transliteration: v'hit'barakhv v'zar'akha kol gvoyey haaretz 'ekev asher shama'ta b'koliy
translation: All the nations of the earth shall bless themselves by your descendants, because you have obeyed My command.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֤שָׁב אַבְרָהָם֙ אֶל־נְעָרָ֔יו וַיָּקֻ֛מוּ וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ יַחְדָּ֖ו אֶל־בְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב אַבְרָהָ֖ם בִּבְאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayashav av'raham el-n'arayv vayakumv vayel'khv yach'dav el-b'er shava' vayeshev av'raham biv'er shava' (f)
translation: Abraham then returned to his servants, and they departed together for Beer-sheba; and Abraham stayed in Beer-sheba.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחֲרֵי֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וַיֻּגַּ֥ד לְאַבְרָהָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר הִ֠נֵּה יָלְדָ֨ה מִלְכָּ֥ה גַם־הִ֛וא בָּנִ֖ים לְנָח֥וֹר אָחִֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy acharey had'variym haeleh vayugad l'av'raham lemor hineh yal'dah mil'kah gam-hiv baniym l'nachvor achiykha
translation: Some time later, Abraham was told, “Milcah too has borne children to your brother Nahor:

hebrew: אֶת־ע֥וּץ בְּכֹר֖וֹ וְאֶת־בּ֣וּז אָחִ֑יו וְאֶת־קְמוּאֵ֖ל אֲבִ֥י אֲרָֽם׃
transliteration: et-'vtz b'khorvo v'et-bvz achiyv v'et-k'mvel aviy aram
translation: Uz the first-born, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram;

hebrew: וְאֶת־כֶּ֣שֶׂד וְאֶת־חֲז֔וֹ וְאֶת־פִּלְדָּ֖שׁ וְאֶת־יִדְלָ֑ף וְאֵ֖ת בְּתוּאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'et-kesed v'et-chazvo v'et-pil'dash v'et-yid'laf v'et b'tvel
translation: and Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel”—

hebrew: וּבְתוּאֵ֖ל יָלַ֣ד אֶת־רִבְקָ֑ה שְׁמֹנָ֥ה אֵ֙לֶּה֙ יָלְדָ֣ה מִלְכָּ֔ה לְנָח֖וֹר אֲחִ֥י אַבְרָהָֽם׃
transliteration: vv'tvel yalad et-riv'kah sh'monah eleh yal'dah mil'kah l'nachvor achiy av'raham
translation: Bethuel being the father of Rebekah. These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham’s brother.

hebrew: וּפִֽילַגְשׁ֖וֹ וּשְׁמָ֣הּ רְאוּמָ֑ה וַתֵּ֤לֶד גַּם־הִוא֙ אֶת־טֶ֣בַח וְאֶת־גַּ֔חַם וְאֶת־תַּ֖חַשׁ וְאֶֽת־מַעֲכָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vfiylag'shvo vsh'mah r'vmah vateled gam-hiv et-tevach v'et-gacham v'et-tachash v'et-ma'akhah (s)
translation: And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore children: Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.

hebrew: וַיִּהְיוּ֙ חַיֵּ֣י שָׂרָ֔ה מֵאָ֥ה שָׁנָ֛ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְשֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֑ים שְׁנֵ֖י חַיֵּ֥י שָׂרָֽה׃
transliteration: vayih'yv chayey sarah meah shanah v'es'riym shanah v'sheva' shaniym sh'ney chayey sarah
translation: Sarah’s lifetime—the span of Sarah’s life—came to one hundred and twenty-seven years.

hebrew: וַתָּ֣מָת שָׂרָ֗ה בְּקִרְיַ֥ת אַרְבַּ֛ע הִ֥וא חֶבְר֖וֹן בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַיָּבֹא֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם לִסְפֹּ֥ד לְשָׂרָ֖ה וְלִבְכֹּתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vatamat sarah b'kir'yat ar'ba' hiv chev'rvon b'eretz k'na'an vayavo av'raham lis'pod l'sarah v'liv'kotah
translation: Sarah died in Kiriath-arba—now Hebron—in the land of Canaan; and Abraham proceeded to mourn for Sarah and to bewail her.

hebrew: וַיָּ֙קָם֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֣י מֵת֑וֹ וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אֶל־בְּנֵי־חֵ֖ת לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayakam av'raham me'al p'ney metvo vay'daber el-b'ney-chet lemor
translation: Then Abraham rose from beside his dead, and spoke to the Hittites, saying,

hebrew: גֵּר־וְתוֹשָׁ֥ב אָנֹכִ֖י עִמָּכֶ֑ם תְּנ֨וּ לִ֤י אֲחֻזַּת־קֶ֙בֶר֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם וְאֶקְבְּרָ֥ה מֵתִ֖י מִלְּפָנָֽי׃
transliteration: ger-v'tvoshav anokhiy 'imakhem t'nv liy achuzat-kever 'imakhem v'ek'b'rah metiy mil'fanay
translation: “I am a resident alien among you; sell me a burial site among you, that I may remove my dead for burial.”

hebrew: וַיַּעֲנ֧וּ בְנֵי־חֵ֛ת אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֥ר לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaya'anv v'ney-chet et-av'raham lemor lvo
translation: And the Hittites replied to Abraham, saying to him,

hebrew: שְׁמָעֵ֣נוּ ׀ אֲדֹנִ֗י נְשִׂ֨יא אֱלֹהִ֤ים אַתָּה֙ בְּתוֹכֵ֔נוּ בְּמִבְחַ֣ר קְבָרֵ֔ינוּ קְבֹ֖ר אֶת־מֵתֶ֑ךָ אִ֣ישׁ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ אֶת־קִבְר֛וֹ לֹֽא־יִכְלֶ֥ה מִמְּךָ֖ מִקְּבֹ֥ר מֵתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: sh'ma'env  adoniy n'siy elohiym atah b'tvokhenv b'miv'char k'vareynv k'vor et-metekha iysh mimenv et-kiv'rvo lo-yikh'leh mim'kha mik'vor metekha
translation: “Hear us, my lord: you are the elect of God among us. Bury your dead in the choicest of our burial places; none of us will withhold his burial place from you for burying your dead.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֧קָם אַבְרָהָ֛ם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ לְעַם־הָאָ֖רֶץ לִבְנֵי־חֵֽת׃
transliteration: vayakam av'raham vayish'tachv l'am-haaretz liv'ney-chet
translation: Thereupon Abraham bowed low to the people of the land, the Hittites,

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתָּ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־יֵ֣שׁ אֶֽת־נַפְשְׁכֶ֗ם לִקְבֹּ֤ר אֶת־מֵתִי֙ מִלְּפָנַ֔י שְׁמָע֕וּנִי וּפִגְעוּ־לִ֖י בְּעֶפְר֥וֹן בֶּן־צֹֽחַר׃
transliteration: vay'daber itam lemor im-yesh et-naf'sh'khem lik'bor et-metiy mil'fanay sh'ma'vniy vfig'v-liy b'ef'rvon ben-tzochar
translation: and he said to them, “If it is your wish that I remove my dead for burial, you must agree to intercede for me with Ephron son of Zohar.

hebrew: וְיִתֶּן־לִ֗י אֶת־מְעָרַ֤ת הַמַּכְפֵּלָה֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּקְצֵ֣ה שָׂדֵ֑הוּ בְּכֶ֨סֶף מָלֵ֜א יִתְּנֶ֥נָּה לִ֛י בְּתוֹכְכֶ֖ם לַאֲחֻזַּת־קָֽבֶר׃
transliteration: v'yiten-liy et-m'arat hamakh'pelah asher-lvo asher bik'tzeh sadehv b'khesef male yit'nenah liy b'tvokh'khem laachuzat-kaver
translation: Let him sell me the cave of Machpelah that he owns, which is at the edge of his land. Let him sell it to me, at the full price, for a burial site in your midst.”

hebrew: וְעֶפְר֥וֹן יֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּת֣וֹךְ בְּנֵי־חֵ֑ת וַיַּעַן֩ עֶפְר֨וֹן הַחִתִּ֤י אֶת־אַבְרָהָם֙ בְּאָזְנֵ֣י בְנֵי־חֵ֔ת לְכֹ֛ל בָּאֵ֥י שַֽׁעַר־עִיר֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: v'ef'rvon yoshev b'tvokh' b'ney-chet vaya'an 'ef'rvon hachitiy et-av'raham b'az'ney v'ney-chet l'khol baey sha'ar-'iyrvo lemor
translation: Ephron was present among the Hittites; so Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearing of the Hittites, all who entered the gate of his town,aI.e., all his fellow townsmen. saying,

hebrew: לֹֽא־אֲדֹנִ֣י שְׁמָעֵ֔נִי הַשָּׂדֶה֙ נָתַ֣תִּי לָ֔ךְ וְהַמְּעָרָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ לְךָ֣ נְתַתִּ֑יהָ לְעֵינֵ֧י בְנֵי־עַמִּ֛י נְתַתִּ֥יהָ לָּ֖ךְ קְבֹ֥ר מֵתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: lo-adoniy sh'ma'eniy hasadeh natatiy lakh' v'ham'arah asher-bvo l'kha n'tatiyha l'eyney v'ney-'amiy n'tatiyha lakh' k'vor metekha
translation: “No, my lord, hear me: I give you the field and I give you the cave that is in it; I give it to you in the presence of my people. Bury your dead.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁתַּ֙חוּ֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם לִפְנֵ֖י עַ֥ם הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vayish'tachv av'raham lif'ney 'am haaretz
translation: Then Abraham bowed low before the people of the land,

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר אֶל־עֶפְר֜וֹן בְּאָזְנֵ֤י עַם־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַ֛ךְ אִם־אַתָּ֥ה ל֖וּ שְׁמָעֵ֑נִי נָתַ֜תִּי כֶּ֤סֶף הַשָּׂדֶה֙ קַ֣ח מִמֶּ֔נִּי וְאֶקְבְּרָ֥ה אֶת־מֵתִ֖י שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: vay'daber el-'ef'rvon b'az'ney 'am-haaretz lemor akh' im-atah lv sh'ma'eniy natatiy kesef hasadeh kach mimeniy v'ek'b'rah et-metiy shamah
translation: and spoke to Ephron in the hearing of the people of the land, saying, “If only you would hear me out! Let me pay the price of the land; accept it from me, that I may bury my dead there.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַן עֶפְר֛וֹן אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֥ר לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaya'an 'ef'rvon et-av'raham lemor lvo
translation: And Ephron replied to Abraham, saying to him,

hebrew: אֲדֹנִ֣י שְׁמָעֵ֔נִי אֶרֶץ֩ אַרְבַּ֨ע מֵאֹ֧ת שֶֽׁקֶל־כֶּ֛סֶף בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵֽינְךָ֖ מַה־הִ֑וא וְאֶת־מֵתְךָ֖ קְבֹֽר׃
transliteration: adoniy sh'ma'eniy eretz ar'ba' meot shekel-kesef beyniy vveyn'kha mah-hiv v'et-met'kha k'vor
translation: “My lord, do hear me! A piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver—what is that between you and me? Go and bury your dead.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע אַבְרָהָם֮ אֶל־עֶפְרוֹן֒ וַיִּשְׁקֹ֤ל אַבְרָהָם֙ לְעֶפְרֹ֔ן אֶת־הַכֶּ֕סֶף אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר בְּאָזְנֵ֣י בְנֵי־חֵ֑ת אַרְבַּ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ שֶׁ֣קֶל כֶּ֔סֶף עֹבֵ֖ר לַסֹּחֵֽר׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' av'raham el-'ef'rvon vayish'kol av'raham l'ef'ron et-hakesef asher diber b'az'ney v'ney-chet ar'ba' mevot shekel kesef 'over lasocher
translation: Abraham accepted Ephron’s terms. Abraham paid out to Ephron the money that he had named in the hearing of the Hittites—four hundred shekels of silver at the going merchants’ rate.

hebrew: וַיָּ֣קָם ׀ שְׂדֵ֣ה עֶפְר֗וֹן אֲשֶׁר֙ בַּמַּכְפֵּלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י מַמְרֵ֑א הַשָּׂדֶה֙ וְהַמְּעָרָ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־בּ֔וֹ וְכָל־הָעֵץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּכָל־גְּבֻל֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: vayakam  s'deh 'ef'rvon asher bamakh'pelah asher lif'ney mam're hasadeh v'ham'arah asher-bvo v'khal-ha'etz asher basadeh asher b'khal-g'vulvo saviyv
translation: So Ephron’s land in Machpelah, near Mamre—the field with its cave and all the trees anywhere within the confines of that field—passed

hebrew: לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְמִקְנָ֖ה לְעֵינֵ֣י בְנֵי־חֵ֑ת בְּכֹ֖ל בָּאֵ֥י שַֽׁעַר־עִירֽוֹ׃
transliteration: l'av'raham l'mik'nah l'eyney v'ney-chet b'khol baey sha'ar-'iyrvo
translation: to Abraham as his possession, in the presence of the Hittites, of all who entered the gate of his town.aI.e., all his fellow townsmen.

hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵן֩ קָבַ֨ר אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ אֶל־מְעָרַ֞ת שְׂדֵ֧ה הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֛ה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י מַמְרֵ֖א הִ֣וא חֶבְר֑וֹן בְּאֶ֖רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: v'acharey-khen kavar av'raham et-sarah ish'tvo el-m'arat s'deh hamakh'pelah 'al-p'ney mam're hiv chev'rvon b'eretz k'na'an
translation: And then Abraham buried his wife Sarah in the cave of the field of Machpelah, facing Mamre—now Hebron—in the land of Canaan.

hebrew: וַיָּ֨קָם הַשָּׂדֶ֜ה וְהַמְּעָרָ֧ה אֲשֶׁר־בּ֛וֹ לְאַבְרָהָ֖ם לַאֲחֻזַּת־קָ֑בֶר מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵי־חֵֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayakam hasadeh v'ham'arah asher-bvo l'av'raham laachuzat-kaver meet b'ney-chet (s)
translation: Thus the field with its cave passed from the Hittites to Abraham, as a burial site.

hebrew: וְאַבְרָהָ֣ם זָקֵ֔ן בָּ֖א בַּיָּמִ֑ים וַֽיהוָ֛ה בֵּרַ֥ךְ אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם בַּכֹּֽל׃
transliteration: v'av'raham zaken ba bayamiym vayhvah berakh' et-av'raham bakol
translation: Abraham was now old, advanced in years, and the L<small>ORD</small> had blessed Abraham in all things.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֗ם אֶל־עַבְדּוֹ֙ זְקַ֣ן בֵּית֔וֹ הַמֹּשֵׁ֖ל בְּכָל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ שִֽׂים־נָ֥א יָדְךָ֖ תַּ֥חַת יְרֵכִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer av'raham el-'av'dvo z'kan beytvo hamoshel b'khal-asher-lvo siym-na yad'kha tachat y'rekhiy
translation: And Abraham said to the senior servant of his household, who had charge of all that he owned, “Put your hand under my thigh

hebrew: וְאַשְׁבִּ֣יעֲךָ֔ בַּֽיהוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וֵֽאלֹהֵ֖י הָאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־תִקַּ֤ח אִשָּׁה֙ לִבְנִ֔י מִבְּנוֹת֙ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י יוֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'ash'biy'akha bayhvah elohey hashamayim velohey haaretz asher lo-tikach ishah liv'niy mib'nvot hak'na'aniy asher anokhiy yvoshev b'kir'bvo
translation: and I will make you swear by the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I dwell,

hebrew: כִּ֧י אֶל־אַרְצִ֛י וְאֶל־מוֹלַדְתִּ֖י תֵּלֵ֑ךְ וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ אִשָּׁ֖ה לִבְנִ֥י לְיִצְחָֽק׃
transliteration: kiy el-ar'tziy v'el-mvolad'tiy telekh' v'lakach'ta ishah liv'niy l'yitz'chak
translation: but will go to the land of my birth and get a wife for my son Isaac.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ הָעֶ֔בֶד אוּלַי֙ לֹא־תֹאבֶ֣ה הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה לָלֶ֥כֶת אַחֲרַ֖י אֶל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את הֶֽהָשֵׁ֤ב אָשִׁיב֙ אֶת־בִּנְךָ֔ אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יָצָ֥אתָ מִשָּֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv ha'eved vlay lo-toveh haishah lalekhet acharay el-haaretz hazot hehashev ashiyv et-bin'kha el-haaretz asher-yatzata misham
translation: And the servant said to him, “What if the woman does not consent to follow me to this land, shall I then take your son back to the land from which you came?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו אַבְרָהָ֑ם הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֔ פֶּן־תָּשִׁ֥יב אֶת־בְּנִ֖י שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv av'raham hishamer l'kha pen-tashiyv et-b'niy shamah
translation: Abraham answered him, “On no account must you take my son back there!

hebrew: יְהוָ֣ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם אֲשֶׁ֨ר לְקָחַ֜נִי מִבֵּ֣ית אָבִי֮ וּמֵאֶ֣רֶץ מֽוֹלַדְתִּי֒ וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּר־לִ֜י וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר נִֽשְׁבַּֽע־לִי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְזַ֨רְעֲךָ֔ אֶתֵּ֖ן אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את ה֗וּא יִשְׁלַ֤ח מַלְאָכוֹ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ אִשָּׁ֛ה לִבְנִ֖י מִשָּֽׁם׃
transliteration: y'hvah  elohey hashamayim asher l'kachaniy mibeyt aviy vmeeretz mvolad'tiy vaasher diber-liy vaasher nish'ba'-liy lemor l'zar'akha eten et-haaretz hazot hv yish'lach mal'akhvo l'faneykha v'lakach'ta ishah liv'niy misham
translation: The L<small>ORD</small>, the God of heaven, who took me from my father’s house and from my native land, who promised me on oath, saying, ‘I will assign this land to your offspring’—He will send His angel before you, and you will get a wife for my son from there.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֨א תֹאבֶ֤ה הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ לָלֶ֣כֶת אַחֲרֶ֔יךָ וְנִקִּ֕יתָ מִשְּׁבֻעָתִ֖י זֹ֑את רַ֣ק אֶת־בְּנִ֔י לֹ֥א תָשֵׁ֖ב שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: v'im-lo toveh haishah lalekhet achareykha v'nikiyta mish'vu'atiy zot rak et-b'niy lo tashev shamah
translation: And if the woman does not consent to follow you, you shall then be clear of this oath to me; but do not take my son back there.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֤שֶׂם הָעֶ֙בֶד֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ תַּ֛חַת יֶ֥רֶךְ אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֑יו וַיִּשָּׁ֣בַֽע ל֔וֹ עַל־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayasem ha'eved et-yadvo tachat yerekh' av'raham adonayv vayishava' lvo 'al-hadavar hazeh
translation: So the servant put his hand under the thigh of his master Abraham and swore to him as bidden.aLit. “about this matter.”

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח הָ֠עֶבֶד עֲשָׂרָ֨ה גְמַלִּ֜ים מִגְּמַלֵּ֤י אֲדֹנָיו֙ וַיֵּ֔לֶךְ וְכָל־ט֥וּב אֲדֹנָ֖יו בְּיָד֑וֹ וַיָּ֗קָם וַיֵּ֛לֶךְ אֶל־אֲרַ֥ם נַֽהֲרַ֖יִם אֶל־עִ֥יר נָחֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vayikach ha'eved 'asarah g'maliym mig'maley adonayv vayelekh' v'khal-tvv adonayv b'yadvo vayakam vayelekh' el-aram naharayim el-'iyr nachvor
translation: Then the servant took ten of his master’s camels and set out, taking with him all the bounty of his master; and he made his way to Aram-naharaim, to the city of Nahor.

hebrew: וַיַּבְרֵ֧ךְ הַגְּמַלִּ֛ים מִח֥וּץ לָעִ֖יר אֶל־בְּאֵ֣ר הַמָּ֑יִם לְעֵ֣ת עֶ֔רֶב לְעֵ֖ת צֵ֥את הַשֹּׁאֲבֹֽת׃
transliteration: vayav'rekh' hag'maliym michvtz la'iyr el-b'er hamayim l'et 'erev l'et tzet hashoavot
translation: He made the camels kneel down by the well outside the city, at evening time, the time when women come out to draw water.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֓ר ׀ יְהוָ֗ה אֱלֹהֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם הַקְרֵה־נָ֥א לְפָנַ֖י הַיּ֑וֹם וַעֲשֵׂה־חֶ֕סֶד עִ֖ם אֲדֹנִ֥י אַבְרָהָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomar  y'hvah elohey adoniy av'raham hak'reh-na l'fanay hayvom va'aseh-chesed 'im adoniy av'raham
translation: And he said, “O L<small>ORD</small>, God of my master Abraham, grant me good fortune this day, and deal graciously with my master Abraham:

hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י נִצָּ֖ב עַל־עֵ֣ין הַמָּ֑יִם וּבְנוֹת֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י הָעִ֔יר יֹצְאֹ֖ת לִשְׁאֹ֥ב מָֽיִם׃
transliteration: hineh anokhiy nitzav 'al-'eyn hamayim vv'nvot an'shey ha'iyr yotz'ot lish'ov mayim
translation: Here I stand by the spring as the daughters of the townsmen come out to draw water;

hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה הַֽנַּעֲרָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֹמַ֤ר אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ הַטִּי־נָ֤א כַדֵּךְ֙ וְאֶשְׁתֶּ֔ה וְאָמְרָ֣ה שְׁתֵ֔ה וְגַם־גְּמַלֶּ֖יךָ אַשְׁקֶ֑ה אֹתָ֤הּ הֹכַ֙חְתָּ֙ לְעַבְדְּךָ֣ לְיִצְחָ֔ק וּבָ֣הּ אֵדַ֔ע כִּי־עָשִׂ֥יתָ חֶ֖סֶד עִם־אֲדֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: v'hayah hana'ara asher omar eleyha hatiy-na khadekh' v'esh'teh v'am'rah sh'teh v'gam-g'maleykha ash'keh otah hokhach'ta l'av'd'kha l'yitz'chak vvah eda' kiy-'asiyta chesed 'im-adoniy
translation: let the maiden to whom I say, ‘Please, lower your jar that I may drink,’ and who replies, ‘Drink, and I will also water your camels’—let her be the one whom You have decreed for Your servant Isaac. Thereby shall I know that You have dealt graciously with my master.”

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־ה֗וּא טֶרֶם֮ כִּלָּ֣ה לְדַבֵּר֒ וְהִנֵּ֧ה רִבְקָ֣ה יֹצֵ֗את אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֻלְּדָה֙ לִבְתוּאֵ֣ל בֶּן־מִלְכָּ֔ה אֵ֥שֶׁת נָח֖וֹר אֲחִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֑ם וְכַדָּ֖הּ עַל־שִׁכְמָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy-hv terem kilah l'daber v'hineh riv'kah yotzet asher yul'dah liv'tvel ben-mil'kah eshet nachvor achiy av'raham v'khadah 'al-shikh'mah
translation: He had scarcely finished speaking, when Rebekah, who was born to Bethuel, the son of Milcah the wife of Abraham’s brother Nahor, came out with her jar on her shoulder.

hebrew: וְהַֽנַּעֲרָ֗ טֹבַ֤ת מַרְאֶה֙ מְאֹ֔ד בְּתוּלָ֕ה וְאִ֖ישׁ לֹ֣א יְדָעָ֑הּ וַתֵּ֣רֶד הָעַ֔יְנָה וַתְּמַלֵּ֥א כַדָּ֖הּ וַתָּֽעַל׃
transliteration: v'hana'ara tovat mar'eh m'od b'tvlah v'iysh lo y'da'ah vatered ha'ay'nah vat'male khadah vata'al
translation: The maiden was very beautiful, a virgin whom no man had known. She went down to the spring, filled her jar, and came up.

hebrew: וַיָּ֥רָץ הָעֶ֖בֶד לִקְרָאתָ֑הּ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הַגְמִיאִ֥ינִי נָ֛א מְעַט־מַ֖יִם מִכַּדֵּֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayaratz ha'eved lik'ratah vayomer hag'miyiyniy na m'at-mayim mikadekh'
translation: The servant ran toward her and said, “Please, let me sip a little water from your jar.”

hebrew: וַתֹּ֖אמֶר שְׁתֵ֣ה אֲדֹנִ֑י וַתְּמַהֵ֗ר וַתֹּ֧רֶד כַּדָּ֛הּ עַל־יָדָ֖הּ וַתַּשְׁקֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: vatomer sh'teh adoniy vat'maher vatored kadah 'al-yadah vatash'kehv
translation: “Drink, my lord,” she said, and she quickly lowered her jar upon her hand and let him drink.

hebrew: וַתְּכַ֖ל לְהַשְׁקֹת֑וֹ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר גַּ֤ם לִגְמַלֶּ֙יךָ֙ אֶשְׁאָ֔ב עַ֥ד אִם־כִּלּ֖וּ לִשְׁתֹּֽת׃
transliteration: vat'khal l'hash'kotvo vatomer gam lig'maleykha esh'av 'ad im-kilv lish'tot
translation: When she had let him drink his fill, she said, “I will also draw for your camels, until they finish drinking.”

hebrew: וַתְּמַהֵ֗ר וַתְּעַ֤ר כַּדָּהּ֙ אֶל־הַשֹּׁ֔קֶת וַתָּ֥רָץ ע֛וֹד אֶֽל־הַבְּאֵ֖ר לִשְׁאֹ֑ב וַתִּשְׁאַ֖ב לְכָל־גְּמַלָּֽיו׃
transliteration: vat'maher vat'ar kadah el-hashoket vataratz 'vod el-hab'er lish'ov vatish'av l'khal-g'malayv
translation: Quickly emptying her jar into the trough, she ran back to the well to draw, and she drew for all his camels.

hebrew: וְהָאִ֥ישׁ מִשְׁתָּאֵ֖ה לָ֑הּ מַחֲרִ֕ישׁ לָדַ֗עַת הַֽהִצְלִ֧יחַ יְהוָ֛ה דַּרְכּ֖וֹ אִם־לֹֽא׃
transliteration: v'haiysh mish'taeh lah machariysh lada'at hahitz'liycha y'hvah dar'kvo im-lo
translation: The man, meanwhile, stood gazing at her, silently wondering whether the L<small>ORD</small> had made his errand successful or not.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר כִּלּ֤וּ הַגְּמַלִּים֙ לִשְׁתּ֔וֹת וַיִּקַּ֤ח הָאִישׁ֙ נֶ֣זֶם זָהָ֔ב בֶּ֖קַע מִשְׁקָל֑וֹ וּשְׁנֵ֤י צְמִידִים֙ עַל־יָדֶ֔יהָ עֲשָׂרָ֥ה זָהָ֖ב מִשְׁקָלָֽם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kaasher kilv hag'maliym lish'tvot vayikach haiysh nezem zahav beka' mish'kalvo vsh'ney tz'miydiym 'al-yadeyha 'asarah zahav mish'kalam
translation: When the camels had finished drinking, the man took a gold nose-ring weighing a half-shekel,bHeb. beqa‘. and two gold bands for her arms, ten shekels in weight.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ בַּת־מִ֣י אַ֔תְּ הַגִּ֥ידִי נָ֖א לִ֑י הֲיֵ֧שׁ בֵּית־אָבִ֛יךְ מָק֥וֹם לָ֖נוּ לָלִֽין׃
transliteration: vayomer bat-miy at' hagiydiy na liy hayesh beyt-aviykh' makvom lanv laliyn
translation: “Pray tell me,” he said, “whose daughter are you? Is there room in your father’s house for us to spend the night?”

hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו בַּת־בְּתוּאֵ֖ל אָנֹ֑כִי בֶּן־מִלְכָּ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָלְדָ֖ה לְנָחֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vatomer elayv bat-b'tvel anokhiy ben-mil'kah asher yal'dah l'nachvor
translation: She replied, “I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor.”

hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו גַּם־תֶּ֥בֶן גַּם־מִסְפּ֖וֹא רַ֣ב עִמָּ֑נוּ גַּם־מָק֖וֹם לָלֽוּן׃
transliteration: vatomer elayv gam-teven gam-mis'pvo rav 'imanv gam-makvom lalvn
translation: And she went on, “There is plenty of strawcHeb. teben, shredded straw, which in the East is mixed with feed; cf. v. 32. and feed at home, and also room to spend the night.”

hebrew: וַיִּקֹּ֣ד הָאִ֔ישׁ וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayikod haiysh vayish'tachv layhvah
translation: The man bowed low in homage to the L<small>ORD</small>

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר בָּר֤וּךְ יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם אֲ֠שֶׁר לֹֽא־עָזַ֥ב חַסְדּ֛וֹ וַאֲמִתּ֖וֹ מֵעִ֣ם אֲדֹנִ֑י אָנֹכִ֗י בַּדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ נָחַ֣נִי יְהוָ֔ה בֵּ֖ית אֲחֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer barvkh' y'hvah elohey adoniy av'raham asher lo-'azav chas'dvo vaamitvo me'im adoniy anokhiy baderekh' nachaniy y'hvah beyt achey adoniy
translation: and said, “Blessed be the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of my master Abraham, who has not withheld His steadfast faithfulness from my master. For I have been guided on my errand by the L<small>ORD</small>, to the house of my master’s kinsmen.”

hebrew: וַתָּ֙רָץ֙ הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ וַתַּגֵּ֖ד לְבֵ֣ית אִמָּ֑הּ כַּדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: vataratz hana'ara vataged l'veyt imah kad'variym haeleh
translation: The maiden ran and told all this to her mother’s household.

hebrew: וּלְרִבְקָ֥ה אָ֖ח וּשְׁמ֣וֹ לָבָ֑ן וַיָּ֨רָץ לָבָ֧ן אֶל־הָאִ֛ישׁ הַח֖וּצָה אֶל־הָעָֽיִן׃
transliteration: vl'riv'kah ach vsh'mvo lavan vayaratz lavan el-haiysh hachvtzah el-ha'ayin
translation: Now Rebekah had a brother whose name was Laban. Laban ran out to the man at the spring—

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כִּרְאֹ֣ת אֶת־הַנֶּ֗זֶם וְֽאֶת־הַצְּמִדִים֮ עַל־יְדֵ֣י אֲחֹתוֹ֒ וּכְשָׁמְע֗וֹ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֞י רִבְקָ֤ה אֲחֹתוֹ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּֽה־דִבֶּ֥ר אֵלַ֖י הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיָּבֹא֙ אֶל־הָאִ֔ישׁ וְהִנֵּ֛ה עֹמֵ֥ד עַל־הַגְּמַלִּ֖ים עַל־הָעָֽיִן׃
transliteration: vay'hiy  kir'ot et-hanezem v'et-hatz'midiym 'al-y'dey achotvo vkh'sham'vo et-div'rey riv'kah achotvo lemor koh-diber elay haiysh vayavo el-haiysh v'hineh 'omed 'al-hag'maliym 'al-ha'ayin
translation: when he saw the nose-ring and the bands on his sister’s arms, and when he heard his sister Rebekah say, “Thus the man spoke to me.” He went up to the man, who was still standing beside the camels at the spring.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בּ֖וֹא בְּר֣וּךְ יְהוָ֑ה לָ֤מָּה תַעֲמֹד֙ בַּח֔וּץ וְאָנֹכִי֙ פִּנִּ֣יתִי הַבַּ֔יִת וּמָק֖וֹם לַגְּמַלִּֽים׃
transliteration: vayomer bvo b'rvkh' y'hvah lamah ta'amod bachvtz v'anokhiy piniytiy habayit vmakvom lag'maliym
translation: “Come in, O blessed of the L<small>ORD</small>,” he said, “why do you remain outside, when I have made ready the house and a place for the camels?”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א הָאִישׁ֙ הַבַּ֔יְתָה וַיְפַתַּ֖ח הַגְּמַלִּ֑ים וַיִּתֵּ֨ן תֶּ֤בֶן וּמִסְפּוֹא֙ לַגְּמַלִּ֔ים וּמַ֙יִם֙ לִרְחֹ֣ץ רַגְלָ֔יו וְרַגְלֵ֥י הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayavo haiysh habay'tah vay'fatach hag'maliym vayiten teven vmis'pvo lag'maliym vmayim lir'chotz rag'layv v'rag'ley haanashiym asher itvo
translation: So the man entered the house, and the camels were unloaded. The camels were given straw and feed, and water was brought to bathe his feet and the feet of the men with him.

hebrew: ויישם [וַיּוּשַׂ֤ם] לְפָנָיו֙ לֶאֱכֹ֔ל וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֹכַ֔ל עַ֥ד אִם־דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי דְּבָרָ֑י וַיֹּ֖אמֶר דַּבֵּֽר׃
transliteration: vyyshm [vayvsam] l'fanayv leekhol vayomer lo okhal 'ad im-dibar'tiy d'varay vayomer daber
translation: But when food was set before him, he said, “I will not eat until I have told my tale.” He said, “Speak, then.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר עֶ֥בֶד אַבְרָהָ֖ם אָנֹֽכִי׃
transliteration: vayomar 'eved av'raham anokhiy
translation: “I am Abraham’s servant,” he began.

hebrew: וַיהוָ֞ה בֵּרַ֧ךְ אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֛י מְאֹ֖ד וַיִּגְדָּ֑ל וַיִּתֶּן־ל֞וֹ צֹ֤אן וּבָקָר֙ וְכֶ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֔ב וַעֲבָדִם֙ וּשְׁפָחֹ֔ת וּגְמַלִּ֖ים וַחֲמֹרִֽים׃
transliteration: vayhvah berakh' et-adoniy m'od vayig'dal vayiten-lvo tzon vvakar v'khesef v'zahav va'avadim vsh'fachot vg'maliym vachamoriym
translation: “The L<small>ORD</small> has greatly blessed my master, and he has become rich: He has given him sheep and cattle, silver and gold, male and female slaves, camels and asses.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֡לֶד שָׂרָה֩ אֵ֨שֶׁת אֲדֹנִ֥י בֵן֙ לַֽאדֹנִ֔י אַחֲרֵ֖י זִקְנָתָ֑הּ וַיִּתֶּן־לּ֖וֹ אֶת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vateled sarah eshet adoniy ven ladoniy acharey zik'natah vayiten-lvo et-kal-asher-lvo
translation: And Sarah, my master’s wife, bore my master a son in her old age, and he has assigned to him everything he owns.

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁבִּעֵ֥נִי אֲדֹנִ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹא־תִקַּ֤ח אִשָּׁה֙ לִבְנִ֔י מִבְּנוֹת֙ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י יֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּאַרְצֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayash'bi'eniy adoniy lemor lo-tikach ishah liv'niy mib'nvot hak'na'aniy asher anokhiy yoshev b'ar'tzvo
translation: Now my master made me swear, saying, ‘You shall not get a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites in whose land I dwell;

hebrew: אִם־לֹ֧א אֶל־בֵּית־אָבִ֛י תֵּלֵ֖ךְ וְאֶל־מִשְׁפַּחְתִּ֑י וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ אִשָּׁ֖ה לִבְנִֽי׃
transliteration: im-lo el-beyt-aviy telekh' v'el-mish'pach'tiy v'lakach'ta ishah liv'niy
translation: but you shall go to my father’s house, to my kindred, and get a wife for my son.’

hebrew: וָאֹמַ֖ר אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֑י אֻלַ֛י לֹא־תֵלֵ֥ךְ הָאִשָּׁ֖ה אַחֲרָֽי׃
transliteration: vaomar el-adoniy ulay lo-telekh' haishah acharay
translation: And I said to my master, ‘What if the woman does not follow me?’

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑י יְהוָ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־הִתְהַלַּ֣כְתִּי לְפָנָ֗יו יִשְׁלַ֨ח מַלְאָכ֤וֹ אִתָּךְ֙ וְהִצְלִ֣יחַ דַּרְכֶּ֔ךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ אִשָּׁה֙ לִבְנִ֔י מִמִּשְׁפַּחְתִּ֖י וּמִבֵּ֥ית אָבִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer elay y'hvah asher-hit'halakh'tiy l'fanayv yish'lach mal'akhvo itakh' v'hitz'liycha dar'kekha v'lakach'ta ishah liv'niy mimish'pach'tiy vmibeyt aviy
translation: He replied to me, ‘The L<small>ORD</small>, whose ways I have followed, will send His angel with you and make your errand successful; and you will get a wife for my son from my kindred, from my father’s house.

hebrew: אָ֤ז תִּנָּקֶה֙ מֵאָ֣לָתִ֔י כִּ֥י תָב֖וֹא אֶל־מִשְׁפַּחְתִּ֑י וְאִם־לֹ֤א יִתְּנוּ֙ לָ֔ךְ וְהָיִ֥יתָ נָקִ֖י מֵאָלָתִֽי׃
transliteration: az tinakeh mealatiy kiy tavvo el-mish'pach'tiy v'im-lo yit'nv lakh' v'hayiyta nakiy mealatiy
translation: Thus only shall you be freed from my adjuration: if, when you come to my kindred, they refuse you—only then shall you be freed from my adjuration.’

hebrew: וָאָבֹ֥א הַיּ֖וֹם אֶל־הָעָ֑יִן וָאֹמַ֗ר יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם אִם־יֶשְׁךָ־נָּא֙ מַצְלִ֣יחַ דַּרְכִּ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י הֹלֵ֥ךְ עָלֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vaavo hayvom el-ha'ayin vaomar y'hvah elohey adoniy av'raham im-yesh'kha-na matz'liycha dar'kiy asher anokhiy holekh' 'aleyha
translation: “I came today to the spring, and I said: O L<small>ORD</small>, God of my master Abraham, if You would indeed grant success to the errand on which I am engaged!

hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י נִצָּ֖ב עַל־עֵ֣ין הַמָּ֑יִם וְהָיָ֤ה הָֽעַלְמָה֙ הַיֹּצֵ֣את לִשְׁאֹ֔ב וְאָמַרְתִּ֣י אֵלֶ֔יהָ הַשְׁקִֽינִי־נָ֥א מְעַט־מַ֖יִם מִכַּדֵּֽךְ׃
transliteration: hineh anokhiy nitzav 'al-'eyn hamayim v'hayah ha'al'mah hayotzet lish'ov v'amar'tiy eleyha hash'kiyniy-na m'at-mayim mikadekh'
translation: As I stand by the spring of water, let the young woman who comes out to draw and to whom I say, ‘Please, let me drink a little water from your jar,’

hebrew: וְאָמְרָ֤ה אֵלַי֙ גַּם־אַתָּ֣ה שְׁתֵ֔ה וְגַ֥ם לִגְמַלֶּ֖יךָ אֶשְׁאָ֑ב הִ֣וא הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הֹכִ֥יחַ יְהוָ֖ה לְבֶן־אֲדֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: v'am'rah elay gam-atah sh'teh v'gam lig'maleykha esh'av hiv haishah asher-hokhiycha y'hvah l'ven-adoniy
translation: and who answers, ‘You may drink, and I will also draw for your camels’—let her be the wife whom the L<small>ORD</small> has decreed for my master’s son.’

hebrew: אֲנִי֩ טֶ֨רֶם אֲכַלֶּ֜ה לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־לִבִּ֗י וְהִנֵּ֨ה רִבְקָ֤ה יֹצֵאת֙ וְכַדָּ֣הּ עַל־שִׁכְמָ֔הּ וַתֵּ֥רֶד הָעַ֖יְנָה וַתִּשְׁאָ֑ב וָאֹמַ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יהָ הַשְׁקִ֥ינִי נָֽא׃
transliteration: aniy terem akhaleh l'daber el-libiy v'hineh riv'kah yotzet v'khadah 'al-shikh'mah vatered ha'ay'nah vatish'av vaomar eleyha hash'kiyniy na
translation: I had scarcely finished praying in my heart, when Rebekah came out with her jar on her shoulder, and went down to the spring and drew. And I said to her, ‘Please give me a drink.’

hebrew: וַתְּמַהֵ֗ר וַתּ֤וֹרֶד כַּדָּהּ֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יהָ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁתֵ֔ה וְגַם־גְּמַלֶּ֖יךָ אַשְׁקֶ֑ה וָאֵ֕שְׁתְּ וְגַ֥ם הַגְּמַלִּ֖ים הִשְׁקָֽתָה׃
transliteration: vat'maher vatvored kadah me'aleyha vatomer sh'teh v'gam-g'maleykha ash'keh vaesh't' v'gam hag'maliym hish'katah
translation: She quickly lowered her jar and said, ‘Drink, and I will also water your camels.’ So I drank, and she also watered the camels.

hebrew: וָאֶשְׁאַ֣ל אֹתָ֗הּ וָאֹמַר֮ בַּת־מִ֣י אַתְּ֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר בַּת־בְּתוּאֵל֙ בֶּן־נָח֔וֹר אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָֽלְדָה־לּ֖וֹ מִלְכָּ֑ה וָאָשִׂ֤ם הַנֶּ֙זֶם֙ עַל־אַפָּ֔הּ וְהַצְּמִידִ֖ים עַל־יָדֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vaesh'al otah vaomar bat-miy at' vatomer bat-b'tvel ben-nachvor asher yal'dah-lvo mil'kah vaasim hanezem 'al-apah v'hatz'miydiym 'al-yadeyha
translation: I inquired of her, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ And she said, ‘The daughter of Bethuel, son of Nahor, whom Milcah bore to him.’ And I put the ring on her nose and the bands on her arms.
