hebrew: וָאֶקֹּ֥ד וָֽאֶשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה לַיהוָ֑ה וָאֲבָרֵ֗ךְ אֶת־יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִנְחַ֙נִי֙ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ אֱמֶ֔ת לָקַ֛חַת אֶת־בַּת־אֲחִ֥י אֲדֹנִ֖י לִבְנֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaekod vaesh'tachaveh layhvah vaavarekh' et-y'hvah elohey adoniy av'raham asher hin'chaniy b'derekh' emet lakachat et-bat-achiy adoniy liv'nvo
translation: Then I bowed low in homage to the L<small>ORD</small> and blessed the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of my master Abraham, who led me on the right way to get the daughter of my master’s brother for his son.

hebrew: וְ֠עַתָּה אִם־יֶשְׁכֶ֨ם עֹשִׂ֜ים חֶ֧סֶד וֶֽאֱמֶ֛ת אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֖י הַגִּ֣ידוּ לִ֑י וְאִם־לֹ֕א הַגִּ֣ידוּ לִ֔י וְאֶפְנֶ֥ה עַל־יָמִ֖ין א֥וֹ עַל־שְׂמֹֽאל׃
transliteration: v'atah im-yesh'khem 'osiym chesed veemet et-adoniy hagiydv liy v'im-lo hagiydv liy v'ef'neh 'al-yamiyn vo 'al-s'mol
translation: And now, if you mean to treat my master with true kindness, tell me; and if not, tell me also, that I may turn right or left.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן לָבָ֤ן וּבְתוּאֵל֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מֵיְהוָ֖ה יָצָ֣א הַדָּבָ֑ר לֹ֥א נוּכַ֛ל דַּבֵּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ רַ֥ע אוֹ־טֽוֹב׃
transliteration: vaya'an lavan vv'tvel vayom'rv mey'hvah yatza hadavar lo nvkhal daber eleykha ra' vo-tvov
translation: Then Laban and Bethuel answered, “The matter was decreed by the L<small>ORD</small>; we cannot speak to you bad or good.

hebrew: הִנֵּֽה־רִבְקָ֥ה לְפָנֶ֖יךָ קַ֣ח וָלֵ֑ךְ וּתְהִ֤י אִשָּׁה֙ לְבֶן־אֲדֹנֶ֔יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: hineh-riv'kah l'faneykha kach valekh' vt'hiy ishah l'ven-adoneykha kaasher diber y'hvah
translation: Here is Rebekah before you; take her and go, and let her be a wife to your master’s son, as the L<small>ORD</small> has spoken.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמַ֛ע עֶ֥בֶד אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶת־דִּבְרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ אַ֖רְצָה לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kaasher shama' 'eved av'raham et-div'reyhem vayish'tachv ar'tzah layhvah
translation: When Abraham’s servant heard their words, he bowed low to the ground before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵ֨א הָעֶ֜בֶד כְּלֵי־כֶ֨סֶף וּכְלֵ֤י זָהָב֙ וּבְגָדִ֔ים וַיִּתֵּ֖ן לְרִבְקָ֑ה וּמִ֨גְדָּנֹ֔ת נָתַ֥ן לְאָחִ֖יהָ וּלְאִמָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayvotze ha'eved k'ley-khesef vkh'ley zahav vv'gadiym vayiten l'riv'kah vmig'danot natan l'achiyha vl'imah
translation: The servant brought out objects of silver and gold, and garments, and gave them to Rebekah; and he gave presents to her brother and her mother.

hebrew: וַיֹּאכְל֣וּ וַיִּשְׁתּ֗וּ ה֛וּא וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־עִמּ֖וֹ וַיָּלִ֑ינוּ וַיָּק֣וּמוּ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שַׁלְּחֻ֥נִי לַֽאדֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: vayokh'lv vayish'tv hv v'haanashiym asher-'imvo vayaliynv vayakvmv vaboker vayomer shal'chuniy ladoniy
translation: Then he and the men with him ate and drank, and they spent the night. When they arose next morning, he said, “Give me leave to go to my master.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אָחִ֙יהָ֙ וְאִמָּ֔הּ תֵּשֵׁ֨ב הַנַּעֲרָ֥ אִתָּ֛נוּ יָמִ֖ים א֣וֹ עָשׂ֑וֹר אַחַ֖ר תֵּלֵֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer achiyha v'imah teshev hana'ara itanv yamiym vo 'asvor achar telekh'
translation: But her brother and her mother said, “Let the maiden remain with us dLit. “days or ten.”some ten days;-d then you may go.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ אַל־תְּאַחֲר֣וּ אֹתִ֔י וַֽיהוָ֖ה הִצְלִ֣יחַ דַּרְכִּ֑י שַׁלְּח֕וּנִי וְאֵלְכָ֖ה לַֽאדֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem al-t'acharv otiy vayhvah hitz'liycha dar'kiy shal'chvniy v'el'khah ladoniy
translation: He said to them, “Do not delay me, now that the L<small>ORD</small> has made my errand successful. Give me leave that I may go to my master.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ נִקְרָ֣א לַֽנַּעֲרָ֑ וְנִשְׁאֲלָ֖ה אֶת־פִּֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayom'rv nik'ra lana'ara v'nish'alah et-piyha
translation: And they said, “Let us call the girl and ask for her reply.”

hebrew: וַיִּקְרְא֤וּ לְרִבְקָה֙ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יהָ הֲתֵלְכִ֖י עִם־הָאִ֣ישׁ הַזֶּ֑ה וַתֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלֵֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayik'r'v l'riv'kah vayom'rv eleyha hatel'khiy 'im-haiysh hazeh vatomer elekh'
translation: They called Rebekah and said to her, “Will you go with this man?” And she said, “I will.”

hebrew: וַֽיְשַׁלְּח֛וּ אֶת־רִבְקָ֥ה אֲחֹתָ֖ם וְאֶת־מֵנִקְתָּ֑הּ וְאֶת־עֶ֥בֶד אַבְרָהָ֖ם וְאֶת־אֲנָשָֽׁיו׃
transliteration: vay'shal'chv et-riv'kah achotam v'et-menik'tah v'et-'eved av'raham v'et-anashayv
translation: So they sent off their sister Rebekah and her nurse along with Abraham’s servant and his men.

hebrew: וַיְבָרֲכ֤וּ אֶת־רִבְקָה֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ לָ֔הּ אֲחֹתֵ֕נוּ אַ֥תְּ הֲיִ֖י לְאַלְפֵ֣י רְבָבָ֑ה וְיִירַ֣שׁ זַרְעֵ֔ךְ אֵ֖ת שַׁ֥עַר שֹׂנְאָֽיו׃
transliteration: vay'varakhv et-riv'kah vayom'rv lah achotenv at' hayiy l'al'fey r'vavah v'yiyrash zar'ekh' et sha'ar son'ayv
translation:
And they blessed Rebekah and said to her,
“O sister!
May you grow
Into thousands of myriads;
May your offspring seize
The gates of their foes.”

hebrew: וַתָּ֨קָם רִבְקָ֜ה וְנַעֲרֹתֶ֗יהָ וַתִּרְכַּ֙בְנָה֙ עַל־הַגְּמַלִּ֔ים וַתֵּלַ֖כְנָה אַחֲרֵ֣י הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיִּקַּ֥ח הָעֶ֛בֶד אֶת־רִבְקָ֖ה וַיֵּלַֽךְ׃
transliteration: vatakam riv'kah v'na'aroteyha vatir'kav'nah 'al-hag'maliym vatelakh'nah acharey haiysh vayikach ha'eved et-riv'kah vayelakh'
translation: Then Rebekah and her maids arose, mounted the camels, and followed the man. So the servant took Rebekah and went his way.

hebrew: וְיִצְחָק֙ בָּ֣א מִבּ֔וֹא בְּאֵ֥ר לַחַ֖י רֹאִ֑י וְה֥וּא יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּאֶ֥רֶץ הַנֶּֽגֶב׃
transliteration: v'yitz'chak ba mibvo b'er lachay roiy v'hv yvoshev b'eretz hanegev
translation: Isaac had just come back from the vicinity of Beer-lahai-roi, for he was settled in the region of the Negeb.

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א יִצְחָ֛ק לָשׂ֥וּחַ בַּשָּׂדֶ֖ה לִפְנ֣וֹת עָ֑רֶב וַיִּשָּׂ֤א עֵינָיו֙ וַיַּ֔רְא וְהִנֵּ֥ה גְמַלִּ֖ים בָּאִֽים׃
transliteration: vayetze yitz'chak lasvcha basadeh lif'nvot 'arev vayisa 'eynayv vayar' v'hineh g'maliym baiym
translation: And Isaac went out walkingeOthers “to meditate”; meaning of Heb. uncertain. in the field toward evening and, looking up, he saw camels approaching.

hebrew: וַתִּשָּׂ֤א רִבְקָה֙ אֶת־עֵינֶ֔יהָ וַתֵּ֖רֶא אֶת־יִצְחָ֑ק וַתִּפֹּ֖ל מֵעַ֥ל הַגָּמָֽל׃
transliteration: vatisa riv'kah et-'eyneyha vatere et-yitz'chak vatipol me'al hagamal
translation: Raising her eyes, Rebekah saw Isaac. She alighted from the camel

hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־הָעֶ֗בֶד מִֽי־הָאִ֤ישׁ הַלָּזֶה֙ הַהֹלֵ֤ךְ בַּשָּׂדֶה֙ לִקְרָאתֵ֔נוּ וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הָעֶ֖בֶד ה֣וּא אֲדֹנִ֑י וַתִּקַּ֥ח הַצָּעִ֖יף וַתִּתְכָּֽס׃
transliteration: vatomer el-ha'eved miy-haiysh halazeh haholekh' basadeh lik'ratenv vayomer ha'eved hv adoniy vatikach hatza'iyf vatit'kas
translation: and said to the servant, “Who is that man walking in the field toward us?” And the servant said, “That is my master.” So she took her veil and covered herself.

hebrew: וַיְסַפֵּ֥ר הָעֶ֖בֶד לְיִצְחָ֑ק אֵ֥ת כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
transliteration: vay'saper ha'eved l'yitz'chak et kal-had'variym asher 'asah
translation: The servant told Isaac all the things that he had done.

hebrew: וַיְבִאֶ֣הָ יִצְחָ֗ק הָאֹ֙הֱלָה֙ שָׂרָ֣ה אִמּ֔וֹ וַיִּקַּ֧ח אֶת־רִבְקָ֛ה וַתְּהִי־ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֖ה וַיֶּאֱהָבֶ֑הָ וַיִּנָּחֵ֥ם יִצְחָ֖ק אַחֲרֵ֥י אִמּֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'vieha yitz'chak haohelah sarah imvo vayikach et-riv'kah vat'hiy-lvo l'ishah vayeehaveha vayinachem yitz'chak acharey imvo (f)
translation: Isaac then brought her into the tent of his mother Sarah, and he took Rebekah as his wife. Isaac loved her, and thus found comfort after his mother’s death.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֧סֶף אַבְרָהָ֛ם וַיִּקַּ֥ח אִשָּׁ֖ה וּשְׁמָ֥הּ קְטוּרָֽה׃
transliteration: vayosef av'raham vayikach ishah vsh'mah k'tvrah
translation: Abraham took another wife, whose name was Keturah.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֣לֶד ל֗וֹ אֶת־זִמְרָן֙ וְאֶת־יָקְשָׁ֔ן וְאֶת־מְדָ֖ן וְאֶת־מִדְיָ֑ן וְאֶת־יִשְׁבָּ֖ק וְאֶת־שֽׁוּחַ׃
transliteration: vateled lvo et-zim'ran v'et-yak'shan v'et-m'dan v'et-mid'yan v'et-yish'bak v'et-shvcha
translation: She bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.

hebrew: וְיָקְשָׁ֣ן יָלַ֔ד אֶת־שְׁבָ֖א וְאֶת־דְּדָ֑ן וּבְנֵ֣י דְדָ֔ן הָי֛וּ אַשּׁוּרִ֥ם וּלְטוּשִׁ֖ים וּלְאֻמִּֽים׃
transliteration: v'yak'shan yalad et-sh'va v'et-d'dan vv'ney d'dan hayv ashvrim vl'tvshiym vl'umiym
translation: Jokshan begot Sheba and Dedan. The descendants of Dedan were the Asshurim, the Letushim, and the Leummim.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י מִדְיָ֗ן עֵיפָ֤ה וָעֵ֙פֶר֙ וַחֲנֹ֔ךְ וַאֲבִידָ֖ע וְאֶלְדָּעָ֑ה כָּל־אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י קְטוּרָֽה׃
transliteration: vv'ney mid'yan 'eyfah va'efer vachanokh' vaaviyda' v'el'da'ah kal-eleh b'ney k'tvrah
translation: The descendants of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Enoch,aOr “Hanoch.” Abida, and Eldaah. All these were descendants of Keturah.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֧ן אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֶת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ לְיִצְחָֽק׃
transliteration: vayiten av'raham et-kal-asher-lvo l'yitz'chak
translation: Abraham willed all that he owned to Isaac;

hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֤י הַפִּֽילַגְשִׁים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַבְרָהָ֔ם נָתַ֥ן אַבְרָהָ֖ם מַתָּנֹ֑ת וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֞ם מֵעַ֨ל יִצְחָ֤ק בְּנוֹ֙ בְּעוֹדֶ֣נּוּ חַ֔י קֵ֖דְמָה אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ קֶֽדֶם׃
transliteration: v'liv'ney hapiylag'shiym asher l'av'raham natan av'raham matanot vay'shal'chem me'al yitz'chak b'nvo b'vodenv chay ked'mah el-eretz kedem
translation: but to Abraham’s sons by concubines Abraham gave gifts while he was still living, and he sent them away from his son Isaac eastward, to the land of the East.

hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה יְמֵ֛י שְׁנֵֽי־חַיֵּ֥י אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־חָ֑י מְאַ֥ת שָׁנָ֛ה וְשִׁבְעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְחָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִֽים׃
transliteration: v'eleh y'mey sh'ney-chayey av'raham asher-chay m'at shanah v'shiv'iym shanah v'chamesh shaniym
translation: This was the total span of Abraham’s life: one hundred and seventy-five years.

hebrew: וַיִּגְוַ֨ע וַיָּ֧מָת אַבְרָהָ֛ם בְּשֵׂיבָ֥ה טוֹבָ֖ה זָקֵ֣ן וְשָׂבֵ֑עַ וַיֵּאָ֖סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
transliteration: vayig'va' vayamat av'raham b'seyvah tvovah zaken v'save'a vayeasef el-'amayv
translation: And Abraham breathed his last, dying at a good ripe age, old and contented; and he was gathered to his kin.

hebrew: וַיִּקְבְּר֨וּ אֹת֜וֹ יִצְחָ֤ק וְיִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ בָּנָ֔יו אֶל־מְעָרַ֖ת הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֑ה אֶל־שְׂדֵ֞ה עֶפְרֹ֤ן בֶּן־צֹ֙חַר֙ הַֽחִתִּ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י מַמְרֵֽא׃
transliteration: vayik'b'rv otvo yitz'chak v'yish'ma'el banayv el-m'arat hamakh'pelah el-s'deh 'ef'ron ben-tzochar hachitiy asher 'al-p'ney mam're
translation: His sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron son of Zohar the Hittite, facing Mamre,

hebrew: הַשָּׂדֶ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־קָנָ֥ה אַבְרָהָ֖ם מֵאֵ֣ת בְּנֵי־חֵ֑ת שָׁ֛מָּה קֻבַּ֥ר אַבְרָהָ֖ם וְשָׂרָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: hasadeh asher-kanah av'raham meet b'ney-chet shamah kubar av'raham v'sarah ish'tvo
translation: the field that Abraham had bought from the Hittites; there Abraham was buried, and Sarah his wife.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחֲרֵי֙ מ֣וֹת אַבְרָהָ֔ם וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב יִצְחָ֔ק עִם־בְּאֵ֥ר לַחַ֖י רֹאִֽי׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'hiy acharey mvot av'raham vay'varekh' elohiym et-yitz'chak b'nvo vayeshev yitz'chak 'im-b'er lachay roiy (s)
translation: After the death of Abraham, God blessed his son Isaac. And Isaac settled near Beer-lahai-roi.

hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תֹּלְדֹ֥ת יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָלְדָ֜ה הָגָ֧ר הַמִּצְרִ֛ית שִׁפְחַ֥ת שָׂרָ֖ה לְאַבְרָהָֽם׃
transliteration: v'eleh tol'dot yish'ma'el ben-av'raham asher yal'dah hagar hamitz'riyt shif'chat sarah l'av'raham
translation: This is the line of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah’s slave, bore to Abraham.

hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁמוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׁמָעֵ֔אל בִּשְׁמֹתָ֖ם לְתוֹלְדֹתָ֑ם בְּכֹ֤ר יִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ נְבָיֹ֔ת וְקֵדָ֥ר וְאַדְבְּאֵ֖ל וּמִבְשָֽׂם׃
transliteration: v'eleh sh'mvot b'ney yish'ma'el bish'motam l'tvol'dotam b'khor yish'ma'el n'vayot v'kedar v'ad'b'el vmiv'sam
translation: These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, in the order of their birth: Nebaioth, the first-born of Ishmael, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

hebrew: וּמִשְׁמָ֥ע וְדוּמָ֖ה וּמַשָּֽׂא׃
transliteration: vmish'ma' v'dvmah vmasa
translation: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,

hebrew: חֲדַ֣ד וְתֵימָ֔א יְט֥וּר נָפִ֖ישׁ וָקֵֽדְמָה׃
transliteration: chadad v'teyma y'tvr nafiysh vaked'mah
translation: Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedmah.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הֵ֞ם בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ וְאֵ֣לֶּה שְׁמֹתָ֔ם בְּחַצְרֵיהֶ֖ם וּבְטִֽירֹתָ֑ם שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר נְשִׂיאִ֖ם לְאֻמֹּתָֽם׃
transliteration: eleh hem b'ney yish'ma'el v'eleh sh'motam b'chatz'reyhem vv'tiyrotam sh'neym-'asar n'siyim l'umotam
translation: These are the sons of Ishmael and these are their names by their villages and by their encampments: twelve chieftains of as many tribes.—

hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י יִשְׁמָעֵ֔אל מְאַ֥ת שָׁנָ֛ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְשֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֑ים וַיִּגְוַ֣ע וַיָּ֔מָת וַיֵּאָ֖סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
transliteration: v'eleh sh'ney chayey yish'ma'el m'at shanah vsh'loshiym shanah v'sheva' shaniym vayig'va' vayamat vayeasef el-'amayv
translation: These were the years of the life of Ishmael: one hundred and thirty-seven years; then he breathed his last and died, and was gathered to his kin.—

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכְּנ֨וּ מֵֽחֲוִילָ֜ה עַד־שׁ֗וּר אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י מִצְרַ֔יִם בֹּאֲכָ֖ה אַשּׁ֑וּרָה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י כָל־אֶחָ֖יו נָפָֽל׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayish'k'nv mechaviylah 'ad-shvr asher 'al-p'ney mitz'rayim boakhah ashvrah 'al-p'ney khal-echayv nafal (f)
translation: They dwelt from Havilah, by Shur, which is close to Egypt, all the way to Asshur; they camped alongside all their kinsmen.

hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֥ת יִצְחָ֖ק בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֑ם אַבְרָהָ֖ם הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־יִצְחָֽק׃
transliteration: v'eleh tvol'dot yitz'chak ben-av'raham av'raham hvoliyd et-yitz'chak
translation: This is the story of Isaac, son of Abraham. Abraham begot Isaac.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י יִצְחָק֙ בֶּן־אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּקַחְתּ֣וֹ אֶת־רִבְקָ֗ה בַּת־בְּתוּאֵל֙ הָֽאֲרַמִּ֔י מִפַּדַּ֖ן אֲרָ֑ם אֲח֛וֹת לָבָ֥ן הָאֲרַמִּ֖י ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy yitz'chak ben-ar'ba'iym shanah b'kach'tvo et-riv'kah bat-b'tvel haaramiy mipadan aram achvot lavan haaramiy lvo l'ishah
translation: Isaac was forty years old when he took to wife Rebekah, daughter of Bethuel the Aramean of Paddan-aram, sister of Laban the Aramean.

hebrew: וַיֶּעְתַּ֨ר יִצְחָ֤ק לַֽיהוָה֙ לְנֹ֣כַח אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י עֲקָרָ֖ה הִ֑וא וַיֵּעָ֤תֶר לוֹ֙ יְהוָ֔ה וַתַּ֖הַר רִבְקָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaye'tar yitz'chak layhvah l'nokhach ish'tvo kiy 'akarah hiv vaye'ater lvo y'hvah vatahar riv'kah ish'tvo
translation: Isaac pleaded with the L<small>ORD</small> on behalf of his wife, because she was barren; and the L<small>ORD</small> responded to his plea, and his wife Rebekah conceived.

hebrew: וַיִּתְרֹֽצֲצ֤וּ הַבָּנִים֙ בְּקִרְבָּ֔הּ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אִם־כֵּ֔ן לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה אָנֹ֑כִי וַתֵּ֖לֶךְ לִדְרֹ֥שׁ אֶת־יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayit'rotzatzv habaniym b'kir'bah vatomer im-ken lamah zeh anokhiy vatelekh' lid'rosh et-y'hvah
translation: But the children struggled in her womb, and she said, “If so, why do I exist?”bMeaning of Heb. uncertain. She went to inquire of the LORD,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה לָ֗הּ שְׁנֵ֤י גיים [גוֹיִם֙] בְּבִטְנֵ֔ךְ וּשְׁנֵ֣י לְאֻמִּ֔ים מִמֵּעַ֖יִךְ יִפָּרֵ֑דוּ וּלְאֹם֙ מִלְאֹ֣ם יֶֽאֱמָ֔ץ וְרַ֖ב יַעֲבֹ֥ד צָעִֽיר׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah lah sh'ney gyym [gvoyim] b'vit'nekh' vsh'ney l'umiym mime'ayikh' yiparedv vl'om mil'om yeematz v'rav ya'avod tza'iyr
translation:
and the LORD answered her,
“Two nations are in your womb,
Two separate peoples shall issue from your body;
One people shall be mightier than the other,
And the older shall serve the younger.”

hebrew: וַיִּמְלְא֥וּ יָמֶ֖יהָ לָלֶ֑דֶת וְהִנֵּ֥ה תוֹמִ֖ם בְּבִטְנָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayim'l'v yameyha laledet v'hineh tvomim b'vit'nah
translation: When her time to give birth was at hand, there were twins in her womb.

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֤א הָרִאשׁוֹן֙ אַדְמוֹנִ֔י כֻּלּ֖וֹ כְּאַדֶּ֣רֶת שֵׂעָ֑ר וַיִּקְרְא֥וּ שְׁמ֖וֹ עֵשָֽׂו׃
transliteration: vayetze harishvon ad'mvoniy kulvo k'aderet se'ar vayik'r'v sh'mvo 'esav
translation: The first one emerged red, like a hairy mantle all over; so they named him Esau.cSynonym of “Seir,” play on Heb. se‘ar “hair.”

hebrew: וְאַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֞ן יָצָ֣א אָחִ֗יו וְיָד֤וֹ אֹחֶ֙זֶת֙ בַּעֲקֵ֣ב עֵשָׂ֔ו וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְיִצְחָ֛ק בֶּן־שִׁשִּׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה בְּלֶ֥דֶת אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'acharey-khen yatza achiyv v'yadvo ochezet ba'akev 'esav vayik'ra sh'mvo ya'akov v'yitz'chak ben-shishiym shanah b'ledet otam
translation: Then his brother emerged, holding on to the heel of Esau; so they named him Jacob.dPlay on Heb. ‘aqeb “heel.” Isaac was sixty years old when they were born.

hebrew: וַֽיִּגְדְּלוּ֙ הַנְּעָרִ֔ים וַיְהִ֣י עֵשָׂ֗ו אִ֛ישׁ יֹדֵ֥עַ צַ֖יִד אִ֣ישׁ שָׂדֶ֑ה וְיַעֲקֹב֙ אִ֣ישׁ תָּ֔ם יֹשֵׁ֖ב אֹהָלִֽים׃
transliteration: vayig'd'lv han'ariym vay'hiy 'esav iysh yode'a tzayid iysh sadeh v'ya'akov iysh tam yoshev ohaliym
translation: When the boys grew up, Esau became a skillful hunter, a man of the outdoors; but Jacob was a mild man who stayed in camp.

hebrew: וַיֶּאֱהַ֥ב יִצְחָ֛ק אֶת־עֵשָׂ֖ו כִּי־צַ֣יִד בְּפִ֑יו וְרִבְקָ֖ה אֹהֶ֥בֶת אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: vayeehav yitz'chak et-'esav kiy-tzayid b'fiyv v'riv'kah ohevet et-ya'akov
translation: Isaac favored Esau because eLit. “game was in his mouth.”he had a taste for game;-e but Rebekah favored Jacob.

hebrew: וַיָּ֥זֶד יַעֲקֹ֖ב נָזִ֑יד וַיָּבֹ֥א עֵשָׂ֛ו מִן־הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה וְה֥וּא עָיֵֽף׃
transliteration: vayazed ya'akov naziyd vayavo 'esav min-hasadeh v'hv 'ayef
translation: Once when Jacob was cooking a stew, Esau came in from the open, famished.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֵשָׂ֜ו אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֗ב הַלְעִיטֵ֤נִי נָא֙ מִן־הָאָדֹ֤ם הָאָדֹם֙ הַזֶּ֔ה כִּ֥י עָיֵ֖ף אָנֹ֑כִי עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמ֖וֹ אֱדֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayomer 'esav el-ya'akov hal'iyteniy na min-haadom haadom hazeh kiy 'ayef anokhiy 'al-ken kara-sh'mvo edvom
translation: And Esau said to Jacob, “Give me some of that red stuff to gulp down, for I am famished”—which is why he was named Edom.fPlay on Heb. ’adom “red.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֑ב מִכְרָ֥ה כַיּ֛וֹם אֶת־בְּכֹֽרָתְךָ֖ לִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov mikh'rah khayvom et-b'khorat'kha liy
translation: Jacob said, “First sell me your birthright.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר עֵשָׂ֔ו הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י הוֹלֵ֖ךְ לָמ֑וּת וְלָמָּה־זֶּ֥ה לִ֖י בְּכֹרָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer 'esav hineh anokhiy hvolekh' lamvt v'lamah-zeh liy b'khorah
translation: And Esau said, “I am at the point of death, so of what use is my birthright to me?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֗ב הִשָּׁ֤בְעָה לִּי֙ כַּיּ֔וֹם וַיִּשָּׁבַ֖ע ל֑וֹ וַיִּמְכֹּ֥ר אֶת־בְּכֹרָת֖וֹ לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov hishav'ah liy kayvom vayishava' lvo vayim'kor et-b'khoratvo l'ya'akov
translation: But Jacob said, “Swear to me first.” So he swore to him, and sold his birthright to Jacob.

hebrew: וְיַעֲקֹ֞ב נָתַ֣ן לְעֵשָׂ֗ו לֶ֚חֶם וּנְזִ֣יד עֲדָשִׁ֔ים וַיֹּ֣אכַל וַיֵּ֔שְׁתְּ וַיָּ֖קָם וַיֵּלַ֑ךְ וַיִּ֥בֶז עֵשָׂ֖ו אֶת־הַבְּכֹרָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'ya'akov natan l'esav lechem vn'ziyd 'adashiym vayokhal vayesh't' vayakam vayelakh' vayivez 'esav et-hab'khorah (s)
translation: Jacob then gave Esau bread and lentil stew; he ate and drank, and he rose and went away. Thus did Esau spurn the birthright.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י רָעָב֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ מִלְּבַד֙ הָרָעָ֣ב הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה בִּימֵ֣י אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיֵּ֧לֶךְ יִצְחָ֛ק אֶל־אֲבִימֶּ֥לֶךְ מֶֽלֶךְ־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים גְּרָֽרָה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy ra'av baaretz mil'vad hara'av harishvon asher hayah biymey av'raham vayelekh' yitz'chak el-aviymelekh' melekh'-p'lish'tiym g'rarah
translation: There was a famine in the land—aside from the previous famine that had occurred in the days of Abraham—and Isaac went to Abimelech, king of the Philistines, in Gerar.

hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֤א אֵלָיו֙ יְהוָ֔ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אַל־תֵּרֵ֣ד מִצְרָ֑יְמָה שְׁכֹ֣ן בָּאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֹמַ֥ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vayera elayv y'hvah vayomer al-tered mitz'ray'mah sh'khon baaretz asher omar eleykha
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> had appeared to him and said, “Do not go down to Egypt; stay in the land which I point out to you.

hebrew: גּ֚וּר בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את וְאֶֽהְיֶ֥ה עִמְּךָ֖ וַאֲבָרְכֶ֑ךָּ כִּֽי־לְךָ֣ וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֗ אֶתֵּן֙ אֶת־כָּל־הָֽאֲרָצֹ֣ת הָאֵ֔ל וַהֲקִֽמֹתִי֙ אֶת־הַשְּׁבֻעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖עְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם אָבִֽיךָ׃
transliteration: gvr baaretz hazot v'eh'yeh 'im'kha vaavar'kheka kiy-l'kha vl'zar'akha eten et-kal-haaratzot hael vahakimotiy et-hash'vu'ah asher nish'ba'tiy l'av'raham aviykha
translation: Reside in this land, and I will be with you and bless you; I will assign all these lands to you and to your heirs, fulfilling the oath that I swore to your father Abraham.

hebrew: וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֤י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ כְּכוֹכְבֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְנָתַתִּ֣י לְזַרְעֲךָ֔ אֵ֥ת כָּל־הָאֲרָצֹ֖ת הָאֵ֑ל וְהִתְבָּרֲכ֣וּ בְזַרְעֲךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'hir'beytiy et-zar'akha k'khvokh'vey hashamayim v'natatiy l'zar'akha et kal-haaratzot hael v'hit'barakhv v'zar'akha kol gvoyey haaretz
translation: I will make your heirs as numerous as the stars of heaven, and assign to your heirs all these lands, so that all the nations of the earth shall bless themselves by your heirs—

hebrew: עֵ֕קֶב אֲשֶׁר־שָׁמַ֥ע אַבְרָהָ֖ם בְּקֹלִ֑י וַיִּשְׁמֹר֙ מִשְׁמַרְתִּ֔י מִצְוֺתַ֖י חֻקּוֹתַ֥י וְתוֹרֹתָֽי׃
transliteration: 'ekev asher-shama' av'raham b'koliy vayish'mor mish'mar'tiy mitz'votay chukvotay v'tvorotay
translation: inasmuch as Abraham obeyed Me and kept My charge: My commandments, My laws, and My teachings.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב יִצְחָ֖ק בִּגְרָֽר׃
transliteration: vayeshev yitz'chak big'rar
translation: So Isaac stayed in Gerar.

hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁאֲל֞וּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמָּקוֹם֙ לְאִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֑וא כִּ֤י יָרֵא֙ לֵאמֹ֣ר אִשְׁתִּ֔י פֶּן־יַֽהַרְגֻ֜נִי אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמָּקוֹם֙ עַל־רִבְקָ֔ה כִּֽי־טוֹבַ֥ת מַרְאֶ֖ה הִֽיא׃
transliteration: vayish'alv an'shey hamakvom l'ish'tvo vayomer achotiy hiv kiy yare lemor ish'tiy pen-yahar'guniy an'shey hamakvom 'al-riv'kah kiy-tvovat mar'eh hiy
translation: When the men of the place asked him about his wife, he said, “She is my sister,” for he was afraid to say “my wife,” thinking, “The men of the place might kill me on account of Rebekah, for she is beautiful.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּ֣י אָֽרְכוּ־ל֥וֹ שָׁם֙ הַיָּמִ֔ים וַיַּשְׁקֵ֗ף אֲבִימֶ֙לֶךְ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים בְּעַ֖ד הַֽחַלּ֑וֹן וַיַּ֗רְא וְהִנֵּ֤ה יִצְחָק֙ מְצַחֵ֔ק אֵ֖ת רִבְקָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kiy ar'khv-lvo sham hayamiym vayash'kef aviymelekh' melekh' p'lish'tiym b'ad hachalvon vayar' v'hineh yitz'chak m'tzachek et riv'kah ish'tvo
translation: When some time had passed, Abimelech king of the Philistines, looking out of the window, saw Isaac fondling his wife Rebekah.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ לְיִצְחָ֗ק וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַ֣ךְ הִנֵּ֤ה אִשְׁתְּךָ֙ הִ֔וא וְאֵ֥יךְ אָמַ֖רְתָּ אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֑וא וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ יִצְחָ֔ק כִּ֣י אָמַ֔רְתִּי פֶּן־אָמ֖וּת עָלֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayik'ra aviymelekh' l'yitz'chak vayomer akh' hineh ish't'kha hiv v'eykh' amar'ta achotiy hiv vayomer elayv yitz'chak kiy amar'tiy pen-amvt 'aleyha
translation: Abimelech sent for Isaac and said, “So she is your wife! Why then did you say: ‘She is my sister?’” Isaac said to him, “Because I thought I might lose my life on account of her.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ מַה־זֹּ֖את עָשִׂ֣יתָ לָּ֑נוּ כִּ֠מְעַט שָׁכַ֞ב אַחַ֤ד הָעָם֙ אֶת־אִשְׁתֶּ֔ךָ וְהֵבֵאתָ֥ עָלֵ֖ינוּ אָשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayomer aviymelekh' mah-zot 'asiyta lanv kim'at shakhav achad ha'am et-ish'tekha v'heveta 'aleynv asham
translation: Abimelech said, “What have you done to us! One of the people might have lain with your wife, and you would have brought guilt upon us.”

hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ אֶת־כָּל־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר הַנֹּגֵ֜עַ בָּאִ֥ישׁ הַזֶּ֛ה וּבְאִשְׁתּ֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: vay'tzav aviymelekh' et-kal-ha'am lemor hanoge'a baiysh hazeh vv'ish'tvo mvot yvmat
translation: Abimelech then charged all the people, saying, “Anyone who molests this man or his wife shall be put to death.”

hebrew: וַיִּזְרַ֤ע יִצְחָק֙ בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַהִ֔וא וַיִּמְצָ֛א בַּשָּׁנָ֥ה הַהִ֖וא מֵאָ֣ה שְׁעָרִ֑ים וַֽיְבָרֲכֵ֖הוּ יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayiz'ra' yitz'chak baaretz hahiv vayim'tza bashanah hahiv meah sh'ariym vay'varakhehv y'hvah
translation: Isaac sowed in that land and reaped a hundredfold the same year. The L<small>ORD</small> blessed him,

hebrew: וַיִּגְדַּ֖ל הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ הָלוֹךְ֙ וְגָדֵ֔ל עַ֥ד כִּֽי־גָדַ֖ל מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: vayig'dal haiysh vayelekh' halvokh' v'gadel 'ad kiy-gadal m'od
translation: and the man grew richer and richer until he was very wealthy:

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־ל֤וֹ מִקְנֵה־צֹאן֙ וּמִקְנֵ֣ה בָקָ֔ר וַעֲבֻדָּ֖ה רַבָּ֑ה וַיְקַנְא֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
transliteration: vay'hiy-lvo mik'neh-tzon vmik'neh vakar va'avudah rabah vay'kan'v otvo p'lish'tiym
translation: he acquired flocks and herds, and a large household, so that the Philistines envied him.

hebrew: וְכָל־הַבְּאֵרֹ֗ת אֲשֶׁ֤ר חָֽפְרוּ֙ עַבְדֵ֣י אָבִ֔יו בִּימֵ֖י אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֑יו סִתְּמ֣וּם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיְמַלְא֖וּם עָפָֽר׃
transliteration: v'khal-hab'erot asher chaf'rv 'av'dey aviyv biymey av'raham aviyv sit'mvm p'lish'tiym vay'mal'vm 'afar
translation: And the Philistines stopped up all the wells which his father’s servants had dug in the days of his father Abraham, filling them with earth.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ אֶל־יִצְחָ֑ק לֵ֚ךְ מֵֽעִמָּ֔נוּ כִּֽי־עָצַֽמְתָּ־מִמֶּ֖נּוּ מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: vayomer aviymelekh' el-yitz'chak lekh' me'imanv kiy-'atzam'ta-mimenv m'od
translation: And Abimelech said to Isaac, “Go away from us, for you have become far too big for us.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ מִשָּׁ֖ם יִצְחָ֑ק וַיִּ֥חַן בְּנַֽחַל־גְּרָ֖ר וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayelekh' misham yitz'chak vayichan b'nachal-g'rar vayeshev sham
translation: So Isaac departed from there and encamped in the wadi of Gerar, where he settled.

hebrew: וַיָּ֨שָׁב יִצְחָ֜ק וַיַּחְפֹּ֣ר ׀ אֶת־בְּאֵרֹ֣ת הַמַּ֗יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר חָֽפְרוּ֙ בִּימֵי֙ אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֔יו וַיְסַתְּמ֣וּם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים אַחֲרֵ֖י מ֣וֹת אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיִּקְרָ֤א לָהֶן֙ שֵׁמ֔וֹת כַּשֵּׁמֹ֕ת אֲשֶׁר־קָרָ֥א לָהֶ֖ן אָבִֽיו׃
transliteration: vayashav yitz'chak vayach'por  et-b'erot hamayim asher chaf'rv biymey av'raham aviyv vay'sat'mvm p'lish'tiym acharey mvot av'raham vayik'ra lahen shemvot kashemot asher-kara lahen aviyv
translation: Isaac dug anew the wells which had been dug in the days of his father Abraham and which the Philistines had stopped up after Abraham’s death; and he gave them the same names that his father had given them.

hebrew: וַיַּחְפְּר֥וּ עַבְדֵֽי־יִצְחָ֖ק בַּנָּ֑חַל וַיִּ֨מְצְאוּ־שָׁ֔ם בְּאֵ֖ר מַ֥יִם חַיִּֽים׃
transliteration: vayach'p'rv 'av'dey-yitz'chak banachal vayim'tz'v-sham b'er mayim chayiym
translation: But when Isaac’s servants, digging in the wadi, found there a well of spring water,

hebrew: וַיָּרִ֜יבוּ רֹעֵ֣י גְרָ֗ר עִם־רֹעֵ֥י יִצְחָ֛ק לֵאמֹ֖ר לָ֣נוּ הַמָּ֑יִם וַיִּקְרָ֤א שֵֽׁם־הַבְּאֵר֙ עֵ֔שֶׂק כִּ֥י הִֽתְעַשְּׂק֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayariyvv ro'ey g'rar 'im-ro'ey yitz'chak lemor lanv hamayim vayik'ra shem-hab'er 'esek kiy hit'as'kv 'imvo
translation: the herdsmen of Gerar quarreled with Isaac’s herdsmen, saying, “The water is ours.” He named that well Esek,aI.e., “contention.” because they contended with him.

hebrew: וַֽיַּחְפְּרוּ֙ בְּאֵ֣ר אַחֶ֔רֶת וַיָּרִ֖יבוּ גַּם־עָלֶ֑יהָ וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמָ֖הּ שִׂטְנָֽה׃
transliteration: vayach'p'rv b'er acheret vayariyvv gam-'aleyha vayik'ra sh'mah sit'nah
translation: And when they dug another well, they disputed over that one also; so he named it Sitnah.bI.e., “harassment.”

hebrew: וַיַּעְתֵּ֣ק מִשָּׁ֗ם וַיַּחְפֹּר֙ בְּאֵ֣ר אַחֶ֔רֶת וְלֹ֥א רָב֖וּ עָלֶ֑יהָ וַיִּקְרָ֤א שְׁמָהּ֙ רְחֹב֔וֹת וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כִּֽי־עַתָּ֞ה הִרְחִ֧יב יְהוָ֛ה לָ֖נוּ וּפָרִ֥ינוּ בָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vaya'tek misham vayach'por b'er acheret v'lo ravv 'aleyha vayik'ra sh'mah r'chovvot vayomer kiy-'atah hir'chiyv y'hvah lanv vfariynv vaaretz
translation: He moved from there and dug yet another well, and they did not quarrel over it; so he called it Rehoboth, saying, “Now at last the LORD has granted us ample spacecHeb. hirḥib, connected with “Rehoboth.” to increase in the land.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל מִשָּׁ֖ם בְּאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃
transliteration: vaya'al misham b'er shava'
translation: From there he went up to Beer-sheba.

hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֨א אֵלָ֤יו יְהוָה֙ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֔וּא וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָנֹכִ֕י אֱלֹהֵ֖י אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֑יךָ אַל־תִּירָא֙ כִּֽי־אִתְּךָ֣ אָנֹ֔כִי וּבֵֽרַכְתִּ֙יךָ֙ וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֣י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֔ בַּעֲב֖וּר אַבְרָהָ֥ם עַבְדִּֽי׃
transliteration: vayera elayv y'hvah balay'lah hahv vayomer anokhiy elohey av'raham aviykha al-tiyra kiy-it'kha anokhiy vverakh'tiykha v'hir'beytiy et-zar'akha ba'avvr av'raham 'av'diy
translation: That night the L<small>ORD</small> appeared to him and said, “I am the God of your father Abraham. Fear not, for I am with you, and I will bless you and increase your offspring for the sake of My servant Abraham.”

hebrew: וַיִּ֧בֶן שָׁ֣ם מִזְבֵּ֗חַ וַיִּקְרָא֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהוָ֔ה וַיֶּט־שָׁ֖ם אָהֳל֑וֹ וַיִּכְרוּ־שָׁ֥ם עַבְדֵי־יִצְחָ֖ק בְּאֵֽר׃
transliteration: vayiven sham miz'becha vayik'ra b'shem y'hvah vayet-sham aholvo vayikh'rv-sham 'av'dey-yitz'chak b'er
translation: So he built an altar there and invoked the L<small>ORD</small> by name. Isaac pitched his tent there and his servants started digging a well.

hebrew: וַאֲבִימֶ֕לֶךְ הָלַ֥ךְ אֵלָ֖יו מִגְּרָ֑ר וַאֲחֻזַּת֙ מֵֽרֵעֵ֔הוּ וּפִיכֹ֖ל שַׂר־צְבָאֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaaviymelekh' halakh' elayv mig'rar vaachuzat mere'ehv vfiykhol sar-tz'vavo
translation: And Abimelech came to him from Gerar, with Ahuzzath his councilor and Phicol chief of his troops.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ יִצְחָ֔ק מַדּ֖וּעַ בָּאתֶ֣ם אֵלָ֑י וְאַתֶּם֙ שְׂנֵאתֶ֣ם אֹתִ֔י וַתְּשַׁלְּח֖וּנִי מֵאִתְּכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem yitz'chak madv'a batem elay v'atem s'netem otiy vat'shal'chvniy meit'khem
translation: Isaac said to them, “Why have you come to me, seeing that you have been hostile to me and have driven me away from you?”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ רָא֣וֹ רָאִינוּ֮ כִּֽי־הָיָ֣ה יְהוָ֣ה ׀ עִמָּךְ֒ וַנֹּ֗אמֶר תְּהִ֨י נָ֥א אָלָ֛ה בֵּינוֹתֵ֖ינוּ בֵּינֵ֣ינוּ וּבֵינֶ֑ךָ וְנִכְרְתָ֥ה בְרִ֖ית עִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayom'rv ravo raiynv kiy-hayah y'hvah  'imakh' vanomer t'hiy na alah beynvoteynv beyneynv vveynekha v'nikh'r'tah v'riyt 'imakh'
translation: And they said, “We now see plainly that the L<small>ORD</small> has been with you, and we thought: Let there be a sworn treaty between our two parties, between you and us. Let us make a pact with you

hebrew: אִם־תַּעֲשֵׂ֨ה עִמָּ֜נוּ רָעָ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א נְגַֽעֲנ֔וּךָ וְכַאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשִׂ֤ינוּ עִמְּךָ֙ רַק־ט֔וֹב וַנְּשַׁלֵּֽחֲךָ֖ בְּשָׁל֑וֹם אַתָּ֥ה עַתָּ֖ה בְּר֥וּךְ יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: im-ta'aseh 'imanv ra'ah kaasher lo n'ga'anvkha v'khaasher 'asiynv 'im'kha rak-tvov van'shalechakha b'shalvom atah 'atah b'rvkh' y'hvah
translation: that you will not do us harm, just as we have not molested you but have always dealt kindly with you and sent you away in peace. From now on, be you blessed of the L<small>ORD</small>!”

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ לָהֶם֙ מִשְׁתֶּ֔ה וַיֹּאכְל֖וּ וַיִּשְׁתּֽוּ׃
transliteration: vaya'as lahem mish'teh vayokh'lv vayish'tv
translation: Then he made for them a feast, and they ate and drank.

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֣ימוּ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיִּשָּׁבְע֖וּ אִ֣ישׁ לְאָחִ֑יו וַיְשַׁלְּחֵ֣ם יִצְחָ֔ק וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ מֵאִתּ֖וֹ בְּשָׁלֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayash'kiymv vaboker vayishav'v iysh l'achiyv vay'shal'chem yitz'chak vayel'khv meitvo b'shalvom
translation: Early in the morning, they exchanged oaths. Isaac then bade them farewell, and they departed from him in peace.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ עַבְדֵ֣י יִצְחָ֔ק וַיַּגִּ֣דוּ ל֔וֹ עַל־אֹד֥וֹת הַבְּאֵ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָפָ֑רוּ וַיֹּ֥אמְרוּ ל֖וֹ מָצָ֥אנוּ מָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy  bayvom hahv vayavov 'av'dey yitz'chak vayagidv lvo 'al-odvot hab'er asher chafarv vayom'rv lvo matzanv mayim
translation: That same day Isaac’s servants came and told him about the well they had dug, and said to him, “We have found water!”

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֹתָ֖הּ שִׁבְעָ֑ה עַל־כֵּ֤ן שֵׁם־הָעִיר֙ בְּאֵ֣ר שֶׁ֔בַע עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayik'ra otah shiv'ah 'al-ken shem-ha'iyr b'er sheva' 'ad hayvom hazeh (s)
translation: He named it Shibah;dAs though “oath.” therefore the name of the city is Beer-sheba to this day.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י עֵשָׂו֙ בֶּן־אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וַיִּקַּ֤ח אִשָּׁה֙ אֶת־יְהוּדִ֔ית בַּת־בְּאֵרִ֖י הַֽחִתִּ֑י וְאֶת־בָּ֣שְׂמַ֔ת בַּת־אֵילֹ֖ן הַֽחִתִּֽי׃
transliteration: vay'hiy 'esav ben-ar'ba'iym shanah vayikach ishah et-y'hvdiyt bat-b'eriy hachitiy v'et-bas'mat bat-eylon hachitiy
translation: When Esau was forty years old, he took to wife Judith daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath daughter of Elon the Hittite;

hebrew: וַתִּהְיֶ֖יןָ מֹ֣רַת ר֑וּחַ לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּלְרִבְקָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vatih'yeyna morat rvcha l'yitz'chak vl'riv'kah (s)
translation: and they were a source of bitterness to Isaac and Rebekah.

hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ כִּֽי־זָקֵ֣ן יִצְחָ֔ק וַתִּכְהֶ֥יןָ עֵינָ֖יו מֵרְאֹ֑ת וַיִּקְרָ֞א אֶת־עֵשָׂ֣ו ׀ בְּנ֣וֹ הַגָּדֹ֗ל וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ בְּנִ֔י וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו הִנֵּֽנִי׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kiy-zaken yitz'chak vatikh'heyna 'eynayv mer'ot vayik'ra et-'esav  b'nvo hagadol vayomer elayv b'niy vayomer elayv hineniy
translation: When Isaac was old and his eyes were too dim to see, he called his older son Esau and said to him, “My son.” He answered, “Here I am.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּה־נָ֖א זָקַ֑נְתִּי לֹ֥א יָדַ֖עְתִּי י֥וֹם מוֹתִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer hineh-na zakan'tiy lo yada'tiy yvom mvotiy
translation: And he said, “I am old now, and I do not know how soon I may die.

hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ שָׂא־נָ֣א כֵלֶ֔יךָ תֶּלְיְךָ֖ וְקַשְׁתֶּ֑ךָ וְצֵא֙ הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה וְצ֥וּדָה לִּ֖י צידה [צָֽיִד׃]
transliteration: v'atah sa-na kheleykha tel'y'kha v'kash'tekha v'tze hasadeh v'tzvdah liy tzydh [tzayid]
translation: Take your gear, your quiver and bow, and go out into the open and hunt me some game.

hebrew: וַעֲשֵׂה־לִ֨י מַטְעַמִּ֜ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אָהַ֛בְתִּי וְהָבִ֥יאָה לִּ֖י וְאֹכֵ֑לָה בַּעֲב֛וּר תְּבָרֶכְךָ֥ נַפְשִׁ֖י בְּטֶ֥רֶם אָמֽוּת׃
transliteration: va'aseh-liy mat'amiym kaasher ahav'tiy v'haviyah liy v'okhelah ba'avvr t'varekh'kha naf'shiy b'terem amvt
translation: Then prepare a dish for me such as I like, and bring it to me to eat, so that I may give you my innermost blessing before I die.”

hebrew: וְרִבְקָ֣ה שֹׁמַ֔עַת בְּדַבֵּ֣ר יִצְחָ֔ק אֶל־עֵשָׂ֖ו בְּנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ עֵשָׂו֙ הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה לָצ֥וּד צַ֖יִד לְהָבִֽיא׃
transliteration: v'riv'kah shoma'at b'daber yitz'chak el-'esav b'nvo vayelekh' 'esav hasadeh latzvd tzayid l'haviy
translation: Rebekah had been listening as Isaac spoke to his son Esau. When Esau had gone out into the open to hunt game to bring home,

hebrew: וְרִבְקָה֙ אָֽמְרָ֔ה אֶל־יַעֲקֹ֥ב בְּנָ֖הּ לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֤ה שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֶת־אָבִ֔יךָ מְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶל־עֵשָׂ֥ו אָחִ֖יךָ לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: v'riv'kah am'rah el-ya'akov b'nah lemor hineh shama'tiy et-aviykha m'daber el-'esav achiykha lemor
translation: Rebekah said to her son Jacob, “I overheard your father speaking to your brother Esau, saying,

hebrew: הָבִ֨יאָה לִּ֥י צַ֛יִד וַעֲשֵׂה־לִ֥י מַטְעַמִּ֖ים וְאֹכֵ֑לָה וַאֲבָרֶכְכָ֛ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י מוֹתִֽי׃
transliteration: haviyah liy tzayid va'aseh-liy mat'amiym v'okhelah vaavarekh'khah lif'ney y'hvah lif'ney mvotiy
translation: ‘Bring me some game and prepare a dish for me to eat, that I may bless you, with the L<small>ORD</small>’s approval, before I die.’

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֥ה בְנִ֖י שְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹלִ֑י לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י מְצַוָּ֥ה אֹתָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'atah v'niy sh'ma' b'koliy laasher aniy m'tzavah otakh'
translation: Now, my son, listen carefully as I instruct you.

hebrew: לֶךְ־נָא֙ אֶל־הַצֹּ֔אן וְקַֽח־לִ֣י מִשָּׁ֗ם שְׁנֵ֛י גְּדָיֵ֥י עִזִּ֖ים טֹבִ֑ים וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂ֨ה אֹתָ֧ם מַטְעַמִּ֛ים לְאָבִ֖יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אָהֵֽב׃
transliteration: lekh'-na el-hatzon v'kach-liy misham sh'ney g'dayey 'iziym toviym v'e'eseh otam mat'amiym l'aviykha kaasher ahev
translation: Go to the flock and fetch me two choice kids, and I will make of them a dish for your father, such as he likes.

hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתָ֥ לְאָבִ֖יךָ וְאָכָ֑ל בַּעֲבֻ֛ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְבָרֶכְךָ֖ לִפְנֵ֥י מוֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'heveta l'aviykha v'akhal ba'avur asher y'varekh'kha lif'ney mvotvo
translation: Then take it to your father to eat, in order that he may bless you before he dies.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֶל־רִבְקָ֖ה אִמּ֑וֹ הֵ֣ן עֵשָׂ֤ו אָחִי֙ אִ֣ישׁ שָׂעִ֔ר וְאָנֹכִ֖י אִ֥ישׁ חָלָֽק׃
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov el-riv'kah imvo hen 'esav achiy iysh sa'ir v'anokhiy iysh chalak
translation: Jacob answered his mother Rebekah, “But my brother Esau is a hairy man and I am smooth-skinned.

hebrew: אוּלַ֤י יְמֻשֵּׁ֙נִי֙ אָבִ֔י וְהָיִ֥יתִי בְעֵינָ֖יו כִּמְתַעְתֵּ֑עַ וְהֵבֵאתִ֥י עָלַ֛י קְלָלָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א בְרָכָֽה׃
transliteration: vlay y'musheniy aviy v'hayiytiy v'eynayv kim'ta'te'a v'hevetiy 'alay k'lalah v'lo v'rakhah
translation: If my father touches me, I shall appear to him as a trickster and bring upon myself a curse, not a blessing.”

hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ אִמּ֔וֹ עָלַ֥י קִלְלָתְךָ֖ בְּנִ֑י אַ֛ךְ שְׁמַ֥ע בְּקֹלִ֖י וְלֵ֥ךְ קַֽח־לִֽי׃
transliteration: vatomer lvo imvo 'alay kil'lat'kha b'niy akh' sh'ma' b'koliy v'lekh' kach-liy
translation: But his mother said to him, “Your curse, my son, be upon me! Just do as I say and go fetch them for me.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ וַיִּקַּ֔ח וַיָּבֵ֖א לְאִמּ֑וֹ וַתַּ֤עַשׂ אִמּוֹ֙ מַטְעַמִּ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָהֵ֥ב אָבִֽיו׃
transliteration: vayelekh' vayikach vayave l'imvo vata'as imvo mat'amiym kaasher ahev aviyv
translation: He got them and brought them to his mother, and his mother prepared a dish such as his father liked.

hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֣ח רִ֠בְקָה אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֨י עֵשָׂ֜ו בְּנָ֤הּ הַגָּדֹל֙ הַחֲמֻדֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתָּ֖הּ בַּבָּ֑יִת וַתַּלְבֵּ֥שׁ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֖ב בְּנָ֥הּ הַקָּטָֽן׃
transliteration: vatikach riv'kah et-big'dey 'esav b'nah hagadol hachamudot asher itah babayit vatal'besh et-ya'akov b'nah hakatan
translation: Rebekah then took the best clothes of her older son Esau, which were there in the house, and had her younger son Jacob put them on;

hebrew: וְאֵ֗ת עֹרֹת֙ גְּדָיֵ֣י הָֽעִזִּ֔ים הִלְבִּ֖ישָׁה עַל־יָדָ֑יו וְעַ֖ל חֶלְקַ֥ת צַוָּארָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'et 'orot g'dayey ha'iziym hil'biyshah 'al-yadayv v'al chel'kat tzavarayv
translation: and she covered his hands and the hairless part of his neck with the skins of the kids.

hebrew: וַתִּתֵּ֧ן אֶת־הַמַּטְעַמִּ֛ים וְאֶת־הַלֶּ֖חֶם אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑תָה בְּיַ֖ד יַעֲקֹ֥ב בְּנָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vatiten et-hamat'amiym v'et-halechem asher 'asatah b'yad ya'akov b'nah
translation: Then she put in the hands of her son Jacob the dish and the bread that she had prepared.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א אֶל־אָבִ֖יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אָבִ֑י וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הִנֶּ֔נִּי מִ֥י אַתָּ֖ה בְּנִֽי׃
transliteration: vayavo el-aviyv vayomer aviy vayomer hineniy miy atah b'niy
translation: He went to his father and said, “Father.” And he said, “Yes, which of my sons are you?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶל־אָבִ֗יו אָנֹכִי֙ עֵשָׂ֣ו בְּכֹרֶ֔ךָ עָשִׂ֕יתִי כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ אֵלָ֑י קֽוּם־נָ֣א שְׁבָ֗ה וְאָכְלָה֙ מִצֵּידִ֔י בַּעֲב֖וּר תְּבָרֲכַ֥נִּי נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov el-aviyv anokhiy 'esav b'khorekha 'asiytiy kaasher dibar'ta elay kvm-na sh'vah v'akh'lah mitzeydiy ba'avvr t'varakhaniy naf'shekha
translation: Jacob said to his father, “I am Esau, your first-born; I have done as you told me. Pray sit up and eat of my game, that you may give me your innermost blessing.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִצְחָק֙ אֶל־בְּנ֔וֹ מַה־זֶּ֛ה מִהַ֥רְתָּ לִמְצֹ֖א בְּנִ֑י וַיֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֥י הִקְרָ֛ה יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לְפָנָֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer yitz'chak el-b'nvo mah-zeh mihar'ta lim'tzo b'niy vayomer kiy hik'rah y'hvah eloheykha l'fanay
translation: Isaac said to his son, “How did you succeed so quickly, my son?” And he said, “Because the L<small>ORD</small> your God granted me good fortune.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִצְחָק֙ אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֔ב גְּשָׁה־נָּ֥א וַאֲמֻֽשְׁךָ֖ בְּנִ֑י הַֽאַתָּ֥ה זֶ֛ה בְּנִ֥י עֵשָׂ֖ו אִם־לֹֽא׃
transliteration: vayomer yitz'chak el-ya'akov g'shah-na vaamush'kha b'niy haatah zeh b'niy 'esav im-lo
translation: Isaac said to Jacob, “Come closer that I may feel you, my son—whether you are really my son Esau or not.”

hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֧שׁ יַעֲקֹ֛ב אֶל־יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו וַיְמֻשֵּׁ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הַקֹּל֙ ק֣וֹל יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְהַיָּדַ֖יִם יְדֵ֥י עֵשָֽׂו׃
transliteration: vayigash ya'akov el-yitz'chak aviyv vay'mushehv vayomer hakol kvol ya'akov v'hayadayim y'dey 'esav
translation: So Jacob drew close to his father Isaac, who felt him and wondered. “The voice is the voice of Jacob, yet the hands are the hands of Esau.”

hebrew: וְלֹ֣א הִכִּיר֔וֹ כִּֽי־הָי֣וּ יָדָ֗יו כִּידֵ֛י עֵשָׂ֥ו אָחִ֖יו שְׂעִרֹ֑ת וַֽיְבָרְכֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: v'lo hikiyrvo kiy-hayv yadayv kiydey 'esav achiyv s'irot vay'var'khehv
translation: He did not recognize him, because his hands were hairy like those of his brother Esau; and so he blessed him.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אַתָּ֥ה זֶ֖ה בְּנִ֣י עֵשָׂ֑ו וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayomer atah zeh b'niy 'esav vayomer aniy
translation: He asked, “Are you really my son Esau?” And when he said, “I am,”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הַגִּ֤שָׁה לִּי֙ וְאֹֽכְלָה֙ מִצֵּ֣יד בְּנִ֔י לְמַ֥עַן תְּבָֽרֶכְךָ֖ נַפְשִׁ֑י וַיַּגֶּשׁ־לוֹ֙ וַיֹּאכַ֔ל וַיָּ֧בֵא ל֦וֹ יַ֖יִן וַיֵּֽשְׁתְּ׃
transliteration: vayomer hagishah liy v'okh'lah mitzeyd b'niy l'ma'an t'varekh'kha naf'shiy vayagesh-lvo vayokhal vayave lvo yayin vayesh't'
translation: he said, “Serve me and let me eat of my son’s game that I may give you my innermost blessing.” So he served him and he ate, and he brought him wine and he drank.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו יִצְחָ֣ק אָבִ֑יו גְּשָׁה־נָּ֥א וּשְׁקָה־לִּ֖י בְּנִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv yitz'chak aviyv g'shah-na vsh'kah-liy b'niy
translation: Then his father Isaac said to him, “Come close and kiss me, my son”;

hebrew: וַיִּגַּשׁ֙ וַיִּשַּׁק־ל֔וֹ וַיָּ֛רַח אֶת־רֵ֥יחַ בְּגָדָ֖יו וַֽיְבָרֲכֵ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר רְאֵה֙ רֵ֣יחַ בְּנִ֔י כְּרֵ֣יחַ שָׂדֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּרֲכ֖וֹ יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayigash vayishak-lvo vayarach et-reycha b'gadayv vay'varakhehv vayomer r'eh reycha b'niy k'reycha sadeh asher berakhvo y'hvah
translation: and he went up and kissed him. And he smelled his clothes and he blessed him, saying, “Ah, the smell of my son is like the smell of the fields that the L<small>ORD</small> has blessed.

hebrew: וְיִֽתֶּן־לְךָ֙ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים מִטַּל֙ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּמִשְׁמַנֵּ֖י הָאָ֑רֶץ וְרֹ֥ב דָּגָ֖ן וְתִירֹֽשׁ׃
transliteration: v'yiten-l'kha haelohiym mital hashamayim vmish'maney haaretz v'rov dagan v'tiyrosh
translation:
“May God give you
Of the dew of heaven and the fat of the earth,
Abundance of new grain and wine.

hebrew: יַֽעַבְד֣וּךָ עַמִּ֗ים וישתחו [וְיִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֤וּ] לְךָ֙ לְאֻמִּ֔ים הֱוֵ֤ה גְבִיר֙ לְאַחֶ֔יךָ וְיִשְׁתַּחֲוּ֥וּ לְךָ֖ בְּנֵ֣י אִמֶּ֑ךָ אֹרְרֶ֣יךָ אָר֔וּר וּֽמְבָרֲכֶ֖יךָ בָּרֽוּךְ׃
transliteration: ya'av'dvkha 'amiym vyshtchv [v'yish'tachavv] l'kha l'umiym heveh g'viyr l'acheykha v'yish'tachavv l'kha b'ney imekha or'reykha arvr vm'varakheykha barvkh'
translation:
Let peoples serve you,
And nations bow to you;
Be master over your brothers,
And let your mother’s sons bow to you.
Cursed be they who curse you,
Blessed they who bless you.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר כִּלָּ֣ה יִצְחָק֮ לְבָרֵ֣ךְ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹב֒ וַיְהִ֗י אַ֣ךְ יָצֹ֤א יָצָא֙ יַעֲקֹ֔ב מֵאֵ֥ת פְּנֵ֖י יִצְחָ֣ק אָבִ֑יו וְעֵשָׂ֣ו אָחִ֔יו בָּ֖א מִצֵּידֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kaasher kilah yitz'chak l'varekh' et-ya'akov vay'hiy akh' yatzo yatza ya'akov meet p'ney yitz'chak aviyv v'esav achiyv ba mitzeydvo
translation: No sooner had Jacob left the presence of his father Isaac—after Isaac had finished blessing Jacob—than his brother Esau came back from his hunt.

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ גַּם־הוּא֙ מַטְעַמִּ֔ים וַיָּבֵ֖א לְאָבִ֑יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְאָבִ֗יו יָקֻ֤ם אָבִי֙ וְיֹאכַל֙ מִצֵּ֣יד בְּנ֔וֹ בַּעֲב֖וּר תְּבָרֲכַ֥נִּי נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
transliteration: vaya'as gam-hv mat'amiym vayave l'aviyv vayomer l'aviyv yakum aviy v'yokhal mitzeyd b'nvo ba'avvr t'varakhaniy naf'shekha
translation: He too prepared a dish and brought it to his father. And he said to his father, “Let my father sit up and eat of his son’s game, so that you may give me your innermost blessing.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֛וֹ יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו מִי־אָ֑תָּה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אֲנִ֛י בִּנְךָ֥ בְכֹֽרְךָ֖ עֵשָֽׂו׃
transliteration: vayomer lvo yitz'chak aviyv miy-atah vayomer aniy bin'kha v'khor'kha 'esav
translation: His father Isaac said to him, “Who are you?” And he said, “I am your son, Esau, your first-born!”

hebrew: וַיֶּחֱרַ֨ד יִצְחָ֣ק חֲרָדָה֮ גְּדֹלָ֣ה עַד־מְאֹד֒ וַיֹּ֡אמֶר מִֽי־אֵפ֡וֹא ה֣וּא הַצָּֽד־צַיִד֩ וַיָּ֨בֵא לִ֜י וָאֹכַ֥ל מִכֹּ֛ל בְּטֶ֥רֶם תָּב֖וֹא וָאֲבָרֲכֵ֑הוּ גַּם־בָּר֖וּךְ יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: vayecherad yitz'chak charadah g'dolah 'ad-m'od vayomer miy-efvo hv hatzad-tzayid vayave liy vaokhal mikol b'terem tavvo vaavarakhehv gam-barvkh' yih'yeh
translation: Isaac was seized with very violent trembling. “Who was it then,” he demanded, “that hunted game and brought it to me? Moreover, I ate of it before you came, and I blessed him; now he must remain blessed!”

hebrew: כִּשְׁמֹ֤עַ עֵשָׂו֙ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֣י אָבִ֔יו וַיִּצְעַ֣ק צְעָקָ֔ה גְּדֹלָ֥ה וּמָרָ֖ה עַד־מְאֹ֑ד וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְאָבִ֔יו בָּרֲכֵ֥נִי גַם־אָ֖נִי אָבִֽי׃
transliteration: kish'mo'a 'esav et-div'rey aviyv vayitz'ak tz'akah g'dolah vmarah 'ad-m'od vayomer l'aviyv barakheniy gam-aniy aviy
translation: When Esau heard his father’s words, he burst into wild and bitter sobbing, and said to his father, “Bless me too, Father!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בָּ֥א אָחִ֖יךָ בְּמִרְמָ֑ה וַיִּקַּ֖ח בִּרְכָתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer ba achiykha b'mir'mah vayikach bir'khatekha
translation: But he answered, “Your brother came with guile and took away your blessing.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר הֲכִי֩ קָרָ֨א שְׁמ֜וֹ יַעֲקֹ֗ב וַֽיַּעְקְבֵ֙נִי֙ זֶ֣ה פַעֲמַ֔יִם אֶת־בְּכֹרָתִ֣י לָקָ֔ח וְהִנֵּ֥ה עַתָּ֖ה לָקַ֣ח בִּרְכָתִ֑י וַיֹּאמַ֕ר הֲלֹא־אָצַ֥לְתָּ לִּ֖י בְּרָכָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer hakhiy kara sh'mvo ya'akov vaya'k'veniy zeh fa'amayim et-b'khoratiy lakach v'hineh 'atah lakach bir'khatiy vayomar halo-atzal'ta liy b'rakhah
translation: [Esau] said, “Was he, then, named Jacob that he might supplantaHeb. ‘aqab, connected with “Jacob.” me these two times? First he took away my birthright and now he has taken away my blessing!” And he added, “Have you not reserved a blessing for me?”

hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן יִצְחָ֜ק וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְעֵשָׂ֗ו הֵ֣ן גְּבִ֞יר שַׂמְתִּ֥יו לָךְ֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־אֶחָ֗יו נָתַ֤תִּי לוֹ֙ לַעֲבָדִ֔ים וְדָגָ֥ן וְתִירֹ֖שׁ סְמַכְתִּ֑יו וּלְכָ֣ה אֵפ֔וֹא מָ֥ה אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֖ה בְּנִֽי׃
transliteration: vaya'an yitz'chak vayomer l'esav hen g'viyr sam'tiyv lakh' v'et-kal-echayv natatiy lvo la'avadiym v'dagan v'tiyrosh s'makh'tiyv vl'khah efvo mah e'eseh b'niy
translation: Isaac answered, saying to Esau, “But I have made him master over you: I have given him all his brothers for servants, and sustained him with grain and wine. What, then, can I still do for you, my son?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֵשָׂ֜ו אֶל־אָבִ֗יו הַֽבְרָכָ֨ה אַחַ֤ת הִֽוא־לְךָ֙ אָבִ֔י בָּרֲכֵ֥נִי גַם־אָ֖נִי אָבִ֑י וַיִּשָּׂ֥א עֵשָׂ֛ו קֹל֖וֹ וַיֵּֽבְךְּ׃
transliteration: vayomer 'esav el-aviyv hav'rakhah achat hiv-l'kha aviy barakheniy gam-aniy aviy vayisa 'esav kolvo vayev'k'
translation: And Esau said to his father, “Have you but one blessing, Father? Bless me too, Father!” And Esau wept aloud.

hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַן יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֑יו הִנֵּ֞ה מִשְׁמַנֵּ֤י הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה מֽוֹשָׁבֶ֔ךָ וּמִטַּ֥ל הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם מֵעָֽל׃
transliteration: vaya'an yitz'chak aviyv vayomer elayv hineh mish'maney haaretz yih'yeh mvoshavekha vmital hashamayim me'al
translation:
And his father Isaac answered, saying to him,
“See, your abode shall bOthers “be away from the fat of the earth and from.”enjoy the fat of the earth
And-b the dew of heaven above.

hebrew: וְעַל־חַרְבְּךָ֣ תִֽחְיֶ֔ה וְאֶת־אָחִ֖יךָ תַּעֲבֹ֑ד וְהָיָה֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר תָּרִ֔יד וּפָרַקְתָּ֥ עֻלּ֖וֹ מֵעַ֥ל צַוָּארֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'al-char'b'kha tich'yeh v'et-achiykha ta'avod v'hayah kaasher tariyd vfarak'ta 'ulvo me'al tzavarekha
translation:
Yet by your sword you shall live,
And you shall serve your brother;
But when you grow restive,
You shall break his yoke from your neck.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׂטֹ֤ם עֵשָׂו֙ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֔ב עַל־הַ֨בְּרָכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּרֲכ֖וֹ אָבִ֑יו וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֵשָׂ֜ו בְּלִבּ֗וֹ יִקְרְבוּ֙ יְמֵי֙ אֵ֣בֶל אָבִ֔י וְאַֽהַרְגָ֖ה אֶת־יַעֲקֹ֥ב אָחִֽי׃
transliteration: vayis'tom 'esav et-ya'akov 'al-hab'rakhah asher berakhvo aviyv vayomer 'esav b'libvo yik'r'vv y'mey evel aviy v'ahar'gah et-ya'akov achiy
translation: Now Esau harbored a grudge against Jacob because of the blessing which his father had given him, and Esau said to himself, “Let but the mourning period of my father come, and I will kill my brother Jacob.”

hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֣ד לְרִבְקָ֔ה אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י עֵשָׂ֖ו בְּנָ֣הּ הַגָּדֹ֑ל וַתִּשְׁלַ֞ח וַתִּקְרָ֤א לְיַעֲקֹב֙ בְּנָ֣הּ הַקָּטָ֔ן וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו הִנֵּה֙ עֵשָׂ֣ו אָחִ֔יךָ מִתְנַחֵ֥ם לְךָ֖ לְהָרְגֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayugad l'riv'kah et-div'rey 'esav b'nah hagadol vatish'lach vatik'ra l'ya'akov b'nah hakatan vatomer elayv hineh 'esav achiykha mit'nachem l'kha l'har'gekha
translation: When the words of her older son Esau were reported to Rebekah, she sent for her younger son Jacob and said to him, “Your brother Esau is consoling himself by planning to kill you.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֥ה בְנִ֖י שְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹלִ֑י וְק֧וּם בְּרַח־לְךָ֛ אֶל־לָבָ֥ן אָחִ֖י חָרָֽנָה׃
transliteration: v'atah v'niy sh'ma' b'koliy v'kvm b'rach-l'kha el-lavan achiy charanah
translation: Now, my son, listen to me. Flee at once to Haran, to my brother Laban.

hebrew: וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֥ עִמּ֖וֹ יָמִ֣ים אֲחָדִ֑ים עַ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־תָּשׁ֖וּב חֲמַ֥ת אָחִֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'yashav'ta 'imvo yamiym achadiym 'ad asher-tashvv chamat achiykha
translation: Stay with him a while, until your brother’s fury subsides—

hebrew: עַד־שׁ֨וּב אַף־אָחִ֜יךָ מִמְּךָ֗ וְשָׁכַח֙ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֣יתָ לּ֔וֹ וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֖י וּלְקַחְתִּ֣יךָ מִשָּׁ֑ם לָמָ֥ה אֶשְׁכַּ֛ל גַּם־שְׁנֵיכֶ֖ם י֥וֹם אֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: 'ad-shvv af-achiykha mim'kha v'shakhach et asher-'asiyta lvo v'shalach'tiy vl'kach'tiykha misham lamah esh'kal gam-sh'neykhem yvom echad
translation: until your brother’s anger against you subsides—and he forgets what you have done to him. Then I will fetch you from there. Let me not lose you both in one day!”

hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר רִבְקָה֙ אֶל־יִצְחָ֔ק קַ֣צְתִּי בְחַיַּ֔י מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנ֣וֹת חֵ֑ת אִם־לֹקֵ֣חַ יַ֠עֲקֹב אִשָּׁ֨ה מִבְּנֽוֹת־חֵ֤ת כָּאֵ֙לֶּה֙ מִבְּנ֣וֹת הָאָ֔רֶץ לָ֥מָּה לִּ֖י חַיִּֽים׃
transliteration: vatomer riv'kah el-yitz'chak katz'tiy v'chayay mip'ney b'nvot chet im-lokecha ya'akov ishah mib'nvot-chet kaeleh mib'nvot haaretz lamah liy chayiym
translation: Rebekah said to Isaac, “I am disgusted with my life because of the Hittite women. If Jacob marries a Hittite woman like these, from among the native women, what good will life be to me?”

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א יִצְחָ֛ק אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹת֑וֹ וַיְצַוֵּ֙הוּ֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ לֹֽא־תִקַּ֥ח אִשָּׁ֖ה מִבְּנ֥וֹת כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: vayik'ra yitz'chak el-ya'akov vay'varekh' otvo vay'tzavehv vayomer lvo lo-tikach ishah mib'nvot k'na'an
translation: So Isaac sent for Jacob and blessed him. He instructed him, saying, “You shall not take a wife from among the Canaanite women.

hebrew: ק֥וּם לֵךְ֙ פַּדֶּ֣נָֽה אֲרָ֔ם בֵּ֥יתָה בְתוּאֵ֖ל אֲבִ֣י אִמֶּ֑ךָ וְקַח־לְךָ֤ מִשָּׁם֙ אִשָּׁ֔ה מִבְּנ֥וֹת לָבָ֖ן אֲחִ֥י אִמֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: kvm lekh' padenah aram beytah v'tvel aviy imekha v'kach-l'kha misham ishah mib'nvot lavan achiy imekha
translation: Up, go to Paddan-aram, to the house of Bethuel, your mother’s father, and take a wife there from among the daughters of Laban, your mother’s brother.

hebrew: וְאֵ֤ל שַׁדַּי֙ יְבָרֵ֣ךְ אֹֽתְךָ֔ וְיַפְרְךָ֖ וְיַרְבֶּ֑ךָ וְהָיִ֖יתָ לִקְהַ֥ל עַמִּֽים׃
transliteration: v'el shaday y'varekh' ot'kha v'yaf'r'kha v'yar'bekha v'hayiyta lik'hal 'amiym
translation: May El ShaddaiaSee note at 17.1. bless you, make you fertile and numerous, so that you become an assembly of peoples.

hebrew: וְיִֽתֶּן־לְךָ֙ אֶת־בִּרְכַּ֣ת אַבְרָהָ֔ם לְךָ֖ וּלְזַרְעֲךָ֣ אִתָּ֑ךְ לְרִשְׁתְּךָ֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מְגֻרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן אֱלֹהִ֖ים לְאַבְרָהָֽם׃
transliteration: v'yiten-l'kha et-bir'kat av'raham l'kha vl'zar'akha itakh' l'rish't'kha et-eretz m'gureykha asher-natan elohiym l'av'raham
translation: May He grant the blessing of Abraham to you and your offspring, that you may possess the land where you are sojourning, which God assigned to Abraham.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יִצְחָק֙ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֔ב וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ פַּדֶּ֣נָֽה אֲרָ֑ם אֶל־לָבָ֤ן בֶּן־בְּתוּאֵל֙ הָֽאֲרַמִּ֔י אֲחִ֣י רִבְקָ֔ה אֵ֥ם יַעֲקֹ֖ב וְעֵשָֽׂו׃
transliteration: vayish'lach yitz'chak et-ya'akov vayelekh' padenah aram el-lavan ben-b'tvel haaramiy achiy riv'kah em ya'akov v'esav
translation: Then Isaac sent Jacob off, and he went to Paddan-aram, to Laban the son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, mother of Jacob and Esau.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא עֵשָׂ֗ו כִּֽי־בֵרַ֣ךְ יִצְחָק֮ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹב֒ וְשִׁלַּ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ פַּדֶּ֣נָֽה אֲרָ֔ם לָקַֽחַת־ל֥וֹ מִשָּׁ֖ם אִשָּׁ֑ה בְּבָרֲכ֣וֹ אֹת֔וֹ וַיְצַ֤ו עָלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹֽא־תִקַּ֥ח אִשָּׁ֖ה מִבְּנ֥וֹת כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: vayar' 'esav kiy-verakh' yitz'chak et-ya'akov v'shilach otvo padenah aram lakachat-lvo misham ishah b'varakhvo otvo vay'tzav 'alayv lemor lo-tikach ishah mib'nvot k'na'an
translation: When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him off to Paddan-aram to take a wife from there, charging him, as he blessed him, “You shall not take a wife from among the Canaanite women,”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֶל־אָבִ֖יו וְאֶל־אִמּ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ פַּדֶּ֥נָֽה אֲרָֽם׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' ya'akov el-aviyv v'el-imvo vayelekh' padenah aram
translation: and that Jacob had obeyed his father and mother and gone to Paddan-aram,

hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא עֵשָׂ֔ו כִּ֥י רָע֖וֹת בְּנ֣וֹת כְּנָ֑עַן בְּעֵינֵ֖י יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִֽיו׃
transliteration: vayar' 'esav kiy ra'vot b'nvot k'na'an b'eyney yitz'chak aviyv
translation: Esau realized that the Canaanite women displeased his father Isaac.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ עֵשָׂ֖ו אֶל־יִשְׁמָעֵ֑אל וַיִּקַּ֡ח אֶֽת־מָחֲלַ֣ת ׀ בַּת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֨אל בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֲח֧וֹת נְבָי֛וֹת עַל־נָשָׁ֖יו ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayelekh' 'esav el-yish'ma'el vayikach et-machalat  bat-yish'ma'el ben-av'raham achvot n'vayvot 'al-nashayv lvo l'ishah (s)
translation: So Esau went to Ishmael and took to wife, in addition to the wives he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael son of Abraham, sister of Nebaioth.

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִבְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ חָרָֽנָה׃
transliteration: vayetze ya'akov mib'er shava' vayelekh' charanah
translation: Jacob left Beer-sheba, and set out for Haran.

hebrew: וַיִּפְגַּ֨ע בַּמָּק֜וֹם וַיָּ֤לֶן שָׁם֙ כִּי־בָ֣א הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ וַיִּקַּח֙ מֵאַבְנֵ֣י הַמָּק֔וֹם וַיָּ֖שֶׂם מְרַֽאֲשֹׁתָ֑יו וַיִּשְׁכַּ֖ב בַּמָּק֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
transliteration: vayif'ga' bamakvom vayalen sham kiy-va hashemesh vayikach meav'ney hamakvom vayasem m'raashotayv vayish'kav bamakvom hahv
translation: He came upon a certain place and stopped there for the night, for the sun had set. Taking one of the stones of that place, he put it under his head and lay down in that place.

hebrew: וַֽיַּחֲלֹ֗ם וְהִנֵּ֤ה סֻלָּם֙ מֻצָּ֣ב אַ֔רְצָה וְרֹאשׁ֖וֹ מַגִּ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמָ֑יְמָה וְהִנֵּה֙ מַלְאֲכֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֔ים עֹלִ֥ים וְיֹרְדִ֖ים בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayachalom v'hineh sulam mutzav ar'tzah v'roshvo magiy'a hashamay'mah v'hineh mal'akhey elohiym 'oliym v'yor'diym bvo
translation: He had a dream; a stairwaybOr “ramp”; others “ladder.” was set on the ground and its top reached to the sky, and angels of God were going up and down on it.

hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה יְהוָ֜ה נִצָּ֣ב עָלָיו֮ וַיֹּאמַר֒ אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֗ה אֱלֹהֵי֙ אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֔יךָ וֵאלֹהֵ֖י יִצְחָ֑ק הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ שֹׁכֵ֣ב עָלֶ֔יהָ לְךָ֥ אֶתְּנֶ֖נָּה וּלְזַרְעֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'hineh y'hvah nitzav 'alayv vayomar aniy y'hvah elohey av'raham aviykha velohey yitz'chak haaretz asher atah shokhev 'aleyha l'kha et'nenah vl'zar'ekha
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> was standing beside him and He said, “I am the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of your father Abraham and the God of Isaac: the ground on which you are lying I will assign to you and to your offspring.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה זַרְעֲךָ֙ כַּעֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֔רֶץ וּפָרַצְתָּ֛ יָ֥מָּה וָקֵ֖דְמָה וְצָפֹ֣נָה וָנֶ֑גְבָּה וְנִבְרֲכ֥וּ בְךָ֛ כָּל־מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הָאֲדָמָ֖ה וּבְזַרְעֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'hayah zar'akha ka'afar haaretz vfaratz'ta yamah vaked'mah v'tzafonah vaneg'bah v'niv'rakhv v'kha kal-mish'p'chot haadamah vv'zar'ekha
translation: Your descendants shall be as the dust of the earth; you shall spread out to the west and to the east, to the north and to the south. All the families of the earth shall bless themselves by you and your descendants.

hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י עִמָּ֗ךְ וּשְׁמַרְתִּ֙יךָ֙ בְּכֹ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־תֵּלֵ֔ךְ וַהֲשִׁ֣בֹתִ֔יךָ אֶל־הָאֲדָמָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את כִּ֚י לֹ֣א אֶֽעֱזָבְךָ֔ עַ֚ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִם־עָשִׂ֔יתִי אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'hineh anokhiy 'imakh' vsh'mar'tiykha b'khol asher-telekh' vahashivotiykha el-haadamah hazot kiy lo e'ezav'kha 'ad asher im-'asiytiy et asher-dibar'tiy lakh'
translation: Remember, I am with you: I will protect you wherever you go and will bring you back to this land. I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.”

hebrew: וַיִּיקַ֣ץ יַעֲקֹב֮ מִשְּׁנָתוֹ֒ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָכֵן֙ יֵ֣שׁ יְהוָ֔ה בַּמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְאָנֹכִ֖י לֹ֥א יָדָֽעְתִּי׃
transliteration: vayiykatz ya'akov mish'natvo vayomer akhen yesh y'hvah bamakvom hazeh v'anokhiy lo yada'tiy
translation: Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “Surely the L<small>ORD</small> is present in this place, and I did not know it!”

hebrew: וַיִּירָא֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר מַה־נּוֹרָ֖א הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה אֵ֣ין זֶ֗ה כִּ֚י אִם־בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְזֶ֖ה שַׁ֥עַר הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayiyra vayomar mah-nvora hamakvom hazeh eyn zeh kiy im-beyt elohiym v'zeh sha'ar hashamayim
translation: Shaken, he said, “How awesome is this place! This is none other than the abode of God, and that is the gateway to heaven.”

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם יַעֲקֹ֜ב בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֶת־הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣ם מְרַֽאֲשֹׁתָ֔יו וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֹתָ֖הּ מַצֵּבָ֑ה וַיִּצֹ֥ק שֶׁ֖מֶן עַל־רֹאשָֽׁהּ׃
transliteration: vayash'kem ya'akov baboker vayikach et-haeven asher-sam m'raashotayv vayasem otah matzevah vayitzok shemen 'al-roshah
translation: Early in the morning, Jacob took the stone that he had put under his head and set it up as a pillar and poured oil on the top of it.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֛א אֶת־שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל וְאוּלָ֛ם ל֥וּז שֵׁם־הָעִ֖יר לָרִאשֹׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: vayik'ra et-shem-hamakvom hahv beyt-el v'vlam lvz shem-ha'iyr larishonah
translation: He named that site Bethel;cI.e., “house of God.” but previously the name of the city had been Luz.

hebrew: וַיִּדַּ֥ר יַעֲקֹ֖ב נֶ֣דֶר לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־יִהְיֶ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים עִמָּדִ֗י וּשְׁמָרַ֙נִי֙ בַּדֶּ֤רֶךְ הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָנֹכִ֣י הוֹלֵ֔ךְ וְנָֽתַן־לִ֥י לֶ֛חֶם לֶאֱכֹ֖ל וּבֶ֥גֶד לִלְבֹּֽשׁ׃
transliteration: vayidar ya'akov neder lemor im-yih'yeh elohiym 'imadiy vsh'maraniy baderekh' hazeh asher anokhiy hvolekh' v'natan-liy lechem leekhol vveged lil'bosh
translation: Jacob then made a vow, saying, “If God remains with me, if He protects me on this journey that I am making, and gives me bread to eat and clothing to wear,

hebrew: וְשַׁבְתִּ֥י בְשָׁל֖וֹם אֶל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑י וְהָיָ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה לִ֖י לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: v'shav'tiy v'shalvom el-beyt aviy v'hayah y'hvah liy lelohiym
translation: and if I return safe to my father’s house—the L<small>ORD</small> shall be my God.

hebrew: וְהָאֶ֣בֶן הַזֹּ֗את אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֙מְתִּי֙ מַצֵּבָ֔ה יִהְיֶ֖ה בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּתֶּן־לִ֔י עַשֵּׂ֖ר אֲעַשְּׂרֶ֥נּוּ לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'haeven hazot asher-sam'tiy matzevah yih'yeh beyt elohiym v'khol asher titen-liy 'aser a'as'renv lakh'
translation: And this stone, which I have set up as a pillar, shall be God’s abode; and of all that You give me, I will set aside a tithe for You.”

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א יַעֲקֹ֖ב רַגְלָ֑יו וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ אַ֥רְצָה בְנֵי־קֶֽדֶם׃
transliteration: vayisa ya'akov rag'layv vayelekh' ar'tzah v'ney-kedem
translation: Jacob aLit. “lifted up his feet.”resumed his journey-a and came to the land of the Easterners.

hebrew: וַיַּ֞רְא וְהִנֵּ֧ה בְאֵ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֗ה וְהִנֵּה־שָׁ֞ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה עֶדְרֵי־צֹאן֙ רֹבְצִ֣ים עָלֶ֔יהָ כִּ֚י מִן־הַבְּאֵ֣ר הַהִ֔וא יַשְׁק֖וּ הָעֲדָרִ֑ים וְהָאֶ֥בֶן גְּדֹלָ֖ה עַל־פִּ֥י הַבְּאֵֽר׃
transliteration: vayar' v'hineh v'er basadeh v'hineh-sham sh'loshah 'ed'rey-tzon rov'tziym 'aleyha kiy min-hab'er hahiv yash'kv ha'adariym v'haeven g'dolah 'al-piy hab'er
translation: There before his eyes was a well in the open. Three flocks of sheep were lying there beside it, for the flocks were watered from that well. The stone on the mouth of the well was large.

hebrew: וְנֶאֶסְפוּ־שָׁ֣מָּה כָל־הָעֲדָרִ֗ים וְגָלֲל֤וּ אֶת־הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ מֵעַל֙ פִּ֣י הַבְּאֵ֔ר וְהִשְׁק֖וּ אֶת־הַצֹּ֑אן וְהֵשִׁ֧יבוּ אֶת־הָאֶ֛בֶן עַל־פִּ֥י הַבְּאֵ֖ר לִמְקֹמָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'nees'fv-shamah khal-ha'adariym v'galalv et-haeven me'al piy hab'er v'hish'kv et-hatzon v'heshiyvv et-haeven 'al-piy hab'er lim'komah
translation: When all the flocks were gathered there, the stone would be rolled from the mouth of the well and the sheep watered; then the stone would be put back in its place on the mouth of the well.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ יַעֲקֹ֔ב אַחַ֖י מֵאַ֣יִן אַתֶּ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מֵחָרָ֖ן אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer lahem ya'akov achay meayin atem vayom'rv mecharan anach'nv
translation: Jacob said to them, “My friends, where are you from?” And they said, “We are from Haran.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ם הַיְדַעְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־לָבָ֣ן בֶּן־נָח֑וֹר וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ יָדָֽעְנוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer lahem hay'da'tem et-lavan ben-nachvor vayom'rv yada'nv
translation: He said to them, “Do you know Laban the son of Nahor?” And they said, “Yes, we do.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָהֶ֖ם הֲשָׁל֣וֹם ל֑וֹ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ שָׁל֔וֹם וְהִנֵּה֙ רָחֵ֣ל בִּתּ֔וֹ בָּאָ֖ה עִם־הַצֹּֽאן׃
transliteration: vayomer lahem hashalvom lvo vayom'rv shalvom v'hineh rachel bitvo baah 'im-hatzon
translation: He continued, “Is he well?” They answered, “Yes, he is; and there is his daughter Rachel, coming with the flock.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֵ֥ן עוֹד֙ הַיּ֣וֹם גָּד֔וֹל לֹא־עֵ֖ת הֵאָסֵ֣ף הַמִּקְנֶ֑ה הַשְׁק֥וּ הַצֹּ֖אן וּלְכ֥וּ רְעֽוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer hen 'vod hayvom gadvol lo-'et heasef hamik'neh hash'kv hatzon vl'khv r'v
translation: He said, “It is still broad daylight, too early to round up the animals; water the flock and take them to pasture.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֮ לֹ֣א נוּכַל֒ עַ֣ד אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֵאָֽסְפוּ֙ כָּל־הָ֣עֲדָרִ֔ים וְגָֽלֲלוּ֙ אֶת־הָאֶ֔בֶן מֵעַ֖ל פִּ֣י הַבְּאֵ֑ר וְהִשְׁקִ֖ינוּ הַצֹּֽאן׃
transliteration: vayom'rv lo nvkhal 'ad asher yeas'fv kal-ha'adariym v'galalv et-haeven me'al piy hab'er v'hish'kiynv hatzon
translation: But they said, “We cannot, until all the flocks are rounded up; then the stone is rolled off the mouth of the well and we water the sheep.”

hebrew: עוֹדֶ֖נּוּ מְדַבֵּ֣ר עִמָּ֑ם וְרָחֵ֣ל ׀ בָּ֗אָה עִם־הַצֹּאן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאָבִ֔יהָ כִּ֥י רֹעָ֖ה הִֽוא׃
transliteration: 'vodenv m'daber 'imam v'rachel  baah 'im-hatzon asher l'aviyha kiy ro'ah hiv
translation: While he was still speaking with them, Rachel came with her father’s flock; for she was a shepherdess.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ רָאָ֨ה יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶת־רָחֵ֗ל בַּת־לָבָן֙ אֲחִ֣י אִמּ֔וֹ וְאֶת־צֹ֥אן לָבָ֖ן אֲחִ֣י אִמּ֑וֹ וַיִּגַּ֣שׁ יַעֲקֹ֗ב וַיָּ֤גֶל אֶת־הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ מֵעַל֙ פִּ֣י הַבְּאֵ֔ר וַיַּ֕שְׁקְ אֶת־צֹ֥אן לָבָ֖ן אֲחִ֥י אִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kaasher raah ya'akov et-rachel bat-lavan achiy imvo v'et-tzon lavan achiy imvo vayigash ya'akov vayagel et-haeven me'al piy hab'er vayash'k' et-tzon lavan achiy imvo
translation: And when Jacob saw Rachel, the daughter of his unclebLit. “his mother’s brother.” Laban, and the flock of his uncle Laban, Jacob went up and rolled the stone off the mouth of the well, and watered the flock of his uncle Laban.

hebrew: וַיִּשַּׁ֥ק יַעֲקֹ֖ב לְרָחֵ֑ל וַיִּשָּׂ֥א אֶת־קֹל֖וֹ וַיֵּֽבְךְּ׃
transliteration: vayishak ya'akov l'rachel vayisa et-kolvo vayev'k'
translation: Then Jacob kissed Rachel, and broke into tears.

hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֨ד יַעֲקֹ֜ב לְרָחֵ֗ל כִּ֣י אֲחִ֤י אָבִ֙יהָ֙ ה֔וּא וְכִ֥י בֶן־רִבְקָ֖ה ה֑וּא וַתָּ֖רָץ וַתַּגֵּ֥ד לְאָבִֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayaged ya'akov l'rachel kiy achiy aviyha hv v'khiy ven-riv'kah hv vataratz vataged l'aviyha
translation: Jacob told Rachel that he was her father’s kinsman, that he was Rebekah’s son; and she ran and told her father.

hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ לָבָ֜ן אֶת־שֵׁ֣מַע ׀ יַעֲקֹ֣ב בֶּן־אֲחֹת֗וֹ וַיָּ֤רָץ לִקְרָאתוֹ֙ וַיְחַבֶּק־לוֹ֙ וַיְנַשֶּׁק־ל֔וֹ וַיְבִיאֵ֖הוּ אֶל־בֵּית֑וֹ וַיְסַפֵּ֣ר לְלָבָ֔ן אֵ֥ת כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy khish'mo'a lavan et-shema'  ya'akov ben-achotvo vayaratz lik'ratvo vay'chabek-lvo vay'nashek-lvo vay'viyehv el-beytvo vay'saper l'lavan et kal-had'variym haeleh
translation: On hearing the news of his sister’s son Jacob, Laban ran to greet him; he embraced him and kissed him, and took him into his house. He told Laban all that had happened,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ לָבָ֔ן אַ֛ךְ עַצְמִ֥י וּבְשָׂרִ֖י אָ֑תָּה וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב עִמּ֖וֹ חֹ֥דֶשׁ יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: vayomer lvo lavan akh' 'atz'miy vv'sariy atah vayeshev 'imvo chodesh yamiym
translation:
and Laban said to him, “You are truly my bone and flesh.”
When he had stayed with him a month’s time,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָבָן֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב הֲכִי־אָחִ֣י אַ֔תָּה וַעֲבַדְתַּ֖נִי חִנָּ֑ם הַגִּ֥ידָה לִּ֖י מַה־מַּשְׂכֻּרְתֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer lavan l'ya'akov hakhiy-achiy atah va'avad'taniy chinam hagiydah liy mah-mas'kur'tekha
translation: Laban said to Jacob, “Just because you are a kinsman, should you serve me for nothing? Tell me, what shall your wages be?”

hebrew: וּלְלָבָ֖ן שְׁתֵּ֣י בָנ֑וֹת שֵׁ֤ם הַגְּדֹלָה֙ לֵאָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַקְּטַנָּ֖ה רָחֵֽל׃
transliteration: vl'lavan sh'tey vanvot shem hag'dolah leah v'shem hak'tanah rachel
translation: Now Laban had two daughters; the name of the older one was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.

hebrew: וְעֵינֵ֥י לֵאָ֖ה רַכּ֑וֹת וְרָחֵל֙ הָֽיְתָ֔ה יְפַת־תֹּ֖אַר וִיפַ֥ת מַרְאֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'eyney leah rakvot v'rachel hay'tah y'fat-toar viyfat mar'eh
translation: Leah had weak eyes; Rachel was shapely and beautiful.

hebrew: וַיֶּאֱהַ֥ב יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־רָחֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֶֽעֱבָדְךָ֙ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֔ים בְּרָחֵ֥ל בִּתְּךָ֖ הַקְּטַנָּֽה׃
transliteration: vayeehav ya'akov et-rachel vayomer e'evad'kha sheva' shaniym b'rachel bit'kha hak'tanah
translation: Jacob loved Rachel; so he answered, “I will serve you seven years for your younger daughter Rachel.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָבָ֗ן ט֚וֹב תִּתִּ֣י אֹתָ֣הּ לָ֔ךְ מִתִּתִּ֥י אֹתָ֖הּ לְאִ֣ישׁ אַחֵ֑ר שְׁבָ֖ה עִמָּדִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer lavan tvov titiy otah lakh' mititiy otah l'iysh acher sh'vah 'imadiy
translation: Laban said, “Better that I give her to you than that I should give her to an outsider. Stay with me.”

hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֧ד יַעֲקֹ֛ב בְּרָחֵ֖ל שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֑ים וַיִּהְי֤וּ בְעֵינָיו֙ כְּיָמִ֣ים אֲחָדִ֔ים בְּאַהֲבָת֖וֹ אֹתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vaya'avod ya'akov b'rachel sheva' shaniym vayih'yv v'eynayv k'yamiym achadiym b'ahavatvo otah
translation: So Jacob served seven years for Rachel and they seemed to him but a few days because of his love for her.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֤ב אֶל־לָבָן֙ הָבָ֣ה אֶת־אִשְׁתִּ֔י כִּ֥י מָלְא֖וּ יָמָ֑י וְאָב֖וֹאָה אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov el-lavan havah et-ish'tiy kiy mal'v yamay v'avvoah eleyha
translation: Then Jacob said to Laban, “Give me my wife, for my time is fulfilled, that I may cohabit with her.”

hebrew: וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ף לָבָ֛ן אֶת־כָּל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י הַמָּק֖וֹם וַיַּ֥עַשׂ מִשְׁתֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayeesof lavan et-kal-an'shey hamakvom vaya'as mish'teh
translation: And Laban gathered all the people of the place and made a feast.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בָעֶ֔רֶב וַיִּקַּח֙ אֶת־לֵאָ֣ה בִתּ֔וֹ וַיָּבֵ֥א אֹתָ֖הּ אֵלָ֑יו וַיָּבֹ֖א אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy va'erev vayikach et-leah vitvo vayave otah elayv vayavo eleyha
translation: When evening came, he took his daughter Leah and brought her to him; and he cohabited with her.—

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן לָבָן֙ לָ֔הּ אֶת־זִלְפָּ֖ה שִׁפְחָת֑וֹ לְלֵאָ֥ה בִתּ֖וֹ שִׁפְחָֽה׃
transliteration: vayiten lavan lah et-zil'pah shif'chatvo l'leah vitvo shif'chah
translation: Laban had given his maidservant Zilpah to his daughter Leah as her maid.—

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בַבֹּ֔קֶר וְהִנֵּה־הִ֖וא לֵאָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־לָבָ֗ן מַה־זֹּאת֙ עָשִׂ֣יתָ לִּ֔י הֲלֹ֤א בְרָחֵל֙ עָבַ֣דְתִּי עִמָּ֔ךְ וְלָ֖מָּה רִמִּיתָֽנִי׃
transliteration: vay'hiy vaboker v'hineh-hiv leah vayomer el-lavan mah-zot 'asiyta liy halo v'rachel 'avad'tiy 'imakh' v'lamah rimiytaniy
translation: When morning came, there was Leah! So he said to Laban, “What is this you have done to me? I was in your service for Rachel! Why did you deceive me?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָבָ֔ן לֹא־יֵעָשֶׂ֥ה כֵ֖ן בִּמְקוֹמֵ֑נוּ לָתֵ֥ת הַצְּעִירָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י הַבְּכִירָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer lavan lo-ye'aseh khen bim'kvomenv latet hatz'iyrah lif'ney hab'khiyrah
translation: Laban said, “It is not the practice in our place to marry off the younger before the older.

hebrew: מַלֵּ֖א שְׁבֻ֣עַ זֹ֑את וְנִתְּנָ֨ה לְךָ֜ גַּם־אֶת־זֹ֗את בַּעֲבֹדָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲבֹ֣ד עִמָּדִ֔י ע֖וֹד שֶֽׁבַע־שָׁנִ֥ים אֲחֵרֽוֹת׃
transliteration: male sh'vu'a zot v'nit'nah l'kha gam-et-zot ba'avodah asher ta'avod 'imadiy 'vod sheva'-shaniym achervot
translation: Wait until the bridal week of this one is over and we will give you that one too, provided you serve me another seven years.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ יַעֲקֹב֙ כֵּ֔ן וַיְמַלֵּ֖א שְׁבֻ֣עַ זֹ֑את וַיִּתֶּן־ל֛וֹ אֶת־רָחֵ֥ל בִּתּ֖וֹ ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vaya'as ya'akov ken vay'male sh'vu'a zot vayiten-lvo et-rachel bitvo lvo l'ishah
translation: Jacob did so; he waited out the bridal week of the one, and then he gave him his daughter Rachel as wife.—

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן לָבָן֙ לְרָחֵ֣ל בִּתּ֔וֹ אֶת־בִּלְהָ֖ה שִׁפְחָת֑וֹ לָ֖הּ לְשִׁפְחָֽה׃
transliteration: vayiten lavan l'rachel bitvo et-bil'hah shif'chatvo lah l'shif'chah
translation: Laban had given his maidservant Bilhah to his daughter Rachel as her maid.—

hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ גַּ֣ם אֶל־רָחֵ֔ל וַיֶּאֱהַ֥ב גַּֽם־אֶת־רָחֵ֖ל מִלֵּאָ֑ה וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ד עִמּ֔וֹ ע֖וֹד שֶֽׁבַע־שָׁנִ֥ים אֲחֵרֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayavo gam el-rachel vayeehav gam-et-rachel mileah vaya'avod 'imvo 'vod sheva'-shaniym achervot
translation: And Jacob cohabited with Rachel also; indeed, he loved Rachel more than Leah. And he served him another seven years.

hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא יְהוָה֙ כִּֽי־שְׂנוּאָ֣ה לֵאָ֔ה וַיִּפְתַּ֖ח אֶת־רַחְמָ֑הּ וְרָחֵ֖ל עֲקָרָֽה׃
transliteration: vayar' y'hvah kiy-s'nvah leah vayif'tach et-rach'mah v'rachel 'akarah
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> saw that Leah was unloved and He opened her womb; but Rachel was barren.

hebrew: וַתַּ֤הַר לֵאָה֙ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ רְאוּבֵ֑ן כִּ֣י אָֽמְרָ֗ה כִּֽי־רָאָ֤ה יְהוָה֙ בְּעָנְיִ֔י כִּ֥י עַתָּ֖ה יֶאֱהָבַ֥נִי אִישִֽׁי׃
transliteration: vatahar leah vateled ben vatik'ra sh'mvo r'vven kiy am'rah kiy-raah y'hvah b'an'yiy kiy 'atah yeehavaniy iyshiy
translation: Leah conceived and bore a son, and named him Reuben;cUnderstood as “See a son.” for she declared, “It means: ‘The LORD has seendHeb. ra’ah, connected with the first part of “Reuben.” my affliction’; it also means: ‘Now my husband will love me.’”eHeb. ye’ehabani, connected with the last part of “Reuben.”

hebrew: וַתַּ֣הַר עוֹד֮ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּן֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֤ע יְהוָה֙ כִּֽי־שְׂנוּאָ֣ה אָנֹ֔כִי וַיִּתֶּן־לִ֖י גַּם־אֶת־זֶ֑ה וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ שִׁמְעֽוֹן׃
transliteration: vatahar 'vod vateled ben vatomer kiy-shama' y'hvah kiy-s'nvah anokhiy vayiten-liy gam-et-zeh vatik'ra sh'mvo shim'von
translation: She conceived again and bore a son, and declared, “This is because the LORD heardfHeb. shama‘, connected with “Simeon.” that I was unloved and has given me this one also”; so she named him Simeon.

hebrew: וַתַּ֣הַר עוֹד֮ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּן֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר עַתָּ֤ה הַפַּ֙עַם֙ יִלָּוֶ֤ה אִישִׁי֙ אֵלַ֔י כִּֽי־יָלַ֥דְתִּי ל֖וֹ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה בָנִ֑ים עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמ֖וֹ לֵוִֽי׃
transliteration: vatahar 'vod vateled ben vatomer 'atah hapa'am yilaveh iyshiy elay kiy-yalad'tiy lvo sh'loshah vaniym 'al-ken kara-sh'mvo leviy
translation: Again she conceived and bore a son and declared, “This time my husband will become attachedgHeb. yillaweh, connected with “Levi.” to me, for I have borne him three sons.” Therefore he was named Levi.

hebrew: וַתַּ֨הַר ע֜וֹד וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֗ן וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַפַּ֙עַם֙ אוֹדֶ֣ה אֶת־יְהוָ֔ה עַל־כֵּ֛ן קָרְאָ֥ה שְׁמ֖וֹ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֖ד מִלֶּֽדֶת׃
transliteration: vatahar 'vod vateled ben vatomer hapa'am vodeh et-y'hvah 'al-ken kar'ah sh'mvo y'hvdah vata'amod miledet
translation: She conceived again and bore a son, and declared, “This time I will praisehHeb. ’odeh, connected with “Judah.” the LORD.” Therefore she named him Judah. Then she stopped bearing.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֣רֶא רָחֵ֗ל כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָֽלְדָה֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב וַתְּקַנֵּ֥א רָחֵ֖ל בַּאֲחֹתָ֑הּ וַתֹּ֤אמֶר אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹב֙ הָֽבָה־לִּ֣י בָנִ֔ים וְאִם־אַ֖יִן מֵתָ֥ה אָנֹֽכִי׃
transliteration: vatere rachel kiy lo yal'dah l'ya'akov vat'kane rachel baachotah vatomer el-ya'akov havah-liy vaniym v'im-ayin metah anokhiy
translation: When Rachel saw that she had borne Jacob no children, she became envious of her sister; and Rachel said to Jacob, “Give me children, or I shall die.”

hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יַעֲקֹ֖ב בְּרָחֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֲתַ֤חַת אֱלֹהִים֙ אָנֹ֔כִי אֲשֶׁר־מָנַ֥ע מִמֵּ֖ךְ פְּרִי־בָֽטֶן׃
transliteration: vayichar-af ya'akov b'rachel vayomer hatachat elohiym anokhiy asher-mana' mimekh' p'riy-vaten
translation: Jacob was incensed at Rachel, and said, “Can I take the place of God, who has denied you fruit of the womb?”

hebrew: וַתֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּ֛ה אֲמָתִ֥י בִלְהָ֖ה בֹּ֣א אֵלֶ֑יהָ וְתֵלֵד֙ עַל־בִּרְכַּ֔י וְאִבָּנֶ֥ה גַם־אָנֹכִ֖י מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
transliteration: vatomer hineh amatiy vil'hah bo eleyha v'teled 'al-bir'kay v'ibaneh gam-anokhiy mimenah
translation: She said, “Here is my maid Bilhah. Consort with her, that she may bear on my knees and that through her I too may have children.”

hebrew: וַתִּתֶּן־ל֛וֹ אֶת־בִּלְהָ֥ה שִׁפְחָתָ֖הּ לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיָּבֹ֥א אֵלֶ֖יהָ יַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: vatiten-lvo et-bil'hah shif'chatah l'ishah vayavo eleyha ya'akov
translation: So she gave him her maid Bilhah as concubine, and Jacob cohabited with her.

hebrew: וַתַּ֣הַר בִּלְהָ֔ה וַתֵּ֥לֶד לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב בֵּֽן׃
transliteration: vatahar bil'hah vateled l'ya'akov ben
translation: Bilhah conceived and bore Jacob a son.

hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר רָחֵל֙ דָּנַ֣נִּי אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְגַם֙ שָׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹלִ֔י וַיִּתֶּן־לִ֖י בֵּ֑ן עַל־כֵּ֛ן קָרְאָ֥ה שְׁמ֖וֹ דָּֽן׃
transliteration: vatomer rachel dananiy elohiym v'gam shama' b'koliy vayiten-liy ben 'al-ken kar'ah sh'mvo dan
translation: And Rachel said, “God has vindicated me;aHeb. dananni, connected with “Dan.” indeed, He has heeded my plea and given me a son.” Therefore she named him Dan.

hebrew: וַתַּ֣הַר ע֔וֹד וַתֵּ֕לֶד בִּלְהָ֖ה שִׁפְחַ֣ת רָחֵ֑ל בֵּ֥ן שֵׁנִ֖י לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: vatahar 'vod vateled bil'hah shif'chat rachel ben sheniy l'ya'akov
translation: Rachel’s maid Bilhah conceived again and bore Jacob a second son.

hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר רָחֵ֗ל נַפְתּוּלֵ֨י אֱלֹהִ֧ים ׀ נִפְתַּ֛לְתִּי עִם־אֲחֹתִ֖י גַּם־יָכֹ֑לְתִּי וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ נַפְתָּלִֽי׃
transliteration: vatomer rachel naf'tvley elohiym  nif'tal'tiy 'im-achotiy gam-yakhol'tiy vatik'ra sh'mvo naf'taliy
translation: And Rachel said, bHeb. naphtule … naphtalti, connected with “Naphtali.” Lit. “A contest of God …”“A fateful contest I waged-b with my sister; yes, and I have prevailed.” So she named him Naphtali.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֣רֶא לֵאָ֔ה כִּ֥י עָמְדָ֖ה מִלֶּ֑דֶת וַתִּקַּח֙ אֶת־זִלְפָּ֣ה שִׁפְחָתָ֔הּ וַתִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛הּ לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vatere leah kiy 'am'dah miledet vatikach et-zil'pah shif'chatah vatiten otah l'ya'akov l'ishah
translation: When Leah saw that she had stopped bearing, she took her maid Zilpah and gave her to Jacob as concubine.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֗לֶד זִלְפָּ֛ה שִׁפְחַ֥ת לֵאָ֖ה לְיַעֲקֹ֥ב בֵּֽן׃
transliteration: vateled zil'pah shif'chat leah l'ya'akov ben
translation: And when Leah’s maid Zilpah bore Jacob a son,

hebrew: וַתֹּ֥אמֶר לֵאָ֖ה בגד [בָּ֣א] [גָ֑ד] וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ גָּֽד׃
transliteration: vatomer leah vgd [ba] [gad] vatik'ra et-sh'mvo gad
translation: Leah said, “What luck!”cKethib begad; the qere reads ba gad “luck has come”; connected with “Gad.” So she named him Gad.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֗לֶד זִלְפָּה֙ שִׁפְחַ֣ת לֵאָ֔ה בֵּ֥ן שֵׁנִ֖י לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: vateled zil'pah shif'chat leah ben sheniy l'ya'akov
translation: When Leah’s maid Zilpah bore Jacob a second son,

hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לֵאָ֔ה בְּאָשְׁרִ֕י כִּ֥י אִשְּׁר֖וּנִי בָּנ֑וֹת וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ אָשֵֽׁר׃
transliteration: vatomer leah b'ash'riy kiy ish'rvniy banvot vatik'ra et-sh'mvo asher
translation: Leah declared, “What fortune!”dHeb. be’oshri, connected with “Asher.” meaning, “Women will deem me fortunate.” So she named him Asher.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ רְאוּבֵ֜ן בִּימֵ֣י קְצִיר־חִטִּ֗ים וַיִּמְצָ֤א דֽוּדָאִים֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה וַיָּבֵ֣א אֹתָ֔ם אֶל־לֵאָ֖ה אִמּ֑וֹ וַתֹּ֤אמֶר רָחֵל֙ אֶל־לֵאָ֔ה תְּנִי־נָ֣א לִ֔י מִדּוּדָאֵ֖י בְּנֵֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayelekh' r'vven biymey k'tziyr-chitiym vayim'tza dvdaiym basadeh vayave otam el-leah imvo vatomer rachel el-leah t'niy-na liy midvdaey b'nekh'
translation: Once, at the time of the wheat harvest, Reuben came upon some mandrakes in the field and brought them to his mother Leah. Rachel said to Leah, “Please give me some of your son’s mandrakes.”

hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לָ֗הּ הַמְעַט֙ קַחְתֵּ֣ךְ אֶת־אִישִׁ֔י וְלָקַ֕חַת גַּ֥ם אֶת־דּוּדָאֵ֖י בְּנִ֑י וַתֹּ֣אמֶר רָחֵ֗ל לָכֵן֙ יִשְׁכַּ֤ב עִמָּךְ֙ הַלַּ֔יְלָה תַּ֖חַת דּוּדָאֵ֥י בְנֵֽךְ׃
transliteration: vatomer lah ham'at kach'tekh' et-iyshiy v'lakachat gam et-dvdaey b'niy vatomer rachel lakhen yish'kav 'imakh' halay'lah tachat dvdaey v'nekh'
translation: But she said to her, “Was it not enough for you to take away my husband, that you would also take my son’s mandrakes?” Rachel replied, “I promise, he shall lie with you tonight, in return for your son’s mandrakes.”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א יַעֲקֹ֣ב מִן־הַשָּׂדֶה֮ בָּעֶרֶב֒ וַתֵּצֵ֨א לֵאָ֜ה לִקְרָאת֗וֹ וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֵלַ֣י תָּב֔וֹא כִּ֚י שָׂכֹ֣ר שְׂכַרְתִּ֔יךָ בְּדוּדָאֵ֖י בְּנִ֑י וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב עִמָּ֖הּ בַּלַּ֥יְלָה הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vayavo ya'akov min-hasadeh ba'erev vatetze leah lik'ratvo vatomer elay tavvo kiy sakhor s'khar'tiykha b'dvdaey b'niy vayish'kav 'imah balay'lah hv
translation: When Jacob came home from the field in the evening, Leah went out to meet him and said, “You are to sleep with me, for I have hired you with my son’s mandrakes.” And he lay with her that night.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־לֵאָ֑ה וַתַּ֛הַר וַתֵּ֥לֶד לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב בֵּ֥ן חֲמִישִֽׁי׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' elohiym el-leah vatahar vateled l'ya'akov ben chamiyshiy
translation: God heeded Leah, and she conceived and bore him a fifth son.

hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לֵאָ֗ה נָתַ֤ן אֱלֹהִים֙ שְׂכָרִ֔י אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תִּי שִׁפְחָתִ֖י לְאִישִׁ֑י וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יִשָּׂשכָֽר׃
transliteration: vatomer leah natan elohiym s'khariy asher-natatiy shif'chatiy l'iyshiy vatik'ra sh'mvo yisashkhar
translation: And Leah said, “God has given me my rewardeHeb. sekhari, connected with “Issachar.” for having given my maid to my husband.” So she named him Issachar.

hebrew: וַתַּ֤הַר עוֹד֙ לֵאָ֔ה וַתֵּ֥לֶד בֵּן־שִׁשִּׁ֖י לְּיַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: vatahar 'vod leah vateled ben-shishiy l'ya'akov
translation: When Leah conceived again and bore Jacob a sixth son,

hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לֵאָ֗ה זְבָדַ֨נִי אֱלֹהִ֥ים ׀ אֹתִי֮ זֵ֣בֶד טוֹב֒ הַפַּ֙עַם֙ יִזְבְּלֵ֣נִי אִישִׁ֔י כִּֽי־יָלַ֥דְתִּי ל֖וֹ שִׁשָּׁ֣ה בָנִ֑ים וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ זְבֻלֽוּן׃
