transliteration: vatomer leah z'vadaniy elohiym  otiy zeved tvov hapa'am yiz'b'leniy iyshiy kiy-yalad'tiy lvo shishah vaniym vatik'ra et-sh'mvo z'vulvn
translation: Leah said, “God has given me a choice gift;fHeb. zebadani … zebed. this time my husband will exalt me,gHeb. yizbeleni; others “will dwell with me.” for I have borne him six sons.” So she named him Zebulun.

hebrew: וְאַחַ֖ר יָ֣לְדָה בַּ֑ת וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמָ֖הּ דִּינָֽה׃
transliteration: v'achar yal'dah bat vatik'ra et-sh'mah diynah
translation: Last, she bore him a daughter, and named her Dinah.

hebrew: וַיִּזְכֹּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־רָחֵ֑ל וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ אֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיִּפְתַּ֖ח אֶת־רַחְמָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayiz'kor elohiym et-rachel vayish'ma' eleyha elohiym vayif'tach et-rach'mah
translation: Now God remembered Rachel; God heeded her and opened her womb.

hebrew: וַתַּ֖הַר וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַתֹּ֕אמֶר אָסַ֥ף אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־חֶרְפָּתִֽי׃
transliteration: vatahar vateled ben vatomer asaf elohiym et-cher'patiy
translation: She conceived and bore a son, and said, “God has taken awayhHeb. ‘asaph. my disgrace.”

hebrew: וַתִּקְרָ֧א אֶת־שְׁמ֛וֹ יוֹסֵ֖ף לֵאמֹ֑ר יֹסֵ֧ף יְהוָ֛ה לִ֖י בֵּ֥ן אַחֵֽר׃
transliteration: vatik'ra et-sh'mvo yvosef lemor yosef y'hvah liy ben acher
translation: So she named him Joseph, which is to say, “May the LORD addiHeb. yoseph. another son for me.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יָלְדָ֥ה רָחֵ֖ל אֶת־יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ אֶל־לָבָ֔ן שַׁלְּחֵ֙נִי֙ וְאֵ֣לְכָ֔ה אֶל־מְקוֹמִ֖י וּלְאַרְצִֽי׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kaasher yal'dah rachel et-yvosef vayomer ya'akov el-lavan shal'cheniy v'el'khah el-m'kvomiy vl'ar'tziy
translation: After Rachel had borne Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, “Give me leave to go back to my own homeland.

hebrew: תְּנָ֞ה אֶת־נָשַׁ֣י וְאֶת־יְלָדַ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָבַ֧דְתִּי אֹֽתְךָ֛ בָּהֵ֖ן וְאֵלֵ֑כָה כִּ֚י אַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתָּ אֶת־עֲבֹדָתִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲבַדְתִּֽיךָ׃
transliteration: t'nah et-nashay v'et-y'laday asher 'avad'tiy ot'kha bahen v'elekhah kiy atah yada'ta et-'avodatiy asher 'avad'tiykha
translation: Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have served you, that I may go; for well you know what services I have rendered you.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ לָבָ֔ן אִם־נָ֛א מָצָ֥אתִי חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ נִחַ֕שְׁתִּי וַיְבָרֲכֵ֥נִי יְהוָ֖ה בִּגְלָלֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv lavan im-na matzatiy chen b'eyneykha nichash'tiy vay'varakheniy y'hvah big'lalekha
translation: But Laban said to him, “If you will indulge me,jLit. “If I have found favor in your eyes.” I have learned by divination that the LORD has blessed me on your account.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר נָקְבָ֧ה שְׂכָרְךָ֛ עָלַ֖י וְאֶתֵּֽנָה׃
transliteration: vayomar nak'vah s'khar'kha 'alay v'etenah
translation: And he continued, “Name the wages due from me, and I will pay you.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו אַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתָּ אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲבַדְתִּ֑יךָ וְאֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה מִקְנְךָ֖ אִתִּֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv atah yada'ta et asher 'avad'tiykha v'et asher-hayah mik'n'kha itiy
translation: But he said, “You know well how I have served you and how your livestock has fared with me.

hebrew: כִּ֡י מְעַט֩ אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֨ה לְךָ֤ לְפָנַי֙ וַיִּפְרֹ֣ץ לָרֹ֔ב וַיְבָ֧רֶךְ יְהוָ֛ה אֹתְךָ֖ לְרַגְלִ֑י וְעַתָּ֗ה מָתַ֛י אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה גַם־אָנֹכִ֖י לְבֵיתִֽי׃
transliteration: kiy m'at asher-hayah l'kha l'fanay vayif'rotz larov vay'varekh' y'hvah ot'kha l'rag'liy v'atah matay e'eseh gam-anokhiy l'veytiy
translation: For the little you had before I came has grown to much, since the L<small>ORD</small> has blessed you wherever I turned. And now, when shall I make provision for my own household?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מָ֣ה אֶתֶּן־לָ֑ךְ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ לֹא־תִתֶּן־לִ֣י מְא֔וּמָה אִם־תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לִּי֙ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה אָשׁ֛וּבָה אֶרְעֶ֥ה צֹֽאנְךָ֖ אֶשְׁמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer mah eten-lakh' vayomer ya'akov lo-titen-liy m'vmah im-ta'aseh-liy hadavar hazeh ashvvah er'eh tzon'kha esh'mor
translation: He said, “What shall I pay you?” And Jacob said, “Pay me nothing! If you will do this thing for me, I will again pasture and keep your flocks:

hebrew: אֶֽעֱבֹ֨ר בְּכָל־צֹֽאנְךָ֜ הַיּ֗וֹם הָסֵ֨ר מִשָּׁ֜ם כָּל־שֶׂ֣ה ׀ נָקֹ֣ד וְטָל֗וּא וְכָל־שֶׂה־חוּם֙ בַּכְּשָׂבִ֔ים וְטָל֥וּא וְנָקֹ֖ד בָּעִזִּ֑ים וְהָיָ֖ה שְׂכָרִֽי׃
transliteration: e'evor b'khal-tzon'kha hayvom haser misham kal-seh  nakod v'talv v'khal-seh-chvm bak'saviym v'talv v'nakod ba'iziym v'hayah s'khariy
translation: let me pass through your whole flock today, removing from there every speckled and spotted animal—every dark-colored sheep and every spotted and speckled goat. Such shall be my wages.

hebrew: וְעָֽנְתָה־בִּ֤י צִדְקָתִי֙ בְּי֣וֹם מָחָ֔ר כִּֽי־תָב֥וֹא עַל־שְׂכָרִ֖י לְפָנֶ֑יךָ כֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־אֵינֶנּוּ֩ נָקֹ֨ד וְטָל֜וּא בָּֽעִזִּ֗ים וְחוּם֙ בַּכְּשָׂבִ֔ים גָּנ֥וּב ה֖וּא אִתִּֽי׃
transliteration: v'an'tah-biy tzid'katiy b'yvom machar kiy-tavvo 'al-s'khariy l'faneykha kol asher-eynenv nakod v'talv ba'iziym v'chvm bak'saviym ganvv hv itiy
translation: In the future when you go over my wages, let my honesty toward you testify for me: if there are among my goats any that are not speckled or spotted or any sheep that are not dark-colored, they got there by theft.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָבָ֖ן הֵ֑ן ל֖וּ יְהִ֥י כִדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer lavan hen lv y'hiy khid'varekha
translation: And Laban said, “Very well, let it be as you say.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֣סַר בַּיּוֹם֩ הַה֨וּא אֶת־הַתְּיָשִׁ֜ים הָֽעֲקֻדִּ֣ים וְהַטְּלֻאִ֗ים וְאֵ֤ת כָּל־הָֽעִזִּים֙ הַנְּקֻדּ֣וֹת וְהַטְּלֻאֹ֔ת כֹּ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־לָבָן֙ בּ֔וֹ וְכָל־ח֖וּם בַּכְּשָׂבִ֑ים וַיִּתֵּ֖ן בְּיַד־בָּנָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayasar bayvom hahv et-hat'yashiym ha'akudiym v'hat'luiym v'et kal-ha'iziym han'kudvot v'hat'luot kol asher-lavan bvo v'khal-chvm bak'saviym vayiten b'yad-banayv
translation: But that same day he removed the streaked and spotted he-goats and all the speckled and spotted she-goats—every one that had white on it—and all the dark-colored sheep, and left them in the charge of his sons.

hebrew: וַיָּ֗שֶׂם דֶּ֚רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים בֵּינ֖וֹ וּבֵ֣ין יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְיַעֲקֹ֗ב רֹעֶ֛ה אֶת־צֹ֥אן לָבָ֖ן הַנּוֹתָרֹֽת׃
transliteration: vayasem derekh' sh'loshet yamiym beynvo vveyn ya'akov v'ya'akov ro'eh et-tzon lavan hanvotarot
translation: And he put a distance of three days’ journey between himself and Jacob, while Jacob was pasturing the rest of Laban’s flock.

hebrew: וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֣וֹ יַעֲקֹ֗ב מַקַּ֥ל לִבְנֶ֛ה לַ֖ח וְל֣וּז וְעֶרְמ֑וֹן וַיְפַצֵּ֤ל בָּהֵן֙ פְּצָל֣וֹת לְבָנ֔וֹת מַחְשֹׂף֙ הַלָּבָ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַמַּקְלֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayikach-lvo ya'akov makal liv'neh lach v'lvz v'er'mvon vay'fatzel bahen p'tzalvot l'vanvot mach'sof halavan asher 'al-hamak'lvot
translation: Jacob then got fresh shoots of poplar, and of almond and plane, and peeled white stripes in them, laying bare the white of the shoots.

hebrew: וַיַּצֵּ֗ג אֶת־הַמַּקְלוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר פִּצֵּ֔ל בָּרֳהָטִ֖ים בְּשִֽׁקֲת֣וֹת הַמָּ֑יִם אֲשֶׁר֩ תָּבֹ֨אןָ הַצֹּ֤אן לִשְׁתּוֹת֙ לְנֹ֣כַח הַצֹּ֔אן וַיֵּחַ֖מְנָה בְּבֹאָ֥ן לִשְׁתּֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayatzeg et-hamak'lvot asher pitzel barohatiym b'shikatvot hamayim asher tavona hatzon lish'tvot l'nokhach hatzon vayecham'nah b'voan lish'tvot
translation: The rods that he had peeled he set up in front of the goatskLit. “flocks.” in the troughs, the water receptacles, that the goats came to drink from. Their mating occurred when they came to drink,

hebrew: וַיֶּחֱמ֥וּ הַצֹּ֖אן אֶל־הַמַּקְל֑וֹת וַתֵּלַ֣דְןָ הַצֹּ֔אן עֲקֻדִּ֥ים נְקֻדִּ֖ים וּטְלֻאִֽים׃
transliteration: vayechemv hatzon el-hamak'lvot vatelad'na hatzon 'akudiym n'kudiym vt'luiym
translation: and since the goats mated by the rods, the goats brought forth streaked, speckled, and spotted young.

hebrew: וְהַכְּשָׂבִים֮ הִפְרִ֣יד יַעֲקֹב֒ וַ֠יִּתֵּן פְּנֵ֨י הַצֹּ֧אן אֶל־עָקֹ֛ד וְכָל־ח֖וּם בְּצֹ֣אן לָבָ֑ן וַיָּֽשֶׁת־ל֤וֹ עֲדָרִים֙ לְבַדּ֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א שָׁתָ֖ם עַל־צֹ֥אן לָבָֽן׃
transliteration: v'hak'saviym hif'riyd ya'akov vayiten p'ney hatzon el-'akod v'khal-chvm b'tzon lavan vayashet-lvo 'adariym l'vadvo v'lo shatam 'al-tzon lavan
translation: But Jacob dealt separately with the sheep; he made these animals face the streaked or wholly dark-colored animals in Laban’s flock. And so he produced special flocks for himself, which he did not put with Laban’s flocks.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה בְּכָל־יַחֵם֮ הַצֹּ֣אן הַמְקֻשָּׁרוֹת֒ וְשָׂ֨ם יַעֲקֹ֧ב אֶת־הַמַּקְל֛וֹת לְעֵינֵ֥י הַצֹּ֖אן בָּרֳהָטִ֑ים לְיַחְמֵ֖נָּה בַּמַּקְלֽוֹת׃
transliteration: v'hayah b'khal-yachem hatzon ham'kusharvot v'sam ya'akov et-hamak'lvot l'eyney hatzon barohatiym l'yach'menah bamak'lvot
translation: Moreover, when the sturdierlOr “early-breeding.” animals were mating, Jacob would place the rods in the troughs, in full view of the animals, so that they mated by the rods;

hebrew: וּבְהַעֲטִ֥יף הַצֹּ֖אן לֹ֣א יָשִׂ֑ים וְהָיָ֤ה הָעֲטֻפִים֙ לְלָבָ֔ן וְהַקְּשֻׁרִ֖ים לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: vv'ha'atiyf hatzon lo yasiym v'hayah ha'atufiym l'lavan v'hak'shuriym l'ya'akov
translation: but with the feeblermOr “late-breeding.” animals he would not place them there. Thus the feeble ones-m went to Laban and the sturdy to Jacob.

hebrew: וַיִּפְרֹ֥ץ הָאִ֖ישׁ מְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד וַֽיְהִי־לוֹ֙ צֹ֣אן רַבּ֔וֹת וּשְׁפָחוֹת֙ וַעֲבָדִ֔ים וּגְמַלִּ֖ים וַחֲמֹרִֽים׃
transliteration: vayif'rotz haiysh m'od m'od vay'hiy-lvo tzon rabvot vsh'fachvot va'avadiym vg'maliym vachamoriym
translation: So the man grew exceedingly prosperous, and came to own large flocks, maidservants and menservants, camels and asses.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֗ע אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֤י בְנֵֽי־לָבָן֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לָקַ֣ח יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֵ֖ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאָבִ֑ינוּ וּמֵאֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאָבִ֔ינוּ עָשָׂ֕ה אֵ֥ת כָּל־הַכָּבֹ֖ד הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' et-div'rey v'ney-lavan lemor lakach ya'akov et kal-asher l'aviynv vmeasher l'aviynv 'asah et kal-hakavod hazeh
translation: Now he heard the things that Laban’s sons were saying: “Jacob has taken all that was our father’s, and from that which was our father’s he has built up all this wealth.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י לָבָ֑ן וְהִנֵּ֥ה אֵינֶ֛נּוּ עִמּ֖וֹ כִּתְמ֥וֹל שִׁלְשֽׁוֹם׃
transliteration: vayar' ya'akov et-p'ney lavan v'hineh eynenv 'imvo kit'mvol shil'shvom
translation: Jacob also saw that Laban’s manner toward him was not as it had been in the past.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֔ב שׁ֛וּב אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ אֲבוֹתֶ֖יךָ וּלְמוֹלַדְתֶּ֑ךָ וְאֶֽהְיֶ֖ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-ya'akov shvv el-eretz avvoteykha vl'mvolad'tekha v'eh'yeh 'imakh'
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Jacob, “Return to the land of your fathers where you were born, and I will be with you.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח יַעֲקֹ֔ב וַיִּקְרָ֖א לְרָחֵ֣ל וּלְלֵאָ֑ה הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה אֶל־צֹאנֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayish'lach ya'akov vayik'ra l'rachel vl'leah hasadeh el-tzonvo
translation: Jacob had Rachel and Leah called to the field, where his flock was,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ן רֹאֶ֤ה אָנֹכִי֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י אֲבִיכֶ֔ן כִּֽי־אֵינֶ֥נּוּ אֵלַ֖י כִּתְמֹ֣ל שִׁלְשֹׁ֑ם וֵֽאלֹהֵ֣י אָבִ֔י הָיָ֖ה עִמָּדִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer lahen roeh anokhiy et-p'ney aviykhen kiy-eynenv elay kit'mol shil'shom velohey aviy hayah 'imadiy
translation: and said to them, “I see that your father’s manner toward me is not as it has been in the past. But the God of my father has been with me.

hebrew: וְאַתֵּ֖נָה יְדַעְתֶּ֑ן כִּ֚י בְּכָל־כֹּחִ֔י עָבַ֖דְתִּי אֶת־אֲבִיכֶֽן׃
transliteration: v'atenah y'da'ten kiy b'khal-kochiy 'avad'tiy et-aviykhen
translation: As you know, I have served your father with all my might;

hebrew: וַאֲבִיכֶן֙ הֵ֣תֶל בִּ֔י וְהֶחֱלִ֥ף אֶת־מַשְׂכֻּרְתִּ֖י עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת מֹנִ֑ים וְלֹֽא־נְתָנ֣וֹ אֱלֹהִ֔ים לְהָרַ֖ע עִמָּדִֽי׃
transliteration: vaaviykhen hetel biy v'hechelif et-mas'kur'tiy 'aseret moniym v'lo-n'tanvo elohiym l'hara' 'imadiy
translation: but your father has cheated me, changing my wages time and again.aLit. “ten times.” God, however, would not let him do me harm.

hebrew: אִם־כֹּ֣ה יֹאמַ֗ר נְקֻדִּים֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה שְׂכָרֶ֔ךָ וְיָלְד֥וּ כָל־הַצֹּ֖אן נְקֻדִּ֑ים וְאִם־כֹּ֣ה יֹאמַ֗ר עֲקֻדִּים֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה שְׂכָרֶ֔ךָ וְיָלְד֥וּ כָל־הַצֹּ֖אן עֲקֻדִּֽים׃
transliteration: im-koh yomar n'kudiym yih'yeh s'kharekha v'yal'dv khal-hatzon n'kudiym v'im-koh yomar 'akudiym yih'yeh s'kharekha v'yal'dv khal-hatzon 'akudiym
translation: If he said thus, ‘The speckled shall be your wages,’ then all the flocks would drop speckled young; and if he said thus, ‘The streaked shall be your wages,’ then all the flocks would drop streaked young.

hebrew: וַיַּצֵּ֧ל אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־מִקְנֵ֥ה אֲבִיכֶ֖ם וַיִּתֶּן־לִֽי׃
transliteration: vayatzel elohiym et-mik'neh aviykhem vayiten-liy
translation: God has taken away your father’s livestock and given it to me.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּעֵת֙ יַחֵ֣ם הַצֹּ֔אן וָאֶשָּׂ֥א עֵינַ֛י וָאֵ֖רֶא בַּחֲל֑וֹם וְהִנֵּ֤ה הָֽעַתֻּדִים֙ הָעֹלִ֣ים עַל־הַצֹּ֔אן עֲקֻדִּ֥ים נְקֻדִּ֖ים וּבְרֻדִּֽים׃
transliteration: vay'hiy b'et yachem hatzon vaesa 'eynay vaere bachalvom v'hineh ha'atudiym ha'oliym 'al-hatzon 'akudiym n'kudiym vv'rudiym
translation: “Once, at the mating time of the flocks, bLit. “I raised my eyes and saw in a dream, behold.”I had a dream in which I saw-b that the he-goats mating with the flock were streaked, speckled, and mottled.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלַ֜י מַלְאַ֧ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים בַּחֲל֖וֹם יַֽעֲקֹ֑ב וָאֹמַ֖ר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayomer elay mal'akh' haelohiym bachalvom ya'akov vaomar hineniy
translation: And in the dream an angel of God said to me, ‘Jacob!’ ‘Here,’ I answered.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר שָׂא־נָ֨א עֵינֶ֤יךָ וּרְאֵה֙ כָּל־הָֽעַתֻּדִים֙ הָעֹלִ֣ים עַל־הַצֹּ֔אן עֲקֻדִּ֥ים נְקֻדִּ֖ים וּבְרֻדִּ֑ים כִּ֣י רָאִ֔יתִי אֵ֛ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָבָ֖ן עֹ֥שֶׂה לָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer sa-na 'eyneykha vr'eh kal-ha'atudiym ha'oliym 'al-hatzon 'akudiym n'kudiym vv'rudiym kiy raiytiy et kal-asher lavan 'oseh lakh'
translation: And he said, ‘Note well that all the he-goats which are mating with the flock are streaked, speckled, and mottled; for I have noted all that Laban has been doing to you.

hebrew: אָנֹכִ֤י הָאֵל֙ בֵּֽית־אֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר מָשַׁ֤חְתָּ שָּׁם֙ מַצֵּבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָדַ֥רְתָּ לִּ֛י שָׁ֖ם נֶ֑דֶר עַתָּ֗ה ק֥וּם צֵא֙ מִן־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את וְשׁ֖וּב אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ מוֹלַדְתֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: anokhiy hael beyt-el asher mashach'ta sham matzevah asher nadar'ta liy sham neder 'atah kvm tze min-haaretz hazot v'shvv el-eretz mvolad'tekha
translation: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed a pillar and where you made a vow to Me. Now, arise and leave this land and return to your native land.’”

hebrew: וַתַּ֤עַן רָחֵל֙ וְלֵאָ֔ה וַתֹּאמַ֖רְנָה ל֑וֹ הַע֥וֹד לָ֛נוּ חֵ֥לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֖ה בְּבֵ֥ית אָבִֽינוּ׃
transliteration: vata'an rachel v'leah vatomar'nah lvo ha'vod lanv chelek v'nachalah b'veyt aviynv
translation: Then Rachel and Leah answered him, saying, “Have we still a share in the inheritance of our father’s house?

hebrew: הֲל֧וֹא נָכְרִיּ֛וֹת נֶחְשַׁ֥בְנוּ ל֖וֹ כִּ֣י מְכָרָ֑נוּ וַיֹּ֥אכַל גַּם־אָכ֖וֹל אֶת־כַּסְפֵּֽנוּ׃
transliteration: halvo nakh'riyvot nech'shav'nv lvo kiy m'kharanv vayokhal gam-akhvol et-kas'penv
translation: Surely, he regards us as outsiders, now that he has sold us and has used up our purchase price.

hebrew: כִּ֣י כָל־הָעֹ֗שֶׁר אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִצִּ֤יל אֱלֹהִים֙ מֵֽאָבִ֔ינוּ לָ֥נוּ ה֖וּא וּלְבָנֵ֑ינוּ וְעַתָּ֗ה כֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמַ֧ר אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֵלֶ֖יךָ עֲשֵֽׂה׃
transliteration: kiy khal-ha'osher asher hitziyl elohiym meaviynv lanv hv vl'vaneynv v'atah kol asher amar elohiym eleykha 'aseh
translation: Truly, all the wealth that God has taken away from our father belongs to us and to our children. Now then, do just as God has told you.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֖קָם יַעֲקֹ֑ב וַיִּשָּׂ֛א אֶת־בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶת־נָשָׁ֖יו עַל־הַגְּמַלִּֽים׃
transliteration: vayakam ya'akov vayisa et-banayv v'et-nashayv 'al-hag'maliym
translation: Thereupon Jacob put his children and wives on camels;

hebrew: וַיִּנְהַ֣ג אֶת־כָּל־מִקְנֵ֗הוּ וְאֶת־כָּל־רְכֻשׁוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָכָ֔שׁ מִקְנֵה֙ קִנְיָנ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָכַ֖שׁ בְּפַדַּ֣ן אֲרָ֑ם לָב֛וֹא אֶל־יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו אַ֥רְצָה כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: vayin'hag et-kal-mik'nehv v'et-kal-r'khushvo asher rakhash mik'neh kin'yanvo asher rakhash b'fadan aram lavvo el-yitz'chak aviyv ar'tzah k'na'an
translation: and he drove off all his livestock and all the wealth that he had amassed, the livestock in his possession that he had acquired in Paddan-aram, to go to his father Isaac in the land of Canaan.

hebrew: וְלָבָ֣ן הָלַ֔ךְ לִגְזֹ֖ז אֶת־צֹאנ֑וֹ וַתִּגְנֹ֣ב רָחֵ֔ל אֶת־הַתְּרָפִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְאָבִֽיהָ׃
transliteration: v'lavan halakh' lig'zoz et-tzonvo vatig'nov rachel et-hat'rafiym asher l'aviyha
translation: Meanwhile Laban had gone to shear his sheep, and Rachel stole her father’s household idols.

hebrew: וַיִּגְנֹ֣ב יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֶת־לֵ֥ב לָבָ֖ן הָאֲרַמִּ֑י עַל־בְּלִי֙ הִגִּ֣יד ל֔וֹ כִּ֥י בֹרֵ֖חַ הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vayig'nov ya'akov et-lev lavan haaramiy 'al-b'liy higiyd lvo kiy vorecha hv
translation: Jacob cLit. “stole the mind of Laban the Aramean”; similarly in v. 26.kept Laban the Aramean in the dark,-c not telling him that he was fleeing,

hebrew: וַיִּבְרַ֥ח הוּא֙ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וַיָּ֖קָם וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ר אֶת־הַנָּהָ֑ר וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־פָּנָ֖יו הַ֥ר הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
transliteration: vayiv'rach hv v'khal-asher-lvo vayakam vaya'avor et-hanahar vayasem et-panayv har hagil'ad
translation: and fled with all that he had. Soon he was across the Euphrates and heading toward the hill country of Gilead.

hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֥ד לְלָבָ֖ן בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י כִּ֥י בָרַ֖ח יַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: vayugad l'lavan bayvom hash'liyshiy kiy varach ya'akov
translation: On the third day, Laban was told that Jacob had fled.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֶת־אֶחָיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וַיִּרְדֹּ֣ף אַחֲרָ֔יו דֶּ֖רֶךְ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים וַיַּדְבֵּ֥ק אֹת֖וֹ בְּהַ֥ר הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
transliteration: vayikach et-echayv 'imvo vayir'dof acharayv derekh' shiv'at yamiym vayad'bek otvo b'har hagil'ad
translation: So he took his kinsmen with him and pursued him a distance of seven days, catching up with him in the hill country of Gilead.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֧א אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶל־לָבָ֥ן הָאֲרַמִּ֖י בַּחֲלֹ֣ם הַלָּ֑יְלָה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ הִשָּׁ֧מֶר לְךָ֛ פֶּן־תְּדַבֵּ֥ר עִֽם־יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִטּ֥וֹב עַד־רָֽע׃
transliteration: vayavo elohiym el-lavan haaramiy bachalom halay'lah vayomer lvo hishamer l'kha pen-t'daber 'im-ya'akov mitvov 'ad-ra'
translation: But God appeared to Laban the Aramean in a dream by night and said to him, “Beware of attempting anything with Jacob, good or bad.”

hebrew: וַיַּשֵּׂ֥ג לָבָ֖ן אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְיַעֲקֹ֗ב תָּקַ֤ע אֶֽת־אָהֳלוֹ֙ בָּהָ֔ר וְלָבָ֛ן תָּקַ֥ע אֶת־אֶחָ֖יו בְּהַ֥ר הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
transliteration: vayaseg lavan et-ya'akov v'ya'akov taka' et-aholvo bahar v'lavan taka' et-echayv b'har hagil'ad
translation: Laban overtook Jacob. Jacob had pitched his tent on the Height, and Laban with his kinsmen encamped in the hill country of Gilead.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָבָן֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֔יתָ וַתִּגְנֹ֖ב אֶת־לְבָבִ֑י וַתְּנַהֵג֙ אֶת־בְּנֹתַ֔י כִּשְׁבֻי֖וֹת חָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: vayomer lavan l'ya'akov meh 'asiyta vatig'nov et-l'vaviy vat'naheg et-b'notay kish'vuyvot charev
translation: And Laban said to Jacob, “What did you mean by keeping me in the dark and carrying off my daughters like captives of the sword?

hebrew: לָ֤מָּה נַחְבֵּ֙אתָ֙ לִבְרֹ֔חַ וַתִּגְנֹ֖ב אֹתִ֑י וְלֹא־הִגַּ֣דְתָּ לִּ֔י וָֽאֲשַׁלֵּחֲךָ֛ בְּשִׂמְחָ֥ה וּבְשִׁרִ֖ים בְּתֹ֥ף וּבְכִנּֽוֹר׃
transliteration: lamah nach'beta liv'rocha vatig'nov otiy v'lo-higad'ta liy vaashalechakha b'sim'chah vv'shiriym b'tof vv'khinvor
translation: Why did you flee in secrecy and mislead me and not tell me? I would have sent you off with festive music, with timbrel and lyre.

hebrew: וְלֹ֣א נְטַשְׁתַּ֔נִי לְנַשֵּׁ֥ק לְבָנַ֖י וְלִבְנֹתָ֑י עַתָּ֖ה הִסְכַּ֥לְתָּֽ עֲשֽׂוֹ׃
transliteration: v'lo n'tash'taniy l'nashek l'vanay v'liv'notay 'atah his'kal'ta 'asvo
translation: You did not even let me kiss my sons and daughters good-by! It was a foolish thing for you to do.

hebrew: יֶשׁ־לְאֵ֣ל יָדִ֔י לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת עִמָּכֶ֖ם רָ֑ע וֵֽאלֹהֵ֨י אֲבִיכֶ֜ם אֶ֣מֶשׁ ׀ אָמַ֧ר אֵלַ֣י לֵאמֹ֗ר הִשָּׁ֧מֶר לְךָ֛ מִדַּבֵּ֥ר עִֽם־יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִטּ֥וֹב עַד־רָֽע׃
transliteration: yesh-l'el yadiy la'asvot 'imakhem ra' velohey aviykhem emesh  amar elay lemor hishamer l'kha midaber 'im-ya'akov mitvov 'ad-ra'
translation: I have it in my power to do you harm; but the God of your father said to me last night, ‘Beware of attempting anything with Jacob, good or bad.’

hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ הָלֹ֣ךְ הָלַ֔כְתָּ כִּֽי־נִכְסֹ֥ף נִכְסַ֖פְתָּה לְבֵ֣ית אָבִ֑יךָ לָ֥מָּה גָנַ֖בְתָּ אֶת־אֱלֹהָֽי׃
transliteration: v'atah halokh' halakh'ta kiy-nikh'sof nikh'saf'tah l'veyt aviykha lamah ganav'ta et-elohay
translation: Very well, you had to leave because you were longing for your father’s house; but why did you steal my gods?”

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן יַעֲקֹ֖ב וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְלָבָ֑ן כִּ֣י יָרֵ֔אתִי כִּ֣י אָמַ֔רְתִּי פֶּן־תִּגְזֹ֥ל אֶת־בְּנוֹתֶ֖יךָ מֵעִמִּֽי׃
transliteration: vaya'an ya'akov vayomer l'lavan kiy yaretiy kiy amar'tiy pen-tig'zol et-b'nvoteykha me'imiy
translation: Jacob answered Laban, saying, “I was afraid because I thought you would take your daughters from me by force.

hebrew: עִ֠ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּמְצָ֣א אֶת־אֱלֹהֶיךָ֮ לֹ֣א יִֽחְיֶה֒ נֶ֣גֶד אַחֵ֧ינוּ הַֽכֶּר־לְךָ֛ מָ֥ה עִמָּדִ֖י וְקַֽח־לָ֑ךְ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֣ע יַעֲקֹ֔ב כִּ֥י רָחֵ֖ל גְּנָבָֽתַם׃
transliteration: 'im asher tim'tza et-eloheykha lo yich'yeh neged acheynv haker-l'kha mah 'imadiy v'kach-lakh' v'lo-yada' ya'akov kiy rachel g'navatam
translation: But anyone with whom you find your gods shall not remain alive! In the presence of our kinsmen, point out what I have of yours and take it.” Jacob, of course, did not know that Rachel had stolen them.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א לָבָ֜ן בְּאֹ֥הֶל יַעֲקֹ֣ב ׀ וּבְאֹ֣הֶל לֵאָ֗ה וּבְאֹ֛הֶל שְׁתֵּ֥י הָאֲמָהֹ֖ת וְלֹ֣א מָצָ֑א וַיֵּצֵא֙ מֵאֹ֣הֶל לֵאָ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֖א בְּאֹ֥הֶל רָחֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayavo lavan b'ohel ya'akov  vv'ohel leah vv'ohel sh'tey haamahot v'lo matza vayetze meohel leah vayavo b'ohel rachel
translation: So Laban went into Jacob’s tent and Leah’s tent and the tents of the two maidservants; but he did not find them. Leaving Leah’s tent, he entered Rachel’s tent.

hebrew: וְרָחֵ֞ל לָקְחָ֣ה אֶת־הַתְּרָפִ֗ים וַתְּשִׂמֵ֛ם בְּכַ֥ר הַגָּמָ֖ל וַתֵּ֣שֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וַיְמַשֵּׁ֥שׁ לָבָ֛ן אֶת־כָּל־הָאֹ֖הֶל וְלֹ֥א מָצָֽא׃
transliteration: v'rachel lak'chah et-hat'rafiym vat'simem b'khar hagamal vateshev 'aleyhem vay'mashesh lavan et-kal-haohel v'lo matza
translation: Rachel, meanwhile, had taken the idols and placed them in the camel cushion and sat on them; and Laban rummaged through the tent without finding them.

hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־אָבִ֗יהָ אַל־יִ֙חַר֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י כִּ֣י ל֤וֹא אוּכַל֙ לָק֣וּם מִפָּנֶ֔יךָ כִּי־דֶ֥רֶךְ נָשִׁ֖ים לִ֑י וַיְחַפֵּ֕שׂ וְלֹ֥א מָצָ֖א אֶת־הַתְּרָפִֽים׃
transliteration: vatomer el-aviyha al-yichar b'eyney adoniy kiy lvo vkhal lakvm mipaneykha kiy-derekh' nashiym liy vay'chapes v'lo matza et-hat'rafiym
translation: For she said to her father, “Let not my lord take it amiss that I cannot rise before you, for the period of women is upon me.” Thus he searched, but could not find the household idols.

hebrew: וַיִּ֥חַר לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב וַיָּ֣רֶב בְּלָבָ֑ן וַיַּ֤עַן יַעֲקֹב֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְלָבָ֔ן מַה־פִּשְׁעִי֙ מַ֣ה חַטָּאתִ֔י כִּ֥י דָלַ֖קְתָּ אַחֲרָֽי׃
transliteration: vayichar l'ya'akov vayarev b'lavan vaya'an ya'akov vayomer l'lavan mah-pish'iy mah chatatiy kiy dalak'ta acharay
translation: Now Jacob became incensed and took up his grievance with Laban. Jacob spoke up and said to Laban, “What is my crime, what is my guilt that you should pursue me?

hebrew: כִּֽי־מִשַּׁ֣שְׁתָּ אֶת־כָּל־כֵּלַ֗י מַה־מָּצָ֙אתָ֙ מִכֹּ֣ל כְּלֵי־בֵיתֶ֔ךָ שִׂ֣ים כֹּ֔ה נֶ֥גֶד אַחַ֖י וְאַחֶ֑יךָ וְיוֹכִ֖יחוּ בֵּ֥ין שְׁנֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: kiy-mishash'ta et-kal-kelay mah-matzata mikol k'ley-veytekha siym koh neged achay v'acheykha v'yvokhiychv beyn sh'neynv
translation: You rummaged through all my things; what have you found of all your household objects? Set it here, before my kinsmen and yours, and let them decide between us two.

hebrew: זֶה֩ עֶשְׂרִ֨ים שָׁנָ֤ה אָנֹכִי֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ רְחֵלֶ֥יךָ וְעִזֶּ֖יךָ לֹ֣א שִׁכֵּ֑לוּ וְאֵילֵ֥י צֹאנְךָ֖ לֹ֥א אָכָֽלְתִּי׃
transliteration: zeh 'es'riym shanah anokhiy 'imakh' r'cheleykha v'izeykha lo shikelv v'eyley tzon'kha lo akhal'tiy
translation: “These twenty years I have spent in your service, your ewes and she-goats never miscarried, nor did I feast on rams from your flock.

hebrew: טְרֵפָה֙ לֹא־הֵבֵ֣אתִי אֵלֶ֔יךָ אָנֹכִ֣י אֲחַטֶּ֔נָּה מִיָּדִ֖י תְּבַקְשֶׁ֑נָּה גְּנֻֽבְתִ֣י י֔וֹם וּגְנֻֽבְתִ֖י לָֽיְלָה׃
transliteration: t'refah lo-hevetiy eleykha anokhiy achatenah miyadiy t'vak'shenah g'nuv'tiy yvom vg'nuv'tiy lay'lah
translation: That which was torn by beasts I never brought to you; I myself made good the loss; you exacted it of me, whether snatched by day or snatched by night.

hebrew: הָיִ֧יתִי בַיּ֛וֹם אֲכָלַ֥נִי חֹ֖רֶב וְקֶ֣רַח בַּלָּ֑יְלָה וַתִּדַּ֥ד שְׁנָתִ֖י מֵֽעֵינָֽי׃
transliteration: hayiytiy vayvom akhalaniy chorev v'kerach balay'lah vatidad sh'natiy me'eynay
translation: Often,dLit. “I was.” scorching heat ravaged me by day and frost by night; and sleep fled from my eyes.

hebrew: זֶה־לִּ֞י עֶשְׂרִ֣ים שָׁנָה֮ בְּבֵיתֶךָ֒ עֲבַדְתִּ֜יךָ אַרְבַּֽע־עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ בִּשְׁתֵּ֣י בְנֹתֶ֔יךָ וְשֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים בְּצֹאנֶ֑ךָ וַתַּחֲלֵ֥ף אֶת־מַשְׂכֻּרְתִּ֖י עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת מֹנִֽים׃
transliteration: zeh-liy 'es'riym shanah b'veytekha 'avad'tiykha ar'ba'-'es'reh shanah bish'tey v'noteykha v'shesh shaniym b'tzonekha vatachalef et-mas'kur'tiy 'aseret moniym
translation: Of the twenty years that I spent in your household, I served you fourteen years for your two daughters, and six years for your flocks; and you changed my wages time and again.eLit. “ten times.”

hebrew: לוּלֵ֡י אֱלֹהֵ֣י אָבִי֩ אֱלֹהֵ֨י אַבְרָהָ֜ם וּפַ֤חַד יִצְחָק֙ הָ֣יָה לִ֔י כִּ֥י עַתָּ֖ה רֵיקָ֣ם שִׁלַּחְתָּ֑נִי אֶת־עָנְיִ֞י וְאֶת־יְגִ֧יעַ כַּפַּ֛י רָאָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים וַיּ֥וֹכַח אָֽמֶשׁ׃
transliteration: lvley elohey aviy elohey av'raham vfachad yitz'chak hayah liy kiy 'atah reykam shilach'taniy et-'an'yiy v'et-y'giy'a kapay raah elohiym vayvokhach amesh
translation: Had not the God of my father, the God of Abraham and the FearfMeaning of Heb. paḥad uncertain. of Isaac, been with me, you would have sent me away empty-handed. But God took notice of my plight and the toil of my hands, and He gave judgment last night.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן לָבָ֜ן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֗ב הַבָּנ֨וֹת בְּנֹתַ֜י וְהַבָּנִ֤ים בָּנַי֙ וְהַצֹּ֣אן צֹאנִ֔י וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה רֹאֶ֖ה לִי־ה֑וּא וְלִבְנֹתַ֞י מָֽה־אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֤ה לָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ הַיּ֔וֹם א֥וֹ לִבְנֵיהֶ֖ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָלָֽדוּ׃
transliteration: vaya'an lavan vayomer el-ya'akov habanvot b'notay v'habaniym banay v'hatzon tzoniy v'khol asher-atah roeh liy-hv v'liv'notay mah-e'eseh laeleh hayvom vo liv'neyhen asher yaladv
translation: Then Laban spoke up and said to Jacob, “The daughters are my daughters, the children are my children, and the flocks are my flocks; all that you see is mine. Yet what can I do now about my daughters or the children they have borne?

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה לְכָ֛ה נִכְרְתָ֥ה בְרִ֖ית אֲנִ֣י וָאָ֑תָּה וְהָיָ֥ה לְעֵ֖ד בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'atah l'khah nikh'r'tah v'riyt aniy vaatah v'hayah l'ed beyniy vveynekha
translation: Come, then, let us make a pact, you and I, that there may be a witness between you and me.”

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֥ח יַעֲקֹ֖ב אָ֑בֶן וַיְרִימֶ֖הָ מַצֵּבָֽה׃
transliteration: vayikach ya'akov aven vay'riymeha matzevah
translation: Thereupon Jacob took a stone and set it up as a pillar.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֤ב לְאֶחָיו֙ לִקְט֣וּ אֲבָנִ֔ים וַיִּקְח֥וּ אֲבָנִ֖ים וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־גָ֑ל וַיֹּ֥אכְלוּ שָׁ֖ם עַל־הַגָּֽל׃
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov l'echayv lik'tv avaniym vayik'chv avaniym vaya'asv-gal vayokh'lv sham 'al-hagal
translation: And Jacob said to his kinsmen, “Gather stones.” So they took stones and made a mound; and they partook of a meal there by the mound.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא־ל֣וֹ לָבָ֔ן יְגַ֖ר שָׂהֲדוּתָ֑א וְיַֽעֲקֹ֔ב קָ֥רָא ל֖וֹ גַּלְעֵֽד׃
transliteration: vayik'ra-lvo lavan y'gar sahadvta v'ya'akov kara lvo gal'ed
translation: Laban named it Yegar-sahadutha,gAramaic for “the mound (or, stone-heap) of witness.” but Jacob named it Gal-ed.hHeb. for “the mound (or, stone-heap) of witness,” reflecting the name Gilead, v. 23.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָבָ֔ן הַגַּ֨ל הַזֶּ֥ה עֵ֛ד בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינְךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמ֖וֹ גַּלְעֵֽד׃
transliteration: vayomer lavan hagal hazeh 'ed beyniy vveyn'kha hayvom 'al-ken kara-sh'mvo gal'ed
translation: And Laban declared, “This mound is a witness between you and me this day.” That is why it was named Gal-ed;

hebrew: וְהַמִּצְפָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֔ר יִ֥צֶף יְהוָ֖ה בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֑ךָ כִּ֥י נִסָּתֵ֖ר אִ֥ישׁ מֵרֵעֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: v'hamitz'pah asher amar yitzef y'hvah beyniy vveynekha kiy nisater iysh mere'ehv
translation: and [it was called] Mizpah, because he said, “May the LORD watchiHeb. yiseph, associated with Mizpah. between you and me, when we are out of sight of each other.

hebrew: אִם־תְּעַנֶּ֣ה אֶת־בְּנֹתַ֗י וְאִם־תִּקַּ֤ח נָשִׁים֙ עַל־בְּנֹתַ֔י אֵ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ עִמָּ֑נוּ רְאֵ֕ה אֱלֹהִ֥ים עֵ֖ד בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: im-t'aneh et-b'notay v'im-tikach nashiym 'al-b'notay eyn iysh 'imanv r'eh elohiym 'ed beyniy vveynekha
translation: If you ill-treat my daughters or take other wives besides my daughters—though no one else be about, remember, God Himself will be witness between you and me.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָבָ֖ן לְיַעֲקֹ֑ב הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ הַגַּ֣ל הַזֶּ֗ה וְהִנֵּה֙ הַמַצֵּבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָרִ֖יתִי בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer lavan l'ya'akov hineh  hagal hazeh v'hineh hamatzevah asher yariytiy beyniy vveynekha
translation: And Laban said to Jacob, “Here is this mound and here the pillar which I have set up between you and me:

hebrew: עֵ֚ד הַגַּ֣ל הַזֶּ֔ה וְעֵדָ֖ה הַמַּצֵּבָ֑ה אִם־אָ֗נִי לֹֽא־אֶֽעֱבֹ֤ר אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־הַגַּ֣ל הַזֶּ֔ה וְאִם־אַ֠תָּה לֹא־תַעֲבֹ֨ר אֵלַ֜י אֶת־הַגַּ֥ל הַזֶּ֛ה וְאֶת־הַמַּצֵּבָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לְרָעָֽה׃
transliteration: 'ed hagal hazeh v'edah hamatzevah im-aniy lo-e'evor eleykha et-hagal hazeh v'im-atah lo-ta'avor elay et-hagal hazeh v'et-hamatzevah hazot l'ra'ah
translation: this mound shall be witness and this pillar shall be witness that I am not to cross to you past this mound, and that you are not to cross to me past this mound and this pillar, with hostile intent.

hebrew: אֱלֹהֵ֨י אַבְרָהָ֜ם וֵֽאלֹהֵ֤י נָחוֹר֙ יִשְׁפְּט֣וּ בֵינֵ֔ינוּ אֱלֹהֵ֖י אֲבִיהֶ֑ם וַיִּשָּׁבַ֣ע יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּפַ֖חַד אָבִ֥יו יִצְחָֽק׃
transliteration: elohey av'raham velohey nachvor yish'p'tv veyneynv elohey aviyhem vayishava' ya'akov b'fachad aviyv yitz'chak
translation: May the God of Abraham and the god of Nahor”—their ancestral deities—“judge between us.” And Jacob swore by the FearfMeaning of Heb. paḥad uncertain. of his father Isaac.

hebrew: וַיִּזְבַּ֨ח יַעֲקֹ֥ב זֶ֙בַח֙ בָּהָ֔ר וַיִּקְרָ֥א לְאֶחָ֖יו לֶאֱכָל־לָ֑חֶם וַיֹּ֣אכְלוּ לֶ֔חֶם וַיָּלִ֖ינוּ בָּהָֽר׃
transliteration: vayiz'bach ya'akov zevach bahar vayik'ra l'echayv leekhal-lachem vayokh'lv lechem vayaliynv bahar
translation: Jacob then offered up a sacrifice on the Height, and invited his kinsmen to partake of the meal. After the meal, they spent the night on the Height.

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם לָבָ֜ן בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיְנַשֵּׁ֧ק לְבָנָ֛יו וְלִבְנוֹתָ֖יו וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֶתְהֶ֑ם וַיֵּ֛לֶךְ וַיָּ֥שָׁב לָבָ֖ן לִמְקֹמֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayash'kem lavan baboker vay'nashek l'vanayv v'liv'nvotayv vay'varekh' et'hem vayelekh' vayashav lavan lim'komvo
translation: Early in the morning, Laban kissed his sons and daughters and bade them good-by; then Laban left on his journey homeward.

hebrew: וְיַעֲקֹ֖ב הָלַ֣ךְ לְדַרְכּ֑וֹ וַיִּפְגְּעוּ־ב֖וֹ מַלְאֲכֵ֥י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: v'ya'akov halakh' l'dar'kvo vayif'g'v-vvo mal'akhey elohiym
translation: Jacob went on his way, and angels of God encountered him.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר רָאָ֔ם מַחֲנֵ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים זֶ֑ה וַיִּקְרָ֛א שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא מַֽחֲנָֽיִם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov kaasher raam machaneh elohiym zeh vayik'ra shem-hamakvom hahv machanayim (f)
translation: When he saw them, Jacob said, “This is God’s camp.” So he named that place Mahanaim.aConnected with Heb. maḥaneh, “camp.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח יַעֲקֹ֤ב מַלְאָכִים֙ לְפָנָ֔יו אֶל־עֵשָׂ֖ו אָחִ֑יו אַ֥רְצָה שֵׂעִ֖יר שְׂדֵ֥ה אֱדֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayish'lach ya'akov mal'akhiym l'fanayv el-'esav achiyv ar'tzah se'iyr s'deh edvom
translation: Jacob sent messengers ahead to his brother Esau in the land of Seir, the country of Edom,

hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו אֹתָם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֣ה תֹאמְר֔וּן לַֽאדֹנִ֖י לְעֵשָׂ֑ו כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ עַבְדְּךָ֣ יַעֲקֹ֔ב עִם־לָבָ֣ן גַּ֔רְתִּי וָאֵחַ֖ר עַד־עָֽתָּה׃
transliteration: vay'tzav otam lemor koh tom'rvn ladoniy l'esav koh amar 'av'd'kha ya'akov 'im-lavan gar'tiy vaechar 'ad-'atah
translation: and instructed them as follows, bOr “Thus you shall say to my lord Esau, ‘Thus says your servant Jacob:…’”“Thus shall you say, ‘To my lord Esau, thus says your servant Jacob:-b I stayed with Laban and remained until now;

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־לִי֙ שׁ֣וֹר וַחֲמ֔וֹר צֹ֖אן וְעֶ֣בֶד וְשִׁפְחָ֑ה וָֽאֶשְׁלְחָה֙ לְהַגִּ֣יד לַֽאדֹנִ֔י לִמְצֹא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy-liy shvor vachamvor tzon v'eved v'shif'chah vaesh'l'chah l'hagiyd ladoniy lim'tzo-chen b'eyneykha
translation: I have acquired cattle, asses, sheep, and male and female slaves; and I send this message to my lord in the hope of gaining your favor.’”

hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ הַמַּלְאָכִ֔ים אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב לֵאמֹ֑ר בָּ֤אנוּ אֶל־אָחִ֙יךָ֙ אֶל־עֵשָׂ֔ו וְגַם֙ הֹלֵ֣ךְ לִקְרָֽאתְךָ֔ וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֥וֹת אִ֖ישׁ עִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayashuvv hamal'akhiym el-ya'akov lemor banv el-achiykha el-'esav v'gam holekh' lik'rat'kha v'ar'ba'-mevot iysh 'imvo
translation: The messengers returned to Jacob, saying, “We came to your brother Esau; he himself is coming to meet you, and there are four hundred men with him.”

hebrew: וַיִּירָ֧א יַעֲקֹ֛ב מְאֹ֖ד וַיֵּ֣צֶר ל֑וֹ וַיַּ֜חַץ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֗וֹ וְאֶת־הַצֹּ֧אן וְאֶת־הַבָּקָ֛ר וְהַגְּמַלִּ֖ים לִשְׁנֵ֥י מַחֲנֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayiyra ya'akov m'od vayetzer lvo vayachatz et-ha'am asher-itvo v'et-hatzon v'et-habakar v'hag'maliym lish'ney machanvot
translation: Jacob was greatly frightened; in his anxiety, he divided the people with him, and the flocks and herds and camels, into two camps,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אִם־יָב֥וֹא עֵשָׂ֛ו אֶל־הַמַּחֲנֶ֥ה הָאַחַ֖ת וְהִכָּ֑הוּ וְהָיָ֛ה הַמַּחֲנֶ֥ה הַנִּשְׁאָ֖ר לִפְלֵיטָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer im-yavvo 'esav el-hamachaneh haachat v'hikahv v'hayah hamachaneh hanish'ar lif'leytah
translation: thinking, “If Esau comes to the one camp and attacks it, the other camp may yet escape.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֮ יַעֲקֹב֒ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אָבִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם וֵאלֹהֵ֖י אָבִ֣י יִצְחָ֑ק יְהוָ֞ה הָאֹמֵ֣ר אֵלַ֗י שׁ֧וּב לְאַרְצְךָ֛ וּלְמוֹלַדְתְּךָ֖ וְאֵיטִ֥יבָה עִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov elohey aviy av'raham velohey aviy yitz'chak y'hvah haomer elay shvv l'ar'tz'kha vl'mvolad't'kha v'eytiyvah 'imakh'
translation: Then Jacob said, “O God of my father Abraham and God of my father Isaac, O L<small>ORD</small>, who said to me, ‘Return to your native land and I will deal bountifully with you’!

hebrew: קָטֹ֜נְתִּי מִכֹּ֤ל הַחֲסָדִים֙ וּמִכָּל־הָ֣אֱמֶ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתָ אֶת־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֣י בְמַקְלִ֗י עָבַ֙רְתִּי֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֣ן הַזֶּ֔ה וְעַתָּ֥ה הָיִ֖יתִי לִשְׁנֵ֥י מַחֲנֽוֹת׃
transliteration: katon'tiy mikol hachasadiym vmikal-haemet asher 'asiyta et-'av'dekha kiy v'mak'liy 'avar'tiy et-hayar'den hazeh v'atah hayiytiy lish'ney machanvot
translation: I am unworthy of all the kindness that You have so steadfastly shown Your servant: with my staff alone I crossed this Jordan, and now I have become two camps.

hebrew: הַצִּילֵ֥נִי נָ֛א מִיַּ֥ד אָחִ֖י מִיַּ֣ד עֵשָׂ֑ו כִּֽי־יָרֵ֤א אָנֹכִי֙ אֹת֔וֹ פֶּן־יָב֣וֹא וְהִכַּ֔נִי אֵ֖ם עַל־בָּנִֽים׃
transliteration: hatziyleniy na miyad achiy miyad 'esav kiy-yare anokhiy otvo pen-yavvo v'hikaniy em 'al-baniym
translation: Deliver me, I pray, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau; else, I fear, he may come and strike me down, mothers and children alike.

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה אָמַ֔רְתָּ הֵיטֵ֥ב אֵיטִ֖יב עִמָּ֑ךְ וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ כְּח֣וֹל הַיָּ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יִסָּפֵ֖ר מֵרֹֽב׃
transliteration: v'atah amar'ta heytev eytiyv 'imakh' v'sam'tiy et-zar'akha k'chvol hayam asher lo-yisafer merov
translation: Yet You have said, ‘I will deal bountifully with you and make your offspring as the sands of the sea, which are too numerous to count.’”

hebrew: וַיָּ֥לֶן שָׁ֖ם בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֑וּא וַיִּקַּ֞ח מִן־הַבָּ֧א בְיָד֛וֹ מִנְחָ֖ה לְעֵשָׂ֥ו אָחִֽיו׃
transliteration: vayalen sham balay'lah hahv vayikach min-haba v'yadvo min'chah l'esav achiyv
translation: After spending the night there, he selected from what was at hand these presents for his brother Esau:

hebrew: עִזִּ֣ים מָאתַ֔יִם וּתְיָשִׁ֖ים עֶשְׂרִ֑ים רְחֵלִ֥ים מָאתַ֖יִם וְאֵילִ֥ים עֶשְׂרִֽים׃
transliteration: 'iziym matayim vt'yashiym 'es'riym r'cheliym matayim v'eyliym 'es'riym
translation: 200 she-goats and 20 he-goats; 200 ewes and 20 rams;

hebrew: גְּמַלִּ֧ים מֵינִיק֛וֹת וּבְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשִׁ֑ים פָּר֤וֹת אַרְבָּעִים֙ וּפָרִ֣ים עֲשָׂרָ֔ה אֲתֹנֹ֣ת עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וַעְיָרִ֖ם עֲשָׂרָֽה׃
transliteration: g'maliym meyniykvot vv'neyhem sh'loshiym parvot ar'ba'iym vfariym 'asarah atonot 'es'riym va'yarim 'asarah
translation: 30 milch camels with their colts; 40 cows and 10 bulls; 20 she-asses and 10 he-asses.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּן֙ בְּיַד־עֲבָדָ֔יו עֵ֥דֶר עֵ֖דֶר לְבַדּ֑וֹ וַ֤יֹּאמֶר אֶל־עֲבָדָיו֙ עִבְר֣וּ לְפָנַ֔י וְרֶ֣וַח תָּשִׂ֔ימוּ בֵּ֥ין עֵ֖דֶר וּבֵ֥ין עֵֽדֶר׃
transliteration: vayiten b'yad-'avadayv 'eder 'eder l'vadvo vayomer el-'avadayv 'iv'rv l'fanay v'revach tasiymv beyn 'eder vveyn 'eder
translation: These he put in the charge of his servants, drove by drove, and he told his servants, “Go on ahead, and keep a distance between droves.”

hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ו אֶת־הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן לֵאמֹ֑ר כִּ֣י יִֽפְגָּשְׁךָ֞ עֵשָׂ֣ו אָחִ֗י וִשְׁאֵֽלְךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְמִי־אַ֙תָּה֙ וְאָ֣נָה תֵלֵ֔ךְ וּלְמִ֖י אֵ֥לֶּה לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vay'tzav et-harishvon lemor kiy yif'gash'kha 'esav achiy vish'el'kha lemor l'miy-atah v'anah telekh' vl'miy eleh l'faneykha
translation: He instructed the one in front as follows, “When my brother Esau meets you and asks you, ‘Whose man are you? Where are you going? And whose [animals] are these ahead of you?’

hebrew: וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ לְעַבְדְּךָ֣ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב מִנְחָ֥ה הִוא֙ שְׁלוּחָ֔ה לַֽאדֹנִ֖י לְעֵשָׂ֑ו וְהִנֵּ֥ה גַם־ה֖וּא אַחֲרֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: v'amar'ta l'av'd'kha l'ya'akov min'chah hiv sh'lvchah ladoniy l'esav v'hineh gam-hv achareynv
translation: you shall answer, ‘Your servant Jacob’s; they are a gift sent to my lord Esau; and [Jacob] himself is right behind us.’”

hebrew: וַיְצַ֞ו גַּ֣ם אֶת־הַשֵּׁנִ֗י גַּ֚ם אֶת־הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י גַּ֚ם אֶת־כָּל־הַהֹ֣לְכִ֔ים אַחֲרֵ֥י הָעֲדָרִ֖ים לֵאמֹ֑ר כַּדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ תְּדַבְּר֣וּן אֶל־עֵשָׂ֔ו בְּמֹצַאֲכֶ֖ם אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vay'tzav gam et-hasheniy gam et-hash'liyshiy gam et-kal-hahol'khiym acharey ha'adariym lemor kadavar hazeh t'dab'rvn el-'esav b'motzaakhem otvo
translation: He gave similar instructions to the second one, and the third, and all the others who followed the droves, namely, “Thus and so shall you say to Esau when you reach him.

hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֕ם גַּ֗ם הִנֵּ֛ה עַבְדְּךָ֥ יַעֲקֹ֖ב אַחֲרֵ֑ינוּ כִּֽי־אָמַ֞ר אֲכַפְּרָ֣ה פָנָ֗יו בַּמִּנְחָה֙ הַהֹלֶ֣כֶת לְפָנָ֔י וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵן֙ אֶרְאֶ֣ה פָנָ֔יו אוּלַ֖י יִשָּׂ֥א פָנָֽי׃
transliteration: vaamar'tem gam hineh 'av'd'kha ya'akov achareynv kiy-amar akhap'rah fanayv bamin'chah haholekhet l'fanay v'acharey-khen er'eh fanayv vlay yisa fanay
translation: And you shall add, ‘And your servant Jacob himself is right behind us.’” For he reasoned, “If I propitiate him with presents in advance, and then face him, perhaps he will show me favor.”

hebrew: וַתַּעֲבֹ֥ר הַמִּנְחָ֖ה עַל־פָּנָ֑יו וְה֛וּא לָ֥ן בַּלַּֽיְלָה־הַה֖וּא בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vata'avor hamin'chah 'al-panayv v'hv lan balay'lah-hahv bamachaneh
translation: And so the gift went on ahead, while he remained in camp that night.

hebrew: וַיָּ֣קָם ׀ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה ה֗וּא וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֤י נָשָׁיו֙ וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י שִׁפְחֹתָ֔יו וְאֶת־אַחַ֥ד עָשָׂ֖ר יְלָדָ֑יו וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֔ר אֵ֖ת מַעֲבַ֥ר יַבֹּֽק׃
transliteration: vayakam  balay'lah hv vayikach et-sh'tey nashayv v'et-sh'tey shif'chotayv v'et-achad 'asar y'ladayv vaya'avor et ma'avar yabok
translation: That same night he arose, and taking his two wives, his two maidservants, and his eleven children, he crossed the ford of the Jabbok.

hebrew: וַיִּקָּחֵ֔ם וַיַּֽעֲבִרֵ֖ם אֶת־הַנָּ֑חַל וַֽיַּעֲבֵ֖ר אֶת־אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ׃
transliteration: vayikachem vaya'avirem et-hanachal vaya'aver et-asher-lvo
translation: After taking them across the stream, he sent across all his possessions.

hebrew: וַיִּוָּתֵ֥ר יַעֲקֹ֖ב לְבַדּ֑וֹ וַיֵּאָבֵ֥ק אִישׁ֙ עִמּ֔וֹ עַ֖ד עֲל֥וֹת הַשָּֽׁחַר׃
transliteration: vayivater ya'akov l'vadvo vayeavek iysh 'imvo 'ad 'alvot hashachar
translation: Jacob was left alone. And a man wrestled with him until the break of dawn.

hebrew: וַיַּ֗רְא כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָכֹל֙ ל֔וֹ וַיִּגַּ֖ע בְּכַף־יְרֵכ֑וֹ וַתֵּ֙קַע֙ כַּף־יֶ֣רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּהֵֽאָבְק֖וֹ עִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayar' kiy lo yakhol lvo vayiga' b'khaf-y'rekhvo vateka' kaf-yerekh' ya'akov b'heav'kvo 'imvo
translation: When he saw that he had not prevailed against him, he wrenched Jacob’s hip at its socket, so that the socket of his hip was strained as he wrestled with him.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שַׁלְּחֵ֔נִי כִּ֥י עָלָ֖ה הַשָּׁ֑חַר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֲשַֽׁלֵּחֲךָ֔ כִּ֖י אִם־בֵּרַכְתָּֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayomer shal'cheniy kiy 'alah hashachar vayomer lo ashalechakha kiy im-berakh'taniy
translation: Then he said, “Let me go, for dawn is breaking.” But he answered, “I will not let you go, unless you bless me.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו מַה־שְּׁמֶ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv mah-sh'mekha vayomer ya'akov
translation: Said the other, “What is your name?” He replied, “Jacob.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לֹ֤א יַעֲקֹב֙ יֵאָמֵ֥ר עוֹד֙ שִׁמְךָ֔ כִּ֖י אִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּֽי־שָׂרִ֧יתָ עִם־אֱלֹהִ֛ים וְעִם־אֲנָשִׁ֖ים וַתּוּכָֽל׃
transliteration: vayomer lo ya'akov yeamer 'vod shim'kha kiy im-yis'rael kiy-sariyta 'im-elohiym v'im-anashiym vatvkhal
translation: Said he, “Your name shall no longer be Jacob, but Israel, for you have strivencHeb. saritha, connected with first part of “Israel.” with dOr “God (Elohim, connected with second part of ‘Israel’) and men.”beings divine and human,-d and have prevailed.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֣ל יַעֲקֹ֗ב וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַגִּֽידָה־נָּ֣א שְׁמֶ֔ךָ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה תִּשְׁאַ֣ל לִשְׁמִ֑י וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֹת֖וֹ שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayish'al ya'akov vayomer hagiydah-na sh'mekha vayomer lamah zeh tish'al lish'miy vay'varekh' otvo sham
translation: Jacob asked, “Pray tell me your name.” But he said, “You must not ask my name!” And he took leave of him there.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֧א יַעֲקֹ֛ב שֵׁ֥ם הַמָּק֖וֹם פְּנִיאֵ֑ל כִּֽי־רָאִ֤יתִי אֱלֹהִים֙ פָּנִ֣ים אֶל־פָּנִ֔ים וַתִּנָּצֵ֖ל נַפְשִֽׁי׃
transliteration: vayik'ra ya'akov shem hamakvom p'niyel kiy-raiytiy elohiym paniym el-paniym vatinatzel naf'shiy
translation: So Jacob named the place Peniel,eUnderstood as “face of God.” meaning, “I have seen a divine being face to face, yet my life has been preserved.”

hebrew: וַיִּֽזְרַֽח־ל֣וֹ הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָבַ֖ר אֶת־פְּנוּאֵ֑ל וְה֥וּא צֹלֵ֖עַ עַל־יְרֵכֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayiz'rach-lvo hashemesh kaasher 'avar et-p'nvel v'hv tzole'a 'al-y'rekhvo
translation: The sun rose upon him as he passed Penuel, limping on his hip.

hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֡ן לֹֽא־יֹאכְל֨וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־גִּ֣יד הַנָּשֶׁ֗ה אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־כַּ֣ף הַיָּרֵ֔ךְ עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֤י נָגַע֙ בְּכַף־יֶ֣רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּגִ֖יד הַנָּשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: 'al-ken lo-yokh'lv v'ney-yis'rael et-giyd hanasheh asher 'al-kaf hayarekh' 'ad hayvom hazeh kiy naga' b'khaf-yerekh' ya'akov b'giyd hanasheh
translation: That is why the children of Israel to this day do not eat the thigh muscle that is on the socket of the hip, since Jacob’s hip socket was wrenched at the thigh muscle.

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א יַעֲקֹ֜ב עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּרְא֙ וְהִנֵּ֣ה עֵשָׂ֣ו בָּ֔א וְעִמּ֕וֹ אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת אִ֑ישׁ וַיַּ֣חַץ אֶת־הַיְלָדִ֗ים עַל־לֵאָה֙ וְעַל־רָחֵ֔ל וְעַ֖ל שְׁתֵּ֥י הַשְּׁפָחֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayisa ya'akov 'eynayv vayar' v'hineh 'esav ba v'imvo ar'ba' mevot iysh vayachatz et-hay'ladiym 'al-leah v'al-rachel v'al sh'tey hash'fachvot
translation: Looking up, Jacob saw Esau coming, accompanied by four hundred men. He divided the children among Leah, Rachel, and the two maids,

hebrew: וַיָּ֧שֶׂם אֶת־הַשְּׁפָח֛וֹת וְאֶת־יַלְדֵיהֶ֖ן רִֽאשֹׁנָ֑ה וְאֶת־לֵאָ֤ה וִֽילָדֶ֙יהָ֙ אַחֲרֹנִ֔ים וְאֶת־רָחֵ֥ל וְאֶת־יוֹסֵ֖ף אַחֲרֹנִֽים׃
transliteration: vayasem et-hash'fachvot v'et-yal'deyhen rishonah v'et-leah viyladeyha acharoniym v'et-rachel v'et-yvosef acharoniym
translation: putting the maids and their children first, Leah and her children next, and Rachel and Joseph last.

hebrew: וְה֖וּא עָבַ֣ר לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֤חוּ אַ֙רְצָה֙ שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֔ים עַד־גִּשְׁתּ֖וֹ עַד־אָחִֽיו׃
transliteration: v'hv 'avar lif'neyhem vayish'tachv ar'tzah sheva' p'amiym 'ad-gish'tvo 'ad-achiyv
translation: He himself went on ahead and bowed low to the ground seven times until he was near his brother.

hebrew: וַיָּ֨רָץ עֵשָׂ֤ו לִקְרָאתוֹ֙ וַֽיְחַבְּקֵ֔הוּ וַיִּפֹּ֥ל עַל־צַוָּארָ֖ו וַׄיִּׄשָּׁׄקֵ֑ׄהׄוּׄ וַיִּבְכּֽוּ׃
transliteration: vayaratz 'esav lik'ratvo vay'chab'kehv vayipol 'al-tzavarav vayishakehv vayiv'kv
translation: Esau ran to greet him. He embraced him and, falling on his neck, he kissed him; and they wept.

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֣א אֶת־עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּ֤רְא אֶת־הַנָּשִׁים֙ וְאֶת־הַיְלָדִ֔ים וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מִי־אֵ֣לֶּה לָּ֑ךְ וַיֹּאמַ֕ר הַיְלָדִ֕ים אֲשֶׁר־חָנַ֥ן אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayisa et-'eynayv vayar' et-hanashiym v'et-hay'ladiym vayomer miy-eleh lakh' vayomar hay'ladiym asher-chanan elohiym et-'av'dekha
translation: Looking about, he saw the women and the children. “Who,” he asked, “are these with you?” He answered, “The children with whom God has favored your servant.”

hebrew: וַתִּגַּ֧שְׁןָ הַשְּׁפָח֛וֹת הֵ֥נָּה וְיַלְדֵיהֶ֖ן וַתִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶֽיןָ׃
transliteration: vatigash'na hash'fachvot henah v'yal'deyhen vatish'tachaveyna
translation: Then the maids, with their children, came forward and bowed low;

hebrew: וַתִּגַּ֧שׁ גַּם־לֵאָ֛ה וִילָדֶ֖יהָ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֑וּ וְאַחַ֗ר נִגַּ֥שׁ יוֹסֵ֛ף וְרָחֵ֖ל וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ׃
transliteration: vatigash gam-leah viyladeyha vayish'tachavv v'achar nigash yvosef v'rachel vayish'tachavv
translation: next Leah, with her children, came forward and bowed low; and last, Joseph and Rachel came forward and bowed low.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מִ֥י לְךָ֛ כָּל־הַמַּחֲנֶ֥ה הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּגָ֑שְׁתִּי וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לִמְצֹא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer miy l'kha kal-hamachaneh hazeh asher pagash'tiy vayomer lim'tzo-chen b'eyney adoniy
translation: And he asked, “What do you mean by all this company which I have met?” He answered, “To gain my lord’s favor.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר עֵשָׂ֖ו יֶשׁ־לִ֣י רָ֑ב אָחִ֕י יְהִ֥י לְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁר־לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer 'esav yesh-liy rav achiy y'hiy l'kha asher-lakh'
translation: Esau said, “I have enough, my brother; let what you have remain yours.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֗ב אַל־נָא֙ אִם־נָ֨א מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ מִנְחָתִ֖י מִיָּדִ֑י כִּ֣י עַל־כֵּ֞ן רָאִ֣יתִי פָנֶ֗יךָ כִּרְאֹ֛ת פְּנֵ֥י אֱלֹהִ֖ים וַתִּרְצֵֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov al-na im-na matzatiy chen b'eyneykha v'lakach'ta min'chatiy miyadiy kiy 'al-ken raiytiy faneykha kir'ot p'ney elohiym vatir'tzeniy
translation: But Jacob said, “No, I pray you; if you would do me this favor, accept from me this gift; for to see your face is like seeing the face of God, and you have received me favorably.

hebrew: קַח־נָ֤א אֶת־בִּרְכָתִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֻבָ֣את לָ֔ךְ כִּֽי־חַנַּ֥נִי אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְכִ֣י יֶשׁ־לִי־כֹ֑ל וַיִּפְצַר־בּ֖וֹ וַיִּקָּֽח׃
transliteration: kach-na et-bir'khatiy asher huvat lakh' kiy-chananiy elohiym v'khiy yesh-liy-khol vayif'tzar-bvo vayikach
translation: Please accept my present which has been brought to you, for God has favored me and I have plenty.” And when he urged him, he accepted.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר נִסְעָ֣ה וְנֵלֵ֑כָה וְאֵלְכָ֖ה לְנֶגְדֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer nis'ah v'nelekhah v'el'khah l'neg'dekha
translation: And [Esau] said, “Let us start on our journey, and I will proceed at your pace.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו אֲדֹנִ֤י יֹדֵ֙עַ֙ כִּֽי־הַיְלָדִ֣ים רַכִּ֔ים וְהַצֹּ֥אן וְהַבָּקָ֖ר עָל֣וֹת עָלָ֑י וּדְפָקוּם֙ י֣וֹם אֶחָ֔ד וָמֵ֖תוּ כָּל־הַצֹּֽאן׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv adoniy yode'a kiy-hay'ladiym rakiym v'hatzon v'habakar 'alvot 'alay vd'fakvm yvom echad vametv kal-hatzon
translation: But he said to him, “My lord knows that the children are frail and that the flocks and herds, which are nursing, are a care to me; if they are driven hard a single day, all the flocks will die.

hebrew: יַעֲבָר־נָ֥א אֲדֹנִ֖י לִפְנֵ֣י עַבְדּ֑וֹ וַאֲנִ֞י אֶֽתְנָהֲלָ֣ה לְאִטִּ֗י לְרֶ֨גֶל הַמְּלָאכָ֤ה אֲשֶׁר־לְפָנַי֙ וּלְרֶ֣גֶל הַיְלָדִ֔ים עַ֛ד אֲשֶׁר־אָבֹ֥א אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֖י שֵׂעִֽירָה׃
transliteration: ya'avar-na adoniy lif'ney 'av'dvo vaaniy et'nahalah l'itiy l'regel ham'lakhah asher-l'fanay vl'regel hay'ladiym 'ad asher-avo el-adoniy se'iyrah
translation: Let my lord go on ahead of his servant, while I travel slowly, at the pace of the cattle before me and at the pace of the children, until I come to my lord in Seir.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר עֵשָׂ֔ו אַצִּֽיגָה־נָּ֣א עִמְּךָ֔ מִן־הָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתִּ֑י וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לָ֣מָּה זֶּ֔ה אֶמְצָא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer 'esav atziygah-na 'im'kha min-ha'am asher itiy vayomer lamah zeh em'tza-chen b'eyney adoniy
translation: Then Esau said, “Let me assign to you some of the men who are with me.” But he said, “Oh no, my lord is too kind to me!”

hebrew: וַיָּשָׁב֩ בַּיּ֨וֹם הַה֥וּא עֵשָׂ֛ו לְדַרְכּ֖וֹ שֵׂעִֽירָה׃
transliteration: vayashav bayvom hahv 'esav l'dar'kvo se'iyrah
translation: So Esau started back that day on his way to Seir.

hebrew: וְיַעֲקֹב֙ נָסַ֣ע סֻכֹּ֔תָה וַיִּ֥בֶן ל֖וֹ בָּ֑יִת וּלְמִקְנֵ֙הוּ֙ עָשָׂ֣ה סֻכֹּ֔ת עַל־כֵּ֛ן קָרָ֥א שֵׁם־הַמָּק֖וֹם סֻכּֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'ya'akov nasa' sukotah vayiven lvo bayit vl'mik'nehv 'asah sukot 'al-ken kara shem-hamakvom sukvot (s)
translation: But Jacob journeyed on to Succoth, and built a house for himself and made stalls for his cattle; that is why the place was called Succoth.aMeaning “stalls,” “huts,” “booths.”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֩ יַעֲקֹ֨ב שָׁלֵ֜ם עִ֣יר שְׁכֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן בְּבֹא֖וֹ מִפַּדַּ֣ן אֲרָ֑ם וַיִּ֖חַן אֶת־פְּנֵ֥י הָעִֽיר׃
transliteration: vayavo ya'akov shalem 'iyr sh'khem asher b'eretz k'na'an b'vovo mipadan aram vayichan et-p'ney ha'iyr
translation: Jacob arrived safe in the city of Shechem which is in the land of Canaan—having come thus from Paddan-aram—and he encamped before the city.

hebrew: וַיִּ֜קֶן אֶת־חֶלְקַ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָֽטָה־שָׁם֙ אָהֳל֔וֹ מִיַּ֥ד בְּנֵֽי־חֲמ֖וֹר אֲבִ֣י שְׁכֶ֑ם בְּמֵאָ֖ה קְשִׂיטָֽה׃
transliteration: vayiken et-chel'kat hasadeh asher natah-sham aholvo miyad b'ney-chamvor aviy sh'khem b'meah k'siytah
translation: The parcel of land where he pitched his tent he purchased from the children of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for a hundred kesitahs.bHeb. qesit·ah, a unit of unknown value.

hebrew: וַיַּצֶּב־שָׁ֖ם מִזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּ֨קְרָא־ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ל אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayatzev-sham miz'becha vayik'ra-lvo el elohey yis'rael (s)
translation: He set up an altar there, and called it El-elohe-yisrael.c“El, God of Israel.”

hebrew: וַתֵּצֵ֤א דִינָה֙ בַּת־לֵאָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָלְדָ֖ה לְיַעֲקֹ֑ב לִרְא֖וֹת בִּבְנ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vatetze diynah bat-leah asher yal'dah l'ya'akov lir'vot biv'nvot haaretz
translation: Now Dinah, the daughter whom Leah had borne to Jacob, went out to visit the daughters of the land.

hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא אֹתָ֜הּ שְׁכֶ֧ם בֶּן־חֲמ֛וֹר הַֽחִוִּ֖י נְשִׂ֣יא הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּקַּ֥ח אֹתָ֛הּ וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב אֹתָ֖הּ וַיְעַנֶּֽהָ׃
transliteration: vayar' otah sh'khem ben-chamvor hachiviy n'siy haaretz vayikach otah vayish'kav otah vay'aneha
translation: Shechem son of Hamor the Hivite, chief of the country, saw her, and took her and lay with her by force.

hebrew: וַתִּדְבַּ֣ק נַפְשׁ֔וֹ בְּדִינָ֖ה בַּֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וַיֶּֽאֱהַב֙ אֶת־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ וַיְדַבֵּ֖ר עַל־לֵ֥ב הַֽנַּעֲרָֽ׃
transliteration: vatid'bak naf'shvo b'diynah bat-ya'akov vayeehav et-hana'ara vay'daber 'al-lev hana'ara
translation: Being strongly drawn to Dinah daughter of Jacob, and in love with the maiden, he spoke to the maiden tenderly.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁכֶ֔ם אֶל־חֲמ֥וֹר אָבִ֖יו לֵאמֹ֑ר קַֽח־לִ֛י אֶת־הַיַּלְדָּ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayomer sh'khem el-chamvor aviyv lemor kach-liy et-hayal'dah hazot l'ishah
translation: So Shechem said to his father Hamor, “Get me this girl as a wife.”

hebrew: וְיַעֲקֹ֣ב שָׁמַ֗ע כִּ֤י טִמֵּא֙ אֶת־דִּינָ֣ה בִתּ֔וֹ וּבָנָ֛יו הָי֥וּ אֶת־מִקְנֵ֖הוּ בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וְהֶחֱרִ֥שׁ יַעֲקֹ֖ב עַד־בֹּאָֽם׃
transliteration: v'ya'akov shama' kiy time et-diynah vitvo vvanayv hayv et-mik'nehv basadeh v'hecherish ya'akov 'ad-boam
translation: Jacob heard that he had defiled his daughter Dinah; but since his sons were in the field with his cattle, Jacob kept silent until they came home.

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֛א חֲמ֥וֹר אֲבִֽי־שְׁכֶ֖ם אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֑ב לְדַבֵּ֖ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayetze chamvor aviy-sh'khem el-ya'akov l'daber itvo
translation: Then Shechem’s father Hamor came out to Jacob to speak to him.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֨י יַעֲקֹ֜ב בָּ֤אוּ מִן־הַשָּׂדֶה֙ כְּשָׁמְעָ֔ם וַיִּֽתְעַצְּבוּ֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיִּ֥חַר לָהֶ֖ם מְאֹ֑ד כִּֽי־נְבָלָ֞ה עָשָׂ֣ה בְיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לִשְׁכַּב֙ אֶת־בַּֽת־יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְכֵ֖ן לֹ֥א יֵעָשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: vv'ney ya'akov bav min-hasadeh k'sham'am vayit'atz'vv haanashiym vayichar lahem m'od kiy-n'valah 'asah v'yis'rael lish'kav et-bat-ya'akov v'khen lo ye'aseh
translation: Meanwhile Jacob’s sons, having heard the news, came in from the field. The men were distressed and very angry, because he had committed an outrage in Israel by lying with Jacob’s daughter—a thing not to be done.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר חֲמ֖וֹר אִתָּ֣ם לֵאמֹ֑ר שְׁכֶ֣ם בְּנִ֗י חָֽשְׁקָ֤ה נַפְשׁוֹ֙ בְּבִתְּכֶ֔ם תְּנ֨וּ נָ֥א אֹתָ֛הּ ל֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vay'daber chamvor itam lemor sh'khem b'niy chash'kah naf'shvo b'vit'khem t'nv na otah lvo l'ishah
translation: And Hamor spoke with them, saying, “My son Shechem longs for your daughter. Please give her to him in marriage.

hebrew: וְהִֽתְחַתְּנ֖וּ אֹתָ֑נוּ בְּנֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ תִּתְּנוּ־לָ֔נוּ וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֵ֖ינוּ תִּקְח֥וּ לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hit'chat'nv otanv b'noteykhem tit'nv-lanv v'et-b'noteynv tik'chv lakhem
translation: Intermarry with us: give your daughters to us, and take our daughters for yourselves:

hebrew: וְאִתָּ֖נוּ תֵּשֵׁ֑בוּ וְהָאָ֙רֶץ֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם שְׁבוּ֙ וּסְחָר֔וּהָ וְהֵֽאָחֲז֖וּ בָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'itanv teshevv v'haaretz tih'yeh lif'neykhem sh'vv vs'charvha v'heachazv bah
translation: You will dwell among us, and the land will be open before you; settle, move about, and acquire holdings in it.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁכֶם֙ אֶל־אָבִ֣יה וְאֶל־אַחֶ֔יהָ אֶמְצָא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵיכֶ֑ם וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר תֹּאמְר֛וּ אֵלַ֖י אֶתֵּֽן׃
transliteration: vayomer sh'khem el-aviyh v'el-acheyha em'tza-chen b'eyneykhem vaasher tom'rv elay eten
translation: Then Shechem said to her father and brothers, “Do me this favor, and I will pay whatever you tell me.

hebrew: הַרְבּ֨וּ עָלַ֤י מְאֹד֙ מֹ֣הַר וּמַתָּ֔ן וְאֶ֨תְּנָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר תֹּאמְר֖וּ אֵלָ֑י וּתְנוּ־לִ֥י אֶת־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: har'bv 'alay m'od mohar vmatan v'et'nah kaasher tom'rv elay vt'nv-liy et-hana'ara l'ishah
translation: Ask of me a bride-price ever so high, as well as gifts, and I will pay what you tell me; only give me the maiden for a wife.”

hebrew: וַיַּעֲנ֨וּ בְנֵֽי־יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶת־שְׁכֶ֨ם וְאֶת־חֲמ֥וֹר אָבִ֛יו בְּמִרְמָ֖ה וַיְדַבֵּ֑רוּ אֲשֶׁ֣ר טִמֵּ֔א אֵ֖ת דִּינָ֥ה אֲחֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vaya'anv v'ney-ya'akov et-sh'khem v'et-chamvor aviyv b'mir'mah vay'daberv asher time et diynah achotam
translation: Jacob’s sons answered Shechem and his father Hamor—speaking with guile because he had defiled their sister Dinah—

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם לֹ֤א נוּכַל֙ לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה לָתֵת֙ אֶת־אֲחֹתֵ֔נוּ לְאִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־ל֣וֹ עָרְלָ֑ה כִּֽי־חֶרְפָּ֥ה הִ֖וא לָֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vayom'rv aleyhem lo nvkhal la'asvot hadavar hazeh latet et-achotenv l'iysh asher-lvo 'ar'lah kiy-cher'pah hiv lanv
translation: and said to them, “We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to a man who is uncircumcised, for that is a disgrace among us.

hebrew: אַךְ־בְּזֹ֖את נֵא֣וֹת לָכֶ֑ם אִ֚ם תִּהְי֣וּ כָמֹ֔נוּ לְהִמֹּ֥ל לָכֶ֖ם כָּל־זָכָֽר׃
transliteration: akh'-b'zot nevot lakhem im tih'yv khamonv l'himol lakhem kal-zakhar
translation: Only on this condition will we agree with you; that you will become like us in that every male among you is circumcised.

hebrew: וְנָתַ֤נּוּ אֶת־בְּנֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ לָכֶ֔ם וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֵיכֶ֖ם נִֽקַּֽח־לָ֑נוּ וְיָשַׁ֣בְנוּ אִתְּכֶ֔ם וְהָיִ֖ינוּ לְעַ֥ם אֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: v'natanv et-b'noteynv lakhem v'et-b'noteykhem nikach-lanv v'yashav'nv it'khem v'hayiynv l'am echad
translation: Then we will give our daughters to you and take your daughters to ourselves; and we will dwell among you and become as one kindred.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֧א תִשְׁמְע֛וּ אֵלֵ֖ינוּ לְהִמּ֑וֹל וְלָקַ֥חְנוּ אֶת־בִּתֵּ֖נוּ וְהָלָֽכְנוּ׃
transliteration: v'im-lo tish'm'v eleynv l'himvol v'lakach'nv et-bitenv v'halakh'nv
translation: But if you will not listen to us and become circumcised, we will take our daughter and go.”

hebrew: וַיִּֽיטְב֥וּ דִבְרֵיהֶ֖ם בְּעֵינֵ֣י חֲמ֑וֹר וּבְעֵינֵ֖י שְׁכֶ֥ם בֶּן־חֲמֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vayiyt'vv div'reyhem b'eyney chamvor vv'eyney sh'khem ben-chamvor
translation: Their words pleased Hamor and Hamor’s son Shechem.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־אֵחַ֤ר הַנַּ֙עַר֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת הַדָּבָ֔ר כִּ֥י חָפֵ֖ץ בְּבַֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְה֣וּא נִכְבָּ֔ד מִכֹּ֖ל בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽיו׃
transliteration: v'lo-echar hana'ar la'asvot hadavar kiy chafetz b'vat-ya'akov v'hv nikh'bad mikol beyt aviyv
translation: And the youth lost no time in doing the thing, for he wanted Jacob’s daughter. Now he was the most respected in his father’s house.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א חֲמ֛וֹר וּשְׁכֶ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ אֶל־שַׁ֣עַר עִירָ֑ם וַֽיְדַבְּר֛וּ אֶל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י עִירָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayavo chamvor vsh'khem b'nvo el-sha'ar 'iyram vay'dab'rv el-an'shey 'iyram lemor
translation: So Hamor and his son Shechem went to the aLit. “gate.”public place-a of their town and spoke to their fellow townsmen, saying,

hebrew: הָאֲנָשִׁ֨ים הָאֵ֜לֶּה שְֽׁלֵמִ֧ים הֵ֣ם אִתָּ֗נוּ וְיֵשְׁב֤וּ בָאָ֙רֶץ֙ וְיִסְחֲר֣וּ אֹתָ֔הּ וְהָאָ֛רֶץ הִנֵּ֥ה רַֽחֲבַת־יָדַ֖יִם לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם אֶת־בְּנֹתָם֙ נִקַּֽח־לָ֣נוּ לְנָשִׁ֔ים וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֵ֖ינוּ נִתֵּ֥ן לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: haanashiym haeleh sh'lemiym hem itanv v'yesh'vv vaaretz v'yis'charv otah v'haaretz hineh rachavat-yadayim lif'neyhem et-b'notam nikach-lanv l'nashiym v'et-b'noteynv niten lahem
translation: “These people are our friends; let them settle in the land and move about in it, for the land is large enough for them; we will take their daughters to ourselves as wives and give our daughters to them.

hebrew: אַךְ־בְּ֠זֹאת יֵאֹ֨תוּ לָ֤נוּ הָאֲנָשִׁים֙ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת אִתָּ֔נוּ לִהְי֖וֹת לְעַ֣ם אֶחָ֑ד בְּהִמּ֥וֹל לָ֙נוּ֙ כָּל־זָכָ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר הֵ֥ם נִמֹּלִֽים׃
transliteration: akh'-b'zot yeotv lanv haanashiym lashevet itanv lih'yvot l'am echad b'himvol lanv kal-zakhar kaasher hem nimoliym
translation: But only on this condition will the men agree with us to dwell among us and be as one kindred: that all our males become circumcised as they are circumcised.

hebrew: מִקְנֵהֶ֤ם וְקִנְיָנָם֙ וְכָל־בְּהֶמְתָּ֔ם הֲל֥וֹא לָ֖נוּ הֵ֑ם אַ֚ךְ נֵא֣וֹתָה לָהֶ֔ם וְיֵשְׁב֖וּ אִתָּֽנוּ׃
transliteration: mik'nehem v'kin'yanam v'khal-b'hem'tam halvo lanv hem akh' nevotah lahem v'yesh'vv itanv
translation: Their cattle and substance and all their beasts will be ours, if we only agree to their terms, so that they will settle among us.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְע֤וּ אֶל־חֲמוֹר֙ וְאֶל־שְׁכֶ֣ם בְּנ֔וֹ כָּל־יֹצְאֵ֖י שַׁ֣עַר עִיר֑וֹ וַיִּמֹּ֙לוּ֙ כָּל־זָכָ֔ר כָּל־יֹצְאֵ֖י שַׁ֥עַר עִירֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayish'm'v el-chamvor v'el-sh'khem b'nvo kal-yotz'ey sha'ar 'iyrvo vayimolv kal-zakhar kal-yotz'ey sha'ar 'iyrvo
translation: All bI.e., all his fellow townsmen.who went out of the gate of his town-b heeded Hamor and his son Shechem, and all males, bI.e., all his fellow townsmen.all those who went out of the gate of his town,-bwere circumcised.

hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֜י בִּֽהְיוֹתָ֣ם כֹּֽאֲבִ֗ים וַיִּקְח֣וּ שְׁנֵֽי־בְנֵי־יַ֠עֲקֹב שִׁמְע֨וֹן וְלֵוִ֜י אֲחֵ֤י דִינָה֙ אִ֣ישׁ חַרְבּ֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ עַל־הָעִ֖יר בֶּ֑טַח וַיַּֽהַרְג֖וּ כָּל־זָכָֽר׃
transliteration: vay'hiy vayvom hash'liyshiy bih'yvotam koaviym vayik'chv sh'ney-v'ney-ya'akov shim'von v'leviy achey diynah iysh char'bvo vayavov 'al-ha'iyr betach vayahar'gv kal-zakhar
translation: On the third day, when they were in pain, Simeon and Levi, two of Jacob’s sons, brothers of Dinah, took each his sword, came upon the city unmolested, and slew all the males.

hebrew: וְאֶת־חֲמוֹר֙ וְאֶת־שְׁכֶ֣ם בְּנ֔וֹ הָרְג֖וּ לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וַיִּקְח֧וּ אֶת־דִּינָ֛ה מִבֵּ֥ית שְׁכֶ֖ם וַיֵּצֵֽאוּ׃
transliteration: v'et-chamvor v'et-sh'khem b'nvo har'gv l'fiy-charev vayik'chv et-diynah mibeyt sh'khem vayetzev
translation: They put Hamor and his son Shechem to the sword, took Dinah out of Shechem’s house, and went away.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֗ב בָּ֚אוּ עַל־הַ֣חֲלָלִ֔ים וַיָּבֹ֖זּוּ הָעִ֑יר אֲשֶׁ֥ר טִמְּא֖וּ אֲחוֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: b'ney ya'akov bav 'al-hachalaliym vayavozv ha'iyr asher tim'v achvotam
translation: The other sons of Jacob came upon the slain and plundered the town, because their sister had been defiled.

hebrew: אֶת־צֹאנָ֥ם וְאֶת־בְּקָרָ֖ם וְאֶת־חֲמֹרֵיהֶ֑ם וְאֵ֧ת אֲשֶׁר־בָּעִ֛יר וְאֶת־אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֖ה לָקָֽחוּ׃
transliteration: et-tzonam v'et-b'karam v'et-chamoreyhem v'et asher-ba'iyr v'et-asher basadeh lakachv
translation: They seized their flocks and herds and asses, all that was inside the town and outside;

hebrew: וְאֶת־כָּל־חֵילָ֤ם וְאֶת־כָּל־טַפָּם֙ וְאֶת־נְשֵׁיהֶ֔ם שָׁב֖וּ וַיָּבֹ֑זּוּ וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּבָּֽיִת׃
transliteration: v'et-kal-cheylam v'et-kal-tapam v'et-n'sheyhem shavv vayavozv v'et kal-asher babayit
translation: all their wealth, all their children, and their wives, all that was in the houses, they took as captives and booty.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶל־שִׁמְע֣וֹן וְאֶל־לֵוִי֮ עֲכַרְתֶּ֣ם אֹתִי֒ לְהַבְאִישֵׁ֙נִי֙ בְּיֹשֵׁ֣ב הָאָ֔רֶץ בַּֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י וּבַפְּרִזִּ֑י וַאֲנִי֙ מְתֵ֣י מִסְפָּ֔ר וְנֶאֶסְפ֤וּ עָלַי֙ וְהִכּ֔וּנִי וְנִשְׁמַדְתִּ֖י אֲנִ֥י וּבֵיתִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov el-shim'von v'el-leviy 'akhar'tem otiy l'hav'iysheniy b'yoshev haaretz bak'na'aniy vvap'riziy vaaniy m'tey mis'par v'nees'fv 'alay v'hikvniy v'nish'mad'tiy aniy vveytiy
translation: Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, “You have brought trouble on me, making me odious among the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites and the Perizzites; my men are few in number, so that if they unite against me and attack me, I and my house will be destroyed.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֑וּ הַכְזוֹנָ֕ה יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה אֶת־אֲחוֹתֵֽנוּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayom'rv hakh'zvonah ya'aseh et-achvotenv (f)
translation: But they answered, “Should our sister be treated like a whore?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֔ב ק֛וּם עֲלֵ֥ה בֵֽית־אֵ֖ל וְשֶׁב־שָׁ֑ם וַעֲשֵׂה־שָׁ֣ם מִזְבֵּ֔חַ לָאֵל֙ הַנִּרְאֶ֣ה אֵלֶ֔יךָ בְּבָרְחֲךָ֔ מִפְּנֵ֖י עֵשָׂ֥ו אָחִֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym el-ya'akov kvm 'aleh veyt-el v'shev-sham va'aseh-sham miz'becha lael hanir'eh eleykha b'var'chakha mip'ney 'esav achiykha
translation: God said to Jacob, “Arise, go up to Bethel and remain there; and build an altar there to the God who appeared to you when you were fleeing from your brother Esau.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ אֶל־בֵּית֔וֹ וְאֶ֖ל כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמּ֑וֹ הָסִ֜רוּ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֤י הַנֵּכָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּתֹכְכֶ֔ם וְהִֽטַּהֲר֔וּ וְהַחֲלִ֖יפוּ שִׂמְלֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov el-beytvo v'el kal-asher 'imvo hasirv et-elohey hanekhar asher b'tokh'khem v'hitaharv v'hachaliyfv sim'loteykhem
translation: So Jacob said to his household and to all who were with him, “Rid yourselves of the alien gods in your midst, purify yourselves, and change your clothes.

hebrew: וְנָק֥וּמָה וְנַעֲלֶ֖ה בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂה־שָּׁ֣ם מִזְבֵּ֗חַ לָאֵ֞ל הָעֹנֶ֤ה אֹתִי֙ בְּי֣וֹם צָֽרָתִ֔י וַיְהִי֙ עִמָּדִ֔י בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלָֽכְתִּי׃
transliteration: v'nakvmah v'na'aleh beyt-el v'e'eseh-sham miz'becha lael ha'oneh otiy b'yvom tzaratiy vay'hiy 'imadiy baderekh' asher halakh'tiy
translation: Come, let us go up to Bethel, and I will build an altar there to the God who answered me when I was in distress and who has been with me wherever I have gone.”

hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֣וּ אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֗ב אֵ֣ת כָּל־אֱלֹהֵ֤י הַנֵּכָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיָדָ֔ם וְאֶת־הַנְּזָמִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּאָזְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּטְמֹ֤ן אֹתָם֙ יַעֲקֹ֔ב תַּ֥חַת הָאֵלָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עִם־שְׁכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayit'nv el-ya'akov et kal-elohey hanekhar asher b'yadam v'et-han'zamiym asher b'az'neyhem vayit'mon otam ya'akov tachat haelah asher 'im-sh'khem
translation: They gave to Jacob all the alien gods that they had, and the rings that were in their ears, and Jacob buried them under the terebinth that was near Shechem.

hebrew: וַיִּסָּ֑עוּ וַיְהִ֣י ׀ חִתַּ֣ת אֱלֹהִ֗ים עַל־הֶֽעָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ סְבִיבֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם וְלֹ֣א רָֽדְפ֔וּ אַחֲרֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: vayisa'v vay'hiy  chitat elohiym 'al-he'ariym asher s'viyvoteyhem v'lo rad'fv acharey b'ney ya'akov
translation: As they set out, a terror from God fell on the cities round about, so that they did not pursue the sons of Jacob.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א יַעֲקֹ֜ב ל֗וּזָה אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן הִ֖וא בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל ה֖וּא וְכָל־הָעָ֥ם אֲשֶׁר־עִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayavo ya'akov lvzah asher b'eretz k'na'an hiv beyt-el hv v'khal-ha'am asher-'imvo
translation: Thus Jacob came to Luz—that is, Bethel—in the land of Canaan, he and all the people who were with him.

hebrew: וַיִּ֤בֶן שָׁם֙ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ וַיִּקְרָא֙ לַמָּק֔וֹם אֵ֖ל בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל כִּ֣י שָׁ֗ם נִגְל֤וּ אֵלָיו֙ הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים בְּבָרְח֖וֹ מִפְּנֵ֥י אָחִֽיו׃
transliteration: vayiven sham miz'becha vayik'ra lamakvom el beyt-el kiy sham nig'lv elayv haelohiym b'var'chvo mip'ney achiyv
translation: There he built an altar and named the site El-bethel,a“The God of Bethel.” for it was there that God had revealed Himself to him when he was fleeing from his brother.

hebrew: וַתָּ֤מָת דְּבֹרָה֙ מֵינֶ֣קֶת רִבְקָ֔ה וַתִּקָּבֵ֛ר מִתַּ֥חַת לְבֵֽית־אֵ֖ל תַּ֣חַת הָֽאַלּ֑וֹן וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ אַלּ֥וֹן בָּכֽוּת׃ (פ)
transliteration: vatamat d'vorah meyneket riv'kah vatikaver mitachat l'veyt-el tachat haalvon vayik'ra sh'mvo alvon bakhvt (f)
translation: Deborah, Rebekah’s nurse, died, and was buried under the oak below Bethel; so it was named Allon-bacuth.bUnderstood as “the oak of the weeping.”

hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹב֙ ע֔וֹד בְּבֹא֖וֹ מִפַּדַּ֣ן אֲרָ֑ם וַיְבָ֖רֶךְ אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayera elohiym el-ya'akov 'vod b'vovo mipadan aram vay'varekh' otvo
translation: God appeared again to Jacob on his arrival from Paddan-aram, and He blessed him.

hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמֶר־ל֥וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים שִׁמְךָ֣ יַעֲקֹ֑ב לֹֽא־יִקָּרֵא֩ שִׁמְךָ֨ ע֜וֹד יַעֲקֹ֗ב כִּ֤י אִם־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה שְׁמֶ֔ךָ וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayomer-lvo elohiym shim'kha ya'akov lo-yikare shim'kha 'vod ya'akov kiy im-yis'rael yih'yeh sh'mekha vayik'ra et-sh'mvo yis'rael
translation:
God said to him,
“You whose name is Jacob,
You shall be called Jacob no more,
But Israel shall be your name.”
Thus He named him Israel.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֩ ל֨וֹ אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֲנִ֨י אֵ֤ל שַׁדַּי֙ פְּרֵ֣ה וּרְבֵ֔ה גּ֛וֹי וּקְהַ֥ל גּוֹיִ֖ם יִהְיֶ֣ה מִמֶּ֑ךָּ וּמְלָכִ֖ים מֵחֲלָצֶ֥יךָ יֵצֵֽאוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer lvo elohiym aniy el shaday p'reh vr'veh gvoy vk'hal gvoyim yih'yeh mimeka vm'lakhiym mechalatzeykha yetzev
translation:
And God said to him,
“I am El Shaddai.cCf. 17.1.
Be fertile and increase;
A nation, yea an assembly of nations,
Shall descend from you.
Kings shall issue from your loins.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֛תִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם וּלְיִצְחָ֖ק לְךָ֣ אֶתְּנֶ֑נָּה וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֥ אַחֲרֶ֖יךָ אֶתֵּ֥ן אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'et-haaretz asher natatiy l'av'raham vl'yitz'chak l'kha et'nenah vl'zar'akha achareykha eten et-haaretz
translation:
The land that I assigned to Abraham and Isaac
I assign to you;
And to your offspring to come
Will I assign the land.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל מֵעָלָ֖יו אֱלֹהִ֑ים בַּמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaya'al me'alayv elohiym bamakvom asher-diber itvo
translation: God parted from him at the spot where He had spoken to him;

hebrew: וַיַּצֵּ֨ב יַעֲקֹ֜ב מַצֵּבָ֗ה בַּמָּק֛וֹם אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ מַצֶּ֣בֶת אָ֑בֶן וַיַּסֵּ֤ךְ עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ נֶ֔סֶךְ וַיִּצֹ֥ק עָלֶ֖יהָ שָֽׁמֶן׃
transliteration: vayatzev ya'akov matzevah bamakvom asher-diber itvo matzevet aven vayasekh' 'aleyha nesekh' vayitzok 'aleyha shamen
translation: and Jacob set up a pillar at the site where He had spoken to him, a pillar of stone, and he offered a libation on it and poured oil upon it.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁר֩ דִּבֶּ֨ר אִתּ֥וֹ שָׁ֛ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים בֵּֽית־אֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayik'ra ya'akov et-shem hamakvom asher diber itvo sham elohiym beyt-el
translation: Jacob gave the site, where God had spoken to him, the name of Bethel.

hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית אֵ֔ל וַֽיְהִי־ע֥וֹד כִּבְרַת־הָאָ֖רֶץ לָב֣וֹא אֶפְרָ֑תָה וַתֵּ֥לֶד רָחֵ֖ל וַתְּקַ֥שׁ בְּלִדְתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayis'v mibeyt el vay'hiy-'vod kiv'rat-haaretz lavvo ef'ratah vateled rachel vat'kash b'lid'tah
translation: They set out from Bethel; but when they were still some distance short of Ephrath, Rachel was in childbirth, and she had hard labor.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י בְהַקְשֹׁתָ֖הּ בְּלִדְתָּ֑הּ וַתֹּ֨אמֶר לָ֤הּ הַמְיַלֶּ֙דֶת֙ אַל־תִּ֣ירְאִ֔י כִּֽי־גַם־זֶ֥ה לָ֖ךְ בֵּֽן׃
transliteration: vay'hiy v'hak'shotah b'lid'tah vatomer lah ham'yaledet al-tiyr'iy kiy-gam-zeh lakh' ben
translation: When her labor was at its hardest, the midwife said to her, “Have no fear, for it is another boy for you.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י בְּצֵ֤את נַפְשָׁהּ֙ כִּ֣י מֵ֔תָה וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ בֶּן־אוֹנִ֑י וְאָבִ֖יו קָֽרָא־ל֥וֹ בִנְיָמִֽין׃
transliteration: vay'hiy b'tzet naf'shah kiy metah vatik'ra sh'mvo ben-voniy v'aviyv kara-lvo vin'yamiyn
translation: But as she breathed her last—for she was dying—she named him Ben-oni;dUnderstood as “son of my suffering (or, strength).” but his father called him Benjamin.eI.e., “son of the right hand,” or “son of the south.”

hebrew: וַתָּ֖מָת רָחֵ֑ל וַתִּקָּבֵר֙ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ אֶפְרָ֔תָה הִ֖וא בֵּ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃
transliteration: vatamat rachel vatikaver b'derekh' ef'ratah hiv beyt lachem
translation: Thus Rachel died. She was buried on the road to Ephrath—now Bethlehem.

hebrew: וַיַּצֵּ֧ב יַעֲקֹ֛ב מַצֵּבָ֖ה עַל־קְבֻרָתָ֑הּ הִ֛וא מַצֶּ֥בֶת קְבֻֽרַת־רָחֵ֖ל עַד־הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayatzev ya'akov matzevah 'al-k'vuratah hiv matzevet k'vurat-rachel 'ad-hayvom
translation: Over her grave Jacob set up a pillar; it is the pillar at Rachel’s grave to this day.

hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֖ע יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֵּ֣ט אָֽהֳלֹ֔ה מֵהָ֖לְאָה לְמִגְדַּל־עֵֽדֶר׃
transliteration: vayisa' yis'rael vayet aholoh mehal'ah l'mig'dal-'eder
translation: Israel journeyed on, and pitched his tent beyond Migdal-eder.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בִּשְׁכֹּ֤ן יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַהִ֔וא וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ רְאוּבֵ֔ן וַיִּשְׁכַּ֕ב֙ אֶת־בִּלְהָ֖ה֙ פִּילֶ֣גֶשׁ אָבִ֑֔יו וַיִּשְׁמַ֖ע יִשְׂרָאֵֽ֑ל (פ) וַיִּֽהְי֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יַעֲקֹ֖ב שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃
transliteration: vay'hiy bish'kon yis'rael baaretz hahiv vayelekh' r'vven vayish'kav et-bil'hah piylegesh aviyv vayish'ma' yis'rael (f) vayih'yv v'ney-ya'akov sh'neym 'asar
translation:
While Israel stayed in that land, Reuben went and lay with Bilhah, his father’s concubine; and Israel found out.
Now the sons of Jacob were twelve in number.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י לֵאָ֔ה בְּכ֥וֹר יַעֲקֹ֖ב רְאוּבֵ֑ן וְשִׁמְעוֹן֙ וְלֵוִ֣י וִֽיהוּדָ֔ה וְיִשָּׂשכָ֖ר וּזְבוּלֻֽן׃
transliteration: b'ney leah b'khvor ya'akov r'vven v'shim'von v'leviy viyhvdah v'yisashkhar vz'vvlun
translation: The sons of Leah: Reuben—Jacob’s first-born—Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י רָחֵ֔ל יוֹסֵ֖ף וּבִנְיָמִֽן׃
transliteration: b'ney rachel yvosef vvin'yamin
translation: The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֤י בִלְהָה֙ שִׁפְחַ֣ת רָחֵ֔ל דָּ֖ן וְנַפְתָּלִֽי׃
transliteration: vv'ney vil'hah shif'chat rachel dan v'naf'taliy
translation: The sons of Bilhah, Rachel’s maid: Dan and Naphtali.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י זִלְפָּ֛ה שִׁפְחַ֥ת לֵאָ֖ה גָּ֣ד וְאָשֵׁ֑ר אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻלַּד־ל֖וֹ בְּפַדַּ֥ן אֲרָֽם׃
transliteration: vv'ney zil'pah shif'chat leah gad v'asher eleh b'ney ya'akov asher yulad-lvo b'fadan aram
translation: And the sons of Zilpah, Leah’s maid: Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob who were born to him in Paddan-aram.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א יַעֲקֹב֙ אֶל־יִצְחָ֣ק אָבִ֔יו מַמְרֵ֖א קִרְיַ֣ת הָֽאַרְבַּ֑ע הִ֣וא חֶבְר֔וֹן אֲשֶׁר־גָּֽר־שָׁ֥ם אַבְרָהָ֖ם וְיִצְחָֽק׃
transliteration: vayavo ya'akov el-yitz'chak aviyv mam're kir'yat haar'ba' hiv chev'rvon asher-gar-sham av'raham v'yitz'chak
translation: And Jacob came to his father Isaac at Mamre, at Kiriath-arba—now Hebron—where Abraham and Isaac had sojourned.

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֖וּ יְמֵ֣י יִצְחָ֑ק מְאַ֥ת שָׁנָ֖ה וּשְׁמֹנִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: vayih'yv y'mey yitz'chak m'at shanah vsh'moniym shanah
translation: Isaac was a hundred and eighty years old

hebrew: וַיִּגְוַ֨ע יִצְחָ֤ק וַיָּ֙מָת֙ וַיֵּאָ֣סֶף אֶל־עַמָּ֔יו זָקֵ֖ן וּשְׂבַ֣ע יָמִ֑ים וַיִּקְבְּר֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ עֵשָׂ֥ו וְיַעֲקֹ֖ב בָּנָֽיו׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayig'va' yitz'chak vayamat vayeasef el-'amayv zaken vs'va' yamiym vayik'b'rv otvo 'esav v'ya'akov banayv (f)
translation: when he breathed his last and died. HefLit. “Isaac.” was gathered to his kin in ripe old age; and he was buried by his sons Esau and Jacob.

hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תֹּלְד֥וֹת עֵשָׂ֖ו ה֥וּא אֱדֽוֹם׃
transliteration: v'eleh tol'dvot 'esav hv edvom
translation: This is the line of Esau—that is, Edom.

hebrew: עֵשָׂ֛ו לָקַ֥ח אֶת־נָשָׁ֖יו מִבְּנ֣וֹת כְּנָ֑עַן אֶת־עָדָ֗ה בַּת־אֵילוֹן֙ הַֽחִתִּ֔י וְאֶת־אָהֳלִֽיבָמָה֙ בַּת־עֲנָ֔ה בַּת־צִבְע֖וֹן הַֽחִוִּֽי׃
transliteration: 'esav lakach et-nashayv mib'nvot k'na'an et-'adah bat-eylvon hachitiy v'et-aholiyvamah bat-'anah bat-tziv'von hachiviy
translation: Esau took his wives from among the Canaanite women—Adah daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Oholibamah daughter of Anah daughter of Zibeon the HiviteaCf. v. 20, “Horite.”—

hebrew: וְאֶת־בָּשְׂמַ֥ת בַּת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל אֲח֥וֹת נְבָיֽוֹת׃
transliteration: v'et-bas'mat bat-yish'ma'el achvot n'vayvot
translation: and also Basemath daughter of Ishmael and sister of Nebaioth.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֧לֶד עָדָ֛ה לְעֵשָׂ֖ו אֶת־אֱלִיפָ֑ז וּבָ֣שְׂמַ֔ת יָלְדָ֖ה אֶת־רְעוּאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vateled 'adah l'esav et-eliyfaz vvas'mat yal'dah et-r'vel
translation: Adah bore to Esau Eliphaz; Basemath bore Reuel;

hebrew: וְאָהֳלִֽיבָמָה֙ יָֽלְדָ֔ה אֶת־יעיש [יְע֥וּשׁ] וְאֶת־יַעְלָ֖ם וְאֶת־קֹ֑רַח אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י עֵשָׂ֔ו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻלְּדוּ־ל֖וֹ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: v'aholiyvamah yal'dah et-y'ysh [y'vsh] v'et-ya'lam v'et-korach eleh b'ney 'esav asher yul'dv-lvo b'eretz k'na'an
translation: and Oholibamah bore Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. Those were the sons of Esau, who were born to him in the land of Canaan.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח עֵשָׂ֡ו אֶת־נָ֠שָׁיו וְאֶת־בָּנָ֣יו וְאֶת־בְּנֹתָיו֮ וְאֶת־כָּל־נַפְשׁ֣וֹת בֵּיתוֹ֒ וְאֶת־מִקְנֵ֣הוּ וְאֶת־כָּל־בְּהֶמְתּ֗וֹ וְאֵת֙ כָּל־קִנְיָנ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָכַ֖שׁ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ אֶל־אֶ֔רֶץ מִפְּנֵ֖י יַעֲקֹ֥ב אָחִֽיו׃
transliteration: vayikach 'esav et-nashayv v'et-banayv v'et-b'notayv v'et-kal-naf'shvot beytvo v'et-mik'nehv v'et-kal-b'hem'tvo v'et kal-kin'yanvo asher rakhash b'eretz k'na'an vayelekh' el-eretz mip'ney ya'akov achiyv
translation: Esau took his wives, his sons and daughters, and all the members of his household, his cattle and all his livestock, and all the property that he had acquired in the land of Canaan, and went to another land because of his brother Jacob.

hebrew: כִּֽי־הָיָ֧ה רְכוּשָׁ֛ם רָ֖ב מִשֶּׁ֣בֶת יַחְדָּ֑ו וְלֹ֨א יָֽכְלָ֜ה אֶ֤רֶץ מְגֽוּרֵיהֶם֙ לָשֵׂ֣את אֹתָ֔ם מִפְּנֵ֖י מִקְנֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: kiy-hayah r'khvsham rav mishevet yach'dav v'lo yakh'lah eretz m'gvreyhem laset otam mip'ney mik'neyhem
translation: For their possessions were too many for them to dwell together, and the land where they sojourned could not support them because of their livestock.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב עֵשָׂו֙ בְּהַ֣ר שֵׂעִ֔יר עֵשָׂ֖ו ה֥וּא אֱדֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayeshev 'esav b'har se'iyr 'esav hv edvom
translation: So Esau settled in the hill country of Seir—Esau being Edom.

hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תֹּלְד֥וֹת עֵשָׂ֖ו אֲבִ֣י אֱד֑וֹם בְּהַ֖ר שֵׂעִֽיר׃
transliteration: v'eleh tol'dvot 'esav aviy edvom b'har se'iyr
translation: This, then, is the line of Esau, the ancestor of the Edomites, in the hill country of Seir.

hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה שְׁמ֣וֹת בְּנֵֽי־עֵשָׂ֑ו אֱלִיפַ֗ז בֶּן־עָדָה֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת עֵשָׂ֔ו רְעוּאֵ֕ל בֶּן־בָּשְׂמַ֖ת אֵ֥שֶׁת עֵשָֽׂו׃
transliteration: eleh sh'mvot b'ney-'esav eliyfaz ben-'adah eshet 'esav r'vel ben-bas'mat eshet 'esav
translation: These are the names of Esau’s sons: Eliphaz, the son of Esau’s wife Adah; Reuel, the son of Esau’s wife Basemath.

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י אֱלִיפָ֑ז תֵּימָ֣ן אוֹמָ֔ר צְפ֥וֹ וְגַעְתָּ֖ם וּקְנַֽז׃
transliteration: vayih'yv b'ney eliyfaz teyman vomar tz'fvo v'ga'tam vk'naz
translation: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.

hebrew: וְתִמְנַ֣ע ׀ הָיְתָ֣ה פִילֶ֗גֶשׁ לֶֽאֱלִיפַז֙ בֶּן־עֵשָׂ֔ו וַתֵּ֥לֶד לֶאֱלִיפַ֖ז אֶת־עֲמָלֵ֑ק אֵ֕לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י עָדָ֖ה אֵ֥שֶׁת עֵשָֽׂו׃
transliteration: v'tim'na'  hay'tah fiylegesh leeliyfaz ben-'esav vateled leeliyfaz et-'amalek eleh b'ney 'adah eshet 'esav
translation: Timna was a concubine of Esau’s son Eliphaz; she bore Amalek to Eliphaz. Those were the descendants of Esau’s wife Adah.

hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ בְּנֵ֣י רְעוּאֵ֔ל נַ֥חַת וָזֶ֖רַח שַׁמָּ֣ה וּמִזָּ֑ה אֵ֣לֶּ֣ה הָי֔וּ בְּנֵ֥י בָשְׂמַ֖ת אֵ֥שֶׁת עֵשָֽׂו׃
transliteration: v'eleh b'ney r'vel nachat vazerach shamah vmizah eleh hayv b'ney vas'mat eshet 'esav
translation: And these were the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. Those were the descendants of Esau’s wife Basemath.

hebrew: וְאֵ֣לֶּה הָי֗וּ בְּנֵ֨י אָהֳלִיבָמָ֧ה בַת־עֲנָ֛ה בַּת־צִבְע֖וֹן אֵ֣שֶׁת עֵשָׂ֑ו וַתֵּ֣לֶד לְעֵשָׂ֔ו אֶת־יעיש [יְע֥וּשׁ] וְאֶת־יַעְלָ֖ם וְאֶת־קֹֽרַח׃
transliteration: v'eleh hayv b'ney aholiyvamah vat-'anah bat-tziv'von eshet 'esav vateled l'esav et-y'ysh [y'vsh] v'et-ya'lam v'et-korach
translation: And these were the sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah, daughter of Anah daughter of Zibeon: she bore to Esau Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.

hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־עֵשָׂ֑ו בְּנֵ֤י אֱלִיפַז֙ בְּכ֣וֹר עֵשָׂ֔ו אַלּ֤וּף תֵּימָן֙ אַלּ֣וּף אוֹמָ֔ר אַלּ֥וּף צְפ֖וֹ אַלּ֥וּף קְנַֽז׃
transliteration: eleh alvfey v'ney-'esav b'ney eliyfaz b'khvor 'esav alvf teyman alvf vomar alvf tz'fvo alvf k'naz
translation: These are the clans of the children of Esau. The descendants of Esau’s first-born Eliphaz: the clans Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz,

hebrew: אַלּֽוּף־קֹ֛רַח אַלּ֥וּף גַּעְתָּ֖ם אַלּ֣וּף עֲמָלֵ֑ק אֵ֣לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֤י אֱלִיפַז֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֱד֔וֹם אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י עָדָֽה׃
transliteration: alvf-korach alvf ga'tam alvf 'amalek eleh alvfey eliyfaz b'eretz edvom eleh b'ney 'adah
translation: Korah, Gatam, and Amalek; these are the clans of Eliphaz in the land of Edom. Those are the descendants of Adah.

hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה בְּנֵ֤י רְעוּאֵל֙ בֶּן־עֵשָׂ֔ו אַלּ֥וּף נַ֙חַת֙ אַלּ֣וּף זֶ֔רַח אַלּ֥וּף שַׁמָּ֖ה אַלּ֣וּף מִזָּ֑ה אֵ֣לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֤י רְעוּאֵל֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֱד֔וֹם אֵ֕לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י בָשְׂמַ֖ת אֵ֥שֶׁת עֵשָֽׂו׃
transliteration: v'eleh b'ney r'vel ben-'esav alvf nachat alvf zerach alvf shamah alvf mizah eleh alvfey r'vel b'eretz edvom eleh b'ney vas'mat eshet 'esav
