translation: And these are the descendants of Esau’s son Reuel: the clans Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah; these are the clans of Reuel in the land of Edom. Those are the descendants of Esau’s wife Basemath.

hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה בְּנֵ֤י אָהֳלִֽיבָמָה֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת עֵשָׂ֔ו אַלּ֥וּף יְע֛וּשׁ אַלּ֥וּף יַעְלָ֖ם אַלּ֣וּף קֹ֑רַח אֵ֣לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֞י אָֽהֳלִיבָמָ֛ה בַּת־עֲנָ֖ה אֵ֥שֶׁת עֵשָֽׂו׃
transliteration: v'eleh b'ney aholiyvamah eshet 'esav alvf y'vsh alvf ya'lam alvf korach eleh alvfey aholiyvamah bat-'anah eshet 'esav
translation: And these are the descendants of Esau’s wife Oholibamah: the clans Jeush, Jalam, and Korah; these are the clans of Esau’s wife Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah.

hebrew: אֵ֧לֶּה בְנֵי־עֵשָׂ֛ו וְאֵ֥לֶּה אַלּוּפֵיהֶ֖ם ה֥וּא אֱדֽוֹם׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh v'ney-'esav v'eleh alvfeyhem hv edvom (s)
translation: Those were the sons of Esau—that is, Edom—and those are their clans.

hebrew: אֵ֤לֶּה בְנֵֽי־שֵׂעִיר֙ הַחֹרִ֔י יֹשְׁבֵ֖י הָאָ֑רֶץ לוֹטָ֥ן וְשׁוֹבָ֖ל וְצִבְע֥וֹן וַעֲנָֽה׃
transliteration: eleh v'ney-se'iyr hachoriy yosh'vey haaretz lvotan v'shvoval v'tziv'von va'anah
translation: These were the sons of Seir the Horite, who were settled in the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,

hebrew: וְדִשׁ֥וֹן וְאֵ֖צֶר וְדִישָׁ֑ן אֵ֣לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֧י הַחֹרִ֛י בְּנֵ֥י שֵׂעִ֖יר בְּאֶ֥רֶץ אֱדֽוֹם׃
transliteration: v'dishvon v'etzer v'diyshan eleh alvfey hachoriy b'ney se'iyr b'eretz edvom
translation: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. Those are the clans of the Horites, the descendants of Seir, in the land of Edom.

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ בְנֵי־לוֹטָ֖ן חֹרִ֣י וְהֵימָ֑ם וַאֲח֥וֹת לוֹטָ֖ן תִּמְנָֽע׃
transliteration: vayih'yv v'ney-lvotan choriy v'heymam vaachvot lvotan tim'na'
translation: The sons of Lotan were Hori and Hemam; and Lotan’s sister was Timna.

hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ בְּנֵ֣י שׁוֹבָ֔ל עַלְוָ֥ן וּמָנַ֖חַת וְעֵיבָ֑ל שְׁפ֖וֹ וְאוֹנָֽם׃
transliteration: v'eleh b'ney shvoval 'al'van vmanachat v'eyval sh'fvo v'vonam
translation: The sons of Shobal were these: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.

hebrew: וְאֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵֽי־צִבְע֖וֹן וְאַיָּ֣ה וַעֲנָ֑ה ה֣וּא עֲנָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר מָצָ֤א אֶת־הַיֵּמִם֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר בִּרְעֹת֥וֹ אֶת־הַחֲמֹרִ֖ים לְצִבְע֥וֹן אָבִֽיו׃
transliteration: v'eleh v'ney-tziv'von v'ayah va'anah hv 'anah asher matza et-hayemim bamid'bar bir'otvo et-hachamoriym l'tziv'von aviyv
translation: The sons of Zibeon were these: AiahbHeb. “and Aiah.” and Anah—that was the Anah who discovered the hot springscMeaning of Heb. yemim uncertain. in the wilderness while pasturing the asses of his father Zibeon.

hebrew: וְאֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵֽי־עֲנָ֖ה דִּשֹׁ֑ן וְאָהֳלִיבָמָ֖ה בַּת־עֲנָֽה׃
transliteration: v'eleh v'ney-'anah dishon v'aholiyvamah bat-'anah
translation: The children of Anah were these: Dishon and Anah’s daughter Oholibamah.

hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י דִישָׁ֑ן חֶמְדָּ֥ן וְאֶשְׁבָּ֖ן וְיִתְרָ֥ן וּכְרָֽן׃
transliteration: v'eleh b'ney diyshan chem'dan v'esh'ban v'yit'ran vkh'ran
translation: The sons of DishondHeb. Dishan; but cf. vv. 21, 25, 28, and 30, and 1 Chron. 1.41. were these: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.

hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵי־אֵ֑צֶר בִּלְהָ֥ן וְזַעֲוָ֖ן וַעֲקָֽן׃
transliteration: eleh b'ney-etzer bil'han v'za'avan va'akan
translation: The sons of Ezer were these: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.

hebrew: אֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵֽי־דִישָׁ֖ן ע֥וּץ וַאֲרָֽן׃
transliteration: eleh v'ney-diyshan 'vtz vaaran
translation: And the sons of Dishan were these: Uz and Aran.

hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֣י הַחֹרִ֑י אַלּ֤וּף לוֹטָן֙ אַלּ֣וּף שׁוֹבָ֔ל אַלּ֥וּף צִבְע֖וֹן אַלּ֥וּף עֲנָֽה׃
transliteration: eleh alvfey hachoriy alvf lvotan alvf shvoval alvf tziv'von alvf 'anah
translation: These are the clans of the Horites: the clans Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,

hebrew: אַלּ֥וּף דִּשֹׁ֛ן אַלּ֥וּף אֵ֖צֶר אַלּ֣וּף דִּישָׁ֑ן אֵ֣לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֧י הַחֹרִ֛י לְאַלֻּפֵיהֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ שֵׂעִֽיר׃ (פ)
transliteration: alvf dishon alvf etzer alvf diyshan eleh alvfey hachoriy l'alufeyhem b'eretz se'iyr (f)
translation: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. Those are the clans of the Horites, clan by clan, in the land of Seir.

hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ הַמְּלָכִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר מָלְכ֖וּ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֱד֑וֹם לִפְנֵ֥י מְלָךְ־מֶ֖לֶךְ לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'eleh ham'lakhiym asher mal'khv b'eretz edvom lif'ney m'lakh'-melekh' liv'ney yis'rael
translation: These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites.

hebrew: וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ בֶּאֱד֔וֹם בֶּ֖לַע בֶּן־בְּע֑וֹר וְשֵׁ֥ם עִיר֖וֹ דִּנְהָֽבָה׃
transliteration: vayim'lokh' beedvom bela' ben-b'vor v'shem 'iyrvo din'havah
translation: Bela son of Beor reigned in Edom, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

hebrew: וַיָּ֖מָת בָּ֑לַע וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו יוֹבָ֥ב בֶּן־זֶ֖רַח מִבָּצְרָֽה׃
transliteration: vayamat bala' vayim'lokh' tach'tayv yvovav ben-zerach mibatz'rah
translation: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah, from Bozrah, succeeded him as king.

hebrew: וַיָּ֖מָת יוֹבָ֑ב וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו חֻשָׁ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ הַתֵּימָנִֽי׃
transliteration: vayamat yvovav vayim'lokh' tach'tayv chusham meeretz hateymaniy
translation: When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites succeeded him as king.

hebrew: וַיָּ֖מָת חֻשָׁ֑ם וַיִּמְלֹ֨ךְ תַּחְתָּ֜יו הֲדַ֣ד בֶּן־בְּדַ֗ד הַמַּכֶּ֤ה אֶת־מִדְיָן֙ בִּשְׂדֵ֣ה מוֹאָ֔ב וְשֵׁ֥ם עִיר֖וֹ עֲוִֽית׃
transliteration: vayamat chusham vayim'lokh' tach'tayv hadad ben-b'dad hamakeh et-mid'yan bis'deh mvoav v'shem 'iyrvo 'aviyt
translation: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated the Midianites in the country of Moab, succeeded him as king; the name of his city was Avith.

hebrew: וַיָּ֖מָת הֲדָ֑ד וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו שַׂמְלָ֖ה מִמַּשְׂרֵקָֽה׃
transliteration: vayamat hadad vayim'lokh' tach'tayv sam'lah mimas'rekah
translation: When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah succeeded him as king.

hebrew: וַיָּ֖מָת שַׂמְלָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו שָׁא֖וּל מֵרְחֹב֥וֹת הַנָּהָֽר׃
transliteration: vayamat sam'lah vayim'lokh' tach'tayv shavl mer'chovvot hanahar
translation: When Samlah died, SauleOr “Shaul.” of Rehoboth-on-the-river succeeded him as king.

hebrew: וַיָּ֖מָת שָׁא֑וּל וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו בַּ֥עַל חָנָ֖ן בֶּן־עַכְבּֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vayamat shavl vayim'lokh' tach'tayv ba'al chanan ben-'akh'bvor
translation: When Saul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor succeeded him as king.

hebrew: וַיָּמָת֮ בַּ֣עַל חָנָ֣ן בֶּן־עַכְבּוֹר֒ וַיִּמְלֹ֤ךְ תַּחְתָּיו֙ הֲדַ֔ר וְשֵׁ֥ם עִיר֖וֹ פָּ֑עוּ וְשֵׁ֨ם אִשְׁתּ֤וֹ מְהֵֽיטַבְאֵל֙ בַּת־מַטְרֵ֔ד בַּ֖ת מֵ֥י זָהָֽב׃
transliteration: vayamat ba'al chanan ben-'akh'bvor vayim'lokh' tach'tayv hadar v'shem 'iyrvo pa'v v'shem ish'tvo m'heytav'el bat-mat'red bat mey zahav
translation: And when Baal-hanan son of Achbor died, Hadar succeeded him as king; the name of his city was Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred daughter of Me-zahab.

hebrew: וְ֠אֵלֶּה שְׁמ֞וֹת אַלּוּפֵ֤י עֵשָׂו֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔ם לִמְקֹמֹתָ֖ם בִּשְׁמֹתָ֑ם אַלּ֥וּף תִּמְנָ֛ע אַלּ֥וּף עַֽלְוָ֖ה אַלּ֥וּף יְתֵֽת׃
transliteration: v'eleh sh'mvot alvfey 'esav l'mish'p'chotam lim'komotam bish'motam alvf tim'na' alvf 'al'vah alvf y'tet
translation: These are the names of the clans of Esau, each with its families and locality, name by name: the clans Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,

hebrew: אַלּ֧וּף אָהֳלִיבָמָ֛ה אַלּ֥וּף אֵלָ֖ה אַלּ֥וּף פִּינֹֽן׃
transliteration: alvf aholiyvamah alvf elah alvf piynon
translation: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,

hebrew: אַלּ֥וּף קְנַ֛ז אַלּ֥וּף תֵּימָ֖ן אַלּ֥וּף מִבְצָֽר׃
transliteration: alvf k'naz alvf teyman alvf miv'tzar
translation: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,

hebrew: אַלּ֥וּף מַגְדִּיאֵ֖ל אַלּ֣וּף עִירָ֑ם אֵ֣לֶּה ׀ אַלּוּפֵ֣י אֱד֗וֹם לְמֹֽשְׁבֹתָם֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֲחֻזָּתָ֔ם ה֥וּא עֵשָׂ֖ו אֲבִ֥י אֱדֽוֹם׃ (פ)
transliteration: alvf mag'diyel alvf 'iyram eleh  alvfey edvom l'mosh'votam b'eretz achuzatam hv 'esav aviy edvom (f)
translation: Magdiel, and Iram. Those are the clans of Edom—that is, of Esau, father of the Edomites—by their settlements in the land which they hold.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּאֶ֖רֶץ מְגוּרֵ֣י אָבִ֑יו בְּאֶ֖רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: vayeshev ya'akov b'eretz m'gvrey aviyv b'eretz k'na'an
translation: Now Jacob was settled in the land where his father had sojourned, the land of Canaan.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה ׀ תֹּלְד֣וֹת יַעֲקֹ֗ב יוֹסֵ֞ף בֶּן־שְׁבַֽע־עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ הָיָ֨ה רֹעֶ֤ה אֶת־אֶחָיו֙ בַּצֹּ֔אן וְה֣וּא נַ֗עַר אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י בִלְהָ֛ה וְאֶת־בְּנֵ֥י זִלְפָּ֖ה נְשֵׁ֣י אָבִ֑יו וַיָּבֵ֥א יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶת־דִּבָּתָ֥ם רָעָ֖ה אֶל־אֲבִיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: eleh  tol'dvot ya'akov yvosef ben-sh'va'-'es'reh shanah hayah ro'eh et-echayv batzon v'hv na'ar et-b'ney vil'hah v'et-b'ney zil'pah n'shey aviyv vayave yvosef et-dibatam ra'ah el-aviyhem
translation:
This, then, is the line of Jacob:
At seventeen years of age, Joseph tended the flocks with his brothers, as a helper to the sons of his father’s wives Bilhah and Zilpah. And Joseph brought bad reports of them to their father.

hebrew: וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אָהַ֤ב אֶת־יוֹסֵף֙ מִכָּל־בָּנָ֔יו כִּֽי־בֶן־זְקֻנִ֥ים ה֖וּא ל֑וֹ וְעָ֥שָׂה ל֖וֹ כְּתֹ֥נֶת פַּסִּֽים׃
transliteration: v'yis'rael ahav et-yvosef mikal-banayv kiy-ven-z'kuniym hv lvo v'asah lvo k'tonet pasiym
translation: Now Israel loved Joseph best of all his sons, for he was the child of his old age; and he had made him an ornamented tunic.aOr “a coat of many colors”; meaning of Heb. uncertain.

hebrew: וַיִּרְא֣וּ אֶחָ֗יו כִּֽי־אֹת֞וֹ אָהַ֤ב אֲבִיהֶם֙ מִכָּל־אֶחָ֔יו וַֽיִּשְׂנְא֖וּ אֹת֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א יָכְל֖וּ דַּבְּר֥וֹ לְשָׁלֹֽם׃
transliteration: vayir'v echayv kiy-otvo ahav aviyhem mikal-echayv vayis'n'v otvo v'lo yakh'lv dab'rvo l'shalom
translation: And when his brothers saw that their father loved him more than any of his brothers, they hated him so that they could not speak a friendly word to him.

hebrew: וַיַּחֲלֹ֤ם יוֹסֵף֙ חֲל֔וֹם וַיַּגֵּ֖ד לְאֶחָ֑יו וַיּוֹסִ֥פוּ ע֖וֹד שְׂנֹ֥א אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayachalom yvosef chalvom vayaged l'echayv vayvosifv 'vod s'no otvo
translation: Once Joseph had a dream which he told to his brothers; and they hated him even more.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֕א הַחֲל֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָלָֽמְתִּי׃
transliteration: vayomer aleyhem shim'v-na hachalvom hazeh asher chalam'tiy
translation: He said to them, “Hear this dream which I have dreamed:

hebrew: וְ֠הִנֵּה אֲנַ֜חְנוּ מְאַלְּמִ֤ים אֲלֻמִּים֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֛ה קָ֥מָה אֲלֻמָּתִ֖י וְגַם־נִצָּ֑בָה וְהִנֵּ֤ה תְסֻבֶּ֙ינָה֙ אֲלֻמֹּ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וַתִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖יןָ לַאֲלֻמָּתִֽי׃
transliteration: v'hineh anach'nv m'al'miym alumiym b'tvokh' hasadeh v'hineh kamah alumatiy v'gam-nitzavah v'hineh t'subeynah alumoteykhem vatish'tachaveyna laalumatiy
translation: There we were binding sheaves in the field, when suddenly my sheaf stood up and remained upright; then your sheaves gathered around and bowed low to my sheaf.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמְרוּ לוֹ֙ אֶחָ֔יו הֲמָלֹ֤ךְ תִּמְלֹךְ֙ עָלֵ֔ינוּ אִם־מָשׁ֥וֹל תִּמְשֹׁ֖ל בָּ֑נוּ וַיּוֹסִ֤פוּ עוֹד֙ שְׂנֹ֣א אֹת֔וֹ עַל־חֲלֹמֹתָ֖יו וְעַל־דְּבָרָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayom'rv lvo echayv hamalokh' tim'lokh' 'aleynv im-mashvol tim'shol banv vayvosifv 'vod s'no otvo 'al-chalomotayv v'al-d'varayv
translation: His brothers answered, “Do you mean to reign over us? Do you mean to rule over us?” And they hated him even more for his talk about his dreams.

hebrew: וַיַּחֲלֹ֥ם עוֹד֙ חֲל֣וֹם אַחֵ֔ר וַיְסַפֵּ֥ר אֹת֖וֹ לְאֶחָ֑יו וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֨ה חָלַ֤מְתִּֽי חֲלוֹם֙ ע֔וֹד וְהִנֵּ֧ה הַשֶּׁ֣מֶשׁ וְהַיָּרֵ֗חַ וְאַחַ֤ד עָשָׂר֙ כּֽוֹכָבִ֔ים מִֽשְׁתַּחֲוִ֖ים לִֽי׃
transliteration: vayachalom 'vod chalvom acher vay'saper otvo l'echayv vayomer hineh chalam'tiy chalvom 'vod v'hineh hashemesh v'hayarecha v'achad 'asar kvokhaviym mish'tachaviym liy
translation: He dreamed another dream and told it to his brothers, saying, “Look, I have had another dream: And this time, the sun, the moon, and eleven stars were bowing down to me.”

hebrew: וַיְסַפֵּ֣ר אֶל־אָבִיו֮ וְאֶל־אֶחָיו֒ וַיִּגְעַר־בּ֣וֹ אָבִ֔יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ מָ֛ה הַחֲל֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָלָ֑מְתָּ הֲב֣וֹא נָב֗וֹא אֲנִי֙ וְאִמְּךָ֣ וְאַחֶ֔יךָ לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֥ת לְךָ֖ אָֽרְצָה׃
transliteration: vay'saper el-aviyv v'el-echayv vayig'ar-bvo aviyv vayomer lvo mah hachalvom hazeh asher chalam'ta havvo navvo aniy v'im'kha v'acheykha l'hish'tachavot l'kha ar'tzah
translation: And when he told it to his father and brothers, his father berated him. “What,” he said to him, “is this dream you have dreamed? Are we to come, I and your mother and your brothers, and bow low to you to the ground?”

hebrew: וַיְקַנְאוּ־ב֖וֹ אֶחָ֑יו וְאָבִ֖יו שָׁמַ֥ר אֶת־הַדָּבָֽר׃
transliteration: vay'kan'v-vvo echayv v'aviyv shamar et-hadavar
translation: So his brothers were wrought up at him, and his father kept the matter in mind.

hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ אֶחָ֑יו לִרְע֛וֹת אֶׄתׄ־צֹ֥אן אֲבִיהֶ֖ם בִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayel'khv echayv lir'vot et-tzon aviyhem bish'khem
translation: One time, when his brothers had gone to pasture their father’s flock at Shechem,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶל־יוֹסֵ֗ף הֲל֤וֹא אַחֶ֙יךָ֙ רֹעִ֣ים בִּשְׁכֶ֔ם לְכָ֖ה וְאֶשְׁלָחֲךָ֣ אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹ הִנֵּֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayomer yis'rael el-yvosef halvo acheykha ro'iym bish'khem l'khah v'esh'lachakha aleyhem vayomer lvo hineniy
translation: Israel said to Joseph, “Your brothers are pasturing at Shechem. Come, I will send you to them.” He answered, “I am ready.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ לֶךְ־נָ֨א רְאֵ֜ה אֶת־שְׁל֤וֹם אַחֶ֙יךָ֙ וְאֶת־שְׁל֣וֹם הַצֹּ֔אן וַהֲשִׁבֵ֖נִי דָּבָ֑ר וַיִּשְׁלָחֵ֙הוּ֙ מֵעֵ֣מֶק חֶבְר֔וֹן וַיָּבֹ֖א שְׁכֶֽמָה׃
transliteration: vayomer lvo lekh'-na r'eh et-sh'lvom acheykha v'et-sh'lvom hatzon vahashiveniy davar vayish'lachehv me'emek chev'rvon vayavo sh'khemah
translation:
And he said to him, “Go and see how your brothers are and how the flocks are faring, and bring me back word.” So he sent him from the valley of Hebron.
When he reached Shechem,

hebrew: וַיִּמְצָאֵ֣הוּ אִ֔ישׁ וְהִנֵּ֥ה תֹעֶ֖ה בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וַיִּשְׁאָלֵ֧הוּ הָאִ֛ישׁ לֵאמֹ֖ר מַה־תְּבַקֵּֽשׁ׃
transliteration: vayim'tzaehv iysh v'hineh to'eh basadeh vayish'alehv haiysh lemor mah-t'vakesh
translation: a man came upon him wandering in the fields. The man asked him, “What are you looking for?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אֶת־אַחַ֖י אָנֹכִ֣י מְבַקֵּ֑שׁ הַגִּֽידָה־נָּ֣א לִ֔י אֵיפֹ֖ה הֵ֥ם רֹעִֽים׃
transliteration: vayomer et-achay anokhiy m'vakesh hagiydah-na liy eyfoh hem ro'iym
translation: He answered, “I am looking for my brothers. Could you tell me where they are pasturing?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הָאִישׁ֙ נָסְע֣וּ מִזֶּ֔ה כִּ֤י שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֹֽמְרִ֔ים נֵלְכָ֖ה דֹּתָ֑יְנָה וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ יוֹסֵף֙ אַחַ֣ר אֶחָ֔יו וַיִּמְצָאֵ֖ם בְּדֹתָֽן׃
transliteration: vayomer haiysh nas'v mizeh kiy shama'tiy om'riym nel'khah dotay'nah vayelekh' yvosef achar echayv vayim'tzaem b'dotan
translation: The man said, “They have gone from here, for I heard them say: Let us go to Dothan.” So Joseph followed his brothers and found them at Dothan.

hebrew: וַיִּרְא֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ מֵרָחֹ֑ק וּבְטֶ֙רֶם֙ יִקְרַ֣ב אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּֽתְנַכְּל֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ לַהֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayir'v otvo merachok vv'terem yik'rav aleyhem vayit'nak'lv otvo lahamiytvo
translation: They saw him from afar, and before he came close to them they conspired to kill him.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֑יו הִנֵּ֗ה בַּ֛עַל הַחֲלֹמ֥וֹת הַלָּזֶ֖ה בָּֽא׃
transliteration: vayom'rv iysh el-achiyv hineh ba'al hachalomvot halazeh ba
translation: They said to one another, “Here comes that dreamer!

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ לְכ֣וּ וְנַֽהַרְגֵ֗הוּ וְנַשְׁלִכֵ֙הוּ֙ בְּאַחַ֣ד הַבֹּר֔וֹת וְאָמַ֕רְנוּ חַיָּ֥ה רָעָ֖ה אֲכָלָ֑תְהוּ וְנִרְאֶ֕ה מַה־יִּהְי֖וּ חֲלֹמֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'atah  l'khv v'nahar'gehv v'nash'likhehv b'achad haborvot v'amar'nv chayah ra'ah akhalat'hv v'nir'eh mah-yih'yv chalomotayv
translation: Come now, let us kill him and throw him into one of the pits; and we can say, ‘A savage beast devoured him.’ We shall see what comes of his dreams!”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע רְאוּבֵ֔ן וַיַּצִּלֵ֖הוּ מִיָּדָ֑ם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹ֥א נַכֶּ֖נּוּ נָֽפֶשׁ׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' r'vven vayatzilehv miyadam vayomer lo nakenv nafesh
translation: But when Reuben heard it, he tried to save him from them. He said, “Let us not take his life.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֣ם ׀ רְאוּבֵן֮ אַל־תִּשְׁפְּכוּ־דָם֒ הַשְׁלִ֣יכוּ אֹת֗וֹ אֶל־הַבּ֤וֹר הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר וְיָ֖ד אַל־תִּשְׁלְחוּ־ב֑וֹ לְמַ֗עַן הַצִּ֤יל אֹתוֹ֙ מִיָּדָ֔ם לַהֲשִׁיב֖וֹ אֶל־אָבִֽיו׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem  r'vven al-tish'p'khv-dam hash'liykhv otvo el-habvor hazeh asher bamid'bar v'yad al-tish'l'chv-vvo l'ma'an hatziyl otvo miyadam lahashiyvvo el-aviyv
translation: And Reuben went on, “Shed no blood! Cast him into that pit out in the wilderness, but do not touch him yourselves”—intending to save him from them and restore him to his father.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֕י כַּֽאֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥א יוֹסֵ֖ף אֶל־אֶחָ֑יו וַיַּפְשִׁ֤יטוּ אֶת־יוֹסֵף֙ אֶת־כֻּתָּנְתּ֔וֹ אֶת־כְּתֹ֥נֶת הַפַּסִּ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kaasher-ba yvosef el-echayv vayaf'shiytv et-yvosef et-kutan'tvo et-k'tonet hapasiym asher 'alayv
translation: When Joseph came up to his brothers, they stripped Joseph of his tunic, the ornamented tunic that he was wearing,

hebrew: וַיִּ֨קָּחֻ֔הוּ וַיַּשְׁלִ֥כוּ אֹת֖וֹ הַבֹּ֑רָה וְהַבּ֣וֹר רֵ֔ק אֵ֥ין בּ֖וֹ מָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayikachuhv vayash'likhv otvo haborah v'habvor rek eyn bvo mayim
translation: and took him and cast him into the pit. The pit was empty; there was no water in it.

hebrew: וַיֵּשְׁבוּ֮ לֶֽאֱכָל־לֶחֶם֒ וַיִּשְׂא֤וּ עֵֽינֵיהֶם֙ וַיִּרְא֔וּ וְהִנֵּה֙ אֹרְחַ֣ת יִשְׁמְעֵאלִ֔ים בָּאָ֖ה מִגִּלְעָ֑ד וּגְמַלֵּיהֶ֣ם נֹֽשְׂאִ֗ים נְכֹאת֙ וּצְרִ֣י וָלֹ֔ט הוֹלְכִ֖ים לְהוֹרִ֥יד מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
transliteration: vayesh'vv leekhal-lechem vayis'v 'eyneyhem vayir'v v'hineh or'chat yish'm'eliym baah migil'ad vg'maleyhem nos'iym n'khot vtz'riy valot hvol'khiym l'hvoriyd mitz'ray'mah
translation: Then they sat down to a meal. Looking up, they saw a caravan of Ishmaelites coming from Gilead, their camels bearing gum, balm, and ladanum to be taken to Egypt.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוּדָ֖ה אֶל־אֶחָ֑יו מַה־בֶּ֗צַע כִּ֤י נַהֲרֹג֙ אֶת־אָחִ֔ינוּ וְכִסִּ֖ינוּ אֶת־דָּמֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvdah el-echayv mah-betza' kiy naharog et-achiynv v'khisiynv et-damvo
translation: Then Judah said to his brothers, “What do we gain by killing our brother and covering up his blood?

hebrew: לְכ֞וּ וְנִמְכְּרֶ֣נּוּ לַיִּשְׁמְעֵאלִ֗ים וְיָדֵ֙נוּ֙ אַל־תְּהִי־ב֔וֹ כִּֽי־אָחִ֥ינוּ בְשָׂרֵ֖נוּ ה֑וּא וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֖וּ אֶחָֽיו׃
transliteration: l'khv v'nim'k'renv layish'm'eliym v'yadenv al-t'hiy-vvo kiy-achiynv v'sarenv hv vayish'm'v echayv
translation: Come, let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, but let us not do away with him ourselves. After all, he is our brother, our own flesh.” His brothers agreed.

hebrew: וַיַּֽעַבְרוּ֩ אֲנָשִׁ֨ים מִדְיָנִ֜ים סֹֽחֲרִ֗ים וַֽיִּמְשְׁכוּ֙ וַיַּֽעֲל֤וּ אֶת־יוֹסֵף֙ מִן־הַבּ֔וֹר וַיִּמְכְּר֧וּ אֶת־יוֹסֵ֛ף לַיִּשְׁמְעֵאלִ֖ים בְּעֶשְׂרִ֣ים כָּ֑סֶף וַיָּבִ֥יאוּ אֶת־יוֹסֵ֖ף מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
transliteration: vaya'av'rv anashiym mid'yaniym sochariym vayim'sh'khv vaya'alv et-yvosef min-habvor vayim'k'rv et-yvosef layish'm'eliym b'es'riym kasef vayaviyv et-yvosef mitz'ray'mah
translation: When Midianite traders passed by, they pulled Joseph up out of the pit. They sold Joseph for twenty pieces of silver to the Ishmaelites, who brought Joseph to Egypt.

hebrew: וַיָּ֤שָׁב רְאוּבֵן֙ אֶל־הַבּ֔וֹר וְהִנֵּ֥ה אֵין־יוֹסֵ֖ף בַּבּ֑וֹר וַיִּקְרַ֖ע אֶת־בְּגָדָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayashav r'vven el-habvor v'hineh eyn-yvosef babvor vayik'ra' et-b'gadayv
translation: When Reuben returned to the pit and saw that Joseph was not in the pit, he rent his clothes.

hebrew: וַיָּ֥שָׁב אֶל־אֶחָ֖יו וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַיֶּ֣לֶד אֵינֶ֔נּוּ וַאֲנִ֖י אָ֥נָה אֲנִי־בָֽא׃
transliteration: vayashav el-echayv vayomar hayeled eynenv vaaniy anah aniy-va
translation: Returning to his brothers, he said, “The boy is gone! Now, what am I to do?”

hebrew: וַיִּקְח֖וּ אֶת־כְּתֹ֣נֶת יוֹסֵ֑ף וַֽיִּשְׁחֲטוּ֙ שְׂעִ֣יר עִזִּ֔ים וַיִּטְבְּל֥וּ אֶת־הַכֻּתֹּ֖נֶת בַּדָּֽם׃
transliteration: vayik'chv et-k'tonet yvosef vayish'chatv s'iyr 'iziym vayit'b'lv et-hakutonet badam
translation: Then they took Joseph’s tunic, slaughtered a kid, and dipped the tunic in the blood.

hebrew: וַֽיְשַׁלְּח֞וּ אֶת־כְּתֹ֣נֶת הַפַּסִּ֗ים וַיָּבִ֙יאוּ֙ אֶל־אֲבִיהֶ֔ם וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ זֹ֣את מָצָ֑אנוּ הַכֶּר־נָ֗א הַכְּתֹ֧נֶת בִּנְךָ֛ הִ֖וא אִם־לֹֽא׃
transliteration: vay'shal'chv et-k'tonet hapasiym vayaviyv el-aviyhem vayom'rv zot matzanv haker-na hak'tonet bin'kha hiv im-lo
translation: They had the ornamented tunic taken to their father, and they said, “We found this. Please examine it; is it your son’s tunic or not?”

hebrew: וַיַּכִּירָ֤הּ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ כְּתֹ֣נֶת בְּנִ֔י חַיָּ֥ה רָעָ֖ה אֲכָלָ֑תְהוּ טָרֹ֥ף טֹרַ֖ף יוֹסֵֽף׃
transliteration: vayakiyrah vayomer k'tonet b'niy chayah ra'ah akhalat'hv tarof toraf yvosef
translation: He recognized it, and said, “My son’s tunic! A savage beast devoured him! Joseph was torn by a beast!”

hebrew: וַיִּקְרַ֤ע יַעֲקֹב֙ שִׂמְלֹתָ֔יו וַיָּ֥שֶׂם שַׂ֖ק בְּמָתְנָ֑יו וַיִּתְאַבֵּ֥ל עַל־בְּנ֖וֹ יָמִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃
transliteration: vayik'ra' ya'akov sim'lotayv vayasem sak b'mat'nayv vayit'abel 'al-b'nvo yamiym rabiym
translation: Jacob rent his clothes, put sackcloth on his loins, and observed mourning for his son many days.

hebrew: וַיָּקֻמוּ֩ כָל־בָּנָ֨יו וְכָל־בְּנֹתָ֜יו לְנַחֲמ֗וֹ וַיְמָאֵן֙ לְהִתְנַחֵ֔ם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר כִּֽי־אֵרֵ֧ד אֶל־בְּנִ֛י אָבֵ֖ל שְׁאֹ֑לָה וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ אֹת֖וֹ אָבִֽיו׃
transliteration: vayakumv khal-banayv v'khal-b'notayv l'nachamvo vay'maen l'hit'nachem vayomer kiy-ered el-b'niy avel sh'olah vayev'k' otvo aviyv
translation: All his sons and daughters sought to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted, saying, “No, I will go down mourning to my son in Sheol.” Thus his father bewailed him.

hebrew: וְהַ֨מְּדָנִ֔ים מָכְר֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ אֶל־מִצְרָ֑יִם לְפֽוֹטִיפַר֙ סְרִ֣יס פַּרְעֹ֔ה שַׂ֖ר הַטַּבָּחִֽים׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'ham'daniym makh'rv otvo el-mitz'rayim l'fvotiyfar s'riys par'oh sar hatabachiym (f)
translation: The Midianites,bHeb. “Medanites.” meanwhile, sold him in Egypt to Potiphar, a courtier of Pharaoh and his chief steward.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא וַיֵּ֥רֶד יְהוּדָ֖ה מֵאֵ֣ת אֶחָ֑יו וַיֵּ֛ט עַד־אִ֥ישׁ עֲדֻלָּמִ֖י וּשְׁמ֥וֹ חִירָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy ba'et hahiv vayered y'hvdah meet echayv vayet 'ad-iysh 'adulamiy vsh'mvo chiyrah
translation: About that time Judah left his brothers and camped near a certain Adullamite whose name was Hirah.

hebrew: וַיַּרְא־שָׁ֧ם יְהוּדָ֛ה בַּת־אִ֥ישׁ כְּנַעֲנִ֖י וּשְׁמ֣וֹ שׁ֑וּעַ וַיִּקָּחֶ֖הָ וַיָּבֹ֥א אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayar'-sham y'hvdah bat-iysh k'na'aniy vsh'mvo shv'a vayikacheha vayavo eleyha
translation: There Judah saw the daughter of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua, and he married her and cohabited with her.

hebrew: וַתַּ֖הַר וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ עֵֽר׃
transliteration: vatahar vateled ben vayik'ra et-sh'mvo 'er
translation: She conceived and bore a son, and he named him Er.

hebrew: וַתַּ֥הַר ע֖וֹד וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ אוֹנָֽן׃
transliteration: vatahar 'vod vateled ben vatik'ra et-sh'mvo vonan
translation: She conceived again and bore a son, and named him Onan.

hebrew: וַתֹּ֤סֶף עוֹד֙ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ שֵׁלָ֑ה וְהָיָ֥ה בִכְזִ֖יב בְּלִדְתָּ֥הּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vatosef 'vod vateled ben vatik'ra et-sh'mvo shelah v'hayah vikh'ziyv b'lid'tah otvo
translation: Once again she bore a son, and named him Shelah; he was at Chezib when she bore him.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֧ח יְהוּדָ֛ה אִשָּׁ֖ה לְעֵ֣ר בְּכוֹר֑וֹ וּשְׁמָ֖הּ תָּמָֽר׃
transliteration: vayikach y'hvdah ishah l'er b'khvorvo vsh'mah tamar
translation: Judah got a wife for Er his first-born; her name was Tamar.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י עֵ֚ר בְּכ֣וֹר יְהוּדָ֔ה רַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וַיְמִתֵ֖הוּ יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy 'er b'khvor y'hvdah ra' b'eyney y'hvah vay'mitehv y'hvah
translation: But Er, Judah’s first-born, was displeasing to the L<small>ORD</small>, and the L<small>ORD</small> took his life.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוּדָה֙ לְאוֹנָ֔ן בֹּ֛א אֶל־אֵ֥שֶׁת אָחִ֖יךָ וְיַבֵּ֣ם אֹתָ֑הּ וְהָקֵ֥ם זֶ֖רַע לְאָחִֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvdah l'vonan bo el-eshet achiykha v'yabem otah v'hakem zera' l'achiykha
translation: Then Judah said to Onan, “Join with your brother’s wife and do your duty by her as a brother-in-law,aCf. Deut. 25.5. and provide offspring for your brother.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֣דַע אוֹנָ֔ן כִּ֛י לֹּ֥א ל֖וֹ יִהְיֶ֣ה הַזָּ֑רַע וְהָיָ֞ה אִם־בָּ֨א אֶל־אֵ֤שֶׁת אָחִיו֙ וְשִׁחֵ֣ת אַ֔רְצָה לְבִלְתִּ֥י נְתָן־זֶ֖רַע לְאָחִֽיו׃
transliteration: vayeda' vonan kiy lo lvo yih'yeh hazara' v'hayah im-ba el-eshet achiyv v'shichet ar'tzah l'vil'tiy n'tan-zera' l'achiyv
translation: But Onan, knowing that the seed would not count as his, let it go to wastebLit. “spoil on the ground.” whenever he joined with his brother’s wife, so as not to provide offspring for his brother.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֛רַע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה וַיָּ֖מֶת גַּם־אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayera' b'eyney y'hvah asher 'asah vayamet gam-otvo
translation: What he did was displeasing to the L<small>ORD</small>, and He took his life also.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוּדָה֩ לְתָמָ֨ר כַּלָּת֜וֹ שְׁבִ֧י אַלְמָנָ֣ה בֵית־אָבִ֗יךְ עַד־יִגְדַּל֙ שֵׁלָ֣ה בְנִ֔י כִּ֣י אָמַ֔ר פֶּן־יָמ֥וּת גַּם־ה֖וּא כְּאֶחָ֑יו וַתֵּ֣לֶךְ תָּמָ֔ר וַתֵּ֖שֶׁב בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvdah l'tamar kalatvo sh'viy al'manah veyt-aviykh' 'ad-yig'dal shelah v'niy kiy amar pen-yamvt gam-hv k'echayv vatelekh' tamar vateshev beyt aviyha
translation: Then Judah said to his daughter-in-law Tamar, “Stay as a widow in your father’s house until my son Shelah grows up”—for he thought, “He too might die like his brothers.” So Tamar went to live in her father’s house.

hebrew: וַיִּרְבּוּ֙ הַיָּמִ֔ים וַתָּ֖מָת בַּת־שׁ֣וּעַ אֵֽשֶׁת־יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּנָּ֣חֶם יְהוּדָ֗ה וַיַּ֜עַל עַל־גֹּֽזֲזֵ֤י צֹאנוֹ֙ ה֗וּא וְחִירָ֛ה רֵעֵ֥הוּ הָעֲדֻלָּמִ֖י תִּמְנָֽתָה׃
transliteration: vayir'bv hayamiym vatamat bat-shv'a eshet-y'hvdah vayinachem y'hvdah vaya'al 'al-gozazey tzonvo hv v'chiyrah re'ehv ha'adulamiy tim'natah
translation: A long time afterward, Shua’s daughter, the wife of Judah, died. When cLit. “he was comforted.”his period of mourning was over,-c Judah went up to Timnah to his sheepshearers, together with his friend Hirah the Adullamite.

hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֥ד לְתָמָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֥ה חָמִ֛יךְ עֹלֶ֥ה תִמְנָ֖תָה לָגֹ֥ז צֹאנֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayugad l'tamar lemor hineh chamiykh' 'oleh tim'natah lagoz tzonvo
translation: And Tamar was told, “Your father-in-law is coming up to Timnah for the sheepshearing.”

hebrew: וַתָּסַר֩ בִּגְדֵ֨י אַלְמְנוּתָ֜הּ מֵֽעָלֶ֗יהָ וַתְּכַ֤ס בַּצָּעִיף֙ וַתִּתְעַלָּ֔ף וַתֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ בְּפֶ֣תַח עֵינַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־דֶּ֣רֶךְ תִּמְנָ֑תָה כִּ֤י רָאֲתָה֙ כִּֽי־גָדַ֣ל שֵׁלָ֔ה וְהִ֕וא לֹֽא־נִתְּנָ֥ה ל֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vatasar big'dey al'm'nvtah me'aleyha vat'khas batza'iyf vatit'alaf vateshev b'fetach 'eynayim asher 'al-derekh' tim'natah kiy raatah kiy-gadal shelah v'hiv lo-nit'nah lvo l'ishah
translation: So she took off her widow’s garb, covered her face with a veil, and, wrapping herself up, sat down at the entrance to Enaim,dCf. Enam, Josh. 15.34. Others “in an open place” or “at the crossroad.” which is on the road to Timnah; for she saw that Shelah was grown up, yet she had not been given to him as wife.

hebrew: וַיִּרְאֶ֣הָ יְהוּדָ֔ה וַֽיַּחְשְׁבֶ֖הָ לְזוֹנָ֑ה כִּ֥י כִסְּתָ֖ה פָּנֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayir'eha y'hvdah vayach'sh'veha l'zvonah kiy khis'tah paneyha
translation: When Judah saw her, he took her for a harlot; for she had covered her face.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨ט אֵלֶ֜יהָ אֶל־הַדֶּ֗רֶךְ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הָֽבָה־נָּא֙ אָב֣וֹא אֵלַ֔יִךְ כִּ֚י לֹ֣א יָדַ֔ע כִּ֥י כַלָּת֖וֹ הִ֑וא וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ מַה־תִּתֶּן־לִּ֔י כִּ֥י תָב֖וֹא אֵלָֽי׃
transliteration: vayet eleyha el-haderekh' vayomer havah-na avvo elayikh' kiy lo yada' kiy khalatvo hiv vatomer mah-titen-liy kiy tavvo elay
translation: So he turned aside to her by the road and said, “Here, let me sleep with you”—for he did not know that she was his daughter-in-law. “What,” she asked, “will you pay for sleeping with me?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָנֹכִ֛י אֲשַׁלַּ֥ח גְּדִֽי־עִזִּ֖ים מִן־הַצֹּ֑אן וַתֹּ֕אמֶר אִם־תִּתֵּ֥ן עֵרָב֖וֹן עַ֥ד שָׁלְחֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer anokhiy ashalach g'diy-'iziym min-hatzon vatomer im-titen 'eravvon 'ad shal'chekha
translation: He replied, “I will send a kid from my flock.” But she said, “You must leave a pledge until you have sent it.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מָ֣ה הָֽעֵרָבוֹן֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶתֶּן־לָּךְ֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר חֹתָֽמְךָ֙ וּפְתִילֶ֔ךָ וּמַטְּךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וַיִּתֶּן־לָּ֛הּ וַיָּבֹ֥א אֵלֶ֖יהָ וַתַּ֥הַר לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer mah ha'eravvon asher eten-lakh' vatomer chotam'kha vf'tiylekha vmat'kha asher b'yadekha vayiten-lah vayavo eleyha vatahar lvo
translation: And he said, “What pledge shall I give you?” She replied, “Your seal and cord, and the staff which you carry.” So he gave them to her and slept with her, and she conceived by him.

hebrew: וַתָּ֣קָם וַתֵּ֔לֶךְ וַתָּ֥סַר צְעִיפָ֖הּ מֵעָלֶ֑יהָ וַתִּלְבַּ֖שׁ בִּגְדֵ֥י אַלְמְנוּתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vatakam vatelekh' vatasar tz'iyfah me'aleyha vatil'bash big'dey al'm'nvtah
translation: Then she went on her way. She took off her veil and again put on her widow’s garb.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח יְהוּדָ֜ה אֶת־גְּדִ֣י הָֽעִזִּ֗ים בְּיַד֙ רֵעֵ֣הוּ הָֽעֲדֻלָּמִ֔י לָקַ֥חַת הָעֵרָב֖וֹן מִיַּ֣ד הָאִשָּׁ֑ה וְלֹ֖א מְצָאָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayish'lach y'hvdah et-g'diy ha'iziym b'yad re'ehv ha'adulamiy lakachat ha'eravvon miyad haishah v'lo m'tzaah
translation: Judah sent the kid by his friend the Adullamite, to redeem the pledge from the woman; but he could not find her.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֞ל אֶת־אַנְשֵׁ֤י מְקֹמָהּ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַיֵּ֧ה הַקְּדֵשָׁ֛ה הִ֥וא בָעֵינַ֖יִם עַל־הַדָּ֑רֶךְ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ לֹא־הָיְתָ֥ה בָזֶ֖ה קְדֵשָֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayish'al et-an'shey m'komah lemor ayeh hak'deshah hiv va'eynayim 'al-hadarekh' vayom'rv lo-hay'tah vazeh k'deshah
translation: He inquired of the people of that town, “Where is the cult prostitute, the one at Enaim, by the road?” But they said, “There has been no prostitute here.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֙שָׁב֙ אֶל־יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לֹ֣א מְצָאתִ֑יהָ וְגַ֨ם אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמָּקוֹם֙ אָֽמְר֔וּ לֹא־הָיְתָ֥ה בָזֶ֖ה קְדֵשָֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayashav el-y'hvdah vayomer lo m'tzatiyha v'gam an'shey hamakvom am'rv lo-hay'tah vazeh k'deshah
translation: So he returned to Judah and said, “I could not find her; moreover, the townspeople said: There has been no prostitute here.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוּדָה֙ תִּֽקַּֽח־לָ֔הּ פֶּ֖ן נִהְיֶ֣ה לָב֑וּז הִנֵּ֤ה שָׁלַ֙חְתִּי֙ הַגְּדִ֣י הַזֶּ֔ה וְאַתָּ֖ה לֹ֥א מְצָאתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvdah tikach-lah pen nih'yeh lavvz hineh shalach'tiy hag'diy hazeh v'atah lo m'tzatah
translation: Judah said, “Let her keep them, lest we become a laughingstock. I did send her this kid, but you did not find her.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כְּמִשְׁלֹ֣שׁ חֳדָשִׁ֗ים וַיֻּגַּ֨ד לִֽיהוּדָ֤ה לֵֽאמֹר֙ זָֽנְתָה֙ תָּמָ֣ר כַּלָּתֶ֔ךָ וְגַ֛ם הִנֵּ֥ה הָרָ֖ה לִזְנוּנִ֑ים וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוּדָ֔ה הוֹצִיא֖וּהָ וְתִשָּׂרֵֽף׃
transliteration: vay'hiy  k'mish'losh chodashiym vayugad liyhvdah lemor zan'tah tamar kalatekha v'gam hineh harah liz'nvniym vayomer y'hvdah hvotziyvha v'tisaref
translation: About three months later, Judah was told, “Your daughter-in-law Tamar has played the harlot; in fact, she is with child by harlotry.” “Bring her out,” said Judah, “and let her be burned.”

hebrew: הִ֣וא מוּצֵ֗את וְהִ֨יא שָׁלְחָ֤ה אֶל־חָמִ֙יהָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְאִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁר־אֵ֣לֶּה לּ֔וֹ אָנֹכִ֖י הָרָ֑ה וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַכֶּר־נָ֔א לְמִ֞י הַחֹתֶ֧מֶת וְהַפְּתִילִ֛ים וְהַמַּטֶּ֖ה הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: hiv mvtzet v'hiy shal'chah el-chamiyha lemor l'iysh asher-eleh lvo anokhiy harah vatomer haker-na l'miy hachotemet v'hap'tiyliym v'hamateh haeleh
translation: As she was being brought out, she sent this message to her father-in-law, “I am with child by the man to whom these belong.” And she added, “Examine these: whose seal and cord and staff are these?”

hebrew: וַיַּכֵּ֣ר יְהוּדָ֗ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ צָֽדְקָ֣ה מִמֶּ֔נִּי כִּֽי־עַל־כֵּ֥ן לֹא־נְתַתִּ֖יהָ לְשֵׁלָ֣ה בְנִ֑י וְלֹֽא־יָסַ֥ף ע֖וֹד לְדַעְתָּֽה׃
transliteration: vayaker y'hvdah vayomer tzad'kah mimeniy kiy-'al-ken lo-n'tatiyha l'shelah v'niy v'lo-yasaf 'vod l'da'tah
translation: Judah recognized them, and said, “She is more in the right than I, inasmuch as I did not give her to my son Shelah.” And he was not intimate with her again.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י בְּעֵ֣ת לִדְתָּ֑הּ וְהִנֵּ֥ה תְאוֹמִ֖ים בְּבִטְנָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy b'et lid'tah v'hineh t'vomiym b'vit'nah
translation: When the time came for her to give birth, there were twins in her womb!

hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י בְלִדְתָּ֖הּ וַיִּתֶּן־יָ֑ד וַתִּקַּ֣ח הַמְיַלֶּ֗דֶת וַתִּקְשֹׁ֨ר עַל־יָד֤וֹ שָׁנִי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר זֶ֖ה יָצָ֥א רִאשֹׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy v'lid'tah vayiten-yad vatikach ham'yaledet vatik'shor 'al-yadvo shaniy lemor zeh yatza rishonah
translation: While she was in labor, one of them put out his hand, and the midwife tied a crimson thread on that hand, to signify: This one came out first.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כְּמֵשִׁ֣יב יָד֗וֹ וְהִנֵּה֙ יָצָ֣א אָחִ֔יו וַתֹּ֕אמֶר מַה־פָּרַ֖צְתָּ עָלֶ֣יךָ פָּ֑רֶץ וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ פָּֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy  k'meshiyv yadvo v'hineh yatza achiyv vatomer mah-paratz'ta 'aleykha paretz vayik'ra sh'mvo paretz
translation: But just then he drew back his hand, and out came his brother; and she said, “What a breacheHeb. pereṣ you have made for yourself!” So he was named Perez.

hebrew: וְאַחַר֙ יָצָ֣א אָחִ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־יָד֖וֹ הַשָּׁנִ֑י וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ זָֽרַח׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'achar yatza achiyv asher 'al-yadvo hashaniy vayik'ra sh'mvo zarach (s)
translation: Afterward his brother came out, on whose hand was the crimson thread; he was named Zerah.fI.e., “brightness,” perhaps alluding to the crimson thread.

hebrew: וְיוֹסֵ֖ף הוּרַ֣ד מִצְרָ֑יְמָה וַיִּקְנֵ֡הוּ פּוֹטִיפַר֩ סְרִ֨יס פַּרְעֹ֜ה שַׂ֤ר הַטַּבָּחִים֙ אִ֣ישׁ מִצְרִ֔י מִיַּד֙ הַיִּשְׁמְעֵאלִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹרִדֻ֖הוּ שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: v'yvosef hvrad mitz'ray'mah vayik'nehv pvotiyfar s'riys par'oh sar hatabachiym iysh mitz'riy miyad hayish'm'eliym asher hvoriduhv shamah
translation: When Joseph was taken down to Egypt, a certain Egyptian, Potiphar, a courtier of Pharaoh and his chief steward, bought him from the Ishmaelites who had brought him there.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י יְהוָה֙ אֶת־יוֹסֵ֔ף וַיְהִ֖י אִ֣ישׁ מַצְלִ֑יחַ וַיְהִ֕י בְּבֵ֖ית אֲדֹנָ֥יו הַמִּצְרִֽי׃
transliteration: vay'hiy y'hvah et-yvosef vay'hiy iysh matz'liycha vay'hiy b'veyt adonayv hamitz'riy
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> was with Joseph, and he was a successful man; and he stayed in the house of his Egyptian master.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא אֲדֹנָ֔יו כִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה אִתּ֑וֹ וְכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁר־ה֣וּא עֹשֶׂ֔ה יְהוָ֖ה מַצְלִ֥יחַ בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayar' adonayv kiy y'hvah itvo v'khol asher-hv 'oseh y'hvah matz'liycha b'yadvo
translation: And when his master saw that the L<small>ORD</small> was with him and that the L<small>ORD</small> lent success to everything he undertook,

hebrew: וַיִּמְצָ֨א יוֹסֵ֥ף חֵ֛ן בְּעֵינָ֖יו וַיְשָׁ֣רֶת אֹת֑וֹ וַיַּפְקִדֵ֙הוּ֙ עַל־בֵּית֔וֹ וְכָל־יֶשׁ־ל֖וֹ נָתַ֥ן בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayim'tza yvosef chen b'eynayv vay'sharet otvo vayaf'kidehv 'al-beytvo v'khal-yesh-lvo natan b'yadvo
translation: he took a liking to Joseph. He made him his personal attendant and put him in charge of his household, placing in his hands all that he owned.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י מֵאָז֩ הִפְקִ֨יד אֹת֜וֹ בְּבֵית֗וֹ וְעַל֙ כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֶשׁ־ל֔וֹ וַיְבָ֧רֶךְ יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית הַמִּצְרִ֖י בִּגְלַ֣ל יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיְהִ֞י בִּרְכַּ֤ת יְהוָה֙ בְּכָל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֶשׁ־ל֔וֹ בַּבַּ֖יִת וּבַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy meaz hif'kiyd otvo b'veytvo v'al kal-asher yesh-lvo vay'varekh' y'hvah et-beyt hamitz'riy big'lal yvosef vay'hiy bir'kat y'hvah b'khal-asher yesh-lvo babayit vvasadeh
translation: And from the time that the Egyptian put him in charge of his household and of all that he owned, the L<small>ORD</small> blessed his house for Joseph’s sake, so that the blessing of the L<small>ORD</small> was upon everything that he owned, in the house and outside.

hebrew: וַיַּעֲזֹ֣ב כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֮ בְּיַד־יוֹסֵף֒ וְלֹא־יָדַ֤ע אִתּוֹ֙ מְא֔וּמָה כִּ֥י אִם־הַלֶּ֖חֶם אֲשֶׁר־ה֣וּא אוֹכֵ֑ל וַיְהִ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף יְפֵה־תֹ֖אַר וִיפֵ֥ה מַרְאֶֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'azov kal-asher-lvo b'yad-yvosef v'lo-yada' itvo m'vmah kiy im-halechem asher-hv vokhel vay'hiy yvosef y'feh-toar viyfeh mar'eh
translation: He left all that he had in Joseph’s hands and, with him there, he paid attention to nothing save the food that he ate. Now Joseph was well built and handsome.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחַר֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וַתִּשָּׂ֧א אֵֽשֶׁת־אֲדֹנָ֛יו אֶת־עֵינֶ֖יהָ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֑ף וַתֹּ֖אמֶר שִׁכְבָ֥ה עִמִּֽי׃
transliteration: vay'hiy achar had'variym haeleh vatisa eshet-adonayv et-'eyneyha el-yvosef vatomer shikh'vah 'imiy
translation: After a time, his master’s wife cast her eyes upon Joseph and said, “Lie with me.”

hebrew: וַיְמָאֵ֓ן ׀ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אֵ֣שֶׁת אֲדֹנָ֔יו הֵ֣ן אֲדֹנִ֔י לֹא־יָדַ֥ע אִתִּ֖י מַה־בַּבָּ֑יִת וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יֶשׁ־ל֖וֹ נָתַ֥ן בְּיָדִֽי׃
transliteration: vay'maen  vayomer el-eshet adonayv hen adoniy lo-yada' itiy mah-babayit v'khol asher-yesh-lvo natan b'yadiy
translation: But he refused. He said to his master’s wife, “Look, with me here, my master gives no thought to anything in this house, and all that he owns he has placed in my hands.

hebrew: אֵינֶ֨נּוּ גָד֜וֹל בַּבַּ֣יִת הַזֶּה֮ מִמֶּנִּי֒ וְלֹֽא־חָשַׂ֤ךְ מִמֶּ֙נִּי֙ מְא֔וּמָה כִּ֥י אִם־אוֹתָ֖ךְ בַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר אַתְּ־אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וְאֵ֨יךְ אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֜ה הָרָעָ֤ה הַגְּדֹלָה֙ הַזֹּ֔את וְחָטָ֖אתִי לֵֽאלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: eynenv gadvol babayit hazeh mimeniy v'lo-chasakh' mimeniy m'vmah kiy im-votakh' baasher at'-ish'tvo v'eykh' e'eseh hara'ah hag'dolah hazot v'chatatiy lelohiym
translation: He wields no more authority in this house than I, and he has withheld nothing from me except yourself, since you are his wife. How then could I do this most wicked thing, and sin before God?”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כְּדַבְּרָ֥הּ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף י֣וֹם ׀ י֑וֹם וְלֹא־שָׁמַ֥ע אֵלֶ֛יהָ לִשְׁכַּ֥ב אֶצְלָ֖הּ לִהְי֥וֹת עִמָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy k'dab'rah el-yvosef yvom  yvom v'lo-shama' eleyha lish'kav etz'lah lih'yvot 'imah
translation: And much as she coaxed Joseph day after day, he did not yield to her request to lie beside her, to be with her.

hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ כְּהַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֥א הַבַּ֖יְתָה לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת מְלַאכְתּ֑וֹ וְאֵ֨ין אִ֜ישׁ מֵאַנְשֵׁ֥י הַבַּ֛יִת שָׁ֖ם בַּבָּֽיִת׃
transliteration: vay'hiy k'hayvom hazeh vayavo habay'tah la'asvot m'lakh'tvo v'eyn iysh mean'shey habayit sham babayit
translation: One such day, he came into the house to do his work. None of the household being there inside,

hebrew: וַתִּתְפְּשֵׂ֧הוּ בְּבִגְד֛וֹ לֵאמֹ֖ר שִׁכְבָ֣ה עִמִּ֑י וַיַּעֲזֹ֤ב בִּגְדוֹ֙ בְּיָדָ֔הּ וַיָּ֖נָס וַיֵּצֵ֥א הַחֽוּצָה׃
transliteration: vatit'p'sehv b'vig'dvo lemor shikh'vah 'imiy vaya'azov big'dvo b'yadah vayanas vayetze hachvtzah
translation: she caught hold of him by his garment and said, “Lie with me!” But he left his garment in her hand and got away and fled outside.

hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ כִּרְאוֹתָ֔הּ כִּֽי־עָזַ֥ב בִּגְד֖וֹ בְּיָדָ֑הּ וַיָּ֖נָס הַחֽוּצָה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kir'votah kiy-'azav big'dvo b'yadah vayanas hachvtzah
translation: When she saw that he had left it in her hand and had fled outside,

hebrew: וַתִּקְרָ֞א לְאַנְשֵׁ֣י בֵיתָ֗הּ וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר רְא֗וּ הֵ֥בִיא לָ֛נוּ אִ֥ישׁ עִבְרִ֖י לְצַ֣חֶק בָּ֑נוּ בָּ֤א אֵלַי֙ לִשְׁכַּ֣ב עִמִּ֔י וָאֶקְרָ֖א בְּק֥וֹל גָּדֽוֹל׃
transliteration: vatik'ra l'an'shey veytah vatomer lahem lemor r'v heviy lanv iysh 'iv'riy l'tzachek banv ba elay lish'kav 'imiy vaek'ra b'kvol gadvol
translation: she called out to her servants and said to them, “Look, he had to bring us a Hebrew to dally with us! This one came to lie with me; but I screamed loud.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י כְשָׁמְע֔וֹ כִּֽי־הֲרִימֹ֥תִי קוֹלִ֖י וָאֶקְרָ֑א וַיַּעֲזֹ֤ב בִּגְדוֹ֙ אֶצְלִ֔י וַיָּ֖נָס וַיֵּצֵ֥א הַחֽוּצָה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kh'sham'vo kiy-hariymotiy kvoliy vaek'ra vaya'azov big'dvo etz'liy vayanas vayetze hachvtzah
translation: And when he heard me screaming at the top of my voice, he left his garment with me and got away and fled outside.”

hebrew: וַתַּנַּ֥ח בִּגְד֖וֹ אֶצְלָ֑הּ עַד־בּ֥וֹא אֲדֹנָ֖יו אֶל־בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vatanach big'dvo etz'lah 'ad-bvo adonayv el-beytvo
translation: She kept his garment beside her, until his master came home.

hebrew: וַתְּדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלָ֔יו כַּדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לֵאמֹ֑ר בָּֽא־אֵלַ֞י הָעֶ֧בֶד הָֽעִבְרִ֛י אֲשֶׁר־הֵבֵ֥אתָ לָּ֖נוּ לְצַ֥חֶק בִּֽי׃
transliteration: vat'daber elayv kad'variym haeleh lemor ba-elay ha'eved ha'iv'riy asher-heveta lanv l'tzachek biy
translation: Then she told him the same story, saying, “The Hebrew slave whom you brought into our house came to me to dally with me;

hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּהֲרִימִ֥י קוֹלִ֖י וָאֶקְרָ֑א וַיַּעֲזֹ֥ב בִּגְד֛וֹ אֶצְלִ֖י וַיָּ֥נָס הַחֽוּצָה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kahariymiy kvoliy vaek'ra vaya'azov big'dvo etz'liy vayanas hachvtzah
translation: but when I screamed at the top of my voice, he left his garment with me and fled outside.”

hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ אֲדֹנָ֜יו אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֣י אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבְּרָ֤ה אֵלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כַּדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה עָ֥שָׂהּ לִ֖י עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וַיִּ֖חַר אַפּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy khish'mo'a adonayv et-div'rey ish'tvo asher dib'rah elayv lemor kad'variym haeleh 'asah liy 'av'dekha vayichar apvo
translation: When his master heard the story that his wife told him, namely, “Thus and so your slave did to me,” he was furious.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֩ אֲדֹנֵ֨י יוֹסֵ֜ף אֹת֗וֹ וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית הַסֹּ֔הַר מְק֕וֹם אֲשֶׁר־אסורי [אֲסִירֵ֥י] הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֲסוּרִ֑ים וַֽיְהִי־שָׁ֖ם בְּבֵ֥ית הַסֹּֽהַר׃
transliteration: vayikach adoney yvosef otvo vayit'nehv el-beyt hasohar m'kvom asher-svry [asiyrey] hamelekh' asvriym vay'hiy-sham b'veyt hasohar
translation: So Joseph’s master had him put in prison, where the king’s prisoners were confined. But even while he was there in prison,

hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י יְהוָה֙ אֶת־יוֹסֵ֔ף וַיֵּ֥ט אֵלָ֖יו חָ֑סֶד וַיִּתֵּ֣ן חִנּ֔וֹ בְּעֵינֵ֖י שַׂ֥ר בֵּית־הַסֹּֽהַר׃
transliteration: vay'hiy y'hvah et-yvosef vayet elayv chased vayiten chinvo b'eyney sar beyt-hasohar
translation: the L<small>ORD</small> was with Joseph: He extended kindness to him and disposed the chief jailer favorably toward him.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֞ן שַׂ֤ר בֵּית־הַסֹּ֙הַר֙ בְּיַד־יוֹסֵ֔ף אֵ֚ת כָּל־הָ֣אֲסִירִ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּבֵ֣ית הַסֹּ֑הַר וְאֵ֨ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר עֹשִׂים֙ שָׁ֔ם ה֖וּא הָיָ֥ה עֹשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: vayiten sar beyt-hasohar b'yad-yvosef et kal-haasiyrim asher b'veyt hasohar v'et kal-asher 'osiym sham hv hayah 'oseh
translation: The chief jailer put in Joseph’s charge all the prisoners who were in that prison, and he was the one to carry out everything that was done there.

hebrew: אֵ֣ין ׀ שַׂ֣ר בֵּית־הַסֹּ֗הַר רֹאֶ֤ה אֶֽת־כָּל־מְא֙וּמָה֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ בַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אִתּ֑וֹ וַֽאֲשֶׁר־ה֥וּא עֹשֶׂ֖ה יְהוָ֥ה מַצְלִֽיחַ׃ (ס)
transliteration: eyn  sar beyt-hasohar roeh et-kal-m'vmah b'yadvo baasher y'hvah itvo vaasher-hv 'oseh y'hvah matz'liycha (s)
translation: The chief jailer did not supervise anything that was in Joseph’saLit. “his.” charge, because the LORD was with him, and whatever he did the LORD made successful.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחַר֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה חָֽטְא֛וּ מַשְׁקֵ֥ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֖יִם וְהָאֹפֶ֑ה לַאֲדֹנֵיהֶ֖ם לְמֶ֥לֶךְ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy achar had'variym haeleh chat'v mash'keh melekh'-mitz'rayim v'haofeh laadoneyhem l'melekh' mitz'rayim
translation: Some time later, the cupbearer and the baker of the king of Egypt gave offense to their lord the king of Egypt.

hebrew: וַיִּקְצֹ֣ף פַּרְעֹ֔ה עַ֖ל שְׁנֵ֣י סָרִיסָ֑יו עַ֚ל שַׂ֣ר הַמַּשְׁקִ֔ים וְעַ֖ל שַׂ֥ר הָאוֹפִֽים׃
transliteration: vayik'tzof par'oh 'al sh'ney sariysayv 'al sar hamash'kiym v'al sar havofiym
translation: Pharaoh was angry with his two courtiers, the chief cupbearer and the chief baker,

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן אֹתָ֜ם בְּמִשְׁמַ֗ר בֵּ֛ית שַׂ֥ר הַטַבָּחִ֖ים אֶל־בֵּ֣ית הַסֹּ֑הַר מְק֕וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹסֵ֖ף אָס֥וּר שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayiten otam b'mish'mar beyt sar hatabachiym el-beyt hasohar m'kvom asher yvosef asvr sham
translation: and put them in custody, in the house of the chief steward, in the same prison house where Joseph was confined.

hebrew: וַ֠יִּפְקֹד שַׂ֣ר הַטַּבָּחִ֧ים אֶת־יוֹסֵ֛ף אִתָּ֖ם וַיְשָׁ֣רֶת אֹתָ֑ם וַיִּהְי֥וּ יָמִ֖ים בְּמִשְׁמָֽר׃
transliteration: vayif'kod sar hatabachiym et-yvosef itam vay'sharet otam vayih'yv yamiym b'mish'mar
translation:
The chief steward assigned Joseph to them, and he attended them.
When they had been in custody for some time,

hebrew: וַיַּֽחַלְמוּ֩ חֲל֨וֹם שְׁנֵיהֶ֜ם אִ֤ישׁ חֲלֹמוֹ֙ בְּלַ֣יְלָה אֶחָ֔ד אִ֖ישׁ כְּפִתְר֣וֹן חֲלֹמ֑וֹ הַמַּשְׁקֶ֣ה וְהָאֹפֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁר֙ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲסוּרִ֖ים בְּבֵ֥ית הַסֹּֽהַר׃
transliteration: vayachal'mv chalvom sh'neyhem iysh chalomvo b'lay'lah echad iysh k'fit'rvon chalomvo hamash'keh v'haofeh asher l'melekh' mitz'rayim asher asvriym b'veyt hasohar
translation: both of them—the cupbearer and the baker of the king of Egypt, who were confined in the prison—dreamed in the same night, each his own dream and each dream with its own meaning.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֧א אֲלֵיהֶ֛ם יוֹסֵ֖ף בַּבֹּ֑קֶר וַיַּ֣רְא אֹתָ֔ם וְהִנָּ֖ם זֹעֲפִֽים׃
transliteration: vayavo aleyhem yvosef baboker vayar' otam v'hinam zo'afiym
translation: When Joseph came to them in the morning, he saw that they were distraught.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֞ל אֶת־סְרִיסֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אִתּ֧וֹ בְמִשְׁמַ֛ר בֵּ֥ית אֲדֹנָ֖יו לֵאמֹ֑ר מַדּ֛וּעַ פְּנֵיכֶ֥ם רָעִ֖ים הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayish'al et-s'riysey far'oh asher itvo v'mish'mar beyt adonayv lemor madv'a p'neykhem ra'iym hayvom
translation: He asked Pharaoh’s courtiers, who were with him in custody in his master’s house, saying, “Why do you appear downcast today?”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֔יו חֲל֣וֹם חָלַ֔מְנוּ וּפֹתֵ֖ר אֵ֣ין אֹת֑וֹ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם יוֹסֵ֗ף הֲל֤וֹא לֵֽאלֹהִים֙ פִּתְרֹנִ֔ים סַפְּרוּ־נָ֖א לִֽי׃
transliteration: vayom'rv elayv chalvom chalam'nv vfoter eyn otvo vayomer alehem yvosef halvo lelohiym pit'roniym sap'rv-na liy
translation: And they said to him, “We had dreams, and there is no one to interpret them.” So Joseph said to them, “Surely God can interpret! Tell me [your dreams].”

hebrew: וַיְסַפֵּ֧ר שַֽׂר־הַמַּשְׁקִ֛ים אֶת־חֲלֹמ֖וֹ לְיוֹסֵ֑ף וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ בַּחֲלוֹמִ֕י וְהִנֵּה־גֶ֖פֶן לְפָנָֽי׃
transliteration: vay'saper sar-hamash'kiym et-chalomvo l'yvosef vayomer lvo bachalvomiy v'hineh-gefen l'fanay
translation: Then the chief cupbearer told his dream to Joseph. He said to him, “In my dream, there was a vine in front of me.

hebrew: וּבַגֶּ֖פֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה שָׂרִיגִ֑ם וְהִ֤יא כְפֹרַ֙חַת֙ עָלְתָ֣ה נִצָּ֔הּ הִבְשִׁ֥ילוּ אַשְׁכְּלֹתֶ֖יהָ עֲנָבִֽים׃
transliteration: vvagefen sh'loshah sariygim v'hiy kh'forachat 'al'tah nitzah hiv'shiylv ash'k'loteyha 'anaviym
translation: On the vine were three branches. It had barely budded, when out came its blossoms and its clusters ripened into grapes.

hebrew: וְכ֥וֹס פַּרְעֹ֖ה בְּיָדִ֑י וָאֶקַּ֣ח אֶת־הָֽעֲנָבִ֗ים וָֽאֶשְׂחַ֤ט אֹתָם֙ אֶל־כּ֣וֹס פַּרְעֹ֔ה וָאֶתֵּ֥ן אֶת־הַכּ֖וֹס עַל־כַּ֥ף פַּרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: v'khvos par'oh b'yadiy vaekach et-ha'anaviym vaes'chat otam el-kvos par'oh vaeten et-hakvos 'al-kaf par'oh
translation: Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand, and I took the grapes, pressed them into Pharaoh’s cup, and placed the cup in Pharaoh’s hand.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ יוֹסֵ֔ף זֶ֖ה פִּתְרֹנ֑וֹ שְׁלֹ֙שֶׁת֙ הַשָּׂ֣רִגִ֔ים שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים הֵֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer lvo yvosef zeh pit'ronvo sh'loshet hasarigiym sh'loshet yamiym hem
translation: Joseph said to him, “This is its interpretation: The three branches are three days.

hebrew: בְּע֣וֹד ׀ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֗ים יִשָּׂ֤א פַרְעֹה֙ אֶת־רֹאשֶׁ֔ךָ וַהֲשִֽׁיבְךָ֖ עַל־כַּנֶּ֑ךָ וְנָתַתָּ֤ כוֹס־פַּרְעֹה֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ כַּמִּשְׁפָּט֙ הָֽרִאשׁ֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיִ֖יתָ מַשְׁקֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: b'vod  sh'loshet yamiym yisa far'oh et-roshekha vahashiyv'kha 'al-kanekha v'natata khvos-par'oh b'yadvo kamish'pat harishvon asher hayiyta mash'kehv
translation: In three days Pharaoh will pardon youaLit. “lift up your head.” and restore you to your post; you will place Pharaoh’s cup in his hand, as was your custom formerly when you were his cupbearer.

hebrew: כִּ֧י אִם־זְכַרְתַּ֣נִי אִתְּךָ֗ כַּאֲשֶׁר֙ יִ֣יטַב לָ֔ךְ וְעָשִֽׂיתָ־נָּ֥א עִמָּדִ֖י חָ֑סֶד וְהִזְכַּרְתַּ֙נִי֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְהוֹצֵאתַ֖נִי מִן־הַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: kiy im-z'khar'taniy it'kha kaasher yiytav lakh' v'asiyta-na 'imadiy chased v'hiz'kar'taniy el-par'oh v'hvotzetaniy min-habayit hazeh
translation: But think of me when all is well with you again, and do me the kindness of mentioning me to Pharaoh, so as to free me from this place.

hebrew: כִּֽי־גֻנֹּ֣ב גֻּנַּ֔בְתִּי מֵאֶ֖רֶץ הָעִבְרִ֑ים וְגַם־פֹּה֙ לֹא־עָשִׂ֣יתִֽי מְא֔וּמָה כִּֽי־שָׂמ֥וּ אֹתִ֖י בַּבּֽוֹר׃
transliteration: kiy-gunov gunav'tiy meeretz ha'iv'riym v'gam-poh lo-'asiytiy m'vmah kiy-samv otiy babvor
translation: For in truth, I was kidnapped from the land of the Hebrews; nor have I done anything here that they should have put me in the dungeon.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא שַׂר־הָאֹפִ֖ים כִּ֣י ט֣וֹב פָּתָ֑ר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אַף־אֲנִי֙ בַּחֲלוֹמִ֔י וְהִנֵּ֗ה שְׁלֹשָׁ֛ה סַלֵּ֥י חֹרִ֖י עַל־רֹאשִֽׁי׃
transliteration: vayar' sar-haofiym kiy tvov patar vayomer el-yvosef af-aniy bachalvomiy v'hineh sh'loshah saley choriy 'al-roshiy
translation: When the chief baker saw how favorably he had interpreted, he said to Joseph, “In my dream, similarly, there were three openwork basketsbOthers “baskets with white bread” or “white baskets”; meaning of Heb. ḥori uncertain. on my head.

hebrew: וּבַסַּ֣ל הָֽעֶלְי֔וֹן מִכֹּ֛ל מַאֲכַ֥ל פַּרְעֹ֖ה מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֹפֶ֑ה וְהָע֗וֹף אֹכֵ֥ל אֹתָ֛ם מִן־הַסַּ֖ל מֵעַ֥ל רֹאשִֽׁי׃
transliteration: vvasal ha'el'yvon mikol maakhal par'oh ma'aseh ofeh v'ha'vof okhel otam min-hasal me'al roshiy
translation: In the uppermost basket were all kinds of food for Pharaoh that a baker prepares; and the birds were eating it out of the basket above my head.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַן יוֹסֵף֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר זֶ֖ה פִּתְרֹנ֑וֹ שְׁלֹ֙שֶׁת֙ הַסַּלִּ֔ים שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים הֵֽם׃
transliteration: vaya'an yvosef vayomer zeh pit'ronvo sh'loshet hasaliym sh'loshet yamiym hem
translation: Joseph answered, “This is its interpretation: The three baskets are three days.

hebrew: בְּע֣וֹד ׀ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֗ים יִשָּׂ֨א פַרְעֹ֤ה אֶת־רֹֽאשְׁךָ֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יךָ וְתָלָ֥ה אוֹתְךָ֖ עַל־עֵ֑ץ וְאָכַ֥ל הָע֛וֹף אֶת־בְּשָׂרְךָ֖ מֵעָלֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: b'vod  sh'loshet yamiym yisa far'oh et-rosh'kha me'aleykha v'talah vot'kha 'al-'etz v'akhal ha'vof et-b'sar'kha me'aleykha
translation: In three days Pharaoh will lift off your head and impale you upon a pole; and the birds will pick off your flesh.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֗י י֚וֹם הֻלֶּ֣דֶת אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וַיַּ֥עַשׂ מִשְׁתֶּ֖ה לְכָל־עֲבָדָ֑יו וַיִּשָּׂ֞א אֶת־רֹ֣אשׁ ׀ שַׂ֣ר הַמַּשְׁקִ֗ים וְאֶת־רֹ֛אשׁ שַׂ֥ר הָאֹפִ֖ים בְּת֥וֹךְ עֲבָדָֽיו׃
transliteration: vay'hiy  bayvom hash'liyshiy yvom huledet et-par'oh vaya'as mish'teh l'khal-'avadayv vayisa et-rosh  sar hamash'kiym v'et-rosh sar haofiym b'tvokh' 'avadayv
translation: On the third day—his birthday—Pharaoh made a banquet for all his officials, and he singled outcLit. “lifted the head of.” his chief cupbearer and his chief baker from among his officials.

hebrew: וַיָּ֛שֶׁב אֶת־שַׂ֥ר הַמַּשְׁקִ֖ים עַל־מַשְׁקֵ֑הוּ וַיִּתֵּ֥ן הַכּ֖וֹס עַל־כַּ֥ף פַּרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayashev et-sar hamash'kiym 'al-mash'kehv vayiten hakvos 'al-kaf par'oh
translation: He restored the chief cupbearer to his cupbearing, and he placed the cup in Pharaoh’s hand;

hebrew: וְאֵ֛ת שַׂ֥ר הָאֹפִ֖ים תָּלָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּתַ֛ר לָהֶ֖ם יוֹסֵֽף׃
transliteration: v'et sar haofiym talah kaasher patar lahem yvosef
translation: but the chief baker he impaled—just as Joseph had interpreted to them.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־זָכַ֧ר שַֽׂר־הַמַּשְׁקִ֛ים אֶת־יוֹסֵ֖ף וַיִּשְׁכָּחֵֽהוּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'lo-zakhar sar-hamash'kiym et-yvosef vayish'kachehv (f)
translation: Yet the chief cupbearer did not think of Joseph; he forgot him.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י מִקֵּ֖ץ שְׁנָתַ֣יִם יָמִ֑ים וּפַרְעֹ֣ה חֹלֵ֔ם וְהִנֵּ֖ה עֹמֵ֥ד עַל־הַיְאֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'hiy miketz sh'natayim yamiym vfar'oh cholem v'hineh 'omed 'al-hay'or
translation: After two years’ time, Pharaoh dreamed that he was standing by the Nile,

hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה מִן־הַיְאֹ֗ר עֹלֹת֙ שֶׁ֣בַע פָּר֔וֹת יְפ֥וֹת מַרְאֶ֖ה וּבְרִיאֹ֣ת בָּשָׂ֑ר וַתִּרְעֶ֖ינָה בָּאָֽחוּ׃
transliteration: v'hineh min-hay'or 'olot sheva' parvot y'fvot mar'eh vv'riyot basar vatir'eynah baachv
translation: when out of the Nile there came up seven cows, handsome and sturdy, and they grazed in the reed grass.

hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֞ה שֶׁ֧בַע פָּר֣וֹת אֲחֵר֗וֹת עֹל֤וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶן֙ מִן־הַיְאֹ֔ר רָע֥וֹת מַרְאֶ֖ה וְדַקּ֣וֹת בָּשָׂ֑ר וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֛דְנָה אֵ֥צֶל הַפָּר֖וֹת עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיְאֹֽר׃
transliteration: v'hineh sheva' parvot achervot 'olvot achareyhen min-hay'or ra'vot mar'eh v'dakvot basar vata'amod'nah etzel haparvot 'al-s'fat hay'or
translation: But presently, seven other cows came up from the Nile close behind them, ugly and gaunt, and stood beside the cows on the bank of the Nile;

hebrew: וַתֹּאכַ֣לְנָה הַפָּר֗וֹת רָע֤וֹת הַמַּרְאֶה֙ וְדַקֹּ֣ת הַבָּשָׂ֔ר אֵ֚ת שֶׁ֣בַע הַפָּר֔וֹת יְפֹ֥ת הַמַּרְאֶ֖ה וְהַבְּרִיאֹ֑ת וַיִּיקַ֖ץ פַּרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vatokhal'nah haparvot ra'vot hamar'eh v'dakot habasar et sheva' haparvot y'fot hamar'eh v'hab'riyot vayiykatz par'oh
translation: and the ugly gaunt cows ate up the seven handsome sturdy cows. And Pharaoh awoke.

hebrew: וַיִּישָׁ֕ן וַֽיַּחֲלֹ֖ם שֵׁנִ֑ית וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ שֶׁ֣בַע שִׁבֳּלִ֗ים עֹל֛וֹת בְּקָנֶ֥ה אֶחָ֖ד בְּרִיא֥וֹת וְטֹבֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayiyshan vayachalom sheniyt v'hineh  sheva' shiboliym 'olvot b'kaneh echad b'riyvot v'tovvot
translation: He fell asleep and dreamed a second time: Seven ears of grain, solid and healthy, grew on a single stalk.

hebrew: וְהִנֵּה֙ שֶׁ֣בַע שִׁבֳּלִ֔ים דַּקּ֖וֹת וּשְׁדוּפֹ֣ת קָדִ֑ים צֹמְח֖וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶֽן׃
transliteration: v'hineh sheva' shiboliym dakvot vsh'dvfot kadiym tzom'chvot achareyhen
translation: But close behind them sprouted seven ears, thin and scorched by the east wind.

hebrew: וַתִּבְלַ֙עְנָה֙ הַשִּׁבֳּלִ֣ים הַדַּקּ֔וֹת אֵ֚ת שֶׁ֣בַע הַֽשִּׁבֳּלִ֔ים הַבְּרִיא֖וֹת וְהַמְּלֵא֑וֹת וַיִּיקַ֥ץ פַּרְעֹ֖ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה חֲלֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vativ'la'nah hashiboliym hadakvot et sheva' hashiboliym hab'riyvot v'ham'levot vayiykatz par'oh v'hineh chalvom
translation: And the thin ears swallowed up the seven solid and full ears. Then Pharaoh awoke: it was a dream!

hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י בַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ וַתִּפָּ֣עֶם רוּח֔וֹ וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח וַיִּקְרָ֛א אֶת־כָּל־חַרְטֻמֵּ֥י מִצְרַ֖יִם וְאֶת־כָּל־חֲכָמֶ֑יהָ וַיְסַפֵּ֨ר פַּרְעֹ֤ה לָהֶם֙ אֶת־חֲלֹמ֔וֹ וְאֵין־פּוֹתֵ֥ר אוֹתָ֖ם לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy vaboker vatipa'em rvchvo vayish'lach vayik'ra et-kal-char'tumey mitz'rayim v'et-kal-chakhameyha vay'saper par'oh lahem et-chalomvo v'eyn-pvoter votam l'far'oh
translation: Next morning, his spirit was agitated, and he sent for all the magicians of Egypt, and all its wise men; and Pharaoh told them his dreams, but none could interpret them for Pharaoh.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּר֙ שַׂ֣ר הַמַּשְׁקִ֔ים אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר אֶת־חֲטָאַ֕י אֲנִ֖י מַזְכִּ֥יר הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vay'daber sar hamash'kiym et-par'oh lemor et-chataay aniy maz'kiyr hayvom
translation: The chief cupbearer then spoke up and said to Pharaoh, “I must make mention today of my offenses.

hebrew: פַּרְעֹ֖ה קָצַ֣ף עַל־עֲבָדָ֑יו וַיִּתֵּ֨ן אֹתִ֜י בְּמִשְׁמַ֗ר בֵּ֚ית שַׂ֣ר הַטַּבָּחִ֔ים אֹתִ֕י וְאֵ֖ת שַׂ֥ר הָאֹפִֽים׃
transliteration: par'oh katzaf 'al-'avadayv vayiten otiy b'mish'mar beyt sar hatabachiym otiy v'et sar haofiym
translation: Once Pharaoh was angry with his servants, and placed me in custody in the house of the chief steward, together with the chief baker.

hebrew: וַנַּֽחַלְמָ֥ה חֲל֛וֹם בְּלַ֥יְלָה אֶחָ֖ד אֲנִ֣י וָה֑וּא אִ֛ישׁ כְּפִתְר֥וֹן חֲלֹמ֖וֹ חָלָֽמְנוּ׃
transliteration: vanachal'mah chalvom b'lay'lah echad aniy vahv iysh k'fit'rvon chalomvo chalam'nv
translation: We had dreams the same night, he and I, each of us a dream with a meaning of its own.

hebrew: וְשָׁ֨ם אִתָּ֜נוּ נַ֣עַר עִבְרִ֗י עֶ֚בֶד לְשַׂ֣ר הַטַּבָּחִ֔ים וַנְּ֨סַפֶּר־ל֔וֹ וַיִּפְתָּר־לָ֖נוּ אֶת־חֲלֹמֹתֵ֑ינוּ אִ֥ישׁ כַּחֲלֹמ֖וֹ פָּתָֽר׃
transliteration: v'sham itanv na'ar 'iv'riy 'eved l'sar hatabachiym van'saper-lvo vayif'tar-lanv et-chalomoteynv iysh kachalomvo patar
translation: A Hebrew youth was there with us, a servant of the chief steward; and when we told him our dreams, he interpreted them for us, telling each of the meaning of his dream.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּֽתַר־לָ֖נוּ כֵּ֣ן הָיָ֑ה אֹתִ֛י הֵשִׁ֥יב עַל־כַּנִּ֖י וְאֹת֥וֹ תָלָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kaasher patar-lanv ken hayah otiy heshiyv 'al-kaniy v'otvo talah
translation: And as he interpreted for us, so it came to pass: I was restored to my post, and the other was impaled.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח פַּרְעֹה֙ וַיִּקְרָ֣א אֶת־יוֹסֵ֔ף וַיְרִיצֻ֖הוּ מִן־הַבּ֑וֹר וַיְגַלַּח֙ וַיְחַלֵּ֣ף שִׂמְלֹתָ֔יו וַיָּבֹ֖א אֶל־פַּרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayish'lach par'oh vayik'ra et-yvosef vay'riytzuhv min-habvor vay'galach vay'chalef sim'lotayv vayavo el-par'oh
translation: Thereupon Pharaoh sent for Joseph, and he was rushed from the dungeon. He had his hair cut and changed his clothes, and he appeared before Pharaoh.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף חֲל֣וֹם חָלַ֔מְתִּי וּפֹתֵ֖ר אֵ֣ין אֹת֑וֹ וַאֲנִ֗י שָׁמַ֤עְתִּי עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר תִּשְׁמַ֥ע חֲל֖וֹם לִפְתֹּ֥ר אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh el-yvosef chalvom chalam'tiy vfoter eyn otvo vaaniy shama'tiy 'aleykha lemor tish'ma' chalvom lif'tor otvo
translation: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I have had a dream, but no one can interpret it. Now I have heard it said of you that for you to hear a dream is to tell its meaning.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן יוֹסֵ֧ף אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֛ה לֵאמֹ֖ר בִּלְעָדָ֑י אֱלֹהִ֕ים יַעֲנֶ֖ה אֶת־שְׁל֥וֹם פַּרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'an yvosef et-par'oh lemor bil'aday elohiym ya'aneh et-sh'lvom par'oh
translation: Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, “Not I! God will see to Pharaoh’s welfare.”

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶל־יוֹסֵ֑ף בַּחֲלֹמִ֕י הִנְנִ֥י עֹמֵ֖ד עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיְאֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber par'oh el-yvosef bachalomiy hin'niy 'omed 'al-s'fat hay'or
translation: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “In my dream, I was standing on the bank of the Nile,

hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה מִן־הַיְאֹ֗ר עֹלֹת֙ שֶׁ֣בַע פָּר֔וֹת בְּרִיא֥וֹת בָּשָׂ֖ר וִיפֹ֣ת תֹּ֑אַר וַתִּרְעֶ֖ינָה בָּאָֽחוּ׃
transliteration: v'hineh min-hay'or 'olot sheva' parvot b'riyvot basar viyfot toar vatir'eynah baachv
translation: when out of the Nile came up seven sturdy and well-formed cows and grazed in the reed grass.

hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֞ה שֶֽׁבַע־פָּר֤וֹת אֲחֵרוֹת֙ עֹל֣וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ן דַּלּ֨וֹת וְרָע֥וֹת תֹּ֛אַר מְאֹ֖ד וְרַקּ֣וֹת בָּשָׂ֑ר לֹֽא־רָאִ֧יתִי כָהֵ֛נָּה בְּכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לָרֹֽעַ׃
transliteration: v'hineh sheva'-parvot achervot 'olvot achareyhen dalvot v'ra'vot toar m'od v'rakvot basar lo-raiytiy khahenah b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim laro'a
translation: Presently there followed them seven other cows, scrawny, ill-formed, and emaciated—never had I seen their likes for ugliness in all the land of Egypt!

hebrew: וַתֹּאכַ֙לְנָה֙ הַפָּר֔וֹת הָרַקּ֖וֹת וְהָרָע֑וֹת אֵ֣ת שֶׁ֧בַע הַפָּר֛וֹת הָרִאשֹׁנ֖וֹת הַבְּרִיאֹֽת׃
transliteration: vatokhal'nah haparvot harakvot v'hara'vot et sheva' haparvot harishonvot hab'riyot
translation: And the seven lean and ugly cows ate up the first seven cows, the sturdy ones;

hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֣אנָה אֶל־קִרְבֶּ֗נָה וְלֹ֤א נוֹדַע֙ כִּי־בָ֣אוּ אֶל־קִרְבֶּ֔נָה וּמַרְאֵיהֶ֣ן רַ֔ע כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר בַּתְּחִלָּ֑ה וָאִיקָֽץ׃
transliteration: vatavonah el-kir'benah v'lo nvoda' kiy-vav el-kir'benah vmar'eyhen ra' kaasher bat'chilah vaiykatz
translation: but when they had consumed them, one could not tell that they had consumed them, for they looked just as bad as before. And I awoke.

hebrew: וָאֵ֖רֶא בַּחֲלֹמִ֑י וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ שֶׁ֣בַע שִׁבֳּלִ֗ים עֹלֹ֛ת בְּקָנֶ֥ה אֶחָ֖ד מְלֵאֹ֥ת וְטֹבֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vaere bachalomiy v'hineh  sheva' shiboliym 'olot b'kaneh echad m'leot v'tovvot
translation: In my other dream, I saw seven ears of grain, full and healthy, growing on a single stalk;

hebrew: וְהִנֵּה֙ שֶׁ֣בַע שִׁבֳּלִ֔ים צְנֻמ֥וֹת דַּקּ֖וֹת שְׁדֻפ֣וֹת קָדִ֑ים צֹמְח֖וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hineh sheva' shiboliym tz'numvot dakvot sh'dufvot kadiym tzom'chvot achareyhem
translation: but right behind them sprouted seven ears, shriveled, thin, and scorched by the east wind.

hebrew: וַתִּבְלַ֙עְןָ֙ הָשִׁבֳּלִ֣ים הַדַּקֹּ֔ת אֵ֛ת שֶׁ֥בַע הַֽשִׁבֳּלִ֖ים הַטֹּב֑וֹת וָֽאֹמַר֙ אֶל־הַֽחַרְטֻמִּ֔ים וְאֵ֥ין מַגִּ֖יד לִֽי׃
transliteration: vativ'la'na hashiboliym hadakot et sheva' hashiboliym hatovvot vaomar el-hachar'tumiym v'eyn magiyd liy
translation: And the thin ears swallowed the seven healthy ears. I have told my magicians, but none has an explanation for me.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה חֲל֥וֹם פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶחָ֣ד ה֑וּא אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֧ר הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים עֹשֶׂ֖ה הִגִּ֥יד לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-par'oh chalvom par'oh echad hv et asher haelohiym 'oseh higiyd l'far'oh
translation: And Joseph said to Pharaoh, “Pharaoh’s dreams are one and the same: God has told Pharaoh what He is about to do.

hebrew: שֶׁ֧בַע פָּרֹ֣ת הַטֹּבֹ֗ת שֶׁ֤בַע שָׁנִים֙ הֵ֔נָּה וְשֶׁ֤בַע הַֽשִּׁבֳּלִים֙ הַטֹּבֹ֔ת שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים הֵ֑נָּה חֲל֖וֹם אֶחָ֥ד הֽוּא׃
transliteration: sheva' parot hatovot sheva' shaniym henah v'sheva' hashiboliym hatovot sheva' shaniym henah chalvom echad hv
translation: The seven healthy cows are seven years, and the seven healthy ears are seven years; it is the same dream.

hebrew: וְשֶׁ֣בַע הַ֠פָּרוֹת הָֽרַקּ֨וֹת וְהָרָעֹ֜ת הָעֹלֹ֣ת אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ן שֶׁ֤בַע שָׁנִים֙ הֵ֔נָּה וְשֶׁ֤בַע הַֽשִׁבֳּלִים֙ הָרֵק֔וֹת שְׁדֻפ֖וֹת הַקָּדִ֑ים יִהְי֕וּ שֶׁ֖בַע שְׁנֵ֥י רָעָֽב׃
transliteration: v'sheva' haparvot harakvot v'hara'ot ha'olot achareyhen sheva' shaniym henah v'sheva' hashiboliym harekvot sh'dufvot hakadiym yih'yv sheva' sh'ney ra'av
translation: The seven lean and ugly cows that followed are seven years, as are also the seven empty ears scorched by the east wind; they are seven years of famine.

hebrew: ה֣וּא הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים עֹשֶׂ֖ה הֶרְאָ֥ה אֶת־פַּרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: hv hadavar asher dibar'tiy el-par'oh asher haelohiym 'oseh her'ah et-par'oh
translation: It is just as I have told Pharaoh: God has revealed to Pharaoh what He is about to do.

hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים בָּא֑וֹת שָׂבָ֥ע גָּד֖וֹל בְּכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: hineh sheva' shaniym bavot sava' gadvol b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: Immediately ahead are seven years of great abundance in all the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וְ֠קָמוּ שֶׁ֨בַע שְׁנֵ֤י רָעָב֙ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ן וְנִשְׁכַּ֥ח כָּל־הַשָּׂבָ֖ע בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְכִלָּ֥ה הָרָעָ֖ב אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'kamv sheva' sh'ney ra'av achareyhen v'nish'kach kal-hasava' b'eretz mitz'rayim v'khilah hara'av et-haaretz
translation: After them will come seven years of famine, and all the abundance in the land of Egypt will be forgotten. As the land is ravaged by famine,

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יִוָּדַ֤ע הַשָּׂבָע֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ מִפְּנֵ֛י הָרָעָ֥ב הַה֖וּא אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֑ן כִּֽי־כָבֵ֥ד ה֖וּא מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: v'lo-yivada' hasava' baaretz mip'ney hara'av hahv acharey-khen kiy-khaved hv m'od
translation: no trace of the abundance will be left in the land because of the famine thereafter, for it will be very severe.

hebrew: וְעַ֨ל הִשָּׁנ֧וֹת הַחֲל֛וֹם אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה פַּעֲמָ֑יִם כִּֽי־נָכ֤וֹן הַדָּבָר֙ מֵעִ֣ם הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וּמְמַהֵ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים לַעֲשֹׂתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'al hishanvot hachalvom el-par'oh pa'amayim kiy-nakhvon hadavar me'im haelohiym vm'maher haelohiym la'asotvo
translation: As for Pharaoh having had the same dream twice, it means that the matter has been determined by God, and that God will soon carry it out.

hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ יֵרֶ֣א פַרְעֹ֔ה אִ֖ישׁ נָב֣וֹן וְחָכָ֑ם וִישִׁיתֵ֖הוּ עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'atah yere far'oh iysh navvon v'chakham viyshiytehv 'al-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: “Accordingly, let Pharaoh find a man of discernment and wisdom, and set him over the land of Egypt.

hebrew: יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה פַרְעֹ֔ה וְיַפְקֵ֥ד פְּקִדִ֖ים עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְחִמֵּשׁ֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּשֶׁ֖בַע שְׁנֵ֥י הַשָּׂבָֽע׃
transliteration: ya'aseh far'oh v'yaf'ked p'kidiym 'al-haaretz v'chimesh et-eretz mitz'rayim b'sheva' sh'ney hasava'
translation: And let Pharaoh take steps to appoint overseers over the land, and organizeaOthers “take a fifth part of”; meaning of Heb. uncertain. the land of Egypt in the seven years of plenty.

hebrew: וְיִקְבְּצ֗וּ אֶת־כָּל־אֹ֙כֶל֙ הַשָּׁנִ֣ים הַטֹּבֹ֔ת הַבָּאֹ֖ת הָאֵ֑לֶּה וְיִצְבְּרוּ־בָ֞ר תַּ֧חַת יַד־פַּרְעֹ֛ה אֹ֥כֶל בֶּעָרִ֖ים וְשָׁמָֽרוּ׃
transliteration: v'yik'b'tzv et-kal-okhel hashaniym hatovot habaot haeleh v'yitz'b'rv-var tachat yad-par'oh okhel be'ariym v'shamarv
translation: Let all the food of these good years that are coming be gathered, and let the grain be collected under Pharaoh’s authority as food to be stored in the cities.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה הָאֹ֤כֶל לְפִקָּדוֹן֙ לָאָ֔רֶץ לְשֶׁ֙בַע֙ שְׁנֵ֣י הָרָעָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּהְיֶ֖יןָ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְלֹֽא־תִכָּרֵ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ בָּרָעָֽב׃
transliteration: v'hayah haokhel l'fikadvon laaretz l'sheva' sh'ney hara'av asher tih'yeyna b'eretz mitz'rayim v'lo-tikaret haaretz bara'av
translation: Let that food be a reserve for the land for the seven years of famine which will come upon the land of Egypt, so that the land may not perish in the famine.”

hebrew: וַיִּיטַ֥ב הַדָּבָ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וּבְעֵינֵ֖י כָּל־עֲבָדָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayiytav hadavar b'eyney far'oh vv'eyney kal-'avadayv
translation: The plan pleased Pharaoh and all his courtiers.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶל־עֲבָדָ֑יו הֲנִמְצָ֣א כָזֶ֔ה אִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֛ר ר֥וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֖ים בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh el-'avadayv hanim'tza khazeh iysh asher rvcha elohiym bvo
translation: And Pharaoh said to his courtiers, “Could we find another like him, a man in whom is the spirit of God?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אַחֲרֵ֨י הוֹדִ֧יעַ אֱלֹהִ֛ים אוֹתְךָ֖ אֶת־כָּל־זֹ֑את אֵין־נָב֥וֹן וְחָכָ֖ם כָּמֽוֹךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh el-yvosef acharey hvodiy'a elohiym vot'kha et-kal-zot eyn-navvon v'chakham kamvokha
translation: So Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Since God has made all this known to you, there is none so discerning and wise as you.

hebrew: אַתָּה֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה עַל־בֵּיתִ֔י וְעַל־פִּ֖יךָ יִשַּׁ֣ק כָּל־עַמִּ֑י רַ֥ק הַכִּסֵּ֖א אֶגְדַּ֥ל מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
transliteration: atah tih'yeh 'al-beytiy v'al-piykha yishak kal-'amiy rak hakise eg'dal mimeka
translation: You shall be in charge of my court, and by your command shall all my people be directed;bOthers “order themselves” or “pay homage”; meaning of Heb. yishshaq uncertain. only with respect to the throne shall I be superior to you.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶל־יוֹסֵ֑ף רְאֵה֙ נָתַ֣תִּי אֹֽתְךָ֔ עַ֖ל כָּל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh el-yvosef r'eh natatiy ot'kha 'al kal-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: Pharaoh further said to Joseph, “See, I put you in charge of all the land of Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֨סַר פַּרְעֹ֤ה אֶת־טַבַּעְתּוֹ֙ מֵעַ֣ל יָד֔וֹ וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֖הּ עַל־יַ֣ד יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיַּלְבֵּ֤שׁ אֹתוֹ֙ בִּגְדֵי־שֵׁ֔שׁ וַיָּ֛שֶׂם רְבִ֥ד הַזָּהָ֖ב עַל־צַוָּארֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayasar par'oh et-taba'tvo me'al yadvo vayiten otah 'al-yad yvosef vayal'besh otvo big'dey-shesh vayasem r'vid hazahav 'al-tzavarvo
translation: And removing his signet ring from his hand, Pharaoh put it on Joseph’s hand; and he had him dressed in robes of fine linen, and put a gold chain about his neck.

hebrew: וַיַּרְכֵּ֣ב אֹת֗וֹ בְּמִרְכֶּ֤בֶת הַמִּשְׁנֶה֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וַיִּקְרְא֥וּ לְפָנָ֖יו אַבְרֵ֑ךְ וְנָת֣וֹן אֹת֔וֹ עַ֖ל כָּל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayar'kev otvo b'mir'kevet hamish'neh asher-lvo vayik'r'v l'fanayv av'rekh' v'natvon otvo 'al kal-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: He had him ride in the chariot of his second-in-command, and they cried before him, “Abrek!”cOthers “Bow the knee,” as though from Heb. barakh “to kneel”; perhaps from an Egyptian word of unknown meaning. Thus he placed him over all the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֛ה אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף אֲנִ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וּבִלְעָדֶ֗יךָ לֹֽא־יָרִ֨ים אִ֧ישׁ אֶת־יָד֛וֹ וְאֶת־רַגְל֖וֹ בְּכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh el-yvosef aniy far'oh vvil'adeykha lo-yariym iysh et-yadvo v'et-rag'lvo b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I am Pharaoh; yet without you, no one shall lift up hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א פַרְעֹ֣ה שֵׁם־יוֹסֵף֮ צָֽפְנַ֣ת פַּעְנֵחַ֒ וַיִּתֶּן־ל֣וֹ אֶת־אָֽסְנַ֗ת בַּת־פּ֥וֹטִי פֶ֛רַע כֹּהֵ֥ן אֹ֖ן לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיֵּצֵ֥א יוֹסֵ֖ף עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayik'ra far'oh shem-yvosef tzaf'nat pa'necha vayiten-lvo et-as'nat bat-pvotiy fera' kohen on l'ishah vayetze yvosef 'al-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: Pharaoh then gave Joseph the name Zaphenath-paneah;dEgyptian for “God speaks; he lives,” or “creator of life.” and he gave him for a wife Asenath daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On. Thus Joseph emerged in charge of the land of Egypt.—

hebrew: וְיוֹסֵף֙ בֶּן־שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּעָמְד֕וֹ לִפְנֵ֖י פַּרְעֹ֣ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיֵּצֵ֤א יוֹסֵף֙ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וַֽיַּעְבֹ֖ר בְּכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'yvosef ben-sh'loshiym shanah b'am'dvo lif'ney par'oh melekh'-mitz'rayim vayetze yvosef milif'ney far'oh vaya'vor b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: Joseph was thirty years old when he entered the service of Pharaoh king of Egypt.—Leaving Pharaoh’s presence, Joseph traveled through all the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וַתַּ֣עַשׂ הָאָ֔רֶץ בְּשֶׁ֖בַע שְׁנֵ֣י הַשָּׂבָ֑ע לִקְמָצִֽים׃
transliteration: vata'as haaretz b'sheva' sh'ney hasava' lik'matziym
translation: During the seven years of plenty, the land produced in abundance.

hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּ֞ץ אֶת־כָּל־אֹ֣כֶל ׀ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר הָיוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּתֶּן־אֹ֖כֶל בֶּעָרִ֑ים אֹ֧כֶל שְׂדֵה־הָעִ֛יר אֲשֶׁ֥ר סְבִיבֹתֶ֖יהָ נָתַ֥ן בְּתוֹכָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayik'botz et-kal-okhel  sheva' shaniym asher hayv b'eretz mitz'rayim vayiten-okhel be'ariym okhel s'deh-ha'iyr asher s'viyvoteyha natan b'tvokhah
translation: And he gathered all the grain of eLit. “the seven years that were in the land of Egypt.”the seven years that the land of Egypt was enjoying,-e and stored the grain in the cities; he put in each city the grain of the fields around it.

hebrew: וַיִּצְבֹּ֨ר יוֹסֵ֥ף בָּ֛ר כְּח֥וֹל הַיָּ֖ם הַרְבֵּ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד עַ֛ד כִּי־חָדַ֥ל לִסְפֹּ֖ר כִּי־אֵ֥ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
transliteration: vayitz'bor yvosef bar k'chvol hayam har'beh m'od 'ad kiy-chadal lis'por kiy-eyn mis'par
translation: So Joseph collected produce in very large quantity, like the sands of the sea, until he ceased to measure it, for it could not be measured.

hebrew: וּלְיוֹסֵ֤ף יֻלַּד֙ שְׁנֵ֣י בָנִ֔ים בְּטֶ֥רֶם תָּב֖וֹא שְׁנַ֣ת הָרָעָ֑ב אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָֽלְדָה־לּוֹ֙ אָֽסְנַ֔ת בַּת־פּ֥וֹטִי פֶ֖רַע כֹּהֵ֥ן אֽוֹן׃
transliteration: vl'yvosef yulad sh'ney vaniym b'terem tavvo sh'nat hara'av asher yal'dah-lvo as'nat bat-pvotiy fera' kohen von
translation: Before the years of famine came, Joseph became the father of two sons, whom Asenath daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On, bore to him.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם הַבְּכ֖וֹר מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה כִּֽי־נַשַּׁ֤נִי אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־כָּל־עֲמָלִ֔י וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽי׃
transliteration: vayik'ra yvosef et-shem hab'khvor m'nasheh kiy-nashaniy elohiym et-kal-'amaliy v'et kal-beyt aviy
translation: Joseph named the first-born Manasseh, meaning, “God has made me forgetfHeb. nashshani, connected with “Manasseh” (Menashsheh). completely my hardship and my parental home.”

hebrew: וְאֵ֛ת שֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖י קָרָ֣א אֶפְרָ֑יִם כִּֽי־הִפְרַ֥נִי אֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּאֶ֥רֶץ עָנְיִֽי׃
transliteration: v'et shem hasheniy kara ef'rayim kiy-hif'raniy elohiym b'eretz 'an'yiy
translation: And the second he named Ephraim, meaning, “God has made me fertilegHeb. hiphrani, connected with “Ephraim.” in the land of my affliction.”

hebrew: וַתִּכְלֶ֕ינָה שֶׁ֖בַע שְׁנֵ֣י הַשָּׂבָ֑ע אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vatikh'leynah sheva' sh'ney hasava' asher hayah b'eretz mitz'rayim
translation: The seven years of abundance that the land of Egypt enjoyed came to an end,

hebrew: וַתְּחִלֶּ֜ינָה שֶׁ֣בַע שְׁנֵ֤י הָרָעָב֙ לָב֔וֹא כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָמַ֣ר יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיְהִ֤י רָעָב֙ בְּכָל־הָ֣אֲרָצ֔וֹת וּבְכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם הָ֥יָה לָֽחֶם׃
transliteration: vat'chileynah sheva' sh'ney hara'av lavvo kaasher amar yvosef vay'hiy ra'av b'khal-haaratzvot vv'khal-eretz mitz'rayim hayah lachem
translation: and the seven years of famine set in, just as Joseph had foretold. There was famine in all lands, but throughout the land of Egypt there was bread.

hebrew: וַתִּרְעַב֙ כָּל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּצְעַ֥ק הָעָ֛ם אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לַלָּ֑חֶם וַיֹּ֨אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֤ה לְכָל־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לְכ֣וּ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אֲשֶׁר־יֹאמַ֥ר לָכֶ֖ם תַּעֲשֽׂוּ׃
transliteration: vatir'av kal-eretz mitz'rayim vayitz'ak ha'am el-par'oh lalachem vayomer par'oh l'khal-mitz'rayim l'khv el-yvosef asher-yomar lakhem ta'asv
translation: And when all the land of Egypt felt the hunger, the people cried out to Pharaoh for bread; and Pharaoh said to all the Egyptians, “Go to Joseph; whatever he tells you, you shall do.”—

hebrew: וְהָרָעָ֣ב הָיָ֔ה עַ֖ל כָּל־פְּנֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּפְתַּ֨ח יוֹסֵ֜ף אֶֽת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר בָּהֶם֙ וַיִּשְׁבֹּ֣ר לְמִצְרַ֔יִם וַיֶּחֱזַ֥ק הָֽרָעָ֖ב בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'hara'av hayah 'al kal-p'ney haaretz vayif'tach yvosef et-kal-asher bahem vayish'bor l'mitz'rayim vayechezak hara'av b'eretz mitz'rayim
translation: Accordingly, when the famine became severe in the land of Egypt, Joseph laid open all that was within, and rationed out grain to the Egyptians. The famine, however, spread over the whole world.

hebrew: וְכָל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ בָּ֣אוּ מִצְרַ֔יְמָה לִשְׁבֹּ֖ר אֶל־יוֹסֵ֑ף כִּֽי־חָזַ֥ק הָרָעָ֖ב בְּכָל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'khal-haaretz bav mitz'ray'mah lish'bor el-yvosef kiy-chazak hara'av b'khal-haaretz
translation: So all the world came to Joseph in Egypt to procure rations, for the famine had become severe throughout the world.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא יַעֲקֹ֔ב כִּ֥י יֶשׁ־שֶׁ֖בֶר בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ לְבָנָ֔יו לָ֖מָּה תִּתְרָאֽוּ׃
transliteration: vayar' ya'akov kiy yesh-shever b'mitz'rayim vayomer ya'akov l'vanayv lamah tit'rav
translation: When Jacob saw that there were food rations to be had in Egypt, heaLit. “Jacob.” said to his sons, “Why do you keep looking at one another?

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּ֣ה שָׁמַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֥י יֶשׁ־שֶׁ֖בֶר בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם רְדוּ־שָׁ֙מָּה֙ וְשִׁבְרוּ־לָ֣נוּ מִשָּׁ֔ם וְנִחְיֶ֖ה וְלֹ֥א נָמֽוּת׃
transliteration: vayomer hineh shama'tiy kiy yesh-shever b'mitz'rayim r'dv-shamah v'shiv'rv-lanv misham v'nich'yeh v'lo namvt
translation: Now I hear,” he went on, “that there are rations to be had in Egypt. Go down and procure rations for us there, that we may live and not die.”

hebrew: וַיֵּרְד֥וּ אֲחֵֽי־יוֹסֵ֖ף עֲשָׂרָ֑ה לִשְׁבֹּ֥ר בָּ֖ר מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayer'dv achey-yvosef 'asarah lish'bor bar mimitz'rayim
translation: So ten of Joseph’s brothers went down to get grain rations in Egypt;

hebrew: וְאֶת־בִּנְיָמִין֙ אֲחִ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף לֹא־שָׁלַ֥ח יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־אֶחָ֑יו כִּ֣י אָמַ֔ר פֶּן־יִקְרָאֶ֖נּוּ אָסֽוֹן׃
transliteration: v'et-bin'yamiyn achiy yvosef lo-shalach ya'akov et-echayv kiy amar pen-yik'raenv asvon
translation: for Jacob did not send Joseph’s brother Benjamin with his brothers, since he feared that he might meet with disaster.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִשְׁבֹּ֖ר בְּת֣וֹךְ הַבָּאִ֑ים כִּֽי־הָיָ֥ה הָרָעָ֖ב בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: vayavov b'ney yis'rael lish'bor b'tvokh' habaiym kiy-hayah hara'av b'eretz k'na'an
translation: Thus the sons of Israel were among those who came to procure rations, for the famine extended to the land of Canaan.

hebrew: וְיוֹסֵ֗ף ה֚וּא הַשַּׁלִּ֣יט עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ ה֥וּא הַמַּשְׁבִּ֖יר לְכָל־עַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֲחֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף וַיִּשְׁתַּֽחֲווּ־ל֥וֹ אַפַּ֖יִם אָֽרְצָה׃
transliteration: v'yvosef hv hashaliyt 'al-haaretz hv hamash'biyr l'khal-'am haaretz vayavov achey yvosef vayish'tachavv-lvo apayim ar'tzah
translation: Now Joseph was the vizier of the land; it was he who dispensed rations to all the people of the land. And Joseph’s brothers came and bowed low to him, with their faces to the ground.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶת־אֶחָ֖יו וַיַּכִּרֵ֑ם וַיִּתְנַכֵּ֨ר אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר אִתָּ֣ם קָשׁ֗וֹת וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ מֵאַ֣יִן בָּאתֶ֔ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנַ֖עַן לִשְׁבָּר־אֹֽכֶל׃
transliteration: vayar' yvosef et-echayv vayakirem vayit'naker aleyhem vay'daber itam kashvot vayomer alehem meayin batem vayom'rv meeretz k'na'an lish'bar-okhel
translation: When Joseph saw his brothers, he recognized them; but he acted like a stranger toward them and spoke harshly to them. He asked them, “Where do you come from?” And they said, “From the land of Canaan, to procure food.”

hebrew: וַיַּכֵּ֥ר יוֹסֵ֖ף אֶת־אֶחָ֑יו וְהֵ֖ם לֹ֥א הִכִּרֻֽהוּ׃
transliteration: vayaker yvosef et-echayv v'hem lo hikiruhv
translation: For though Joseph recognized his brothers, they did not recognize him.

hebrew: וַיִּזְכֹּ֣ר יוֹסֵ֔ף אֵ֚ת הַחֲלֹמ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָלַ֖ם לָהֶ֑ם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ מְרַגְּלִ֣ים אַתֶּ֔ם לִרְא֛וֹת אֶת־עֶרְוַ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ בָּאתֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayiz'kor yvosef et hachalomvot asher chalam lahem vayomer alehem m'rag'liym atem lir'vot et-'er'vat haaretz batem
translation: Recalling the dreams that he had dreamed about them, Joseph said to them, “You are spies, you have come to see the land in its nakedness.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו לֹ֣א אֲדֹנִ֑י וַעֲבָדֶ֥יךָ בָּ֖אוּ לִשְׁבָּר־אֹֽכֶל׃
transliteration: vayom'rv elayv lo adoniy va'avadeykha bav lish'bar-okhel
translation: But they said to him, “No, my lord! Truly, your servants have come to procure food.

hebrew: כֻּלָּ֕נוּ בְּנֵ֥י אִישׁ־אֶחָ֖ד נָ֑חְנוּ כֵּנִ֣ים אֲנַ֔חְנוּ לֹא־הָי֥וּ עֲבָדֶ֖יךָ מְרַגְּלִֽים׃
transliteration: kulanv b'ney iysh-echad nach'nv keniym anach'nv lo-hayv 'avadeykha m'rag'liym
translation: We are all of us sons of the same man; we are honest men; your servants have never been spies!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֑ם לֹ֕א כִּֽי־עֶרְוַ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ בָּאתֶ֥ם לִרְאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem lo kiy-'er'vat haaretz batem lir'vot
translation: And he said to them, “No, you have come to see the land in its nakedness!”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ שְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂר֩ עֲבָדֶ֨יךָ אַחִ֧ים ׀ אֲנַ֛חְנוּ בְּנֵ֥י אִישׁ־אֶחָ֖ד בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְהִנֵּ֨ה הַקָּטֹ֤ן אֶת־אָבִ֙ינוּ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם וְהָאֶחָ֖ד אֵינֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: vayom'rv sh'neym 'asar 'avadeykha achiym  anach'nv b'ney iysh-echad b'eretz k'na'an v'hineh hakaton et-aviynv hayvom v'haechad eynenv
translation: And they replied, “We your servants were twelve brothers, sons of a certain man in the land of Canaan; the youngest, however, is now with our father, and one is no more.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֖ם יוֹסֵ֑ף ה֗וּא אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבַּ֧רְתִּי אֲלֵכֶ֛ם לֵאמֹ֖ר מְרַגְּלִ֥ים אַתֶּֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem yvosef hv asher dibar'tiy alekhem lemor m'rag'liym atem
translation: But Joseph said to them, “It is just as I have told you: You are spies!

hebrew: בְּזֹ֖את תִּבָּחֵ֑נוּ חֵ֤י פַרְעֹה֙ אִם־תֵּצְא֣וּ מִזֶּ֔ה כִּ֧י אִם־בְּב֛וֹא אֲחִיכֶ֥ם הַקָּטֹ֖ן הֵֽנָּה׃
transliteration: b'zot tibachenv chey far'oh im-tetz'v mizeh kiy im-b'vvo achiykhem hakaton henah
translation: By this you shall be put to the test: unless your youngest brother comes here, by Pharaoh, you shall not depart from this place!

hebrew: שִׁלְח֨וּ מִכֶּ֣ם אֶחָד֮ וְיִקַּ֣ח אֶת־אֲחִיכֶם֒ וְאַתֶּם֙ הֵאָ֣סְר֔וּ וְיִבָּֽחֲנוּ֙ דִּבְרֵיכֶ֔ם הַֽאֱמֶ֖ת אִתְּכֶ֑ם וְאִם־לֹ֕א חֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה כִּ֥י מְרַגְּלִ֖ים אַתֶּֽם׃
