transliteration: shil'chv mikem echad v'yikach et-achiykhem v'atem heas'rv v'yibachanv div'reykhem haemet it'khem v'im-lo chey far'oh kiy m'rag'liym atem
translation: Let one of you go and bring your brother, while the rest of you remain confined, that your words may be put to the test whether there is truth in you. Else, by Pharaoh, you are nothing but spies!”

hebrew: וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ף אֹתָ֛ם אֶל־מִשְׁמָ֖ר שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: vayeesof otam el-mish'mar sh'loshet yamiym
translation: And he confined them in the guardhouse for three days.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֤ם יוֹסֵף֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י זֹ֥את עֲשׂ֖וּ וִֽחְי֑וּ אֶת־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אֲנִ֥י יָרֵֽא׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem yvosef bayvom hash'liyshiy zot 'asv vich'yv et-haelohiym aniy yare
translation: On the third day Joseph said to them, “Do this and you shall live, for I am a God-fearing man.

hebrew: אִם־כֵּנִ֣ים אַתֶּ֔ם אֲחִיכֶ֣ם אֶחָ֔ד יֵאָסֵ֖ר בְּבֵ֣ית מִשְׁמַרְכֶ֑ם וְאַתֶּם֙ לְכ֣וּ הָבִ֔יאוּ שֶׁ֖בֶר רַעֲב֥וֹן בָּתֵּיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: im-keniym atem achiykhem echad yeaser b'veyt mish'mar'khem v'atem l'khv haviyv shever ra'avvon bateykhem
translation: If you are honest men, let one of you brothers be held in your place of detention, while the rest of you go and take home rations for your starving households;

hebrew: וְאֶת־אֲחִיכֶ֤ם הַקָּטֹן֙ תָּבִ֣יאוּ אֵלַ֔י וְיֵאָמְנ֥וּ דִבְרֵיכֶ֖ם וְלֹ֣א תָמ֑וּתוּ וַיַּעֲשׂוּ־כֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'et-achiykhem hakaton taviyv elay v'yeam'nv div'reykhem v'lo tamvtv vaya'asv-khen
translation: but you must bring me your youngest brother, that your words may be verified and that you may not die.” And they did accordingly.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֗יו אֲבָל֮ אֲשֵׁמִ֣ים ׀ אֲנַחְנוּ֮ עַל־אָחִינוּ֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר רָאִ֜ינוּ צָרַ֥ת נַפְשׁ֛וֹ בְּהִתְחַֽנְנ֥וֹ אֵלֵ֖ינוּ וְלֹ֣א שָׁמָ֑עְנוּ עַל־כֵּן֙ בָּ֣אָה אֵלֵ֔ינוּ הַצָּרָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
transliteration: vayom'rv iysh el-achiyv aval ashemiym  anach'nv 'al-achiynv asher raiynv tzarat naf'shvo b'hit'chan'nvo eleynv v'lo shama'nv 'al-ken baah eleynv hatzarah hazot
translation: They said to one another, “Alas, we are being punished on account of our brother, because we looked on at his anguish, yet paid no heed as he pleaded with us. That is why this distress has come upon us.”

hebrew: וַיַּעַן֩ רְאוּבֵ֨ן אֹתָ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר הֲלוֹא֩ אָמַ֨רְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶ֧ם ׀ לֵאמֹ֛ר אַל־תֶּחֶטְא֥וּ בַיֶּ֖לֶד וְלֹ֣א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֑ם וְגַם־דָּמ֖וֹ הִנֵּ֥ה נִדְרָֽשׁ׃
transliteration: vaya'an r'vven otam lemor halvo amar'tiy aleykhem  lemor al-techet'v vayeled v'lo sh'ma'tem v'gam-damvo hineh nid'rash
translation: Then Reuben spoke up and said to them, “Did I not tell you, ‘Do no wrong to the boy’? But you paid no heed. Now comes the reckoning for his blood.”

hebrew: וְהֵם֙ לֹ֣א יָֽדְע֔וּ כִּ֥י שֹׁמֵ֖עַ יוֹסֵ֑ף כִּ֥י הַמֵּלִ֖יץ בֵּינֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'hem lo yad'v kiy shome'a yvosef kiy hameliytz beynotam
translation: They did not know that Joseph understood, for there was an interpreter between him and them.

hebrew: וַיִּסֹּ֥ב מֵֽעֲלֵיהֶ֖ם וַיֵּ֑בְךְּ וַיָּ֤שָׁב אֲלֵהֶם֙ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֵֽאִתָּם֙ אֶת־שִׁמְע֔וֹן וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ר אֹת֖וֹ לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayisov me'aleyhem vayev'k' vayashav alehem vay'daber alehem vayikach meitam et-shim'von vayeesor otvo l'eyneyhem
translation: He turned away from them and wept. But he came back to them and spoke to them; and he took Simeon from among them and had him bound before their eyes.

hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו יוֹסֵ֗ף וַיְמַלְא֣וּ אֶת־כְּלֵיהֶם֮ בָּר֒ וּלְהָשִׁ֤יב כַּסְפֵּיהֶם֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־שַׂקּ֔וֹ וְלָתֵ֥ת לָהֶ֛ם צֵדָ֖ה לַדָּ֑רֶךְ וַיַּ֥עַשׂ לָהֶ֖ם כֵּֽן׃
transliteration: vay'tzav yvosef vay'mal'v et-k'leyhem bar vl'hashiyv kas'peyhem iysh el-sakvo v'latet lahem tzedah ladarekh' vaya'as lahem ken
translation: Then Joseph gave orders to fill their bags with grain, return each one’s money to his sack, and give them provisions for the journey; and this was done for them.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ אֶת־שִׁבְרָ֖ם עַל־חֲמֹרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ מִשָּֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayis'v et-shiv'ram 'al-chamoreyhem vayel'khv misham
translation: So they loaded their asses with the rations and departed from there.

hebrew: וַיִּפְתַּ֨ח הָאֶחָ֜ד אֶת־שַׂקּ֗וֹ לָתֵ֥ת מִסְפּ֛וֹא לַחֲמֹר֖וֹ בַּמָּל֑וֹן וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־כַּסְפּ֔וֹ וְהִנֵּה־ה֖וּא בְּפִ֥י אַמְתַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayif'tach haechad et-sakvo latet mis'pvo lachamorvo bamalvon vayar' et-kas'pvo v'hineh-hv b'fiy am'tach'tvo
translation: As one of them was opening his sack to give feed to his ass at the night encampment, he saw his money right there at the mouth of his bag.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֶל־אֶחָיו֙ הוּשַׁ֣ב כַּסְפִּ֔י וְגַ֖ם הִנֵּ֣ה בְאַמְתַּחְתִּ֑י וַיֵּצֵ֣א לִבָּ֗ם וַיֶּֽחֶרְד֞וּ אִ֤ישׁ אֶל־אָחִיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מַה־זֹּ֛את עָשָׂ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים לָֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer el-echayv hvshav kas'piy v'gam hineh v'am'tach'tiy vayetze libam vayecher'dv iysh el-achiyv lemor mah-zot 'asah elohiym lanv
translation: And he said to his brothers, “My money has been returned! It is here in my bag!” Their hearts sank; and, trembling, they turned to one another, saying, “What is this that God has done to us?”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֛אוּ אֶל־יַעֲקֹ֥ב אֲבִיהֶ֖ם אַ֣רְצָה כְּנָ֑עַן וַיַּגִּ֣ידוּ ל֔וֹ אֵ֛ת כָּל־הַקֹּרֹ֥ת אֹתָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayavov el-ya'akov aviyhem ar'tzah k'na'an vayagiydv lvo et kal-hakorot otam lemor
translation: When they came to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan, they told him all that had befallen them, saying,

hebrew: דִּ֠בֶּר הָאִ֨ישׁ אֲדֹנֵ֥י הָאָ֛רֶץ אִתָּ֖נוּ קָשׁ֑וֹת וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֹתָ֔נוּ כִּֽמְרַגְּלִ֖ים אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: diber haiysh adoney haaretz itanv kashvot vayiten otanv kim'rag'liym et-haaretz
translation: “The man who is lord of the land spoke harshly to us and accused us of spying on the land.

hebrew: וַנֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו כֵּנִ֣ים אֲנָ֑חְנוּ לֹ֥א הָיִ֖ינוּ מְרַגְּלִֽים׃
transliteration: vanomer elayv keniym anach'nv lo hayiynv m'rag'liym
translation: We said to him, ‘We are honest men; we have never been spies!

hebrew: שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר אֲנַ֛חְנוּ אַחִ֖ים בְּנֵ֣י אָבִ֑ינוּ הָאֶחָ֣ד אֵינֶ֔נּוּ וְהַקָּטֹ֥ן הַיּ֛וֹם אֶת־אָבִ֖ינוּ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: sh'neym-'asar anach'nv achiym b'ney aviynv haechad eynenv v'hakaton hayvom et-aviynv b'eretz k'na'an
translation: There were twelve of us brothers, sons by the same father; but one is no more, and the youngest is now with our father in the land of Canaan.’

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלֵ֗ינוּ הָאִישׁ֙ אֲדֹנֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ בְּזֹ֣את אֵדַ֔ע כִּ֥י כֵנִ֖ים אַתֶּ֑ם אֲחִיכֶ֤ם הָֽאֶחָד֙ הַנִּ֣יחוּ אִתִּ֔י וְאֶת־רַעֲב֥וֹן בָּתֵּיכֶ֖ם קְח֥וּ וָלֵֽכוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer eleynv haiysh adoney haaretz b'zot eda' kiy kheniym atem achiykhem haechad haniychv itiy v'et-ra'avvon bateykhem k'chv valekhv
translation: But the man who is lord of the land said to us, ‘By this I shall know that you are honest men: leave one of your brothers with me, and take something for your starving households and be off.

hebrew: וְ֠הָבִיאוּ אֶת־אֲחִיכֶ֣ם הַקָּטֹן֮ אֵלַי֒ וְאֵֽדְעָ֗ה כִּ֣י לֹ֤א מְרַגְּלִים֙ אַתֶּ֔ם כִּ֥י כֵנִ֖ים אַתֶּ֑ם אֶת־אֲחִיכֶם֙ אֶתֵּ֣ן לָכֶ֔ם וְאֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ תִּסְחָֽרוּ׃
transliteration: v'haviyv et-achiykhem hakaton elay v'ed'ah kiy lo m'rag'liym atem kiy kheniym atem et-achiykhem eten lakhem v'et-haaretz tis'charv
translation: And bring your youngest brother to me, that I may know that you are not spies but honest men. I will then restore your brother to you, and you shall be free to move about in the land.’”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י הֵ֚ם מְרִיקִ֣ים שַׂקֵּיהֶ֔ם וְהִנֵּה־אִ֥ישׁ צְרוֹר־כַּסְפּ֖וֹ בְּשַׂקּ֑וֹ וַיִּרְא֞וּ אֶת־צְרֹר֧וֹת כַּסְפֵּיהֶ֛ם הֵ֥מָּה וַאֲבִיהֶ֖ם וַיִּירָֽאוּ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy hem m'riykiym sakeyhem v'hineh-iysh tz'rvor-kas'pvo b'sakvo vayir'v et-tz'rorvot kas'peyhem hemah vaaviyhem vayiyrav
translation: As they were emptying their sacks, there, in each one’s sack, was his money-bag! When they and their father saw their money-bags, they were dismayed.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ יַעֲקֹ֣ב אֲבִיהֶ֔ם אֹתִ֖י שִׁכַּלְתֶּ֑ם יוֹסֵ֤ף אֵינֶ֙נּוּ֙ וְשִׁמְע֣וֹן אֵינֶ֔נּוּ וְאֶת־בִּנְיָמִ֣ן תִּקָּ֔חוּ עָלַ֖י הָי֥וּ כֻלָּֽנָה׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem ya'akov aviyhem otiy shikal'tem yvosef eynenv v'shim'von eynenv v'et-bin'yamin tikachv 'alay hayv khulanah
translation: Their father Jacob said to them, “It is always me that you bereave: Joseph is no more and Simeon is no more, and now you would take away Benjamin. These things always happen to me!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר רְאוּבֵן֙ אֶל־אָבִ֣יו לֵאמֹ֔ר אֶת־שְׁנֵ֤י בָנַי֙ תָּמִ֔ית אִם־לֹ֥א אֲבִיאֶ֖נּוּ אֵלֶ֑יךָ תְּנָ֤ה אֹתוֹ֙ עַל־יָדִ֔י וַאֲנִ֖י אֲשִׁיבֶ֥נּוּ אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer r'vven el-aviyv lemor et-sh'ney vanay tamiyt im-lo aviyenv eleykha t'nah otvo 'al-yadiy vaaniy ashiyvenv eleykha
translation: Then Reuben said to his father, “You may kill my two sons if I do not bring him back to you. Put him in my care, and I will return him to you.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹֽא־יֵרֵ֥ד בְּנִ֖י עִמָּכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־אָחִ֨יו מֵ֜ת וְה֧וּא לְבַדּ֣וֹ נִשְׁאָ֗ר וּקְרָאָ֤הוּ אָסוֹן֙ בַּדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּֽלְכוּ־בָ֔הּ וְהוֹרַדְתֶּ֧ם אֶת־שֵׂיבָתִ֛י בְּיָג֖וֹן שְׁאֽוֹלָה׃
transliteration: vayomer lo-yered b'niy 'imakhem kiy-achiyv met v'hv l'vadvo nish'ar vk'raahv asvon baderekh' asher tel'khv-vah v'hvorad'tem et-seyvatiy b'yagvon sh'volah
translation: But he said, “My son must not go down with you, for his brother is dead and he alone is left. If he meets with disaster on the journey you are taking, you will send my white head down to Sheol in grief.”

hebrew: וְהָרָעָ֖ב כָּבֵ֥ד בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'hara'av kaved baaretz
translation: But the famine in the land was severe.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר כִּלּוּ֙ לֶאֱכֹ֣ל אֶת־הַשֶּׁ֔בֶר אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵבִ֖יאוּ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ אֲבִיהֶ֔ם שֻׁ֖בוּ שִׁבְרוּ־לָ֥נוּ מְעַט־אֹֽכֶל׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kaasher kilv leekhol et-hashever asher heviyv mimitz'rayim vayomer aleyhem aviyhem shuvv shiv'rv-lanv m'at-okhel
translation: And when they had eaten up the rations which they had brought from Egypt, their father said to them, “Go again and procure some food for us.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אֵלָ֛יו יְהוּדָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר הָעֵ֣ד הֵעִד֩ בָּ֨נוּ הָאִ֤ישׁ לֵאמֹר֙ לֹֽא־תִרְא֣וּ פָנַ֔י בִּלְתִּ֖י אֲחִיכֶ֥ם אִתְּכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv y'hvdah lemor ha'ed he'id banv haiysh lemor lo-tir'v fanay bil'tiy achiykhem it'khem
translation: But Judah said to him, “The man warned us, aLit. “Do not see my face.”‘Do not let me see your faces-a unless your brother is with you.’

hebrew: אִם־יֶשְׁךָ֛ מְשַׁלֵּ֥חַ אֶת־אָחִ֖ינוּ אִתָּ֑נוּ נֵרְדָ֕ה וְנִשְׁבְּרָ֥ה לְךָ֖ אֹֽכֶל׃
transliteration: im-yesh'kha m'shalecha et-achiynv itanv ner'dah v'nish'b'rah l'kha okhel
translation: If you will let our brother go with us, we will go down and procure food for you;

hebrew: וְאִם־אֵינְךָ֥ מְשַׁלֵּ֖חַ לֹ֣א נֵרֵ֑ד כִּֽי־הָאִ֞ישׁ אָמַ֤ר אֵלֵ֙ינוּ֙ לֹֽא־תִרְא֣וּ פָנַ֔י בִּלְתִּ֖י אֲחִיכֶ֥ם אִתְּכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'im-eyn'kha m'shalecha lo nered kiy-haiysh amar eleynv lo-tir'v fanay bil'tiy achiykhem it'khem
translation: but if you will not let him go, we will not go down, for the man said to us, aLit. “Do not see my face.”‘Do not let me see your faces-a unless your brother is with you.’”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לָמָ֥ה הֲרֵעֹתֶ֖ם לִ֑י לְהַגִּ֣יד לָאִ֔ישׁ הַע֥וֹד לָכֶ֖ם אָֽח׃
transliteration: vayomer yis'rael lamah hare'otem liy l'hagiyd laiysh ha'vod lakhem ach
translation: And Israel said, “Why did you serve me so ill as to tell the man that you had another brother?”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֡וּ שָׁא֣וֹל שָֽׁאַל־הָ֠אִישׁ לָ֣נוּ וּלְמֽוֹלַדְתֵּ֜נוּ לֵאמֹ֗ר הַע֨וֹד אֲבִיכֶ֥ם חַי֙ הֲיֵ֣שׁ לָכֶ֣ם אָ֔ח וַנַ֨גֶּד־ל֔וֹ עַל־פִּ֖י הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה הֲיָד֣וֹעַ נֵדַ֔ע כִּ֣י יֹאמַ֔ר הוֹרִ֖ידוּ אֶת־אֲחִיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayom'rv shavol shaal-haiysh lanv vl'mvolad'tenv lemor ha'vod aviykhem chay hayesh lakhem ach vanaged-lvo 'al-piy had'variym haeleh hayadvo'a neda' kiy yomar hvoriydv et-achiykhem
translation: They replied, “But the man kept asking about us and our family, saying, ‘Is your father still living? Have you another brother?’ And we answered him accordingly. How were we to know that he would say, ‘Bring your brother here’?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוּדָ֜ה אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל אָבִ֗יו שִׁלְחָ֥ה הַנַּ֛עַר אִתִּ֖י וְנָק֣וּמָה וְנֵלֵ֑כָה וְנִֽחְיֶה֙ וְלֹ֣א נָמ֔וּת גַּם־אֲנַ֥חְנוּ גַם־אַתָּ֖ה גַּם־טַפֵּֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvdah el-yis'rael aviyv shil'chah hana'ar itiy v'nakvmah v'nelekhah v'nich'yeh v'lo namvt gam-anach'nv gam-atah gam-tapenv
translation: Then Judah said to his father Israel, “Send the boy in my care, and let us be on our way, that we may live and not die—you and we and our children.

hebrew: אָֽנֹכִי֙ אֶֽעֶרְבֶ֔נּוּ מִיָּדִ֖י תְּבַקְשֶׁ֑נּוּ אִם־לֹ֨א הֲבִיאֹתִ֤יו אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ וְהִצַּגְתִּ֣יו לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְחָטָ֥אתִֽי לְךָ֖ כָּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
transliteration: anokhiy e'er'venv miyadiy t'vak'shenv im-lo haviyotiyv eleykha v'hitzag'tiyv l'faneykha v'chatatiy l'kha kal-hayamiym
translation: I myself will be surety for him; you may hold me responsible: if I do not bring him back to you and set him before you, I shall stand guilty before you forever.

hebrew: כִּ֖י לוּלֵ֣א הִתְמַהְמָ֑הְנוּ כִּֽי־עַתָּ֥ה שַׁ֖בְנוּ זֶ֥ה פַעֲמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: kiy lvle hit'mah'mah'nv kiy-'atah shav'nv zeh fa'amayim
translation: For we could have been there and back twice if we had not dawdled.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל אֲבִיהֶ֗ם אִם־כֵּ֣ן ׀ אֵפוֹא֮ זֹ֣את עֲשׂוּ֒ קְח֞וּ מִזִּמְרַ֤ת הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ בִּכְלֵיכֶ֔ם וְהוֹרִ֥ידוּ לָאִ֖ישׁ מִנְחָ֑ה מְעַ֤ט צֳרִי֙ וּמְעַ֣ט דְּבַ֔שׁ נְכֹ֣את וָלֹ֔ט בָּטְנִ֖ים וּשְׁקֵדִֽים׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem yis'rael aviyhem im-ken  efvo zot 'asv k'chv mizim'rat haaretz bikh'leykhem v'hvoriydv laiysh min'chah m'at tzoriy vm'at d'vash n'khot valot bat'niym vsh'kediym
translation: Then their father Israel said to them, “If it must be so, do this: take some of the choice products of the land in your baggage, and carry them down as a gift for the man—some balm and some honey, gum, ladanum, pistachio nuts, and almonds.

hebrew: וְכֶ֥סֶף מִשְׁנֶ֖ה קְח֣וּ בְיֶדְכֶ֑ם וְאֶת־הַכֶּ֜סֶף הַמּוּשָׁ֨ב בְּפִ֤י אַמְתְּחֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ תָּשִׁ֣יבוּ בְיֶדְכֶ֔ם אוּלַ֥י מִשְׁגֶּ֖ה הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'khesef mish'neh k'chv v'yed'khem v'et-hakesef hamvshav b'fiy am't'choteykhem tashiyvv v'yed'khem vlay mish'geh hv
translation: And take with you double the money, carrying back with you the money that was replaced in the mouths of your bags; perhaps it was a mistake.

hebrew: וְאֶת־אֲחִיכֶ֖ם קָ֑חוּ וְק֖וּמוּ שׁ֥וּבוּ אֶל־הָאִֽישׁ׃
transliteration: v'et-achiykhem kachv v'kvmv shvvv el-haiysh
translation: Take your brother too; and go back at once to the man.

hebrew: וְאֵ֣ל שַׁדַּ֗י יִתֵּ֨ן לָכֶ֤ם רַחֲמִים֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הָאִ֔ישׁ וְשִׁלַּ֥ח לָכֶ֛ם אֶת־אֲחִיכֶ֥ם אַחֵ֖ר וְאֶת־בִּנְיָמִ֑ין וַאֲנִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁכֹ֖לְתִּי שָׁכָֽלְתִּי׃
transliteration: v'el shaday yiten lakhem rachamiym lif'ney haiysh v'shilach lakhem et-achiykhem acher v'et-bin'yamiyn vaaniy kaasher shakhol'tiy shakhal'tiy
translation: And may El Shaddai dispose the man to mercy toward you, that he may release to you your other brother, as well as Benjamin. As for me, if I am to be bereaved, I shall be bereaved.”

hebrew: וַיִּקְח֤וּ הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את וּמִשְׁנֶה־כֶּ֛סֶף לָקְח֥וּ בְיָדָ֖ם וְאֶת־בִּנְיָמִ֑ן וַיָּקֻ֙מוּ֙ וַיֵּרְד֣וּ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיַּֽעַמְד֖וּ לִפְנֵ֥י יוֹסֵֽף׃
transliteration: vayik'chv haanashiym et-hamin'chah hazot vmish'neh-kesef lak'chv v'yadam v'et-bin'yamin vayakumv vayer'dv mitz'rayim vaya'am'dv lif'ney yvosef
translation: So the men took that gift, and they took with them double the money, as well as Benjamin. They made their way down to Egypt, where they presented themselves to Joseph.

hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא יוֹסֵ֣ף אִתָּם֮ אֶת־בִּנְיָמִין֒ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לַֽאֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־בֵּית֔וֹ הָבֵ֥א אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים הַבָּ֑יְתָה וּטְבֹ֤חַ טֶ֙בַח֙ וְהָכֵ֔ן כִּ֥י אִתִּ֛י יֹאכְל֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים בַּֽצָּהֳרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayar' yvosef itam et-bin'yamiyn vayomer laasher 'al-beytvo have et-haanashiym habay'tah vt'vocha tevach v'hakhen kiy itiy yokh'lv haanashiym batzahorayim
translation: When Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to his house steward, “Take the men into the house; slaughter and prepare an animal, for the men will dine with me at noon.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ הָאִ֔ישׁ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָמַ֣ר יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיָּבֵ֥א הָאִ֛ישׁ אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים בֵּ֥יתָה יוֹסֵֽף׃
transliteration: vaya'as haiysh kaasher amar yvosef vayave haiysh et-haanashiym beytah yvosef
translation: The man did as Joseph said, and he brought the men into Joseph’s house.

hebrew: וַיִּֽירְא֣וּ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֗ים כִּ֣י הֽוּבְאוּ֮ בֵּ֣ית יוֹסֵף֒ וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ עַל־דְּבַ֤ר הַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ הַשָּׁ֤ב בְּאַמְתְּחֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ בַּתְּחִלָּ֔ה אֲנַ֖חְנוּ מֽוּבָאִ֑ים לְהִתְגֹּלֵ֤ל עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ וּלְהִתְנַפֵּ֣ל עָלֵ֔ינוּ וְלָקַ֧חַת אֹתָ֛נוּ לַעֲבָדִ֖ים וְאֶת־חֲמֹרֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: vayiyr'v haanashiym kiy hvv'v beyt yvosef vayom'rv 'al-d'var hakesef hashav b'am't'choteynv bat'chilah anach'nv mvvaiym l'hit'golel 'aleynv vl'hit'napel 'aleynv v'lakachat otanv la'avadiym v'et-chamoreynv
translation: But the men were frightened at being brought into Joseph’s house. “It must be,” they thought, “because of the money replaced in our bags the first time that we have been brought inside, as a pretext to attack us and seize us as slaves, with our pack animals.”

hebrew: וַֽיִּגְּשׁוּ֙ אֶל־הָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־בֵּ֣ית יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיְדַבְּר֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו פֶּ֥תַח הַבָּֽיִת׃
transliteration: vayig'shv el-haiysh asher 'al-beyt yvosef vay'dab'rv elayv petach habayit
translation: So they went up to Joseph’s house steward and spoke to him at the entrance of the house.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִ֑י יָרֹ֥ד יָרַ֛דְנוּ בַּתְּחִלָּ֖ה לִשְׁבָּר־אֹֽכֶל׃
transliteration: vayom'rv biy adoniy yarod yarad'nv bat'chilah lish'bar-okhel
translation: “If you please, my lord,” they said, “we came down once before to procure food.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֞י כִּי־בָ֣אנוּ אֶל־הַמָּל֗וֹן וַֽנִּפְתְּחָה֙ אֶת־אַמְתְּחֹתֵ֔ינוּ וְהִנֵּ֤ה כֶֽסֶף־אִישׁ֙ בְּפִ֣י אַמְתַּחְתּ֔וֹ כַּסְפֵּ֖נוּ בְּמִשְׁקָל֑וֹ וַנָּ֥שֶׁב אֹת֖וֹ בְּיָדֵֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kiy-vanv el-hamalvon vanif't'chah et-am't'choteynv v'hineh khesef-iysh b'fiy am'tach'tvo kas'penv b'mish'kalvo vanashev otvo b'yadenv
translation: But when we arrived at the night encampment and opened our bags, there was each one’s money in the mouth of his bag, our money in full.bLit. “by its weight.” So we have brought it back with us.

hebrew: וְכֶ֧סֶף אַחֵ֛ר הוֹרַ֥דְנוּ בְיָדֵ֖נוּ לִשְׁבָּר־אֹ֑כֶל לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְנוּ מִי־שָׂ֥ם כַּסְפֵּ֖נוּ בְּאַמְתְּחֹתֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: v'khesef acher hvorad'nv v'yadenv lish'bar-okhel lo yada'nv miy-sam kas'penv b'am't'choteynv
translation: And we have brought down with us other money to procure food. We do not know who put the money in our bags.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֩ שָׁל֨וֹם לָכֶ֜ם אַל־תִּירָ֗אוּ אֱלֹ֨הֵיכֶ֜ם וֵֽאלֹהֵ֤י אֲבִיכֶם֙ נָתַ֨ן לָכֶ֤ם מַטְמוֹן֙ בְּאַמְתְּחֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם כַּסְפְּכֶ֖ם בָּ֣א אֵלָ֑י וַיּוֹצֵ֥א אֲלֵהֶ֖ם אֶת־שִׁמְעֽוֹן׃
transliteration: vayomer shalvom lakhem al-tiyrav eloheykhem velohey aviykhem natan lakhem mat'mvon b'am't'choteykhem kas'p'khem ba elay vayvotze alehem et-shim'von
translation: He replied, “All is well with you; do not be afraid. Your God, the God of your father, must have put treasure in your bags for you. I got your payment.” And he brought out Simeon to them.

hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֥א הָאִ֛ישׁ אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים בֵּ֣יתָה יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיִּתֶּן־מַ֙יִם֙ וַיִּרְחֲצ֣וּ רַגְלֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּתֵּ֥ן מִסְפּ֖וֹא לַחֲמֹֽרֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayave haiysh et-haanashiym beytah yvosef vayiten-mayim vayir'chatzv rag'leyhem vayiten mis'pvo lachamoreyhem
translation: Then the man brought the men into Joseph’s house; he gave them water to bathe their feet, and he provided feed for their asses.

hebrew: וַיָּכִ֙ינוּ֙ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה עַד־בּ֥וֹא יוֹסֵ֖ף בַּֽצָּהֳרָ֑יִם כִּ֣י שָֽׁמְע֔וּ כִּי־שָׁ֖ם יֹ֥אכְלוּ לָֽחֶם׃
transliteration: vayakhiynv et-hamin'chah 'ad-bvo yvosef batzahorayim kiy sham'v kiy-sham yokh'lv lachem
translation: They laid out their gifts to await Joseph’s arrival at noon, for they had heard that they were to dine there.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א יוֹסֵף֙ הַבַּ֔יְתָה וַיָּבִ֥יאּוּ ל֛וֹ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־בְּיָדָ֖ם הַבָּ֑יְתָה וַיִּשְׁתַּחֲווּ־ל֖וֹ אָֽרְצָה׃
transliteration: vayavo yvosef habay'tah vayaviyv lvo et-hamin'chah asher-b'yadam habay'tah vayish'tachavv-lvo ar'tzah
translation: When Joseph came home, they presented to him the gifts that they had brought with them into the house, bowing low before him to the ground.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֤ל לָהֶם֙ לְשָׁל֔וֹם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֲשָׁל֛וֹם אֲבִיכֶ֥ם הַזָּקֵ֖ן אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲמַרְתֶּ֑ם הַעוֹדֶ֖נּוּ חָֽי׃
transliteration: vayish'al lahem l'shalvom vayomer hashalvom aviykhem hazaken asher amar'tem ha'vodenv chay
translation: He greeted them, and he said, “How is your aged father of whom you spoke? Is he still in good health?”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ שָׁל֛וֹם לְעַבְדְּךָ֥ לְאָבִ֖ינוּ עוֹדֶ֣נּוּ חָ֑י וַֽיִּקְּד֖וּ וישתחו [וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוּֽוּ׃]
transliteration: vayom'rv shalvom l'av'd'kha l'aviynv 'vodenv chay vayik'dv vyshtchv [vayish'tachavv]
translation: They replied, “It is well with your servant our father; he is still in good health.” And they bowed and made obeisance.

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֣א עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּ֞רְא אֶת־בִּנְיָמִ֣ין אָחִיו֮ בֶּן־אִמּוֹ֒ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֲזֶה֙ אֲחִיכֶ֣ם הַקָּטֹ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֵלָ֑י וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אֱלֹהִ֥ים יָחְנְךָ֖ בְּנִֽי׃
transliteration: vayisa 'eynayv vayar' et-bin'yamiyn achiyv ben-imvo vayomer hazeh achiykhem hakaton asher amar'tem elay vayomar elohiym yach'n'kha b'niy
translation: Looking about, he saw his brother Benjamin, his mother’s son, and asked, “Is this your youngest brother of whom you spoke to me?” And he went on, “May God be gracious to you, my boy.”

hebrew: וַיְמַהֵ֣ר יוֹסֵ֗ף כִּֽי־נִכְמְר֤וּ רַחֲמָיו֙ אֶל־אָחִ֔יו וַיְבַקֵּ֖שׁ לִבְכּ֑וֹת וַיָּבֹ֥א הַחַ֖דְרָה וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: vay'maher yvosef kiy-nikh'm'rv rachamayv el-achiyv vay'vakesh liv'kvot vayavo hachad'rah vayev'k' shamah
translation: With that, Joseph hurried out, for he was overcome with feeling toward his brother and was on the verge of tears; he went into a room and wept there.

hebrew: וַיִּרְחַ֥ץ פָּנָ֖יו וַיֵּצֵ֑א וַיִּ֨תְאַפַּ֔ק וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שִׂ֥ימוּ לָֽחֶם׃
transliteration: vayir'chatz panayv vayetze vayit'apak vayomer siymv lachem
translation: Then he washed his face, reappeared, and—now in control of himself—gave the order, “Serve the meal.”

hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ ל֛וֹ לְבַדּ֖וֹ וְלָהֶ֣ם לְבַדָּ֑ם וְלַמִּצְרִ֞ים הָאֹכְלִ֤ים אִתּוֹ֙ לְבַדָּ֔ם כִּי֩ לֹ֨א יוּכְל֜וּן הַמִּצְרִ֗ים לֶאֱכֹ֤ל אֶת־הָֽעִבְרִים֙ לֶ֔חֶם כִּי־תוֹעֵבָ֥ה הִ֖וא לְמִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayasiymv lvo l'vadvo v'lahem l'vadam v'lamitz'riym haokh'liym itvo l'vadam kiy lo yvkh'lvn hamitz'riym leekhol et-ha'iv'riym lechem kiy-tvo'evah hiv l'mitz'rayim
translation: They served him by himself, and them by themselves, and the Egyptians who ate with him by themselves; for the Egyptians could not dine with the Hebrews, since that would be abhorrent to the Egyptians.

hebrew: וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ לְפָנָ֔יו הַבְּכֹר֙ כִּבְכֹ֣רָת֔וֹ וְהַצָּעִ֖יר כִּצְעִרָת֑וֹ וַיִּתְמְה֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים אִ֥ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: vayesh'vv l'fanayv hab'khor kiv'khoratvo v'hatza'iyr kitz'iratvo vayit'm'hv haanashiym iysh el-re'ehv
translation: As they were seated by his direction, from the oldest in the order of his seniority to the youngest in the order of his youth, the men looked at one another in astonishment.

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א מַשְׂאֹ֜ת מֵאֵ֣ת פָּנָיו֮ אֲלֵהֶם֒ וַתֵּ֜רֶב מַשְׂאַ֧ת בִּנְיָמִ֛ן מִמַּשְׂאֹ֥ת כֻּלָּ֖ם חָמֵ֣שׁ יָד֑וֹת וַיִּשְׁתּ֥וּ וַֽיִּשְׁכְּר֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayisa mas'ot meet panayv alehem vaterev mas'at bin'yamin mimas'ot kulam chamesh yadvot vayish'tv vayish'k'rv 'imvo
translation: Portions were served them from his table; but Benjamin’s portion was severalcLit. “five.” times that of anyone else. And they drank their fill with him.

hebrew: וַיְצַ֞ו אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־בֵּיתוֹ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ מַלֵּ֞א אֶת־אַמְתְּחֹ֤ת הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ אֹ֔כֶל כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יוּכְל֖וּן שְׂאֵ֑ת וְשִׂ֥ים כֶּֽסֶף־אִ֖ישׁ בְּפִ֥י אַמְתַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vay'tzav et-asher 'al-beytvo lemor male et-am't'chot haanashiym okhel kaasher yvkh'lvn s'et v'siym kesef-iysh b'fiy am'tach'tvo
translation: Then he instructed his house steward as follows, “Fill the men’s bags with food, as much as they can carry, and put each one’s money in the mouth of his bag.

hebrew: וְאֶת־גְּבִיעִ֞י גְּבִ֣יעַ הַכֶּ֗סֶף תָּשִׂים֙ בְּפִי֙ אַמְתַּ֣חַת הַקָּטֹ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת כֶּ֣סֶף שִׁבְר֑וֹ וַיַּ֕עַשׂ כִּדְבַ֥ר יוֹסֵ֖ף אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃
transliteration: v'et-g'viy'iy g'viy'a hakesef tasiym b'fiy am'tachat hakaton v'et kesef shiv'rvo vaya'as kid'var yvosef asher diber
translation: Put my silver goblet in the mouth of the bag of the youngest one, together with his money for the rations.” And he did as Joseph told him.

hebrew: הַבֹּ֖קֶר א֑וֹר וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים שֻׁלְּח֔וּ הֵ֖מָּה וַחֲמֹרֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: haboker vor v'haanashiym shul'chv hemah vachamoreyhem
translation: With the first light of morning, the men were sent off with their pack animals.

hebrew: הֵ֠ם יָֽצְא֣וּ אֶת־הָעִיר֮ לֹ֣א הִרְחִיקוּ֒ וְיוֹסֵ֤ף אָמַר֙ לַֽאֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־בֵּית֔וֹ ק֥וּם רְדֹ֖ף אַחֲרֵ֣י הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֑ים וְהִשַּׂגְתָּם֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם לָ֛מָּה שִׁלַּמְתֶּ֥ם רָעָ֖ה תַּ֥חַת טוֹבָֽה׃
transliteration: hem yatz'v et-ha'iyr lo hir'chiykv v'yvosef amar laasher 'al-beytvo kvm r'dof acharey haanashiym v'hisag'tam v'amar'ta alehem lamah shilam'tem ra'ah tachat tvovah
translation: They had just left the city and had not gone far, when Joseph said to his steward, “Up, go after the men! And when you overtake them, say to them, ‘Why did you repay good with evil?

hebrew: הֲל֣וֹא זֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁתֶּ֤ה אֲדֹנִי֙ בּ֔וֹ וְה֕וּא נַחֵ֥שׁ יְנַחֵ֖שׁ בּ֑וֹ הֲרֵעֹתֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲשִׂיתֶֽם׃
transliteration: halvo zeh asher yish'teh adoniy bvo v'hv nachesh y'nachesh bvo hare'otem asher 'asiytem
translation: It is the very one from which my master drinks and which he uses for divination. It was a wicked thing for you to do!’”

hebrew: וַֽיַּשִּׂגֵ֑ם וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: vayasigem vay'daber alehem et-had'variym haeleh
translation: He overtook them and spoke those words to them.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֔יו לָ֚מָּה יְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲדֹנִ֔י כַּדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה חָלִ֙ילָה֙ לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ מֵעֲשׂ֖וֹת כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayom'rv elayv lamah y'daber adoniy kad'variym haeleh chaliylah la'avadeykha me'asvot kadavar hazeh
translation: And they said to him, “Why does my lord say such things? Far be it from your servants to do anything of the kind!

hebrew: הֵ֣ן כֶּ֗סֶף אֲשֶׁ֤ר מָצָ֙אנוּ֙ בְּפִ֣י אַמְתְּחֹתֵ֔ינוּ הֱשִׁיבֹ֥נוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְאֵ֗יךְ נִגְנֹב֙ מִבֵּ֣ית אֲדֹנֶ֔יךָ כֶּ֖סֶף א֥וֹ זָהָֽב׃
transliteration: hen kesef asher matzanv b'fiy am't'choteynv heshiyvonv eleykha meeretz k'na'an v'eykh' nig'nov mibeyt adoneykha kesef vo zahav
translation: Here we brought back to you from the land of Canaan the money that we found in the mouths of our bags. How then could we have stolen any silver or gold from your master’s house!

hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִמָּצֵ֥א אִתּ֛וֹ מֵעֲבָדֶ֖יךָ וָמֵ֑ת וְגַם־אֲנַ֕חְנוּ נִֽהְיֶ֥ה לַֽאדֹנִ֖י לַעֲבָדִֽים׃
transliteration: asher yimatze itvo me'avadeykha vamet v'gam-anach'nv nih'yeh ladoniy la'avadiym
translation: Whichever of your servants it is found with shall die; the rest of us, moreover, shall become slaves to my lord.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר גַּם־עַתָּ֥ה כְדִבְרֵיכֶ֖ם כֶּן־ה֑וּא אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִמָּצֵ֤א אִתּוֹ֙ יִהְיֶה־לִּ֣י עָ֔בֶד וְאַתֶּ֖ם תִּהְי֥וּ נְקִיִּֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer gam-'atah kh'div'reykhem ken-hv asher yimatze itvo yih'yeh-liy 'aved v'atem tih'yv n'kiyim
translation: He replied, “Although what you are proposing is right, only the one with whom it is found shall be my slave; but the rest of you shall go free.”

hebrew: וַֽיְמַהֲר֗וּ וַיּוֹרִ֛דוּ אִ֥ישׁ אֶת־אַמְתַּחְתּ֖וֹ אָ֑רְצָה וַֽיִּפְתְּח֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ אַמְתַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vay'maharv vayvoridv iysh et-am'tach'tvo ar'tzah vayif't'chv iysh am'tach'tvo
translation: So each one hastened to lower his bag to the ground, and each one opened his bag.

hebrew: וַיְחַפֵּ֕שׂ בַּגָּד֣וֹל הֵחֵ֔ל וּבַקָּטֹ֖ן כִּלָּ֑ה וַיִּמָּצֵא֙ הַגָּבִ֔יעַ בְּאַמְתַּ֖חַת בִּנְיָמִֽן׃
transliteration: vay'chapes bagadvol hechel vvakaton kilah vayimatze hagaviy'a b'am'tachat bin'yamin
translation: He searched, beginning with the oldest and ending with the youngest; and the goblet turned up in Benjamin’s bag.

hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְע֖וּ שִׂמְלֹתָ֑ם וַֽיַּעֲמֹס֙ אִ֣ישׁ עַל־חֲמֹר֔וֹ וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ הָעִֽירָה׃
transliteration: vayik'r'v sim'lotam vaya'amos iysh 'al-chamorvo vayashuvv ha'iyrah
translation: At this they rent their clothes. Each reloaded his pack animal, and they returned to the city.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א יְהוּדָ֤ה וְאֶחָיו֙ בֵּ֣יתָה יוֹסֵ֔ף וְה֖וּא עוֹדֶ֣נּוּ שָׁ֑ם וַיִּפְּל֥וּ לְפָנָ֖יו אָֽרְצָה׃
transliteration: vayavo y'hvdah v'echayv beytah yvosef v'hv 'vodenv sham vayip'lv l'fanayv ar'tzah
translation: When Judah and his brothers reentered the house of Joseph, who was still there, they threw themselves on the ground before him.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ יוֹסֵ֔ף מָֽה־הַמַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲשִׂיתֶ֑ם הֲל֣וֹא יְדַעְתֶּ֔ם כִּֽי־נַחֵ֧שׁ יְנַחֵ֛שׁ אִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּמֹֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayomer lahem yvosef mah-hama'aseh hazeh asher 'asiytem halvo y'da'tem kiy-nachesh y'nachesh iysh asher kamoniy
translation: Joseph said to them, “What is this deed that you have done? Do you not know that a man like me practices divination?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוּדָ֗ה מַה־נֹּאמַר֙ לַֽאדֹנִ֔י מַה־נְּדַבֵּ֖ר וּמַה־נִּצְטַדָּ֑ק הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים מָצָא֙ אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ הִנֶּנּ֤וּ עֲבָדִים֙ לַֽאדֹנִ֔י גַּם־אֲנַ֕חְנוּ גַּ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־נִמְצָ֥א הַגָּבִ֖יעַ בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvdah mah-nomar ladoniy mah-n'daber vmah-nitz'tadak haelohiym matza et-'avon 'avadeykha hinenv 'avadiym ladoniy gam-anach'nv gam asher-nim'tza hagaviy'a b'yadvo
translation: Judah replied, “What can we say to my lord? How can we plead, how can we prove our innocence? God has uncovered the crime of your servants. Here we are, then, slaves of my lord, the rest of us as much as he in whose possession the goblet was found.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר חָלִ֣ילָה לִּ֔י מֵעֲשׂ֖וֹת זֹ֑את הָאִ֡ישׁ אֲשֶׁר֩ נִמְצָ֨א הַגָּבִ֜יעַ בְּיָד֗וֹ ה֚וּא יִהְיֶה־לִּ֣י עָ֔בֶד וְאַתֶּ֕ם עֲל֥וּ לְשָׁל֖וֹם אֶל־אֲבִיכֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayomer chaliylah liy me'asvot zot haiysh asher nim'tza hagaviy'a b'yadvo hv yih'yeh-liy 'aved v'atem 'alv l'shalvom el-aviykhem (f)
translation: But he replied, “Far be it from me to act thus! Only he in whose possession the goblet was found shall be my slave; the rest of you go back in peace to your father.”

hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֨שׁ אֵלָ֜יו יְהוּדָ֗ה וַיֹּאמֶר֮ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִי֒ יְדַבֶּר־נָ֨א עַבְדְּךָ֤ דָבָר֙ בְּאָזְנֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י וְאַל־יִ֥חַר אַפְּךָ֖ בְּעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י כָמ֖וֹךָ כְּפַרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayigash elayv y'hvdah vayomer biy adoniy y'daber-na 'av'd'kha davar b'az'ney adoniy v'al-yichar ap'kha b'av'dekha kiy khamvokha k'far'oh
translation: Then Judah went up to him and said, “Please, my lord, let your servant appeal to my lord, and do not be impatient with your servant, you who are the equal of Pharaoh.

hebrew: אֲדֹנִ֣י שָׁאַ֔ל אֶת־עֲבָדָ֖יו לֵאמֹ֑ר הֲיֵשׁ־לָכֶ֥ם אָ֖ב אוֹ־אָֽח׃
transliteration: adoniy shaal et-'avadayv lemor hayesh-lakhem av vo-ach
translation: My lord asked his servants, ‘Have you a father or another brother?’

hebrew: וַנֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֔י יֶשׁ־לָ֙נוּ֙ אָ֣ב זָקֵ֔ן וְיֶ֥לֶד זְקֻנִ֖ים קָטָ֑ן וְאָחִ֨יו מֵ֜ת וַיִּוָּתֵ֨ר ה֧וּא לְבַדּ֛וֹ לְאִמּ֖וֹ וְאָבִ֥יו אֲהֵבֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vanomer el-adoniy yesh-lanv av zaken v'yeled z'kuniym katan v'achiyv met vayivater hv l'vadvo l'imvo v'aviyv ahevvo
translation: We told my lord, ‘We have an old father, and there is a child of his old age, the youngest; his full brother is dead, so that he alone is left of his mother, and his father dotes on him.’

hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ הוֹרִדֻ֖הוּ אֵלָ֑י וְאָשִׂ֥ימָה עֵינִ֖י עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: vatomer el-'avadeykha hvoriduhv elay v'asiymah 'eyniy 'alayv
translation: Then you said to your servants, ‘Bring him down to me, that I may set eyes on him.’

hebrew: וַנֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֔י לֹא־יוּכַ֥ל הַנַּ֖עַר לַעֲזֹ֣ב אֶת־אָבִ֑יו וְעָזַ֥ב אֶת־אָבִ֖יו וָמֵֽת׃
transliteration: vanomer el-adoniy lo-yvkhal hana'ar la'azov et-aviyv v'azav et-aviyv vamet
translation: We said to my lord, ‘The boy cannot leave his father; if he were to leave him, his father would die.’

hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ אִם־לֹ֥א יֵרֵ֛ד אֲחִיכֶ֥ם הַקָּטֹ֖ן אִתְּכֶ֑ם לֹ֥א תֹסִפ֖וּן לִרְא֥וֹת פָּנָֽי׃
transliteration: vatomer el-'avadeykha im-lo yered achiykhem hakaton it'khem lo tosifvn lir'vot panay
translation: But you said to your servants, ‘Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, do not let me see your faces.’

hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ כִּ֣י עָלִ֔ינוּ אֶֽל־עַבְדְּךָ֖ אָבִ֑י וַנַּ֨גֶּד־ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kiy 'aliynv el-'av'd'kha aviy vanaged-lvo et div'rey adoniy
translation: When we came back to your servant my father, we reported my lord’s words to him.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָבִ֑ינוּ שֻׁ֖בוּ שִׁבְרוּ־לָ֥נוּ מְעַט־אֹֽכֶל׃
transliteration: vayomer aviynv shuvv shiv'rv-lanv m'at-okhel
translation: “Later our father said, ‘Go back and procure some food for us.’

hebrew: וַנֹּ֕אמֶר לֹ֥א נוּכַ֖ל לָרֶ֑דֶת אִם־יֵשׁ֩ אָחִ֨ינוּ הַקָּטֹ֤ן אִתָּ֙נוּ֙ וְיָרַ֔דְנוּ כִּי־לֹ֣א נוּכַ֗ל לִרְאוֹת֙ פְּנֵ֣י הָאִ֔ישׁ וְאָחִ֥ינוּ הַקָּטֹ֖ן אֵינֶ֥נּוּ אִתָּֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vanomer lo nvkhal laredet im-yesh achiynv hakaton itanv v'yarad'nv kiy-lo nvkhal lir'vot p'ney haiysh v'achiynv hakaton eynenv itanv
translation: We answered, ‘We cannot go down; only if our youngest brother is with us can we go down, for we may not aLit. “see the man’s face.”show our faces to the man-a unless our youngest brother is with us.’

hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר עַבְדְּךָ֥ אָבִ֖י אֵלֵ֑ינוּ אַתֶּ֣ם יְדַעְתֶּ֔ם כִּ֥י שְׁנַ֖יִם יָֽלְדָה־לִּ֥י אִשְׁתִּֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer 'av'd'kha aviy eleynv atem y'da'tem kiy sh'nayim yal'dah-liy ish'tiy
translation: Your servant my father said to us, ‘As you know, my wife bore me two sons.

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֤א הָֽאֶחָד֙ מֵֽאִתִּ֔י וָאֹמַ֕ר אַ֖ךְ טָרֹ֣ף טֹרָ֑ף וְלֹ֥א רְאִיתִ֖יו עַד־הֵֽנָּה׃
transliteration: vayetze haechad meitiy vaomar akh' tarof toraf v'lo r'iytiyv 'ad-henah
translation: But one is gone from me, and I said: Alas, he was torn by a beast! And I have not seen him since.

hebrew: וּלְקַחְתֶּ֧ם גַּם־אֶת־זֶ֛ה מֵעִ֥ם פָּנַ֖י וְקָרָ֣הוּ אָס֑וֹן וְהֽוֹרַדְתֶּ֧ם אֶת־שֵׂיבָתִ֛י בְּרָעָ֖ה שְׁאֹֽלָה׃
transliteration: vl'kach'tem gam-et-zeh me'im panay v'karahv asvon v'hvorad'tem et-seyvatiy b'ra'ah sh'olah
translation: If you take this one from me, too, and he meets with disaster, you will send my white head down to Sheol in sorrow.’

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה כְּבֹאִי֙ אֶל־עַבְדְּךָ֣ אָבִ֔י וְהַנַּ֖עַר אֵינֶ֣נּוּ אִתָּ֑נוּ וְנַפְשׁ֖וֹ קְשׁוּרָ֥ה בְנַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
transliteration: v'atah k'voiy el-'av'd'kha aviy v'hana'ar eynenv itanv v'naf'shvo k'shvrah v'naf'shvo
translation: “Now, if I come to your servant my father and the boy is not with us—since his own life is so bound up with his—

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּרְאוֹת֛וֹ כִּי־אֵ֥ין הַנַּ֖עַר וָמֵ֑ת וְהוֹרִ֨ידוּ עֲבָדֶ֜יךָ אֶת־שֵׂיבַ֨ת עַבְדְּךָ֥ אָבִ֛ינוּ בְּיָג֖וֹן שְׁאֹֽלָה׃
transliteration: v'hayah kir'votvo kiy-eyn hana'ar vamet v'hvoriydv 'avadeykha et-seyvat 'av'd'kha aviynv b'yagvon sh'olah
translation: when he sees that the boy is not with us, he will die, and your servants will send the white head of your servant our father down to Sheol in grief.

hebrew: כִּ֤י עַבְדְּךָ֙ עָרַ֣ב אֶת־הַנַּ֔עַר מֵעִ֥ם אָבִ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־לֹ֤א אֲבִיאֶ֙נּוּ֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְחָטָ֥אתִי לְאָבִ֖י כָּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
transliteration: kiy 'av'd'kha 'arav et-hana'ar me'im aviy lemor im-lo aviyenv eleykha v'chatatiy l'aviy kal-hayamiym
translation: Now your servant has pledged himself for the boy to my father, saying, ‘If I do not bring him back to you, I shall stand guilty before my father forever.’

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה יֵֽשֶׁב־נָ֤א עַבְדְּךָ֙ תַּ֣חַת הַנַּ֔עַר עֶ֖בֶד לַֽאדֹנִ֑י וְהַנַּ֖עַר יַ֥עַל עִם־אֶחָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'atah yeshev-na 'av'd'kha tachat hana'ar 'eved ladoniy v'hana'ar ya'al 'im-echayv
translation: Therefore, please let your servant remain as a slave to my lord instead of the boy, and let the boy go back with his brothers.

hebrew: כִּי־אֵיךְ֙ אֶֽעֱלֶ֣ה אֶל־אָבִ֔י וְהַנַּ֖עַר אֵינֶ֣נּוּ אִתִּ֑י פֶּ֚ן אֶרְאֶ֣ה בָרָ֔ע אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִמְצָ֖א אֶת־אָבִֽי׃
transliteration: kiy-eykh' e'eleh el-aviy v'hana'ar eynenv itiy pen er'eh vara' asher yim'tza et-aviy
translation: For how can I go back to my father unless the boy is with me? Let me not be witness to the woe that would overtake my father!”

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יָכֹ֨ל יוֹסֵ֜ף לְהִתְאַפֵּ֗ק לְכֹ֤ל הַנִּצָּבִים֙ עָלָ֔יו וַיִּקְרָ֕א הוֹצִ֥יאוּ כָל־אִ֖ישׁ מֵעָלָ֑י וְלֹא־עָ֤מַד אִישׁ֙ אִתּ֔וֹ בְּהִתְוַדַּ֥ע יוֹסֵ֖ף אֶל־אֶחָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'lo-yakhol yvosef l'hit'apek l'khol hanitzaviym 'alayv vayik'ra hvotziyv khal-iysh me'alay v'lo-'amad iysh itvo b'hit'vada' yvosef el-echayv
translation: Joseph could no longer control himself before all his attendants, and he cried out, “Have everyone withdraw from me!” So there was no one else about when Joseph made himself known to his brothers.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֶת־קֹל֖וֹ בִּבְכִ֑י וַיִּשְׁמְע֣וּ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּשְׁמַ֖ע בֵּ֥ית פַּרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayiten et-kolvo biv'khiy vayish'm'v mitz'rayim vayish'ma' beyt par'oh
translation: His sobs were so loud that the Egyptians could hear, and so the news reached Pharaoh’s palace.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יוֹסֵ֤ף אֶל־אֶחָיו֙ אֲנִ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף הַע֥וֹד אָבִ֖י חָ֑י וְלֹֽא־יָכְל֤וּ אֶחָיו֙ לַעֲנ֣וֹת אֹת֔וֹ כִּ֥י נִבְהֲל֖וּ מִפָּנָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-echayv aniy yvosef ha'vod aviy chay v'lo-yakh'lv echayv la'anvot otvo kiy niv'halv mipanayv
translation: Joseph said to his brothers, “I am Joseph. Is my father still well?” But his brothers could not answer him, so dumfounded were they on account of him.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יוֹסֵ֧ף אֶל־אֶחָ֛יו גְּשׁוּ־נָ֥א אֵלַ֖י וַיִּגָּ֑שׁוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֲנִי֙ יוֹסֵ֣ף אֲחִיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־מְכַרְתֶּ֥ם אֹתִ֖י מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-echayv g'shv-na elay vayigashv vayomer aniy yvosef achiykhem asher-m'khar'tem otiy mitz'ray'mah
translation: Then Joseph said to his brothers, “Come forward to me.” And when they came forward, he said, “I am your brother Joseph, he whom you sold into Egypt.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ אַל־תֵּעָ֣צְב֗וּ וְאַל־יִ֙חַר֙ בְּעֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם כִּֽי־מְכַרְתֶּ֥ם אֹתִ֖י הֵ֑נָּה כִּ֣י לְמִֽחְיָ֔ה שְׁלָחַ֥נִי אֱלֹהִ֖ים לִפְנֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'atah  al-te'atz'vv v'al-yichar b'eyneykhem kiy-m'khar'tem otiy henah kiy l'mich'yah sh'lachaniy elohiym lif'neykhem
translation: Now, do not be distressed or reproach yourselves because you sold me hither; it was to save life that God sent me ahead of you.

hebrew: כִּי־זֶ֛ה שְׁנָתַ֥יִם הָרָעָ֖ב בְּקֶ֣רֶב הָאָ֑רֶץ וְעוֹד֙ חָמֵ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵין־חָרִ֖ישׁ וְקָצִּֽיר׃
transliteration: kiy-zeh sh'natayim hara'av b'kerev haaretz v'vod chamesh shaniym asher eyn-chariysh v'katziyr
translation: It is now two years that there has been famine in the land, and there are still five years to come in which there shall be no yield from tilling.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלָחֵ֤נִי אֱלֹהִים֙ לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם לָשׂ֥וּם לָכֶ֛ם שְׁאֵרִ֖ית בָּאָ֑רֶץ וּלְהַחֲי֣וֹת לָכֶ֔ם לִפְלֵיטָ֖ה גְּדֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: vayish'lacheniy elohiym lif'neykhem lasvm lakhem sh'eriyt baaretz vl'hachayvot lakhem lif'leytah g'dolah
translation: God has sent me ahead of you to ensure your survival on earth, and to save your lives in an extraordinary deliverance.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה לֹֽא־אַתֶּ֞ם שְׁלַחְתֶּ֤ם אֹתִי֙ הֵ֔נָּה כִּ֖י הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיְשִׂימֵ֨נִֽי לְאָ֜ב לְפַרְעֹ֗ה וּלְאָדוֹן֙ לְכָל־בֵּית֔וֹ וּמֹשֵׁ֖ל בְּכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'atah lo-atem sh'lach'tem otiy henah kiy haelohiym vay'siymeniy l'av l'far'oh vl'advon l'khal-beytvo vmoshel b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: So, it was not you who sent me here, but God; and He has made me a father to Pharaoh, lord of all his household, and ruler over the whole land of Egypt.

hebrew: מַהֲרוּ֮ וַעֲל֣וּ אֶל־אָבִי֒ וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֣ם אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ בִּנְךָ֣ יוֹסֵ֔ף שָׂמַ֧נִי אֱלֹהִ֛ים לְאָד֖וֹן לְכָל־מִצְרָ֑יִם רְדָ֥ה אֵלַ֖י אַֽל־תַּעֲמֹֽד׃
transliteration: maharv va'alv el-aviy vaamar'tem elayv koh amar bin'kha yvosef samaniy elohiym l'advon l'khal-mitz'rayim r'dah elay al-ta'amod
translation: “Now, hurry back to my father and say to him: Thus says your son Joseph, ‘God has made me lord of all Egypt; come down to me without delay.

hebrew: וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֣ בְאֶֽרֶץ־גֹּ֗שֶׁן וְהָיִ֤יתָ קָרוֹב֙ אֵלַ֔י אַתָּ֕ה וּבָנֶ֖יךָ וּבְנֵ֣י בָנֶ֑יךָ וְצֹאנְךָ֥ וּבְקָרְךָ֖ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁר־לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'yashav'ta v'eretz-goshen v'hayiyta karvov elay atah vvaneykha vv'ney vaneykha v'tzon'kha vv'kar'kha v'khal-asher-lakh'
translation: You will dwell in the region of Goshen, where you will be near me—you and your children and your grandchildren, your flocks and herds, and all that is yours.

hebrew: וְכִלְכַּלְתִּ֤י אֹֽתְךָ֙ שָׁ֔ם כִּי־ע֛וֹד חָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים רָעָ֑ב פֶּן־תִּוָּרֵ֛שׁ אַתָּ֥ה וּבֵֽיתְךָ֖ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁר־לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'khil'kal'tiy ot'kha sham kiy-'vod chamesh shaniym ra'av pen-tivaresh atah vveyt'kha v'khal-asher-lakh'
translation: There I will provide for you—for there are yet five years of famine to come—that you and your household and all that is yours may not suffer want.’

hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֤ה עֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ רֹא֔וֹת וְעֵינֵ֖י אָחִ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ין כִּי־פִ֖י הַֽמְדַבֵּ֥ר אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hineh 'eyneykhem rovot v'eyney achiy vin'yamiyn kiy-fiy ham'daber aleykhem
translation: You can see for yourselves, and my brother Benjamin for himself, that it is indeed I who am speaking to you.

hebrew: וְהִגַּדְתֶּ֣ם לְאָבִ֗י אֶת־כָּל־כְּבוֹדִי֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר רְאִיתֶ֑ם וּמִֽהַרְתֶּ֛ם וְהוֹרַדְתֶּ֥ם אֶת־אָבִ֖י הֵֽנָּה׃
transliteration: v'higad'tem l'aviy et-kal-k'vvodiy b'mitz'rayim v'et kal-asher r'iytem vmihar'tem v'hvorad'tem et-aviy henah
translation: And you must tell my father everything about my high station in Egypt and all that you have seen; and bring my father here with all speed.”

hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֛ל עַל־צַוְּארֵ֥י בִנְיָמִֽן־אָחִ֖יו וַיֵּ֑בְךְּ וּבִנְיָמִ֔ן בָּכָ֖ה עַל־צַוָּארָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayipol 'al-tzav'rey vin'yamin-achiyv vayev'k' vvin'yamin bakhah 'al-tzavarayv
translation: With that he embracedaLit. “fell on.” his brother Benjamin around the neck and wept, and Benjamin wept on his neck.

hebrew: וַיְנַשֵּׁ֥ק לְכָל־אֶחָ֖יו וַיֵּ֣בְךְּ עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְאַ֣חֲרֵי כֵ֔ן דִּבְּר֥וּ אֶחָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vay'nashek l'khal-echayv vayev'k' 'aleyhem v'acharey khen dib'rv echayv itvo
translation: He kissed all his brothers and wept upon them; only then were his brothers able to talk to him.

hebrew: וְהַקֹּ֣ל נִשְׁמַ֗ע בֵּ֤ית פַּרְעֹה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בָּ֖אוּ אֲחֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיִּיטַב֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וּבְעֵינֵ֖י עֲבָדָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'hakol nish'ma' beyt par'oh lemor bav achey yvosef vayiytav b'eyney far'oh vv'eyney 'avadayv
translation: The news reached Pharaoh’s palace: “Joseph’s brothers have come.” Pharaoh and his courtiers were pleased.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אֱמֹ֥ר אֶל־אַחֶ֖יךָ זֹ֣את עֲשׂ֑וּ טַֽעֲנוּ֙ אֶת־בְּעִ֣ירְכֶ֔ם וּלְכוּ־בֹ֖אוּ אַ֥רְצָה כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh el-yvosef emor el-acheykha zot 'asv ta'anv et-b'iyr'khem vl'khv-vov ar'tzah k'na'an
translation: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Say to your brothers, ‘Do as follows: load up your beasts and go at once to the land of Canaan.

hebrew: וּקְח֧וּ אֶת־אֲבִיכֶ֛ם וְאֶת־בָּתֵּיכֶ֖ם וּבֹ֣אוּ אֵלָ֑י וְאֶתְּנָ֣ה לָכֶ֗ם אֶת־טוּב֙ אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וְאִכְל֖וּ אֶת־חֵ֥לֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vk'chv et-aviykhem v'et-bateykhem vvov elay v'et'nah lakhem et-tvv eretz mitz'rayim v'ikh'lv et-chelev haaretz
translation: Take your father and your households and come to me; I will give you the best of the land of Egypt and you shall live off the fat of the land.’

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֥ה צֻוֵּ֖יתָה זֹ֣את עֲשׂ֑וּ קְחוּ־לָכֶם֩ מֵאֶ֨רֶץ מִצְרַ֜יִם עֲגָל֗וֹת לְטַפְּכֶם֙ וְלִנְשֵׁיכֶ֔ם וּנְשָׂאתֶ֥ם אֶת־אֲבִיכֶ֖ם וּבָאתֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'atah tzuveytah zot 'asv k'chv-lakhem meeretz mitz'rayim 'agalvot l'tap'khem v'lin'sheykhem vn'satem et-aviykhem vvatem
translation: And you are bidden [to add], ‘Do as follows: take from the land of Egypt wagons for your children and your wives, and bring your father here.

hebrew: וְעֵ֣ינְכֶ֔ם אַל־תָּחֹ֖ס עַל־כְּלֵיכֶ֑ם כִּי־ט֛וּב כָּל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לָכֶ֥ם הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'eyn'khem al-tachos 'al-k'leykhem kiy-tvv kal-eretz mitz'rayim lakhem hv
translation: And never mind your belongings, for the best of all the land of Egypt shall be yours.’”

hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵן֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּתֵּ֨ן לָהֶ֥ם יוֹסֵ֛ף עֲגָל֖וֹת עַל־פִּ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַיִּתֵּ֥ן לָהֶ֛ם צֵדָ֖ה לַדָּֽרֶךְ׃
transliteration: vaya'asv-khen b'ney yis'rael vayiten lahem yvosef 'agalvot 'al-piy far'oh vayiten lahem tzedah ladarekh'
translation: The sons of Israel did so; Joseph gave them wagons as Pharaoh had commanded, and he supplied them with provisions for the journey.

hebrew: לְכֻלָּ֥ם נָתַ֛ן לָאִ֖ישׁ חֲלִפ֣וֹת שְׂמָלֹ֑ת וּלְבִנְיָמִ֤ן נָתַן֙ שְׁלֹ֣שׁ מֵא֣וֹת כֶּ֔סֶף וְחָמֵ֖שׁ חֲלִפֹ֥ת שְׂמָלֹֽת׃
transliteration: l'khulam natan laiysh chalifvot s'malot vl'vin'yamin natan sh'losh mevot kesef v'chamesh chalifot s'malot
translation: To each of them, moreover, he gave a change of clothing; but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver and severalbLit. “five”; cf. 43.34. changes of clothing.

hebrew: וּלְאָבִ֞יו שָׁלַ֤ח כְּזֹאת֙ עֲשָׂרָ֣ה חֲמֹרִ֔ים נֹשְׂאִ֖ים מִטּ֣וּב מִצְרָ֑יִם וְעֶ֣שֶׂר אֲתֹנֹ֡ת נֹֽ֠שְׂאֹת בָּ֣ר וָלֶ֧חֶם וּמָז֛וֹן לְאָבִ֖יו לַדָּֽרֶךְ׃
transliteration: vl'aviyv shalach k'zot 'asarah chamoriym nos'iym mitvv mitz'rayim v'eser atonot nos'ot bar valechem vmazvon l'aviyv ladarekh'
translation: And to his father he sent the following: ten he-asses laden with the best things of Egypt, and ten she-asses laden with grain, bread, and provisions for his father on the journey.

hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־אֶחָ֖יו וַיֵּלֵ֑כוּ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אַֽל־תִּרְגְּז֖וּ בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
transliteration: vay'shalach et-echayv vayelekhv vayomer alehem al-tir'g'zv badarekh'
translation: As he sent his brothers off on their way, he told them, “Do not be quarrelsome on the way.”

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֲבִיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vaya'alv mimitz'rayim vayavov eretz k'na'an el-ya'akov aviyhem
translation: They went up from Egypt and came to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan.

hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֨דוּ ל֜וֹ לֵאמֹ֗ר ע֚וֹד יוֹסֵ֣ף חַ֔י וְכִֽי־ה֥וּא מֹשֵׁ֖ל בְּכָל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיָּ֣פָג לִבּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י לֹא־הֶאֱמִ֖ין לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayagidv lvo lemor 'vod yvosef chay v'khiy-hv moshel b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim vayafag libvo kiy lo-heemiyn lahem
translation: And they told him, “Joseph is still alive; yes, he is ruler over the whole land of Egypt.” His heart went numb, for he did not believe them.

hebrew: וַיְדַבְּר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו אֵ֣ת כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֤י יוֹסֵף֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־הָ֣עֲגָל֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח יוֹסֵ֖ף לָשֵׂ֣את אֹת֑וֹ וַתְּחִ֕י ר֖וּחַ יַעֲקֹ֥ב אֲבִיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vay'dab'rv elayv et kal-div'rey yvosef asher diber alehem vayar' et-ha'agalvot asher-shalach yvosef laset otvo vat'chiy rvcha ya'akov aviyhem
translation: But when they recounted all that Joseph had said to them, and when he saw the wagons that Joseph had sent to transport him, the spirit of their father Jacob revived.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רַ֛ב עוֹד־יוֹסֵ֥ף בְּנִ֖י חָ֑י אֵֽלְכָ֥ה וְאֶרְאֶ֖נּוּ בְּטֶ֥רֶם אָמֽוּת׃
transliteration: vayomer yis'rael rav 'vod-yvosef b'niy chay el'khah v'er'env b'terem amvt
translation: “Enough!” said Israel. “My son Joseph is still alive! I must go and see him before I die.”

hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֤ע יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֖א בְּאֵ֣רָה שָּׁ֑בַע וַיִּזְבַּ֣ח זְבָחִ֔ים לֵאלֹהֵ֖י אָבִ֥יו יִצְחָֽק׃
transliteration: vayisa' yis'rael v'khal-asher-lvo vayavo b'erah shava' vayiz'bach z'vachiym lelohey aviyv yitz'chak
translation: So Israel set out with all that was his, and he came to Beer-sheba, where he offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּמַרְאֹ֣ת הַלַּ֔יְלָה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֣ב ׀ יַעֲקֹ֑ב וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym  l'yis'rael b'mar'ot halay'lah vayomer ya'akov  ya'akov vayomer hineniy
translation: God called to Israel in a vision by night: “Jacob! Jacob!” He answered, “Here.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָנֹכִ֥י הָאֵ֖ל אֱלֹהֵ֣י אָבִ֑יךָ אַל־תִּירָא֙ מֵרְדָ֣ה מִצְרַ֔יְמָה כִּֽי־לְג֥וֹי גָּד֖וֹל אֲשִֽׂימְךָ֥ שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayomer anokhiy hael elohey aviykha al-tiyra mer'dah mitz'ray'mah kiy-l'gvoy gadvol asiym'kha sham
translation: And He said, “I am God, the God of your father. Fear not to go down to Egypt, for I will make you there into a great nation.

hebrew: אָנֹכִ֗י אֵרֵ֤ד עִמְּךָ֙ מִצְרַ֔יְמָה וְאָנֹכִ֖י אַֽעַלְךָ֣ גַם־עָלֹ֑ה וְיוֹסֵ֕ף יָשִׁ֥ית יָד֖וֹ עַל־עֵינֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: anokhiy ered 'im'kha mitz'ray'mah v'anokhiy a'al'kha gam-'aloh v'yvosef yashiyt yadvo 'al-'eyneykha
translation: I Myself will go down with you to Egypt, and I Myself will also bring you back; and Joseph’s hand shall close your eyes.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֥קָם יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִבְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיִּשְׂא֨וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־יַעֲקֹ֣ב אֲבִיהֶ֗ם וְאֶת־טַפָּם֙ וְאֶת־נְשֵׁיהֶ֔ם בָּעֲגָל֕וֹת אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח פַּרְעֹ֖ה לָשֵׂ֥את אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayakam ya'akov mib'er shava' vayis'v v'ney-yis'rael et-ya'akov aviyhem v'et-tapam v'et-n'sheyhem ba'agalvot asher-shalach par'oh laset otvo
translation: So Jacob set out from Beer-sheba. The sons of Israel put their father Jacob and their children and their wives in the wagons that Pharaoh had sent to transport him;

hebrew: וַיִּקְח֣וּ אֶת־מִקְנֵיהֶ֗ם וְאֶת־רְכוּשָׁם֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר רָֽכְשׁוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ מִצְרָ֑יְמָה יַעֲקֹ֖ב וְכָל־זַרְע֥וֹ אִתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayik'chv et-mik'neyhem v'et-r'khvsham asher rakh'shv b'eretz k'na'an vayavov mitz'ray'mah ya'akov v'khal-zar'vo itvo
translation: and they took along their livestock and the wealth that they had amassed in the land of Canaan. Thus Jacob and all his offspring with him came to Egypt:

hebrew: בָּנָ֞יו וּבְנֵ֤י בָנָיו֙ אִתּ֔וֹ בְּנֹתָ֛יו וּבְנ֥וֹת בָּנָ֖יו וְכָל־זַרְע֑וֹ הֵבִ֥יא אִתּ֖וֹ מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃ (ס)
transliteration: banayv vv'ney vanayv itvo b'notayv vv'nvot banayv v'khal-zar'vo heviy itvo mitz'ray'mah (s)
translation: he brought with him to Egypt his sons and grandsons, his daughters and granddaughters—all his offspring.

hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה שְׁמ֧וֹת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הַבָּאִ֥ים מִצְרַ֖יְמָה יַעֲקֹ֣ב וּבָנָ֑יו בְּכֹ֥ר יַעֲקֹ֖ב רְאוּבֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'eleh sh'mvot b'ney-yis'rael habaiym mitz'ray'mah ya'akov vvanayv b'khor ya'akov r'vven
translation:
These are the names of the Israelites, Jacob and his descendants, who came to Egypt.
Jacob’s first-born Reuben;

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י רְאוּבֵ֑ן חֲנ֥וֹךְ וּפַלּ֖וּא וְחֶצְר֥וֹן וְכַרְמִֽי׃
transliteration: vv'ney r'vven chanvokh' vfalv v'chetz'rvon v'khar'miy
translation: Reuben’s sons: Enoch,aOr “Hanoch.” Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֗וֹן יְמוּאֵ֧ל וְיָמִ֛ין וְאֹ֖הַד וְיָכִ֣ין וְצֹ֑חַר וְשָׁא֖וּל בֶּן־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִֽית׃
transliteration: vv'ney shim'von y'mvel v'yamiyn v'ohad v'yakhiyn v'tzochar v'shavl ben-hak'na'aniyt
translation: Simeon’s sons: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and SaulbOr “Shaul.” the son of a Canaanite woman.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י לֵוִ֑י גֵּרְשׁ֕וֹן קְהָ֖ת וּמְרָרִֽי׃
transliteration: vv'ney leviy ger'shvon k'hat vm'rariy
translation: Levi’s sons: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה עֵ֧ר וְאוֹנָ֛ן וְשֵׁלָ֖ה וָפֶ֣רֶץ וָזָ֑רַח וַיָּ֨מָת עֵ֤ר וְאוֹנָן֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן וַיִּהְי֥וּ בְנֵי־פֶ֖רֶץ חֶצְר֥וֹן וְחָמֽוּל׃
transliteration: vv'ney y'hvdah 'er v'vonan v'shelah vaferetz vazarach vayamat 'er v'vonan b'eretz k'na'an vayih'yv v'ney-feretz chetz'rvon v'chamvl
translation: Judah’s sons: Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah—but Er and Onan had died in the land of Canaan; and Perez’s sons were Hezron and Hamul.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י יִשָׂשכָ֑ר תּוֹלָ֥ע וּפֻוָּ֖ה וְי֥וֹב וְשִׁמְרֽוֹן׃
transliteration: vv'ney yisashkhar tvola' vfuvah v'yvov v'shim'rvon
translation: Issachar’s sons: Tola, Puvah, Iob, and Shimron.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י זְבוּלֻ֑ן סֶ֥רֶד וְאֵל֖וֹן וְיַחְלְאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vv'ney z'vvlun sered v'elvon v'yach'l'el
translation: Zebulun’s sons: Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה ׀ בְּנֵ֣י לֵאָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָֽלְדָ֤ה לְיַעֲקֹב֙ בְּפַדַּ֣ן אֲרָ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת דִּינָ֣ה בִתּ֑וֹ כָּל־נֶ֧פֶשׁ בָּנָ֛יו וּבְנוֹתָ֖יו שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וְשָׁלֹֽשׁ׃
transliteration: eleh  b'ney leah asher yal'dah l'ya'akov b'fadan aram v'et diynah vitvo kal-nefesh banayv vv'nvotayv sh'loshiym v'shalosh
translation: Those were the sons whom Leah bore to Jacob in Paddan-aram, in addition to his daughter Dinah. Persons in all, male and female: 33.cIncluding Jacob.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י גָ֔ד צִפְי֥וֹן וְחַגִּ֖י שׁוּנִ֣י וְאֶצְבֹּ֑ן עֵרִ֥י וַֽאֲרוֹדִ֖י וְאַרְאֵלִֽי׃
transliteration: vv'ney gad tzif'yvon v'chagiy shvniy v'etz'bon 'eriy vaarvodiy v'ar'eliy
translation: Gad’s sons: Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י אָשֵׁ֗ר יִמְנָ֧ה וְיִשְׁוָ֛ה וְיִשְׁוִ֥י וּבְרִיעָ֖ה וְשֶׂ֣רַח אֲחֹתָ֑ם וּבְנֵ֣י בְרִיעָ֔ה חֶ֖בֶר וּמַלְכִּיאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vv'ney asher yim'nah v'yish'vah v'yish'viy vv'riy'ah v'serach achotam vv'ney v'riy'ah chever vmal'kiyel
translation: Asher’s sons: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah, and their sister Serah. Beriah’s sons: Heber and Malchiel.

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י זִלְפָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן לָבָ֖ן לְלֵאָ֣ה בִתּ֑וֹ וַתֵּ֤לֶד אֶת־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב שֵׁ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה נָֽפֶשׁ׃
transliteration: eleh b'ney zil'pah asher-natan lavan l'leah vitvo vateled et-eleh l'ya'akov shesh 'es'reh nafesh
translation: These were the descendants of Zilpah, whom Laban had given to his daughter Leah. These she bore to Jacob—16 persons.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י רָחֵל֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת יַֽעֲקֹ֔ב יוֹסֵ֖ף וּבִנְיָמִֽן׃
transliteration: b'ney rachel eshet ya'akov yvosef vvin'yamin
translation: The sons of Jacob’s wife Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin.

hebrew: וַיִּוָּלֵ֣ד לְיוֹסֵף֮ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַיִם֒ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָֽלְדָה־לּוֹ֙ אָֽסְנַ֔ת בַּת־פּ֥וֹטִי פֶ֖רַע כֹּהֵ֣ן אֹ֑ן אֶת־מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה וְאֶת־אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayivaled l'yvosef b'eretz mitz'rayim asher yal'dah-lvo as'nat bat-pvotiy fera' kohen on et-m'nasheh v'et-ef'rayim
translation: To Joseph were born in the land of Egypt Manasseh and Ephraim, whom Asenath daughter of Poti-phera priest of On bore to him.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֗ן בֶּ֤לַע וָבֶ֙כֶר֙ וְאַשְׁבֵּ֔ל גֵּרָ֥א וְנַעֲמָ֖ן אֵחִ֣י וָרֹ֑אשׁ מֻפִּ֥ים וְחֻפִּ֖ים וָאָֽרְדְּ׃
transliteration: vv'ney vin'yamin bela' vavekher v'ash'bel gera v'na'aman echiy varosh mupiym v'chupiym vaar'd'
translation: Benjamin’s sons: Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י רָחֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻלַּ֖ד לְיַעֲקֹ֑ב כָּל־נֶ֖פֶשׁ אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָֽׂר׃
transliteration: eleh b'ney rachel asher yulad l'ya'akov kal-nefesh ar'ba'ah 'asar
translation: These were the descendants of Rachel who were born to Jacob—14 persons in all.

hebrew: וּבְנֵי־דָ֖ן חֻשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: vv'ney-dan chushiym
translation: Dan’s son:dHeb. “sons.” Hushim.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י נַפְתָּלִ֑י יַחְצְאֵ֥ל וְגוּנִ֖י וְיֵ֥צֶר וְשִׁלֵּֽם׃
transliteration: vv'ney naf'taliy yach'tz'el v'gvniy v'yetzer v'shilem
translation: Naphtali’s sons: Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י בִלְהָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן לָבָ֖ן לְרָחֵ֣ל בִּתּ֑וֹ וַתֵּ֧לֶד אֶת־אֵ֛לֶּה לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב כָּל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ שִׁבְעָֽה׃
transliteration: eleh b'ney vil'hah asher-natan lavan l'rachel bitvo vateled et-eleh l'ya'akov kal-nefesh shiv'ah
translation: These were the descendants of Bilhah, whom Laban had given to his daughter Rachel. These she bore to Jacob—7 persons in all.

hebrew: כָּל־הַ֠נֶּפֶשׁ הַבָּאָ֨ה לְיַעֲקֹ֤ב מִצְרַ֙יְמָה֙ יֹצְאֵ֣י יְרֵכ֔וֹ מִלְּבַ֖ד נְשֵׁ֣י בְנֵי־יַעֲקֹ֑ב כָּל־נֶ֖פֶשׁ שִׁשִּׁ֥ים וָשֵֽׁשׁ׃
transliteration: kal-hanefesh habaah l'ya'akov mitz'ray'mah yotz'ey y'rekhvo mil'vad n'shey v'ney-ya'akov kal-nefesh shishiym vashesh
translation: All the persons belonging to Jacob who came to EgypteNot including Joseph and Joseph’s two sons.—his own issue, aside from the wives of Jacob’s sons—all these persons numbered 66.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י יוֹסֵ֛ף אֲשֶׁר־יֻלַּד־ל֥וֹ בְמִצְרַ֖יִם נֶ֣פֶשׁ שְׁנָ֑יִם כָּל־הַנֶּ֧פֶשׁ לְבֵֽית־יַעֲקֹ֛ב הַבָּ֥אָה מִצְרַ֖יְמָה שִׁבְעִֽים׃ (פ)
transliteration: vv'ney yvosef asher-yulad-lvo v'mitz'rayim nefesh sh'nayim kal-hanefesh l'veyt-ya'akov habaah mitz'ray'mah shiv'iym (f)
translation: And Joseph’s sons who were born to him in Egypt were two in number. Thus the total of Jacob’s household who came to Egypt was seventy persons.fIncluding Jacob and Joseph.

hebrew: וְאֶת־יְהוּדָ֞ה שָׁלַ֤ח לְפָנָיו֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף לְהוֹרֹ֥ת לְפָנָ֖יו גֹּ֑שְׁנָה וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אַ֥רְצָה גֹּֽשֶׁן׃
transliteration: v'et-y'hvdah shalach l'fanayv el-yvosef l'hvorot l'fanayv gosh'nah vayavov ar'tzah goshen
translation: He had sent Judah ahead of him to Joseph, to point the way before him to Goshen. So when they came to the region of Goshen,

hebrew: וַיֶּאְסֹ֤ר יוֹסֵף֙ מֶרְכַּבְתּ֔וֹ וַיַּ֛עַל לִקְרַֽאת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל אָבִ֖יו גֹּ֑שְׁנָה וַיֵּרָ֣א אֵלָ֗יו וַיִּפֹּל֙ עַל־צַוָּארָ֔יו וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ עַל־צַוָּארָ֖יו עֽוֹד׃
transliteration: vaye'sor yvosef mer'kav'tvo vaya'al lik'rat-yis'rael aviyv gosh'nah vayera elayv vayipol 'al-tzavarayv vayev'k' 'al-tzavarayv 'vod
translation: Joseph orderedgLit. “hitched.” his chariot and went to Goshen to meet his father Israel; he presented himself to him and, embracing him around the neck, he wept on his neck a good while.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף אָמ֣וּתָה הַפָּ֑עַם אַחֲרֵי֙ רְאוֹתִ֣י אֶת־פָּנֶ֔יךָ כִּ֥י עוֹדְךָ֖ חָֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer yis'rael el-yvosef amvtah hapa'am acharey r'votiy et-paneykha kiy 'vod'kha chay
translation: Then Israel said to Joseph, “Now I can die, having seen for myself that you are still alive.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יוֹסֵ֤ף אֶל־אֶחָיו֙ וְאֶל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֔יו אֶעֱלֶ֖ה וְאַגִּ֣ידָה לְפַרְעֹ֑ה וְאֹֽמְרָ֣ה אֵלָ֔יו אַחַ֧י וּבֵית־אָבִ֛י אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּאֶֽרֶץ־כְּנַ֖עַן בָּ֥אוּ אֵלָֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-echayv v'el-beyt aviyv e'eleh v'agiydah l'far'oh v'om'rah elayv achay vveyt-aviy asher b'eretz-k'na'an bav elay
translation: Then Joseph said to his brothers and to his father’s household, “I will go up and tell the news to Pharaoh, and say to him, ‘My brothers and my father’s household, who were in the land of Canaan, have come to me.

hebrew: וְהָאֲנָשִׁים֙ רֹ֣עֵי צֹ֔אן כִּֽי־אַנְשֵׁ֥י מִקְנֶ֖ה הָי֑וּ וְצֹאנָ֧ם וּבְקָרָ֛ם וְכָל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָהֶ֖ם הֵבִֽיאוּ׃
transliteration: v'haanashiym ro'ey tzon kiy-an'shey mik'neh hayv v'tzonam vv'karam v'khal-asher lahem heviyv
translation: The men are shepherds; they have always been breeders of livestock, and they have brought with them their flocks and herds and all that is theirs.’

hebrew: וְהָיָ֕ה כִּֽי־יִקְרָ֥א לָכֶ֖ם פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְאָמַ֖ר מַה־מַּעֲשֵׂיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy-yik'ra lakhem par'oh v'amar mah-ma'aseykhem
translation: So when Pharaoh summons you and asks, ‘What is your occupation?’

hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֗ם אַנְשֵׁ֨י מִקְנֶ֜ה הָי֤וּ עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ מִנְּעוּרֵ֣ינוּ וְעַד־עַ֔תָּה גַּם־אֲנַ֖חְנוּ גַּם־אֲבֹתֵ֑ינוּ בַּעֲב֗וּר תֵּשְׁבוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֔שֶׁן כִּֽי־תוֹעֲבַ֥ת מִצְרַ֖יִם כָּל־רֹ֥עֵה צֹֽאן׃
transliteration: vaamar'tem an'shey mik'neh hayv 'avadeykha min'vreynv v'ad-'atah gam-anach'nv gam-avoteynv ba'avvr tesh'vv b'eretz goshen kiy-tvo'avat mitz'rayim kal-ro'eh tzon
translation: you shall answer, ‘Your servants have been breeders of livestock from the start until now, both we and our fathers’—so that you may stay in the region of Goshen. For all shepherds are abhorrent to Egyptians.”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א יוֹסֵף֮ וַיַּגֵּ֣ד לְפַרְעֹה֒ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אָבִ֨י וְאַחַ֜י וְצֹאנָ֤ם וּבְקָרָם֙ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָהֶ֔ם בָּ֖אוּ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְהִנָּ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ גֹּֽשֶׁן׃
transliteration: vayavo yvosef vayaged l'far'oh vayomer aviy v'achay v'tzonam vv'karam v'khal-asher lahem bav meeretz k'na'an v'hinam b'eretz goshen
translation: Then Joseph came and reported to Pharaoh, saying, “My father and my brothers, with their flocks and herds and all that is theirs, have come from the land of Canaan and are now in the region of Goshen.”

hebrew: וּמִקְצֵ֣ה אֶחָ֔יו לָקַ֖ח חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וַיַּצִּגֵ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י פַרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vmik'tzeh echayv lakach chamishah anashiym vayatzigem lif'ney far'oh
translation: And selecting a fewaLit. “five.” of his brothers, he presented them to Pharaoh.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֛ה אֶל־אֶחָ֖יו מַה־מַּעֲשֵׂיכֶ֑ם וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֗ה רֹעֵ֥ה צֹאן֙ עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ גַּם־אֲנַ֖חְנוּ גַּם־אֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh el-echayv mah-ma'aseykhem vayom'rv el-par'oh ro'eh tzon 'avadeykha gam-anach'nv gam-avvoteynv
translation: Pharaoh said to his brothers, “What is your occupation?” They answered Pharaoh, “We your servants are shepherds, as were also our fathers.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֗ה לָג֣וּר בָּאָרֶץ֮ בָּאנוּ֒ כִּי־אֵ֣ין מִרְעֶ֗ה לַצֹּאן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ כִּֽי־כָבֵ֥ד הָרָעָ֖ב בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְעַתָּ֛ה יֵֽשְׁבוּ־נָ֥א עֲבָדֶ֖יךָ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ גֹּֽשֶׁן׃
transliteration: vayom'rv el-par'oh lagvr baaretz banv kiy-eyn mir'eh latzon asher la'avadeykha kiy-khaved hara'av b'eretz k'na'an v'atah yesh'vv-na 'avadeykha b'eretz goshen
translation: We have come,” they told Pharaoh, “to sojourn in this land, for there is no pasture for your servants’ flocks, the famine being severe in the land of Canaan. Pray, then, let your servants stay in the region of Goshen.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֔ה אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף לֵאמֹ֑ר אָבִ֥יךָ וְאַחֶ֖יךָ בָּ֥אוּ אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh el-yvosef lemor aviykha v'acheykha bav eleykha
translation: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “As regards your father and your brothers who have come to you,

hebrew: אֶ֤רֶץ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לְפָנֶ֣יךָ הִ֔וא בְּמֵיטַ֣ב הָאָ֔רֶץ הוֹשֵׁ֥ב אֶת־אָבִ֖יךָ וְאֶת־אַחֶ֑יךָ יֵשְׁבוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֔שֶׁן וְאִם־יָדַ֗עְתָּ וְיֶשׁ־בָּם֙ אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֔יִל וְשַׂמְתָּ֛ם שָׂרֵ֥י מִקְנֶ֖ה עַל־אֲשֶׁר־לִֽי׃
transliteration: eretz mitz'rayim l'faneykha hiv b'meytav haaretz hvoshev et-aviykha v'et-acheykha yesh'vv b'eretz goshen v'im-yada'ta v'yesh-bam an'shey-chayil v'sam'tam sarey mik'neh 'al-asher-liy
translation: the land of Egypt is open before you: settle your father and your brothers in the best part of the land; let them stay in the region of Goshen. And if you know any capable men among them, put them in charge of my livestock.”

hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֤א יוֹסֵף֙ אֶת־יַֽעֲקֹ֣ב אָבִ֔יו וַיַּֽעֲמִדֵ֖הוּ לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־פַּרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayave yvosef et-ya'akov aviyv vaya'amidehv lif'ney far'oh vay'varekh' ya'akov et-par'oh
translation: Joseph then brought his father Jacob and presented him to Pharaoh; and Jacob greeted Pharaoh.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֑ב כַּמָּ֕ה יְמֵ֖י שְׁנֵ֥י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh el-ya'akov kamah y'mey sh'ney chayeykha
translation: Pharaoh asked Jacob, “How many are the years of your life?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה יְמֵי֙ שְׁנֵ֣י מְגוּרַ֔י שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָ֑ה מְעַ֣ט וְרָעִ֗ים הָיוּ֙ יְמֵי֙ שְׁנֵ֣י חַיַּ֔י וְלֹ֣א הִשִּׂ֗יגוּ אֶת־יְמֵי֙ שְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י אֲבֹתַ֔י בִּימֵ֖י מְגוּרֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov el-par'oh y'mey sh'ney m'gvray sh'loshiym vm'at shanah m'at v'ra'iym hayv y'mey sh'ney chayay v'lo hisiygv et-y'mey sh'ney chayey avotay biymey m'gvreyhem
translation: And Jacob answered Pharaoh, “The years of my sojourn [on earth] are one hundred and thirty. Few and hard have been the years of my life, nor do they come up to the life spans of my fathers during their sojourns.”

hebrew: וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַיֵּצֵ֖א מִלִּפְנֵ֥י פַרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vay'varekh' ya'akov et-par'oh vayetze milif'ney far'oh
translation: Then Jacob bade Pharaoh farewell, and left Pharaoh’s presence.

hebrew: וַיּוֹשֵׁ֣ב יוֹסֵף֮ אֶת־אָבִ֣יו וְאֶת־אֶחָיו֒ וַיִּתֵּ֨ן לָהֶ֤ם אֲחֻזָּה֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּמֵיטַ֥ב הָאָ֖רֶץ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ רַעְמְסֵ֑ס כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֥ה פַרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayvoshev yvosef et-aviyv v'et-echayv vayiten lahem achuzah b'eretz mitz'rayim b'meytav haaretz b'eretz ra'm'ses kaasher tzivah far'oh
translation: So Joseph settled his father and his brothers, giving them holdings in the choicest part of the land of Egypt, in the region of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.

hebrew: וַיְכַלְכֵּ֤ל יוֹסֵף֙ אֶת־אָבִ֣יו וְאֶת־אֶחָ֔יו וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑יו לֶ֖חֶם לְפִ֥י הַטָּֽף׃
transliteration: vay'khal'kel yvosef et-aviyv v'et-echayv v'et kal-beyt aviyv lechem l'fiy hataf
translation: Joseph sustained his father, and his brothers, and all his father’s household with bread, down to the little ones.

hebrew: וְלֶ֤חֶם אֵין֙ בְּכָל־הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּֽי־כָבֵ֥ד הָרָעָ֖ב מְאֹ֑ד וַתֵּ֜לַהּ אֶ֤רֶץ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ וְאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן מִפְּנֵ֖י הָרָעָֽב׃
transliteration: v'lechem eyn b'khal-haaretz kiy-khaved hara'av m'od vatelah eretz mitz'rayim v'eretz k'na'an mip'ney hara'av
translation: Now there was no bread in all the world, for the famine was very severe; both the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan languished because of the famine.

hebrew: וַיְלַקֵּ֣ט יוֹסֵ֗ף אֶת־כָּל־הַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ הַנִּמְצָ֤א בְאֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ וּבְאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן בַּשֶּׁ֖בֶר אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֣ם שֹׁבְרִ֑ים וַיָּבֵ֥א יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶת־הַכֶּ֖סֶף בֵּ֥יתָה פַרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vay'laket yvosef et-kal-hakesef hanim'tza v'eretz-mitz'rayim vv'eretz k'na'an bashever asher-hem shov'riym vayave yvosef et-hakesef beytah far'oh
translation: Joseph gathered in all the money that was to be found in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan, as payment for the rations that were being procured, and Joseph brought the money into Pharaoh’s palace.

hebrew: וַיִּתֹּ֣ם הַכֶּ֗סֶף מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַיִם֮ וּמֵאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַעַן֒ וַיָּבֹאוּ֩ כָל־מִצְרַ֨יִם אֶל־יוֹסֵ֤ף לֵאמֹר֙ הָֽבָה־לָּ֣נוּ לֶ֔חֶם וְלָ֥מָּה נָמ֖וּת נֶגְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י אָפֵ֖ס כָּֽסֶף׃
transliteration: vayitom hakesef meeretz mitz'rayim vmeeretz k'na'an vayavov khal-mitz'rayim el-yvosef lemor havah-lanv lechem v'lamah namvt neg'dekha kiy afes kasef
translation: And when the money gave out in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan, all the Egyptians came to Joseph and said, “Give us bread, lest we die before your very eyes; for the money is gone!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ הָב֣וּ מִקְנֵיכֶ֔ם וְאֶתְּנָ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם בְּמִקְנֵיכֶ֑ם אִם־אָפֵ֖ס כָּֽסֶף׃
transliteration: vayomer yvosef havv mik'neykhem v'et'nah lakhem b'mik'neykhem im-afes kasef
translation: And Joseph said, “Bring your livestock, and I will sell to you against your livestock, if the money is gone.”

hebrew: וַיָּבִ֣יאוּ אֶת־מִקְנֵיהֶם֮ אֶל־יוֹסֵף֒ וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לָהֶם֩ יוֹסֵ֨ף לֶ֜חֶם בַּסּוּסִ֗ים וּבְמִקְנֵ֥ה הַצֹּ֛אן וּבְמִקְנֵ֥ה הַבָּקָ֖ר וּבַחֲמֹרִ֑ים וַיְנַהֲלֵ֤ם בַּלֶּ֙חֶם֙ בְּכָל־מִקְנֵהֶ֔ם בַּשָּׁנָ֖ה הַהִֽוא׃
transliteration: vayaviyv et-mik'neyhem el-yvosef vayiten lahem yvosef lechem basvsiym vv'mik'neh hatzon vv'mik'neh habakar vvachamoriym vay'nahalem balechem b'khal-mik'nehem bashanah hahiv
translation: So they brought their livestock to Joseph, and Joseph gave them bread in exchange for the horses, for the stocks of sheep and cattle, and the asses; thus he provided them with bread that year in exchange for all their livestock.

hebrew: וַתִּתֹּם֮ הַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַהִוא֒ וַיָּבֹ֨אוּ אֵלָ֜יו בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשֵּׁנִ֗ית וַיֹּ֤אמְרוּ לוֹ֙ לֹֽא־נְכַחֵ֣ד מֵֽאֲדֹנִ֔י כִּ֚י אִם־תַּ֣ם הַכֶּ֔סֶף וּמִקְנֵ֥ה הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֑י לֹ֤א נִשְׁאַר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י בִּלְתִּ֥י אִם־גְּוִיָּתֵ֖נוּ וְאַדְמָתֵֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vatitom hashanah hahiv vayavov elayv bashanah hasheniyt vayom'rv lvo lo-n'khached meadoniy kiy im-tam hakesef vmik'neh hab'hemah el-adoniy lo nish'ar lif'ney adoniy bil'tiy im-g'viyatenv v'ad'matenv
translation: And when that year was ended, they came to him the next year and said to him, “We cannot hide from my lord that, with all the money and animal stocks consigned to my lord, nothing is left at my lord’s disposal save our persons and our farmland.

hebrew: לָ֧מָּה נָמ֣וּת לְעֵינֶ֗יךָ גַּם־אֲנַ֙חְנוּ֙ גַּ֣ם אַדְמָתֵ֔נוּ קְנֵֽה־אֹתָ֥נוּ וְאֶת־אַדְמָתֵ֖נוּ בַּלָּ֑חֶם וְנִֽהְיֶ֞ה אֲנַ֤חְנוּ וְאַדְמָתֵ֙נוּ֙ עֲבָדִ֣ים לְפַרְעֹ֔ה וְתֶן־זֶ֗רַע וְנִֽחְיֶה֙ וְלֹ֣א נָמ֔וּת וְהָאֲדָמָ֖ה לֹ֥א תֵשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: lamah namvt l'eyneykha gam-anach'nv gam ad'matenv k'neh-otanv v'et-ad'matenv balachem v'nih'yeh anach'nv v'ad'matenv 'avadiym l'far'oh v'ten-zera' v'nich'yeh v'lo namvt v'haadamah lo tesham
translation: Let us not perish before your eyes, both we and our land. Take us and our land in exchange for bread, and we with our land will be serfs to Pharaoh; provide the seed, that we may live and not die, and that the land may not become a waste.”

hebrew: וַיִּ֨קֶן יוֹסֵ֜ף אֶת־כָּל־אַדְמַ֤ת מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לְפַרְעֹ֔ה כִּֽי־מָכְר֤וּ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ אִ֣ישׁ שָׂדֵ֔הוּ כִּֽי־חָזַ֥ק עֲלֵהֶ֖ם הָרָעָ֑ב וַתְּהִ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayiken yvosef et-kal-ad'mat mitz'rayim l'far'oh kiy-makh'rv mitz'rayim iysh sadehv kiy-chazak 'alehem hara'av vat'hiy haaretz l'far'oh
translation: So Joseph gained possession of all the farm land of Egypt for Pharaoh, every Egyptian having sold his field because the famine was too much for them; thus the land passed over to Pharaoh.

hebrew: וְאֶ֨ת־הָעָ֔ם הֶעֱבִ֥יר אֹת֖וֹ לֶעָרִ֑ים מִקְצֵ֥ה גְבוּל־מִצְרַ֖יִם וְעַד־קָצֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: v'et-ha'am he'eviyr otvo le'ariym mik'tzeh g'vvl-mitz'rayim v'ad-katzehv
translation: And he removed the population town by town,bMeaning of Heb. uncertain. from one end of Egypt’s border to the other.

hebrew: רַ֛ק אַדְמַ֥ת הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים לֹ֣א קָנָ֑ה כִּי֩ חֹ֨ק לַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים מֵאֵ֣ת פַּרְעֹ֗ה וְאָֽכְל֤וּ אֶת־חֻקָּם֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֤ן לָהֶם֙ פַּרְעֹ֔ה עַל־כֵּ֕ן לֹ֥א מָכְר֖וּ אֶת־אַדְמָתָֽם׃
transliteration: rak ad'mat hakohaniym lo kanah kiy chok lakohaniym meet par'oh v'akh'lv et-chukam asher natan lahem par'oh 'al-ken lo makh'rv et-ad'matam
translation: Only the land of the priests he did not take over, for the priests had an allotment from Pharaoh, and they lived off the allotment which Pharaoh had made to them; therefore they did not sell their land.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם הֵן֩ קָנִ֨יתִי אֶתְכֶ֥ם הַיּ֛וֹם וְאֶת־אַדְמַתְכֶ֖ם לְפַרְעֹ֑ה הֵֽא־לָכֶ֣ם זֶ֔רַע וּזְרַעְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-ha'am hen kaniytiy et'khem hayvom v'et-ad'mat'khem l'far'oh he-lakhem zera' vz'ra'tem et-haadamah
translation: Then Joseph said to the people, “Whereas I have this day acquired you and your land for Pharaoh, here is seed for you to sow the land.

hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּתְּבוּאֹ֔ת וּנְתַתֶּ֥ם חֲמִישִׁ֖ית לְפַרְעֹ֑ה וְאַרְבַּ֣ע הַיָּדֹ֡ת יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶם֩ לְזֶ֨רַע הַשָּׂדֶ֧ה וּֽלְאָכְלְכֶ֛ם וְלַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּבָתֵּיכֶ֖ם וְלֶאֱכֹ֥ל לְטַפְּכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hayah bat'vvot vn'tatem chamiyshiyt l'far'oh v'ar'ba' hayadot yih'yeh lakhem l'zera' hasadeh vl'akh'l'khem v'laasher b'vateykhem v'leekhol l'tap'khem
translation: And when harvest comes, you shall give one-fifth to Pharaoh, and four-fifths shall be yours as seed for the fields and as food for you and those in your households, and as nourishment for your children.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ הֶחֱיִתָ֑נוּ נִמְצָא־חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י וְהָיִ֥ינוּ עֲבָדִ֖ים לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayom'rv hecheyitanv nim'tza-chen b'eyney adoniy v'hayiynv 'avadiym l'far'oh
translation: And they said, “You have saved our lives! We are grateful to my lord, and we shall be serfs to Pharaoh.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֣שֶׂם אֹתָ֣הּ יוֹסֵ֡ף לְחֹק֩ עַד־הַיּ֨וֹם הַזֶּ֜ה עַל־אַדְמַ֥ת מִצְרַ֛יִם לְפַרְעֹ֖ה לַחֹ֑מֶשׁ רַ֞ק אַדְמַ֤ת הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ לְבַדָּ֔ם לֹ֥א הָיְתָ֖ה לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayasem otah yvosef l'chok 'ad-hayvom hazeh 'al-ad'mat mitz'rayim l'far'oh lachomesh rak ad'mat hakohaniym l'vadam lo hay'tah l'far'oh
translation: And Joseph made it into a land law in Egypt, which is still valid, that a fifth should be Pharaoh’s; only the land of the priests did not become Pharaoh’s.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֧שֶׁב יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֑שֶׁן וַיֵּאָחֲז֣וּ בָ֔הּ וַיִּפְר֥וּ וַיִּרְבּ֖וּ מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: vayeshev yis'rael b'eretz mitz'rayim b'eretz goshen vayeachazv vah vayif'rv vayir'bv m'od
translation: Thus Israel settled in the country of Egypt, in the region of Goshen; they acquired holdings in it, and were fertile and increased greatly.

hebrew: וַיְחִ֤י יַעֲקֹב֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם שְׁבַ֥ע עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָ֑ה וַיְהִ֤י יְמֵֽי־יַעֲקֹב֙ שְׁנֵ֣י חַיָּ֔יו שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֔ים וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'chiy ya'akov b'eretz mitz'rayim sh'va' 'es'reh shanah vay'hiy y'mey-ya'akov sh'ney chayayv sheva' shaniym v'ar'ba'iym vm'at shanah
translation: Jacob lived seventeen years in the land of Egypt, so that the span of Jacob’s life came to one hundred and forty-seven years.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרְב֣וּ יְמֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֘ל לָמוּת֒ וַיִּקְרָ֣א ׀ לִבְנ֣וֹ לְיוֹסֵ֗ף וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ אִם־נָ֨א מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ שִֽׂים־נָ֥א יָדְךָ֖ תַּ֣חַת יְרֵכִ֑י וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ עִמָּדִי֙ חֶ֣סֶד וֶאֱמֶ֔ת אַל־נָ֥א תִקְבְּרֵ֖נִי בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayik'r'vv y'mey-yis'rael lamvt vayik'ra  liv'nvo l'yvosef vayomer lvo im-na matzatiy chen b'eyneykha siym-na yad'kha tachat y'rekhiy v'asiyta 'imadiy chesed veemet al-na tik'b'reniy b'mitz'rayim
translation: And when the time approached for Israel to die, he summoned his son Joseph and said to him, “Do me this favor, place your hand under my thigh as a pledge of your steadfast loyalty: please do not bury me in Egypt.

hebrew: וְשָֽׁכַבְתִּי֙ עִם־אֲבֹתַ֔י וּנְשָׂאתַ֙נִי֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם וּקְבַרְתַּ֖נִי בִּקְבֻרָתָ֑ם וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אָנֹכִ֖י אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה כִדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'shakhav'tiy 'im-avotay vn'sataniy mimitz'rayim vk'var'taniy bik'vuratam vayomar anokhiy e'eseh khid'varekha
translation: When I lie down with my fathers, take me up from Egypt and bury me in their burial-place.” He replied, “I will do as you have spoken.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִשָּֽׁבְעָה֙ לִ֔י וַיִּשָּׁבַ֖ע ל֑וֹ וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הַמִּטָּֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayomer hishav'ah liy vayishava' lvo vayish'tachv yis'rael 'al-rosh hamitah (f)
translation: And he said, “Swear to me.” And he swore to him. Then Israel bowed at the head of the bed.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחֲרֵי֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְיוֹסֵ֔ף הִנֵּ֥ה אָבִ֖יךָ חֹלֶ֑ה וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־שְׁנֵ֤י בָנָיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ אֶת־מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה וְאֶת־אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy acharey had'variym haeleh vayomer l'yvosef hineh aviykha choleh vayikach et-sh'ney vanayv 'imvo et-m'nasheh v'et-ef'rayim
translation: Some time afterward, Joseph was told, “Your father is ill.” So he took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.

hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֣ד לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּ֛ה בִּנְךָ֥ יוֹסֵ֖ף בָּ֣א אֵלֶ֑יךָ וַיִּתְחַזֵּק֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב עַל־הַמִּטָּֽה׃
transliteration: vayaged l'ya'akov vayomer hineh bin'kha yvosef ba eleykha vayit'chazek yis'rael vayeshev 'al-hamitah
translation: When Jacob was told, “Your son Joseph has come to see you,” Israel summoned his strength and sat up in bed.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אֵ֥ל שַׁדַּ֛י נִרְאָֽה־אֵלַ֥י בְּל֖וּז בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַיְבָ֖רֶךְ אֹתִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer ya'akov el-yvosef el shaday nir'ah-elay b'lvz b'eretz k'na'an vay'varekh' otiy
translation: And Jacob said to Joseph, “El Shaddai appeared to me at Luz in the land of Canaan, and He blessed me,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י הִנְנִ֤י מַפְרְךָ֙ וְהִרְבִּיתִ֔ךָ וּנְתַתִּ֖יךָ לִקְהַ֣ל עַמִּ֑ים וְנָ֨תַתִּ֜י אֶת־הָאָ֧רֶץ הַזֹּ֛את לְזַרְעֲךָ֥ אַחֲרֶ֖יךָ אֲחֻזַּ֥ת עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer elay hin'niy maf'r'kha v'hir'biytikha vn'tatiykha lik'hal 'amiym v'natatiy et-haaretz hazot l'zar'akha achareykha achuzat 'volam
translation: and said to me, ‘I will make you fertile and numerous, making of you a community of peoples; and I will assign this land to your offspring to come for an everlasting possession.’

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה שְׁנֵֽי־בָנֶיךָ֩ הַנּוֹלָדִ֨ים לְךָ֜ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֗יִם עַד־בֹּאִ֥י אֵלֶ֛יךָ מִצְרַ֖יְמָה לִי־הֵ֑ם אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ וּמְנַשֶּׁ֔ה כִּרְאוּבֵ֥ן וְשִׁמְע֖וֹן יִֽהְיוּ־לִֽי׃
transliteration: v'atah sh'ney-vaneykha hanvoladiym l'kha b'eretz mitz'rayim 'ad-boiy eleykha mitz'ray'mah liy-hem ef'rayim vm'nasheh kir'vven v'shim'von yih'yv-liy
translation: Now, your two sons, who were born to you in the land of Egypt before I came to you in Egypt, shall be mine; Ephraim and Manasseh shall be mine no less than Reuben and Simeon.

hebrew: וּמוֹלַדְתְּךָ֛ אֲשֶׁר־הוֹלַ֥דְתָּ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֖ם לְךָ֣ יִהְי֑וּ עַ֣ל שֵׁ֧ם אֲחֵיהֶ֛ם יִקָּרְא֖וּ בְּנַחֲלָתָֽם׃
transliteration: vmvolad't'kha asher-hvolad'ta achareyhem l'kha yih'yv 'al shem acheyhem yikar'v b'nachalatam
translation: But progeny born to you after them shall be yours; they shall be recorded insteadaLit. “under the name.” of their brothers in their inheritance.

hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י ׀ בְּבֹאִ֣י מִפַּדָּ֗ן מֵ֩תָה֩ עָלַ֨י רָחֵ֜ל בְּאֶ֤רֶץ כְּנַ֙עַן֙ בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ בְּע֥וֹד כִּבְרַת־אֶ֖רֶץ לָבֹ֣א אֶפְרָ֑תָה וָאֶקְבְּרֶ֤הָ שָּׁם֙ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ אֶפְרָ֔ת הִ֖וא בֵּ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃
transliteration: vaaniy  b'voiy mipadan metah 'alay rachel b'eretz k'na'an baderekh' b'vod kiv'rat-eretz lavo ef'ratah vaek'b'reha sham b'derekh' ef'rat hiv beyt lachem
translation: I [do this because], when I was returning from Paddan, Rachel died, to my sorrow, while I was journeying in the land of Canaan, when still some distance short of Ephrath; and I buried her there on the road to Ephrath”—now Bethlehem.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מִי־אֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: vayar' yis'rael et-b'ney yvosef vayomer miy-eleh
translation: Noticing Joseph’s sons, Israel asked, “Who are these?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ אֶל־אָבִ֔יו בָּנַ֣י הֵ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־נָֽתַן־לִ֥י אֱלֹהִ֖ים בָּזֶ֑ה וַיֹּאמַ֕ר קָֽחֶם־נָ֥א אֵלַ֖י וַאֲבָרֲכֵֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-aviyv banay hem asher-natan-liy elohiym bazeh vayomar kachem-na elay vaavarakhem
translation: And Joseph said to his father, “They are my sons, whom God has given me here.” “Bring them up to me,” he said, “that I may bless them.”

hebrew: וְעֵינֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ כָּבְד֣וּ מִזֹּ֔קֶן לֹ֥א יוּכַ֖ל לִרְא֑וֹת וַיַּגֵּ֤שׁ אֹתָם֙ אֵלָ֔יו וַיִּשַּׁ֥ק לָהֶ֖ם וַיְחַבֵּ֥ק לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'eyney yis'rael kav'dv mizoken lo yvkhal lir'vot vayagesh otam elayv vayishak lahem vay'chabek lahem
translation: Now Israel’s eyes were dim with age; he could not see. So [Joseph] brought them close to him, and he kissed them and embraced them.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף רְאֹ֥ה פָנֶ֖יךָ לֹ֣א פִלָּ֑לְתִּי וְהִנֵּ֨ה הֶרְאָ֥ה אֹתִ֛י אֱלֹהִ֖ים גַּ֥ם אֶת־זַרְעֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer yis'rael el-yvosef r'oh faneykha lo filal'tiy v'hineh her'ah otiy elohiym gam et-zar'ekha
translation: And Israel said to Joseph, “I never expected to see you again, and here God has let me see your children as well.”

hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵ֥א יוֹסֵ֛ף אֹתָ֖ם מֵעִ֣ם בִּרְכָּ֑יו וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ לְאַפָּ֖יו אָֽרְצָה׃
transliteration: vayvotze yvosef otam me'im bir'kayv vayish'tachv l'apayv ar'tzah
translation: Joseph then removed them from his knees, and bowed low with his face to the ground.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח יוֹסֵף֮ אֶת־שְׁנֵיהֶם֒ אֶת־אֶפְרַ֤יִם בִּֽימִינוֹ֙ מִשְּׂמֹ֣אל יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֶת־מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה בִשְׂמֹאל֖וֹ מִימִ֣ין יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּגֵּ֖שׁ אֵלָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayikach yvosef et-sh'neyhem et-ef'rayim biymiynvo mis'mol yis'rael v'et-m'nasheh vis'molvo miymiyn yis'rael vayagesh elayv
translation: Joseph took the two of them, Ephraim with his right hand—to Israel’s left—and Manasseh with his left hand—to Israel’s right—and brought them close to him.
