hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל אֶת־יְמִינ֜וֹ וַיָּ֨שֶׁת עַל־רֹ֤אשׁ אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ וְה֣וּא הַצָּעִ֔יר וְאֶת־שְׂמֹאל֖וֹ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה שִׂכֵּל֙ אֶת־יָדָ֔יו כִּ֥י מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה הַבְּכֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vayish'lach yis'rael et-y'miynvo vayashet 'al-rosh ef'rayim v'hv hatza'iyr v'et-s'molvo 'al-rosh m'nasheh sikel et-yadayv kiy m'nasheh hab'khvor
translation: But Israel stretched out his right hand and laid it on Ephraim’s head, though he was the younger, and his left hand on Manasseh’s head—thus crossing his hands—although Manasseh was the first-born.

hebrew: וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֶת־יוֹסֵ֖ף וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הָֽאֱלֹהִ֡ים אֲשֶׁר֩ הִתְהַלְּכ֨וּ אֲבֹתַ֤י לְפָנָיו֙ אַבְרָהָ֣ם וְיִצְחָ֔ק הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ הָרֹעֶ֣ה אֹתִ֔י מֵעוֹדִ֖י עַד־הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vay'varekh' et-yvosef vayomar haelohiym asher hit'hal'khv avotay l'fanayv av'raham v'yitz'chak haelohiym haro'eh otiy me'vodiy 'ad-hayvom hazeh
translation:
And he blessed Joseph, saying,
“The God in whose ways my fathers Abraham and Isaac walked,
The God who has been my shepherd from my birth to this day—

hebrew: הַמַּלְאָךְ֩ הַגֹּאֵ֨ל אֹתִ֜י מִכָּל־רָ֗ע יְבָרֵךְ֮ אֶת־הַנְּעָרִים֒ וְיִקָּרֵ֤א בָהֶם֙ שְׁמִ֔י וְשֵׁ֥ם אֲבֹתַ֖י אַבְרָהָ֣ם וְיִצְחָ֑ק וְיִדְגּ֥וּ לָרֹ֖ב בְּקֶ֥רֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: hamal'akh' hagoel otiy mikal-ra' y'varekh' et-han'ariym v'yikare vahem sh'miy v'shem avotay av'raham v'yitz'chak v'yid'gv larov b'kerev haaretz
translation:
The Angel who has redeemed me from all harm—
Bless the lads.
In them may my name be recalled,
And the names of my fathers Abraham and Isaac,
And may they be teeming multitudes upon the earth.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא יוֹסֵ֗ף כִּי־יָשִׁ֨ית אָבִ֧יו יַד־יְמִינ֛וֹ עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ אֶפְרַ֖יִם וַיֵּ֣רַע בְּעֵינָ֑יו וַיִּתְמֹ֣ךְ יַד־אָבִ֗יו לְהָסִ֥יר אֹתָ֛הּ מֵעַ֥ל רֹאשׁ־אֶפְרַ֖יִם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ מְנַשֶּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayar' yvosef kiy-yashiyt aviyv yad-y'miynvo 'al-rosh ef'rayim vayera' b'eynayv vayit'mokh' yad-aviyv l'hasiyr otah me'al rosh-ef'rayim 'al-rosh m'nasheh
translation: When Joseph saw that his father was placing his right hand on Ephraim’s head, he thought it wrong; so he took hold of his father’s hand to move it from Ephraim’s head to Manasseh’s.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶל־אָבִ֖יו לֹא־כֵ֣ן אָבִ֑י כִּי־זֶ֣ה הַבְּכֹ֔ר שִׂ֥ים יְמִינְךָ֖ עַל־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-aviyv lo-khen aviy kiy-zeh hab'khor siym y'miyn'kha 'al-roshvo
translation: “Not so, Father,” Joseph said to his father, “for the other is the first-born; place your right hand on his head.”

hebrew: וַיְמָאֵ֣ן אָבִ֗יו וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יָדַ֤עְתִּֽי בְנִי֙ יָדַ֔עְתִּי גַּם־ה֥וּא יִֽהְיֶה־לְּעָ֖ם וְגַם־ה֣וּא יִגְדָּ֑ל וְאוּלָ֗ם אָחִ֤יו הַקָּטֹן֙ יִגְדַּ֣ל מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְזַרְע֖וֹ יִהְיֶ֥ה מְלֹֽא־הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
transliteration: vay'maen aviyv vayomer yada'tiy v'niy yada'tiy gam-hv yih'yeh-l'am v'gam-hv yig'dal v'vlam achiyv hakaton yig'dal mimenv v'zar'vo yih'yeh m'lo-hagvoyim
translation: But his father objected, saying, “I know, my son, I know. He too shall become a people, and he too shall be great. Yet his younger brother shall be greater than he, and his offspring shall be plentiful enough for nations.”

hebrew: וַיְבָ֨רֲכֵ֜ם בַּיּ֣וֹם הַהוּא֮ לֵאמוֹר֒ בְּךָ֗ יְבָרֵ֤ךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יְשִֽׂמְךָ֣ אֱלֹהִ֔ים כְּאֶפְרַ֖יִם וְכִמְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־אֶפְרַ֖יִם לִפְנֵ֥י מְנַשֶּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vay'varakhem bayvom hahv lemvor b'kha y'varekh' yis'rael lemor y'sim'kha elohiym k'ef'rayim v'khim'nasheh vayasem et-ef'rayim lif'ney m'nasheh
translation: So he blessed them that day, saying, “By you shall Israel invoke blessings, saying: God make you like Ephraim and Manasseh.” Thus he put Ephraim before Manasseh.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף הִנֵּ֥ה אָנֹכִ֖י מֵ֑ת וְהָיָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם וְהֵשִׁ֣יב אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ אֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer yis'rael el-yvosef hineh anokhiy met v'hayah elohiym 'imakhem v'heshiyv et'khem el-eretz avoteykhem
translation: Then Israel said to Joseph, “I am about to die; but God will be with you and bring you back to the land of your fathers.

hebrew: וַאֲנִ֞י נָתַ֧תִּֽי לְךָ֛ שְׁכֶ֥ם אַחַ֖ד עַל־אַחֶ֑יךָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר לָקַ֙חְתִּי֙ מִיַּ֣ד הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י בְּחַרְבִּ֖י וּבְקַשְׁתִּֽי׃ (פ)
transliteration: vaaniy natatiy l'kha sh'khem achad 'al-acheykha asher lakach'tiy miyad haemoriy b'char'biy vv'kash'tiy (f)
translation: And now, I assign to you one portionbMeaning of Heb. shekhem uncertain; others “mountain slope.” more than to your brothers, which I wrested from the Amorites with my sword and bow.”

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶל־בָּנָ֑יו וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֵאָֽסְפוּ֙ וְאַגִּ֣ידָה לָכֶ֔ם אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־יִקְרָ֥א אֶתְכֶ֖ם בְּאַחֲרִ֥ית הַיָּמִֽים׃
transliteration: vayik'ra ya'akov el-banayv vayomer heas'fv v'agiydah lakhem et asher-yik'ra et'khem b'achariyt hayamiym
translation: And Jacob called his sons and said, “Come together that I may tell you what is to befall you in days to come.

hebrew: הִקָּבְצ֥וּ וְשִׁמְע֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְשִׁמְע֖וּ אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל אֲבִיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: hikav'tzv v'shim'v b'ney ya'akov v'shim'v el-yis'rael aviykhem
translation:
Assemble and hearken, O sons of Jacob;
Hearken to Israel your father:

hebrew: רְאוּבֵן֙ בְּכֹ֣רִי אַ֔תָּה כֹּחִ֖י וְרֵאשִׁ֣ית אוֹנִ֑י יֶ֥תֶר שְׂאֵ֖ת וְיֶ֥תֶר עָֽז׃
transliteration: r'vven b'khoriy atah kochiy v'reshiyt voniy yeter s'et v'yeter 'az
translation:
Reuben, you are my first-born,
My might and first fruit of my vigor,
Exceeding in rank
And exceeding in honor.

hebrew: פַּ֤חַז כַּמַּ֙יִם֙ אַל־תּוֹתַ֔ר כִּ֥י עָלִ֖יתָ מִשְׁכְּבֵ֣י אָבִ֑יךָ אָ֥ז חִלַּ֖לְתָּ יְצוּעִ֥י עָלָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: pachaz kamayim al-tvotar kiy 'aliyta mish'k'vey aviykha az chilal'ta y'tzv'iy 'alah (f)
translation:
Unstable as water, you shall excel no longer;
For when you mounted your father’s bed,
You brought disgrace—my couch he mounted!

hebrew: שִׁמְע֥וֹן וְלֵוִ֖י אַחִ֑ים כְּלֵ֥י חָמָ֖ס מְכֵרֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: shim'von v'leviy achiym k'ley chamas m'kheroteyhem
translation:
Simeon and Levi are a pair;
Their weapons are tools of lawlessness.

hebrew: בְּסֹדָם֙ אַל־תָּבֹ֣א נַפְשִׁ֔י בִּקְהָלָ֖ם אַל־תֵּחַ֣ד כְּבֹדִ֑י כִּ֤י בְאַפָּם֙ הָ֣רְגוּ אִ֔ישׁ וּבִרְצֹנָ֖ם עִקְּרוּ־שֽׁוֹר׃
transliteration: b'sodam al-tavo naf'shiy bik'halam al-techad k'vodiy kiy v'apam har'gv iysh vvir'tzonam 'ik'rv-shvor
translation:
Let not my person be included in their council,
Let not my being be counted in their assembly.
For when angry they slay men,
And when pleased they maim oxen.

hebrew: אָר֤וּר אַפָּם֙ כִּ֣י עָ֔ז וְעֶבְרָתָ֖ם כִּ֣י קָשָׁ֑תָה אֲחַלְּקֵ֣ם בְּיַעֲקֹ֔ב וַאֲפִיצֵ֖ם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (ס)
transliteration: arvr apam kiy 'az v'ev'ratam kiy kashatah achal'kem b'ya'akov vaafiytzem b'yis'rael (s)
translation:
Cursed be their anger so fierce,
And their wrath so relentless.
I will divide them in Jacob,
Scatter them in Israel.

hebrew: יְהוּדָ֗ה אַתָּה֙ יוֹד֣וּךָ אַחֶ֔יךָ יָדְךָ֖ בְּעֹ֣רֶף אֹיְבֶ֑יךָ יִשְׁתַּחֲוּ֥וּ לְךָ֖ בְּנֵ֥י אָבִֽיךָ׃
transliteration: y'hvdah atah yvodvkha acheykha yad'kha b'oref oy'veykha yish'tachavv l'kha b'ney aviykha
translation:
You, O Judah, your brothers shall praise;
Your hand shall be on the nape of your foes;
Your father’s sons shall bow low to you.

hebrew: גּ֤וּר אַרְיֵה֙ יְהוּדָ֔ה מִטֶּ֖רֶף בְּנִ֣י עָלִ֑יתָ כָּרַ֨ע רָבַ֧ץ כְּאַרְיֵ֛ה וּכְלָבִ֖יא מִ֥י יְקִימֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: gvr ar'yeh y'hvdah miteref b'niy 'aliyta kara' ravatz k'ar'yeh vkh'laviy miy y'kiymenv
translation:
Judah is a lion’s whelp;
On prey, my son, have you grown.
He crouches, lies down like a lion,
Like aHeb. labi, another word for “lion.”the king of beasts-a—who dare rouse him?

hebrew: לֹֽא־יָס֥וּר שֵׁ֙בֶט֙ מִֽיהוּדָ֔ה וּמְחֹקֵ֖ק מִבֵּ֣ין רַגְלָ֑יו עַ֚ד כִּֽי־יָבֹ֣א שילה [שִׁיל֔וֹ] וְל֖וֹ יִקְּהַ֥ת עַמִּֽים׃
transliteration: lo-yasvr shevet miyhvdah vm'chokek mibeyn rag'layv 'ad kiy-yavo shylh [shiylvo] v'lvo yik'hat 'amiym
translation:
The scepter shall not depart from Judah,
Nor the ruler’s staff from between his feet;
So that tribute shall come to himbShiloh, understood as shai loh “tribute to him,” following Midrash; cf. Isa. 18.7. Meaning of Heb. uncertain; lit. “Until he comes to Shiloh.”
And the homage of peoples be his.

hebrew: אֹסְרִ֤י לַגֶּ֙פֶן֙ עירה [עִיר֔וֹ] וְלַשֹּׂרֵקָ֖ה בְּנִ֣י אֲתֹנ֑וֹ כִּבֵּ֤ס בַּיַּ֙יִן֙ לְבֻשׁ֔וֹ וּבְדַם־עֲנָבִ֖ים סותה [סוּתֽוֹ׃]
transliteration: os'riy lagefen 'yrh ['iyrvo] v'lasorekah b'niy atonvo kibes bayayin l'vushvo vv'dam-'anaviym svth [svtvo]
translation:
He tethers his ass to a vine,
His ass’s foal to a choice vine;
He washes his garment in wine,
His robe in blood of grapes.

hebrew: חַכְלִילִ֥י עֵינַ֖יִם מִיָּ֑יִן וּלְבֶן־שִׁנַּ֖יִם מֵחָלָֽב׃ (פ)
transliteration: chakh'liyliy 'eynayim miyayin vl'ven-shinayim mechalav (f)
translation:
cOr “His eyes are dark from wine,His eyes are darker than wine;
His teeth are whiter than milk.-c

hebrew: זְבוּלֻ֕ן לְח֥וֹף יַמִּ֖ים יִשְׁכֹּ֑ן וְהוּא֙ לְח֣וֹף אֳנִיּ֔וֹת וְיַרְכָת֖וֹ עַל־צִידֹֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: z'vvlun l'chvof yamiym yish'kon v'hv l'chvof oniyvot v'yar'khatvo 'al-tziydon (s)
translation:
Zebulun shall dwell by the seashore;
He shall be a haven for ships,
And his flank shall rest on Sidon.

hebrew: יִשָּׂשכָ֖ר חֲמֹ֣ר גָּ֑רֶם רֹבֵ֖ץ בֵּ֥ין הַֽמִּשְׁפְּתָֽיִם׃
transliteration: yisashkhar chamor garem rovetz beyn hamish'p'tayim
translation:
Issachar is a strong-boned ass,
Crouching among the sheepfolds.

hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא מְנֻחָה֙ כִּ֣י ט֔וֹב וְאֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ כִּ֣י נָעֵ֑מָה וַיֵּ֤ט שִׁכְמוֹ֙ לִסְבֹּ֔ל וַיְהִ֖י לְמַס־עֹבֵֽד׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayar' m'nuchah kiy tvov v'et-haaretz kiy na'emah vayet shikh'mvo lis'bol vay'hiy l'mas-'oved (s)
translation:
When he saw how good was security,
And how pleasant was the country,
He bent his shoulder to the burden,
And became a toiling serf.

hebrew: דָּ֖ן יָדִ֣ין עַמּ֑וֹ כְּאַחַ֖ד שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: dan yadiyn 'amvo k'achad shiv'tey yis'rael
translation:
Dan shall govern his people,
As one of the tribes of Israel.

hebrew: יְהִי־דָן֙ נָחָ֣שׁ עֲלֵי־דֶ֔רֶךְ שְׁפִיפֹ֖ן עֲלֵי־אֹ֑רַח הַנֹּשֵׁךְ֙ עִקְּבֵי־ס֔וּס וַיִּפֹּ֥ל רֹכְב֖וֹ אָחֽוֹר׃
transliteration: y'hiy-dan nachash 'aley-derekh' sh'fiyfon 'aley-orach hanoshekh' 'ik'vey-svs vayipol rokh'vvo achvor
translation:
Dan shall be a serpent by the road,
A viper by the path,
That bites the horse’s heels
So that his rider is thrown backward.

hebrew: לִֽישׁוּעָתְךָ֖ קִוִּ֥יתִי יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: liyshv'at'kha kiviytiy y'hvah
translation: I wait for Your deliverance, O L<small>ORD</small>!

hebrew: גָּ֖ד גְּד֣וּד יְגוּדֶ֑נּוּ וְה֖וּא יָגֻ֥ד עָקֵֽב׃ (ס)
transliteration: gad g'dvd y'gvdenv v'hv yagud 'akev (s)
translation:
Gad shall be raided by raiders,
But he shall raid at their heels.

hebrew: מֵאָשֵׁ֖ר שְׁמֵנָ֣ה לַחְמ֑וֹ וְה֥וּא יִתֵּ֖ן מַֽעֲדַנֵּי־מֶֽלֶךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: measher sh'menah lach'mvo v'hv yiten ma'adaney-melekh' (s)
translation:
Asher’s bread shall be rich,
And he shall yield royal dainties.

hebrew: נַפְתָּלִ֖י אַיָּלָ֣ה שְׁלֻחָ֑ה הַנֹּתֵ֖ן אִמְרֵי־שָֽׁפֶר׃ (ס)
transliteration: naf'taliy ayalah sh'luchah hanoten im'rey-shafer (s)
translation:
Naphtali is a hind let loose,
Which yields lovely fawns.

hebrew: בֵּ֤ן פֹּרָת֙ יוֹסֵ֔ף בֵּ֥ן פֹּרָ֖ת עֲלֵי־עָ֑יִן בָּנ֕וֹת צָעֲדָ֖ה עֲלֵי־שֽׁוּר׃
transliteration: ben porat yvosef ben porat 'aley-'ayin banvot tza'adah 'aley-shvr
translation:
dOthers “Joseph is a fruitful bough,Joseph is a wild ass,
A wild ass by a spring
—Wild colts on a hillside.-d

hebrew: וַֽיְמָרֲרֻ֖הוּ וָרֹ֑בּוּ וַֽיִּשְׂטְמֻ֖הוּ בַּעֲלֵ֥י חִצִּֽים׃
transliteration: vay'mararuhv varobv vayis't'muhv ba'aley chitziym
translation:
Archers bitterly assailed him;
They shot at him and harried him.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֤שֶׁב בְּאֵיתָן֙ קַשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַיָּפֹ֖זּוּ זְרֹעֵ֣י יָדָ֑יו מִידֵי֙ אֲבִ֣יר יַעֲקֹ֔ב מִשָּׁ֥ם רֹעֶ֖ה אֶ֥בֶן יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vateshev b'eytan kash'tvo vayafozv z'ro'ey yadayv miydey aviyr ya'akov misham ro'eh even yis'rael
translation:
Yet his bow stayed taut,
And his armseHeb. “the arms of his hands.” were made firm
By the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob—
There, the Shepherd, the Rock of Israel—

hebrew: מֵאֵ֨ל אָבִ֜יךָ וְיַעְזְרֶ֗ךָּ וְאֵ֤ת שַׁדַּי֙ וִיבָ֣רְכֶ֔ךָּ בִּרְכֹ֤ת שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ מֵעָ֔ל בִּרְכֹ֥ת תְּה֖וֹם רֹבֶ֣צֶת תָּ֑חַת בִּרְכֹ֥ת שָׁדַ֖יִם וָרָֽחַם׃
transliteration: meel aviykha v'ya'z'reka v'et shaday viyvar'kheka bir'khot shamayim me'al bir'khot t'hvom rovetzet tachat bir'khot shadayim varacham
translation:
The God of your father who helps you,
And Shaddai who blesses you
With blessings of heaven above,
Blessings of the deep that couches below,
Blessings of the breast and womb.

hebrew: בִּרְכֹ֣ת אָבִ֗יךָ גָּֽבְרוּ֙ עַל־בִּרְכֹ֣ת הוֹרַ֔י עַֽד־תַּאֲוַ֖ת גִּבְעֹ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם תִּֽהְיֶ֙ין֙ לְרֹ֣אשׁ יוֹסֵ֔ף וּלְקָדְקֹ֖ד נְזִ֥יר אֶחָֽיו׃ (פ)
transliteration: bir'khot aviykha gav'rv 'al-bir'khot hvoray 'ad-taavat giv'ot 'volam tih'yeyn l'rosh yvosef vl'kad'kod n'ziyr echayv (f)
translation:
fMeaning of Heb. uncertain.The blessings of your father
Surpass the blessings of my ancestors,
To the utmost bounds of the eternal hills.-f
May they rest on the head of Joseph,
On the brow of the elect of his brothers.

hebrew: בִּנְיָמִין֙ זְאֵ֣ב יִטְרָ֔ף בַּבֹּ֖קֶר יֹ֣אכַל עַ֑ד וְלָעֶ֖רֶב יְחַלֵּ֥ק שָׁלָֽל׃
transliteration: bin'yamiyn z'ev yit'raf baboker yokhal 'ad v'la'erev y'chalek shalal
translation:
Benjamin is a ravenous wolf;
In the morning he consumes the foe,gMeaning of Heb. uncertain; others “booty.”
And in the evening he divides the spoil.”

hebrew: כָּל־אֵ֛לֶּה שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂ֑ר וְ֠זֹאת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֨ר לָהֶ֤ם אֲבִיהֶם֙ וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אוֹתָ֔ם אִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר כְּבִרְכָת֖וֹ בֵּרַ֥ךְ אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: kal-eleh shiv'tey yis'rael sh'neym 'asar v'zot asher-diber lahem aviyhem vay'varekh' votam iysh asher k'vir'khatvo berakh' otam
translation: All these were the tribes of Israel, twelve in number, and this is what their father said to them as he bade them farewell, addressing to each a parting word appropriate to him.

hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו אוֹתָ֗ם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ אֲנִי֙ נֶאֱסָ֣ף אֶל־עַמִּ֔י קִבְר֥וּ אֹתִ֖י אֶל־אֲבֹתָ֑י אֶל־הַ֨מְּעָרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּשְׂדֵ֖ה עֶפְר֥וֹן הַֽחִתִּֽי׃
transliteration: vay'tzav votam vayomer alehem aniy neesaf el-'amiy kiv'rv otiy el-avotay el-ham'arah asher bis'deh 'ef'rvon hachitiy
translation: Then he instructed them, saying to them, “I am about to be gathered to my kin. Bury me with my fathers in the cave which is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,

hebrew: בַּמְּעָרָ֞ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר בִּשְׂדֵ֧ה הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־פְּנֵי־מַמְרֵ֖א בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן אֲשֶׁר֩ קָנָ֨ה אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה מֵאֵ֛ת עֶפְרֹ֥ן הַחִתִּ֖י לַאֲחֻזַּת־קָֽבֶר׃
transliteration: bam'arah asher bis'deh hamakh'pelah asher 'al-p'ney-mam're b'eretz k'na'an asher kanah av'raham et-hasadeh meet 'ef'ron hachitiy laachuzat-kaver
translation: the cave which is in the field of Machpelah, facing Mamre, in the land of Canaan, the field that Abraham bought from Ephron the Hittite for a burial site—

hebrew: שָׁ֣מָּה קָֽבְר֞וּ אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֗ם וְאֵת֙ שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ שָׁ֚מָּה קָבְר֣וּ אֶת־יִצְחָ֔ק וְאֵ֖ת רִבְקָ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וְשָׁ֥מָּה קָבַ֖רְתִּי אֶת־לֵאָֽה׃
transliteration: shamah kav'rv et-av'raham v'et sarah ish'tvo shamah kav'rv et-yitz'chak v'et riv'kah ish'tvo v'shamah kavar'tiy et-leah
translation: there Abraham and his wife Sarah were buried; there Isaac and his wife Rebekah were buried; and there I buried Leah—

hebrew: מִקְנֵ֧ה הַשָּׂדֶ֛ה וְהַמְּעָרָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ מֵאֵ֥ת בְּנֵי־חֵֽת׃
transliteration: mik'neh hasadeh v'ham'arah asher-bvo meet b'ney-chet
translation: the field and the cave in it, bought from the Hittites.”

hebrew: וַיְכַ֤ל יַעֲקֹב֙ לְצַוֺּ֣ת אֶת־בָּנָ֔יו וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ף רַגְלָ֖יו אֶל־הַמִּטָּ֑ה וַיִּגְוַ֖ע וַיֵּאָ֥סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
transliteration: vay'khal ya'akov l'tzavot et-banayv vayeesof rag'layv el-hamitah vayig'va' vayeasef el-'amayv
translation: When Jacob finished his instructions to his sons, he drew his feet into the bed and, breathing his last, he was gathered to his people.

hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֥ל יוֹסֵ֖ף עַל־פְּנֵ֣י אָבִ֑יו וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ עָלָ֖יו וַיִּשַּׁק־לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayipol yvosef 'al-p'ney aviyv vayev'k' 'alayv vayishak-lvo
translation: Joseph flung himself upon his father’s face and wept over him and kissed him.

hebrew: וַיְצַ֨ו יוֹסֵ֤ף אֶת־עֲבָדָיו֙ אֶת־הָרֹ֣פְאִ֔ים לַחֲנֹ֖ט אֶת־אָבִ֑יו וַיַּחַנְט֥וּ הָרֹפְאִ֖ים אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vay'tzav yvosef et-'avadayv et-harof'iym lachanot et-aviyv vayachan'tv harof'iym et-yis'rael
translation: Then Joseph ordered the physicians in his service to embalm his father, and the physicians embalmed Israel.

hebrew: וַיִּמְלְאוּ־לוֹ֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם כִּ֛י כֵּ֥ן יִמְלְא֖וּ יְמֵ֣י הַחֲנֻטִ֑ים וַיִּבְכּ֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ מִצְרַ֖יִם שִׁבְעִ֥ים יֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayim'l'v-lvo ar'ba'iym yvom kiy ken yim'l'v y'mey hachanutiym vayiv'kv otvo mitz'rayim shiv'iym yvom
translation: It required forty days, for such is the full period of embalming. The Egyptians bewailed him seventy days;

hebrew: וַיַּֽעַבְרוּ֙ יְמֵ֣י בְכִית֔וֹ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יוֹסֵ֔ף אֶל־בֵּ֥ית פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־נָ֨א מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם דַּבְּרוּ־נָ֕א בְּאָזְנֵ֥י פַרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vaya'av'rv y'mey v'khiytvo vay'daber yvosef el-beyt par'oh lemor im-na matzatiy chen b'eyneykhem dab'rv-na b'az'ney far'oh lemor
translation: and when the wailing period was over, Joseph spoke to Pharaoh’s court, saying, “Do me this favor, and lay this appeal before Pharaoh:

hebrew: אָבִ֞י הִשְׁבִּיעַ֣נִי לֵאמֹ֗ר הִנֵּ֣ה אָנֹכִי֮ מֵת֒ בְּקִבְרִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר כָּרִ֤יתִי לִי֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן שָׁ֖מָּה תִּקְבְּרֵ֑נִי וְעַתָּ֗ה אֶֽעֱלֶה־נָּ֛א וְאֶקְבְּרָ֥ה אֶת־אָבִ֖י וְאָשֽׁוּבָה׃
transliteration: aviy hish'biy'aniy lemor hineh anokhiy met b'kiv'riy asher kariytiy liy b'eretz k'na'an shamah tik'b'reniy v'atah e'eleh-na v'ek'b'rah et-aviy v'ashvvah
translation: ‘My father made me swear, saying, “I am about to die. Be sure to bury me in the grave which I made ready for myself in the land of Canaan.” Now, therefore, let me go up and bury my father; then I shall return.’”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֑ה עֲלֵ֛ה וּקְבֹ֥ר אֶת־אָבִ֖יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הִשְׁבִּיעֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh 'aleh vk'vor et-aviykha kaasher hish'biy'ekha
translation: And Pharaoh said, “Go up and bury your father, as he made you promise on oath.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל יוֹסֵ֖ף לִקְבֹּ֣ר אֶת־אָבִ֑יו וַיַּֽעֲל֨וּ אִתּ֜וֹ כָּל־עַבְדֵ֤י פַרְעֹה֙ זִקְנֵ֣י בֵית֔וֹ וְכֹ֖ל זִקְנֵ֥י אֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vaya'al yvosef lik'bor et-aviyv vaya'alv itvo kal-'av'dey far'oh zik'ney veytvo v'khol zik'ney eretz-mitz'rayim
translation: So Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the officials of Pharaoh, the senior members of his court, and all of Egypt’s dignitaries,

hebrew: וְכֹל֙ בֵּ֣ית יוֹסֵ֔ף וְאֶחָ֖יו וּבֵ֣ית אָבִ֑יו רַ֗ק טַפָּם֙ וְצֹאנָ֣ם וּבְקָרָ֔ם עָזְב֖וּ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ גֹּֽשֶׁן׃
transliteration: v'khol beyt yvosef v'echayv vveyt aviyv rak tapam v'tzonam vv'karam 'az'vv b'eretz goshen
translation: together with all of Joseph’s household, his brothers, and his father’s household; only their children, their flocks, and their herds were left in the region of Goshen.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַל עִמּ֔וֹ גַּם־רֶ֖כֶב גַּם־פָּרָשִׁ֑ים וַיְהִ֥י הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה כָּבֵ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: vaya'al 'imvo gam-rekhev gam-parashiym vay'hiy hamachaneh kaved m'od
translation: Chariots, too, and horsemen went up with him; it was a very large troop.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ עַד־גֹּ֣רֶן הָאָטָ֗ד אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וַיִּ֨סְפְּדוּ־שָׁ֔ם מִסְפֵּ֛ד גָּד֥וֹל וְכָבֵ֖ד מְאֹ֑ד וַיַּ֧עַשׂ לְאָבִ֛יו אֵ֖בֶל שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: vayavov 'ad-goren haatad asher b'ever hayar'den vayis'p'dv-sham mis'ped gadvol v'khaved m'od vaya'as l'aviyv evel shiv'at yamiym
translation: When they came to GorenaOr “the threshing floor of.” ha-Atad, which is beyond the Jordan, they held there a very great and solemn lamentation; and he observed a mourning period of seven days for his father.

hebrew: וַיַּ֡רְא יוֹשֵׁב֩ הָאָ֨רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֜י אֶת־הָאֵ֗בֶל בְּגֹ֙רֶן֙ הָֽאָטָ֔ד וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֵֽבֶל־כָּבֵ֥ד זֶ֖ה לְמִצְרָ֑יִם עַל־כֵּ֞ן קָרָ֤א שְׁמָהּ֙ אָבֵ֣ל מִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעֵ֥בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
transliteration: vayar' yvoshev haaretz hak'na'aniy et-haevel b'goren haatad vayom'rv evel-kaved zeh l'mitz'rayim 'al-ken kara sh'mah avel mitz'rayim asher b'ever hayar'den
translation: And when the Canaanite inhabitants of the land saw the mourning at Goren ha-Atad, they said, “This is a solemn mourning on the part of the Egyptians.” That is why it was named Abel-mizraim,bInterpreted as “the mourning of the Egyptians.” which is beyond the Jordan.

hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ בָנָ֖יו ל֑וֹ כֵּ֖ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽם׃
transliteration: vaya'asv vanayv lvo ken kaasher tzivam
translation: Thus his sons did for him as he had instructed them.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׂא֨וּ אֹת֤וֹ בָנָיו֙ אַ֣רְצָה כְּנַ֔עַן וַיִּקְבְּר֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ בִּמְעָרַ֖ת שְׂדֵ֣ה הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר קָנָה֩ אַבְרָהָ֨ם אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֜ה לַאֲחֻזַּת־קֶ֗בֶר מֵאֵ֛ת עֶפְרֹ֥ן הַחִתִּ֖י עַל־פְּנֵ֥י מַמְרֵֽא׃
transliteration: vayis'v otvo vanayv ar'tzah k'na'an vayik'b'rv otvo bim'arat s'deh hamakh'pelah asher kanah av'raham et-hasadeh laachuzat-kever meet 'ef'ron hachitiy 'al-p'ney mam're
translation: His sons carried him to the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, the field near Mamre, which Abraham had bought for a burial site from Ephron the Hittite.

hebrew: וַיָּ֨שָׁב יוֹסֵ֤ף מִצְרַ֙יְמָה֙ ה֣וּא וְאֶחָ֔יו וְכָל־הָעֹלִ֥ים אִתּ֖וֹ לִקְבֹּ֣ר אֶת־אָבִ֑יו אַחֲרֵ֖י קָבְר֥וֹ אֶת־אָבִֽיו׃
transliteration: vayashav yvosef mitz'ray'mah hv v'echayv v'khal-ha'oliym itvo lik'bor et-aviyv acharey kav'rvo et-aviyv
translation: After burying his father, Joseph returned to Egypt, he and his brothers and all who had gone up with him to bury his father.

hebrew: וַיִּרְא֤וּ אֲחֵֽי־יוֹסֵף֙ כִּי־מֵ֣ת אֲבִיהֶ֔ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ ל֥וּ יִשְׂטְמֵ֖נוּ יוֹסֵ֑ף וְהָשֵׁ֤ב יָשִׁיב֙ לָ֔נוּ אֵ֚ת כָּל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר גָּמַ֖לְנוּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayir'v achey-yvosef kiy-met aviyhem vayom'rv lv yis't'menv yvosef v'hashev yashiyv lanv et kal-hara'ah asher gamal'nv otvo
translation: When Joseph’s brothers saw that their father was dead, they said, “What if Joseph still bears a grudge against us and pays us back for all the wrong that we did him!”

hebrew: וַיְצַוּ֕וּ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף לֵאמֹ֑ר אָבִ֣יךָ צִוָּ֔ה לִפְנֵ֥י מוֹת֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'tzavv el-yvosef lemor aviykha tzivah lif'ney mvotvo lemor
translation: So they sent this message to Joseph, “Before his death your father left this instruction:

hebrew: כֹּֽה־תֹאמְר֣וּ לְיוֹסֵ֗ף אָ֣נָּ֡א שָׂ֣א נָ֠א פֶּ֣שַׁע אַחֶ֤יךָ וְחַטָּאתָם֙ כִּי־רָעָ֣ה גְמָל֔וּךָ וְעַתָּה֙ שָׂ֣א נָ֔א לְפֶ֥שַׁע עַבְדֵ֖י אֱלֹהֵ֣י אָבִ֑יךָ וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ יוֹסֵ֖ף בְּדַבְּרָ֥ם אֵלָֽיו׃
transliteration: koh-tom'rv l'yvosef ana sa na pesha' acheykha v'chatatam kiy-ra'ah g'malvkha v'atah sa na l'fesha' 'av'dey elohey aviykha vayev'k' yvosef b'dab'ram elayv
translation: So shall you say to Joseph, ‘Forgive, I urge you, the offense and guilt of your brothers who treated you so harshly.’ Therefore, please forgive the offense of the servants of the God of your father.” And Joseph was in tears as they spoke to him.

hebrew: וַיֵּלְכוּ֙ גַּם־אֶחָ֔יו וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ לְפָנָ֑יו וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ הִנֶּ֥נּֽוּ לְךָ֖ לַעֲבָדִֽים׃
transliteration: vayel'khv gam-echayv vayip'lv l'fanayv vayom'rv hinenv l'kha la'avadiym
translation: His brothers went to him themselves, flung themselves before him, and said, “We are prepared to be your slaves.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֛ם יוֹסֵ֖ף אַל־תִּירָ֑אוּ כִּ֛י הֲתַ֥חַת אֱלֹהִ֖ים אָֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem yvosef al-tiyrav kiy hatachat elohiym aniy
translation: But Joseph said to them, “Have no fear! Am I a substitute for God?

hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֕ם חֲשַׁבְתֶּ֥ם עָלַ֖י רָעָ֑ה אֱלֹהִים֙ חֲשָׁבָ֣הּ לְטֹבָ֔ה לְמַ֗עַן עֲשֹׂ֛ה כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה לְהַחֲיֹ֥ת עַם־רָֽב׃
transliteration: v'atem chashav'tem 'alay ra'ah elohiym chashavah l'tovah l'ma'an 'asoh kayvom hazeh l'hachayot 'am-rav
translation: Besides, although you intended me harm, God intended it for good, so as to bring about the present result—the survival of many people.

hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ אַל־תִּירָ֔אוּ אָנֹכִ֛י אֲכַלְכֵּ֥ל אֶתְכֶ֖ם וְאֶֽת־טַפְּכֶ֑ם וַיְנַחֵ֣ם אוֹתָ֔ם וַיְדַבֵּ֖ר עַל־לִבָּֽם׃
transliteration: v'atah al-tiyrav anokhiy akhal'kel et'khem v'et-tap'khem vay'nachem votam vay'daber 'al-libam
translation: And so, fear not. I will sustain you and your children.” Thus he reassured them, speaking kindly to them.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב יוֹסֵף֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם ה֖וּא וּבֵ֣ית אָבִ֑יו וַיְחִ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף מֵאָ֥ה וָעֶ֖שֶׂר שָׁנִֽים׃
transliteration: vayeshev yvosef b'mitz'rayim hv vveyt aviyv vay'chiy yvosef meah va'eser shaniym
translation: So Joseph and his father’s household remained in Egypt. Joseph lived one hundred and ten years.

hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא יוֹסֵף֙ לְאֶפְרַ֔יִם בְּנֵ֖י שִׁלֵּשִׁ֑ים גַּ֗ם בְּנֵ֤י מָכִיר֙ בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה יֻלְּד֖וּ עַל־בִּרְכֵּ֥י יוֹסֵֽף׃
transliteration: vayar' yvosef l'ef'rayim b'ney shileshiym gam b'ney makhiyr ben-m'nasheh yul'dv 'al-bir'key yvosef
translation: Joseph lived to see children of the third generation of Ephraim; the children of Machir son of Manasseh were likewise born upon Joseph’s knees.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ אֶל־אֶחָ֔יו אָנֹכִ֖י מֵ֑ת וֵֽאלֹהִ֞ים פָּקֹ֧ד יִפְקֹ֣ד אֶתְכֶ֗ם וְהֶעֱלָ֤ה אֶתְכֶם֙ מִן־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֛ע לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-echayv anokhiy met velohiym pakod yif'kod et'khem v'he'elah et'khem min-haaretz hazot el-haaretz asher nish'ba' l'av'raham l'yitz'chak vl'ya'akov
translation: At length, Joseph said to his brothers, “I am about to die. God will surely take notice of you and bring you up from this land to the land that He promised on oath to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.”

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁבַּ֣ע יוֹסֵ֔ף אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר פָּקֹ֨ד יִפְקֹ֤ד אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְהַעֲלִתֶ֥ם אֶת־עַצְמֹתַ֖י מִזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayash'ba' yvosef et-b'ney yis'rael lemor pakod yif'kod elohiym et'khem v'ha'alitem et-'atz'motay mizeh
translation: So Joseph made the sons of Israel swear, saying, “When God has taken notice of you, you shall carry up my bones from here.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֣מָת יוֹסֵ֔ף בֶּן־מֵאָ֥ה וָעֶ֖שֶׂר שָׁנִ֑ים וַיַּחַנְט֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ וַיִּ֥ישֶׂם בָּאָר֖וֹן בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayamat yvosef ben-meah va'eser shaniym vayachan'tv otvo vayiysem baarvon b'mitz'rayim
translation: Joseph died at the age of one hundred and ten years; and he was embalmed and placed in a coffin in Egypt.

hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁמוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַבָּאִ֖ים מִצְרָ֑יְמָה אֵ֣ת יַעֲקֹ֔ב אִ֥ישׁ וּבֵית֖וֹ בָּֽאוּ׃
transliteration: v'eleh sh'mvot b'ney yis'rael habaiym mitz'ray'mah et ya'akov iysh vveytvo bav
translation: These are the names of the sons of Israel who came to Egypt with Jacob, each coming with his household:

hebrew: רְאוּבֵ֣ן שִׁמְע֔וֹן לֵוִ֖י וִיהוּדָֽה׃
transliteration: r'vven shim'von leviy viyhvdah
translation: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah;

hebrew: יִשָּׂשכָ֥ר זְבוּלֻ֖ן וּבְנְיָמִֽן׃
transliteration: yisashkhar z'vvlun vv'n'yamin
translation: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin;

hebrew: דָּ֥ן וְנַפְתָּלִ֖י גָּ֥ד וְאָשֵֽׁר׃
transliteration: dan v'naf'taliy gad v'asher
translation: Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֗י כָּל־נֶ֛פֶשׁ יֹצְאֵ֥י יֶֽרֶךְ־יַעֲקֹ֖ב שִׁבְעִ֣ים נָ֑פֶשׁ וְיוֹסֵ֖ף הָיָ֥ה בְמִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kal-nefesh yotz'ey yerekh'-ya'akov shiv'iym nafesh v'yvosef hayah v'mitz'rayim
translation: The total number of persons that were of Jacob’s issue came to seventy, Joseph being already in Egypt.

hebrew: וַיָּ֤מָת יוֹסֵף֙ וְכָל־אֶחָ֔יו וְכֹ֖ל הַדּ֥וֹר הַהֽוּא׃
transliteration: vayamat yvosef v'khal-echayv v'khol hadvor hahv
translation: Joseph died, and all his brothers, and all that generation.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל פָּר֧וּ וַֽיִּשְׁרְצ֛וּ וַיִּרְבּ֥וּ וַיַּֽעַצְמ֖וּ בִּמְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד וַתִּמָּלֵ֥א הָאָ֖רֶץ אֹתָֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vv'ney yis'rael parv vayish'r'tzv vayir'bv vaya'atz'mv bim'od m'od vatimale haaretz otam (f)
translation: But the Israelites were fertile and prolific; they multiplied and increased very greatly, so that the land was filled with them.

hebrew: וַיָּ֥קָם מֶֽלֶךְ־חָדָ֖שׁ עַל־מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יָדַ֖ע אֶת־יוֹסֵֽף׃
transliteration: vayakam melekh'-chadash 'al-mitz'rayim asher lo-yada' et-yvosef
translation: A new king arose over Egypt who did not know Joseph.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֶל־עַמּ֑וֹ הִנֵּ֗ה עַ֚ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רַ֥ב וְעָצ֖וּם מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer el-'amvo hineh 'am b'ney yis'rael rav v'atzvm mimenv
translation: And he said to his people, “Look, the Israelite people are much too numerous for us.

hebrew: הָ֥בָה נִֽתְחַכְּמָ֖ה ל֑וֹ פֶּן־יִרְבֶּ֗ה וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־תִקְרֶ֤אנָה מִלְחָמָה֙ וְנוֹסַ֤ף גַּם־הוּא֙ עַל־שֹׂ֣נְאֵ֔ינוּ וְנִלְחַם־בָּ֖נוּ וְעָלָ֥ה מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: havah nit'chak'mah lvo pen-yir'beh v'hayah kiy-tik'renah mil'chamah v'nvosaf gam-hv 'al-son'eynv v'nil'cham-banv v'alah min-haaretz
translation: Let us deal shrewdly with them, so that they may not increase; otherwise in the event of war they may join our enemies in fighting against us and aMeaning perhaps from their wretched condition, cf. Hos. 2.2; or “gain ascendancy over the country.” Others “get them up out of the land.”rise from the ground.”-a

hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֤ימוּ עָלָיו֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מִסִּ֔ים לְמַ֥עַן עַנֹּת֖וֹ בְּסִבְלֹתָ֑ם וַיִּ֜בֶן עָרֵ֤י מִסְכְּנוֹת֙ לְפַרְעֹ֔ה אֶת־פִּתֹ֖ם וְאֶת־רַעַמְסֵֽס׃
transliteration: vayasiymv 'alayv sarey misiym l'ma'an 'anotvo b'siv'lotam vayiven 'arey mis'k'nvot l'far'oh et-pitom v'et-ra'am'ses
translation: So they set taskmasters over them to oppress them with forced labor; and they built garrison citiesbOthers “store cities.” for Pharaoh: Pithom and Raamses.

hebrew: וְכַאֲשֶׁר֙ יְעַנּ֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ כֵּ֥ן יִרְבֶּ֖ה וְכֵ֣ן יִפְרֹ֑ץ וַיָּקֻ֕צוּ מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'khaasher y'anv otvo ken yir'beh v'khen yif'rotz vayakutzv mip'ney b'ney yis'rael
translation: But the more they were oppressed, the more they increased and spread out, so that the [Egyptians] came to dread the Israelites.

hebrew: וַיַּעֲבִ֧דוּ מִצְרַ֛יִם אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּפָֽרֶךְ׃
transliteration: vaya'avidv mitz'rayim et-b'ney yis'rael b'farekh'
translation: The Egyptians ruthlessly imposed upon the Israelites

hebrew: וַיְמָרְר֨וּ אֶת־חַיֵּיהֶ֜ם בַּעֲבֹדָ֣ה קָשָׁ֗ה בְּחֹ֙מֶר֙ וּבִלְבֵנִ֔ים וּבְכָל־עֲבֹדָ֖ה בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה אֵ֚ת כָּל־עֲבֹ֣דָתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־עָבְד֥וּ בָהֶ֖ם בְּפָֽרֶךְ׃
transliteration: vay'mar'rv et-chayeyhem ba'avodah kashah b'chomer vvil'veniym vv'khal-'avodah basadeh et kal-'avodatam asher-'av'dv vahem b'farekh'
translation: cBrought up from the end of the verse for clarity.the various labors that they made them perform. Ruthlessly-c they made life bitter for them with harsh labor at mortar and bricks and with all sorts of tasks in the field.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם לַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֖ת הָֽעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת אֲשֶׁ֨ר שֵׁ֤ם הָֽאַחַת֙ שִׁפְרָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית פּוּעָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer melekh' mitz'rayim lam'yal'dot ha'iv'riyot asher shem haachat shif'rah v'shem hasheniyt pv'ah
translation: The king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, one of whom was named Shiphrah and the other Puah,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר בְּיַלֶּדְכֶן֙ אֶת־הָֽעִבְרִיּ֔וֹת וּרְאִיתֶ֖ן עַל־הָאָבְנָ֑יִם אִם־בֵּ֥ן הוּא֙ וַהֲמִתֶּ֣ן אֹת֔וֹ וְאִם־בַּ֥ת הִ֖יא וָחָֽיָה׃
transliteration: vayomer b'yaled'khen et-ha'iv'riyvot vr'iyten 'al-haav'nayim im-ben hv vahamiten otvo v'im-bat hiy vachayah
translation: saying, “When you deliver the Hebrew women, look at the birthstool:dMore exactly, the brick or stone supports used by Egyptian women during childbirth. if it is a boy, kill him; if it is a girl, let her live.”

hebrew: וַתִּירֶ֤אןָ הַֽמְיַלְּדֹת֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְלֹ֣א עָשׂ֔וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ן מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרָ֑יִם וַתְּחַיֶּ֖יןָ אֶת־הַיְלָדִֽים׃
transliteration: vatiyrena ham'yal'dot et-haelohiym v'lo 'asv kaasher diber aleyhen melekh' mitz'rayim vat'chayeyna et-hay'ladiym
translation: The midwives, fearing God, did not do as the king of Egypt had told them; they let the boys live.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֔ת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ן מַדּ֥וּעַ עֲשִׂיתֶ֖ן הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַתְּחַיֶּ֖יןָ אֶת־הַיְלָדִֽים׃
transliteration: vayik'ra melekh'-mitz'rayim lam'yal'dot vayomer lahen madv'a 'asiyten hadavar hazeh vat'chayeyna et-hay'ladiym
translation: So the king of Egypt summoned the midwives and said to them, “Why have you done this thing, letting the boys live?”

hebrew: וַתֹּאמַ֤רְןָ הַֽמְיַלְּדֹת֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה כִּ֣י לֹ֧א כַנָּשִׁ֛ים הַמִּצְרִיֹּ֖ת הָֽעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת כִּֽי־חָי֣וֹת הֵ֔נָּה בְּטֶ֨רֶם תָּב֧וֹא אֲלֵהֶ֛ן הַמְיַלֶּ֖דֶת וְיָלָֽדוּ׃
transliteration: vatomar'na ham'yal'dot el-par'oh kiy lo khanashiym hamitz'riyot ha'iv'riyot kiy-chayvot henah b'terem tavvo alehen ham'yaledet v'yaladv
translation: The midwives said to Pharaoh, “Because the Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women: they are vigorous. Before the midwife can come to them, they have given birth.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥יטֶב אֱלֹהִ֖ים לַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֑ת וַיִּ֧רֶב הָעָ֛ם וַיַּֽעַצְמ֖וּ מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: vayeytev elohiym lam'yal'dot vayirev ha'am vaya'atz'mv m'od
translation: And God dealt well with the midwives; and the people multiplied and increased greatly.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כִּֽי־יָֽרְא֥וּ הַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֖ת אֶת־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיַּ֥עַשׂ לָהֶ֖ם בָּתִּֽים׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kiy-yar'v ham'yal'dot et-haelohiym vaya'as lahem batiym
translation: And because the midwives feared God, He established householdseMeaning of Heb. batim uncertain. for them.

hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו פַּרְעֹ֔ה לְכָל־עַמּ֖וֹ לֵאמֹ֑ר כָּל־הַבֵּ֣ן הַיִּלּ֗וֹד הַיְאֹ֙רָה֙ תַּשְׁלִיכֻ֔הוּ וְכָל־הַבַּ֖ת תְּחַיּֽוּן׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'tzav par'oh l'khal-'amvo lemor kal-haben hayilvod hay'orah tash'liykhuhv v'khal-habat t'chayvn (s)
translation: Then Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, “Every boy that is born you shall throw into the Nile, but let every girl live.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ אִ֖ישׁ מִבֵּ֣ית לֵוִ֑י וַיִּקַּ֖ח אֶת־בַּת־לֵוִֽי׃
transliteration: vayelekh' iysh mibeyt leviy vayikach et-bat-leviy
translation: A certain man of the house of Levi went and married a Levite woman.

hebrew: וַתַּ֥הַר הָאִשָּׁ֖ה וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַתֵּ֤רֶא אֹתוֹ֙ כִּי־ט֣וֹב ה֔וּא וַֽתִּצְפְּנֵ֖הוּ שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה יְרָחִֽים׃
transliteration: vatahar haishah vateled ben vatere otvo kiy-tvov hv vatitz'p'nehv sh'loshah y'rachiym
translation: The woman conceived and bore a son; and when she saw how beautiful he was, she hid him for three months.

hebrew: וְלֹא־יָכְלָ֣ה עוֹד֮ הַצְּפִינוֹ֒ וַתִּֽקַּֽח־לוֹ֙ תֵּ֣בַת גֹּ֔מֶא וַתַּחְמְרָ֥ה בַחֵמָ֖ר וּבַזָּ֑פֶת וַתָּ֤שֶׂם בָּהּ֙ אֶת־הַיֶּ֔לֶד וַתָּ֥שֶׂם בַּסּ֖וּף עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיְאֹֽר׃
transliteration: v'lo-yakh'lah 'vod hatz'fiynvo vatikach-lvo tevat gome vatach'm'rah vachemar vvazafet vatasem bah et-hayeled vatasem basvf 'al-s'fat hay'or
translation: When she could hide him no longer, she got a wicker basket for him and caulked it with bitumen and pitch. She put the child into it and placed it among the reeds by the bank of the Nile.

hebrew: וַתֵּתַצַּ֥ב אֲחֹת֖וֹ מֵרָחֹ֑ק לְדֵעָ֕ה מַה־יֵּעָשֶׂ֖ה לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vatetatzav achotvo merachok l'de'ah mah-ye'aseh lvo
translation: And his sister stationed herself at a distance, to learn what would befall him.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֤רֶד בַּת־פַּרְעֹה֙ לִרְחֹ֣ץ עַל־הַיְאֹ֔ר וְנַעֲרֹתֶ֥יהָ הֹלְכֹ֖ת עַל־יַ֣ד הַיְאֹ֑ר וַתֵּ֤רֶא אֶת־הַתֵּבָה֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַסּ֔וּף וַתִּשְׁלַ֥ח אֶת־אֲמָתָ֖הּ וַתִּקָּחֶֽהָ
transliteration: vatered bat-par'oh lir'chotz 'al-hay'or v'na'aroteyha hol'khot 'al-yad hay'or vatere et-hatevah b'tvokh' hasvf vatish'lach et-amatah vatikacheha
translation: The daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe in the Nile, while her maidens walked along the Nile. She spied the basket among the reeds and sent her slave girl to fetch it.

hebrew: וַתִּפְתַּח֙ וַתִּרְאֵ֣הוּ אֶת־הַיֶּ֔לֶד וְהִנֵּה־נַ֖עַר בֹּכֶ֑ה וַתַּחְמֹ֣ל עָלָ֔יו וַתֹּ֕אמֶר מִיַּלְדֵ֥י הָֽעִבְרִ֖ים זֶֽה׃
transliteration: vatif'tach vatir'ehv et-hayeled v'hineh-na'ar bokheh vatach'mol 'alayv vatomer miyal'dey ha'iv'riym zeh
translation: When she opened it, she saw that it was a child, a boy crying. She took pity on it and said, “This must be a Hebrew child.”

hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֲחֹתוֹ֮ אֶל־בַּת־פַּרְעֹה֒ הַאֵלֵ֗ךְ וְקָרָ֤אתִי לָךְ֙ אִשָּׁ֣ה מֵינֶ֔קֶת מִ֖ן הָעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת וְתֵינִ֥ק לָ֖ךְ אֶת־הַיָּֽלֶד׃
transliteration: vatomer achotvo el-bat-par'oh haelekh' v'karatiy lakh' ishah meyneket min ha'iv'riyot v'teynik lakh' et-hayaled
translation: Then his sister said to Pharaoh’s daughter, “Shall I go and get you a Hebrew nurse to suckle the child for you?”

hebrew: וַתֹּֽאמֶר־לָ֥הּ בַּת־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵ֑כִי וַתֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ הָֽעַלְמָ֔ה וַתִּקְרָ֖א אֶת־אֵ֥ם הַיָּֽלֶד׃
transliteration: vatomer-lah bat-par'oh lekhiy vatelekh' ha'al'mah vatik'ra et-em hayaled
translation: And Pharaoh’s daughter answered, “Yes.” So the girl went and called the child’s mother.

hebrew: וַתֹּ֧אמֶר לָ֣הּ בַּת־פַּרְעֹ֗ה הֵילִ֜יכִי אֶת־הַיֶּ֤לֶד הַזֶּה֙ וְהֵינִקִ֣הוּ לִ֔י וַאֲנִ֖י אֶתֵּ֣ן אֶת־שְׂכָרֵ֑ךְ וַתִּקַּ֧ח הָאִשָּׁ֛ה הַיֶּ֖לֶד וַתְּנִיקֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: vatomer lah bat-par'oh heyliykhiy et-hayeled hazeh v'heynikihv liy vaaniy eten et-s'kharekh' vatikach haishah hayeled vat'niykehv
translation: And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Take this child and nurse it for me, and I will pay your wages.” So the woman took the child and nursed it.

hebrew: וַיִגְדַּ֣ל הַיֶּ֗לֶד וַתְּבִאֵ֙הוּ֙ לְבַת־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וַֽיְהִי־לָ֖הּ לְבֵ֑ן וַתִּקְרָ֤א שְׁמוֹ֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַתֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֥י מִן־הַמַּ֖יִם מְשִׁיתִֽהוּ׃
transliteration: vayig'dal hayeled vat'viehv l'vat-par'oh vay'hiy-lah l'ven vatik'ra sh'mvo mosheh vatomer kiy min-hamayim m'shiytihv
translation: When the child grew up, she brought him to Pharaoh’s daughter, who made him her son. She named him Moses,aHeb. Mosheh from Egyptian for “born of”; here associated with mashah “draw out.” explaining, “I drew him out of the water.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֗ם וַיִּגְדַּ֤ל מֹשֶׁה֙ וַיֵּצֵ֣א אֶל־אֶחָ֔יו וַיַּ֖רְא בְּסִבְלֹתָ֑ם וַיַּרְא֙ אִ֣ישׁ מִצְרִ֔י מַכֶּ֥ה אִישׁ־עִבְרִ֖י מֵאֶחָֽיו׃
transliteration: vay'hiy  bayamiym hahem vayig'dal mosheh vayetze el-echayv vayar' b'siv'lotam vayar' iysh mitz'riy makeh iysh-'iv'riy meechayv
translation: Some time after that, when Moses had grown up, he went out to his kinsfolk and witnessed their labors. He saw an Egyptian beating a Hebrew, one of his kinsmen.

hebrew: וַיִּ֤פֶן כֹּה֙ וָכֹ֔ה וַיַּ֖רְא כִּ֣י אֵ֣ין אִ֑ישׁ וַיַּךְ֙ אֶת־הַמִּצְרִ֔י וַֽיִּטְמְנֵ֖הוּ בַּחֽוֹל׃
transliteration: vayifen koh vakhoh vayar' kiy eyn iysh vayakh' et-hamitz'riy vayit'm'nehv bachvol
translation: He turned this way and that and, seeing no one about, he struck down the Egyptian and hid him in the sand.

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשֵּׁנִ֔י וְהִנֵּ֛ה שְׁנֵֽי־אֲנָשִׁ֥ים עִבְרִ֖ים נִצִּ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לָֽרָשָׁ֔ע לָ֥מָּה תַכֶּ֖ה רֵעֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayetze bayvom hasheniy v'hineh sh'ney-anashiym 'iv'riym nitziym vayomer larasha' lamah takeh re'ekha
translation: When he went out the next day, he found two Hebrews fighting; so he said to the offender, “Why do you strike your fellow?”

hebrew: וַ֠יֹּאמֶר מִ֣י שָֽׂמְךָ֞ לְאִ֨ישׁ שַׂ֤ר וְשֹׁפֵט֙ עָלֵ֔ינוּ הַלְהָרְגֵ֙נִי֙ אַתָּ֣ה אֹמֵ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָרַ֖גְתָּ אֶת־הַמִּצְרִ֑י וַיִּירָ֤א מֹשֶׁה֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר אָכֵ֖ן נוֹדַ֥ע הַדָּבָֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer miy sam'kha l'iysh sar v'shofet 'aleynv hal'har'geniy atah omer kaasher harag'ta et-hamitz'riy vayiyra mosheh vayomar akhen nvoda' hadavar
translation: He retorted, “Who made you chief and ruler over us? Do you mean to kill me as you killed the Egyptian?” Moses was frightened, and thought: Then the matter is known!

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה וַיְבַקֵּ֖שׁ לַהֲרֹ֣ג אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיִּבְרַ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב בְּאֶֽרֶץ־מִדְיָ֖ן וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב עַֽל־הַבְּאֵֽר׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' par'oh et-hadavar hazeh vay'vakesh laharog et-mosheh vayiv'rach mosheh mip'ney far'oh vayeshev b'eretz-mid'yan vayeshev 'al-hab'er
translation: When Pharaoh learned of the matter, he sought to kill Moses; but Moses fled from Pharaoh. He arrivedbLit. “sat” or “settled.” in the land of Midian, and sat down beside a well.

hebrew: וּלְכֹהֵ֥ן מִדְיָ֖ן שֶׁ֣בַע בָּנ֑וֹת וַתָּבֹ֣אנָה וַתִּדְלֶ֗נָה וַתְּמַלֶּ֙אנָה֙ אֶת־הָ֣רְהָטִ֔ים לְהַשְׁק֖וֹת צֹ֥אן אֲבִיהֶֽן׃
transliteration: vl'khohen mid'yan sheva' banvot vatavonah vatid'lenah vat'malenah et-har'hatiym l'hash'kvot tzon aviyhen
translation: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters. They came to draw water, and filled the troughs to water their father’s flock;

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ הָרֹעִ֖ים וַיְגָרְשׁ֑וּם וַיָּ֤קָם מֹשֶׁה֙ וַיּ֣וֹשִׁעָ֔ן וַיַּ֖שְׁקְ אֶת־צֹאנָֽם׃
transliteration: vayavov haro'iym vay'gar'shvm vayakam mosheh vayvoshi'an vayash'k' et-tzonam
translation: but shepherds came and drove them off. Moses rose to their defense, and he watered their flock.

hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֕אנָה אֶל־רְעוּאֵ֖ל אֲבִיהֶ֑ן וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מַדּ֛וּעַ מִהַרְתֶּ֥ן בֹּ֖א הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vatavonah el-r'vel aviyhen vayomer madv'a mihar'ten bo hayvom
translation: When they returned to their father Reuel, he said, “How is it that you have come back so soon today?”

hebrew: וַתֹּאמַ֕רְןָ אִ֣ישׁ מִצְרִ֔י הִצִּילָ֖נוּ מִיַּ֣ד הָרֹעִ֑ים וְגַם־דָּלֹ֤ה דָלָה֙ לָ֔נוּ וַיַּ֖שְׁקְ אֶת־הַצֹּֽאן׃
transliteration: vatomar'na iysh mitz'riy hitziylanv miyad haro'iym v'gam-daloh dalah lanv vayash'k' et-hatzon
translation: They answered, “An Egyptian rescued us from the shepherds; he even drew water for us and watered the flock.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֶל־בְּנֹתָ֖יו וְאַיּ֑וֹ לָ֤מָּה זֶּה֙ עֲזַבְתֶּ֣ן אֶת־הָאִ֔ישׁ קִרְאֶ֥ן ל֖וֹ וְיֹ֥אכַל לָֽחֶם׃
transliteration: vayomer el-b'notayv v'ayvo lamah zeh 'azav'ten et-haiysh kir'en lvo v'yokhal lachem
translation: He said to his daughters, “Where is he then? Why did you leave the man? Ask him in to break bread.”

hebrew: וַיּ֥וֹאֶל מֹשֶׁ֖ה לָשֶׁ֣בֶת אֶת־הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיִּתֵּ֛ן אֶת־צִפֹּרָ֥ה בִתּ֖וֹ לְמֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayvoel mosheh lashevet et-haiysh vayiten et-tziporah vitvo l'mosheh
translation: Moses consented to stay with the man, and he gave Moses his daughter Zipporah as wife.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֔ן וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ גֵּרְשֹׁ֑ם כִּ֣י אָמַ֔ר גֵּ֣ר הָיִ֔יתִי בְּאֶ֖רֶץ נָכְרִיָּֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vateled ben vayik'ra et-sh'mvo ger'shom kiy amar ger hayiytiy b'eretz nakh'riyah (f)
translation: She bore a son whom he named Gershom,cAssociated with ger sham, “a stranger there.” for he said, “I have been a stranger in a foreign land.”

hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ בַיָּמִ֨ים הָֽרַבִּ֜ים הָהֵ֗ם וַיָּ֙מָת֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיֵּאָנְח֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מִן־הָעֲבֹדָ֖ה וַיִּזְעָ֑קוּ וַתַּ֧עַל שַׁוְעָתָ֛ם אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים מִן־הָעֲבֹדָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy vayamiym harabiym hahem vayamat melekh' mitz'rayim vayean'chv v'ney-yis'rael min-ha'avodah vayiz'akv vata'al shav'atam el-haelohiym min-ha'avodah
translation: A long time after that, the king of Egypt died. The Israelites were groaning under the bondage and cried out; and their cry for help from the bondage rose up to God.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־נַאֲקָתָ֑ם וַיִּזְכֹּ֤ר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־בְּרִית֔וֹ אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶת־יִצְחָ֥ק וְאֶֽת־יַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' elohiym et-naakatam vayiz'kor elohiym et-b'riytvo et-av'raham et-yitz'chak v'et-ya'akov
translation: God heard their moaning, and God remembered His covenant with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֵּ֖דַע אֱלֹהִֽים׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayar' elohiym et-b'ney yis'rael vayeda' elohiym (s)
translation: God looked upon the Israelites, and God took notice of them.

hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁ֗ה הָיָ֥ה רֹעֶ֛ה אֶת־צֹ֛אן יִתְר֥וֹ חֹתְנ֖וֹ כֹּהֵ֣ן מִדְיָ֑ן וַיִּנְהַ֤ג אֶת־הַצֹּאן֙ אַחַ֣ר הַמִּדְבָּ֔ר וַיָּבֹ֛א אֶל־הַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים חֹרֵֽבָה׃
transliteration: vmosheh hayah ro'eh et-tzon yit'rvo chot'nvo kohen mid'yan vayin'hag et-hatzon achar hamid'bar vayavo el-har haelohiym chorevah
translation: Now Moses, tending the flock of his father-in-law Jethro, the priest of Midian, drove the flock into the wilderness, and came to Horeb, the mountain of God.

hebrew: וַ֠יֵּרָא מַלְאַ֨ךְ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֵלָ֛יו בְּלַבַּת־אֵ֖שׁ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַסְּנֶ֑ה וַיַּ֗רְא וְהִנֵּ֤ה הַסְּנֶה֙ בֹּעֵ֣ר בָּאֵ֔שׁ וְהַסְּנֶ֖ה אֵינֶ֥נּוּ אֻכָּֽל׃
transliteration: vayera mal'akh' y'hovah elayv b'labat-esh mitvokh' has'neh vayar' v'hineh has'neh bo'er baesh v'has'neh eynenv ukal
translation: An angel of the L<small>ORD</small> appeared to him in a blazing fire out of a bush. He gazed, and there was a bush all aflame, yet the bush was not consumed.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אָסֻֽרָה־נָּ֣א וְאֶרְאֶ֔ה אֶת־הַמַּרְאֶ֥ה הַגָּדֹ֖ל הַזֶּ֑ה מַדּ֖וּעַ לֹא־יִבְעַ֥ר הַסְּנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh asurah-na v'er'eh et-hamar'eh hagadol hazeh madv'a lo-yiv'ar has'neh
translation: Moses said, “I must turn aside to look at this marvelous sight; why doesn’t the bush burn up?”

hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא יְהוָ֖ה כִּ֣י סָ֣ר לִרְא֑וֹת וַיִּקְרָא֩ אֵלָ֨יו אֱלֹהִ֜ים מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַסְּנֶ֗ה וַיֹּ֛אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֥ה מֹשֶׁ֖ה וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayar' y'hvah kiy sar lir'vot vayik'ra elayv elohiym mitvokh' has'neh vayomer mosheh mosheh vayomer hineniy
translation: When the L<small>ORD</small> saw that he had turned aside to look, God called to him out of the bush: “Moses! Moses!” He answered, “Here I am.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אַל־תִּקְרַ֣ב הֲלֹ֑ם שַׁל־נְעָלֶ֙יךָ֙ מֵעַ֣ל רַגְלֶ֔יךָ כִּ֣י הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ עוֹמֵ֣ד עָלָ֔יו אַדְמַת־קֹ֖דֶשׁ הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vayomer al-tik'rav halom shal-n'aleykha me'al rag'leykha kiy hamakvom asher atah 'vomed 'alayv ad'mat-kodesh hv
translation: And He said, “Do not come closer. Remove your sandals from your feet, for the place on which you stand is holy ground.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אָנֹכִי֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י אָבִ֔יךָ אֱלֹהֵ֧י אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִצְחָ֖ק וֵאלֹהֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֑ב וַיַּסְתֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ פָּנָ֔יו כִּ֣י יָרֵ֔א מֵהַבִּ֖יט אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: vayomer anokhiy elohey aviykha elohey av'raham elohey yitz'chak velohey ya'akov vayas'ter mosheh panayv kiy yare mehabiyt el-haelohiym
translation: I am,” He said, “the God of your father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.” And Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look at God.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָ֔ה רָאֹ֥ה רָאִ֛יתִי אֶת־עֳנִ֥י עַמִּ֖י אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וְאֶת־צַעֲקָתָ֤ם שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י נֹֽגְשָׂ֔יו כִּ֥י יָדַ֖עְתִּי אֶת־מַכְאֹבָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah raoh raiytiy et-'oniy 'amiy asher b'mitz'rayim v'et-tza'akatam shama'tiy mip'ney nog'sayv kiy yada'tiy et-makh'ovayv
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> continued, “I have marked well the plight of My people in Egypt and have heeded their outcry because of their taskmasters; yes, I am mindful of their sufferings.

hebrew: וָאֵרֵ֞ד לְהַצִּיל֣וֹ ׀ מִיַּ֣ד מִצְרַ֗יִם וּֽלְהַעֲלֹתוֹ֮ מִן־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַהִוא֒ אֶל־אֶ֤רֶץ טוֹבָה֙ וּרְחָבָ֔ה אֶל־אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָ֑שׁ אֶל־מְק֤וֹם הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ וְהַ֣חִתִּ֔י וְהָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י וְהַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃
transliteration: vaered l'hatziylvo  miyad mitz'rayim vl'ha'alotvo min-haaretz hahiv el-eretz tvovah vr'chavah el-eretz zavat chalav vd'vash el-m'kvom hak'na'aniy v'hachitiy v'haemoriy v'hap'riziy v'hachiviy v'hay'vvsiy
translation: I have come down to rescue them from the Egyptians and to bring them out of that land to a good and spacious land, a land flowing with milk and honey, the region of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה הִנֵּ֛ה צַעֲקַ֥ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בָּ֣אָה אֵלָ֑י וְגַם־רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הַלַּ֔חַץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִצְרַ֖יִם לֹחֲצִ֥ים אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'atah hineh tza'akat b'ney-yis'rael baah elay v'gam-raiytiy et-halachatz asher mitz'rayim lochatziym otam
translation: Now the cry of the Israelites has reached Me; moreover, I have seen how the Egyptians oppress them.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה לְכָ֔ה וְאֶֽשְׁלָחֲךָ֖ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְהוֹצֵ֛א אֶת־עַמִּ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'atah l'khah v'esh'lachakha el-par'oh v'hvotze et-'amiy v'ney-yis'rael mimitz'rayim
translation: Come, therefore, I will send you to Pharaoh, and you shall free My people, the Israelites, from Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים מִ֣י אָנֹ֔כִי כִּ֥י אֵלֵ֖ךְ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְכִ֥י אוֹצִ֛יא אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-haelohiym miy anokhiy kiy elekh' el-par'oh v'khiy votziy et-b'ney yis'rael mimitz'rayim
translation: But Moses said to God, “Who am I that I should go to Pharaoh and free the Israelites from Egypt?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ כִּֽי־אֶֽהְיֶ֣ה עִמָּ֔ךְ וְזֶה־לְּךָ֣ הָא֔וֹת כִּ֥י אָנֹכִ֖י שְׁלַחְתִּ֑יךָ בְּהוֹצִֽיאֲךָ֤ אֶת־הָעָם֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם תַּֽעַבְדוּן֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים עַ֖ל הָהָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer kiy-eh'yeh 'imakh' v'zeh-l'kha havot kiy anokhiy sh'lach'tiykha b'hvotziyakha et-ha'am mimitz'rayim ta'av'dvn et-haelohiym 'al hahar hazeh
translation: And He said, “I will be with you; that shall be your sign that it was I who sent you. And when you have freed the people from Egypt, you shall worship God at this mountain.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֗ים הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֣י בָא֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וְאָמַרְתִּ֣י לָהֶ֔ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם שְׁלָחַ֣נִי אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וְאָֽמְרוּ־לִ֣י מַה־שְּׁמ֔וֹ מָ֥ה אֹמַ֖ר אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-haelohiym hineh anokhiy va el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'tiy lahem elohey avvoteykhem sh'lachaniy aleykhem v'am'rv-liy mah-sh'mvo mah omar alehem
translation: Moses said to God, “When I come to the Israelites and say to them, ‘The God of your fathers has sent me to you,’ and they ask me, ‘What is His name?’ what shall I say to them?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶֽהְיֶ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶֽהְיֶ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כֹּ֤ה תֹאמַר֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶֽהְיֶ֖ה שְׁלָחַ֥נִי אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym el-mosheh eh'yeh asher eh'yeh vayomer koh tomar liv'ney yis'rael eh'yeh sh'lachaniy aleykhem
translation: And God said to Moses, “Ehyeh-Asher-Ehyeh.”aMeaning of Heb. uncertain; variously translated: “I Am That I Am”; “I Am Who I Am”; “I Will Be What I Will Be”; etc. He continued, “Thus shall you say to the Israelites, ‘EhyehbOthers “I Am” or “I Will Be.” sent me to you.’”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֩ ע֨וֹד אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כֹּֽה־תֹאמַר֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ יְהוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֗ם אֱלֹהֵ֨י אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִצְחָ֛ק וֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹ֖ב שְׁלָחַ֣נִי אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם זֶה־שְּׁמִ֣י לְעֹלָ֔ם וְזֶ֥ה זִכְרִ֖י לְדֹ֥ר דֹּֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer 'vod elohiym el-mosheh koh-tomar el-b'ney yis'rael y'hvah elohey avoteykhem elohey av'raham elohey yitz'chak velohey ya'akov sh'lachaniy aleykhem zeh-sh'miy l'olam v'zeh zikh'riy l'dor dor
translation:
And God said further to Moses, “Thus shall you speak to the Israelites: The LORD,cThe name YHWH (traditionally read Adonai “the Lord”) is here associated with the root hayah “to be.” the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has sent me to you:
This shall be My name forever,
This My appellation for all eternity.

hebrew: לֵ֣ךְ וְאָֽסַפְתָּ֞ אֶת־זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֤ אֲלֵהֶם֙ יְהוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י אֲבֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ נִרְאָ֣ה אֵלַ֔י אֱלֹהֵ֧י אַבְרָהָ֛ם יִצְחָ֥ק וְיַעֲקֹ֖ב לֵאמֹ֑ר פָּקֹ֤ד פָּקַ֙דְתִּי֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְאֶת־הֶעָשׂ֥וּי לָכֶ֖ם בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: lekh' v'asaf'ta et-zik'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem y'hvah elohey avoteykhem nir'ah elay elohey av'raham yitz'chak v'ya'akov lemor pakod pakad'tiy et'khem v'et-he'asvy lakhem b'mitz'rayim
translation: “Go and assemble the elders of Israel and say to them: the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, has appeared to me and said, ‘I have taken note of you and of what is being done to you in Egypt,

hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר אַעֲלֶ֣ה אֶתְכֶם֮ מֵעֳנִ֣י מִצְרַיִם֒ אֶל־אֶ֤רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ וְהַ֣חִתִּ֔י וְהָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י וְהַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִ֑י אֶל־אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
transliteration: vaomar a'aleh et'khem me'oniy mitz'rayim el-eretz hak'na'aniy v'hachitiy v'haemoriy v'hap'riziy v'hachiviy v'hay'vvsiy el-eretz zavat chalav vd'vash
translation: and I have declared: I will take you out of the misery of Egypt to the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, to a land flowing with milk and honey.’

hebrew: וְשָׁמְע֖וּ לְקֹלֶ֑ךָ וּבָאתָ֡ אַתָּה֩ וְזִקְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֗יִם וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֤ם אֵלָיו֙ יְהוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י הָֽעִבְרִיִּים֙ נִקְרָ֣ה עָלֵ֔ינוּ וְעַתָּ֗ה נֵֽלֲכָה־נָּ֞א דֶּ֣רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר וְנִזְבְּחָ֖ה לַֽיהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: v'sham'v l'kolekha vvata atah v'zik'ney yis'rael el-melekh' mitz'rayim vaamar'tem elayv y'hvah elohey ha'iv'riyiym nik'rah 'aleynv v'atah nelakhah-na derekh' sh'loshet yamiym bamid'bar v'niz'b'chah layhvah eloheynv
translation: They will listen to you; then you shall go with the elders of Israel to the king of Egypt and you shall say to him, ‘The L<small>ORD</small>, the God of the Hebrews, manifested Himself to us. Now therefore, let us go a distance of three days into the wilderness to sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small> our God.’

hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֠י לֹֽא־יִתֵּ֥ן אֶתְכֶ֛ם מֶ֥לֶךְ מִצְרַ֖יִם לַהֲלֹ֑ךְ וְלֹ֖א בְּיָ֥ד חֲזָקָֽה׃
transliteration: vaaniy yada'tiy kiy lo-yiten et'khem melekh' mitz'rayim lahalokh' v'lo b'yad chazakah
translation: Yet I know that the king of Egypt will let you go only because of a greater might.

hebrew: וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֤י אֶת־יָדִי֙ וְהִכֵּיתִ֣י אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּכֹל֙ נִפְלְאֹתַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֖ה בְּקִרְבּ֑וֹ וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֖ן יְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'shalach'tiy et-yadiy v'hikeytiy et-mitz'rayim b'khol nif'l'otay asher e'eseh b'kir'bvo v'acharey-khen y'shalach et'khem
translation: So I will stretch out My hand and smite Egypt with various wonders which I will work upon them; after that he shall let you go.

hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֛י אֶת־חֵ֥ן הָֽעָם־הַזֶּ֖ה בְּעֵינֵ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהָיָה֙ כִּ֣י תֵֽלֵכ֔וּן לֹ֥א תֵלְכ֖וּ רֵיקָֽם׃
transliteration: v'natatiy et-chen ha'am-hazeh b'eyney mitz'rayim v'hayah kiy telekhvn lo tel'khv reykam
translation: And I will dispose the Egyptians favorably toward this people, so that when you go, you will not go away empty-handed.

hebrew: וְשָׁאֲלָ֨ה אִשָּׁ֤ה מִשְּׁכֶנְתָּהּ֙ וּמִגָּרַ֣ת בֵּיתָ֔הּ כְּלֵי־כֶ֛סֶף וּכְלֵ֥י זָהָ֖ב וּשְׂמָלֹ֑ת וְשַׂמְתֶּ֗ם עַל־בְּנֵיכֶם֙ וְעַל־בְּנֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְנִצַּלְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'shaalah ishah mish'khen'tah vmigarat beytah k'ley-khesef vkh'ley zahav vs'malot v'sam'tem 'al-b'neykhem v'al-b'noteykhem v'nitzal'tem et-mitz'rayim
translation: Each woman shall borrow from her neighbor and the lodger in her house objects of silver and gold, and clothing, and you shall put these on your sons and daughters, thus stripping the Egyptians.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַן מֹשֶׁה֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר וְהֵן֙ לֹֽא־יַאֲמִ֣ינוּ לִ֔י וְלֹ֥א יִשְׁמְע֖וּ בְּקֹלִ֑י כִּ֣י יֹֽאמְר֔וּ לֹֽא־נִרְאָ֥ה אֵלֶ֖יךָ יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'an mosheh vayomer v'hen lo-yaamiynv liy v'lo yish'm'v b'koliy kiy yom'rv lo-nir'ah eleykha y'hvah
translation: But Moses spoke up and said, “What if they do not believe me and do not listen to me, but say: The L<small>ORD</small> did not appear to you?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אֵלָ֛יו יְהוָ֖ה מזה [מַה־] [זֶּ֣ה] בְיָדֶ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מַטֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv y'hvah mzh [mah-] [zeh] v'yadekha vayomer mateh
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to him, “What is that in your hand?” And he replied, “A rod.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַשְׁלִיכֵ֣הוּ אַ֔רְצָה וַיַּשְׁלִיכֵ֥הוּ אַ֖רְצָה וַיְהִ֣י לְנָחָ֑שׁ וַיָּ֥נָס מֹשֶׁ֖ה מִפָּנָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayomer hash'liykhehv ar'tzah vayash'liykhehv ar'tzah vay'hiy l'nachash vayanas mosheh mipanayv
translation: He said, “Cast it on the ground.” He cast it on the ground and it became a snake; and Moses recoiled from it.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה שְׁלַח֙ יָֽדְךָ֔ וֶאֱחֹ֖ז בִּזְנָב֑וֹ וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יָדוֹ֙ וַיַּ֣חֲזֶק בּ֔וֹ וַיְהִ֥י לְמַטֶּ֖ה בְּכַפּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh sh'lach yad'kha veechoz biz'navvo vayish'lach yadvo vayachazek bvo vay'hiy l'mateh b'khapvo
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Put out your hand and grasp it by the tail”—he put out his hand and seized it, and it became a rod in his hand—

hebrew: לְמַ֣עַן יַאֲמִ֔ינוּ כִּֽי־נִרְאָ֥ה אֵלֶ֛יךָ יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתָ֑ם אֱלֹהֵ֧י אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִצְחָ֖ק וֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: l'ma'an yaamiynv kiy-nir'ah eleykha y'hvah elohey avotam elohey av'raham elohey yitz'chak velohey ya'akov
translation: “that they may believe that the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, did appear to you.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֩ יְהוָ֨ה ל֜וֹ ע֗וֹד הָֽבֵא־נָ֤א יָֽדְךָ֙ בְּחֵיקֶ֔ךָ וַיָּבֵ֥א יָד֖וֹ בְּחֵיק֑וֹ וַיּ֣וֹצִאָ֔הּ וְהִנֵּ֥ה יָד֖וֹ מְצֹרַ֥עַת כַּשָּֽׁלֶג׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah lvo 'vod have-na yad'kha b'cheykekha vayave yadvo b'cheykvo vayvotziah v'hineh yadvo m'tzora'at kashaleg
translation: The LORD said to him further, “Put your hand into your bosom.” He put his hand into his bosom; and when he took it out, his hand was encrusted with snowy scales!aCf. Lev. 13.2–3.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הָשֵׁ֤ב יָֽדְךָ֙ אֶל־חֵיקֶ֔ךָ וַיָּ֥שֶׁב יָד֖וֹ אֶל־חֵיק֑וֹ וַיּֽוֹצִאָהּ֙ מֵֽחֵיק֔וֹ וְהִנֵּה־שָׁ֖בָה כִּבְשָׂרֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer hashev yad'kha el-cheykekha vayashev yadvo el-cheykvo vayvotziah mecheykvo v'hineh-shavah kiv'sarvo
translation: And He said, “Put your hand back into your bosom.”—He put his hand back into his bosom; and when he took it out of his bosom, there it was again like the rest of his body.—

hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ אִם־לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֣ינוּ לָ֔ךְ וְלֹ֣א יִשְׁמְע֔וּ לְקֹ֖ל הָאֹ֣ת הָרִאשׁ֑וֹן וְהֶֽאֱמִ֔ינוּ לְקֹ֖ל הָאֹ֥ת הָאַחֲרֽוֹן׃
transliteration: v'hayah im-lo yaamiynv lakh' v'lo yish'm'v l'kol haot harishvon v'heemiynv l'kol haot haacharvon
translation: “And if they do not believe you or pay heed to the first sign, they will believe the second.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֡ה אִם־לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֡ינוּ גַּם֩ לִשְׁנֵ֨י הָאֹת֜וֹת הָאֵ֗לֶּה וְלֹ֤א יִשְׁמְעוּן֙ לְקֹלֶ֔ךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֙ מִמֵּימֵ֣י הַיְאֹ֔ר וְשָׁפַכְתָּ֖ הַיַּבָּשָׁ֑ה וְהָי֤וּ הַמַּ֙יִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּקַּ֣ח מִן־הַיְאֹ֔ר וְהָי֥וּ לְדָ֖ם בַּיַּבָּֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: v'hayah im-lo yaamiynv gam lish'ney haotvot haeleh v'lo yish'm'vn l'kolekha v'lakach'ta mimeymey hay'or v'shafakh'ta hayabashah v'hayv hamayim asher tikach min-hay'or v'hayv l'dam bayabashet
translation: And if they are not convinced by both these signs and still do not heed you, take some water from the Nile and pour it on the dry ground, and it—the water that you take from the Nile—will turn to blood on the dry ground.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶל־יְהוָה֮ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנָי֒ לֹא֩ אִ֨ישׁ דְּבָרִ֜ים אָנֹ֗כִי גַּ֤ם מִתְּמוֹל֙ גַּ֣ם מִשִּׁלְשֹׁ֔ם גַּ֛ם מֵאָ֥ז דַּבֶּרְךָ אֶל־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֧י כְבַד־פֶּ֛ה וּכְבַ֥ד לָשׁ֖וֹן אָנֹֽכִי׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-y'hvah biy adonay lo iysh d'variym anokhiy gam mit'mvol gam mishil'shom gam meaz daber'kha el-'av'dekha kiy kh'vad-peh vkh'vad lashvon anokhiy
translation: But Moses said to the L<small>ORD</small>, “Please, O Lord, I have never been a man of words, either in times past or now that You have spoken to Your servant; I am slow of speech and slow of tongue.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֵלָ֗יו מִ֣י שָׂ֣ם פֶּה֮ לָֽאָדָם֒ א֚וֹ מִֽי־יָשׂ֣וּם אִלֵּ֔ם א֣וֹ חֵרֵ֔שׁ א֥וֹ פִקֵּ֖חַ א֣וֹ עִוֵּ֑ר הֲלֹ֥א אָנֹכִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elayv miy sam peh laadam vo miy-yasvm ilem vo cheresh vo fikecha vo 'iver halo anokhiy y'hvah
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to him, “Who gives man speech? Who makes him dumb or deaf, seeing or blind? Is it not I, the L<small>ORD</small>?

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה לֵ֑ךְ וְאָנֹכִי֙ אֶֽהְיֶ֣ה עִם־פִּ֔יךָ וְהוֹרֵיתִ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּדַבֵּֽר׃
transliteration: v'atah lekh' v'anokhiy eh'yeh 'im-piykha v'hvoreytiykha asher t'daber
translation: Now go, and I will be with you as you speak and will instruct you what to say.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר בִּ֣י אֲדֹנָ֑י שְֽׁלַֽח־נָ֖א בְּיַד־תִּשְׁלָֽח׃
transliteration: vayomer biy adonay sh'lach-na b'yad-tish'lach
translation: But he said, “Please, O Lord, make someone else Your agent.”bLit. “send through whomever You will send.”

hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֨ף יְהוָ֜ה בְּמֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הֲלֹ֨א אַהֲרֹ֤ן אָחִ֙יךָ֙ הַלֵּוִ֔י יָדַ֕עְתִּי כִּֽי־דַבֵּ֥ר יְדַבֵּ֖ר ה֑וּא וְגַ֤ם הִנֵּה־הוּא֙ יֹצֵ֣א לִקְרָאתֶ֔ךָ וְרָאֲךָ֖ וְשָׂמַ֥ח בְּלִבּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayichar-af y'hvah b'mosheh vayomer halo aharon achiykha haleviy yada'tiy kiy-daber y'daber hv v'gam hineh-hv yotze lik'ratekha v'raakha v'samach b'libvo
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> became angry with Moses, and He said, “There is your brother Aaron the Levite. He, I know, speaks readily. Even now he is setting out to meet you, and he will be happy to see you.

hebrew: וְדִבַּרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֔יו וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים בְּפִ֑יו וְאָנֹכִ֗י אֶֽהְיֶ֤ה עִם־פִּ֙יךָ֙ וְעִם־פִּ֔יהוּ וְהוֹרֵיתִ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֽׂוּן׃
transliteration: v'dibar'ta elayv v'sam'ta et-had'variym b'fiyv v'anokhiy eh'yeh 'im-piykha v'im-piyhv v'hvoreytiy et'khem et asher ta'asvn
translation: You shall speak to him and put the words in his mouth—I will be with you and with him as you speak, and tell both of you what to do—

hebrew: וְדִבֶּר־ה֥וּא לְךָ֖ אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וְהָ֤יָה הוּא֙ יִֽהְיֶה־לְּךָ֣ לְפֶ֔ה וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּֽהְיֶה־לּ֥וֹ לֵֽאלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: v'diber-hv l'kha el-ha'am v'hayah hv yih'yeh-l'kha l'feh v'atah tih'yeh-lvo lelohiym
translation: and he shall speak for you to the people. Thus he shall serve as your spokesman, with you playing the role of GodcCf. 7.1. to him.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַמַּטֶּ֥ה הַזֶּ֖ה תִּקַּ֣ח בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶׂה־בּ֖וֹ אֶת־הָאֹתֹֽת׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'et-hamateh hazeh tikach b'yadekha asher ta'aseh-bvo et-haotot (f)
translation: And take with you this rod, with which you shall perform the signs.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ מֹשֶׁ֜ה וַיָּ֣שָׁב ׀ אֶל־יֶ֣תֶר חֹֽתְנ֗וֹ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ אֵ֣לְכָה נָּ֗א וְאָשׁ֙וּבָה֙ אֶל־אַחַ֣י אֲשֶׁר־בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וְאֶרְאֶ֖ה הַעוֹדָ֣ם חַיִּ֑ים וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יִתְר֛וֹ לְמֹשֶׁ֖ה לֵ֥ךְ לְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayelekh' mosheh vayashav  el-yeter chot'nvo vayomer lvo el'khah na v'ashvvah el-achay asher-b'mitz'rayim v'er'eh ha'vodam chayiym vayomer yit'rvo l'mosheh lekh' l'shalvom
translation: Moses went back to his father-in-law JetherdI.e., Jethro. and said to him, “Let me go back to my kinsmen in Egypt and see how they are faring.”eLit. “whether they are still alive.” And Jethro said to Moses, “Go in peace.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ בְּמִדְיָ֔ן לֵ֖ךְ שֻׁ֣ב מִצְרָ֑יִם כִּי־מֵ֙תוּ֙ כָּל־הָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים הַֽמְבַקְשִׁ֖ים אֶת־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh b'mid'yan lekh' shuv mitz'rayim kiy-metv kal-haanashiym ham'vak'shiym et-naf'shekha
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses in Midian, “Go back to Egypt, for all the men who sought to kill you are dead.”

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֣וֹ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֗יו וַיַּרְכִּבֵם֙ עַֽל־הַחֲמֹ֔ר וַיָּ֖שָׁב אַ֣רְצָה מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־מַטֵּ֥ה הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-ish'tvo v'et-banayv vayar'kivem 'al-hachamor vayashav ar'tzah mitz'rayim vayikach mosheh et-mateh haelohiym b'yadvo
translation: So Moses took his wife and sons, mounted them on an ass, and went back to the land of Egypt; and Moses took the rod of God with him.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ בְּלֶכְתְּךָ֙ לָשׁ֣וּב מִצְרַ֔יְמָה רְאֵ֗ה כָּל־הַמֹּֽפְתִים֙ אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֣מְתִּי בְיָדֶ֔ךָ וַעֲשִׂיתָ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַאֲנִי֙ אֲחַזֵּ֣ק אֶת־לִבּ֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א יְשַׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־הָעָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh b'lekh't'kha lashvv mitz'ray'mah r'eh kal-hamof'tiym asher-sam'tiy v'yadekha va'asiytam lif'ney far'oh vaaniy achazek et-libvo v'lo y'shalach et-ha'am
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “When you return to Egypt, see that you perform before Pharaoh all the marvels that I have put within your power. I, however, will stiffen his heart so that he will not let the people go.

hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה בְּנִ֥י בְכֹרִ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'amar'ta el-par'oh koh amar y'hvah b'niy v'khoriy yis'rael
translation: Then you shall say to Pharaoh, ‘Thus says the L<small>ORD</small>: Israel is My first-born son.

hebrew: וָאֹמַ֣ר אֵלֶ֗יךָ שַׁלַּ֤ח אֶת־בְּנִי֙ וְיַֽעַבְדֵ֔נִי וַתְּמָאֵ֖ן לְשַׁלְּח֑וֹ הִנֵּה֙ אָנֹכִ֣י הֹרֵ֔ג אֶת־בִּנְךָ֖ בְּכֹרֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vaomar eleykha shalach et-b'niy v'ya'av'deniy vat'maen l'shal'chvo hineh anokhiy horeg et-bin'kha b'khorekha
translation: I have said to you, “Let My son go, that he may worship Me,” yet you refuse to let him go. Now I will slay your first-born son.’”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י בַדֶּ֖רֶךְ בַּמָּל֑וֹן וַיִּפְגְּשֵׁ֣הוּ יְהוָ֔ה וַיְבַקֵּ֖שׁ הֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy vaderekh' bamalvon vayif'g'shehv y'hvah vay'vakesh hamiytvo
translation: At a night encampment on the way, the L<small>ORD</small> encountered him and sought to kill him.

hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֨ח צִפֹּרָ֜ה צֹ֗ר וַתִּכְרֹת֙ אֶת־עָרְלַ֣ת בְּנָ֔הּ וַתַּגַּ֖ע לְרַגְלָ֑יו וַתֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֧י חֲתַן־דָּמִ֛ים אַתָּ֖ה לִֽי׃
transliteration: vatikach tziporah tzor vatikh'rot et-'ar'lat b'nah vataga' l'rag'layv vatomer kiy chatan-damiym atah liy
translation: fMeaning of vv. 25–26 uncertain. So Zipporah took a flint and cut off her son’s foreskin, and touched his legs with it, saying, “You are truly a bridegroom of blood to me!”

hebrew: וַיִּ֖רֶף מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אָ֚ז אָֽמְרָ֔ה חֲתַ֥ן דָּמִ֖ים לַמּוּלֹֽת׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayiref mimenv az am'rah chatan damiym lamvlot (f)
translation: And when He let him alone, she added, “A bridegroom of blood because of the circumcision.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן לֵ֛ךְ לִקְרַ֥את מֹשֶׁ֖ה הַמִּדְבָּ֑רָה וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ וַֽיִּפְגְּשֵׁ֛הוּ בְּהַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים וַיִּשַּׁק־לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-aharon lekh' lik'rat mosheh hamid'barah vayelekh' vayif'g'shehv b'har haelohiym vayishak-lvo
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Aaron, “Go to meet Moses in the wilderness.” He went and met him at the mountain of God, and he kissed him.

hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֤ד מֹשֶׁה֙ לְאַֽהֲרֹ֔ן אֵ֛ת כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר שְׁלָח֑וֹ וְאֵ֥ת כָּל־הָאֹתֹ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽהוּ׃
transliteration: vayaged mosheh l'aharon et kal-div'rey y'hvah asher sh'lachvo v'et kal-haotot asher tzivahv
translation: Moses told Aaron about all the things that the L<small>ORD</small> had committed to him and all the signs about which He had instructed him.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיַּ֣אַסְפ֔וּ אֶת־כָּל־זִקְנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayelekh' mosheh v'aharon vayaas'fv et-kal-zik'ney b'ney yis'rael
translation: Then Moses and Aaron went and assembled all the elders of the Israelites.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אַהֲרֹ֔ן אֵ֚ת כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָאֹתֹ֖ת לְעֵינֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃
transliteration: vay'daber aharon et kal-had'variym asher-diber y'hvah el-mosheh vaya'as haotot l'eyney ha'am
translation: Aaron repeated all the words that the L<small>ORD</small> had spoken to Moses, and he performed the signs in the sight of the people,

hebrew: וַֽיַּאֲמֵ֖ן הָעָ֑ם וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֡וּ כִּֽי־פָקַ֨ד יְהוָ֜ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְכִ֤י רָאָה֙ אֶת־עָנְיָ֔ם וַֽיִּקְּד֖וּ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוּֽוּ׃
transliteration: vayaamen ha'am vayish'm'v kiy-fakad y'hvah et-b'ney yis'rael v'khiy raah et-'an'yam vayik'dv vayish'tachavv
translation: and the people were convinced. When they heard that the L<small>ORD</small> had taken note of the Israelites and that He had seen their plight, they bowed low in homage.

hebrew: וְאַחַ֗ר בָּ֚אוּ מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י וְיָחֹ֥גּוּ לִ֖י בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
transliteration: v'achar bav mosheh v'aharon vayom'rv el-par'oh koh-amar y'hvah elohey yis'rael shalach et-'amiy v'yachogv liy bamid'bar
translation: Afterward Moses and Aaron went and said to Pharaoh, “Thus says the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of Israel: Let My people go that they may celebrate a festival for Me in the wilderness.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֔ה מִ֤י יְהוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶשְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹל֔וֹ לְשַׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לֹ֤א יָדַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֔ה וְגַ֥ם אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹ֥א אֲשַׁלֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh miy y'hvah asher esh'ma' b'kolvo l'shalach et-yis'rael lo yada'tiy et-y'hvah v'gam et-yis'rael lo ashalecha
translation: But Pharaoh said, “Who is the L<small>ORD</small> that I should heed Him and let Israel go? I do not know the L<small>ORD</small>, nor will I let Israel go.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֱלֹהֵ֥י הָעִבְרִ֖ים נִקְרָ֣א עָלֵ֑ינוּ נֵ֣לֲכָה נָּ֡א דֶּרֶךְ֩ שְׁלֹ֨שֶׁת יָמִ֜ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֗ר וְנִזְבְּחָה֙ לַֽיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ פֶּ֨ן־יִפְגָּעֵ֔נוּ בַּדֶּ֖בֶר א֥וֹ בֶחָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: vayom'rv elohey ha'iv'riym nik'ra 'aleynv nelakhah na derekh' sh'loshet yamiym bamid'bar v'niz'b'chah layhvah eloheynv pen-yif'ga'env badever vo vecharev
translation: They answered, “The God of the Hebrews has manifested Himself to us. Let us go, we pray, a distance of three days into the wilderness to sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small> our God, lest He strike us with pestilence or sword.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם לָ֚מָּה מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן תַּפְרִ֥יעוּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם מִמַּֽעֲשָׂ֑יו לְכ֖וּ לְסִבְלֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem melekh' mitz'rayim lamah mosheh v'aharon taf'riy'v et-ha'am mima'asayv l'khv l'siv'loteykhem
translation: But the king of Egypt said to them, “Moses and Aaron, why do you distract the people from their tasks? Get to your labors!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֔ה הֵן־רַבִּ֥ים עַתָּ֖ה עַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהִשְׁבַּתֶּ֥ם אֹתָ֖ם מִסִּבְלֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh hen-rabiym 'atah 'am haaretz v'hish'batem otam misiv'lotam
translation: And Pharaoh continued, aSamaritan “Even now they are more numerous than the people of the land,” i.e., than the native population (cf. Gen. 23.7).“The people of the land are already so numerous,-a and you would have them cease from their labors!”bSee 1.5–11.

hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ו פַּרְעֹ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא אֶת־הַנֹּגְשִׂ֣ים בָּעָ֔ם וְאֶת־שֹׁטְרָ֖יו לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'tzav par'oh bayvom hahv et-hanog'siym ba'am v'et-shot'rayv lemor
translation: That same day Pharaoh charged the taskmasters and foremen of the people, saying,

hebrew: לֹ֣א תֹאסִפ֞וּן לָתֵ֨ת תֶּ֧בֶן לָעָ֛ם לִלְבֹּ֥ן הַלְּבֵנִ֖ים כִּתְמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֑ם הֵ֚ם יֵֽלְכ֔וּ וְקֹשְׁשׁ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם תֶּֽבֶן׃
transliteration: lo tosifvn latet teven la'am lil'bon hal'veniym kit'mvol shil'shom hem yel'khv v'kosh'shv lahem teven
translation: “You shall no longer provide the people with straw for making bricks as heretofore; let them go and gather straw for themselves.

hebrew: וְאֶת־מַתְכֹּ֨נֶת הַלְּבֵנִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֵם֩ עֹשִׂ֨ים תְּמ֤וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁם֙ תָּשִׂ֣ימוּ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם לֹ֥א תִגְרְע֖וּ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ כִּֽי־נִרְפִּ֣ים הֵ֔ם עַל־כֵּ֗ן הֵ֤ם צֹֽעֲקִים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר נֵלְכָ֖ה נִזְבְּחָ֥ה לֵאלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: v'et-mat'konet hal'veniym asher hem 'osiym t'mvol shil'shom tasiymv 'aleyhem lo tig'r'v mimenv kiy-nir'piym hem 'al-ken hem tzo'akiym lemor nel'khah niz'b'chah leloheynv
translation: But impose upon them the same quota of bricks as they have been making heretofore; do not reduce it, for they are shirkers; that is why they cry, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to our God!’

hebrew: תִּכְבַּ֧ד הָעֲבֹדָ֛ה עַל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים וְיַעֲשׂוּ־בָ֑הּ וְאַל־יִשְׁע֖וּ בְּדִבְרֵי־שָֽׁקֶר׃
transliteration: tikh'bad ha'avodah 'al-haanashiym v'ya'asv-vah v'al-yish'v b'div'rey-shaker
translation: Let heavier work be laid upon the men; let them keep at it and not pay attention to deceitful promises.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨צְא֜וּ נֹגְשֵׂ֤י הָעָם֙ וְשֹׁ֣טְרָ֔יו וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ אֶל־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר פַּרְעֹ֔ה אֵינֶ֛נִּי נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶ֖ם תֶּֽבֶן׃
transliteration: vayetz'v nog'sey ha'am v'shot'rayv vayom'rv el-ha'am lemor koh amar par'oh eyneniy noten lakhem teven
translation: So the taskmasters and foremen of the people went out and said to the people, “Thus says Pharaoh: I will not give you any straw.

hebrew: אַתֶּ֗ם לְכ֨וּ קְח֤וּ לָכֶם֙ תֶּ֔בֶן מֵאֲשֶׁ֖ר תִּמְצָ֑אוּ כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין נִגְרָ֛ע מֵעֲבֹדַתְכֶ֖ם דָּבָֽר׃
transliteration: atem l'khv k'chv lakhem teven measher tim'tzav kiy eyn nig'ra' me'avodat'khem davar
translation: You must go and get the straw yourselves wherever you can find it; but there shall be no decrease whatever in your work.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֥פֶץ הָעָ֖ם בְּכָל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם לְקֹשֵׁ֥שׁ קַ֖שׁ לַתֶּֽבֶן׃
transliteration: vayafetz ha'am b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim l'koshesh kash lateven
translation: Then the people scattered throughout the land of Egypt to gather stubble for straw.

hebrew: וְהַנֹּגְשִׂ֖ים אָצִ֣ים לֵאמֹ֑ר כַּלּ֤וּ מַעֲשֵׂיכֶם֙ דְּבַר־י֣וֹם בְּיוֹמ֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּהְי֥וֹת הַתֶּֽבֶן׃
transliteration: v'hanog'siym atziym lemor kalv ma'aseykhem d'var-yvom b'yvomvo kaasher bih'yvot hateven
translation: And the taskmasters pressed them, saying, “You must complete the same work assignment each day as when you had straw.”

hebrew: וַיֻּכּ֗וּ שֹֽׁטְרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣מוּ עֲלֵהֶ֔ם נֹגְשֵׂ֥י פַרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר מַדּ֡וּעַ לֹא֩ כִלִּיתֶ֨ם חָקְכֶ֤ם לִלְבֹּן֙ כִּתְמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֔ם גַּם־תְּמ֖וֹל גַּם־הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayukv shot'rey b'ney yis'rael asher-samv 'alehem nog'sey far'oh lemor madv'a lo khiliytem chak'khem lil'bon kit'mvol shil'shom gam-t'mvol gam-hayvom
translation: And the foremen of the Israelites, whom Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten. “Why,” they were asked, “did you not complete the prescribed amount of bricks, either yesterday or today, as you did before?”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ שֹֽׁטְרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּצְעֲק֥וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר לָ֧מָּה תַעֲשֶׂ֦ה כֹ֖ה לַעֲבָדֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vayavov shot'rey b'ney yis'rael vayitz'akv el-par'oh lemor lamah ta'aseh khoh la'avadeykha
translation: Then the foremen of the Israelites came to Pharaoh and cried: “Why do you deal thus with your servants?

hebrew: תֶּ֗בֶן אֵ֤ין נִתָּן֙ לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ וּלְבֵנִ֛ים אֹמְרִ֥ים לָ֖נוּ עֲשׂ֑וּ וְהִנֵּ֧ה עֲבָדֶ֛יךָ מֻכִּ֖ים וְחָטָ֥את עַמֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: teven eyn nitan la'avadeykha vl'veniym om'riym lanv 'asv v'hineh 'avadeykha mukiym v'chatat 'amekha
translation: No straw is issued to your servants, yet they demand of us: Make bricks! Thus your servants are being beaten, when the fault is with your own people.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר נִרְפִּ֥ים אַתֶּ֖ם נִרְפִּ֑ים עַל־כֵּן֙ אַתֶּ֣ם אֹֽמְרִ֔ים נֵלְכָ֖ה נִזְבְּחָ֥ה לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer nir'piym atem nir'piym 'al-ken atem om'riym nel'khah niz'b'chah layhvah
translation: He replied, “You are shirkers, shirkers! That is why you say, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small>.’

hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ לְכ֣וּ עִבְד֔וּ וְתֶ֖בֶן לֹא־יִנָּתֵ֣ן לָכֶ֑ם וְתֹ֥כֶן לְבֵנִ֖ים תִּתֵּֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: v'atah l'khv 'iv'dv v'teven lo-yinaten lakhem v'tokhen l'veniym titenv
translation: Be off now to your work! No straw shall be issued to you, but you must produce your quota of bricks!”

hebrew: וַיִּרְא֞וּ שֹֽׁטְרֵ֧י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֹתָ֖ם בְּרָ֣ע לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹא־תִגְרְע֥וּ מִלִּבְנֵיכֶ֖ם דְּבַר־י֥וֹם בְּיוֹמֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayir'v shot'rey v'ney-yis'rael otam b'ra' lemor lo-tig'r'v miliv'neykhem d'var-yvom b'yvomvo
translation: Now the foremen of the Israelites found themselves in trouble because of the order, “You must not reduce your daily quantity of bricks.”

hebrew: וַֽיִּפְגְּעוּ֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֔ן נִצָּבִ֖ים לִקְרָאתָ֑ם בְּצֵאתָ֖ם מֵאֵ֥ת פַּרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayif'g'v et-mosheh v'et-aharon nitzaviym lik'ratam b'tzetam meet par'oh
translation: As they left Pharaoh’s presence, they came upon Moses and Aaron standing in their path,

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם יֵ֧רֶא יְהוָ֛ה עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם וְיִשְׁפֹּ֑ט אֲשֶׁ֧ר הִבְאַשְׁתֶּ֣ם אֶת־רֵיחֵ֗נוּ בְּעֵינֵ֤י פַרְעֹה֙ וּבְעֵינֵ֣י עֲבָדָ֔יו לָֽתֶת־חֶ֥רֶב בְּיָדָ֖ם לְהָרְגֵֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vayom'rv alehem yere y'hvah 'aleykhem v'yish'pot asher hiv'ash'tem et-reychenv b'eyney far'oh vv'eyney 'avadayv latet-cherev b'yadam l'har'genv
translation: and they said to them, “May the L<small>ORD</small> look upon you and punish you for making us loathsome to Pharaoh and his courtiers—putting a sword in their hands to slay us.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֧שָׁב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־יְהוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנָ֗י לָמָ֤ה הֲרֵעֹ֙תָה֙ לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה שְׁלַחְתָּֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayashav mosheh el-y'hvah vayomar adonay lamah hare'otah la'am hazeh lamah zeh sh'lach'taniy
translation: Then Moses returned to the L<small>ORD</small> and said, “O Lord, why did You bring harm upon this people? Why did You send me?

hebrew: וּמֵאָ֞ז בָּ֤אתִי אֶל־פַּרְעֹה֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר בִּשְׁמֶ֔ךָ הֵרַ֖ע לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה וְהַצֵּ֥ל לֹא־הִצַּ֖לְתָּ אֶת־עַמֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: vmeaz batiy el-par'oh l'daber bish'mekha hera' la'am hazeh v'hatzel lo-hitzal'ta et-'amekha
translation: Ever since I came to Pharaoh to speak in Your name, he has dealt worse with this people; and still You have not delivered Your people.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה עַתָּ֣ה תִרְאֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֖ה לְפַרְעֹ֑ה כִּ֣י בְיָ֤ד חֲזָקָה֙ יְשַׁלְּחֵ֔ם וּבְיָ֣ד חֲזָקָ֔ה יְגָרְשֵׁ֖ם מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh 'atah tir'eh asher e'eseh l'far'oh kiy v'yad chazakah y'shal'chem vv'yad chazakah y'gar'shem mear'tzvo (s)
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “You shall soon see what I will do to Pharaoh: he shall let them go because of a greater might; indeed, because of a greater might he shall drive them from his land.”

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'daber elohiym el-mosheh vayomer elayv aniy y'hvah
translation: God spoke to Moses and said to him, “I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וָאֵרָ֗א אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֶל־יִצְחָ֥ק וְאֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב בְּאֵ֣ל שַׁדָּ֑י וּשְׁמִ֣י יְהוָ֔ה לֹ֥א נוֹדַ֖עְתִּי לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vaera el-av'raham el-yitz'chak v'el-ya'akov b'el shaday vsh'miy y'hvah lo nvoda'tiy lahem
translation: I appeared to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob as El Shaddai, but I did not make Myself known to them by My name יהוה.aThis divine name is traditionally not pronounced; instead, Adonai, “(the) Lord,” is regularly substituted for it.

hebrew: וְגַ֨ם הֲקִמֹ֤תִי אֶת־בְּרִיתִי֙ אִתָּ֔ם לָתֵ֥ת לָהֶ֖ם אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן אֵ֛ת אֶ֥רֶץ מְגֻרֵיהֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־גָּ֥רוּ בָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'gam hakimotiy et-b'riytiy itam latet lahem et-eretz k'na'an et eretz m'gureyhem asher-garv vah
translation: I also established My covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land in which they lived as sojourners.

hebrew: וְגַ֣ם ׀ אֲנִ֣י שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי אֶֽת־נַאֲקַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִצְרַ֖יִם מַעֲבִדִ֣ים אֹתָ֑ם וָאֶזְכֹּ֖ר אֶת־בְּרִיתִֽי׃
transliteration: v'gam  aniy shama'tiy et-naakat b'ney yis'rael asher mitz'rayim ma'avidiym otam vaez'kor et-b'riytiy
translation: I have now heard the moaning of the Israelites because the Egyptians are holding them in bondage, and I have remembered My covenant.

hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן אֱמֹ֥ר לִבְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֘ל אֲנִ֣י יְהוָה֒ וְהוֹצֵאתִ֣י אֶתְכֶ֗ם מִתַּ֙חַת֙ סִבְלֹ֣ת מִצְרַ֔יִם וְהִצַּלְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵעֲבֹדָתָ֑ם וְגָאַלְתִּ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ בִּזְר֣וֹעַ נְטוּיָ֔ה וּבִשְׁפָטִ֖ים גְּדֹלִֽים׃
transliteration: lakhen emor liv'ney-yis'rael aniy y'hvah v'hvotzetiy et'khem mitachat siv'lot mitz'rayim v'hitzal'tiy et'khem me'avodatam v'gaal'tiy et'khem biz'rvo'a n'tvyah vvish'fatiym g'doliym
translation: Say, therefore, to the Israelite people: I am the L<small>ORD</small>. I will free you from the labors of the Egyptians and deliver you from their bondage. I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and through extraordinary chastisements.
