hebrew: וְלָקַחְתִּ֨י אֶתְכֶ֥ם לִי֙ לְעָ֔ם וְהָיִ֥יתִי לָכֶ֖ם לֵֽאלֹהִ֑ים וִֽידַעְתֶּ֗ם כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם הַמּוֹצִ֣יא אֶתְכֶ֔ם מִתַּ֖חַת סִבְל֥וֹת מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'lakach'tiy et'khem liy l'am v'hayiytiy lakhem lelohiym viyda'tem kiy aniy y'hvah eloheykhem hamvotziy et'khem mitachat siv'lvot mitz'rayim
translation: And I will take you to be My people, and I will be your God. And you shall know that I, the L<small>ORD</small>, am your God who freed you from the labors of the Egyptians.

hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתִ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָשָׂ֙אתִי֙ אֶת־יָדִ֔י לָתֵ֣ת אֹתָ֔הּ לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹ֑ב וְנָתַתִּ֨י אֹתָ֥הּ לָכֶ֛ם מוֹרָשָׁ֖ה אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hevetiy et'khem el-haaretz asher nasatiy et-yadiy latet otah l'av'raham l'yitz'chak vl'ya'akov v'natatiy otah lakhem mvorashah aniy y'hvah
translation: I will bring you into the land which I sworebLit. “raised My hand.” to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and I will give it to you for a possession, I the LORD.”

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר מֹשֶׁ֛ה כֵּ֖ן אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹ֤א שָֽׁמְעוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה מִקֹּ֣צֶר ר֔וּחַ וּמֵעֲבֹדָ֖ה קָשָֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh ken el-b'ney yis'rael v'lo sham'v el-mosheh mikotzer rvcha vme'avodah kashah (f)
translation: But when Moses told this to the Israelites, they would not listen to Moses, their spirits crushed by cruel bondage.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying,

hebrew: בֹּ֣א דַבֵּ֔ר אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרָ֑יִם וִֽישַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃
transliteration: bo daber el-par'oh melekh' mitz'rayim viyshalach et-b'ney-yis'rael mear'tzvo
translation: “Go and tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the Israelites depart from his land.”

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֔ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר הֵ֤ן בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֹֽא־שָׁמְע֣וּ אֵלַ֔י וְאֵיךְ֙ יִשְׁמָעֵ֣נִי פַרְעֹ֔ה וַאֲנִ֖י עֲרַ֥ל שְׂפָתָֽיִם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh lif'ney y'hvah lemor hen b'ney-yis'rael lo-sham'v elay v'eykh' yish'ma'eniy far'oh vaaniy 'aral s'fatayim (f)
translation: But Moses appealed to the L<small>ORD</small>, saying, “The Israelites would not listen to me; how then should Pharaoh heed me, a man of impeded speech!”

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֒ וַיְצַוֵּם֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרָ֑יִם לְהוֹצִ֥יא אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon vay'tzavem el-b'ney yis'rael v'el-par'oh melekh' mitz'rayim l'hvotziy et-b'ney-yis'rael meeretz mitz'rayim (s)
translation: So the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to both Moses and Aaron in regard to the Israelites and Pharaoh king of Egypt, instructing them to deliver the Israelites from the land of Egypt.

hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה רָאשֵׁ֣י בֵית־אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּנֵ֨י רְאוּבֵ֜ן בְּכֹ֣ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל חֲנ֤וֹךְ וּפַלּוּא֙ חֶצְר֣וֹן וְכַרְמִ֔י אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת רְאוּבֵֽן׃
transliteration: eleh rashey veyt-avotam b'ney r'vven b'khor yis'rael chanvokh' vfalv chetz'rvon v'khar'miy eleh mish'p'chot r'vven
translation:
The following are the heads of their respective clans.
The sons of Reuben, Israel’s first-born: EnochcOr “Hanoch”; cf. on Gen. 46.9. and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi; those are the families of Reuben.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֗וֹן יְמוּאֵ֨ל וְיָמִ֤ין וְאֹ֙הַד֙ וְיָכִ֣ין וְצֹ֔חַר וְשָׁא֖וּל בֶּן־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֑ית אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת שִׁמְעֽוֹן׃
transliteration: vv'ney shim'von y'mvel v'yamiyn v'ohad v'yakhiyn v'tzochar v'shavl ben-hak'na'aniyt eleh mish'p'chot shim'von
translation: The sons of Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and SauldOr “Shaul”; cf. on Gen. 46.10. the son of a Canaanite woman; those are the families of Simeon.

hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה שְׁמ֤וֹת בְּנֵֽי־לֵוִי֙ לְתֹ֣לְדֹתָ֔ם גֵּרְשׁ֕וֹן וּקְהָ֖ת וּמְרָרִ֑י וּשְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י לֵוִ֔י שֶׁ֧בַע וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: v'eleh sh'mvot b'ney-leviy l'tol'dotam ger'shvon vk'hat vm'rariy vsh'ney chayey leviy sheva' vsh'loshiym vm'at shanah
translation: These are the names of Levi’s sons by their lineage: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari; and the span of Levi’s life was 137 years.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י גֵרְשׁ֛וֹן לִבְנִ֥י וְשִׁמְעִ֖י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: b'ney ger'shvon liv'niy v'shim'iy l'mish'p'chotam
translation: The sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei, by their families.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י קְהָ֔ת עַמְרָ֣ם וְיִצְהָ֔ר וְחֶבְר֖וֹן וְעֻזִּיאֵ֑ל וּשְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י קְהָ֔ת שָׁלֹ֧שׁ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: vv'ney k'hat 'am'ram v'yitz'har v'chev'rvon v'uziyel vsh'ney chayey k'hat shalosh vsh'loshiym vm'at shanah
translation: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel; and the span of Kohath’s life was 133 years.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י מְרָרִ֖י מַחְלִ֣י וּמוּשִׁ֑י אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הַלֵּוִ֖י לְתֹלְדֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vv'ney m'rariy mach'liy vmvshiy eleh mish'p'chot haleviy l'tol'dotam
translation: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites by their lineage.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח עַמְרָ֜ם אֶת־יוֹכֶ֤בֶד דֹּֽדָתוֹ֙ ל֣וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֔ה וַתֵּ֣לֶד ל֔וֹ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְאֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וּשְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י עַמְרָ֔ם שֶׁ֧בַע וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: vayikach 'am'ram et-yvokheved dodatvo lvo l'ishah vateled lvo et-aharon v'et-mosheh vsh'ney chayey 'am'ram sheva' vsh'loshiym vm'at shanah
translation: Amram took to wife his father’s sister Jochebed, and she bore him Aaron and Moses; and the span of Amram’s life was 137 years.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י יִצְהָ֑ר קֹ֥רַח וָנֶ֖פֶג וְזִכְרִֽי׃
transliteration: vv'ney yitz'har korach vanefeg v'zikh'riy
translation: The sons of Izhar: Korah, Nepheg, and Zichri.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י עֻזִּיאֵ֑ל מִֽישָׁאֵ֥ל וְאֶלְצָפָ֖ן וְסִתְרִֽי׃
transliteration: vv'ney 'uziyel miyshael v'el'tzafan v'sit'riy
translation: The sons of Uzziel: Mishael, Elzaphan, and Sithri.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־אֱלִישֶׁ֧בַע בַּת־עַמִּינָדָ֛ב אֲח֥וֹת נַחְשׁ֖וֹן ל֣וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַתֵּ֣לֶד ל֗וֹ אֶת־נָדָב֙ וְאֶת־אֲבִיה֔וּא אֶת־אֶלְעָזָ֖ר וְאֶת־אִֽיתָמָֽר׃
transliteration: vayikach aharon et-eliysheva' bat-'amiynadav achvot nach'shvon lvo l'ishah vateled lvo et-nadav v'et-aviyhv et-el'azar v'et-iytamar
translation: Aaron took to wife Elisheba, daughter of Amminadab and sister of Nahshon, and she bore him Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י קֹ֔רַח אַסִּ֥יר וְאֶלְקָנָ֖ה וַאֲבִיאָסָ֑ף אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הַקָּרְחִֽי׃
transliteration: vv'ney korach asiyr v'el'kanah vaaviyasaf eleh mish'p'chot hakar'chiy
translation: The sons of Korah: Assir, Elkanah, and Abiasaph. Those are the families of the Korahites.

hebrew: וְאֶלְעָזָ֨ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֜ן לָקַֽח־ל֨וֹ מִבְּנ֤וֹת פּֽוּטִיאֵל֙ ל֣וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֔ה וַתֵּ֥לֶד ל֖וֹ אֶת־פִּֽינְחָ֑ס אֵ֗לֶּה רָאשֵׁ֛י אֲב֥וֹת הַלְוִיִּ֖ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'el'azar ben-aharon lakach-lvo mib'nvot pvtiyel lvo l'ishah vateled lvo et-piyn'chas eleh rashey avvot hal'viyim l'mish'p'chotam
translation: And Aaron’s son Eleazar took to wife one of Putiel’s daughters, and she bore him Phinehas. Those are the heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites by their families.

hebrew: ה֥וּא אַהֲרֹ֖ן וּמֹשֶׁ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמַ֤ר יְהוָה֙ לָהֶ֔ם הוֹצִ֜יאוּ אֶת־בְּנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם עַל־צִבְאֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: hv aharon vmosheh asher amar y'hvah lahem hvotziyv et-b'ney yis'rael meeretz mitz'rayim 'al-tziv'otam
translation: It is the same Aaron and Moses to whom the L<small>ORD</small> said, “Bring forth the Israelites from the land of Egypt, troop by troop.”

hebrew: הֵ֗ם הַֽמְדַבְּרִים֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֣ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֔יִם לְהוֹצִ֥יא אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם ה֥וּא מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹֽן׃
transliteration: hem ham'dab'riym el-par'oh melekh'-mitz'rayim l'hvotziy et-b'ney-yis'rael mimitz'rayim hv mosheh v'aharon
translation: It was they who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt to free the Israelites from the Egyptians; these are the same Moses and Aaron.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּי֨וֹם דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'hiy b'yvom diber y'hvah el-mosheh b'eretz mitz'rayim (f)
translation: For when the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹ֖ר אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֑ה דַּבֵּ֗ר אֶל־פַּרְעֹה֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם אֵ֛ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י דֹּבֵ֥ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor aniy y'hvah daber el-par'oh melekh' mitz'rayim et kal-asher aniy dover eleykha
translation: and the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “I am the L<small>ORD</small>; speak to Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I will tell you,”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה הֵ֤ן אֲנִי֙ עֲרַ֣ל שְׂפָתַ֔יִם וְאֵ֕יךְ יִשְׁמַ֥ע אֵלַ֖י פַּרְעֹֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayomer mosheh lif'ney y'hvah hen aniy 'aral s'fatayim v'eykh' yish'ma' elay par'oh (f)
translation: Moses appealed to the L<small>ORD</small>, saying, “See, I am of impeded speech; how then should Pharaoh heed me!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה רְאֵ֛ה נְתַתִּ֥יךָ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לְפַרְעֹ֑ה וְאַהֲרֹ֥ן אָחִ֖יךָ יִהְיֶ֥ה נְבִיאֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh r'eh n'tatiykha elohiym l'far'oh v'aharon achiykha yih'yeh n'viyekha
translation: The LORD replied to Moses, “See, I place you in the role of God to Pharaoh, with your brother Aaron as your prophet.aCf. 4.16.

hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה תְדַבֵּ֔ר אֵ֖ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲצַוֶּ֑ךָּ וְאַהֲרֹ֤ן אָחִ֙יךָ֙ יְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְשִׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃
transliteration: atah t'daber et kal-asher atzaveka v'aharon achiykha y'daber el-par'oh v'shilach et-b'ney-yis'rael mear'tzvo
translation: You shall repeat all that I command you, and your brother Aaron shall speak to Pharaoh to let the Israelites depart from his land.

hebrew: וַאֲנִ֥י אַקְשֶׁ֖ה אֶת־לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֧י אֶת־אֹתֹתַ֛י וְאֶת־מוֹפְתַ֖י בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vaaniy ak'sheh et-lev par'oh v'hir'beytiy et-ototay v'et-mvof'tay b'eretz mitz'rayim
translation: But I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, that I may multiply My signs and marvels in the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יִשְׁמַ֤ע אֲלֵכֶם֙ פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְנָתַתִּ֥י אֶת־יָדִ֖י בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וְהוֹצֵאתִ֨י אֶת־צִבְאֹתַ֜י אֶת־עַמִּ֤י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בִּשְׁפָטִ֖ים גְּדֹלִֽים׃
transliteration: v'lo-yish'ma' alekhem par'oh v'natatiy et-yadiy b'mitz'rayim v'hvotzetiy et-tziv'otay et-'amiy v'ney-yis'rael meeretz mitz'rayim bish'fatiym g'doliym
translation: When Pharaoh does not heed you, I will lay My hand upon Egypt and deliver My ranks, My people the Israelites, from the land of Egypt with extraordinary chastisements.

hebrew: וְיָדְע֤וּ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֔ה בִּנְטֹתִ֥י אֶת־יָדִ֖י עַל־מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהוֹצֵאתִ֥י אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִתּוֹכָֽם׃
transliteration: v'yad'v mitz'rayim kiy-aniy y'hvah bin'totiy et-yadiy 'al-mitz'rayim v'hvotzetiy et-b'ney-yis'rael mitvokham
translation: And the Egyptians shall know that I am the L<small>ORD</small>, when I stretch out My hand over Egypt and bring out the Israelites from their midst.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֑ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֹתָ֖ם כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃
transliteration: vaya'as mosheh v'aharon kaasher tzivah y'hvah otam ken 'asv
translation: This Moses and Aaron did; as the L<small>ORD</small> commanded them, so they did.

hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁה֙ בֶּן־שְׁמֹנִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְאַֽהֲרֹ֔ן בֶּן־שָׁלֹ֥שׁ וּשְׁמֹנִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה בְּדַבְּרָ֖ם אֶל־פַּרְעֹֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vmosheh ben-sh'moniym shanah v'aharon ben-shalosh vsh'moniym shanah b'dab'ram el-par'oh (f)
translation: Moses was eighty years old and Aaron eighty-three, when they made their demand on Pharaoh.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses and Aaron,

hebrew: כִּי֩ יְדַבֵּ֨ר אֲלֵכֶ֤ם פַּרְעֹה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר תְּנ֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם מוֹפֵ֑ת וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן קַ֧ח אֶֽת־מַטְּךָ֛ וְהַשְׁלֵ֥ךְ לִפְנֵֽי־פַרְעֹ֖ה יְהִ֥י לְתַנִּֽין׃
transliteration: kiy y'daber alekhem par'oh lemor t'nv lakhem mvofet v'amar'ta el-aharon kach et-mat'kha v'hash'lekh' lif'ney-far'oh y'hiy l'taniyn
translation: “When Pharaoh speaks to you and says, ‘Produce your marvel,’ you shall say to Aaron, ‘Take your rod and cast it down before Pharaoh.’ It shall turn into a serpent.”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְאַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וַיַּ֣עַשׂוּ כֵ֔ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהוָ֑ה וַיַּשְׁלֵ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־מַטֵּ֗הוּ לִפְנֵ֥י פַרְעֹ֛ה וְלִפְנֵ֥י עֲבָדָ֖יו וַיְהִ֥י לְתַנִּֽין׃
transliteration: vayavo mosheh v'aharon el-par'oh vaya'asv khen kaasher tzivah y'hvah vayash'lekh' aharon et-matehv lif'ney far'oh v'lif'ney 'avadayv vay'hiy l'taniyn
translation: So Moses and Aaron came before Pharaoh and did just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded: Aaron cast down his rod in the presence of Pharaoh and his courtiers, and it turned into a serpent.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא֙ גַּם־פַּרְעֹ֔ה לַֽחֲכָמִ֖ים וְלַֽמְכַשְּׁפִ֑ים וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֨וּ גַם־הֵ֜ם חַרְטֻמֵּ֥י מִצְרַ֛יִם בְּלַהֲטֵיהֶ֖ם כֵּֽן׃
transliteration: vayik'ra gam-par'oh lachakhamiym v'lam'khash'fiym vaya'asv gam-hem char'tumey mitz'rayim b'lahateyhem ken
translation: Then Pharaoh, for his part, summoned the wise men and the sorcerers; and the Egyptian magicians, in turn, did the same with their spells;

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁלִ֙יכוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ מַטֵּ֔הוּ וַיִּהְי֖וּ לְתַנִּינִ֑ם וַיִּבְלַ֥ע מַטֵּֽה־אַהֲרֹ֖ן אֶת־מַטֹּתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayash'liykhv iysh matehv vayih'yv l'taniynim vayiv'la' mateh-aharon et-matotam
translation: each cast down his rod, and they turned into serpents. But Aaron’s rod swallowed their rods.

hebrew: וַיֶּחֱזַק֙ לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖ע אֲלֵהֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayechezak lev par'oh v'lo shama' alehem kaasher diber y'hvah (f)
translation: Yet Pharaoh’s heart stiffened and he did not heed them, as the L<small>ORD</small> had said.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כָּבֵ֖ד לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֑ה מֵאֵ֖ן לְשַׁלַּ֥ח הָעָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh kaved lev par'oh meen l'shalach ha'am
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Pharaoh is stubborn; he refuses to let the people go.

hebrew: לֵ֣ךְ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֞ה בַּבֹּ֗קֶר הִנֵּה֙ יֹצֵ֣א הַמַּ֔יְמָה וְנִצַּבְתָּ֥ לִקְרָאת֖וֹ עַל־שְׂפַ֣ת הַיְאֹ֑ר וְהַמַּטֶּ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־נֶהְפַּ֥ךְ לְנָחָ֖שׁ תִּקַּ֥ח בְּיָדֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: lekh' el-par'oh baboker hineh yotze hamay'mah v'nitzav'ta lik'ratvo 'al-s'fat hay'or v'hamateh asher-neh'pakh' l'nachash tikach b'yadekha
translation: Go to Pharaoh in the morning, as he is coming out to the water, and station yourself before him at the edge of the Nile, taking with you the rod that turned into a snake.

hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו יְהוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י הָעִבְרִים֙ שְׁלָחַ֤נִי אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר שַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י וְיַֽעַבְדֻ֖נִי בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְהִנֵּ֥ה לֹא־שָׁמַ֖עְתָּ עַד־כֹּֽה׃
transliteration: v'amar'ta elayv y'hvah elohey ha'iv'riym sh'lachaniy eleykha lemor shalach et-'amiy v'ya'av'duniy bamid'bar v'hineh lo-shama'ta 'ad-koh
translation: And say to him, ‘The L<small>ORD</small>, the God of the Hebrews, sent me to you to say, “Let My people go that they may worship Me in the wilderness.” But you have paid no heed until now.

hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה בְּזֹ֣את תֵּדַ֔ע כִּ֖י אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֑ה הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י מַכֶּ֣ה ׀ בַּמַּטֶּ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־בְּיָדִ֗י עַל־הַמַּ֛יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּיְאֹ֖ר וְנֶהֶפְכ֥וּ לְדָֽם׃
transliteration: koh amar y'hvah b'zot teda' kiy aniy y'hvah hineh anokhiy makeh  bamateh asher-b'yadiy 'al-hamayim asher bay'or v'nehef'khv l'dam
translation: Thus says the L<small>ORD</small>, “By this you shall know that I am the L<small>ORD</small>.” See, I shall strike the water in the Nile with the rod that is in my hand, and it will be turned into blood;

hebrew: וְהַדָּגָ֧ה אֲשֶׁר־בַּיְאֹ֛ר תָּמ֖וּת וּבָאַ֣שׁ הַיְאֹ֑ר וְנִלְא֣וּ מִצְרַ֔יִם לִשְׁתּ֥וֹת מַ֖יִם מִן־הַיְאֹֽר׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hadagah asher-bay'or tamvt vvaash hay'or v'nil'v mitz'rayim lish'tvot mayim min-hay'or (s)
translation: and the fish in the Nile will die. The Nile will stink so that the Egyptians will find it impossible to drink the water of the Nile.’”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֱמֹ֣ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֡ן קַ֣ח מַטְּךָ֣ וּנְטֵֽה־יָדְךָ֩ עַל־מֵימֵ֨י מִצְרַ֜יִם עַֽל־נַהֲרֹתָ֣ם ׀ עַל־יְאֹרֵיהֶ֣ם וְעַל־אַגְמֵיהֶ֗ם וְעַ֛ל כָּל־מִקְוֵ֥ה מֵימֵיהֶ֖ם וְיִֽהְיוּ־דָ֑ם וְהָ֤יָה דָם֙ בְּכָל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וּבָעֵצִ֖ים וּבָאֲבָנִֽים׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh emor el-aharon kach mat'kha vn'teh-yad'kha 'al-meymey mitz'rayim 'al-naharotam  'al-y'oreyhem v'al-ag'meyhem v'al kal-mik'veh meymeyhem v'yih'yv-dam v'hayah dam b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim vva'etziym vvaavaniym
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Say to Aaron: Take your rod and hold out your arm over the waters of Egypt—its rivers, its canals, its ponds, all its bodies of water—that they may turn to blood; there shall be blood throughout the land of Egypt, even in vessels of wood and stone.”

hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵן֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה וְאַהֲרֹ֜ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ צִוָּ֣ה יְהוָ֗ה וַיָּ֤רֶם בַּמַּטֶּה֙ וַיַּ֤ךְ אֶת־הַמַּ֙יִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּיְאֹ֔ר לְעֵינֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וּלְעֵינֵ֖י עֲבָדָ֑יו וַיֵּהָֽפְכ֛וּ כָּל־הַמַּ֥יִם אֲשֶׁר־בַּיְאֹ֖ר לְדָֽם׃
transliteration: vaya'asv-khen mosheh v'aharon kaasher  tzivah y'hvah vayarem bamateh vayakh' et-hamayim asher bay'or l'eyney far'oh vl'eyney 'avadayv vayehaf'khv kal-hamayim asher-bay'or l'dam
translation: Moses and Aaron did just as the L<small>ORD</small> commanded: he lifted up the rod and struck the water in the Nile in the sight of Pharaoh and his courtiers, and all the water in the Nile was turned into blood

hebrew: וְהַדָּגָ֨ה אֲשֶׁר־בַּיְאֹ֥ר מֵ֙תָה֙ וַיִּבְאַ֣שׁ הַיְאֹ֔ר וְלֹא־יָכְל֣וּ מִצְרַ֔יִם לִשְׁתּ֥וֹת מַ֖יִם מִן־הַיְאֹ֑ר וַיְהִ֥י הַדָּ֖ם בְּכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'hadagah asher-bay'or metah vayiv'ash hay'or v'lo-yakh'lv mitz'rayim lish'tvot mayim min-hay'or vay'hiy hadam b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: and the fish in the Nile died. The Nile stank so that the Egyptians could not drink water from the Nile; and there was blood throughout the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֛ן חַרְטֻמֵּ֥י מִצְרַ֖יִם בְּלָטֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֶּחֱזַ֤ק לֵב־פַּרְעֹה֙ וְלֹא־שָׁמַ֣ע אֲלֵהֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'asv-khen char'tumey mitz'rayim b'lateyhem vayechezak lev-par'oh v'lo-shama' alehem kaasher diber y'hvah
translation: But when the Egyptian magicians did the same with their spells, Pharaoh’s heart stiffened and he did not heed them—as the L<small>ORD</small> had spoken.

hebrew: וַיִּ֣פֶן פַּרְעֹ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֖א אֶל־בֵּית֑וֹ וְלֹא־שָׁ֥ת לִבּ֖וֹ גַּם־לָזֹֽאת׃
transliteration: vayifen par'oh vayavo el-beytvo v'lo-shat libvo gam-lazot
translation: Pharaoh turned and went into his palace, paying no regard even to this.

hebrew: וַיַּחְפְּר֧וּ כָל־מִצְרַ֛יִם סְבִיבֹ֥ת הַיְאֹ֖ר מַ֣יִם לִשְׁתּ֑וֹת כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָֽכְלוּ֙ לִשְׁתֹּ֔ת מִמֵּימֵ֖י הַיְאֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayach'p'rv khal-mitz'rayim s'viyvot hay'or mayim lish'tvot kiy lo yakh'lv lish'tot mimeymey hay'or
translation: And all the Egyptians had to dig round about the Nile for drinking water, because they could not drink the water of the Nile.

hebrew: וַיִּמָּלֵ֖א שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים אַחֲרֵ֥י הַכּוֹת־יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־הַיְאֹֽר׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayimale shiv'at yamiym acharey hakvot-y'hvah et-hay'or (f)
translation: When seven days had passed after the L<small>ORD</small> struck the Nile,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בֹּ֖א אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה שַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־עַמִּ֖י וְיַֽעַבְדֻֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh bo el-par'oh v'amar'ta elayv koh amar y'hvah shalach et-'amiy v'ya'av'duniy
translation: the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh and say to him, ‘Thus says the L<small>ORD</small>: Let My people go that they may worship Me.

hebrew: וְאִם־מָאֵ֥ן אַתָּ֖ה לְשַׁלֵּ֑חַ הִנֵּ֣ה אָנֹכִ֗י נֹגֵ֛ף אֶת־כָּל־גְּבוּלְךָ֖ בַּֽצְפַרְדְּעִֽים׃
transliteration: v'im-maen atah l'shalecha hineh anokhiy nogef et-kal-g'vvl'kha batz'far'd'iym
translation: If you refuse to let them go, then I will plague your whole country with frogs.

hebrew: וְשָׁרַ֣ץ הַיְאֹר֮ צְפַרְדְּעִים֒ וְעָלוּ֙ וּבָ֣אוּ בְּבֵיתֶ֔ךָ וּבַחֲדַ֥ר מִשְׁכָּבְךָ֖ וְעַל־מִטָּתֶ֑ךָ וּבְבֵ֤ית עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ וּבְעַמֶּ֔ךָ וּבְתַנּוּרֶ֖יךָ וּבְמִשְׁאֲרוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'sharatz hay'or tz'far'd'iym v'alv vvav b'veytekha vvachadar mish'kav'kha v'al-mitatekha vv'veyt 'avadeykha vv'amekha vv'tanvreykha vv'mish'arvoteykha
translation: The Nile shall swarm with frogs, and they shall come up and enter your palace, your bedchamber and your bed, the houses of your courtiers and your people, and your ovens and your kneading bowls.

hebrew: וּבְכָ֥ה וּֽבְעַמְּךָ֖ וּבְכָל־עֲבָדֶ֑יךָ יַעֲל֖וּ הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִֽים׃
transliteration: vv'khah vv'am'kha vv'khal-'avadeykha ya'alv hatz'far'd'iym
translation: The frogs shall come up on you and on your people and on all your courtiers.’”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ אֱמֹ֣ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן נְטֵ֤ה אֶת־יָדְךָ֙ בְּמַטֶּ֔ךָ עַל־הַ֨נְּהָרֹ֔ת עַל־הַיְאֹרִ֖ים וְעַל־הָאֲגַמִּ֑ים וְהַ֥עַל אֶת־הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֖ים עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh emor el-aharon n'teh et-yad'kha b'matekha 'al-han'harot 'al-hay'oriym v'al-haagamiym v'ha'al et-hatz'far'd'iym 'al-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Say to Aaron: Hold out your arm with the rod over the rivers, the canals, and the ponds, and bring up the frogs on the land of Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֤ט אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ עַ֖ל מֵימֵ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם וַתַּ֙עַל֙ הַצְּפַרְדֵּ֔עַ וַתְּכַ֖ס אֶת־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayet aharon et-yadvo 'al meymey mitz'rayim vata'al hatz'far'de'a vat'khas et-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: Aaron held out his arm over the waters of Egypt, and the frogs came up and covered the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֥ן הַֽחֲרְטֻמִּ֖ים בְּלָטֵיהֶ֑ם וַיַּעֲל֥וּ אֶת־הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֖ים עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vaya'asv-khen hachar'tumiym b'lateyhem vaya'alv et-hatz'far'd'iym 'al-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: But the magicians did the same with their spells, and brought frogs upon the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א פַרְעֹ֜ה לְמֹשֶׁ֣ה וּֽלְאַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַעְתִּ֣ירוּ אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה וְיָסֵר֙ הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֔ים מִמֶּ֖נִּי וּמֵֽעַמִּ֑י וַאֲשַׁלְּחָה֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וְיִזְבְּח֖וּ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayik'ra far'oh l'mosheh vl'aharon vayomer ha'tiyrv el-y'hvah v'yaser hatz'far'd'iym mimeniy vme'amiy vaashal'chah et-ha'am v'yiz'b'chv layhvah
translation: Then Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “Plead with the L<small>ORD</small> to remove the frogs from me and my people, and I will let the people go to sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small>.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה לְפַרְעֹה֮ הִתְפָּאֵ֣ר עָלַי֒ לְמָתַ֣י ׀ אַעְתִּ֣יר לְךָ֗ וְלַעֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ וּֽלְעַמְּךָ֔ לְהַכְרִית֙ הַֽצֲפַרְדְּעִ֔ים מִמְּךָ֖ וּמִבָּתֶּ֑יךָ רַ֥ק בַּיְאֹ֖ר תִּשָּׁאַֽרְנָה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh l'far'oh hit'paer 'alay l'matay  a'tiyr l'kha v'la'avadeykha vl'am'kha l'hakh'riyt hatzafar'd'iym mim'kha vmibateykha rak bay'or tishaar'nah
translation: And Moses said to Pharaoh, “You may have this triumph over me: for what time shall I plead in behalf of you and your courtiers and your people, that the frogs be cut off from you and your houses, to remain only in the Nile?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לְמָחָ֑ר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ כִּדְבָ֣רְךָ֔ לְמַ֣עַן תֵּדַ֔ע כִּי־אֵ֖ין כַּיהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer l'machar vayomer kid'var'kha l'ma'an teda' kiy-eyn kayhvah eloheynv
translation: “For tomorrow,” he replied. And [Moses] said, “As you say—that you may know that there is none like the L<small>ORD</small> our God;

hebrew: וְסָר֣וּ הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֗ים מִמְּךָ֙ וּמִבָּ֣תֶּ֔יךָ וּמֵעֲבָדֶ֖יךָ וּמֵעַמֶּ֑ךָ רַ֥ק בַּיְאֹ֖ר תִּשָּׁאַֽרְנָה׃
transliteration: v'sarv hatz'far'd'iym mim'kha vmibateykha vme'avadeykha vme'amekha rak bay'or tishaar'nah
translation: the frogs shall retreat from you and your courtiers and your people; they shall remain only in the Nile.”

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן מֵעִ֣ם פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַיִּצְעַ֤ק מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה עַל־דְּבַ֥ר הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֖ים אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֥ם לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayetze mosheh v'aharon me'im par'oh vayitz'ak mosheh el-y'hvah 'al-d'var hatz'far'd'iym asher-sam l'far'oh
translation: Then Moses and Aaron left Pharaoh’s presence, and Moses cried out to the L<small>ORD</small> in the matter of the frogs which He had inflicted upon Pharaoh.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ יְהוָ֖ה כִּדְבַ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיָּמֻ֙תוּ֙ הַֽצְפַרְדְּעִ֔ים מִן־הַבָּתִּ֥ים מִן־הַחֲצֵרֹ֖ת וּמִן־הַשָּׂדֹֽת׃
transliteration: vaya'as y'hvah kid'var mosheh vayamutv hatz'far'd'iym min-habatiym min-hachatzerot vmin-hasadot
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> did as Moses asked; the frogs died out in the houses, the courtyards, and the fields.

hebrew: וַיִּצְבְּר֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם חֳמָרִ֣ם חֳמָרִ֑ם וַתִּבְאַ֖שׁ הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vayitz'b'rv otam chomarim chomarim vativ'ash haaretz
translation: And they piled them up in heaps, till the land stank.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא פַּרְעֹ֗ה כִּ֤י הָֽיְתָה֙ הָֽרְוָחָ֔ה וְהַכְבֵּד֙ אֶת־לִבּ֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖ע אֲלֵהֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayar' par'oh kiy hay'tah har'vachah v'hakh'bed et-libvo v'lo shama' alehem kaasher diber y'hvah (s)
translation: But when Pharaoh saw that there was relief, he became stubborn and would not heed them, as the L<small>ORD</small> had spoken.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ אֱמֹר֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן נְטֵ֣ה אֶֽת־מַטְּךָ֔ וְהַ֖ךְ אֶת־עֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהָיָ֥ה לְכִנִּ֖ם בְּכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh emor el-aharon n'teh et-mat'kha v'hakh' et-'afar haaretz v'hayah l'khinim b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Say to Aaron: Hold out your rod and strike the dust of the earth, and it shall turn to lice throughout the land of Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֗ן וַיֵּט֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן אֶת־יָד֤וֹ בְמַטֵּ֙הוּ֙ וַיַּךְ֙ אֶת־עֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֔רֶץ וַתְּהִי֙ הַכִּנָּ֔ם בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָ֑ה כָּל־עֲפַ֥ר הָאָ֛רֶץ הָיָ֥ה כִנִּ֖ים בְּכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vaya'asv-khen vayet aharon et-yadvo v'matehv vayakh' et-'afar haaretz vat'hiy hakinam baadam vvab'hemah kal-'afar haaretz hayah khiniym b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: And they did so. Aaron held out his arm with the rod and struck the dust of the earth, and vermin came upon man and beast; all the dust of the earth turned to lice throughout the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֨ן הַחַרְטֻמִּ֧ים בְּלָטֵיהֶ֛ם לְהוֹצִ֥יא אֶת־הַכִּנִּ֖ים וְלֹ֣א יָכֹ֑לוּ וַתְּהִי֙ הַכִּנָּ֔ם בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'asv-khen hachar'tumiym b'lateyhem l'hvotziy et-hakiniym v'lo yakholv vat'hiy hakinam baadam vvab'hemah
translation: The magicians did the like with their spells to produce lice, but they could not. The vermin remained upon man and beast;

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ הַֽחַרְטֻמִּים֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה אֶצְבַּ֥ע אֱלֹהִ֖ים הִ֑וא וַיֶּחֱזַ֤ק לֵב־פַּרְעֹה֙ וְלֹֽא־שָׁמַ֣ע אֲלֵהֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayom'rv hachar'tumiym el-par'oh etz'ba' elohiym hiv vayechezak lev-par'oh v'lo-shama' alehem kaasher diber y'hvah (s)
translation: and the magicians said to Pharaoh, “This is the finger of God!” But Pharaoh’s heart stiffened and he would not heed them, as the L<small>ORD</small> had spoken.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה הַשְׁכֵּ֤ם בַּבֹּ֙קֶר֙ וְהִתְיַצֵּב֙ לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה הִנֵּ֖ה יוֹצֵ֣א הַמָּ֑יְמָה וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה שַׁלַּ֥ח עַמִּ֖י וְיַֽעַבְדֻֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh hash'kem baboker v'hit'yatzev lif'ney far'oh hineh yvotze hamay'mah v'amar'ta elayv koh amar y'hvah shalach 'amiy v'ya'av'duniy
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Early in the morning present yourself to Pharaoh, as he is coming out to the water, and say to him, ‘Thus says the L<small>ORD</small>: Let My people go that they may worship Me.

hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־אֵינְךָ֮ מְשַׁלֵּ֣חַ אֶת־עַמִּי֒ הִנְנִי֩ מַשְׁלִ֨יחַ בְּךָ֜ וּבַעֲבָדֶ֧יךָ וּֽבְעַמְּךָ֛ וּבְבָתֶּ֖יךָ אֶת־הֶעָרֹ֑ב וּמָ֨לְא֜וּ בָּתֵּ֤י מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ אֶת־הֶ֣עָרֹ֔ב וְגַ֥ם הָאֲדָמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֥ם עָלֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: kiy im-eyn'kha m'shalecha et-'amiy hin'niy mash'liycha b'kha vva'avadeykha vv'am'kha vv'vateykha et-he'arov vmal'v batey mitz'rayim et-he'arov v'gam haadamah asher-hem 'aleyha
translation: For if you do not let My people go, I will let loose aOthers “wild beasts.”swarms of insects-a against you and your courtiers and your people and your houses; the houses of the Egyptians, and the very ground they stand on, shall be filled with swarms of insects.

hebrew: וְהִפְלֵיתִי֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַה֜וּא אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֗שֶׁן אֲשֶׁ֤ר עַמִּי֙ עֹמֵ֣ד עָלֶ֔יהָ לְבִלְתִּ֥י הֱיֽוֹת־שָׁ֖ם עָרֹ֑ב לְמַ֣עַן תֵּדַ֔ע כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה בְּקֶ֥רֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'hif'leytiy vayvom hahv et-eretz goshen asher 'amiy 'omed 'aleyha l'vil'tiy heyvot-sham 'arov l'ma'an teda' kiy aniy y'hvah b'kerev haaretz
translation: But on that day I will set apart the region of Goshen, where My people dwell, so that no swarms of insects shall be there, that you may know that I the L<small>ORD</small> am in the midst of the land.

hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֣י פְדֻ֔ת בֵּ֥ין עַמִּ֖י וּבֵ֣ין עַמֶּ֑ךָ לְמָחָ֥ר יִהְיֶ֖ה הָאֹ֥ת הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: v'sam'tiy f'dut beyn 'amiy vveyn 'amekha l'machar yih'yeh haot hazeh
translation: And I will make a distinctionbMeaning of peduth uncertain. between My people and your people. Tomorrow this sign shall come to pass.’”

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ יְהוָה֙ כֵּ֔ן וַיָּבֹא֙ עָרֹ֣ב כָּבֵ֔ד בֵּ֥יתָה פַרְעֹ֖ה וּבֵ֣ית עֲבָדָ֑יו וּבְכָל־אֶ֧רֶץ מִצְרַ֛יִם תִּשָּׁחֵ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ מִפְּנֵ֥י הֶעָרֹֽב׃
transliteration: vaya'as y'hvah ken vayavo 'arov kaved beytah far'oh vveyt 'avadayv vv'khal-eretz mitz'rayim tishachet haaretz mip'ney he'arov
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> did so. Heavy swarms of insects invaded Pharaoh’s palace and the houses of his courtiers; throughout the country of Egypt the land was ruined because of the swarms of insects.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א פַרְעֹ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה וּֽלְאַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לְכ֛וּ זִבְח֥וּ לֵֽאלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vayik'ra far'oh el-mosheh vl'aharon vayomer l'khv ziv'chv leloheykhem baaretz
translation: Then Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “Go and sacrifice to your God within the land.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה לֹ֤א נָכוֹן֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת כֵּ֔ן כִּ֚י תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת מִצְרַ֔יִם נִזְבַּ֖ח לַיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ הֵ֣ן נִזְבַּ֞ח אֶת־תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת מִצְרַ֛יִם לְעֵינֵיהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֥א יִסְקְלֻֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh lo nakhvon la'asvot ken kiy tvo'avat mitz'rayim niz'bach layhvah eloheynv hen niz'bach et-tvo'avat mitz'rayim l'eyneyhem v'lo yis'k'lunv
translation: But Moses replied, “It would not be right to do this, for what we sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small> our God is untouchable to the Egyptians. If we sacrifice that which is untouchable to the Egyptians before their very eyes, will they not stone us!

hebrew: דֶּ֚רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים נֵלֵ֖ךְ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְזָבַ֙חְנוּ֙ לַֽיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר יֹאמַ֥ר אֵלֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: derekh' sh'loshet yamiym nelekh' bamid'bar v'zavach'nv layhvah eloheynv kaasher yomar eleynv
translation: So we must go a distance of three days into the wilderness and sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small> our God as He may command us.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֗ה אָנֹכִ֞י אֲשַׁלַּ֤ח אֶתְכֶם֙ וּזְבַחְתֶּ֞ם לַיהוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר רַ֛ק הַרְחֵ֥ק לֹא־תַרְחִ֖יקוּ לָלֶ֑כֶת הַעְתִּ֖ירוּ בַּעֲדִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer par'oh anokhiy ashalach et'khem vz'vach'tem layhvah eloheykhem bamid'bar rak har'chek lo-tar'chiykv lalekhet ha'tiyrv ba'adiy
translation: Pharaoh said, “I will let you go to sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small> your God in the wilderness; but do not go very far. Plead, then, for me.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י יוֹצֵ֤א מֵֽעִמָּךְ֙ וְהַעְתַּרְתִּ֣י אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה וְסָ֣ר הֶעָרֹ֗ב מִפַּרְעֹ֛ה מֵעֲבָדָ֥יו וּמֵעַמּ֖וֹ מָחָ֑ר רַ֗ק אַל־יֹסֵ֤ף פַּרְעֹה֙ הָתֵ֔ל לְבִלְתִּי֙ שַׁלַּ֣ח אֶת־הָעָ֔ם לִזְבֹּ֖חַ לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh hineh anokhiy yvotze me'imakh' v'ha'tar'tiy el-y'hvah v'sar he'arov mipar'oh me'avadayv vme'amvo machar rak al-yosef par'oh hatel l'vil'tiy shalach et-ha'am liz'bocha layhvah
translation: And Moses said, “When I leave your presence, I will plead with the L<small>ORD</small> that the swarms of insects depart tomorrow from Pharaoh and his courtiers and his people; but let not Pharaoh again act deceitfully, not letting the people go to sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small>.”

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א מֹשֶׁ֖ה מֵעִ֣ם פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַיֶּעְתַּ֖ר אֶל־יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayetze mosheh me'im par'oh vaye'tar el-y'hvah
translation: So Moses left Pharaoh’s presence and pleaded with the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ יְהוָה֙ כִּדְבַ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיָּ֙סַר֙ הֶעָרֹ֔ב מִפַּרְעֹ֖ה מֵעֲבָדָ֣יו וּמֵעַמּ֑וֹ לֹ֥א נִשְׁאַ֖ר אֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: vaya'as y'hvah kid'var mosheh vayasar he'arov mipar'oh me'avadayv vme'amvo lo nish'ar echad
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> did as Moses asked: He removed the swarms of insects from Pharaoh, from his courtiers, and from his people; not one remained.

hebrew: וַיַּכְבֵּ֤ד פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶת־לִבּ֔וֹ גַּ֖ם בַּפַּ֣עַם הַזֹּ֑את וְלֹ֥א שִׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־הָעָֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayakh'bed par'oh et-libvo gam bapa'am hazot v'lo shilach et-ha'am (f)
translation: But Pharaoh became stubborn this time also, and would not let the people go.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בֹּ֖א אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְדִבַּרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָֽעִבְרִ֔ים שַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־עַמִּ֖י וְיַֽעַבְדֻֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh bo el-par'oh v'dibar'ta elayv koh-amar y'hvah elohey ha'iv'riym shalach et-'amiy v'ya'av'duniy
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh and say to him, ‘Thus says the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of the Hebrews: Let My people go to worship Me.

hebrew: כִּ֛י אִם־מָאֵ֥ן אַתָּ֖ה לְשַׁלֵּ֑חַ וְעוֹדְךָ֖ מַחֲזִ֥יק בָּֽם׃
transliteration: kiy im-maen atah l'shalecha v'vod'kha machaziyk bam
translation: For if you refuse to let them go, and continue to hold them,

hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה יַד־יְהוָ֜ה הוֹיָ֗ה בְּמִקְנְךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה בַּסּוּסִ֤ים בַּֽחֲמֹרִים֙ בַּגְּמַלִּ֔ים בַּבָּקָ֖ר וּבַצֹּ֑אן דֶּ֖בֶר כָּבֵ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: hineh yad-y'hvah hvoyah b'mik'n'kha asher basadeh basvsiym bachamoriym bag'maliym babakar vvatzon dever kaved m'od
translation: then the hand of the L<small>ORD</small> will strike your livestock in the fields—the horses, the asses, the camels, the cattle, and the sheep—with a very severe pestilence.

hebrew: וְהִפְלָ֣ה יְהוָ֔ה בֵּ֚ין מִקְנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּבֵ֖ין מִקְנֵ֣ה מִצְרָ֑יִם וְלֹ֥א יָמ֛וּת מִכָּל־לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל דָּבָֽר׃
transliteration: v'hif'lah y'hvah beyn mik'neh yis'rael vveyn mik'neh mitz'rayim v'lo yamvt mikal-liv'ney yis'rael davar
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> will make a distinction between the livestock of Israel and the livestock of the Egyptians, so that nothing shall die of all that belongs to the Israelites.

hebrew: וַיָּ֥שֶׂם יְהוָ֖ה מוֹעֵ֣ד לֵאמֹ֑ר מָחָ֗ר יַעֲשֶׂ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vayasem y'hvah mvo'ed lemor machar ya'aseh y'hvah hadavar hazeh baaretz
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> has fixed the time: tomorrow the L<small>ORD</small> will do this thing in the land.’”

hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ יְהוָ֜ה אֶת־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ מִֽמָּחֳרָ֔ת וַיָּ֕מָת כֹּ֖ל מִקְנֵ֣ה מִצְרָ֑יִם וּמִמִּקְנֵ֥ה בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹא־מֵ֥ת אֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: vaya'as y'hvah et-hadavar hazeh mimachorat vayamat kol mik'neh mitz'rayim vmimik'neh v'ney-yis'rael lo-met echad
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> did so the next day: all the livestock of the Egyptians died, but of the livestock of the Israelites not a beast died.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֗ה לֹא־מֵ֛ת מִמִּקְנֵ֥ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַד־אֶחָ֑ד וַיִּכְבַּד֙ לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְלֹ֥א שִׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־הָעָֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayish'lach par'oh v'hineh lo-met mimik'neh yis'rael 'ad-echad vayikh'bad lev par'oh v'lo shilach et-ha'am (f)
translation: When Pharaoh inquired, he found that not a head of the livestock of Israel had died; yet Pharaoh remained stubborn, and he would not let the people go.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֒ קְח֤וּ לָכֶם֙ מְלֹ֣א חָפְנֵיכֶ֔ם פִּ֖יחַ כִּבְשָׁ֑ן וּזְרָק֥וֹ מֹשֶׁ֛ה הַשָּׁמַ֖יְמָה לְעֵינֵ֥י פַרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon k'chv lakhem m'lo chaf'neykhem piycha kiv'shan vz'rakvo mosheh hashamay'mah l'eyney far'oh
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses and Aaron, “Each of you take handfuls of soot from the kiln, and let Moses throw it toward the sky in the sight of Pharaoh.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה לְאָבָ֔ק עַ֖ל כָּל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהָיָ֨ה עַל־הָאָדָ֜ם וְעַל־הַבְּהֵמָ֗ה לִשְׁחִ֥ין פֹּרֵ֛חַ אֲבַעְבֻּעֹ֖ת בְּכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'hayah l'avak 'al kal-eretz mitz'rayim v'hayah 'al-haadam v'al-hab'hemah lish'chiyn porecha ava'bu'ot b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: It shall become a fine dust all over the land of Egypt, and cause an inflammation breaking out in boils on man and beast throughout the land of Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיִּקְח֞וּ אֶת־פִּ֣יחַ הַכִּבְשָׁ֗ן וַיַּֽעַמְדוּ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וַיִּזְרֹ֥ק אֹת֛וֹ מֹשֶׁ֖ה הַשָּׁמָ֑יְמָה וַיְהִ֗י שְׁחִין֙ אֲבַעְבֻּעֹ֔ת פֹּרֵ֕חַ בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָֽה׃
transliteration: vayik'chv et-piycha hakiv'shan vaya'am'dv lif'ney far'oh vayiz'rok otvo mosheh hashamay'mah vay'hiy sh'chiyn ava'bu'ot porecha baadam vvab'hemah
translation: So they took soot of the kiln and appeared before Pharaoh; Moses threw it toward the sky, and it caused an inflammation breaking out in boils on man and beast.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יָכְל֣וּ הַֽחַרְטֻמִּ֗ים לַעֲמֹ֛ד לִפְנֵ֥י מֹשֶׁ֖ה מִפְּנֵ֣י הַשְּׁחִ֑ין כִּֽי־הָיָ֣ה הַשְּׁחִ֔ין בַּֽחֲרְטֻמִּ֖ם וּבְכָל־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'lo-yakh'lv hachar'tumiym la'amod lif'ney mosheh mip'ney hash'chiyn kiy-hayah hash'chiyn bachar'tumim vv'khal-mitz'rayim
translation: The magicians were unable to confront Moses because of the inflammation, for the inflammation afflicted the magicians as well as all the other Egyptians.

hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּ֤ק יְהוָה֙ אֶת־לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖ע אֲלֵהֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'chazek y'hvah et-lev par'oh v'lo shama' alehem kaasher diber y'hvah el-mosheh (s)
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> stiffened the heart of Pharaoh, and he would not heed them, just as the L<small>ORD</small> had told Moses.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה הַשְׁכֵּ֣ם בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וְהִתְיַצֵּ֖ב לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָֽעִבְרִ֔ים שַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־עַמִּ֖י וְיַֽעַבְדֻֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh hash'kem baboker v'hit'yatzev lif'ney far'oh v'amar'ta elayv koh-amar y'hvah elohey ha'iv'riym shalach et-'amiy v'ya'av'duniy
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Early in the morning present yourself to Pharaoh and say to him, ‘Thus says the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of the Hebrews: Let My people go to worship Me.

hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ בַּפַּ֣עַם הַזֹּ֗את אֲנִ֨י שֹׁלֵ֜חַ אֶת־כָּל־מַגֵּפֹתַי֙ אֶֽל־לִבְּךָ֔ וּבַעֲבָדֶ֖יךָ וּבְעַמֶּ֑ךָ בַּעֲב֣וּר תֵּדַ֔ע כִּ֛י אֵ֥ין כָּמֹ֖נִי בְּכָל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: kiy  bapa'am hazot aniy sholecha et-kal-magefotay el-lib'kha vva'avadeykha vv'amekha ba'avvr teda' kiy eyn kamoniy b'khal-haaretz
translation: For this time I will send all My plagues upon your person, and your courtiers, and your people, in order that you may know that there is none like Me in all the world.

hebrew: כִּ֤י עַתָּה֙ שָׁלַ֣חְתִּי אֶת־יָדִ֔י וָאַ֥ךְ אוֹתְךָ֛ וְאֶֽת־עַמְּךָ֖ בַּדָּ֑בֶר וַתִּכָּחֵ֖ד מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: kiy 'atah shalach'tiy et-yadiy vaakh' vot'kha v'et-'am'kha badaver vatikached min-haaretz
translation: I could have stretched forth My hand and stricken you and your people with pestilence, and you would have been effaced from the earth.

hebrew: וְאוּלָ֗ם בַּעֲב֥וּר זֹאת֙ הֶעֱמַדְתִּ֔יךָ בַּעֲב֖וּר הַרְאֹתְךָ֣ אֶת־כֹּחִ֑י וּלְמַ֛עַן סַפֵּ֥ר שְׁמִ֖י בְּכָל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'vlam ba'avvr zot he'emad'tiykha ba'avvr har'ot'kha et-kochiy vl'ma'an saper sh'miy b'khal-haaretz
translation: Nevertheless I have spared you for this purpose: in order to show you My power, and in order that My fame may resound throughout the world.

hebrew: עוֹדְךָ֖ מִסְתּוֹלֵ֣ל בְּעַמִּ֑י לְבִלְתִּ֖י שַׁלְּחָֽם׃
transliteration: 'vod'kha mis'tvolel b'amiy l'vil'tiy shal'cham
translation: Yet you continue to thwartaOthers “exalt yourself over.” My people, and do not let them go!

hebrew: הִנְנִ֤י מַמְטִיר֙ כָּעֵ֣ת מָחָ֔ר בָּרָ֖ד כָּבֵ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־הָיָ֤ה כָמֹ֙הוּ֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם לְמִן־הַיּ֥וֹם הִוָּסְדָ֖ה וְעַד־עָֽתָּה׃
transliteration: hin'niy mam'tiyr ka'et machar barad kaved m'od asher lo-hayah khamohv b'mitz'rayim l'min-hayvom hivas'dah v'ad-'atah
translation: This time tomorrow I will rain down a very heavy hail, such as has not been in Egypt from the day it was founded until now.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה שְׁלַ֤ח הָעֵז֙ אֶֽת־מִקְנְךָ֔ וְאֵ֛ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְךָ֖ בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה כָּל־הָאָדָ֨ם וְהַבְּהֵמָ֜ה אֲשֶֽׁר־יִמָּצֵ֣א בַשָּׂדֶ֗ה וְלֹ֤א יֵֽאָסֵף֙ הַבַּ֔יְתָה וְיָרַ֧ד עֲלֵהֶ֛ם הַבָּרָ֖ד וָמֵֽתוּ׃
transliteration: v'atah sh'lach ha'ez et-mik'n'kha v'et kal-asher l'kha basadeh kal-haadam v'hab'hemah asher-yimatze vasadeh v'lo yeasef habay'tah v'yarad 'alehem habarad vametv
translation: Therefore, order your livestock and everything you have in the open brought under shelter; every man and beast that is found outside, not having been brought indoors, shall perish when the hail comes down upon them!’”

hebrew: הַיָּרֵא֙ אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה מֵֽעַבְדֵ֖י פַּרְעֹ֑ה הֵנִ֛יס אֶת־עֲבָדָ֥יו וְאֶת־מִקְנֵ֖הוּ אֶל־הַבָּתִּֽים׃
transliteration: hayare et-d'var y'hvah me'av'dey par'oh heniys et-'avadayv v'et-mik'nehv el-habatiym
translation: Those among Pharaoh’s courtiers who feared the L<small>ORD</small>’s word brought their slaves and livestock indoors to safety;

hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־שָׂ֛ם לִבּ֖וֹ אֶל־דְּבַ֣ר יְהוָ֑ה וַֽיַּעֲזֹ֛ב אֶת־עֲבָדָ֥יו וְאֶת־מִקְנֵ֖הוּ בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vaasher lo-sam libvo el-d'var y'hvah vaya'azov et-'avadayv v'et-mik'nehv basadeh (f)
translation: but those who paid no regard to the word of the L<small>ORD</small> left their slaves and livestock in the open.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה נְטֵ֤ה אֶת־יָֽדְךָ֙ עַל־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וִיהִ֥י בָרָ֖ד בְּכָל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם עַל־הָאָדָ֣ם וְעַל־הַבְּהֵמָ֗ה וְעַ֛ל כָּל־עֵ֥שֶׂב הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh n'teh et-yad'kha 'al-hashamayim viyhiy varad b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim 'al-haadam v'al-hab'hemah v'al kal-'esev hasadeh b'eretz mitz'rayim
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Hold out your arm toward the sky that hail may fall on all the land of Egypt, upon man and beast and all the grasses of the field in the land of Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨ט מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶת־מַטֵּהוּ֮ עַל־הַשָּׁמַיִם֒ וַֽיהוָ֗ה נָתַ֤ן קֹלֹת֙ וּבָרָ֔ד וַתִּ֥הֲלַךְ אֵ֖שׁ אָ֑רְצָה וַיַּמְטֵ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה בָּרָ֖ד עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayet mosheh et-matehv 'al-hashamayim vayhvah natan kolot vvarad vatihalakh' esh ar'tzah vayam'ter y'hvah barad 'al-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: So Moses held out his rod toward the sky, and the L<small>ORD</small> sent thunder and hail, and fire streamed down to the ground, as the L<small>ORD</small> rained down hail upon the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בָרָ֔ד וְאֵ֕שׁ מִתְלַקַּ֖חַת בְּת֣וֹךְ הַבָּרָ֑ד כָּבֵ֣ד מְאֹ֔ד אֲ֠שֶׁר לֹֽא־הָיָ֤ה כָמֹ֙הוּ֙ בְּכָל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מֵאָ֖ז הָיְתָ֥ה לְגֽוֹי׃
transliteration: vay'hiy varad v'esh mit'lakachat b'tvokh' habarad kaved m'od asher lo-hayah khamohv b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim meaz hay'tah l'gvoy
translation: The hail was very heavy—fire flashing in the midst of the hail—such as had not fallen on the land of Egypt since it had become a nation.

hebrew: וַיַּ֨ךְ הַבָּרָ֜ד בְּכָל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֗יִם אֵ֚ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה מֵאָדָ֖ם וְעַד־בְּהֵמָ֑ה וְאֵ֨ת כָּל־עֵ֤שֶׂב הַשָּׂדֶה֙ הִכָּ֣ה הַבָּרָ֔ד וְאֶת־כָּל־עֵ֥ץ הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה שִׁבֵּֽר׃
transliteration: vayakh' habarad b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim et kal-asher basadeh meadam v'ad-b'hemah v'et kal-'esev hasadeh hikah habarad v'et-kal-'etz hasadeh shiber
translation: Throughout the land of Egypt the hail struck down all that were in the open, both man and beast; the hail also struck down all the grasses of the field and shattered all the trees of the field.

hebrew: רַ֚ק בְּאֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֔שֶׁן אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לֹ֥א הָיָ֖ה בָּרָֽד׃
transliteration: rak b'eretz goshen asher-sham b'ney yis'rael lo hayah barad
translation: Only in the region of Goshen, where the Israelites were, there was no hail.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח פַּרְעֹ֗ה וַיִּקְרָא֙ לְמֹשֶׁ֣ה וּֽלְאַהֲרֹ֔ן וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֖ם חָטָ֣אתִי הַפָּ֑עַם יְהוָה֙ הַצַּדִּ֔יק וַאֲנִ֥י וְעַמִּ֖י הָרְשָׁעִֽים׃
transliteration: vayish'lach par'oh vayik'ra l'mosheh vl'aharon vayomer alehem chatatiy hapa'am y'hvah hatzadiyk vaaniy v'amiy har'sha'iym
translation: Thereupon Pharaoh sent for Moses and Aaron and said to them, “I stand guilty this time. The L<small>ORD</small> is in the right, and I and my people are in the wrong.

hebrew: הַעְתִּ֙ירוּ֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה וְרַ֕ב מִֽהְיֹ֛ת קֹלֹ֥ת אֱלֹהִ֖ים וּבָרָ֑ד וַאֲשַׁלְּחָ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תֹסִפ֖וּן לַעֲמֹֽד׃
transliteration: ha'tiyrv el-y'hvah v'rav mih'yot kolot elohiym vvarad vaashal'chah et'khem v'lo tosifvn la'amod
translation: Plead with the L<small>ORD</small> that there may be an end of God’s thunder and of hail. I will let you go; you need stay no longer.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה כְּצֵאתִי֙ אֶת־הָעִ֔יר אֶפְרֹ֥שׂ אֶת־כַּפַּ֖י אֶל־יְהוָ֑ה הַקֹּל֣וֹת יֶחְדָּל֗וּן וְהַבָּרָד֙ לֹ֣א יִֽהְיֶה־ע֔וֹד לְמַ֣עַן תֵּדַ֔ע כִּ֥י לַיהוָ֖ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv mosheh k'tzetiy et-ha'iyr ef'ros et-kapay el-y'hvah hakolvot yech'dalvn v'habarad lo yih'yeh-'vod l'ma'an teda' kiy layhvah haaretz
translation: Moses said to him, “As I go out of the city, I shall spread out my hands to the L<small>ORD</small>; the thunder will cease and the hail will fall no more, so that you may know that the earth is the L<small>ORD</small>’s.

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֖ה וַעֲבָדֶ֑יךָ יָדַ֕עְתִּי כִּ֚י טֶ֣רֶם תִּֽירְא֔וּן מִפְּנֵ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: v'atah va'avadeykha yada'tiy kiy terem tiyr'vn mip'ney y'hvah elohiym
translation: But I know that you and your courtiers do not yet fear the L<small>ORD</small> God.”—

hebrew: וְהַפִּשְׁתָּ֥ה וְהַשְּׂעֹרָ֖ה נֻכָּ֑תָה כִּ֤י הַשְּׂעֹרָה֙ אָבִ֔יב וְהַפִּשְׁתָּ֖ה גִּבְעֹֽל׃
transliteration: v'hapish'tah v'has'orah nukatah kiy has'orah aviyv v'hapish'tah giv'ol
translation: Now the flax and barley were ruined, for the barley was in the ear and the flax was in bud;

hebrew: וְהַחִטָּ֥ה וְהַכֻּסֶּ֖מֶת לֹ֣א נֻכּ֑וּ כִּ֥י אֲפִילֹ֖ת הֵֽנָּה׃
transliteration: v'hachitah v'hakusemet lo nukv kiy afiylot henah
translation: but the wheat and the emmerbA kind of wheat. were not hurt, for they ripen late.—

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א מֹשֶׁ֜ה מֵעִ֤ם פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶת־הָעִ֔יר וַיִּפְרֹ֥שׂ כַּפָּ֖יו אֶל־יְהוָ֑ה וַֽיַּחְדְּל֤וּ הַקֹּלוֹת֙ וְהַבָּרָ֔ד וּמָטָ֖ר לֹא־נִתַּ֥ךְ אָֽרְצָה׃
transliteration: vayetze mosheh me'im par'oh et-ha'iyr vayif'ros kapayv el-y'hvah vayach'd'lv hakolvot v'habarad vmatar lo-nitakh' ar'tzah
translation: Leaving Pharaoh, Moses went outside the city and spread out his hands to the L<small>ORD</small>: the thunder and the hail ceased, and no rain came pouring down upon the earth.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא פַּרְעֹ֗ה כִּֽי־חָדַ֨ל הַמָּטָ֧ר וְהַבָּרָ֛ד וְהַקֹּלֹ֖ת וַיֹּ֣סֶף לַחֲטֹ֑א וַיַּכְבֵּ֥ד לִבּ֖וֹ ה֥וּא וַעֲבָדָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayar' par'oh kiy-chadal hamatar v'habarad v'hakolot vayosef lachato vayakh'bed libvo hv va'avadayv
translation: But when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunder had ceased, he became stubborn and reverted to his guilty ways, as did his courtiers.

hebrew: וַֽיֶּחֱזַק֙ לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְלֹ֥א שִׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayechezak lev par'oh v'lo shilach et-b'ney yis'rael kaasher diber y'hvah b'yad-mosheh (f)
translation: So Pharaoh’s heart stiffened and he would not let the Israelites go, just as the L<small>ORD</small> had foretold through Moses.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בֹּ֖א אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה כִּֽי־אֲנִ֞י הִכְבַּ֤דְתִּי אֶת־לִבּוֹ֙ וְאֶת־לֵ֣ב עֲבָדָ֔יו לְמַ֗עַן שִׁתִ֛י אֹתֹתַ֥י אֵ֖לֶּה בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh bo el-par'oh kiy-aniy hikh'bad'tiy et-libvo v'et-lev 'avadayv l'ma'an shitiy ototay eleh b'kir'bvo
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh. For I have hardened his heart and the hearts of his courtiers, in order that I may display these My signs among them,

hebrew: וּלְמַ֡עַן תְּסַפֵּר֩ בְּאָזְנֵ֨י בִנְךָ֜ וּבֶן־בִּנְךָ֗ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִתְעַלַּ֙לְתִּי֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וְאֶת־אֹתֹתַ֖י אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֣מְתִּי בָ֑ם וִֽידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּי־אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vl'ma'an t'saper b'az'ney vin'kha vven-bin'kha et asher hit'alal'tiy b'mitz'rayim v'et-ototay asher-sam'tiy vam viyda'tem kiy-aniy y'hvah
translation: and that you may recount in the hearing of your child and of your child’s child how I made a mockery of the Egyptians and how I displayed My signs among them—in order that you may know that I am the L<small>ORD</small>.”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹן֮ אֶל־פַּרְעֹה֒ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָֽעִבְרִ֔ים עַד־מָתַ֣י מֵאַ֔נְתָּ לֵעָנֹ֖ת מִפָּנָ֑י שַׁלַּ֥ח עַמִּ֖י וְיַֽעַבְדֻֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayavo mosheh v'aharon el-par'oh vayom'rv elayv koh-amar y'hvah elohey ha'iv'riym 'ad-matay mean'ta le'anot mipanay shalach 'amiy v'ya'av'duniy
translation: So Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and said to him, “Thus says the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of the Hebrews, ‘How long will you refuse to humble yourself before Me? Let My people go that they may worship Me.

hebrew: כִּ֛י אִם־מָאֵ֥ן אַתָּ֖ה לְשַׁלֵּ֣חַ אֶת־עַמִּ֑י הִנְנִ֨י מֵבִ֥יא מָחָ֛ר אַרְבֶּ֖ה בִּגְבֻלֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: kiy im-maen atah l'shalecha et-'amiy hin'niy meviy machar ar'beh big'vulekha
translation: For if you refuse to let My people go, tomorrow I will bring locusts on your territory.

hebrew: וְכִסָּה֙ אֶת־עֵ֣ין הָאָ֔רֶץ וְלֹ֥א יוּכַ֖ל לִרְאֹ֣ת אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְאָכַ֣ל ׀ אֶת־יֶ֣תֶר הַפְּלֵטָ֗ה הַנִּשְׁאֶ֤רֶת לָכֶם֙ מִן־הַבָּרָ֔ד וְאָכַל֙ אֶת־כָּל־הָעֵ֔ץ הַצֹּמֵ֥חַ לָכֶ֖ם מִן־הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'khisah et-'eyn haaretz v'lo yvkhal lir'ot et-haaretz v'akhal  et-yeter hap'letah hanish'eret lakhem min-habarad v'akhal et-kal-ha'etz hatzomecha lakhem min-hasadeh
translation: They shall cover the surface of the land, so that no one will be able to see the land. They shall devour the surviving remnant that was left to you after the hail; and they shall eat away all your trees that grow in the field.

hebrew: וּמָלְא֨וּ בָתֶּ֜יךָ וּבָתֵּ֣י כָל־עֲבָדֶיךָ֮ וּבָתֵּ֣י כָל־מִצְרַיִם֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־רָא֤וּ אֲבֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ וַאֲב֣וֹת אֲבֹתֶ֔יךָ מִיּ֗וֹם הֱיוֹתָם֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַיִּ֥פֶן וַיֵּצֵ֖א מֵעִ֥ם פַּרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: vmal'v vateykha vvatey khal-'avadeykha vvatey khal-mitz'rayim asher lo-rav avoteykha vaavvot avoteykha miyvom heyvotam 'al-haadamah 'ad hayvom hazeh vayifen vayetze me'im par'oh
translation: Moreover, they shall fill your palaces and the houses of all your courtiers and of all the Egyptians—something that neither your fathers nor fathers’ fathers have seen from the day they appeared on earth to this day.’” With that he turned and left Pharaoh’s presence.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֩ עַבְדֵ֨י פַרְעֹ֜ה אֵלָ֗יו עַד־מָתַי֙ יִהְיֶ֨ה זֶ֥ה לָ֙נוּ֙ לְמוֹקֵ֔שׁ שַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְיַֽעַבְד֖וּ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם הֲטֶ֣רֶם תֵּדַ֔ע כִּ֥י אָבְדָ֖ה מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayom'rv 'av'dey far'oh elayv 'ad-matay yih'yeh zeh lanv l'mvokesh shalach et-haanashiym v'ya'av'dv et-y'hvah eloheyhem haterem teda' kiy av'dah mitz'rayim
translation: Pharaoh’s courtiers said to him, “How long shall this one be a snare to us? Let the men go to worship the L<small>ORD</small> their God! Are you not yet aware that Egypt is lost?”

hebrew: וַיּוּשַׁ֞ב אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְאֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם לְכ֥וּ עִבְד֖וּ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם מִ֥י וָמִ֖י הַהֹלְכִֽים׃
transliteration: vayvshav et-mosheh v'et-aharon el-par'oh vayomer alehem l'khv 'iv'dv et-y'hvah eloheykhem miy vamiy hahol'khiym
translation: So Moses and Aaron were brought back to Pharaoh and he said to them, “Go, worship the L<small>ORD</small> your God! Who are the ones to go?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה בִּנְעָרֵ֥ינוּ וּבִזְקֵנֵ֖ינוּ נֵלֵ֑ךְ בְּבָנֵ֨ינוּ וּבִבְנוֹתֵ֜נוּ בְּצֹאנֵ֤נוּ וּבִבְקָרֵ֙נוּ֙ נֵלֵ֔ךְ כִּ֥י חַג־יְהוָ֖ה לָֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh bin'areynv vviz'keneynv nelekh' b'vaneynv vviv'nvotenv b'tzonenv vviv'karenv nelekh' kiy chag-y'hvah lanv
translation: Moses replied, “We will all go, young and old: we will go with our sons and daughters, our flocks and herds; for we must observe the L<small>ORD</small>’s festival.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם יְהִ֨י כֵ֤ן יְהוָה֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר אֲשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶתְכֶ֖ם וְאֶֽת־טַפְּכֶ֑ם רְא֕וּ כִּ֥י רָעָ֖ה נֶ֥גֶד פְּנֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem y'hiy khen y'hvah 'imakhem kaasher ashalach et'khem v'et-tap'khem r'v kiy ra'ah neged p'neykhem
translation: But he said to them, “The L<small>ORD</small> be with you—the same as I mean to let your children go with you! Clearly, you are bent on mischief.

hebrew: לֹ֣א כֵ֗ן לְכֽוּ־נָ֤א הַגְּבָרִים֙ וְעִבְד֣וּ אֶת־יְהוָ֔ה כִּ֥י אֹתָ֖הּ אַתֶּ֣ם מְבַקְשִׁ֑ים וַיְגָ֣רֶשׁ אֹתָ֔ם מֵאֵ֖ת פְּנֵ֥י פַרְעֹֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: lo khen l'khv-na hag'variym v'iv'dv et-y'hvah kiy otah atem m'vak'shiym vay'garesh otam meet p'ney far'oh (f)
translation: No! You menfolk go and worship the L<small>ORD</small>, since that is what you want.” And they were expelled from Pharaoh’s presence.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה נְטֵ֨ה יָדְךָ֜ עַל־אֶ֤רֶץ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ בָּֽאַרְבֶּ֔ה וְיַ֖עַל עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְיֹאכַל֙ אֶת־כָּל־עֵ֣שֶׂב הָאָ֔רֶץ אֵ֛ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִשְׁאִ֖יר הַבָּרָֽד׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh n'teh yad'kha 'al-eretz mitz'rayim baar'beh v'ya'al 'al-eretz mitz'rayim v'yokhal et-kal-'esev haaretz et kal-asher hish'iyr habarad
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Hold out your arm over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come upon the land of Egypt and eat up all the grasses in the land, whatever the hail has left.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨ט מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶת־מַטֵּהוּ֮ עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַיִם֒ וַֽיהוָ֗ה נִהַ֤ג ר֥וּחַ קָדִים֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ כָּל־הַיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא וְכָל־הַלָּ֑יְלָה הַבֹּ֣קֶר הָיָ֔ה וְר֙וּחַ֙ הַקָּדִ֔ים נָשָׂ֖א אֶת־הָאַרְבֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayet mosheh et-matehv 'al-eretz mitz'rayim vayhvah nihag rvcha kadiym baaretz kal-hayvom hahv v'khal-halay'lah haboker hayah v'rvcha hakadiym nasa et-haar'beh
translation: So Moses held out his rod over the land of Egypt, and the L<small>ORD</small> drove an east wind over the land all that day and all night; and when morning came, the east wind had brought the locusts.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַל הָֽאַרְבֶּ֗ה עַ֚ל כָּל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיָּ֕נַח בְּכֹ֖ל גְּב֣וּל מִצְרָ֑יִם כָּבֵ֣ד מְאֹ֔ד לְ֠פָנָיו לֹא־הָ֨יָה כֵ֤ן אַרְבֶּה֙ כָּמֹ֔הוּ וְאַחֲרָ֖יו לֹ֥א יִֽהְיֶה־כֵּֽן׃
transliteration: vaya'al haar'beh 'al kal-eretz mitz'rayim vayanach b'khol g'vvl mitz'rayim kaved m'od l'fanayv lo-hayah khen ar'beh kamohv v'acharayv lo yih'yeh-ken
translation: Locusts invaded all the land of Egypt and settled within all the territory of Egypt in a thick mass; never before had there been so many, nor will there ever be so many again.

hebrew: וַיְכַ֞ס אֶת־עֵ֣ין כָּל־הָאָרֶץ֮ וַתֶּחְשַׁ֣ךְ הָאָרֶץ֒ וַיֹּ֜אכַל אֶת־כָּל־עֵ֣שֶׂב הָאָ֗רֶץ וְאֵת֙ כָּל־פְּרִ֣י הָעֵ֔ץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹתִ֖יר הַבָּרָ֑ד וְלֹא־נוֹתַ֨ר כָּל־יֶ֧רֶק בָּעֵ֛ץ וּבְעֵ֥שֶׂב הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה בְּכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vay'khas et-'eyn kal-haaretz vatech'shakh' haaretz vayokhal et-kal-'esev haaretz v'et kal-p'riy ha'etz asher hvotiyr habarad v'lo-nvotar kal-yerek ba'etz vv'esev hasadeh b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim
translation: They hid all the land from view, and the land was darkened; and they ate up all the grasses of the field and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left, so that nothing green was left, of tree or grass of the field, in all the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וַיְמַהֵ֣ר פַּרְעֹ֔ה לִקְרֹ֖א לְמֹשֶׁ֣ה וּֽלְאַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיֹּ֗אמֶר חָטָ֛אתִי לַיהוָ֥ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֖ם וְלָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vay'maher par'oh lik'ro l'mosheh vl'aharon vayomer chatatiy layhvah eloheykhem v'lakhem
translation: Pharaoh hurriedly summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “I stand guilty before the L<small>ORD</small> your God and before you.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה שָׂ֣א נָ֤א חַטָּאתִי֙ אַ֣ךְ הַפַּ֔עַם וְהַעְתִּ֖ירוּ לַיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם וְיָסֵר֙ מֵֽעָלַ֔י רַ֖ק אֶת־הַמָּ֥וֶת הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: v'atah sa na chatatiy akh' hapa'am v'ha'tiyrv layhvah eloheykhem v'yaser me'alay rak et-hamavet hazeh
translation: Forgive my offense just this once, and plead with the L<small>ORD</small> your God that He but remove this death from me.”

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֖א מֵעִ֣ם פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַיֶּעְתַּ֖ר אֶל־יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayetze me'im par'oh vaye'tar el-y'hvah
translation: So he left Pharaoh’s presence and pleaded with the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיַּהֲפֹ֨ךְ יְהוָ֤ה רֽוּחַ־יָם֙ חָזָ֣ק מְאֹ֔ד וַיִּשָּׂא֙ אֶת־הָ֣אַרְבֶּ֔ה וַיִּתְקָעֵ֖הוּ יָ֣מָּה סּ֑וּף לֹ֤א נִשְׁאַר֙ אַרְבֶּ֣ה אֶחָ֔ד בְּכֹ֖ל גְּב֥וּל מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayahafokh' y'hvah rvcha-yam chazak m'od vayisa et-haar'beh vayit'ka'ehv yamah svf lo nish'ar ar'beh echad b'khol g'vvl mitz'rayim
translation: The LORD caused a shift to a very strong west wind, which lifted the locusts and hurled them into the Sea of Reeds;aTraditionally, but incorrectly, “Red Sea.” not a single locust remained in all the territory of Egypt.

hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּ֥ק יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְלֹ֥א שִׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'chazek y'hvah et-lev par'oh v'lo shilach et-b'ney yis'rael (f)
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> stiffened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let the Israelites go.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה נְטֵ֤ה יָֽדְךָ֙ עַל־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וִ֥יהִי חֹ֖שֶׁךְ עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְיָמֵ֖שׁ חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh n'teh yad'kha 'al-hashamayim viyhiy choshekh' 'al-eretz mitz'rayim v'yamesh choshekh'
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Hold out your arm toward the sky that there may be darkness upon the land of Egypt, a darkness that can be touched.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥ט מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־יָד֖וֹ עַל־הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַיְהִ֧י חֹֽשֶׁךְ־אֲפֵלָ֛ה בְּכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: vayet mosheh et-yadvo 'al-hashamayim vay'hiy choshekh'-afelah b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim sh'loshet yamiym
translation: Moses held out his arm toward the sky and thick darkness descended upon all the land of Egypt for three days.

hebrew: לֹֽא־רָא֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־אָחִ֗יו וְלֹא־קָ֛מוּ אִ֥ישׁ מִתַּחְתָּ֖יו שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים וּֽלְכָל־בְּנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הָ֥יָה א֖וֹר בְּמוֹשְׁבֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: lo-rav iysh et-achiyv v'lo-kamv iysh mitach'tayv sh'loshet yamiym vl'khal-b'ney yis'rael hayah vor b'mvosh'votam
translation: People could not see one another, and for three days no one could get up from where he was; but all the Israelites enjoyed light in their dwellings.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א פַרְעֹ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לְכוּ֙ עִבְד֣וּ אֶת־יְהוָ֔ה רַ֛ק צֹאנְכֶ֥ם וּבְקַרְכֶ֖ם יֻצָּ֑ג גַּֽם־טַפְּכֶ֖ם יֵלֵ֥ךְ עִמָּכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayik'ra far'oh el-mosheh vayomer l'khv 'iv'dv et-y'hvah rak tzon'khem vv'kar'khem yutzag gam-tap'khem yelekh' 'imakhem
translation: Pharaoh then summoned Moses and said, “Go, worship the L<small>ORD</small>! Only your flocks and your herds shall be left behind; even your children may go with you.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה גַּם־אַתָּ֛ה תִּתֵּ֥ן בְּיָדֵ֖נוּ זְבָחִ֣ים וְעֹל֑וֹת וְעָשִׂ֖ינוּ לַיהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh gam-atah titen b'yadenv z'vachiym v'olvot v'asiynv layhvah eloheynv
translation: But Moses said, “You yourself must provide us with sacrifices and burnt offerings to offer up to the L<small>ORD</small> our God;

hebrew: וְגַם־מִקְנֵ֜נוּ יֵלֵ֣ךְ עִמָּ֗נוּ לֹ֤א תִשָּׁאֵר֙ פַּרְסָ֔ה כִּ֚י מִמֶּ֣נּוּ נִקַּ֔ח לַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וַאֲנַ֣חְנוּ לֹֽא־נֵדַ֗ע מַֽה־נַּעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֔ה עַד־בֹּאֵ֖נוּ שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: v'gam-mik'nenv yelekh' 'imanv lo tishaer par'sah kiy mimenv nikach la'avod et-y'hvah eloheynv vaanach'nv lo-neda' mah-na'avod et-y'hvah 'ad-boenv shamah
translation: our own livestock, too, shall go along with us—not a hoof shall remain behind: for we must select from it for the worship of the L<small>ORD</small> our God; and we shall not know with what we are to worship the L<small>ORD</small> until we arrive there.”

hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּ֥ק יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְלֹ֥א אָבָ֖ה לְשַׁלְּחָֽם׃
transliteration: vay'chazek y'hvah et-lev par'oh v'lo avah l'shal'cham
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> stiffened Pharaoh’s heart and he would not agree to let them go.

hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמֶר־ל֥וֹ פַרְעֹ֖ה לֵ֣ךְ מֵעָלָ֑י הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֗ אֶל־תֹּ֙סֶף֙ רְא֣וֹת פָּנַ֔י כִּ֗י בְּי֛וֹם רְאֹתְךָ֥ פָנַ֖י תָּמֽוּת׃
transliteration: vayomer-lvo far'oh lekh' me'alay hishamer l'kha el-tosef r'vot panay kiy b'yvom r'ot'kha fanay tamvt
translation: Pharaoh said to him, “Be gone from me! Take care not to see me again, for the moment you look upon my face you shall die.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה כֵּ֣ן דִּבַּ֑רְתָּ לֹא־אֹסִ֥ף ע֖וֹד רְא֥וֹת פָּנֶֽיךָ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayomer mosheh ken dibar'ta lo-osif 'vod r'vot paneykha (f)
translation: And Moses replied, “You have spoken rightly. I shall not see your face again!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה ע֣וֹד נֶ֤גַע אֶחָד֙ אָבִ֤יא עַל־פַּרְעֹה֙ וְעַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֕ן יְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִזֶּ֑ה כְּשַׁ֨לְּח֔וֹ כָּלָ֕ה גָּרֵ֛שׁ יְגָרֵ֥שׁ אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh 'vod nega' echad aviy 'al-par'oh v'al-mitz'rayim acharey-khen y'shalach et'khem mizeh k'shal'chvo kalah garesh y'garesh et'khem mizeh
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “I will bring but one more plague upon Pharaoh and upon Egypt; after that he shall let you go from here; indeed, when he lets you go, he will drive you out of here one and all.

hebrew: דַּבֶּר־נָ֖א בְּאָזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וְיִשְׁאֲל֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ ׀ מֵאֵ֣ת רֵעֵ֗הוּ וְאִשָּׁה֙ מֵאֵ֣ת רְעוּתָ֔הּ כְּלֵי־כֶ֖סֶף וּכְלֵ֥י זָהָֽב׃
transliteration: daber-na b'az'ney ha'am v'yish'alv iysh  meet re'ehv v'ishah meet r'vtah k'ley-khesef vkh'ley zahav
translation: Tell the people to borrow, each man from his neighbor and each woman from hers, objects of silver and gold.”

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֧ן יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־חֵ֥ן הָעָ֖ם בְּעֵינֵ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם גַּ֣ם ׀ הָאִ֣ישׁ מֹשֶׁ֗ה גָּד֤וֹל מְאֹד֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּעֵינֵ֥י עַבְדֵֽי־פַרְעֹ֖ה וּבְעֵינֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayiten y'hvah et-chen ha'am b'eyney mitz'rayim gam  haiysh mosheh gadvol m'od b'eretz mitz'rayim b'eyney 'av'dey-far'oh vv'eyney ha'am (s)
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> disposed the Egyptians favorably toward the people. Moreover, Moses himself was much esteemed in the land of Egypt, among Pharaoh’s courtiers and among the people.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֑ה כַּחֲצֹ֣ת הַלַּ֔יְלָה אֲנִ֥י יוֹצֵ֖א בְּת֥וֹךְ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh koh amar y'hvah kachatzot halay'lah aniy yvotze b'tvokh' mitz'rayim
translation: Moses said, “Thus says the L<small>ORD</small>: Toward midnight I will go forth among the Egyptians,

hebrew: וּמֵ֣ת כָּל־בְּכוֹר֮ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַיִם֒ מִבְּכ֤וֹר פַּרְעֹה֙ הַיֹּשֵׁ֣ב עַל־כִּסְא֔וֹ עַ֚ד בְּכ֣וֹר הַשִּׁפְחָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר אַחַ֣ר הָרֵחָ֑יִם וְכֹ֖ל בְּכ֥וֹר בְּהֵמָֽה׃
transliteration: vmet kal-b'khvor b'eretz mitz'rayim mib'khvor par'oh hayoshev 'al-kis'vo 'ad b'khvor hashif'chah asher achar harechayim v'khol b'khvor b'hemah
translation: and every first-born in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first-born of Pharaoh who sits on his throne to the first-born of the slave girl who is behind the millstones; and all the first-born of the cattle.

hebrew: וְהָֽיְתָ֛ה צְעָקָ֥ה גְדֹלָ֖ה בְּכָל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר כָּמֹ֙הוּ֙ לֹ֣א נִהְיָ֔תָה וְכָמֹ֖הוּ לֹ֥א תֹסִֽף׃
transliteration: v'hay'tah tz'akah g'dolah b'khal-eretz mitz'rayim asher kamohv lo nih'yatah v'khamohv lo tosif
translation: And there shall be a loud cry in all the land of Egypt, such as has never been or will ever be again;

hebrew: וּלְכֹ֣ל ׀ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֹ֤א יֶֽחֱרַץ־כֶּ֙לֶב֙ לְשֹׁנ֔וֹ לְמֵאִ֖ישׁ וְעַד־בְּהֵמָ֑ה לְמַ֙עַן֙ תֵּֽדְע֔וּן אֲשֶׁר֙ יַפְלֶ֣ה יְהוָ֔ה בֵּ֥ין מִצְרַ֖יִם וּבֵ֥ין יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vl'khol  b'ney yis'rael lo yecheratz-kelev l'shonvo l'meiysh v'ad-b'hemah l'ma'an ted'vn asher yaf'leh y'hvah beyn mitz'rayim vveyn yis'rael
translation: but not a dog shall snarlaOthers “move (or whet) his tongue.” at any of the Israelites, at man or beast—in order that you may know that the LORD makes a distinction between Egypt and Israel.

hebrew: וְיָרְד֣וּ כָל־עֲבָדֶיךָ֩ אֵ֨לֶּה אֵלַ֜י וְהִשְׁתַּֽחֲוּוּ־לִ֣י לֵאמֹ֗ר צֵ֤א אַתָּה֙ וְכָל־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־בְּרַגְלֶ֔יךָ וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֖ן אֵצֵ֑א וַיֵּצֵ֥א מֵֽעִם־פַּרְעֹ֖ה בָּחֳרִי־אָֽף׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'yar'dv khal-'avadeykha eleh elay v'hish'tachavv-liy lemor tze atah v'khal-ha'am asher-b'rag'leykha v'acharey-khen etze vayetze me'im-par'oh bachoriy-af (s)
translation: Then all these courtiers of yours shall come down to me and bow low to me, saying, ‘Depart, you and all the people who follow you!’ After that I will depart.” And he left Pharaoh’s presence in hot anger.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה לֹא־יִשְׁמַ֥ע אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם פַּרְעֹ֑ה לְמַ֛עַן רְב֥וֹת מוֹפְתַ֖י בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh lo-yish'ma' aleykhem par'oh l'ma'an r'vvot mvof'tay b'eretz mitz'rayim
translation: Now the L<small>ORD</small> had said to Moses, “Pharaoh will not heed you, in order that My marvels may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.”

hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֗ן עָשׂ֛וּ אֶת־כָּל־הַמֹּפְתִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַיְחַזֵּ֤ק יְהוָה֙ אֶת־לֵ֣ב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְלֹֽא־שִׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vmosheh v'aharon 'asv et-kal-hamof'tiym haeleh lif'ney far'oh vay'chazek y'hvah et-lev par'oh v'lo-shilach et-b'ney-yis'rael mear'tzvo (f)
translation: Moses and Aaron had performed all these marvels before Pharaoh, but the L<small>ORD</small> had stiffened the heart of Pharaoh so that he would not let the Israelites go from his land.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon b'eretz mitz'rayim lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt:

hebrew: הַחֹ֧דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם רֹ֣אשׁ חֳדָשִׁ֑ים רִאשׁ֥וֹן הוּא֙ לָכֶ֔ם לְחָדְשֵׁ֖י הַשָּׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: hachodesh hazeh lakhem rosh chodashiym rishvon hv lakhem l'chad'shey hashanah
translation: This month shall mark for you the beginning of the months; it shall be the first of the months of the year for you.

hebrew: דַּבְּר֗וּ אֶֽל־כָּל־עֲדַ֤ת יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בֶּעָשֹׂ֖ר לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֑ה וְיִקְח֣וּ לָהֶ֗ם אִ֛ישׁ שֶׂ֥ה לְבֵית־אָבֹ֖ת שֶׂ֥ה לַבָּֽיִת׃
transliteration: dab'rv el-kal-'adat yis'rael lemor be'asor lachodesh hazeh v'yik'chv lahem iysh seh l'veyt-avot seh labayit
translation: Speak to the whole community of Israel and say that on the tenth of this month each of them shall take a lambaOr “kid.” Heb. seh means either “sheep” or “goat”; cf. v. 5. to a family, a lamb to a household.

hebrew: וְאִם־יִמְעַ֣ט הַבַּיִת֮ מִהְיֹ֣ת מִשֶּׂה֒ וְלָקַ֣ח ה֗וּא וּשְׁכֵנ֛וֹ הַקָּרֹ֥ב אֶל־בֵּית֖וֹ בְּמִכְסַ֣ת נְפָשֹׁ֑ת אִ֚ישׁ לְפִ֣י אָכְל֔וֹ תָּכֹ֖סּוּ עַל־הַשֶּֽׂה׃
transliteration: v'im-yim'at habayit mih'yot miseh v'lakach hv vsh'khenvo hakarov el-beytvo b'mikh'sat n'fashot iysh l'fiy akh'lvo takhosv 'al-haseh
translation: But if the household is too small for a lamb, let him share one with a neighbor who dwells nearby, in proportion to the number of persons: you shall contribute for the lamb according to what each household will eat.

hebrew: שֶׂ֥ה תָמִ֛ים זָכָ֥ר בֶּן־שָׁנָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם מִן־הַכְּבָשִׂ֥ים וּמִן־הָעִזִּ֖ים תִּקָּֽחוּ׃
transliteration: seh tamiym zakhar ben-shanah yih'yeh lakhem min-hak'vasiym vmin-ha'iziym tikachv
translation: Your lamb shall be without blemish, a yearling male; you may take it from the sheep or from the goats.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה לָכֶם֙ לְמִשְׁמֶ֔רֶת עַ֣ד אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֑ה וְשָׁחֲט֣וּ אֹת֗וֹ כֹּ֛ל קְהַ֥ל עֲדַֽת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'hayah lakhem l'mish'meret 'ad ar'ba'ah 'asar yvom lachodesh hazeh v'shachatv otvo kol k'hal 'adat-yis'rael beyn ha'ar'bayim
translation: You shall keep watch over it until the fourteenth day of this month; and all the assembled congregation of the Israelites shall slaughter it at twilight.

hebrew: וְלָֽקְחוּ֙ מִן־הַדָּ֔ם וְנָֽתְנ֛וּ עַל־שְׁתֵּ֥י הַמְּזוּזֹ֖ת וְעַל־הַמַּשְׁק֑וֹף עַ֚ל הַבָּ֣תִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־יֹאכְל֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'lak'chv min-hadam v'nat'nv 'al-sh'tey ham'zvzot v'al-hamash'kvof 'al habatiym asher-yokh'lv otvo bahem
translation: They shall take some of the blood and put it on the two doorposts and the lintel of the houses in which they are to eat it.

hebrew: וְאָכְל֥וּ אֶת־הַבָּשָׂ֖ר בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַזֶּ֑ה צְלִי־אֵ֣שׁ וּמַצּ֔וֹת עַל־מְרֹרִ֖ים יֹאכְלֻֽהוּ׃
transliteration: v'akh'lv et-habasar balay'lah hazeh tz'liy-esh vmatzvot 'al-m'roriym yokh'luhv
translation: They shall eat the flesh that same night; they shall eat it roasted over the fire, with unleavened bread and with bitter herbs.

hebrew: אַל־תֹּאכְל֤וּ מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ נָ֔א וּבָשֵׁ֥ל מְבֻשָּׁ֖ל בַּמָּ֑יִם כִּ֣י אִם־צְלִי־אֵ֔שׁ רֹאשׁ֥וֹ עַל־כְּרָעָ֖יו וְעַל־קִרְבּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: al-tokh'lv mimenv na vvashel m'vushal bamayim kiy im-tz'liy-esh roshvo 'al-k'ra'ayv v'al-kir'bvo
translation: Do not eat any of it raw, or cooked in any way with water, but roasted—head, legs, and entrails—over the fire.

hebrew: וְלֹא־תוֹתִ֥ירוּ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַד־בֹּ֑קֶר וְהַנֹּתָ֥ר מִמֶּ֛נּוּ עַד־בֹּ֖קֶר בָּאֵ֥שׁ תִּשְׂרֹֽפוּ׃
transliteration: v'lo-tvotiyrv mimenv 'ad-boker v'hanotar mimenv 'ad-boker baesh tis'rofv
translation: You shall not leave any of it over until morning; if any of it is left until morning, you shall burn it.

hebrew: וְכָכָה֮ תֹּאכְל֣וּ אֹתוֹ֒ מָתְנֵיכֶ֣ם חֲגֻרִ֔ים נַֽעֲלֵיכֶם֙ בְּרַגְלֵיכֶ֔ם וּמַקֶּלְכֶ֖ם בְּיֶדְכֶ֑ם וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֤ם אֹתוֹ֙ בְּחִפָּז֔וֹן פֶּ֥סַח ה֖וּא לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'khakhah tokh'lv otvo mat'neykhem chaguriym na'aleykhem b'rag'leykhem vmakel'khem b'yed'khem vaakhal'tem otvo b'chipazvon pesach hv layhvah
translation: This is how you shall eat it: your loins girded, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and you shall eat it hurriedly: it is a passover offeringbOr “protective offering”; Heb. pesaḥ. to the LORD.

hebrew: וְעָבַרְתִּ֣י בְאֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַיִם֮ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַזֶּה֒ וְהִכֵּיתִ֤י כָל־בְּכוֹר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מֵאָדָ֖ם וְעַד־בְּהֵמָ֑ה וּבְכָל־אֱלֹהֵ֥י מִצְרַ֛יִם אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה שְׁפָטִ֖ים אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'avar'tiy v'eretz-mitz'rayim balay'lah hazeh v'hikeytiy khal-b'khvor b'eretz mitz'rayim meadam v'ad-b'hemah vv'khal-elohey mitz'rayim e'eseh sh'fatiym aniy y'hvah
translation: For that night I will go through the land of Egypt and strike down every first-born in the land of Egypt, both man and beast; and I will mete out punishments to all the gods of Egypt, I the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ הַדָּ֨ם לָכֶ֜ם לְאֹ֗ת עַ֤ל הַבָּתִּים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַתֶּ֣ם שָׁ֔ם וְרָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וּפָסַחְתִּ֖י עֲלֵכֶ֑ם וְלֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֨ה בָכֶ֥ם נֶ֙גֶף֙ לְמַשְׁחִ֔ית בְּהַכֹּתִ֖י בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'hayah hadam lakhem l'ot 'al habatiym asher atem sham v'raiytiy et-hadam vfasach'tiy 'alekhem v'lo-yih'yeh vakhem negef l'mash'chiyt b'hakotiy b'eretz mitz'rayim
translation: And the blood on the houses where you are staying shall be a sign for you: when I see the blood I will pass overcOr “protect”; cf. v. 11, note b. you, so that no plague will destroy you when I strike the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ הַיּ֨וֹם הַזֶּ֤ה לָכֶם֙ לְזִכָּר֔וֹן וְחַגֹּתֶ֥ם אֹת֖וֹ חַ֣ג לַֽיהוָ֑ה לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם תְּחָגֻּֽהוּ׃
transliteration: v'hayah hayvom hazeh lakhem l'zikarvon v'chagotem otvo chag layhvah l'doroteykhem chukat 'volam t'chaguhv
translation: This day shall be to you one of remembrance: you shall celebrate it as a festival to the L<small>ORD</small> throughout the ages; you shall celebrate it as an institution for all time.

hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֤ת יָמִים֙ מַצּ֣וֹת תֹּאכֵ֔לוּ אַ֚ךְ בַּיּ֣וֹם הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן תַּשְׁבִּ֥יתוּ שְּׂאֹ֖ר מִבָּתֵּיכֶ֑ם כִּ֣י ׀ כָּל־אֹכֵ֣ל חָמֵ֗ץ וְנִכְרְתָ֞ה הַנֶּ֤פֶשׁ הַהִוא֙ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִיּ֥וֹם הָרִאשֹׁ֖ן עַד־י֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִעִֽי׃
transliteration: shiv'at yamiym matzvot tokhelv akh' bayvom harishvon tash'biytv s'or mibateykhem kiy  kal-okhel chametz v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv miyis'rael miyvom harishon 'ad-yvom hash'vi'iy
translation: Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread; on the very first day you shall remove leaven from your houses, for whoever eats leavened bread from the first day to the seventh day, that person shall be cut off from Israel.

hebrew: וּבַיּ֤וֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן֙ מִקְרָא־קֹ֔דֶשׁ וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י מִקְרָא־קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם כָּל־מְלָאכָה֙ לֹא־יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה בָהֶ֔ם אַ֚ךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵאָכֵ֣ל לְכָל־נֶ֔פֶשׁ ה֥וּא לְבַדּ֖וֹ יֵעָשֶׂ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vvayvom harishvon mik'ra-kodesh vvayvom hash'viy'iy mik'ra-kodesh yih'yeh lakhem kal-m'lakhah lo-ye'aseh vahem akh' asher yeakhel l'khal-nefesh hv l'vadvo ye'aseh lakhem
translation: You shall celebrate a sacred occasion on the first day, and a sacred occasion on the seventh day; no work at all shall be done on them; only what every person is to eat, that alone may be prepared for you.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֮ אֶת־הַמַּצּוֹת֒ כִּ֗י בְּעֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אֶת־צִבְאוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֞ם אֶת־הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֛ה לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶ֖ם חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem et-hamatzvot kiy b'etzem hayvom hazeh hvotzetiy et-tziv'voteykhem meeretz mitz'rayim vsh'mar'tem et-hayvom hazeh l'doroteykhem chukat 'volam
translation: You shall observe the [Feast of] Unleavened Bread, for on this very day I brought your ranks out of the land of Egypt; you shall observe this day throughout the ages as an institution for all time.

hebrew: בָּרִאשֹׁ֡ן בְּאַרְבָּעָה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר י֤וֹם לַחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ בָּעֶ֔רֶב תֹּאכְל֖וּ מַצֹּ֑ת עַ֠ד י֣וֹם הָאֶחָ֧ד וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים לַחֹ֖דֶשׁ בָּעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: barishon b'ar'ba'ah 'asar yvom lachodesh ba'erev tokh'lv matzot 'ad yvom haechad v'es'riym lachodesh ba'arev
translation: In the first month, from the fourteenth day of the month at evening, you shall eat unleavened bread until the twenty-first day of the month at evening.

hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים שְׂאֹ֕ר לֹ֥א יִמָּצֵ֖א בְּבָתֵּיכֶ֑ם כִּ֣י ׀ כָּל־אֹכֵ֣ל מַחְמֶ֗צֶת וְנִכְרְתָ֞ה הַנֶּ֤פֶשׁ הַהִוא֙ מֵעֲדַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בַּגֵּ֖ר וּבְאֶזְרַ֥ח הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: shiv'at yamiym s'or lo yimatze b'vateykhem kiy  kal-okhel mach'metzet v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv me'adat yis'rael bager vv'ez'rach haaretz
translation: No leaven shall be found in your houses for seven days. For whoever eats what is leavened, that person shall be cut off from the community of Israel, whether he is a stranger or a citizen of the country.

hebrew: כָּל־מַחְמֶ֖צֶת לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֑לוּ בְּכֹל֙ מוֹשְׁבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם תֹּאכְל֖וּ מַצּֽוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: kal-mach'metzet lo tokhelv b'khol mvosh'voteykhem tokh'lv matzvot (f)
translation: You shall eat nothing leavened; in all your settlements you shall eat unleavened bread.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה לְכָל־זִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֑ם מִֽשְׁכ֗וּ וּקְח֨וּ לָכֶ֥ם צֹ֛אן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתֵיכֶ֖ם וְשַׁחֲט֥וּ הַפָּֽסַח׃
transliteration: vayik'ra mosheh l'khal-zik'ney yis'rael vayomer alehem mish'khv vk'chv lakhem tzon l'mish'p'choteykhem v'shachatv hapasach
translation: Moses then summoned all the elders of Israel and said to them, “Go, pick out lambs for your families, and slaughter the passover offering.

hebrew: וּלְקַחְתֶּ֞ם אֲגֻדַּ֣ת אֵז֗וֹב וּטְבַלְתֶּם֮ בַּדָּ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־בַּסַּף֒ וְהִגַּעְתֶּ֤ם אֶל־הַמַּשְׁקוֹף֙ וְאֶל־שְׁתֵּ֣י הַמְּזוּזֹ֔ת מִן־הַדָּ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּסָּ֑ף וְאַתֶּ֗ם לֹ֥א תֵצְא֛וּ אִ֥ישׁ מִפֶּֽתַח־בֵּית֖וֹ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
transliteration: vl'kach'tem agudat ezvov vt'val'tem badam asher-basaf v'higa'tem el-hamash'kvof v'el-sh'tey ham'zvzot min-hadam asher basaf v'atem lo tetz'v iysh mipetach-beytvo 'ad-boker
translation: Take a bunch of hyssop, dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and apply some of the blood that is in the basin to the lintel and to the two doorposts. None of you shall go outside the door of his house until morning.

hebrew: וְעָבַ֣ר יְהוָה֮ לִנְגֹּ֣ף אֶת־מִצְרַיִם֒ וְרָאָ֤ה אֶת־הַדָּם֙ עַל־הַמַּשְׁק֔וֹף וְעַ֖ל שְׁתֵּ֣י הַמְּזוּזֹ֑ת וּפָסַ֤ח יְהוָה֙ עַל־הַפֶּ֔תַח וְלֹ֤א יִתֵּן֙ הַמַּשְׁחִ֔ית לָבֹ֥א אֶל־בָּתֵּיכֶ֖ם לִנְגֹּֽף׃
transliteration: v'avar y'hvah lin'gof et-mitz'rayim v'raah et-hadam 'al-hamash'kvof v'al sh'tey ham'zvzot vfasach y'hvah 'al-hapetach v'lo yiten hamash'chiyt lavo el-bateykhem lin'gof
translation: For when the LORD goes through to smite the Egyptians, He will see the blood on the lintel and the two doorposts, and the LORD will pass over the door and not let the Destroyer enter and smite your home.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה לְחָק־לְךָ֥ וּלְבָנֶ֖יךָ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem et-hadavar hazeh l'chak-l'kha vl'vaneykha 'ad-'volam
translation: “You shall observe this as an institution for all time, for you and for your descendants.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־תָבֹ֣אוּ אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֧ן יְהוָ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֵּ֑ר וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הָעֲבֹדָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy-tavov el-haaretz asher yiten y'hvah lakhem kaasher diber vsh'mar'tem et-ha'avodah hazot
translation: And when you enter the land that the L<small>ORD</small> will give you, as He has promised, you shall observe this rite.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֕ה כִּֽי־יֹאמְר֥וּ אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם בְּנֵיכֶ֑ם מָ֛ה הָעֲבֹדָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy-yom'rv aleykhem b'neykhem mah ha'avodah hazot lakhem
translation: And when your children ask you, ‘What do you mean by this rite?’

hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֡ם זֶֽבַח־פֶּ֨סַח ה֜וּא לַֽיהוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּ֠סַח עַל־בָּתֵּ֤י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם בְּנָגְפּ֥וֹ אֶת־מִצְרַ֖יִם וְאֶת־בָּתֵּ֣ינוּ הִצִּ֑יל וַיִּקֹּ֥ד הָעָ֖ם וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוּֽוּ׃
transliteration: vaamar'tem zevach-pesach hv layhvah asher pasach 'al-batey v'ney-yis'rael b'mitz'rayim b'nag'pvo et-mitz'rayim v'et-bateynv hitziyl vayikod ha'am vayish'tachavv
translation:
you shall say, ‘It is the passover sacrifice to the LORD, because He passed over the houses of the Israelites in Egypt when He smote the Egyptians, but saved our houses.’”
The people then bowed low in homage.

hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayel'khv vaya'asv b'ney yis'rael kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh v'aharon ken 'asv (s)
translation: And the Israelites went and did so; just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּחֲצִ֣י הַלַּ֗יְלָה וַֽיהוָה֮ הִכָּ֣ה כָל־בְּכוֹר֮ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַיִם֒ מִבְּכֹ֤ר פַּרְעֹה֙ הַיֹּשֵׁ֣ב עַל־כִּסְא֔וֹ עַ֚ד בְּכ֣וֹר הַשְּׁבִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּבֵ֣ית הַבּ֑וֹר וְכֹ֖ל בְּכ֥וֹר בְּהֵמָֽה׃
