transliteration: vay'hiy  bachatziy halay'lah vayhvah hikah khal-b'khvor b'eretz mitz'rayim mib'khor par'oh hayoshev 'al-kis'vo 'ad b'khvor hash'viy asher b'veyt habvor v'khol b'khvor b'hemah
translation: In the middle of the night the L<small>ORD</small> struck down all the first-born in the land of Egypt, from the first-born of Pharaoh who sat on the throne to the first-born of the captive who was in the dungeon, and all the first-born of the cattle.

hebrew: וַיָּ֨קָם פַּרְעֹ֜ה לַ֗יְלָה ה֤וּא וְכָל־עֲבָדָיו֙ וְכָל־מִצְרַ֔יִם וַתְּהִ֛י צְעָקָ֥ה גְדֹלָ֖ה בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם כִּֽי־אֵ֣ין בַּ֔יִת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵֽין־שָׁ֖ם מֵֽת׃
transliteration: vayakam par'oh lay'lah hv v'khal-'avadayv v'khal-mitz'rayim vat'hiy tz'akah g'dolah b'mitz'rayim kiy-eyn bayit asher eyn-sham met
translation: And Pharaoh arose in the night, with all his courtiers and all the Egyptians—because there was a loud cry in Egypt; for there was no house where there was not someone dead.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא֩ לְמֹשֶׁ֨ה וּֽלְאַהֲרֹ֜ן לַ֗יְלָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ ק֤וּמוּ צְּאוּ֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ עַמִּ֔י גַּם־אַתֶּ֖ם גַּם־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּלְכ֛וּ עִבְד֥וּ אֶת־יְהוָ֖ה כְּדַבֶּרְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayik'ra l'mosheh vl'aharon lay'lah vayomer kvmv tz'v mitvokh' 'amiy gam-atem gam-b'ney yis'rael vl'khv 'iv'dv et-y'hvah k'daber'khem
translation: He summoned Moses and Aaron in the night and said, “Up, depart from among my people, you and the Israelites with you! Go, worship the L<small>ORD</small> as you said!

hebrew: גַּם־צֹאנְכֶ֨ם גַּם־בְּקַרְכֶ֥ם קְח֛וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּרְתֶּ֖ם וָלֵ֑כוּ וּבֵֽרַכְתֶּ֖ם גַּם־אֹתִֽי׃
transliteration: gam-tzon'khem gam-b'kar'khem k'chv kaasher dibar'tem valekhv vverakh'tem gam-otiy
translation: Take also your flocks and your herds, as you said, and begone! And may you bring a blessing upon me also!”

hebrew: וַתֶּחֱזַ֤ק מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ עַל־הָעָ֔ם לְמַהֵ֖ר לְשַׁלְּחָ֣ם מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּ֥י אָמְר֖וּ כֻּלָּ֥נוּ מֵתִֽים׃
transliteration: vatechezak mitz'rayim 'al-ha'am l'maher l'shal'cham min-haaretz kiy am'rv kulanv metiym
translation: The Egyptians urged the people on, impatient to have them leave the country, for they said, “We shall all be dead.”

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א הָעָ֛ם אֶת־בְּצֵק֖וֹ טֶ֣רֶם יֶחְמָ֑ץ מִשְׁאֲרֹתָ֛ם צְרֻרֹ֥ת בְּשִׂמְלֹתָ֖ם עַל־שִׁכְמָֽם׃
transliteration: vayisa ha'am et-b'tzekvo terem yech'matz mish'arotam tz'rurot b'sim'lotam 'al-shikh'mam
translation: So the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneading bowls wrapped in their cloaks upon their shoulders.

hebrew: וּבְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל עָשׂ֖וּ כִּדְבַ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַֽיִּשְׁאֲלוּ֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם כְּלֵי־כֶ֛סֶף וּכְלֵ֥י זָהָ֖ב וּשְׂמָלֹֽת׃
transliteration: vv'ney-yis'rael 'asv kid'var mosheh vayish'alv mimitz'rayim k'ley-khesef vkh'ley zahav vs'malot
translation: The Israelites had done Moses’ bidding and borrowed from the Egyptians objects of silver and gold, and clothing.

hebrew: וַֽיהוָ֞ה נָתַ֨ן אֶת־חֵ֥ן הָעָ֛ם בְּעֵינֵ֥י מִצְרַ֖יִם וַיַּשְׁאִל֑וּם וַֽיְנַצְּל֖וּ אֶת־מִצְרָֽיִם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayhvah natan et-chen ha'am b'eyney mitz'rayim vayash'ilvm vay'natz'lv et-mitz'rayim (f)
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> had disposed the Egyptians favorably toward the people, and they let them have their request; thus they stripped the Egyptians.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מֵרַעְמְסֵ֖ס סֻכֹּ֑תָה כְּשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֨וֹת אֶ֧לֶף רַגְלִ֛י הַגְּבָרִ֖ים לְבַ֥ד מִטָּֽף׃
transliteration: vayis'v v'ney-yis'rael mera'm'ses sukotah k'shesh-mevot elef rag'liy hag'variym l'vad mitaf
translation: The Israelites journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand men on foot, aside from children.

hebrew: וְגַם־עֵ֥רֶב רַ֖ב עָלָ֣ה אִתָּ֑ם וְצֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֔ר מִקְנֶ֖ה כָּבֵ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: v'gam-'erev rav 'alah itam v'tzon vvakar mik'neh kaved m'od
translation: Moreover, a mixed multitude went up with them, and very much livestock, both flocks and herds.

hebrew: וַיֹּאפ֨וּ אֶת־הַבָּצֵ֜ק אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצִ֧יאוּ מִמִּצְרַ֛יִם עֻגֹ֥ת מַצּ֖וֹת כִּ֣י לֹ֣א חָמֵ֑ץ כִּֽי־גֹרְשׁ֣וּ מִמִּצְרַ֗יִם וְלֹ֤א יָֽכְלוּ֙ לְהִתְמַהְמֵ֔הַּ וְגַם־צֵדָ֖ה לֹא־עָשׂ֥וּ לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayofv et-habatzek asher hvotziyv mimitz'rayim 'ugot matzvot kiy lo chametz kiy-gor'shv mimitz'rayim v'lo yakh'lv l'hit'mah'meha v'gam-tzedah lo-'asv lahem
translation: And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough that they had taken out of Egypt, for it was not leavened, since they had been driven out of Egypt and could not delay; nor had they prepared any provisions for themselves.

hebrew: וּמוֹשַׁב֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָשְׁב֖וּ בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: vmvoshav b'ney yis'rael asher yash'vv b'mitz'rayim sh'loshiym shanah v'ar'ba' mevot shanah
translation: The length of time that the Israelites lived in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years;

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מִקֵּץ֙ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיְהִ֗י בְּעֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה יָֽצְא֛וּ כָּל־צִבְא֥וֹת יְהוָ֖ה מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy miketz sh'loshiym shanah v'ar'ba' mevot shanah vay'hiy b'etzem hayvom hazeh yatz'v kal-tziv'vot y'hvah meeretz mitz'rayim
translation: at the end of the four hundred and thirtieth year, to the very day, all the ranks of the L<small>ORD</small> departed from the land of Egypt.

hebrew: לֵ֣יל שִׁמֻּרִ֥ים הוּא֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה לְהוֹצִיאָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם הֽוּא־הַלַּ֤יְלָה הַזֶּה֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה שִׁמֻּרִ֛ים לְכָל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: leyl shimuriym hv layhvah l'hvotziyam meeretz mitz'rayim hv-halay'lah hazeh layhvah shimuriym l'khal-b'ney yis'rael l'dorotam (f)
translation: That was for the L<small>ORD</small> a night of vigil to bring them out of the land of Egypt; that same night is the L<small>ORD</small>’s, one of vigil for all the children of Israel throughout the ages.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן זֹ֖את חֻקַּ֣ת הַפָּ֑סַח כָּל־בֶּן־נֵכָ֖ר לֹא־יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh v'aharon zot chukat hapasach kal-ben-nekhar lo-yokhal bvo
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses and Aaron: This is the law of the passover offering: No foreigner shall eat of it.

hebrew: וְכָל־עֶ֥בֶד אִ֖ישׁ מִקְנַת־כָּ֑סֶף וּמַלְתָּ֣ה אֹת֔וֹ אָ֖ז יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'khal-'eved iysh mik'nat-kasef vmal'tah otvo az yokhal bvo
translation: But any slave a man has bought may eat of it once he has been circumcised.

hebrew: תּוֹשָׁ֥ב וְשָׂכִ֖יר לֹא־יֹ֥אכַל־בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: tvoshav v'sakhiyr lo-yokhal-bvo
translation: No bound or hired laborer shall eat of it.

hebrew: בְּבַ֤יִת אֶחָד֙ יֵאָכֵ֔ל לֹא־תוֹצִ֧יא מִן־הַבַּ֛יִת מִן־הַבָּשָׂ֖ר ח֑וּצָה וְעֶ֖צֶם לֹ֥א תִשְׁבְּרוּ־בֽוֹ׃
transliteration: b'vayit echad yeakhel lo-tvotziy min-habayit min-habasar chvtzah v'etzem lo tish'b'rv-vvo
translation: It shall be eaten in one house: you shall not take any of the flesh outside the house; nor shall you break a bone of it.

hebrew: כָּל־עֲדַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יַעֲשׂ֥וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kal-'adat yis'rael ya'asv otvo
translation: The whole community of Israel shall offer it.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָג֨וּר אִתְּךָ֜ גֵּ֗ר וְעָ֣שָׂה פֶסַח֮ לַיהוָה֒ הִמּ֧וֹל ל֣וֹ כָל־זָכָ֗ר וְאָז֙ יִקְרַ֣ב לַעֲשֹׂת֔וֹ וְהָיָ֖ה כְּאֶזְרַ֣ח הָאָ֑רֶץ וְכָל־עָרֵ֖ל לֹֽא־יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yagvr it'kha ger v'asah fesach layhvah himvol lvo khal-zakhar v'az yik'rav la'asotvo v'hayah k'ez'rach haaretz v'khal-'arel lo-yokhal bvo
translation: If a stranger who dwells with you would offer the passover to the L<small>ORD</small>, all his males must be circumcised; then he shall be admitted to offer it; he shall then be as a citizen of the country. But no uncircumcised person may eat of it.

hebrew: תּוֹרָ֣ה אַחַ֔ת יִהְיֶ֖ה לָֽאֶזְרָ֑ח וְלַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֥ר בְּתוֹכְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: tvorah achat yih'yeh laez'rach v'lager hagar b'tvokh'khem
translation: There shall be one law for the citizen and for the stranger who dwells among you.

hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֖וּ כָּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֖ן כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vaya'asv kal-b'ney yis'rael kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh v'et-aharon ken 'asv (s)
translation: And all the Israelites did so; as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י בְּעֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה הוֹצִ֨יא יְהוָ֜ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם עַל־צִבְאֹתָֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'hiy b'etzem hayvom hazeh hvotziy y'hvah et-b'ney yis'rael meeretz mitz'rayim 'al-tziv'otam (f)
translation: That very day the L<small>ORD</small> freed the Israelites from the land of Egypt, troop by troop.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke further to Moses, saying,

hebrew: קַדֶּשׁ־לִ֨י כָל־בְּכ֜וֹר פֶּ֤טֶר כָּל־רֶ֙חֶם֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָ֑ה לִ֖י הֽוּא׃
transliteration: kadesh-liy khal-b'khvor peter kal-rechem biv'ney yis'rael baadam vvab'hemah liy hv
translation: “Consecrate to Me every first-born; man and beast, the first issue of every womb among the Israelites is Mine.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־הָעָ֗ם זָכ֞וֹר אֶת־הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְצָאתֶ֤ם מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ מִבֵּ֣ית עֲבָדִ֔ים כִּ֚י בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֔ד הוֹצִ֧יא יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִזֶּ֑ה וְלֹ֥א יֵאָכֵ֖ל חָמֵֽץ׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-ha'am zakhvor et-hayvom hazeh asher y'tzatem mimitz'rayim mibeyt 'avadiym kiy b'chozek yad hvotziy y'hovah et'khem mizeh v'lo yeakhel chametz
translation:
And Moses said to the people,
“Remember this day, on which you went free from Egypt, the house of bondage, how the LORD freed you from it with a mighty hand: no leavened bread shall be eaten.

hebrew: הַיּ֖וֹם אַתֶּ֣ם יֹצְאִ֑ים בְּחֹ֖דֶשׁ הָאָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: hayvom atem yotz'iym b'chodesh haaviyv
translation: You go free on this day, in the monthaOr “on the new moon.” of Abib.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה כִֽי־יְבִֽיאֲךָ֣ יְהוָ֡ה אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽ֠כְּנַעֲנִי וְהַחִתִּ֨י וְהָאֱמֹרִ֜י וְהַחִוִּ֣י וְהַיְבוּסִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֤ע לַאֲבֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ לָ֣תֶת לָ֔ךְ אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָ֑שׁ וְעָבַדְתָּ֛ אֶת־הָעֲבֹדָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: v'hayah khiy-y'viyakha y'hvah el-eretz hak'na'aniy v'hachitiy v'haemoriy v'hachiviy v'hay'vvsiy asher nish'ba' laavoteykha latet lakh' eretz zavat chalav vd'vash v'avad'ta et-ha'avodah hazot bachodesh hazeh
translation: So, when the L<small>ORD</small> has brought you into the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, which He swore to your fathers to give you, a land flowing with milk and honey, you shall observe in this month the following practice:

hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים תֹּאכַ֣ל מַצֹּ֑ת וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י חַ֖ג לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: shiv'at yamiym tokhal matzot vvayvom hash'viy'iy chag layhvah
translation: “Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a festival of the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: מַצּוֹת֙ יֵֽאָכֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת שִׁבְעַ֣ת הַיָּמִ֑ים וְלֹֽא־יֵרָאֶ֨ה לְךָ֜ חָמֵ֗ץ וְלֹֽא־יֵרָאֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ שְׂאֹ֖ר בְּכָל־גְּבֻלֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: matzvot yeakhel et shiv'at hayamiym v'lo-yeraeh l'kha chametz v'lo-yeraeh l'kha s'or b'khal-g'vulekha
translation: Throughout the seven days unleavened bread shall be eaten; no leavened bread shall be found with you, and no leaven shall be found in all your territory.

hebrew: וְהִגַּדְתָּ֣ לְבִנְךָ֔ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא לֵאמֹ֑ר בַּעֲב֣וּר זֶ֗ה עָשָׂ֤ה יְהוָה֙ לִ֔י בְּצֵאתִ֖י מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'higad'ta l'vin'kha bayvom hahv lemor ba'avvr zeh 'asah y'hvah liy b'tzetiy mimitz'rayim
translation: And you shall explain to your child on that day, ‘It is because of what the L<small>ORD</small> did for me when I went free from Egypt.’

hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ לְךָ֨ לְא֜וֹת עַל־יָדְךָ֗ וּלְזִכָּרוֹן֙ בֵּ֣ין עֵינֶ֔יךָ לְמַ֗עַן תִּהְיֶ֛ה תּוֹרַ֥ת יְהוָ֖ה בְּפִ֑יךָ כִּ֚י בְּיָ֣ד חֲזָקָ֔ה הוֹצִֽאֲךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'hayah l'kha l'vot 'al-yad'kha vl'zikarvon beyn 'eyneykha l'ma'an tih'yeh tvorat y'hvah b'fiykha kiy b'yad chazakah hvotziakha y'hovah mimitz'rayim
translation: “And this shall serve you as a sign on your hand and as a reminder on your foreheadbLit. “between your eyes.”—in order that the Teaching of the LORD may be in your mouth—that with a mighty hand the LORD freed you from Egypt.

hebrew: וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֛ אֶת־הַחֻקָּ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לְמוֹעֲדָ֑הּ מִיָּמִ֖ים יָמִֽימָה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'shamar'ta et-hachukah hazot l'mvo'adah miyamiym yamiymah (s)
translation: You shall keep this institution at its set time from year to year.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־יְבִֽאֲךָ֤ יְהוָה֙ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר נִשְׁבַּ֥ע לְךָ֖ וְלַֽאֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ וּנְתָנָ֖הּ לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy-y'viakha y'hvah el-eretz hak'na'aniy kaasher nish'ba' l'kha v'laavoteykha vn'tanah lakh'
translation: “And when the L<small>ORD</small> has brought you into the land of the Canaanites, as He swore to you and to your fathers, and has given it to you,

hebrew: וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ֥ כָל־פֶּֽטֶר־רֶ֖חֶם לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וְכָל־פֶּ֣טֶר ׀ שֶׁ֣גֶר בְּהֵמָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ הַזְּכָרִ֖ים לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'ha'avar'ta khal-peter-rechem layhovah v'khal-peter  sheger b'hemah asher yih'yeh l'kha haz'khariym layhvah
translation: you shall set apart for the L<small>ORD</small> every first issue of the womb: every male firstling that your cattle drop shall be the L<small>ORD</small>’s.

hebrew: וְכָל־פֶּ֤טֶר חֲמֹר֙ תִּפְדֶּ֣ה בְשֶׂ֔ה וְאִם־לֹ֥א תִפְדֶּ֖ה וַעֲרַפְתּ֑וֹ וְכֹ֨ל בְּכ֥וֹר אָדָ֛ם בְּבָנֶ֖יךָ תִּפְדֶּֽה׃
transliteration: v'khal-peter chamor tif'deh v'seh v'im-lo tif'deh va'araf'tvo v'khol b'khvor adam b'vaneykha tif'deh
translation: But every firstling ass you shall redeem with a sheep; if you do not redeem it, you must break its neck. And you must redeem every first-born male among your children.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־יִשְׁאָלְךָ֥ בִנְךָ֛ מָחָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֣ר מַה־זֹּ֑את וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֔יו בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֗ד הוֹצִיאָ֧נוּ יְהוָ֛ה מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy-yish'al'kha vin'kha machar lemor mah-zot v'amar'ta elayv b'chozek yad hvotziyanv y'hvah mimitz'rayim mibeyt 'avadiym
translation: And when, in time to come, your child asks you, saying, ‘What does this mean?’ you shall reply, ‘It was with a mighty hand that the L<small>ORD</small> brought us out from Egypt, the house of bondage.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּֽי־הִקְשָׁ֣ה פַרְעֹה֮ לְשַׁלְּחֵנוּ֒ וַיַּהֲרֹ֨ג יְהֹוָ֤ה כָּל־בְּכוֹר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מִבְּכֹ֥ר אָדָ֖ם וְעַד־בְּכ֣וֹר בְּהֵמָ֑ה עַל־כֵּן֩ אֲנִ֨י זֹבֵ֜חַ לַֽיהוָ֗ה כָּל־פֶּ֤טֶר רֶ֙חֶם֙ הַזְּכָרִ֔ים וְכָל־בְּכ֥וֹר בָּנַ֖י אֶפְדֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kiy-hik'shah far'oh l'shal'chenv vayaharog y'hovah kal-b'khvor b'eretz mitz'rayim mib'khor adam v'ad-b'khvor b'hemah 'al-ken aniy zovecha layhvah kal-peter rechem haz'khariym v'khal-b'khvor banay ef'deh
translation: When Pharaoh stubbornly refused to let us go, the L<small>ORD</small> slew every first-born in the land of Egypt, the first-born of both man and beast. Therefore I sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small> every first male issue of the womb, but redeem every male first-born among my children.’

hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה לְאוֹת֙ עַל־יָ֣דְכָ֔ה וּלְטוֹטָפֹ֖ת בֵּ֣ין עֵינֶ֑יךָ כִּ֚י בְּחֹ֣זֶק יָ֔ד הוֹצִיאָ֥נוּ יְהוָ֖ה מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hayah l'vot 'al-yad'khah vl'tvotafot beyn 'eyneykha kiy b'chozek yad hvotziyanv y'hvah mimitz'rayim (s)
translation: “And so it shall be as a sign upon your hand and as a symbolcOthers “frontlet.” on your forehead that with a mighty hand the LORD freed us from Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּשַׁלַּ֣ח פַּרְעֹה֮ אֶת־הָעָם֒ וְלֹא־נָחָ֣ם אֱלֹהִ֗ים דֶּ֚רֶךְ אֶ֣רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים כִּ֥י קָר֖וֹב ה֑וּא כִּ֣י ׀ אָמַ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים פֶּֽן־יִנָּחֵ֥ם הָעָ֛ם בִּרְאֹתָ֥ם מִלְחָמָ֖ה וְשָׁ֥בוּ מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy b'shalach par'oh et-ha'am v'lo-nacham elohiym derekh' eretz p'lish'tiym kiy karvov hv kiy  amar elohiym pen-yinachem ha'am bir'otam mil'chamah v'shavv mitz'ray'mah
translation: Now when Pharaoh let the people go, God did not lead them by way of the land of the Philistines, although it was nearer; for God said, “The people may have a change of heart when they see war, and return to Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיַּסֵּ֨ב אֱלֹהִ֧ים ׀ אֶת־הָעָ֛ם דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר יַם־ס֑וּף וַחֲמֻשִׁ֛ים עָל֥וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayasev elohiym  et-ha'am derekh' hamid'bar yam-svf vachamushiym 'alv v'ney-yis'rael meeretz mitz'rayim
translation:
So God led the people round about, by way of the wilderness at the Sea of Reeds.
Now the Israelites went up armeddMeaning of Heb. ḥamushim uncertain. out of the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־עַצְמ֥וֹת יוֹסֵ֖ף עִמּ֑וֹ כִּי֩ הַשְׁבֵּ֨עַ הִשְׁבִּ֜יעַ אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר פָּקֹ֨ד יִפְקֹ֤ד אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְהַעֲלִיתֶ֧ם אֶת־עַצְמֹתַ֛י מִזֶּ֖ה אִתְּכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-'atz'mvot yvosef 'imvo kiy hash'be'a hish'biy'a et-b'ney yis'rael lemor pakod yif'kod elohiym et'khem v'ha'aliytem et-'atz'motay mizeh it'khem
translation: And Moses took with him the bones of Joseph, who had exacted an oath from the children of Israel, saying, “God will be sure to take notice of you: then you shall carry up my bones from here with you.”

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִסֻּכֹּ֑ת וַיַּחֲנ֣וּ בְאֵתָ֔ם בִּקְצֵ֖ה הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
transliteration: vayis'v misukot vayachanv v'etam bik'tzeh hamid'bar
translation: They set out from Succoth, and encamped at Etham, at the edge of the wilderness.

hebrew: וַֽיהוָ֡ה הֹלֵךְ֩ לִפְנֵיהֶ֨ם יוֹמָ֜ם בְּעַמּ֤וּד עָנָן֙ לַנְחֹתָ֣ם הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְלַ֛יְלָה בְּעַמּ֥וּד אֵ֖שׁ לְהָאִ֣יר לָהֶ֑ם לָלֶ֖כֶת יוֹמָ֥ם וָלָֽיְלָה׃
transliteration: vayhvah holekh' lif'neyhem yvomam b'amvd 'anan lan'chotam haderekh' v'lay'lah b'amvd esh l'haiyr lahem lalekhet yvomam valay'lah
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> went before them in a pillar of cloud by day, to guide them along the way, and in a pillar of fire by night, to give them light, that they might travel day and night.

hebrew: לֹֽא־יָמִ֞ישׁ עַמּ֤וּד הֶֽעָנָן֙ יוֹמָ֔ם וְעַמּ֥וּד הָאֵ֖שׁ לָ֑יְלָה לִפְנֵ֖י הָעָֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: lo-yamiysh 'amvd he'anan yvomam v'amvd haesh lay'lah lif'ney ha'am (f)
translation: The pillar of cloud by day and the pillar of fire by night did not depart from before the people.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hovah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses:

hebrew: דַּבֵּר֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וְיָשֻׁ֗בוּ וְיַחֲנוּ֙ לִפְנֵי֙ פִּ֣י הַחִירֹ֔ת בֵּ֥ין מִגְדֹּ֖ל וּבֵ֣ין הַיָּ֑ם לִפְנֵי֙ בַּ֣עַל צְפֹ֔ן נִכְח֥וֹ תַחֲנ֖וּ עַל־הַיָּֽם׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'yashuvv v'yachanv lif'ney piy hachiyrot beyn mig'dol vveyn hayam lif'ney ba'al tz'fon nikh'chvo tachanv 'al-hayam
translation: Tell the Israelites to turn back and encamp before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, before Baal-zephon; you shall encamp facing it, by the sea.

hebrew: וְאָמַ֤ר פַּרְעֹה֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נְבֻכִ֥ים הֵ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ סָגַ֥ר עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
transliteration: v'amar par'oh liv'ney yis'rael n'vukhiym hem baaretz sagar 'aleyhem hamid'bar
translation: Pharaoh will say of the Israelites, “They are astray in the land; the wilderness has closed in on them.”

hebrew: וְחִזַּקְתִּ֣י אֶת־לֵב־פַּרְעֹה֮ וְרָדַ֣ף אַחֲרֵיהֶם֒ וְאִכָּבְדָ֤ה בְּפַרְעֹה֙ וּבְכָל־חֵיל֔וֹ וְיָדְע֥וּ מִצְרַ֖יִם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'chizak'tiy et-lev-par'oh v'radaf achareyhem v'ikav'dah b'far'oh vv'khal-cheylvo v'yad'v mitz'rayim kiy-aniy y'hvah vaya'asv-khen
translation:
Then I will stiffen Pharaoh’s heart and he will pursue them, that I may gain glory through Pharaoh and all his host; and the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD.
And they did so.

hebrew: וַיֻּגַּד֙ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם כִּ֥י בָרַ֖ח הָעָ֑ם וַ֠יֵּהָפֵךְ לְבַ֨ב פַּרְעֹ֤ה וַעֲבָדָיו֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם וַיֹּֽאמרוּ֙ מַה־זֹּ֣את עָשִׂ֔ינוּ כִּֽי־שִׁלַּ֥חְנוּ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵעָבְדֵֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vayugad l'melekh' mitz'rayim kiy varach ha'am vayehafekh' l'vav par'oh va'avadayv el-ha'am vayomrv mah-zot 'asiynv kiy-shilach'nv et-yis'rael me'av'denv
translation: When the king of Egypt was told that the people had fled, Pharaoh and his courtiers had a change of heart about the people and said, “What is this we have done, releasing Israel from our service?”

hebrew: וַיֶּאְסֹ֖ר אֶת־רִכְבּ֑וֹ וְאֶת־עַמּ֖וֹ לָקַ֥ח עִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaye'sor et-rikh'bvo v'et-'amvo lakach 'imvo
translation: He orderedaSee on Gen. 46.29. his chariot and took his men with him;

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֗ח שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת רֶ֙כֶב֙ בָּח֔וּר וְכֹ֖ל רֶ֣כֶב מִצְרָ֑יִם וְשָׁלִשִׁ֖ם עַל־כֻּלּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayikach shesh-mevot rekhev bachvr v'khol rekhev mitz'rayim v'shalishim 'al-kulvo
translation: he took six hundred of his picked chariots, and the rest of the chariots of Egypt, with officersbHeb. shalish; originally “third man on royal chariot”; hence “adjutant,” “officer.” in all of them.

hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּ֣ק יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־לֵ֤ב פַּרְעֹה֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּרְדֹּ֕ף אַחֲרֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יֹצְאִ֖ים בְּיָ֥ד רָמָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'chazek y'hovah et-lev par'oh melekh' mitz'rayim vayir'dof acharey b'ney yis'rael vv'ney yis'rael yotz'iym b'yad ramah
translation: The LORD stiffened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he gave chase to the Israelites. As the Israelites were departing defiantly,cLit. “with upraised hand.”

hebrew: וַיִּרְדְּפ֨וּ מִצְרַ֜יִם אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם וַיַּשִּׂ֤יגוּ אוֹתָם֙ חֹנִ֣ים עַל־הַיָּ֔ם כָּל־סוּס֙ רֶ֣כֶב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וּפָרָשָׁ֖יו וְחֵיל֑וֹ עַל־פִּי֙ הַֽחִירֹ֔ת לִפְנֵ֖י בַּ֥עַל צְפֹֽן׃
transliteration: vayir'd'fv mitz'rayim achareyhem vayasiygv votam choniym 'al-hayam kal-svs rekhev par'oh vfarashayv v'cheylvo 'al-piy hachiyrot lif'ney ba'al tz'fon
translation: the Egyptians gave chase to them, and all the chariot horses of Pharaoh, his horsemen, and his warriors overtook them encamped by the sea, near Pi-hahiroth, before Baal-zephon.

hebrew: וּפַרְעֹ֖ה הִקְרִ֑יב וַיִּשְׂאוּ֩ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל אֶת־עֵינֵיהֶ֜ם וְהִנֵּ֥ה מִצְרַ֣יִם ׀ נֹסֵ֣עַ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם וַיִּֽירְאוּ֙ מְאֹ֔ד וַיִּצְעֲק֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vfar'oh hik'riyv vayis'v v'ney-yis'rael et-'eyneyhem v'hineh mitz'rayim  nose'a achareyhem vayiyr'v m'od vayitz'akv v'ney-yis'rael el-y'hvah
translation: As Pharaoh drew near, the Israelites caught sight of the Egyptians advancing upon them. Greatly frightened, the Israelites cried out to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ הַֽמִבְּלִ֤י אֵין־קְבָרִים֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם לְקַחְתָּ֖נוּ לָמ֣וּת בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר מַה־זֹּאת֙ עָשִׂ֣יתָ לָּ֔נוּ לְהוֹצִיאָ֖נוּ מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayom'rv el-mosheh hamib'liy eyn-k'variym b'mitz'rayim l'kach'tanv lamvt bamid'bar mah-zot 'asiyta lanv l'hvotziyanv mimitz'rayim
translation: And they said to Moses, “Was it for want of graves in Egypt that you brought us to die in the wilderness? What have you done to us, taking us out of Egypt?

hebrew: הֲלֹא־זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁר֩ דִּבַּ֨רְנוּ אֵלֶ֤יךָ בְמִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר חֲדַ֥ל מִמֶּ֖נּוּ וְנַֽעַבְדָ֣ה אֶת־מִצְרָ֑יִם כִּ֣י ט֥וֹב לָ֙נוּ֙ עֲבֹ֣ד אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם מִמֻּתֵ֖נוּ בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
transliteration: halo-zeh hadavar asher dibar'nv eleykha v'mitz'rayim lemor chadal mimenv v'na'av'dah et-mitz'rayim kiy tvov lanv 'avod et-mitz'rayim mimutenv bamid'bar
translation: Is this not the very thing we told you in Egypt, saying, ‘Let us be, and we will serve the Egyptians, for it is better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in the wilderness’?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶל־הָעָם֮ אַל־תִּירָאוּ֒ הִֽתְיַצְב֗וּ וּרְאוּ֙ אֶת־יְשׁוּעַ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם כִּ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר רְאִיתֶ֤ם אֶת־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ הַיּ֔וֹם לֹ֥א תֹסִ֛יפוּ לִרְאֹתָ֥ם ע֖וֹד עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-ha'am al-tiyrav hit'yatz'vv vr'v et-y'shv'at y'hvah asher-ya'aseh lakhem hayvom kiy asher r'iytem et-mitz'rayim hayvom lo tosiyfv lir'otam 'vod 'ad-'volam
translation: But Moses said to the people, “Have no fear! Stand by, and witness the deliverance which the L<small>ORD</small> will work for you today; for the Egyptians whom you see today you will never see again.

hebrew: יְהוָ֖ה יִלָּחֵ֣ם לָכֶ֑ם וְאַתֶּ֖ם תַּחֲרִישֽׁוּן׃ (פ)
transliteration: y'hvah yilachem lakhem v'atem tachariyshvn (f)
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will battle for you; you hold your peace!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה מַה־תִּצְעַ֖ק אֵלָ֑י דַּבֵּ֥ר אֶל־בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְיִסָּֽעוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh mah-titz'ak elay daber el-b'ney-yis'rael v'yisa'v
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Why do you cry out to Me? Tell the Israelites to go forward.

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה הָרֵ֣ם אֶֽת־מַטְּךָ֗ וּנְטֵ֧ה אֶת־יָדְךָ֛ עַל־הַיָּ֖ם וּבְקָעֵ֑הוּ וְיָבֹ֧אוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּ֖ם בַּיַּבָּשָֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'atah harem et-mat'kha vn'teh et-yad'kha 'al-hayam vv'ka'ehv v'yavov v'ney-yis'rael b'tvokh' hayam bayabashah
translation: And you lift up your rod and hold out your arm over the sea and split it, so that the Israelites may march into the sea on dry ground.

hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י הִנְנִ֤י מְחַזֵּק֙ אֶת־לֵ֣ב מִצְרַ֔יִם וְיָבֹ֖אוּ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וְאִכָּבְדָ֤ה בְּפַרְעֹה֙ וּבְכָל־חֵיל֔וֹ בְּרִכְבּ֖וֹ וּבְפָרָשָֽׁיו׃
transliteration: vaaniy hin'niy m'chazek et-lev mitz'rayim v'yavov achareyhem v'ikav'dah b'far'oh vv'khal-cheylvo b'rikh'bvo vv'farashayv
translation: And I will stiffen the hearts of the Egyptians so that they go in after them; and I will gain glory through Pharaoh and all his warriors, his chariots, and his horsemen.

hebrew: וְיָדְע֥וּ מִצְרַ֖יִם כִּי־אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֑ה בְּהִכָּבְדִ֣י בְּפַרְעֹ֔ה בְּרִכְבּ֖וֹ וּבְפָרָשָֽׁיו׃
transliteration: v'yad'v mitz'rayim kiy-aniy y'hvah b'hikav'diy b'far'oh b'rikh'bvo vv'farashayv
translation: Let the Egyptians know that I am the L<small>ORD</small>, when I gain glory through Pharaoh, his chariots, and his horsemen.”

hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֞ע מַלְאַ֣ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים הַהֹלֵךְ֙ לִפְנֵי֙ מַחֲנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ מֵאַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּסַּ֞ע עַמּ֤וּד הֶֽעָנָן֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיַּֽעֲמֹ֖ד מֵאַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayisa' mal'akh' haelohiym haholekh' lif'ney machaneh yis'rael vayelekh' meachareyhem vayisa' 'amvd he'anan mip'neyhem vaya'amod meachareyhem
translation: The angel of God, who had been going ahead of the Israelite army, now moved and followed behind them; and the pillar of cloud shifted from in front of them and took up a place behind them,

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֞א בֵּ֣ין ׀ מַחֲנֵ֣ה מִצְרַ֗יִם וּבֵין֙ מַחֲנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיְהִ֤י הֶֽעָנָן֙ וְהַחֹ֔שֶׁךְ וַיָּ֖אֶר אֶת־הַלָּ֑יְלָה וְלֹא־קָרַ֥ב זֶ֛ה אֶל־זֶ֖ה כָּל־הַלָּֽיְלָה׃
transliteration: vayavo beyn  machaneh mitz'rayim vveyn machaneh yis'rael vay'hiy he'anan v'hachoshekh' vayaer et-halay'lah v'lo-karav zeh el-zeh kal-halay'lah
translation: and it came between the army of the Egyptians and the army of Israel. Thus there was the cloud with the darkness, and it cast a spelldFrom root ’rr, “cast a spell” or “curse.” Others “and it lit up.” upon the night, so that the one could not come near the other all through the night.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨ט מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶת־יָדוֹ֮ עַל־הַיָּם֒ וַיּ֣וֹלֶךְ יְהוָ֣ה ׀ אֶת־הַ֠יָּם בְּר֨וּחַ קָדִ֤ים עַזָּה֙ כָּל־הַלַּ֔יְלָה וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־הַיָּ֖ם לֶחָרָבָ֑ה וַיִּבָּקְע֖וּ הַמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayet mosheh et-yadvo 'al-hayam vayvolekh' y'hvah  et-hayam b'rvcha kadiym 'azah kal-halay'lah vayasem et-hayam lecharavah vayibak'v hamayim
translation: Then Moses held out his arm over the sea and the L<small>ORD</small> drove back the sea with a strong east wind all that night, and turned the sea into dry ground. The waters were split,

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֧אוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּ֖ם בַּיַּבָּשָׁ֑ה וְהַמַּ֤יִם לָהֶם֙ חֹמָ֔ה מִֽימִינָ֖ם וּמִשְּׂמֹאלָֽם׃
transliteration: vayavov v'ney-yis'rael b'tvokh' hayam bayabashah v'hamayim lahem chomah miymiynam vmis'molam
translation: and the Israelites went into the sea on dry ground, the waters forming a wall for them on their right and on their left.

hebrew: וַיִּרְדְּפ֤וּ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּ֚ל ס֣וּס פַּרְעֹ֔ה רִכְבּ֖וֹ וּפָרָשָׁ֑יו אֶל־תּ֖וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃
transliteration: vayir'd'fv mitz'rayim vayavov achareyhem kol svs par'oh rikh'bvo vfarashayv el-tvokh' hayam
translation: The Egyptians came in pursuit after them into the sea, all of Pharaoh’s horses, chariots, and horsemen.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בְּאַשְׁמֹ֣רֶת הַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיַּשְׁקֵ֤ף יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מַחֲנֵ֣ה מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּעַמּ֥וּד אֵ֖שׁ וְעָנָ֑ן וַיָּ֕הָם אֵ֖ת מַחֲנֵ֥ה מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy b'ash'moret haboker vayash'kef y'hvah el-machaneh mitz'rayim b'amvd esh v'anan vayaham et machaneh mitz'rayim
translation: At the morning watch, the L<small>ORD</small> looked down upon the Egyptian army from a pillar of fire and cloud, and threw the Egyptian army into panic.

hebrew: וַיָּ֗סַר אֵ֚ת אֹפַ֣ן מַרְכְּבֹתָ֔יו וַֽיְנַהֲגֵ֖הוּ בִּכְבֵדֻ֑ת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מִצְרַ֗יִם אָנ֙וּסָה֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֣י יְהוָ֔ה נִלְחָ֥ם לָהֶ֖ם בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayasar et ofan mar'k'votayv vay'nahagehv bikh'vedut vayomer mitz'rayim anvsah mip'ney yis'rael kiy y'hvah nil'cham lahem b'mitz'rayim (f)
translation: He lockedeFrom root ’sr, with several ancient versions. Others “took off.” the wheels of their chariots so that they moved forward with difficulty. And the Egyptians said, “Let us flee from the Israelites, for the LORD is fighting for them against Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה נְטֵ֥ה אֶת־יָדְךָ֖ עַל־הַיָּ֑ם וְיָשֻׁ֤בוּ הַמַּ֙יִם֙ עַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם עַל־רִכְבּ֖וֹ וְעַל־פָּרָשָֽׁיו׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh n'teh et-yad'kha 'al-hayam v'yashuvv hamayim 'al-mitz'rayim 'al-rikh'bvo v'al-parashayv
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Hold out your arm over the sea, that the waters may come back upon the Egyptians and upon their chariots and upon their horsemen.”

hebrew: וַיֵּט֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה אֶת־יָד֜וֹ עַל־הַיָּ֗ם וַיָּ֨שָׁב הַיָּ֜ם לִפְנ֥וֹת בֹּ֙קֶר֙ לְאֵ֣יתָנ֔וֹ וּמִצְרַ֖יִם נָסִ֣ים לִקְרָאת֑וֹ וַיְנַעֵ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מִצְרַ֖יִם בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃
transliteration: vayet mosheh et-yadvo 'al-hayam vayashav hayam lif'nvot boker l'eytanvo vmitz'rayim nasiym lik'ratvo vay'na'er y'hvah et-mitz'rayim b'tvokh' hayam
translation: Moses held out his arm over the sea, and at daybreak the sea returned to its normal state, and the Egyptians fled at its approach. But the L<small>ORD</small> hurled the Egyptians into the sea.

hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֣בוּ הַמַּ֗יִם וַיְכַסּ֤וּ אֶת־הָרֶ֙כֶב֙ וְאֶת־הַפָּ֣רָשִׁ֔ים לְכֹל֙ חֵ֣יל פַּרְעֹ֔ה הַבָּאִ֥ים אַחֲרֵיהֶ֖ם בַּיָּ֑ם לֹֽא־נִשְׁאַ֥ר בָּהֶ֖ם עַד־אֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: vayashuvv hamayim vay'khasv et-harekhev v'et-haparashiym l'khol cheyl par'oh habaiym achareyhem bayam lo-nish'ar bahem 'ad-echad
translation: The waters turned back and covered the chariots and the horsemen—Pharaoh’s entire army that followed them into the sea; not one of them remained.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הָלְכ֥וּ בַיַּבָּשָׁ֖ה בְּת֣וֹךְ הַיָּ֑ם וְהַמַּ֤יִם לָהֶם֙ חֹמָ֔ה מִֽימִינָ֖ם וּמִשְּׂמֹאלָֽם׃
transliteration: vv'ney yis'rael hal'khv vayabashah b'tvokh' hayam v'hamayim lahem chomah miymiynam vmis'molam
translation: But the Israelites had marched through the sea on dry ground, the waters forming a wall for them on their right and on their left.

hebrew: וַיּ֨וֹשַׁע יְהוָ֜ה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֛וּא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִיַּ֣ד מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיַּ֤רְא יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם מֵ֖ת עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיָּֽם׃
transliteration: vayvosha' y'hvah bayvom hahv et-yis'rael miyad mitz'rayim vayar' yis'rael et-mitz'rayim met 'al-s'fat hayam
translation: Thus the L<small>ORD</small> delivered Israel that day from the Egyptians. Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the shore of the sea.

hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־הַיָּ֣ד הַגְּדֹלָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה יְהוָה֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּֽירְא֥וּ הָעָ֖ם אֶת־יְהוָ֑ה וַיַּֽאֲמִ֙ינוּ֙ בַּֽיהוָ֔ה וּבְמֹשֶׁ֖ה עַבְדּֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayar' yis'rael et-hayad hag'dolah asher 'asah y'hvah b'mitz'rayim vayiyr'v ha'am et-y'hvah vayaamiynv bayhvah vv'mosheh 'av'dvo (f)
translation: And when Israel saw the wondrous power which the L<small>ORD</small> had wielded against the Egyptians, the people feared the L<small>ORD</small>; they had faith in the L<small>ORD</small> and His servant Moses.

hebrew: אָ֣ז יָשִֽׁיר־מֹשֶׁה֩ וּבְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־הַשִּׁירָ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ לֵאמֹ֑ר אָשִׁ֤ירָה לַֽיהוָה֙ כִּֽי־גָאֹ֣ה גָּאָ֔ה ס֥וּס וְרֹכְב֖וֹ רָמָ֥ה בַיָּֽם׃
transliteration: az yashiyr-mosheh vv'ney yis'rael et-hashiyrah hazot layhvah vayom'rv lemor ashiyrah layhvah kiy-gaoh gaah svs v'rokh'vvo ramah vayam
translation:
Then Moses and the Israelites sang this song to the LORD. They said:
I will sing to the LORD, for He has triumphed gloriously;
Horse and driver He has hurled into the sea.

hebrew: עָזִּ֤י וְזִמְרָת֙ יָ֔הּ וַֽיְהִי־לִ֖י לִֽישׁוּעָ֑ה זֶ֤ה אֵלִי֙ וְאַנְוֵ֔הוּ אֱלֹהֵ֥י אָבִ֖י וַאֲרֹמְמֶֽנְהוּ׃
transliteration: 'aziy v'zim'rat yah vay'hiy-liy liyshv'ah zeh eliy v'an'vehv elohey aviy vaarom'men'hv
translation:
The LORDaHeb. Yah. is my strength and might;bOthers “song.”
He is become my deliverance.
This is my God and I will enshrinecOthers “glorify.” Him;
The God of my father, and I will exalt Him.

hebrew: יְהוָ֖ה אִ֣ישׁ מִלְחָמָ֑ה יְהוָ֖ה שְׁמֽוֹ׃
transliteration: y'hvah iysh mil'chamah y'hvah sh'mvo
translation:
The LORD, the Warrior—
LORD is His name!

hebrew: מַרְכְּבֹ֥ת פַּרְעֹ֛ה וְחֵיל֖וֹ יָרָ֣ה בַיָּ֑ם וּמִבְחַ֥ר שָֽׁלִשָׁ֖יו טֻבְּע֥וּ בְיַם־סֽוּף׃
transliteration: mar'k'vot par'oh v'cheylvo yarah vayam vmiv'char shalishayv tub'v v'yam-svf
translation:
Pharaoh’s chariots and his army
He has cast into the sea;
And the pick of his officers
Are drowned in the Sea of Reeds.

hebrew: תְּהֹמֹ֖ת יְכַסְיֻ֑מוּ יָרְד֥וּ בִמְצוֹלֹ֖ת כְּמוֹ־אָֽבֶן׃
transliteration: t'homot y'khas'yumv yar'dv vim'tzvolot k'mvo-aven
translation:
The deeps covered them;
They went down into the depths like a stone.

hebrew: יְמִֽינְךָ֣ יְהוָ֔ה נֶאְדָּרִ֖י בַּכֹּ֑חַ יְמִֽינְךָ֥ יְהוָ֖ה תִּרְעַ֥ץ אוֹיֵֽב׃
transliteration: y'miyn'kha y'hvah ne'dariy bakocha y'miyn'kha y'hvah tir'atz voyev
translation:
Your right hand, O LORD, glorious in power,
Your right hand, O LORD, shatters the foe!

hebrew: וּבְרֹ֥ב גְּאוֹנְךָ֖ תַּהֲרֹ֣ס קָמֶ֑יךָ תְּשַׁלַּח֙ חֲרֹ֣נְךָ֔ יֹאכְלֵ֖מוֹ כַּקַּֽשׁ׃
transliteration: vv'rov g'von'kha taharos kameykha t'shalach charon'kha yokh'lemvo kakash
translation:
In Your great triumph You break Your opponents;
You send forth Your fury, it consumes them like straw.

hebrew: וּבְר֤וּחַ אַפֶּ֙יךָ֙ נֶ֣עֶרְמוּ מַ֔יִם נִצְּב֥וּ כְמוֹ־נֵ֖ד נֹזְלִ֑ים קָֽפְא֥וּ תְהֹמֹ֖ת בְּלֶב־יָֽם׃
transliteration: vv'rvcha apeykha ne'er'mv mayim nitz'vv kh'mvo-ned noz'liym kaf'v t'homot b'lev-yam
translation:
At the blast of Your nostrils the waters piled up,
The floods stood straight like a wall;
The deeps froze in the heart of the sea.

hebrew: אָמַ֥ר אוֹיֵ֛ב אֶרְדֹּ֥ף אַשִּׂ֖יג אֲחַלֵּ֣ק שָׁלָ֑ל תִּמְלָאֵ֣מוֹ נַפְשִׁ֔י אָרִ֣יק חַרְבִּ֔י תּוֹרִישֵׁ֖מוֹ יָדִֽי׃
transliteration: amar voyev er'dof asiyg achalek shalal tim'laemvo naf'shiy ariyk char'biy tvoriyshemvo yadiy
translation:
The foe said,
“I will pursue, I will overtake,
I will divide the spoil;
My desire shall have its fill of them.
I will bare my sword—
My hand shall subdue them.”

hebrew: נָשַׁ֥פְתָּ בְרוּחֲךָ֖ כִּסָּ֣מוֹ יָ֑ם צָֽלֲלוּ֙ כַּֽעוֹפֶ֔רֶת בְּמַ֖יִם אַדִּירִֽים׃
transliteration: nashaf'ta v'rvchakha kisamvo yam tzalalv ka'voferet b'mayim adiyriym
translation:
You made Your wind blow, the sea covered them;
They sank like lead in the majestic waters.

hebrew: מִֽי־כָמֹ֤כָה בָּֽאֵלִם֙ יְהוָ֔ה מִ֥י כָּמֹ֖כָה נֶאְדָּ֣ר בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ נוֹרָ֥א תְהִלֹּ֖ת עֹ֥שֵׂה פֶֽלֶא׃
transliteration: miy-khamokhah baelim y'hvah miy kamokhah ne'dar bakodesh nvora t'hilot 'oseh fele
translation:
Who is like You, O LORD, among the celestials;dOthers “mighty.”
Who is like You, majestic in holiness,
Awesome in splendor, working wonders!

hebrew: נָטִ֙יתָ֙ יְמִ֣ינְךָ֔ תִּבְלָעֵ֖מוֹ אָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: natiyta y'miyn'kha tiv'la'emvo aretz
translation:
You put out Your right hand,
The earth swallowed them.

hebrew: נָחִ֥יתָ בְחַסְדְּךָ֖ עַם־ז֣וּ גָּאָ֑לְתָּ נֵהַ֥לְתָּ בְעָזְּךָ֖ אֶל־נְוֵ֥ה קָדְשֶֽׁךָ׃
transliteration: nachiyta v'chas'd'kha 'am-zv gaal'ta nehal'ta v'az'kha el-n'veh kad'shekha
translation:
In Your love You lead the people You redeemed;
In Your strength You guide them to Your holy abode.

hebrew: שָֽׁמְע֥וּ עַמִּ֖ים יִרְגָּז֑וּן חִ֣יל אָחַ֔ז יֹשְׁבֵ֖י פְּלָֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: sham'v 'amiym yir'gazvn chiyl achaz yosh'vey p'lashet
translation:
The peoples hear, they tremble;
Agony grips the dwellers in Philistia.

hebrew: אָ֤ז נִבְהֲלוּ֙ אַלּוּפֵ֣י אֱד֔וֹם אֵילֵ֣י מוֹאָ֔ב יֹֽאחֲזֵ֖מוֹ רָ֑עַד נָמֹ֕גוּ כֹּ֖ל יֹשְׁבֵ֥י כְנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: az niv'halv alvfey edvom eyley mvoav yochazemvo ra'ad namogv kol yosh'vey kh'na'an
translation:
Now are the clans of Edom dismayed;
The tribes of Moab—trembling grips them;
All the dwellers in Canaan are aghast.

hebrew: תִּפֹּ֨ל עֲלֵיהֶ֤ם אֵימָ֙תָה֙ וָפַ֔חַד בִּגְדֹ֥ל זְרוֹעֲךָ֖ יִדְּמ֣וּ כָּאָ֑בֶן עַד־יַעֲבֹ֤ר עַמְּךָ֙ יְהוָ֔ה עַֽד־יַעֲבֹ֖ר עַם־ז֥וּ קָנִֽיתָ׃
transliteration: tipol 'aleyhem eymatah vafachad big'dol z'rvo'akha yid'mv kaaven 'ad-ya'avor 'am'kha y'hvah 'ad-ya'avor 'am-zv kaniyta
translation:
Terror and dread descend upon them;
Through the might of Your arm they are still as stone—
Till Your people cross over, O LORD,
Till Your people cross whom You have ransomed.

hebrew: תְּבִאֵ֗מוֹ וְתִטָּעֵ֙מוֹ֙ בְּהַ֣ר נַחֲלָֽתְךָ֔ מָכ֧וֹן לְשִׁבְתְּךָ֛ פָּעַ֖לְתָּ יְהוָ֑ה מִקְּדָ֕שׁ אֲדֹנָ֖י כּוֹנְנ֥וּ יָדֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: t'viemvo v'tita'emvo b'har nachalat'kha makhvon l'shiv't'kha pa'al'ta y'hvah mik'dash adonay kvon'nv yadeykha
translation:
You will bring them and plant them in Your own mountain,
The place You made to dwell in, O LORD,
The sanctuary, O Lord, which Your hands established.

hebrew: יְהוָ֥ה ׀ יִמְלֹ֖ךְ לְעֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
transliteration: y'hvah  yim'lokh' l'olam va'ed
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will reign for ever and ever!

hebrew: כִּ֣י בָא֩ ס֨וּס פַּרְעֹ֜ה בְּרִכְבּ֤וֹ וּבְפָרָשָׁיו֙ בַּיָּ֔ם וַיָּ֧שֶׁב יְהוָ֛ה עֲלֵהֶ֖ם אֶת־מֵ֣י הַיָּ֑ם וּבְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הָלְכ֥וּ בַיַּבָּשָׁ֖ה בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: kiy va svs par'oh b'rikh'bvo vv'farashayv bayam vayashev y'hvah 'alehem et-mey hayam vv'ney yis'rael hal'khv vayabashah b'tvokh' hayam (f)
translation: For the horses of Pharaoh, with his chariots and horsemen, went into the sea; and the L<small>ORD</small> turned back on them the waters of the sea; but the Israelites marched on dry ground in the midst of the sea.

hebrew: וַתִּקַּח֩ מִרְיָ֨ם הַנְּבִיאָ֜ה אֲח֧וֹת אַהֲרֹ֛ן אֶת־הַתֹּ֖ף בְּיָדָ֑הּ וַתֵּצֶ֤אןָ כָֽל־הַנָּשִׁים֙ אַחֲרֶ֔יהָ בְּתֻפִּ֖ים וּבִמְחֹלֹֽת׃
transliteration: vatikach mir'yam han'viyah achvot aharon et-hatof b'yadah vatetzena khal-hanashiym achareyha b'tupiym vvim'cholot
translation: Then Miriam the prophetess, Aaron’s sister, took a timbrel in her hand, and all the women went out after her in dance with timbrels.

hebrew: וַתַּ֥עַן לָהֶ֖ם מִרְיָ֑ם שִׁ֤ירוּ לַֽיהוָה֙ כִּֽי־גָאֹ֣ה גָּאָ֔ה ס֥וּס וְרֹכְב֖וֹ רָמָ֥ה בַיָּֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: vata'an lahem mir'yam shiyrv layhvah kiy-gaoh gaah svs v'rokh'vvo ramah vayam (s)
translation:
And Miriam chanted for them:
Sing to the LORD, for He has triumphed gloriously;
Horse and driver He has hurled into the sea.

hebrew: וַיַּסַּ֨ע מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִיַּם־ס֔וּף וַיֵּצְא֖וּ אֶל־מִדְבַּר־שׁ֑וּר וַיֵּלְכ֧וּ שְׁלֹֽשֶׁת־יָמִ֛ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר וְלֹא־מָ֥צְאוּ מָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayasa' mosheh et-yis'rael miyam-svf vayetz'v el-mid'bar-shvr vayel'khv sh'loshet-yamiym bamid'bar v'lo-matz'v mayim
translation: Then Moses caused Israel to set out from the Sea of Reeds. They went on into the wilderness of Shur; they traveled three days in the wilderness and found no water.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ מָרָ֔תָה וְלֹ֣א יָֽכְל֗וּ לִשְׁתֹּ֥ת מַ֙יִם֙ מִמָּרָ֔ה כִּ֥י מָרִ֖ים הֵ֑ם עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמָ֖הּ מָרָֽה׃
transliteration: vayavov maratah v'lo yakh'lv lish'tot mayim mimarah kiy mariym hem 'al-ken kara-sh'mah marah
translation: They came to Marah, but they could not drink the water of Marah because it was bitter; that is why it was named Marah.eI.e., “bitter.”

hebrew: וַיִּלֹּ֧נוּ הָעָ֛ם עַל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹ֖ר מַה־נִּשְׁתֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayilonv ha'am 'al-mosheh lemor mah-nish'teh
translation: And the people grumbled against Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?”

hebrew: וַיִּצְעַ֣ק אֶל־יְהוָ֗ה וַיּוֹרֵ֤הוּ יְהוָה֙ עֵ֔ץ וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ֙ אֶל־הַמַּ֔יִם וַֽיִּמְתְּק֖וּ הַמָּ֑יִם שָׁ֣ם שָׂ֥ם ל֛וֹ חֹ֥ק וּמִשְׁפָּ֖ט וְשָׁ֥ם נִסָּֽהוּ׃
transliteration: vayitz'ak el-y'hvah vayvorehv y'hvah 'etz vayash'lekh' el-hamayim vayim't'kv hamayim sham sam lvo chok vmish'pat v'sham nisahv
translation:
So he cried out to the LORD, and the LORD showed him a piece of wood; he threw it into the water and the water became sweet.
There He made for them a fixed rule, and there He put them to the test.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֩ אִם־שָׁמ֨וֹעַ תִּשְׁמַ֜ע לְק֣וֹל ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ וְהַיָּשָׁ֤ר בְּעֵינָיו֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְהַֽאֲזַנְתָּ֙ לְמִצְוֺתָ֔יו וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֖ כָּל־חֻקָּ֑יו כָּֽל־הַמַּֽחֲלָ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֤מְתִּי בְמִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לֹא־אָשִׂ֣ים עָלֶ֔יךָ כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה רֹפְאֶֽךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayomer im-shamvo'a tish'ma' l'kvol  y'hvah eloheykha v'hayashar b'eynayv ta'aseh v'haazan'ta l'mitz'votayv v'shamar'ta kal-chukayv kal-hamachalah asher-sam'tiy v'mitz'rayim lo-asiym 'aleykha kiy aniy y'hvah rof'ekha (s)
translation: He said, “If you will heed the L<small>ORD</small> your God diligently, doing what is upright in His sight, giving ear to His commandments and keeping all His laws, then I will not bring upon you any of the diseases that I brought upon the Egyptians, for I the L<small>ORD</small> am your healer.”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אֵילִ֔מָה וְשָׁ֗ם שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֛ה עֵינֹ֥ת מַ֖יִם וְשִׁבְעִ֣ים תְּמָרִ֑ים וַיַּחֲנוּ־שָׁ֖ם עַל־הַמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayavov eylimah v'sham sh'teym 'es'reh 'eynot mayim v'shiv'iym t'mariym vayachanv-sham 'al-hamayim
translation: And they came to Elim, where there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees; and they encamped there beside the water.

hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מֵֽאֵילִ֔ם וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ כָּל־עֲדַ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־מִדְבַּר־סִ֔ין אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּין־אֵילִ֖ם וּבֵ֣ין סִינָ֑י בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר יוֹם֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י לְצֵאתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayis'v meeylim vayavov kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael el-mid'bar-siyn asher beyn-eylim vveyn siynay bachamishah 'asar yvom lachodesh hasheniy l'tzetam meeretz mitz'rayim
translation: Setting out from Elim, the whole Israelite community came to the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departure from the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וילינו [וַיִּלּ֜וֹנוּ] כָּל־עֲדַ֧ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עַל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
transliteration: vylynv [vayilvonv] kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael 'al-mosheh v'al-aharon bamid'bar
translation: In the wilderness, the whole Israelite community grumbled against Moses and Aaron.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֲלֵהֶ֜ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מִֽי־יִתֵּ֨ן מוּתֵ֤נוּ בְיַד־יְהוָה֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּשִׁבְתֵּ֙נוּ֙ עַל־סִ֣יר הַבָּשָׂ֔ר בְּאָכְלֵ֥נוּ לֶ֖חֶם לָשֹׂ֑בַע כִּֽי־הוֹצֵאתֶ֤ם אֹתָ֙נוּ֙ אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה לְהָמִ֛ית אֶת־כָּל־הַקָּהָ֥ל הַזֶּ֖ה בָּרָעָֽב׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayom'rv alehem b'ney yis'rael miy-yiten mvtenv v'yad-y'hvah b'eretz mitz'rayim b'shiv'tenv 'al-siyr habasar b'akh'lenv lechem lasova' kiy-hvotzetem otanv el-hamid'bar hazeh l'hamiyt et-kal-hakahal hazeh bara'av (s)
translation: The Israelites said to them, “If only we had died by the hand of the L<small>ORD</small> in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the fleshpots, when we ate our fill of bread! For you have brought us out into this wilderness to starve this whole congregation to death.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה הִנְנִ֨י מַמְטִ֥יר לָכֶ֛ם לֶ֖חֶם מִן־הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְיָצָ֨א הָעָ֤ם וְלָֽקְטוּ֙ דְּבַר־י֣וֹם בְּיוֹמ֔וֹ לְמַ֧עַן אֲנַסֶּ֛נּוּ הֲיֵלֵ֥ךְ בְּתוֹרָתִ֖י אִם־לֹֽא׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh hin'niy mam'tiyr lakhem lechem min-hashamayim v'yatza ha'am v'lak'tv d'var-yvom b'yvomvo l'ma'an anasenv hayelekh' b'tvoratiy im-lo
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “I will rain down bread for you from the sky, and the people shall go out and gather each day that day’s portion—that I may thus test them, to see whether they will follow My instructions or not.

hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֔י וְהֵכִ֖ינוּ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־יָבִ֑יאוּ וְהָיָ֣ה מִשְׁנֶ֔ה עַ֥ל אֲשֶֽׁר־יִלְקְט֖וּ י֥וֹם ׀ יֽוֹם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hayah bayvom hashishiy v'hekhiynv et asher-yaviyv v'hayah mish'neh 'al asher-yil'k'tv yvom  yvom (s)
translation: But on the sixth day, when they apportion what they have brought in, it shall prove to be double the amount they gather each day.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן אֶֽל־כָּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עֶ֕רֶב וִֽידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֧י יְהוָ֛ה הוֹצִ֥יא אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh v'aharon el-kal-b'ney yis'rael 'erev viyda'tem kiy y'hvah hvotziy et'khem meeretz mitz'rayim
translation: So Moses and Aaron said to all the Israelites, “By evening you shall know it was the L<small>ORD</small> who brought you out from the land of Egypt;

hebrew: וּבֹ֗קֶר וּרְאִיתֶם֙ אֶת־כְּב֣וֹד יְהוָ֔ה בְּשָׁמְע֥וֹ אֶת־תְּלֻנֹּתֵיכֶ֖ם עַל־יְהוָ֑ה וְנַ֣חְנוּ מָ֔ה כִּ֥י תלונו [תַלִּ֖ינוּ] עָלֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: vvoker vr'iytem et-k'vvod y'hvah b'sham'vo et-t'lunoteykhem 'al-y'hvah v'nach'nv mah kiy tlvnv [taliynv] 'aleynv
translation: and in the morning you shall behold the PresenceaOthers “glory.” of the LORD, because He has heard your grumblings against the LORD. For who are we that you should grumble against us?

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה בְּתֵ֣ת יְהוָה֩ לָכֶ֨ם בָּעֶ֜רֶב בָּשָׂ֣ר לֶאֱכֹ֗ל וְלֶ֤חֶם בַּבֹּ֙קֶר֙ לִשְׂבֹּ֔עַ בִּשְׁמֹ֤עַ יְהוָה֙ אֶת־תְּלֻנֹּ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֥ם מַלִּינִ֖ם עָלָ֑יו וְנַ֣חְנוּ מָ֔ה לֹא־עָלֵ֥ינוּ תְלֻנֹּתֵיכֶ֖ם כִּ֥י עַל־יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh b'tet y'hvah lakhem ba'erev basar leekhol v'lechem baboker lis'bo'a bish'mo'a y'hvah et-t'lunoteykhem asher-atem maliynim 'alayv v'nach'nv mah lo-'aleynv t'lunoteykhem kiy 'al-y'hvah
translation: Since it is the L<small>ORD</small>,” Moses continued, “who will give you flesh to eat in the evening and bread in the morning to the full, because the L<small>ORD</small> has heard the grumblings you utter against Him, what is our part? Your grumbling is not against us, but against the L<small>ORD</small>!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן אֱמֹ֗ר אֶֽל־כָּל־עֲדַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל קִרְב֖וּ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה כִּ֣י שָׁמַ֔ע אֵ֖ת תְּלֻנֹּתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon emor el-kal-'adat b'ney yis'rael kir'vv lif'ney y'hvah kiy shama' et t'lunoteykhem
translation: Then Moses said to Aaron, “Say to the whole Israelite community: Advance toward the L<small>ORD</small>, for He has heard your grumbling.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּדַבֵּ֤ר אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־כָּל־עֲדַ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּפְנ֖וּ אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְהִנֵּה֙ כְּב֣וֹד יְהוָ֔ה נִרְאָ֖ה בֶּעָנָֽן׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'hiy k'daber aharon el-kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael vayif'nv el-hamid'bar v'hineh k'vvod y'hvah nir'ah be'anan (f)
translation: And as Aaron spoke to the whole Israelite community, they turned toward the wilderness, and there, in a cloud, appeared the Presence of the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses:

hebrew: שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי אֶת־תְּלוּנֹּת֮ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ דַּבֵּ֨ר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר בֵּ֤ין הָֽעַרְבַּ֙יִם֙ תֹּאכְל֣וּ בָשָׂ֔ר וּבַבֹּ֖קֶר תִּשְׂבְּעוּ־לָ֑חֶם וִֽידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: shama'tiy et-t'lvnot b'ney yis'rael daber alehem lemor beyn ha'ar'bayim tokh'lv vasar vvaboker tis'b'v-lachem viyda'tem kiy aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: “I have heard the grumbling of the Israelites. Speak to them and say: By evening you shall eat flesh, and in the morning you shall have your fill of bread; and you shall know that I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בָעֶ֔רֶב וַתַּ֣עַל הַשְּׂלָ֔ו וַתְּכַ֖ס אֶת־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וּבַבֹּ֗קֶר הָֽיְתָה֙ שִׁכְבַ֣ת הַטַּ֔ל סָבִ֖יב לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy va'erev vata'al has'lav vat'khas et-hamachaneh vvaboker hay'tah shikh'vat hatal saviyv lamachaneh
translation: In the evening quail appeared and covered the camp; in the morning there was a fall of dew about the camp.

hebrew: וַתַּ֖עַל שִׁכְבַ֣ת הַטָּ֑ל וְהִנֵּ֞ה עַל־פְּנֵ֤י הַמִּדְבָּר֙ דַּ֣ק מְחֻסְפָּ֔ס דַּ֥ק כַּכְּפֹ֖ר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vata'al shikh'vat hatal v'hineh 'al-p'ney hamid'bar dak m'chus'pas dak kak'for 'al-haaretz
translation: When the fall of dew lifted, there, over the surface of the wilderness, lay a fine and flaky substance, as fine as frost on the ground.

hebrew: וַיִּרְא֣וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ אִ֤ישׁ אֶל־אָחִיו֙ מָ֣ן ה֔וּא כִּ֛י לֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּ מַה־ה֑וּא וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם ה֣וּא הַלֶּ֔חֶם אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧ן יְהוָ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם לְאָכְלָֽה׃
transliteration: vayir'v v'ney-yis'rael vayom'rv iysh el-achiyv man hv kiy lo yad'v mah-hv vayomer mosheh alehem hv halechem asher natan y'hvah lakhem l'akh'lah
translation: When the Israelites saw it, they said to one another, “What is it?”bHeb. man hu; others “It is manna.”—for they did not know what it was. And Moses said to them, “That is the bread which the LORD has given you to eat.

hebrew: זֶ֤ה הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהוָ֔ה לִקְט֣וּ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ אִ֖ישׁ לְפִ֣י אָכְל֑וֹ עֹ֣מֶר לַגֻּלְגֹּ֗לֶת מִסְפַּר֙ נַפְשֹׁ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אִ֛ישׁ לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּאָהֳל֖וֹ תִּקָּֽחוּ׃
transliteration: zeh hadavar asher tzivah y'hvah lik'tv mimenv iysh l'fiy akh'lvo 'omer lagul'golet mis'par naf'shoteykhem iysh laasher b'aholvo tikachv
translation: This is what the LORD has commanded: Gather as much of it as each of you requires to eat, an omer to a person for as many of you as there are; each of you shall fetch for those in his tent.”

hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֖ן בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיִּלְקְט֔וּ הַמַּרְבֶּ֖ה וְהַמַּמְעִֽיט׃
transliteration: vaya'asv-khen b'ney yis'rael vayil'k'tv hamar'beh v'hamam'iyt
translation: The Israelites did so, some gathering much, some little.

hebrew: וַיָּמֹ֣דּוּ בָעֹ֔מֶר וְלֹ֤א הֶעְדִּיף֙ הַמַּרְבֶּ֔ה וְהַמַּמְעִ֖יט לֹ֣א הֶחְסִ֑יר אִ֥ישׁ לְפִֽי־אָכְל֖וֹ לָקָֽטוּ׃
transliteration: vayamodv va'omer v'lo he'diyf hamar'beh v'hamam'iyt lo hech'siyr iysh l'fiy-akh'lvo lakatv
translation: But when they measured it by the omer, he who had gathered much had no excess, and he who had gathered little had no deficiency: they had gathered as much as they needed to eat.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אִ֕ישׁ אַל־יוֹתֵ֥ר מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh alehem iysh al-yvoter mimenv 'ad-boker
translation: And Moses said to them, “Let no one leave any of it over until morning.”

hebrew: וְלֹא־שָׁמְע֣וּ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיּוֹתִ֨רוּ אֲנָשִׁ֤ים מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ עַד־בֹּ֔קֶר וַיָּ֥רֻם תּוֹלָעִ֖ים וַיִּבְאַ֑שׁ וַיִּקְצֹ֥ף עֲלֵהֶ֖ם מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'lo-sham'v el-mosheh vayvotirv anashiym mimenv 'ad-boker vayarum tvola'iym vayiv'ash vayik'tzof 'alehem mosheh
translation: But they paid no attention to Moses; some of them left of it until morning, and it became infested with maggots and stank. And Moses was angry with them.

hebrew: וַיִּלְקְט֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֔קֶר אִ֖ישׁ כְּפִ֣י אָכְל֑וֹ וְחַ֥ם הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ וְנָמָֽס׃
transliteration: vayil'k'tv otvo baboker baboker iysh k'fiy akh'lvo v'cham hashemesh v'namas
translation: So they gathered it every morning, each as much as he needed to eat; for when the sun grew hot, it would melt.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֗י לָֽקְט֥וּ לֶ֙חֶם֙ מִשְׁנֶ֔ה שְׁנֵ֥י הָעֹ֖מֶר לָאֶחָ֑ד וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ כָּל־נְשִׂיאֵ֣י הָֽעֵדָ֔ה וַיַּגִּ֖ידוּ לְמֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy  bayvom hashishiy lak'tv lechem mish'neh sh'ney ha'omer laechad vayavov kal-n'siyey ha'edah vayagiydv l'mosheh
translation: On the sixth day they gathered double the amount of food, two omers for each; and when all the chieftains of the community came and told Moses,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם ה֚וּא אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה שַׁבָּת֧וֹן שַׁבַּת־קֹ֛דֶשׁ לַֽיהוָ֖ה מָחָ֑ר אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאפ֞וּ אֵפ֗וּ וְאֵ֤ת אֲשֶֽׁר־תְּבַשְּׁלוּ֙ בַּשֵּׁ֔לוּ וְאֵת֙ כָּל־הָ֣עֹדֵ֔ף הַנִּ֧יחוּ לָכֶ֛ם לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת עַד־הַבֹּֽקֶר׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem hv asher diber y'hvah shabatvon shabat-kodesh layhvah machar et asher-tofv efv v'et asher-t'vash'lv bashelv v'et kal-ha'odef haniychv lakhem l'mish'meret 'ad-haboker
translation: he said to them, “This is what the L<small>ORD</small> meant: Tomorrow is a day of rest, a holy sabbath of the L<small>ORD</small>. Bake what you would bake and boil what you would boil; and all that is left put aside to be kept until morning.”

hebrew: וַיַּנִּ֤יחוּ אֹתוֹ֙ עַד־הַבֹּ֔קֶר כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֣ה מֹשֶׁ֑ה וְלֹ֣א הִבְאִ֔ישׁ וְרִמָּ֖ה לֹא־הָ֥יְתָה בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayaniychv otvo 'ad-haboker kaasher tzivah mosheh v'lo hiv'iysh v'rimah lo-hay'tah bvo
translation: So they put it aside until morning, as Moses had ordered; and it did not turn foul, and there were no maggots in it.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אִכְלֻ֣הוּ הַיּ֔וֹם כִּֽי־שַׁבָּ֥ת הַיּ֖וֹם לַיהוָ֑ה הַיּ֕וֹם לֹ֥א תִמְצָאֻ֖הוּ בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh ikh'luhv hayvom kiy-shabat hayvom layhvah hayvom lo tim'tzauhv basadeh
translation: Then Moses said, “Eat it today, for today is a sabbath of the L<small>ORD</small>; you will not find it today on the plain.

hebrew: שֵׁ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים תִּלְקְטֻ֑הוּ וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֛י שַׁבָּ֖ת לֹ֥א יִֽהְיֶה־בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: sheshet yamiym til'k'tuhv vvayvom hash'viy'iy shabat lo yih'yeh-bvo
translation: Six days you shall gather it; on the seventh day, the sabbath, there will be none.”

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י יָצְא֥וּ מִן־הָעָ֖ם לִלְקֹ֑ט וְלֹ֖א מָצָֽאוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'hiy bayvom hash'viy'iy yatz'v min-ha'am lil'kot v'lo matzav (s)
translation: Yet some of the people went out on the seventh day to gather, but they found nothing.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה עַד־אָ֙נָה֙ מֵֽאַנְתֶּ֔ם לִשְׁמֹ֥ר מִצְוֺתַ֖י וְתוֹרֹתָֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh 'ad-anah mean'tem lish'mor mitz'votay v'tvorotay
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “How long will you all refuse to obey My commandments and My teachings?

hebrew: רְא֗וּ כִּֽי־יְהוָה֮ נָתַ֣ן לָכֶ֣ם הַשַּׁבָּת֒ עַל־כֵּ֠ן ה֣וּא נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶ֛ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֖י לֶ֣חֶם יוֹמָ֑יִם שְׁב֣וּ ׀ אִ֣ישׁ תַּחְתָּ֗יו אַל־יֵ֥צֵא אִ֛ישׁ מִמְּקֹמ֖וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִֽי׃
transliteration: r'v kiy-y'hvah natan lakhem hashabat 'al-ken hv noten lakhem bayvom hashishiy lechem yvomayim sh'vv  iysh tach'tayv al-yetze iysh mim'komvo bayvom hash'viy'iy
translation: Mark that the L<small>ORD</small> has given you the sabbath; therefore He gives you two days’ food on the sixth day. Let everyone remain where he is: let no one leave his place on the seventh day.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁבְּת֥וּ הָעָ֖ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִעִֽי׃
transliteration: vayish'b'tv ha'am bayvom hash'vi'iy
translation: So the people remained inactive on the seventh day.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרְא֧וּ בֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ מָ֑ן וְה֗וּא כְּזֶ֤רַע גַּד֙ לָבָ֔ן וְטַעְמ֖וֹ כְּצַפִּיחִ֥ת בִּדְבָֽשׁ׃
transliteration: vayik'r'v veyt-yis'rael et-sh'mvo man v'hv k'zera' gad lavan v'ta'mvo k'tzapiychit bid'vash
translation: The house of Israel named it manna;cHeb. man. it was like coriander seed, white, and it tasted like wafersdMeaning of Heb. ṣappiḥith uncertain. in honey.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה זֶ֤ה הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהוָ֔ה מְלֹ֤א הָעֹ֙מֶר֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶ֑ם לְמַ֣עַן ׀ יִרְא֣וּ אֶת־הַלֶּ֗חֶם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶאֱכַ֤לְתִּי אֶתְכֶם֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר בְּהוֹצִיאִ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh zeh hadavar asher tzivah y'hvah m'lo ha'omer mimenv l'mish'meret l'doroteykhem l'ma'an  yir'v et-halechem asher heekhal'tiy et'khem bamid'bar b'hvotziyiy et'khem meeretz mitz'rayim
translation: Moses said, “This is what the LORD has commanded: Let one omer of it be kept throughout the ages, in order that they may see the bread that I fed you in the wilderness when I brought you out from the land of Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן קַ֚ח צִנְצֶ֣נֶת אַחַ֔ת וְתֶן־שָׁ֥מָּה מְלֹֽא־הָעֹ֖מֶר מָ֑ן וְהַנַּ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon kach tzin'tzenet achat v'ten-shamah m'lo-ha'omer man v'hanach otvo lif'ney y'hvah l'mish'meret l'doroteykhem
translation: And Moses said to Aaron, “Take a jar, put one omer of manna in it, and place it before the LORD, to be kept throughout the ages.”

hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיַּנִּיחֵ֧הוּ אַהֲרֹ֛ן לִפְנֵ֥י הָעֵדֻ֖ת לְמִשְׁמָֽרֶת׃
transliteration: kaasher tzivah y'hvah el-mosheh vayaniychehv aharon lif'ney ha'edut l'mish'maret
translation: As the LORD had commanded Moses, Aaron placed it before the Pact,eOthers “Testimony.” to be kept.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אָֽכְל֤וּ אֶת־הַמָּן֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה עַד־בֹּאָ֖ם אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ נוֹשָׁ֑בֶת אֶת־הַמָּן֙ אָֽכְל֔וּ עַד־בֹּאָ֕ם אֶל־קְצֵ֖ה אֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: vv'ney yis'rael akh'lv et-haman ar'ba'iym shanah 'ad-boam el-eretz nvoshavet et-haman akh'lv 'ad-boam el-k'tzeh eretz k'na'an
translation: And the Israelites ate manna forty years, until they came to a settled land; they ate the manna until they came to the border of the land of Canaan.

hebrew: וְהָעֹ֕מֶר עֲשִׂרִ֥ית הָאֵיפָ֖ה הֽוּא׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'ha'omer 'asiriyt haeyfah hv (f)
translation: The omer is a tenth of an ephah.

hebrew: וַ֠יִּסְעוּ כָּל־עֲדַ֨ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל מִמִּדְבַּר־סִ֛ין לְמַסְעֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־פִּ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בִּרְפִידִ֔ים וְאֵ֥ין מַ֖יִם לִשְׁתֹּ֥ת הָעָֽם׃
transliteration: vayis'v kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael mimid'bar-siyn l'mas'eyhem 'al-piy y'hvah vayachanv bir'fiydiym v'eyn mayim lish'tot ha'am
translation: From the wilderness of Sin the whole Israelite community continued by stages as the L<small>ORD</small> would command. They encamped at Rephidim, and there was no water for the people to drink.

hebrew: וַיָּ֤רֶב הָעָם֙ עִם־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ תְּנוּ־לָ֥נוּ מַ֖יִם וְנִשְׁתֶּ֑ה וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה מַה־תְּרִיבוּן֙ עִמָּדִ֔י מַה־תְּנַסּ֖וּן אֶת־יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayarev ha'am 'im-mosheh vayom'rv t'nv-lanv mayim v'nish'teh vayomer lahem mosheh mah-t'riyvvn 'imadiy mah-t'nasvn et-y'hvah
translation: The people quarreled with Moses. “Give us water to drink,” they said; and Moses replied to them, “Why do you quarrel with me? Why do you try the L<small>ORD</small>?”

hebrew: וַיִּצְמָ֨א שָׁ֤ם הָעָם֙ לַמַּ֔יִם וַיָּ֥לֶן הָעָ֖ם עַל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לָ֤מָּה זֶּה֙ הֶעֱלִיתָ֣נוּ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם לְהָמִ֥ית אֹתִ֛י וְאֶת־בָּנַ֥י וְאֶת־מִקְנַ֖י בַּצָּמָֽא׃
transliteration: vayitz'ma sham ha'am lamayim vayalen ha'am 'al-mosheh vayomer lamah zeh he'eliytanv mimitz'rayim l'hamiyt otiy v'et-banay v'et-mik'nay batzama
translation: But the people thirsted there for water; and the people grumbled against Moses and said, “Why did you bring us up from Egypt, to kill us and our children and livestock with thirst?”

hebrew: וַיִּצְעַ֤ק מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֣ה לֵאמֹ֔ר מָ֥ה אֶעֱשֶׂ֖ה לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה ע֥וֹד מְעַ֖ט וּסְקָלֻֽנִי׃
transliteration: vayitz'ak mosheh el-y'hvah lemor mah e'eseh la'am hazeh 'vod m'at vs'kaluniy
translation: Moses cried out to the L<small>ORD</small>, saying, “What shall I do with this people? Before long they will be stoning me!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה עֲבֹר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם וְקַ֥ח אִתְּךָ֖ מִזִּקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּמַטְּךָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִכִּ֤יתָ בּוֹ֙ אֶת־הַיְאֹ֔ר קַ֥ח בְּיָדְךָ֖ וְהָלָֽכְתָּ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh 'avor lif'ney ha'am v'kach it'kha mizik'ney yis'rael vmat'kha asher hikiyta bvo et-hay'or kach b'yad'kha v'halakh'ta
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Pass before the people; take with you some of the elders of Israel, and take along the rod with which you struck the Nile, and set out.

hebrew: הִנְנִ֣י עֹמֵד֩ לְפָנֶ֨יךָ שָּׁ֥ם ׀ עַֽל־הַצּוּר֮ בְּחֹרֵב֒ וְהִכִּ֣יתָ בַצּ֗וּר וְיָצְא֥וּ מִמֶּ֛נּוּ מַ֖יִם וְשָׁתָ֣ה הָעָ֑ם וַיַּ֤עַשׂ כֵּן֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְעֵינֵ֖י זִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: hin'niy 'omed l'faneykha sham  'al-hatzvr b'chorev v'hikiyta vatzvr v'yatz'v mimenv mayim v'shatah ha'am vaya'as ken mosheh l'eyney zik'ney yis'rael
translation: I will be standing there before you on the rock at Horeb. Strike the rock and water will issue from it, and the people will drink.” And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא֙ שֵׁ֣ם הַמָּק֔וֹם מַסָּ֖ה וּמְרִיבָ֑ה עַל־רִ֣יב ׀ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְעַ֨ל נַסֹּתָ֤ם אֶת־יְהוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הֲיֵ֧שׁ יְהוָ֛ה בְּקִרְבֵּ֖נוּ אִם־אָֽיִן׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayik'ra shem hamakvom masah vm'riyvah 'al-riyv  b'ney yis'rael v'al nasotam et-y'hvah lemor hayesh y'hvah b'kir'benv im-ayin (f)
translation: The place was named MassahaI.e., “Trial.” and Meribah,bI.e., “Quarrel.” because the Israelites quarreled and because they tried the LORD, saying, “Is the LORD present among us or not?”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֖א עֲמָלֵ֑ק וַיִּלָּ֥חֶם עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בִּרְפִידִֽם׃
transliteration: vayavo 'amalek vayilachem 'im-yis'rael bir'fiydim
translation: Amalek came and fought with Israel at Rephidim.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ בְּחַר־לָ֣נוּ אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְצֵ֖א הִלָּחֵ֣ם בַּעֲמָלֵ֑ק מָחָ֗ר אָנֹכִ֤י נִצָּב֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַגִּבְעָ֔ה וּמַטֵּ֥ה הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּיָדִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-y'hvoshu'a b'char-lanv anashiym v'tze hilachem ba'amalek machar anokhiy nitzav 'al-rosh hagiv'ah vmateh haelohiym b'yadiy
translation: Moses said to Joshua, “Pick some men for us, and go out and do battle with Amalek. Tomorrow I will station myself on the top of the hill, with the rod of God in my hand.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר אָֽמַר־לוֹ֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם בַּעֲמָלֵ֑ק וּמֹשֶׁה֙ אַהֲרֹ֣ן וְח֔וּר עָל֖וּ רֹ֥אשׁ הַגִּבְעָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'as y'hvoshu'a kaasher amar-lvo mosheh l'hilachem ba'amalek vmosheh aharon v'chvr 'alv rosh hagiv'ah
translation: Joshua did as Moses told him and fought with Amalek, while Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרִ֥ים מֹשֶׁ֛ה יָד֖וֹ וְגָבַ֣ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְכַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יָנִ֛יחַ יָד֖וֹ וְגָבַ֥ר עֲמָלֵֽק׃
transliteration: v'hayah kaasher yariym mosheh yadvo v'gavar yis'rael v'khaasher yaniycha yadvo v'gavar 'amalek
translation: Then, whenever Moses held up his hand, Israel prevailed; but whenever he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.

hebrew: וִידֵ֤י מֹשֶׁה֙ כְּבֵדִ֔ים וַיִּקְחוּ־אֶ֛בֶן וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ תַחְתָּ֖יו וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב עָלֶ֑יהָ וְאַהֲרֹ֨ן וְח֜וּר תָּֽמְכ֣וּ בְיָדָ֗יו מִזֶּ֤ה אֶחָד֙ וּמִזֶּ֣ה אֶחָ֔ד וַיְהִ֥י יָדָ֛יו אֱמוּנָ֖ה עַד־בֹּ֥א הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃
transliteration: viydey mosheh k'vediym vayik'chv-even vayasiymv tach'tayv vayeshev 'aleyha v'aharon v'chvr tam'khv v'yadayv mizeh echad vmizeh echad vay'hiy yadayv emvnah 'ad-bo hashamesh
translation: But Moses’ hands grew heavy; so they took a stone and put it under him and he sat on it, while Aaron and Hur, one on each side, supported his hands; thus his hands remained steady until the sun set.

hebrew: וַיַּחֲלֹ֧שׁ יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶת־עֲמָלֵ֥ק וְאֶת־עַמּ֖וֹ לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayachalosh y'hvoshu'a et-'amalek v'et-'amvo l'fiy-charev (f)
translation: And Joshua overwhelmed the people of AmalekcLit. “Amalek and his people.” with the sword.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כְּתֹ֨ב זֹ֤את זִכָּרוֹן֙ בַּסֵּ֔פֶר וְשִׂ֖ים בְּאָזְנֵ֣י יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ כִּֽי־מָחֹ֤ה אֶמְחֶה֙ אֶת־זֵ֣כֶר עֲמָלֵ֔ק מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh k'tov zot zikarvon basefer v'siym b'az'ney y'hvoshu'a kiy-machoh em'cheh et-zekher 'amalek mitachat hashamayim
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Inscribe this in a document as a reminder, and read it aloud to Joshua: I will utterly blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven!”

hebrew: וַיִּ֥בֶן מֹשֶׁ֖ה מִזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יְהוָ֥ה ׀ נִסִּֽי׃
transliteration: vayiven mosheh miz'becha vayik'ra sh'mvo y'hvah  nisiy
translation: And Moses built an altar and named it Adonai-nissi.dI.e., “The Lord is my banner.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כִּֽי־יָד֙ עַל־כֵּ֣ס יָ֔הּ מִלְחָמָ֥ה לַיהוָ֖ה בַּֽעֲמָלֵ֑ק מִדֹּ֖ר דֹּֽר׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayomer kiy-yad 'al-kes yah mil'chamah layhvah ba'amalek midor dor (f)
translation: He said, “It means, ‘Hand upon the throneeMeaning of Heb. kes uncertain. of the LORD!’ The LORD will be at war with Amalek throughout the ages.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֞ע יִתְר֨וֹ כֹהֵ֤ן מִדְיָן֙ חֹתֵ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֵת֩ כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ לְמֹשֶׁ֔ה וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַמּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־הוֹצִ֧יא יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' yit'rvo khohen mid'yan choten mosheh et kal-asher 'asah elohiym l'mosheh vl'yis'rael 'amvo kiy-hvotziy y'hvah et-yis'rael mimitz'rayim
translation: Jethro priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard all that God had done for Moses and for Israel His people, how the L<small>ORD</small> had brought Israel out from Egypt.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֗ח יִתְרוֹ֙ חֹתֵ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־צִפֹּרָ֖ה אֵ֣שֶׁת מֹשֶׁ֑ה אַחַ֖ר שִׁלּוּחֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayikach yit'rvo choten mosheh et-tziporah eshet mosheh achar shilvcheyha
translation: So Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after she had been sent home,

hebrew: וְאֵ֖ת שְׁנֵ֣י בָנֶ֑יהָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר שֵׁ֤ם הָֽאֶחָד֙ גֵּֽרְשֹׁ֔ם כִּ֣י אָמַ֔ר גֵּ֣ר הָיִ֔יתִי בְּאֶ֖רֶץ נָכְרִיָּֽה׃
transliteration: v'et sh'ney vaneyha asher shem haechad ger'shom kiy amar ger hayiytiy b'eretz nakh'riyah
translation: and her two sons—of whom one was named Gershom, that is to say, “I have been a strangeraHeb. ger. in a foreign land”;

hebrew: וְשֵׁ֥ם הָאֶחָ֖ד אֱלִיעֶ֑זֶר כִּֽי־אֱלֹהֵ֤י אָבִי֙ בְּעֶזְרִ֔י וַיַּצִּלֵ֖נִי מֵחֶ֥רֶב פַּרְעֹֽה׃
transliteration: v'shem haechad eliy'ezer kiy-elohey aviy b'ez'riy vayatzileniy mecherev par'oh
translation: and the other was named Eliezer,bLit. “(My) God is help.” meaning, “The God of my father was my help, and He delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh.”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֞א יִתְר֨וֹ חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֛ה וּבָנָ֥יו וְאִשְׁתּ֖וֹ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֗ר אֲשֶׁר־ה֛וּא חֹנֶ֥ה שָׁ֖ם הַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: vayavo yit'rvo choten mosheh vvanayv v'ish'tvo el-mosheh el-hamid'bar asher-hv choneh sham har haelohiym
translation: Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought Moses’ sons and wife to him in the wilderness, where he was encamped at the mountain of God.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֲנִ֛י חֹתֶנְךָ֥ יִתְר֖וֹ בָּ֣א אֵלֶ֑יךָ וְאִ֨שְׁתְּךָ֔ וּשְׁנֵ֥י בָנֶ֖יהָ עִמָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayomer el-mosheh aniy choten'kha yit'rvo ba eleykha v'ish't'kha vsh'ney vaneyha 'imah
translation: He sent word to Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you, with your wife and her two sons.”

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א מֹשֶׁ֜ה לִקְרַ֣את חֹֽתְנ֗וֹ וַיִּשְׁתַּ֙חוּ֙ וַיִּשַּׁק־ל֔וֹ וַיִּשְׁאֲל֥וּ אִישׁ־לְרֵעֵ֖הוּ לְשָׁל֑וֹם וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ הָאֹֽהֱלָה׃
transliteration: vayetze mosheh lik'rat chot'nvo vayish'tachv vayishak-lvo vayish'alv iysh-l're'ehv l'shalvom vayavov haohelah
translation: Moses went out to meet his father-in-law; he bowed low and kissed him; each asked after the other’s welfare, and they went into the tent.

hebrew: וַיְסַפֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ לְחֹ֣תְנ֔וֹ אֵת֩ כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה יְהוָה֙ לְפַרְעֹ֣ה וּלְמִצְרַ֔יִם עַ֖ל אוֹדֹ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֵ֤ת כָּל־הַתְּלָאָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מְצָאָ֣תַם בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ וַיַּצִּלֵ֖ם יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'saper mosheh l'chot'nvo et kal-asher 'asah y'hvah l'far'oh vl'mitz'rayim 'al vodot yis'rael et kal-hat'laah asher m'tzaatam baderekh' vayatzilem y'hvah
translation: Moses then recounted to his father-in-law everything that the L<small>ORD</small> had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, all the hardships that had befallen them on the way, and how the L<small>ORD</small> had delivered them.

hebrew: וַיִּ֣חַדְּ יִתְר֔וֹ עַ֚ל כָּל־הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִצִּיל֖וֹ מִיַּ֥ד מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayichad' yit'rvo 'al kal-hatvovah asher-'asah y'hvah l'yis'rael asher hitziylvo miyad mitz'rayim
translation: And Jethro rejoiced over all the kindness that the L<small>ORD</small> had shown Israel when He delivered them from the Egyptians.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֮ יִתְרוֹ֒ בָּר֣וּךְ יְהוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִצִּ֥יל אֶתְכֶ֛ם מִיַּ֥ד מִצְרַ֖יִם וּמִיַּ֣ד פַּרְעֹ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִצִּיל֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם מִתַּ֖חַת יַד־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer yit'rvo barvkh' y'hvah asher hitziyl et'khem miyad mitz'rayim vmiyad par'oh asher hitziyl et-ha'am mitachat yad-mitz'rayim
translation: “Blessed be the L<small>ORD</small>,” Jethro said, “who delivered you from the Egyptians and from Pharaoh, and who delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.

hebrew: עַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּֽי־גָד֥וֹל יְהוָ֖ה מִכָּל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּ֣י בַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר זָד֖וּ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: 'atah yada'tiy kiy-gadvol y'hvah mikal-haelohiym kiy vadavar asher zadv 'aleyhem
translation: Now I know that the LORD is greater than all gods, cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.yes, by the result of their very schemes against [the people].”-c

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח יִתְר֨וֹ חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֛ה עֹלָ֥ה וּזְבָחִ֖ים לֵֽאלֹהִ֑ים וַיָּבֹ֨א אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְכֹ֣ל ׀ זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֶאֱכָל־לֶ֛חֶם עִם־חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: vayikach yit'rvo choten mosheh 'olah vz'vachiym lelohiym vayavo aharon v'khol  zik'ney yis'rael leekhal-lechem 'im-choten mosheh lif'ney haelohiym
translation: And Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought a burnt offering and sacrifices for God; and Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to partake of the meal before God with Moses’ father-in-law.

hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ מִֽמָּחֳרָ֔ת וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב מֹשֶׁ֖ה לִשְׁפֹּ֣ט אֶת־הָעָ֑ם וַיַּעֲמֹ֤ד הָעָם֙ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה מִן־הַבֹּ֖קֶר עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: vay'hiy mimachorat vayeshev mosheh lish'pot et-ha'am vaya'amod ha'am 'al-mosheh min-haboker 'ad-ha'arev
translation: Next day, Moses sat as magistrate among the people, while the people stood about Moses from morning until evening.

hebrew: וַיַּרְא֙ חֹתֵ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֵ֛ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־ה֥וּא עֹשֶׂ֖ה לָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מָֽה־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתָּ֤ה עֹשֶׂה֙ לָעָ֔ם מַדּ֗וּעַ אַתָּ֤ה יוֹשֵׁב֙ לְבַדֶּ֔ךָ וְכָל־הָעָ֛ם נִצָּ֥ב עָלֶ֖יךָ מִן־בֹּ֥קֶר עַד־עָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: vayar' choten mosheh et kal-asher-hv 'oseh la'am vayomer mah-hadavar hazeh asher atah 'oseh la'am madv'a atah yvoshev l'vadekha v'khal-ha'am nitzav 'aleykha min-boker 'ad-'arev
translation: But when Moses’ father-in-law saw how much he had to do for the people, he said, “What is this thing that you are doing to the people? Why do you actdLit. “sit” as magistrate; cf. v. 13. alone, while all the people stand about you from morning until evening?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה לְחֹתְנ֑וֹ כִּֽי־יָבֹ֥א אֵלַ֛י הָעָ֖ם לִדְרֹ֥שׁ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh l'chot'nvo kiy-yavo elay ha'am lid'rosh elohiym
translation: Moses replied to his father-in-law, “It is because the people come to me to inquire of God.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֨ה לָהֶ֤ם דָּבָר֙ בָּ֣א אֵלַ֔י וְשָׁ֣פַטְתִּ֔י בֵּ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ וּבֵ֣ין רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְהוֹדַעְתִּ֛י אֶת־חֻקֵּ֥י הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים וְאֶת־תּוֹרֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: kiy-yih'yeh lahem davar ba elay v'shafat'tiy beyn iysh vveyn re'ehv v'hvoda'tiy et-chukey haelohiym v'et-tvorotayv
translation: When they have a dispute, it comes before me, and I decide between one person and another, and I make known the laws and teachings of God.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֵלָ֑יו לֹא־טוֹב֙ הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֖ה עֹשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: vayomer choten mosheh elayv lo-tvov hadavar asher atah 'oseh
translation: But Moses’ father-in-law said to him, “The thing you are doing is not right;

hebrew: נָבֹ֣ל תִּבֹּ֔ל גַּם־אַתָּ֕ה גַּם־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמָּ֑ךְ כִּֽי־כָבֵ֤ד מִמְּךָ֙ הַדָּבָ֔ר לֹא־תוּכַ֥ל עֲשֹׂ֖הוּ לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: navol tibol gam-atah gam-ha'am hazeh asher 'imakh' kiy-khaved mim'kha hadavar lo-tvkhal 'asohv l'vadekha
translation: you will surely wear yourself out, and these people as well. For the task is too heavy for you; you cannot do it alone.

hebrew: עַתָּ֞ה שְׁמַ֤ע בְּקֹלִי֙ אִיעָ֣צְךָ֔ וִיהִ֥י אֱלֹהִ֖ים עִמָּ֑ךְ הֱיֵ֧ה אַתָּ֣ה לָעָ֗ם מ֚וּל הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים וְהֵבֵאתָ֥ אַתָּ֛ה אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: 'atah sh'ma' b'koliy iy'atz'kha viyhiy elohiym 'imakh' heyeh atah la'am mvl haelohiym v'heveta atah et-had'variym el-haelohiym
translation: Now listen to me. I will give you counsel, and God be with you! You represent the people before God: you bring the disputes before God,

hebrew: וְהִזְהַרְתָּ֣ה אֶתְהֶ֔ם אֶת־הַחֻקִּ֖ים וְאֶת־הַתּוֹרֹ֑ת וְהוֹדַעְתָּ֣ לָהֶ֗ם אֶת־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ יֵ֣לְכוּ בָ֔הּ וְאֶת־הַֽמַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲשֽׂוּן׃
transliteration: v'hiz'har'tah et'hem et-hachukiym v'et-hatvorot v'hvoda'ta lahem et-haderekh' yel'khv vah v'et-hama'aseh asher ya'asvn
translation: and enjoin upon them the laws and the teachings, and make known to them the way they are to go and the practices they are to follow.

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה תֶחֱזֶ֣ה מִכָּל־הָ֠עָם אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֜יִל יִרְאֵ֧י אֱלֹהִ֛ים אַנְשֵׁ֥י אֱמֶ֖ת שֹׂ֣נְאֵי בָ֑צַע וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ עֲלֵהֶ֗ם שָׂרֵ֤י אֲלָפִים֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מֵא֔וֹת שָׂרֵ֥י חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֥י עֲשָׂרֹֽת׃
transliteration: v'atah techezeh mikal-ha'am an'shey-chayil yir'ey elohiym an'shey emet son'ey vatza' v'sam'ta 'alehem sarey alafiym sarey mevot sarey chamishiym v'sarey 'asarot
translation: You shall also seek out from among all the people capable men who fear God, trustworthy men who spurn ill-gotten gain. Set these over them as chiefs of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens,

hebrew: וְשָׁפְט֣וּ אֶת־הָעָם֮ בְּכָל־עֵת֒ וְהָיָ֞ה כָּל־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַגָּדֹל֙ יָבִ֣יאוּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְכָל־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַקָּטֹ֖ן יִשְׁפְּטוּ־הֵ֑ם וְהָקֵל֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יךָ וְנָשְׂא֖וּ אִתָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'shaf'tv et-ha'am b'khal-'et v'hayah kal-hadavar hagadol yaviyv eleykha v'khal-hadavar hakaton yish'p'tv-hem v'hakel me'aleykha v'nas'v itakh'
translation: and let them judge the people at all times. Have them bring every major dispute to you, but let them decide every minor dispute themselves. Make it easier for yourself by letting them share the burden with you.

hebrew: אִ֣ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְצִוְּךָ֣ אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְיָֽכָלְתָּ֖ עֲמֹ֑ד וְגַם֙ כָּל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה עַל־מְקֹמ֖וֹ יָבֹ֥א בְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
transliteration: im et-hadavar hazeh ta'aseh v'tziv'kha elohiym v'yakhal'ta 'amod v'gam kal-ha'am hazeh 'al-m'komvo yavo v'shalvom
translation: If you do this—and God so commands you—you will be able to bear up; and all these people too will go home unwearied.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע מֹשֶׁ֖ה לְק֣וֹל חֹתְנ֑וֹ וַיַּ֕עַשׂ כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָמָֽר׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' mosheh l'kvol chot'nvo vaya'as kol asher amar
translation: Moses heeded his father-in-law and did just as he had said.

hebrew: וַיִּבְחַ֨ר מֹשֶׁ֤ה אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֙יִל֙ מִכָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛ם רָאשִׁ֖ים עַל־הָעָ֑ם שָׂרֵ֤י אֲלָפִים֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מֵא֔וֹת שָׂרֵ֥י חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֥י עֲשָׂרֹֽת׃
transliteration: vayiv'char mosheh an'shey-chayil mikal-yis'rael vayiten otam rashiym 'al-ha'am sarey alafiym sarey mevot sarey chamishiym v'sarey 'asarot
translation: Moses chose capable men out of all Israel, and appointed them heads over the people—chiefs of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens;

hebrew: וְשָׁפְט֥וּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם בְּכָל־עֵ֑ת אֶת־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַקָּשֶׁה֙ יְבִיא֣וּן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְכָל־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַקָּטֹ֖ן יִשְׁפּוּט֥וּ הֵֽם׃
transliteration: v'shaf'tv et-ha'am b'khal-'et et-hadavar hakasheh y'viyvn el-mosheh v'khal-hadavar hakaton yish'pvtv hem
translation: and they judged the people at all times: the difficult matters they would bring to Moses, and all the minor matters they would decide themselves.

hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶת־חֹתְנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ ל֖וֹ אֶל־אַרְצֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'shalach mosheh et-chot'nvo vayelekh' lvo el-ar'tzvo (f)
translation: Then Moses bade his father-in-law farewell, and he went his way to his own land.

hebrew: בַּחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י לְצֵ֥את בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם בַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה בָּ֖אוּ מִדְבַּ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
transliteration: bachodesh hash'liyshiy l'tzet b'ney-yis'rael meeretz mitz'rayim bayvom hazeh bav mid'bar siynay
translation: On the third new moon after the Israelites had gone forth from the land of Egypt, on that very day, they entered the wilderness of Sinai.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֣וּ מֵרְפִידִ֗ים וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ מִדְבַּ֣ר סִינַ֔י וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַיִּֽחַן־שָׁ֥ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נֶ֥גֶד הָהָֽר׃
transliteration: vayis'v mer'fiydiym vayavov mid'bar siynay vayachanv bamid'bar vayichan-sham yis'rael neged hahar
translation: Having journeyed from Rephidim, they entered the wilderness of Sinai and encamped in the wilderness. Israel encamped there in front of the mountain,

hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁ֥ה עָלָ֖ה אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֵלָ֤יו יְהוָה֙ מִן־הָהָ֣ר לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֤ה תֹאמַר֙ לְבֵ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְתַגֵּ֖יד לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vmosheh 'alah el-haelohiym vayik'ra elayv y'hvah min-hahar lemor koh tomar l'veyt ya'akov v'tageyd liv'ney yis'rael
translation: and Moses went up to God. The L<small>ORD</small> called to him from the mountain, saying, “Thus shall you say to the house of Jacob and declare to the children of Israel:

hebrew: אַתֶּ֣ם רְאִיתֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתִי לְמִצְרָ֑יִם וָאֶשָּׂ֤א אֶתְכֶם֙ עַל־כַּנְפֵ֣י נְשָׁרִ֔ים וָאָבִ֥א אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃
transliteration: atem r'iytem asher 'asiytiy l'mitz'rayim vaesa et'khem 'al-kan'fey n'shariym vaavi et'khem elay
translation: ‘You have seen what I did to the Egyptians, how I bore you on eagles’ wings and brought you to Me.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה אִם־שָׁמ֤וֹעַ תִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ בְּקֹלִ֔י וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֑י וִהְיִ֨יתֶם לִ֤י סְגֻלָּה֙ מִכָּל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים כִּי־לִ֖י כָּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'atah im-shamvo'a tish'm'v b'koliy vsh'mar'tem et-b'riytiy vih'yiytem liy s'gulah mikal-ha'amiym kiy-liy kal-haaretz
translation: Now then, if you will obey Me faithfully and keep My covenant, you shall be My treasured possession among all the peoples. Indeed, all the earth is Mine,

hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֧ם תִּהְיוּ־לִ֛י מַמְלֶ֥כֶת כֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְג֣וֹי קָד֑וֹשׁ אֵ֚לֶּה הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּדַבֵּ֖ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'atem tih'yv-liy mam'lekhet kohaniym v'gvoy kadvosh eleh had'variym asher t'daber el-b'ney yis'rael
translation: but you shall be to Me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words that you shall speak to the children of Israel.”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיִּקְרָ֖א לְזִקְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וַיָּ֣שֶׂם לִפְנֵיהֶ֗ם אֵ֚ת כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖הוּ יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayavo mosheh vayik'ra l'zik'ney ha'am vayasem lif'neyhem et kal-had'variym haeleh asher tzivahv y'hvah
translation: Moses came and summoned the elders of the people and put before them all that the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded him.

hebrew: וַיַּעֲנ֨וּ כָל־הָעָ֤ם יַחְדָּו֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה נַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וַיָּ֧שֶׁב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם אֶל־יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'anv khal-ha'am yach'dav vayom'rv kol asher-diber y'hvah na'aseh vayashev mosheh et-div'rey ha'am el-y'hvah
translation: All the people answered as one, saying, “All that the L<small>ORD</small> has spoken we will do!” And Moses brought back the people’s words to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י בָּ֣א אֵלֶיךָ֮ בְּעַ֣ב הֶֽעָנָן֒ בַּעֲב֞וּר יִשְׁמַ֤ע הָעָם֙ בְּדַבְּרִ֣י עִמָּ֔ךְ וְגַם־בְּךָ֖ יַאֲמִ֣ינוּ לְעוֹלָ֑ם וַיַּגֵּ֥ד מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם אֶל־יְהוָֽה׃
