transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh hineh anokhiy ba eleykha b'av he'anan ba'avvr yish'ma' ha'am b'dab'riy 'imakh' v'gam-b'kha yaamiynv l'volam vayaged mosheh et-div'rey ha'am el-y'hvah
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “I will come to you in a thick cloud, in order that the people may hear when I speak with you and so trust you ever after.” Then Moses reported the people’s words to the L<small>ORD</small>,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ לֵ֣ךְ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ם הַיּ֖וֹם וּמָחָ֑ר וְכִבְּס֖וּ שִׂמְלֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh lekh' el-ha'am v'kidash'tam hayvom vmachar v'khib'sv sim'lotam
translation: and the LORD said to Moses, “Go to the people and warn them to stay pureaCf. v. 15. today and tomorrow. Let them wash their clothes.

hebrew: וְהָי֥וּ נְכֹנִ֖ים לַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י כִּ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֗י יֵרֵ֧ד יְהוָ֛ה לְעֵינֵ֥י כָל־הָעָ֖ם עַל־הַ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
transliteration: v'hayv n'khoniym layvom hash'liyshiy kiy  bayvom hash'liyshiy yered y'hvah l'eyney khal-ha'am 'al-har siynay
translation: Let them be ready for the third day; for on the third day the L<small>ORD</small> will come down, in the sight of all the people, on Mount Sinai.

hebrew: וְהִגְבַּלְתָּ֤ אֶת־הָעָם֙ סָבִ֣יב לֵאמֹ֔ר הִשָּׁמְר֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם עֲל֥וֹת בָּהָ֖ר וּנְגֹ֣עַ בְּקָצֵ֑הוּ כָּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּהָ֖ר מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: v'hig'bal'ta et-ha'am saviyv lemor hisham'rv lakhem 'alvot bahar vn'go'a b'katzehv kal-hanoge'a bahar mvot yvmat
translation: You shall set bounds for the people round about, saying, ‘Beware of going up the mountain or touching the border of it. Whoever touches the mountain shall be put to death:

hebrew: לֹא־תִגַּ֨ע בּ֜וֹ יָ֗ד כִּֽי־סָק֤וֹל יִסָּקֵל֙ אוֹ־יָרֹ֣ה יִיָּרֶ֔ה אִם־בְּהֵמָ֥ה אִם־אִ֖ישׁ לֹ֣א יִחְיֶ֑ה בִּמְשֹׁךְ֙ הַיֹּבֵ֔ל הֵ֖מָּה יַעֲל֥וּ בָהָֽר׃
transliteration: lo-tiga' bvo yad kiy-sakvol yisakel vo-yaroh yiyareh im-b'hemah im-iysh lo yich'yeh bim'shokh' hayovel hemah ya'alv vahar
translation: no hand shall touch him, but he shall be either stoned or shot; beast or man, he shall not live.’ When the ram’s horn bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.sounds a long blast,-b they may go up on the mountain.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֧רֶד מֹשֶׁ֛ה מִן־הָהָ֖ר אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וַיְקַדֵּשׁ֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וַֽיְכַבְּס֖וּ שִׂמְלֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayered mosheh min-hahar el-ha'am vay'kadesh et-ha'am vay'khab'sv sim'lotam
translation: Moses came down from the mountain to the people and warned the people to stay pure, and they washed their clothes.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם הֱי֥וּ נְכֹנִ֖ים לִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים אַֽל־תִּגְּשׁ֖וּ אֶל־אִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayomer el-ha'am heyv n'khoniym lish'loshet yamiym al-tig'shv el-ishah
translation: And he said to the people, “Be ready for the third day: do not go near a woman.”

hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֜י בִּֽהְיֹ֣ת הַבֹּ֗קֶר וַיְהִי֩ קֹלֹ֨ת וּבְרָקִ֜ים וְעָנָ֤ן כָּבֵד֙ עַל־הָהָ֔ר וְקֹ֥ל שֹׁפָ֖ר חָזָ֣ק מְאֹ֑ד וַיֶּחֱרַ֥ד כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy vayvom hash'liyshiy bih'yot haboker vay'hiy kolot vv'rakiym v'anan kaved 'al-hahar v'kol shofar chazak m'od vayecherad kal-ha'am asher bamachaneh
translation: On the third day, as morning dawned, there was thunder, and lightning, and a dense cloud upon the mountain, and a very loud blast of the horn; and all the people who were in the camp trembled.

hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵ֨א מֹשֶׁ֧ה אֶת־הָעָ֛ם לִקְרַ֥את הָֽאֱלֹהִ֖ים מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וַיִּֽתְיַצְּב֖וּ בְּתַחְתִּ֥ית הָהָֽר׃
transliteration: vayvotze mosheh et-ha'am lik'rat haelohiym min-hamachaneh vayit'yatz'vv b'tach'tiyt hahar
translation: Moses led the people out of the camp toward God, and they took their places at the foot of the mountain.

hebrew: וְהַ֤ר סִינַי֙ עָשַׁ֣ן כֻּלּ֔וֹ מִ֠פְּנֵי אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרַ֥ד עָלָ֛יו יְהוָ֖ה בָּאֵ֑שׁ וַיַּ֤עַל עֲשָׁנוֹ֙ כְּעֶ֣שֶׁן הַכִּבְשָׁ֔ן וַיֶּחֱרַ֥ד כָּל־הָהָ֖ר מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: v'har siynay 'ashan kulvo mip'ney asher yarad 'alayv y'hvah baesh vaya'al 'ashanvo k'eshen hakiv'shan vayecherad kal-hahar m'od
translation: Now Mount Sinai was all in smoke, for the LORD had come down upon it in fire; the smoke rose like the smoke of a kiln, and the whole mountaincSome Hebrew manuscripts and the Greek read “all the people”; cf. v. 16. trembled violently.

hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ ק֣וֹל הַשּׁוֹפָ֔ר הוֹלֵ֖ךְ וְחָזֵ֣ק מְאֹ֑ד מֹשֶׁ֣ה יְדַבֵּ֔ר וְהָאֱלֹהִ֖ים יַעֲנֶ֥נּוּ בְקֽוֹל׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kvol hashvofar hvolekh' v'chazek m'od mosheh y'daber v'haelohiym ya'anenv v'kvol
translation: The blare of the horn grew louder and louder. As Moses spoke, God answered him in thunder.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֧רֶד יְהוָ֛ה עַל־הַ֥ר סִינַ֖י אֶל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֑ר וַיִּקְרָ֨א יְהוָ֧ה לְמֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָהָ֖ר וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayered y'hvah 'al-har siynay el-rosh hahar vayik'ra y'hvah l'mosheh el-rosh hahar vaya'al mosheh
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> came down upon Mount Sinai, on the top of the mountain, and the L<small>ORD</small> called Moses to the top of the mountain and Moses went up.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה רֵ֖ד הָעֵ֣ד בָּעָ֑ם פֶּן־יֶהֶרְס֤וּ אֶל־יְהוָה֙ לִרְא֔וֹת וְנָפַ֥ל מִמֶּ֖נּוּ רָֽב׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh red ha'ed ba'am pen-yeher'sv el-y'hvah lir'vot v'nafal mimenv rav
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Go down, warn the people not to break through to the L<small>ORD</small> to gaze, lest many of them perish.

hebrew: וְגַ֧ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֛ים הַנִּגָּשִׁ֥ים אֶל־יְהוָ֖ה יִתְקַדָּ֑שׁוּ פֶּן־יִפְרֹ֥ץ בָּהֶ֖ם יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'gam hakohaniym hanigashiym el-y'hvah yit'kadashv pen-yif'rotz bahem y'hvah
translation: The priests also, who come near the L<small>ORD</small>, must stay pure, lest the L<small>ORD</small> break out against them.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה לֹא־יוּכַ֣ל הָעָ֔ם לַעֲלֹ֖ת אֶל־הַ֣ר סִינָ֑י כִּֽי־אַתָּ֞ה הַעֵדֹ֤תָה בָּ֙נוּ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הַגְבֵּ֥ל אֶת־הָהָ֖ר וְקִדַּשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-y'hvah lo-yvkhal ha'am la'alot el-har siynay kiy-atah ha'edotah banv lemor hag'bel et-hahar v'kidash'tvo
translation: But Moses said to the L<small>ORD</small>, “The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai, for You warned us saying, ‘Set bounds about the mountain and sanctify it.’”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֤יו יְהוָה֙ לֶךְ־רֵ֔ד וְעָלִ֥יתָ אַתָּ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֣ן עִמָּ֑ךְ וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהָעָ֗ם אַל־יֶֽהֶרְס֛וּ לַעֲלֹ֥ת אֶל־יְהוָ֖ה פֶּן־יִפְרָץ־בָּֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv y'hvah lekh'-red v'aliyta atah v'aharon 'imakh' v'hakohaniym v'ha'am al-yeher'sv la'alot el-y'hvah pen-yif'ratz-bam
translation: So the L<small>ORD</small> said to him, “Go down, and come back together with Aaron; but let not the priests or the people break through to come up to the L<small>ORD</small>, lest He break out against them.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥רֶד מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲלֵהֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayered mosheh el-ha'am vayomer alehem (s)
translation: And Moses went down to the people and spoke to them.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֵ֛ת כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לֵאמֹֽר׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'daber elohiym et kal-had'variym haeleh lemor (s)
translation: God spoke all these words,aTradition varies as to the division of the Commandments in vv. 2–14, and as to the numbering of the verses from 13 on. saying:

hebrew: אָֽנֹכִ֖י֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֧ר הוֹצֵאתִ֛יךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֣֥ית עֲבָדִֽ֑ים׃
transliteration: anokhiy y'hvah eloheykha asher hvotzetiykha meeretz mitz'rayim mibeyt 'avadiym
translation: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, the house of bondage:

hebrew: לֹֽ֣א יִהְיֶֽה־לְךָ֛֩ אֱלֹהִ֥֨ים אֲחֵרִ֖֜ים עַל־פָּנָֽ֗יַ
transliteration: lo yih'yeh-l'kha elohiym acheriym 'al-panaya
translation: You shall have no other gods besides Me.

transliteration: lo ta'aseh-l'kha fesel  v'khal-t'mvnah asher bashamayim  mima'al vaasher baaretz mitachat vaasher bamayim  mitachat laaretz
translation: You shall not make for yourself a sculptured image, or any likeness of what is in the heavens above, or on the earth below, or in the waters under the earth.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תִשְׁתַּחְוֶ֥֣ה לָהֶ֖ם֮ וְלֹ֣א תָעָבְדֵ֑ם֒ כִּ֣י אָֽנֹכִ֞י יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֵ֣ל קַנָּ֔א פֹּ֠קֵד עֲוֺ֨ן אָבֹ֧ת עַל־בָּנִ֛ים עַל־שִׁלֵּשִׁ֥ים וְעַל־רִבֵּעִ֖ים לְשֹׂנְאָֽ֑י׃
transliteration: lo-tish'tach'veh lahem v'lo ta'av'dem kiy anokhiy y'hvah eloheykha el kana poked 'avon avot 'al-baniym 'al-shileshiym v'al-ribe'iym l'son'ay
translation: You shall not bow down to them or serve them. For I the L<small>ORD</small> your God am an impassioned God, visiting the guilt of the parents upon the children, upon the third and upon the fourth generations of those who reject Me,

hebrew: וְעֹ֥֤שֶׂה חֶ֖֙סֶד֙ לַאֲלָפִ֑֔ים לְאֹהֲבַ֖י וּלְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י מִצְוֺתָֽי׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'oseh chesed laalafiym l'ohavay vl'shom'rey mitz'votay (s)
translation: but showing kindness to the thousandth generation of those who love Me and keep My commandments.

hebrew: לֹ֥א תִשָּׂ֛א אֶת־שֵֽׁם־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לַשָּׁ֑וְא כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יְנַקֶּה֙ יְהוָ֔ה אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־יִשָּׂ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ לַשָּֽׁוְא׃ (פ)
transliteration: lo tisa et-shem-y'hvah eloheykha lashav' kiy lo y'nakeh y'hvah et asher-yisa et-sh'mvo lashav' (f)
translation: You shall not bOthers “take in vain.”swear falsely by-b the name of the LORD your God; for the LORD will not clear one who swears falsely by His name.

hebrew: זָכ֛וֹר֩ אֶת־י֥֨וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֖֜ת לְקַדְּשֽׁ֗וֹ
transliteration: zakhvor et-yvom hashabat l'kad'shvo
translation: Remember the sabbath day and keep it holy.

hebrew: שֵׁ֤֣שֶׁת יָמִ֣ים֙ תַּֽעֲבֹ֔ד֮ וְעָשִׂ֖֣יתָ כָּל־מְלַאכְתֶּֽךָ֒
transliteration: sheshet yamiym ta'avod v'asiyta kal-m'lakh'tekha
translation: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,

hebrew: וְי֙וֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔֜י שַׁבָּ֖֣ת ׀ לַיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑֗יךָ לֹֽ֣א־תַעֲשֶׂ֣֨ה כָל־מְלָאכָ֡֜ה אַתָּ֣ה ׀ וּבִנְךָֽ֣־וּ֠בִתֶּ֗ךָ עַבְדְּךָ֤֨ וַאֲמָֽתְךָ֜֙ וּבְהֶמְתֶּ֔֗ךָ וְגֵרְךָ֖֙ אֲשֶׁ֥֣ר בִּשְׁעָרֶֽ֔יךָ
transliteration: v'yvom hash'viy'iy shabat  layhvah eloheykha lo-ta'aseh khal-m'lakhah atah  vvin'kha-vvitekha 'av'd'kha vaamat'kha vv'hem'tekha v'ger'kha asher bish'areykha
translation: but the seventh day is a sabbath of the L<small>ORD</small> your God: you shall not do any work—you, your son or daughter, your male or female slave, or your cattle, or the stranger who is within your settlements.

hebrew: כִּ֣י שֵֽׁשֶׁת־יָמִים֩ עָשָׂ֨ה יְהוָ֜ה אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם וְאֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֶת־הַיָּם֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֔ם וַיָּ֖נַח בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֑י עַל־כֵּ֗ן בֵּרַ֧ךְ יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־י֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֖ת וַֽיְקַדְּשֵֽׁהוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy sheshet-yamiym 'asah y'hvah et-hashamayim v'et-haaretz et-hayam v'et-kal-asher-bam vayanach bayvom hash'viy'iy 'al-ken berakh' y'hvah et-yvom hashabat vay'kad'shehv (s)
translation: For in six days the L<small>ORD</small> made heaven and earth and sea, and all that is in them, and He rested on the seventh day; therefore the L<small>ORD</small> blessed the sabbath day and hallowed it.

hebrew: כַּבֵּ֥ד אֶת־אָבִ֖יךָ וְאֶת־אִמֶּ֑ךָ לְמַ֙עַן֙ יַאֲרִכ֣וּן יָמֶ֔יךָ עַ֚ל הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kabed et-aviykha v'et-imekha l'ma'an yaarikhvn yameykha 'al haadamah asher-y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh' (s)
translation: Honor your father and your mother, that you may long endure on the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is assigning to you.

transliteration: lo tir'tzach (s) lo tin'af (s) lo tig'nov (s) lo-ta'aneh v're'akha 'ed shaker (s)
translation:
You shall not murder.
You shall not commit adultery.
You shall not steal.
You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.

hebrew: לֹ֥א תַחְמֹ֖ד בֵּ֣ית רֵעֶ֑ךָ לֹֽא־תַחְמֹ֞ד אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֶ֗ךָ וְעַבְדּ֤וֹ וַאֲמָתוֹ֙ וְשׁוֹר֣וֹ וַחֲמֹר֔וֹ וְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְרֵעֶֽךָ׃ (פ)
transliteration: lo tach'mod beyt re'ekha lo-tach'mod eshet re'ekha v'av'dvo vaamatvo v'shvorvo vachamorvo v'khol asher l're'ekha (f)
translation: You shall not covet your neighbor’s house: you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, or his male or female slave, or his ox or his ass, or anything that is your neighbor’s.

hebrew: וְכָל־הָעָם֩ רֹאִ֨ים אֶת־הַקּוֹלֹ֜ת וְאֶת־הַלַּפִּידִ֗ם וְאֵת֙ ק֣וֹל הַשֹּׁפָ֔ר וְאֶת־הָהָ֖ר עָשֵׁ֑ן וַיַּ֤רְא הָעָם֙ וַיָּנֻ֔עוּ וַיַּֽעַמְד֖וּ מֵֽרָחֹֽק׃
transliteration: v'khal-ha'am roiym et-hakvolot v'et-halapiydim v'et kvol hashofar v'et-hahar 'ashen vayar' ha'am vayanu'v vaya'am'dv merachok
translation: All the people witnessed the thunder and lightning, the blare of the horn and the mountain smoking; and when the people saw it, they fell back and stood at a distance.

hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה דַּבֵּר־אַתָּ֥ה עִמָּ֖נוּ וְנִשְׁמָ֑עָה וְאַל־יְדַבֵּ֥ר עִמָּ֛נוּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים פֶּן־נָמֽוּת׃
transliteration: vayom'rv el-mosheh daber-atah 'imanv v'nish'ma'ah v'al-y'daber 'imanv elohiym pen-namvt
translation: “You speak to us,” they said to Moses, “and we will obey; but let not God speak to us, lest we die.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶל־הָעָם֮ אַל־תִּירָאוּ֒ כִּ֗י לְבַֽעֲבוּר֙ נַסּ֣וֹת אֶתְכֶ֔ם בָּ֖א הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וּבַעֲב֗וּר תִּהְיֶ֧ה יִרְאָת֛וֹ עַל־פְּנֵיכֶ֖ם לְבִלְתִּ֥י תֶחֱטָֽאוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-ha'am al-tiyrav kiy l'va'avvr nasvot et'khem ba haelohiym vva'avvr tih'yeh yir'atvo 'al-p'neykhem l'vil'tiy techetav
translation: Moses answered the people, “Be not afraid; for God has come only in order to test you, and in order that the fear of Him may be ever with you, so that you do not go astray.”

hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֥ד הָעָ֖ם מֵרָחֹ֑ק וּמֹשֶׁה֙ נִגַּ֣שׁ אֶל־הָֽעֲרָפֶ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃ (פ)
transliteration: vaya'amod ha'am merachok vmosheh nigash el-ha'arafel asher-sham haelohiym (f)
translation: So the people remained at a distance, while Moses approached the thick cloud where God was.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֹּ֥ה תֹאמַ֖ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אַתֶּ֣ם רְאִיתֶ֔ם כִּ֚י מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי עִמָּכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh koh tomar el-b'ney yis'rael atem r'iytem kiy min-hashamayim dibar'tiy 'imakhem
translation:
The LORD said to Moses:
Thus shall you say to the Israelites: You yourselves saw that I spoke to you from the very heavens:

hebrew: לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּן אִתִּ֑י אֱלֹ֤הֵי כֶ֙סֶף֙ וֵאלֹהֵ֣י זָהָ֔ב לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: lo ta'asvn itiy elohey khesef velohey zahav lo ta'asv lakhem
translation: With Me, therefore, you shall not make any gods of silver, nor shall you make for yourselves any gods of gold.

hebrew: מִזְבַּ֣ח אֲדָמָה֮ תַּעֲשֶׂה־לִּי֒ וְזָבַחְתָּ֣ עָלָ֗יו אֶת־עֹלֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ וְאֶת־שְׁלָמֶ֔יךָ אֶת־צֹֽאנְךָ֖ וְאֶת־בְּקָרֶ֑ךָ בְּכָל־הַמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַזְכִּ֣יר אֶת־שְׁמִ֔י אָב֥וֹא אֵלֶ֖יךָ וּבֵרַכְתִּֽיךָ׃
transliteration: miz'bach adamah ta'aseh-liy v'zavach'ta 'alayv et-'oloteykha v'et-sh'lameykha et-tzon'kha v'et-b'karekha b'khal-hamakvom asher az'kiyr et-sh'miy avvo eleykha vverakh'tiykha
translation: Make for Me an altar of earth and sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your sacrifices of well-being,cOthers “peace-offering.” Meaning of shelamin uncertain. your sheep and your oxen; in every place where I cause My name to be mentioned I will come to you and bless you.

hebrew: וְאִם־מִזְבַּ֤ח אֲבָנִים֙ תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לִּ֔י לֹֽא־תִבְנֶ֥ה אֶתְהֶ֖ן גָּזִ֑ית כִּ֧י חַרְבְּךָ֛ הֵנַ֥פְתָּ עָלֶ֖יהָ וַתְּחַֽלְלֶֽהָ׃
transliteration: v'im-miz'bach avaniym ta'aseh-liy lo-tiv'neh et'hen gaziyt kiy char'b'kha henaf'ta 'aleyha vat'chal'leha
translation: And if you make for Me an altar of stones, do not build it of hewn stones; for by wielding your tool upon them you have profaned them.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תַעֲלֶ֥ה בְמַעֲלֹ֖ת עַֽל־מִזְבְּחִ֑י אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹֽא־תִגָּלֶ֥ה עֶרְוָתְךָ֖ עָלָֽיו׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'lo-ta'aleh v'ma'alot 'al-miz'b'chiy asher lo-tigaleh 'er'vat'kha 'alayv (f)
translation: Do not ascend My altar by steps, that your nakedness may not be exposed upon it.

hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּשִׂ֖ים לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'eleh hamish'patiym asher tasiym lif'neyhem
translation: These are the rules that you shall set before them:

hebrew: כִּ֤י תִקְנֶה֙ עֶ֣בֶד עִבְרִ֔י שֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים יַעֲבֹ֑ד וּבַ֨שְּׁבִעִ֔ת יֵצֵ֥א לַֽחָפְשִׁ֖י חִנָּֽם׃
transliteration: kiy tik'neh 'eved 'iv'riy shesh shaniym ya'avod vvash'vi'it yetze lachaf'shiy chinam
translation: When you acquire a Hebrew slave, he shall serve six years; in the seventh year he shall go free, without payment.

hebrew: אִם־בְּגַפּ֥וֹ יָבֹ֖א בְּגַפּ֣וֹ יֵצֵ֑א אִם־בַּ֤עַל אִשָּׁה֙ ה֔וּא וְיָצְאָ֥ה אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ עִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: im-b'gapvo yavo b'gapvo yetze im-ba'al ishah hv v'yatz'ah ish'tvo 'imvo
translation: If he came single, he shall leave single; if he had a wife, his wife shall leave with him.

hebrew: אִם־אֲדֹנָיו֙ יִתֶּן־ל֣וֹ אִשָּׁ֔ה וְיָלְדָה־ל֥וֹ בָנִ֖ים א֣וֹ בָנ֑וֹת הָאִשָּׁ֣ה וִילָדֶ֗יהָ תִּהְיֶה֙ לַֽאדֹנֶ֔יהָ וְה֖וּא יֵצֵ֥א בְגַפּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: im-adonayv yiten-lvo ishah v'yal'dah-lvo vaniym vo vanvot haishah viyladeyha tih'yeh ladoneyha v'hv yetze v'gapvo
translation: If his master gave him a wife, and she has borne him children, the wife and her children shall belong to the master, and he shall leave alone.

hebrew: וְאִם־אָמֹ֤ר יֹאמַר֙ הָעֶ֔בֶד אָהַ֙בְתִּי֙ אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֔י אֶת־אִשְׁתִּ֖י וְאֶת־בָּנָ֑י לֹ֥א אֵצֵ֖א חָפְשִֽׁי׃
transliteration: v'im-amor yomar ha'eved ahav'tiy et-adoniy et-ish'tiy v'et-banay lo etze chaf'shiy
translation: But if the slave declares, “I love my master, and my wife and children: I do not wish to go free,”

hebrew: וְהִגִּישׁ֤וֹ אֲדֹנָיו֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְהִגִּישׁוֹ֙ אֶל־הַדֶּ֔לֶת א֖וֹ אֶל־הַמְּזוּזָ֑ה וְרָצַ֨ע אֲדֹנָ֤יו אֶת־אָזְנוֹ֙ בַּמַּרְצֵ֔עַ וַעֲבָד֖וֹ לְעֹלָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'higiyshvo adonayv el-haelohiym v'higiyshvo el-hadelet vo el-ham'zvzah v'ratza' adonayv et-az'nvo bamar'tze'a va'avadvo l'olam (s)
translation: his master shall take him before God.aOthers “to the judges.” He shall be brought to the door or the doorpost, and his master shall pierce his ear with an awl; and he shall then remain his slave for life.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִמְכֹּ֥ר אִ֛ישׁ אֶת־בִּתּ֖וֹ לְאָמָ֑ה לֹ֥א תֵצֵ֖א כְּצֵ֥את הָעֲבָדִֽים׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yim'kor iysh et-bitvo l'amah lo tetze k'tzet ha'avadiym
translation: When a man sells his daughter as a slave, she shall not go free as male slaves do.

hebrew: אִם־רָעָ֞ה בְּעֵינֵ֧י אֲדֹנֶ֛יהָ אֲשֶׁר־לא [ל֥וֹ] יְעָדָ֖הּ וְהֶפְדָּ֑הּ לְעַ֥ם נָכְרִ֛י לֹא־יִמְשֹׁ֥ל לְמָכְרָ֖הּ בְּבִגְדוֹ־בָֽהּ׃
transliteration: im-ra'ah b'eyney adoneyha asher-l [lvo] y'adah v'hef'dah l'am nakh'riy lo-yim'shol l'makh'rah b'vig'dvo-vah
translation: If she proves to be displeasing to her master, who designated her for himself, he must let her be redeemed; he shall not have the right to sell her to outsiders, since he broke faith with her.

hebrew: וְאִם־לִבְנ֖וֹ יִֽיעָדֶ֑נָּה כְּמִשְׁפַּ֥ט הַבָּנ֖וֹת יַעֲשֶׂה־לָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'im-liv'nvo yiy'adenah k'mish'pat habanvot ya'aseh-lah
translation: And if he designated her for his son, he shall deal with her as is the practice with free maidens.

hebrew: אִם־אַחֶ֖רֶת יִֽקַּֽח־ל֑וֹ שְׁאֵרָ֛הּ כְּסוּתָ֥הּ וְעֹנָתָ֖הּ לֹ֥א יִגְרָֽע׃
transliteration: im-acheret yikach-lvo sh'erah k'svtah v'onatah lo yig'ra'
translation: If he marries another, he must not withhold from this one her food, her clothing, or her conjugal rights.bOr “ointments.”

hebrew: וְאִם־שְׁלָ֨שׁ־אֵ֔לֶּה לֹ֥א יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה לָ֑הּ וְיָצְאָ֥ה חִנָּ֖ם אֵ֥ין כָּֽסֶף׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'im-sh'lash-eleh lo ya'aseh lah v'yatz'ah chinam eyn kasef (s)
translation: If he fails her in these three ways, she shall go free, without payment.

hebrew: מַכֵּ֥ה אִ֛ישׁ וָמֵ֖ת מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: makeh iysh vamet mvot yvmat
translation: He who fatally strikes a man shall be put to death.

hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א צָדָ֔ה וְהָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אִנָּ֣ה לְיָד֑וֹ וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י לְךָ֙ מָק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָנ֖וּס שָֽׁמָּה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vaasher lo tzadah v'haelohiym inah l'yadvo v'sam'tiy l'kha makvom asher yanvs shamah (s)
translation: If he did not do it by design, but it came about by an act of God, I will assign you a place to which he can flee.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָזִ֥ד אִ֛ישׁ עַל־רֵעֵ֖הוּ לְהָרְג֣וֹ בְעָרְמָ֑ה מֵעִ֣ם מִזְבְּחִ֔י תִּקָּחֶ֖נּוּ לָמֽוּת׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khiy-yazid iysh 'al-re'ehv l'har'gvo v'ar'mah me'im miz'b'chiy tikachenv lamvt (s)
translation: When a man schemes against another and kills him treacherously, you shall take him from My very altar to be put to death.

hebrew: וּמַכֵּ֥ה אָבִ֛יו וְאִמּ֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: vmakeh aviyv v'imvo mvot yvmat
translation: He who strikes his father or his mother shall be put to death.

hebrew: וְגֹנֵ֨ב אִ֧ישׁ וּמְכָר֛וֹ וְנִמְצָ֥א בְיָד֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'gonev iysh vm'kharvo v'nim'tza v'yadvo mvot yvmat (s)
translation: He who kidnaps a man—whether he has sold him or is still holding him—shall be put to death.

hebrew: וּמְקַלֵּ֥ל אָבִ֛יו וְאִמּ֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vm'kalel aviyv v'imvo mvot yvmat (s)
translation: He who insultscOr “reviles.” his father or his mother shall be put to death.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יְרִיבֻ֣ן אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְהִכָּה־אִישׁ֙ אֶת־רֵעֵ֔הוּ בְּאֶ֖בֶן א֣וֹ בְאֶגְרֹ֑ף וְלֹ֥א יָמ֖וּת וְנָפַ֥ל לְמִשְׁכָּֽב׃
transliteration: v'khiy-y'riyvun anashiym v'hikah-iysh et-re'ehv b'even vo v'eg'rof v'lo yamvt v'nafal l'mish'kav
translation: When men quarrel and one strikes the other with stone or fist, and he does not die but has to take to his bed—

hebrew: אִם־יָק֞וּם וְהִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בַּח֛וּץ עַל־מִשְׁעַנְתּ֖וֹ וְנִקָּ֣ה הַמַּכֶּ֑ה רַ֥ק שִׁבְתּ֛וֹ יִתֵּ֖ן וְרַפֹּ֥א יְרַפֵּֽא׃ (ס)
transliteration: im-yakvm v'hit'halekh' bachvtz 'al-mish'an'tvo v'nikah hamakeh rak shiv'tvo yiten v'rapo y'rape (s)
translation: if he then gets up and walks outdoors upon his staff, the assailant shall go unpunished, except that he must pay for his idleness and his cure.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יַכֶּה֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶת־עַבְדּ֜וֹ א֤וֹ אֶת־אֲמָתוֹ֙ בַּשֵּׁ֔בֶט וּמֵ֖ת תַּ֣חַת יָד֑וֹ נָקֹ֖ם יִנָּקֵֽם׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yakeh iysh et-'av'dvo vo et-amatvo bashevet vmet tachat yadvo nakom yinakem
translation: When a man strikes his slave, male or female, with a rod, and he dies there and then,dLit. “under his hand.” he must be avenged.

hebrew: אַ֥ךְ אִם־י֛וֹם א֥וֹ יוֹמַ֖יִם יַעֲמֹ֑ד לֹ֣א יֻקַּ֔ם כִּ֥י כַסְפּ֖וֹ הֽוּא׃ (ס)
transliteration: akh' im-yvom vo yvomayim ya'amod lo yukam kiy khas'pvo hv (s)
translation: But if he survives a day or two, he is not to be avenged, since he is the other’s property.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִנָּצ֣וּ אֲנָשִׁ֗ים וְנָ֨גְפ֜וּ אִשָּׁ֤ה הָרָה֙ וְיָצְא֣וּ יְלָדֶ֔יהָ וְלֹ֥א יִהְיֶ֖ה אָס֑וֹן עָנ֣וֹשׁ יֵעָנֵ֗שׁ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֨ר יָשִׁ֤ית עָלָיו֙ בַּ֣עַל הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וְנָתַ֖ן בִּפְלִלִֽים׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yinatzv anashiym v'nag'fv ishah harah v'yatz'v y'ladeyha v'lo yih'yeh asvon 'anvosh ye'anesh kaasher yashiyt 'alayv ba'al haishah v'natan bif'liliym
translation: When men fight, and one of them pushes a pregnant woman and a miscarriage results, but no other damage ensues, the one responsibleeHeb. “he.” shall be fined according as the woman’s husband may exact from him, the payment to be based on reckoning.fOthers “as the judges determine.”

hebrew: וְאִם־אָס֖וֹן יִהְיֶ֑ה וְנָתַתָּ֥ה נֶ֖פֶשׁ תַּ֥חַת נָֽפֶשׁ׃
transliteration: v'im-asvon yih'yeh v'natatah nefesh tachat nafesh
translation: But if other damage ensues, the penalty shall be life for life,

hebrew: עַ֚יִן תַּ֣חַת עַ֔יִן שֵׁ֖ן תַּ֣חַת שֵׁ֑ן יָ֚ד תַּ֣חַת יָ֔ד רֶ֖גֶל תַּ֥חַת רָֽגֶל׃
transliteration: 'ayin tachat 'ayin shen tachat shen yad tachat yad regel tachat ragel
translation: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,

hebrew: כְּוִיָּה֙ תַּ֣חַת כְּוִיָּ֔ה פֶּ֖צַע תַּ֣חַת פָּ֑צַע חַבּוּרָ֕ה תַּ֖חַת חַבּוּרָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: k'viyah tachat k'viyah petza' tachat patza' chabvrah tachat chabvrah (s)
translation: burn for burn, wound for wound, bruise for bruise.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יַכֶּ֨ה אִ֜ישׁ אֶת־עֵ֥ין עַבְדּ֛וֹ אֽוֹ־אֶת־עֵ֥ין אֲמָת֖וֹ וְשִֽׁחֲתָ֑הּ לַֽחָפְשִׁ֥י יְשַׁלְּחֶ֖נּוּ תַּ֥חַת עֵינֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khiy-yakeh iysh et-'eyn 'av'dvo vo-et-'eyn amatvo v'shichatah lachaf'shiy y'shal'chenv tachat 'eynvo (s)
translation: When a man strikes the eye of his slave, male or female, and destroys it, he shall let him go free on account of his eye.

hebrew: וְאִם־שֵׁ֥ן עַבְדּ֛וֹ אֽוֹ־שֵׁ֥ן אֲמָת֖וֹ יַפִּ֑יל לַֽחָפְשִׁ֥י יְשַׁלְּחֶ֖נּוּ תַּ֥חַת שִׁנּֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'im-shen 'av'dvo vo-shen amatvo yapiyl lachaf'shiy y'shal'chenv tachat shinvo (f)
translation: If he knocks out the tooth of his slave, male or female, he shall let him go free on account of his tooth.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִגַּ֨ח שׁ֥וֹר אֶת־אִ֛ישׁ א֥וֹ אֶת־אִשָּׁ֖ה וָמֵ֑ת סָק֨וֹל יִסָּקֵ֜ל הַשּׁ֗וֹר וְלֹ֤א יֵאָכֵל֙ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֔וֹ וּבַ֥עַל הַשּׁ֖וֹר נָקִֽי׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yigach shvor et-iysh vo et-ishah vamet sakvol yisakel hashvor v'lo yeakhel et-b'sarvo vva'al hashvor nakiy
translation: When an ox gores a man or a woman to death, the ox shall be stoned and its flesh shall not be eaten, but the owner of the ox is not to be punished.

hebrew: וְאִ֡ם שׁוֹר֩ נַגָּ֨ח ה֜וּא מִתְּמֹ֣ל שִׁלְשֹׁ֗ם וְהוּעַ֤ד בִּבְעָלָיו֙ וְלֹ֣א יִשְׁמְרֶ֔נּוּ וְהֵמִ֥ית אִ֖ישׁ א֣וֹ אִשָּׁ֑ה הַשּׁוֹר֙ יִסָּקֵ֔ל וְגַם־בְּעָלָ֖יו יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: v'im shvor nagach hv mit'mol shil'shom v'hv'ad biv'alayv v'lo yish'm'renv v'hemiyt iysh vo ishah hashvor yisakel v'gam-b'alayv yvmat
translation: If, however, that ox has been in the habit of goring, and its owner, though warned, has failed to guard it, and it kills a man or a woman—the ox shall be stoned and its owner, too, shall be put to death.

hebrew: אִם־כֹּ֖פֶר יוּשַׁ֣ת עָלָ֑יו וְנָתַן֙ פִּדְיֹ֣ן נַפְשׁ֔וֹ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יוּשַׁ֖ת עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: im-kofer yvshat 'alayv v'natan pid'yon naf'shvo k'khol asher-yvshat 'alayv
translation: If ransom is laid upon him, he must pay whatever is laid upon him to redeem his life.

hebrew: אוֹ־בֵ֥ן יִגָּ֖ח אוֹ־בַ֣ת יִגָּ֑ח כַּמִּשְׁפָּ֥ט הַזֶּ֖ה יֵעָ֥שֶׂה לּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vo-ven yigach vo-vat yigach kamish'pat hazeh ye'aseh lvo
translation: So, too, if it gores a minor, male or female, [the owner] shall be dealt with according to the same rule.

hebrew: אִם־עֶ֛בֶד יִגַּ֥ח הַשּׁ֖וֹר א֣וֹ אָמָ֑ה כֶּ֣סֶף ׀ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שְׁקָלִ֗ים יִתֵּן֙ לַֽאדֹנָ֔יו וְהַשּׁ֖וֹר יִסָּקֵֽל׃ (ס)
transliteration: im-'eved yigach hashvor vo amah kesef  sh'loshiym sh'kaliym yiten ladonayv v'hashvor yisakel (s)
translation: But if the ox gores a slave, male or female, he shall pay thirty shekels of silver to the master, and the ox shall be stoned.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִפְתַּ֨ח אִ֜ישׁ בּ֗וֹר א֠וֹ כִּֽי־יִכְרֶ֥ה אִ֛ישׁ בֹּ֖ר וְלֹ֣א יְכַסֶּ֑נּוּ וְנָֽפַל־שָׁ֥מָּה שּׁ֖וֹר א֥וֹ חֲמֽוֹר׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yif'tach iysh bvor vo kiy-yikh'reh iysh bor v'lo y'khasenv v'nafal-shamah shvor vo chamvor
translation: When a man opens a pit, or digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or an ass falls into it,

hebrew: בַּ֤עַל הַבּוֹר֙ יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם כֶּ֖סֶף יָשִׁ֣יב לִבְעָלָ֑יו וְהַמֵּ֖ת יִֽהְיֶה־לּֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: ba'al habvor y'shalem kesef yashiyv liv'alayv v'hamet yih'yeh-lvo (s)
translation: the one responsible for the pit must make restitution; he shall pay the price to the owner, but shall keep the dead animal.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִגֹּ֧ף שֽׁוֹר־אִ֛ישׁ אֶת־שׁ֥וֹר רֵעֵ֖הוּ וָמֵ֑ת וּמָ֨כְר֜וּ אֶת־הַשּׁ֤וֹר הַחַי֙ וְחָצ֣וּ אֶת־כַּסְפּ֔וֹ וְגַ֥ם אֶת־הַמֵּ֖ת יֶֽחֱצֽוּן׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yigof shvor-iysh et-shvor re'ehv vamet vmakh'rv et-hashvor hachay v'chatzv et-kas'pvo v'gam et-hamet yechetzvn
translation: When a man’s ox injures his neighbor’s ox and it dies, they shall sell the live ox and divide its price; they shall also divide the dead animal.

hebrew: א֣וֹ נוֹדַ֗ע כִּ֠י שׁ֣וֹר נַגָּ֥ח הוּא֙ מִתְּמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֔ם וְלֹ֥א יִשְׁמְרֶ֖נּוּ בְּעָלָ֑יו שַׁלֵּ֨ם יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם שׁוֹר֙ תַּ֣חַת הַשּׁ֔וֹר וְהַמֵּ֖ת יִֽהְיֶה־לּֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vo nvoda' kiy shvor nagach hv mit'mvol shil'shom v'lo yish'm'renv b'alayv shalem y'shalem shvor tachat hashvor v'hamet yih'yeh-lvo (s)
translation: If, however, it is known that the ox was in the habit of goring, and its owner has failed to guard it, he must restore ox for ox, but shall keep the dead animal.

hebrew: כִּ֤י יִגְנֹֽב־אִישׁ֙ שׁ֣וֹר אוֹ־שֶׂ֔ה וּטְבָח֖וֹ א֣וֹ מְכָר֑וֹ חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בָקָ֗ר יְשַׁלֵּם֙ תַּ֣חַת הַשּׁ֔וֹר וְאַרְבַּע־צֹ֖אן תַּ֥חַת הַשֶּֽׂה׃
transliteration: kiy yig'nov-iysh shvor vo-seh vt'vachvo vo m'kharvo chamishah vakar y'shalem tachat hashvor v'ar'ba'-tzon tachat haseh
translation: gThis constitutes chap. 22.1 in some editions.When a man steals an ox or a sheep, and slaughters it or sells it, he shall pay five oxen for the ox, and four sheep for the sheep.—

hebrew: אִם־בַּמַּחְתֶּ֛רֶת יִמָּצֵ֥א הַגַּנָּ֖ב וְהֻכָּ֣ה וָמֵ֑ת אֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ דָּמִֽים׃
transliteration: im-bamach'teret yimatze haganav v'hukah vamet eyn lvo damiym
translation: If the thief is seized while tunneling,aI.e, under a wall for housebreaking. and he is beaten to death, there is no bloodguilt in his case.

hebrew: אִם־זָרְחָ֥ה הַשֶּׁ֛מֶשׁ עָלָ֖יו דָּמִ֣ים ל֑וֹ שַׁלֵּ֣ם יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם אִם־אֵ֣ין ל֔וֹ וְנִמְכַּ֖ר בִּגְנֵבָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: im-zar'chah hashemesh 'alayv damiym lvo shalem y'shalem im-eyn lvo v'nim'kar big'nevatvo
translation: If the sun has risen on him, there is bloodguilt in that case.—HebI.e, the thief of 21.37. must make restitution; if he lacks the means, he shall be sold for his theft.

hebrew: אִֽם־הִמָּצֵא֩ תִמָּצֵ֨א בְיָד֜וֹ הַגְּנֵבָ֗ה מִשּׁ֧וֹר עַד־חֲמ֛וֹר עַד־שֶׂ֖ה חַיִּ֑ים שְׁנַ֖יִם יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: im-himatze timatze v'yadvo hag'nevah mishvor 'ad-chamvor 'ad-seh chayiym sh'nayim y'shalem (s)
translation: But if what he stole—whether ox or ass or sheep—is found alive in his possession, he shall pay double.

hebrew: כִּ֤י יַבְעֶר־אִישׁ֙ שָׂדֶ֣ה אוֹ־כֶ֔רֶם וְשִׁלַּח֙ אֶת־בעירה [בְּעִיר֔וֹ] וּבִעֵ֖ר בִּשְׂדֵ֣ה אַחֵ֑ר מֵיטַ֥ב שָׂדֵ֛הוּ וּמֵיטַ֥ב כַּרְמ֖וֹ יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy yav'er-iysh sadeh vo-kherem v'shilach et-v'yrh [b'iyrvo] vvi'er bis'deh acher meytav sadehv vmeytav kar'mvo y'shalem (s)
translation: When a man lets his livestock loose to graze in another’s land, and so allows a field or a vineyard to be grazed bare, he must make restitution for the impairmentcLit. “excellence.” of that field or vineyard.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תֵצֵ֨א אֵ֜שׁ וּמָצְאָ֤ה קֹצִים֙ וְנֶאֱכַ֣ל גָּדִ֔ישׁ א֥וֹ הַקָּמָ֖ה א֣וֹ הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה שַׁלֵּ֣ם יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם הַמַּבְעִ֖ר אֶת־הַבְּעֵרָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy-tetze esh vmatz'ah kotziym v'neekhal gadiysh vo hakamah vo hasadeh shalem y'shalem hamav'ir et-hab'erah (s)
translation: When a fire is started and spreads to thorns, so that stacked, standing, or growingdLit. “field.” grain is consumed, he who started the fire must make restitution.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִתֵּן֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֜הוּ כֶּ֤סֶף אֽוֹ־כֵלִים֙ לִשְׁמֹ֔ר וְגֻנַּ֖ב מִבֵּ֣ית הָאִ֑ישׁ אִם־יִמָּצֵ֥א הַגַּנָּ֖ב יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם שְׁנָֽיִם׃
transliteration: kiy-yiten iysh el-re'ehv kesef vo-kheliym lish'mor v'gunav mibeyt haiysh im-yimatze haganav y'shalem sh'nayim
translation: When a man gives money or goods to another for safekeeping, and they are stolen from the man’s house—if the thief is caught, he shall pay double;

hebrew: אִם־לֹ֤א יִמָּצֵא֙ הַגַּנָּ֔ב וְנִקְרַ֥ב בַּֽעַל־הַבַּ֖יִת אֶל־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים אִם־לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֛ח יָד֖וֹ בִּמְלֶ֥אכֶת רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: im-lo yimatze haganav v'nik'rav ba'al-habayit el-haelohiym im-lo shalach yadvo bim'lekhet re'ehv
translation: if the thief is not caught, the owner of the house shall depose before GodeSee note on 21.6. that he has not laid hands on the other’s property.

hebrew: עַֽל־כָּל־דְּבַר־פֶּ֡שַׁע עַל־שׁ֡וֹר עַל־חֲ֠מוֹר עַל־שֶׂ֨ה עַל־שַׂלְמָ֜ה עַל־כָּל־אֲבֵדָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֹאמַר֙ כִּי־ה֣וּא זֶ֔ה עַ֚ד הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים יָבֹ֖א דְּבַר־שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יַרְשִׁיעֻן֙ אֱלֹהִ֔ים יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם שְׁנַ֖יִם לְרֵעֵֽהוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'al-kal-d'var-pesha' 'al-shvor 'al-chamvor 'al-seh 'al-sal'mah 'al-kal-avedah asher yomar kiy-hv zeh 'ad haelohiym yavo d'var-sh'neyhem asher yar'shiy'un elohiym y'shalem sh'nayim l're'ehv (s)
translation: In all charges of misappropriation—pertaining to an ox, an ass, a sheep, a garment, or any other loss, whereof one party alleges, “This is it”—the case of both parties shall come before God: he whom God declares guilty shall pay double to the other.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִתֵּן֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֜הוּ חֲמ֨וֹר אוֹ־שׁ֥וֹר אוֹ־שֶׂ֛ה וְכָל־בְּהֵמָ֖ה לִשְׁמֹ֑ר וּמֵ֛ת אוֹ־נִשְׁבַּ֥ר אוֹ־נִשְׁבָּ֖ה אֵ֥ין רֹאֶֽה׃
transliteration: kiy-yiten iysh el-re'ehv chamvor vo-shvor vo-seh v'khal-b'hemah lish'mor vmet vo-nish'bar vo-nish'bah eyn roeh
translation: When a man gives to another an ass, an ox, a sheep or any other animal to guard, and it dies or is injured or is carried off, with no witness about,

hebrew: שְׁבֻעַ֣ת יְהוָ֗ה תִּהְיֶה֙ בֵּ֣ין שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם אִם־לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֛ח יָד֖וֹ בִּמְלֶ֣אכֶת רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְלָקַ֥ח בְּעָלָ֖יו וְלֹ֥א יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
transliteration: sh'vu'at y'hvah tih'yeh beyn sh'neyhem im-lo shalach yadvo bim'lekhet re'ehv v'lakach b'alayv v'lo y'shalem
translation: an oath before the L<small>ORD</small> shall decide between the two of them that the one has not laid hands on the property of the other; the owner must acquiesce, and no restitution shall be made.

hebrew: וְאִם־גָּנֹ֥ב יִגָּנֵ֖ב מֵעִמּ֑וֹ יְשַׁלֵּ֖ם לִבְעָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'im-ganov yiganev me'imvo y'shalem liv'alayv
translation: But if [the animal] was stolen from him, he shall make restitution to its owner.

hebrew: אִם־טָרֹ֥ף יִטָּרֵ֖ף יְבִאֵ֣הוּ עֵ֑ד הַטְּרֵפָ֖ה לֹ֥א יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: im-tarof yitaref y'viehv 'ed hat'refah lo y'shalem (f)
translation: If it was torn by beasts, he shall bring it as evidence; he need not replace what has been torn by beasts.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִשְׁאַ֥ל אִ֛ישׁ מֵעִ֥ם רֵעֵ֖הוּ וְנִשְׁבַּ֣ר אוֹ־מֵ֑ת בְּעָלָ֥יו אֵין־עִמּ֖וֹ שַׁלֵּ֥ם יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yish'al iysh me'im re'ehv v'nish'bar vo-met b'alayv eyn-'imvo shalem y'shalem
translation: When a man borrows [an animal] from another and it dies or is injured, its owner not being with it, he must make restitution.

hebrew: אִם־בְּעָלָ֥יו עִמּ֖וֹ לֹ֣א יְשַׁלֵּ֑ם אִם־שָׂכִ֣יר ה֔וּא בָּ֖א בִּשְׂכָרֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: im-b'alayv 'imvo lo y'shalem im-sakhiyr hv ba bis'kharvo (s)
translation: If its owner was with it, no restitution need be made; but if it was hired, he is entitled to the hire.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יְפַתֶּ֣ה אִ֗ישׁ בְּתוּלָ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־אֹרָ֖שָׂה וְשָׁכַ֣ב עִמָּ֑הּ מָהֹ֛ר יִמְהָרֶ֥נָּה לּ֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'khiy-y'fateh iysh b'tvlah asher lo-orasah v'shakhav 'imah mahor yim'harenah lvo l'ishah
translation: If a man seduces a virgin for whom the bride-price has not been paid,fSo that she is unmarried; cf. Deut. 20.7; 22.23 ff. and lies with her, he must make her his wife by payment of a bride-price.

hebrew: אִם־מָאֵ֧ן יְמָאֵ֛ן אָבִ֖יהָ לְתִתָּ֣הּ ל֑וֹ כֶּ֣סֶף יִשְׁקֹ֔ל כְּמֹ֖הַר הַבְּתוּלֹֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: im-maen y'maen aviyha l'titah lvo kesef yish'kol k'mohar hab'tvlot (s)
translation: If her father refuses to give her to him, he must still weigh out silver in accordance with the bride-price for virgins.

hebrew: מְכַשֵּׁפָ֖ה לֹ֥א תְחַיֶּֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: m'khashefah lo t'chayeh (s)
translation: You shall not tolerategLit. “let live.” a sorceress.

hebrew: כָּל־שֹׁכֵ֥ב עִם־בְּהֵמָ֖ה מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: kal-shokhev 'im-b'hemah mvot yvmat (s)
translation: Whoever lies with a beast shall be put to death.

hebrew: זֹבֵ֥חַ לָאֱלֹהִ֖ים יָֽחֳרָ֑ם בִּלְתִּ֥י לַיהוָ֖ה לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: zovecha laelohiym yachoram bil'tiy layhvah l'vadvo
translation: Whoever sacrifices to a god other than the LORD alone shall be proscribed.hSee Lev. 27.29.

hebrew: וְגֵ֥ר לֹא־תוֹנֶ֖ה וְלֹ֣א תִלְחָצֶ֑נּוּ כִּֽי־גֵרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'ger lo-tvoneh v'lo til'chatzenv kiy-geriym heyiytem b'eretz mitz'rayim
translation: You shall not wrong a stranger or oppress him, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.

hebrew: כָּל־אַלְמָנָ֥ה וְיָת֖וֹם לֹ֥א תְעַנּֽוּן׃
transliteration: kal-al'manah v'yatvom lo t'anvn
translation: You shall not ill-treat any widow or orphan.

hebrew: אִם־עַנֵּ֥ה תְעַנֶּ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ כִּ֣י אִם־צָעֹ֤ק יִצְעַק֙ אֵלַ֔י שָׁמֹ֥עַ אֶשְׁמַ֖ע צַעֲקָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: im-'aneh t'aneh otvo kiy im-tza'ok yitz'ak elay shamo'a esh'ma' tza'akatvo
translation: If you do mistreat them, I will heed their outcry as soon as they cry out to Me,

hebrew: וְחָרָ֣ה אַפִּ֔י וְהָרַגְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם בֶּחָ֑רֶב וְהָי֤וּ נְשֵׁיכֶם֙ אַלְמָנ֔וֹת וּבְנֵיכֶ֖ם יְתֹמִֽים׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'charah apiy v'harag'tiy et'khem becharev v'hayv n'sheykhem al'manvot vv'neykhem y'tomiym (f)
translation: and My anger shall blaze forth and I will put you to the sword, and your own wives shall become widows and your children orphans.

hebrew: אִם־כֶּ֣סֶף ׀ תַּלְוֶ֣ה אֶת־עַמִּ֗י אֶת־הֶֽעָנִי֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ לֹא־תִהְיֶ֥ה ל֖וֹ כְּנֹשֶׁ֑ה לֹֽא־תְשִׂימ֥וּן עָלָ֖יו נֶֽשֶׁךְ׃
transliteration: im-kesef  tal'veh et-'amiy et-he'aniy 'imakh' lo-tih'yeh lvo k'nosheh lo-t'siymvn 'alayv neshekh'
translation: If you lend money to My people, to the poor among you, do not act toward them as a creditor; exact no interest from them.

hebrew: אִם־חָבֹ֥ל תַּחְבֹּ֖ל שַׂלְמַ֣ת רֵעֶ֑ךָ עַד־בֹּ֥א הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ תְּשִׁיבֶ֥נּוּ לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: im-chavol tach'bol sal'mat re'ekha 'ad-bo hashemesh t'shiyvenv lvo
translation: If you take your neighbor’s garment in pledge, you must return it to him before the sun sets;

hebrew: כִּ֣י הִ֤וא כסותה [כְסוּתוֹ֙] לְבַדָּ֔הּ הִ֥וא שִׂמְלָת֖וֹ לְעֹר֑וֹ בַּמֶּ֣ה יִשְׁכָּ֔ב וְהָיָה֙ כִּֽי־יִצְעַ֣ק אֵלַ֔י וְשָׁמַעְתִּ֖י כִּֽי־חַנּ֥וּן אָֽנִי׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy hiv khsvth [kh'svtvo] l'vadah hiv sim'latvo l'orvo bameh yish'kav v'hayah kiy-yitz'ak elay v'shama'tiy kiy-chanvn aniy (s)
translation: it is his only clothing, the sole covering for his skin. In what else shall he sleep? Therefore, if he cries out to Me, I will pay heed, for I am compassionate.

hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֹ֣א תְקַלֵּ֑ל וְנָשִׂ֥יא בְעַמְּךָ֖ לֹ֥א תָאֹֽר׃
transliteration: elohiym lo t'kalel v'nasiy v'am'kha lo taor
translation: You shall not revile God, nor put a curse upon a chieftain among your people.

hebrew: מְלֵאָתְךָ֥ וְדִמְעֲךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְאַחֵ֑ר בְּכ֥וֹר בָּנֶ֖יךָ תִּתֶּן־לִּֽי׃
transliteration: m'leat'kha v'dim'akha lo t'acher b'khvor baneykha titen-liy
translation: You shall not iMeaning of Heb. uncertain.put off the skimming of the first yield of your vats.-i You shall give Me the first-born among your sons.

hebrew: כֵּֽן־תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לְשֹׁרְךָ֖ לְצֹאנֶ֑ךָ שִׁבְעַ֤ת יָמִים֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה עִם־אִמּ֔וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֖י תִּתְּנוֹ־לִֽי׃
transliteration: ken-ta'aseh l'shor'kha l'tzonekha shiv'at yamiym yih'yeh 'im-imvo bayvom hash'miyniy tit'nvo-liy
translation: You shall do the same with your cattle and your flocks: seven days itjI.e., the male first-born. shall remain with its mother; on the eighth day you shall give it to Me.

hebrew: וְאַנְשֵׁי־קֹ֖דֶשׁ תִּהְי֣וּן לִ֑י וּבָשָׂ֨ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֤ה טְרֵפָה֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֔לוּ לַכֶּ֖לֶב תַּשְׁלִכ֥וּן אֹתֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'an'shey-kodesh tih'yvn liy vvasar basadeh t'refah lo tokhelv lakelev tash'likhvn otvo (s)
translation: You shall be holy people to Me: you must not eat flesh torn by beasts in the field; you shall cast it to the dogs.

hebrew: לֹ֥א תִשָּׂ֖א שֵׁ֣מַע שָׁ֑וְא אַל־תָּ֤שֶׁת יָֽדְךָ֙ עִם־רָשָׁ֔ע לִהְיֹ֖ת עֵ֥ד חָמָֽס׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo tisa shema' shav' al-tashet yad'kha 'im-rasha' lih'yot 'ed chamas (s)
translation: You must not carry false rumors; you shall not join hands with the guilty to act as a malicious witness:

hebrew: לֹֽא־תִהְיֶ֥ה אַחֲרֵֽי־רַבִּ֖ים לְרָעֹ֑ת וְלֹא־תַעֲנֶ֣ה עַל־רִ֗ב לִנְטֹ֛ת אַחֲרֵ֥י רַבִּ֖ים לְהַטֹּֽת׃
transliteration: lo-tih'yeh acharey-rabiym l'ra'ot v'lo-ta'aneh 'al-riv lin'tot acharey rabiym l'hatot
translation: You shall neither side with the mightyaOthers “multitude.” to do wrong—you shall not give perverse testimony in a dispute so as to pervert it in favor of the mighty-a—

hebrew: וְדָ֕ל לֹ֥א תֶהְדַּ֖ר בְּרִיבֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'dal lo teh'dar b'riyvvo (s)
translation: nor shall you show deference to a poor man in his dispute.

hebrew: כִּ֣י תִפְגַּ֞ע שׁ֧וֹר אֹֽיִבְךָ֛ א֥וֹ חֲמֹר֖וֹ תֹּעֶ֑ה הָשֵׁ֥ב תְּשִׁיבֶ֖נּוּ לֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy tif'ga' shvor oyiv'kha vo chamorvo to'eh hashev t'shiyvenv lvo (s)
translation: When you encounter your enemy’s ox or ass wandering, you must take it back to him.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תִרְאֶ֞ה חֲמ֣וֹר שֹׂנַאֲךָ֗ רֹבֵץ֙ תַּ֣חַת מַשָּׂא֔וֹ וְחָדַלְתָּ֖ מֵעֲזֹ֣ב ל֑וֹ עָזֹ֥ב תַּעֲזֹ֖ב עִמּֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy-tir'eh chamvor sonaakha rovetz tachat masavo v'chadal'ta me'azov lvo 'azov ta'azov 'imvo (s)
translation: When you see the ass of your enemy lying under its burden and would refrain from raisingbFor this use of the verb ‘zb, cf. Neh. 3.8, 34. For the whole verse see Deut. 22.4. it, you must nevertheless raise it with him.

hebrew: לֹ֥א תַטֶּ֛ה מִשְׁפַּ֥ט אֶבְיֹנְךָ֖ בְּרִיבֽוֹ׃
transliteration: lo tateh mish'pat ev'yon'kha b'riyvvo
translation: You shall not subvert the rights of your needy in their disputes.

hebrew: מִדְּבַר־שֶׁ֖קֶר תִּרְחָ֑ק וְנָקִ֤י וְצַדִּיק֙ אַֽל־תַּהֲרֹ֔ג כִּ֥י לֹא־אַצְדִּ֖יק רָשָֽׁע׃
transliteration: mid'var-sheker tir'chak v'nakiy v'tzadiyk al-taharog kiy lo-atz'diyk rasha'
translation: Keep far from a false charge; do not bring death on those who are innocent and in the right, for I will not acquit the wrongdoer.

hebrew: וְשֹׁ֖חַד לֹ֣א תִקָּ֑ח כִּ֤י הַשֹּׁ֙חַד֙ יְעַוֵּ֣ר פִּקְחִ֔ים וִֽיסַלֵּ֖ף דִּבְרֵ֥י צַדִּיקִֽים׃
transliteration: v'shochad lo tikach kiy hashochad y'aver pik'chiym viysalef div'rey tzadiykiym
translation: Do not take bribes, for bribes blind the clear-sighted and upset the pleas of those who are in the right.

hebrew: וְגֵ֖ר לֹ֣א תִלְחָ֑ץ וְאַתֶּ֗ם יְדַעְתֶּם֙ אֶת־נֶ֣פֶשׁ הַגֵּ֔ר כִּֽי־גֵרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'ger lo til'chatz v'atem y'da'tem et-nefesh hager kiy-geriym heyiytem b'eretz mitz'rayim
translation: You shall not oppress a stranger, for you know the feelings of the stranger, having yourselves been strangers in the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וְשֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים תִּזְרַ֣ע אֶת־אַרְצֶ֑ךָ וְאָסַפְתָּ֖ אֶת־תְּבוּאָתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'shesh shaniym tiz'ra' et-ar'tzekha v'asaf'ta et-t'vvatah
translation: Six years you shall sow your land and gather in its yield;

hebrew: וְהַשְּׁבִיעִ֞ת תִּשְׁמְטֶ֣נָּה וּנְטַשְׁתָּ֗הּ וְאָֽכְלוּ֙ אֶבְיֹנֵ֣י עַמֶּ֔ךָ וְיִתְרָ֕ם תֹּאכַ֖ל חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה כֵּֽן־תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לְכַרְמְךָ֖ לְזֵיתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'hash'viy'it tish'm'tenah vn'tash'tah v'akh'lv ev'yoney 'amekha v'yit'ram tokhal chayat hasadeh ken-ta'aseh l'khar'm'kha l'zeytekha
translation: but in the seventh you shall let it rest and lie fallow. Let the needy among your people eat of it, and what they leave let the wild beasts eat. You shall do the same with your vineyards and your olive groves.

hebrew: שֵׁ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה מַעֲשֶׂ֔יךָ וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י תִּשְׁבֹּ֑ת לְמַ֣עַן יָנ֗וּחַ שֽׁוֹרְךָ֙ וַחֲמֹרֶ֔ךָ וְיִנָּפֵ֥שׁ בֶּן־אֲמָתְךָ֖ וְהַגֵּֽר׃
transliteration: sheshet yamiym ta'aseh ma'aseykha vvayvom hash'viy'iy tish'bot l'ma'an yanvcha shvor'kha vachamorekha v'yinafesh ben-amat'kha v'hager
translation: Six days you shall do your work, but on the seventh day you shall cease from labor, in order that your ox and your ass may rest, and that your bondman and the stranger may be refreshed.

hebrew: וּבְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־אָמַ֥רְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם תִּשָּׁמֵ֑רוּ וְשֵׁ֨ם אֱלֹהִ֤ים אֲחֵרִים֙ לֹ֣א תַזְכִּ֔ירוּ לֹ֥א יִשָּׁמַ֖ע עַל־פִּֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vv'khol asher-amar'tiy aleykhem tishamerv v'shem elohiym acheriym lo taz'kiyrv lo yishama' 'al-piykha
translation: Be on guard concerning all that I have told you. Make no mention of the names of other gods; they shall not be heard on your lips.

hebrew: שָׁלֹ֣שׁ רְגָלִ֔ים תָּחֹ֥ג לִ֖י בַּשָּׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: shalosh r'galiym tachog liy bashanah
translation: Three times a year you shall hold a festival for Me:

hebrew: אֶת־חַ֣ג הַמַּצּוֹת֮ תִּשְׁמֹר֒ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִים֩ תֹּאכַ֨ל מַצּ֜וֹת כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֗ךָ לְמוֹעֵד֙ חֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽאָבִ֔יב כִּי־ב֖וֹ יָצָ֣אתָ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וְלֹא־יֵרָא֥וּ פָנַ֖י רֵיקָֽם׃
transliteration: et-chag hamatzvot tish'mor shiv'at yamiym tokhal matzvot kaasher tziviytikha l'mvo'ed chodesh haaviyv kiy-vvo yatzata mimitz'rayim v'lo-yerav fanay reykam
translation: You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread—eating unleavened bread for seven days as I have commanded you—at the set time in the monthcSee note at 13.4. of Abib, for in it you went forth from Egypt; and none shall appear before Me empty-handed;

hebrew: וְחַ֤ג הַקָּצִיר֙ בִּכּוּרֵ֣י מַעֲשֶׂ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּזְרַ֖ע בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וְחַ֤ג הָֽאָסִף֙ בְּצֵ֣את הַשָּׁנָ֔ה בְּאָסְפְּךָ֥ אֶֽת־מַעֲשֶׂ֖יךָ מִן־הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'chag hakatziyr bikvrey ma'aseykha asher tiz'ra' basadeh v'chag haasif b'tzet hashanah b'as'p'kha et-ma'aseykha min-hasadeh
translation: and the Feast of the Harvest, of the first fruits of your work, of what you sow in the field; and the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you gather in the results of your work from the field.

hebrew: שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה יֵרָאֶה֙ כָּל־זְכ֣וּרְךָ֔ אֶל־פְּנֵ֖י הָאָדֹ֥ן ׀ יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: shalosh p'amiym bashanah yeraeh kal-z'khvr'kha el-p'ney haadon  y'hvah
translation: Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Sovereign, the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תִזְבַּ֥ח עַל־חָמֵ֖ץ דַּם־זִבְחִ֑י וְלֹֽא־יָלִ֥ין חֵֽלֶב־חַגִּ֖י עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
transliteration: lo-tiz'bach 'al-chametz dam-ziv'chiy v'lo-yaliyn chelev-chagiy 'ad-boker
translation: You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with anything leavened; and the fat of My festal offering shall not be left lying until morning.

hebrew: רֵאשִׁ֗ית בִּכּוּרֵי֙ אַדְמָ֣תְךָ֔ תָּבִ֕יא בֵּ֖ית יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לֹֽא־תְבַשֵּׁ֥ל גְּדִ֖י בַּחֲלֵ֥ב אִמּֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: reshiyt bikvrey ad'mat'kha taviy beyt y'hvah eloheykha lo-t'vashel g'diy bachalev imvo (s)
translation:
The choice first fruits of your soil you shall bring to the house of the LORD your God.
You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.

hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י שֹׁלֵ֤חַ מַלְאָךְ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמָרְךָ֖ בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ וְלַהֲבִ֣יאֲךָ֔ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֲכִנֹֽתִי׃
transliteration: hineh anokhiy sholecha mal'akh' l'faneykha lish'mar'kha badarekh' v'lahaviyakha el-hamakvom asher hakhinotiy
translation: I am sending an angel before you to guard you on the way and to bring you to the place that I have made ready.

hebrew: הִשָּׁ֧מֶר מִפָּנָ֛יו וּשְׁמַ֥ע בְּקֹל֖וֹ אַל־תַּמֵּ֣ר בּ֑וֹ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יִשָּׂא֙ לְפִשְׁעֲכֶ֔ם כִּ֥י שְׁמִ֖י בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: hishamer mipanayv vsh'ma' b'kolvo al-tamer bvo kiy lo yisa l'fish'akhem kiy sh'miy b'kir'bvo
translation: Pay heed to him and obey him. Do not defy him, for he will not pardon your offenses, since My Name is in him;

hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־שָׁמֹ֤עַ תִּשְׁמַע֙ בְּקֹל֔וֹ וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲדַבֵּ֑ר וְאָֽיַבְתִּי֙ אֶת־אֹ֣יְבֶ֔יךָ וְצַרְתִּ֖י אֶת־צֹרְרֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: kiy im-shamo'a tish'ma' b'kolvo v'asiyta kol asher adaber v'ayav'tiy et-oy'veykha v'tzar'tiy et-tzor'reykha
translation: but if you obey him and do all that I say, I will be an enemy to your enemies and a foe to your foes.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יֵלֵ֣ךְ מַלְאָכִי֮ לְפָנֶיךָ֒ וֶהֱבִֽיאֲךָ֗ אֶל־הָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַ֣חִתִּ֔י וְהַפְּרִזִּי֙ וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִ֑י וְהִכְחַדְתִּֽיו׃
transliteration: kiy-yelekh' mal'akhiy l'faneykha veheviyakha el-haemoriy v'hachitiy v'hap'riziy v'hak'na'aniy hachiviy v'hay'vvsiy v'hikh'chad'tiyv
translation: When My angel goes before you and brings you to the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, and I annihilate them,

hebrew: לֹֽא־תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֤ה לֵאלֹֽהֵיהֶם֙ וְלֹ֣א תָֽעָבְדֵ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תַעֲשֶׂ֖ה כְּמַֽעֲשֵׂיהֶ֑ם כִּ֤י הָרֵס֙ תְּהָ֣רְסֵ֔ם וְשַׁבֵּ֥ר תְּשַׁבֵּ֖ר מַצֵּבֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: lo-tish'tachaveh leloheyhem v'lo ta'av'dem v'lo ta'aseh k'ma'aseyhem kiy hares t'har'sem v'shaber t'shaber matzevoteyhem
translation: you shall not bow down to their gods in worship or follow their practices, but shall tear them down and smash their pillars to bits.

hebrew: וַעֲבַדְתֶּ֗ם אֵ֚ת יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵרַ֥ךְ אֶֽת־לַחְמְךָ֖ וְאֶת־מֵימֶ֑יךָ וַהֲסִרֹתִ֥י מַחֲלָ֖ה מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: va'avad'tem et y'hvah eloheykhem vverakh' et-lach'm'kha v'et-meymeykha vahasirotiy machalah mikir'bekha
translation: You shall serve the L<small>ORD</small> your God, and He will bless your bread and your water. And I will remove sickness from your midst.

hebrew: לֹ֥א תִהְיֶ֛ה מְשַׁכֵּלָ֥ה וַעֲקָרָ֖ה בְּאַרְצֶ֑ךָ אֶת־מִסְפַּ֥ר יָמֶ֖יךָ אֲמַלֵּֽא׃
transliteration: lo tih'yeh m'shakelah va'akarah b'ar'tzekha et-mis'par yameykha amale
translation: No woman in your land shall miscarry or be barren. I will let you enjoy the full count of your days.

hebrew: אֶת־אֵֽימָתִי֙ אֲשַׁלַּ֣ח לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְהַמֹּתִי֙ אֶת־כָּל־הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּבֹ֖א בָּהֶ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֧י אֶת־כָּל־אֹיְבֶ֛יךָ אֵלֶ֖יךָ עֹֽרֶף׃
transliteration: et-eymatiy ashalach l'faneykha v'hamotiy et-kal-ha'am asher tavo bahem v'natatiy et-kal-oy'veykha eleykha 'oref
translation: I will send forth My terror before you, and I will throw into panic all the people among whom you come, and I will make all your enemies turn taildLit. “back.” before you.

hebrew: וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֥י אֶת־הַצִּרְעָ֖ה לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְגֵרְשָׁ֗ה אֶת־הַחִוִּ֧י אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֛י וְאֶת־הַחִתִּ֖י מִלְּפָנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'shalach'tiy et-hatzir'ah l'faneykha v'ger'shah et-hachiviy et-hak'na'aniy v'et-hachitiy mil'faneykha
translation: I will send a plagueeOthers “hornet”; meaning of Heb. uncertain. ahead of you, and it shall drive out before you the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites.

hebrew: לֹ֧א אֲגָרְשֶׁ֛נּוּ מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ בְּשָׁנָ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת פֶּן־תִּהְיֶ֤ה הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ שְׁמָמָ֔ה וְרַבָּ֥ה עָלֶ֖יךָ חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
transliteration: lo agar'shenv mipaneykha b'shanah echat pen-tih'yeh haaretz sh'mamah v'rabah 'aleykha chayat hasadeh
translation: I will not drive them out before you in a single year, lest the land become desolate and the wild beasts multiply to your hurt.

hebrew: מְעַ֥ט מְעַ֛ט אֲגָרְשֶׁ֖נּוּ מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ עַ֚ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּפְרֶ֔ה וְנָחַלְתָּ֖ אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: m'at m'at agar'shenv mipaneykha 'ad asher tif'reh v'nachal'ta et-haaretz
translation: I will drive them out before you little by little, until you have increased and possess the land.

hebrew: וְשַׁתִּ֣י אֶת־גְּבֻלְךָ֗ מִיַּם־סוּף֙ וְעַד־יָ֣ם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וּמִמִּדְבָּ֖ר עַד־הַנָּהָ֑ר כִּ֣י ׀ אֶתֵּ֣ן בְּיֶדְכֶ֗ם אֵ֚ת יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ וְגֵרַשְׁתָּ֖מוֹ מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'shatiy et-g'vul'kha miyam-svf v'ad-yam p'lish'tiym vmimid'bar 'ad-hanahar kiy  eten b'yed'khem et yosh'vey haaretz v'gerash'tamvo mipaneykha
translation: I will set your borders from the Sea of Reeds to the Sea of Philistia, and from the wilderness to the Euphrates; for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hands, and you will drive them out before you.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תִכְרֹ֥ת לָהֶ֛ם וְלֵאלֹֽהֵיהֶ֖ם בְּרִֽית׃
transliteration: lo-tikh'rot lahem v'leloheyhem b'riyt
translation: You shall make no covenant with them and their gods.

hebrew: לֹ֤א יֵשְׁבוּ֙ בְּאַרְצְךָ֔ פֶּן־יַחֲטִ֥יאוּ אֹתְךָ֖ לִ֑י כִּ֤י תַעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ לְמוֹקֵֽשׁ׃ (פ)
transliteration: lo yesh'vv b'ar'tz'kha pen-yachatiyv ot'kha liy kiy ta'avod et-eloheyhem kiy-yih'yeh l'kha l'mvokesh (f)
translation: They shall not remain in your land, lest they cause you to sin against Me; for you will serve their gods—and it will prove a snare to you.

hebrew: וְאֶל־מֹשֶׁ֨ה אָמַ֜ר עֲלֵ֣ה אֶל־יְהוָ֗ה אַתָּה֙ וְאַהֲרֹן֙ נָדָ֣ב וַאֲבִיה֔וּא וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים מִזִּקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִיתֶ֖ם מֵרָחֹֽק׃
transliteration: v'el-mosheh amar 'aleh el-y'hvah atah v'aharon nadav vaaviyhv v'shiv'iym mizik'ney yis'rael v'hish'tachaviytem merachok
translation: Then He said to Moses, “Come up to the L<small>ORD</small>, with Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy elders of Israel, and bow low from afar.

hebrew: וְנִגַּ֨שׁ מֹשֶׁ֤ה לְבַדּוֹ֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה וְהֵ֖ם לֹ֣א יִגָּ֑שׁוּ וְהָעָ֕ם לֹ֥א יַעֲל֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'nigash mosheh l'vadvo el-y'hvah v'hem lo yigashv v'ha'am lo ya'alv 'imvo
translation: Moses alone shall come near the L<small>ORD</small>; but the others shall not come near, nor shall the people come up with him.”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיְסַפֵּ֤ר לָעָם֙ אֵ֚ת כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֑ים וַיַּ֨עַן כָּל־הָעָ֜ם ק֤וֹל אֶחָד֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה נַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: vayavo mosheh vay'saper la'am et kal-div'rey y'hvah v'et kal-hamish'patiym vaya'an kal-ha'am kvol echad vayom'rv kal-had'variym asher-diber y'hvah na'aseh
translation: Moses went and repeated to the people all the commands of the L<small>ORD</small> and all the rules; and all the people answered with one voice, saying, “All the things that the L<small>ORD</small> has commanded we will do!”

hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֣ב מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֵ֚ת כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֣ם בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וַיִּ֥בֶן מִזְבֵּ֖חַ תַּ֣חַת הָהָ֑ר וּשְׁתֵּ֤ים עֶשְׂרֵה֙ מַצֵּבָ֔ה לִשְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayikh'tov mosheh et kal-div'rey y'hvah vayash'kem baboker vayiven miz'becha tachat hahar vsh'teym 'es'reh matzevah lish'neym 'asar shiv'tey yis'rael
translation:
Moses then wrote down all the commands of the LORD.
Early in the morning, he set up an altar at the foot of the mountain, with twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח אֶֽת־נַעֲרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיַּֽעֲל֖וּ עֹלֹ֑ת וַֽיִּזְבְּח֞וּ זְבָחִ֧ים שְׁלָמִ֛ים לַיהוָ֖ה פָּרִֽים׃
transliteration: vayish'lach et-na'arey b'ney yis'rael vaya'alv 'olot vayiz'b'chv z'vachiym sh'lamiym layhvah pariym
translation: He designated some young men among the Israelites, and they offered burnt offerings and sacrificed bulls as offerings of well-being to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ חֲצִ֣י הַדָּ֔ם וַיָּ֖שֶׂם בָּאַגָּנֹ֑ת וַחֲצִ֣י הַדָּ֔ם זָרַ֖ק עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh chatziy hadam vayasem baaganot vachatziy hadam zarak 'al-hamiz'becha
translation: Moses took one part of the blood and put it in basins, and the other part of the blood he dashed against the altar.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֙ סֵ֣פֶר הַבְּרִ֔ית וַיִּקְרָ֖א בְּאָזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה נַעֲשֶׂ֥ה וְנִשְׁמָֽע׃
transliteration: vayikach sefer hab'riyt vayik'ra b'az'ney ha'am vayom'rv kol asher-diber y'hvah na'aseh v'nish'ma'
translation: Then he took the record of the covenant and read it aloud to the people. And they said, “All that the LORD has spoken aLit. “we will do and obey.”we will faithfully do!”-a

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וַיִּזְרֹ֖ק עַל־הָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֤ה דַֽם־הַבְּרִית֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר כָּרַ֤ת יְהוָה֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם עַ֥ל כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-hadam vayiz'rok 'al-ha'am vayomer hineh dam-hab'riyt asher karat y'hvah 'imakhem 'al kal-had'variym haeleh
translation: Moses took the blood and dashed it on the people and said, “This is the blood of the covenant that the L<small>ORD</small> now makes with you concerning all these commands.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֑ן נָדָב֙ וַאֲבִיה֔וּא וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים מִזִּקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vaya'al mosheh v'aharon nadav vaaviyhv v'shiv'iym mizik'ney yis'rael
translation: Then Moses and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy elders of Israel ascended;

hebrew: וַיִּרְא֕וּ אֵ֖ת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְתַ֣חַת רַגְלָ֗יו כְּמַעֲשֵׂה֙ לִבְנַ֣ת הַסַּפִּ֔יר וּכְעֶ֥צֶם הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לָטֹֽהַר׃
transliteration: vayir'v et elohey yis'rael v'tachat rag'layv k'ma'aseh liv'nat hasapiyr vkh'etzem hashamayim latohar
translation: and they saw the God of Israel: under His feet there was the likeness of a pavement of sapphire, like the very sky for purity.

hebrew: וְאֶל־אֲצִילֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֖ח יָד֑וֹ וַֽיֶּחֱזוּ֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיֹּאכְל֖וּ וַיִּשְׁתּֽוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'el-atziyley b'ney yis'rael lo shalach yadvo vayechezv et-haelohiym vayokh'lv vayish'tv (s)
translation: Yet He did not raise His hand against the leadersbMeaning of Heb. ’aṣilim uncertain. of the Israelites; they beheld God, and they ate and drank.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה עֲלֵ֥ה אֵלַ֛י הָהָ֖רָה וֶהְיֵה־שָׁ֑ם וְאֶתְּנָ֨ה לְךָ֜ אֶת־לֻחֹ֣ת הָאֶ֗בֶן וְהַתּוֹרָה֙ וְהַמִּצְוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּתַ֖בְתִּי לְהוֹרֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh 'aleh elay haharah veh'yeh-sham v'et'nah l'kha et-luchot haeven v'hatvorah v'hamitz'vah asher katav'tiy l'hvorotam
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Come up to Me on the mountain and wait there, and I will give you the stone tablets with the teachings and commandments which I have inscribed to instruct them.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֣קָם מֹשֶׁ֔ה וִיהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ מְשָׁרְת֑וֹ וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: vayakam mosheh viyhvoshu'a m'shar'tvo vaya'al mosheh el-har haelohiym
translation: So Moses and his attendant Joshua arose, and Moses ascended the mountain of God.

hebrew: וְאֶל־הַזְּקֵנִ֤ים אָמַר֙ שְׁבוּ־לָ֣נוּ בָזֶ֔ה עַ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־נָשׁ֖וּב אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וְהִנֵּ֨ה אַהֲרֹ֤ן וְחוּר֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם מִי־בַ֥עַל דְּבָרִ֖ים יִגַּ֥שׁ אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'el-haz'keniym amar sh'vv-lanv vazeh 'ad asher-nashvv aleykhem v'hineh aharon v'chvr 'imakhem miy-va'al d'variym yigash alehem
translation: To the elders he had said, “Wait here for us until we return to you. You have Aaron and Hur with you; let anyone who has a legal matter approach them.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הָהָ֑ר וַיְכַ֥ס הֶעָנָ֖ן אֶת־הָהָֽר׃
transliteration: vaya'al mosheh el-hahar vay'khas he'anan et-hahar
translation: When Moses had ascended the mountain, the cloud covered the mountain.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכֹּ֤ן כְּבוֹד־יְהוָה֙ עַל־הַ֣ר סִינַ֔י וַיְכַסֵּ֥הוּ הֶעָנָ֖ן שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים וַיִּקְרָ֧א אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֛ה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י מִתּ֥וֹךְ הֶעָנָֽן׃
transliteration: vayish'kon k'vvod-y'hvah 'al-har siynay vay'khasehv he'anan sheshet yamiym vayik'ra el-mosheh bayvom hash'viy'iy mitvokh' he'anan
translation: The Presence of the L<small>ORD</small> abode on Mount Sinai, and the cloud hid it for six days. On the seventh day He called to Moses from the midst of the cloud.

hebrew: וּמַרְאֵה֙ כְּב֣וֹד יְהוָ֔ה כְּאֵ֥שׁ אֹכֶ֖לֶת בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֑ר לְעֵינֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vmar'eh k'vvod y'hvah k'esh okhelet b'rosh hahar l'eyney b'ney yis'rael
translation: Now the Presence of the L<small>ORD</small> appeared in the sight of the Israelites as a consuming fire on the top of the mountain.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה בְּת֥וֹךְ הֶעָנָ֖ן וַיַּ֣עַל אֶל־הָהָ֑ר וַיְהִ֤י מֹשֶׁה֙ בָּהָ֔ר אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָֽיְלָה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayavo mosheh b'tvokh' he'anan vaya'al el-hahar vay'hiy mosheh bahar ar'ba'iym yvom v'ar'ba'iym lay'lah (f)
translation: Moses went inside the cloud and ascended the mountain; and Moses remained on the mountain forty days and forty nights.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְיִקְחוּ־לִ֖י תְּרוּמָ֑ה מֵאֵ֤ת כָּל־אִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִדְּבֶ֣נּוּ לִבּ֔וֹ תִּקְח֖וּ אֶת־תְּרוּמָתִֽי׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'yik'chv-liy t'rvmah meet kal-iysh asher yid'venv libvo tik'chv et-t'rvmatiy
translation: Tell the Israelite people to bring Me gifts; you shall accept gifts for Me from every person whose heart so moves him.

hebrew: וְזֹאת֙ הַתְּרוּמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּקְח֖וּ מֵאִתָּ֑ם זָהָ֥ב וָכֶ֖סֶף וּנְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: v'zot hat'rvmah asher tik'chv meitam zahav vakhesef vn'choshet
translation: And these are the gifts that you shall accept from them: gold, silver, and copper;

hebrew: וּתְכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ וְעִזִּֽים׃
transliteration: vt'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh v'iziym
translation: blue, purple, and crimson yarns, fine linen, goats’ hair;

hebrew: וְעֹרֹ֨ת אֵילִ֧ם מְאָדָּמִ֛ים וְעֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים וַעֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּֽים׃
transliteration: v'orot eylim m'adamiym v'orot t'chashiym va'atzey shitiym
translation: tanned ram skins,aOthers “rams’ skins dyed red.” dolphinbOr “dugong”; meaning of Hebrew taḥash uncertain. skins, and acacia wood;

hebrew: שֶׁ֖מֶן לַמָּאֹ֑ר בְּשָׂמִים֙ לְשֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְלִקְטֹ֖רֶת הַסַּמִּֽים׃
transliteration: shemen lamaor b'samiym l'shemen hamish'chah v'lik'toret hasamiym
translation: oil for lighting, spices for the anointing oil and for the aromatic incense;

hebrew: אַבְנֵי־שֹׁ֕הַם וְאַבְנֵ֖י מִלֻּאִ֑ים לָאֵפֹ֖ד וְלַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
transliteration: av'ney-shoham v'av'ney miluiym laefod v'lachoshen
translation: lapis lazulicCf. Gen. 2.12 and note. and other stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece.

hebrew: וְעָ֥שׂוּ לִ֖י מִקְדָּ֑שׁ וְשָׁכַנְתִּ֖י בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
transliteration: v'asv liy mik'dash v'shakhan'tiy b'tvokham
translation: And let them make Me a sanctuary that I may dwell among them.

hebrew: כְּכֹ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֲנִי֙ מַרְאֶ֣ה אוֹתְךָ֔ אֵ֚ת תַּבְנִ֣ית הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת תַּבְנִ֣ית כָּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְכֵ֖ן תַּעֲשֽׂוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: k'khol asher aniy mar'eh vot'kha et tav'niyt hamish'kan v'et tav'niyt kal-kelayv v'khen ta'asv (s)
translation: Exactly as I show you—the pattern of the Tabernacle and the pattern of all its furnishings—so shall you make it.

hebrew: וְעָשׂ֥וּ אֲר֖וֹן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֨יִם וָחֵ֜צִי אָרְכּ֗וֹ וְאַמָּ֤ה וָחֵ֙צִי֙ רָחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'asv arvon 'atzey shitiym amatayim vachetziy ar'kvo v'amah vachetziy rach'bvo v'amah vachetziy komatvo
translation: They shall make an ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.

hebrew: וְצִפִּיתָ֤ אֹתוֹ֙ זָהָ֣ב טָה֔וֹר מִבַּ֥יִת וּמִח֖וּץ תְּצַפֶּ֑נּוּ וְעָשִׂ֧יתָ עָלָ֛יו זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'tzipiyta otvo zahav tahvor mibayit vmichvtz t'tzapenv v'asiyta 'alayv zer zahav saviyv
translation: Overlay it with pure gold—overlay it inside and out—and make upon it a gold molding round about.

hebrew: וְיָצַ֣קְתָּ לּ֗וֹ אַרְבַּע֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֔ב וְנָ֣תַתָּ֔ה עַ֖ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פַּעֲמֹתָ֑יו וּשְׁתֵּ֣י טַבָּעֹ֗ת עַל־צַלְעוֹ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת וּשְׁתֵּי֙ טַבָּעֹ֔ת עַל־צַלְע֖וֹ הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
transliteration: v'yatzak'ta lvo ar'ba' tab'ot zahav v'natatah 'al ar'ba' pa'amotayv vsh'tey taba'ot 'al-tzal'vo haechat vsh'tey taba'ot 'al-tzal'vo hasheniyt
translation: Cast four gold rings for it, to be attached to its four feet, two rings on one of its side walls and two on the other.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ בַדֵּ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
transliteration: v'asiyta vadey 'atzey shitiym v'tzipiyta otam zahav
translation: Make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold;

hebrew: וְהֵֽבֵאתָ֤ אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ בַּטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֖ל צַלְעֹ֣ת הָאָרֹ֑ן לָשֵׂ֥את אֶת־הָאָרֹ֖ן בָּהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'heveta et-habadiym bataba'ot 'al tzal'ot haaron laset et-haaron bahem
translation: then insert the poles into the rings on the side walls of the ark, for carrying the ark.

hebrew: בְּטַבְּעֹת֙ הָאָרֹ֔ן יִהְי֖וּ הַבַּדִּ֑ים לֹ֥א יָסֻ֖רוּ מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: b'tab'ot haaron yih'yv habadiym lo yasurv mimenv
translation: The poles shall remain in the rings of the ark: they shall not be removed from it.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֖ אֶל־הָאָרֹ֑ן אֵ֚ת הָעֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶתֵּ֖ן אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'natata el-haaron et ha'edut asher eten eleykha
translation: And deposit in the Ark [the tablets of] the Pact which I will give you.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ כַפֹּ֖רֶת זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר אַמָּתַ֤יִם וָחֵ֙צִי֙ אָרְכָּ֔הּ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי רָחְבָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'asiyta khaporet zahav tahvor amatayim vachetziy ar'kah v'amah vachetziy rach'bah
translation: You shall make a cover of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֛יתָ שְׁנַ֥יִם כְּרֻבִ֖ים זָהָ֑ב מִקְשָׁה֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹתָ֔ם מִשְּׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
transliteration: v'asiyta sh'nayim k'ruviym zahav mik'shah ta'aseh otam mish'ney k'tzvot hakaporet
translation: Make two cherubim of gold—make them of hammered work—at the two ends of the cover.

hebrew: וַ֠עֲשֵׂה כְּר֨וּב אֶחָ֤ד מִקָּצָה֙ מִזֶּ֔ה וּכְרוּב־אֶחָ֥ד מִקָּצָ֖ה מִזֶּ֑ה מִן־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֖ים עַל־שְׁנֵ֥י קְצוֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: va'aseh k'rvv echad mikatzah mizeh vkh'rvv-echad mikatzah mizeh min-hakaporet ta'asv et-hak'ruviym 'al-sh'ney k'tzvotayv
translation: Make one cherub at one end and the other cherub at the other end; of one piece with the cover shall you make the cherubim at its two ends.

hebrew: וְהָי֣וּ הַכְּרֻבִים֩ פֹּרְשֵׂ֨י כְנָפַ֜יִם לְמַ֗עְלָה סֹכְכִ֤ים בְּכַנְפֵיהֶם֙ עַל־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת וּפְנֵיהֶ֖ם אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֑יו אֶל־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת יִהְי֖וּ פְּנֵ֥י הַכְּרֻבִֽים׃
transliteration: v'hayv hak'ruviym por'sey kh'nafayim l'ma'lah sokh'khiym b'khan'feyhem 'al-hakaporet vf'neyhem iysh el-achiyv el-hakaporet yih'yv p'ney hak'ruviym
translation: The cherubim shall have their wings spread out above, shielding the cover with their wings. They shall confront each other, the faces of the cherubim being turned toward the cover.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֧ אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת עַל־הָאָרֹ֖ן מִלְמָ֑עְלָה וְאֶל־הָ֣אָרֹ֔ן תִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־הָ֣עֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶתֵּ֖ן אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'natata et-hakaporet 'al-haaron mil'ma'lah v'el-haaron titen et-ha'edut asher eten eleykha
translation: Place the cover on top of the Ark, after depositing inside the Ark the Pact that I will give you.

hebrew: וְנוֹעַדְתִּ֣י לְךָ֮ שָׁם֒ וְדִבַּרְתִּ֨י אִתְּךָ֜ מֵעַ֣ל הַכַּפֹּ֗רֶת מִבֵּין֙ שְׁנֵ֣י הַכְּרֻבִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־אֲרֹ֣ן הָעֵדֻ֑ת אֵ֣ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֧ר אֲצַוֶּ֛ה אוֹתְךָ֖ אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'nvo'ad'tiy l'kha sham v'dibar'tiy it'kha me'al hakaporet mibeyn sh'ney hak'ruviym asher 'al-aron ha'edut et kal-asher atzaveh vot'kha el-b'ney yis'rael (f)
translation: There I will meet with you, and I will impart to you—from above the cover, from between the two cherubim that are on top of the Ark of the Pact—all that I will command you concerning the Israelite people.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ שֻׁלְחָ֖ן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֤יִם אָרְכּוֹ֙ וְאַמָּ֣ה רָחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'asiyta shul'chan 'atzey shitiym amatayim ar'kvo v'amah rach'bvo v'amah vachetziy komatvo
translation: You shall make a table of acacia wood, two cubits long, one cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high.

hebrew: וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹת֖וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לּ֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'tzipiyta otvo zahav tahvor v'asiyta lvo zer zahav saviyv
translation: Overlay it with pure gold, and make a gold molding around it.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֨יתָ לּ֥וֹ מִסְגֶּ֛רֶת טֹ֖פַח סָבִ֑יב וְעָשִׂ֧יתָ זֵר־זָהָ֛ב לְמִסְגַּרְתּ֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'asiyta lvo mis'geret tofach saviyv v'asiyta zer-zahav l'mis'gar'tvo saviyv
translation: Make a rim of a hand’s breadth around it, and make a gold molding for its rim round about.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ לּ֔וֹ אַרְבַּ֖ע טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֑ב וְנָתַתָּ֙ אֶת־הַטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע הַפֵּאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְאַרְבַּ֥ע רַגְלָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'asiyta lvo ar'ba' tab'ot zahav v'natata et-hataba'ot 'al ar'ba' hapeot asher l'ar'ba' rag'layv
translation: Make four gold rings for it, and attach the rings to the four corners at its four legs.

hebrew: לְעֻמַּת֙ הַמִּסְגֶּ֔רֶת תִּהְיֶ֖יןָ הַטַּבָּעֹ֑ת לְבָתִּ֣ים לְבַדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
transliteration: l'umat hamis'geret tih'yeyna hataba'ot l'vatiym l'vadiym laset et-hashul'chan
translation: The rings shall be next to the rim, as holders for poles to carry the table.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וְנִשָּׂא־בָ֖ם אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
transliteration: v'asiyta et-habadiym 'atzey shitiym v'tzipiyta otam zahav v'nisa-vam et-hashul'chan
translation: Make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold; by these the table shall be carried.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֨יתָ קְּעָרֹתָ֜יו וְכַפֹּתָ֗יו וּקְשׂוֹתָיו֙ וּמְנַקִּיֹּתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻסַּ֖ךְ בָּהֵ֑ן זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'asiyta k'arotayv v'khapotayv vk'svotayv vm'nakiyotayv asher yusakh' bahen zahav tahvor ta'aseh otam
translation: Make its bowls, ladles, jars and jugs with which to offer libations; make them of pure gold.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֧ עַֽל־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֛ן לֶ֥חֶם פָּנִ֖ים לְפָנַ֥י תָּמִֽיד׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'natata 'al-hashul'chan lechem paniym l'fanay tamiyd (f)
translation: And on the table you shall set the bread of display, to be before Me always.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מְנֹרַ֖ת זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר מִקְשָׁ֞ה תֵּעָשֶׂ֤ה הַמְּנוֹרָה֙ יְרֵכָ֣הּ וְקָנָ֔הּ גְּבִיעֶ֛יהָ כַּפְתֹּרֶ֥יהָ וּפְרָחֶ֖יהָ מִמֶּ֥נָּה יִהְיֽוּ׃
transliteration: v'asiyta m'norat zahav tahvor mik'shah te'aseh ham'nvorah y'rekhah v'kanah g'viy'eyha kaf'toreyha vf'racheyha mimenah yih'yv
translation: You shall make a lampstand of pure gold; the lampstand shall be made of hammered work; its base and its shaft, its cups, calyxes, and petals shall be of one piece.

hebrew: וְשִׁשָּׁ֣ה קָנִ֔ים יֹצְאִ֖ים מִצִּדֶּ֑יהָ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה ׀ קְנֵ֣י מְנֹרָ֗ה מִצִּדָּהּ֙ הָאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁלֹשָׁה֙ קְנֵ֣י מְנֹרָ֔ה מִצִּדָּ֖הּ הַשֵּׁנִֽי׃
transliteration: v'shishah kaniym yotz'iym mitzideyha sh'loshah  k'ney m'norah mitzidah haechad vsh'loshah k'ney m'norah mitzidah hasheniy
translation: Six branches shall issue from its sides; three branches from one side of the lampstand and three branches from the other side of the lampstand.

hebrew: שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה גְ֠בִעִים מְֽשֻׁקָּדִ֞ים בַּקָּנֶ֣ה הָאֶחָד֮ כַּפְתֹּ֣ר וָפֶרַח֒ וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה גְבִעִ֗ים מְשֻׁקָּדִ֛ים בַּקָּנֶ֥ה הָאֶחָ֖ד כַּפְתֹּ֣ר וָפָ֑רַח כֵּ֚ן לְשֵׁ֣שֶׁת הַקָּנִ֔ים הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מִן־הַמְּנֹרָֽה׃
transliteration: sh'loshah g'vi'iym m'shukadiym bakaneh haechad kaf'tor vaferach vsh'loshah g'vi'iym m'shukadiym bakaneh haechad kaf'tor vafarach ken l'sheshet hakaniym hayotz'iym min-ham'norah
translation: On one branch there shall be three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals, and on the next branch there shall be three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals; so for all six branches issuing from the lampstand.

hebrew: וּבַמְּנֹרָ֖ה אַרְבָּעָ֣ה גְבִעִ֑ים מְשֻׁקָּדִ֔ים כַּפְתֹּרֶ֖יהָ וּפְרָחֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vvam'norah ar'ba'ah g'vi'iym m'shukadiym kaf'toreyha vf'racheyha
translation: And on the lampstand itself there shall be four cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals:

hebrew: וְכַפְתֹּ֡ר תַּחַת֩ שְׁנֵ֨י הַקָּנִ֜ים מִמֶּ֗נָּה וְכַפְתֹּר֙ תַּ֣חַת שְׁנֵ֤י הַקָּנִים֙ מִמֶּ֔נָּה וְכַפְתֹּ֕ר תַּחַת־שְׁנֵ֥י הַקָּנִ֖ים מִמֶּ֑נָּה לְשֵׁ֙שֶׁת֙ הַקָּנִ֔ים הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מִן־הַמְּנֹרָֽה׃
transliteration: v'khaf'tor tachat sh'ney hakaniym mimenah v'khaf'tor tachat sh'ney hakaniym mimenah v'khaf'tor tachat-sh'ney hakaniym mimenah l'sheshet hakaniym hayotz'iym min-ham'norah
translation: a calyx, of one piece with it, under a pair of branches; and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the second pair of branches, and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the last pair of branches; so for all six branches issuing from the lampstand.

hebrew: כַּפְתֹּרֵיהֶ֥ם וּקְנֹתָ֖ם מִמֶּ֣נָּה יִהְי֑וּ כֻּלָּ֛הּ מִקְשָׁ֥ה אַחַ֖ת זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
transliteration: kaf'toreyhem vk'notam mimenah yih'yv kulah mik'shah achat zahav tahvor
translation: Their calyxes and their stems shall be of one piece with it, the whole of it a single hammered piece of pure gold.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־נֵרֹתֶ֖יהָ שִׁבְעָ֑ה וְהֶֽעֱלָה֙ אֶת־נֵ֣רֹתֶ֔יהָ וְהֵאִ֖יר עַל־עֵ֥בֶר פָּנֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: v'asiyta et-neroteyha shiv'ah v'he'elah et-neroteyha v'heiyr 'al-'ever paneyha
translation: Make its seven lamps—the lamps shall be so mounted as to give the light on its front side—

hebrew: וּמַלְקָחֶ֥יהָ וּמַחְתֹּתֶ֖יהָ זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vmal'kacheyha vmach'toteyha zahav tahvor
translation: and its tongs and fire pans of pure gold.

hebrew: כִּכָּ֛ר זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹתָ֑הּ אֵ֥ת כָּל־הַכֵּלִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: kikar zahav tahvor ya'aseh otah et kal-hakeliym haeleh
translation: It shall be made, with all these furnishings, out of a talent of pure gold.

hebrew: וּרְאֵ֖ה וַעֲשֵׂ֑ה בְּתַ֨בְנִיתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה מָרְאֶ֖ה בָּהָֽר׃ (ס)
transliteration: vr'eh va'aseh b'tav'niytam asher-atah mar'eh bahar (s)
translation: Note well, and follow the patterns for them that are being shown you on the mountain.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֥ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה עֶ֣שֶׂר יְרִיעֹ֑ת שֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֗ר וּתְכֵ֤לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י כְּרֻבִ֛ים מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֖ב תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'et-hamish'kan ta'aseh 'eser y'riy'ot shesh mash'zar vt'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tola'at shaniy k'ruviym ma'aseh choshev ta'aseh otam
translation: As for the tabernacle,aHere the lowest of the covers of the Tabernacle. make it of ten strips of cloth; make these of fine twisted linen, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, with a design of cherubim worked into them.

hebrew: אֹ֣רֶךְ ׀ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָֽאַחַ֗ת שְׁמֹנֶ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֙חַב֙ אַרְבַּ֣ע בָּאַמָּ֔ה הַיְרִיעָ֖ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֥ה אַחַ֖ת לְכָל־הַיְרִיעֹֽת׃
transliteration: orekh'  hay'riy'ah haachat sh'moneh v'es'riym baamah v'rochav ar'ba' baamah hay'riy'ah haechat midah achat l'khal-hay'riy'ot
translation: The length of each cloth shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each cloth shall be four cubits, all the cloths to have the same measurements.

hebrew: חֲמֵ֣שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֗ת תִּֽהְיֶ֙יןָ֙ חֹֽבְרֹ֔ת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָ֑הּ וְחָמֵ֤שׁ יְרִיעֹת֙ חֹֽבְרֹ֔ת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: chamesh hay'riy'ot tih'yeyna chov'rot ishah el-achotah v'chamesh y'riy'ot chov'rot ishah el-achotah
translation: Five of the cloths shall be joined to one another, and the other five cloths shall be joined to one another.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ לֻֽלְאֹ֣ת תְּכֵ֗לֶת עַ֣ל שְׂפַ֤ת הַיְרִיעָה֙ הָאֶחָ֔ת מִקָּצָ֖ה בַּחֹבָ֑רֶת וְכֵ֤ן תַּעֲשֶׂה֙ בִּשְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַקִּ֣יצוֹנָ֔ה בַּמַּחְבֶּ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
transliteration: v'asiyta lul'ot t'khelet 'al s'fat hay'riy'ah haechat mikatzah bachovaret v'khen ta'aseh bis'fat hay'riy'ah hakiytzvonah bamach'beret hasheniyt
translation: Make loops of blue wool on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set; and do likewise on the edge of the outermost cloth of the other set:

hebrew: חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻֽלָאֹ֗ת תַּעֲשֶׂה֮ בַּיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאֶחָת֒ וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻֽלָאֹ֗ת תַּעֲשֶׂה֙ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הַיְרִיעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בַּמַּחְבֶּ֣רֶת הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית מַקְבִּילֹת֙ הַלֻּ֣לָאֹ֔ת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: chamishiym lulaot ta'aseh bay'riy'ah haechat vachamishiym lulaot ta'aseh bik'tzeh hay'riy'ah asher bamach'beret hasheniyt mak'biylot halulaot ishah el-achotah
translation: make fifty loops on the one cloth, and fifty loops on the edge of the end cloth of the other set, the loops to be opposite one another.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים קַרְסֵ֣י זָהָ֑ב וְחִבַּרְתָּ֨ אֶת־הַיְרִיעֹ֜ת אִשָּׁ֤ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָהּ֙ בַּקְּרָסִ֔ים וְהָיָ֥ה הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן אֶחָֽד׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'asiyta chamishiym kar'sey zahav v'chibar'ta et-hay'riy'ot ishah el-achotah bak'rasiym v'hayah hamish'kan echad (f)
translation: And make fifty gold clasps, and couple the cloths to one another with the clasps, so that the tabernacle becomes one whole.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ יְרִיעֹ֣ת עִזִּ֔ים לְאֹ֖הֶל עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עַשְׁתֵּי־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה יְרִיעֹ֖ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'asiyta y'riy'ot 'iziym l'ohel 'al-hamish'kan 'ash'tey-'es'reh y'riy'ot ta'aseh otam
translation: You shall then make cloths of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle; make the cloths eleven in number.

hebrew: אֹ֣רֶךְ ׀ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָֽאַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֙חַב֙ אַרְבַּ֣ע בָּאַמָּ֔ה הַיְרִיעָ֖ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֣ה אַחַ֔ת לְעַשְׁתֵּ֥י עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה יְרִיעֹֽת׃
transliteration: orekh'  hay'riy'ah haachat sh'loshiym baamah v'rochav ar'ba' baamah hay'riy'ah haechat midah achat l'ash'tey 'es'reh y'riy'ot
translation: The length of each cloth shall be thirty cubits, and the width of each cloth shall be four cubits, the eleven cloths to have the same measurements.

hebrew: וְחִבַּרְתָּ֞ אֶת־חֲמֵ֤שׁ הַיְרִיעֹת֙ לְבָ֔ד וְאֶת־שֵׁ֥שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֖ת לְבָ֑ד וְכָפַלְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הַשִּׁשִּׁ֔ית אֶל־מ֖וּל פְּנֵ֥י הָאֹֽהֶל׃
transliteration: v'chibar'ta et-chamesh hay'riy'ot l'vad v'et-shesh hay'riy'ot l'vad v'khafal'ta et-hay'riy'ah hashishiyt el-mvl p'ney haohel
translation: Join five of the cloths by themselves, and the other six cloths by themselves; and fold over the sixth cloth at the front of the tent.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻֽלָאֹ֗ת עַ֣ל שְׂפַ֤ת הַיְרִיעָה֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת הַקִּיצֹנָ֖ה בַּחֹבָ֑רֶת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻֽלָאֹ֗ת עַ֚ל שְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַחֹבֶ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
transliteration: v'asiyta chamishiym lulaot 'al s'fat hay'riy'ah haechat hakiytzonah bachovaret vachamishiym lulaot 'al s'fat hay'riy'ah hachoveret hasheniyt
translation: Make fifty loops on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set, and fifty loops on the edge of the cloth of the other set.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֛יתָ קַרְסֵ֥י נְחֹ֖שֶׁת חֲמִשִּׁ֑ים וְהֵבֵאתָ֤ אֶת־הַקְּרָסִים֙ בַּלֻּ֣לָאֹ֔ת וְחִבַּרְתָּ֥ אֶת־הָאֹ֖הֶל וְהָיָ֥ה אֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: v'asiyta kar'sey n'choshet chamishiym v'heveta et-hak'rasiym balulaot v'chibar'ta et-haohel v'hayah echad
translation: Make fifty copper clasps, and fit the clasps into the loops, and couple the tent together so that it becomes one whole.

hebrew: וְסֶ֙רַח֙ הָעֹדֵ֔ף בִּירִיעֹ֖ת הָאֹ֑הֶל חֲצִ֤י הַיְרִיעָה֙ הָעֹדֶ֔פֶת תִּסְרַ֕ח עַ֖ל אֲחֹרֵ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
transliteration: v'serach ha'odef biyriy'ot haohel chatziy hay'riy'ah ha'odefet tis'rach 'al achorey hamish'kan
translation: As for the overlapping excess of the cloths of the tent, the extra half-cloth shall overlap the back of the tabernacle,

hebrew: וְהָאַמָּ֨ה מִזֶּ֜ה וְהָאַמָּ֤ה מִזֶּה֙ בָּעֹדֵ֔ף בְּאֹ֖רֶךְ יְרִיעֹ֣ת הָאֹ֑הֶל יִהְיֶ֨ה סָר֜וּחַ עַל־צִדֵּ֧י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן מִזֶּ֥ה וּמִזֶּ֖ה לְכַסֹּתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'haamah mizeh v'haamah mizeh ba'odef b'orekh' y'riy'ot haohel yih'yeh sarvcha 'al-tzidey hamish'kan mizeh vmizeh l'khasotvo
translation: while the extra cubit at either end of each length of tent cloth shall hang down to the bottom of the two sides of the Tabernacle and cover it.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ מִכְסֶה֙ לָאֹ֔הֶל עֹרֹ֥ת אֵילִ֖ם מְאָדָּמִ֑ים וּמִכְסֵ֛ה עֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'asiyta mikh'seh laohel 'orot eylim m'adamiym vmikh'seh 'orot t'chashiym mil'ma'lah (f)
translation: And make for the tent a covering of tanned ram skins, and a covering of dolphin skins above.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֖ים עֹמְדִֽים׃
transliteration: v'asiyta et-hak'rashiym lamish'kan 'atzey shitiym 'om'diym
translation: You shall make the planks for the Tabernacle of acacia wood, upright.

hebrew: עֶ֥שֶׂר אַמּ֖וֹת אֹ֣רֶךְ הַקָּ֑רֶשׁ וְאַמָּה֙ וַחֲצִ֣י הָֽאַמָּ֔ה רֹ֖חַב הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: 'eser amvot orekh' hakaresh v'amah vachatziy haamah rochav hakeresh haechad
translation: The length of each plank shall be ten cubits and the width of each plank a cubit and a half.

hebrew: שְׁתֵּ֣י יָד֗וֹת לַקֶּ֙רֶשׁ֙ הָאֶחָ֔ד מְשֻׁלָּבֹ֔ת אִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָ֑הּ כֵּ֣ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל קַרְשֵׁ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
transliteration: sh'tey yadvot lakeresh haechad m'shulavot ishah el-achotah ken ta'aseh l'khol kar'shey hamish'kan
translation: Each plank shall have two tenons, parallelbMeaning of Heb. meshullaboth uncertain. to each other; do the same with all the planks of the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֶשְׂרִ֣ים קֶ֔רֶשׁ לִפְאַ֖ת נֶ֥גְבָּה תֵימָֽנָה׃
transliteration: v'asiyta et-hak'rashiym lamish'kan 'es'riym keresh lif'at neg'bah teymanah
translation: Of the planks of the Tabernacle, make twenty planks on the southcHeb. uses two terms for “south.” side:
