hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אַדְנֵי־כֶ֔סֶף תַּעֲשֶׂ֕ה תַּ֖חַת עֶשְׂרִ֣ים הַקָּ֑רֶשׁ שְׁנֵ֨י אֲדָנִ֜ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֤רֶשׁ הָאֶחָד֙ לִשְׁתֵּ֣י יְדֹתָ֔יו וּשְׁנֵ֧י אֲדָנִ֛ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֖ד לִשְׁתֵּ֥י יְדֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'ar'ba'iym ad'ney-khesef ta'aseh tachat 'es'riym hakaresh sh'ney adaniym tachat-hakeresh haechad lish'tey y'dotayv vsh'ney adaniym tachat-hakeresh haechad lish'tey y'dotayv
translation: making forty silver sockets under the twenty planks, two sockets under the one plank for its two tenons and two sockets under each following plank for its two tenons;

hebrew: וּלְצֶ֧לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית לִפְאַ֣ת צָפ֑וֹן עֶשְׂרִ֖ים קָֽרֶשׁ׃
transliteration: vl'tzela' hamish'kan hasheniyt lif'at tzafvon 'es'riym karesh
translation: and for the other side wall of the Tabernacle, on the north side, twenty planks,

hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים אַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֗ים תַּ֚חַת הַקֶּ֣רֶשׁ הָֽאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: v'ar'ba'iym ad'neyhem kasef sh'ney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad vsh'ney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad
translation: with their forty silver sockets, two sockets under the one plank and two sockets under each following plank.

hebrew: וּֽלְיַרְכְּתֵ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יָ֑מָּה תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה שִׁשָּׁ֥ה קְרָשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: vl'yar'k'tey hamish'kan yamah ta'aseh shishah k'rashiym
translation: And for the rear of the Tabernacle, to the west, make six planks;

hebrew: וּשְׁנֵ֤י קְרָשִׁים֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה לִמְקֻצְעֹ֖ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן בַּיַּרְכָתָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vsh'ney k'rashiym ta'aseh lim'kutz'ot hamish'kan bayar'khatayim
translation: and make two planks for the corners of the Tabernacle at the rear.

hebrew: וְיִֽהְי֣וּ תֹֽאֲמִים֮ מִלְּמַטָּה֒ וְיַחְדָּ֗ו יִהְי֤וּ תַמִּים֙ עַל־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ אֶל־הַטַּבַּ֖עַת הָאֶחָ֑ת כֵּ֚ן יִהְיֶ֣ה לִשְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם לִשְׁנֵ֥י הַמִּקְצֹעֹ֖ת יִהְיֽוּ׃
transliteration: v'yih'yv toamiym mil'matah v'yach'dav yih'yv tamiym 'al-roshvo el-hataba'at haechat ken yih'yeh lish'neyhem lish'ney hamik'tzo'ot yih'yv
translation: dMeaning of Heb. uncertain.They shall match at the bottom, and terminate alike at the top inside one ring;-d thus shall it be with both of them: they shall form the two corners.

hebrew: וְהָיוּ֙ שְׁמֹנָ֣ה קְרָשִׁ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אֲדָנִ֑ים שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֗ים תַּ֚חַת הַקֶּ֣רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: v'hayv sh'monah k'rashiym v'ad'neyhem kesef shishah 'asar adaniym sh'ney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad vsh'ney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad
translation: Thus there shall be eight planks with their sockets of silver: sixteen sockets, two sockets under the first plank, and two sockets under each of the other planks.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ בְרִיחִ֖ם עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חֲמִשָּׁ֕ה לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: v'asiyta v'riychim 'atzey shitiym chamishah l'kar'shey tzela'-hamish'kan haechad
translation: You shall make bars of acacia wood: five for the planks of the one side wall of the Tabernacle,

hebrew: וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בְרִיחִ֔ם לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בְרִיחִ֗ם לְקַרְשֵׁי֙ צֶ֣לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן לַיַּרְכָתַ֖יִם יָֽמָּה׃
transliteration: vachamishah v'riychim l'kar'shey tzela'-hamish'kan hasheniyt vachamishah v'riychim l'kar'shey tzela' hamish'kan layar'khatayim yamah
translation: five bars for the planks of the other side wall of the Tabernacle, and five bars for the planks of the wall of the Tabernacle at the rear to the west.

hebrew: וְהַבְּרִ֥יחַ הַתִּיכֹ֖ן בְּת֣וֹךְ הַקְּרָשִׁ֑ים מַבְרִ֕חַ מִן־הַקָּצֶ֖ה אֶל־הַקָּצֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'hab'riycha hatiykhon b'tvokh' hak'rashiym mav'richa min-hakatzeh el-hakatzeh
translation: The center bar halfway up the planks shall run from end to end.

hebrew: וְֽאֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֞ים תְּצַפֶּ֣ה זָהָ֗ב וְאֶת־טַבְּעֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה זָהָ֔ב בָּתִּ֖ים לַבְּרִיחִ֑ם וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֶת־הַבְּרִיחִ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
transliteration: v'et-hak'rashiym t'tzapeh zahav v'et-tab'oteyhem ta'aseh zahav batiym lab'riychim v'tzipiyta et-hab'riychim zahav
translation: Overlay the planks with gold, and make their rings of gold, as holders for the bars; and overlay the bars with gold.

hebrew: וַהֲקֵמֹתָ֖ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן כְּמִ֨שְׁפָּט֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָרְאֵ֖יתָ בָּהָֽר׃ (ס)
transliteration: vahakemota et-hamish'kan k'mish'patvo asher har'eyta bahar (s)
translation: Then set up the Tabernacle according to the manner of it that you were shown on the mountain.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ פָרֹ֗כֶת תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֛ב יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָ֖הּ כְּרֻבִֽים׃
transliteration: v'asiyta farokhet t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh mash'zar ma'aseh choshev ya'aseh otah k'ruviym
translation: You shall make a curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen; it shall have a design of cherubim worked into it.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֹתָ֗הּ עַל־אַרְבָּעָה֙ עַמּוּדֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים מְצֻפִּ֣ים זָהָ֔ב וָוֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב עַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה אַדְנֵי־כָֽסֶף׃
transliteration: v'natatah otah 'al-ar'ba'ah 'amvdey shitiym m'tzupiym zahav vaveyhem zahav 'al-ar'ba'ah ad'ney-khasef
translation: Hang it upon four posts of acacia wood overlaid with gold and having hooks of gold, [set] in four sockets of silver.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֶת־הַפָּרֹכֶת֮ תַּ֣חַת הַקְּרָסִים֒ וְהֵבֵאתָ֥ שָׁ֙מָּה֙ מִבֵּ֣ית לַפָּרֹ֔כֶת אֵ֖ת אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵד֑וּת וְהִבְדִּילָ֤ה הַפָּרֹ֙כֶת֙ לָכֶ֔ם בֵּ֣ין הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וּבֵ֖ין קֹ֥דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: v'natatah et-haparokhet tachat hak'rasiym v'heveta shamah mibeyt laparokhet et arvon ha'edvt v'hiv'diylah haparokhet lakhem beyn hakodesh vveyn kodesh hakodashiym
translation: Hang the curtain under the clasps, and carry the Ark of the Pact there, behind the curtain, so that the curtain shall serve you as a partition between the Holy and the Holy of Holies.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֙ אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת עַ֖ל אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵדֻ֑ת בְּקֹ֖דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: v'natata et-hakaporet 'al arvon ha'edut b'kodesh hakodashiym
translation: Place the cover upon the Ark of the Pact in the Holy of Holies.

hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֤ אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ מִח֣וּץ לַפָּרֹ֔כֶת וְאֶת־הַמְּנֹרָה֙ נֹ֣כַח הַשֻּׁלְחָ֔ן עַ֛ל צֶ֥לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן תֵּימָ֑נָה וְהַ֨שֻּׁלְחָ֔ן תִּתֵּ֖ן עַל־צֶ֥לַע צָפֽוֹן׃
transliteration: v'sam'ta et-hashul'chan michvtz laparokhet v'et-ham'norah nokhach hashul'chan 'al tzela' hamish'kan teymanah v'hashul'chan titen 'al-tzela' tzafvon
translation: Place the table outside the curtain, and the lampstand by the south wall of the Tabernacle opposite the table, which is to be placed by the north wall.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ מָסָךְ֙ לְפֶ֣תַח הָאֹ֔הֶל תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֹקֵֽם׃
transliteration: v'asiyta masakh' l'fetach haohel t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh mash'zar ma'aseh rokem
translation: You shall make a screen for the entrance of the Tent, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ לַמָּסָ֗ךְ חֲמִשָּׁה֙ עַמּוּדֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וְצִפִּיתָ֤ אֹתָם֙ זָהָ֔ב וָוֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וְיָצַקְתָּ֣ לָהֶ֔ם חֲמִשָּׁ֖ה אַדְנֵ֥י נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'asiyta lamasakh' chamishah 'amvdey shitiym v'tzipiyta otam zahav vaveyhem zahav v'yatzak'ta lahem chamishah ad'ney n'choshet (s)
translation: Make five posts of acacia wood for the screen and overlay them with gold—their hooks being of gold—and cast for them five sockets of copper.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חָמֵשׁ֩ אַמּ֨וֹת אֹ֜רֶךְ וְחָמֵ֧שׁ אַמּ֣וֹת רֹ֗חַב רָב֤וּעַ יִהְיֶה֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְשָׁלֹ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'asiyta et-hamiz'becha 'atzey shitiym chamesh amvot orekh' v'chamesh amvot rochav ravv'a yih'yeh hamiz'becha v'shalosh amvot komatvo
translation: You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide—the altar is to be square—and three cubits high.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ קַרְנֹתָ֗יו עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פִּנֹּתָ֔יו מִמֶּ֖נּוּ תִּהְיֶ֣יןָ קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹת֖וֹ נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: v'asiyta kar'notayv 'al ar'ba' pinotayv mimenv tih'yeyna kar'notayv v'tzipiyta otvo n'choshet
translation: Make its horns on the four corners, the horns to be of one piece with it; and overlay it with copper.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ סִּֽירֹתָיו֙ לְדַשְּׁנ֔וֹ וְיָעָיו֙ וּמִזְרְקֹתָ֔יו וּמִזְלְגֹתָ֖יו וּמַחְתֹּתָ֑יו לְכָל־כֵּלָ֖יו תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: v'asiyta siyrotayv l'dash'nvo v'ya'ayv vmiz'r'kotayv vmiz'l'gotayv vmach'totayv l'khal-kelayv ta'aseh n'choshet
translation: Make the pails for removing its ashes, as well as its scrapers, basins, flesh hooks, and fire pans—make all its utensils of copper.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ לּוֹ֙ מִכְבָּ֔ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֶ֣שֶׁת נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ עַל־הָרֶ֗שֶׁת אַרְבַּע֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת נְחֹ֔שֶׁת עַ֖ל אַרְבַּ֥ע קְצוֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'asiyta lvo mikh'bar ma'aseh reshet n'choshet v'asiyta 'al-hareshet ar'ba' tab'ot n'choshet 'al ar'ba' k'tzvotayv
translation: Make for it a grating of meshwork in copper; and on the mesh make four copper rings at its four corners.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֹתָ֗הּ תַּ֛חַת כַּרְכֹּ֥ב הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ מִלְּמָ֑טָּה וְהָיְתָ֣ה הָרֶ֔שֶׁת עַ֖ד חֲצִ֥י הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'natatah otah tachat kar'kov hamiz'becha mil'matah v'hay'tah hareshet 'ad chatziy hamiz'becha
translation: Set the mesh below, under the ledge of the altar, so that it extends to the middle of the altar.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ בַדִּים֙ לַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ בַּדֵּ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: v'asiyta vadiym lamiz'becha badey 'atzey shitiym v'tzipiyta otam n'choshet
translation: And make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with copper.

hebrew: וְהוּבָ֥א אֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו בַּטַּבָּעֹ֑ת וְהָי֣וּ הַבַּדִּ֗ים עַל־שְׁתֵּ֛י צַלְעֹ֥ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ בִּשְׂאֵ֥ת אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'hvva et-badayv bataba'ot v'hayv habadiym 'al-sh'tey tzal'ot hamiz'becha bis'et otvo
translation: The poles shall be inserted into the rings, so that the poles remain on the two sides of the altar when it is carried.

hebrew: נְב֥וּב לֻחֹ֖ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹת֑וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶרְאָ֥ה אֹתְךָ֛ בָּהָ֖ר כֵּ֥ן יַעֲשֽׂוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: n'vvv luchot ta'aseh otvo kaasher her'ah ot'kha bahar ken ya'asv (s)
translation: Make it hollow, of boards. As you were shown on the mountain, so shall they be made.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ אֵ֖ת חֲצַ֣ר הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן לִפְאַ֣ת נֶֽגֶב־תֵּ֠ימָנָה קְלָעִ֨ים לֶחָצֵ֜ר שֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֗ר מֵאָ֤ה בָֽאַמָּה֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ לַפֵּאָ֖ה הָאֶחָֽת׃
transliteration: v'asiyta et chatzar hamish'kan lif'at negev-teymanah k'la'iym lechatzer shesh mash'zar meah vaamah orekh' lapeah haechat
translation:
You shall make the enclosure of the Tabernacle:
On the south side,aCf. note at 26.18. a hundred cubits of hangings of fine twisted linen for the length of the enclosure on that side—

hebrew: וְעַמֻּדָ֣יו עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם עֶשְׂרִ֖ים נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
transliteration: v'amudayv 'es'riym v'ad'neyhem 'es'riym n'choshet vavey ha'amudiym vachashukeyhem kasef
translation: with its twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts to be of silver.

hebrew: וְכֵ֨ן לִפְאַ֤ת צָפוֹן֙ בָּאֹ֔רֶךְ קְלָעִ֖ים מֵ֣אָה אֹ֑רֶךְ ועמדו [וְעַמּוּדָ֣יו] עֶשְׂרִ֗ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֤ם עֶשְׂרִים֙ נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָֽעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
transliteration: v'khen lif'at tzafvon baorekh' k'la'iym meah orekh' v'mdv [v'amvdayv] 'es'riym v'ad'neyhem 'es'riym n'choshet vavey ha'amudiym vachashukeyhem kasef
translation: Again a hundred cubits of hangings for its length along the north side—with its twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts to be of silver.

hebrew: וְרֹ֤חַב הֶֽחָצֵר֙ לִפְאַת־יָ֔ם קְלָעִ֖ים חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אַמָּ֑ה עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם עֲשָׂרָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם עֲשָׂרָֽה׃
transliteration: v'rochav hechatzer lif'at-yam k'la'iym chamishiym amah 'amudeyhem 'asarah v'ad'neyhem 'asarah
translation: For the width of the enclosure, on the west side, fifty cubits of hangings, with their ten posts and their ten sockets.

hebrew: וְרֹ֣חַב הֶֽחָצֵ֗ר לִפְאַ֛ת קֵ֥דְמָה מִזְרָ֖חָה חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אַמָּֽה׃
transliteration: v'rochav hechatzer lif'at ked'mah miz'rachah chamishiym amah
translation: For the width of the enclosure on the front, or east side, fifty cubits:

hebrew: וַחֲמֵ֨שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה אַמָּ֛ה קְלָעִ֖ים לַכָּתֵ֑ף עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
transliteration: vachamesh 'es'reh amah k'la'iym lakatef 'amudeyhem sh'loshah v'ad'neyhem sh'loshah
translation: fifteen cubits of hangings on the one flank, with their three posts and their three sockets;

hebrew: וְלַכָּתֵף֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔ית חְמֵ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה קְלָעִ֑ים עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'lakatef hasheniyt ch'mesh 'es'reh k'la'iym 'amudeyhem sh'loshah v'ad'neyhem sh'loshah
translation: fifteen cubits of hangings on the other flank, with their three posts and their three sockets;

hebrew: וּלְשַׁ֨עַר הֶֽחָצֵ֜ר מָסָ֣ךְ ׀ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים אַמָּ֗ה תְּכֵ֨לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֜ן וְתוֹלַ֧עַת שָׁנִ֛י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מָשְׁזָ֖ר מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֑ם עַמֻּֽדֵיהֶם֙ אַרְבָּעָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם אַרְבָּעָֽה׃
transliteration: vl'sha'ar hechatzer masakh'  'es'riym amah t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh mash'zar ma'aseh rokem 'amudeyhem ar'ba'ah v'ad'neyhem ar'ba'ah
translation: and for the gate of the enclosure, a screen of twenty cubits, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery, with their four posts and their four sockets.

hebrew: כָּל־עַמּוּדֵ֨י הֶֽחָצֵ֤ר סָבִיב֙ מְחֻשָּׁקִ֣ים כֶּ֔סֶף וָוֵיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: kal-'amvdey hechatzer saviyv m'chushakiym kesef vaveyhem kasef v'ad'neyhem n'choshet
translation: All the posts round the enclosure shall be banded with silver and their hooks shall be of silver; their sockets shall be of copper.

hebrew: אֹ֣רֶךְ הֶֽחָצֵר֩ מֵאָ֨ה בָֽאַמָּ֜ה וְרֹ֣חַב ׀ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים בַּחֲמִשִּׁ֗ים וְקֹמָ֛ה חָמֵ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת שֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֑ר וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: orekh' hechatzer meah vaamah v'rochav  chamishiym bachamishiym v'komah chamesh amvot shesh mash'zar v'ad'neyhem n'choshet
translation: The length of the enclosure shall be a hundred cubits, and the width fifty throughout; and the height five cubits—[with hangings] of fine twisted linen. The sockets shall be of copper:

hebrew: לְכֹל֙ כְּלֵ֣י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן בְּכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָת֑וֹ וְכָל־יְתֵדֹתָ֛יו וְכָל־יִתְדֹ֥ת הֶחָצֵ֖ר נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ (ס)
transliteration: l'khol k'ley hamish'kan b'khol 'avodatvo v'khal-y'tedotayv v'khal-yit'dot hechatzer n'choshet (s)
translation: all the utensils of the Tabernacle,bI.e., of the Tabernacle enclosure; the furnishings inside were of gold. for all its service, as well as all its pegs and all the pegs of the court, shall be of copper.

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה תְּצַוֶּ֣ה ׀ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְיִקְח֨וּ אֵלֶ֜יךָ שֶׁ֣מֶן זַ֥יִת זָ֛ךְ כָּתִ֖ית לַמָּא֑וֹר לְהַעֲלֹ֥ת נֵ֖ר תָּמִֽיד׃
transliteration: v'atah t'tzaveh  et-b'ney yis'rael v'yik'chv eleykha shemen zayit zakh' katiyt lamavor l'ha'alot ner tamiyd
translation: You shall further instruct the Israelites to bring you clear oil of beaten olives for lighting, for kindling lamps regularly.

hebrew: בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵד֩ מִח֨וּץ לַפָּרֹ֜כֶת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָעֵדֻ֗ת יַעֲרֹךְ֩ אֹת֨וֹ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו מֵעֶ֥רֶב עַד־בֹּ֖קֶר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹ֣רֹתָ֔ם מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (ס)
transliteration: b'ohel mvo'ed michvtz laparokhet asher 'al-ha'edut ya'arokh' otvo aharon vvanayv me'erev 'ad-boker lif'ney y'hvah chukat 'volam l'dorotam meet b'ney yis'rael (s)
translation: Aaron and his sons shall set them up in the Tent of Meeting, outside the curtain which is over [the Ark of] the Pact, [to burn] from evening to morning before the L<small>ORD</small>. It shall be a due from the Israelites for all time, throughout the ages.

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֡ה הַקְרֵ֣ב אֵלֶיךָ֩ אֶת־אַהֲרֹ֨ן אָחִ֜יךָ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֣יו אִתּ֔וֹ מִתּ֛וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִ֑י אַהֲרֹ֕ן נָדָ֧ב וַאֲבִיה֛וּא אֶלְעָזָ֥ר וְאִיתָמָ֖ר בְּנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹֽן׃
transliteration: v'atah hak'rev eleykha et-aharon achiykha v'et-banayv itvo mitvokh' b'ney yis'rael l'khahanvo-liy aharon nadav vaaviyhv el'azar v'iytamar b'ney aharon
translation: You shall bring forward your brother Aaron, with his sons, from among the Israelites, to serve Me as priests: Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ בִגְדֵי־קֹ֖דֶשׁ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן אָחִ֑יךָ לְכָב֖וֹד וּלְתִפְאָֽרֶת׃
transliteration: v'asiyta vig'dey-kodesh l'aharon achiykha l'khavvod vl'tif'aret
translation: Make sacral vestments for your brother Aaron, for dignity and adornment.

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֗ה תְּדַבֵּר֙ אֶל־כָּל־חַכְמֵי־לֵ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִלֵּאתִ֖יו ר֣וּחַ חָכְמָ֑ה וְעָשׂ֞וּ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֧י אַהֲרֹ֛ן לְקַדְּשׁ֖וֹ לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִֽי׃
transliteration: v'atah t'daber el-kal-chakh'mey-lev asher miletiyv rvcha chakh'mah v'asv et-big'dey aharon l'kad'shvo l'khahanvo-liy
translation: Next you shall instruct all who are aLit. “wise of heart, whom I have filled with a spirit of wisdom.”skillful, whom I have endowed with the gift of skill,-a to make Aaron’s vestments, for consecrating him to serve Me as priest.

hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה הַבְּגָדִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַעֲשׂ֗וּ חֹ֤שֶׁן וְאֵפוֹד֙ וּמְעִ֔יל וּכְתֹ֥נֶת תַּשְׁבֵּ֖ץ מִצְנֶ֣פֶת וְאַבְנֵ֑ט וְעָשׂ֨וּ בִגְדֵי־קֹ֜דֶשׁ לְאַהֲרֹ֥ן אָחִ֛יךָ וּלְבָנָ֖יו לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִֽי׃
transliteration: v'eleh hab'gadiym asher ya'asv choshen v'efvod vm'iyl vkh'tonet tash'betz mitz'nefet v'av'net v'asv vig'dey-kodesh l'aharon achiykha vl'vanayv l'khahanvo-liy
translation: These are the vestments they are to make: a breastpiece, an ephod, a robe, a fringedbOthers “checkered.” tunic, a headdress, and a sash. They shall make those sacral vestments for your brother Aaron and his sons, for priestly service to Me;

hebrew: וְהֵם֙ יִקְח֣וּ אֶת־הַזָּהָ֔ב וְאֶת־הַתְּכֵ֖לֶת וְאֶת־הָֽאַרְגָּמָ֑ן וְאֶת־תּוֹלַ֥עַת הַשָּׁנִ֖י וְאֶת־הַשֵּֽׁשׁ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hem yik'chv et-hazahav v'et-hat'khelet v'et-haar'gaman v'et-tvola'at hashaniy v'et-hashesh (f)
translation: they, therefore, shall receive the gold, the blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and the fine linen.

hebrew: וְעָשׂ֖וּ אֶת־הָאֵפֹ֑ד זָ֠הָב תְּכֵ֨לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֜ן תּוֹלַ֧עַת שָׁנִ֛י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מָשְׁזָ֖ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵֽׁב׃
transliteration: v'asv et-haefod zahav t'khelet v'ar'gaman tvola'at shaniy v'shesh mash'zar ma'aseh choshev
translation: They shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen, worked into designs.

hebrew: שְׁתֵּ֧י כְתֵפֹ֣ת חֹֽבְרֹ֗ת יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֛וֹ אֶל־שְׁנֵ֥י קְצוֹתָ֖יו וְחֻבָּֽר׃
transliteration: sh'tey kh'tefot chov'rot yih'yeh-lvo el-sh'ney k'tzvotayv v'chubar
translation: It shall have two shoulder-pieces attached; they shall be attached at its two ends.

hebrew: וְחֵ֤שֶׁב אֲפֻדָּתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֔יו כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֖הוּ מִמֶּ֣נּוּ יִהְיֶ֑ה זָהָ֗ב תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מָשְׁזָֽר׃
transliteration: v'cheshev afudatvo asher 'alayv k'ma'asehv mimenv yih'yeh zahav t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh mash'zar
translation: And the decorated band that is upon it shall be made like it, of one piece with it: of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.

hebrew: וְלָ֣קַחְתָּ֔ אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֖י אַבְנֵי־שֹׁ֑הַם וּפִתַּחְתָּ֣ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם שְׁמ֖וֹת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta et-sh'tey av'ney-shoham vfitach'ta 'aleyhem sh'mvot b'ney yis'rael
translation: Then take two lazuli stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel:

hebrew: שִׁשָּׁה֙ מִשְּׁמֹתָ֔ם עַ֖ל הָאֶ֣בֶן הָאֶחָ֑ת וְאֶת־שְׁמ֞וֹת הַשִּׁשָּׁ֧ה הַנּוֹתָרִ֛ים עַל־הָאֶ֥בֶן הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית כְּתוֹלְדֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: shishah mish'motam 'al haeven haechat v'et-sh'mvot hashishah hanvotariym 'al-haeven hasheniyt k'tvol'dotam
translation: six of their names on the one stone, and the names of the remaining six on the other stone, in the order of their birth.

hebrew: מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה חָרַשׁ֮ אֶבֶן֒ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חֹתָ֗ם תְּפַתַּח֙ אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י הָאֲבָנִ֔ים עַל־שְׁמֹ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מֻסַבֹּ֛ת מִשְׁבְּצ֥וֹת זָהָ֖ב תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: ma'aseh charash even pitvchey chotam t'fatach et-sh'tey haavaniym 'al-sh'mot b'ney yis'rael musabot mish'b'tzvot zahav ta'aseh otam
translation: On the two stones you shall make seal engravings—the work of a lapidary—of the names of the sons of Israel. Having bordered them with frames of gold,

hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֞ אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י הָאֲבָנִ֗ים עַ֚ל כִּתְפֹ֣ת הָֽאֵפֹ֔ד אַבְנֵ֥י זִכָּרֹ֖ן לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְנָשָׂא֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן אֶת־שְׁמוֹתָ֜ם לִפְנֵ֧י יְהוָ֛ה עַל־שְׁתֵּ֥י כְתֵפָ֖יו לְזִכָּרֹֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'sam'ta et-sh'tey haavaniym 'al kit'fot haefod av'ney zikaron liv'ney yis'rael v'nasa aharon et-sh'mvotam lif'ney y'hvah 'al-sh'tey kh'tefayv l'zikaron (s)
translation: attach the two stones to the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, as stones for remembrance of the Israelite people, whose names Aaron shall carry upon his two shoulder-pieces for remembrance before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מִשְׁבְּצֹ֖ת זָהָֽב׃
transliteration: v'asiyta mish'b'tzot zahav
translation: Then make frames of gold

hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּ֤י שַׁרְשְׁרֹת֙ זָהָ֣ב טָה֔וֹר מִגְבָּלֹ֛ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָ֖ם מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה עֲבֹ֑ת וְנָתַתָּ֛ה אֶת־שַׁרְשְׁרֹ֥ת הָעֲבֹתֹ֖ת עַל־הַֽמִּשְׁבְּצֹֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vsh'tey shar'sh'rot zahav tahvor mig'balot ta'aseh otam ma'aseh 'avot v'natatah et-shar'sh'rot ha'avotot 'al-hamish'b'tzot (s)
translation: and two chains of pure gold; braid these like corded work, and fasten the corded chains to the frames.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ חֹ֤שֶׁן מִשְׁפָּט֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה חֹשֵׁ֔ב כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה אֵפֹ֖ד תַּעֲשֶׂ֑נּוּ זָ֠הָב תְּכֵ֨לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֜ן וְתוֹלַ֧עַת שָׁנִ֛י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מָשְׁזָ֖ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'asiyta choshen mish'pat ma'aseh choshev k'ma'aseh efod ta'asenv zahav t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh mash'zar ta'aseh otvo
translation: You shall make a breastpiece of decision,cSee v. 30 below; others “judgment.” worked into a design; make it in the style of the ephod: make it of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.

hebrew: רָב֥וּעַ יִֽהְיֶ֖ה כָּפ֑וּל זֶ֥רֶת אָרְכּ֖וֹ וְזֶ֥רֶת רָחְבּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: ravv'a yih'yeh kafvl zeret ar'kvo v'zeret rach'bvo
translation: It shall be square and doubled, a span in length and a span in width.

hebrew: וּמִלֵּאתָ֥ בוֹ֙ מִלֻּ֣אַת אֶ֔בֶן אַרְבָּעָ֖ה טוּרִ֣ים אָ֑בֶן ט֗וּר אֹ֤דֶם פִּטְדָה֙ וּבָרֶ֔קֶת הַטּ֖וּר הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: vmileta vvo miluat even ar'ba'ah tvriym aven tvr odem pit'dah vvareket hatvr haechad
translation: Set in it mounted stones, in four rows of stones. The first row shall be a row of dThe identity of several of these twelve stones is uncertain.carnelian, chrysolite, and emerald;

hebrew: וְהַטּ֖וּר הַשֵּׁנִ֑י נֹ֥פֶךְ סַפִּ֖יר וְיָהֲלֹֽם׃
transliteration: v'hatvr hasheniy nofekh' sapiyr v'yahalom
translation: the second row: a turquoise, a sapphire, and an amethyst;

hebrew: וְהַטּ֖וּר הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י לֶ֥שֶׁם שְׁב֖וֹ וְאַחְלָֽמָה׃
transliteration: v'hatvr hash'liyshiy leshem sh'vvo v'ach'lamah
translation: the third row: a jacinth, an agate, and a crystal;

hebrew: וְהַטּוּר֙ הָרְבִיעִ֔י תַּרְשִׁ֥ישׁ וְשֹׁ֖הַם וְיָשְׁפֵ֑ה מְשֻׁבָּצִ֥ים זָהָ֛ב יִהְי֖וּ בְּמִלּוּאֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'hatvr har'viy'iy tar'shiysh v'shoham v'yash'feh m'shubatziym zahav yih'yv b'milvotam
translation: and the fourth row: a beryl, a lapis lazuli, and a jasper. They shall be framed with gold in their mountings.

hebrew: וְ֠הָאֲבָנִים תִּֽהְיֶ֜יןָ עַל־שְׁמֹ֧ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה עַל־שְׁמֹתָ֑ם פִּתּוּחֵ֤י חוֹתָם֙ אִ֣ישׁ עַל־שְׁמ֔וֹ תִּֽהְיֶ֕יןָ לִשְׁנֵ֥י עָשָׂ֖ר שָֽׁבֶט׃
transliteration: v'haavaniym tih'yeyna 'al-sh'mot b'ney-yis'rael sh'teym 'es'reh 'al-sh'motam pitvchey chvotam iysh 'al-sh'mvo tih'yeyna lish'ney 'asar shavet
translation: The stones shall correspond [in number] to the names of the sons of Israel: twelve, corresponding to their names. They shall be engraved like seals, each with its name, for the twelve tribes.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֧יתָ עַל־הַחֹ֛שֶׁן שַֽׁרְשֹׁ֥ת גַּבְלֻ֖ת מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה עֲבֹ֑ת זָהָ֖ב טָהֽוֹר׃
transliteration: v'asiyta 'al-hachoshen shar'shot gav'lut ma'aseh 'avot zahav tahvor
translation: On the breastpiece make braided chains of corded work in pure gold.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ עַל־הַחֹ֔שֶׁן שְׁתֵּ֖י טַבְּע֣וֹת זָהָ֑ב וְנָתַתָּ֗ אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ הַטַּבָּע֔וֹת עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
transliteration: v'asiyta 'al-hachoshen sh'tey tab'vot zahav v'natata et-sh'tey hataba'vot 'al-sh'ney k'tzvot hachoshen
translation: Make two rings of gold on the breastpiece, and fasten the two rings at the two ends of the breastpiece,

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֗ה אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ עֲבֹתֹ֣ת הַזָּהָ֔ב עַל־שְׁתֵּ֖י הַטַּבָּעֹ֑ת אֶל־קְצ֖וֹת הַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
transliteration: v'natatah et-sh'tey 'avotot hazahav 'al-sh'tey hataba'ot el-k'tzvot hachoshen
translation: attaching the two golden cords to the two rings at the ends of the breastpiece.

hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת שְׁתֵּ֤י קְצוֹת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הָעֲבֹתֹ֔ת תִּתֵּ֖ן עַל־שְׁתֵּ֣י הַֽמִּשְׁבְּצ֑וֹת וְנָתַתָּ֛ה עַל־כִּתְפ֥וֹת הָאֵפֹ֖ד אֶל־מ֥וּל פָּנָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'et sh'tey k'tzvot sh'tey ha'avotot titen 'al-sh'tey hamish'b'tzvot v'natatah 'al-kit'fvot haefod el-mvl panayv
translation: Then fasten the two ends of the cords to the two frames, which you shall attach to the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, at the front.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֗יתָ שְׁתֵּי֙ טַבְּע֣וֹת זָהָ֔ב וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ אֹתָ֔ם עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י קְצ֣וֹת הַחֹ֑שֶׁן עַל־שְׂפָת֕וֹ אֲשֶׁ֛ר אֶל־עֵ֥בֶר הָאֵפֹ֖ד בָּֽיְתָה׃
transliteration: v'asiyta sh'tey tab'vot zahav v'sam'ta otam 'al-sh'ney k'tzvot hachoshen 'al-s'fatvo asher el-'ever haefod bay'tah
translation: Make two rings of gold and attach them to the two ends of the breastpiece, at its inner edge, which faces the ephod.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂיתָ֮ שְׁתֵּ֣י טַבְּע֣וֹת זָהָב֒ וְנָתַתָּ֣ה אֹתָ֡ם עַל־שְׁתֵּי֩ כִתְפ֨וֹת הָאֵפ֤וֹד מִלְּמַ֙טָּה֙ מִמּ֣וּל פָּנָ֔יו לְעֻמַּ֖ת מֶחְבַּרְתּ֑וֹ מִמַּ֕עַל לְחֵ֖שֶׁב הָאֵפֽוֹד׃
transliteration: v'asiyta sh'tey tab'vot zahav v'natatah otam 'al-sh'tey khit'fvot haefvod mil'matah mimvl panayv l'umat mech'bar'tvo mima'al l'cheshev haefvod
translation: And make two other rings of gold and fasten them on the front of the ephod, low on the two shoulder-pieces, close to its seam above the decorated band.

hebrew: וְיִרְכְּס֣וּ אֶת־הַ֠חֹשֶׁן מטבעתו [מִֽטַּבְּעֹתָ֞יו] אֶל־טַבְּעֹ֤ת הָאֵפֹד֙ בִּפְתִ֣יל תְּכֵ֔לֶת לִֽהְי֖וֹת עַל־חֵ֣שֶׁב הָאֵפ֑וֹד וְלֹֽא־יִזַּ֣ח הַחֹ֔שֶׁן מֵעַ֖ל הָאֵפֽוֹד׃
transliteration: v'yir'k'sv et-hachoshen mtv'tv [mitab'otayv] el-tab'ot haefod bif'tiyl t'khelet lih'yvot 'al-cheshev haefvod v'lo-yizach hachoshen me'al haefvod
translation: The breastpiece shall be held in place by a cord of blue from its rings to the rings of the ephod, so that the breastpiece rests on the decorated band and does not come loose from the ephod.

hebrew: וְנָשָׂ֣א אַ֠הֲרֹן אֶת־שְׁמ֨וֹת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל בְּחֹ֧שֶׁן הַמִּשְׁפָּ֛ט עַל־לִבּ֖וֹ בְּבֹא֣וֹ אֶל־הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ לְזִכָּרֹ֥ן לִפְנֵֽי־יְהוָ֖ה תָּמִֽיד׃
transliteration: v'nasa aharon et-sh'mvot b'ney-yis'rael b'choshen hamish'pat 'al-libvo b'vovo el-hakodesh l'zikaron lif'ney-y'hvah tamiyd
translation: Aaron shall carry the names of the sons of Israel on the breastpiece of decision over his heart, when he enters the sanctuary, for remembrance before the L<small>ORD</small> at all times.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֞ אֶל־חֹ֣שֶׁן הַמִּשְׁפָּ֗ט אֶת־הָאוּרִים֙ וְאֶת־הַתֻּמִּ֔ים וְהָיוּ֙ עַל־לֵ֣ב אַהֲרֹ֔ן בְּבֹא֖וֹ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְנָשָׂ֣א אַ֠הֲרֹן אֶת־מִשְׁפַּ֨ט בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל עַל־לִבּ֛וֹ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה תָּמִֽיד׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'natata el-choshen hamish'pat et-havriym v'et-hatumiym v'hayv 'al-lev aharon b'vovo lif'ney y'hvah v'nasa aharon et-mish'pat b'ney-yis'rael 'al-libvo lif'ney y'hvah tamiyd (s)
translation: Inside the breastpiece of decision you shall place the Urim and Thummim,eMeaning of these two words uncertain. They designate a kind of oracle; cf. Num. 27.21. so that they are over Aaron’s heart when he comes before the LORD. Thus Aaron shall carry the instrument of decision for the Israelites over his heart before the LORD at all times.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֛יתָ אֶת־מְעִ֥יל הָאֵפ֖וֹד כְּלִ֥יל תְּכֵֽלֶת׃
transliteration: v'asiyta et-m'iyl haefvod k'liyl t'khelet
translation: You shall make the robe of the ephod of pure blue.fOthers “all of blue.”

hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה פִֽי־רֹאשׁ֖וֹ בְּתוֹכ֑וֹ שָׂפָ֡ה יִֽהְיֶה֩ לְפִ֨יו סָבִ֜יב מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֹרֵ֗ג כְּפִ֥י תַחְרָ֛א יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֖וֹ לֹ֥א יִקָּרֵֽעַ׃
transliteration: v'hayah fiy-roshvo b'tvokhvo safah yih'yeh l'fiyv saviyv ma'aseh oreg k'fiy tach'ra yih'yeh-lvo lo yikare'a
translation: The opening for the head shall be in the middle of it; the opening shall have a binding of woven work round about—it shall be like the opening of a coat of mail—so that it does not tear.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ עַל־שׁוּלָ֗יו רִמֹּנֵי֙ תְּכֵ֤לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתוֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י עַל־שׁוּלָ֖יו סָבִ֑יב וּפַעֲמֹנֵ֥י זָהָ֛ב בְּתוֹכָ֖ם סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'asiyta 'al-shvlayv rimoney t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy 'al-shvlayv saviyv vfa'amoney zahav b'tvokham saviyv
translation: On its hem make pomegranates of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, all around the hem, with bells of gold between them all around:

hebrew: פַּעֲמֹ֤ן זָהָב֙ וְרִמּ֔וֹן פַּֽעֲמֹ֥ן זָהָ֖ב וְרִמּ֑וֹן עַל־שׁוּלֵ֥י הַמְּעִ֖יל סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: pa'amon zahav v'rimvon pa'amon zahav v'rimvon 'al-shvley ham'iyl saviyv
translation: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, all around the hem of the robe.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה עַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לְשָׁרֵ֑ת וְנִשְׁמַ֣ע ק֠וֹלוֹ בְּבֹא֨וֹ אֶל־הַקֹּ֜דֶשׁ לִפְנֵ֧י יְהוָ֛ה וּבְצֵאת֖וֹ וְלֹ֥א יָמֽוּת׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hayah 'al-aharon l'sharet v'nish'ma' kvolvo b'vovo el-hakodesh lif'ney y'hvah vv'tzetvo v'lo yamvt (s)
translation: Aaron shall wear it while officiating, so that the sound of it is heard when he comes into the sanctuary before the L<small>ORD</small> and when he goes out—that he may not die.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ צִּ֖יץ זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וּפִתַּחְתָּ֤ עָלָיו֙ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חֹתָ֔ם קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'asiyta tziytz zahav tahvor vfitach'ta 'alayv pitvchey chotam kodesh layhvah
translation: You shall make a frontlet of pure gold and engrave on it the seal inscription: “Holy to the L<small>ORD</small>.”

hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֤ אֹתוֹ֙ עַל־פְּתִ֣יל תְּכֵ֔לֶת וְהָיָ֖ה עַל־הַמִּצְנָ֑פֶת אֶל־מ֥וּל פְּנֵֽי־הַמִּצְנֶ֖פֶת יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'sam'ta otvo 'al-p'tiyl t'khelet v'hayah 'al-hamitz'nafet el-mvl p'ney-hamitz'nefet yih'yeh
translation: Suspend it on a cord of blue, so that it may remain on the headdress; it shall remain on the front of the headdress.

hebrew: וְהָיָה֮ עַל־מֵ֣צַח אַהֲרֹן֒ וְנָשָׂ֨א אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן הַקֳּדָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר יַקְדִּ֙ישׁוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְכָֽל־מַתְּנֹ֖ת קָדְשֵׁיהֶ֑ם וְהָיָ֤ה עַל־מִצְחוֹ֙ תָּמִ֔יד לְרָצ֥וֹן לָהֶ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hayah 'al-metzach aharon v'nasa aharon et-'avon hakodashiym asher yak'diyshv b'ney yis'rael l'khal-mat'not kad'sheyhem v'hayah 'al-mitz'chvo tamiyd l'ratzvon lahem lif'ney y'hvah
translation: It shall be on Aaron’s forehead, that Aaron may take away any sin arising from the holy things that the Israelites consecrate, from any of their sacred donations; it shall be on his forehead at all times, to win acceptance for them before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְשִׁבַּצְתָּ֙ הַכְּתֹ֣נֶת שֵׁ֔שׁ וְעָשִׂ֖יתָ מִצְנֶ֣פֶת שֵׁ֑שׁ וְאַבְנֵ֥ט תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה רֹקֵֽם׃
transliteration: v'shibatz'ta hak'tonet shesh v'asiyta mitz'nefet shesh v'av'net ta'aseh ma'aseh rokem
translation:
You shall make the fringed tunic of fine linen.
You shall make the headdress of fine linen.
You shall make the sash of embroidered work.

hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֤י אַהֲרֹן֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה כֻתֳּנֹ֔ת וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לָהֶ֖ם אַבְנֵטִ֑ים וּמִגְבָּעוֹת֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה לָהֶ֔ם לְכָב֖וֹד וּלְתִפְאָֽרֶת׃
transliteration: v'liv'ney aharon ta'aseh khutonot v'asiyta lahem av'netiym vmig'ba'vot ta'aseh lahem l'khavvod vl'tif'aret
translation: And for Aaron’s sons also you shall make tunics, and make sashes for them, and make turbans for them, for dignity and adornment.

hebrew: וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֤ אֹתָם֙ אֶת־אַהֲרֹ֣ן אָחִ֔יךָ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו אִתּ֑וֹ וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֨ אֹתָ֜ם וּמִלֵּאתָ֧ אֶת־יָדָ֛ם וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם וְכִהֲנ֥וּ לִֽי׃
transliteration: v'hil'bash'ta otam et-aharon achiykha v'et-banayv itvo vmashach'ta otam vmileta et-yadam v'kidash'ta otam v'khihanv liy
translation: Put these on your brother Aaron and on his sons as well; anoint them, and ordain themgLit. “and fill their hands.” and consecrate them to serve Me as priests.

hebrew: וַעֲשֵׂ֤ה לָהֶם֙ מִכְנְסֵי־בָ֔ד לְכַסּ֖וֹת בְּשַׂ֣ר עֶרְוָ֑ה מִמָּתְנַ֥יִם וְעַד־יְרֵכַ֖יִם יִהְיֽוּ׃
transliteration: va'aseh lahem mikh'n'sey-vad l'khasvot b'sar 'er'vah mimat'nayim v'ad-y'rekhayim yih'yv
translation: You shall also make for them linen breeches to cover their nakedness; they shall extend from the hips to the thighs.

hebrew: וְהָיוּ֩ עַל־אַהֲרֹ֨ן וְעַל־בָּנָ֜יו בְּבֹאָ֣ם ׀ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֗ד א֣וֹ בְגִשְׁתָּ֤ם אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לְשָׁרֵ֣ת בַּקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וְלֹא־יִשְׂא֥וּ עָוֺ֖ן וָמֵ֑תוּ חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֛ם ל֖וֹ וּלְזַרְע֥וֹ אַחֲרָֽיו׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hayv 'al-aharon v'al-banayv b'voam  el-ohel mvo'ed vo v'gish'tam el-hamiz'becha l'sharet bakodesh v'lo-yis'v 'avon vametv chukat 'volam lvo vl'zar'vo acharayv (s)
translation: They shall be worn by Aaron and his sons when they enter the Tent of Meeting or when they approach the altar to officiate in the sanctuary, so that they do not incur punishment and die. It shall be a law for all time for him and for his offspring to come.

hebrew: וְזֶ֨ה הַדָּבָ֜ר אֲשֶֽׁר־תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לָהֶ֛ם לְקַדֵּ֥שׁ אֹתָ֖ם לְכַהֵ֣ן לִ֑י לְ֠קַח פַּ֣ר אֶחָ֧ד בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר וְאֵילִ֥ם שְׁנַ֖יִם תְּמִימִֽם׃
transliteration: v'zeh hadavar asher-ta'aseh lahem l'kadesh otam l'khahen liy l'kach par echad ben-bakar v'eylim sh'nayim t'miymim
translation: This is what you shall do to them in consecrating them to serve Me as priests: Take a young bull of the herd and two rams without blemish;

hebrew: וְלֶ֣חֶם מַצּ֗וֹת וְחַלֹּ֤ת מַצֹּת֙ בְּלוּלֹ֣ת בַּשֶּׁ֔מֶן וּרְקִיקֵ֥י מַצּ֖וֹת מְשֻׁחִ֣ים בַּשָּׁ֑מֶן סֹ֥לֶת חִטִּ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'lechem matzvot v'chalot matzot b'lvlot bashemen vr'kiykey matzvot m'shuchiym bashamen solet chitiym ta'aseh otam
translation: also unleavened bread, unleavened cakes with oil mixed in, and unleavened wafers spread with oil—make these of choice wheat flour.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֤ אוֹתָם֙ עַל־סַ֣ל אֶחָ֔ד וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בַּסָּ֑ל וְאֶ֨ת־הַפָּ֔ר וְאֵ֖ת שְׁנֵ֥י הָאֵילִֽם׃
transliteration: v'natata votam 'al-sal echad v'hik'rav'ta otam basal v'et-hapar v'et sh'ney haeylim
translation: Place these in one basket and present them in the basket, along with the bull and the two rams.

hebrew: וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֤ן וְאֶת־בָּנָיו֙ תַּקְרִ֔יב אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְרָחַצְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בַּמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'et-aharon v'et-banayv tak'riyv el-petach ohel mvo'ed v'rachatz'ta otam bamayim
translation: Lead Aaron and his sons up to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and wash them with water.

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ אֶת־הַבְּגָדִ֗ים וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֤ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־הַכֻּתֹּ֔נֶת וְאֵת֙ מְעִ֣יל הָאֵפֹ֔ד וְאֶת־הָאֵפֹ֖ד וְאֶת־הַחֹ֑שֶׁן וְאָפַדְתָּ֣ ל֔וֹ בְּחֵ֖שֶׁב הָאֵפֹֽד׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta et-hab'gadiym v'hil'bash'ta et-aharon et-hakutonet v'et m'iyl haefod v'et-haefod v'et-hachoshen v'afad'ta lvo b'cheshev haefod
translation: Then take the vestments, and clothe Aaron with the tunic, the robe of the ephod, the ephod, and the breastpiece, and gird him with the decorated band of the ephod.

hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ הַמִּצְנֶ֖פֶת עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וְנָתַתָּ֛ אֶת־נֵ֥זֶר הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ עַל־הַמִּצְנָֽפֶת׃
transliteration: v'sam'ta hamitz'nefet 'al-roshvo v'natata et-nezer hakodesh 'al-hamitz'nafet
translation: Put the headdress on his head, and place the holy diadem upon the headdress.

hebrew: וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְיָצַקְתָּ֖ עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֖ אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta et-shemen hamish'chah v'yatzak'ta 'al-roshvo vmashach'ta otvo
translation: Take the anointing oil and pour it on his head and anoint him.

hebrew: וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו תַּקְרִ֑יב וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֖ם כֻּתֳּנֹֽת׃
transliteration: v'et-banayv tak'riyv v'hil'bash'tam kutonot
translation: Then bring his sons forward; clothe them with tunics

hebrew: וְחָגַרְתָּ֩ אֹתָ֨ם אַבְנֵ֜ט אַהֲרֹ֣ן וּבָנָ֗יו וְחָבַשְׁתָּ֤ לָהֶם֙ מִגְבָּעֹ֔ת וְהָיְתָ֥ה לָהֶ֛ם כְּהֻנָּ֖ה לְחֻקַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם וּמִלֵּאתָ֥ יַֽד־אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְיַד־בָּנָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'chagar'ta otam av'net aharon vvanayv v'chavash'ta lahem mig'ba'ot v'hay'tah lahem k'hunah l'chukat 'volam vmileta yad-aharon v'yad-banayv
translation:
and wind turbans upon them. And gird both Aaron and his sons with sashes. And so they shall have priesthood as their right for all time.
You shall then ordain Aaron and his sons.

hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַפָּ֔ר לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְסָמַ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הַפָּֽר׃
transliteration: v'hik'rav'ta et-hapar lif'ney ohel mvo'ed v'samakh' aharon vvanayv et-y'deyhem 'al-rosh hapar
translation: Lead the bull up to the front of the Tent of Meeting, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the head of the bull.

hebrew: וְשָׁחַטְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַפָּ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'shachat'ta et-hapar lif'ney y'hvah petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: Slaughter the bull before the L<small>ORD</small>, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,

hebrew: וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ מִדַּ֣ם הַפָּ֔ר וְנָתַתָּ֛ה עַל־קַרְנֹ֥ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ בְּאֶצְבָּעֶ֑ךָ וְאֶת־כָּל־הַדָּ֣ם תִּשְׁפֹּ֔ךְ אֶל־יְס֖וֹד הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta midam hapar v'natatah 'al-kar'not hamiz'becha b'etz'ba'ekha v'et-kal-hadam tish'pokh' el-y'svod hamiz'becha
translation: and take some of the bull’s blood and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger; then pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.

hebrew: וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֗ אֶֽת־כָּל־הַחֵלֶב֮ הַֽמְכַסֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַקֶּרֶב֒ וְאֵ֗ת הַיֹּתֶ֙רֶת֙ עַל־הַכָּבֵ֔ד וְאֵת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֔ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֖לֶב אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֑ן וְהִקְטַרְתָּ֖ הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta et-kal-hachelev ham'khaseh et-hakerev v'et hayoteret 'al-hakaved v'et sh'tey hak'layot v'et-hachelev asher 'aleyhen v'hik'tar'ta hamiz'bechah
translation: Take all the fat that covers the entrails, the protuberance on the liver, and the two kidneys with the fat on them, and turn them into smoke upon the altar.

hebrew: וְאֶת־בְּשַׂ֤ר הַפָּר֙ וְאֶת־עֹר֣וֹ וְאֶת־פִּרְשׁ֔וֹ תִּשְׂרֹ֣ף בָּאֵ֔שׁ מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה חַטָּ֖את הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'et-b'sar hapar v'et-'orvo v'et-pir'shvo tis'rof baesh michvtz lamachaneh chatat hv
translation: The rest of the flesh of the bull, its hide, and its dung shall be put to the fire outside the camp; it is a sin offering.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאַ֥יִל הָאֶחָ֖ד תִּקָּ֑ח וְסָ֨מְכ֜וּ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
transliteration: v'et-haayil haechad tikach v'sam'khv aharon vvanayv et-y'deyhem 'al-rosh haayil
translation: Next take the one ram, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the ram’s head.

hebrew: וְשָׁחַטְתָּ֖ אֶת־הָאָ֑יִל וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־דָּמ֔וֹ וְזָרַקְתָּ֥ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'shachat'ta et-haayil v'lakach'ta et-damvo v'zarak'ta 'al-hamiz'becha saviyv
translation: Slaughter the ram, and take its blood and dash it against all sides of the altar.

hebrew: וְאֶ֨ת־הָאַ֔יִל תְּנַתֵּ֖חַ לִנְתָחָ֑יו וְרָחַצְתָּ֤ קִרְבּוֹ֙ וּכְרָעָ֔יו וְנָתַתָּ֥ עַל־נְתָחָ֖יו וְעַל־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
transliteration: v'et-haayil t'natecha lin'tachayv v'rachatz'ta kir'bvo vkh'ra'ayv v'natata 'al-n'tachayv v'al-roshvo
translation: Cut up the ram into sections, wash its entrails and legs, and put them with its quarters and its head.

hebrew: וְהִקְטַרְתָּ֤ אֶת־כָּל־הָאַ֙יִל֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עֹלָ֥ה ה֖וּא לַֽיהוָ֑ה רֵ֣יחַ נִיח֔וֹחַ אִשֶּׁ֥ה לַיהוָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'hik'tar'ta et-kal-haayil hamiz'bechah 'olah hv layhvah reycha niychvocha isheh layhvah hv
translation: Turn all of the ram into smoke upon the altar. It is a burnt offering to the L<small>ORD</small>, a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְלָ֣קַחְתָּ֔ אֵ֖ת הָאַ֣יִל הַשֵּׁנִ֑י וְסָמַ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta et haayil hasheniy v'samakh' aharon vvanayv et-y'deyhem 'al-rosh haayil
translation: Then take the other ram, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the ram’s head.

hebrew: וְשָׁחַטְתָּ֣ אֶת־הָאַ֗יִל וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ מִדָּמוֹ֙ וְנָֽתַתָּ֡ה עַל־תְּנוּךְ֩ אֹ֨זֶן אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְעַל־תְּנ֨וּךְ אֹ֤זֶן בָּנָיו֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדָם֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְלָ֖ם הַיְמָנִ֑ית וְזָרַקְתָּ֧ אֶת־הַדָּ֛ם עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'shachat'ta et-haayil v'lakach'ta midamvo v'natatah 'al-t'nvkh' ozen aharon v'al-t'nvkh' ozen banayv hay'maniyt v'al-bohen yadam hay'maniyt v'al-bohen rag'lam hay'maniyt v'zarak'ta et-hadam 'al-hamiz'becha saviyv
translation: Slaughter the ram, and take some of its blood and put it on the ridgeaOr “lobe.” of Aaron’s right ear and on the ridges of his sons’ right ears, and on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet; and dash the rest of the blood against every side of the altar round about.

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֞ מִן־הַדָּ֨ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַֽל־הַמִּזְבֵּחַ֮ וּמִשֶּׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה֒ וְהִזֵּיתָ֤ עַֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְעַל־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְעַל־בָּנָ֛יו וְעַל־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּ֑וֹ וְקָדַ֥שׁ הוּא֙ וּבְגָדָ֔יו וּבָנָ֛יו וּבִגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta min-hadam asher 'al-hamiz'becha vmishemen hamish'chah v'hizeyta 'al-aharon v'al-b'gadayv v'al-banayv v'al-big'dey vanayv itvo v'kadash hv vv'gadayv vvanayv vvig'dey vanayv itvo
translation: Take some of the blood that is on the altar and some of the anointing oil and sprinkle upon Aaron and his vestments, and also upon his sons and his sons’ vestments. Thus shall he and his vestments be holy, as well as his sons and his sons’ vestments.

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ מִן־הָ֠אַיִל הַחֵ֨לֶב וְהָֽאַלְיָ֜ה וְאֶת־הַחֵ֣לֶב ׀ הַֽמְכַסֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַקֶּ֗רֶב וְאֵ֨ת יֹתֶ֤רֶת הַכָּבֵד֙ וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֗ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵהֶ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת שׁ֣וֹק הַיָּמִ֑ין כִּ֛י אֵ֥יל מִלֻּאִ֖ים הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta min-haayil hachelev v'haal'yah v'et-hachelev  ham'khaseh et-hakerev v'et yoteret hakaved v'et  sh'tey hak'layot v'et-hachelev asher 'alehen v'et shvok hayamiyn kiy eyl miluiym hv
translation: You shall take from the ram the fat parts—the broad tail, the fat that covers the entrails, the protuberance on the liver, the two kidneys with the fat on them—and the right thigh; for this is a ram of ordination.

hebrew: וְכִכַּ֨ר לֶ֜חֶם אַחַ֗ת וַֽחַלַּ֨ת לֶ֥חֶם שֶׁ֛מֶן אַחַ֖ת וְרָקִ֣יק אֶחָ֑ד מִסַּל֙ הַמַּצּ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'khikar lechem achat vachalat lechem shemen achat v'rakiyk echad misal hamatzvot asher lif'ney y'hvah
translation: Add one flat loaf of bread, one cake of oil bread, and one wafer, from the basket of unleavened bread that is before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ הַכֹּ֔ל עַ֚ל כַּפֵּ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְעַ֖ל כַּפֵּ֣י בָנָ֑יו וְהֵנַפְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'sam'ta hakol 'al kapey aharon v'al kapey vanayv v'henaf'ta otam t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah
translation: Place all these on the palms of Aaron and his sons, and offer them as an elevation offering before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ אֹתָם֙ מִיָּדָ֔ם וְהִקְטַרְתָּ֥ הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חָה עַל־הָעֹלָ֑ה לְרֵ֤יחַ נִיח֙וֹחַ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה אִשֶּׁ֥ה ה֖וּא לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta otam miyadam v'hik'tar'ta hamiz'bechah 'al-ha'olah l'reycha niychvocha lif'ney y'hvah isheh hv layhvah
translation: Take them from their hands and turn them into smoke upon the altar with the burnt offering, as a pleasing odor before the L<small>ORD</small>; it is an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ אֶת־הֶֽחָזֶ֗ה מֵאֵ֤יל הַמִּלֻּאִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַהֲרֹ֔ן וְהֵנַפְתָּ֥ אֹת֛וֹ תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְהָיָ֥ה לְךָ֖ לְמָנָֽה׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta et-hechazeh meeyl hamiluiym asher l'aharon v'henaf'ta otvo t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah v'hayah l'kha l'manah
translation: Then take the breast of Aaron’s ram of ordination and offer it as an elevation offering before the L<small>ORD</small>; it shall be your portion.

hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֞ אֵ֣ת ׀ חֲזֵ֣ה הַתְּנוּפָ֗ה וְאֵת֙ שׁ֣וֹק הַתְּרוּמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוּנַ֖ף וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר הוּרָ֑ם מֵאֵיל֙ הַמִּלֻּאִ֔ים מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּמֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר לְבָנָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'kidash'ta et  chazeh hat'nvfah v'et shvok hat'rvmah asher hvnaf vaasher hvram meeyl hamiluiym measher l'aharon vmeasher l'vanayv
translation: You shall consecrate the breast that was offered as an elevation offering and the thigh that was offered as a gift offering from the ram of ordination—from that which was Aaron’s and from that which was his sons’—

hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ לְאַהֲרֹ֨ן וּלְבָנָ֜יו לְחָק־עוֹלָ֗ם מֵאֵת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֥י תְרוּמָ֖ה ה֑וּא וּתְרוּמָ֞ה יִהְיֶ֨ה מֵאֵ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִזִּבְחֵ֣י שַׁלְמֵיהֶ֔ם תְּרוּמָתָ֖ם לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hayah l'aharon vl'vanayv l'chak-'volam meet b'ney yis'rael kiy t'rvmah hv vt'rvmah yih'yeh meet b'ney-yis'rael miziv'chey shal'meyhem t'rvmatam layhvah
translation: and those parts shall be a due for all time from the Israelites to Aaron and his descendants. For they are a gift; and so shall they be a gift from the Israelites, their gift to the L<small>ORD</small> out of their sacrifices of well-being.

hebrew: וּבִגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַהֲרֹ֔ן יִהְי֥וּ לְבָנָ֖יו אַחֲרָ֑יו לְמָשְׁחָ֣ה בָהֶ֔ם וּלְמַלֵּא־בָ֖ם אֶת־יָדָֽם׃
transliteration: vvig'dey hakodesh asher l'aharon yih'yv l'vanayv acharayv l'mash'chah vahem vl'male-vam et-yadam
translation: The sacral vestments of Aaron shall pass on to his sons after him, for them to be anointed and ordained in.

hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים יִלְבָּשָׁ֧ם הַכֹּהֵ֛ן תַּחְתָּ֖יו מִבָּנָ֑יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָבֹ֛א אֶל־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד לְשָׁרֵ֥ת בַּקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: shiv'at yamiym yil'basham hakohen tach'tayv mibanayv asher yavo el-ohel mvo'ed l'sharet bakodesh
translation: He among his sons who becomes priest in his stead, who enters the Tent of Meeting to officiate within the sanctuary, shall wear them seven days.

hebrew: וְאֵ֛ת אֵ֥יל הַמִּלֻּאִ֖ים תִּקָּ֑ח וּבִשַּׁלְתָּ֥ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ בְּמָקֹ֥ם קָדֹֽשׁ׃
transliteration: v'et eyl hamiluiym tikach vvishal'ta et-b'sarvo b'makom kadosh
translation: You shall take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in the sacred precinct;

hebrew: וְאָכַ֨ל אַהֲרֹ֤ן וּבָנָיו֙ אֶת־בְּשַׂ֣ר הָאַ֔יִל וְאֶת־הַלֶּ֖חֶם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּסָּ֑ל פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'akhal aharon vvanayv et-b'sar haayil v'et-halechem asher basal petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: and Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְאָכְל֤וּ אֹתָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר כֻּפַּ֣ר בָּהֶ֔ם לְמַלֵּ֥א אֶת־יָדָ֖ם לְקַדֵּ֣שׁ אֹתָ֑ם וְזָ֥ר לֹא־יֹאכַ֖ל כִּי־קֹ֥דֶשׁ הֵֽם׃
transliteration: v'akh'lv otam asher kupar bahem l'male et-yadam l'kadesh otam v'zar lo-yokhal kiy-kodesh hem
translation: These things shall be eaten only by those for whom expiation was made with them when they were ordained and consecrated; they may not be eaten by a layman, for they are holy.

hebrew: וְֽאִם־יִוָּתֵ֞ר מִבְּשַׂ֧ר הַמִּלֻּאִ֛ים וּמִן־הַלֶּ֖חֶם עַד־הַבֹּ֑קֶר וְשָׂרַפְתָּ֤ אֶת־הַנּוֹתָר֙ בָּאֵ֔שׁ לֹ֥א יֵאָכֵ֖ל כִּי־קֹ֥דֶשׁ הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'im-yivater mib'sar hamiluiym vmin-halechem 'ad-haboker v'saraf'ta et-hanvotar baesh lo yeakhel kiy-kodesh hv
translation: And if any of the flesh of ordination, or any of the bread, is left until morning, you shall put what is left to the fire; it shall not be eaten, for it is holy.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ לְאַהֲרֹ֤ן וּלְבָנָיו֙ כָּ֔כָה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוִּ֖יתִי אֹתָ֑כָה שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים תְּמַלֵּ֥א יָדָֽם׃
transliteration: v'asiyta l'aharon vl'vanayv kakhah k'khol asher-tziviytiy otakhah shiv'at yamiym t'male yadam
translation: Thus you shall do to Aaron and his sons, just as I have commanded you. You shall ordain them through seven days,

hebrew: וּפַ֨ר חַטָּ֜את תַּעֲשֶׂ֤ה לַיּוֹם֙ עַל־הַכִּפֻּרִ֔ים וְחִטֵּאתָ֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ בְּכַפֶּרְךָ֖ עָלָ֑יו וּמָֽשַׁחְתָּ֥ אֹת֖וֹ לְקַדְּשֽׁוֹ׃
transliteration: vfar chatat ta'aseh layvom 'al-hakipuriym v'chiteta 'al-hamiz'becha b'khaper'kha 'alayv vmashach'ta otvo l'kad'shvo
translation: and each day you shall prepare a bull as a sin offering for expiation; you shall purge the altar by performing purification upon it, and you shall anoint it to consecrate it.

hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים תְּכַפֵּר֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֖ אֹת֑וֹ וְהָיָ֤ה הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ קֹ֣דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֔ים כָּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בַּמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ יִקְדָּֽשׁ׃ (ס)
transliteration: shiv'at yamiym t'khaper 'al-hamiz'becha v'kidash'ta otvo v'hayah hamiz'becha kodesh kadashiym kal-hanoge'a bamiz'becha yik'dash (s)
translation: Seven days you shall perform purification for the altar to consecrate it, and the altar shall become most holy; whatever touches the altar shall become consecrated.

hebrew: וְזֶ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֛ה שְׁנַ֥יִם לַיּ֖וֹם תָּמִֽיד׃
transliteration: v'zeh asher ta'aseh 'al-hamiz'becha k'vasiym b'ney-shanah sh'nayim layvom tamiyd
translation: Now this is what you shall offer upon the altar: two yearling lambs each day, regularly.

hebrew: אֶת־הַכֶּ֥בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֖ד תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה בַבֹּ֑קֶר וְאֵת֙ הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: et-hakeves haechad ta'aseh vaboker v'et hakeves hasheniy ta'aseh beyn ha'ar'bayim
translation: You shall offer the one lamb in the morning, and you shall offer the other lamb at twilight.

hebrew: וְעִשָּׂרֹ֨ן סֹ֜לֶת בָּל֨וּל בְּשֶׁ֤מֶן כָּתִית֙ רֶ֣בַע הַהִ֔ין וְנֵ֕סֶךְ רְבִעִ֥ית הַהִ֖ין יָ֑יִן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: v'isaron solet balvl b'shemen katiyt reva' hahiyn v'nesekh' r'vi'iyt hahiyn yayin lakeves haechad
translation: There shall be a tenth of a measure of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil mixed in, and a libation of a quarter hin of wine for one lamb;

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֣ין הָעַרְבָּ֑יִם כְּמִנְחַ֨ת הַבֹּ֤קֶר וּכְנִסְכָּהּ֙ תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לָּ֔הּ לְרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'et hakeves hasheniy ta'aseh beyn ha'ar'bayim k'min'chat haboker vkh'nis'kah ta'aseh-lah l'reycha niychocha isheh layhvah
translation: and you shall offer the other lamb at twilight, repeating with it the meal offering of the morning with its libation—an offering by fire for a pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>,

hebrew: עֹלַ֤ת תָּמִיד֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם פֶּ֥תַח אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אִוָּעֵ֤ד לָכֶם֙ שָׁ֔מָּה לְדַבֵּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: 'olat tamiyd l'doroteykhem petach ohel-mvo'ed lif'ney y'hvah asher iva'ed lakhem shamah l'daber eleykha sham
translation:
a regular burnt offering throughout the generations, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting before the LORD.
For there I will meet with you, and there I will speak with you,

hebrew: וְנֹעַדְתִּ֥י שָׁ֖מָּה לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְנִקְדַּ֖שׁ בִּכְבֹדִֽי׃
transliteration: v'no'ad'tiy shamah liv'ney yis'rael v'nik'dash bikh'vodiy
translation: and there I will meet with the Israelites, and it shall be sanctified by My Presence.

hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתִּ֛י אֶת־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וְאֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֧ן וְאֶת־בָּנָ֛יו אֲקַדֵּ֖שׁ לְכַהֵ֥ן לִֽי׃
transliteration: v'kidash'tiy et-ohel mvo'ed v'et-hamiz'becha v'et-aharon v'et-banayv akadesh l'khahen liy
translation: I will sanctify the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and I will consecrate Aaron and his sons to serve Me as priests.

hebrew: וְשָׁ֣כַנְתִּ֔י בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהָיִ֥יתִי לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: v'shakhan'tiy b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael v'hayiytiy lahem lelohiym
translation: I will abide among the Israelites, and I will be their God.

hebrew: וְיָדְע֗וּ כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצֵ֧אתִי אֹתָ֛ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לְשָׁכְנִ֣י בְתוֹכָ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'yad'v kiy aniy y'hvah eloheyhem asher hvotzetiy otam meeretz mitz'rayim l'shakh'niy v'tvokham aniy y'hvah eloheyhem (f)
translation: And they shall know that I the L<small>ORD</small> am their God, who brought them out from the land of Egypt that I might abide among them, I the L<small>ORD</small> their God.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מִזְבֵּ֖חַ מִקְטַ֣ר קְטֹ֑רֶת עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'asiyta miz'becha mik'tar k'toret 'atzey shitiym ta'aseh otvo
translation: You shall make an altar for burning incense; make it of acacia wood.

hebrew: אַמָּ֨ה אָרְכּ֜וֹ וְאַמָּ֤ה רָחְבּוֹ֙ רָב֣וּעַ יִהְיֶ֔ה וְאַמָּתַ֖יִם קֹמָת֑וֹ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ קַרְנֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: amah ar'kvo v'amah rach'bvo ravv'a yih'yeh v'amatayim komatvo mimenv kar'notayv
translation: It shall be a cubit long and a cubit wide—it shall be square—and two cubits high, its horns of one piece with it.

hebrew: וְצִפִּיתָ֨ אֹת֜וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֗וֹר אֶת־גַּגּ֧וֹ וְאֶת־קִירֹתָ֛יו סָבִ֖יב וְאֶת־קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לּ֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'tzipiyta otvo zahav tahvor et-gagvo v'et-kiyrotayv saviyv v'et-kar'notayv v'asiyta lvo zer zahav saviyv
translation: Overlay it with pure gold: its top, its sides round about, and its horns; and make a gold molding for it round about.

hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּי֩ טַבְּעֹ֨ת זָהָ֜ב תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לּ֣וֹ ׀ מִתַּ֣חַת לְזֵר֗וֹ עַ֚ל שְׁתֵּ֣י צַלְעֹתָ֔יו תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה עַל־שְׁנֵ֣י צִדָּ֑יו וְהָיָה֙ לְבָתִּ֣ים לְבַדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֥את אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֵֽמָּה׃
transliteration: vsh'tey tab'ot zahav ta'aseh-lvo  mitachat l'zervo 'al sh'tey tzal'otayv ta'aseh 'al-sh'ney tzidayv v'hayah l'vatiym l'vadiym laset otvo bahemah
translation: And make two gold rings for it under its molding; make them on its two side walls, on oppositeaLit. “its two.” sides. They shall serve as holders for poles with which to carry it.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֖ים עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
transliteration: v'asiyta et-habadiym 'atzey shitiym v'tzipiyta otam zahav
translation: Make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אֹתוֹ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַפָּרֹ֔כֶת אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־אֲרֹ֣ן הָעֵדֻ֑ת לִפְנֵ֣י הַכַּפֹּ֗רֶת אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־הָ֣עֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֛ר אִוָּעֵ֥ד לְךָ֖ שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: v'natatah otvo lif'ney haparokhet asher 'al-aron ha'edut lif'ney hakaporet asher 'al-ha'edut asher iva'ed l'kha shamah
translation: Place it in front of the curtain that is over the Ark of the Pact—in front of the cover that is over the Pact—where I will meet with you.

hebrew: וְהִקְטִ֥יר עָלָ֛יו אַהֲרֹ֖ן קְטֹ֣רֶת סַמִּ֑ים בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֗קֶר בְּהֵיטִיב֛וֹ אֶת־הַנֵּרֹ֖ת יַקְטִירֶֽנָּה׃
transliteration: v'hik'tiyr 'alayv aharon k'toret samiym baboker baboker b'heytiyvvo et-hanerot yak'tiyrenah
translation: On it Aaron shall burn aromatic incense: he shall burn it every morning when he tends the lamps,

hebrew: וּבְהַעֲלֹ֨ת אַהֲרֹ֧ן אֶת־הַנֵּרֹ֛ת בֵּ֥ין הָעֲרְבַּ֖יִם יַקְטִירֶ֑נָּה קְטֹ֧רֶת תָּמִ֛יד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vv'ha'alot aharon et-hanerot beyn ha'ar'bayim yak'tiyrenah k'toret tamiyd lif'ney y'hvah l'doroteykhem
translation: and Aaron shall burn it at twilight when he lights the lamps—a regular incense offering before the L<small>ORD</small> throughout the ages.

hebrew: לֹא־תַעֲל֥וּ עָלָ֛יו קְטֹ֥רֶת זָרָ֖ה וְעֹלָ֣ה וּמִנְחָ֑ה וְנֵ֕סֶךְ לֹ֥א תִסְּכ֖וּ עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: lo-ta'alv 'alayv k'toret zarah v'olah vmin'chah v'nesekh' lo tis'khv 'alayv
translation: You shall not offer alien incense on it, or a burnt offering or a meal offering; neither shall you pour a libation on it.

hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֤ר אַהֲרֹן֙ עַל־קַרְנֹתָ֔יו אַחַ֖ת בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה מִדַּ֞ם חַטַּ֣את הַכִּפֻּרִ֗ים אַחַ֤ת בַּשָּׁנָה֙ יְכַפֵּ֤ר עָלָיו֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם קֹֽדֶשׁ־קָֽדָשִׁ֥ים ה֖וּא לַיהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'khiper aharon 'al-kar'notayv achat bashanah midam chatat hakipuriym achat bashanah y'khaper 'alayv l'doroteykhem kodesh-kadashiym hv layhvah (f)
translation: Once a year Aaron shall perform purification upon its horns with blood of the sin offering of purification; purification shall be performed upon it once a year throughout the ages. It is most holy to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: כִּ֣י תִשָּׂ֞א אֶת־רֹ֥אשׁ בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֘ל לִפְקֻדֵיהֶם֒ וְנָ֨תְנ֜וּ אִ֣ישׁ כֹּ֧פֶר נַפְשׁ֛וֹ לַיהוָ֖ה בִּפְקֹ֣ד אֹתָ֑ם וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה בָהֶ֛ם נֶ֖גֶף בִּפְקֹ֥ד אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: kiy tisa et-rosh b'ney-yis'rael lif'kudeyhem v'nat'nv iysh kofer naf'shvo layhvah bif'kod otam v'lo-yih'yeh vahem negef bif'kod otam
translation: When you take a census of the Israelite people according to their enrollment, each shall pay the L<small>ORD</small> a ransom for himself on being enrolled, that no plague may come upon them through their being enrolled.

hebrew: זֶ֣ה ׀ יִתְּנ֗וּ כָּל־הָעֹבֵר֙ עַל־הַפְּקֻדִ֔ים מַחֲצִ֥ית הַשֶּׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ עֶשְׂרִ֤ים גֵּרָה֙ הַשֶּׁ֔קֶל מַחֲצִ֣ית הַשֶּׁ֔קֶל תְּרוּמָ֖ה לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: zeh  yit'nv kal-ha'over 'al-hap'kudiym machatziyt hashekel b'shekel hakodesh 'es'riym gerah hashekel machatziyt hashekel t'rvmah layhvah
translation: This is what everyone who is entered in the records shall pay: a half-shekel by the sanctuary weight—twenty gerahs to the shekel—a half-shekel as an offering to the LORD.

hebrew: כֹּ֗ל הָעֹבֵר֙ עַל־הַפְּקֻדִ֔ים מִבֶּ֛ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וָמָ֑עְלָה יִתֵּ֖ן תְּרוּמַ֥ת יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: kol ha'over 'al-hap'kudiym miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah yiten t'rvmat y'hvah
translation: Everyone who is entered in the records, from the age of twenty years up, shall give the L<small>ORD</small>’s offering:

hebrew: הֶֽעָשִׁ֣יר לֹֽא־יַרְבֶּ֗ה וְהַדַּל֙ לֹ֣א יַמְעִ֔יט מִֽמַּחֲצִ֖ית הַשָּׁ֑קֶל לָתֵת֙ אֶת־תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: he'ashiyr lo-yar'beh v'hadal lo yam'iyt mimachatziyt hashakel latet et-t'rvmat y'hvah l'khaper 'al-naf'shoteykhem
translation: the rich shall not pay more and the poor shall not pay less than half a shekel when giving the L<small>ORD</small>’s offering as expiation for your persons.

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֞ אֶת־כֶּ֣סֶף הַכִּפֻּרִ֗ים מֵאֵת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְנָתַתָּ֣ אֹת֔וֹ עַל־עֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהָיָה֩ לִבְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל לְזִכָּרוֹן֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'lakach'ta et-kesef hakipuriym meet b'ney yis'rael v'natata otvo 'al-'avodat ohel mvo'ed v'hayah liv'ney yis'rael l'zikarvon lif'ney y'hvah l'khaper 'al-naf'shoteykhem (f)
translation: You shall take the expiation money from the Israelites and assign it to the service of the Tent of Meeting; it shall serve the Israelites as a reminder before the L<small>ORD</small>, as expiation for your persons.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ כִּיּ֥וֹר נְחֹ֛שֶׁת וְכַנּ֥וֹ נְחֹ֖שֶׁת לְרָחְצָ֑ה וְנָתַתָּ֣ אֹת֗וֹ בֵּֽין־אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ וּבֵ֣ין הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְנָתַתָּ֥ שָׁ֖מָּה מָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'asiyta kiyvor n'choshet v'khanvo n'choshet l'rach'tzah v'natata otvo beyn-ohel mvo'ed vveyn hamiz'becha v'natata shamah mayim
translation: Make a laver of copper and a stand of copper for it, for washing; and place it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar. Put water in it,

hebrew: וְרָחֲצ֛וּ אַהֲרֹ֥ן וּבָנָ֖יו מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־רַגְלֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'rachatzv aharon vvanayv mimenv et-y'deyhem v'et-rag'leyhem
translation: and let Aaron and his sons wash their hands and feet [in water drawn] from it.

hebrew: בְּבֹאָ֞ם אֶל־אֹ֧הֶל מוֹעֵ֛ד יִרְחֲצוּ־מַ֖יִם וְלֹ֣א יָמֻ֑תוּ א֣וֹ בְגִשְׁתָּ֤ם אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לְשָׁרֵ֔ת לְהַקְטִ֥יר אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: b'voam el-ohel mvo'ed yir'chatzv-mayim v'lo yamutv vo v'gish'tam el-hamiz'becha l'sharet l'hak'tiyr isheh layhvah
translation: When they enter the Tent of Meeting they shall wash with water, that they may not die; or when they approach the altar to serve, to turn into smoke an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>,

hebrew: וְרָחֲצ֛וּ יְדֵיהֶ֥ם וְרַגְלֵיהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֣א יָמֻ֑תוּ וְהָיְתָ֨ה לָהֶ֧ם חָק־עוֹלָ֛ם ל֥וֹ וּלְזַרְע֖וֹ לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'rachatzv y'deyhem v'rag'leyhem v'lo yamutv v'hay'tah lahem chak-'volam lvo vl'zar'vo l'dorotam (f)
translation: they shall wash their hands and feet, that they may not die. It shall be a law for all time for them—for him and his offspring—throughout the ages.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה קַח־לְךָ֮ בְּשָׂמִ֣ים רֹאשׁ֒ מָר־דְּרוֹר֙ חֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת וְקִנְּמָן־בֶּ֥שֶׂם מַחֲצִית֖וֹ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וּמָאתָ֑יִם וּקְנֵה־בֹ֖שֶׂם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'atah kach-l'kha b'samiym rosh mar-d'rvor chamesh mevot v'kin'man-besem machatziytvo chamishiym vmatayim vk'neh-vosem chamishiym vmatayim
translation: Next take choice spices: five hundred weight of solidifiedbOthers “flowing.” myrrh, half as much—two hundred and fifty—of fragrant cinnamon, two hundred and fifty of aromatic cane,

hebrew: וְקִדָּ֕ה חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וְשֶׁ֥מֶן זַ֖יִת הִֽין׃
transliteration: v'kidah chamesh mevot b'shekel hakodesh v'shemen zayit hiyn
translation: five hundred—by the sanctuary weight—of cassia, and a hin of olive oil.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ אֹת֗וֹ שֶׁ֚מֶן מִשְׁחַת־קֹ֔דֶשׁ רֹ֥קַח מִרְקַ֖חַת מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֑חַ שֶׁ֥מֶן מִשְׁחַת־קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'asiyta otvo shemen mish'chat-kodesh rokach mir'kachat ma'aseh rokecha shemen mish'chat-kodesh yih'yeh
translation: Make of this a sacred anointing oil, a compound of ingredients expertly blended, to serve as sacred anointing oil.

hebrew: וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֥ ב֖וֹ אֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְאֵ֖ת אֲר֥וֹן הָעֵדֻֽת׃
transliteration: vmashach'ta vvo et-ohel mvo'ed v'et arvon ha'edut
translation: With it anoint the Tent of Meeting, the Ark of the Pact,

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֖ה וְאֶת־כֵּלֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת מִזְבַּ֥ח הַקְּטֹֽרֶת׃
transliteration: v'et-hashul'chan v'et-kal-kelayv v'et-ham'norah v'et-keleyha v'et miz'bach hak'toret
translation: the table and all its utensils, the lampstand and all its fittings, the altar of incense,

hebrew: וְאֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְאֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֖ר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'et-miz'bach ha'olah v'et-kal-kelayv v'et-hakiyor v'et-kanvo
translation: the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the laver and its stand.

hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֣ אֹתָ֔ם וְהָי֖וּ קֹ֣דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֑ים כָּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּהֶ֖ם יִקְדָּֽשׁ׃
transliteration: v'kidash'ta otam v'hayv kodesh kadashiym kal-hanoge'a bahem yik'dash
translation: Thus you shall consecrate them so that they may be most holy; whatever touches them shall be consecrated.

hebrew: וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֥ן וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו תִּמְשָׁ֑ח וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם לְכַהֵ֥ן לִֽי׃
transliteration: v'et-aharon v'et-banayv tim'shach v'kidash'ta otam l'khahen liy
translation: You shall also anoint Aaron and his sons, consecrating them to serve Me as priests.

hebrew: וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תְּדַבֵּ֣ר לֵאמֹ֑ר שֶׁ֠מֶן מִשְׁחַת־קֹ֨דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֥ה זֶ֛ה לִ֖י לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'el-b'ney yis'rael t'daber lemor shemen mish'chat-kodesh yih'yeh zeh liy l'doroteykhem
translation: And speak to the Israelite people, as follows: This shall be an anointing oil sacred to Me throughout the ages.

hebrew: עַל־בְּשַׂ֤ר אָדָם֙ לֹ֣א יִיסָ֔ךְ וּבְמַ֨תְכֻּנְתּ֔וֹ לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ כָּמֹ֑הוּ קֹ֣דֶשׁ ה֔וּא קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: 'al-b'sar adam lo yiysakh' vv'mat'kun'tvo lo ta'asv kamohv kodesh hv kodesh yih'yeh lakhem
translation: It must not be rubbed on any person’s body, and you must not make anything like it in the same proportions; it is sacred, to be held sacred by you.

hebrew: אִ֚ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִרְקַ֣ח כָּמֹ֔הוּ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יִתֵּ֛ן מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַל־זָ֑ר וְנִכְרַ֖ת מֵעַמָּֽיו׃ (ס)
transliteration: iysh asher yir'kach kamohv vaasher yiten mimenv 'al-zar v'nikh'rat me'amayv (s)
translation: Whoever compounds its like, or puts any of it on a layman, shall be cut off from his kin.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֜ה קַח־לְךָ֣ סַמִּ֗ים נָטָ֤ף ׀ וּשְׁחֵ֙לֶת֙ וְחֶלְבְּנָ֔ה סַמִּ֖ים וּלְבֹנָ֣ה זַכָּ֑ה בַּ֥ד בְּבַ֖ד יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh kach-l'kha samiym nataf  vsh'chelet v'chel'b'nah samiym vl'vonah zakah bad b'vad yih'yeh
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses: Take the herbs stacte, onycha, and galbanum—these herbs together with pure frankincense; let there be an equal part of each.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ אֹתָהּ֙ קְטֹ֔רֶת רֹ֖קַח מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רוֹקֵ֑חַ מְמֻלָּ֖ח טָה֥וֹר קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: v'asiyta otah k'toret rokach ma'aseh rvokecha m'mulach tahvor kodesh
translation: Make them into incense, a compound expertly blended, refined, pure, sacred.

hebrew: וְשָֽׁחַקְתָּ֣ מִמֶּנָּה֮ הָדֵק֒ וְנָתַתָּ֨ה מִמֶּ֜נָּה לִפְנֵ֤י הָעֵדֻת֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֛ר אִוָּעֵ֥ד לְךָ֖ שָׁ֑מָּה קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים תִּהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'shachak'ta mimenah hadek v'natatah mimenah lif'ney ha'edut b'ohel mvo'ed asher iva'ed l'kha shamah kodesh kadashiym tih'yeh lakhem
translation: Beat some of it into powder, and put some before the Pact in the Tent of Meeting, where I will meet with you; it shall be most holy to you.

hebrew: וְהַקְּטֹ֙רֶת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה בְּמַ֨תְכֻּנְתָּ֔הּ לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ לָכֶ֑ם קֹ֛דֶשׁ תִּהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hak'toret asher ta'aseh b'mat'kun'tah lo ta'asv lakhem kodesh tih'yeh l'kha layhvah
translation: But when you make this incense, you must not make any in the same proportions for yourselves; it shall be held by you sacred to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: אִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה כָמ֖וֹהָ לְהָרִ֣יחַ בָּ֑הּ וְנִכְרַ֖ת מֵעַמָּֽיו׃ (ס)
transliteration: iysh asher-ya'aseh khamvoha l'hariycha bah v'nikh'rat me'amayv (s)
translation: Whoever makes any like it, to smell of it, shall be cut off from his kin.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses:

hebrew: רְאֵ֖ה קָרָ֣אתִֽי בְשֵׁ֑ם בְּצַלְאֵ֛ל בֶּן־אוּרִ֥י בֶן־ח֖וּר לְמַטֵּ֥ה יְהוּדָֽה׃
transliteration: r'eh karatiy v'shem b'tzal'el ben-vriy ven-chvr l'mateh y'hvdah
translation: See, I have singled out by name Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.

hebrew: וָאֲמַלֵּ֥א אֹת֖וֹ ר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֑ים בְּחָכְמָ֛ה וּבִתְבוּנָ֥ה וּבְדַ֖עַת וּבְכָל־מְלָאכָֽה׃
transliteration: vaamale otvo rvcha elohiym b'chakh'mah vvit'vvnah vv'da'at vv'khal-m'lakhah
translation: I have endowed him with a divine spirit of skill, ability, and knowledge in every kind of craft;

hebrew: לַחְשֹׁ֖ב מַחֲשָׁבֹ֑ת לַעֲשׂ֛וֹת בַּזָּהָ֥ב וּבַכֶּ֖סֶף וּבַנְּחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: lach'shov machashavot la'asvot bazahav vvakesef vvan'choshet
translation: to make designs for work in gold, silver, and copper,

hebrew: וּבַחֲרֹ֥שֶׁת אֶ֛בֶן לְמַלֹּ֖את וּבַחֲרֹ֣שֶׁת עֵ֑ץ לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּכָל־מְלָאכָֽה׃
transliteration: vvacharoshet even l'malot vvacharoshet 'etz la'asvot b'khal-m'lakhah
translation: to cut stones for setting and to carve wood—to work in every kind of craft.

hebrew: וַאֲנִ֞י הִנֵּ֧ה נָתַ֣תִּי אִתּ֗וֹ אֵ֣ת אָהֳלִיאָ֞ב בֶּן־אֲחִֽיסָמָךְ֙ לְמַטֵּה־דָ֔ן וּבְלֵ֥ב כָּל־חֲכַם־לֵ֖ב נָתַ֣תִּי חָכְמָ֑ה וְעָשׂ֕וּ אֵ֖ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּיתִֽךָ׃
transliteration: vaaniy hineh natatiy itvo et aholiyav ben-achiysamakh' l'mateh-dan vv'lev kal-chakham-lev natatiy chakh'mah v'asv et kal-asher tziviytikha
translation: Moreover, I have assigned to him Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and I have also granted skill to all who are skillful, that they may make everything that I have commanded you:

hebrew: אֵ֣ת ׀ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֗ד וְאֶת־הָֽאָרֹן֙ לָֽעֵדֻ֔ת וְאֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֖רֶת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֑יו וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־כְּלֵ֥י הָאֹֽהֶל׃
transliteration: et  ohel mvo'ed v'et-haaron la'edut v'et-hakaporet asher 'alayv v'et kal-k'ley haohel
translation: the Tent of Meeting, the Ark for the Pact and the cover upon it, and all the furnishings of the Tent;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ וְאֶת־כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֥ה הַטְּהֹרָ֖ה וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת מִזְבַּ֥ח הַקְּטֹֽרֶת׃
transliteration: v'et-hashul'chan v'et-kelayv v'et-ham'norah hat'horah v'et-kal-keleyha v'et miz'bach hak'toret
translation: the table and its utensils, the pure lampstandaOr “lampstand of pure gold.” and all its fittings, and the altar of incense;

hebrew: וְאֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְאֶת־הַכִּיּ֖וֹר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'et-miz'bach ha'olah v'et-kal-kelayv v'et-hakiyvor v'et-kanvo
translation: the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the laver and its stand;

hebrew: וְאֵ֖ת בִּגְדֵ֣י הַשְּׂרָ֑ד וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו לְכַהֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'et big'dey has'rad v'et-big'dey hakodesh l'aharon hakohen v'et-big'dey vanayv l'khahen
translation: the servicebOthers “plaited.” vestments, the sacral vestments of Aaron the priest and the vestments of his sons, for their service as priests;

hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת שֶׁ֧מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֛ה וְאֶת־קְטֹ֥רֶת הַסַּמִּ֖ים לַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוִּיתִ֖ךָ יַעֲשֽׂוּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'et shemen hamish'chah v'et-k'toret hasamiym lakodesh k'khol asher-tziviytikha ya'asv (f)
translation: as well as the anointing oil and the aromatic incense for the sanctuary. Just as I have commanded you, they shall do.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses:

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה דַּבֵּ֨ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַ֥ךְ אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתַ֖י תִּשְׁמֹ֑רוּ כִּי֩ א֨וֹת הִ֜וא בֵּינִ֤י וּבֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם לָדַ֕עַת כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה מְקַדִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'atah daber el-b'ney yis'rael lemor akh' et-shab'totay tish'morv kiy vot hiv beyniy vveyneykhem l'doroteykhem lada'at kiy aniy y'hvah m'kadish'khem
translation: Speak to the Israelite people and say: Nevertheless, you must keep My sabbaths, for this is a sign between Me and you throughout the ages, that you may know that I the L<small>ORD</small> have consecrated you.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת כִּ֛י קֹ֥דֶשׁ הִ֖וא לָכֶ֑ם מְחַֽלְלֶ֙יהָ֙ מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֔ת כִּ֗י כָּל־הָעֹשֶׂ֥ה בָהּ֙ מְלָאכָ֔ה וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמֶּֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem et-hashabat kiy kodesh hiv lakhem m'chal'leyha mvot yvmat kiy kal-ha'oseh vah m'lakhah v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv mikerev 'ameyha
translation: You shall keep the sabbath, for it is holy for you. He who profanes it shall be put to death: whoever does work on it, that person shall be cut off from among his kin.

hebrew: שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִים֮ יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה מְלָאכָה֒ וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י שַׁבַּ֧ת שַׁבָּת֛וֹן קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַיהוָ֑ה כָּל־הָעֹשֶׂ֧ה מְלָאכָ֛ה בְּי֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֖ת מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: sheshet yamiym ye'aseh m'lakhah vvayvom hash'viy'iy shabat shabatvon kodesh layhvah kal-ha'oseh m'lakhah b'yvom hashabat mvot yvmat
translation: Six days may work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a sabbath of complete rest, holy to the L<small>ORD</small>; whoever does work on the sabbath day shall be put to death.

hebrew: וְשָׁמְר֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶת־הַשַּׁבָּ֑ת לַעֲשׂ֧וֹת אֶת־הַשַּׁבָּ֛ת לְדֹרֹתָ֖ם בְּרִ֥ית עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: v'sham'rv v'ney-yis'rael et-hashabat la'asvot et-hashabat l'dorotam b'riyt 'volam
translation: The Israelite people shall keep the sabbath, observing the sabbath throughout the ages as a covenant for all time:

hebrew: בֵּינִ֗י וּבֵין֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל א֥וֹת הִ֖וא לְעֹלָ֑ם כִּי־שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֗ים עָשָׂ֤ה יְהוָה֙ אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם וְאֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י שָׁבַ֖ת וַיִּנָּפַֽשׁ׃ (ס)
transliteration: beyniy vveyn b'ney yis'rael vot hiv l'olam kiy-sheshet yamiym 'asah y'hvah et-hashamayim v'et-haaretz vvayvom hash'viy'iy shavat vayinafash (s)
translation: it shall be a sign for all time between Me and the people of Israel. For in six days the L<small>ORD</small> made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day He ceased from work and was refreshed.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כְּכַלֹּתוֹ֙ לְדַבֵּ֤ר אִתּוֹ֙ בְּהַ֣ר סִינַ֔י שְׁנֵ֖י לֻחֹ֣ת הָעֵדֻ֑ת לֻחֹ֣ת אֶ֔בֶן כְּתֻבִ֖ים בְּאֶצְבַּ֥ע אֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: vayiten el-mosheh k'khalotvo l'daber itvo b'har siynay sh'ney luchot ha'edut luchot even k'tuviym b'etz'ba' elohiym
translation: When He finished speaking with him on Mount Sinai, He gave Moses the two tablets of the Pact, stone tablets inscribed with the finger of God.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא הָעָ֔ם כִּֽי־בֹשֵׁ֥שׁ מֹשֶׁ֖ה לָרֶ֣דֶת מִן־הָהָ֑ר וַיִּקָּהֵ֨ל הָעָ֜ם עַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ אֵלָיו֙ ק֣וּם ׀ עֲשֵׂה־לָ֣נוּ אֱלֹהִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֵֽלְכוּ֙ לְפָנֵ֔ינוּ כִּי־זֶ֣ה ׀ מֹשֶׁ֣ה הָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֶֽעֱלָ֙נוּ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לֹ֥א יָדַ֖עְנוּ מֶה־הָ֥יָה לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayar' ha'am kiy-voshesh mosheh laredet min-hahar vayikahel ha'am 'al-aharon vayom'rv elayv kvm  'aseh-lanv elohiym asher yel'khv l'faneynv kiy-zeh  mosheh haiysh asher he'elanv meeretz mitz'rayim lo yada'nv meh-hayah lvo
translation: When the people saw that Moses was so long in coming down from the mountain, the people gathered against Aaron and said to him, “Come, make us a god who shall go before us, for that man Moses, who brought us from the land of Egypt—we do not know what has happened to him.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ אַהֲרֹ֔ן פָּֽרְקוּ֙ נִזְמֵ֣י הַזָּהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּאָזְנֵ֣י נְשֵׁיכֶ֔ם בְּנֵיכֶ֖ם וּבְנֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וְהָבִ֖יאוּ אֵלָֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem aharon par'kv niz'mey hazahav asher b'az'ney n'sheykhem b'neykhem vv'noteykhem v'haviyv elay
translation: Aaron said to them, “Take off the gold rings that are on the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring them to me.”

hebrew: וַיִּתְפָּֽרְקוּ֙ כָּל־הָעָ֔ם אֶת־נִזְמֵ֥י הַזָּהָ֖ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּאָזְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיָּבִ֖יאוּ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹֽן׃
transliteration: vayit'par'kv kal-ha'am et-niz'mey hazahav asher b'az'neyhem vayaviyv el-aharon
translation: And all the people took off the gold rings that were in their ears and brought them to Aaron.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח מִיָּדָ֗ם וַיָּ֤צַר אֹתוֹ֙ בַּחֶ֔רֶט וַֽיַּעֲשֵׂ֖הוּ עֵ֣גֶל מַסֵּכָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֵ֤לֶּה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶעֱל֖וּךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayikach miyadam vayatzar otvo bacheret vaya'asehv 'egel masekhah vayom'rv eleh eloheykha yis'rael asher he'elvkha meeretz mitz'rayim
translation: This he took from them and aCf. Zech. 11.13 (beth hayyoṣer, “foundry” ); others “fashioned it with a graving tool.”cast in a mold,-a and made it into a molten calf. And they exclaimed, bOthers “These are your gods.”“This is your god,-b O Israel, who brought you out of the land of Egypt!”

hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא אַהֲרֹ֔ן וַיִּ֥בֶן מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לְפָנָ֑יו וַיִּקְרָ֤א אַֽהֲרֹן֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר חַ֥ג לַיהוָ֖ה מָחָֽר׃
transliteration: vayar' aharon vayiven miz'becha l'fanayv vayik'ra aharon vayomar chag layhvah machar
translation: When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it; and Aaron announced: “Tomorrow shall be a festival of the L<small>ORD</small>!”

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֙ימוּ֙ מִֽמָּחֳרָ֔ת וַיַּעֲל֣וּ עֹלֹ֔ת וַיַּגִּ֖שׁוּ שְׁלָמִ֑ים וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב הָעָם֙ לֶֽאֱכֹ֣ל וְשָׁת֔וֹ וַיָּקֻ֖מוּ לְצַחֵֽק׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayash'kiymv mimachorat vaya'alv 'olot vayagishv sh'lamiym vayeshev ha'am leekhol v'shatvo vayakumv l'tzachek (f)
translation: Early next day, the people offered up burnt offerings and brought sacrifices of well-being; they sat down to eat and drink, and then rose to dance.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה לֶךְ־רֵ֕ד כִּ֚י שִׁחֵ֣ת עַמְּךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶעֱלֵ֖יתָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lekh'-red kiy shichet 'am'kha asher he'eleyta meeretz mitz'rayim
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, “Hurry down, for your people, whom you brought out of the land of Egypt, have acted basely.

hebrew: סָ֣רוּ מַהֵ֗ר מִן־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֔ם עָשׂ֣וּ לָהֶ֔ם עֵ֖גֶל מַסֵּכָ֑ה וַיִּשְׁתַּֽחֲווּ־לוֹ֙ וַיִּזְבְּחוּ־ל֔וֹ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֵ֤לֶּה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶֽעֱל֖וּךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: sarv maher min-haderekh' asher tziviytim 'asv lahem 'egel masekhah vayish'tachavv-lvo vayiz'b'chv-lvo vayom'rv eleh eloheykha yis'rael asher he'elvkha meeretz mitz'rayim
translation: They have been quick to turn aside from the way that I enjoined upon them. They have made themselves a molten calf and bowed low to it and sacrificed to it, saying: ‘This is your god, O Israel, who brought you out of the land of Egypt!’”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֖רֶף הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh raiytiy et-ha'am hazeh v'hineh 'am-k'sheh-'oref hv
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> further said to Moses, “I see that this is a stiffnecked people.

hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ הַנִּ֣יחָה לִּ֔י וְיִֽחַר־אַפִּ֥י בָהֶ֖ם וַאֲכַלֵּ֑ם וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה אוֹתְךָ֖ לְג֥וֹי גָּדֽוֹל׃
transliteration: v'atah haniychah liy v'yichar-apiy vahem vaakhalem v'e'eseh vot'kha l'gvoy gadvol
translation: Now, let Me be, that My anger may blaze forth against them and that I may destroy them, and make of you a great nation.”

hebrew: וַיְחַ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־פְּנֵ֖י יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יו וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לָמָ֤ה יְהוָה֙ יֶחֱרֶ֤ה אַפְּךָ֙ בְּעַמֶּ֔ךָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הוֹצֵ֙אתָ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּכֹ֥חַ גָּד֖וֹל וּבְיָ֥ד חֲזָקָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'chal mosheh et-p'ney y'hvah elohayv vayomer lamah y'hvah yechereh ap'kha b'amekha asher hvotzeta meeretz mitz'rayim b'khocha gadvol vv'yad chazakah
translation: But Moses implored the L<small>ORD</small> his God, saying, “Let not Your anger, O L<small>ORD</small>, blaze forth against Your people, whom You delivered from the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand.

hebrew: לָמָּה֩ יֹאמְר֨וּ מִצְרַ֜יִם לֵאמֹ֗ר בְּרָעָ֤ה הֽוֹצִיאָם֙ לַהֲרֹ֤ג אֹתָם֙ בֶּֽהָרִ֔ים וּ֨לְכַלֹּתָ֔ם מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֑ה שׁ֚וּב מֵחֲר֣וֹן אַפֶּ֔ךָ וְהִנָּחֵ֥ם עַל־הָרָעָ֖ה לְעַמֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: lamah yom'rv mitz'rayim lemor b'ra'ah hvotziyam laharog otam behariym vl'khalotam me'al p'ney haadamah shvv mecharvon apekha v'hinachem 'al-hara'ah l'amekha
translation: Let not the Egyptians say, ‘It was with evil intent that He delivered them, only to kill them off in the mountains and annihilate them from the face of the earth.’ Turn from Your blazing anger, and renounce the plan to punish Your people.

hebrew: זְכֹ֡ר לְאַבְרָהָם֩ לְיִצְחָ֨ק וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל עֲבָדֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֣עְתָּ לָהֶם֮ בָּךְ֒ וַתְּדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אַרְבֶּה֙ אֶֽת־זַרְעֲכֶ֔ם כְּכוֹכְבֵ֖י הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְכָל־הָאָ֨רֶץ הַזֹּ֜את אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֗רְתִּי אֶתֵּן֙ לְזַרְעֲכֶ֔ם וְנָחֲל֖וּ לְעֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: z'khor l'av'raham l'yitz'chak vl'yis'rael 'avadeykha asher nish'ba'ta lahem bakh' vat'daber alehem ar'beh et-zar'akhem k'khvokh'vey hashamayim v'khal-haaretz hazot asher amar'tiy eten l'zar'akhem v'nachalv l'olam
translation: Remember Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, how You swore to them by Your Self and said to them: I will make your offspring as numerous as the stars of heaven, and I will give to your offspring this whole land of which I spoke, to possess forever.”

hebrew: וַיִּנָּ֖חֶם יְהוָ֑ה עַל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לְעַמּֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayinachem y'hvah 'al-hara'ah asher diber la'asvot l'amvo (f)
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> renounced the punishment He had planned to bring upon His people.
