hebrew: וַיִּ֜פֶן וַיֵּ֤רֶד מֹשֶׁה֙ מִן־הָהָ֔ר וּשְׁנֵ֛י לֻחֹ֥ת הָעֵדֻ֖ת בְּיָד֑וֹ לֻחֹ֗ת כְּתֻבִים֙ מִשְּׁנֵ֣י עֶבְרֵיהֶ֔ם מִזֶּ֥ה וּמִזֶּ֖ה הֵ֥ם כְּתֻבִֽים׃
transliteration: vayifen vayered mosheh min-hahar vsh'ney luchot ha'edut b'yadvo luchot k'tuviym mish'ney 'ev'reyhem mizeh vmizeh hem k'tuviym
translation: Thereupon Moses turned and went down from the mountain bearing the two tablets of the Pact, tablets inscribed on both their surfaces: they were inscribed on the one side and on the other.

hebrew: וְהַ֨לֻּחֹ֔ת מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים הֵ֑מָּה וְהַמִּכְתָּ֗ב מִכְתַּ֤ב אֱלֹהִים֙ ה֔וּא חָר֖וּת עַל־הַלֻּחֹֽת׃
transliteration: v'haluchot ma'aseh elohiym hemah v'hamikh'tav mikh'tav elohiym hv charvt 'al-haluchot
translation: The tablets were God’s work, and the writing was God’s writing, incised upon the tablets.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֧ע יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶת־ק֥וֹל הָעָ֖ם בְּרֵעֹ֑ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה ק֥וֹל מִלְחָמָ֖ה בַּֽמַּחֲנֶה׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' y'hvoshu'a et-kvol ha'am b're'oh vayomer el-mosheh kvol mil'chamah bamachaneh
translation: When Joshua heard the sound of the people in its boisterousness, he said to Moses, “There is a cry of war in the camp.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֵ֥ין קוֹל֙ עֲנ֣וֹת גְּבוּרָ֔ה וְאֵ֥ין ק֖וֹל עֲנ֣וֹת חֲלוּשָׁ֑ה ק֣וֹל עַנּ֔וֹת אָנֹכִ֖י שֹׁמֵֽעַ׃
transliteration: vayomer eyn kvol 'anvot g'vvrah v'eyn kvol 'anvot chalvshah kvol 'anvot anokhiy shome'a
translation:
But he answered,
“It is not the sound of the tune of triumph,
Or the sound of the tune of defeat;
It is the sound of song that I hear!”

hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר קָרַב֙ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַיַּ֥רְא אֶת־הָעֵ֖גֶל וּמְחֹלֹ֑ת וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֣ף מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיַּשְׁלֵ֤ךְ מידו [מִיָּדָיו֙] אֶת־הַלֻּחֹ֔ת וַיְשַׁבֵּ֥ר אֹתָ֖ם תַּ֥חַת הָהָֽר׃
transliteration: vay'hiy kaasher karav el-hamachaneh vayar' et-ha'egel vm'cholot vayichar-af mosheh vayash'lekh' mydv [miyadayv] et-haluchot vay'shaber otam tachat hahar
translation: As soon as Moses came near the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, he became enraged; and he hurled the tablets from his hands and shattered them at the foot of the mountain.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־הָעֵ֨גֶל אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשׂוּ֙ וַיִּשְׂרֹ֣ף בָּאֵ֔שׁ וַיִּטְחַ֖ן עַ֣ד אֲשֶׁר־דָּ֑ק וַיִּ֙זֶר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַמַּ֔יִם וַיַּ֖שְׁקְ אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayikach et-ha'egel asher 'asv vayis'rof baesh vayit'chan 'ad asher-dak vayizer 'al-p'ney hamayim vayash'k' et-b'ney yis'rael
translation: He took the calf that they had made and burned it; he ground it to powder and strewed it upon the water and so made the Israelites drink it.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן מֶֽה־עָשָׂ֥ה לְךָ֖ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּֽי־הֵבֵ֥אתָ עָלָ֖יו חֲטָאָ֥ה גְדֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon meh-'asah l'kha ha'am hazeh kiy-heveta 'alayv chataah g'dolah
translation: Moses said to Aaron, “What did this people do to you that you have brought such great sin upon them?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַהֲרֹ֔ן אַל־יִ֥חַר אַ֖ף אֲדֹנִ֑י אַתָּה֙ יָדַ֣עְתָּ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם כִּ֥י בְרָ֖ע הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vayomer aharon al-yichar af adoniy atah yada'ta et-ha'am kiy v'ra' hv
translation: Aaron said, “Let not my lord be enraged. You know that this people is bent on evil.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ לִ֔י עֲשֵׂה־לָ֣נוּ אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֵלְכ֖וּ לְפָנֵ֑ינוּ כִּי־זֶ֣ה ׀ מֹשֶׁ֣ה הָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֶֽעֱלָ֙נוּ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לֹ֥א יָדַ֖עְנוּ מֶה־הָ֥יָה לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayom'rv liy 'aseh-lanv elohiym asher yel'khv l'faneynv kiy-zeh  mosheh haiysh asher he'elanv meeretz mitz'rayim lo yada'nv meh-hayah lvo
translation: They said to me, ‘Make us a god to lead us; for that man Moses, who brought us from the land of Egypt—we do not know what has happened to him.’

hebrew: וָאֹמַ֤ר לָהֶם֙ לְמִ֣י זָהָ֔ב הִתְפָּרָ֖קוּ וַיִּתְּנוּ־לִ֑י וָאַשְׁלִכֵ֣הוּ בָאֵ֔שׁ וַיֵּצֵ֖א הָעֵ֥גֶל הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vaomar lahem l'miy zahav hit'parakv vayit'nv-liy vaash'likhehv vaesh vayetze ha'egel hazeh
translation: So I said to them, ‘Whoever has gold, take it off!’ They gave it to me and I hurled it into the fire and out came this calf!”

hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם כִּ֥י פָרֻ֖עַ ה֑וּא כִּֽי־פְרָעֹ֣ה אַהֲרֹ֔ן לְשִׁמְצָ֖ה בְּקָמֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayar' mosheh et-ha'am kiy faru'a hv kiy-f'ra'oh aharon l'shim'tzah b'kameyhem
translation: Moses saw that the people were out of control—since Aaron had let them get out of control—so that they were a menacecOthers “an object of derision.” to any who might oppose them.

hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֤ד מֹשֶׁה֙ בְּשַׁ֣עַר הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מִ֥י לַיהוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י וַיֵּאָסְפ֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו כָּל־בְּנֵ֥י לֵוִֽי׃
transliteration: vaya'amod mosheh b'sha'ar hamachaneh vayomer miy layhvah elay vayeas'fv elayv kal-b'ney leviy
translation: Moses stood up in the gate of the camp and said, “Whoever is for the L<small>ORD</small>, come here!” And all the Levites rallied to him.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ם כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שִׂ֥ימוּ אִישׁ־חַרְבּ֖וֹ עַל־יְרֵכ֑וֹ עִבְר֨וּ וָשׁ֜וּבוּ מִשַּׁ֤עַר לָשַׁ֙עַר֙ בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְהִרְג֧וּ אִֽישׁ־אֶת־אָחִ֛יו וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶת־רֵעֵ֖הוּ וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶת־קְרֹבֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer lahem koh-amar y'hvah elohey yis'rael siymv iysh-char'bvo 'al-y'rekhvo 'iv'rv vashvvv misha'ar lasha'ar bamachaneh v'hir'gv iysh-et-achiyv v'iysh et-re'ehv v'iysh et-k'rovvo
translation: He said to them, “Thus says the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of Israel: Each of you put sword on thigh, go back and forth from gate to gate throughout the camp, and slay brother, neighbor, and kin.”

hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֥וּ בְנֵֽי־לֵוִ֖י כִּדְבַ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיִּפֹּ֤ל מִן־הָעָם֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא כִּשְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אַלְפֵ֖י אִֽישׁ׃
transliteration: vaya'asv v'ney-leviy kid'var mosheh vayipol min-ha'am bayvom hahv kish'loshet al'fey iysh
translation: The Levites did as Moses had bidden; and some three thousand of the people fell that day.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה מִלְא֨וּ יֶדְכֶ֤ם הַיּוֹם֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה כִּ֛י אִ֥ישׁ בִּבְנ֖וֹ וּבְאָחִ֑יו וְלָתֵ֧ת עֲלֵיכֶ֛ם הַיּ֖וֹם בְּרָכָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh mil'v yed'khem hayvom layhvah kiy iysh biv'nvo vv'achiyv v'latet 'aleykhem hayvom b'rakhah
translation: And Moses said, “Dedicate yourselvesdLit. “fill your hands.” to the LORD this day—for each of you has been against son and brother—that He may bestow a blessing upon you today.”

hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ מִֽמָּחֳרָ֔ת וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם אַתֶּ֥ם חֲטָאתֶ֖ם חֲטָאָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֑ה וְעַתָּה֙ אֶֽעֱלֶ֣ה אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה אוּלַ֥י אֲכַפְּרָ֖ה בְּעַ֥ד חַטַּאתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy mimachorat vayomer mosheh el-ha'am atem chatatem chataah g'dolah v'atah e'eleh el-y'hvah vlay akhap'rah b'ad chatat'khem
translation: The next day Moses said to the people, “You have been guilty of a great sin. Yet I will now go up to the L<small>ORD</small>; perhaps I may win forgiveness for your sin.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֧שָׁב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־יְהוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אָ֣נָּ֗א חָטָ֞א הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ חֲטָאָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֔ה וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י זָהָֽב׃
transliteration: vayashav mosheh el-y'hvah vayomar ana chata ha'am hazeh chataah g'dolah vaya'asv lahem elohey zahav
translation: Moses went back to the L<small>ORD</small> and said, “Alas, this people is guilty of a great sin in making for themselves a god of gold.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה אִם־תִּשָּׂ֣א חַטָּאתָ֑ם וְאִם־אַ֕יִן מְחֵ֣נִי נָ֔א מִֽסִּפְרְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּתָֽבְתָּ׃
transliteration: v'atah im-tisa chatatam v'im-ayin m'cheniy na misif'r'kha asher katav'ta
translation: Now, if You will forgive their sin [well and good]; but if not, erase me from the record which You have written!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה מִ֚י אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָֽטָא־לִ֔י אֶמְחֶ֖נּוּ מִסִּפְרִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh miy asher chata-liy em'chenv misif'riy
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “He who has sinned against Me, him only will I erase from My record.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֞ה לֵ֣ךְ ׀ נְחֵ֣ה אֶת־הָעָ֗ם אֶ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֙רְתִּי֙ לָ֔ךְ הִנֵּ֥ה מַלְאָכִ֖י יֵלֵ֣ךְ לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וּבְי֣וֹם פָּקְדִ֔י וּפָקַדְתִּ֥י עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם חַטָּאתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'atah lekh'  n'cheh et-ha'am el asher-dibar'tiy lakh' hineh mal'akhiy yelekh' l'faneykha vv'yvom pak'diy vfakad'tiy 'aleyhem chatatam
translation: Go now, lead the people where I told you. See, My angel shall go before you. But when I make an accounting, I will bring them to account for their sins.”

hebrew: וַיִּגֹּ֥ף יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־הָעָ֑ם עַ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשׂ֣וּ אֶת־הָעֵ֔גֶל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה אַהֲרֹֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayigof y'hvah et-ha'am 'al asher 'asv et-ha'egel asher 'asah aharon (s)
translation: Then the LORD sent a plague upon the people, eMeaning of Heb. uncertain.for what they did with the calf that Aaron made.-e

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר יְהוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ לֵ֣ךְ עֲלֵ֣ה מִזֶּ֔ה אַתָּ֣ה וְהָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶֽעֱלִ֖יתָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִ֠שְׁבַּעְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֨ם לְיִצְחָ֤ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹב֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְזַרְעֲךָ֖ אֶתְּנֶֽנָּה׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lekh' 'aleh mizeh atah v'ha'am asher he'eliyta meeretz mitz'rayim el-haaretz asher nish'ba'tiy l'av'raham l'yitz'chak vl'ya'akov lemor l'zar'akha et'nenah
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Set out from here, you and the people that you have brought up from the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, ‘To your offspring will I give it’—

hebrew: וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֥י לְפָנֶ֖יךָ מַלְאָ֑ךְ וְגֵֽרַשְׁתִּ֗י אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י וְהַֽחִתִּי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃
transliteration: v'shalach'tiy l'faneykha mal'akh' v'gerash'tiy et-hak'na'aniy haemoriy v'hachitiy v'hap'riziy hachiviy v'hay'vvsiy
translation: I will send an angel before you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites—

hebrew: אֶל־אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָ֑שׁ כִּי֩ לֹ֨א אֶֽעֱלֶ֜ה בְּקִרְבְּךָ֗ כִּ֤י עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֙רֶף֙ אַ֔תָּה פֶּן־אֲכֶלְךָ֖ בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
transliteration: el-eretz zavat chalav vd'vash kiy lo e'eleh b'kir'b'kha kiy 'am-k'sheh-'oref atah pen-akhel'kha badarekh'
translation: a land flowing with milk and honey. But I will not go in your midst, since you are a stiffnecked people, lest I destroy you on the way.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע הָעָ֗ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הָרָ֛ע הַזֶּ֖ה וַיִּתְאַבָּ֑לוּ וְלֹא־שָׁ֛תוּ אִ֥ישׁ עֶדְי֖וֹ עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' ha'am et-hadavar hara' hazeh vayit'abalv v'lo-shatv iysh 'ed'yvo 'alayv
translation: When the people heard this harsh word, they went into mourning, and none put on his finery.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֱמֹ֤ר אֶל־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אַתֶּ֣ם עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֔רֶף רֶ֧גַע אֶחָ֛ד אֶֽעֱלֶ֥ה בְקִרְבְּךָ֖ וְכִלִּיתִ֑יךָ וְעַתָּ֗ה הוֹרֵ֤ד עֶדְיְךָ֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יךָ וְאֵדְעָ֖ה מָ֥ה אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh emor el-b'ney-yis'rael atem 'am-k'sheh-'oref rega' echad e'eleh v'kir'b'kha v'khiliytiykha v'atah hvored 'ed'y'kha me'aleykha v'ed'ah mah e'eseh-lakh'
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Say to the Israelite people, ‘You are a stiffnecked people. If I were to go in your midst for one moment, I would destroy you. Now, then, leave off your finery, and I will consider what to do to you.’”

hebrew: וַיִּֽתְנַצְּל֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־עֶדְיָ֖ם מֵהַ֥ר חוֹרֵֽב׃
transliteration: vayit'natz'lv v'ney-yis'rael et-'ed'yam mehar chvorev
translation: So the Israelites remained stripped of their finery from Mount Horeb on.

hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁה֩ יִקַּ֨ח אֶת־הָאֹ֜הֶל וְנָֽטָה־ל֣וֹ ׀ מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֗ה הַרְחֵק֙ מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְקָ֥רָא ל֖וֹ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהָיָה֙ כָּל־מְבַקֵּ֣שׁ יְהוָ֔ה יֵצֵא֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֖ר מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vmosheh yikach et-haohel v'natah-lvo  michvtz lamachaneh har'chek min-hamachaneh v'kara lvo ohel mvo'ed v'hayah kal-m'vakesh y'hvah yetze el-ohel mvo'ed asher michvtz lamachaneh
translation: Now Moses would take the Tent and pitch it outside the camp, at some distance from the camp. It was called the Tent of Meeting, and whoever sought the L<small>ORD</small> would go out to the Tent of Meeting that was outside the camp.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כְּצֵ֤את מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־הָאֹ֔הֶל יָק֙וּמוּ֙ כָּל־הָעָ֔ם וְנִ֨צְּב֔וּ אִ֖ישׁ פֶּ֣תַח אָהֳל֑וֹ וְהִבִּ֙יטוּ֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה עַד־בֹּא֖וֹ הָאֹֽהֱלָה׃
transliteration: v'hayah k'tzet mosheh el-haohel yakvmv kal-ha'am v'nitz'vv iysh petach aholvo v'hibiytv acharey mosheh 'ad-bovo haohelah
translation: Whenever Moses went out to the Tent, all the people would rise and stand, each at the entrance of his tent, and gaze after Moses until he had entered the Tent.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כְּבֹ֤א מֹשֶׁה֙ הָאֹ֔הֱלָה יֵרֵד֙ עַמּ֣וּד הֶֽעָנָ֔ן וְעָמַ֖ד פֶּ֣תַח הָאֹ֑הֶל וְדִבֶּ֖ר עִם־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'hayah k'vo mosheh haohelah yered 'amvd he'anan v'amad petach haohel v'diber 'im-mosheh
translation: And when Moses entered the Tent, the pillar of cloud would descend and stand at the entrance of the Tent, while He spoke with Moses.

hebrew: וְרָאָ֤ה כָל־הָעָם֙ אֶת־עַמּ֣וּד הֶֽעָנָ֔ן עֹמֵ֖ד פֶּ֣תַח הָאֹ֑הֶל וְקָ֤ם כָּל־הָעָם֙ וְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוּ֔וּ אִ֖ישׁ פֶּ֥תַח אָהֳלֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'raah khal-ha'am et-'amvd he'anan 'omed petach haohel v'kam kal-ha'am v'hish'tachavv iysh petach aholvo
translation: When all the people saw the pillar of cloud poised at the entrance of the Tent, all the people would rise and bow low, each at the entrance of his tent.

hebrew: וְדִבֶּ֨ר יְהוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ פָּנִ֣ים אֶל־פָּנִ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יְדַבֵּ֥ר אִ֖ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְשָׁב֙ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וּמְשָׁ֨רְת֜וֹ יְהוֹשֻׁ֤עַ בִּן־נוּן֙ נַ֔עַר לֹ֥א יָמִ֖ישׁ מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֹֽהֶל׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'diber y'hvah el-mosheh paniym el-paniym kaasher y'daber iysh el-re'ehv v'shav el-hamachaneh vm'shar'tvo y'hvoshu'a bin-nvn na'ar lo yamiysh mitvokh' haohel (s)
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> would speak to Moses face to face, as one man speaks to another. And he would then return to the camp; but his attendant, Joshua son of Nun, a youth, would not stir out of the Tent.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־יְהוָ֗ה רְ֠אֵה אַתָּ֞ה אֹמֵ֤ר אֵלַי֙ הַ֚עַל אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְאַתָּה֙ לֹ֣א הֽוֹדַעְתַּ֔נִי אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־תִּשְׁלַ֖ח עִמִּ֑י וְאַתָּ֤ה אָמַ֙רְתָּ֙ יְדַעְתִּ֣יךָֽ בְשֵׁ֔ם וְגַם־מָצָ֥אתָ חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינָֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-y'hvah r'eh atah omer elay ha'al et-ha'am hazeh v'atah lo hvoda'taniy et asher-tish'lach 'imiy v'atah amar'ta y'da'tiykha v'shem v'gam-matzata chen b'eynay
translation: Moses said to the L<small>ORD</small>, “See, You say to me, ‘Lead this people forward,’ but You have not made known to me whom You will send with me. Further, You have said, ‘I have singled you out by name, and you have, indeed, gained My favor.’

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה אִם־נָא֩ מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֜ן בְּעֵינֶ֗יךָ הוֹדִעֵ֤נִי נָא֙ אֶת־דְּרָכֶ֔ךָ וְאֵדָ֣עֲךָ֔ לְמַ֥עַן אֶמְצָא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ וּרְאֵ֕ה כִּ֥י עַמְּךָ֖ הַגּ֥וֹי הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: v'atah im-na matzatiy chen b'eyneykha hvodi'eniy na et-d'rakhekha v'eda'akha l'ma'an em'tza-chen b'eyneykha vr'eh kiy 'am'kha hagvoy hazeh
translation: Now, if I have truly gained Your favor, pray let me know Your ways, that I may know You and continue in Your favor. Consider, too, that this nation is Your people.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר פָּנַ֥י יֵלֵ֖כוּ וַהֲנִחֹ֥תִי לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomar panay yelekhv vahanichotiy lakh'
translation: And He said, aLit. “My face will go and I will.”“I will go in the lead and will-a lighten your burden.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑יו אִם־אֵ֤ין פָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ הֹלְכִ֔ים אַֽל־תַּעֲלֵ֖נוּ מִזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv im-eyn paneykha hol'khiym al-ta'alenv mizeh
translation: And he said to Him, “Unless You go in the lead, do not make us leave this place.

hebrew: וּבַמֶּ֣ה ׀ יִוָּדַ֣ע אֵפ֗וֹא כִּֽי־מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֤ן בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲנִ֣י וְעַמֶּ֔ךָ הֲל֖וֹא בְּלֶכְתְּךָ֣ עִמָּ֑נוּ וְנִפְלֵ֙ינוּ֙ אֲנִ֣י וְעַמְּךָ֔ מִכָּ֨ל־הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vvameh  yivada' efvo kiy-matzatiy chen b'eyneykha aniy v'amekha halvo b'lekh't'kha 'imanv v'nif'leynv aniy v'am'kha mikal-ha'am asher 'al-p'ney haadamah (f)
translation: For how shall it be known that Your people have gained Your favor unless You go with us, so that we may be distinguished, Your people and I, from every people on the face of the earth?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה גַּ֣ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֑ה כִּֽי־מָצָ֤אתָ חֵן֙ בְּעֵינַ֔י וָאֵדָעֲךָ֖ בְּשֵֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh gam et-hadavar hazeh asher dibar'ta e'eseh kiy-matzata chen b'eynay vaeda'akha b'shem
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “I will also do this thing that you have asked; for you have truly gained My favor and I have singled you out by name.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַרְאֵ֥נִי נָ֖א אֶת־כְּבֹדֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomar har'eniy na et-k'vodekha
translation: He said, “Oh, let me behold Your Presence!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֲנִ֨י אַעֲבִ֤יר כָּל־טוּבִי֙ עַל־פָּנֶ֔יךָ וְקָרָ֧אתִֽי בְשֵׁ֛ם יְהוָ֖ה לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְחַנֹּתִי֙ אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָחֹ֔ן וְרִחַמְתִּ֖י אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲרַחֵֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer aniy a'aviyr kal-tvviy 'al-paneykha v'karatiy v'shem y'hvah l'faneykha v'chanotiy et-asher achon v'richam'tiy et-asher arachem
translation: And He answered, “I will make all My goodness pass before you, and I will proclaim before you the name LORD, bLit. “and I will grant the grace that I will grant and show the compassion that I will show.”and the grace that I grant and the compassion that I show.-b

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹ֥א תוּכַ֖ל לִרְאֹ֣ת אֶת־פָּנָ֑י כִּ֛י לֹֽא־יִרְאַ֥נִי הָאָדָ֖ם וָחָֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer lo tvkhal lir'ot et-panay kiy lo-yir'aniy haadam vachay
translation: But,” He said, “you cannot see My face, for man may not see Me and live.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָ֔ה הִנֵּ֥ה מָק֖וֹם אִתִּ֑י וְנִצַּבְתָּ֖ עַל־הַצּֽוּר׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah hineh makvom itiy v'nitzav'ta 'al-hatzvr
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said, “See, there is a place near Me. Station yourself on the rock

hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּעֲבֹ֣ר כְּבֹדִ֔י וְשַׂמְתִּ֖יךָ בְּנִקְרַ֣ת הַצּ֑וּר וְשַׂכֹּתִ֥י כַפִּ֛י עָלֶ֖יךָ עַד־עָבְרִֽי׃
transliteration: v'hayah ba'avor k'vodiy v'sam'tiykha b'nik'rat hatzvr v'sakotiy khapiy 'aleykha 'ad-'av'riy
translation: and, as My Presence passes by, I will put you in a cleft of the rock and shield you with My hand until I have passed by.

hebrew: וַהֲסִרֹתִי֙ אֶת־כַּפִּ֔י וְרָאִ֖יתָ אֶת־אֲחֹרָ֑י וּפָנַ֖י לֹ֥א יֵרָאֽוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vahasirotiy et-kapiy v'raiyta et-achoray vfanay lo yerav (s)
translation: Then I will take My hand away and you will see My back; but My face must not be seen.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה פְּסָל־לְךָ֛ שְׁנֵֽי־לֻחֹ֥ת אֲבָנִ֖ים כָּרִאשֹׁנִ֑ים וְכָתַבְתִּי֙ עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֔ת אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָי֛וּ עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֥ת הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר שִׁבַּֽרְתָּ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh p'sal-l'kha sh'ney-luchot avaniym karishoniym v'khatav'tiy 'al-haluchot et-had'variym asher hayv 'al-haluchot harishoniym asher shibar'ta
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses: “Carve two tablets of stone like the first, and I will inscribe upon the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you shattered.

hebrew: וֶהְיֵ֥ה נָכ֖וֹן לַבֹּ֑קֶר וְעָלִ֤יתָ בַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ אֶל־הַ֣ר סִינַ֔י וְנִצַּבְתָּ֥ לִ֛י שָׁ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָהָֽר׃
transliteration: veh'yeh nakhvon laboker v'aliyta vaboker el-har siynay v'nitzav'ta liy sham 'al-rosh hahar
translation: Be ready by morning, and in the morning come up to Mount Sinai and present yourself there to Me, on the top of the mountain.

hebrew: וְאִישׁ֙ לֹֽא־יַעֲלֶ֣ה עִמָּ֔ךְ וְגַם־אִ֥ישׁ אַל־יֵרָ֖א בְּכָל־הָהָ֑ר גַּם־הַצֹּ֤אן וְהַבָּקָר֙ אַל־יִרְע֔וּ אֶל־מ֖וּל הָהָ֥ר הַהֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'iysh lo-ya'aleh 'imakh' v'gam-iysh al-yera b'khal-hahar gam-hatzon v'habakar al-yir'v el-mvl hahar hahv
translation: No one else shall come up with you, and no one else shall be seen anywhere on the mountain; neither shall the flocks and the herds graze at the foot of this mountain.”

hebrew: וַיִּפְסֹ֡ל שְׁנֵֽי־לֻחֹ֨ת אֲבָנִ֜ים כָּרִאשֹׁנִ֗ים וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם מֹשֶׁ֤ה בַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ וַיַּ֙עַל֙ אֶל־הַ֣ר סִינַ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ וַיִּקַּ֣ח בְּיָד֔וֹ שְׁנֵ֖י לֻחֹ֥ת אֲבָנִֽים׃
transliteration: vayif'sol sh'ney-luchot avaniym karishoniym vayash'kem mosheh vaboker vaya'al el-har siynay kaasher tzivah y'hvah otvo vayikach b'yadvo sh'ney luchot avaniym
translation: So Moses carved two tablets of stone, like the first, and early in the morning he went up on Mount Sinai, as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded him, taking the two stone tablets with him.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֤רֶד יְהוָה֙ בֶּֽעָנָ֔ן וַיִּתְיַצֵּ֥ב עִמּ֖וֹ שָׁ֑ם וַיִּקְרָ֥א בְשֵׁ֖ם יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayered y'hvah be'anan vayit'yatzev 'imvo sham vayik'ra v'shem y'hvah
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> came down in a cloud; He stood with him there, and proclaimed the name L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֨ר יְהוָ֥ה ׀ עַל־פָּנָיו֮ וַיִּקְרָא֒ יְהוָ֣ה ׀ יְהוָ֔ה אֵ֥ל רַח֖וּם וְחַנּ֑וּן אֶ֥רֶךְ אַפַּ֖יִם וְרַב־חֶ֥סֶד וֶאֱמֶֽת ׀
transliteration: vaya'avor y'hvah  'al-panayv vayik'ra y'hvah  y'hvah el rachvm v'chanvn erekh' apayim v'rav-chesed veemet
translation: The LORD passed before him aOr “and the Lord proclaimed: The Lord! a God compassionate,” etc.; cf. Num. 14.17–18.and proclaimed: “The LORD! the LORD!-a a God compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in kindness and faithfulness,

hebrew: נֹצֵ֥ר חֶ֙סֶד֙ לָאֲלָפִ֔ים נֹשֵׂ֥א עָוֺ֛ן וָפֶ֖שַׁע וְחַטָּאָ֑ה וְנַקֵּה֙ לֹ֣א יְנַקֶּ֔ה פֹּקֵ֣ד ׀ עֲוֺ֣ן אָב֗וֹת עַל־בָּנִים֙ וְעַל־בְּנֵ֣י בָנִ֔ים עַל־שִׁלֵּשִׁ֖ים וְעַל־רִבֵּעִֽים׃
transliteration: notzer chesed laalafiym nose 'avon vafesha' v'chataah v'nakeh lo y'nakeh poked  'avon avvot 'al-baniym v'al-b'ney vaniym 'al-shileshiym v'al-ribe'iym
translation: extending kindness to the thousandth generation, forgiving iniquity, transgression, and sin; yet He does not remit all punishment, but visits the iniquity of parents upon children and children’s children, upon the third and fourth generations.”

hebrew: וַיְמַהֵ֖ר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיִּקֹּ֥ד אַ֖רְצָה וַיִּשְׁתָּֽחוּ׃
transliteration: vay'maher mosheh vayikod ar'tzah vayish'tachv
translation: Moses hastened to bow low to the ground in homage,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר אִם־נָא֩ מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֤ן בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲדֹנָ֔י יֵֽלֶךְ־נָ֥א אֲדֹנָ֖י בְּקִרְבֵּ֑נוּ כִּ֤י עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֙רֶף֙ ה֔וּא וְסָלַחְתָּ֛ לַעֲוֺנֵ֥נוּ וּלְחַטָּאתֵ֖נוּ וּנְחַלְתָּֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer im-na matzatiy chen b'eyneykha adonay yelekh'-na adonay b'kir'benv kiy 'am-k'sheh-'oref hv v'salach'ta la'avonenv vl'chatatenv vn'chal'tanv
translation: and said, “If I have gained Your favor, O Lord, pray, let the Lord go in our midst, even though this is a stiffnecked people. Pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your own!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֣ה אָנֹכִי֮ כֹּרֵ֣ת בְּרִית֒ נֶ֤גֶד כָּֽל־עַמְּךָ֙ אֶעֱשֶׂ֣ה נִפְלָאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹֽא־נִבְרְא֥וּ בְכָל־הָאָ֖רֶץ וּבְכָל־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם וְרָאָ֣ה כָל־הָ֠עָם אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֨ה בְקִרְבּ֜וֹ אֶת־מַעֲשֵׂ֤ה יְהוָה֙ כִּֽי־נוֹרָ֣א ה֔וּא אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י עֹשֶׂ֥ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer hineh anokhiy koret b'riyt neged kal-'am'kha e'eseh nif'laot asher lo-niv'r'v v'khal-haaretz vv'khal-hagvoyim v'raah khal-ha'am asher-atah v'kir'bvo et-ma'aseh y'hvah kiy-nvora hv asher aniy 'oseh 'imakh'
translation: He said: I hereby make a covenant. Before all your people I will work such wonders as have not been wrought on all the earth or in any nation; and all the people bLit. “in whose midst you are.”who are with you-b shall see how awesome are the LORD’s deeds which I will perform for you.

hebrew: שְׁמָ֨ר־לְךָ֔ אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י מְצַוְּךָ֣ הַיּ֑וֹם הִנְנִ֧י גֹרֵ֣שׁ מִפָּנֶ֗יךָ אֶת־הָאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י וְהַחִתִּי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י וְהַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃
transliteration: sh'mar-l'kha et asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom hin'niy goresh mipaneykha et-haemoriy v'hak'na'aniy v'hachitiy v'hap'riziy v'hachiviy v'hay'vvsiy
translation: Mark well what I command you this day. I will drive out before you the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.

hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֗ פֶּן־תִּכְרֹ֤ת בְּרִית֙ לְיוֹשֵׁ֣ב הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֖ה בָּ֣א עָלֶ֑יהָ פֶּן־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְמוֹקֵ֖שׁ בְּקִרְבֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: hishamer l'kha pen-tikh'rot b'riyt l'yvoshev haaretz asher atah ba 'aleyha pen-yih'yeh l'mvokesh b'kir'bekha
translation: Beware of making a covenant with the inhabitants of the land against which you are advancing, lest they be a snare in your midst.

hebrew: כִּ֤י אֶת־מִזְבְּחֹתָם֙ תִּתֹּצ֔וּן וְאֶת־מַצֵּבֹתָ֖ם תְּשַׁבֵּר֑וּן וְאֶת־אֲשֵׁרָ֖יו תִּכְרֹתֽוּן׃
transliteration: kiy et-miz'b'chotam titotzvn v'et-matzevotam t'shabervn v'et-asherayv tikh'rotvn
translation: No, you must tear down their altars, smash their pillars, and cut down their sacred posts;

hebrew: כִּ֛י לֹ֥א תִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה לְאֵ֣ל אַחֵ֑ר כִּ֤י יְהוָה֙ קַנָּ֣א שְׁמ֔וֹ אֵ֥ל קַנָּ֖א הֽוּא׃
transliteration: kiy lo tish'tachaveh l'el acher kiy y'hvah kana sh'mvo el kana hv
translation: for you must not worship any other god, because the L<small>ORD</small>, whose name is Impassioned, is an impassioned God.

hebrew: פֶּן־תִּכְרֹ֥ת בְּרִ֖ית לְיוֹשֵׁ֣ב הָאָ֑רֶץ וְזָנ֣וּ ׀ אַחֲרֵ֣י אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶ֗ם וְזָבְחוּ֙ לֵאלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם וְקָרָ֣א לְךָ֔ וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ מִזִּבְחֽוֹ׃
transliteration: pen-tikh'rot b'riyt l'yvoshev haaretz v'zanv  acharey eloheyhem v'zav'chv leloheyhem v'kara l'kha v'akhal'ta miziv'chvo
translation: You must not make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, for they will lust after their gods and sacrifice to their gods and invite you, and you will eat of their sacrifices.

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ מִבְּנֹתָ֖יו לְבָנֶ֑יךָ וְזָנ֣וּ בְנֹתָ֗יו אַחֲרֵי֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ן וְהִזְנוּ֙ אֶת־בָּנֶ֔יךָ אַחֲרֵ֖י אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽן׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta mib'notayv l'vaneykha v'zanv v'notayv acharey eloheyhen v'hiz'nv et-baneykha acharey eloheyhen
translation: And when you take wives from among their daughters for your sons, their daughters will lust after their gods and will cause your sons to lust after their gods.

hebrew: אֱלֹהֵ֥י מַסֵּכָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: elohey masekhah lo ta'aseh-lakh'
translation: You shall not make molten gods for yourselves.

hebrew: אֶת־חַ֣ג הַמַּצּוֹת֮ תִּשְׁמֹר֒ שִׁבְעַ֨ת יָמִ֜ים תֹּאכַ֤ל מַצּוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֔ךָ לְמוֹעֵ֖ד חֹ֣דֶשׁ הָאָבִ֑יב כִּ֚י בְּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽאָבִ֔יב יָצָ֖אתָ מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: et-chag hamatzvot tish'mor shiv'at yamiym tokhal matzvot asher tziviytikha l'mvo'ed chodesh haaviyv kiy b'chodesh haaviyv yatzata mimitz'rayim
translation: You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread—eating unleavened bread for seven days, as I have commanded you—at the set time of the monthcSee note at 13.4. of Abib, for in the month of Abib you went forth from Egypt.

hebrew: כָּל־פֶּ֥טֶר רֶ֖חֶם לִ֑י וְכָֽל־מִקְנְךָ֙ תִּזָּכָ֔ר פֶּ֖טֶר שׁ֥וֹר וָשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: kal-peter rechem liy v'khal-mik'n'kha tizakhar peter shvor vaseh
translation: Every first issue of the womb is Mine, from all your livestock that drop a maledHeb. tizzakhar, form uncertain. as firstling, whether cattle or sheep.

hebrew: וּפֶ֤טֶר חֲמוֹר֙ תִּפְדֶּ֣ה בְשֶׂ֔ה וְאִם־לֹ֥א תִפְדֶּ֖ה וַעֲרַפְתּ֑וֹ כֹּ֣ל בְּכ֤וֹר בָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ תִּפְדֶּ֔ה וְלֹֽא־יֵרָא֥וּ פָנַ֖י רֵיקָֽם׃
transliteration: vfeter chamvor tif'deh v'seh v'im-lo tif'deh va'araf'tvo kol b'khvor baneykha tif'deh v'lo-yerav fanay reykam
translation:
But the firstling of an ass you shall redeem with a sheep; if you do not redeem it, you must break its neck. And you must redeem every first-born among your sons.
None shall appear before Me empty-handed.

hebrew: שֵׁ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ תַּעֲבֹ֔ד וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י תִּשְׁבֹּ֑ת בֶּחָרִ֥ישׁ וּבַקָּצִ֖יר תִּשְׁבֹּֽת׃
transliteration: sheshet yamiym ta'avod vvayvom hash'viy'iy tish'bot bechariysh vvakatziyr tish'bot
translation: Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall cease from labor; you shall cease from labor even at plowing time and harvest time.

hebrew: וְחַ֤ג שָׁבֻעֹת֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה לְךָ֔ בִּכּוּרֵ֖י קְצִ֣יר חִטִּ֑ים וְחַג֙ הָֽאָסִ֔יף תְּקוּפַ֖ת הַשָּׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: v'chag shavu'ot ta'aseh l'kha bikvrey k'tziyr chitiym v'chag haasiyf t'kvfat hashanah
translation: You shall observe the Feast of Weeks, of the first fruits of the wheat harvest; and the Feast of Ingathering at the turn of the year.

hebrew: שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה יֵרָאֶה֙ כָּל־זְכ֣וּרְךָ֔ אֶת־פְּנֵ֛י הָֽאָדֹ֥ן ׀ יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: shalosh p'amiym bashanah yeraeh kal-z'khvr'kha et-p'ney haadon  y'hvah elohey yis'rael
translation: Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Sovereign L<small>ORD</small>, the God of Israel.

hebrew: כִּֽי־אוֹרִ֤ישׁ גּוֹיִם֙ מִפָּנֶ֔יךָ וְהִרְחַבְתִּ֖י אֶת־גְּבוּלֶ֑ךָ וְלֹא־יַחְמֹ֥ד אִישׁ֙ אֶֽת־אַרְצְךָ֔ בַּעֲלֹֽתְךָ֗ לֵרָאוֹת֙ אֶת־פְּנֵי֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: kiy-voriysh gvoyim mipaneykha v'hir'chav'tiy et-g'vvlekha v'lo-yach'mod iysh et-ar'tz'kha ba'alot'kha leravot et-p'ney y'hvah eloheykha shalosh p'amiym bashanah
translation: I will drive out nations from your path and enlarge your territory; no one will covet your land when you go up to appear before the L<small>ORD</small> your God three times a year.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תִשְׁחַ֥ט עַל־חָמֵ֖ץ דַּם־זִבְחִ֑י וְלֹא־יָלִ֣ין לַבֹּ֔קֶר זֶ֖בַח חַ֥ג הַפָּֽסַח׃
transliteration: lo-tish'chat 'al-chametz dam-ziv'chiy v'lo-yaliyn laboker zevach chag hapasach
translation: You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with anything leavened; and the sacrifice of the Feast of Passover shall not be left lying until morning.

hebrew: רֵאשִׁ֗ית בִּכּוּרֵי֙ אַדְמָ֣תְךָ֔ תָּבִ֕יא בֵּ֖ית יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לֹא־תְבַשֵּׁ֥ל גְּדִ֖י בַּחֲלֵ֥ב אִמּֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: reshiyt bikvrey ad'mat'kha taviy beyt y'hvah eloheykha lo-t'vashel g'diy bachalev imvo (f)
translation:
The choice first fruits of your soil you shall bring to the house of the LORD your God.
You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כְּתָב־לְךָ֖ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה כִּ֞י עַל־פִּ֣י ׀ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה כָּרַ֧תִּי אִתְּךָ֛ בְּרִ֖ית וְאֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh k'tav-l'kha et-had'variym haeleh kiy 'al-piy  had'variym haeleh karatiy it'kha b'riyt v'et-yis'rael
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses: Write down these commandments, for in accordance with these commandments I make a covenant with you and with Israel.

hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־שָׁ֣ם עִם־יְהוָ֗ה אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יוֹם֙ וְאַרְבָּעִ֣ים לַ֔יְלָה לֶ֚חֶם לֹ֣א אָכַ֔ל וּמַ֖יִם לֹ֣א שָׁתָ֑ה וַיִּכְתֹּ֣ב עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֗ת אֵ֚ת דִּבְרֵ֣י הַבְּרִ֔ית עֲשֶׂ֖רֶת הַדְּבָרִֽים׃
transliteration: vay'hiy-sham 'im-y'hvah ar'ba'iym yvom v'ar'ba'iym lay'lah lechem lo akhal vmayim lo shatah vayikh'tov 'al-haluchot et div'rey hab'riyt 'aseret had'variym
translation: And he was there with the L<small>ORD</small> forty days and forty nights; he ate no bread and drank no water; and he wrote down on the tablets the terms of the covenant, the Ten Commandments.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּרֶ֤דֶת מֹשֶׁה֙ מֵהַ֣ר סִינַ֔י וּשְׁנֵ֨י לֻחֹ֤ת הָֽעֵדֻת֙ בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בְּרִדְתּ֖וֹ מִן־הָהָ֑ר וּמֹשֶׁ֣ה לֹֽא־יָדַ֗ע כִּ֥י קָרַ֛ן ע֥וֹר פָּנָ֖יו בְּדַבְּר֥וֹ אִתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy b'redet mosheh mehar siynay vsh'ney luchot ha'edut b'yad-mosheh b'rid'tvo min-hahar vmosheh lo-yada' kiy karan 'vor panayv b'dab'rvo itvo
translation: So Moses came down from Mount Sinai. And as Moses came down from the mountain bearing the two tablets of the Pact, Moses was not aware that the skin of his face was radiant, since he had spoken with Him.

hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְכָל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה קָרַ֖ן ע֣וֹר פָּנָ֑יו וַיִּֽירְא֖וּ מִגֶּ֥שֶׁת אֵלָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayar' aharon v'khal-b'ney yis'rael et-mosheh v'hineh karan 'vor panayv vayiyr'v migeshet elayv
translation: Aaron and all the Israelites saw that the skin of Moses’ face was radiant; and they shrank from coming near him.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֲלֵהֶם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיָּשֻׁ֧בוּ אֵלָ֛יו אַהֲרֹ֥ן וְכָל־הַנְּשִׂאִ֖ים בָּעֵדָ֑ה וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayik'ra alehem mosheh vayashuvv elayv aharon v'khal-han'siiym ba'edah vay'daber mosheh alehem
translation: But Moses called to them, and Aaron and all the chieftains in the assembly returned to him, and Moses spoke to them.

hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֥ן נִגְּשׁ֖וּ כָּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיְצַוֵּ֕ם אֵת֩ כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אִתּ֖וֹ בְּהַ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
transliteration: v'acharey-khen nig'shv kal-b'ney yis'rael vay'tzavem et kal-asher diber y'hvah itvo b'har siynay
translation: Afterward all the Israelites came near, and he instructed them concerning all that the L<small>ORD</small> had imparted to him on Mount Sinai.

hebrew: וַיְכַ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֔ה מִדַּבֵּ֖ר אִתָּ֑ם וַיִּתֵּ֥ן עַל־פָּנָ֖יו מַסְוֶֽה׃
transliteration: vay'khal mosheh midaber itam vayiten 'al-panayv mas'veh
translation: And when Moses had finished speaking with them, he put a veil over his face.

hebrew: וּבְבֹ֨א מֹשֶׁ֜ה לִפְנֵ֤י יְהוָה֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ יָסִ֥יר אֶת־הַמַּסְוֶ֖ה עַד־צֵאת֑וֹ וְיָצָ֗א וְדִבֶּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְצֻוֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vv'vo mosheh lif'ney y'hvah l'daber itvo yasiyr et-hamas'veh 'ad-tzetvo v'yatza v'diber el-b'ney yis'rael et asher y'tzuveh
translation: Whenever Moses went in before the L<small>ORD</small> to speak with Him, he would leave the veil off until he came out; and when he came out and told the Israelites what he had been commanded,

hebrew: וְרָא֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה כִּ֣י קָרַ֔ן ע֖וֹר פְּנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֑ה וְהֵשִׁ֨יב מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶת־הַמַּסְוֶה֙ עַל־פָּנָ֔יו עַד־בֹּא֖וֹ לְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'rav v'ney-yis'rael et-p'ney mosheh kiy karan 'vor p'ney mosheh v'heshiyv mosheh et-hamas'veh 'al-panayv 'ad-bovo l'daber itvo (s)
translation: the Israelites would see how radiant the skin of Moses’ face was. Moses would then put the veil back over his face until he went in to speak with Him.

hebrew: וַיַּקְהֵ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶֽת־כָּל־עֲדַ֛ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אֵ֚לֶּה הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayak'hel mosheh et-kal-'adat b'ney yis'rael vayomer alehem eleh had'variym asher-tzivah y'hvah la'asot otam
translation:
Moses then convoked the whole Israelite community and said to them:
These are the things that the LORD has commanded you to do:

hebrew: שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִים֮ תֵּעָשֶׂ֣ה מְלָאכָה֒ וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י יִהְיֶ֨ה לָכֶ֥ם קֹ֛דֶשׁ שַׁבַּ֥ת שַׁבָּת֖וֹן לַיהוָ֑ה כָּל־הָעֹשֶׂ֥ה ב֛וֹ מְלָאכָ֖ה יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: sheshet yamiym te'aseh m'lakhah vvayvom hash'viy'iy yih'yeh lakhem kodesh shabat shabatvon layhvah kal-ha'oseh vvo m'lakhah yvmat
translation: On six days work may be done, but on the seventh day you shall have a sabbath of complete rest, holy to the L<small>ORD</small>; whoever does any work on it shall be put to death.

hebrew: לֹא־תְבַעֲר֣וּ אֵ֔שׁ בְּכֹ֖ל מֹשְׁבֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם בְּי֖וֹם הַשַּׁבָּֽת׃ (פ)
transliteration: lo-t'va'arv esh b'khol mosh'voteykhem b'yvom hashabat (f)
translation: You shall kindle no fire throughout your settlements on the sabbath day.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־כָּל־עֲדַ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael lemor zeh hadavar asher-tzivah y'hvah lemor
translation:
Moses said further to the whole community of Israelites:
This is what the LORD has commanded:

hebrew: קְח֨וּ מֵֽאִתְּכֶ֤ם תְּרוּמָה֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה כֹּ֚ל נְדִ֣יב לִבּ֔וֹ יְבִיאֶ֕הָ אֵ֖ת תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה זָהָ֥ב וָכֶ֖סֶף וּנְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: k'chv meit'khem t'rvmah layhvah kol n'diyv libvo y'viyeha et t'rvmat y'hvah zahav vakhesef vn'choshet
translation: Take from among you gifts to the L<small>ORD</small>; everyone whose heart so moves him shall bring them—gifts for the L<small>ORD</small>: gold, silver, and copper;

hebrew: וּתְכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ וְעִזִּֽים׃
transliteration: vt'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh v'iziym
translation: aSee 25.4 ff. and the notes there.blue, purple, and crimson yarns, fine linen, and goats’ hair;

hebrew: וְעֹרֹ֨ת אֵילִ֧ם מְאָדָּמִ֛ים וְעֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים וַעֲצֵ֥י שִׂטִּֽים׃
transliteration: v'orot eylim m'adamiym v'orot t'chashiym va'atzey sitiym
translation: tanned ram skins, dolphin skins, and acacia wood;

hebrew: וְשֶׁ֖מֶן לַמָּא֑וֹר וּבְשָׂמִים֙ לְשֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְלִקְטֹ֖רֶת הַסַּמִּֽים׃
transliteration: v'shemen lamavor vv'samiym l'shemen hamish'chah v'lik'toret hasamiym
translation: oil for lighting, spices for the anointing oil and for the aromatic incense;

hebrew: וְאַ֨בְנֵי־שֹׁ֔הַם וְאַבְנֵ֖י מִלֻּאִ֑ים לָאֵפ֖וֹד וְלַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
transliteration: v'av'ney-shoham v'av'ney miluiym laefvod v'lachoshen
translation: lapis lazuli and other stones for setting, for the ephod and the breastpiece.

hebrew: וְכָל־חֲכַם־לֵ֖ב בָּכֶ֑ם יָבֹ֣אוּ וְיַעֲשׂ֔וּ אֵ֛ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖ה יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'khal-chakham-lev bakhem yavov v'ya'asv et kal-asher tzivah y'hvah
translation: And let all among you who are skilled come and make all that the L<small>ORD</small> has commanded:

hebrew: אֶת־הַ֨מִּשְׁכָּ֔ן אֶֽת־אָהֳל֖וֹ וְאֶת־מִכְסֵ֑הוּ אֶת־קְרָסָיו֙ וְאֶת־קְרָשָׁ֔יו אֶת־בְּרִיחָ֕ו אֶת־עַמֻּדָ֖יו וְאֶת־אֲדָנָֽיו׃
transliteration: et-hamish'kan et-aholvo v'et-mikh'sehv et-k'rasayv v'et-k'rashayv et-b'riychav et-'amudayv v'et-adanayv
translation: the Tabernacle, its tent and its covering, its clasps and its planks, its bars, its posts, and its sockets;

hebrew: אֶת־הָאָרֹ֥ן וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֑רֶת וְאֵ֖ת פָּרֹ֥כֶת הַמָּסָֽךְ׃
transliteration: et-haaron v'et-badayv et-hakaporet v'et parokhet hamasakh'
translation: the ark and its poles, the cover, and the curtain for the screen;

hebrew: אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֥ן וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְאֵ֖ת לֶ֥חֶם הַפָּנִֽים׃
transliteration: et-hashul'chan v'et-badayv v'et-kal-kelayv v'et lechem hapaniym
translation: the table, and its poles and all its utensils; and the bread of display;

hebrew: וְאֶת־מְנֹרַ֧ת הַמָּא֛וֹר וְאֶת־כֵּלֶ֖יהָ וְאֶת־נֵרֹתֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת שֶׁ֥מֶן הַמָּאֽוֹר׃
transliteration: v'et-m'norat hamavor v'et-keleyha v'et-neroteyha v'et shemen hamavor
translation: the lampstand for lighting, its furnishings and its lamps, and the oil for lighting;

hebrew: וְאֶת־מִזְבַּ֤ח הַקְּטֹ֙רֶת֙ וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֔יו וְאֵת֙ שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת קְטֹ֣רֶת הַסַּמִּ֑ים וְאֶת־מָסַ֥ךְ הַפֶּ֖תַח לְפֶ֥תַח הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
transliteration: v'et-miz'bach hak'toret v'et-badayv v'et shemen hamish'chah v'et k'toret hasamiym v'et-masakh' hapetach l'fetach hamish'kan
translation: the altar of incense and its poles; the anointing oil and the aromatic incense; and the entrance screen for the entrance of the Tabernacle;

hebrew: אֵ֣ת ׀ מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֗ה וְאֶת־מִכְבַּ֤ר הַנְּחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ אֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֑יו אֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֖ר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: et  miz'bach ha'olah v'et-mikh'bar han'choshet asher-lvo et-badayv v'et-kal-kelayv et-hakiyor v'et-kanvo
translation: the altar of burnt offering, its copper grating, its poles, and all its furnishings; the laver and its stand;

hebrew: אֵ֚ת קַלְעֵ֣י הֶחָצֵ֔ר אֶת־עַמֻּדָ֖יו וְאֶת־אֲדָנֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֕ת מָסַ֖ךְ שַׁ֥עַר הֶחָצֵֽר׃
transliteration: et kal'ey hechatzer et-'amudayv v'et-adaneyha v'et masakh' sha'ar hechatzer
translation: the hangings of the enclosure, its posts and its sockets, and the screen for the gate of the court;

hebrew: אֶת־יִתְדֹ֧ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן וְאֶת־יִתְדֹ֥ת הֶחָצֵ֖ר וְאֶת־מֵיתְרֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: et-yit'dot hamish'kan v'et-yit'dot hechatzer v'et-meyt'reyhem
translation: the pegs for the Tabernacle, the pegs for the enclosure, and their cords;

hebrew: אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י הַשְּׂרָ֖ד לְשָׁרֵ֣ת בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו לְכַהֵֽן׃
transliteration: et-big'dey has'rad l'sharet bakodesh et-big'dey hakodesh l'aharon hakohen v'et-big'dey vanayv l'khahen
translation: the service vestments for officiating in the sanctuary, the sacral vestments of Aaron the priest and the vestments of his sons for priestly service.

hebrew: וַיֵּֽצְא֛וּ כָּל־עֲדַ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִלִּפְנֵ֥י מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayetz'v kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael milif'ney mosheh
translation: So the whole community of the Israelites left Moses’ presence.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֕אוּ כָּל־אִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־נְשָׂא֣וֹ לִבּ֑וֹ וְכֹ֡ל אֲשֶׁר֩ נָדְבָ֨ה רוּח֜וֹ אֹת֗וֹ הֵ֠בִיאוּ אֶת־תְּרוּמַ֨ת יְהוָ֜ה לִמְלֶ֨אכֶת אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ וּלְכָל־עֲבֹ֣דָת֔וֹ וּלְבִגְדֵ֖י הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: vayavov kal-iysh asher-n'savo libvo v'khol asher nad'vah rvchvo otvo heviyv et-t'rvmat y'hvah lim'lekhet ohel mvo'ed vl'khal-'avodatvo vl'vig'dey hakodesh
translation: And everyone who excelled in ability and everyone whose spirit moved him came, bringing to the L<small>ORD</small> his offering for the work of the Tent of Meeting and for all its service and for the sacral vestments.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים עַל־הַנָּשִׁ֑ים כֹּ֣ל ׀ נְדִ֣יב לֵ֗ב הֵ֠בִיאוּ חָ֣ח וָנֶ֜זֶם וְטַבַּ֤עַת וְכוּמָז֙ כָּל־כְּלִ֣י זָהָ֔ב וְכָל־אִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵנִ֛יף תְּנוּפַ֥ת זָהָ֖ב לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayavov haanashiym 'al-hanashiym kol  n'diyv lev heviyv chach vanezem v'taba'at v'khvmaz kal-k'liy zahav v'khal-iysh asher heniyf t'nvfat zahav layhvah
translation: Men and women, all whose hearts moved them, all who would make an elevation offering of gold to the LORD, came bringing brooches, earrings, rings, and pendantsbMeaning of Heb. kumaz uncertain.—gold objects of all kinds.

hebrew: וְכָל־אִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־נִמְצָ֣א אִתּ֗וֹ תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ וְעִזִּ֑ים וְעֹרֹ֨ת אֵילִ֧ם מְאָדָּמִ֛ים וְעֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים הֵבִֽיאוּ׃
transliteration: v'khal-iysh asher-nim'tza itvo t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh v'iziym v'orot eylim m'adamiym v'orot t'chashiym heviyv
translation: And everyone who had in his possession blue, purple, and crimson yarns, fine linen, goats’ hair, tanned ram skins, and dolphin skins, brought them;

hebrew: כָּל־מֵרִ֗ים תְּר֤וּמַת כֶּ֙סֶף֙ וּנְחֹ֔שֶׁת הֵבִ֕יאוּ אֵ֖ת תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה וְכֹ֡ל אֲשֶׁר֩ נִמְצָ֨א אִתּ֜וֹ עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֛ים לְכָל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת הָעֲבֹדָ֖ה הֵבִֽיאוּ׃
transliteration: kal-meriym t'rvmat kesef vn'choshet heviyv et t'rvmat y'hvah v'khol asher nim'tza itvo 'atzey shitiym l'khal-m'lekhet ha'avodah heviyv
translation: everyone who would make gifts of silver or copper brought them as gifts for the L<small>ORD</small>; and everyone who had in his possession acacia wood for any work of the service brought that.

hebrew: וְכָל־אִשָּׁ֥ה חַכְמַת־לֵ֖ב בְּיָדֶ֣יהָ טָו֑וּ וַיָּבִ֣יאוּ מַטְוֶ֗ה אֶֽת־הַתְּכֵ֙לֶת֙ וְאֶת־הָֽאַרְגָּמָ֔ן אֶת־תּוֹלַ֥עַת הַשָּׁנִ֖י וְאֶת־הַשֵּֽׁשׁ׃
transliteration: v'khal-ishah chakh'mat-lev b'yadeyha tavv vayaviyv mat'veh et-hat'khelet v'et-haar'gaman et-tvola'at hashaniy v'et-hashesh
translation: And all the skilled women spun with their own hands, and brought what they had spun, in blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and in fine linen.

hebrew: וְכָל־הַ֨נָּשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָשָׂ֥א לִבָּ֛ן אֹתָ֖נָה בְּחָכְמָ֑ה טָו֖וּ אֶת־הָעִזִּֽים׃
transliteration: v'khal-hanashiym asher nasa liban otanah b'chakh'mah tavv et-ha'iziym
translation: And all the women who excelled in that skill spun the goats’ hair.

hebrew: וְהַנְּשִׂאִ֣ם הֵבִ֔יאוּ אֵ֚ת אַבְנֵ֣י הַשֹּׁ֔הַם וְאֵ֖ת אַבְנֵ֣י הַמִּלֻּאִ֑ים לָאֵפ֖וֹד וְלַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
transliteration: v'han'siim heviyv et av'ney hashoham v'et av'ney hamiluiym laefvod v'lachoshen
translation: And the chieftains brought lapis lazuli and other stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַבֹּ֖שֶׂם וְאֶת־הַשָּׁ֑מֶן לְמָא֕וֹר וּלְשֶׁ֙מֶן֙ הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְלִקְטֹ֖רֶת הַסַּמִּֽים׃
transliteration: v'et-habosem v'et-hashamen l'mavor vl'shemen hamish'chah v'lik'toret hasamiym
translation: and spices and oil for lighting, for the anointing oil, and for the aromatic incense.

hebrew: כָּל־אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשָּׁ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָדַ֣ב לִבָּם֮ אֹתָם֒ לְהָבִיא֙ לְכָל־הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֑ה הֵבִ֧יאוּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל נְדָבָ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: kal-iysh v'ishah asher nadav libam otam l'haviy l'khal-ham'lakhah asher tzivah y'hvah la'asvot b'yad-mosheh heviyv v'ney-yis'rael n'davah layhvah (f)
translation: Thus the Israelites, all the men and women whose hearts moved them to bring anything for the work that the L<small>ORD</small>, through Moses, had commanded to be done, brought it as a freewill offering to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רְא֛וּ קָרָ֥א יְהוָ֖ה בְּשֵׁ֑ם בְּצַלְאֵ֛ל בֶּן־אוּרִ֥י בֶן־ח֖וּר לְמַטֵּ֥ה יְהוּדָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-b'ney yis'rael r'v kara y'hvah b'shem b'tzal'el ben-vriy ven-chvr l'mateh y'hvdah
translation: And Moses said to the Israelites: See, the L<small>ORD</small> has singled out by name Bezalel, son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.

hebrew: וַיְמַלֵּ֥א אֹת֖וֹ ר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֑ים בְּחָכְמָ֛ה בִּתְבוּנָ֥ה וּבְדַ֖עַת וּבְכָל־מְלָאכָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'male otvo rvcha elohiym b'chakh'mah bit'vvnah vv'da'at vv'khal-m'lakhah
translation: He has endowed him with a divine spirit of skill, ability, and knowledge in every kind of craft

hebrew: וְלַחְשֹׁ֖ב מַֽחַשָׁבֹ֑ת לַעֲשֹׂ֛ת בַּזָּהָ֥ב וּבַכֶּ֖סֶף וּבַנְּחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: v'lach'shov machashavot la'asot bazahav vvakesef vvan'choshet
translation: and cMoved up from v. 34 for clarity.has inspired him-c to make designs for work in gold, silver, and copper,

hebrew: וּבַחֲרֹ֥שֶׁת אֶ֛בֶן לְמַלֹּ֖את וּבַחֲרֹ֣שֶׁת עֵ֑ץ לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּכָל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת מַחֲשָֽׁבֶת׃
transliteration: vvacharoshet even l'malot vvacharoshet 'etz la'asvot b'khal-m'lekhet machashavet
translation: to cut stones for setting and to carve wood—to work in every kind of designer’s craft—

hebrew: וּלְהוֹרֹ֖ת נָתַ֣ן בְּלִבּ֑וֹ ה֕וּא וְאָֽהֳלִיאָ֥ב בֶּן־אֲחִיסָמָ֖ךְ לְמַטֵּה־דָֽן׃
transliteration: vl'hvorot natan b'libvo hv v'aholiyav ben-achiysamakh' l'mateh-dan
translation: and to give directions. He and Oholiab son of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan

hebrew: מִלֵּ֨א אֹתָ֜ם חָכְמַת־לֵ֗ב לַעֲשׂוֹת֮ כָּל־מְלֶ֣אכֶת חָרָ֣שׁ ׀ וְחֹשֵׁב֒ וְרֹקֵ֞ם בַּתְּכֵ֣לֶת וּבָֽאַרְגָּמָ֗ן בְּתוֹלַ֧עַת הַשָּׁנִ֛י וּבַשֵּׁ֖שׁ וְאֹרֵ֑ג עֹשֵׂי֙ כָּל־מְלָאכָ֔ה וְחֹשְׁבֵ֖י מַחֲשָׁבֹֽת׃
transliteration: mile otam chakh'mat-lev la'asvot kal-m'lekhet charash  v'choshev v'rokem bat'khelet vvaar'gaman b'tvola'at hashaniy vvashesh v'oreg 'osey kal-m'lakhah v'chosh'vey machashavot
translation: have been endowed with the skill to do any work—of the carver, the designer, the embroiderer in blue, purple, crimson yarns, and in fine linen, and of the weaver—as workers in all crafts and as makers of designs.

hebrew: וְעָשָׂה֩ בְצַלְאֵ֨ל וְאָהֳלִיאָ֜ב וְכֹ֣ל ׀ אִ֣ישׁ חֲכַם־לֵ֗ב אֲשֶׁר֩ נָתַ֨ן יְהוָ֜ה חָכְמָ֤ה וּתְבוּנָה֙ בָּהֵ֔מָּה לָדַ֣עַת לַעֲשֹׂ֔ת אֶֽת־כָּל־מְלֶ֖אכֶת עֲבֹדַ֣ת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ לְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖ה יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'asah v'tzal'el v'aholiyav v'khol  iysh chakham-lev asher natan y'hvah chakh'mah vt'vvnah bahemah lada'at la'asot et-kal-m'lekhet 'avodat hakodesh l'khol asher-tzivah y'hvah
translation: Let, then, Bezalel and Oholiab and all the skilled persons whom the L<small>ORD</small> has endowed with skill and ability to perform expertly all the tasks connected with the service of the sanctuary carry out all that the L<small>ORD</small> has commanded.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶל־בְּצַלְאֵ֘ל וְאֶל־אָֽהֳלִיאָב֒ וְאֶל֙ כָּל־אִ֣ישׁ חֲכַם־לֵ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧ן יְהוָ֛ה חָכְמָ֖ה בְּלִבּ֑וֹ כֹּ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר נְשָׂא֣וֹ לִבּ֔וֹ לְקָרְבָ֥ה אֶל־הַמְּלָאכָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת אֹתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayik'ra mosheh el-b'tzal'el v'el-aholiyav v'el kal-iysh chakham-lev asher natan y'hvah chakh'mah b'libvo kol asher n'savo libvo l'kar'vah el-ham'lakhah la'asot otah
translation: Moses then called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every skilled person whom the L<small>ORD</small> had endowed with skill, everyone who excelled in ability, to undertake the task and carry it out.

hebrew: וַיִּקְח֞וּ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֵ֤ת כָּל־הַתְּרוּמָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵבִ֜יאוּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לִמְלֶ֛אכֶת עֲבֹדַ֥ת הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ לַעֲשֹׂ֣ת אֹתָ֑הּ וְ֠הֵם הֵבִ֨יאוּ אֵלָ֥יו ע֛וֹד נְדָבָ֖ה בַּבֹּ֥קֶר בַּבֹּֽקֶר׃
transliteration: vayik'chv milif'ney mosheh et kal-hat'rvmah asher heviyv b'ney yis'rael lim'lekhet 'avodat hakodesh la'asot otah v'hem heviyv elayv 'vod n'davah baboker baboker
translation: They took over from Moses all the gifts that the Israelites had brought, to carry out the tasks connected with the service of the sanctuary. But when these continued to bring freewill offerings to him morning after morning,

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ כָּל־הַ֣חֲכָמִ֔ים הָעֹשִׂ֕ים אֵ֖ת כָּל־מְלֶ֣אכֶת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ אִֽישׁ־אִ֥ישׁ מִמְּלַאכְתּ֖וֹ אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֥מָּה עֹשִֽׂים׃
transliteration: vayavov kal-hachakhamiym ha'osiym et kal-m'lekhet hakodesh iysh-iysh mim'lakh'tvo asher-hemah 'osiym
translation: all the artisans who were engaged in the tasks of the sanctuary came, each from the task upon which he was engaged,

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה לֵּאמֹ֔ר מַרְבִּ֥ים הָעָ֖ם לְהָבִ֑יא מִדֵּ֤י הָֽעֲבֹדָה֙ לַמְּלָאכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת אֹתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayom'rv el-mosheh lemor mar'biym ha'am l'haviy midey ha'avodah lam'lakhah asher-tzivah y'hvah la'asot otah
translation: and said to Moses, “The people are bringing more than is needed for the tasks entailed in the work that the L<small>ORD</small> has commanded to be done.”

hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיַּעֲבִ֨ירוּ ק֥וֹל בַּֽמַּחֲנֶה֮ לֵאמֹר֒ אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשָּׁ֗ה אַל־יַעֲשׂוּ־ע֛וֹד מְלָאכָ֖ה לִתְרוּמַ֣ת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וַיִּכָּלֵ֥א הָעָ֖ם מֵהָבִֽיא׃
transliteration: vay'tzav mosheh vaya'aviyrv kvol bamachaneh lemor iysh v'ishah al-ya'asv-'vod m'lakhah lit'rvmat hakodesh vayikale ha'am mehaviy
translation: Moses thereupon had this proclamation made throughout the camp: “Let no man or woman make further effort toward gifts for the sanctuary!” So the people stopped bringing:

hebrew: וְהַמְּלָאכָ֗ה הָיְתָ֥ה דַיָּ֛ם לְכָל־הַמְּלָאכָ֖ה לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת אֹתָ֑הּ וְהוֹתֵֽר׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'ham'lakhah hay'tah dayam l'khal-ham'lakhah la'asvot otah v'hvoter (s)
translation: their efforts had been more than enough for all the tasks to be done.

hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֨וּ כָל־חֲכַם־לֵ֜ב בְּעֹשֵׂ֧י הַמְּלָאכָ֛ה אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן עֶ֣שֶׂר יְרִיעֹ֑ת שֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֗ר וּתְכֵ֤לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתוֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י כְּרֻבִ֛ים מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֖ב עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vaya'asv khal-chakham-lev b'osey ham'lakhah et-hamish'kan 'eser y'riy'ot shesh mash'zar vt'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy k'ruviym ma'aseh choshev 'asah otam
translation: Then all the skilled among those engaged in the work made the tabernacle of ten strips of cloth, which they made of fine twisted linen, blue, purple, and crimson yarns; into these they worked a design of cherubim.

hebrew: אֹ֜רֶךְ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָֽאַחַ֗ת שְׁמֹנֶ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֙חַב֙ אַרְבַּ֣ע בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה הַיְרִיעָ֖ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֥ה אַחַ֖ת לְכָל־הַיְרִיעֹֽת׃
transliteration: orekh' hay'riy'ah haachat sh'moneh v'es'riym baamah v'rochav ar'ba' baamah hay'riy'ah haechat midah achat l'khal-hay'riy'ot
translation: The length of each cloth was twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each cloth was four cubits, all cloths having the same measurements.

hebrew: וַיְחַבֵּר֙ אֶת־חֲמֵ֣שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֔ת אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָ֑ת וְחָמֵ֤שׁ יְרִיעֹת֙ חִבַּ֔ר אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָֽת׃
transliteration: vay'chaber et-chamesh hay'riy'ot achat el-echat v'chamesh y'riy'ot chibar achat el-echat
translation: They joined five of the cloths to one another, and they joined the other five cloths to one another.

hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ לֻֽלְאֹ֣ת תְּכֵ֗לֶת עַ֣ל שְׂפַ֤ת הַיְרִיעָה֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת מִקָּצָ֖ה בַּמַּחְבָּ֑רֶת כֵּ֤ן עָשָׂה֙ בִּשְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַקִּ֣יצוֹנָ֔ה בַּמַּחְבֶּ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
transliteration: vaya'as lul'ot t'khelet 'al s'fat hay'riy'ah haechat mikatzah bamach'baret ken 'asah bis'fat hay'riy'ah hakiytzvonah bamach'beret hasheniyt
translation: They made loops of blue wool on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set, and did the same on the edge of the outermost cloth of the other set:

hebrew: חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻלָאֹ֗ת עָשָׂה֮ בַּיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאֶחָת֒ וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻלָאֹ֗ת עָשָׂה֙ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הַיְרִיעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בַּמַּחְבֶּ֣רֶת הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית מַקְבִּילֹת֙ הַלֻּ֣לָאֹ֔ת אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָֽת׃
transliteration: chamishiym lulaot 'asah bay'riy'ah haechat vachamishiym lulaot 'asah bik'tzeh hay'riy'ah asher bamach'beret hasheniyt mak'biylot halulaot achat el-echat
translation: they made fifty loops on the one cloth, and they made fifty loops on the edge of the end cloth of the other set, the loops being opposite one another.

hebrew: וַיַּ֕עַשׂ חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים קַרְסֵ֣י זָהָ֑ב וַיְחַבֵּ֨ר אֶת־הַיְרִעֹ֜ת אַחַ֤ת אֶל־אַחַת֙ בַּקְּרָסִ֔ים וַֽיְהִ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן אֶחָֽד׃ (ס)
transliteration: vaya'as chamishiym kar'sey zahav vay'chaber et-hay'ri'ot achat el-achat bak'rasiym vay'hiy hamish'kan echad (s)
translation: And they made fifty gold clasps and coupled the unitsaLit. “strip of cloth,” here used collectively. to one another with the clasps, so that the tabernacle became one whole.

hebrew: וַיַּ֙עַשׂ֙ יְרִיעֹ֣ת עִזִּ֔ים לְאֹ֖הֶל עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עַשְׁתֵּֽי־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה יְרִיעֹ֖ת עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vaya'as y'riy'ot 'iziym l'ohel 'al-hamish'kan 'ash'tey-'es'reh y'riy'ot 'asah otam
translation: They made cloths of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle; they made the cloths eleven in number.

hebrew: אֹ֜רֶךְ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֣ע אַמּ֔וֹת רֹ֖חַב הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֣ה אַחַ֔ת לְעַשְׁתֵּ֥י עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה יְרִיעֹֽת׃
transliteration: orekh' hay'riy'ah haachat sh'loshiym baamah v'ar'ba' amvot rochav hay'riy'ah haechat midah achat l'ash'tey 'es'reh y'riy'ot
translation: The length of each cloth was thirty cubits, and the width of each cloth was four cubits, the eleven cloths having the same measurements.

hebrew: וַיְחַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־חֲמֵ֥שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֖ת לְבָ֑ד וְאֶת־שֵׁ֥שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֖ת לְבָֽד׃
transliteration: vay'chaber et-chamesh hay'riy'ot l'vad v'et-shesh hay'riy'ot l'vad
translation: They joined five of the cloths by themselves, and the other six cloths by themselves.

hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ לֻֽלָאֹ֣ת חֲמִשִּׁ֗ים עַ֚ל שְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַקִּיצֹנָ֖ה בַּמַּחְבָּ֑רֶת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים לֻלָאֹ֗ת עָשָׂה֙ עַל־שְׂפַ֣ת הַיְרִיעָ֔ה הַחֹבֶ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
transliteration: vaya'as lulaot chamishiym 'al s'fat hay'riy'ah hakiytzonah bamach'baret vachamishiym lulaot 'asah 'al-s'fat hay'riy'ah hachoveret hasheniyt
translation: They made fifty loops on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set, and they made fifty loops on the edge of the end cloth of the other set.

hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ קַרְסֵ֥י נְחֹ֖שֶׁת חֲמִשִּׁ֑ים לְחַבֵּ֥ר אֶת־הָאֹ֖הֶל לִֽהְיֹ֥ת אֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: vaya'as kar'sey n'choshet chamishiym l'chaber et-haohel lih'yot echad
translation: They made fifty copper clasps to couple the tent together so that it might become one whole.

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ מִכְסֶה֙ לָאֹ֔הֶל עֹרֹ֥ת אֵלִ֖ים מְאָדָּמִ֑ים וּמִכְסֵ֛ה עֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vaya'as mikh'seh laohel 'orot eliym m'adamiym vmikh'seh 'orot t'chashiym mil'ma'lah (s)
translation: And they made a covering of tanned ram skins for the tent, and a covering of dolphin skins above.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֖ים עֹמְדִֽים׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-hak'rashiym lamish'kan 'atzey shitiym 'om'diym
translation: They made the planks for the Tabernacle of acacia wood, upright.

hebrew: עֶ֥שֶׂר אַמֹּ֖ת אֹ֣רֶךְ הַקָּ֑רֶשׁ וְאַמָּה֙ וַחֲצִ֣י הָֽאַמָּ֔ה רֹ֖חַב הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: 'eser amot orekh' hakaresh v'amah vachatziy haamah rochav hakeresh haechad
translation: The length of each plank was ten cubits, the width of each plank a cubit and a half.

hebrew: שְׁתֵּ֣י יָדֹ֗ת לַקֶּ֙רֶשׁ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ד מְשֻׁלָּבֹ֔ת אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָ֑ת כֵּ֣ן עָשָׂ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל קַרְשֵׁ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
transliteration: sh'tey yadot lakeresh haechad m'shulavot achat el-echat ken 'asah l'khol kar'shey hamish'kan
translation: Each plank had two tenons, parallelbSee note at 26.17. to each other; they did the same with all the planks of the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֶשְׂרִ֣ים קְרָשִׁ֔ים לִפְאַ֖ת נֶ֥גֶב תֵּימָֽנָה׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-hak'rashiym lamish'kan 'es'riym k'rashiym lif'at negev teymanah
translation: Of the planks of the Tabernacle, they made twenty planks for the south side,cSee note at 26.18.

hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אַדְנֵי־כֶ֔סֶף עָשָׂ֕ה תַּ֖חַת עֶשְׂרִ֣ים הַקְּרָשִׁ֑ים שְׁנֵ֨י אֲדָנִ֜ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֤רֶשׁ הָאֶחָד֙ לִשְׁתֵּ֣י יְדֹתָ֔יו וּשְׁנֵ֧י אֲדָנִ֛ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֖ד לִשְׁתֵּ֥י יְדֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'ar'ba'iym ad'ney-khesef 'asah tachat 'es'riym hak'rashiym sh'ney adaniym tachat-hakeresh haechad lish'tey y'dotayv vsh'ney adaniym tachat-hakeresh haechad lish'tey y'dotayv
translation: making forty silver sockets under the twenty planks, two sockets under one plank for its two tenons and two sockets under each following plank for its two tenons;

hebrew: וּלְצֶ֧לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית לִפְאַ֣ת צָפ֑וֹן עָשָׂ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים קְרָשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: vl'tzela' hamish'kan hasheniyt lif'at tzafvon 'asah 'es'riym k'rashiym
translation: and for the other side wall of the Tabernacle, the north side, twenty planks,

hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים אַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֗ים תַּ֚חַת הַקֶּ֣רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: v'ar'ba'iym ad'neyhem kasef sh'ney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad vsh'ney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad
translation: with their forty silver sockets, two sockets under one plank and two sockets under each following plank.

hebrew: וּֽלְיַרְכְּתֵ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יָ֑מָּה עָשָׂ֖ה שִׁשָּׁ֥ה קְרָשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: vl'yar'k'tey hamish'kan yamah 'asah shishah k'rashiym
translation: And for the rear of the Tabernacle, to the west, they made six planks;

hebrew: וּשְׁנֵ֤י קְרָשִׁים֙ עָשָׂ֔ה לִמְקֻצְעֹ֖ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן בַּיַּרְכָתָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vsh'ney k'rashiym 'asah lim'kutz'ot hamish'kan bayar'khatayim
translation: and they made two planks for the corners of the Tabernacle at the rear.

hebrew: וְהָי֣וּ תוֹאֲמִם֮ מִלְּמַטָּה֒ וְיַחְדָּ֗ו יִהְי֤וּ תַמִּים֙ אֶל־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ אֶל־הַטַּבַּ֖עַת הָאֶחָ֑ת כֵּ֚ן עָשָׂ֣ה לִשְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם לִשְׁנֵ֖י הַמִּקְצֹעֹֽת׃
transliteration: v'hayv tvoamim mil'matah v'yach'dav yih'yv tamiym el-roshvo el-hataba'at haechat ken 'asah lish'neyhem lish'ney hamik'tzo'ot
translation: dSee note at 26.24.They matched at the bottom, but terminated as one at the top into one ring;-d they did so with both of them at the two corners.

hebrew: וְהָיוּ֙ שְׁמֹנָ֣ה קְרָשִׁ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אֲדָנִ֑ים שְׁנֵ֤י אֲדָנִים֙ שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: v'hayv sh'monah k'rashiym v'ad'neyhem kesef shishah 'asar adaniym sh'ney adaniym sh'ney adaniym tachat hakeresh haechad
translation: Thus there were eight planks with their sockets of silver: sixteen sockets, two under each plank.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ בְּרִיחֵ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חֲמִשָּׁ֕ה לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הָאֶחָֽת׃
transliteration: vaya'as b'riychey 'atzey shitiym chamishah l'kar'shey tzela'-hamish'kan haechat
translation: They made bars of acacia wood, five for the planks of the one side wall of the Tabernacle,

hebrew: וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בְרִיחִ֔ם לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית וַחֲמִשָּׁ֤ה בְרִיחִם֙ לְקַרְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן לַיַּרְכָתַ֖יִם יָֽמָּה׃
transliteration: vachamishah v'riychim l'kar'shey tzela'-hamish'kan hasheniyt vachamishah v'riychim l'kar'shey hamish'kan layar'khatayim yamah
translation: five bars for the planks of the other side wall of the Tabernacle, and five bars for the planks of the wall of the Tabernacle at the rear, to the west;

hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אֶת־הַבְּרִ֣יחַ הַתִּיכֹ֑ן לִבְרֹ֙חַ֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַקְּרָשִׁ֔ים מִן־הַקָּצֶ֖ה אֶל־הַקָּצֶֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-hab'riycha hatiykhon liv'rocha b'tvokh' hak'rashiym min-hakatzeh el-hakatzeh
translation: they made the center bar to run, halfway up the planks, from end to end.

hebrew: וְֽאֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֞ים צִפָּ֣ה זָהָ֗ב וְאֶת־טַבְּעֹתָם֙ עָשָׂ֣ה זָהָ֔ב בָּתִּ֖ים לַבְּרִיחִ֑ם וַיְצַ֥ף אֶת־הַבְּרִיחִ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
transliteration: v'et-hak'rashiym tzipah zahav v'et-tab'otam 'asah zahav batiym lab'riychim vay'tzaf et-hab'riychim zahav
translation: They overlaid the planks with gold, and made their rings of gold, as holders for the bars; and they overlaid the bars with gold.

hebrew: וַיַּ֙עַשׂ֙ אֶת־הַפָּרֹ֔כֶת תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֛ב עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתָ֖הּ כְּרֻבִֽים׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-haparokhet t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh mash'zar ma'aseh choshev 'asah otah k'ruviym
translation: They made the curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, working into it a design of cherubim.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ לָ֗הּ אַרְבָּעָה֙ עַמּוּדֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וַיְצַפֵּ֣ם זָהָ֔ב וָוֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וַיִּצֹ֣ק לָהֶ֔ם אַרְבָּעָ֖ה אַדְנֵי־כָֽסֶף׃
transliteration: vaya'as lah ar'ba'ah 'amvdey shitiym vay'tzapem zahav vaveyhem zahav vayitzok lahem ar'ba'ah ad'ney-khasef
translation: They made for it four posts of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold, with their hooks of gold; and they cast for them four silver sockets.

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ מָסָךְ֙ לְפֶ֣תַח הָאֹ֔הֶל תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֹקֵֽם׃
transliteration: vaya'as masakh' l'fetach haohel t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh mash'zar ma'aseh rokem
translation: They made the screen for the entrance of the Tent, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery;

hebrew: וְאֶת־עַמּוּדָ֤יו חֲמִשָּׁה֙ וְאֶת־וָ֣וֵיהֶ֔ם וְצִפָּ֧ה רָאשֵׁיהֶ֛ם וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם חֲמִשָּׁ֖ה נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'et-'amvdayv chamishah v'et-vaveyhem v'tzipah rasheyhem vachashukeyhem zahav v'ad'neyhem chamishah n'choshet (f)
translation: and five posts for it with their hooks. They overlaid their tops and their bands with gold; but the five sockets were of copper.

hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ בְּצַלְאֵ֛ל אֶת־הָאָרֹ֖ן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֨יִם וָחֵ֜צִי אָרְכּ֗וֹ וְאַמָּ֤ה וָחֵ֙צִי֙ רָחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaya'as b'tzal'el et-haaron 'atzey shitiym amatayim vachetziy ar'kvo v'amah vachetziy rach'bvo v'amah vachetziy komatvo
translation: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.

hebrew: וַיְצַפֵּ֛הוּ זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר מִבַּ֣יִת וּמִח֑וּץ וַיַּ֥עַשׂ ל֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: vay'tzapehv zahav tahvor mibayit vmichvtz vaya'as lvo zer zahav saviyv
translation: He overlaid it with pure gold, inside and out; and he made a gold molding for it round about.

hebrew: וַיִּצֹ֣ק ל֗וֹ אַרְבַּע֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֔ב עַ֖ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פַּעֲמֹתָ֑יו וּשְׁתֵּ֣י טַבָּעֹ֗ת עַל־צַלְעוֹ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת וּשְׁתֵּי֙ טַבָּע֔וֹת עַל־צַלְע֖וֹ הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
transliteration: vayitzok lvo ar'ba' tab'ot zahav 'al ar'ba' pa'amotayv vsh'tey taba'ot 'al-tzal'vo haechat vsh'tey taba'vot 'al-tzal'vo hasheniyt
translation: He cast four gold rings for it, for its four feet: two rings on one of its side walls and two rings on the other.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ בַּדֵּ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
transliteration: vaya'as badey 'atzey shitiym vay'tzaf otam zahav
translation: He made poles of acacia wood, overlaid them with gold,

hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֤א אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ בַּטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֖ל צַלְעֹ֣ת הָאָרֹ֑ן לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הָאָרֹֽן׃
transliteration: vayave et-habadiym bataba'ot 'al tzal'ot haaron laset et-haaron
translation: and inserted the poles into the rings on the side walls of the ark for carrying the ark.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ כַּפֹּ֖רֶת זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר אַמָּתַ֤יִם וָחֵ֙צִי֙ אָרְכָּ֔הּ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי רָחְבָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vaya'as kaporet zahav tahvor amatayim vachetziy ar'kah v'amah vachetziy rach'bah
translation: He made a cover of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.

hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ שְׁנֵ֥י כְרֻבִ֖ים זָהָ֑ב מִקְשָׁה֙ עָשָׂ֣ה אֹתָ֔ם מִשְּׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
transliteration: vaya'as sh'ney kh'ruviym zahav mik'shah 'asah otam mish'ney k'tzvot hakaporet
translation: He made two cherubim of gold; he made them of hammered work, at the two ends of the cover:

hebrew: כְּרוּב־אֶחָ֤ד מִקָּצָה֙ מִזֶּ֔ה וּכְרוּב־אֶחָ֥ד מִקָּצָ֖ה מִזֶּ֑ה מִן־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת עָשָׂ֥ה אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֖ים מִשְּׁנֵ֥י קצוותו [קְצוֹתָֽיו׃]
transliteration: k'rvv-echad mikatzah mizeh vkh'rvv-echad mikatzah mizeh min-hakaporet 'asah et-hak'ruviym mish'ney ktzvvtv [k'tzvotayv]
translation: one cherub at one end and the other cherub at the other end; he made the cherubim of one piece with the cover, at its two ends.

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ הַכְּרֻבִים֩ פֹּרְשֵׂ֨י כְנָפַ֜יִם לְמַ֗עְלָה סֹֽכְכִ֤ים בְּכַנְפֵיהֶם֙ עַל־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת וּפְנֵיהֶ֖ם אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֑יו אֶל־הַכַּפֹּ֔רֶת הָי֖וּ פְּנֵ֥י הַכְּרֻבִֽים׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayih'yv hak'ruviym por'sey kh'nafayim l'ma'lah sokh'khiym b'khan'feyhem 'al-hakaporet vf'neyhem iysh el-achiyv el-hakaporet hayv p'ney hak'ruviym (f)
translation: The cherubim had their wings spread out above, shielding the cover with their wings. They faced each other; the faces of the cherubim were turned toward the cover.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֖ן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֤יִם אָרְכּוֹ֙ וְאַמָּ֣ה רָחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-hashul'chan 'atzey shitiym amatayim ar'kvo v'amah rach'bvo v'amah vachetziy komatvo
translation: He made the table of acacia wood, two cubits long, one cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high;

hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ף אֹת֖וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וַיַּ֥עַשׂ ל֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: vay'tzaf otvo zahav tahvor vaya'as lvo zer zahav saviyv
translation: he overlaid it with pure gold and made a gold molding around it.

hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ ל֥וֹ מִסְגֶּ֛רֶת טֹ֖פַח סָבִ֑יב וַיַּ֧עַשׂ זֵר־זָהָ֛ב לְמִסְגַּרְתּ֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: vaya'as lvo mis'geret tofach saviyv vaya'as zer-zahav l'mis'gar'tvo saviyv
translation: He made a rim of a hand’s breadth around it and made a gold molding for its rim round about.

hebrew: וַיִּצֹ֣ק ל֔וֹ אַרְבַּ֖ע טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֑ב וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־הַטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע הַפֵּאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְאַרְבַּ֥ע רַגְלָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayitzok lvo ar'ba' tab'ot zahav vayiten et-hataba'ot 'al ar'ba' hapeot asher l'ar'ba' rag'layv
translation: He cast four gold rings for it and attached the rings to the four corners at its four legs.

hebrew: לְעֻמַּת֙ הַמִּסְגֶּ֔רֶת הָי֖וּ הַטַּבָּעֹ֑ת בָּתִּים֙ לַבַּדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
transliteration: l'umat hamis'geret hayv hataba'ot batiym labadiym laset et-hashul'chan
translation: The rings were next to the rim, as holders for the poles to carry the table.

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם זָהָ֑ב לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-habadiym 'atzey shitiym vay'tzaf otam zahav laset et-hashul'chan
translation: He made the poles of acacia wood for carrying the table, and overlaid them with gold.

hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ אֶֽת־הַכֵּלִ֣ים ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֗ן אֶת־קְעָרֹתָ֤יו וְאֶת־כַּפֹּתָיו֙ וְאֵת֙ מְנַקִּיֹּתָ֔יו וְאֶת־הַקְּשָׂוֺ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻסַּ֖ךְ בָּהֵ֑ן זָהָ֖ב טָהֽוֹר׃ (פ)
transliteration: vaya'as et-hakeliym  asher 'al-hashul'chan et-k'arotayv v'et-kapotayv v'et m'nakiyotayv v'et-hak'savot asher yusakh' bahen zahav tahvor (f)
translation: The utensils that were to be upon the table—its bowls, ladles, jugs, and jars with which to offer libations—he made of pure gold.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֖ה זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר מִקְשָׁ֞ה עָשָׂ֤ה אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָה֙ יְרֵכָ֣הּ וְקָנָ֔הּ גְּבִיעֶ֛יהָ כַּפְתֹּרֶ֥יהָ וּפְרָחֶ֖יהָ מִמֶּ֥נָּה הָיֽוּ׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-ham'norah zahav tahvor mik'shah 'asah et-ham'norah y'rekhah v'kanah g'viy'eyha kaf'toreyha vf'racheyha mimenah hayv
translation: He made the lampstand of pure gold. He made the lampstand—its base and its shaft—of hammered work; its cups, calyxes, and petals were of one piece with it.

hebrew: וְשִׁשָּׁ֣ה קָנִ֔ים יֹצְאִ֖ים מִצִּדֶּ֑יהָ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה ׀ קְנֵ֣י מְנֹרָ֗ה מִצִּדָּהּ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁלֹשָׁה֙ קְנֵ֣י מְנֹרָ֔ה מִצִּדָּ֖הּ הַשֵּׁנִֽי׃
transliteration: v'shishah kaniym yotz'iym mitzideyha sh'loshah  k'ney m'norah mitzidah haechad vsh'loshah k'ney m'norah mitzidah hasheniy
translation: Six branches issued from its sides: three branches from one side of the lampstand, and three branches from the other side of the lampstand.

hebrew: שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה גְ֠בִעִים מְֽשֻׁקָּדִ֞ים בַּקָּנֶ֣ה הָאֶחָד֮ כַּפְתֹּ֣ר וָפֶרַח֒ וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה גְבִעִ֗ים מְשֻׁקָּדִ֛ים בְּקָנֶ֥ה אֶחָ֖ד כַּפְתֹּ֣ר וָפָ֑רַח כֵּ֚ן לְשֵׁ֣שֶׁת הַקָּנִ֔ים הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מִן־הַמְּנֹרָֽה׃
transliteration: sh'loshah g'vi'iym m'shukadiym bakaneh haechad kaf'tor vaferach vsh'loshah g'vi'iym m'shukadiym b'kaneh echad kaf'tor vafarach ken l'sheshet hakaniym hayotz'iym min-ham'norah
translation: There were three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals, on one branch; and there were three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals, on the next branch; so for all six branches issuing from the lampstand.

hebrew: וּבַמְּנֹרָ֖ה אַרְבָּעָ֣ה גְבִעִ֑ים מְשֻׁ֨קָּדִ֔ים כַּפְתֹּרֶ֖יהָ וּפְרָחֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vvam'norah ar'ba'ah g'vi'iym m'shukadiym kaf'toreyha vf'racheyha
translation: On the lampstand itself there were four cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals:

hebrew: וְכַפְתֹּ֡ר תַּחַת֩ שְׁנֵ֨י הַקָּנִ֜ים מִמֶּ֗נָּה וְכַפְתֹּר֙ תַּ֣חַת שְׁנֵ֤י הַקָּנִים֙ מִמֶּ֔נָּה וְכַפְתֹּ֕ר תַּֽחַת־שְׁנֵ֥י הַקָּנִ֖ים מִמֶּ֑נָּה לְשֵׁ֙שֶׁת֙ הַקָּנִ֔ים הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
transliteration: v'khaf'tor tachat sh'ney hakaniym mimenah v'khaf'tor tachat sh'ney hakaniym mimenah v'khaf'tor tachat-sh'ney hakaniym mimenah l'sheshet hakaniym hayotz'iym mimenah
translation: a calyx, of one piece with it, under a pair of branches; and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the second pair of branches; and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the last pair of branches; so for all six branches issuing from it.

hebrew: כַּפְתֹּרֵיהֶ֥ם וּקְנֹתָ֖ם מִמֶּ֣נָּה הָי֑וּ כֻּלָּ֛הּ מִקְשָׁ֥ה אַחַ֖ת זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
transliteration: kaf'toreyhem vk'notam mimenah hayv kulah mik'shah achat zahav tahvor
translation: Their calyxes and their stems were of one piece with it, the whole of it a single hammered piece of pure gold.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־נֵרֹתֶ֖יהָ שִׁבְעָ֑ה וּמַלְקָחֶ֥יהָ וּמַחְתֹּתֶ֖יהָ זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-neroteyha shiv'ah vmal'kacheyha vmach'toteyha zahav tahvor
translation: He made its seven lamps, its tongs, and its fire pans of pure gold.

hebrew: כִּכָּ֛ר זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר עָשָׂ֣ה אֹתָ֑הּ וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־כֵּלֶֽיהָ׃ (פ)
transliteration: kikar zahav tahvor 'asah otah v'et kal-keleyha (f)
translation: He made it and all its furnishings out of a talent of pure gold.

hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ אֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הַקְּטֹ֖רֶת עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּ֣ה אָרְכּוֹ֩ וְאַמָּ֨ה רָחְבּ֜וֹ רָב֗וּעַ וְאַמָּתַ֙יִם֙ קֹֽמָת֔וֹ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ הָי֥וּ קַרְנֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-miz'bach hak'toret 'atzey shitiym amah ar'kvo v'amah rach'bvo ravv'a v'amatayim komatvo mimenv hayv kar'notayv
translation: He made the incense altar of acacia wood, a cubit long and a cubit wide—square—and two cubits high; its horns were of one piece with it.

hebrew: וַיְצַ֨ף אֹת֜וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֗וֹר אֶת־גַּגּ֧וֹ וְאֶת־קִירֹתָ֛יו סָבִ֖יב וְאֶת־קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וַיַּ֥עַשׂ ל֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: vay'tzaf otvo zahav tahvor et-gagvo v'et-kiyrotayv saviyv v'et-kar'notayv vaya'as lvo zer zahav saviyv
translation: He overlaid it with pure gold: its top, its sides round about, and its horns; and he made a gold molding for it round about.

hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּי֩ טַבְּעֹ֨ת זָהָ֜ב עָֽשָׂה־ל֣וֹ ׀ מִתַּ֣חַת לְזֵר֗וֹ עַ֚ל שְׁתֵּ֣י צַלְעֹתָ֔יו עַ֖ל שְׁנֵ֣י צִדָּ֑יו לְבָתִּ֣ים לְבַדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֥את אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vsh'tey tab'ot zahav 'asah-lvo  mitachat l'zervo 'al sh'tey tzal'otayv 'al sh'ney tzidayv l'vatiym l'vadiym laset otvo bahem
translation: He made two gold rings for it under its molding, on its two walls—on opposite sides—as holders for the poles with which to carry it.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֖ים עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-habadiym 'atzey shitiym vay'tzaf otam zahav
translation: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.

hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ אֶת־שֶׁ֤מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה֙ קֹ֔דֶשׁ וְאֶת־קְטֹ֥רֶת הַסַּמִּ֖ים טָה֑וֹר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֹקֵֽחַ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vaya'as et-shemen hamish'chah kodesh v'et-k'toret hasamiym tahvor ma'aseh rokecha (f)
translation: He prepared the sacred anointing oil and the pure aromatic incense, expertly blended.

hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ אֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָ֖ה עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חָמֵשׁ֩ אַמּ֨וֹת אָרְכּ֜וֹ וְחָֽמֵשׁ־אַמּ֤וֹת רָחְבּוֹ֙ רָב֔וּעַ וְשָׁלֹ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-miz'bach ha'olah 'atzey shitiym chamesh amvot ar'kvo v'chamesh-amvot rach'bvo ravv'a v'shalosh amvot komatvo
translation: He made the altar for burnt offering of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide—square—and three cubits high.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ קַרְנֹתָ֗יו עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פִּנֹּתָ֔יו מִמֶּ֖נּוּ הָי֣וּ קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וַיְצַ֥ף אֹת֖וֹ נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: vaya'as kar'notayv 'al ar'ba' pinotayv mimenv hayv kar'notayv vay'tzaf otvo n'choshet
translation: He made horns for it on its four corners, the horns being of one piece with it; and he overlaid it with copper.

hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ אֶֽת־כָּל־כְּלֵ֣י הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חַ אֶת־הַסִּירֹ֤ת וְאֶת־הַיָּעִים֙ וְאֶת־הַמִּזְרָקֹ֔ת אֶת־הַמִּזְלָגֹ֖ת וְאֶת־הַמַּחְתֹּ֑ת כָּל־כֵּלָ֖יו עָשָׂ֥ה נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-kal-k'ley hamiz'becha et-hasiyrot v'et-haya'iym v'et-hamiz'rakot et-hamiz'lagot v'et-hamach'tot kal-kelayv 'asah n'choshet
translation: He made all the utensils of the altar—the pails, the scrapers, the basins, the flesh hooks, and the fire pans; he made all these utensils of copper.

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ לַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ מִכְבָּ֔ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֶ֣שֶׁת נְחֹ֑שֶׁת תַּ֧חַת כַּרְכֻּבּ֛וֹ מִלְּמַ֖טָּה עַד־חֶצְיֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaya'as lamiz'becha mikh'bar ma'aseh reshet n'choshet tachat kar'kubvo mil'matah 'ad-chetz'yvo
translation: He made for the altar a grating of meshwork in copper, extending below, under its ledge, to its middle.

hebrew: וַיִּצֹ֞ק אַרְבַּ֧ע טַבָּעֹ֛ת בְּאַרְבַּ֥ע הַקְּצָוֺ֖ת לְמִכְבַּ֣ר הַנְּחֹ֑שֶׁת בָּתִּ֖ים לַבַּדִּֽים׃
transliteration: vayitzok ar'ba' taba'ot b'ar'ba' hak'tzavot l'mikh'bar han'choshet batiym labadiym
translation: He cast four rings, at the four corners of the copper grating, as holders for the poles.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֖ים עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-habadiym 'atzey shitiym vay'tzaf otam n'choshet
translation: He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with copper;

hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֨א אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֜ים בַּטַּבָּעֹ֗ת עַ֚ל צַלְעֹ֣ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ לָשֵׂ֥את אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֶ֑ם נְב֥וּב לֻחֹ֖ת עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayave et-habadiym bataba'ot 'al tzal'ot hamiz'becha laset otvo bahem n'vvv luchot 'asah otvo (s)
translation: and he inserted the poles into the rings on the side walls of the altar, to carry it by them. He made it hollow, of boards.

hebrew: וַיַּ֗עַשׂ אֵ֚ת הַכִּיּ֣וֹר נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וְאֵ֖ת כַּנּ֣וֹ נְחֹ֑שֶׁת בְּמַרְאֹת֙ הַצֹּ֣בְאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר צָֽבְא֔וּ פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃ (ס)
transliteration: vaya'as et hakiyvor n'choshet v'et kanvo n'choshet b'mar'ot hatzov'ot asher tzav'v petach ohel mvo'ed (s)
translation: He made the laver of copper and its stand of copper, from the mirrors of the women who performed tasksaMeaning of Heb. uncertain. at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אֶת־הֶחָצֵ֑ר לִפְאַ֣ת ׀ נֶ֣גֶב תֵּימָ֗נָה קַלְעֵ֤י הֶֽחָצֵר֙ שֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֔ר מֵאָ֖ה בָּאַמָּֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-hechatzer lif'at  negev teymanah kal'ey hechatzer shesh mash'zar meah baamah
translation:
He made the enclosure:
On the southbCf. note at 26.18. side, a hundred cubits of hangings of fine twisted linen for the enclosure—

hebrew: עַמּוּדֵיהֶ֣ם עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם עֶשְׂרִ֖ים נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
transliteration: 'amvdeyhem 'es'riym v'ad'neyhem 'es'riym n'choshet vavey ha'amudiym vachashukeyhem kasef
translation: with their twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts being silver.

hebrew: וְלִפְאַ֤ת צָפוֹן֙ מֵאָ֣ה בָֽאַמָּ֔ה עַמּוּדֵיהֶ֣ם עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם עֶשְׂרִ֖ים נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָֽעַמּוּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
transliteration: v'lif'at tzafvon meah vaamah 'amvdeyhem 'es'riym v'ad'neyhem 'es'riym n'choshet vavey ha'amvdiym vachashukeyhem kasef
translation: On the north side, a hundred cubits—with their twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts being silver.

hebrew: וְלִפְאַת־יָ֗ם קְלָעִים֙ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה עַמּוּדֵיהֶ֥ם עֲשָׂרָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם עֲשָׂרָ֑ה וָוֵ֧י הָעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשׁוּקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
transliteration: v'lif'at-yam k'la'iym chamishiym baamah 'amvdeyhem 'asarah v'ad'neyhem 'asarah vavey ha'amudiym vachashvkeyhem kasef
translation: On the west side, fifty cubits of hangings—with their ten posts and their ten sockets, the hooks and bands of the posts being silver.

hebrew: וְלִפְאַ֛ת קֵ֥דְמָה מִזְרָ֖חָה חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אַמָּֽה׃
transliteration: v'lif'at ked'mah miz'rachah chamishiym amah
translation: And on the front side, to the east, fifty cubits:

hebrew: קְלָעִ֛ים חֲמֵשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה אַמָּ֖ה אֶל־הַכָּתֵ֑ף עַמּוּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
transliteration: k'la'iym chamesh-'es'reh amah el-hakatef 'amvdeyhem sh'loshah v'ad'neyhem sh'loshah
translation: fifteen cubits of hangings on the one flank, with their three posts and their three sockets,

hebrew: וְלַכָּתֵ֣ף הַשֵּׁנִ֗ית מִזֶּ֤ה וּמִזֶּה֙ לְשַׁ֣עַר הֶֽחָצֵ֔ר קְלָעִ֕ים חֲמֵ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה אַמָּ֑ה עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'lakatef hasheniyt mizeh vmizeh l'sha'ar hechatzer k'la'iym chamesh 'es'reh amah 'amudeyhem sh'loshah v'ad'neyhem sh'loshah
translation: and fifteen cubits of hangings on the other flank—on each side of the gate of the enclosurecWhich accounts for the remaining 20 cubits; cf. v. 18.—with their three posts and their three sockets.

hebrew: כָּל־קַלְעֵ֧י הֶחָצֵ֛ר סָבִ֖יב שֵׁ֥שׁ מָשְׁזָֽר׃
transliteration: kal-kal'ey hechatzer saviyv shesh mash'zar
translation: All the hangings around the enclosure were of fine twisted linen.

hebrew: וְהָאֲדָנִ֣ים לָֽעַמֻּדִים֮ נְחֹשֶׁת֒ וָוֵ֨י הָֽעַמּוּדִ֜ים וַחֲשׁוּקֵיהֶם֙ כֶּ֔סֶף וְצִפּ֥וּי רָאשֵׁיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף וְהֵם֙ מְחֻשָּׁקִ֣ים כֶּ֔סֶף כֹּ֖ל עַמֻּדֵ֥י הֶחָצֵֽר׃
transliteration: v'haadaniym la'amudiym n'choshet vavey ha'amvdiym vachashvkeyhem kesef v'tzipvy rasheyhem kasef v'hem m'chushakiym kesef kol 'amudey hechatzer
translation: The sockets for the posts were of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts were of silver, the overlay of their tops was of silver; all the posts of the enclosure were banded with silver.—

hebrew: וּמָסַ֞ךְ שַׁ֤עַר הֶחָצֵר֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֔ם תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֑ר וְעֶשְׂרִ֤ים אַמָּה֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ וְקוֹמָ֤ה בְרֹ֙חַב֙ חָמֵ֣שׁ אַמּ֔וֹת לְעֻמַּ֖ת קַלְעֵ֥י הֶחָצֵֽר׃
transliteration: vmasakh' sha'ar hechatzer ma'aseh rokem t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh mash'zar v'es'riym amah orekh' v'kvomah v'rochav chamesh amvot l'umat kal'ey hechatzer
translation: The screen of the gate of the enclosure, done in embroidery, was of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen. It was twenty cubits long. dMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Its height—or width—was five cubits, like that of-d the hangings of the enclosure.

hebrew: וְעַמֻּֽדֵיהֶם֙ אַרְבָּעָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם אַרְבָּעָ֖ה נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּ֔סֶף וְצִפּ֧וּי רָאשֵׁיהֶ֛ם וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
transliteration: v'amudeyhem ar'ba'ah v'ad'neyhem ar'ba'ah n'choshet vaveyhem kesef v'tzipvy rasheyhem vachashukeyhem kasef
