translation: The posts were four; their four sockets were of copper, their hooks of silver; and the overlay of their tops was of silver, as were also their bands.—

hebrew: וְֽכָל־הַיְתֵדֹ֞ת לַמִּשְׁכָּ֧ן וְלֶחָצֵ֛ר סָבִ֖יב נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khal-hay'tedot lamish'kan v'lechatzer saviyv n'choshet (s)
translation: All the pegs of the Tabernacle and of the enclosure round about were of copper.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה פְקוּדֵ֤י הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ מִשְׁכַּ֣ן הָעֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר פֻּקַּ֖ד עַל־פִּ֣י מֹשֶׁ֑ה עֲבֹדַת֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם בְּיַד֙ אִֽיתָמָ֔ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: eleh f'kvdey hamish'kan mish'kan ha'edut asher pukad 'al-piy mosheh 'avodat hal'viyim b'yad iytamar ben-aharon hakohen
translation: These are the records of the Tabernacle, the Tabernacle of the Pact, which were drawn up at Moses’ bidding—the work of the Levites under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.

hebrew: וּבְצַלְאֵ֛ל בֶּן־אוּרִ֥י בֶן־ח֖וּר לְמַטֵּ֣ה יְהוּדָ֑ה עָשָׂ֕ה אֵ֛ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vv'tzal'el ben-vriy ven-chvr l'mateh y'hvdah 'asah et kal-asher-tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: Now Bezalel, son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, had made all that the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses;

hebrew: וְאִתּ֗וֹ אָהֳלִיאָ֞ב בֶּן־אֲחִיסָמָ֛ךְ לְמַטֵּה־דָ֖ן חָרָ֣שׁ וְחֹשֵׁ֑ב וְרֹקֵ֗ם בַּתְּכֵ֙לֶת֙ וּבָֽאַרְגָּמָ֔ן וּבְתוֹלַ֥עַת הַשָּׁנִ֖י וּבַשֵּֽׁשׁ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'itvo aholiyav ben-achiysamakh' l'mateh-dan charash v'choshev v'rokem bat'khelet vvaar'gaman vv'tvola'at hashaniy vvashesh (s)
translation: at his side was Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, carver and designer, and embroiderer in blue, purple, and crimson yarns and in fine linen.

hebrew: כָּל־הַזָּהָ֗ב הֶֽעָשׂוּי֙ לַמְּלָאכָ֔ה בְּכֹ֖ל מְלֶ֣אכֶת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וַיְהִ֣י ׀ זְהַ֣ב הַתְּנוּפָ֗ה תֵּ֤שַׁע וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ כִּכָּ֔ר וּשְׁבַ֨ע מֵא֧וֹת וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים שֶׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֥קֶל הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: kal-hazahav he'asvy lam'lakhah b'khol m'lekhet hakodesh vay'hiy  z'hav hat'nvfah tesha' v'es'riym kikar vsh'va' mevot vsh'loshiym shekel b'shekel hakodesh
translation: All the gold that was used for the work, in all the work of the sanctuary—the elevation offering of gold—came to 29 talentseA talent here equals 3,000 shekels. and 730 shekels by the sanctuary weight.

hebrew: וְכֶ֛סֶף פְּקוּדֵ֥י הָעֵדָ֖ה מְאַ֣ת כִּכָּ֑ר וְאֶלֶף֩ וּשְׁבַ֨ע מֵא֜וֹת וַחֲמִשָּׁ֧ה וְשִׁבְעִ֛ים שֶׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֥קֶל הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: v'khesef p'kvdey ha'edah m'at kikar v'elef vsh'va' mevot vachamishah v'shiv'iym shekel b'shekel hakodesh
translation: The silver of those of the community who were recorded came to 100 talents and 1,775 shekels by the sanctuary weight:

hebrew: בֶּ֚קַע לַגֻּלְגֹּ֔לֶת מַחֲצִ֥ית הַשֶּׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ לְכֹ֨ל הָעֹבֵ֜ר עַל־הַפְּקֻדִ֗ים מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה לְשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֙לֶף֙ וּשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֔ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃
transliteration: beka' lagul'golet machatziyt hashekel b'shekel hakodesh l'khol ha'over 'al-hap'kudiym miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah l'shesh-mevot elef vsh'loshet alafiym vachamesh mevot vachamishiym
translation: a half-shekelfHeb. beqa‘. a head, half a shekel by the sanctuary weight, for each one who was entered in the records, from the age of twenty years up, 603,550 men.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מְאַת֙ כִּכַּ֣ר הַכֶּ֔סֶף לָצֶ֗קֶת אֵ֚ת אַדְנֵ֣י הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וְאֵ֖ת אַדְנֵ֣י הַפָּרֹ֑כֶת מְאַ֧ת אֲדָנִ֛ים לִמְאַ֥ת הַכִּכָּ֖ר כִּכָּ֥ר לָאָֽדֶן׃
transliteration: vay'hiy m'at kikar hakesef latzeket et ad'ney hakodesh v'et ad'ney haparokhet m'at adaniym lim'at hakikar kikar laaden
translation: The 100 talents of silver were for casting the sockets of the sanctuary and the sockets for the curtain, 100 sockets to the 100 talents, a talent a socket.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאֶ֜לֶף וּשְׁבַ֤ע הַמֵּאוֹת֙ וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה וְשִׁבְעִ֔ים עָשָׂ֥ה וָוִ֖ים לָעַמּוּדִ֑ים וְצִפָּ֥ה רָאשֵׁיהֶ֖ם וְחִשַּׁ֥ק אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'et-haelef vsh'va' hamevot vachamishah v'shiv'iym 'asah vaviym la'amvdiym v'tzipah rasheyhem v'chishak otam
translation: And of the 1,775 shekels he made hooks for the posts, overlay for their tops, and bands around them.

hebrew: וּנְחֹ֥שֶׁת הַתְּנוּפָ֖ה שִׁבְעִ֣ים כִּכָּ֑ר וְאַלְפַּ֥יִם וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֖וֹת שָֽׁקֶל׃
transliteration: vn'choshet hat'nvfah shiv'iym kikar v'al'payim v'ar'ba'-mevot shakel
translation: The copper from the elevation offering came to 70 talents and 2,400 shekels.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ בָּ֗הּ אֶת־אַדְנֵי֙ פֶּ֚תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וְאֵת֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח הַנְּחֹ֔שֶׁת וְאֶת־מִכְבַּ֥ר הַנְּחֹ֖שֶׁת אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־כְּלֵ֥י הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: vaya'as bah et-ad'ney petach ohel mvo'ed v'et miz'bach han'choshet v'et-mikh'bar han'choshet asher-lvo v'et kal-k'ley hamiz'becha
translation: Of it he made the sockets for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting; the copper altar and its copper grating and all the utensils of the altar;

hebrew: וְאֶת־אַדְנֵ֤י הֶֽחָצֵר֙ סָבִ֔יב וְאֶת־אַדְנֵ֖י שַׁ֣עַר הֶחָצֵ֑ר וְאֵ֨ת כָּל־יִתְדֹ֧ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן וְאֶת־כָּל־יִתְדֹ֥ת הֶחָצֵ֖ר סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'et-ad'ney hechatzer saviyv v'et-ad'ney sha'ar hechatzer v'et kal-yit'dot hamish'kan v'et-kal-yit'dot hechatzer saviyv
translation: the sockets of the enclosure round about and the sockets of the gate of the enclosure; and all the pegs of the Tabernacle and all the pegs of the enclosure round about.

hebrew: וּמִן־הַתְּכֵ֤לֶת וְהָֽאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתוֹלַ֣עַת הַשָּׁנִ֔י עָשׂ֥וּ בִגְדֵי־שְׂרָ֖ד לְשָׁרֵ֣ת בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֞וּ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַהֲרֹ֔ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vmin-hat'khelet v'haar'gaman v'tvola'at hashaniy 'asv vig'dey-s'rad l'sharet bakodesh vaya'asv et-big'dey hakodesh asher l'aharon kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (f)
translation: Of the blue, purple, and crimson yarns they alsoaSee 36.8. made the service vestments for officiating in the sanctuary; they made Aaron’s sacral vestments—as the LORD had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אֶת־הָאֵפֹ֑ד זָהָ֗ב תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מָשְׁזָֽר׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-haefod zahav t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh mash'zar
translation: The ephod was madebHere and elsewhere in this chapter the singular active verb (lit. “he made”) is used impersonally. of gold, blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen.

hebrew: וַֽיְרַקְּע֞וּ אֶת־פַּחֵ֣י הַזָּהָב֮ וְקִצֵּ֣ץ פְּתִילִם֒ לַעֲשׂ֗וֹת בְּת֤וֹךְ הַתְּכֵ֙לֶת֙ וּבְת֣וֹךְ הָֽאַרְגָּמָ֔ן וּבְת֛וֹךְ תּוֹלַ֥עַת הַשָּׁנִ֖י וּבְת֣וֹךְ הַשֵּׁ֑שׁ מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה חֹשֵֽׁב׃
transliteration: vay'rak'v et-pachey hazahav v'kitzetz p'tiylim la'asvot b'tvokh' hat'khelet vv'tvokh' haar'gaman vv'tvokh' tvola'at hashaniy vv'tvokh' hashesh ma'aseh choshev
translation: They hammered out sheets of gold and cut threads to be worked into designs among the blue, the purple, and the crimson yarns, and the fine linen.

hebrew: כְּתֵפֹ֥ת עָֽשׂוּ־ל֖וֹ חֹבְרֹ֑ת עַל־שְׁנֵ֥י קצוותו [קְצוֹתָ֖יו] חֻבָּֽר׃
transliteration: k'tefot 'asv-lvo chov'rot 'al-sh'ney ktzvvtv [k'tzvotayv] chubar
translation: They made for it attaching shoulder-pieces; they were attached at its two ends.

hebrew: וְחֵ֨שֶׁב אֲפֻדָּת֜וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֗יו מִמֶּ֣נּוּ הוּא֮ כְּמַעֲשֵׂהוּ֒ זָהָ֗ב תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֑ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'cheshev afudatvo asher 'alayv mimenv hv k'ma'asehv zahav t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh mash'zar kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: The decorated band that was upon it was made like it, of one piece with it; of gold, blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂוּ֙ אֶת־אַבְנֵ֣י הַשֹּׁ֔הַם מֻֽסַבֹּ֖ת מִשְׁבְּצֹ֣ת זָהָ֑ב מְפֻתָּחֹת֙ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חוֹתָ֔ם עַל־שְׁמ֖וֹת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vaya'asv et-av'ney hashoham musabot mish'b'tzot zahav m'futachot pitvchey chvotam 'al-sh'mvot b'ney yis'rael
translation: They bordered the lazuli stones with frames of gold, engraved with seal engravings of the names of the sons of Israel.

hebrew: וַיָּ֣שֶׂם אֹתָ֗ם עַ֚ל כִּתְפֹ֣ת הָאֵפֹ֔ד אַבְנֵ֥י זִכָּר֖וֹן לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayasem otam 'al kit'fot haefod av'ney zikarvon liv'ney yis'rael kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (f)
translation: They were set on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, as stones of remembrance for the Israelites—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ אֶת־הַחֹ֛שֶׁן מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֖ב כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֵפֹ֑ד זָהָ֗ב תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מָשְׁזָֽר׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-hachoshen ma'aseh choshev k'ma'aseh efod zahav t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy v'shesh mash'zar
translation: The breastpiece was made in the style of the ephod: of gold, blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen.

hebrew: רָב֧וּעַ הָיָ֛ה כָּפ֖וּל עָשׂ֣וּ אֶת־הַחֹ֑שֶׁן זֶ֧רֶת אָרְכּ֛וֹ וְזֶ֥רֶת רָחְבּ֖וֹ כָּפֽוּל׃
transliteration: ravv'a hayah kafvl 'asv et-hachoshen zeret ar'kvo v'zeret rach'bvo kafvl
translation: It was square; they made the breastpiece doubled—a span in length and a span in width, doubled.

hebrew: וַיְמַלְאוּ־ב֔וֹ אַרְבָּעָ֖ה ט֣וּרֵי אָ֑בֶן ט֗וּר אֹ֤דֶם פִּטְדָה֙ וּבָרֶ֔קֶת הַטּ֖וּר הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: vay'mal'v-vvo ar'ba'ah tvrey aven tvr odem pit'dah vvareket hatvr haechad
translation: They set in it four rows of stones. The first row was a row of cSee note at 28.17.carnelian, chrysolite, and emerald;

hebrew: וְהַטּ֖וּר הַשֵּׁנִ֑י נֹ֥פֶךְ סַפִּ֖יר וְיָהֲלֹֽם׃
transliteration: v'hatvr hasheniy nofekh' sapiyr v'yahalom
translation: the second row: a turquoise, a sapphire, and an amethyst;

hebrew: וְהַטּ֖וּר הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י לֶ֥שֶׁם שְׁב֖וֹ וְאַחְלָֽמָה׃
transliteration: v'hatvr hash'liyshiy leshem sh'vvo v'ach'lamah
translation: the third row: a jacinth, an agate, and a crystal;

hebrew: וְהַטּוּר֙ הָֽרְבִיעִ֔י תַּרְשִׁ֥ישׁ שֹׁ֖הַם וְיָשְׁפֵ֑ה מֽוּסַבֹּ֛ת מִשְׁבְּצ֥וֹת זָהָ֖ב בְּמִלֻּאֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'hatvr har'viy'iy tar'shiysh shoham v'yash'feh mvsabot mish'b'tzvot zahav b'miluotam
translation: and the fourth row: a beryl, a lapis lazuli, and a jasper. They were encircled in their mountings with frames of gold.

hebrew: וְ֠הָאֲבָנִים עַל־שְׁמֹ֨ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל הֵ֛נָּה שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה עַל־שְׁמֹתָ֑ם פִּתּוּחֵ֤י חֹתָם֙ אִ֣ישׁ עַל־שְׁמ֔וֹ לִשְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר שָֽׁבֶט׃
transliteration: v'haavaniym 'al-sh'mot b'ney-yis'rael henah sh'teym 'es'reh 'al-sh'motam pitvchey chotam iysh 'al-sh'mvo lish'neym 'asar shavet
translation: The stones corresponded [in number] to the names of the sons of Israel: twelve, corresponding to their names; engraved like seals, each with its name, for the twelve tribes.

hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֧וּ עַל־הַחֹ֛שֶׁן שַׁרְשְׁרֹ֥ת גַּבְלֻ֖ת מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה עֲבֹ֑ת זָהָ֖ב טָהֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vaya'asv 'al-hachoshen shar'sh'rot gav'lut ma'aseh 'avot zahav tahvor
translation: On the breastpiece they made braided chains of corded work in pure gold.

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֗וּ שְׁתֵּי֙ מִשְׁבְּצֹ֣ת זָהָ֔ב וּשְׁתֵּ֖י טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֑ב וַֽיִּתְּנ֗וּ אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ הַטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
transliteration: vaya'asv sh'tey mish'b'tzot zahav vsh'tey tab'ot zahav vayit'nv et-sh'tey hataba'ot 'al-sh'ney k'tzvot hachoshen
translation: They made two frames of gold and two rings of gold, and fastened the two rings at the two ends of the breastpiece,

hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנ֗וּ שְׁתֵּי֙ הָעֲבֹתֹ֣ת הַזָּהָ֔ב עַל־שְׁתֵּ֖י הַטַּבָּעֹ֑ת עַל־קְצ֖וֹת הַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
transliteration: vayit'nv sh'tey ha'avotot hazahav 'al-sh'tey hataba'ot 'al-k'tzvot hachoshen
translation: attaching the two golden cords to the two rings at the ends of the breastpiece.

hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת שְׁתֵּ֤י קְצוֹת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הָֽעֲבֹתֹ֔ת נָתְנ֖וּ עַל־שְׁתֵּ֣י הַֽמִּשְׁבְּצֹ֑ת וַֽיִּתְּנֻ֛ם עַל־כִּתְפֹ֥ת הָאֵפֹ֖ד אֶל־מ֥וּל פָּנָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'et sh'tey k'tzvot sh'tey ha'avotot nat'nv 'al-sh'tey hamish'b'tzot vayit'num 'al-kit'fot haefod el-mvl panayv
translation: They then fastened the two ends of the cords to the two frames, attaching them to the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, at the front.

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֗וּ שְׁתֵּי֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֔ב וַיָּשִׂ֕ימוּ עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י קְצ֣וֹת הַחֹ֑שֶׁן עַל־שְׂפָת֕וֹ אֲשֶׁ֛ר אֶל־עֵ֥בֶר הָאֵפֹ֖ד בָּֽיְתָה׃
transliteration: vaya'asv sh'tey tab'ot zahav vayasiymv 'al-sh'ney k'tzvot hachoshen 'al-s'fatvo asher el-'ever haefod bay'tah
translation: They made two rings of gold and attached them to the two ends of the breastpiece, at its inner edge, which faced the ephod.

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂוּ֮ שְׁתֵּ֣י טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָב֒ וַֽיִּתְּנֻ֡ם עַל־שְׁתֵּי֩ כִתְפֹ֨ת הָאֵפֹ֤ד מִלְמַ֙טָּה֙ מִמּ֣וּל פָּנָ֔יו לְעֻמַּ֖ת מֶחְבַּרְתּ֑וֹ מִמַּ֕עַל לְחֵ֖שֶׁב הָאֵפֹֽד׃
transliteration: vaya'asv sh'tey tab'ot zahav vayit'num 'al-sh'tey khit'fot haefod mil'matah mimvl panayv l'umat mech'bar'tvo mima'al l'cheshev haefod
translation: They made two other rings of gold and fastened them on the front of the ephod, low on the two shoulder-pieces, close to its seam above the decorated band.

hebrew: וַיִּרְכְּס֣וּ אֶת־הַחֹ֡שֶׁן מִטַּבְּעֹתָיו֩ אֶל־טַבְּעֹ֨ת הָאֵפֹ֜ד בִּפְתִ֣יל תְּכֵ֗לֶת לִֽהְיֹת֙ עַל־חֵ֣שֶׁב הָאֵפֹ֔ד וְלֹֽא־יִזַּ֣ח הַחֹ֔שֶׁן מֵעַ֖ל הָאֵפֹ֑ד כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayir'k'sv et-hachoshen mitab'otayv el-tab'ot haefod bif'tiyl t'khelet lih'yot 'al-cheshev haefod v'lo-yizach hachoshen me'al haefod kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: The breastpiece was held in place by a cord of blue from its rings to the rings of the ephod, so that the breastpiece rested on the decorated band and did not come loose from the ephod—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ אֶת־מְעִ֥יל הָאֵפֹ֖ד מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֹרֵ֑ג כְּלִ֖יל תְּכֵֽלֶת׃
transliteration: vaya'as et-m'iyl haefod ma'aseh oreg k'liyl t'khelet
translation: The robe for the ephod was made of woven work, of pure blue.dSee note at 28.31.

hebrew: וּפִֽי־הַמְּעִ֥יל בְּתוֹכ֖וֹ כְּפִ֣י תַחְרָ֑א שָׂפָ֥ה לְפִ֛יו סָבִ֖יב לֹ֥א יִקָּרֵֽעַ׃
transliteration: vfiy-ham'iyl b'tvokhvo k'fiy tach'ra safah l'fiyv saviyv lo yikare'a
translation: The opening of the robe, in the middle of it, was like the opening of a coat of mail, with a binding around the opening, so that it would not tear.

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂוּ֙ עַל־שׁוּלֵ֣י הַמְּעִ֔יל רִמּוֹנֵ֕י תְּכֵ֥לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֖ן וְתוֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֑י מָשְׁזָֽר׃
transliteration: vaya'asv 'al-shvley ham'iyl rimvoney t'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy mash'zar
translation: On the hem of the robe they made pomegranates of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, twisted.

hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ פַעֲמֹנֵ֖י זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וַיִּתְּנ֨וּ אֶת־הַפַּֽעֲמֹנִ֜ים בְּת֣וֹךְ הָרִמֹּנִ֗ים עַל־שׁוּלֵ֤י הַמְּעִיל֙ סָבִ֔יב בְּת֖וֹךְ הָרִמֹּנִֽים׃
transliteration: vaya'asv fa'amoney zahav tahvor vayit'nv et-hapa'amoniym b'tvokh' harimoniym 'al-shvley ham'iyl saviyv b'tvokh' harimoniym
translation: They also made bells of pure gold, and attached the bells between the pomegranates, all around the hem of the robe, between the pomegranates:

hebrew: פַּעֲמֹ֤ן וְרִמֹּן֙ פַּעֲמֹ֣ן וְרִמֹּ֔ן עַל־שׁוּלֵ֥י הַמְּעִ֖יל סָבִ֑יב לְשָׁרֵ֕ת כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: pa'amon v'rimon pa'amon v'rimon 'al-shvley ham'iyl saviyv l'sharet kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (s)
translation: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, all around the hem of the robe for officiating in—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֛וּ אֶת־הַכָּתְנֹ֥ת שֵׁ֖שׁ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֹרֵ֑ג לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָֽיו׃
transliteration: vaya'asv et-hakat'not shesh ma'aseh oreg l'aharon vl'vanayv
translation: They made the tunics of fine linen, of woven work, for Aaron and his sons;

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ הַמִּצְנֶ֣פֶת שֵׁ֔שׁ וְאֶת־פַּאֲרֵ֥י הַמִּגְבָּעֹ֖ת שֵׁ֑שׁ וְאֶת־מִכְנְסֵ֥י הַבָּ֖ד שֵׁ֥שׁ מָשְׁזָֽר׃
transliteration: v'et hamitz'nefet shesh v'et-paarey hamig'ba'ot shesh v'et-mikh'n'sey habad shesh mash'zar
translation: and the headdress of fine linen, and the decorated turbans of fine linen, and the linen breeches of fine twisted linen;

hebrew: וְֽאֶת־הָאַבְנֵ֞ט שֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֗ר וּתְכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'et-haav'net shesh mash'zar vt'khelet v'ar'gaman v'tvola'at shaniy ma'aseh rokem kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (s)
translation: and sashes of fine twisted linen, blue, purple, and crimson yarns, done in embroidery—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֛וּ אֶת־צִ֥יץ נֵֽזֶר־הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וַיִּכְתְּב֣וּ עָלָ֗יו מִכְתַּב֙ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חוֹתָ֔ם קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'asv et-tziytz nezer-hakodesh zahav tahvor vayikh't'vv 'alayv mikh'tav pitvchey chvotam kodesh layhvah
translation: They made the frontlet for the holy diadem of pure gold, and incised upon it the seal inscription: “Holy to the L<small>ORD</small>.”

hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֤וּ עָלָיו֙ פְּתִ֣יל תְּכֵ֔לֶת לָתֵ֥ת עַל־הַמִּצְנֶ֖פֶת מִלְמָ֑עְלָה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayit'nv 'alayv p'tiyl t'khelet latet 'al-hamitz'nefet mil'ma'lah kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (s)
translation: They attached to it a cord of blue to fix it upon the headdress above—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֕כֶל כָּל־עֲבֹדַ֕ת מִשְׁכַּ֖ן אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וַֽיַּעֲשׂוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כְּ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vatekhel kal-'avodat mish'kan ohel mvo'ed vaya'asv b'ney yis'rael k'khol asher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh ken 'asv (f)
translation: Thus was completed all the work of the Tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting. The Israelites did so; just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses, so they did.

hebrew: וַיָּבִ֤יאוּ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־הָאֹ֖הֶל וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֑יו קְרָסָ֣יו קְרָשָׁ֔יו בריחו [בְּרִיחָ֖יו] וְעַמֻּדָ֥יו וַאֲדָנָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayaviyv et-hamish'kan el-mosheh et-haohel v'et-kal-kelayv k'rasayv k'rashayv vrychv [b'riychayv] v'amudayv vaadanayv
translation: Then they brought the Tabernacle to Moses, with the Tent and all its furnishings: its clasps, its planks, its bars, its posts, and its sockets;

hebrew: וְאֶת־מִכְסֵ֞ה עוֹרֹ֤ת הָֽאֵילִם֙ הַמְאָדָּמִ֔ים וְאֶת־מִכְסֵ֖ה עֹרֹ֣ת הַתְּחָשִׁ֑ים וְאֵ֖ת פָּרֹ֥כֶת הַמָּסָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'et-mikh'seh 'vorot haeylim ham'adamiym v'et-mikh'seh 'orot hat'chashiym v'et parokhet hamasakh'
translation: the covering of tanned ram skins, the covering of dolphin skins, and the curtain for the screen;

hebrew: אֶת־אֲרֹ֥ן הָעֵדֻ֖ת וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֑יו וְאֵ֖ת הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
transliteration: et-aron ha'edut v'et-badayv v'et hakaporet
translation: the Ark of the Pact and its poles, and the cover;

hebrew: אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ אֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֵ֖ת לֶ֥חֶם הַפָּנִֽים׃
transliteration: et-hashul'chan et-kal-kelayv v'et lechem hapaniym
translation: the table and all its utensils, and the bread of display;

hebrew: אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֨ה הַטְּהֹרָ֜ה אֶת־נֵרֹתֶ֗יהָ נֵרֹ֛ת הַמַּֽעֲרָכָ֖ה וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת שֶׁ֥מֶן הַמָּאֽוֹר׃
transliteration: et-ham'norah hat'horah et-neroteyha nerot hama'arakhah v'et-kal-keleyha v'et shemen hamavor
translation: the pure lampstand,eSee note at 31.8. its lamps—lamps in due order—and all its fittings, and the oil for lighting;

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח הַזָּהָ֔ב וְאֵת֙ שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת קְטֹ֣רֶת הַסַּמִּ֑ים וְאֵ֕ת מָסַ֖ךְ פֶּ֥תַח הָאֹֽהֶל׃
transliteration: v'et miz'bach hazahav v'et shemen hamish'chah v'et k'toret hasamiym v'et masakh' petach haohel
translation: the altar of gold, the oil for anointing, the aromatic incense, and the screen for the entrance of the Tent;

hebrew: אֵ֣ת ׀ מִזְבַּ֣ח הַנְּחֹ֗שֶׁת וְאֶת־מִכְבַּ֤ר הַנְּחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ אֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֑יו אֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֖ר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: et  miz'bach han'choshet v'et-mikh'bar han'choshet asher-lvo et-badayv v'et-kal-kelayv et-hakiyor v'et-kanvo
translation: the copper altar with its copper grating, its poles and all its utensils, and the laver and its stand;

hebrew: אֵת֩ קַלְעֵ֨י הֶחָצֵ֜ר אֶת־עַמֻּדֶ֣יהָ וְאֶת־אֲדָנֶ֗יהָ וְאֶת־הַמָּסָךְ֙ לְשַׁ֣עַר הֶֽחָצֵ֔ר אֶת־מֵיתָרָ֖יו וִיתֵדֹתֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֗ת כָּל־כְּלֵ֛י עֲבֹדַ֥ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן לְאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: et kal'ey hechatzer et-'amudeyha v'et-adaneyha v'et-hamasakh' l'sha'ar hechatzer et-meytarayv viytedoteyha v'et kal-k'ley 'avodat hamish'kan l'ohel mvo'ed
translation: the hangings of the enclosure, its posts and its sockets, the screen for the gate of the enclosure, its cords and its pegs—all the furnishings for the service of the Tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting;

hebrew: אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י הַשְּׂרָ֖ד לְשָׁרֵ֣ת בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו לְכַהֵֽן׃
transliteration: et-big'dey has'rad l'sharet bakodesh et-big'dey hakodesh l'aharon hakohen v'et-big'dey vanayv l'khahen
translation: the service vestments for officiating in the sanctuary, the sacral vestments of Aaron the priest, and the vestments of his sons for priestly service.

hebrew: כְּכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה כֵּ֤ן עָשׂוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת כָּל־הָעֲבֹדָֽה׃
transliteration: k'khol asher-tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh ken 'asv b'ney yis'rael et kal-ha'avodah
translation: Just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses, so the Israelites had done all the work.

hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־כָּל־הַמְּלָאכָ֗ה וְהִנֵּה֙ עָשׂ֣וּ אֹתָ֔הּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה כֵּ֣ן עָשׂ֑וּ וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֹתָ֖ם מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayar' mosheh et-kal-ham'lakhah v'hineh 'asv otah kaasher tzivah y'hvah ken 'asv vay'varekh' otam mosheh (f)
translation: And when Moses saw that they had performed all the tasks—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded, so they had done—Moses blessed them.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: בְּיוֹם־הַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ תָּקִ֕ים אֶת־מִשְׁכַּ֖ן אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: b'yvom-hachodesh harishvon b'echad lachodesh takiym et-mish'kan ohel mvo'ed
translation: On the first day of the first month you shall set up the Tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ שָׁ֔ם אֵ֖ת אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵד֑וּת וְסַכֹּתָ֥ עַל־הָאָרֹ֖ן אֶת־הַפָּרֹֽכֶת׃
transliteration: v'sam'ta sham et arvon ha'edvt v'sakota 'al-haaron et-haparokhet
translation: Place there the Ark of the Pact, and screen off the ark with the curtain.

hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתָ֙ אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֔ן וְעָרַכְתָּ֖ אֶת־עֶרְכּ֑וֹ וְהֵבֵאתָ֙ אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֔ה וְהַעֲלֵיתָ֖ אֶת־נֵרֹתֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: v'heveta et-hashul'chan v'arakh'ta et-'er'kvo v'heveta et-ham'norah v'ha'aleyta et-neroteyha
translation: Bring in the table and lay out its due setting; bring in the lampstand and light its lamps;

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֞ה אֶת־מִזְבַּ֤ח הַזָּהָב֙ לִקְטֹ֔רֶת לִפְנֵ֖י אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵדֻ֑ת וְשַׂמְתָּ֛ אֶת־מָסַ֥ךְ הַפֶּ֖תַח לַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
transliteration: v'natatah et-miz'bach hazahav lik'toret lif'ney arvon ha'edut v'sam'ta et-masakh' hapetach lamish'kan
translation: and place the gold altar of incense before the Ark of the Pact. Then put up the screen for the entrance of the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וְנָ֣תַתָּ֔ה אֵ֖ת מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֑ה לִפְנֵ֕י פֶּ֖תַח מִשְׁכַּ֥ן אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'natatah et miz'bach ha'olah lif'ney petach mish'kan ohel-mvo'ed
translation: You shall place the altar of burnt offering before the entrance of the Tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְנָֽתַתָּ֙ אֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֔ר בֵּֽין־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וּבֵ֣ין הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְנָתַתָּ֥ שָׁ֖ם מָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'natata et-hakiyor beyn-ohel mvo'ed vveyn hamiz'becha v'natata sham mayim
translation: Place the laver between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water in it.

hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ אֶת־הֶחָצֵ֖ר סָבִ֑יב וְנָ֣תַתָּ֔ אֶת־מָסַ֖ךְ שַׁ֥עַר הֶחָצֵֽר׃
transliteration: v'sam'ta et-hechatzer saviyv v'natata et-masakh' sha'ar hechatzer
translation: Set up the enclosure round about, and put in place the screen for the gate of the enclosure.

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן וְאֶת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־בּ֑וֹ וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹת֛וֹ וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֖יו וְהָ֥יָה קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta et-shemen hamish'chah vmashach'ta et-hamish'kan v'et-kal-asher-bvo v'kidash'ta otvo v'et-kal-kelayv v'hayah kodesh
translation: You shall take the anointing oil and anoint the Tabernacle and all that is in it to consecrate it and all its furnishings, so that it shall be holy.

hebrew: וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֛ אֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֙ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְהָיָ֥ה הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: vmashach'ta et-miz'bach ha'olah v'et-kal-kelayv v'kidash'ta et-hamiz'becha v'hayah hamiz'becha kodesh kadashiym
translation: Then anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils to consecrate the altar, so that the altar shall be most holy.

hebrew: וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֖ר וְאֶת־כַּנּ֑וֹ וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֖ אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vmashach'ta et-hakiyor v'et-kanvo v'kidash'ta otvo
translation: And anoint the laver and its stand to consecrate it.

hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֤ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֔יו אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְרָחַצְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בַּמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'hik'rav'ta et-aharon v'et-banayv el-petach ohel mvo'ed v'rachatz'ta otam bamayim
translation: You shall bring Aaron and his sons forward to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and wash them with the water.

hebrew: וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֙ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֔ן אֵ֖ת בִּגְדֵ֣י הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֥ אֹת֛וֹ וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹת֖וֹ וְכִהֵ֥ן לִֽי׃
transliteration: v'hil'bash'ta et-aharon et big'dey hakodesh vmashach'ta otvo v'kidash'ta otvo v'khihen liy
translation: Put the sacral vestments on Aaron, and anoint him and consecrate him, that he may serve Me as priest.

hebrew: וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו תַּקְרִ֑יב וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם כֻּתֳּנֹֽת׃
transliteration: v'et-banayv tak'riyv v'hil'bash'ta otam kutonot
translation: Then bring his sons forward, put tunics on them,

hebrew: וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֣ אֹתָ֗ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר מָשַׁ֙חְתָּ֙ אֶת־אֲבִיהֶ֔ם וְכִהֲנ֖וּ לִ֑י וְ֠הָיְתָה לִהְיֹ֨ת לָהֶ֧ם מָשְׁחָתָ֛ם לִכְהֻנַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vmashach'ta otam kaasher mashach'ta et-aviyhem v'khihanv liy v'hay'tah lih'yot lahem mash'chatam likh'hunat 'volam l'dorotam
translation: and anoint them as you have anointed their father, that they may serve Me as priests. This their anointing shall serve them for everlasting priesthood throughout the ages.

hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֑ה כְּ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֹת֖וֹ כֵּ֥ן עָשָֽׂה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vaya'as mosheh k'khol asher tzivah y'hvah otvo ken 'asah (s)
translation: This Moses did; just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded him, so he did.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י בַּחֹ֧דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֛וֹן בַּשָּׁנָ֥ה הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ הוּקַ֖ם הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
transliteration: vay'hiy bachodesh harishvon bashanah hasheniyt b'echad lachodesh hvkam hamish'kan
translation: In the first month of the second year, on the first of the month, the Tabernacle was set up.

hebrew: וַיָּ֨קֶם מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֗ן וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־אֲדָנָ֔יו וַיָּ֙שֶׂם֙ אֶת־קְרָשָׁ֔יו וַיִּתֵּ֖ן אֶת־בְּרִיחָ֑יו וַיָּ֖קֶם אֶת־עַמּוּדָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayakem mosheh et-hamish'kan vayiten et-adanayv vayasem et-k'rashayv vayiten et-b'riychayv vayakem et-'amvdayv
translation: Moses set up the Tabernacle, placing its sockets, setting up its planks, inserting its bars, and erecting its posts.

hebrew: וַיִּפְרֹ֤שׂ אֶת־הָאֹ֙הֶל֙ עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן וַיָּ֜שֶׂם אֶת־מִכְסֵ֥ה הָאֹ֛הֶל עָלָ֖יו מִלְמָ֑עְלָה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayif'ros et-haohel 'al-hamish'kan vayasem et-mikh'seh haohel 'alayv mil'ma'lah kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (s)
translation: He spread the tent over the Tabernacle, placing the covering of the tent on top of it—just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח וַיִּתֵּ֤ן אֶת־הָעֵדֻת֙ אֶל־הָ֣אָרֹ֔ן וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֖ים עַל־הָאָרֹ֑ן וַיִּתֵּ֧ן אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת עַל־הָאָרֹ֖ן מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃
transliteration: vayikach vayiten et-ha'edut el-haaron vayasem et-habadiym 'al-haaron vayiten et-hakaporet 'al-haaron mil'ma'lah
translation: He took the Pact and placed it in the ark; he fixed the poles to the ark, placed the cover on top of the ark,

hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֣א אֶת־הָאָרֹן֮ אֶל־הַמִּשְׁכָּן֒ וַיָּ֗שֶׂם אֵ֚ת פָּרֹ֣כֶת הַמָּסָ֔ךְ וַיָּ֕סֶךְ עַ֖ל אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵד֑וּת כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayave et-haaron el-hamish'kan vayasem et parokhet hamasakh' vayasekh' 'al arvon ha'edvt kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (s)
translation: and brought the ark inside the Tabernacle. Then he put up the curtain for screening, and screened off the Ark of the Pact—just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד עַ֛ל יֶ֥רֶךְ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן צָפֹ֑נָה מִח֖וּץ לַפָּרֹֽכֶת׃
transliteration: vayiten et-hashul'chan b'ohel mvo'ed 'al yerekh' hamish'kan tzafonah michvtz laparokhet
translation: He placed the table in the Tent of Meeting, outside the curtain, on the north side of the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וַיַּעֲרֹ֥ךְ עָלָ֛יו עֵ֥רֶךְ לֶ֖חֶם לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vaya'arokh' 'alayv 'erekh' lechem lif'ney y'hvah kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (s)
translation: Upon it he laid out the setting of bread before the L<small>ORD</small>—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיָּ֤שֶׂם אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָה֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד נֹ֖כַח הַשֻּׁלְחָ֑ן עַ֛ל יֶ֥רֶךְ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן נֶֽגְבָּה׃
transliteration: vayasem et-ham'norah b'ohel mvo'ed nokhach hashul'chan 'al yerekh' hamish'kan neg'bah
translation: He placed the lampstand in the Tent of Meeting opposite the table, on the south side of the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל הַנֵּרֹ֖ת לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vaya'al hanerot lif'ney y'hvah kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (s)
translation: And he lit the lamps before the L<small>ORD</small>—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיָּ֛שֶׂם אֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הַזָּהָ֖ב בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד לִפְנֵ֖י הַפָּרֹֽכֶת׃
transliteration: vayasem et-miz'bach hazahav b'ohel mvo'ed lif'ney haparokhet
translation: He placed the altar of gold in the Tent of Meeting, before the curtain.

hebrew: וַיַּקְטֵ֥ר עָלָ֖יו קְטֹ֣רֶת סַמִּ֑ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayak'ter 'alayv k'toret samiym kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (f)
translation: On it he burned aromatic incense—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיָּ֛שֶׂם אֶת־מָסַ֥ךְ הַפֶּ֖תַח לַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
transliteration: vayasem et-masakh' hapetach lamish'kan
translation: Then he put up the screen for the entrance of the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֔ה שָׂ֕ם פֶּ֖תַח מִשְׁכַּ֣ן אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֑ד וַיַּ֣עַל עָלָ֗יו אֶת־הָעֹלָה֙ וְאֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'et miz'bach ha'olah sam petach mish'kan ohel-mvo'ed vaya'al 'alayv et-ha'olah v'et-hamin'chah kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (s)
translation: At the entrance of the Tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting he placed the altar of burnt offering. On it he offered up the burnt offering and the meal offering—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיָּ֙שֶׂם֙ אֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֔ר בֵּֽין־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וּבֵ֣ין הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּתֵּ֥ן שָׁ֛מָּה מַ֖יִם לְרָחְצָֽה׃
transliteration: vayasem et-hakiyor beyn-ohel mvo'ed vveyn hamiz'becha vayiten shamah mayim l'rach'tzah
translation: He placed the laver between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water in it for washing.

hebrew: וְרָחֲצ֣וּ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֣ן וּבָנָ֑יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־רַגְלֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'rachatzv mimenv mosheh v'aharon vvanayv et-y'deyhem v'et-rag'leyhem
translation: From it Moses and Aaron and his sons would wash their hands and feet;

hebrew: בְּבֹאָ֞ם אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֗ד וּבְקָרְבָתָ֛ם אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ יִרְחָ֑צוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: b'voam el-ohel mvo'ed vv'kar'vatam el-hamiz'becha yir'chatzv kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (s)
translation: they washed when they entered the Tent of Meeting and when they approached the altar—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיָּ֣קֶם אֶת־הֶחָצֵ֗ר סָבִיב֙ לַמִּשְׁכָּ֣ן וְלַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וַיִּתֵּ֕ן אֶת־מָסַ֖ךְ שַׁ֣עַר הֶחָצֵ֑ר וַיְכַ֥ל מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶת־הַמְּלָאכָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayakem et-hechatzer saviyv lamish'kan v'lamiz'becha vayiten et-masakh' sha'ar hechatzer vay'khal mosheh et-ham'lakhah (f)
translation:
And he set up the enclosure around the Tabernacle and the altar, and put up the screen for the gate of the enclosure.
When Moses had finished the work,

hebrew: וַיְכַ֥ס הֶעָנָ֖ן אֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וּכְב֣וֹד יְהוָ֔ה מָלֵ֖א אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
transliteration: vay'khas he'anan et-ohel mvo'ed vkh'vvod y'hvah male et-hamish'kan
translation: the cloud covered the Tent of Meeting, and the Presence of the L<small>ORD</small> filled the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וְלֹא־יָכֹ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֗ה לָבוֹא֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד כִּֽי־שָׁכַ֥ן עָלָ֖יו הֶעָנָ֑ן וּכְב֣וֹד יְהוָ֔ה מָלֵ֖א אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
transliteration: v'lo-yakhol mosheh lavvo el-ohel mvo'ed kiy-shakhan 'alayv he'anan vkh'vvod y'hvah male et-hamish'kan
translation: Moses could not enter the Tent of Meeting, because the cloud had settled upon it and the Presence of the L<small>ORD</small> filled the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וּבְהֵעָל֤וֹת הֶֽעָנָן֙ מֵעַ֣ל הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן יִסְע֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּכֹ֖ל מַסְעֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vv'he'alvot he'anan me'al hamish'kan yis'v b'ney yis'rael b'khol mas'eyhem
translation: When the cloud lifted from the Tabernacle, the Israelites would set out, on their various journeys;

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֥א יֵעָלֶ֖ה הֶעָנָ֑ן וְלֹ֣א יִסְע֔וּ עַד־י֖וֹם הֵעָלֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im-lo ye'aleh he'anan v'lo yis'v 'ad-yvom he'alotvo
translation: but if the cloud did not lift, they would not set out until such time as it did lift.

hebrew: כִּי֩ עֲנַ֨ן יְהוָ֤ה עַֽל־הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ יוֹמָ֔ם וְאֵ֕שׁ תִּהְיֶ֥ה לַ֖יְלָה בּ֑וֹ לְעֵינֵ֥י כָל־בֵּֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּכָל־מַסְעֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: kiy 'anan y'hvah 'al-hamish'kan yvomam v'esh tih'yeh lay'lah bvo l'eyney khal-beyt-yis'rael b'khal-mas'eyhem
translation: For over the Tabernacle a cloud of the LORD rested by day, and fire would appear in itaI.e., in the cloud. by night, in the view of all the house of Israel throughout their journeys.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֖א אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֵלָ֔יו מֵאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayik'ra el-mosheh vay'daber y'hvah elayv meohel mvo'ed lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> called to Moses and spoke to him from the Tent of Meeting, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אָדָ֗ם כִּֽי־יַקְרִ֥יב מִכֶּ֛ם קָרְבָּ֖ן לַֽיהוָ֑ה מִן־הַבְּהֵמָ֗ה מִן־הַבָּקָר֙ וּמִן־הַצֹּ֔אן תַּקְרִ֖יבוּ אֶת־קָרְבַּנְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem adam kiy-yak'riyv mikem kar'ban layhvah min-hab'hemah min-habakar vmin-hatzon tak'riyvv et-kar'ban'khem
translation:
Speak to the Israelite people, and say to them:
When any of you presents an offering of cattle to the LORD, aLit. “you shall offer your.”he shall choose his-a offering from the herd or from the flock.

hebrew: אִם־עֹלָ֤ה קָרְבָּנוֹ֙ מִן־הַבָּקָ֔ר זָכָ֥ר תָּמִ֖ים יַקְרִיבֶ֑נּוּ אֶל־פֶּ֝תַח אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ יַקְרִ֣יב אֹת֔וֹ לִרְצֹנ֖וֹ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: im-'olah kar'banvo min-habakar zakhar tamiym yak'riyvenv el-petach ohel mvo'ed yak'riyv otvo lir'tzonvo lif'ney y'hvah
translation: If his offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he shall make his offering a male without blemish. He shall bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, for acceptance in his behalf before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְסָמַ֣ךְ יָד֔וֹ עַ֖ל רֹ֣אשׁ הָעֹלָ֑ה וְנִרְצָ֥ה ל֖וֹ לְכַפֵּ֥ר עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'samakh' yadvo 'al rosh ha'olah v'nir'tzah lvo l'khaper 'alayv
translation: He shall lay his hand upon the head of the burnt offering, that it may be acceptable in his behalf, in expiation for him.

hebrew: וְשָׁחַ֛ט אֶת־בֶּ֥ן הַבָּקָ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְ֠הִקְרִיבוּ בְּנֵ֨י אַהֲרֹ֤ן הַֽכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וְזָרְק֨וּ אֶת־הַדָּ֤ם עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ סָבִ֔יב אֲשֶׁר־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'shachat et-ben habakar lif'ney y'hvah v'hik'riyvv b'ney aharon hakohaniym et-hadam v'zar'kv et-hadam 'al-hamiz'becha saviyv asher-petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: The bull shall be slaughtered before the L<small>ORD</small>; and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall offer the blood, dashing the blood against all sides of the altar which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְהִפְשִׁ֖יט אֶת־הָעֹלָ֑ה וְנִתַּ֥ח אֹתָ֖הּ לִנְתָחֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: v'hif'shiyt et-ha'olah v'nitach otah lin'tacheyha
translation: The burnt offering shall be flayed and cut up into sections.

hebrew: וְ֠נָתְנוּ בְּנֵ֨י אַהֲרֹ֧ן הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֵ֖שׁ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְעָרְכ֥וּ עֵצִ֖ים עַל־הָאֵֽשׁ׃
transliteration: v'nat'nv b'ney aharon hakohen esh 'al-hamiz'becha v'ar'khv 'etziym 'al-haesh
translation: The sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire on the altar and lay out wood upon the fire;

hebrew: וְעָרְכ֗וּ בְּנֵ֤י אַהֲרֹן֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים אֵ֚ת הַנְּתָחִ֔ים אֶת־הָרֹ֖אשׁ וְאֶת־הַפָּ֑דֶר עַל־הָעֵצִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָאֵ֔שׁ אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'ar'khv b'ney aharon hakohaniym et han'tachiym et-harosh v'et-hapader 'al-ha'etziym asher 'al-haesh asher 'al-hamiz'becha
translation: and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall lay out the sections, with the head and the suet, on the wood that is on the fire upon the altar.

hebrew: וְקִרְבּ֥וֹ וּכְרָעָ֖יו יִרְחַ֣ץ בַּמָּ֑יִם וְהִקְטִ֨יר הַכֹּהֵ֤ן אֶת־הַכֹּל֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עֹלָ֛ה אִשֵּׁ֥ה רֵֽיחַ־נִיח֖וֹחַ לַֽיהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'kir'bvo vkh'ra'ayv yir'chatz bamayim v'hik'tiyr hakohen et-hakol hamiz'bechah 'olah isheh reycha-niychvocha layhvah (s)
translation: Its entrails and legs shall be washed with water, and the priest shall turn the whole into smoke on the altar as a burnt offering, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְאִם־מִן־הַצֹּ֨אן קָרְבָּנ֧וֹ מִן־הַכְּשָׂבִ֛ים א֥וֹ מִן־הָעִזִּ֖ים לְעֹלָ֑ה זָכָ֥ר תָּמִ֖ים יַקְרִיבֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: v'im-min-hatzon kar'banvo min-hak'saviym vo min-ha'iziym l'olah zakhar tamiym yak'riyvenv
translation: If his offering for a burnt offering is from the flock, of sheep or of goats, he shall make his offering a male without blemish.

hebrew: וְשָׁחַ֨ט אֹת֜וֹ עַ֣ל יֶ֧רֶךְ הַמִּזְבֵּ֛חַ צָפֹ֖נָה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְזָרְק֡וּ בְּנֵי֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן הַכֹּהֲנִ֧ים אֶת־דָּמ֛וֹ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'shachat otvo 'al yerekh' hamiz'becha tzafonah lif'ney y'hvah v'zar'kv b'ney aharon hakohaniym et-damvo 'al-hamiz'becha saviyv
translation: It shall be slaughtered before the L<small>ORD</small> on the north side of the altar, and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall dash its blood against all sides of the altar.

hebrew: וְנִתַּ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ לִנְתָחָ֔יו וְאֶת־רֹאשׁ֖וֹ וְאֶת־פִּדְר֑וֹ וְעָרַ֤ךְ הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֹתָ֔ם עַל־הָֽעֵצִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָאֵ֔שׁ אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'nitach otvo lin'tachayv v'et-roshvo v'et-pid'rvo v'arakh' hakohen otam 'al-ha'etziym asher 'al-haesh asher 'al-hamiz'becha
translation: When it has been cut up into sections, the priest shall lay them out, with the head and the suet, on the wood that is on the fire upon the altar.

hebrew: וְהַקֶּ֥רֶב וְהַכְּרָעַ֖יִם יִרְחַ֣ץ בַּמָּ֑יִם וְהִקְרִ֨יב הַכֹּהֵ֤ן אֶת־הַכֹּל֙ וְהִקְטִ֣יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עֹלָ֣ה ה֗וּא אִשֵּׁ֛ה רֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hakerev v'hak'ra'ayim yir'chatz bamayim v'hik'riyv hakohen et-hakol v'hik'tiyr hamiz'bechah 'olah hv isheh reycha niychocha layhvah (f)
translation: The entrails and the legs shall be washed with water; the priest shall offer up and turn the whole into smoke on the altar. It is a burnt offering, an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְאִ֧ם מִן־הָע֛וֹף עֹלָ֥ה קָרְבָּנ֖וֹ לַֽיהוָ֑ה וְהִקְרִ֣יב מִן־הַתֹּרִ֗ים א֛וֹ מִן־בְּנֵ֥י הַיּוֹנָ֖ה אֶת־קָרְבָּנֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im min-ha'vof 'olah kar'banvo layhvah v'hik'riyv min-hatoriym vo min-b'ney hayvonah et-kar'banvo
translation: If his offering to the L<small>ORD</small> is a burnt offering of birds, he shall choose his offering from turtledoves or pigeons.

hebrew: וְהִקְרִיב֤וֹ הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וּמָלַק֙ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ וְהִקְטִ֖יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה וְנִמְצָ֣ה דָמ֔וֹ עַ֖ל קִ֥יר הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyvvo hakohen el-hamiz'becha vmalak et-roshvo v'hik'tiyr hamiz'bechah v'nim'tzah damvo 'al kiyr hamiz'becha
translation: The priest shall bring it to the altar, pinch off its head, and turn it into smoke on the altar; and its blood shall be drained out against the side of the altar.

hebrew: וְהֵסִ֥יר אֶת־מֻרְאָת֖וֹ בְּנֹצָתָ֑הּ וְהִשְׁלִ֨יךְ אֹתָ֜הּ אֵ֤צֶל הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ קֵ֔דְמָה אֶל־מְק֖וֹם הַדָּֽשֶׁן׃
transliteration: v'hesiyr et-mur'atvo b'notzatah v'hish'liykh' otah etzel hamiz'becha ked'mah el-m'kvom hadashen
translation: He shall remove its crop with its contents,bOthers “feathers.” and cast it into the place of the ashes, at the east side of the altar.

hebrew: וְשִׁסַּ֨ע אֹת֣וֹ בִכְנָפָיו֮ לֹ֣א יַבְדִּיל֒ וְהִקְטִ֨יר אֹת֤וֹ הַכֹּהֵן֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עַל־הָעֵצִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָאֵ֑שׁ עֹלָ֣ה ה֗וּא אִשֵּׁ֛ה רֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'shisa' otvo vikh'nafayv lo yav'diyl v'hik'tiyr otvo hakohen hamiz'bechah 'al-ha'etziym asher 'al-haesh 'olah hv isheh reycha niychocha layhvah (s)
translation: The priest shall tear it open by its wings, without severing it, and turn it into smoke on the altar, upon the wood that is on the fire. It is a burnt offering, an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְנֶ֗פֶשׁ כִּֽי־תַקְרִ֞יב קָרְבַּ֤ן מִנְחָה֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה סֹ֖לֶת יִהְיֶ֣ה קָרְבָּנ֑וֹ וְיָצַ֤ק עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ שֶׁ֔מֶן וְנָתַ֥ן עָלֶ֖יהָ לְבֹנָֽה׃
transliteration: v'nefesh kiy-tak'riyv kar'ban min'chah layhvah solet yih'yeh kar'banvo v'yatzak 'aleyha shemen v'natan 'aleyha l'vonah
translation: When a person presents an offering of meal to the L<small>ORD</small>, his offering shall be of choice flour; he shall pour oil upon it, lay frankincense on it,

hebrew: וֶֽהֱבִיאָ֗הּ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹן֮ הַכֹּהֲנִים֒ וְקָמַ֨ץ מִשָּׁ֜ם מְלֹ֣א קֻמְצ֗וֹ מִסָּלְתָּהּ֙ וּמִשַּׁמְנָ֔הּ עַ֖ל כָּל־לְבֹנָתָ֑הּ וְהִקְטִ֨יר הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־אַזְכָּרָתָהּ֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה אִשֵּׁ֛ה רֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: veheviyah el-b'ney aharon hakohaniym v'kamatz misham m'lo kum'tzvo misal'tah vmisham'nah 'al kal-l'vonatah v'hik'tiyr hakohen et-az'karatah hamiz'bechah isheh reycha niychocha layhvah
translation: and present it to Aaron’s sons, the priests. The priest shall scoop out of it a handful of its choice flour and oil, as well as all of its frankincense; and this token portion he shall turn into smoke on the altar, as an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתֶ֙רֶת֙ מִן־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָ֑יו קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים מֵאִשֵּׁ֥י יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hanvoteret min-hamin'chah l'aharon vl'vanayv kodesh kadashiym meishey y'hvah (s)
translation: And the remainder of the meal offering shall be for Aaron and his sons, a most holy portion from the L<small>ORD</small>’s offerings by fire.

hebrew: וְכִ֥י תַקְרִ֛ב קָרְבַּ֥ן מִנְחָ֖ה מַאֲפֵ֣ה תַנּ֑וּר סֹ֣לֶת חַלּ֤וֹת מַצֹּת֙ בְּלוּלֹ֣ת בַּשֶּׁ֔מֶן וּרְקִיקֵ֥י מַצּ֖וֹת מְשֻׁחִ֥ים בַּשָּֽׁמֶן׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khiy tak'riv kar'ban min'chah maafeh tanvr solet chalvot matzot b'lvlot bashemen vr'kiykey matzvot m'shuchiym bashamen (s)
translation: When you present an offering of meal baked in the oven, [it shall be of] choice flour: unleavened cakes with oil mixed in, or unleavened wafers spread with oil.

hebrew: וְאִם־מִנְחָ֥ה עַל־הַֽמַּחֲבַ֖ת קָרְבָּנֶ֑ךָ סֹ֛לֶת בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן מַצָּ֥ה תִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'im-min'chah 'al-hamachavat kar'banekha solet b'lvlah vashemen matzah tih'yeh
translation: If your offering is a meal offering on a griddle, it shall be of choice flour with oil mixed in, unleavened.

hebrew: פָּת֤וֹת אֹתָהּ֙ פִּתִּ֔ים וְיָצַקְתָּ֥ עָלֶ֖יהָ שָׁ֑מֶן מִנְחָ֖ה הִֽוא׃ (ס)
transliteration: patvot otah pitiym v'yatzak'ta 'aleyha shamen min'chah hiv (s)
translation: Break it into bits and pour oil on it; it is a meal offering.

hebrew: וְאִם־מִנְחַ֥ת מַרְחֶ֖שֶׁת קָרְבָּנֶ֑ךָ סֹ֥לֶת בַּשֶּׁ֖מֶן תֵּעָשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: v'im-min'chat mar'cheshet kar'banekha solet bashemen te'aseh
translation: If your offering is a meal offering in a pan, it shall be made of choice flour in oil.

hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתָ֣ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר יֵעָשֶׂ֛ה מֵאֵ֖לֶּה לַיהוָ֑ה וְהִקְרִיבָהּ֙ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהִגִּישָׁ֖הּ אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'heveta et-hamin'chah asher ye'aseh meeleh layhvah v'hik'riyvah el-hakohen v'higiyshah el-hamiz'becha
translation: When you present to the L<small>ORD</small> a meal offering that is made in any of these ways, it shall be brought to the priest who shall take it up to the altar.

hebrew: וְהֵרִ֨ים הַכֹּהֵ֤ן מִן־הַמִּנְחָה֙ אֶת־אַזְכָּ֣רָתָ֔הּ וְהִקְטִ֖יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה אִשֵּׁ֛ה רֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'heriym hakohen min-hamin'chah et-az'karatah v'hik'tiyr hamiz'bechah isheh reycha niychocha layhvah
translation: The priest shall remove the token portion from the meal offering and turn it into smoke on the altar as an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתֶ֙רֶת֙ מִן־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָ֑יו קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים מֵאִשֵּׁ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hanvoteret min-hamin'chah l'aharon vl'vanayv kodesh kadashiym meishey y'hvah
translation: And the remainder of the meal offering shall be for Aaron and his sons, a most holy portion from the L<small>ORD</small>’s offerings by fire.

hebrew: כָּל־הַמִּנְחָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר תַּקְרִ֙יבוּ֙ לַיהוָ֔ה לֹ֥א תֵעָשֶׂ֖ה חָמֵ֑ץ כִּ֤י כָל־שְׂאֹר֙ וְכָל־דְּבַ֔שׁ לֹֽא־תַקְטִ֧ירוּ מִמֶּ֛נּוּ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: kal-hamin'chah asher tak'riyvv layhvah lo te'aseh chametz kiy khal-s'or v'khal-d'vash lo-tak'tiyrv mimenv isheh layhvah
translation: No meal offering that you offer to the L<small>ORD</small> shall be made with leaven, for no leaven or honey may be turned into smoke as an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: קָרְבַּ֥ן רֵאשִׁ֛ית תַּקְרִ֥יבוּ אֹתָ֖ם לַיהוָ֑ה וְאֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֥חַ לֹא־יַעֲל֖וּ לְרֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹֽחַ׃
transliteration: kar'ban reshiyt tak'riyvv otam layhvah v'el-hamiz'becha lo-ya'alv l'reycha niychocha
translation: You may bring them to the LORD as an offering of choice products;aExact meaning of Heb. uncertain. but they shall not be offered up on the altar for a pleasing odor.

hebrew: וְכָל־קָרְבַּ֣ן מִנְחָתְךָ֮ בַּמֶּ֣לַח תִּמְלָח֒ וְלֹ֣א תַשְׁבִּ֗ית מֶ֚לַח בְּרִ֣ית אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ מֵעַ֖ל מִנְחָתֶ֑ךָ עַ֥ל כָּל־קָרְבָּנְךָ֖ תַּקְרִ֥יב מֶֽלַח׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khal-kar'ban min'chat'kha bamelach tim'lach v'lo tash'biyt melach b'riyt eloheykha me'al min'chatekha 'al kal-kar'ban'kha tak'riyv melach (s)
translation: You shall season your every offering of meal with salt; you shall not omit from your meal offering the salt of your covenant with God; with all your offerings you must offer salt.

hebrew: וְאִם־תַּקְרִ֛יב מִנְחַ֥ת בִּכּוּרִ֖ים לַיהוָ֑ה אָבִ֞יב קָל֤וּי בָּאֵשׁ֙ גֶּ֣רֶשׂ כַּרְמֶ֔ל תַּקְרִ֕יב אֵ֖ת מִנְחַ֥ת בִּכּוּרֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'im-tak'riyv min'chat bikvriym layhvah aviyv kalvy baesh geres kar'mel tak'riyv et min'chat bikvreykha
translation: If you bring a meal offering of first fruits to the L<small>ORD</small>, you shall bring new ears parched with fire, grits of the fresh grain, as your meal offering of first fruits.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֤ עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ שֶׁ֔מֶן וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ עָלֶ֖יהָ לְבֹנָ֑ה מִנְחָ֖ה הִֽוא׃
transliteration: v'natata 'aleyha shemen v'sam'ta 'aleyha l'vonah min'chah hiv
translation: You shall add oil to it and lay frankincense on it; it is a meal offering.

hebrew: וְהִקְטִ֨יר הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־אַזְכָּרָתָ֗הּ מִגִּרְשָׂהּ֙ וּמִשַּׁמְנָ֔הּ עַ֖ל כָּל־לְבֹנָתָ֑הּ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hik'tiyr hakohen et-az'karatah migir'sah vmisham'nah 'al kal-l'vonatah isheh layhvah (f)
translation: And the priest shall turn a token portion of it into smoke: some of the grits and oil, with all of the frankincense, as an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְאִם־זֶ֥בַח שְׁלָמִ֖ים קָרְבָּנ֑וֹ אִ֤ם מִן־הַבָּקָר֙ ה֣וּא מַקְרִ֔יב אִם־זָכָר֙ אִם־נְקֵבָ֔ה תָּמִ֥ים יַקְרִיבֶ֖נּוּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'im-zevach sh'lamiym kar'banvo im min-habakar hv mak'riyv im-zakhar im-n'kevah tamiym yak'riyvenv lif'ney y'hvah
translation:
If his offering is a sacrifice of well-beingaOthers “peace offering.” Exact meaning of shelamim uncertain.—
If he offers of the herd, whether a male or a female, he shall bring before the LORD one without blemish.

hebrew: וְסָמַ֤ךְ יָדוֹ֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ קָרְבָּנ֔וֹ וּשְׁחָט֕וֹ פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְזָרְק֡וּ בְּנֵי֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן הַכֹּהֲנִ֧ים אֶת־הַדָּ֛ם עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'samakh' yadvo 'al-rosh kar'banvo vsh'chatvo petach ohel mvo'ed v'zar'kv b'ney aharon hakohaniym et-hadam 'al-hamiz'becha saviyv
translation: He shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering and slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting; and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall dash the blood against all sides of the altar.

hebrew: וְהִקְרִיב֙ מִזֶּ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִ֔ים אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָ֑ה אֶת־הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ הַֽמְכַסֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַקֶּ֔רֶב וְאֵת֙ כָּל־הַחֵ֔לֶב אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַקֶּֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyv mizevach hash'lamiym isheh layhvah et-hachelev ham'khaseh et-hakerev v'et kal-hachelev asher 'al-hakerev
translation: He shall then present from the sacrifice of well-being, as an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>, the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is about the entrails;

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֔ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵהֶ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַכְּסָלִ֑ים וְאֶת־הַיֹּתֶ֙רֶת֙ עַל־הַכָּבֵ֔ד עַל־הַכְּלָי֖וֹת יְסִירֶֽנָּה׃
transliteration: v'et sh'tey hak'layot v'et-hachelev asher 'alehen asher 'al-hak'saliym v'et-hayoteret 'al-hakaved 'al-hak'layvot y'siyrenah
translation: the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, that is at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys.

hebrew: וְהִקְטִ֨ירוּ אֹת֤וֹ בְנֵֽי־אַהֲרֹן֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עַל־הָ֣עֹלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הָעֵצִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָאֵ֑שׁ אִשֵּׁ֛ה רֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַֽיהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hik'tiyrv otvo v'ney-aharon hamiz'bechah 'al-ha'olah asher 'al-ha'etziym asher 'al-haesh isheh reycha niychocha layhvah (f)
translation: Aaron’s sons shall turn these into smoke on the altar, with the burnt offering which is upon the wood that is on the fire, as an offering by fire, of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְאִם־מִן־הַצֹּ֧אן קָרְבָּנ֛וֹ לְזֶ֥בַח שְׁלָמִ֖ים לַיהוָ֑ה זָכָר֙ א֣וֹ נְקֵבָ֔ה תָּמִ֖ים יַקְרִיבֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: v'im-min-hatzon kar'banvo l'zevach sh'lamiym layhvah zakhar vo n'kevah tamiym yak'riyvenv
translation: And if his offering for a sacrifice of well-being to the L<small>ORD</small> is from the flock, whether a male or a female, he shall offer one without blemish.

hebrew: אִם־כֶּ֥שֶׂב הֽוּא־מַקְרִ֖יב אֶת־קָרְבָּנ֑וֹ וְהִקְרִ֥יב אֹת֖וֹ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: im-kesev hv-mak'riyv et-kar'banvo v'hik'riyv otvo lif'ney y'hvah
translation: If he presents a sheep as his offering, he shall bring it before the L<small>ORD</small>

hebrew: וְסָמַ֤ךְ אֶת־יָדוֹ֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ קָרְבָּנ֔וֹ וְשָׁחַ֣ט אֹת֔וֹ לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְ֠זָרְקוּ בְּנֵ֨י אַהֲרֹ֧ן אֶת־דָּמ֛וֹ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'samakh' et-yadvo 'al-rosh kar'banvo v'shachat otvo lif'ney ohel mvo'ed v'zar'kv b'ney aharon et-damvo 'al-hamiz'becha saviyv
translation: and lay his hand upon the head of his offering. It shall be slaughtered before the Tent of Meeting, and Aaron’s sons shall dash its blood against all sides of the altar.

hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֨יב מִזֶּ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִים֮ אִשֶּׁ֣ה לַיהוָה֒ חֶלְבּוֹ֙ הָאַלְיָ֣ה תְמִימָ֔ה לְעֻמַּ֥ת הֶעָצֶ֖ה יְסִירֶ֑נָּה וְאֶת־הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ הַֽמְכַסֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַקֶּ֔רֶב וְאֵת֙ כָּל־הַחֵ֔לֶב אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַקֶּֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyv mizevach hash'lamiym isheh layhvah chel'bvo haal'yah t'miymah l'umat he'atzeh y'siyrenah v'et-hachelev ham'khaseh et-hakerev v'et kal-hachelev asher 'al-hakerev
translation: He shall then present, as an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>, the fat from the sacrifice of well-being: the whole broad tail, which shall be removed close to the backbone; the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is about the entrails;

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֔ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵהֶ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַכְּסָלִ֑ים וְאֶת־הַיֹּתֶ֙רֶת֙ עַל־הַכָּבֵ֔ד עַל־הַכְּלָיֹ֖ת יְסִירֶֽנָּה׃
transliteration: v'et sh'tey hak'layot v'et-hachelev asher 'alehen asher 'al-hak'saliym v'et-hayoteret 'al-hakaved 'al-hak'layot y'siyrenah
translation: the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, that is at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys.

hebrew: וְהִקְטִיר֥וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה לֶ֥חֶם אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hik'tiyrvo hakohen hamiz'bechah lechem isheh layhvah (f)
translation: The priest shall turn these into smoke on the altar as food, an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְאִ֥ם עֵ֖ז קָרְבָּנ֑וֹ וְהִקְרִיב֖וֹ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'im 'ez kar'banvo v'hik'riyvvo lif'ney y'hvah
translation: And if his offering is a goat, he shall bring it before the L<small>ORD</small>

hebrew: וְסָמַ֤ךְ אֶת־יָדוֹ֙ עַל־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ וְשָׁחַ֣ט אֹת֔וֹ לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְ֠זָרְקוּ בְּנֵ֨י אַהֲרֹ֧ן אֶת־דָּמ֛וֹ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'samakh' et-yadvo 'al-roshvo v'shachat otvo lif'ney ohel mvo'ed v'zar'kv b'ney aharon et-damvo 'al-hamiz'becha saviyv
translation: and lay his hand upon its head. It shall be slaughtered before the Tent of Meeting, and Aaron’s sons shall dash its blood against all sides of the altar.

hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֤יב מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ קָרְבָּנ֔וֹ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַֽיהוָ֑ה אֶת־הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ הַֽמְכַסֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַקֶּ֔רֶב וְאֵת֙ כָּל־הַחֵ֔לֶב אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַקֶּֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyv mimenv kar'banvo isheh layhvah et-hachelev ham'khaseh et-hakerev v'et kal-hachelev asher 'al-hakerev
translation: He shall then present as his offering from it, as an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>, the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is about the entrails;

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֔ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵהֶ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַכְּסָלִ֑ים וְאֶת־הַיֹּתֶ֙רֶת֙ עַל־הַכָּבֵ֔ד עַל־הַכְּלָיֹ֖ת יְסִירֶֽנָּה׃
transliteration: v'et sh'tey hak'layot v'et-hachelev asher 'alehen asher 'al-hak'saliym v'et-hayoteret 'al-hakaved 'al-hak'layot y'siyrenah
translation: the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, that is at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys.

hebrew: וְהִקְטִירָ֥ם הַכֹּהֵ֖ן הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה לֶ֤חֶם אִשֶּׁה֙ לְרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ כָּל־חֵ֖לֶב לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hik'tiyram hakohen hamiz'bechah lechem isheh l'reycha niychocha kal-chelev layhvah
translation:
The priest shall turn these into smoke on the altar as food, an offering by fire, of pleasing odor.
All fat is the LORD’s.

hebrew: חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכֹ֖ל מֽוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶ֑ם כָּל־חֵ֥לֶב וְכָל־דָּ֖ם לֹ֥א תֹאכֵֽלוּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: chukat 'volam l'doroteykhem b'khol mvosh'voteykhem kal-chelev v'khal-dam lo tokhelv (f)
translation: It is a law for all time throughout the ages, in all your settlements: you must not eat any fat or any blood.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֘ל לֵאמֹר֒ נֶ֗פֶשׁ כִּֽי־תֶחֱטָ֤א בִשְׁגָגָה֙ מִכֹּל֙ מִצְוֺ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר לֹ֣א תֵעָשֶׂ֑ינָה וְעָשָׂ֕ה מֵאַחַ֖ת מֵהֵֽנָּה׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael lemor nefesh kiy-techeta vish'gagah mikol mitz'vot y'hvah asher lo te'aseynah v'asah meachat mehenah
translation:
Speak to the Israelite people thus:
When a person unwittingly incurs guilt in regard to any of the LORD’s commandments about things not to be done, and does one of them—

hebrew: אִ֣ם הַכֹּהֵ֧ן הַמָּשִׁ֛יחַ יֶחֱטָ֖א לְאַשְׁמַ֣ת הָעָ֑ם וְהִקְרִ֡יב עַ֣ל חַטָּאתוֹ֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר חָטָ֜א פַּ֣ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֥ר תָּמִ֛ים לַיהוָ֖ה לְחַטָּֽאת׃
transliteration: im hakohen hamashiycha yecheta l'ash'mat ha'am v'hik'riyv 'al chatatvo asher chata par ben-bakar tamiym layhvah l'chatat
translation: If it is the anointed priest who has incurred guilt, so that blame falls upon the people, he shall offer for the sin of which he is guilty a bull of the herd without blemish as a sin offeringaSo traditionally; more precisely “offering of purgation.” to the LORD.

hebrew: וְהֵבִ֣יא אֶת־הַפָּ֗ר אֶל־פֶּ֛תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְסָמַ֤ךְ אֶת־יָדוֹ֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַפָּ֔ר וְשָׁחַ֥ט אֶת־הַפָּ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'heviy et-hapar el-petach ohel mvo'ed lif'ney y'hvah v'samakh' et-yadvo 'al-rosh hapar v'shachat et-hapar lif'ney y'hvah
translation: He shall bring the bull to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, before the L<small>ORD</small>, and lay his hand upon the head of the bull. The bull shall be slaughtered before the L<small>ORD</small>,

hebrew: וְלָקַ֛ח הַכֹּהֵ֥ן הַמָּשִׁ֖יחַ מִדַּ֣ם הַפָּ֑ר וְהֵבִ֥יא אֹת֖וֹ אֶל־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen hamashiycha midam hapar v'heviy otvo el-ohel mvo'ed
translation: and the anointed priest shall take some of the bull’s blood and bring it into the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְטָבַ֧ל הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־אֶצְבָּע֖וֹ בַּדָּ֑ם וְהִזָּ֨ה מִן־הַדָּ֜ם שֶׁ֤בַע פְּעָמִים֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה אֶת־פְּנֵ֖י פָּרֹ֥כֶת הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: v'taval hakohen et-etz'ba'vo badam v'hizah min-hadam sheva' p'amiym lif'ney y'hvah et-p'ney parokhet hakodesh
translation: The priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle of the blood seven times before the L<small>ORD</small>, in front of the curtain of the Shrine.

hebrew: וְנָתַן֩ הַכֹּהֵ֨ן מִן־הַדָּ֜ם עַל־קַ֠רְנוֹת מִזְבַּ֨ח קְטֹ֤רֶת הַסַּמִּים֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְאֵ֣ת ׀ כָּל־דַּ֣ם הַפָּ֗ר יִשְׁפֹּךְ֙ אֶל־יְסוֹד֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'natan hakohen min-hadam 'al-kar'nvot miz'bach k'toret hasamiym lif'ney y'hvah asher b'ohel mvo'ed v'et  kal-dam hapar yish'pokh' el-y'svod miz'bach ha'olah asher-petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: The priest shall put some of the blood on the horns of the altar of aromatic incense, which is in the Tent of Meeting, before the L<small>ORD</small>; and all the rest of the bull’s blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְאֶת־כָּל־חֵ֛לֶב פַּ֥ר הַֽחַטָּ֖את יָרִ֣ים מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אֶת־הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ הַֽמְכַסֶּ֣ה עַל־הַקֶּ֔רֶב וְאֵת֙ כָּל־הַחֵ֔לֶב אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַקֶּֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'et-kal-chelev par hachatat yariym mimenv et-hachelev ham'khaseh 'al-hakerev v'et kal-hachelev asher 'al-hakerev
translation: He shall remove all the fat from the bull of sin offering: the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is about the entrails;

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֔ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַכְּסָלִ֑ים וְאֶת־הַיֹּתֶ֙רֶת֙ עַל־הַכָּבֵ֔ד עַל־הַכְּלָי֖וֹת יְסִירֶֽנָּה׃
transliteration: v'et sh'tey hak'layot v'et-hachelev asher 'aleyhen asher 'al-hak'saliym v'et-hayoteret 'al-hakaved 'al-hak'layvot y'siyrenah
translation: the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, that is at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which he shall remove with the kidneys—

hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר יוּרַ֔ם מִשּׁ֖וֹר זֶ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִ֑ים וְהִקְטִירָם֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן עַ֖ל מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: kaasher yvram mishvor zevach hash'lamiym v'hik'tiyram hakohen 'al miz'bach ha'olah
translation: just as it is removed from the ox of the sacrifice of well-being. The priest shall turn them into smoke on the altar of burnt offering.

hebrew: וְאֶת־ע֤וֹר הַפָּר֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־בְּשָׂר֔וֹ עַל־רֹאשׁ֖וֹ וְעַל־כְּרָעָ֑יו וְקִרְבּ֖וֹ וּפִרְשֽׁוֹ׃
transliteration: v'et-'vor hapar v'et-kal-b'sarvo 'al-roshvo v'al-k'ra'ayv v'kir'bvo vfir'shvo
translation: But the hide of the bull, and all its flesh, as well as its head and legs, its entrails and its dung—

hebrew: וְהוֹצִ֣יא אֶת־כָּל־הַ֠פָּר אֶל־מִח֨וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֜ה אֶל־מָק֤וֹם טָהוֹר֙ אֶל־שֶׁ֣פֶךְ הַדֶּ֔שֶׁן וְשָׂרַ֥ף אֹת֛וֹ עַל־עֵצִ֖ים בָּאֵ֑שׁ עַל־שֶׁ֥פֶךְ הַדֶּ֖שֶׁן יִשָּׂרֵֽף׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hvotziy et-kal-hapar el-michvtz lamachaneh el-makvom tahvor el-shefekh' hadeshen v'saraf otvo 'al-'etziym baesh 'al-shefekh' hadeshen yisaref (f)
translation: all the rest of the bull—he shall carry to a clean place outside the camp, to the ash heap, and burn it up in a wood fire; it shall be burned on the ash heap.

hebrew: וְאִ֨ם כָּל־עֲדַ֤ת יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ יִשְׁגּ֔וּ וְנֶעְלַ֣ם דָּבָ֔ר מֵעֵינֵ֖י הַקָּהָ֑ל וְ֠עָשׂוּ אַחַ֨ת מִכָּל־מִצְוֺ֧ת יְהוָ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תֵעָשֶׂ֖ינָה וְאָשֵֽׁמוּ׃
transliteration: v'im kal-'adat yis'rael yish'gv v'ne'lam davar me'eyney hakahal v'asv achat mikal-mitz'vot y'hvah asher lo-te'aseynah v'ashemv
translation: If it is the whole community of Israel that has erred and the matter escapes the notice of the congregation, so that they do any of the things which by the L<small>ORD</small>’s commandments ought not to be done, and they realize their guilt—

hebrew: וְנֽוֹדְעָה֙ הַֽחַטָּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטְא֖וּ עָלֶ֑יהָ וְהִקְרִ֨יבוּ הַקָּהָ֜ל פַּ֤ר בֶּן־בָּקָר֙ לְחַטָּ֔את וְהֵבִ֣יאוּ אֹת֔וֹ לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'nvod'ah hachatat asher chat'v 'aleyha v'hik'riyvv hakahal par ben-bakar l'chatat v'heviyv otvo lif'ney ohel mvo'ed
translation: when the sin through which they incurred guilt becomes known, the congregation shall offer a bull of the herd as a sin offering, and bring it before the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְ֠סָמְכוּ זִקְנֵ֨י הָעֵדָ֧ה אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֛ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הַפָּ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְשָׁחַ֥ט אֶת־הַפָּ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'sam'khv zik'ney ha'edah et-y'deyhem 'al-rosh hapar lif'ney y'hvah v'shachat et-hapar lif'ney y'hvah
translation: The elders of the community shall lay their hands upon the head of the bull before the L<small>ORD</small>, and the bull shall be slaughtered before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְהֵבִ֛יא הַכֹּהֵ֥ן הַמָּשִׁ֖יחַ מִדַּ֣ם הַפָּ֑ר אֶל־אֹ֖הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'heviy hakohen hamashiycha midam hapar el-ohel mvo'ed
translation: The anointed priest shall bring some of the blood of the bull into the Tent of Meeting,

hebrew: וְטָבַ֧ל הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶצְבָּע֖וֹ מִן־הַדָּ֑ם וְהִזָּ֞ה שֶׁ֤בַע פְּעָמִים֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה אֵ֖ת פְּנֵ֥י הַפָּרֹֽכֶת׃
transliteration: v'taval hakohen etz'ba'vo min-hadam v'hizah sheva' p'amiym lif'ney y'hvah et p'ney haparokhet
translation: and the priest shall dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle of it seven times before the L<small>ORD</small>, in front of the curtain.

hebrew: וּמִן־הַדָּ֞ם יִתֵּ֣ן ׀ עַל־קַרְנֹ֣ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חַ אֲשֶׁר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְאֵ֣ת כָּל־הַדָּ֗ם יִשְׁפֹּךְ֙ אֶל־יְסוֹד֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: vmin-hadam yiten  'al-kar'not hamiz'becha asher lif'ney y'hvah asher b'ohel mvo'ed v'et kal-hadam yish'pokh' el-y'svod miz'bach ha'olah asher-petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: Some of the blood he shall put on the horns of the altar which is before the L<small>ORD</small> in the Tent of Meeting, and all the rest of the blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְאֵ֥ת כָּל־חֶלְבּ֖וֹ יָרִ֣ים מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וְהִקְטִ֖יר הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
transliteration: v'et kal-chel'bvo yariym mimenv v'hik'tiyr hamiz'bechah
translation: He shall remove all its fat from it and turn it into smoke on the altar.

hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֣ה לַפָּ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ לְפַ֣ר הַֽחַטָּ֔את כֵּ֖ן יַעֲשֶׂה־לּ֑וֹ וְכִפֶּ֧ר עֲלֵהֶ֛ם הַכֹּהֵ֖ן וְנִסְלַ֥ח לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'asah lapar kaasher 'asah l'far hachatat ken ya'aseh-lvo v'khiper 'alehem hakohen v'nis'lach lahem
translation: He shall do with this bull just as is done with the [priest’s] bull of sin offering; he shall do the same with it. Thus the priest shall make expiation for them, and they shall be forgiven.

hebrew: וְהוֹצִ֣יא אֶת־הַפָּ֗ר אֶל־מִחוּץ֙ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְשָׂרַ֣ף אֹת֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׂרַ֔ף אֵ֖ת הַפָּ֣ר הָרִאשׁ֑וֹן חַטַּ֥את הַקָּהָ֖ל הֽוּא׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hvotziy et-hapar el-michvtz lamachaneh v'saraf otvo kaasher saraf et hapar harishvon chatat hakahal hv (f)
translation: He shall carry the bull outside the camp and burn it as he burned the first bull; it is the sin offering of the congregation.

hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָשִׂ֖יא יֶֽחֱטָ֑א וְעָשָׂ֡ה אַחַ֣ת מִכָּל־מִצְוֺת֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהָ֜יו אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹא־תֵעָשֶׂ֛ינָה בִּשְׁגָגָ֖ה וְאָשֵֽׁם׃
transliteration: asher nasiy yecheta v'asah achat mikal-mitz'vot y'hvah elohayv asher lo-te'aseynah bish'gagah v'ashem
translation: In case it is a chieftain who incurs guilt by doing unwittingly any of the things which by the commandment of the L<small>ORD</small> his God ought not to be done, and he realizes his guilt—

hebrew: אֽוֹ־הוֹדַ֤ע אֵלָיו֙ חַטָּאת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטָ֖א בָּ֑הּ וְהֵבִ֧יא אֶת־קָרְבָּנ֛וֹ שְׂעִ֥יר עִזִּ֖ים זָכָ֥ר תָּמִֽים׃
transliteration: vo-hvoda' elayv chatatvo asher chata bah v'heviy et-kar'banvo s'iyr 'iziym zakhar tamiym
translation: or the sin of which he is guilty is brought to his knowledge—he shall bring as his offering a male goat without blemish.

hebrew: וְסָמַ֤ךְ יָדוֹ֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַשָּׂעִ֔יר וְשָׁחַ֣ט אֹת֔וֹ בִּמְק֛וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִשְׁחַ֥ט אֶת־הָעֹלָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה חַטָּ֖את הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'samakh' yadvo 'al-rosh hasa'iyr v'shachat otvo bim'kvom asher-yish'chat et-ha'olah lif'ney y'hvah chatat hv
translation: He shall lay his hand upon the goat’s head, and it shall be slaughtered at the spot where the burnt offering is slaughteredbCf. 1.11. before the LORD; it is a sin offering.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֨ח הַכֹּהֵ֜ן מִדַּ֤ם הַֽחַטָּאת֙ בְּאֶצְבָּע֔וֹ וְנָתַ֕ן עַל־קַרְנֹ֖ת מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֑ה וְאֶת־דָּמ֣וֹ יִשְׁפֹּ֔ךְ אֶל־יְס֖וֹד מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen midam hachatat b'etz'ba'vo v'natan 'al-kar'not miz'bach ha'olah v'et-damvo yish'pokh' el-y'svod miz'bach ha'olah
translation: The priest shall take with his finger some of the blood of the sin offering and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering; and the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering.

hebrew: וְאֶת־כָּל־חֶלְבּוֹ֙ יַקְטִ֣יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה כְּחֵ֖לֶב זֶ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִ֑ים וְכִפֶּ֨ר עָלָ֧יו הַכֹּהֵ֛ן מֵחַטָּאת֖וֹ וְנִסְלַ֥ח לֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'et-kal-chel'bvo yak'tiyr hamiz'bechah k'chelev zevach hash'lamiym v'khiper 'alayv hakohen mechatatvo v'nis'lach lvo (f)
translation: All its fat he shall turn into smoke on the altar, like the fat of the sacrifice of well-being. Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for his sin, and he shall be forgiven.

hebrew: וְאִם־נֶ֧פֶשׁ אַחַ֛ת תֶּחֱטָ֥א בִשְׁגָגָ֖ה מֵעַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ בַּ֠עֲשֹׂתָהּ אַחַ֨ת מִמִּצְוֺ֧ת יְהוָ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תֵעָשֶׂ֖ינָה וְאָשֵֽׁם׃
transliteration: v'im-nefesh achat techeta vish'gagah me'am haaretz ba'asotah achat mimitz'vot y'hvah asher lo-te'aseynah v'ashem
translation: If any person from among the populacecLit. “people of the country.” unwittingly incurs guilt by doing any of the things which by the LORD’s commandments ought not to be done, and he realizes his guilt—

hebrew: א֚וֹ הוֹדַ֣ע אֵלָ֔יו חַטָּאת֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטָ֑א וְהֵבִ֨יא קָרְבָּנ֜וֹ שְׂעִירַ֤ת עִזִּים֙ תְּמִימָ֣ה נְקֵבָ֔ה עַל־חַטָּאת֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטָֽא׃
transliteration: vo hvoda' elayv chatatvo asher chata v'heviy kar'banvo s'iyrat 'iziym t'miymah n'kevah 'al-chatatvo asher chata
translation: or the sin of which he is guilty is brought to his knowledge—he shall bring a female goat without blemish as his offering for the sin of which he is guilty.

hebrew: וְסָמַךְ֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ עַ֖ל רֹ֣אשׁ הַֽחַטָּ֑את וְשָׁחַט֙ אֶת־הַ֣חַטָּ֔את בִּמְק֖וֹם הָעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: v'samakh' et-yadvo 'al rosh hachatat v'shachat et-hachatat bim'kvom ha'olah
translation: He shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering, and the sin offering shall be slaughtered at the place of the burnt offering.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֨ח הַכֹּהֵ֤ן מִדָּמָהּ֙ בְּאֶצְבָּע֔וֹ וְנָתַ֕ן עַל־קַרְנֹ֖ת מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֑ה וְאֶת־כָּל־דָּמָ֣הּ יִשְׁפֹּ֔ךְ אֶל־יְס֖וֹד הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen midamah b'etz'ba'vo v'natan 'al-kar'not miz'bach ha'olah v'et-kal-damah yish'pokh' el-y'svod hamiz'becha
translation: The priest shall take with his finger some of its blood and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering; and all the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar.

hebrew: וְאֶת־כָּל־חֶלְבָּ֣הּ יָסִ֗יר כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר הוּסַ֣ר חֵלֶב֮ מֵעַ֣ל זֶ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִים֒ וְהִקְטִ֤יר הַכֹּהֵן֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה לְרֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָ֑ה וְכִפֶּ֥ר עָלָ֛יו הַכֹּהֵ֖ן וְנִסְלַ֥ח לֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'et-kal-chel'bah yasiyr kaasher hvsar chelev me'al zevach hash'lamiym v'hik'tiyr hakohen hamiz'bechah l'reycha niychocha layhvah v'khiper 'alayv hakohen v'nis'lach lvo (f)
translation: He shall remove all its fat, just as the fat is removed from the sacrifice of well-being; and the priest shall turn it into smoke on the altar, for a pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>. Thus the priest shall make expiation for him, and he shall be forgiven.

hebrew: וְאִם־כֶּ֛בֶשׂ יָבִ֥יא קָרְבָּנ֖וֹ לְחַטָּ֑את נְקֵבָ֥ה תְמִימָ֖ה יְבִיאֶֽנָּה׃
transliteration: v'im-keves yaviy kar'banvo l'chatat n'kevah t'miymah y'viyenah
translation: If the offering he brings as a sin offering is a sheep, he shall bring a female without blemish.

hebrew: וְסָמַךְ֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ עַ֖ל רֹ֣אשׁ הַֽחַטָּ֑את וְשָׁחַ֤ט אֹתָהּ֙ לְחַטָּ֔את בִּמְק֕וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִשְׁחַ֖ט אֶת־הָעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: v'samakh' et-yadvo 'al rosh hachatat v'shachat otah l'chatat bim'kvom asher yish'chat et-ha'olah
translation: He shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering, and it shall be slaughtered as a sin offering at the spot where the burnt offering is slaughtered.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֨ח הַכֹּהֵ֜ן מִדַּ֤ם הַֽחַטָּאת֙ בְּאֶצְבָּע֔וֹ וְנָתַ֕ן עַל־קַרְנֹ֖ת מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֑ה וְאֶת־כָּל־דָּמָ֣הּ יִשְׁפֹּ֔ךְ אֶל־יְס֖וֹד הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen midam hachatat b'etz'ba'vo v'natan 'al-kar'not miz'bach ha'olah v'et-kal-damah yish'pokh' el-y'svod hamiz'becha
translation: The priest shall take with his finger some of the blood of the sin offering and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and all the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar.

hebrew: וְאֶת־כָּל־חֶלְבָּ֣ה יָסִ֗יר כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יוּסַ֥ר חֵֽלֶב־הַכֶּשֶׂב֮ מִזֶּ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִים֒ וְהִקְטִ֨יר הַכֹּהֵ֤ן אֹתָם֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עַ֖ל אִשֵּׁ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְכִפֶּ֨ר עָלָ֧יו הַכֹּהֵ֛ן עַל־חַטָּאת֥וֹ אֲשֶׁר־חָטָ֖א וְנִסְלַ֥ח לֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'et-kal-chel'bah yasiyr kaasher yvsar chelev-hakesev mizevach hash'lamiym v'hik'tiyr hakohen otam hamiz'bechah 'al ishey y'hvah v'khiper 'alayv hakohen 'al-chatatvo asher-chata v'nis'lach lvo (f)
translation: And all its fat he shall remove just as the fat of the sheep of the sacrifice of well-being is removed; and this the priest shall turn into smoke on the altar, over the L<small>ORD</small>’s offering by fire. Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for the sin of which he is guilty, and he shall be forgiven.

hebrew: וְנֶ֣פֶשׁ כִּֽי־תֶחֱטָ֗א וְשָֽׁמְעָה֙ ק֣וֹל אָלָ֔ה וְה֣וּא עֵ֔ד א֥וֹ רָאָ֖ה א֣וֹ יָדָ֑ע אִם־ל֥וֹא יַגִּ֖יד וְנָשָׂ֥א עֲוֺנֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'nefesh kiy-techeta v'sham'ah kvol alah v'hv 'ed vo raah vo yada' im-lvo yagiyd v'nasa 'avonvo
translation:
If a person incurs guilt—
When he has heard a public imprecationaNamely, against one who withholds testimony. and—although able to testify as one who has either seen or learned of the matter—he does not give information, so that he is subject to punishment;

hebrew: א֣וֹ נֶ֗פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּגַּע֮ בְּכָל־דָּבָ֣ר טָמֵא֒ אוֹ֩ בְנִבְלַ֨ת חַיָּ֜ה טְמֵאָ֗ה א֤וֹ בְּנִבְלַת֙ בְּהֵמָ֣ה טְמֵאָ֔ה א֕וֹ בְּנִבְלַ֖ת שֶׁ֣רֶץ טָמֵ֑א וְנֶעְלַ֣ם מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְה֥וּא טָמֵ֖א וְאָשֵֽׁם׃
transliteration: vo nefesh asher tiga' b'khal-davar tame vo v'niv'lat chayah t'meah vo b'niv'lat b'hemah t'meah vo b'niv'lat sheretz tame v'ne'lam mimenv v'hv tame v'ashem
translation: Or when a person touches any unclean thing—be it the carcass of an unclean beast or the carcass of unclean cattle or the carcass of an unclean creeping thing—and the fact has escaped him, and then, being unclean, he realizes his guilt;

hebrew: א֣וֹ כִ֤י יִגַּע֙ בְּטֻמְאַ֣ת אָדָ֔ם לְכֹל֙ טֻמְאָת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִטְמָ֖א בָּ֑הּ וְנֶעְלַ֣ם מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְה֥וּא יָדַ֖ע וְאָשֵֽׁם׃
transliteration: vo khiy yiga' b'tum'at adam l'khol tum'atvo asher yit'ma bah v'ne'lam mimenv v'hv yada' v'ashem
translation: Or when he touches human uncleanness—any such uncleanness whereby one becomes unclean—and, though he has known it, the fact has escaped him, but later he realizes his guilt;

hebrew: א֣וֹ נֶ֡פֶשׁ כִּ֣י תִשָּׁבַע֩ לְבַטֵּ֨א בִשְׂפָתַ֜יִם לְהָרַ֣ע ׀ א֣וֹ לְהֵיטִ֗יב לְ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְבַטֵּ֧א הָאָדָ֛ם בִּשְׁבֻעָ֖ה וְנֶעְלַ֣ם מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וְהוּא־יָדַ֥ע וְאָשֵׁ֖ם לְאַחַ֥ת מֵאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: vo nefesh kiy tishava' l'vate vis'fatayim l'hara'  vo l'heytiyv l'khol asher y'vate haadam bish'vu'ah v'ne'lam mimenv v'hv-yada' v'ashem l'achat meeleh
translation: Or when a person uttersbLit. “utters with his lips.” an oath to bad or good purpose—whatever a man may utter in an oath—and, though he has known it, the fact has escaped him, but later he realizes his guilt in any of these matters—

hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה כִֽי־יֶאְשַׁ֖ם לְאַחַ֣ת מֵאֵ֑לֶּה וְהִ֨תְוַדָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטָ֖א עָלֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: v'hayah khiy-ye'sham l'achat meeleh v'hit'vadah asher chata 'aleyha
translation: when he realizes his guilt in any of these matters, he shall confess that wherein he has sinned.

hebrew: וְהֵבִ֣יא אֶת־אֲשָׁמ֣וֹ לַיהוָ֡ה עַ֣ל חַטָּאתוֹ֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר חָטָ֜א נְקֵבָ֨ה מִן־הַצֹּ֥אן כִּשְׂבָּ֛ה אֽוֹ־שְׂעִירַ֥ת עִזִּ֖ים לְחַטָּ֑את וְכִפֶּ֥ר עָלָ֛יו הַכֹּהֵ֖ן מֵחַטָּאתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'heviy et-ashamvo layhvah 'al chatatvo asher chata n'kevah min-hatzon kis'bah vo-s'iyrat 'iziym l'chatat v'khiper 'alayv hakohen mechatatvo
translation: And he shall bring as his penalty to the L<small>ORD</small>, for the sin of which he is guilty, a female from the flock, sheep or goat, as a sin offering; and the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for his sin.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֨א תַגִּ֣יע יָדוֹ֮ דֵּ֣י שֶׂה֒ וְהֵבִ֨יא אֶת־אֲשָׁמ֜וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטָ֗א שְׁתֵּ֥י תֹרִ֛ים אֽוֹ־שְׁנֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־יוֹנָ֖ה לַֽיהוָ֑ה אֶחָ֥ד לְחַטָּ֖את וְאֶחָ֥ד לְעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: v'im-lo tagiy' yadvo dey seh v'heviy et-ashamvo asher chata sh'tey toriym vo-sh'ney v'ney-yvonah layhvah echad l'chatat v'echad l'olah
translation: But if his means do not suffice for a sheep, he shall bring to the L<small>ORD</small>, as his penalty for that of which he is guilty, two turtledoves or two pigeons, one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering.

hebrew: וְהֵבִ֤יא אֹתָם֙ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהִקְרִ֛יב אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לַחַטָּ֖את רִאשׁוֹנָ֑ה וּמָלַ֧ק אֶת־רֹאשׁ֛וֹ מִמּ֥וּל עָרְפּ֖וֹ וְלֹ֥א יַבְדִּֽיל׃
transliteration: v'heviy otam el-hakohen v'hik'riyv et-asher lachatat rishvonah vmalak et-roshvo mimvl 'ar'pvo v'lo yav'diyl
translation: He shall bring them to the priest, who shall offer first the one for the sin offering, pinching its head at the nape without severing it.

hebrew: וְהִזָּ֞ה מִדַּ֤ם הַחַטָּאת֙ עַל־קִ֣יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְהַנִּשְׁאָ֣ר בַּדָּ֔ם יִמָּצֵ֖ה אֶל־יְס֣וֹד הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ חַטָּ֖את הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'hizah midam hachatat 'al-kiyr hamiz'becha v'hanish'ar badam yimatzeh el-y'svod hamiz'becha chatat hv
translation: He shall sprinkle some of the blood of the sin offering on the side of the altar, and what remains of the blood shall be drained out at the base of the altar; it is a sin offering.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַשֵּׁנִ֛י יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה עֹלָ֖ה כַּמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט וְכִפֶּ֨ר עָלָ֧יו הַכֹּהֵ֛ן מֵחַטָּאת֥וֹ אֲשֶׁר־חָטָ֖א וְנִסְלַ֥ח לֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'et-hasheniy ya'aseh 'olah kamish'pat v'khiper 'alayv hakohen mechatatvo asher-chata v'nis'lach lvo (s)
translation: And the second he shall prepare as a burnt offering, according to regulation. Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for the sin of which he is guilty, and he shall be forgiven.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹא֩ תַשִּׂ֨יג יָד֜וֹ לִשְׁתֵּ֣י תֹרִ֗ים אוֹ֮ לִשְׁנֵ֣י בְנֵי־יוֹנָה֒ וְהֵבִ֨יא אֶת־קָרְבָּנ֜וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטָ֗א עֲשִׂירִ֧ת הָאֵפָ֛ה סֹ֖לֶת לְחַטָּ֑את לֹא־יָשִׂ֨ים עָלֶ֜יהָ שֶׁ֗מֶן וְלֹא־יִתֵּ֤ן עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ לְבֹנָ֔ה כִּ֥י חַטָּ֖את הִֽיא׃
transliteration: v'im-lo tasiyg yadvo lish'tey toriym vo lish'ney v'ney-yvonah v'heviy et-kar'banvo asher chata 'asiyrit haefah solet l'chatat lo-yasiym 'aleyha shemen v'lo-yiten 'aleyha l'vonah kiy chatat hiy
translation: And if his means do not suffice for two turtledoves or two pigeons, he shall bring as his offering for that of which he is guilty a tenth of an ephah of choice flour for a sin offering; he shall not add oil to it or lay frankincense on it, for it is a sin offering.

hebrew: וֶהֱבִיאָהּ֮ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵן֒ וְקָמַ֣ץ הַכֹּהֵ֣ן ׀ מִ֠מֶּנָּה מְל֨וֹא קֻמְצ֜וֹ אֶת־אַזְכָּרָתָה֙ וְהִקְטִ֣יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עַ֖ל אִשֵּׁ֣י יְהוָ֑ה חַטָּ֖את הִֽוא׃
transliteration: veheviyah el-hakohen v'kamatz hakohen  mimenah m'lvo kum'tzvo et-az'karatah v'hik'tiyr hamiz'bechah 'al ishey y'hvah chatat hiv
translation: He shall bring it to the priest, and the priest shall scoop out of it a handful as a token portion of it and turn it into smoke on the altar, with the L<small>ORD</small>’s offerings by fire; it is a sin offering.

hebrew: וְכִפֶּר֩ עָלָ֨יו הַכֹּהֵ֜ן עַל־חַטָּאת֧וֹ אֲשֶׁר־חָטָ֛א מֵֽאַחַ֥ת מֵאֵ֖לֶּה וְנִסְלַ֣ח ל֑וֹ וְהָיְתָ֥ה לַכֹּהֵ֖ן כַּמִּנְחָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khiper 'alayv hakohen 'al-chatatvo asher-chata meachat meeleh v'nis'lach lvo v'hay'tah lakohen kamin'chah (s)
translation: Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf for whichever of these sins he is guilty, and he shall be forgiven. It shall belong to the priest, like the meal offering.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: נֶ֚פֶשׁ כִּֽי־תִמְעֹ֣ל מַ֔עַל וְחָֽטְאָה֙ בִּשְׁגָגָ֔ה מִקָּדְשֵׁ֖י יְהוָ֑ה וְהֵבִיא֩ אֶת־אֲשָׁמ֨וֹ לַֽיהוָ֜ה אַ֧יִל תָּמִ֣ים מִן־הַצֹּ֗אן בְּעֶרְכְּךָ֛ כֶּֽסֶף־שְׁקָלִ֥ים בְּשֶֽׁקֶל־הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ לְאָשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: nefesh kiy-tim'ol ma'al v'chat'ah bish'gagah mikad'shey y'hvah v'heviy et-ashamvo layhvah ayil tamiym min-hatzon b'er'k'kha kesef-sh'kaliym b'shekel-hakodesh l'asham
translation: When a person commits a trespass, being unwittingly remiss about any of the L<small>ORD</small>’s sacred things, he shall bring as his penalty to the L<small>ORD</small> a ram without blemish from the flock, convertible into payment in silver by the sanctuary weight, as a guilt offering.

hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר֩ חָטָ֨א מִן־הַקֹּ֜דֶשׁ יְשַׁלֵּ֗ם וְאֶת־חֲמִֽישִׁתוֹ֙ יוֹסֵ֣ף עָלָ֔יו וְנָתַ֥ן אֹת֖וֹ לַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְהַכֹּהֵ֗ן יְכַפֵּ֥ר עָלָ֛יו בְּאֵ֥יל הָאָשָׁ֖ם וְנִסְלַ֥ח לֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'et asher chata min-hakodesh y'shalem v'et-chamiyshitvo yvosef 'alayv v'natan otvo lakohen v'hakohen y'khaper 'alayv b'eyl haasham v'nis'lach lvo (f)
translation: He shall make restitution for that wherein he was remiss about the sacred things, and he shall add a fifth part to it and give it to the priest. The priest shall make expiation on his behalf with the ram of the guilt offering, and he shall be forgiven.
