hebrew: וְאִם־נֶ֙פֶשׁ֙ כִּ֣י תֶֽחֱטָ֔א וְעָֽשְׂתָ֗ה אַחַת֙ מִכָּל־מִצְוֺ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר לֹ֣א תֵעָשֶׂ֑ינָה וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֥ע וְאָשֵׁ֖ם וְנָשָׂ֥א עֲוֺנֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im-nefesh kiy techeta v'as'tah achat mikal-mitz'vot y'hvah asher lo te'aseynah v'lo-yada' v'ashem v'nasa 'avonvo
translation: And when a person, without knowing it, sins in regard to any of the L<small>ORD</small>’s commandments about things not to be done, and then realizes his guilt, he shall be subject to punishment.

hebrew: וְ֠הֵבִיא אַ֣יִל תָּמִ֧ים מִן־הַצֹּ֛אן בְּעֶרְכְּךָ֥ לְאָשָׁ֖ם אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְכִפֶּר֩ עָלָ֨יו הַכֹּהֵ֜ן עַ֣ל שִׁגְגָת֧וֹ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁגָ֛ג וְה֥וּא לֹֽא־יָדַ֖ע וְנִסְלַ֥ח לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'heviy ayil tamiym min-hatzon b'er'k'kha l'asham el-hakohen v'khiper 'alayv hakohen 'al shig'gatvo asher-shagag v'hv lo-yada' v'nis'lach lvo
translation: He shall bring to the priest a ram without blemish from the flock, or the equivalent,cI.e., in currency; cf. v. 15. as a guilt offering. The priest shall make expiation on his behalf for the error that he committed unwittingly, and he shall be forgiven.

hebrew: אָשָׁ֖ם ה֑וּא אָשֹׁ֥ם אָשַׁ֖ם לַיהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: asham hv ashom asham layhvah (f)
translation: It is a guilt offering; he has incurred guilt before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: נֶ֚פֶשׁ כִּ֣י תֶחֱטָ֔א וּמָעֲלָ֥ה מַ֖עַל בַּיהוָ֑ה וְכִחֵ֨שׁ בַּעֲמִית֜וֹ בְּפִקָּד֗וֹן אֽוֹ־בִתְשׂ֤וּמֶת יָד֙ א֣וֹ בְגָזֵ֔ל א֖וֹ עָשַׁ֥ק אֶת־עֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: nefesh kiy techeta vma'alah ma'al bayhvah v'khichesh ba'amiytvo b'fikadvon vo-vit'svmet yad vo v'gazel vo 'ashak et-'amiytvo
translation: When a person sins and commits a trespass against the LORD by dealing deceitfully with his fellow in the matter of a deposit or a pledge,dMeaning of Heb. uncertain. or through robbery, or by defrauding his fellow,

hebrew: אֽוֹ־מָצָ֧א אֲבֵדָ֛ה וְכִ֥חֶשׁ בָּ֖הּ וְנִשְׁבַּ֣ע עַל־שָׁ֑קֶר עַל־אַחַ֗ת מִכֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה הָאָדָ֖ם לַחֲטֹ֥א בָהֵֽנָּה׃
transliteration: vo-matza avedah v'khichesh bah v'nish'ba' 'al-shaker 'al-achat mikol asher-ya'aseh haadam lachato vahenah
translation: or by finding something lost and lying about it; if he swears falsely regarding any one of the various things that one may do and sin thereby—

hebrew: וְהָיָה֮ כִּֽי־יֶחֱטָ֣א וְאָשֵׁם֒ וְהֵשִׁ֨יב אֶת־הַגְּזֵלָ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר גָּזָ֗ל א֤וֹ אֶת־הָעֹ֙שֶׁק֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׁ֔ק א֚וֹ אֶת־הַפִּקָּד֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָפְקַ֖ד אִתּ֑וֹ א֥וֹ אֶת־הָאֲבֵדָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר מָצָֽא׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy-yecheta v'ashem v'heshiyv et-hag'zelah asher gazal vo et-ha'oshek asher 'ashak vo et-hapikadvon asher haf'kad itvo vo et-haavedah asher matza
translation: when one has thus sinned and, realizing his guilt, would restore that which he got through robbery or fraud, or the deposit that was entrusted to him, or the lost thing that he found,

hebrew: א֠וֹ מִכֹּ֞ל אֲשֶׁר־יִשָּׁבַ֣ע עָלָיו֮ לַשֶּׁקֶר֒ וְשִׁלַּ֤ם אֹתוֹ֙ בְּרֹאשׁ֔וֹ וַחֲמִשִׁתָ֖יו יֹסֵ֣ף עָלָ֑יו לַאֲשֶׁ֨ר ה֥וּא ל֛וֹ יִתְּנֶ֖נּוּ בְּי֥וֹם אַשְׁמָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vo mikol asher-yishava' 'alayv lasheker v'shilam otvo b'roshvo vachamishitayv yosef 'alayv laasher hv lvo yit'nenv b'yvom ash'matvo
translation: or anything else about which he swore falsely, he shall repay the principal amount and add a fifth part to it. He shall pay it to its owner when he realizes his guilt.

hebrew: וְאֶת־אֲשָׁמ֥וֹ יָבִ֖יא לַיהוָ֑ה אַ֣יִל תָּמִ֧ים מִן־הַצֹּ֛אן בְּעֶרְכְּךָ֥ לְאָשָׁ֖ם אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'et-ashamvo yaviy layhvah ayil tamiym min-hatzon b'er'k'kha l'asham el-hakohen
translation: Then he shall bring to the priest, as his penalty to the LORD, a ram without blemish from the flock, or the equivalent,eI.e., in currency; cf. v. 15. as a guilt offering.

hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֨ר עָלָ֧יו הַכֹּהֵ֛ן לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה וְנִסְלַ֣ח ל֑וֹ עַל־אַחַ֛ת מִכֹּ֥ל אֲשֶֽׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה לְאַשְׁמָ֥ה בָֽהּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'khiper 'alayv hakohen lif'ney y'hvah v'nis'lach lvo 'al-achat mikol asher-ya'aseh l'ash'mah vah (f)
translation: The priest shall make expiation on his behalf before the L<small>ORD</small>, and he shall be forgiven for whatever he may have done to draw blame thereby.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: צַ֤ו אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֣יו לֵאמֹ֔ר זֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הָעֹלָ֑ה הִ֣וא הָעֹלָ֡ה עַל֩ מוֹקְדָ֨ה עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֤חַ כָּל־הַלַּ֙יְלָה֙ עַד־הַבֹּ֔קֶר וְאֵ֥שׁ הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ תּ֥וּקַד בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: tzav et-aharon v'et-banayv lemor zot tvorat ha'olah hiv ha'olah 'al mvok'dah 'al-hamiz'becha kal-halay'lah 'ad-haboker v'esh hamiz'becha tvkad bvo
translation:
Command Aaron and his sons thus:
This is the ritual of the burnt offering: The burnt offering itself shall remain where it is burned upon the altar all night until morning, while the fire on the altar is kept going on it.

hebrew: וְלָבַ֨שׁ הַכֹּהֵ֜ן מִדּ֣וֹ בַ֗ד וּמִֽכְנְסֵי־בַד֮ יִלְבַּ֣שׁ עַל־בְּשָׂרוֹ֒ וְהֵרִ֣ים אֶת־הַדֶּ֗שֶׁן אֲשֶׁ֨ר תֹּאכַ֥ל הָאֵ֛שׁ אֶת־הָעֹלָ֖ה עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְשָׂמ֕וֹ אֵ֖צֶל הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'lavash hakohen midvo vad vmikh'n'sey-vad yil'bash 'al-b'sarvo v'heriym et-hadeshen asher tokhal haesh et-ha'olah 'al-hamiz'becha v'samvo etzel hamiz'becha
translation: The priest shall dress in linen raiment, with linen breeches next to his body; and he shall take up the ashes to which the fire has reduced the burnt offering on the altar and place them beside the altar.

hebrew: וּפָשַׁט֙ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְלָבַ֖שׁ בְּגָדִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וְהוֹצִ֤יא אֶת־הַדֶּ֙שֶׁן֙ אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה אֶל־מָק֖וֹם טָהֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vfashat et-b'gadayv v'lavash b'gadiym acheriym v'hvotziy et-hadeshen el-michvtz lamachaneh el-makvom tahvor
translation: He shall then take off his vestments and put on other vestments, and carry the ashes outside the camp to a clean place.

hebrew: וְהָאֵ֨שׁ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֤חַ תּֽוּקַד־בּוֹ֙ לֹ֣א תִכְבֶּ֔ה וּבִעֵ֨ר עָלֶ֧יהָ הַכֹּהֵ֛ן עֵצִ֖ים בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֑קֶר וְעָרַ֤ךְ עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ הָֽעֹלָ֔ה וְהִקְטִ֥יר עָלֶ֖יהָ חֶלְבֵ֥י הַשְּׁלָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'haesh 'al-hamiz'becha tvkad-bvo lo tikh'beh vvi'er 'aleyha hakohen 'etziym baboker baboker v'arakh' 'aleyha ha'olah v'hik'tiyr 'aleyha chel'vey hash'lamiym
translation: The fire on the altar shall be kept burning, not to go out: every morning the priest shall feed wood to it, lay out the burnt offering on it, and turn into smoke the fat parts of the offerings of well-being.

hebrew: אֵ֗שׁ תָּמִ֛יד תּוּקַ֥ד עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ לֹ֥א תִכְבֶֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: esh tamiyd tvkad 'al-hamiz'becha lo tikh'veh (s)
translation: A perpetual fire shall be kept burning on the altar, not to go out.

hebrew: וְזֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הַמִּנְחָ֑ה הַקְרֵ֨ב אֹתָ֤הּ בְּנֵֽי־אַהֲרֹן֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־פְּנֵ֖י הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'zot tvorat hamin'chah hak'rev otah b'ney-aharon lif'ney y'hvah el-p'ney hamiz'becha
translation: And this is the ritual of the meal offering: Aaron’s sons shall present it before the L<small>ORD</small>, in front of the altar.

hebrew: וְהֵרִ֨ים מִמֶּ֜נּוּ בְּקֻמְצ֗וֹ מִסֹּ֤לֶת הַמִּנְחָה֙ וּמִשַּׁמְנָ֔הּ וְאֵת֙ כָּל־הַלְּבֹנָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַמִּנְחָ֑ה וְהִקְטִ֣יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חַ רֵ֧יחַ נִיחֹ֛חַ אַזְכָּרָתָ֖הּ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'heriym mimenv b'kum'tzvo misolet hamin'chah vmisham'nah v'et kal-hal'vonah asher 'al-hamin'chah v'hik'tiyr hamiz'becha reycha niychocha az'karatah layhvah
translation: A handful of the choice flour and oil of the meal offering shall be taken from it, with all the frankincense that is on the meal offering, and this token portion shall be turned into smoke on the altar as a pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתֶ֣רֶת מִמֶּ֔נָּה יֹאכְל֖וּ אַהֲרֹ֣ן וּבָנָ֑יו מַצּ֤וֹת תֵּֽאָכֵל֙ בְּמָק֣וֹם קָדֹ֔שׁ בַּחֲצַ֥ר אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד יֹאכְלֽוּהָ׃
transliteration: v'hanvoteret mimenah yokh'lv aharon vvanayv matzvot teakhel b'makvom kadosh bachatzar ohel-mvo'ed yokh'lvha
translation: What is left of it shall be eaten by Aaron and his sons; it shall be eaten as unleavened cakes, in the sacred precinct; they shall eat it in the enclosure of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: לֹ֤א תֵאָפֶה֙ חָמֵ֔ץ חֶלְקָ֛ם נָתַ֥תִּי אֹתָ֖הּ מֵאִשָּׁ֑י קֹ֤דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁים֙ הִ֔וא כַּחַטָּ֖את וְכָאָשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: lo teafeh chametz chel'kam natatiy otah meishay kodesh kadashiym hiv kachatat v'khaasham
translation: It shall not be baked with leaven; I have given it as their portion from My offerings by fire; it is most holy, like the sin offering and the guilt offering.

hebrew: כָּל־זָכָ֞ר בִּבְנֵ֤י אַהֲרֹן֙ יֹֽאכֲלֶ֔נָּה חָק־עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם מֵאִשֵּׁ֖י יְהוָ֑ה כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יִגַּ֥ע בָּהֶ֖ם יִקְדָּֽשׁ׃ (פ)
transliteration: kal-zakhar biv'ney aharon yokhalenah chak-'volam l'doroteykhem meishey y'hvah kol asher-yiga' bahem yik'dash (f)
translation: Only the males among Aaron’s descendants may eat of it, as their due for all time throughout the ages from the L<small>ORD</small>’s offerings by fire. Anything that touches these shall become holy.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: זֶ֡ה קָרְבַּן֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן וּבָנָ֜יו אֲשֶׁר־יַקְרִ֣יבוּ לַֽיהוָ֗ה בְּיוֹם֙ הִמָּשַׁ֣ח אֹת֔וֹ עֲשִׂירִ֨ת הָאֵפָ֥ה סֹ֛לֶת מִנְחָ֖ה תָּמִ֑יד מַחֲצִיתָ֣הּ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וּמַחֲצִיתָ֖הּ בָּעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: zeh kar'ban aharon vvanayv asher-yak'riyvv layhvah b'yvom himashach otvo 'asiyrit haefah solet min'chah tamiyd machatziytah baboker vmachatziytah ba'arev
translation: This is the offering that Aaron and his sons shall offer to the LORD on the occasion of hisaOr “their.” anointment: a tenth of an ephah of choice flour as a regular meal offering, half of it in the morning and half of it in the evening,

hebrew: עַֽל־מַחֲבַ֗ת בַּשֶּׁ֛מֶן תֵּעָשֶׂ֖ה מֻרְבֶּ֣כֶת תְּבִיאֶ֑נָּה תֻּפִינֵי֙ מִנְחַ֣ת פִּתִּ֔ים תַּקְרִ֥יב רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: 'al-machavat bashemen te'aseh mur'bekhet t'viyenah tufiyney min'chat pitiym tak'riyv reycha-niychocha layhvah
translation: shall be prepared with oil on a griddle. You shall bring it well soaked, and offer it as a meal offering of baked slices,bMeaning of Heb. tuphine uncertain. of pleasing odor to the LORD.

hebrew: וְהַכֹּהֵ֨ן הַמָּשִׁ֧יחַ תַּחְתָּ֛יו מִבָּנָ֖יו יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹתָ֑הּ חָק־עוֹלָ֕ם לַיהוָ֖ה כָּלִ֥יל תָּקְטָֽר׃
transliteration: v'hakohen hamashiycha tach'tayv mibanayv ya'aseh otah chak-'volam layhvah kaliyl tak'tar
translation: And so shall the priest, anointed from among his sons to succeed him, prepare it; it is the L<small>ORD</small>’s—a law for all time—to be turned entirely into smoke.

hebrew: וְכָל־מִנְחַ֥ת כֹּהֵ֛ן כָּלִ֥יל תִּהְיֶ֖ה לֹ֥א תֵאָכֵֽל׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'khal-min'chat kohen kaliyl tih'yeh lo teakhel (f)
translation: So, too, every meal offering of a priest shall be a whole offering: it shall not be eaten.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֤ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶל־בָּנָ֣יו לֵאמֹ֔ר זֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הַֽחַטָּ֑את בִּמְק֡וֹם אֲשֶׁר֩ תִּשָּׁחֵ֨ט הָעֹלָ֜ה תִּשָּׁחֵ֤ט הַֽחַטָּאת֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים הִֽוא׃
transliteration: daber el-aharon v'el-banayv lemor zot tvorat hachatat bim'kvom asher tishachet ha'olah tishachet hachatat lif'ney y'hvah kodesh kadashiym hiv
translation: Speak to Aaron and his sons thus: This is the ritual of the sin offering: the sin offering shall be slaughtered before the LORD, at the spotcCf. 1.11. where the burnt offering is slaughtered: it is most holy.

hebrew: הַכֹּהֵ֛ן הַֽמְחַטֵּ֥א אֹתָ֖הּ יֹאכֲלֶ֑נָּה בְּמָק֤וֹם קָדֹשׁ֙ תֵּֽאָכֵ֔ל בַּחֲצַ֖ר אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: hakohen ham'chate otah yokhalenah b'makvom kadosh teakhel bachatzar ohel mvo'ed
translation: The priest who offers it as a sin offering shall eat of it; it shall be eaten in the sacred precinct, in the enclosure of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יִגַּ֥ע בִּבְשָׂרָ֖הּ יִקְדָּ֑שׁ וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר יִזֶּ֤ה מִדָּמָהּ֙ עַל־הַבֶּ֔גֶד אֲשֶׁר֙ יִזֶּ֣ה עָלֶ֔יהָ תְּכַבֵּ֖ס בְּמָק֥וֹם קָדֹֽשׁ׃
transliteration: kol asher-yiga' biv'sarah yik'dash vaasher yizeh midamah 'al-habeged asher yizeh 'aleyha t'khabes b'makvom kadosh
translation: Anything that touches its flesh shall become holy; and if any of its blood is spattered upon a garment, you shall wash the bespattered part in the sacred precinct.

hebrew: וּכְלִי־חֶ֛רֶשׂ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּבֻשַּׁל־בּ֖וֹ יִשָּׁבֵ֑ר וְאִם־בִּכְלִ֤י נְחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ בֻּשָּׁ֔לָה וּמֹרַ֥ק וְשֻׁטַּ֖ף בַּמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: vkh'liy-cheres asher t'vushal-bvo yishaver v'im-bikh'liy n'choshet bushalah vmorak v'shutaf bamayim
translation: An earthen vessel in which it was boiled shall be broken; if it was boiled in a copper vessel, [the vessel] shall be scoured and rinsed with water.

hebrew: כָּל־זָכָ֥ר בַּכֹּהֲנִ֖ים יֹאכַ֣ל אֹתָ֑הּ קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים הִֽוא׃
transliteration: kal-zakhar bakohaniym yokhal otah kodesh kadashiym hiv
translation: Only the males in the priestly line may eat of it: it is most holy.

hebrew: וְכָל־חַטָּ֡את אֲשֶׁר֩ יוּבָ֨א מִדָּמָ֜הּ אֶל־אֹ֧הֶל מוֹעֵ֛ד לְכַפֵּ֥ר בַּקֹּ֖דֶשׁ לֹ֣א תֵאָכֵ֑ל בָּאֵ֖שׁ תִּשָּׂרֵֽף׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'khal-chatat asher yvva midamah el-ohel mvo'ed l'khaper bakodesh lo teakhel baesh tisaref (f)
translation: But no sin offering may be eaten from which any blood is brought into the Tent of Meeting for expiation in the sanctuary; any such shall be consumed in fire.

hebrew: וְזֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הָאָשָׁ֑ם קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'zot tvorat haasham kodesh kadashiym hv
translation: This is the ritual of the guilt offering: it is most holy.

hebrew: בִּמְק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁחֲטוּ֙ אֶת־הָ֣עֹלָ֔ה יִשְׁחֲט֖וּ אֶת־הָאָשָׁ֑ם וְאֶת־דָּמ֛וֹ יִזְרֹ֥ק עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: bim'kvom asher yish'chatv et-ha'olah yish'chatv et-haasham v'et-damvo yiz'rok 'al-hamiz'becha saviyv
translation: The guilt offering shall be slaughtered at the spot where the burnt offering is slaughtered, and the blood shall be dashed on all sides of the altar.

hebrew: וְאֵ֥ת כָּל־חֶלְבּ֖וֹ יַקְרִ֣יב מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אֵ֚ת הָֽאַלְיָ֔ה וְאֶת־הַחֵ֖לֶב הַֽמְכַסֶּ֥ה אֶת־הַקֶּֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'et kal-chel'bvo yak'riyv mimenv et haal'yah v'et-hachelev ham'khaseh et-hakerev
translation: All its fat shall be offered: the broad tail; the fat that covers the entrails;

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֔ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַכְּסָלִ֑ים וְאֶת־הַיֹּתֶ֙רֶת֙ עַל־הַכָּבֵ֔ד עַל־הַכְּלָיֹ֖ת יְסִירֶֽנָּה׃
transliteration: v'et sh'tey hak'layot v'et-hachelev asher 'aleyhen asher 'al-hak'saliym v'et-hayoteret 'al-hakaved 'al-hak'layot y'siyrenah
translation: the two kidneys and the fat that is on them at the loins; and the protuberance on the liver, which shall be removed with the kidneys.

hebrew: וְהִקְטִ֨יר אֹתָ֤ם הַכֹּהֵן֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָ֑ה אָשָׁ֖ם הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'hik'tiyr otam hakohen hamiz'bechah isheh layhvah asham hv
translation: The priest shall turn them into smoke on the altar as an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>; it is a guilt offering.

hebrew: כָּל־זָכָ֥ר בַּכֹּהֲנִ֖ים יֹאכְלֶ֑נּוּ בְּמָק֤וֹם קָדוֹשׁ֙ יֵאָכֵ֔ל קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים הֽוּא׃
transliteration: kal-zakhar bakohaniym yokh'lenv b'makvom kadvosh yeakhel kodesh kadashiym hv
translation: Only the males in the priestly line may eat of it; it shall be eaten in the sacred precinct: it is most holy.

hebrew: כַּֽחַטָּאת֙ כָּֽאָשָׁ֔ם תּוֹרָ֥ה אַחַ֖ת לָהֶ֑ם הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְכַפֶּר־בּ֖וֹ ל֥וֹ יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: kachatat kaasham tvorah achat lahem hakohen asher y'khaper-bvo lvo yih'yeh
translation: The guilt offering is like the sin offering. The same rule applies to both: it shall belong to the priest who makes expiation thereby.

hebrew: וְהַ֨כֹּהֵ֔ן הַמַּקְרִ֖יב אֶת־עֹ֣לַת אִ֑ישׁ ע֤וֹר הָֽעֹלָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִקְרִ֔יב לַכֹּהֵ֖ן ל֥וֹ יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'hakohen hamak'riyv et-'olat iysh 'vor ha'olah asher hik'riyv lakohen lvo yih'yeh
translation: So, too, the priest who offers a man’s burnt offering shall keep the skin of the burnt offering that he offered.

hebrew: וְכָל־מִנְחָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר תֵּֽאָפֶה֙ בַּתַּנּ֔וּר וְכָל־נַעֲשָׂ֥ה בַמַּרְחֶ֖שֶׁת וְעַֽל־מַחֲבַ֑ת לַכֹּהֵ֛ן הַמַּקְרִ֥יב אֹתָ֖הּ ל֥וֹ תִֽהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'khal-min'chah asher teafeh batanvr v'khal-na'asah vamar'cheshet v'al-machavat lakohen hamak'riyv otah lvo tih'yeh
translation: Further, any meal offering that is baked in an oven, and any that is prepared in a pan or on a griddle, shall belong to the priest who offers it.

hebrew: וְכָל־מִנְחָ֥ה בְלוּלָֽה־בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן וַחֲרֵבָ֑ה לְכָל־בְּנֵ֧י אַהֲרֹ֛ן תִּהְיֶ֖ה אִ֥ישׁ כְּאָחִֽיו׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'khal-min'chah v'lvlah-vashemen vacharevah l'khal-b'ney aharon tih'yeh iysh k'achiyv (f)
translation: But every other meal offering, with oil mixed in or dry, shall go to the sons of Aaron all alike.

hebrew: וְזֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת זֶ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַקְרִ֖יב לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'zot tvorat zevach hash'lamiym asher yak'riyv layhvah
translation: This is the ritual of the sacrifice of well-being that one may offer to the L<small>ORD</small>:

hebrew: אִ֣ם עַל־תּוֹדָה֮ יַקְרִיבֶנּוּ֒ וְהִקְרִ֣יב ׀ עַל־זֶ֣בַח הַתּוֹדָ֗ה חַלּ֤וֹת מַצּוֹת֙ בְּלוּלֹ֣ת בַּשֶּׁ֔מֶן וּרְקִיקֵ֥י מַצּ֖וֹת מְשֻׁחִ֣ים בַּשָּׁ֑מֶן וְסֹ֣לֶת מֻרְבֶּ֔כֶת חַלֹּ֖ת בְּלוּלֹ֥ת בַּשָּֽׁמֶן׃
transliteration: im 'al-tvodah yak'riyvenv v'hik'riyv  'al-zevach hatvodah chalvot matzvot b'lvlot bashemen vr'kiykey matzvot m'shuchiym bashamen v'solet mur'bekhet chalot b'lvlot bashamen
translation: If he offers it for thanksgiving, he shall offer together with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes with oil mixed in, unleavened wafers spread with oil, and cakes of choice flour with oil mixed in, well soaked.

hebrew: עַל־חַלֹּת֙ לֶ֣חֶם חָמֵ֔ץ יַקְרִ֖יב קָרְבָּנ֑וֹ עַל־זֶ֖בַח תּוֹדַ֥ת שְׁלָמָֽיו׃
transliteration: 'al-chalot lechem chametz yak'riyv kar'banvo 'al-zevach tvodat sh'lamayv
translation: This offering, with cakes of leavened bread added, he shall offer along with his thanksgiving sacrifice of well-being.

hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֨יב מִמֶּ֤נּוּ אֶחָד֙ מִכָּל־קָרְבָּ֔ן תְּרוּמָ֖ה לַיהוָ֑ה לַכֹּהֵ֗ן הַזֹּרֵ֛ק אֶת־דַּ֥ם הַשְּׁלָמִ֖ים ל֥וֹ יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyv mimenv echad mikal-kar'ban t'rvmah layhvah lakohen hazorek et-dam hash'lamiym lvo yih'yeh
translation: Out of this he shall offer one of each kindaLit. “offering.” as a gift to the LORD; it shall go to the priest who dashes the blood of the offering of well-being.

hebrew: וּבְשַׂ֗ר זֶ֚בַח תּוֹדַ֣ת שְׁלָמָ֔יו בְּי֥וֹם קָרְבָּנ֖וֹ יֵאָכֵ֑ל לֹֽא־יַנִּ֥יחַ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
transliteration: vv'sar zevach tvodat sh'lamayv b'yvom kar'banvo yeakhel lo-yaniycha mimenv 'ad-boker
translation: And the flesh of his thanksgiving sacrifice of well-being shall be eaten on the day that it is offered; none of it shall be set aside until morning.

hebrew: וְאִם־נֶ֣דֶר ׀ א֣וֹ נְדָבָ֗ה זֶ֚בַח קָרְבָּנ֔וֹ בְּי֛וֹם הַקְרִיב֥וֹ אֶת־זִבְח֖וֹ יֵאָכֵ֑ל וּמִֽמָּחֳרָ֔ת וְהַנּוֹתָ֥ר מִמֶּ֖נּוּ יֵאָכֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'im-neder  vo n'davah zevach kar'banvo b'yvom hak'riyvvo et-ziv'chvo yeakhel vmimachorat v'hanvotar mimenv yeakhel
translation: If, however, the sacrifice he offers is a votive or a freewill offering, it shall be eaten on the day that he offers his sacrifice, and what is left of it shall be eaten on the morrow.

hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָ֖ר מִבְּשַׂ֣ר הַזָּ֑בַח בַּיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י בָּאֵ֖שׁ יִשָּׂרֵֽף׃
transliteration: v'hanvotar mib'sar hazavach bayvom hash'liyshiy baesh yisaref
translation: What is then left of the flesh of the sacrifice shall be consumed in fire on the third day.

hebrew: וְאִ֣ם הֵאָכֹ֣ל יֵ֠אָכֵל מִבְּשַׂר־זֶ֨בַח שְׁלָמָ֜יו בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי֮ לֹ֣א יֵרָצֶה֒ הַמַּקְרִ֣יב אֹת֗וֹ לֹ֧א יֵחָשֵׁ֛ב ל֖וֹ פִּגּ֣וּל יִהְיֶ֑ה וְהַנֶּ֛פֶשׁ הָאֹכֶ֥לֶת מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עֲוֺנָ֥הּ תִּשָּֽׂא׃
transliteration: v'im heakhol yeakhel mib'sar-zevach sh'lamayv bayvom hash'liyshiy lo yeratzeh hamak'riyv otvo lo yechashev lvo pigvl yih'yeh v'hanefesh haokhelet mimenv 'avonah tisa
translation: If any of the flesh of his sacrifice of well-being is eaten on the third day, it shall not be acceptable; it shall not count for him who offered it. It is an offensive thing, and the person who eats of it shall bear his guilt.

hebrew: וְהַבָּשָׂ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־יִגַּ֤ע בְּכָל־טָמֵא֙ לֹ֣א יֵֽאָכֵ֔ל בָּאֵ֖שׁ יִשָּׂרֵ֑ף וְהַ֨בָּשָׂ֔ר כָּל־טָה֖וֹר יֹאכַ֥ל בָּשָֽׂר׃
transliteration: v'habasar asher-yiga' b'khal-tame lo yeakhel baesh yisaref v'habasar kal-tahvor yokhal basar
translation: Flesh that touches anything unclean shall not be eaten; it shall be consumed in fire. As for other flesh, only he who is clean may eat such flesh.

hebrew: וְהַנֶּ֜פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאכַ֣ל בָּשָׂ֗ר מִזֶּ֤בַח הַשְּׁלָמִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לַיהוָ֔ה וְטֻמְאָת֖וֹ עָלָ֑יו וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵעַמֶּֽיהָ׃
transliteration: v'hanefesh asher-tokhal basar mizevach hash'lamiym asher layhvah v'tum'atvo 'alayv v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv me'ameyha
translation: But the person who, in a state of uncleanness, eats flesh from the L<small>ORD</small>’s sacrifices of well-being, that person shall be cut off from his kin.

hebrew: וְנֶ֜פֶשׁ כִּֽי־תִגַּ֣ע בְּכָל־טָמֵ֗א בְּטֻמְאַ֤ת אָדָם֙ א֣וֹ ׀ בִּבְהֵמָ֣ה טְמֵאָ֗ה א֚וֹ בְּכָל־שֶׁ֣קֶץ טָמֵ֔א וְאָכַ֛ל מִבְּשַׂר־זֶ֥בַח הַשְּׁלָמִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לַיהוָ֑ה וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵעַמֶּֽיהָ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'nefesh kiy-tiga' b'khal-tame b'tum'at adam vo  biv'hemah t'meah vo b'khal-sheketz tame v'akhal mib'sar-zevach hash'lamiym asher layhvah v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv me'ameyha (f)
translation: When a person touches anything unclean, be it human uncleanness or an unclean animal or any unclean creature,bHeb. sheqeṣ, lit. “abomination”; several mss. and ancient versions read shereṣ “swarming things.” and eats flesh from the LORD’s sacrifices of well-being, that person shall be cut off from his kin.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֛ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר כָּל־חֵ֜לֶב שׁ֥וֹר וְכֶ֛שֶׂב וָעֵ֖ז לֹ֥א תֹאכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael lemor kal-chelev shvor v'khesev va'ez lo tokhelv
translation: Speak to the Israelite people thus: You shall eat no fatcI.e., hard, coarse fat (suet); cf. 3.3–5. of ox or sheep or goat.

hebrew: וְחֵ֤לֶב נְבֵלָה֙ וְחֵ֣לֶב טְרֵפָ֔ה יֵעָשֶׂ֖ה לְכָל־מְלָאכָ֑ה וְאָכֹ֖ל לֹ֥א תֹאכְלֻֽהוּ׃
transliteration: v'chelev n'velah v'chelev t'refah ye'aseh l'khal-m'lakhah v'akhol lo tokh'luhv
translation: Fat from animals that died or were torn by beasts may be put to any use, but you must not eat it.

hebrew: כִּ֚י כָּל־אֹכֵ֣ל חֵ֔לֶב מִן־הַ֨בְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַקְרִ֥יב מִמֶּ֛נָּה אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָ֑ה וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הָאֹכֶ֖לֶת מֵֽעַמֶּֽיהָ׃
transliteration: kiy kal-okhel chelev min-hab'hemah asher yak'riyv mimenah isheh layhvah v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh haokhelet me'ameyha
translation: If anyone eats the fat of animals from which offerings by fire may be made to the L<small>ORD</small>, the person who eats it shall be cut off from his kin.

hebrew: וְכָל־דָּם֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכְל֔וּ בְּכֹ֖ל מוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶ֑ם לָע֖וֹף וְלַבְּהֵמָֽה׃
transliteration: v'khal-dam lo tokh'lv b'khol mvosh'voteykhem la'vof v'lab'hemah
translation: And you must not consume any blood, either of bird or of animal, in any of your settlements.

hebrew: כָּל־נֶ֖פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאכַ֣ל כָּל־דָּ֑ם וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵֽעַמֶּֽיהָ׃ (פ)
transliteration: kal-nefesh asher-tokhal kal-dam v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv me'ameyha (f)
translation: Anyone who eats blood shall be cut off from his kin.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֛ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר הַמַּקְרִ֞יב אֶת־זֶ֤בַח שְׁלָמָיו֙ לַיהוָ֔ה יָבִ֧יא אֶת־קָרְבָּנ֛וֹ לַיהוָ֖ה מִזֶּ֥בַח שְׁלָמָֽיו׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael lemor hamak'riyv et-zevach sh'lamayv layhvah yaviy et-kar'banvo layhvah mizevach sh'lamayv
translation: Speak to the Israelite people thus: The offering to the L<small>ORD</small> from a sacrifice of well-being must be presented by him who offers his sacrifice of well-being to the L<small>ORD</small>:

hebrew: יָדָ֣יו תְּבִיאֶ֔ינָה אֵ֖ת אִשֵּׁ֣י יְהוָ֑ה אֶת־הַחֵ֤לֶב עַל־הֶֽחָזֶה֙ יְבִיאֶ֔נּוּ אֵ֣ת הֶחָזֶ֗ה לְהָנִ֥יף אֹת֛וֹ תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: yadayv t'viyeynah et ishey y'hvah et-hachelev 'al-hechazeh y'viyenv et hechazeh l'haniyf otvo t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah
translation: his own hands shall present the L<small>ORD</small>’s offerings by fire. He shall present the fat with the breast, the breast to be elevated as an elevation offering before the L<small>ORD</small>;

hebrew: וְהִקְטִ֧יר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־הַחֵ֖לֶב הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה וְהָיָה֙ הֶֽחָזֶ֔ה לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'hik'tiyr hakohen et-hachelev hamiz'bechah v'hayah hechazeh l'aharon vl'vanayv
translation: the priest shall turn the fat into smoke on the altar, and the breast shall go to Aaron and his sons.

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ שׁ֣וֹק הַיָּמִ֔ין תִּתְּנ֥וּ תְרוּמָ֖ה לַכֹּהֵ֑ן מִזִּבְחֵ֖י שַׁלְמֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'et shvok hayamiyn tit'nv t'rvmah lakohen miziv'chey shal'meykhem
translation: And the right thigh from your sacrifices of well-being you shall present to the priest as a gift;

hebrew: הַמַּקְרִ֞יב אֶת־דַּ֧ם הַשְּׁלָמִ֛ים וְאֶת־הַחֵ֖לֶב מִבְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֑ן ל֧וֹ תִהְיֶ֛ה שׁ֥וֹק הַיָּמִ֖ין לְמָנָֽה׃
transliteration: hamak'riyv et-dam hash'lamiym v'et-hachelev mib'ney aharon lvo tih'yeh shvok hayamiyn l'manah
translation: he from among Aaron’s sons who offers the blood and the fat of the offering of well-being shall get the right thigh as his portion.

hebrew: כִּי֩ אֶת־חֲזֵ֨ה הַתְּנוּפָ֜ה וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שׁ֣וֹק הַתְּרוּמָ֗ה לָקַ֙חְתִּי֙ מֵאֵ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִזִּבְחֵ֖י שַׁלְמֵיהֶ֑ם וָאֶתֵּ֣ן אֹ֠תָם לְאַהֲרֹ֨ן הַכֹּהֵ֤ן וּלְבָנָיו֙ לְחָק־עוֹלָ֔ם מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: kiy et-chazeh hat'nvfah v'et  shvok hat'rvmah lakach'tiy meet b'ney-yis'rael miziv'chey shal'meyhem vaeten otam l'aharon hakohen vl'vanayv l'chak-'volam meet b'ney yis'rael
translation: For I have taken the breast of elevation offering and the thigh of gift offering from the Israelites, from their sacrifices of well-being, and given them to Aaron the priest and to his sons as their due from the Israelites for all time.

hebrew: זֹ֣את מִשְׁחַ֤ת אַהֲרֹן֙ וּמִשְׁחַ֣ת בָּנָ֔יו מֵאִשֵּׁ֖י יְהוָ֑ה בְּיוֹם֙ הִקְרִ֣יב אֹתָ֔ם לְכַהֵ֖ן לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: zot mish'chat aharon vmish'chat banayv meishey y'hvah b'yvom hik'riyv otam l'khahen layhvah
translation: Those shall be the perquisitesdLit. “anointment,” i.e., accruing from anointment. of Aaron and the perquisites of his sons from the LORD’s offerings by fire, once they have been inductedeLit. “brought forward.” to serve the LORD as priests;

hebrew: אֲשֶׁר֩ צִוָּ֨ה יְהוָ֜ה לָתֵ֣ת לָהֶ֗ם בְּיוֹם֙ מָשְׁח֣וֹ אֹתָ֔ם מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: asher tzivah y'hvah latet lahem b'yvom mash'chvo otam meet b'ney yis'rael chukat 'volam l'dorotam
translation: these the L<small>ORD</small> commanded to be given them, once they had been anointed, as a due from the Israelites for all time throughout the ages.

hebrew: זֹ֣את הַתּוֹרָ֗ה לָֽעֹלָה֙ לַמִּנְחָ֔ה וְלַֽחַטָּ֖את וְלָאָשָׁ֑ם וְלַ֨מִּלּוּאִ֔ים וּלְזֶ֖בַח הַשְּׁלָמִֽים׃
transliteration: zot hatvorah la'olah lamin'chah v'lachatat v'laasham v'lamilviym vl'zevach hash'lamiym
translation: Such are the rituals of the burnt offering, the meal offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the offering of ordination, and the sacrifice of well-being,

hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּהַ֣ר סִינָ֑י בְּי֨וֹם צַוֺּת֜וֹ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לְהַקְרִ֧יב אֶת־קָרְבְּנֵיהֶ֛ם לַיהוָ֖ה בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר סִינָֽי׃ (פ)
transliteration: asher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh b'har siynay b'yvom tzavotvo et-b'ney yis'rael l'hak'riyv et-kar'b'neyhem layhvah b'mid'bar siynay (f)
translation: with which the L<small>ORD</small> charged Moses on Mount Sinai, when He commanded that the Israelites present their offerings to the L<small>ORD</small>, in the wilderness of Sinai.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: קַ֤ח אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֣יו אִתּ֔וֹ וְאֵת֙ הַבְּגָדִ֔ים וְאֵ֖ת שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֑ה וְאֵ֣ת ׀ פַּ֣ר הַֽחַטָּ֗את וְאֵת֙ שְׁנֵ֣י הָֽאֵילִ֔ים וְאֵ֖ת סַ֥ל הַמַּצּֽוֹת׃
transliteration: kach et-aharon v'et-banayv itvo v'et hab'gadiym v'et shemen hamish'chah v'et  par hachatat v'et sh'ney haeyliym v'et sal hamatzvot
translation: Take Aaron along with his sons, and the vestments, the anointing oil, the bull of sin offering, the two rams, and the basket of unleavened bread;

hebrew: וְאֵ֥ת כָּל־הָעֵדָ֖ה הַקְהֵ֑ל אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'et kal-ha'edah hak'hel el-petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: and assemble the whole community at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֔ה כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ וַתִּקָּהֵל֙ הָֽעֵדָ֔ה אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: vaya'as mosheh kaasher tzivah y'hvah otvo vatikahel ha'edah el-petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: Moses did as the L<small>ORD</small> commanded him. And when the community was assembled at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הָעֵדָ֑ה זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-ha'edah zeh hadavar asher-tzivah y'hvah la'asvot
translation: Moses said to the community, “This is what the L<small>ORD</small> has commanded to be done.”

hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֣ב מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְאֶת־בָּנָ֑יו וַיִּרְחַ֥ץ אֹתָ֖ם בַּמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayak'rev mosheh et-aharon v'et-banayv vayir'chatz otam bamayim
translation: Then Moses brought Aaron and his sons forward and washed them with water.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן עָלָ֜יו אֶת־הַכֻּתֹּ֗נֶת וַיַּחְגֹּ֤ר אֹתוֹ֙ בָּֽאַבְנֵ֔ט וַיַּלְבֵּ֤שׁ אֹתוֹ֙ אֶֽת־הַמְּעִ֔יל וַיִּתֵּ֥ן עָלָ֖יו אֶת־הָאֵפֹ֑ד וַיַּחְגֹּ֣ר אֹת֗וֹ בְּחֵ֙שֶׁב֙ הָֽאֵפֹ֔ד וַיֶּאְפֹּ֥ד ל֖וֹ בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayiten 'alayv et-hakutonet vayach'gor otvo baav'net vayal'besh otvo et-ham'iyl vayiten 'alayv et-haefod vayach'gor otvo b'cheshev haefod vaye'pod lvo bvo
translation: He put the tunic on him, girded him with the sash, clothed him with the robe, and put the ephod on him, girding him with the decorated band with which he tied it to him.

hebrew: וַיָּ֥שֶׂם עָלָ֖יו אֶת־הַחֹ֑שֶׁן וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶל־הַחֹ֔שֶׁן אֶת־הָאוּרִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַתֻּמִּֽים׃
transliteration: vayasem 'alayv et-hachoshen vayiten el-hachoshen et-havriym v'et-hatumiym
translation: He put the breastpiece on him, and put into the breastpiece the Urim and Thummim.aSee note on Exod. 28.30.

hebrew: וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־הַמִּצְנֶ֖פֶת עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַיָּ֨שֶׂם עַֽל־הַמִּצְנֶ֜פֶת אֶל־מ֣וּל פָּנָ֗יו אֵ֣ת צִ֤יץ הַזָּהָב֙ נֵ֣זֶר הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayasem et-hamitz'nefet 'al-roshvo vayasem 'al-hamitz'nefet el-mvl panayv et tziytz hazahav nezer hakodesh kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: And he set the headdress on his head; and on the headdress, in front, he put the gold frontlet, the holy diadem—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וַיִּמְשַׁ֥ח אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן וְאֶת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־בּ֑וֹ וַיְקַדֵּ֖שׁ אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-shemen hamish'chah vayim'shach et-hamish'kan v'et-kal-asher-bvo vay'kadesh otam
translation: Moses took the anointing oil and anointed the Tabernacle and all that was in it, thus consecrating them.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥ז מִמֶּ֛נּוּ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֑ים וַיִּמְשַׁ֨ח אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֜חַ וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֗יו וְאֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֛ר וְאֶת־כַּנּ֖וֹ לְקַדְּשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayaz mimenv 'al-hamiz'becha sheva' p'amiym vayim'shach et-hamiz'becha v'et-kal-kelayv v'et-hakiyor v'et-kanvo l'kad'sham
translation: He sprinkled some of it on the altar seven times, anointing the altar, all its utensils, and the laver with its stand, to consecrate them.

hebrew: וַיִּצֹק֙ מִשֶּׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה עַ֖ל רֹ֣אשׁ אַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיִּמְשַׁ֥ח אֹת֖וֹ לְקַדְּשֽׁוֹ׃
transliteration: vayitzok mishemen hamish'chah 'al rosh aharon vayim'shach otvo l'kad'shvo
translation: He poured some of the anointing oil upon Aaron’s head and anointed him, to consecrate him.

hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֨ב מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיַּלְבִּשֵׁ֤ם כֻּתֳּנֹת֙ וַיַּחְגֹּ֤ר אֹתָם֙ אַבְנֵ֔ט וַיַּחֲבֹ֥שׁ לָהֶ֖ם מִגְבָּע֑וֹת כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayak'rev mosheh et-b'ney aharon vayal'bishem kutonot vayach'gor otam av'net vayachavosh lahem mig'ba'vot kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: Moses then brought Aaron’s sons forward, clothed them in tunics, girded them with sashes, and wound turbans upon them, as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֕שׁ אֵ֖ת פַּ֣ר הַֽחַטָּ֑את וַיִּסְמֹ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֤ן וּבָנָיו֙ אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֔ם עַל־רֹ֖אשׁ פַּ֥ר הַֽחַטָּֽאת׃
transliteration: vayagesh et par hachatat vayis'mokh' aharon vvanayv et-y'deyhem 'al-rosh par hachatat
translation: He led forward the bull of sin offering. Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the bull of sin offering,

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחָ֗ט וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶת־הַדָּם֙ וַ֠יִּתֵּן עַל־קַרְנ֨וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּ֤חַ סָבִיב֙ בְּאֶצְבָּע֔וֹ וַיְחַטֵּ֖א אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְאֶת־הַדָּ֗ם יָצַק֙ אֶל־יְס֣וֹד הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וַֽיְקַדְּשֵׁ֖הוּ לְכַפֵּ֥ר עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayish'chat vayikach mosheh et-hadam vayiten 'al-kar'nvot hamiz'becha saviyv b'etz'ba'vo vay'chate et-hamiz'becha v'et-hadam yatzak el-y'svod hamiz'becha vay'kad'shehv l'khaper 'alayv
translation: and it was slaughtered. Moses took the blood and with his finger put some on each of the horns of the altar, cleansing the altar; then he poured out the blood at the base of the altar. Thus he consecrated it in order to make expiation upon it.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֗ח אֶֽת־כָּל־הַחֵלֶב֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַקֶּרֶב֒ וְאֵת֙ יֹתֶ֣רֶת הַכָּבֵ֔ד וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֥י הַכְּלָיֹ֖ת וְאֶֽת־חֶלְבְּהֶ֑ן וַיַּקְטֵ֥ר מֹשֶׁ֖ה הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
transliteration: vayikach et-kal-hachelev asher 'al-hakerev v'et yoteret hakaved v'et-sh'tey hak'layot v'et-chel'b'hen vayak'ter mosheh hamiz'bechah
translation: Moses then took all the fat that was about the entrails, and the protuberance of the liver, and the two kidneys and their fat, and turned them into smoke on the altar.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַפָּ֤ר וְאֶת־עֹרוֹ֙ וְאֶת־בְּשָׂר֣וֹ וְאֶת־פִּרְשׁ֔וֹ שָׂרַ֣ף בָּאֵ֔שׁ מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'et-hapar v'et-'orvo v'et-b'sarvo v'et-pir'shvo saraf baesh michvtz lamachaneh kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: The rest of the bull, its hide, its flesh, and its dung, he put to the fire outside the camp—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֕ב אֵ֖ת אֵ֣יל הָעֹלָ֑ה וַֽיִּסְמְכ֞וּ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
transliteration: vayak'rev et eyl ha'olah vayis'm'khv aharon vvanayv et-y'deyhem 'al-rosh haayil
translation: Then he brought forward the ram of burnt offering. Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the ram’s head,

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחָ֑ט וַיִּזְרֹ֨ק מֹשֶׁ֧ה אֶת־הַדָּ֛ם עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: vayish'chat vayiz'rok mosheh et-hadam 'al-hamiz'becha saviyv
translation: and it was slaughtered. Moses dashed the blood against all sides of the altar.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאַ֔יִל נִתַּ֖ח לִנְתָחָ֑יו וַיַּקְטֵ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הָרֹ֔אשׁ וְאֶת־הַנְּתָחִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַפָּֽדֶר׃
transliteration: v'et-haayil nitach lin'tachayv vayak'ter mosheh et-harosh v'et-han'tachiym v'et-hapader
translation: The ram was cut up into sections and Moses turned the head, the sections, and the suet into smoke on the altar;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַקֶּ֥רֶב וְאֶת־הַכְּרָעַ֖יִם רָחַ֣ץ בַּמָּ֑יִם וַיַּקְטֵר֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה אֶת־כָּל־הָאַ֜יִל הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חָה עֹלָ֨ה ה֤וּא לְרֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ אִשֶּׁ֥ה הוּא֙ לַיהוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'et-hakerev v'et-hak'ra'ayim rachatz bamayim vayak'ter mosheh et-kal-haayil hamiz'bechah 'olah hv l'reycha-niychocha isheh hv layhvah kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: Moses washed the entrails and the legs with water and turned all of the ram into smoke. That was a burnt offering for a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵב֙ אֶת־הָאַ֣יִל הַשֵּׁנִ֔י אֵ֖יל הַמִּלֻּאִ֑ים וַֽיִּסְמְכ֞וּ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
transliteration: vayak'rev et-haayil hasheniy eyl hamiluiym vayis'm'khv aharon vvanayv et-y'deyhem 'al-rosh haayil
translation: He brought forward the second ram, the ram of ordination. Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the ram’s head,

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחָ֓ט ׀ וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ מִדָּמ֔וֹ וַיִּתֵּ֛ן עַל־תְּנ֥וּךְ אֹֽזֶן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַיְמָנִ֑ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדוֹ֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְל֖וֹ הַיְמָנִֽית׃
transliteration: vayish'chat  vayikach mosheh midamvo vayiten 'al-t'nvkh' ozen-aharon hay'maniyt v'al-bohen yadvo hay'maniyt v'al-bohen rag'lvo hay'maniyt
translation: and it was slaughtered. Moses took some of its blood and put it on the ridgebOr “lobe.” of Aaron’s right ear, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.

hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֞ב אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיִּתֵּ֨ן מֹשֶׁ֤ה מִן־הַדָּם֙ עַל־תְּנ֤וּךְ אָזְנָם֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדָם֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְלָ֖ם הַיְמָנִ֑ית וַיִּזְרֹ֨ק מֹשֶׁ֧ה אֶת־הַדָּ֛ם עַל־הַֽמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: vayak'rev et-b'ney aharon vayiten mosheh min-hadam 'al-t'nvkh' az'nam hay'maniyt v'al-bohen yadam hay'maniyt v'al-bohen rag'lam hay'maniyt vayiz'rok mosheh et-hadam 'al-hamiz'becha saviyv
translation: Moses then brought forward the sons of Aaron, and put some of the blood on the ridges of their right ears, and on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet; and the rest of the blood Moses dashed against every side of the altar.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־הַחֵ֣לֶב וְאֶת־הָֽאַלְיָ֗ה וְאֶֽת־כָּל־הַחֵלֶב֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַקֶּרֶב֒ וְאֵת֙ יֹתֶ֣רֶת הַכָּבֵ֔ד וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֥י הַכְּלָיֹ֖ת וְאֶֽת־חֶלְבְּהֶ֑ן וְאֵ֖ת שׁ֥וֹק הַיָּמִֽין׃
transliteration: vayikach et-hachelev v'et-haal'yah v'et-kal-hachelev asher 'al-hakerev v'et yoteret hakaved v'et-sh'tey hak'layot v'et-chel'b'hen v'et shvok hayamiyn
translation: He took the fat—the broad tail, all the fat about the entrails, the protuberance of the liver, and the two kidneys and their fat—and the right thigh.

hebrew: וּמִסַּ֨ל הַמַּצּ֜וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֗ה לָ֠קַח חַלַּ֨ת מַצָּ֤ה אַחַת֙ וְֽחַלַּ֨ת לֶ֥חֶם שֶׁ֛מֶן אַחַ֖ת וְרָקִ֣יק אֶחָ֑ד וַיָּ֙שֶׂם֙ עַל־הַ֣חֲלָבִ֔ים וְעַ֖ל שׁ֥וֹק הַיָּמִֽין׃
transliteration: vmisal hamatzvot asher  lif'ney y'hvah lakach chalat matzah achat v'chalat lechem shemen achat v'rakiyk echad vayasem 'al-hachalaviym v'al shvok hayamiyn
translation: From the basket of unleavened bread that was before the L<small>ORD</small>, he took one cake of unleavened bread, one cake of oil bread, and one wafer, and placed them on the fat parts and on the right thigh.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֶת־הַכֹּ֔ל עַ֚ל כַּפֵּ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְעַ֖ל כַּפֵּ֣י בָנָ֑יו וַיָּ֧נֶף אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayiten et-hakol 'al kapey aharon v'al kapey vanayv vayanef otam t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah
translation: He placed all these on the palms of Aaron and on the palms of his sons, and elevated them as an elevation offering before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֹתָם֙ מֵעַ֣ל כַּפֵּיהֶ֔ם וַיַּקְטֵ֥ר הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חָה עַל־הָעֹלָ֑ה מִלֻּאִ֥ים הֵם֙ לְרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֥ה ה֖וּא לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh otam me'al kapeyhem vayak'ter hamiz'bechah 'al-ha'olah miluiym hem l'reycha niychocha isheh hv layhvah
translation: Then Moses took them from their hands and turned them into smoke on the altar with the burnt offering. This was an ordination offering for a pleasing odor; it was an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הֶ֣חָזֶ֔ה וַיְנִיפֵ֥הוּ תְנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה מֵאֵ֣יל הַמִּלֻּאִ֗ים לְמֹשֶׁ֤ה הָיָה֙ לְמָנָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-hechazeh vay'niyfehv t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah meeyl hamiluiym l'mosheh hayah l'manah kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: Moses took the breast and elevated it as an elevation offering before the L<small>ORD</small>; it was Moses’ portion of the ram of ordination—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה מִשֶּׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֗ה וּמִן־הַדָּם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּחַ֒ וַיַּ֤ז עַֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ עַל־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְעַל־בָּנָ֛יו וְעַל־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּ֑וֹ וַיְקַדֵּ֤שׁ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְאֶת־בָּנָ֛יו וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh mishemen hamish'chah vmin-hadam asher 'al-hamiz'becha vayaz 'al-aharon 'al-b'gadayv v'al-banayv v'al-big'dey vanayv itvo vay'kadesh et-aharon et-b'gadayv v'et-banayv v'et-big'dey vanayv itvo
translation: And Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood that was on the altar and sprinkled it upon Aaron and upon his vestments, and also upon his sons and upon their vestments. Thus he consecrated Aaron and his vestments, and also his sons and their vestments.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־אַהֲרֹ֣ן וְאֶל־בָּנָ֗יו בַּשְּׁל֣וּ אֶת־הַבָּשָׂר֮ פֶּ֣תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵד֒ וְשָׁם֙ תֹּאכְל֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ וְאֶ֨ת־הַלֶּ֔חֶם אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּסַ֣ל הַמִּלֻּאִ֑ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר צִוֵּ֙יתִי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַהֲרֹ֥ן וּבָנָ֖יו יֹאכְלֻֽהוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon v'el-banayv bash'lv et-habasar petach ohel mvo'ed v'sham tokh'lv otvo v'et-halechem asher b'sal hamiluiym kaasher tziveytiy lemor aharon vvanayv yokh'luhv
translation: Moses said to Aaron and his sons: Boil the flesh at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and eat it there with the bread that is in the basket of ordination—as I commanded:cOr, vocalizing ṣuwwethi, “I have been commanded”; cf. below, vv. 35 and 10.13. Aaron and his sons shall eat it;

hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָ֥ר בַּבָּשָׂ֖ר וּבַלָּ֑חֶם בָּאֵ֖שׁ תִּשְׂרֹֽפוּ׃
transliteration: v'hanvotar babasar vvalachem baesh tis'rofv
translation: and what is left over of the flesh and the bread you shall consume in fire.

hebrew: וּמִפֶּתַח֩ אֹ֨הֶל מוֹעֵ֜ד לֹ֤א תֵֽצְאוּ֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים עַ֚ד י֣וֹם מְלֹ֔את יְמֵ֖י מִלֻּאֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֚י שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים יְמַלֵּ֖א אֶת־יֶדְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vmipetach ohel mvo'ed lo tetz'v shiv'at yamiym 'ad yvom m'lot y'mey milueykhem kiy shiv'at yamiym y'male et-yed'khem
translation: You shall not go outside the entrance of the Tent of Meeting for seven days, until the day that your period of ordination is completed. For your ordination will require seven days.

hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה לַעֲשֹׂ֖ת לְכַפֵּ֥ר עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: kaasher 'asah bayvom hazeh tzivah y'hvah la'asot l'khaper 'aleykhem
translation: Everything done today, the L<small>ORD</small> has commanded to be done [seven days], to make expiation for you.

hebrew: וּפֶתַח֩ אֹ֨הֶל מוֹעֵ֜ד תֵּשְׁב֨וּ יוֹמָ֤ם וָלַ֙יְלָה֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֛ם אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת יְהוָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א תָמ֑וּתוּ כִּי־כֵ֖ן צֻוֵּֽיתִי׃
transliteration: vfetach ohel mvo'ed tesh'vv yvomam valay'lah shiv'at yamiym vsh'mar'tem et-mish'meret y'hvah v'lo tamvtv kiy-khen tzuveytiy
translation: You shall remain at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting day and night for seven days, keeping the L<small>ORD</small>’s charge—that you may not die—for so I have been commanded.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אַהֲרֹ֖ן וּבָנָ֑יו אֵ֚ת כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vaya'as aharon vvanayv et kal-had'variym asher-tzivah y'hvah b'yad-mosheh (s)
translation: And Aaron and his sons did all the things that the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded through Moses.

hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֔י קָרָ֣א מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָ֑יו וּלְזִקְנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vay'hiy bayvom hash'miyniy kara mosheh l'aharon vl'vanayv vl'zik'ney yis'rael
translation: On the eighth day Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן קַח־לְ֠ךָ עֵ֣גֶל בֶּן־בָּקָ֧ר לְחַטָּ֛את וְאַ֥יִל לְעֹלָ֖ה תְּמִימִ֑ם וְהַקְרֵ֖ב לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer el-aharon kach-l'kha 'egel ben-bakar l'chatat v'ayil l'olah t'miymim v'hak'rev lif'ney y'hvah
translation: He said to Aaron: “Take a calf of the herd for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, without blemish, and bring them before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תְּדַבֵּ֣ר לֵאמֹ֑ר קְח֤וּ שְׂעִיר־עִזִּים֙ לְחַטָּ֔את וְעֵ֨גֶל וָכֶ֧בֶשׂ בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה תְּמִימִ֖ם לְעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: v'el-b'ney yis'rael t'daber lemor k'chv s'iyr-'iziym l'chatat v'egel vakheves b'ney-shanah t'miymim l'olah
translation: And speak to the Israelites, saying: Take a he-goat for a sin offering; a calf and a lamb, yearlings without blemish, for a burnt offering;

hebrew: וְשׁ֨וֹר וָאַ֜יִל לִשְׁלָמִ֗ים לִזְבֹּ֙חַ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וּמִנְחָ֖ה בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן כִּ֣י הַיּ֔וֹם יְהוָ֖ה נִרְאָ֥ה אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'shvor vaayil lish'lamiym liz'bocha lif'ney y'hvah vmin'chah b'lvlah vashamen kiy hayvom y'hvah nir'ah aleykhem
translation: and an ox and a ram for an offering of well-being to sacrifice before the L<small>ORD</small>; and a meal offering with oil mixed in. For today the L<small>ORD</small> will appear to you.”

hebrew: וַיִּקְח֗וּ אֵ֚ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־פְּנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וַֽיִּקְרְבוּ֙ כָּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה וַיַּֽעַמְד֖וּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayik'chv et asher tzivah mosheh el-p'ney ohel mvo'ed vayik'r'vv kal-ha'edah vaya'am'dv lif'ney y'hvah
translation: They brought to the front of the Tent of Meeting the things that Moses had commanded, and the whole community came forward and stood before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה זֶ֧ה הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה תַּעֲשׂ֑וּ וְיֵרָ֥א אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם כְּב֥וֹד יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh zeh hadavar asher-tzivah y'hvah ta'asv v'yera aleykhem k'vvod y'hvah
translation: Moses said: “This is what the L<small>ORD</small> has commanded that you do, that the Presence of the L<small>ORD</small> may appear to you.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן קְרַ֤ב אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ וַעֲשֵׂ֞ה אֶת־חַטָּֽאתְךָ֙ וְאֶת־עֹ֣לָתֶ֔ךָ וְכַפֵּ֥ר בַּֽעַדְךָ֖ וּבְעַ֣ד הָעָ֑ם וַעֲשֵׂ֞ה אֶת־קָרְבַּ֤ן הָעָם֙ וְכַפֵּ֣ר בַּֽעֲדָ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon k'rav el-hamiz'becha va'aseh et-chatat'kha v'et-'olatekha v'khaper ba'ad'kha vv'ad ha'am va'aseh et-kar'ban ha'am v'khaper ba'adam kaasher tzivah y'hvah
translation: Then Moses said to Aaron: “Come forward to the altar and sacrifice your sin offering and your burnt offering, making expiation for yourself and for the people; and sacrifice the people’s offering and make expiation for them, as the L<small>ORD</small> has commanded.”

hebrew: וַיִּקְרַ֥ב אַהֲרֹ֖ן אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּשְׁחַ֛ט אֶת־עֵ֥גֶל הַחַטָּ֖את אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayik'rav aharon el-hamiz'becha vayish'chat et-'egel hachatat asher-lvo
translation: Aaron came forward to the altar and slaughtered his calf of sin offering.

hebrew: וַ֠יַּקְרִבוּ בְּנֵ֨י אַהֲרֹ֣ן אֶת־הַדָּם֮ אֵלָיו֒ וַיִּטְבֹּ֤ל אֶצְבָּעוֹ֙ בַּדָּ֔ם וַיִּתֵּ֖ן עַל־קַרְנ֣וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְאֶת־הַדָּ֣ם יָצַ֔ק אֶל־יְס֖וֹד הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: vayak'rivv b'ney aharon et-hadam elayv vayit'bol etz'ba'vo badam vayiten 'al-kar'nvot hamiz'becha v'et-hadam yatzak el-y'svod hamiz'becha
translation: Aaron’s sons brought the blood to him; he dipped his finger in the blood and put it on the horns of the altar; and he poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַחֵ֨לֶב וְאֶת־הַכְּלָיֹ֜ת וְאֶת־הַיֹּתֶ֤רֶת מִן־הַכָּבֵד֙ מִן־הַ֣חַטָּ֔את הִקְטִ֖יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'et-hachelev v'et-hak'layot v'et-hayoteret min-hakaved min-hachatat hik'tiyr hamiz'bechah kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: The fat, the kidneys, and the protuberance of the liver from the sin offering he turned into smoke on the altar—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַבָּשָׂ֖ר וְאֶת־הָע֑וֹר שָׂרַ֣ף בָּאֵ֔שׁ מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'et-habasar v'et-ha'vor saraf baesh michvtz lamachaneh
translation: and the flesh and the skin were consumed in fire outside the camp.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחַ֖ט אֶת־הָעֹלָ֑ה וַ֠יַּמְצִאוּ בְּנֵ֨י אַהֲרֹ֤ן אֵלָיו֙ אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וַיִּזְרְקֵ֥הוּ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: vayish'chat et-ha'olah vayam'tziv b'ney aharon elayv et-hadam vayiz'r'kehv 'al-hamiz'becha saviyv
translation: Then he slaughtered the burnt offering. Aaron’s sons passed the blood to him, and he dashed it against all sides of the altar.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הָעֹלָ֗ה הִמְצִ֧יאוּ אֵלָ֛יו לִנְתָחֶ֖יהָ וְאֶת־הָרֹ֑אשׁ וַיַּקְטֵ֖ר עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'et-ha'olah him'tziyv elayv lin'tacheyha v'et-harosh vayak'ter 'al-hamiz'becha
translation: They passed the burnt offering to him in sections, as well as the head, and he turned it into smoke on the altar.

hebrew: וַיִּרְחַ֥ץ אֶת־הַקֶּ֖רֶב וְאֶת־הַכְּרָעָ֑יִם וַיַּקְטֵ֥ר עַל־הָעֹלָ֖ה הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
transliteration: vayir'chatz et-hakerev v'et-hak'ra'ayim vayak'ter 'al-ha'olah hamiz'bechah
translation: He washed the entrails and the legs, and turned them into smoke on the altar with the burnt offering.

hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֕ב אֵ֖ת קָרְבַּ֣ן הָעָ֑ם וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־שְׂעִ֤יר הַֽחַטָּאת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָעָ֔ם וַיִּשְׁחָטֵ֥הוּ וַֽיְחַטְּאֵ֖הוּ כָּרִאשֽׁוֹן׃
transliteration: vayak'rev et kar'ban ha'am vayikach et-s'iyr hachatat asher la'am vayish'chatehv vay'chat'ehv karishvon
translation: Next he brought forward the people’s offering. He took the goat for the people’s sin offering, and slaughtered it, and presented it as a sin offering like the previous one.

hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֖ב אֶת־הָעֹלָ֑ה וַֽיַּעֲשֶׂ֖הָ כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
transliteration: vayak'rev et-ha'olah vaya'aseha kamish'pat
translation: He brought forward the burnt offering and sacrificed it according to regulation.

hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵב֮ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָה֒ וַיְמַלֵּ֤א כַפּוֹ֙ מִמֶּ֔נָּה וַיַּקְטֵ֖ר עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ מִלְּבַ֖ד עֹלַ֥ת הַבֹּֽקֶר׃
transliteration: vayak'rev et-hamin'chah vay'male khapvo mimenah vayak'ter 'al-hamiz'becha mil'vad 'olat haboker
translation: He then brought forward the meal offering and, taking a handful of it, he turned it into smoke on the altar—in addition to the burnt offering of the morning.aSee Exod. 29.38–46.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחַ֤ט אֶת־הַשּׁוֹר֙ וְאֶת־הָאַ֔יִל זֶ֥בַח הַשְּׁלָמִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָעָ֑ם וַ֠יַּמְצִאוּ בְּנֵ֨י אַהֲרֹ֤ן אֶת־הַדָּם֙ אֵלָ֔יו וַיִּזְרְקֵ֥הוּ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: vayish'chat et-hashvor v'et-haayil zevach hash'lamiym asher la'am vayam'tziv b'ney aharon et-hadam elayv vayiz'r'kehv 'al-hamiz'becha saviyv
translation: He slaughtered the ox and the ram, the people’s sacrifice of well-being. Aaron’s sons passed the blood to him—which he dashed against every side of the altar—

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַחֲלָבִ֖ים מִן־הַשּׁ֑וֹר וּמִן־הָאַ֔יִל הָֽאַלְיָ֤ה וְהַֽמְכַסֶּה֙ וְהַכְּלָיֹ֔ת וְיֹתֶ֖רֶת הַכָּבֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'et-hachalaviym min-hashvor vmin-haayil haal'yah v'ham'khaseh v'hak'layot v'yoteret hakaved
translation: and the fat parts of the ox and the ram: the broad tail, the covering [fat], the kidneys, and the protuberances of the livers.

hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ אֶת־הַחֲלָבִ֖ים עַל־הֶחָז֑וֹת וַיַּקְטֵ֥ר הַחֲלָבִ֖ים הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
transliteration: vayasiymv et-hachalaviym 'al-hechazvot vayak'ter hachalaviym hamiz'bechah
translation: They laid these fat parts over the breasts; and AaronbThis word moved up from v. 21 for clarity. turned the fat parts into smoke on the altar,

hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת הֶחָז֗וֹת וְאֵת֙ שׁ֣וֹק הַיָּמִ֔ין הֵנִ֧יף אַהֲרֹ֛ן תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֥ה מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'et hechazvot v'et shvok hayamiyn heniyf aharon t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah kaasher tzivah mosheh
translation: and elevated the breasts and the right thighs as an elevation offering before the L<small>ORD</small>—as Moses had commanded.

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א אַהֲרֹ֧ן אֶת־ידו [יָדָ֛יו] אֶל־הָעָ֖ם וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֑ם וַיֵּ֗רֶד מֵעֲשֹׂ֧ת הַֽחַטָּ֛את וְהָעֹלָ֖ה וְהַשְּׁלָמִֽים׃
transliteration: vayisa aharon et-ydv [yadayv] el-ha'am vay'var'khem vayered me'asot hachatat v'ha'olah v'hash'lamiym
translation: Aaron lifted his hands toward the people and blessed them; and he stepped down after offering the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the offering of well-being.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְאַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וַיֵּ֣צְא֔וּ וַֽיְבָרֲכ֖וּ אֶת־הָעָ֑ם וַיֵּרָ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־כָּל־הָעָֽם׃
transliteration: vayavo mosheh v'aharon el-ohel mvo'ed vayetz'v vay'varakhv et-ha'am vayera kh'vvod-y'hvah el-kal-ha'am
translation: Moses and Aaron then went inside the Tent of Meeting. When they came out, they blessed the people; and the Presence of the L<small>ORD</small> appeared to all the people.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֤צֵא אֵשׁ֙ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וַתֹּ֙אכַל֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ אֶת־הָעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶת־הַחֲלָבִ֑ים וַיַּ֤רְא כָּל־הָעָם֙ וַיָּרֹ֔נּוּ וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vatetze esh milif'ney y'hvah vatokhal 'al-hamiz'becha et-ha'olah v'et-hachalaviym vayar' kal-ha'am vayaronv vayip'lv 'al-p'neyhem
translation: Fire came forth from before the L<small>ORD</small> and consumed the burnt offering and the fat parts on the altar. And all the people saw, and shouted, and fell on their faces.

hebrew: וַיִּקְח֣וּ בְנֵֽי־אַ֠הֲרֹן נָדָ֨ב וַאֲבִיה֜וּא אִ֣ישׁ מַחְתָּת֗וֹ וַיִּתְּנ֤וּ בָהֵן֙ אֵ֔שׁ וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ עָלֶ֖יהָ קְטֹ֑רֶת וַיַּקְרִ֜בוּ לִפְנֵ֤י יְהוָה֙ אֵ֣שׁ זָרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹ֦א צִוָּ֖ה אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayik'chv v'ney-aharon nadav vaaviyhv iysh mach'tatvo vayit'nv vahen esh vayasiymv 'aleyha k'toret vayak'rivv lif'ney y'hvah esh zarah asher lo tzivah otam
translation: Now Aaron’s sons Nadab and Abihu each took his fire pan, put fire in it, and laid incense on it; and they offered before the L<small>ORD</small> alien fire, which He had not enjoined upon them.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֥צֵא אֵ֛שׁ מִלִּפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה וַתֹּ֣אכַל אוֹתָ֑ם וַיָּמֻ֖תוּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vatetze esh milif'ney y'hvah vatokhal votam vayamutv lif'ney y'hvah
translation: And fire came forth from the LORD and consumed them; thus they died aOthers “before.”at the instance of-a the LORD.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן הוּא֩ אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהוָ֤ה ׀ לֵאמֹר֙ בִּקְרֹבַ֣י אֶקָּדֵ֔שׁ וְעַל־פְּנֵ֥י כָל־הָעָ֖ם אֶכָּבֵ֑ד וַיִּדֹּ֖ם אַהֲרֹֽן׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon hv asher-diber y'hvah  lemor bik'rovay ekadesh v'al-p'ney khal-ha'am ekaved vayidom aharon
translation:
Then Moses said to Aaron, “This is what the LORD meant when He said:
Through those near to Me I show Myself holy,
And gain glory before all the people.”
And Aaron was silent.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶל־מִֽישָׁאֵל֙ וְאֶ֣ל אֶלְצָפָ֔ן בְּנֵ֥י עֻזִּיאֵ֖ל דֹּ֣ד אַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם קִ֠רְב֞וּ שְׂא֤וּ אֶת־אֲחֵיכֶם֙ מֵאֵ֣ת פְּנֵי־הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ אֶל־מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vayik'ra mosheh el-miyshael v'el el'tzafan b'ney 'uziyel dod aharon vayomer alehem kir'vv s'v et-acheykhem meet p'ney-hakodesh el-michvtz lamachaneh
translation: Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said to them, “Come forward and carry your kinsmen away from the front of the sanctuary to a place outside the camp.”

hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְב֗וּ וַיִּשָּׂאֻם֙ בְּכֻתֳּנֹתָ֔ם אֶל־מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayik'r'vv vayisaum b'khutonotam el-michvtz lamachaneh kaasher diber mosheh
translation: They came forward and carried them out of the camp by their tunics, as Moses had ordered.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֡ן וּלְאֶלְעָזָר֩ וּלְאִֽיתָמָ֨ר ׀ בָּנָ֜יו רָֽאשֵׁיכֶ֥ם אַל־תִּפְרָ֣עוּ ׀ וּבִגְדֵיכֶ֤ם לֹֽא־תִפְרֹ֙מוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א תָמֻ֔תוּ וְעַ֥ל כָּל־הָעֵדָ֖ה יִקְצֹ֑ף וַאֲחֵיכֶם֙ כָּל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יִבְכּוּ֙ אֶת־הַשְּׂרֵפָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר שָׂרַ֥ף יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon vl'el'azar vl'iytamar  banayv rasheykhem al-tif'ra'v  vvig'deykhem lo-tif'romv v'lo tamutv v'al kal-ha'edah yik'tzof vaacheykhem kal-beyt yis'rael yiv'kv et-has'refah asher saraf y'hvah
translation: And Moses said to Aaron and to his sons Eleazar and Ithamar, “Do not bOr “dishevel your hair.”bare your heads-b and do not rend your clothes, lest you die and anger strike the whole community. But your kinsmen, all the house of Israel, shall bewail the burning that the LORD has wrought.

hebrew: וּמִפֶּתַח֩ אֹ֨הֶל מוֹעֵ֜ד לֹ֤א תֵֽצְאוּ֙ פֶּן־תָּמֻ֔תוּ כִּי־שֶׁ֛מֶן מִשְׁחַ֥ת יְהוָ֖ה עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ כִּדְבַ֥ר מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vmipetach ohel mvo'ed lo tetz'v pen-tamutv kiy-shemen mish'chat y'hvah 'aleykhem vaya'asv kid'var mosheh (f)
translation: And so do not go outside the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, lest you die, for the L<small>ORD</small>’s anointing oil is upon you.” And they did as Moses had bidden.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-aharon lemor
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Aaron, saying:

hebrew: יַ֣יִן וְשֵׁכָ֞ר אַל־תֵּ֣שְׁתְּ ׀ אַתָּ֣ה ׀ וּבָנֶ֣יךָ אִתָּ֗ךְ בְּבֹאֲכֶ֛ם אֶל־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וְלֹ֣א תָמֻ֑תוּ חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: yayin v'shekhar al-tesh't'  atah  vvaneykha itakh' b'voakhem el-ohel mvo'ed v'lo tamutv chukat 'volam l'doroteykhem
translation: Drink no wine or other intoxicant, you or your sons, when you enter the Tent of Meeting, that you may not die. This is a law for all time throughout the ages,

hebrew: וּֽלֲהַבְדִּ֔יל בֵּ֥ין הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ וּבֵ֣ין הַחֹ֑ל וּבֵ֥ין הַטָּמֵ֖א וּבֵ֥ין הַטָּהֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vlahav'diyl beyn hakodesh vveyn hachol vveyn hatame vveyn hatahvor
translation: for you must distinguish between the sacred and the profane, and between the unclean and the clean;

hebrew: וּלְהוֹרֹ֖ת אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֵ֚ת כָּל־הַ֣חֻקִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vl'hvorot et-b'ney yis'rael et kal-hachukiym asher diber y'hvah aleyhem b'yad-mosheh (f)
translation: and you must teach the Israelites all the laws which the L<small>ORD</small> has imparted to them through Moses.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן וְאֶ֣ל אֶ֠לְעָזָר וְאֶל־אִ֨יתָמָ֥ר ׀ בָּנָיו֮ הַנּֽוֹתָרִים֒ קְח֣וּ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֗ה הַנּוֹתֶ֙רֶת֙ מֵאִשֵּׁ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וְאִכְל֥וּהָ מַצּ֖וֹת אֵ֣צֶל הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ כִּ֛י קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים הִֽוא׃
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh el-aharon v'el el'azar v'el-iytamar  banayv hanvotariym k'chv et-hamin'chah hanvoteret meishey y'hvah v'ikh'lvha matzvot etzel hamiz'becha kiy kodesh kadashiym hiv
translation: Moses spoke to Aaron and to his remaining sons, Eleazar and Ithamar: Take the meal offering that is left over from the L<small>ORD</small>’s offerings by fire and eat it unleavened beside the altar, for it is most holy.

hebrew: וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֤ם אֹתָהּ֙ בְּמָק֣וֹם קָדֹ֔שׁ כִּ֣י חָקְךָ֤ וְחָק־בָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ הִ֔וא מֵאִשֵּׁ֖י יְהוָ֑ה כִּי־כֵ֖ן צֻוֵּֽיתִי׃
transliteration: vaakhal'tem otah b'makvom kadosh kiy chak'kha v'chak-baneykha hiv meishey y'hvah kiy-khen tzuveytiy
translation: You shall eat it in the sacred precinct, inasmuch as it is your due, and that of your sons, from the L<small>ORD</small>’s offerings by fire; for so I have been commanded.

hebrew: וְאֵת֩ חֲזֵ֨ה הַתְּנוּפָ֜ה וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שׁ֣וֹק הַתְּרוּמָ֗ה תֹּֽאכְלוּ֙ בְּמָק֣וֹם טָה֔וֹר אַתָּ֕ה וּבָנֶ֥יךָ וּבְנֹתֶ֖יךָ אִתָּ֑ךְ כִּֽי־חָקְךָ֤ וְחָק־בָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ נִתְּנ֔וּ מִזִּבְחֵ֥י שַׁלְמֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'et chazeh hat'nvfah v'et  shvok hat'rvmah tokh'lv b'makvom tahvor atah vvaneykha vv'noteykha itakh' kiy-chak'kha v'chak-baneykha nit'nv miziv'chey shal'mey b'ney yis'rael
translation: But the breast of elevation offering and the thigh of gift offering you, and your sons and daughters with you, may eat in any clean place, for they have been assigned as a due to you and your sons from the Israelites’ sacrifices of well-being.

hebrew: שׁ֣וֹק הַתְּרוּמָ֞ה וַחֲזֵ֣ה הַתְּנוּפָ֗ה עַ֣ל אִשֵּׁ֤י הַחֲלָבִים֙ יָבִ֔יאוּ לְהָנִ֥יף תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְהָיָ֨ה לְךָ֜ וּלְבָנֶ֤יךָ אִתְּךָ֙ לְחָק־עוֹלָ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: shvok hat'rvmah vachazeh hat'nvfah 'al ishey hachalaviym yaviyv l'haniyf t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah v'hayah l'kha vl'vaneykha it'kha l'chak-'volam kaasher tzivah y'hvah
translation: Together with the fat of fire offering, they must present the thigh of gift offering and the breast of elevation offering, which are to be elevated as an elevation offering before the L<small>ORD</small>, and which are to be your due and that of your sons with you for all time—as the L<small>ORD</small> has commanded.

hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שְׂעִ֣יר הַֽחַטָּ֗את דָּרֹ֥שׁ דָּרַ֛שׁ מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְהִנֵּ֣ה שֹׂרָ֑ף וַ֠יִּקְצֹף עַל־אֶלְעָזָ֤ר וְעַל־אִֽיתָמָר֙ בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן הַנּוֹתָרִ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: v'et  s'iyr hachatat darosh darash mosheh v'hineh soraf vayik'tzof 'al-el'azar v'al-iytamar b'ney aharon hanvotarim lemor
translation: Then Moses inquired about the goat of sin offering, and it had already been burned! He was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s remaining sons, and said,

hebrew: מַדּ֗וּעַ לֹֽא־אֲכַלְתֶּ֤ם אֶת־הַֽחַטָּאת֙ בִּמְק֣וֹם הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ כִּ֛י קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים הִ֑וא וְאֹתָ֣הּ ׀ נָתַ֣ן לָכֶ֗ם לָשֵׂאת֙ אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן הָעֵדָ֔ה לְכַפֵּ֥ר עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: madv'a lo-akhal'tem et-hachatat bim'kvom hakodesh kiy kodesh kadashiym hiv v'otah  natan lakhem laset et-'avon ha'edah l'khaper 'aleyhem lif'ney y'hvah
translation: “Why did you not eat the sin offering in the sacred area? For it is most holy, and He has given it to you to remove the guilt of the community and to make expiation for them before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: הֵ֚ן לֹא־הוּבָ֣א אֶת־דָּמָ֔הּ אֶל־הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ פְּנִ֑ימָה אָכ֨וֹל תֹּאכְל֥וּ אֹתָ֛הּ בַּקֹּ֖דֶשׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוֵּֽיתִי׃
transliteration: hen lo-hvva et-damah el-hakodesh p'niymah akhvol tokh'lv otah bakodesh kaasher tziveytiy
translation: Since its blood was not brought inside the sanctuary,cAs is done in the case of the most solemn offerings; see 4.3–21; 16.11–17. you should certainly have eaten it in the sanctuary, as I commanded.”

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה הֵ֣ן הַ֠יּוֹם הִקְרִ֨יבוּ אֶת־חַטָּאתָ֤ם וְאֶת־עֹֽלָתָם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וַתִּקְרֶ֥אנָה אֹתִ֖י כָּאֵ֑לֶּה וְאָכַ֤לְתִּי חַטָּאת֙ הַיּ֔וֹם הַיִּיטַ֖ב בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'daber aharon el-mosheh hen hayvom hik'riyvv et-chatatam v'et-'olatam lif'ney y'hvah vatik'renah otiy kaeleh v'akhal'tiy chatat hayvom hayiytav b'eyney y'hvah
translation: And Aaron spoke to Moses, “See, this day they brought their sin offering and their burnt offering before the L<small>ORD</small>, and such things have befallen me! Had I eaten sin offering today, would the L<small>ORD</small> have approved?”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיִּיטַ֖ב בְּעֵינָֽיו׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayish'ma' mosheh vayiytav b'eynayv (f)
translation: And when Moses heard this, he approved.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹ֥ר אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon lemor alehem
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying to them:

hebrew: דַּבְּר֛וּ אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר זֹ֤את הַֽחַיָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֹּאכְל֔וּ מִכָּל־הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: dab'rv el-b'ney yis'rael lemor zot hachayah asher tokh'lv mikal-hab'hemah asher 'al-haaretz
translation:
Speak to the Israelite people thus:
These are the creatures that you may eat from among all the land animals:

hebrew: כֹּ֣ל ׀ מַפְרֶ֣סֶת פַּרְסָ֗ה וְשֹׁסַ֤עַת שֶׁ֙סַע֙ פְּרָסֹ֔ת מַעֲלַ֥ת גֵּרָ֖ה בַּבְּהֵמָ֑ה אֹתָ֖הּ תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: kol  maf'reset par'sah v'shosa'at shesa' p'rasot ma'alat gerah bab'hemah otah tokhelv
translation: any animal that has true hoofs, with clefts through the hoofs, and that chewsaLit. “brings up.” the cud—such you may eat.

hebrew: אַ֤ךְ אֶת־זֶה֙ לֹ֣א תֹֽאכְל֔וּ מִֽמַּעֲלֵי֙ הַגֵּרָ֔ה וּמִמַּפְרִיסֵ֖י הַפַּרְסָ֑ה אֶֽת־הַ֠גָּמָל כִּֽי־מַעֲלֵ֨ה גֵרָ֜ה ה֗וּא וּפַרְסָה֙ אֵינֶ֣נּוּ מַפְרִ֔יס טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: akh' et-zeh lo tokh'lv mima'aley hagerah vmimaf'riysey hapar'sah et-hagamal kiy-ma'aleh gerah hv vfar'sah eynenv maf'riys tame hv lakhem
translation: The following, however, of those that either chew the cud or have true hoofs, you shall not eat: the camel—although it chews the cud, it has no true hoofs: it is unclean for you;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַשָּׁפָ֗ן כִּֽי־מַעֲלֵ֤ה גֵרָה֙ ה֔וּא וּפַרְסָ֖ה לֹ֣א יַפְרִ֑יס טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'et-hashafan kiy-ma'aleh gerah hv vfar'sah lo yaf'riys tame hv lakhem
translation: the daman—although it chews the cud, it has no true hoofs: it is unclean for you;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאַרְנֶ֗בֶת כִּֽי־מַעֲלַ֤ת גֵּרָה֙ הִ֔וא וּפַרְסָ֖ה לֹ֣א הִפְרִ֑יסָה טְמֵאָ֥ה הִ֖וא לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'et-haar'nevet kiy-ma'alat gerah hiv vfar'sah lo hif'riysah t'meah hiv lakhem
translation: the hare—although it chews the cud, it has no true hoofs: it is unclean for you;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַ֠חֲזִיר כִּֽי־מַפְרִ֨יס פַּרְסָ֜ה ה֗וּא וְשֹׁסַ֥ע שֶׁ֙סַע֙ פַּרְסָ֔ה וְה֖וּא גֵּרָ֣ה לֹֽא־יִגָּ֑ר טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'et-hachaziyr kiy-maf'riys par'sah hv v'shosa' shesa' par'sah v'hv gerah lo-yigar tame hv lakhem
translation: and the swine—although it has true hoofs, with the hoofs cleft through, it does not chew the cud: it is unclean for you.

hebrew: מִבְּשָׂרָם֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֔לוּ וּבְנִבְלָתָ֖ם לֹ֣א תִגָּ֑עוּ טְמֵאִ֥ים הֵ֖ם לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: mib'saram lo tokhelv vv'niv'latam lo tiga'v t'meiym hem lakhem
translation: You shall not eat of their flesh or touch their carcasses; they are unclean for you.

hebrew: אֶת־זֶה֙ תֹּֽאכְל֔וּ מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּמָּ֑יִם כֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֩ סְנַפִּ֨יר וְקַשְׂקֶ֜שֶׂת בַּמַּ֗יִם בַּיַּמִּ֛ים וּבַנְּחָלִ֖ים אֹתָ֥ם תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: et-zeh tokh'lv mikol asher bamayim kol asher-lvo s'napiyr v'kas'keset bamayim bayamiym vvan'chaliym otam tokhelv
translation: These you may eat of all that live in water: anything in water, whether in the seas or in the streams, that has fins and scales—these you may eat.

hebrew: וְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֵֽין־ל֜וֹ סְנַפִּ֣יר וְקַשְׂקֶ֗שֶׂת בַּיַּמִּים֙ וּבַנְּחָלִ֔ים מִכֹּל֙ שֶׁ֣רֶץ הַמַּ֔יִם וּמִכֹּ֛ל נֶ֥פֶשׁ הַחַיָּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּמָּ֑יִם שֶׁ֥קֶץ הֵ֖ם לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'khol asher eyn-lvo s'napiyr v'kas'keset bayamiym vvan'chaliym mikol sheretz hamayim vmikol nefesh hachayah asher bamayim sheketz hem lakhem
translation: But anything in the seas or in the streams that has no fins and scales, among all the swarming things of the water and among all the other living creatures that are in the water—they are an abomination for you

hebrew: וְשֶׁ֖קֶץ יִהְי֣וּ לָכֶ֑ם מִבְּשָׂרָם֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֔לוּ וְאֶת־נִבְלָתָ֖ם תְּשַׁקֵּֽצוּ׃
transliteration: v'sheketz yih'yv lakhem mib'saram lo tokhelv v'et-niv'latam t'shaketzv
translation: and an abomination for you they shall remain: you shall not eat of their flesh and you shall abominate their carcasses.

hebrew: כֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵֽין־ל֛וֹ סְנַפִּ֥יר וְקַשְׂקֶ֖שֶׂת בַּמָּ֑יִם שֶׁ֥קֶץ ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: kol asher eyn-lvo s'napiyr v'kas'keset bamayim sheketz hv lakhem
translation: Everything in water that has no fins and scales shall be an abomination for you.

hebrew: וְאֶת־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ תְּשַׁקְּצ֣וּ מִן־הָע֔וֹף לֹ֥א יֵאָכְל֖וּ שֶׁ֣קֶץ הֵ֑ם אֶת־הַנֶּ֙שֶׁר֙ וְאֶת־הַפֶּ֔רֶס וְאֵ֖ת הָעָזְנִיָּֽה׃
transliteration: v'et-eleh t'shak'tzv min-ha'vof lo yeakh'lv sheketz hem et-hanesher v'et-haperes v'et ha'az'niyah
translation: The followingbA number of these cannot be identified with certainty. you shall abominate among the birds—they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle, the vulture, and the black vulture;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַ֨דָּאָ֔ה וְאֶת־הָאַיָּ֖ה לְמִינָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'et-hadaah v'et-haayah l'miynah
translation: the kite, falcons of every variety;

hebrew: אֵ֥ת כָּל־עֹרֵ֖ב לְמִינֽוֹ׃
transliteration: et kal-'orev l'miynvo
translation: all varieties of raven;

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ בַּ֣ת הַֽיַּעֲנָ֔ה וְאֶת־הַתַּחְמָ֖ס וְאֶת־הַשָּׁ֑חַף וְאֶת־הַנֵּ֖ץ לְמִינֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: v'et bat haya'anah v'et-hatach'mas v'et-hashachaf v'et-hanetz l'miynehv
translation: the ostrich, the nighthawk, the sea gull; hawks of every variety;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַכּ֥וֹס וְאֶת־הַשָּׁלָ֖ךְ וְאֶת־הַיַּנְשֽׁוּף׃
transliteration: v'et-hakvos v'et-hashalakh' v'et-hayan'shvf
translation: the little owl, the cormorant, and the great owl;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַתִּנְשֶׁ֥מֶת וְאֶת־הַקָּאָ֖ת וְאֶת־הָרָחָֽם׃
transliteration: v'et-hatin'shemet v'et-hakaat v'et-haracham
translation: the white owl, the pelican, and the bustard;

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ הַחֲסִידָ֔ה הָאֲנָפָ֖ה לְמִינָ֑הּ וְאֶת־הַדּוּכִיפַ֖ת וְאֶת־הָעֲטַלֵּֽף׃
transliteration: v'et hachasiydah haanafah l'miynah v'et-hadvkhiyfat v'et-ha'atalef
translation: the stork; herons of every variety; the hoopoe, and the bat.

hebrew: כֹּ֚ל שֶׁ֣רֶץ הָע֔וֹף הַהֹלֵ֖ךְ עַל־אַרְבַּ֑ע שֶׁ֥קֶץ ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: kol sheretz ha'vof haholekh' 'al-ar'ba' sheketz hv lakhem (s)
translation: All winged swarming things that walk on fours shall be an abomination for you.

hebrew: אַ֤ךְ אֶת־זֶה֙ תֹּֽאכְל֔וּ מִכֹּל֙ שֶׁ֣רֶץ הָע֔וֹף הַהֹלֵ֖ךְ עַל־אַרְבַּ֑ע אֲשֶׁר־לא [ל֤וֹ] כְרָעַ֙יִם֙ מִמַּ֣עַל לְרַגְלָ֔יו לְנַתֵּ֥ר בָּהֵ֖ן עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: akh' et-zeh tokh'lv mikol sheretz ha'vof haholekh' 'al-ar'ba' asher-l [lvo] kh'ra'ayim mima'al l'rag'layv l'nater bahen 'al-haaretz
translation: But these you may eat among all the winged swarming things that walk on fours: all that have, above their feet, jointed legs to leap with on the ground—

hebrew: אֶת־אֵ֤לֶּה מֵהֶם֙ תֹּאכֵ֔לוּ אֶת־הָֽאַרְבֶּ֣ה לְמִינ֔וֹ וְאֶת־הַסָּלְעָ֖ם לְמִינֵ֑הוּ וְאֶת־הַחַרְגֹּ֣ל לְמִינֵ֔הוּ וְאֶת־הֶחָגָ֖ב לְמִינֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: et-eleh mehem tokhelv et-haar'beh l'miynvo v'et-hasal'am l'miynehv v'et-hachar'gol l'miynehv v'et-hechagav l'miynehv
translation: of these you may eat the following:bA number of these cannot be identified with certainty. locusts of every variety; all varieties of bald locust; crickets of every variety; and all varieties of grasshopper.

hebrew: וְכֹל֙ שֶׁ֣רֶץ הָע֔וֹף אֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ אַרְבַּ֣ע רַגְלָ֑יִם שֶׁ֥קֶץ ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'khol sheretz ha'vof asher-lvo ar'ba' rag'layim sheketz hv lakhem
translation: But all other winged swarming things that have four legs shall be an abomination for you.

hebrew: וּלְאֵ֖לֶּה תִּטַּמָּ֑אוּ כָּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בְּנִבְלָתָ֖ם יִטְמָ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: vl'eleh titamav kal-hanoge'a b'niv'latam yit'ma 'ad-ha'arev
translation: And the following shall make you unclean—whoever touches their carcasses shall be unclean until evening,

hebrew: וְכָל־הַנֹּשֵׂ֖א מִנִּבְלָתָ֑ם יְכַבֵּ֥ס בְּגָדָ֖יו וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'khal-hanose miniv'latam y'khabes b'gadayv v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: and whoever carries the carcasses of any of them shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening—

hebrew: לְֽכָל־הַבְּהֵמָ֡ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִוא֩ מַפְרֶ֨סֶת פַּרְסָ֜ה וְשֶׁ֣סַע ׀ אֵינֶ֣נָּה שֹׁסַ֗עַת וְגֵרָה֙ אֵינֶ֣נָּה מַעֲלָ֔ה טְמֵאִ֥ים הֵ֖ם לָכֶ֑ם כָּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּהֶ֖ם יִטְמָֽא׃
transliteration: l'khal-hab'hemah asher hiv maf'reset par'sah v'shesa'  eynenah shosa'at v'gerah eynenah ma'alah t'meiym hem lakhem kal-hanoge'a bahem yit'ma
translation: every animal that has true hoofs but without clefts through the hoofs, or that does not chew the cud. They are unclean for you; whoever touches them shall be unclean.

hebrew: וְכֹ֣ל ׀ הוֹלֵ֣ךְ עַל־כַּפָּ֗יו בְּכָל־הַֽחַיָּה֙ הַהֹלֶ֣כֶת עַל־אַרְבַּ֔ע טְמֵאִ֥ים הֵ֖ם לָכֶ֑ם כָּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בְּנִבְלָתָ֖ם יִטְמָ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'khol  hvolekh' 'al-kapayv b'khal-hachayah haholekhet 'al-ar'ba' t'meiym hem lakhem kal-hanoge'a b'niv'latam yit'ma 'ad-ha'arev
translation: Also all animals that walk on paws, among those that walk on fours, are unclean for you; whoever touches their carcasses shall be unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְהַנֹּשֵׂא֙ אֶת־נִבְלָתָ֔ם יְכַבֵּ֥ס בְּגָדָ֖יו וְטָמֵ֣א עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב טְמֵאִ֥ים הֵ֖מָּה לָכֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hanose et-niv'latam y'khabes b'gadayv v'tame 'ad-ha'arev t'meiym hemah lakhem (s)
translation: And anyone who carries their carcasses shall wash his clothes and remain unclean until evening. They are unclean for you.

hebrew: וְזֶ֤ה לָכֶם֙ הַטָּמֵ֔א בַּשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵ֣ץ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ הַחֹ֥לֶד וְהָעַכְבָּ֖ר וְהַצָּ֥ב לְמִינֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: v'zeh lakhem hatame basheretz hashoretz 'al-haaretz hacholed v'ha'akh'bar v'hatzav l'miynehv
translation: The followingbA number of these cannot be identified with certainty. shall be unclean for you from among the things that swarm on the earth: the mole, the mouse, and great lizards of every variety;

hebrew: וְהָאֲנָקָ֥ה וְהַכֹּ֖חַ וְהַלְּטָאָ֑ה וְהַחֹ֖מֶט וְהַתִּנְשָֽׁמֶת׃
transliteration: v'haanakah v'hakocha v'hal'taah v'hachomet v'hatin'shamet
translation: the gecko, the land crocodile, the lizard, the sand lizard, and the chameleon.

hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה הַטְּמֵאִ֥ים לָכֶ֖ם בְּכָל־הַשָּׁ֑רֶץ כָּל־הַנֹּגֵ֧עַ בָּהֶ֛ם בְּמֹתָ֖ם יִטְמָ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: eleh hat'meiym lakhem b'khal-hasharetz kal-hanoge'a bahem b'motam yit'ma 'ad-ha'arev
translation: Those are for you the unclean among all the swarming things; whoever touches them when they are dead shall be unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְכֹ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־יִפֹּל־עָלָיו֩ מֵהֶ֨ם ׀ בְּמֹתָ֜ם יִטְמָ֗א מִכָּל־כְּלִי־עֵץ֙ א֣וֹ בֶ֤גֶד אוֹ־עוֹר֙ א֣וֹ שָׂ֔ק כָּל־כְּלִ֕י אֲשֶׁר־יֵעָשֶׂ֥ה מְלָאכָ֖ה בָּהֶ֑ם בַּמַּ֧יִם יוּבָ֛א וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעֶ֖רֶב וְטָהֵֽר׃
transliteration: v'khol asher-yipol-'alayv mehem  b'motam yit'ma mikal-k'liy-'etz vo veged vo-'vor vo sak kal-k'liy asher-ye'aseh m'lakhah bahem bamayim yvva v'tame 'ad-ha'erev v'taher
translation: And anything on which one of them falls when dead shall be unclean: be it any article of wood, or a cloth, or a skin, or a sack—any such article that can be put to use shall be dipped in water, and it shall remain unclean until evening; then it shall be clean.

hebrew: וְכָל־כְּלִי־חֶ֔רֶשׂ אֲשֶׁר־יִפֹּ֥ל מֵהֶ֖ם אֶל־תּוֹכ֑וֹ כֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁ֧ר בְּתוֹכ֛וֹ יִטְמָ֖א וְאֹת֥וֹ תִשְׁבֹּֽרוּ׃
transliteration: v'khal-k'liy-cheres asher-yipol mehem el-tvokhvo kol asher b'tvokhvo yit'ma v'otvo tish'borv
translation: And if any of those falls into an earthen vessel, everything inside it shall be unclean and [the vessel] itself you shall break.

hebrew: מִכָּל־הָאֹ֜כֶל אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵאָכֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָב֥וֹא עָלָ֛יו מַ֖יִם יִטְמָ֑א וְכָל־מַשְׁקֶה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִשָּׁתֶ֔ה בְּכָל־כְּלִ֖י יִטְמָֽא׃
transliteration: mikal-haokhel asher yeakhel asher yavvo 'alayv mayim yit'ma v'khal-mash'keh asher yishateh b'khal-k'liy yit'ma
translation: As to any food that may be eaten, it shall become unclean if it came in contact with water;cI.e., if the food then came in contact with the carcass of any animal named in vv. 29–30. as to any liquid that may be drunk, it shall become unclean if it was inside any vessel.dI.e., a vessel that had become contaminated by such contact.

hebrew: וְ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁר־יִפֹּ֨ל מִנִּבְלָתָ֥ם ׀ עָלָיו֮ יִטְמָא֒ תַּנּ֧וּר וְכִירַ֛יִם יֻתָּ֖ץ טְמֵאִ֣ים הֵ֑ם וּטְמֵאִ֖ים יִהְי֥וּ לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'khol asher-yipol miniv'latam  'alayv yit'ma tanvr v'khiyrayim yutatz t'meiym hem vt'meiym yih'yv lakhem
translation: Everything on which the carcass of any of them falls shall be unclean: an oven or stove shall be smashed. They are unclean and unclean they shall remain for you.

hebrew: אַ֣ךְ מַעְיָ֥ן וּב֛וֹר מִקְוֵה־מַ֖יִם יִהְיֶ֣ה טָה֑וֹר וְנֹגֵ֥עַ בְּנִבְלָתָ֖ם יִטְמָֽא׃
transliteration: akh' ma'yan vvvor mik'veh-mayim yih'yeh tahvor v'noge'a b'niv'latam yit'ma
translation: However, a spring or cistern in which water is collected shall be clean, but whoever touches such a carcass in it shall be unclean.

hebrew: וְכִ֤י יִפֹּל֙ מִנִּבְלָתָ֔ם עַל־כָּל־זֶ֥רַע זֵר֖וּעַ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִזָּרֵ֑עַ טָה֖וֹר הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'khiy yipol miniv'latam 'al-kal-zera' zerv'a asher yizare'a tahvor hv
translation: If such a carcass falls upon seed grain that is to be sown, it is clean;

hebrew: וְכִ֤י יֻתַּן־מַ֙יִם֙ עַל־זֶ֔רַע וְנָפַ֥ל מִנִּבְלָתָ֖ם עָלָ֑יו טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khiy yutan-mayim 'al-zera' v'nafal miniv'latam 'alayv tame hv lakhem (s)
translation: but if water is put on the seed and any part of a carcass falls upon it, it shall be unclean for you.

hebrew: וְכִ֤י יָמוּת֙ מִן־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הִ֥יא לָכֶ֖ם לְאָכְלָ֑ה הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בְּנִבְלָתָ֖הּ יִטְמָ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'khiy yamvt min-hab'hemah asher-hiy lakhem l'akh'lah hanoge'a b'niv'latah yit'ma 'ad-ha'arev
translation: If an animal that you may eat has died, anyone who touches its carcass shall be unclean until evening;

hebrew: וְהָֽאֹכֵל֙ מִנִּבְלָתָ֔הּ יְכַבֵּ֥ס בְּגָדָ֖יו וְטָמֵ֣א עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב וְהַנֹּשֵׂא֙ אֶת־נִבְלָתָ֔הּ יְכַבֵּ֥ס בְּגָדָ֖יו וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'haokhel miniv'latah y'khabes b'gadayv v'tame 'ad-ha'arev v'hanose et-niv'latah y'khabes b'gadayv v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: anyone who eats of its carcass shall wash his clothes and remain unclean until evening; and anyone who carries its carcass shall wash his clothes and remain unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְכָל־הַשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵ֣ץ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ שֶׁ֥קֶץ ה֖וּא לֹ֥א יֵאָכֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'khal-hasheretz hashoretz 'al-haaretz sheketz hv lo yeakhel
translation: All the things that swarm upon the earth are an abomination; they shall not be eaten.

hebrew: כֹּל֩ הוֹלֵ֨ךְ עַל־גָּח֜וֹן וְכֹ֣ל ׀ הוֹלֵ֣ךְ עַל־אַרְבַּ֗ע עַ֚ד כָּל־מַרְבֵּ֣ה רַגְלַ֔יִם לְכָל־הַשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵ֣ץ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ לֹ֥א תֹאכְל֖וּם כִּי־שֶׁ֥קֶץ הֵֽם׃
transliteration: kol hvolekh' 'al-gachvon v'khol  hvolekh' 'al-ar'ba' 'ad kal-mar'beh rag'layim l'khal-hasheretz hashoretz 'al-haaretz lo tokh'lvm kiy-sheketz hem
translation: You shall not eat, among all things that swarm upon the earth, anything that crawls on its belly, or anything that walks on fours, or anything that has many legs; for they are an abomination.

hebrew: אַל־תְּשַׁקְּצוּ֙ אֶת־נַפְשֹׁ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכָל־הַשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵ֑ץ וְלֹ֤א תִֽטַּמְּאוּ֙ בָּהֶ֔ם וְנִטְמֵתֶ֖ם בָּֽם׃
transliteration: al-t'shak'tzv et-naf'shoteykhem b'khal-hasheretz hashoretz v'lo titam'v bahem v'nit'metem bam
translation: You shall not draw abomination upon yourselves through anything that swarms; you shall not make yourselves unclean therewith and thus become unclean.

hebrew: כִּ֣י אֲנִ֣י יְהוָה֮ אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֒ וְהִתְקַדִּשְׁתֶּם֙ וִהְיִיתֶ֣ם קְדֹשִׁ֔ים כִּ֥י קָד֖וֹשׁ אָ֑נִי וְלֹ֤א תְטַמְּאוּ֙ אֶת־נַפְשֹׁ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכָל־הַשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הָרֹמֵ֥שׂ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: kiy aniy y'hvah eloheykhem v'hit'kadish'tem vih'yiytem k'doshiym kiy kadvosh aniy v'lo t'tam'v et-naf'shoteykhem b'khal-hasheretz haromes 'al-haaretz
translation: For I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God: you shall sanctify yourselves and be holy, for I am holy. You shall not make yourselves unclean through any swarming thing that moves upon the earth.

hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֗ה הַֽמַּעֲלֶ֤ה אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לִהְיֹ֥ת לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִ֑ים וִהְיִיתֶ֣ם קְדֹשִׁ֔ים כִּ֥י קָד֖וֹשׁ אָֽנִי׃
transliteration: kiy  aniy y'hvah hama'aleh et'khem meeretz mitz'rayim lih'yot lakhem lelohiym vih'yiytem k'doshiym kiy kadvosh aniy
translation: For I the L<small>ORD</small> am He who brought you up from the land of Egypt to be your God: you shall be holy, for I am holy.
