hebrew: זֹ֣את תּוֹרַ֤ת הַבְּהֵמָה֙ וְהָע֔וֹף וְכֹל֙ נֶ֣פֶשׁ הַֽחַיָּ֔ה הָרֹמֶ֖שֶׂת בַּמָּ֑יִם וּלְכָל־נֶ֖פֶשׁ הַשֹּׁרֶ֥צֶת עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: zot tvorat hab'hemah v'ha'vof v'khol nefesh hachayah haromeset bamayim vl'khal-nefesh hashoretzet 'al-haaretz
translation: These are the instructions concerning animals, birds, all living creatures that move in water, and all creatures that swarm on earth,

hebrew: לְהַבְדִּ֕יל בֵּ֥ין הַטָּמֵ֖א וּבֵ֣ין הַטָּהֹ֑ר וּבֵ֤ין הַֽחַיָּה֙ הַֽנֶּאֱכֶ֔לֶת וּבֵין֙ הַֽחַיָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר לֹ֥א תֵאָכֵֽל׃ (פ)
transliteration: l'hav'diyl beyn hatame vveyn hatahor vveyn hachayah haneekhelet vveyn hachayah asher lo teakhel (f)
translation: for distinguishing between the unclean and the clean, between the living things that may be eaten and the living things that may not be eaten.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אִשָּׁה֙ כִּ֣י תַזְרִ֔יעַ וְיָלְדָ֖ה זָכָ֑ר וְטָֽמְאָה֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים כִּימֵ֛י נִדַּ֥ת דְּוֺתָ֖הּ תִּטְמָֽא׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael lemor ishah kiy taz'riy'a v'yal'dah zakhar v'tam'ah shiv'at yamiym kiymey nidat d'votah tit'ma
translation: Speak to the Israelite people thus: When a woman at childbirthaHeb. tazria‘, lit. “brings forth seed.” bears a male, she shall be unclean seven days; she shall be unclean as at the time of her menstrual infirmity.—

hebrew: וּבַיּ֖וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֑י יִמּ֖וֹל בְּשַׂ֥ר עָרְלָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vvayvom hash'miyniy yimvol b'sar 'ar'latvo
translation: On the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.—

hebrew: וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים יוֹם֙ וּשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים תֵּשֵׁ֖ב בִּדְמֵ֣י טָהֳרָ֑ה בְּכָל־קֹ֣דֶשׁ לֹֽא־תִגָּ֗ע וְאֶל־הַמִּקְדָּשׁ֙ לֹ֣א תָבֹ֔א עַד־מְלֹ֖את יְמֵ֥י טָהֳרָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vsh'loshiym yvom vsh'loshet yamiym teshev bid'mey tahorah b'khal-kodesh lo-tiga' v'el-hamik'dash lo tavo 'ad-m'lot y'mey tahorah
translation: She shall remain in a state of blood purificationbMeaning of Heb. uncertain. for thirty-three days: she shall not touch any consecrated thing, nor enter the sanctuary until her period of purification is completed.

hebrew: וְאִם־נְקֵבָ֣ה תֵלֵ֔ד וְטָמְאָ֥ה שְׁבֻעַ֖יִם כְּנִדָּתָ֑הּ וְשִׁשִּׁ֥ים יוֹם֙ וְשֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים תֵּשֵׁ֖ב עַל־דְּמֵ֥י טָהֳרָֽה׃
transliteration: v'im-n'kevah teled v'tam'ah sh'vu'ayim k'nidatah v'shishiym yvom v'sheshet yamiym teshev 'al-d'mey tahorah
translation: If she bears a female, she shall be unclean two weeks as during her menstruation, and she shall remain in a state of blood purificationbMeaning of Heb. uncertain. for sixty-six days.

hebrew: וּבִמְלֹ֣את ׀ יְמֵ֣י טָהֳרָ֗הּ לְבֵן֮ א֣וֹ לְבַת֒ תָּבִ֞יא כֶּ֤בֶשׂ בֶּן־שְׁנָתוֹ֙ לְעֹלָ֔ה וּבֶן־יוֹנָ֥ה אוֹ־תֹ֖ר לְחַטָּ֑את אֶל־פֶּ֥תַח אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: vvim'lot  y'mey tahorah l'ven vo l'vat taviy keves ben-sh'natvo l'olah vven-yvonah vo-tor l'chatat el-petach ohel-mvo'ed el-hakohen
translation: On the completion of her period of purification, for either son or daughter, she shall bring to the priest, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, a lamb in its first year for a burnt offering, and a pigeon or a turtledove for a sin offering.cSee note at 4.3.

hebrew: וְהִקְרִיב֞וֹ לִפְנֵ֤י יְהוָה֙ וְכִפֶּ֣ר עָלֶ֔יהָ וְטָהֲרָ֖ה מִמְּקֹ֣ר דָּמֶ֑יהָ זֹ֤את תּוֹרַת֙ הַיֹּלֶ֔דֶת לַזָּכָ֖ר א֥וֹ לַנְּקֵבָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyvvo lif'ney y'hvah v'khiper 'aleyha v'taharah mim'kor dameyha zot tvorat hayoledet lazakhar vo lan'kevah
translation: He shall offer it before the L<small>ORD</small> and make expiation on her behalf; she shall then be clean from her flow of blood. Such are the rituals concerning her who bears a child, male or female.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֨א תִמְצָ֣א יָדָהּ֮ דֵּ֣י שֶׂה֒ וְלָקְחָ֣ה שְׁתֵּֽי־תֹרִ֗ים א֤וֹ שְׁנֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יוֹנָ֔ה אֶחָ֥ד לְעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶחָ֣ד לְחַטָּ֑את וְכִפֶּ֥ר עָלֶ֛יהָ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן וְטָהֵֽרָה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'im-lo tim'tza yadah dey seh v'lak'chah sh'tey-toriym vo sh'ney b'ney yvonah echad l'olah v'echad l'chatat v'khiper 'aleyha hakohen v'taherah (f)
translation: If, however, her means do not suffice for a sheep, she shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons, one for a burnt offering and the other for a sin offering. The priest shall make expiation on her behalf, and she shall be clean.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

hebrew: אָדָ֗ם כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֤ה בְעוֹר־בְּשָׂרוֹ֙ שְׂאֵ֤ת אֽוֹ־סַפַּ֙חַת֙ א֣וֹ בַהֶ֔רֶת וְהָיָ֥ה בְעוֹר־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ לְנֶ֣גַע צָרָ֑עַת וְהוּבָא֙ אֶל־אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן א֛וֹ אֶל־אַחַ֥ד מִבָּנָ֖יו הַכֹּהֲנִֽים׃
transliteration: adam kiy-yih'yeh v'vor-b'sarvo s'et vo-sapachat vo vaheret v'hayah v'vor-b'sarvo l'nega' tzara'at v'hvva el-aharon hakohen vo el-achad mibanayv hakohaniym
translation: When a person has on the skin of his body a swelling, a rash, or a discoloration, and it develops into a scaly affection on the skin of his body, it shall be reportedaOr “he shall be brought.” to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons, the priests.

hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֣ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֣גַע בְּעֽוֹר־הַ֠בָּשָׂר וְשֵׂעָ֨ר בַּנֶּ֜גַע הָפַ֣ךְ ׀ לָבָ֗ן וּמַרְאֵ֤ה הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ עָמֹק֙ מֵע֣וֹר בְּשָׂר֔וֹ נֶ֥גַע צָרַ֖עַת ה֑וּא וְרָאָ֥הוּ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן וְטִמֵּ֥א אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'raah hakohen et-hanega' b'vor-habasar v'se'ar banega' hafakh'  lavan vmar'eh hanega' 'amok me'vor b'sarvo nega' tzara'at hv v'raahv hakohen v'time otvo
translation: The priest shall examine the affection on the skin of his body: if hair in the affected patch has turned white and the affection appears to be deeper than the skin of his body, it is a leprous affection;bHeb. ṣara‘ath is used for a variety of diseases. Where a human being is declared unclean by reason of ṣara‘ath, the traditional translation “leprosy” has been retained without regard to modern medical terminology. when the priest sees it, he shall pronounce him unclean.

hebrew: וְאִם־בַּהֶרֶת֩ לְבָנָ֨ה הִ֜וא בְּע֣וֹר בְּשָׂר֗וֹ וְעָמֹק֙ אֵין־מַרְאֶ֣הָ מִן־הָע֔וֹר וּשְׂעָרָ֖ה לֹא־הָפַ֣ךְ לָבָ֑ן וְהִסְגִּ֧יר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֖גַע שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'im-baheret l'vanah hiv b'vor b'sarvo v'amok eyn-mar'eha min-ha'vor vs'arah lo-hafakh' lavan v'his'giyr hakohen et-hanega' shiv'at yamiym
translation: But if it is a white discoloration on the skin of his body which does not appear to be deeper than the skin and the hair in it has not turned white, the priest shall isolate the affected person for seven days.

hebrew: וְרָאָ֣הוּ הַכֹּהֵן֮ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי֒ וְהִנֵּ֤ה הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ עָמַ֣ד בְּעֵינָ֔יו לֹֽא־פָשָׂ֥ה הַנֶּ֖גַע בָּע֑וֹר וְהִסְגִּיר֧וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֛ן שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים שֵׁנִֽית׃
transliteration: v'raahv hakohen bayvom hash'viy'iy v'hineh hanega' 'amad b'eynayv lo-fasah hanega' ba'vor v'his'giyrvo hakohen shiv'at yamiym sheniyt
translation: On the seventh day the priest shall examine him, and if the affection has remained unchanged in color and the disease has not spread on the skin, the priest shall isolate him for another seven days.

hebrew: וְרָאָה֩ הַכֹּהֵ֨ן אֹת֜וֹ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי֮ שֵׁנִית֒ וְהִנֵּה֙ כֵּהָ֣ה הַנֶּ֔גַע וְלֹא־פָשָׂ֥ה הַנֶּ֖גַע בָּע֑וֹר וְטִהֲר֤וֹ הַכֹּהֵן֙ מִסְפַּ֣חַת הִ֔יא וְכִבֶּ֥ס בְּגָדָ֖יו וְטָהֵֽר׃
transliteration: v'raah hakohen otvo bayvom hash'viy'iy sheniyt v'hineh kehah hanega' v'lo-fasah hanega' ba'vor v'tiharvo hakohen mis'pachat hiy v'khibes b'gadayv v'taher
translation: On the seventh day the priest shall examine him again: if the affection has faded and has not spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean. It is a rash; he shall wash his clothes, and he shall be clean.

hebrew: וְאִם־פָּשֹׂ֨ה תִפְשֶׂ֤ה הַמִּסְפַּ֙חַת֙ בָּע֔וֹר אַחֲרֵ֧י הֵרָאֹת֛וֹ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לְטָהֳרָת֑וֹ וְנִרְאָ֥ה שֵׁנִ֖ית אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'im-pasoh tif'seh hamis'pachat ba'vor acharey heraotvo el-hakohen l'tahoratvo v'nir'ah sheniyt el-hakohen
translation: But if the rash should spread on the skin after he has presented himself to the priest and been pronounced clean, he shall present himself again to the priest.

hebrew: וְרָאָה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהִנֵּ֛ה פָּשְׂתָ֥ה הַמִּסְפַּ֖חַת בָּע֑וֹר וְטִמְּא֥וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן צָרַ֥עַת הִֽוא׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'raah hakohen v'hineh pas'tah hamis'pachat ba'vor v'tim'vo hakohen tzara'at hiv (f)
translation: And if the priest sees that the rash has spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is leprosy.

hebrew: נֶ֣גַע צָרַ֔עַת כִּ֥י תִהְיֶ֖ה בְּאָדָ֑ם וְהוּבָ֖א אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: nega' tzara'at kiy tih'yeh b'adam v'hvva el-hakohen
translation: When a person has a scaly affection, it shall be reportedcSee note a at 13.2. to the priest.

hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה שְׂאֵת־לְבָנָה֙ בָּע֔וֹר וְהִ֕יא הָפְכָ֖ה שֵׂעָ֣ר לָבָ֑ן וּמִֽחְיַ֛ת בָּשָׂ֥ר חַ֖י בַּשְׂאֵֽת׃
transliteration: v'raah hakohen v'hineh s'et-l'vanah ba'vor v'hiy haf'khah se'ar lavan vmich'yat basar chay bas'et
translation: If the priest finds on the skin a white swelling which has turned some hair white, with dOthers “quick raw flesh.”a patch of undiscolored flesh-d in the swelling,

hebrew: צָרַ֨עַת נוֹשֶׁ֤נֶת הִוא֙ בְּע֣וֹר בְּשָׂר֔וֹ וְטִמְּא֖וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֑ן לֹ֣א יַסְגִּרֶ֔נּוּ כִּ֥י טָמֵ֖א הֽוּא׃
transliteration: tzara'at nvoshenet hiv b'vor b'sarvo v'tim'vo hakohen lo yas'girenv kiy tame hv
translation: it is chronic leprosy on the skin of his body, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean; he need not isolate him, for he is unclean.

hebrew: וְאִם־פָּר֨וֹחַ תִּפְרַ֤ח הַצָּרַ֙עַת֙ בָּע֔וֹר וְכִסְּתָ֣ה הַצָּרַ֗עַת אֵ֚ת כָּל־ע֣וֹר הַנֶּ֔גַע מֵרֹאשׁ֖וֹ וְעַד־רַגְלָ֑יו לְכָל־מַרְאֵ֖ה עֵינֵ֥י הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'im-parvocha tif'rach hatzara'at ba'vor v'khis'tah hatzara'at et kal-'vor hanega' meroshvo v'ad-rag'layv l'khal-mar'eh 'eyney hakohen
translation: If the eruption spreads out over the skin so that it covers all the skin of the affected person from head to foot, wherever the priest can see—

hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֨ה כִסְּתָ֤ה הַצָּרַ֙עַת֙ אֶת־כָּל־בְּשָׂר֔וֹ וְטִהַ֖ר אֶת־הַנָּ֑גַע כֻּלּ֛וֹ הָפַ֥ךְ לָבָ֖ן טָה֥וֹר הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'raah hakohen v'hineh khis'tah hatzara'at et-kal-b'sarvo v'tihar et-hanaga' kulvo hafakh' lavan tahvor hv
translation: if the priest sees that the eruption has covered the whole body—he shall pronounce the affected person clean; he is clean, for he has turned all white.

hebrew: וּבְי֨וֹם הֵרָא֥וֹת בּ֛וֹ בָּשָׂ֥ר חַ֖י יִטְמָֽא׃
transliteration: vv'yvom heravot bvo basar chay yit'ma
translation: But as soon as undiscolored flesh appears in it, he shall be unclean;

hebrew: וְרָאָ֧ה הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־הַבָּשָׂ֥ר הַחַ֖י וְטִמְּא֑וֹ הַבָּשָׂ֥ר הַחַ֛י טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא צָרַ֥עַת הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'raah hakohen et-habasar hachay v'tim'vo habasar hachay tame hv tzara'at hv
translation: when the priest sees the undiscolored flesh, he shall pronounce him unclean. The undiscolored flesh is unclean; it is leprosy.

hebrew: א֣וֹ כִ֥י יָשׁ֛וּב הַבָּשָׂ֥ר הַחַ֖י וְנֶהְפַּ֣ךְ לְלָבָ֑ן וּבָ֖א אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: vo khiy yashvv habasar hachay v'neh'pakh' l'lavan vva el-hakohen
translation: But if the undiscolored flesh again turns white, he shall come to the priest,

hebrew: וְרָאָ֙הוּ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהִנֵּ֛ה נֶהְפַּ֥ךְ הַנֶּ֖גַע לְלָבָ֑ן וְטִהַ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֖גַע טָה֥וֹר הֽוּא׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'raahv hakohen v'hineh neh'pakh' hanega' l'lavan v'tihar hakohen et-hanega' tahvor hv (f)
translation: and the priest shall examine him: if the affection has turned white, the priest shall pronounce the affected person clean; he is clean.

hebrew: וּבָשָׂ֕ר כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה בֽוֹ־בְעֹר֖וֹ שְׁחִ֑ין וְנִרְפָּֽא׃
transliteration: vvasar kiy-yih'yeh vvo-v'orvo sh'chiyn v'nir'pa
translation: When an inflammation appears on the skin of one’s body and it heals,

hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה בִּמְק֤וֹם הַשְּׁחִין֙ שְׂאֵ֣ת לְבָנָ֔ה א֥וֹ בַהֶ֖רֶת לְבָנָ֣ה אֲדַמְדָּ֑מֶת וְנִרְאָ֖ה אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'hayah bim'kvom hash'chiyn s'et l'vanah vo vaheret l'vanah adam'damet v'nir'ah el-hakohen
translation: and a white swelling or a white discoloration streaked with red develops where the inflammation was, he shall present himself to the priest.

hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה מַרְאֶ֙הָ֙ שָׁפָ֣ל מִן־הָע֔וֹר וּשְׂעָרָ֖הּ הָפַ֣ךְ לָבָ֑ן וְטִמְּא֧וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֛ן נֶֽגַע־צָרַ֥עַת הִ֖וא בַּשְּׁחִ֥ין פָּרָֽחָה׃
transliteration: v'raah hakohen v'hineh mar'eha shafal min-ha'vor vs'arah hafakh' lavan v'tim'vo hakohen nega'-tzara'at hiv bash'chiyn parachah
translation: If the priest finds that it appears lower than the rest of the skin and that the hair in it has turned white, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a leprous affection that has broken out in the inflammation.

hebrew: וְאִ֣ם ׀ יִרְאֶ֣נָּה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֵֽין־בָּהּ֙ שֵׂעָ֣ר לָבָ֔ן וּשְׁפָלָ֥ה אֵינֶ֛נָּה מִן־הָע֖וֹר וְהִ֣יא כֵהָ֑ה וְהִסְגִּיר֥וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'im  yir'enah hakohen v'hineh eyn-bah se'ar lavan vsh'falah eynenah min-ha'vor v'hiy khehah v'his'giyrvo hakohen shiv'at yamiym
translation: But if the priest finds that there is no white hair in it and it is not lower than the rest of the skin, and it is faded, the priest shall isolate him for seven days.

hebrew: וְאִם־פָּשֹׂ֥ה תִפְשֶׂ֖ה בָּע֑וֹר וְטִמֵּ֧א הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֹת֖וֹ נֶ֥גַע הִֽוא׃
transliteration: v'im-pasoh tif'seh ba'vor v'time hakohen otvo nega' hiv
translation: If it should spread in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is an affection.

hebrew: וְאִם־תַּחְתֶּ֜יהָ תַּעֲמֹ֤ד הַבַּהֶ֙רֶת֙ לֹ֣א פָשָׂ֔תָה צָרֶ֥בֶת הַשְּׁחִ֖ין הִ֑וא וְטִהֲר֖וֹ הַכֹּהֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'im-tach'teyha ta'amod habaheret lo fasatah tzarevet hash'chiyn hiv v'tiharvo hakohen (s)
translation: But if the discoloration remains stationary, not having spread, it is the scar of the inflammation; the priest shall pronounce him clean.

hebrew: א֣וֹ בָשָׂ֔ר כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה בְעֹר֖וֹ מִכְוַת־אֵ֑שׁ וְֽהָיְתָ֞ה מִֽחְיַ֣ת הַמִּכְוָ֗ה בַּהֶ֛רֶת לְבָנָ֥ה אֲדַמְדֶּ֖מֶת א֥וֹ לְבָנָֽה׃
transliteration: vo vasar kiy-yih'yeh v'orvo mikh'vat-esh v'hay'tah mich'yat hamikh'vah baheret l'vanah adam'demet vo l'vanah
translation: When the skin of one’s body sustains a burn by fire, and the patch from the burn is a discoloration, either white streaked with red, or white,

hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה אֹתָ֣הּ הַכֹּהֵ֡ן וְהִנֵּ֣ה נֶהְפַּךְ֩ שֵׂעָ֨ר לָבָ֜ן בַּבַּהֶ֗רֶת וּמַרְאֶ֙הָ֙ עָמֹ֣ק מִן־הָע֔וֹר צָרַ֣עַת הִ֔וא בַּמִּכְוָ֖ה פָּרָ֑חָה וְטִמֵּ֤א אֹתוֹ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן נֶ֥גַע צָרַ֖עַת הִֽוא׃
transliteration: v'raah otah hakohen v'hineh neh'pakh' se'ar lavan babaheret vmar'eha 'amok min-ha'vor tzara'at hiv bamikh'vah parachah v'time otvo hakohen nega' tzara'at hiv
translation: the priest shall examine it. If some hair has turned white in the discoloration, which itself appears to go deeper than the skin, it is leprosy that has broken out in the burn. The priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a leprous affection.

hebrew: וְאִ֣ם ׀ יִרְאֶ֣נָּה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֵֽין־בַּבֶּהֶ֙רֶת֙ שֵׂעָ֣ר לָבָ֔ן וּשְׁפָלָ֥ה אֵינֶ֛נָּה מִן־הָע֖וֹר וְהִ֣וא כֵהָ֑ה וְהִסְגִּיר֥וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'im  yir'enah hakohen v'hineh eyn-babeheret se'ar lavan vsh'falah eynenah min-ha'vor v'hiv khehah v'his'giyrvo hakohen shiv'at yamiym
translation: But if the priest finds that there is no white hair in the discoloration, and that it is not lower than the rest of the skin, and it is faded, the priest shall isolate him for seven days.

hebrew: וְרָאָ֥הוּ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֑י אִם־פָּשֹׂ֤ה תִפְשֶׂה֙ בָּע֔וֹר וְטִמֵּ֤א הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֹת֔וֹ נֶ֥גַע צָרַ֖עַת הִֽוא׃
transliteration: v'raahv hakohen bayvom hash'viy'iy im-pasoh tif'seh ba'vor v'time hakohen otvo nega' tzara'at hiv
translation: On the seventh day the priest shall examine him: if it has spread in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a leprous affection.

hebrew: וְאִם־תַּחְתֶּיהָ֩ תַעֲמֹ֨ד הַבַּהֶ֜רֶת לֹא־פָשְׂתָ֤ה בָעוֹר֙ וְהִ֣וא כֵהָ֔ה שְׂאֵ֥ת הַמִּכְוָ֖ה הִ֑וא וְטִֽהֲרוֹ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן כִּֽי־צָרֶ֥בֶת הַמִּכְוָ֖ה הִֽוא׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'im-tach'teyha ta'amod habaheret lo-fas'tah va'vor v'hiv khehah s'et hamikh'vah hiv v'tiharvo hakohen kiy-tzarevet hamikh'vah hiv (f)
translation: But if the discoloration has remained stationary, not having spread on the skin, and it is faded, it is the swelling from the burn. The priest shall pronounce him clean, for it is the scar of the burn.

hebrew: וְאִישׁ֙ א֣וֹ אִשָּׁ֔ה כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה ב֖וֹ נָ֑גַע בְּרֹ֖אשׁ א֥וֹ בְזָקָֽן׃
transliteration: v'iysh vo ishah kiy-yih'yeh vvo naga' b'rosh vo v'zakan
translation: If a man or a woman has an affection on the head or in the beard,

hebrew: וְרָאָ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֗גַע וְהִנֵּ֤ה מַרְאֵ֙הוּ֙ עָמֹ֣ק מִן־הָע֔וֹר וּב֛וֹ שֵׂעָ֥ר צָהֹ֖ב דָּ֑ק וְטִמֵּ֨א אֹת֤וֹ הַכֹּהֵן֙ נֶ֣תֶק ה֔וּא צָרַ֧עַת הָרֹ֛אשׁ א֥וֹ הַזָּקָ֖ן הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'raah hakohen et-hanega' v'hineh mar'ehv 'amok min-ha'vor vvvo se'ar tzahov dak v'time otvo hakohen netek hv tzara'at harosh vo hazakan hv
translation: the priest shall examine the affection. If it appears to go deeper than the skin and there is thin yellow hair in it, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a scall, a scaly eruption in the hair or beard.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִרְאֶ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־נֶ֣גַע הַנֶּ֗תֶק וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֵין־מַרְאֵ֙הוּ֙ עָמֹ֣ק מִן־הָע֔וֹר וְשֵׂעָ֥ר שָׁחֹ֖ר אֵ֣ין בּ֑וֹ וְהִסְגִּ֧יר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־נֶ֥גַע הַנֶּ֖תֶק שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yir'eh hakohen et-nega' hanetek v'hineh eyn-mar'ehv 'amok min-ha'vor v'se'ar shachor eyn bvo v'his'giyr hakohen et-nega' hanetek shiv'at yamiym
translation: But if the priest finds that the scall affection does not appear to go deeper than the skin, yet there is no black hair in it, the priest shall isolate the person with the scall affection for seven days.

hebrew: וְרָאָ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֣ן אֶת־הַנֶּגַע֮ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי֒ וְהִנֵּה֙ לֹא־פָשָׂ֣ה הַנֶּ֔תֶק וְלֹא־הָ֥יָה ב֖וֹ שֵׂעָ֣ר צָהֹ֑ב וּמַרְאֵ֣ה הַנֶּ֔תֶק אֵ֥ין עָמֹ֖ק מִן־הָעֽוֹר׃
transliteration: v'raah hakohen et-hanega' bayvom hash'viy'iy v'hineh lo-fasah hanetek v'lo-hayah vvo se'ar tzahov vmar'eh hanetek eyn 'amok min-ha'vor
translation: On the seventh day the priest shall examine the affection. If the scall has not spread and no yellow hair has appeared in it, and the scall does not appear to go deeper than the skin,

hebrew: וְהִ֨תְגַּלָּ֔ח וְאֶת־הַנֶּ֖תֶק לֹ֣א יְגַלֵּ֑חַ וְהִסְגִּ֨יר הַכֹּהֵ֧ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֛תֶק שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים שֵׁנִֽית׃
transliteration: v'hit'galach v'et-hanetek lo y'galecha v'his'giyr hakohen et-hanetek shiv'at yamiym sheniyt
translation: the person with the scall shall shave himself, but without shaving the scall; the priest shall isolate him for another seven days.

hebrew: וְרָאָה֩ הַכֹּהֵ֨ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֜תֶק בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י וְ֠הִנֵּה לֹא־פָשָׂ֤ה הַנֶּ֙תֶק֙ בָּע֔וֹר וּמַרְאֵ֕הוּ אֵינֶ֥נּוּ עָמֹ֖ק מִן־הָע֑וֹר וְטִהַ֤ר אֹתוֹ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְכִבֶּ֥ס בְּגָדָ֖יו וְטָהֵֽר׃
transliteration: v'raah hakohen et-hanetek bayvom hash'viy'iy v'hineh lo-fasah hanetek ba'vor vmar'ehv eynenv 'amok min-ha'vor v'tihar otvo hakohen v'khibes b'gadayv v'taher
translation: On the seventh day the priest shall examine the scall. If the scall has not spread on the skin, and does not appear to go deeper than the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean; he shall wash his clothes, and he shall be clean.

hebrew: וְאִם־פָּשֹׂ֥ה יִפְשֶׂ֛ה הַנֶּ֖תֶק בָּע֑וֹר אַחֲרֵ֖י טָהֳרָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im-pasoh yif'seh hanetek ba'vor acharey tahoratvo
translation: If, however, the scall should spread on the skin after he has been pronounced clean,

hebrew: וְרָאָ֙הוּ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהִנֵּ֛ה פָּשָׂ֥ה הַנֶּ֖תֶק בָּע֑וֹר לֹֽא־יְבַקֵּ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן לַשֵּׂעָ֥ר הַצָּהֹ֖ב טָמֵ֥א הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'raahv hakohen v'hineh pasah hanetek ba'vor lo-y'vaker hakohen lase'ar hatzahov tame hv
translation: the priest shall examine him. If the scall has spread on the skin, the priest need not look for yellow hair: he is unclean.

hebrew: וְאִם־בְּעֵינָיו֩ עָמַ֨ד הַנֶּ֜תֶק וְשֵׂעָ֨ר שָׁחֹ֧ר צָֽמַח־בּ֛וֹ נִרְפָּ֥א הַנֶּ֖תֶק טָה֣וֹר ה֑וּא וְטִהֲר֖וֹ הַכֹּהֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'im-b'eynayv 'amad hanetek v'se'ar shachor tzamach-bvo nir'pa hanetek tahvor hv v'tiharvo hakohen (s)
translation: But if the scall has remained unchanged in color, and black hair has grown in it, the scall is healed; he is clean. The priest shall pronounce him clean.

hebrew: וְאִישׁ֙ אֽוֹ־אִשָּׁ֔ה כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה בְעוֹר־בְּשָׂרָ֖ם בֶּהָרֹ֑ת בֶּהָרֹ֖ת לְבָנֹֽת׃
transliteration: v'iysh vo-ishah kiy-yih'yeh v'vor-b'saram beharot beharot l'vanot
translation: If a man or a woman has the skin of the body streaked with white discolorations,

hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֧ה בְעוֹר־בְּשָׂרָ֛ם בֶּהָרֹ֖ת כֵּה֣וֹת לְבָנֹ֑ת בֹּ֥הַק ה֛וּא פָּרַ֥ח בָּע֖וֹר טָה֥וֹר הֽוּא׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'raah hakohen v'hineh v'vor-b'saram beharot kehvot l'vanot bohak hv parach ba'vor tahvor hv (s)
translation: and the priest sees that the discolorations on the skin of the body are of a dull white, it is a tetter broken out on the skin; he is clean.

hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ כִּ֥י יִמָּרֵ֖ט רֹאשׁ֑וֹ קֵרֵ֥חַ ה֖וּא טָה֥וֹר הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'iysh kiy yimaret roshvo kerecha hv tahvor hv
translation: If a man loses the hair of his head and becomes bald, he is clean.

hebrew: וְאִם֙ מִפְּאַ֣ת פָּנָ֔יו יִמָּרֵ֖ט רֹאשׁ֑וֹ גִּבֵּ֥חַ ה֖וּא טָה֥וֹר הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'im mip'at panayv yimaret roshvo gibecha hv tahvor hv
translation: If he loses the hair on the front part of his head and becomes bald at the forehead, he is clean.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִהְיֶ֤ה בַקָּרַ֙חַת֙ א֣וֹ בַגַּבַּ֔חַת נֶ֖גַע לָבָ֣ן אֲדַמְדָּ֑ם צָרַ֤עַת פֹּרַ֙חַת֙ הִ֔וא בְּקָרַחְתּ֖וֹ א֥וֹ בְגַבַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yih'yeh vakarachat vo vagabachat nega' lavan adam'dam tzara'at porachat hiv b'karach'tvo vo v'gabach'tvo
translation: But if a white affection streaked with red appears on the bald part in the front or at the back of the head, it is a scaly eruption that is spreading over the bald part in the front or at the back of the head.

hebrew: וְרָאָ֨ה אֹת֜וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה שְׂאֵת־הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ לְבָנָ֣ה אֲדַמְדֶּ֔מֶת בְּקָרַחְתּ֖וֹ א֣וֹ בְגַבַּחְתּ֑וֹ כְּמַרְאֵ֥ה צָרַ֖עַת ע֥וֹר בָּשָֽׂר׃
transliteration: v'raah otvo hakohen v'hineh s'et-hanega' l'vanah adam'demet b'karach'tvo vo v'gabach'tvo k'mar'eh tzara'at 'vor basar
translation: The priest shall examine him: if the swollen affection on the bald part in the front or at the back of his head is white streaked with red, like the leprosy of body skin in appearance,

hebrew: אִישׁ־צָר֥וּעַ ה֖וּא טָמֵ֣א ה֑וּא טַמֵּ֧א יְטַמְּאֶ֛נּוּ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן בְּרֹאשׁ֥וֹ נִגְעֽוֹ׃
transliteration: iysh-tzarv'a hv tame hv tame y'tam'env hakohen b'roshvo nig'vo
translation: the man is leprous; he is unclean. The priest shall pronounce him unclean; he has the affection on his head.

hebrew: וְהַצָּר֜וּעַ אֲשֶׁר־בּ֣וֹ הַנֶּ֗גַע בְּגָדָ֞יו יִהְי֤וּ פְרֻמִים֙ וְרֹאשׁוֹ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה פָר֔וּעַ וְעַל־שָׂפָ֖ם יַעְטֶ֑ה וְטָמֵ֥א ׀ טָמֵ֖א יִקְרָֽא׃
transliteration: v'hatzarv'a asher-bvo hanega' b'gadayv yih'yv f'rumiym v'roshvo yih'yeh farv'a v'al-safam ya'teh v'tame  tame yik'ra
translation: As for the person with a leprous affection, his clothes shall be rent, his head shall be left bare,eSee note at 10.6. and he shall cover over his upper lip; and he shall call out, “Unclean! Unclean!”

hebrew: כָּל־יְמֵ֞י אֲשֶׁ֨ר הַנֶּ֥גַע בּ֛וֹ יִטְמָ֖א טָמֵ֣א ה֑וּא בָּדָ֣ד יֵשֵׁ֔ב מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה מוֹשָׁבֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kal-y'mey asher hanega' bvo yit'ma tame hv badad yeshev michvtz lamachaneh mvoshavvo (s)
translation: He shall be unclean as long as the disease is on him. Being unclean, he shall dwell apart; his dwelling shall be outside the camp.

hebrew: וְהַבֶּ֕גֶד כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה ב֖וֹ נֶ֣גַע צָרָ֑עַת בְּבֶ֣גֶד צֶ֔מֶר א֖וֹ בְּבֶ֥גֶד פִּשְׁתִּֽים׃
transliteration: v'habeged kiy-yih'yeh vvo nega' tzara'at b'veged tzemer vo b'veged pish'tiym
translation: When an eruptive affection occurs in a cloth of wool or linen fabric,

hebrew: א֤וֹ בִֽשְׁתִי֙ א֣וֹ בְעֵ֔רֶב לַפִּשְׁתִּ֖ים וְלַצָּ֑מֶר א֣וֹ בְע֔וֹר א֖וֹ בְּכָל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vo vish'tiy vo v'erev lapish'tiym v'latzamer vo v'vor vo b'khal-m'lekhet 'vor
translation: in the warp or in the woof of the linen or the wool, or in a skin or in anything made of skin;

hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה הַנֶּ֜גַע יְרַקְרַ֣ק ׀ א֣וֹ אֲדַמְדָּ֗ם בַּבֶּגֶד֩ א֨וֹ בָע֜וֹר אֽוֹ־בַשְּׁתִ֤י אוֹ־בָעֵ֙רֶב֙ א֣וֹ בְכָל־כְּלִי־ע֔וֹר נֶ֥גַע צָרַ֖עַת ה֑וּא וְהָרְאָ֖ה אֶת־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'hayah hanega' y'rak'rak  vo adam'dam babeged vo va'vor vo-vash'tiy vo-va'erev vo v'khal-k'liy-'vor nega' tzara'at hv v'har'ah et-hakohen
translation: if the affection in the cloth or the skin, in the warp or the woof, or in any article of skin, is streaky greenfOr “yellow.” or red, it is an eruptive affection. It shall be shown to the priest;

hebrew: וְרָאָ֥ה הַכֹּהֵ֖ן אֶת־הַנָּ֑גַע וְהִסְגִּ֥יר אֶת־הַנֶּ֖גַע שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'raah hakohen et-hanaga' v'his'giyr et-hanega' shiv'at yamiym
translation: and the priest, after examining the affection, shall isolate the affected article for seven days.

hebrew: וְרָאָ֨ה אֶת־הַנֶּ֜גַע בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י כִּֽי־פָשָׂ֤ה הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ בַּ֠בֶּגֶד אֽוֹ־בַשְּׁתִ֤י אֽוֹ־בָעֵ֙רֶב֙ א֣וֹ בָע֔וֹר לְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יֵעָשֶׂ֥ה הָע֖וֹר לִמְלָאכָ֑ה צָרַ֧עַת מַמְאֶ֛רֶת הַנֶּ֖גַע טָמֵ֥א הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'raah et-hanega' bayvom hash'viy'iy kiy-fasah hanega' babeged vo-vash'tiy vo-va'erev vo va'vor l'khol asher-ye'aseh ha'vor lim'lakhah tzara'at mam'eret hanega' tame hv
translation: On the seventh day he shall examine the affection: if the affection has spread in the cloth—whether in the warp or the woof, or in the skin, for whatever purpose the skin may be used—the affection is a malignant eruption; it is unclean.

hebrew: וְשָׂרַ֨ף אֶת־הַבֶּ֜גֶד א֥וֹ אֶֽת־הַשְּׁתִ֣י ׀ א֣וֹ אֶת־הָעֵ֗רֶב בַּצֶּ֙מֶר֙ א֣וֹ בַפִּשְׁתִּ֔ים א֚וֹ אֶת־כָּל־כְּלִ֣י הָע֔וֹר אֲשֶׁר־יִהְיֶ֥ה ב֖וֹ הַנָּ֑גַע כִּֽי־צָרַ֤עַת מַמְאֶ֙רֶת֙ הִ֔וא בָּאֵ֖שׁ תִּשָּׂרֵֽף׃
transliteration: v'saraf et-habeged vo et-hash'tiy  vo et-ha'erev batzemer vo vapish'tiym vo et-kal-k'liy ha'vor asher-yih'yeh vvo hanaga' kiy-tzara'at mam'eret hiv baesh tisaref
translation: The cloth—whether warp or woof in wool or linen, or any article of skin—in which the affection is found, shall be burned, for it is a malignant eruption; it shall be consumed in fire.

hebrew: וְאִם֮ יִרְאֶ֣ה הַכֹּהֵן֒ וְהִנֵּה֙ לֹא־פָשָׂ֣ה הַנֶּ֔גַע בַּבֶּ֕גֶד א֥וֹ בַשְּׁתִ֖י א֣וֹ בָעֵ֑רֶב א֖וֹ בְּכָל־כְּלִי־עֽוֹר׃
transliteration: v'im yir'eh hakohen v'hineh lo-fasah hanega' babeged vo vash'tiy vo va'erev vo b'khal-k'liy-'vor
translation: But if the priest sees that the affection in the cloth—whether in warp or in woof, or in any article of skin—has not spread,

hebrew: וְצִוָּה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְכִ֨בְּס֔וּ אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ הַנָּ֑גַע וְהִסְגִּיר֥וֹ שִׁבְעַת־יָמִ֖ים שֵׁנִֽית׃
transliteration: v'tzivah hakohen v'khib'sv et asher-bvo hanaga' v'his'giyrvo shiv'at-yamiym sheniyt
translation: the priest shall order the affected article washed, and he shall isolate it for another seven days.

hebrew: וְרָאָ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אַחֲרֵ֣י ׀ הֻכַּבֵּ֣ס אֶת־הַנֶּ֗גַע וְ֠הִנֵּה לֹֽא־הָפַ֨ךְ הַנֶּ֤גַע אֶת־עֵינוֹ֙ וְהַנֶּ֣גַע לֹֽא־פָשָׂ֔ה טָמֵ֣א ה֔וּא בָּאֵ֖שׁ תִּשְׂרְפֶ֑נּוּ פְּחֶ֣תֶת הִ֔וא בְּקָרַחְתּ֖וֹ א֥וֹ בְגַבַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'raah hakohen acharey  hukabes et-hanega' v'hineh lo-hafakh' hanega' et-'eynvo v'hanega' lo-fasah tame hv baesh tis'r'fenv p'chetet hiv b'karach'tvo vo v'gabach'tvo
translation: And if, after the affected article has been washed, the priest sees that the affection has not changed color and that it has not spread, it is unclean. It shall be consumed in fire; it is a fret,gMeaning of Heb. peḥetheth uncertain. whether on its inner side or on its outer side.

hebrew: וְאִם֮ רָאָ֣ה הַכֹּהֵן֒ וְהִנֵּה֙ כֵּהָ֣ה הַנֶּ֔גַע אַחֲרֵ֖י הֻכַּבֵּ֣ס אֹת֑וֹ וְקָרַ֣ע אֹת֗וֹ מִן־הַבֶּ֙גֶד֙ א֣וֹ מִן־הָע֔וֹר א֥וֹ מִן־הַשְּׁתִ֖י א֥וֹ מִן־הָעֵֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'im raah hakohen v'hineh kehah hanega' acharey hukabes otvo v'kara' otvo min-habeged vo min-ha'vor vo min-hash'tiy vo min-ha'erev
translation: But if the priest sees that the affected part, after it has been washed, is faded, he shall tear it out from the cloth or skin, whether in the warp or in the woof;

hebrew: וְאִם־תֵּרָאֶ֨ה ע֜וֹד בַּ֠בֶּגֶד אֽוֹ־בַשְּׁתִ֤י אֽוֹ־בָעֵ֙רֶב֙ א֣וֹ בְכָל־כְּלִי־ע֔וֹר פֹּרַ֖חַת הִ֑וא בָּאֵ֣שׁ תִּשְׂרְפֶ֔נּוּ אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ הַנָּֽגַע׃
transliteration: v'im-teraeh 'vod babeged vo-vash'tiy vo-va'erev vo v'khal-k'liy-'vor porachat hiv baesh tis'r'fenv et asher-bvo hanaga'
translation: and if it occurs again in the cloth—whether in warp or in woof—or in any article of skin, it is a wild growth; the affected article shall be consumed in fire.

hebrew: וְהַבֶּ֡גֶד אֽוֹ־הַשְּׁתִ֨י אוֹ־הָעֵ֜רֶב אֽוֹ־כָל־כְּלִ֤י הָעוֹר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תְּכַבֵּ֔ס וְסָ֥ר מֵהֶ֖ם הַנָּ֑גַע וְכֻבַּ֥ס שֵׁנִ֖ית וְטָהֵֽר׃
transliteration: v'habeged vo-hash'tiy vo-ha'erev vo-khal-k'liy ha'vor asher t'khabes v'sar mehem hanaga' v'khubas sheniyt v'taher
translation: If, however, the affection disappears from the cloth—warp or woof—or from any article of skin that has been washed, it shall be washed again, and it shall be clean.

hebrew: זֹ֠את תּוֹרַ֨ת נֶֽגַע־צָרַ֜עַת בֶּ֥גֶד הַצֶּ֣מֶר ׀ א֣וֹ הַפִּשְׁתִּ֗ים א֤וֹ הַשְּׁתִי֙ א֣וֹ הָעֵ֔רֶב א֖וֹ כָּל־כְּלִי־ע֑וֹר לְטַהֲר֖וֹ א֥וֹ לְטַמְּאֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: zot tvorat nega'-tzara'at beged hatzemer  vo hapish'tiym vo hash'tiy vo ha'erev vo kal-k'liy-'vor l'taharvo vo l'tam'vo (f)
translation: Such is the procedure for eruptive affections of cloth, woolen or linen, in warp or in woof, or of any article of skin, for pronouncing it clean or unclean.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: זֹ֤את תִּֽהְיֶה֙ תּוֹרַ֣ת הַמְּצֹרָ֔ע בְּי֖וֹם טָהֳרָת֑וֹ וְהוּבָ֖א אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: zot tih'yeh tvorat ham'tzora' b'yvom tahoratvo v'hvva el-hakohen
translation:
This shall be the ritual for a leper at the time that he is to be cleansed.
When it has been reportedaCf. note a at 13.2. to the priest,

hebrew: וְיָצָא֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֶל־מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וְרָאָה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהִנֵּ֛ה נִרְפָּ֥א נֶֽגַע־הַצָּרַ֖עַת מִן־הַצָּרֽוּעַ׃
transliteration: v'yatza hakohen el-michvtz lamachaneh v'raah hakohen v'hineh nir'pa nega'-hatzara'at min-hatzarv'a
translation: the priest shall go outside the camp. If the priest sees that the leper has been healed of his scaly affection,

hebrew: וְצִוָּה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְלָקַ֧ח לַמִּטַּהֵ֛ר שְׁתֵּֽי־צִפֳּרִ֥ים חַיּ֖וֹת טְהֹר֑וֹת וְעֵ֣ץ אֶ֔רֶז וּשְׁנִ֥י תוֹלַ֖עַת וְאֵזֹֽב׃
transliteration: v'tzivah hakohen v'lakach lamitaher sh'tey-tziporiym chayvot t'horvot v'etz erez vsh'niy tvola'at v'ezov
translation: the priest shall order two live clean birds, cedar wood, crimson stuff, and hyssop to be brought for him who is to be cleansed.

hebrew: וְצִוָּה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְשָׁחַ֖ט אֶת־הַצִּפּ֣וֹר הָאֶחָ֑ת אֶל־כְּלִי־חֶ֖רֶשׂ עַל־מַ֥יִם חַיִּֽים׃
transliteration: v'tzivah hakohen v'shachat et-hatzipvor haechat el-k'liy-cheres 'al-mayim chayiym
translation: The priest shall order one of the birds slaughtered over fresh water in an earthen vessel;

hebrew: אֶת־הַצִּפֹּ֤ר הַֽחַיָּה֙ יִקַּ֣ח אֹתָ֔הּ וְאֶת־עֵ֥ץ הָאֶ֛רֶז וְאֶת־שְׁנִ֥י הַתּוֹלַ֖עַת וְאֶת־הָאֵזֹ֑ב וְטָבַ֨ל אוֹתָ֜ם וְאֵ֣ת ׀ הַצִּפֹּ֣ר הַֽחַיָּ֗ה בְּדַם֙ הַצִּפֹּ֣ר הַשְּׁחֻטָ֔ה עַ֖ל הַמַּ֥יִם הַֽחַיִּֽים׃
transliteration: et-hatzipor hachayah yikach otah v'et-'etz haerez v'et-sh'niy hatvola'at v'et-haezov v'taval votam v'et  hatzipor hachayah b'dam hatzipor hash'chutah 'al hamayim hachayiym
translation: and he shall take the live bird, along with the cedar wood, the crimson stuff, and the hyssop, and dip them together with the live bird in the blood of the bird that was slaughtered over the fresh water.

hebrew: וְהִזָּ֗ה עַ֧ל הַמִּטַּהֵ֛ר מִן־הַצָּרַ֖עַת שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֑ים וְטִ֣הֲר֔וֹ וְשִׁלַּ֛ח אֶת־הַצִּפֹּ֥ר הַֽחַיָּ֖ה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'hizah 'al hamitaher min-hatzara'at sheva' p'amiym v'tiharvo v'shilach et-hatzipor hachayah 'al-p'ney hasadeh
translation: He shall then sprinkle it seven times on him who is to be cleansed of the eruption and cleanse him; and he shall set the live bird free in the open country.

hebrew: וְכִבֶּס֩ הַמִּטַּהֵ֨ר אֶת־בְּגָדָ֜יו וְגִלַּ֣ח אֶת־כָּל־שְׂעָר֗וֹ וְרָחַ֤ץ בַּמַּ֙יִם֙ וְטָהֵ֔ר וְאַחַ֖ר יָב֣וֹא אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וְיָשַׁ֛ב מִח֥וּץ לְאָהֳל֖וֹ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'khibes hamitaher et-b'gadayv v'gilach et-kal-s'arvo v'rachatz bamayim v'taher v'achar yavvo el-hamachaneh v'yashav michvtz l'aholvo shiv'at yamiym
translation: The one to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, shave off all his hair, and bathe in water; then he shall be clean. After that he may enter the camp, but he must remain outside his tent seven days.

hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֜י יְגַלַּ֣ח אֶת־כָּל־שְׂעָר֗וֹ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֤וֹ וְאֶת־זְקָנוֹ֙ וְאֵת֙ גַּבֹּ֣ת עֵינָ֔יו וְאֶת־כָּל־שְׂעָר֖וֹ יְגַלֵּ֑חַ וְכִבֶּ֣ס אֶת־בְּגָדָ֗יו וְרָחַ֧ץ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֛וֹ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָהֵֽר׃
transliteration: v'hayah vayvom hash'viy'iy y'galach et-kal-s'arvo et-roshvo v'et-z'kanvo v'et gabot 'eynayv v'et-kal-s'arvo y'galecha v'khibes et-b'gadayv v'rachatz et-b'sarvo bamayim v'taher
translation: On the seventh day he shall shave off all his hair—of head, beard, and eyebrows. When he has shaved off all his hair, he shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; then he shall be clean.

hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֗י יִקַּ֤ח שְׁנֵֽי־כְבָשִׂים֙ תְּמִימִ֔ים וְכַבְשָׂ֥ה אַחַ֛ת בַּת־שְׁנָתָ֖הּ תְּמִימָ֑ה וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה עֶשְׂרֹנִ֗ים סֹ֤לֶת מִנְחָה֙ בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשֶּׁ֔מֶן וְלֹ֥ג אֶחָ֖ד שָֽׁמֶן׃
transliteration: vvayvom hash'miyniy yikach sh'ney-kh'vasiym t'miymiym v'khav'sah achat bat-sh'natah t'miymah vsh'loshah 'es'roniym solet min'chah b'lvlah vashemen v'log echad shamen
translation: On the eighth day he shall take two male lambs without blemish, one ewe lamb in its first year without blemish, three-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in for a meal offering, and one log of oil.

hebrew: וְהֶעֱמִ֞יד הַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַֽמְטַהֵ֗ר אֵ֛ת הָאִ֥ישׁ הַמִּטַּהֵ֖ר וְאֹתָ֑ם לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'he'emiyd hakohen ham'taher et haiysh hamitaher v'otam lif'ney y'hvah petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: These shall be presented before the L<small>ORD</small>, with the man to be cleansed, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, by the priest who performs the cleansing.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֨ח הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֗ד וְהִקְרִ֥יב אֹת֛וֹ לְאָשָׁ֖ם וְאֶת־לֹ֣ג הַשָּׁ֑מֶן וְהֵנִ֥יף אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen et-hakeves haechad v'hik'riyv otvo l'asham v'et-log hashamen v'heniyf otam t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah
translation: The priest shall take one of the male lambs and offer it with the log of oil as a guilt offering, and he shall elevate them as an elevation offering before the LORD.

hebrew: וְשָׁחַ֣ט אֶת־הַכֶּ֗בֶשׂ בִּ֠מְקוֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁחַ֧ט אֶת־הַֽחַטָּ֛את וְאֶת־הָעֹלָ֖ה בִּמְק֣וֹם הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ כִּ֡י כַּ֠חַטָּאת הָאָשָׁ֥ם הוּא֙ לַכֹּהֵ֔ן קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'shachat et-hakeves bim'kvom asher yish'chat et-hachatat v'et-ha'olah bim'kvom hakodesh kiy kachatat haasham hv lakohen kodesh kadashiym hv
translation: The lamb shall be slaughtered at the spot in the sacred area where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered.bSee 1.11; 4.24. For the guilt offering, like the sin offering, goes to the priest; it is most holy.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֣ח הַכֹּהֵן֮ מִדַּ֣ם הָאָשָׁם֒ וְנָתַן֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן עַל־תְּנ֛וּךְ אֹ֥זֶן הַמִּטַּהֵ֖ר הַיְמָנִ֑ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדוֹ֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְל֖וֹ הַיְמָנִֽית׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen midam haasham v'natan hakohen 'al-t'nvkh' ozen hamitaher hay'maniyt v'al-bohen yadvo hay'maniyt v'al-bohen rag'lvo hay'maniyt
translation: The priest shall take some of the blood of the guilt offering, and the priest shall put it on the ridge of the right ear of him who is being cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֥ח הַכֹּהֵ֖ן מִלֹּ֣ג הַשָּׁ֑מֶן וְיָצַ֛ק עַל־כַּ֥ף הַכֹּהֵ֖ן הַשְּׂמָאלִֽית׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen milog hashamen v'yatzak 'al-kaf hakohen has'maliyt
translation: The priest shall then take some of the log of oil and pour it into the palm of his own left hand.

hebrew: וְטָבַ֤ל הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶת־אֶצְבָּע֣וֹ הַיְמָנִ֔ית מִן־הַשֶּׁ֕מֶן אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־כַּפּ֖וֹ הַשְּׂמָאלִ֑ית וְהִזָּ֨ה מִן־הַשֶּׁ֧מֶן בְּאֶצְבָּע֛וֹ שֶׁ֥בַע פְּעָמִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'taval hakohen et-etz'ba'vo hay'maniyt min-hashemen asher 'al-kapvo has'maliyt v'hizah min-hashemen b'etz'ba'vo sheva' p'amiym lif'ney y'hvah
translation: And the priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that is in the palm of his left hand and sprinkle some of the oil with his finger seven times before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וּמִיֶּ֨תֶר הַשֶּׁ֜מֶן אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־כַּפּ֗וֹ יִתֵּ֤ן הַכֹּהֵן֙ עַל־תְּנ֞וּךְ אֹ֤זֶן הַמִּטַּהֵר֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדוֹ֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְל֖וֹ הַיְמָנִ֑ית עַ֖ל דַּ֥ם הָאָשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vmiyeter hashemen asher 'al-kapvo yiten hakohen 'al-t'nvkh' ozen hamitaher hay'maniyt v'al-bohen yadvo hay'maniyt v'al-bohen rag'lvo hay'maniyt 'al dam haasham
translation: Some of the oil left in his palm shall be put by the priest on the ridge of the right ear of the one being cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot—over the blood of the guilt offering.

hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָ֗ר בַּשֶּׁ֙מֶן֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־כַּ֣ף הַכֹּהֵ֔ן יִתֵּ֖ן עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַמִּטַּהֵ֑ר וְכִפֶּ֥ר עָלָ֛יו הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hanvotar bashemen asher 'al-kaf hakohen yiten 'al-rosh hamitaher v'khiper 'alayv hakohen lif'ney y'hvah
translation: The rest of the oil in his palm the priest shall put on the head of the one being cleansed. Thus the priest shall make expiation for him before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֤ה הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶת־הַ֣חַטָּ֔את וְכִפֶּ֕ר עַל־הַמִּטַּהֵ֖ר מִטֻּמְאָת֑וֹ וְאַחַ֖ר יִשְׁחַ֥ט אֶת־הָעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: v'asah hakohen et-hachatat v'khiper 'al-hamitaher mitum'atvo v'achar yish'chat et-ha'olah
translation: The priest shall then offer the sin offering and make expiation for the one being cleansed of his uncleanness. Last, the burnt offering shall be slaughtered,

hebrew: וְהֶעֱלָ֧ה הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־הָעֹלָ֥ה וְאֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֖ה הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה וְכִפֶּ֥ר עָלָ֛יו הַכֹּהֵ֖ן וְטָהֵֽר׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'he'elah hakohen et-ha'olah v'et-hamin'chah hamiz'bechah v'khiper 'alayv hakohen v'taher (s)
translation: and the priest shall offer the burnt offering and the meal offering on the altar, and the priest shall make expiation for him. Then he shall be clean.

hebrew: וְאִם־דַּ֣ל ה֗וּא וְאֵ֣ין יָדוֹ֮ מַשֶּׂגֶת֒ וְ֠לָקַח כֶּ֣בֶשׂ אֶחָ֥ד אָשָׁ֛ם לִתְנוּפָ֖ה לְכַפֵּ֣ר עָלָ֑יו וְעִשָּׂר֨וֹן סֹ֜לֶת אֶחָ֨ד בָּל֥וּל בַּשֶּׁ֛מֶן לְמִנְחָ֖ה וְלֹ֥ג שָֽׁמֶן׃
transliteration: v'im-dal hv v'eyn yadvo maseget v'lakach keves echad asham lit'nvfah l'khaper 'alayv v'isarvon solet echad balvl bashemen l'min'chah v'log shamen
translation: If, however, he is poor and his means are insufficient, he shall take one male lamb for a guilt offering, to be elevated in expiation for him, one-tenth of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in for a meal offering, and a log of oil;

hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּ֣י תֹרִ֗ים א֤וֹ שְׁנֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יוֹנָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּשִּׂ֖יג יָד֑וֹ וְהָיָ֤ה אֶחָד֙ חַטָּ֔את וְהָאֶחָ֖ד עֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: vsh'tey toriym vo sh'ney b'ney yvonah asher tasiyg yadvo v'hayah echad chatat v'haechad 'olah
translation: and two turtledoves or two pigeons, depending on his means, the one to be the sin offering and the other the burnt offering.

hebrew: וְהֵבִ֨יא אֹתָ֜ם בַּיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֛י לְטָהֳרָת֖וֹ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֑ן אֶל־פֶּ֥תַח אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'heviy otam bayvom hash'miyniy l'tahoratvo el-hakohen el-petach ohel-mvo'ed lif'ney y'hvah
translation: On the eighth day of his cleansing he shall bring them to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֧ח הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־כֶּ֥בֶשׂ הָאָשָׁ֖ם וְאֶת־לֹ֣ג הַשָּׁ֑מֶן וְהֵנִ֨יף אֹתָ֧ם הַכֹּהֵ֛ן תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen et-keves haasham v'et-log hashamen v'heniyf otam hakohen t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah
translation: The priest shall take the lamb of guilt offering and the log of oil, and elevate them as an elevation offering before the LORD.

hebrew: וְשָׁחַט֮ אֶת־כֶּ֣בֶשׂ הָֽאָשָׁם֒ וְלָקַ֤ח הַכֹּהֵן֙ מִדַּ֣ם הָֽאָשָׁ֔ם וְנָתַ֛ן עַל־תְּנ֥וּךְ אֹֽזֶן־הַמִּטַּהֵ֖ר הַיְמָנִ֑ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדוֹ֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְל֖וֹ הַיְמָנִֽית׃
transliteration: v'shachat et-keves haasham v'lakach hakohen midam haasham v'natan 'al-t'nvkh' ozen-hamitaher hay'maniyt v'al-bohen yadvo hay'maniyt v'al-bohen rag'lvo hay'maniyt
translation: When the lamb of guilt offering has been slaughtered, the priest shall take some of the blood of the guilt offering and put it on the ridge of the right ear of the one being cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.

hebrew: וּמִן־הַשֶּׁ֖מֶן יִצֹ֣ק הַכֹּהֵ֑ן עַל־כַּ֥ף הַכֹּהֵ֖ן הַשְּׂמָאלִֽית׃
transliteration: vmin-hashemen yitzok hakohen 'al-kaf hakohen has'maliyt
translation: The priest shall then pour some of the oil into the palm of his own left hand,

hebrew: וְהִזָּ֤ה הַכֹּהֵן֙ בְּאֶצְבָּע֣וֹ הַיְמָנִ֔ית מִן־הַשֶּׁ֕מֶן אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־כַּפּ֖וֹ הַשְּׂמָאלִ֑ית שֶׁ֥בַע פְּעָמִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hizah hakohen b'etz'ba'vo hay'maniyt min-hashemen asher 'al-kapvo has'maliyt sheva' p'amiym lif'ney y'hvah
translation: and with the finger of his right hand the priest shall sprinkle some of the oil that is in the palm of his left hand seven times before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְנָתַ֨ן הַכֹּהֵ֜ן מִן־הַשֶּׁ֣מֶן ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־כַּפּ֗וֹ עַל־תְּנ֞וּךְ אֹ֤זֶן הַמִּטַּהֵר֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדוֹ֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְל֖וֹ הַיְמָנִ֑ית עַל־מְק֖וֹם דַּ֥ם הָאָשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: v'natan hakohen min-hashemen  asher 'al-kapvo 'al-t'nvkh' ozen hamitaher hay'maniyt v'al-bohen yadvo hay'maniyt v'al-bohen rag'lvo hay'maniyt 'al-m'kvom dam haasham
translation: Some of the oil in his palm shall be put by the priest on the ridge of the right ear of the one being cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot, over the same places as the blood of the guilt offering;

hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָ֗ר מִן־הַשֶּׁ֙מֶן֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־כַּ֣ף הַכֹּהֵ֔ן יִתֵּ֖ן עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַמִּטַּהֵ֑ר לְכַפֵּ֥ר עָלָ֖יו לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hanvotar min-hashemen asher 'al-kaf hakohen yiten 'al-rosh hamitaher l'khaper 'alayv lif'ney y'hvah
translation: and what is left of the oil in his palm the priest shall put on the head of the one being cleansed, to make expiation for him before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֤ה אֶת־הָֽאֶחָד֙ מִן־הַתֹּרִ֔ים א֖וֹ מִן־בְּנֵ֣י הַיּוֹנָ֑ה מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּשִּׂ֖יג יָדֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'asah et-haechad min-hatoriym vo min-b'ney hayvonah measher tasiyg yadvo
translation: He shall then offer one of the turtledoves or pigeons, depending on his means—

hebrew: אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־תַּשִּׂ֞יג יָד֗וֹ אֶת־הָאֶחָ֥ד חַטָּ֛את וְאֶת־הָאֶחָ֥ד עֹלָ֖ה עַל־הַמִּנְחָ֑ה וְכִפֶּ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן עַ֥ל הַמִּטַּהֵ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: et asher-tasiyg yadvo et-haechad chatat v'et-haechad 'olah 'al-hamin'chah v'khiper hakohen 'al hamitaher lif'ney y'hvah
translation: whichever he can afford—the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, together with the meal offering. Thus the priest shall make expiation before the L<small>ORD</small> for the one being cleansed.

hebrew: זֹ֣את תּוֹרַ֔ת אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ נֶ֣גַע צָרָ֑עַת אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹֽא־תַשִּׂ֥יג יָד֖וֹ בְּטָהֳרָתֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: zot tvorat asher-bvo nega' tzara'at asher lo-tasiyg yadvo b'tahoratvo (f)
translation: Such is the ritual for him who has a scaly affection and whose means for his cleansing are limited.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

hebrew: כִּ֤י תָבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֛י נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶ֖ם לַאֲחֻזָּ֑ה וְנָתַתִּי֙ נֶ֣גַע צָרַ֔עַת בְּבֵ֖ית אֶ֥רֶץ אֲחֻזַּתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: kiy tavov el-eretz k'na'an asher aniy noten lakhem laachuzah v'natatiy nega' tzara'at b'veyt eretz achuzat'khem
translation: When you enter the land of Canaan that I give you as a possession, and I inflict an eruptive plague upon a house in the land you possess,

hebrew: וּבָא֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֣וֹ הַבַּ֔יִת וְהִגִּ֥יד לַכֹּהֵ֖ן לֵאמֹ֑ר כְּנֶ֕גַע נִרְאָ֥ה לִ֖י בַּבָּֽיִת׃
transliteration: vva asher-lvo habayit v'higiyd lakohen lemor k'nega' nir'ah liy babayit
translation: the owner of the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, “Something like a plague has appeared upon my house.”

hebrew: וְצִוָּ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֜ן וּפִנּ֣וּ אֶת־הַבַּ֗יִת בְּטֶ֨רֶם יָבֹ֤א הַכֹּהֵן֙ לִרְא֣וֹת אֶת־הַנֶּ֔גַע וְלֹ֥א יִטְמָ֖א כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּבָּ֑יִת וְאַ֥חַר כֵּ֛ן יָבֹ֥א הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לִרְא֥וֹת אֶת־הַבָּֽיִת׃
transliteration: v'tzivah hakohen vfinv et-habayit b'terem yavo hakohen lir'vot et-hanega' v'lo yit'ma kal-asher babayit v'achar ken yavo hakohen lir'vot et-habayit
translation: The priest shall order the house cleared before the priest enters to examine the plague, so that nothing in the house may become unclean; after that the priest shall enter to examine the house.

hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה אֶת־הַנֶּ֗גַע וְהִנֵּ֤ה הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ בְּקִירֹ֣ת הַבַּ֔יִת שְׁקַֽעֲרוּרֹת֙ יְרַקְרַקֹּ֔ת א֖וֹ אֲדַמְדַּמֹּ֑ת וּמַרְאֵיהֶ֥ן שָׁפָ֖ל מִן־הַקִּֽיר׃
transliteration: v'raah et-hanega' v'hineh hanega' b'kiyrot habayit sh'ka'arvrot y'rak'rakot vo adam'damot vmar'eyhen shafal min-hakiyr
translation: If, when he examines the plague, the plague in the walls of the house is found to consist of greenishcOr “yellowish.” or reddish streaksdMeaning of Heb. sheqa‘aruroth uncertain. that appear to go deep into the wall,

hebrew: וְיָצָ֧א הַכֹּהֵ֛ן מִן־הַבַּ֖יִת אֶל־פֶּ֣תַח הַבָּ֑יִת וְהִסְגִּ֥יר אֶת־הַבַּ֖יִת שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'yatza hakohen min-habayit el-petach habayit v'his'giyr et-habayit shiv'at yamiym
translation: the priest shall come out of the house to the entrance of the house, and close up the house for seven days.

hebrew: וְשָׁ֥ב הַכֹּהֵ֖ן בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֑י וְרָאָ֕ה וְהִנֵּ֛ה פָּשָׂ֥ה הַנֶּ֖גַע בְּקִירֹ֥ת הַבָּֽיִת׃
transliteration: v'shav hakohen bayvom hash'viy'iy v'raah v'hineh pasah hanega' b'kiyrot habayit
translation: On the seventh day the priest shall return. If he sees that the plague has spread on the walls of the house,

hebrew: וְצִוָּה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְחִלְּצוּ֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲבָנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּהֵ֖ן הַנָּ֑גַע וְהִשְׁלִ֤יכוּ אֶתְהֶן֙ אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לָעִ֔יר אֶל־מָק֖וֹם טָמֵֽא׃
transliteration: v'tzivah hakohen v'chil'tzv et-haavaniym asher bahen hanaga' v'hish'liykhv et'hen el-michvtz la'iyr el-makvom tame
translation: the priest shall order the stones with the plague in them to be pulled out and cast outside the city into an unclean place.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַבַּ֛יִת יַקְצִ֥עַ מִבַּ֖יִת סָבִ֑יב וְשָׁפְכ֗וּ אֶת־הֶֽעָפָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִקְצ֔וּ אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לָעִ֔יר אֶל־מָק֖וֹם טָמֵֽא׃
transliteration: v'et-habayit yak'tzi'a mibayit saviyv v'shaf'khv et-he'afar asher hik'tzv el-michvtz la'iyr el-makvom tame
translation: The house shall be scraped inside all around, and the coatingeLit. “dust,” “mud.” that is scraped off shall be dumped outside the city in an unclean place.

hebrew: וְלָקְחוּ֙ אֲבָנִ֣ים אֲחֵר֔וֹת וְהֵבִ֖יאוּ אֶל־תַּ֣חַת הָאֲבָנִ֑ים וְעָפָ֥ר אַחֵ֛ר יִקַּ֖ח וְטָ֥ח אֶת־הַבָּֽיִת׃
transliteration: v'lak'chv avaniym achervot v'heviyv el-tachat haavaniym v'afar acher yikach v'tach et-habayit
translation: They shall take other stones and replace those stones with them, and take other coating and plaster the house.

hebrew: וְאִם־יָשׁ֤וּב הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ וּפָרַ֣ח בַּבַּ֔יִת אַחַ֖ר חִלֵּ֣ץ אֶת־הָאֲבָנִ֑ים וְאַחֲרֵ֛י הִקְצ֥וֹת אֶת־הַבַּ֖יִת וְאַחֲרֵ֥י הִטּֽוֹחַ׃
transliteration: v'im-yashvv hanega' vfarach babayit achar chiletz et-haavaniym v'acharey hik'tzvot et-habayit v'acharey hitvocha
translation: If the plague again breaks out in the house, after the stones have been pulled out and after the house has been scraped and replastered,

hebrew: וּבָא֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְרָאָ֕ה וְהִנֵּ֛ה פָּשָׂ֥ה הַנֶּ֖גַע בַּבָּ֑יִת צָרַ֨עַת מַמְאֶ֥רֶת הִ֛וא בַּבַּ֖יִת טָמֵ֥א הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vva hakohen v'raah v'hineh pasah hanega' babayit tzara'at mam'eret hiv babayit tame hv
translation: the priest shall come to examine: if the plague has spread in the house, it is a malignant eruption in the house; it is unclean.

hebrew: וְנָתַ֣ץ אֶת־הַבַּ֗יִת אֶת־אֲבָנָיו֙ וְאֶת־עֵצָ֔יו וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־עֲפַ֣ר הַבָּ֑יִת וְהוֹצִיא֙ אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לָעִ֔יר אֶל־מָק֖וֹם טָמֵֽא׃
transliteration: v'natatz et-habayit et-avanayv v'et-'etzayv v'et kal-'afar habayit v'hvotziy el-michvtz la'iyr el-makvom tame
translation: The house shall be torn down—its stones and timber and all the coating on the house—and taken to an unclean place outside the city.

hebrew: וְהַבָּא֙ אֶל־הַבַּ֔יִת כָּל־יְמֵ֖י הִסְגִּ֣יר אֹת֑וֹ יִטְמָ֖א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'haba el-habayit kal-y'mey his'giyr otvo yit'ma 'ad-ha'arev
translation: Whoever enters the house while it is closed up shall be unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְהַשֹּׁכֵ֣ב בַּבַּ֔יִת יְכַבֵּ֖ס אֶת־בְּגָדָ֑יו וְהָאֹכֵ֣ל בַּבַּ֔יִת יְכַבֵּ֖ס אֶת־בְּגָדָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'hashokhev babayit y'khabes et-b'gadayv v'haokhel babayit y'khabes et-b'gadayv
translation: Whoever sleeps in the house must wash his clothes, and whoever eats in the house must wash his clothes.

hebrew: וְאִם־בֹּ֨א יָבֹ֜א הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְרָאָה֙ וְ֠הִנֵּה לֹא־פָשָׂ֤ה הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ בַּבַּ֔יִת אַחֲרֵ֖י הִטֹּ֣חַ אֶת־הַבָּ֑יִת וְטִהַ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶת־הַבַּ֔יִת כִּ֥י נִרְפָּ֖א הַנָּֽגַע׃
transliteration: v'im-bo yavo hakohen v'raah v'hineh lo-fasah hanega' babayit acharey hitocha et-habayit v'tihar hakohen et-habayit kiy nir'pa hanaga'
translation: If, however, the priest comes and sees that the plague has not spread in the house after the house was replastered, the priest shall pronounce the house clean, for the plague has healed.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֛ח לְחַטֵּ֥א אֶת־הַבַּ֖יִת שְׁתֵּ֣י צִפֳּרִ֑ים וְעֵ֣ץ אֶ֔רֶז וּשְׁנִ֥י תוֹלַ֖עַת וְאֵזֹֽב׃
transliteration: v'lakach l'chate et-habayit sh'tey tziporiym v'etz erez vsh'niy tvola'at v'ezov
translation: To purge the house, he shall take two birds, cedar wood, crimson stuff, and hyssop.

hebrew: וְשָׁחַ֖ט אֶת־הַצִּפֹּ֣ר הָאֶחָ֑ת אֶל־כְּלִי־חֶ֖רֶשׂ עַל־מַ֥יִם חַיִּֽים׃
transliteration: v'shachat et-hatzipor haechat el-k'liy-cheres 'al-mayim chayiym
translation: He shall slaughter the one bird over fresh water in an earthen vessel.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֣ח אֶת־עֵֽץ־הָ֠אֶרֶז וְאֶת־הָ֨אֵזֹ֜ב וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שְׁנִ֣י הַתּוֹלַ֗עַת וְאֵת֮ הַצִּפֹּ֣ר הַֽחַיָּה֒ וְטָבַ֣ל אֹתָ֗ם בְּדַם֙ הַצִּפֹּ֣ר הַשְּׁחוּטָ֔ה וּבַמַּ֖יִם הַֽחַיִּ֑ים וְהִזָּ֥ה אֶל־הַבַּ֖יִת שֶׁ֥בַע פְּעָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'lakach et-'etz-haerez v'et-haezov v'et  sh'niy hatvola'at v'et hatzipor hachayah v'taval otam b'dam hatzipor hash'chvtah vvamayim hachayiym v'hizah el-habayit sheva' p'amiym
translation: He shall take the cedar wood, the hyssop, the crimson stuff, and the live bird, and dip them in the blood of the slaughtered bird and the fresh water, and sprinkle on the house seven times.

hebrew: וְחִטֵּ֣א אֶת־הַבַּ֔יִת בְּדַם֙ הַצִּפּ֔וֹר וּבַמַּ֖יִם הַֽחַיִּ֑ים וּבַצִּפֹּ֣ר הַחַיָּ֗ה וּבְעֵ֥ץ הָאֶ֛רֶז וּבָאֵזֹ֖ב וּבִשְׁנִ֥י הַתּוֹלָֽעַת׃
transliteration: v'chite et-habayit b'dam hatzipvor vvamayim hachayiym vvatzipor hachayah vv'etz haerez vvaezov vvish'niy hatvola'at
translation: Having purged the house with the blood of the bird, the fresh water, the live bird, the cedar wood, the hyssop, and the crimson stuff,

hebrew: וְשִׁלַּ֞ח אֶת־הַצִּפֹּ֧ר הַֽחַיָּ֛ה אֶל־מִח֥וּץ לָעִ֖יר אֶל־פְּנֵ֣י הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וְכִפֶּ֥ר עַל־הַבַּ֖יִת וְטָהֵֽר׃
transliteration: v'shilach et-hatzipor hachayah el-michvtz la'iyr el-p'ney hasadeh v'khiper 'al-habayit v'taher
translation: he shall set the live bird free outside the city in the open country. Thus he shall make expiation for the house, and it shall be clean.

hebrew: זֹ֖את הַתּוֹרָ֑ה לְכָל־נֶ֥גַע הַצָּרַ֖עַת וְלַנָּֽתֶק׃
transliteration: zot hatvorah l'khal-nega' hatzara'at v'lanatek
translation: Such is the ritual for every eruptive affection—for scalls,

hebrew: וּלְצָרַ֥עַת הַבֶּ֖גֶד וְלַבָּֽיִת׃
transliteration: vl'tzara'at habeged v'labayit
translation: for an eruption on a cloth or a house,

hebrew: וְלַשְׂאֵ֥ת וְלַסַּפַּ֖חַת וְלַבֶּהָֽרֶת׃
transliteration: v'las'et v'lasapachat v'labeharet
translation: for swellings, for rashes, or for discolorations—

hebrew: לְהוֹרֹ֕ת בְּי֥וֹם הַטָּמֵ֖א וּבְי֣וֹם הַטָּהֹ֑ר זֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הַצָּרָֽעַת׃ (ס)
transliteration: l'hvorot b'yvom hatame vv'yvom hatahor zot tvorat hatzara'at (s)
translation:
to determine when they are unclean and when they are clean.
Such is the ritual concerning eruptions.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

hebrew: דַּבְּרוּ֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אִ֣ישׁ אִ֗ישׁ כִּ֤י יִהְיֶה֙ זָ֣ב מִבְּשָׂר֔וֹ זוֹב֖וֹ טָמֵ֥א הֽוּא׃
transliteration: dab'rv el-b'ney yis'rael vaamar'tem alehem iysh iysh kiy yih'yeh zav mib'sarvo zvovvo tame hv
translation:
Speak to the Israelite people and say to them:
When any man has a discharge issuing from his member,aLit. “flesh.” he is unclean.

hebrew: וְזֹ֛את תִּהְיֶ֥ה טֻמְאָת֖וֹ בְּזוֹב֑וֹ רָ֣ר בְּשָׂר֞וֹ אֶת־זוֹב֗וֹ אֽוֹ־הֶחְתִּ֤ים בְּשָׂרוֹ֙ מִזּוֹב֔וֹ טֻמְאָת֖וֹ הִֽוא׃
transliteration: v'zot tih'yeh tum'atvo b'zvovvo rar b'sarvo et-zvovvo vo-hech'tiym b'sarvo mizvovvo tum'atvo hiv
translation: The uncleanness from his discharge shall mean the following—whether his member runs with the discharge or is stopped up so that there is no discharge, his uncleanness means this:

hebrew: כָּל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֗ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁכַּ֥ב עָלָ֛יו הַזָּ֖ב יִטְמָ֑א וְכָֽל־הַכְּלִ֛י אֲשֶׁר־יֵשֵׁ֥ב עָלָ֖יו יִטְמָֽא׃
transliteration: kal-hamish'kav asher yish'kav 'alayv hazav yit'ma v'khal-hak'liy asher-yeshev 'alayv yit'ma
translation: Any bedding on which the one with the discharge lies shall be unclean, and every object on which he sits shall be unclean.

hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִגַּ֖ע בְּמִשְׁכָּב֑וֹ יְכַבֵּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'iysh asher yiga' b'mish'kavvo y'khabes b'gadayv v'rachatz bamayim v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: Anyone who touches his bedding shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְהַיֹּשֵׁב֙ עַֽל־הַכְּלִ֔י אֲשֶׁר־יֵשֵׁ֥ב עָלָ֖יו הַזָּ֑ב יְכַבֵּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'hayoshev 'al-hak'liy asher-yeshev 'alayv hazav y'khabes b'gadayv v'rachatz bamayim v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: Whoever sits on an object on which the one with the discharge has sat shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְהַנֹּגֵ֖עַ בִּבְשַׂ֣ר הַזָּ֑ב יְכַבֵּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'hanoge'a biv'sar hazav y'khabes b'gadayv v'rachatz bamayim v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: Whoever touches the body of the one with the discharge shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָרֹ֛ק הַזָּ֖ב בַּטָּה֑וֹר וְכִבֶּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yarok hazav batahvor v'khibes b'gadayv v'rachatz bamayim v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: If one with a discharge spits on one who is clean, the latter shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְכָל־הַמֶּרְכָּ֗ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִרְכַּ֥ב עָלָ֛יו הַזָּ֖ב יִטְמָֽא׃
transliteration: v'khal-hamer'kav asher yir'kav 'alayv hazav yit'ma
translation: Any means for riding that one with a discharge has mounted shall be unclean;

hebrew: וְכָל־הַנֹּגֵ֗עַ בְּכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִהְיֶ֣ה תַחְתָּ֔יו יִטְמָ֖א עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב וְהַנּוֹשֵׂ֣א אוֹתָ֔ם יְכַבֵּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'khal-hanoge'a b'khol asher yih'yeh tach'tayv yit'ma 'ad-ha'arev v'hanvose votam y'khabes b'gadayv v'rachatz bamayim v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: whoever touches anything that was under him shall be unclean until evening; and whoever carries such things shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִגַּע־בּוֹ֙ הַזָּ֔ב וְיָדָ֖יו לֹא־שָׁטַ֣ף בַּמָּ֑יִם וְכִבֶּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'khol asher yiga'-bvo hazav v'yadayv lo-shataf bamayim v'khibes b'gadayv v'rachatz bamayim v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: If one with a discharge, without having rinsed his hands in water, touches another person, that person shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

hebrew: וּכְלִי־חֶ֛רֶשׂ אֲשֶׁר־יִגַּע־בּ֥וֹ הַזָּ֖ב יִשָּׁבֵ֑ר וְכָל־כְּלִי־עֵ֔ץ יִשָּׁטֵ֖ף בַּמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: vkh'liy-cheres asher-yiga'-bvo hazav yishaver v'khal-k'liy-'etz yishatef bamayim
translation: An earthen vessel that one with a discharge touches shall be broken; and any wooden implement shall be rinsed with water.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִטְהַ֤ר הַזָּב֙ מִזּוֹב֔וֹ וְסָ֨פַר ל֜וֹ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֛ים לְטָהֳרָת֖וֹ וְכִבֶּ֣ס בְּגָדָ֑יו וְרָחַ֧ץ בְּשָׂר֛וֹ בְּמַ֥יִם חַיִּ֖ים וְטָהֵֽר׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yit'har hazav mizvovvo v'safar lvo shiv'at yamiym l'tahoratvo v'khibes b'gadayv v'rachatz b'sarvo b'mayim chayiym v'taher
translation: When one with a discharge becomes clean of his discharge, he shall count off seven days for his cleansing, wash his clothes, and bathe his body in fresh water; then he shall be clean.

hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֗י יִֽקַּֽח־לוֹ֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י תֹרִ֔ים א֥וֹ שְׁנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יוֹנָ֑ה וּבָ֣א ׀ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֗ה אֶל־פֶּ֙תַח֙ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וּנְתָנָ֖ם אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: vvayvom hash'miyniy yikach-lvo sh'tey toriym vo sh'ney b'ney yvonah vva  lif'ney y'hvah el-petach ohel mvo'ed vn'tanam el-hakohen
translation: On the eighth day he shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons and come before the L<small>ORD</small> at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and give them to the priest.

hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֤ה אֹתָם֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֶחָ֣ד חַטָּ֔את וְהָאֶחָ֖ד עֹלָ֑ה וְכִפֶּ֨ר עָלָ֧יו הַכֹּהֵ֛ן לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה מִזּוֹבֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'asah otam hakohen echad chatat v'haechad 'olah v'khiper 'alayv hakohen lif'ney y'hvah mizvovvo (s)
translation: The priest shall offer them, the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering. Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf, for his discharge, before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ כִּֽי־תֵצֵ֥א מִמֶּ֖נּוּ שִׁכְבַת־זָ֑רַע וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֛יִם אֶת־כָּל־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'iysh kiy-tetze mimenv shikh'vat-zara' v'rachatz bamayim et-kal-b'sarvo v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: When a man has an emission of semen, he shall bathe his whole body in water and remain unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְכָל־בֶּ֣גֶד וְכָל־ע֔וֹר אֲשֶׁר־יִהְיֶ֥ה עָלָ֖יו שִׁכְבַת־זָ֑רַע וְכֻבַּ֥ס בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'khal-beged v'khal-'vor asher-yih'yeh 'alayv shikh'vat-zara' v'khubas bamayim v'tame 'ad-ha'arev (f)
translation: All cloth or leather on which semen falls shall be washed in water and remain unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְאִשָּׁ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁכַּ֥ב אִ֛ישׁ אֹתָ֖הּ שִׁכְבַת־זָ֑רַע וְרָחֲצ֣וּ בַמַּ֔יִם וְטָמְא֖וּ עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'ishah asher yish'kav iysh otah shikh'vat-zara' v'rachatzv vamayim v'tam'v 'ad-ha'arev
translation: And if a man has carnal relations with a woman, they shall bathe in water and remain unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְאִשָּׁה֙ כִּֽי־תִהְיֶ֣ה זָבָ֔ה דָּ֛ם יִהְיֶ֥ה זֹבָ֖הּ בִּבְשָׂרָ֑הּ שִׁבְעַ֤ת יָמִים֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה בְנִדָּתָ֔הּ וְכָל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּ֖הּ יִטְמָ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'ishah kiy-tih'yeh zavah dam yih'yeh zovah biv'sarah shiv'at yamiym tih'yeh v'nidatah v'khal-hanoge'a bah yit'ma 'ad-ha'arev
translation: When a woman has a discharge, her discharge being blood from her body, she shall remain in her impurity seven days; whoever touches her shall be unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּשְׁכַּ֥ב עָלָ֛יו בְּנִדָּתָ֖הּ יִטְמָ֑א וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־תֵּשֵׁ֥ב עָלָ֖יו יִטְמָֽא׃
transliteration: v'khol asher tish'kav 'alayv b'nidatah yit'ma v'khol asher-teshev 'alayv yit'ma
translation: Anything that she lies on during her impurity shall be unclean; and anything that she sits on shall be unclean.

hebrew: וְכָל־הַנֹּגֵ֖עַ בְּמִשְׁכָּבָ֑הּ יְכַבֵּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'khal-hanoge'a b'mish'kavah y'khabes b'gadayv v'rachatz bamayim v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: Anyone who touches her bedding shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening;

hebrew: וְכָל־הַנֹּגֵ֔עַ בְּכָל־כְּלִ֖י אֲשֶׁר־תֵּשֵׁ֣ב עָלָ֑יו יְכַבֵּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'khal-hanoge'a b'khal-k'liy asher-teshev 'alayv y'khabes b'gadayv v'rachatz bamayim v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: and anyone who touches any object on which she has sat shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְאִ֨ם עַֽל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֜ב ה֗וּא א֧וֹ עַֽל־הַכְּלִ֛י אֲשֶׁר־הִ֥וא יֹשֶֽׁבֶת־עָלָ֖יו בְּנָגְעוֹ־ב֑וֹ יִטְמָ֖א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'im 'al-hamish'kav hv vo 'al-hak'liy asher-hiv yoshevet-'alayv b'nag'vo-vvo yit'ma 'ad-ha'arev
translation: Be it the bedding or be it the object on which she has sat, on touching it he shall be unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְאִ֡ם שָׁכֹב֩ יִשְׁכַּ֨ב אִ֜ישׁ אֹתָ֗הּ וּתְהִ֤י נִדָּתָהּ֙ עָלָ֔יו וְטָמֵ֖א שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים וְכָל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ב אֲשֶׁר־יִשְׁכַּ֥ב עָלָ֖יו יִטְמָֽא׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'im shakhov yish'kav iysh otah vt'hiy nidatah 'alayv v'tame shiv'at yamiym v'khal-hamish'kav asher-yish'kav 'alayv yit'ma (f)
translation: And if a man lies with her, her impurity is communicated to him; he shall be unclean seven days, and any bedding on which he lies shall become unclean.

hebrew: וְאִשָּׁ֡ה כִּֽי־יָזוּב֩ ז֨וֹב דָּמָ֜הּ יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֗ים בְּלֹא֙ עֶת־נִדָּתָ֔הּ א֥וֹ כִֽי־תָז֖וּב עַל־נִדָּתָ֑הּ כָּל־יְמֵ֞י ז֣וֹב טֻמְאָתָ֗הּ כִּימֵ֧י נִדָּתָ֛הּ תִּהְיֶ֖ה טְמֵאָ֥ה הִֽוא׃
transliteration: v'ishah kiy-yazvv zvov damah yamiym rabiym b'lo 'et-nidatah vo khiy-tazvv 'al-nidatah kal-y'mey zvov tum'atah kiymey nidatah tih'yeh t'meah hiv
translation: When a woman has had a discharge of blood for many days, not at the time of her impurity, or when she has a discharge beyond her period of impurity, she shall be unclean, as though at the time of her impurity, as long as her discharge lasts.

hebrew: כָּל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֞ב אֲשֶׁר־תִּשְׁכַּ֤ב עָלָיו֙ כָּל־יְמֵ֣י זוֹבָ֔הּ כְּמִשְׁכַּ֥ב נִדָּתָ֖הּ יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֑הּ וְכָֽל־הַכְּלִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּשֵׁ֣ב עָלָ֔יו טָמֵ֣א יִהְיֶ֔ה כְּטֻמְאַ֖ת נִדָּתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: kal-hamish'kav asher-tish'kav 'alayv kal-y'mey zvovah k'mish'kav nidatah yih'yeh-lah v'khal-hak'liy asher teshev 'alayv tame yih'yeh k'tum'at nidatah
translation: Any bedding on which she lies while her discharge lasts shall be for her like bedding during her impurity; and any object on which she sits shall become unclean, as it does during her impurity:

hebrew: וְכָל־הַנּוֹגֵ֥עַ בָּ֖ם יִטְמָ֑א וְכִבֶּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'khal-hanvoge'a bam yit'ma v'khibes b'gadayv v'rachatz bamayim v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: whoever touches them shall be unclean; he shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְאִֽם־טָהֲרָ֖ה מִזּוֹבָ֑הּ וְסָ֥פְרָה לָּ֛הּ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים וְאַחַ֥ר תִּטְהָֽר׃
transliteration: v'im-taharah mizvovah v'saf'rah lah shiv'at yamiym v'achar tit'har
translation: When she becomes clean of her discharge, she shall count off seven days, and after that she shall be clean.

hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֗י תִּֽקַּֽח־לָהּ֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י תֹרִ֔ים א֥וֹ שְׁנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יוֹנָ֑ה וְהֵבִיאָ֤ה אוֹתָם֙ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: vvayvom hash'miyniy tikach-lah sh'tey toriym vo sh'ney b'ney yvonah v'heviyah votam el-hakohen el-petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: On the eighth day she shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons, and bring them to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֤ה הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶת־הָאֶחָ֣ד חַטָּ֔את וְאֶת־הָאֶחָ֖ד עֹלָ֑ה וְכִפֶּ֨ר עָלֶ֤יהָ הַכֹּהֵן֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה מִזּ֖וֹב טֻמְאָתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'asah hakohen et-haechad chatat v'et-haechad 'olah v'khiper 'aleyha hakohen lif'ney y'hvah mizvov tum'atah
translation: The priest shall offer the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering; and the priest shall make expiation on her behalf, for her unclean discharge, before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְהִזַּרְתֶּ֥ם אֶת־בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִטֻּמְאָתָ֑ם וְלֹ֤א יָמֻ֙תוּ֙ בְּטֻמְאָתָ֔ם בְּטַמְּאָ֥ם אֶת־מִשְׁכָּנִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
transliteration: v'hizar'tem et-b'ney-yis'rael mitum'atam v'lo yamutv b'tum'atam b'tam'am et-mish'kaniy asher b'tvokham
translation: You shall put the Israelites on guard against their uncleanness, lest they die through their uncleanness by defiling My Tabernacle which is among them.

hebrew: זֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הַזָּ֑ב וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר תֵּצֵ֥א מִמֶּ֛נּוּ שִׁכְבַת־זֶ֖רַע לְטָמְאָה־בָֽהּ׃
transliteration: zot tvorat hazav vaasher tetze mimenv shikh'vat-zera' l'tam'ah-vah
translation: Such is the ritual concerning him who has a discharge: concerning him who has an emission of semen and becomes unclean thereby,

hebrew: וְהַדָּוָה֙ בְּנִדָּתָ֔הּ וְהַזָּב֙ אֶת־זוֹב֔וֹ לַזָּכָ֖ר וְלַנְּקֵבָ֑ה וּלְאִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִשְׁכַּ֖ב עִם־טְמֵאָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hadavah b'nidatah v'hazav et-zvovvo lazakhar v'lan'kevah vl'iysh asher yish'kav 'im-t'meah (f)
translation: and concerning her who is in menstrual infirmity, and concerning anyone, male or female, who has a discharge, and concerning a man who lies with an unclean woman.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אַחֲרֵ֣י מ֔וֹת שְׁנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֑ן בְּקָרְבָתָ֥ם לִפְנֵי־יְהוָ֖ה וַיָּמֻֽתוּ׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh acharey mvot sh'ney b'ney aharon b'kar'vatam lif'ney-y'hvah vayamutv
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron who died when they drew too close to the presence of the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה דַּבֵּר֮ אֶל־אַהֲרֹ֣ן אָחִיךָ֒ וְאַל־יָבֹ֤א בְכָל־עֵת֙ אֶל־הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ מִבֵּ֖ית לַפָּרֹ֑כֶת אֶל־פְּנֵ֨י הַכַּפֹּ֜רֶת אֲשֶׁ֤ר עַל־הָאָרֹן֙ וְלֹ֣א יָמ֔וּת כִּ֚י בֶּֽעָנָ֔ן אֵרָאֶ֖ה עַל־הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh daber el-aharon achiykha v'al-yavo v'khal-'et el-hakodesh mibeyt laparokhet el-p'ney hakaporet asher 'al-haaron v'lo yamvt kiy be'anan eraeh 'al-hakaporet
translation:
The LORD said to Moses:
Tell your brother Aaron that he is not to come at willaLit. “at any time.” into the Shrine behind the curtain, in front of the cover that is upon the ark, lest he die; for I appear in the cloud over the cover.

hebrew: בְּזֹ֛את יָבֹ֥א אַהֲרֹ֖ן אֶל־הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ בְּפַ֧ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר לְחַטָּ֖את וְאַ֥יִל לְעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: b'zot yavo aharon el-hakodesh b'far ben-bakar l'chatat v'ayil l'olah
translation: Thus only shall Aaron enter the Shrine: with a bull of the herd for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.—

hebrew: כְּתֹֽנֶת־בַּ֨ד קֹ֜דֶשׁ יִלְבָּ֗שׁ וּמִֽכְנְסֵי־בַד֮ יִהְי֣וּ עַל־בְּשָׂרוֹ֒ וּבְאַבְנֵ֥ט בַּד֙ יַחְגֹּ֔ר וּבְמִצְנֶ֥פֶת בַּ֖ד יִצְנֹ֑ף בִּגְדֵי־קֹ֣דֶשׁ הֵ֔ם וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֛יִם אֶת־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ וּלְבֵשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: k'tonet-bad kodesh yil'bash vmikh'n'sey-vad yih'yv 'al-b'sarvo vv'av'net bad yach'gor vv'mitz'nefet bad yitz'nof big'dey-kodesh hem v'rachatz bamayim et-b'sarvo vl'vesham
translation: He shall be dressed in a sacral linen tunic, with linen breeches next to his flesh, and be girt with a linen sash, and he shall wear a linen turban. They are sacral vestments; he shall bathe his body in water and then put them on.—

hebrew: וּמֵאֵ֗ת עֲדַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יִקַּ֛ח שְׁנֵֽי־שְׂעִירֵ֥י עִזִּ֖ים לְחַטָּ֑את וְאַ֥יִל אֶחָ֖ד לְעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: vmeet 'adat b'ney yis'rael yikach sh'ney-s'iyrey 'iziym l'chatat v'ayil echad l'olah
translation: And from the Israelite community he shall take two he-goats for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.

hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֧יב אַהֲרֹ֛ן אֶת־פַּ֥ר הַחַטָּ֖את אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ וְכִפֶּ֥ר בַּעֲד֖וֹ וּבְעַ֥ד בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyv aharon et-par hachatat asher-lvo v'khiper ba'advo vv'ad beytvo
translation: Aaron is to offer his own bull of sin offering, to make expiation for himself and for his household.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֖ח אֶת־שְׁנֵ֣י הַשְּׂעִירִ֑ם וְהֶעֱמִ֤יד אֹתָם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'lakach et-sh'ney has'iyrim v'he'emiyd otam lif'ney y'hvah petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: AaronbMoved up from v. 8 for clarity. shall take the two he-goats and let them stand before the LORD at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;

hebrew: וְנָתַ֧ן אַהֲרֹ֛ן עַל־שְׁנֵ֥י הַשְּׂעִירִ֖ם גּוֹרָל֑וֹת גּוֹרָ֤ל אֶחָד֙ לַיהוָ֔ה וְגוֹרָ֥ל אֶחָ֖ד לַעֲזָאזֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'natan aharon 'al-sh'ney has'iyrim gvoralvot gvoral echad layhvah v'gvoral echad la'azazel
translation: and he shall place lots upon the two goats, one marked for the L<small>ORD</small> and the other marked for Azazel.

hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֤יב אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־הַשָּׂעִ֔יר אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָלָ֥ה עָלָ֛יו הַגּוֹרָ֖ל לַיהוָ֑ה וְעָשָׂ֖הוּ חַטָּֽאת׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyv aharon et-hasa'iyr asher 'alah 'alayv hagvoral layhvah v'asahv chatat
translation: Aaron shall bring forward the goat designated by lot for the L<small>ORD</small>, which he is to offer as a sin offering;

hebrew: וְהַשָּׂעִ֗יר אֲשֶׁר֩ עָלָ֨ה עָלָ֤יו הַגּוֹרָל֙ לַעֲזָאזֵ֔ל יָֽעֳמַד־חַ֛י לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה לְכַפֵּ֣ר עָלָ֑יו לְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֹת֛וֹ לַעֲזָאזֵ֖ל הַמִּדְבָּֽרָה׃
transliteration: v'hasa'iyr asher 'alah 'alayv hagvoral la'azazel ya'omad-chay lif'ney y'hvah l'khaper 'alayv l'shalach otvo la'azazel hamid'barah
translation: while the goat designated by lot for Azazel shall be left standing alive before the L<small>ORD</small>, to make expiation with it and to send it off to the wilderness for Azazel.

hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֨יב אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־פַּ֤ר הַֽחַטָּאת֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וְכִפֶּ֥ר בַּֽעֲד֖וֹ וּבְעַ֣ד בֵּית֑וֹ וְשָׁחַ֛ט אֶת־פַּ֥ר הַֽחַטָּ֖את אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyv aharon et-par hachatat asher-lvo v'khiper ba'advo vv'ad beytvo v'shachat et-par hachatat asher-lvo
translation: Aaron shall then offer his bull of sin offering, to make expiation for himself and his household. He shall slaughter his bull of sin offering,

hebrew: וְלָקַ֣ח מְלֹֽא־הַ֠מַּחְתָּה גַּֽחֲלֵי־אֵ֞שׁ מֵעַ֤ל הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וּמְלֹ֣א חָפְנָ֔יו קְטֹ֥רֶת סַמִּ֖ים דַּקָּ֑ה וְהֵבִ֖יא מִבֵּ֥ית לַפָּרֹֽכֶת׃
transliteration: v'lakach m'lo-hamach'tah gachaley-esh me'al hamiz'becha milif'ney y'hvah vm'lo chaf'nayv k'toret samiym dakah v'heviy mibeyt laparokhet
translation: and he shall take a panful of glowing coals scooped from the altar before the L<small>ORD</small>, and two handfuls of finely ground aromatic incense, and bring this behind the curtain.

hebrew: וְנָתַ֧ן אֶֽת־הַקְּטֹ֛רֶת עַל־הָאֵ֖שׁ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְכִסָּ֣ה ׀ עֲנַ֣ן הַקְּטֹ֗רֶת אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הָעֵד֖וּת וְלֹ֥א יָמֽוּת׃
transliteration: v'natan et-hak'toret 'al-haesh lif'ney y'hvah v'khisah  'anan hak'toret et-hakaporet asher 'al-ha'edvt v'lo yamvt
translation: He shall put the incense on the fire before the L<small>ORD</small>, so that the cloud from the incense screens the cover that is over [the Ark of] the Pact, lest he die.

hebrew: וְלָקַח֙ מִדַּ֣ם הַפָּ֔ר וְהִזָּ֧ה בְאֶצְבָּע֛וֹ עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַכַּפֹּ֖רֶת קֵ֑דְמָה וְלִפְנֵ֣י הַכַּפֹּ֗רֶת יַזֶּ֧ה שֶֽׁבַע־פְּעָמִ֛ים מִן־הַדָּ֖ם בְּאֶצְבָּעֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'lakach midam hapar v'hizah v'etz'ba'vo 'al-p'ney hakaporet ked'mah v'lif'ney hakaporet yazeh sheva'-p'amiym min-hadam b'etz'ba'vo
translation: He shall take some of the blood of the bull and sprinkle it with his finger over the cover on the east side; and in front of the cover he shall sprinkle some of the blood with his finger seven times.

hebrew: וְשָׁחַ֞ט אֶת־שְׂעִ֤יר הַֽחַטָּאת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָעָ֔ם וְהֵבִיא֙ אֶת־דָּמ֔וֹ אֶל־מִבֵּ֖ית לַפָּרֹ֑כֶת וְעָשָׂ֣ה אֶת־דָּמ֗וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ לְדַ֣ם הַפָּ֔ר וְהִזָּ֥ה אֹת֛וֹ עַל־הַכַּפֹּ֖רֶת וְלִפְנֵ֥י הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
transliteration: v'shachat et-s'iyr hachatat asher la'am v'heviy et-damvo el-mibeyt laparokhet v'asah et-damvo kaasher 'asah l'dam hapar v'hizah otvo 'al-hakaporet v'lif'ney hakaporet
translation: He shall then slaughter the people’s goat of sin offering, bring its blood behind the curtain, and do with its blood as he has done with the blood of the bull: he shall sprinkle it over the cover and in front of the cover.

hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֣ר עַל־הַקֹּ֗דֶשׁ מִטֻּמְאֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּמִפִּשְׁעֵיהֶ֖ם לְכָל־חַטֹּאתָ֑ם וְכֵ֤ן יַעֲשֶׂה֙ לְאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד הַשֹּׁכֵ֣ן אִתָּ֔ם בְּת֖וֹךְ טֻמְאֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'khiper 'al-hakodesh mitum'ot b'ney yis'rael vmipish'eyhem l'khal-chatotam v'khen ya'aseh l'ohel mvo'ed hashokhen itam b'tvokh' tum'otam
translation: Thus he shall purge the Shrine of the uncleanness and transgression of the Israelites, whatever their sins; and he shall do the same for the Tent of Meeting, which abides with them in the midst of their uncleanness.

hebrew: וְכָל־אָדָ֞ם לֹא־יִהְיֶ֣ה ׀ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֗ד בְּבֹא֛וֹ לְכַפֵּ֥ר בַּקֹּ֖דֶשׁ עַד־צֵאת֑וֹ וְכִפֶּ֤ר בַּעֲדוֹ֙ וּבְעַ֣ד בֵּית֔וֹ וּבְעַ֖ד כָּל־קְהַ֥ל יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'khal-adam lo-yih'yeh  b'ohel mvo'ed b'vovo l'khaper bakodesh 'ad-tzetvo v'khiper ba'advo vv'ad beytvo vv'ad kal-k'hal yis'rael
translation:
When he goes in to make expiation in the Shrine, nobody else shall be in the Tent of Meeting until he comes out.
When he has made expiation for himself and his household, and for the whole congregation of Israel,

hebrew: וְיָצָ֗א אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֛חַ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִפְנֵֽי־יְהוָ֖ה וְכִפֶּ֣ר עָלָ֑יו וְלָקַ֞ח מִדַּ֤ם הַפָּר֙ וּמִדַּ֣ם הַשָּׂעִ֔יר וְנָתַ֛ן עַל־קַרְנ֥וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'yatza el-hamiz'becha asher lif'ney-y'hvah v'khiper 'alayv v'lakach midam hapar vmidam hasa'iyr v'natan 'al-kar'nvot hamiz'becha saviyv
translation: he shall go out to the altar that is before the L<small>ORD</small> and purge it: he shall take some of the blood of the bull and of the goat and apply it to each of the horns of the altar;

hebrew: וְהִזָּ֨ה עָלָ֧יו מִן־הַדָּ֛ם בְּאֶצְבָּע֖וֹ שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֑ים וְטִהֲר֣וֹ וְקִדְּשׁ֔וֹ מִטֻּמְאֹ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'hizah 'alayv min-hadam b'etz'ba'vo sheva' p'amiym v'tiharvo v'kid'shvo mitum'ot b'ney yis'rael
translation: and the rest of the blood he shall sprinkle on it with his finger seven times. Thus he shall cleanse it of the uncleanness of the Israelites and consecrate it.

hebrew: וְכִלָּה֙ מִכַּפֵּ֣ר אֶת־הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וְאֶת־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וְאֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְהִקְרִ֖יב אֶת־הַשָּׂעִ֥יר הֶחָֽי׃
transliteration: v'khilah mikaper et-hakodesh v'et-ohel mvo'ed v'et-hamiz'becha v'hik'riyv et-hasa'iyr hechay
translation: When he has finished purging the Shrine, the Tent of Meeting, and the altar, the live goat shall be brought forward.

hebrew: וְסָמַ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י ידו [יָדָ֗יו] עַ֨ל רֹ֣אשׁ הַשָּׂעִיר֮ הַחַי֒ וְהִתְוַדָּ֣ה עָלָ֗יו אֶת־כָּל־עֲוֺנֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֶת־כָּל־פִּשְׁעֵיהֶ֖ם לְכָל־חַטֹּאתָ֑ם וְנָתַ֤ן אֹתָם֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַשָּׂעִ֔יר וְשִׁלַּ֛ח בְּיַד־אִ֥ישׁ עִתִּ֖י הַמִּדְבָּֽרָה׃
transliteration: v'samakh' aharon et-sh'tey ydv [yadayv] 'al rosh hasa'iyr hachay v'hit'vadah 'alayv et-kal-'avonot b'ney yis'rael v'et-kal-pish'eyhem l'khal-chatotam v'natan otam 'al-rosh hasa'iyr v'shilach b'yad-iysh 'itiy hamid'barah
translation: Aaron shall lay both his hands upon the head of the live goat and confess over it all the iniquities and transgressions of the Israelites, whatever their sins, putting them on the head of the goat; and it shall be sent off to the wilderness through a designatedcMeaning of Heb. ‘itti uncertain. man.

hebrew: וְנָשָׂ֨א הַשָּׂעִ֥יר עָלָ֛יו אֶת־כָּל־עֲוֺנֹתָ֖ם אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ גְּזֵרָ֑ה וְשִׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־הַשָּׂעִ֖יר בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
transliteration: v'nasa hasa'iyr 'alayv et-kal-'avonotam el-eretz g'zerah v'shilach et-hasa'iyr bamid'bar
translation: Thus the goat shall carry on it all their iniquities to an inaccessible region; and the goat shall be set free in the wilderness.

hebrew: וּבָ֤א אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וּפָשַׁט֙ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֣י הַבָּ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָבַ֖שׁ בְּבֹא֣וֹ אֶל־הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וְהִנִּיחָ֖ם שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vva aharon el-ohel mvo'ed vfashat et-big'dey habad asher lavash b'vovo el-hakodesh v'hiniycham sham
translation: And Aaron shall go into the Tent of Meeting, take off the linen vestments that he put on when he entered the Shrine, and leave them there.

hebrew: וְרָחַ֨ץ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֤וֹ בַמַּ֙יִם֙ בְּמָק֣וֹם קָד֔וֹשׁ וְלָבַ֖שׁ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֑יו וְיָצָ֗א וְעָשָׂ֤ה אֶת־עֹֽלָתוֹ֙ וְאֶת־עֹלַ֣ת הָעָ֔ם וְכִפֶּ֥ר בַּעֲד֖וֹ וּבְעַ֥ד הָעָֽם׃
transliteration: v'rachatz et-b'sarvo vamayim b'makvom kadvosh v'lavash et-b'gadayv v'yatza v'asah et-'olatvo v'et-'olat ha'am v'khiper ba'advo vv'ad ha'am
translation: He shall bathe his body in water in the holy precinct and put on his vestments; then he shall come out and offer his burnt offering and the burnt offering of the people, making expiation for himself and for the people.

hebrew: וְאֵ֛ת חֵ֥לֶב הַֽחַטָּ֖את יַקְטִ֥יר הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
transliteration: v'et chelev hachatat yak'tiyr hamiz'bechah
translation: The fat of the sin offering he shall turn into smoke on the altar.

hebrew: וְהַֽמְשַׁלֵּ֤חַ אֶת־הַשָּׂעִיר֙ לַֽעֲזָאזֵ֔ל יְכַבֵּ֣ס בְּגָדָ֔יו וְרָחַ֥ץ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ בַּמָּ֑יִם וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֖ן יָב֥וֹא אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'ham'shalecha et-hasa'iyr la'azazel y'khabes b'gadayv v'rachatz et-b'sarvo bamayim v'acharey-khen yavvo el-hamachaneh
translation: He who set the Azazel-goat free shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; after that he may reenter the camp.

hebrew: וְאֵת֩ פַּ֨ר הַֽחַטָּ֜את וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שְׂעִ֣יר הַֽחַטָּ֗את אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוּבָ֤א אֶת־דָּמָם֙ לְכַפֵּ֣ר בַּקֹּ֔דֶשׁ יוֹצִ֖יא אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וְשָׂרְפ֣וּ בָאֵ֔שׁ אֶת־עֹרֹתָ֥ם וְאֶת־בְּשָׂרָ֖ם וְאֶת־פִּרְשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: v'et par hachatat v'et  s'iyr hachatat asher hvva et-damam l'khaper bakodesh yvotziy el-michvtz lamachaneh v'sar'fv vaesh et-'orotam v'et-b'saram v'et-pir'sham
translation: The bull of sin offering and the goat of sin offering whose blood was brought in to purge the Shrine shall be taken outside the camp; and their hides, flesh, and dung shall be consumed in fire.

hebrew: וְהַשֹּׂרֵ֣ף אֹתָ֔ם יְכַבֵּ֣ס בְּגָדָ֔יו וְרָחַ֥ץ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ בַּמָּ֑יִם וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֖ן יָב֥וֹא אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'hasoref otam y'khabes b'gadayv v'rachatz et-b'sarvo bamayim v'acharey-khen yavvo el-hamachaneh
translation: He who burned them shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; after that he may re-enter the camp.

hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם לְחֻקַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַ֠שְּׁבִיעִי בֶּֽעָשׂ֨וֹר לַחֹ֜דֶשׁ תְּעַנּ֣וּ אֶת־נַפְשֹֽׁתֵיכֶ֗ם וְכָל־מְלָאכָה֙ לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּ הָֽאֶזְרָ֔ח וְהַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֥ר בְּתוֹכְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hay'tah lakhem l'chukat 'volam bachodesh hash'viy'iy be'asvor lachodesh t'anv et-naf'shoteykhem v'khal-m'lakhah lo ta'asv haez'rach v'hager hagar b'tvokh'khem
