translation: And this shall be to you a law for all time: In the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall practice self-denial; and you shall do no manner of work, neither the citizen nor the alien who resides among you.

hebrew: כִּֽי־בַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֛ה יְכַפֵּ֥ר עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם לְטַהֵ֣ר אֶתְכֶ֑ם מִכֹּל֙ חַטֹּ֣אתֵיכֶ֔ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה תִּטְהָֽרוּ׃
transliteration: kiy-vayvom hazeh y'khaper 'aleykhem l'taher et'khem mikol chatoteykhem lif'ney y'hvah tit'harv
translation: For on this day atonement shall be made for you to cleanse you of all your sins; you shall be clean before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: שַׁבַּ֨ת שַׁבָּת֥וֹן הִיא֙ לָכֶ֔ם וְעִנִּיתֶ֖ם אֶת־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶ֑ם חֻקַּ֖ת עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: shabat shabatvon hiy lakhem v'iniytem et-naf'shoteykhem chukat 'volam
translation: It shall be a sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall practice self-denial; it is a law for all time.

hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֨ר הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֲשֶׁר־יִמְשַׁ֣ח אֹת֗וֹ וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר יְמַלֵּא֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ לְכַהֵ֖ן תַּ֣חַת אָבִ֑יו וְלָבַ֛שׁ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י הַבָּ֖ד בִּגְדֵ֥י הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: v'khiper hakohen asher-yim'shach otvo vaasher y'male et-yadvo l'khahen tachat aviyv v'lavash et-big'dey habad big'dey hakodesh
translation: The priest who has been anointed and ordained to serve as priest in place of his father shall make expiation. He shall put on the linen vestments, the sacral vestments.

hebrew: וְכִפֶּר֙ אֶת־מִקְדַּ֣שׁ הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וְאֶת־אֹ֧הֶל מוֹעֵ֛ד וְאֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ יְכַפֵּ֑ר וְעַ֧ל הַכֹּהֲנִ֛ים וְעַל־כָּל־עַ֥ם הַקָּהָ֖ל יְכַפֵּֽר׃
transliteration: v'khiper et-mik'dash hakodesh v'et-ohel mvo'ed v'et-hamiz'becha y'khaper v'al hakohaniym v'al-kal-'am hakahal y'khaper
translation: He shall purge the innermost Shrine; he shall purge the Tent of Meeting and the altar; and he shall make expiation for the priests and for all the people of the congregation.

hebrew: וְהָֽיְתָה־זֹּ֨את לָכֶ֜ם לְחֻקַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֗ם לְכַפֵּ֞ר עַל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִכָּל־חַטֹּאתָ֔ם אַחַ֖ת בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה וַיַּ֕עַשׂ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hay'tah-zot lakhem l'chukat 'volam l'khaper 'al-b'ney yis'rael mikal-chatotam achat bashanah vaya'as kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (f)
translation:
This shall be to you a law for all time: to make atonement for the Israelites for all their sins once a year.
And Moses did as the LORD had commanded him.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֨ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְאֶל־בָּנָ֗יו וְאֶל֙ כָּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: daber el-aharon v'el-banayv v'el kal-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta aleyhem zeh hadavar asher-tzivah y'hvah lemor
translation:
Speak to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelite people and say to them:
This is what the LORD has commanded:

hebrew: אִ֥ישׁ אִישׁ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁחַ֜ט שׁ֥וֹר אוֹ־כֶ֛שֶׂב אוֹ־עֵ֖ז בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה א֚וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִשְׁחַ֔ט מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: iysh iysh mibeyt yis'rael asher yish'chat shvor vo-khesev vo-'ez bamachaneh vo asher yish'chat michvtz lamachaneh
translation: if anyone of the house of Israel slaughters an ox or sheep or goat in the camp, or does so outside the camp,

hebrew: וְאֶל־פֶּ֜תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵד֮ לֹ֣א הֱבִיאוֹ֒ לְהַקְרִ֤יב קָרְבָּן֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י מִשְׁכַּ֣ן יְהוָ֑ה דָּ֣ם יֵחָשֵׁ֞ב לָאִ֤ישׁ הַהוּא֙ דָּ֣ם שָׁפָ֔ךְ וְנִכְרַ֛ת הָאִ֥ישׁ הַה֖וּא מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'el-petach ohel mvo'ed lo heviyvo l'hak'riyv kar'ban layhvah lif'ney mish'kan y'hvah dam yechashev laiysh hahv dam shafakh' v'nikh'rat haiysh hahv mikerev 'amvo
translation: and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting to present it as an offering to the L<small>ORD</small>, before the L<small>ORD</small>’s Tabernacle, bloodguilt shall be imputed to that man: he has shed blood; that man shall be cut off from among his people.

hebrew: לְמַעַן֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָבִ֜יאוּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶֽת־זִבְחֵיהֶם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֵ֣ם זֹבְחִים֮ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַשָּׂדֶה֒ וֶֽהֱבִיאֻ֣ם לַֽיהוָ֗ה אֶל־פֶּ֛תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְזָ֨בְח֜וּ זִבְחֵ֧י שְׁלָמִ֛ים לַֽיהוָ֖ה אוֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: l'ma'an asher yaviyv b'ney yis'rael et-ziv'cheyhem asher hem zov'chiym 'al-p'ney hasadeh veheviyum layhvah el-petach ohel mvo'ed el-hakohen v'zav'chv ziv'chey sh'lamiym layhvah votam
translation: This is in order that the Israelites may bring the sacrifices which they have been making in the open—that they may bring them before the L<small>ORD</small>, to the priest, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and offer them as sacrifices of well-being to the L<small>ORD</small>;

hebrew: וְזָרַ֨ק הַכֹּהֵ֤ן אֶת־הַדָּם֙ עַל־מִזְבַּ֣ח יְהוָ֔ה פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהִקְטִ֣יר הַחֵ֔לֶב לְרֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'zarak hakohen et-hadam 'al-miz'bach y'hvah petach ohel mvo'ed v'hik'tiyr hachelev l'reycha niychocha layhvah
translation: that the priest may dash the blood against the altar of the L<small>ORD</small> at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and turn the fat into smoke as a pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>;

hebrew: וְלֹא־יִזְבְּח֥וּ עוֹד֙ אֶת־זִבְחֵיהֶ֔ם לַשְּׂעִירִ֕ם אֲשֶׁ֛ר הֵ֥ם זֹנִ֖ים אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֛ם תִּֽהְיֶה־זֹּ֥את לָהֶ֖ם לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'lo-yiz'b'chv 'vod et-ziv'cheyhem las'iyrim asher hem zoniym achareyhem chukat 'volam tih'yeh-zot lahem l'dorotam
translation: and that they may offer their sacrifices no more to the goat-demons after whom they stray. This shall be to them a law for all time, throughout the ages.

hebrew: וַאֲלֵהֶ֣ם תֹּאמַ֔ר אִ֥ישׁ אִישׁ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּמִן־הַגֵּ֖ר אֲשֶׁר־יָג֣וּר בְּתוֹכָ֑ם אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲלֶ֥ה עֹלָ֖ה אוֹ־זָֽבַח׃
transliteration: vaalehem tomar iysh iysh mibeyt yis'rael vmin-hager asher-yagvr b'tvokham asher-ya'aleh 'olah vo-zavach
translation: Say to them further: If anyone of the house of Israel or of the strangers who reside among them offers a burnt offering or a sacrifice,

hebrew: וְאֶל־פֶּ֜תַח אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ לֹ֣א יְבִיאֶ֔נּוּ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת אֹת֖וֹ לַיהוָ֑ה וְנִכְרַ֛ת הָאִ֥ישׁ הַה֖וּא מֵעַמָּֽיו׃
transliteration: v'el-petach ohel mvo'ed lo y'viyenv la'asvot otvo layhvah v'nikh'rat haiysh hahv me'amayv
translation: and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting to offer it to the L<small>ORD</small>, that person shall be cut off from his people.

hebrew: וְאִ֨ישׁ אִ֜ישׁ מִבֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וּמִן־הַגֵּר֙ הַגָּ֣ר בְּתוֹכָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֹאכַ֖ל כָּל־דָּ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֣י פָנַ֗י בַּנֶּ֙פֶשׁ֙ הָאֹכֶ֣לֶת אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י אֹתָ֖הּ מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'iysh iysh mibeyt yis'rael vmin-hager hagar b'tvokham asher yokhal kal-dam v'natatiy fanay banefesh haokhelet et-hadam v'hikh'ratiy otah mikerev 'amah
translation: And if anyone of the house of Israel or of the strangers who reside among them partakes of any blood, I will set My face against the person who partakes of the blood, and I will cut him off from among his kin.

hebrew: כִּ֣י נֶ֣פֶשׁ הַבָּשָׂר֮ בַּדָּ֣ם הִוא֒ וַאֲנִ֞י נְתַתִּ֤יו לָכֶם֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־הַדָּ֥ם ה֖וּא בַּנֶּ֥פֶשׁ יְכַפֵּֽר׃
transliteration: kiy nefesh habasar badam hiv vaaniy n'tatiyv lakhem 'al-hamiz'becha l'khaper 'al-naf'shoteykhem kiy-hadam hv banefesh y'khaper
translation: For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have assigned it to you for making expiation for your lives upon the altar; it is the blood, as life, that effects expiation.

hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֤ן אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כָּל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ מִכֶּ֖ם לֹא־תֹ֣אכַל דָּ֑ם וְהַגֵּ֛ר הַגָּ֥ר בְּתוֹכְכֶ֖ם לֹא־יֹ֥אכַל דָּֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'al-ken amar'tiy liv'ney yis'rael kal-nefesh mikem lo-tokhal dam v'hager hagar b'tvokh'khem lo-yokhal dam (s)
translation: Therefore I say to the Israelite people: No person among you shall partake of blood, nor shall the stranger who resides among you partake of blood.

hebrew: וְאִ֨ישׁ אִ֜ישׁ מִבְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וּמִן־הַגֵּר֙ הַגָּ֣ר בְּתוֹכָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצ֜וּד צֵ֥יד חַיָּ֛ה אוֹ־ע֖וֹף אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵאָכֵ֑ל וְשָׁפַךְ֙ אֶת־דָּמ֔וֹ וְכִסָּ֖הוּ בֶּעָפָֽר׃
transliteration: v'iysh iysh mib'ney yis'rael vmin-hager hagar b'tvokham asher yatzvd tzeyd chayah vo-'vof asher yeakhel v'shafakh' et-damvo v'khisahv be'afar
translation: And if any Israelite or any stranger who resides among them hunts down an animal or a bird that may be eaten, he shall pour out its blood and cover it with earth.

hebrew: כִּֽי־נֶ֣פֶשׁ כָּל־בָּשָׂ֗ר דָּמ֣וֹ בְנַפְשׁוֹ֮ הוּא֒ וָֽאֹמַר֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל דַּ֥ם כָּל־בָּשָׂ֖ר לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֑לוּ כִּ֣י נֶ֤פֶשׁ כָּל־בָּשָׂר֙ דָּמ֣וֹ הִ֔וא כָּל־אֹכְלָ֖יו יִכָּרֵֽת׃
transliteration: kiy-nefesh kal-basar damvo v'naf'shvo hv vaomar liv'ney yis'rael dam kal-basar lo tokhelv kiy nefesh kal-basar damvo hiv kal-okh'layv yikaret
translation: For the life of all flesh—its blood is its life. Therefore I say to the Israelite people: You shall not partake of the blood of any flesh, for the life of all flesh is its blood. Anyone who partakes of it shall be cut off.

hebrew: וְכָל־נֶ֗פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תֹּאכַ֤ל נְבֵלָה֙ וּטְרֵפָ֔ה בָּאֶזְרָ֖ח וּבַגֵּ֑ר וְכִבֶּ֨ס בְּגָדָ֜יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֛יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעֶ֖רֶב וְטָהֵֽר׃
transliteration: v'khal-nefesh asher tokhal n'velah vt'refah baez'rach vvager v'khibes b'gadayv v'rachatz bamayim v'tame 'ad-ha'erev v'taher
translation: Any person, whether citizen or stranger, who eats what has died or has been torn by beasts shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening; then he shall be clean.

hebrew: וְאִם֙ לֹ֣א יְכַבֵּ֔ס וּבְשָׂר֖וֹ לֹ֣א יִרְחָ֑ץ וְנָשָׂ֖א עֲוֺנֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'im lo y'khabes vv'sarvo lo yir'chatz v'nasa 'avonvo (f)
translation: But if he does not wash [his clothes] and bathe his body, he shall bear his guilt.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation:
Speak to the Israelite people and say to them:
I the LORD am your God.

hebrew: כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֧ה אֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֛יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְשַׁבְתֶּם־בָּ֖הּ לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ וּכְמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֶֽרֶץ־כְּנַ֡עַן אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲנִי֩ מֵבִ֨יא אֶתְכֶ֥ם שָׁ֙מָּה֙ לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּ וּבְחֻקֹּתֵיהֶ֖ם לֹ֥א תֵלֵֽכוּ׃
transliteration: k'ma'aseh eretz-mitz'rayim asher y'shav'tem-bah lo ta'asv vkh'ma'aseh eretz-k'na'an asher aniy meviy et'khem shamah lo ta'asv vv'chukoteyhem lo telekhv
translation: You shall not copy the practices of the land of Egypt where you dwelt, or of the land of Canaan to which I am taking you; nor shall you follow their laws.

hebrew: אֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֧י תַּעֲשׂ֛וּ וְאֶת־חֻקֹּתַ֥י תִּשְׁמְר֖וּ לָלֶ֣כֶת בָּהֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: et-mish'patay ta'asv v'et-chukotay tish'm'rv lalekhet bahem aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: My rules alone shall you observe, and faithfully follow My laws: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֤ם אֶת־חֻקֹּתַי֙ וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָ֛ם הָאָדָ֖ם וָחַ֣י בָּהֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem et-chukotay v'et-mish'patay asher ya'aseh otam haadam vachay bahem aniy y'hvah (s)
translation: You shall keep My laws and My rules, by the pursuit of which man shall live: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: אִ֥ישׁ אִישׁ֙ אֶל־כָּל־שְׁאֵ֣ר בְּשָׂר֔וֹ לֹ֥א תִקְרְב֖וּ לְגַלּ֣וֹת עֶרְוָ֑ה אֲנִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: iysh iysh el-kal-sh'er b'sarvo lo tik'r'vv l'galvot 'er'vah aniy y'hvah (s)
translation: None of you shall come near anyone of his own flesh to uncover nakedness: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אָבִ֛יךָ וְעֶרְוַ֥ת אִמְּךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה אִמְּךָ֣ הִ֔וא לֹ֥א תְגַלֶּ֖ה עֶרְוָתָֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'er'vat aviykha v'er'vat im'kha lo t'galeh im'kha hiv lo t'galeh 'er'vatah (s)
translation: aA man and his wife are one flesh (Gen. 2.24), even if he should die or divorce her.Your father’s nakedness, that is, the nakedness of your mother, you shall not uncover; she is your mother—you shall not uncover her nakedness.

hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אֵֽשֶׁת־אָבִ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה עֶרְוַ֥ת אָבִ֖יךָ הִֽוא׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'er'vat eshet-aviykha lo t'galeh 'er'vat aviykha hiv (s)
translation: Do not uncover the nakedness of your father’s wife;<sup class="endFootnote">-a</sup> it is the nakedness of your father.

hebrew: עֶרְוַ֨ת אֲחֽוֹתְךָ֤ בַת־אָבִ֙יךָ֙ א֣וֹ בַת־אִמֶּ֔ךָ מוֹלֶ֣דֶת בַּ֔יִת א֖וֹ מוֹלֶ֣דֶת ח֑וּץ לֹ֥א תְגַלֶּ֖ה עֶרְוָתָֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'er'vat achvot'kha vat-aviykha vo vat-imekha mvoledet bayit vo mvoledet chvtz lo t'galeh 'er'vatan (s)
translation: The nakedness of your sister—your father’s daughter or your mother’s, whether born into the household or outside—do not uncover their nakedness.

hebrew: עֶרְוַ֤ת בַּת־בִּנְךָ֙ א֣וֹ בַֽת־בִּתְּךָ֔ לֹ֥א תְגַלֶּ֖ה עֶרְוָתָ֑ן כִּ֥י עֶרְוָתְךָ֖ הֵֽנָּה׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'er'vat bat-bin'kha vo vat-bit'kha lo t'galeh 'er'vatan kiy 'er'vat'kha henah (s)
translation: The nakedness of your son’s daughter, or of your daughter’s daughter—do not uncover their nakedness; for their nakedness is yours.bMeaning uncertain.

hebrew: עֶרְוַ֨ת בַּת־אֵ֤שֶׁת אָבִ֙יךָ֙ מוֹלֶ֣דֶת אָבִ֔יךָ אֲחוֹתְךָ֖ הִ֑וא לֹ֥א תְגַלֶּ֖ה עֶרְוָתָֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'er'vat bat-eshet aviykha mvoledet aviykha achvot'kha hiv lo t'galeh 'er'vatah (s)
translation: The nakedness of your father’s wife’s daughter, who was born into your father’s household—she is your sister; do not uncover her nakedness.

hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אֲחוֹת־אָבִ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה שְׁאֵ֥ר אָבִ֖יךָ הִֽוא׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'er'vat achvot-aviykha lo t'galeh sh'er aviykha hiv (s)
translation: Do not uncover the nakedness of your father’s sister; she is your father’s flesh.

hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אֲחֽוֹת־אִמְּךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה כִּֽי־שְׁאֵ֥ר אִמְּךָ֖ הִֽוא׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'er'vat achvot-im'kha lo t'galeh kiy-sh'er im'kha hiv (s)
translation: Do not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister; for she is your mother’s flesh.

hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אֲחִֽי־אָבִ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה אֶל־אִשְׁתּוֹ֙ לֹ֣א תִקְרָ֔ב דֹּדָֽתְךָ֖ הִֽוא׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'er'vat achiy-aviykha lo t'galeh el-ish'tvo lo tik'rav dodat'kha hiv (s)
translation: Do not uncover the nakedness of your father’s brother: do not approach his wife; she is your aunt.

hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת כַּלָּֽתְךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה אֵ֤שֶׁת בִּנְךָ֙ הִ֔וא לֹ֥א תְגַלֶּ֖ה עֶרְוָתָֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'er'vat kalat'kha lo t'galeh eshet bin'kha hiv lo t'galeh 'er'vatah (s)
translation: Do not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law: she is your son’s wife; you shall not uncover her nakedness.

hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אֵֽשֶׁת־אָחִ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה עֶרְוַ֥ת אָחִ֖יךָ הִֽוא׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'er'vat eshet-achiykha lo t'galeh 'er'vat achiykha hiv (s)
translation: aA man and his wife are one flesh (Gen. 2.24), even if he should die or divorce her.Do not uncover the nakedness of your brother’s wife; it is the nakedness of your brother.-a

hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אִשָּׁ֛ה וּבִתָּ֖הּ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה אֶֽת־בַּת־בְּנָ֞הּ וְאֶת־בַּת־בִּתָּ֗הּ לֹ֤א תִקַּח֙ לְגַלּ֣וֹת עֶרְוָתָ֔הּ שַׁאֲרָ֥ה הֵ֖נָּה זִמָּ֥ה הִֽוא
transliteration: 'er'vat ishah vvitah lo t'galeh et-bat-b'nah v'et-bat-bitah lo tikach l'galvot 'er'vatah shaarah henah zimah hiv
translation: Do not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter; nor shall you marry her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter and uncover her nakedness: they are kindred; it is depravity.

hebrew: וְאִשָּׁ֥ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָ֖הּ לֹ֣א תִקָּ֑ח לִצְרֹ֗ר לְגַלּ֧וֹת עֶרְוָתָ֛הּ עָלֶ֖יהָ בְּחַיֶּֽיהָ׃
transliteration: v'ishah el-achotah lo tikach litz'ror l'galvot 'er'vatah 'aleyha b'chayeyha
translation: Do not marry a woman as a rival to her sister and uncover her nakedness in the other’s lifetime.

hebrew: וְאֶל־אִשָּׁ֖ה בְּנִדַּ֣ת טֻמְאָתָ֑הּ לֹ֣א תִקְרַ֔ב לְגַלּ֖וֹת עֶרְוָתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'el-ishah b'nidat tum'atah lo tik'rav l'galvot 'er'vatah
translation: Do not come near a woman during her period of uncleanness to uncover her nakedness.

hebrew: וְאֶל־אֵ֙שֶׁת֙ עֲמִֽיתְךָ֔ לֹא־תִתֵּ֥ן שְׁכָבְתְּךָ֖ לְזָ֑רַע לְטָמְאָה־בָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'el-eshet 'amiyt'kha lo-titen sh'khav't'kha l'zara' l'tam'ah-vah
translation: Do not have carnal relations with your neighbor’s wife and defile yourself with her.

hebrew: וּמִֽזַּרְעֲךָ֥ לֹא־תִתֵּ֖ן לְהַעֲבִ֣יר לַמֹּ֑לֶךְ וְלֹ֧א תְחַלֵּ֛ל אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vmizar'akha lo-titen l'ha'aviyr lamolekh' v'lo t'chalel et-shem eloheykha aniy y'hvah
translation: Do not allow any of your offspring to be offered up to Molech, and do not profane the name of your God: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְאֶ֨ת־זָכָ֔ר לֹ֥א תִשְׁכַּ֖ב מִשְׁכְּבֵ֣י אִשָּׁ֑ה תּוֹעֵבָ֖ה הִֽוא׃
transliteration: v'et-zakhar lo tish'kav mish'k'vey ishah tvo'evah hiv
translation: Do not lie with a male as one lies with a woman; it is an abhorrence.

hebrew: וּבְכָל־בְּהֵמָ֛ה לֹא־תִתֵּ֥ן שְׁכָבְתְּךָ֖ לְטָמְאָה־בָ֑הּ וְאִשָּׁ֗ה לֹֽא־תַעֲמֹ֞ד לִפְנֵ֧י בְהֵמָ֛ה לְרִבְעָ֖הּ תֶּ֥בֶל הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vv'khal-b'hemah lo-titen sh'khav't'kha l'tam'ah-vah v'ishah lo-ta'amod lif'ney v'hemah l'riv'ah tevel hv
translation: Do not have carnal relations with any beast and defile yourself thereby; and let no woman lend herself to a beast to mate with it; it is perversion.

hebrew: אַל־תִּֽטַּמְּא֖וּ בְּכָל־אֵ֑לֶּה כִּ֤י בְכָל־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ נִטְמְא֣וּ הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י מְשַׁלֵּ֖חַ מִפְּנֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: al-titam'v b'khal-eleh kiy v'khal-eleh nit'm'v hagvoyim asher-aniy m'shalecha mip'neykhem
translation: Do not defile yourselves in any of those ways, for it is by such that the nations that I am casting out before you defiled themselves.

hebrew: וַתִּטְמָ֣א הָאָ֔רֶץ וָאֶפְקֹ֥ד עֲוֺנָ֖הּ עָלֶ֑יהָ וַתָּקִ֥א הָאָ֖רֶץ אֶת־יֹשְׁבֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vatit'ma haaretz vaef'kod 'avonah 'aleyha vataki haaretz et-yosh'veyha
translation: Thus the land became defiled; and I called it to account for its iniquity, and the land spewed out its inhabitants.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֣ם אַתֶּ֗ם אֶת־חֻקֹּתַי֙ וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֔י וְלֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּ מִכֹּ֥ל הַתּוֹעֵבֹ֖ת הָאֵ֑לֶּה הָֽאֶזְרָ֔ח וְהַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֥ר בְּתוֹכְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem atem et-chukotay v'et-mish'patay v'lo ta'asv mikol hatvo'evot haeleh haez'rach v'hager hagar b'tvokh'khem
translation: But you must keep My laws and My rules, and you must not do any of those abhorrent things, neither the citizen nor the stranger who resides among you;

hebrew: כִּ֚י אֶת־כָּל־הַתּוֹעֵבֹ֣ת הָאֵ֔ל עָשׂ֥וּ אַנְשֵֽׁי־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לִפְנֵיכֶ֑ם וַתִּטְמָ֖א הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: kiy et-kal-hatvo'evot hael 'asv an'shey-haaretz asher lif'neykhem vatit'ma haaretz
translation: for all those abhorrent things were done by the people who were in the land before you, and the land became defiled.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תָקִ֤יא הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם בְּטַֽמַּאֲכֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑הּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר קָאָ֛ה אֶת־הַגּ֖וֹי אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִפְנֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'lo-takiy haaretz et'khem b'tamaakhem otah kaasher kaah et-hagvoy asher lif'neykhem
translation: So let not the land spew you out for defiling it, as it spewed out the nation that came before you.

hebrew: כִּ֚י כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַעֲשֶׂ֔ה מִכֹּ֥ל הַתּוֹעֵב֖וֹת הָאֵ֑לֶּה וְנִכְרְת֛וּ הַנְּפָשׁ֥וֹת הָעֹשֹׂ֖ת מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמָּֽם׃
transliteration: kiy kal-asher ya'aseh mikol hatvo'evvot haeleh v'nikh'r'tv han'fashvot ha'osot mikerev 'amam
translation: All who do any of those abhorrent things—such persons shall be cut off from their people.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֣ם אֶת־מִשְׁמַרְתִּ֗י לְבִלְתִּ֨י עֲשׂ֜וֹת מֵחֻקּ֤וֹת הַתּֽוֹעֵבֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נַעֲשׂ֣וּ לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תִֽטַּמְּא֖וּ בָּהֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem et-mish'mar'tiy l'vil'tiy 'asvot mechukvot hatvo'evot asher na'asv lif'neykhem v'lo titam'v bahem aniy y'hvah eloheykhem (f)
translation: You shall keep My charge not to engage in any of the abhorrent practices that were carried on before you, and you shall not defile yourselves through them: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־כָּל־עֲדַ֧ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֥ אֲלֵהֶ֖ם קְדֹשִׁ֣ים תִּהְי֑וּ כִּ֣י קָד֔וֹשׁ אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: daber el-kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem k'doshiym tih'yv kiy kadvosh aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation:
Speak to the whole Israelite community and say to them:
You shall be holy, for I, the LORD your God, am holy.

hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ אִמּ֤וֹ וְאָבִיו֙ תִּירָ֔אוּ וְאֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתַ֖י תִּשְׁמֹ֑רוּ אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: iysh imvo v'aviyv tiyrav v'et-shab'totay tish'morv aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: You shall each revere his mother and his father, and keep My sabbaths: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: אַל־תִּפְנוּ֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלִילִ֔ים וֵֽאלֹהֵי֙ מַסֵּכָ֔ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ לָכֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: al-tif'nv el-haeliyliym velohey masekhah lo ta'asv lakhem aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: Do not turn to idols or make molten gods for yourselves: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: וְכִ֧י תִזְבְּח֛וּ זֶ֥בַח שְׁלָמִ֖ים לַיהוָ֑ה לִֽרְצֹנְכֶ֖ם תִּזְבָּחֻֽהוּ׃
transliteration: v'khiy tiz'b'chv zevach sh'lamiym layhvah lir'tzon'khem tiz'bachuhv
translation: When you sacrifice an offering of well-being to the L<small>ORD</small>, sacrifice it so that it may be accepted on your behalf.

hebrew: בְּי֧וֹם זִבְחֲכֶ֛ם יֵאָכֵ֖ל וּמִֽמָּחֳרָ֑ת וְהַנּוֹתָר֙ עַד־י֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י בָּאֵ֖שׁ יִשָּׂרֵֽף׃
transliteration: b'yvom ziv'chakhem yeakhel vmimachorat v'hanvotar 'ad-yvom hash'liyshiy baesh yisaref
translation: It shall be eaten on the day you sacrifice it, or on the day following; but what is left by the third day must be consumed in fire.

hebrew: וְאִ֛ם הֵאָכֹ֥ל יֵאָכֵ֖ל בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י פִּגּ֥וּל ה֖וּא לֹ֥א יֵרָצֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'im heakhol yeakhel bayvom hash'liyshiy pigvl hv lo yeratzeh
translation: If it should be eaten on the third day, it is an offensive thing, it will not be acceptable.

hebrew: וְאֹֽכְלָיו֙ עֲוֺנ֣וֹ יִשָּׂ֔א כִּֽי־אֶת־קֹ֥דֶשׁ יְהוָ֖ה חִלֵּ֑ל וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵעַמֶּֽיהָ׃
transliteration: v'okh'layv 'avonvo yisa kiy-et-kodesh y'hvah chilel v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv me'ameyha
translation: And he who eats of it shall bear his guilt, for he has profaned what is sacred to the L<small>ORD</small>; that person shall be cut off from his kin.

hebrew: וּֽבְקֻצְרְכֶם֙ אֶת־קְצִ֣יר אַרְצְכֶ֔ם לֹ֧א תְכַלֶּ֛ה פְּאַ֥ת שָׂדְךָ֖ לִקְצֹ֑ר וְלֶ֥קֶט קְצִֽירְךָ֖ לֹ֥א תְלַקֵּֽט׃
transliteration: vv'kutz'r'khem et-k'tziyr ar'tz'khem lo t'khaleh p'at sad'kha lik'tzor v'leket k'tziyr'kha lo t'laket
translation: When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap all the way to the edges of your field, or gather the gleanings of your harvest.

hebrew: וְכַרְמְךָ֙ לֹ֣א תְעוֹלֵ֔ל וּפֶ֥רֶט כַּרְמְךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְלַקֵּ֑ט לֶֽעָנִ֤י וְלַגֵּר֙ תַּעֲזֹ֣ב אֹתָ֔ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'khar'm'kha lo t'volel vferet kar'm'kha lo t'laket le'aniy v'lager ta'azov otam aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: You shall not pick your vineyard bare, or gather the fallen fruit of your vineyard; you shall leave them for the poor and the stranger: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: לֹ֖א תִּגְנֹ֑בוּ וְלֹא־תְכַחֲשׁ֥וּ וְלֹֽא־תְשַׁקְּר֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ בַּעֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: lo tig'novv v'lo-t'khachashv v'lo-t'shak'rv iysh ba'amiytvo
translation: You shall not steal; you shall not deal deceitfully or falsely with one another.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תִשָּׁבְע֥וּ בִשְׁמִ֖י לַשָּׁ֑קֶר וְחִלַּלְתָּ֛ אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'lo-tishav'v vish'miy lashaker v'chilal'ta et-shem eloheykha aniy y'hvah
translation: You shall not swear falsely by My name, profaning the name of your God: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תַעֲשֹׁ֥ק אֶת־רֵֽעֲךָ֖ וְלֹ֣א תִגְזֹ֑ל לֹֽא־תָלִ֞ין פְּעֻלַּ֥ת שָׂכִ֛יר אִתְּךָ֖ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
transliteration: lo-ta'ashok et-re'akha v'lo tig'zol lo-taliyn p'ulat sakhiyr it'kha 'ad-boker
translation: You shall not defraud your fellow. You shall not commit robbery. The wages of a laborer shall not remain with you until morning.

hebrew: לֹא־תְקַלֵּ֣ל חֵרֵ֔שׁ וְלִפְנֵ֣י עִוֵּ֔ר לֹ֥א תִתֵּ֖ן מִכְשֹׁ֑ל וְיָרֵ֥אתָ מֵּאֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: lo-t'kalel cheresh v'lif'ney 'iver lo titen mikh'shol v'yareta meeloheykha aniy y'hvah
translation: You shall not insult the deaf, or place a stumbling block before the blind. You shall fear your God: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: לֹא־תַעֲשׂ֥וּ עָ֙וֶל֙ בַּמִּשְׁפָּ֔ט לֹא־תִשָּׂ֣א פְנֵי־דָ֔ל וְלֹ֥א תֶהְדַּ֖ר פְּנֵ֣י גָד֑וֹל בְּצֶ֖דֶק תִּשְׁפֹּ֥ט עֲמִיתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: lo-ta'asv 'avel bamish'pat lo-tisa f'ney-dal v'lo teh'dar p'ney gadvol b'tzedek tish'pot 'amiytekha
translation: You shall not render an unfair decision: do not favor the poor or show deference to the rich; judge your kinsman fairly.

hebrew: לֹא־תֵלֵ֤ךְ רָכִיל֙ בְּעַמֶּ֔יךָ לֹ֥א תַעֲמֹ֖ד עַל־דַּ֣ם רֵעֶ֑ךָ אֲנִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: lo-telekh' rakhiyl b'ameykha lo ta'amod 'al-dam re'ekha aniy y'hvah
translation: Do not aOthers “go about as a talebearer among”; meaning of Heb. uncertain.deal basely with-a your countrymen. Do not bLit. “stand upon”; precise meaning of Heb. phrase uncertain.profit by-b the blood of your fellow: I am the LORD.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תִשְׂנָ֥א אֶת־אָחִ֖יךָ בִּלְבָבֶ֑ךָ הוֹכֵ֤חַ תּוֹכִ֙יחַ֙ אֶת־עֲמִיתֶ֔ךָ וְלֹא־תִשָּׂ֥א עָלָ֖יו חֵֽטְא׃
transliteration: lo-tis'na et-achiykha bil'vavekha hvokhecha tvokhiycha et-'amiytekha v'lo-tisa 'alayv chet'
translation: You shall not hate your kinsfolk in your heart. Reprove your kinsman butcExact force of we-uncertain. incur no guilt because of him.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תִקֹּ֤ם וְלֹֽא־תִטֹּר֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י עַמֶּ֔ךָ וְאָֽהַבְתָּ֥ לְרֵעֲךָ֖ כָּמ֑וֹךָ אֲנִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: lo-tikom v'lo-titor et-b'ney 'amekha v'ahav'ta l're'akha kamvokha aniy y'hvah
translation: You shall not take vengeance or bear a grudge against your countrymen. Love your fellow as yourself: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: אֶֽת־חֻקֹּתַי֮ תִּשְׁמֹרוּ֒ בְּהֶמְתְּךָ֙ לֹא־תַרְבִּ֣יעַ כִּלְאַ֔יִם שָׂדְךָ֖ לֹא־תִזְרַ֣ע כִּלְאָ֑יִם וּבֶ֤גֶד כִּלְאַ֙יִם֙ שַֽׁעַטְנֵ֔ז לֹ֥א יַעֲלֶ֖ה עָלֶֽיךָ׃ (פ)
transliteration: et-chukotay tish'morv b'hem't'kha lo-tar'biy'a kil'ayim sad'kha lo-tiz'ra' kil'ayim vveged kil'ayim sha'at'nez lo ya'aleh 'aleykha (f)
translation:
You shall observe My laws.
You shall not let your cattle mate with a different kind; you shall not sow your field with two kinds of seed; you shall not put on cloth from a mixture of two kinds of material.

hebrew: וְ֠אִישׁ כִּֽי־יִשְׁכַּ֨ב אֶת־אִשָּׁ֜ה שִׁכְבַת־זֶ֗רַע וְהִ֤וא שִׁפְחָה֙ נֶחֱרֶ֣פֶת לְאִ֔ישׁ וְהָפְדֵּה֙ לֹ֣א נִפְדָּ֔תָה א֥וֹ חֻפְשָׁ֖ה לֹ֣א נִתַּן־לָ֑הּ בִּקֹּ֧רֶת תִּהְיֶ֛ה לֹ֥א יוּמְת֖וּ כִּי־לֹ֥א חֻפָּֽשָׁה׃
transliteration: v'iysh kiy-yish'kav et-ishah shikh'vat-zera' v'hiv shif'chah necherefet l'iysh v'haf'deh lo nif'datah vo chuf'shah lo nitan-lah bikoret tih'yeh lo yvm'tv kiy-lo chupashah
translation: If a man has carnal relations with a woman who is a slave and has been designated for another man, but has not been redeemed or given her freedom, there shall be an indemnity; they shall not, however, be put to death, since she has not been freed.

hebrew: וְהֵבִ֤יא אֶת־אֲשָׁמוֹ֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד אֵ֖יל אָשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: v'heviy et-ashamvo layhvah el-petach ohel mvo'ed eyl asham
translation: But he must bring to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, as his guilt offering to the L<small>ORD</small>, a ram of guilt offering.

hebrew: וְכִפֶּר֩ עָלָ֨יו הַכֹּהֵ֜ן בְּאֵ֤יל הָֽאָשָׁם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה עַל־חַטָּאת֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטָ֑א וְנִסְלַ֣ח ל֔וֹ מֵחַטָּאת֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטָֽא׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'khiper 'alayv hakohen b'eyl haasham lif'ney y'hvah 'al-chatatvo asher chata v'nis'lach lvo mechatatvo asher chata (f)
translation: With the ram of guilt offering the priest shall make expiation for him before the L<small>ORD</small> for the sin that he committed; and the sin that he committed will be forgiven him.

hebrew: וְכִי־תָבֹ֣אוּ אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ וּנְטַעְתֶּם֙ כָּל־עֵ֣ץ מַאֲכָ֔ל וַעֲרַלְתֶּ֥ם עָרְלָת֖וֹ אֶת־פִּרְי֑וֹ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֗ים יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֛ם עֲרֵלִ֖ים לֹ֥א יֵאָכֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'khiy-tavov el-haaretz vn'ta'tem kal-'etz maakhal va'aral'tem 'ar'latvo et-pir'yvo shalosh shaniym yih'yeh lakhem 'areliym lo yeakhel
translation: When you enter the land and plant any tree for food, you shall regard its fruit as forbidden.dHeb. root ‘rl, commonly “to be uncircumcised.” Three years it shall be forbidden-d for you, not to be eaten.

hebrew: וּבַשָּׁנָה֙ הָרְבִיעִ֔ת יִהְיֶ֖ה כָּל־פִּרְי֑וֹ קֹ֥דֶשׁ הִלּוּלִ֖ים לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vvashanah har'viy'it yih'yeh kal-pir'yvo kodesh hilvliym layhvah
translation: In the fourth year all its fruit shall be set aside for jubilation before the L<small>ORD</small>;

hebrew: וּבַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַחֲמִישִׁ֗ת תֹּֽאכְלוּ֙ אֶת־פִּרְי֔וֹ לְהוֹסִ֥יף לָכֶ֖ם תְּבוּאָת֑וֹ אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vvashanah hachamiyshit tokh'lv et-pir'yvo l'hvosiyf lakhem t'vvatvo aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: and only in the fifth year may you use its fruit—that its yield to you may be increased: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: לֹ֥א תֹאכְל֖וּ עַל־הַדָּ֑ם לֹ֥א תְנַחֲשׁ֖וּ וְלֹ֥א תְעוֹנֵֽנוּ׃
transliteration: lo tokh'lv 'al-hadam lo t'nachashv v'lo t'vonenv
translation: You shall not eat anything with its blood. You shall not practice divination or soothsaying.

hebrew: לֹ֣א תַקִּ֔פוּ פְּאַ֖ת רֹאשְׁכֶ֑ם וְלֹ֣א תַשְׁחִ֔ית אֵ֖ת פְּאַ֥ת זְקָנֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: lo takifv p'at rosh'khem v'lo tash'chiyt et p'at z'kanekha
translation: You shall not round off the side-growth on your head, or destroy the side-growth of your beard.

hebrew: וְשֶׂ֣רֶט לָנֶ֗פֶשׁ לֹ֤א תִתְּנוּ֙ בִּבְשַׂרְכֶ֔ם וּכְתֹ֣בֶת קַֽעֲקַ֔ע לֹ֥א תִתְּנ֖וּ בָּכֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'seret lanefesh lo tit'nv biv'sar'khem vkh'tovet ka'aka' lo tit'nv bakhem aniy y'hvah
translation: You shall not make gashes in your flesh for the dead, or incise any marks on yourselves: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: אַל־תְּחַלֵּ֥ל אֶֽת־בִּתְּךָ֖ לְהַזְנוֹתָ֑הּ וְלֹא־תִזְנֶ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ וּמָלְאָ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ זִמָּֽה׃
transliteration: al-t'chalel et-bit'kha l'haz'nvotah v'lo-tiz'neh haaretz vmal'ah haaretz zimah
translation: Do not degrade your daughter and make her a harlot, lest the land fall into harlotry and the land be filled with depravity.

hebrew: אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתַ֣י תִּשְׁמֹ֔רוּ וּמִקְדָּשִׁ֖י תִּירָ֑אוּ אֲנִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: et-shab'totay tish'morv vmik'dashiy tiyrav aniy y'hvah
translation: You shall keep My sabbaths and venerate My sanctuary: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: אַל־תִּפְנ֤וּ אֶל־הָאֹבֹת֙ וְאֶל־הַיִּדְּעֹנִ֔ים אַל־תְּבַקְשׁ֖וּ לְטָמְאָ֣ה בָהֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: al-tif'nv el-haovot v'el-hayid'oniym al-t'vak'shv l'tam'ah vahem aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: Do not turn to ghosts and do not inquire of familiar spirits, to be defiled by them: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: מִפְּנֵ֤י שֵׂיבָה֙ תָּק֔וּם וְהָדַרְתָּ֖ פְּנֵ֣י זָקֵ֑ן וְיָרֵ֥אתָ מֵּאֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: mip'ney seyvah takvm v'hadar'ta p'ney zaken v'yareta meeloheykha aniy y'hvah (f)
translation: You shall rise before the aged and show deference to the old; you shall fear your God: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָג֧וּר אִתְּךָ֛ גֵּ֖ר בְּאַרְצְכֶ֑ם לֹ֥א תוֹנ֖וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yagvr it'kha ger b'ar'tz'khem lo tvonv otvo
translation: When a stranger resides with you in your land, you shall not wrong him.

hebrew: כְּאֶזְרָ֣ח מִכֶּם֩ יִהְיֶ֨ה לָכֶ֜ם הַגֵּ֣ר ׀ הַגָּ֣ר אִתְּכֶ֗ם וְאָהַבְתָּ֥ לוֹ֙ כָּמ֔וֹךָ כִּֽי־גֵרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: k'ez'rach mikem yih'yeh lakhem hager  hagar it'khem v'ahav'ta lvo kamvokha kiy-geriym heyiytem b'eretz mitz'rayim aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: The stranger who resides with you shall be to you as one of your citizens; you shall love him as yourself, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: לֹא־תַעֲשׂ֥וּ עָ֖וֶל בַּמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט בַּמִּדָּ֕ה בַּמִּשְׁקָ֖ל וּבַמְּשׂוּרָֽה׃
transliteration: lo-ta'asv 'avel bamish'pat bamidah bamish'kal vvam'svrah
translation: You shall not falsify measures of length, weight, or capacity.

hebrew: מֹ֧אזְנֵי צֶ֣דֶק אַבְנֵי־צֶ֗דֶק אֵ֥יפַת צֶ֛דֶק וְהִ֥ין צֶ֖דֶק יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם אֲנִי֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: moz'ney tzedek av'ney-tzedek eyfat tzedek v'hiyn tzedek yih'yeh lakhem aniy y'hvah eloheykhem asher-hvotzetiy et'khem meeretz mitz'rayim
translation:
You shall have an honest balance, honest weights, an honest ephah, and an honest hin.
I the LORD am your God who freed you from the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֤ם אֶת־כָּל־חֻקֹּתַי֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־מִשְׁפָּטַ֔י וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem et-kal-chukotay v'et-kal-mish'patay va'asiytem otam aniy y'hvah (f)
translation: You shall faithfully observe all My laws and all My rules: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses:

hebrew: וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֘ל תֹּאמַר֒ אִ֣ישׁ אִישׁ֩ מִבְּנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל וּמִן־הַגֵּ֣ר ׀ הַגָּ֣ר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֧ן מִזַּרְע֛וֹ לַמֹּ֖לֶךְ מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֑ת עַ֥ם הָאָ֖רֶץ יִרְגְּמֻ֥הוּ בָאָֽבֶן׃
transliteration: v'el-b'ney yis'rael tomar iysh iysh mib'ney yis'rael vmin-hager  hagar b'yis'rael asher yiten mizar'vo lamolekh' mvot yvmat 'am haaretz yir'g'muhv vaaven
translation:
Say further to the Israelite people:
Anyone among the Israelites, or among the strangers residing in Israel, who gives any of his offspring to Molech, shall be put to death; the people of the land shall pelt him with stones.

hebrew: וַאֲנִ֞י אֶתֵּ֤ן אֶת־פָּנַי֙ בָּאִ֣ישׁ הַה֔וּא וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י אֹת֖וֹ מִקֶּ֣רֶב עַמּ֑וֹ כִּ֤י מִזַּרְעוֹ֙ נָתַ֣ן לַמֹּ֔לֶךְ לְמַ֗עַן טַמֵּא֙ אֶת־מִקְדָּשִׁ֔י וּלְחַלֵּ֖ל אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם קָדְשִֽׁי׃
transliteration: vaaniy eten et-panay baiysh hahv v'hikh'ratiy otvo mikerev 'amvo kiy mizar'vo natan lamolekh' l'ma'an tame et-mik'dashiy vl'chalel et-shem kad'shiy
translation: And I will set My face against that man and will cut him off from among his people, because he gave of his offspring to Molech and so defiled My sanctuary and profaned My holy name.

hebrew: וְאִ֡ם הַעְלֵ֣ם יַעְלִימֽוּ֩ עַ֨ם הָאָ֜רֶץ אֶת־עֵֽינֵיהֶם֙ מִן־הָאִ֣ישׁ הַה֔וּא בְּתִתּ֥וֹ מִזַּרְע֖וֹ לַמֹּ֑לֶךְ לְבִלְתִּ֖י הָמִ֥ית אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im ha'lem ya'liymv 'am haaretz et-'eyneyhem min-haiysh hahv b'titvo mizar'vo lamolekh' l'vil'tiy hamiyt otvo
translation: And if the people of the land should shut their eyes to that man when he gives of his offspring to Molech, and should not put him to death,

hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֨י אֲנִ֧י אֶת־פָּנַ֛י בָּאִ֥ישׁ הַה֖וּא וּבְמִשְׁפַּחְתּ֑וֹ וְהִכְרַתִּ֨י אֹת֜וֹ וְאֵ֣ת ׀ כָּל־הַזֹּנִ֣ים אַחֲרָ֗יו לִזְנ֛וֹת אַחֲרֵ֥י הַמֹּ֖לֶךְ מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמָּֽם׃
transliteration: v'sam'tiy aniy et-panay baiysh hahv vv'mish'pach'tvo v'hikh'ratiy otvo v'et  kal-hazoniym acharayv liz'nvot acharey hamolekh' mikerev 'amam
translation: I Myself will set My face against that man and his kin, and will cut off from among their people both him and all who follow him in going astray after Molech.

hebrew: וְהַנֶּ֗פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּפְנֶ֤ה אֶל־הָֽאֹבֹת֙ וְאֶל־הַיִּדְּעֹנִ֔ים לִזְנ֖וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֤י אֶת־פָּנַי֙ בַּנֶּ֣פֶשׁ הַהִ֔וא וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י אֹת֖וֹ מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'hanefesh asher tif'neh el-haovot v'el-hayid'oniym liz'nvot achareyhem v'natatiy et-panay banefesh hahiv v'hikh'ratiy otvo mikerev 'amvo
translation: And if any person turns to ghosts and familiar spirits and goes astray after them, I will set My face against that person and cut him off from among his people.

hebrew: וְהִ֨תְקַדִּשְׁתֶּ֔ם וִהְיִיתֶ֖ם קְדֹשִׁ֑ים כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hit'kadish'tem vih'yiytem k'doshiym kiy aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: You shall sanctify yourselves and be holy, for I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־חֻקֹּתַ֔י וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה מְקַדִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem et-chukotay va'asiytem otam aniy y'hvah m'kadish'khem
translation: You shall faithfully observe My laws: I the L<small>ORD</small> make you holy.

hebrew: כִּֽי־אִ֣ישׁ אִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְקַלֵּ֧ל אֶת־אָבִ֛יו וְאֶת־אִמּ֖וֹ מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֑ת אָבִ֧יו וְאִמּ֛וֹ קִלֵּ֖ל דָּמָ֥יו בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kiy-iysh iysh asher y'kalel et-aviyv v'et-imvo mvot yvmat aviyv v'imvo kilel damayv bvo
translation: If anyone insults his father or his mother, he shall be put to death; he has insulted his father and his mother—his bloodguilt is upon him.

hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִנְאַף֙ אֶת־אֵ֣שֶׁת אִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִנְאַ֖ף אֶת־אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֵ֑הוּ מֽוֹת־יוּמַ֥ת הַנֹּאֵ֖ף וְהַנֹּאָֽפֶת׃
transliteration: v'iysh asher yin'af et-eshet iysh asher yin'af et-eshet re'ehv mvot-yvmat hanoef v'hanoafet
translation: If a man commits adultery with a married woman, committing adultery with another man’s wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall be put to death.

hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁכַּב֙ אֶת־אֵ֣שֶׁת אָבִ֔יו עֶרְוַ֥ת אָבִ֖יו גִּלָּ֑ה מֽוֹת־יוּמְת֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם דְּמֵיהֶ֥ם בָּֽם׃
transliteration: v'iysh asher yish'kav et-eshet aviyv 'er'vat aviyv gilah mvot-yvm'tv sh'neyhem d'meyhem bam
translation: If a man lies with his father’s wife, it is the nakedness of his father that he has uncovered; the two shall be put to death—their bloodguilt is upon them.

hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁכַּב֙ אֶת־כַּלָּת֔וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמְת֖וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם תֶּ֥בֶל עָשׂ֖וּ דְּמֵיהֶ֥ם בָּֽם׃
transliteration: v'iysh asher yish'kav et-kalatvo mvot yvm'tv sh'neyhem tevel 'asv d'meyhem bam
translation: If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall be put to death; they have committed incest—their bloodguilt is upon them.

hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁכַּ֤ב אֶת־זָכָר֙ מִשְׁכְּבֵ֣י אִשָּׁ֔ה תּוֹעֵבָ֥ה עָשׂ֖וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם מ֥וֹת יוּמָ֖תוּ דְּמֵיהֶ֥ם בָּֽם׃
transliteration: v'iysh asher yish'kav et-zakhar mish'k'vey ishah tvo'evah 'asv sh'neyhem mvot yvmatv d'meyhem bam
translation: If a man lies with a male as one lies with a woman, the two of them have done an abhorrent thing; they shall be put to death—their bloodguilt is upon them.

hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִקַּ֧ח אֶת־אִשָּׁ֛ה וְאֶת־אִמָּ֖הּ זִמָּ֣ה הִ֑וא בָּאֵ֞שׁ יִשְׂרְפ֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ וְאֶתְהֶ֔ן וְלֹא־תִהְיֶ֥ה זִמָּ֖ה בְּתוֹכְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'iysh asher yikach et-ishah v'et-imah zimah hiv baesh yis'r'fv otvo v'et'hen v'lo-tih'yeh zimah b'tvokh'khem
translation: If a man marries a woman and her mother, it is depravity; both he and they shall be put to the fire, that there be no depravity among you.

hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֧ן שְׁכָבְתּ֛וֹ בִּבְהֵמָ֖ה מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֑ת וְאֶת־הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה תַּהֲרֹֽגוּ׃
transliteration: v'iysh asher yiten sh'khav'tvo biv'hemah mvot yvmat v'et-hab'hemah taharogv
translation: If a man has carnal relations with a beast, he shall be put to death; and you shall kill the beast.

hebrew: וְאִשָּׁ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּקְרַ֤ב אֶל־כָּל־בְּהֵמָה֙ לְרִבְעָ֣ה אֹתָ֔הּ וְהָרַגְתָּ֥ אֶת־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה וְאֶת־הַבְּהֵמָ֑ה מ֥וֹת יוּמָ֖תוּ דְּמֵיהֶ֥ם בָּֽם׃
transliteration: v'ishah asher tik'rav el-kal-b'hemah l'riv'ah otah v'harag'ta et-haishah v'et-hab'hemah mvot yvmatv d'meyhem bam
translation: If a woman approaches any beast to mate with it, you shall kill the woman and the beast; they shall be put to death—their bloodguilt is upon them.

hebrew: וְאִ֣ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִקַּ֣ח אֶת־אֲחֹת֡וֹ בַּת־אָבִ֣יו א֣וֹ בַת־אִ֠מּוֹ וְרָאָ֨ה אֶת־עֶרְוָתָ֜הּ וְהִֽיא־תִרְאֶ֤ה אֶת־עֶרְוָתוֹ֙ חֶ֣סֶד ה֔וּא וְנִ֨כְרְת֔וּ לְעֵינֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י עַמָּ֑ם עֶרְוַ֧ת אֲחֹת֛וֹ גִּלָּ֖ה עֲוֺנ֥וֹ יִשָּֽׂא׃
transliteration: v'iysh asher-yikach et-achotvo bat-aviyv vo vat-imvo v'raah et-'er'vatah v'hiy-tir'eh et-'er'vatvo chesed hv v'nikh'r'tv l'eyney b'ney 'amam 'er'vat achotvo gilah 'avonvo yisa
translation: If a man marries his sister, the daughter of either his father or his mother, so that he sees her nakedness and she sees his nakedness, it is a disgrace; they shall be excommunicatedaLit. “cut off.” in the sight of their kinsfolk. He has uncovered the nakedness of his sister, he shall bear his guilt.

hebrew: וְ֠אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִשְׁכַּ֨ב אֶת־אִשָּׁ֜ה דָּוָ֗ה וְגִלָּ֤ה אֶת־עֶרְוָתָהּ֙ אֶת־מְקֹרָ֣הּ הֶֽעֱרָ֔ה וְהִ֕יא גִּלְּתָ֖ה אֶת־מְק֣וֹר דָּמֶ֑יהָ וְנִכְרְת֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמָּֽם׃
transliteration: v'iysh asher-yish'kav et-ishah davah v'gilah et-'er'vatah et-m'korah he'erah v'hiy gil'tah et-m'kvor dameyha v'nikh'r'tv sh'neyhem mikerev 'amam
translation: If a man lies with a woman in her infirmity and uncovers her nakedness, he has laid bare her flow and she has exposed her blood flow; both of them shall be cut off from among their people.

hebrew: וְעֶרְוַ֨ת אֲח֧וֹת אִמְּךָ֛ וַאֲח֥וֹת אָבִ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה כִּ֧י אֶת־שְׁאֵר֛וֹ הֶעֱרָ֖ה עֲוֺנָ֥ם יִשָּֽׂאוּ׃
transliteration: v'er'vat achvot im'kha vaachvot aviykha lo t'galeh kiy et-sh'ervo he'erah 'avonam yisav
translation: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister or of your father’s sister, for that is laying bare one’s own flesh; they shall bear their guilt.

hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁכַּב֙ אֶת־דֹּ֣דָת֔וֹ עֶרְוַ֥ת דֹּד֖וֹ גִּלָּ֑ה חֶטְאָ֥ם יִשָּׂ֖אוּ עֲרִירִ֥ים יָמֻֽתוּ׃
transliteration: v'iysh asher yish'kav et-dodatvo 'er'vat dodvo gilah chet'am yisav 'ariyriym yamutv
translation: If a man lies with his uncle’s wife, it is his uncle’s nakedness that he has uncovered. They shall bear their guilt: they shall die childless.

hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִקַּ֛ח אֶת־אֵ֥שֶׁת אָחִ֖יו נִדָּ֣ה הִ֑וא עֶרְוַ֥ת אָחִ֛יו גִּלָּ֖ה עֲרִירִ֥ים יִהְיֽוּ׃
transliteration: v'iysh asher yikach et-eshet achiyv nidah hiv 'er'vat achiyv gilah 'ariyriym yih'yv
translation: If a man marries the wife of his brother, it is indecency. It is the nakedness of his brother that he has uncovered; they shall remain childless.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֤ם אֶת־כָּל־חֻקֹּתַי֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־מִשְׁפָּטַ֔י וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם וְלֹא־תָקִ֤יא אֶתְכֶם֙ הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲנִ֜י מֵבִ֥יא אֶתְכֶ֛ם שָׁ֖מָּה לָשֶׁ֥בֶת בָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem et-kal-chukotay v'et-kal-mish'patay va'asiytem otam v'lo-takiy et'khem haaretz asher aniy meviy et'khem shamah lashevet bah
translation: You shall faithfully observe all My laws and all My regulations, lest the land to which I bring you to settle in spew you out.

hebrew: וְלֹ֤א תֵֽלְכוּ֙ בְּחֻקֹּ֣ת הַגּ֔וֹי אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י מְשַׁלֵּ֖חַ מִפְּנֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֤י אֶת־כָּל־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ עָשׂ֔וּ וָאָקֻ֖ץ בָּֽם׃
transliteration: v'lo tel'khv b'chukot hagvoy asher-aniy m'shalecha mip'neykhem kiy et-kal-eleh 'asv vaakutz bam
translation: You shall not follow the practices of the nation that I am driving out before you. For it is because they did all these things that I abhorred them

hebrew: וָאֹמַ֣ר לָכֶ֗ם אַתֶּם֮ תִּֽירְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־אַדְמָתָם֒ וַאֲנִ֞י אֶתְּנֶ֤נָּה לָכֶם֙ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אֹתָ֔הּ אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָ֑שׁ אֲנִי֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הִבְדַּ֥לְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִן־הָֽעַמִּֽים׃
transliteration: vaomar lakhem atem tiyr'shv et-ad'matam vaaniy et'nenah lakhem lareshet otah eretz zavat chalav vd'vash aniy y'hvah eloheykhem asher-hiv'dal'tiy et'khem min-ha'amiym
translation: and said to you: You shall possess their land, for I will give it to you to possess, a land flowing with milk and honey. I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God who has set you apart from other peoples.

hebrew: וְהִבְדַּלְתֶּ֞ם בֵּֽין־הַבְּהֵמָ֤ה הַטְּהֹרָה֙ לַטְּמֵאָ֔ה וּבֵין־הָע֥וֹף הַטָּמֵ֖א לַטָּהֹ֑ר וְלֹֽא־תְשַׁקְּצ֨וּ אֶת־נַפְשֹֽׁתֵיכֶ֜ם בַּבְּהֵמָ֣ה וּבָע֗וֹף וּבְכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּרְמֹ֣שׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הִבְדַּ֥לְתִּי לָכֶ֖ם לְטַמֵּֽא׃
transliteration: v'hiv'dal'tem beyn-hab'hemah hat'horah lat'meah vveyn-ha'vof hatame latahor v'lo-t'shak'tzv et-naf'shoteykhem bab'hemah vva'vof vv'khol asher tir'mos haadamah asher-hiv'dal'tiy lakhem l'tame
translation: So you shall set apart the clean beast from the unclean, the unclean bird from the clean. You shall not draw abomination upon yourselves through beast or bird or anything with which the ground is alive, which I have set apart for you to treat as unclean.

hebrew: וִהְיִ֤יתֶם לִי֙ קְדֹשִׁ֔ים כִּ֥י קָד֖וֹשׁ אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וָאַבְדִּ֥ל אֶתְכֶ֛ם מִן־הָֽעַמִּ֖ים לִהְי֥וֹת לִֽי׃
transliteration: vih'yiytem liy k'doshiym kiy kadvosh aniy y'hvah vaav'dil et'khem min-ha'amiym lih'yvot liy
translation: You shall be holy to Me, for I the L<small>ORD</small> am holy, and I have set you apart from other peoples to be Mine.

hebrew: וְאִ֣ישׁ אֽוֹ־אִשָּׁ֗ה כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֨ה בָהֶ֥ם א֛וֹב א֥וֹ יִדְּעֹנִ֖י מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֑תוּ בָּאֶ֛בֶן יִרְגְּמ֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם דְּמֵיהֶ֥ם בָּֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'iysh vo-ishah kiy-yih'yeh vahem vov vo yid'oniy mvot yvmatv baeven yir'g'mv otam d'meyhem bam (f)
translation: A man or a woman who has a ghost or a familiar spirit shall be put to death; they shall be pelted with stones—their bloodguilt shall be upon them.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֱמֹ֥ר אֶל־הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֑ן וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם לְנֶ֥פֶשׁ לֹֽא־יִטַּמָּ֖א בְּעַמָּֽיו׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh emor el-hakohaniym b'ney aharon v'amar'ta alehem l'nefesh lo-yitama b'amayv
translation:
The LORD said to Moses: Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them:
None shall defile himself for any [dead] person among his kin,

hebrew: כִּ֚י אִם־לִשְׁאֵר֔וֹ הַקָּרֹ֖ב אֵלָ֑יו לְאִמּ֣וֹ וּלְאָבִ֔יו וְלִבְנ֥וֹ וּלְבִתּ֖וֹ וּלְאָחִֽיו׃
transliteration: kiy im-lish'ervo hakarov elayv l'imvo vl'aviyv v'liv'nvo vl'vitvo vl'achiyv
translation: except for the relatives that are closest to him: his mother, his father, his son, his daughter, and his brother;

hebrew: וְלַאֲחֹת֤וֹ הַבְּתוּלָה֙ הַקְּרוֹבָ֣ה אֵלָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־הָיְתָ֖ה לְאִ֑ישׁ לָ֖הּ יִטַּמָּֽא׃
transliteration: v'laachotvo hab'tvlah hak'rvovah elayv asher lo-hay'tah l'iysh lah yitama
translation: also for a virgin sister, close to him because she has not married, for her he may defile himself.

hebrew: לֹ֥א יִטַּמָּ֖א בַּ֣עַל בְּעַמָּ֑יו לְהֵ֖חַלּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: lo yitama ba'al b'amayv l'hechalvo
translation: But he shall not defile himself aLit. “as a husband among his kin”; meaning uncertain.as a kinsman by marriage,-a and so profane himself.

hebrew: לֹֽא־יקרחה [יִקְרְח֤וּ] קָרְחָה֙ בְּרֹאשָׁ֔ם וּפְאַ֥ת זְקָנָ֖ם לֹ֣א יְגַלֵּ֑חוּ וּבִ֨בְשָׂרָ֔ם לֹ֥א יִשְׂרְט֖וּ שָׂרָֽטֶת׃
transliteration: lo-ykrchh [yik'r'chv] kar'chah b'rosham vf'at z'kanam lo y'galechv vviv'saram lo yis'r'tv saratet
translation: They shall not shave smooth any part of their heads, or cut the side-growth of their beards, or make gashes in their flesh.

hebrew: קְדֹשִׁ֤ים יִהְיוּ֙ לֵאלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם וְלֹ֣א יְחַלְּל֔וּ שֵׁ֖ם אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם כִּי֩ אֶת־אִשֵּׁ֨י יְהוָ֜ה לֶ֧חֶם אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֛ם הֵ֥ם מַקְרִיבִ֖ם וְהָ֥יוּ קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: k'doshiym yih'yv leloheyhem v'lo y'chal'lv shem eloheyhem kiy et-ishey y'hvah lechem eloheyhem hem mak'riyvim v'hayv kodesh
translation: They shall be holy to their God and not profane the name of their God; for they offer the L<small>ORD</small>’s offerings by fire, the food of their God, and so must be holy.

hebrew: אִשָּׁ֨ה זֹנָ֤ה וַחֲלָלָה֙ לֹ֣א יִקָּ֔חוּ וְאִשָּׁ֛ה גְּרוּשָׁ֥ה מֵאִישָׁ֖הּ לֹ֣א יִקָּ֑חוּ כִּֽי־קָדֹ֥שׁ ה֖וּא לֵאלֹהָֽיו׃
transliteration: ishah zonah vachalalah lo yikachv v'ishah g'rvshah meiyshah lo yikachv kiy-kadosh hv lelohayv
translation: They shall not marry a woman defiled by harlotry, nor shall they marry one divorced from her husband. For they are holy to their God

hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתּ֔וֹ כִּֽי־אֶת־לֶ֥חֶם אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ ה֣וּא מַקְרִ֑יב קָדֹשׁ֙ יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֔ךְ כִּ֣י קָד֔וֹשׁ אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה מְקַדִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'kidash'tvo kiy-et-lechem eloheykha hv mak'riyv kadosh yih'yeh-lakh' kiy kadvosh aniy y'hvah m'kadish'khem
translation: and you must treat them as holy, since they offer the food of your God; they shall be holy to you, for I the L<small>ORD</small> who sanctify you am holy.

hebrew: וּבַת֙ אִ֣ישׁ כֹּהֵ֔ן כִּ֥י תֵחֵ֖ל לִזְנ֑וֹת אֶת־אָבִ֙יהָ֙ הִ֣יא מְחַלֶּ֔לֶת בָּאֵ֖שׁ תִּשָּׂרֵֽף׃ (ס)
transliteration: vvat iysh kohen kiy techel liz'nvot et-aviyha hiy m'chalelet baesh tisaref (s)
translation: When the daughter of a priest defiles herself through harlotry, it is her father whom she defiles; she shall be put to the fire.

hebrew: וְהַכֹּהֵן֩ הַגָּד֨וֹל מֵאֶחָ֜יו אֲ‍ֽשֶׁר־יוּצַ֥ק עַל־רֹאשׁ֣וֹ ׀ שֶׁ֤מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה֙ וּמִלֵּ֣א אֶת־יָד֔וֹ לִלְבֹּ֖שׁ אֶת־הַבְּגָדִ֑ים אֶת־רֹאשׁוֹ֙ לֹ֣א יִפְרָ֔ע וּבְגָדָ֖יו לֹ֥א יִפְרֹֽם׃
transliteration: v'hakohen hagadvol meechayv a‍sher-yvtzak 'al-roshvo  shemen hamish'chah vmile et-yadvo lil'bosh et-hab'gadiym et-roshvo lo yif'ra' vv'gadayv lo yif'rom
translation: The priest who is exalted above his fellows, on whose head the anointing oil has been poured and who has been ordained to wear the vestments, shall not bare his headbSee note at 10.6. or rend his vestments.

hebrew: וְעַ֛ל כָּל־נַפְשֹׁ֥ת מֵ֖ת לֹ֣א יָבֹ֑א לְאָבִ֥יו וּלְאִמּ֖וֹ לֹ֥א יִטַּמָּֽא׃
transliteration: v'al kal-naf'shot met lo yavo l'aviyv vl'imvo lo yitama
translation: He shall not go in where there is any dead body; he shall not defile himself even for his father or mother.

hebrew: וּמִן־הַמִּקְדָּשׁ֙ לֹ֣א יֵצֵ֔א וְלֹ֣א יְחַלֵּ֔ל אֵ֖ת מִקְדַּ֣שׁ אֱלֹהָ֑יו כִּ֡י נֵ֠זֶר שֶׁ֣מֶן מִשְׁחַ֧ת אֱלֹהָ֛יו עָלָ֖יו אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vmin-hamik'dash lo yetze v'lo y'chalel et mik'dash elohayv kiy nezer shemen mish'chat elohayv 'alayv aniy y'hvah
translation: He shall not go outside the sanctuary and profane the sanctuary of his God, for upon him is the distinction of the anointing oil of his God, Mine the L<small>ORD</small>’s.

hebrew: וְה֕וּא אִשָּׁ֥ה בִבְתוּלֶ֖יהָ יִקָּֽח׃
transliteration: v'hv ishah viv'tvleyha yikach
translation: He may marry only a woman who is a virgin.

hebrew: אַלְמָנָ֤ה וּגְרוּשָׁה֙ וַחֲלָלָ֣ה זֹנָ֔ה אֶת־אֵ֖לֶּה לֹ֣א יִקָּ֑ח כִּ֛י אִם־בְּתוּלָ֥ה מֵעַמָּ֖יו יִקַּ֥ח אִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: al'manah vg'rvshah vachalalah zonah et-eleh lo yikach kiy im-b'tvlah me'amayv yikach ishah
translation: A widow, or a divorced woman, or one who is degraded by harlotry—such he may not marry. Only a virgin of his own kin may he take to wife—

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יְחַלֵּ֥ל זַרְע֖וֹ בְּעַמָּ֑יו כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה מְקַדְּשֽׁוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'lo-y'chalel zar'vo b'amayv kiy aniy y'hvah m'kad'shvo (f)
translation: that he may not profane his offspring among his kin, for I the L<small>ORD</small> have sanctified him.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke further to Moses:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֥ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹ֑ר אִ֣ישׁ מִֽזַּרְעֲךָ֞ לְדֹרֹתָ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֥ה בוֹ֙ מ֔וּם לֹ֣א יִקְרַ֔ב לְהַקְרִ֖יב לֶ֥חֶם אֱלֹהָֽיו׃
transliteration: daber el-aharon lemor iysh mizar'akha l'dorotam asher yih'yeh vvo mvm lo yik'rav l'hak'riyv lechem elohayv
translation: Speak to Aaron and say: No man of your offspring throughout the ages who has a defect shall be qualified to offer the food of his God.

hebrew: כִּ֥י כָל־אִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־בּ֥וֹ מ֖וּם לֹ֣א יִקְרָ֑ב אִ֤ישׁ עִוֵּר֙ א֣וֹ פִסֵּ֔חַ א֥וֹ חָרֻ֖ם א֥וֹ שָׂרֽוּעַ׃
transliteration: kiy khal-iysh asher-bvo mvm lo yik'rav iysh 'iver vo fisecha vo charum vo sarv'a
translation: No one at all who has a defect shall be qualified: no man who is blind, or lame, or cOr “mutilated or has a limb too long.”has a limb too short or too long;-c

hebrew: א֣וֹ אִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִהְיֶ֥ה ב֖וֹ שֶׁ֣בֶר רָ֑גֶל א֖וֹ שֶׁ֥בֶר יָֽד׃
transliteration: vo iysh asher-yih'yeh vvo shever ragel vo shever yad
translation: no man who has a broken leg or a broken arm;

hebrew: אֽוֹ־גִבֵּ֣ן אוֹ־דַ֔ק א֖וֹ תְּבַלֻּ֣ל בְּעֵינ֑וֹ א֤וֹ גָרָב֙ א֣וֹ יַלֶּ֔פֶת א֖וֹ מְר֥וֹחַ אָֽשֶׁךְ׃
transliteration: vo-giben vo-dak vo t'valul b'eynvo vo garav vo yalefet vo m'rvocha ashekh'
translation: or who is a hunchback, or a dwarf, or who has a growth in his eye, or who has a boil-scar, or scurvy, or crushed testes.

hebrew: כָּל־אִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־בּ֣וֹ מ֗וּם מִזֶּ֙רַע֙ אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן לֹ֣א יִגַּ֔שׁ לְהַקְרִ֖יב אֶת־אִשֵּׁ֣י יְהוָ֑ה מ֣וּם בּ֔וֹ אֵ֚ת לֶ֣חֶם אֱלֹהָ֔יו לֹ֥א יִגַּ֖שׁ לְהַקְרִֽיב׃
transliteration: kal-iysh asher-bvo mvm mizera' aharon hakohen lo yigash l'hak'riyv et-ishey y'hvah mvm bvo et lechem elohayv lo yigash l'hak'riyv
translation: No man among the offspring of Aaron the priest who has a defect shall be qualified to offer the L<small>ORD</small>’s offering by fire; having a defect, he shall not be qualified to offer the food of his God.

hebrew: לֶ֣חֶם אֱלֹהָ֔יו מִקָּדְשֵׁ֖י הַקֳּדָשִׁ֑ים וּמִן־הַקֳּדָשִׁ֖ים יֹאכֵֽל׃
transliteration: lechem elohayv mikad'shey hakodashiym vmin-hakodashiym yokhel
translation: He may eat of the food of his God, of the most holy as well as of the holy;

hebrew: אַ֣ךְ אֶל־הַפָּרֹ֜כֶת לֹ֣א יָבֹ֗א וְאֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֛חַ לֹ֥א יִגַּ֖שׁ כִּֽי־מ֣וּם בּ֑וֹ וְלֹ֤א יְחַלֵּל֙ אֶת־מִקְדָּשַׁ֔י כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה מְקַדְּשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: akh' el-haparokhet lo yavo v'el-hamiz'becha lo yigash kiy-mvm bvo v'lo y'chalel et-mik'dashay kiy aniy y'hvah m'kad'sham
translation: but he shall not enter behind the curtain or come near the altar, for he has a defect. He shall not profane these places sacred to Me, for I the L<small>ORD</small> have sanctified them.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְאֶל־בָּנָ֑יו וְאֶֽל־כָּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh el-aharon v'el-banayv v'el-kal-b'ney yis'rael (f)
translation: Thus Moses spoke to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelites.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֨ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְאֶל־בָּנָ֗יו וְיִנָּֽזְרוּ֙ מִקָּדְשֵׁ֣י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלֹ֥א יְחַלְּל֖וּ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם קָדְשִׁ֑י אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵ֧ם מַקְדִּשִׁ֛ים לִ֖י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: daber el-aharon v'el-banayv v'yinaz'rv mikad'shey v'ney-yis'rael v'lo y'chal'lv et-shem kad'shiy asher hem mak'dishiym liy aniy y'hvah
translation: Instruct Aaron and his sons to be scrupulous about the sacred donations that the Israelite people consecrate to Me, lest they profane My holy name, Mine the L<small>ORD</small>’s.

hebrew: אֱמֹ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם לְדֹרֹ֨תֵיכֶ֜ם כָּל־אִ֣ישׁ ׀ אֲשֶׁר־יִקְרַ֣ב מִכָּל־זַרְעֲכֶ֗ם אֶל־הַקֳּדָשִׁים֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַקְדִּ֤ישׁוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה וְטֻמְאָת֖וֹ עָלָ֑יו וְנִכְרְתָ֞ה הַנֶּ֧פֶשׁ הַהִ֛וא מִלְּפָנַ֖י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: emor alehem l'doroteykhem kal-iysh  asher-yik'rav mikal-zar'akhem el-hakodashiym asher yak'diyshv v'ney-yis'rael layhvah v'tum'atvo 'alayv v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv mil'fanay aniy y'hvah
translation:
Say to them:
Throughout the ages, if any man among your offspring, while in a state of uncleanness, partakes of any sacred donation that the Israelite people may consecrate to the LORD, that person shall be cut off from before Me: I am the LORD.

hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ אִ֞ישׁ מִזֶּ֣רַע אַהֲרֹ֗ן וְה֤וּא צָר֙וּעַ֙ א֣וֹ זָ֔ב בַּקֳּדָשִׁים֙ לֹ֣א יֹאכַ֔ל עַ֖ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִטְהָ֑ר וְהַנֹּגֵ֙עַ֙ בְּכָל־טְמֵא־נֶ֔פֶשׁ א֣וֹ אִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־תֵּצֵ֥א מִמֶּ֖נּוּ שִׁכְבַת־זָֽרַע׃
transliteration: iysh iysh mizera' aharon v'hv tzarv'a vo zav bakodashiym lo yokhal 'ad asher yit'har v'hanoge'a b'khal-t'me-nefesh vo iysh asher-tetze mimenv shikh'vat-zara'
translation: No man of Aaron’s offspring who has an eruption or a dischargeaSee chapters 13 and 15. shall eat of the sacred donations until he is clean. If one touches anything made unclean by a corpse, or if a man has an emission of semen,

hebrew: אוֹ־אִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִגַּ֔ע בְּכָל־שֶׁ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִטְמָא־ל֑וֹ א֤וֹ בְאָדָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִטְמָא־ל֔וֹ לְכֹ֖ל טֻמְאָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vo-iysh asher yiga' b'khal-sheretz asher yit'ma-lvo vo v'adam asher yit'ma-lvo l'khol tum'atvo
translation: or if a man touches any swarming thing by which he is made unclean or any human being by whom he is made unclean—whatever his uncleanness—

hebrew: נֶ֚פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּגַּע־בּ֔וֹ וְטָמְאָ֖ה עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב וְלֹ֤א יֹאכַל֙ מִן־הַקֳּדָשִׁ֔ים כִּ֛י אִם־רָחַ֥ץ בְּשָׂר֖וֹ בַּמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: nefesh asher tiga'-bvo v'tam'ah 'ad-ha'arev v'lo yokhal min-hakodashiym kiy im-rachatz b'sarvo bamayim
translation: the person who touches such shall be unclean until evening and shall not eat of the sacred donations unless he has washed his body in water.

hebrew: וּבָ֥א הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ וְטָהֵ֑ר וְאַחַר֙ יֹאכַ֣ל מִן־הַקֳּדָשִׁ֔ים כִּ֥י לַחְמ֖וֹ הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vva hashemesh v'taher v'achar yokhal min-hakodashiym kiy lach'mvo hv
translation: As soon as the sun sets, he shall be clean; and afterward he may eat of the sacred donations, for they are his food.

hebrew: נְבֵלָ֧ה וּטְרֵפָ֛ה לֹ֥א יֹאכַ֖ל לְטָמְאָה־בָ֑הּ אֲנִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: n'velah vt'refah lo yokhal l'tam'ah-vah aniy y'hvah
translation: He shall not eat anything that died or was torn by beasts, thereby becoming unclean: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְשָׁמְר֣וּ אֶת־מִשְׁמַרְתִּ֗י וְלֹֽא־יִשְׂא֤וּ עָלָיו֙ חֵ֔טְא וּמֵ֥תוּ ב֖וֹ כִּ֣י יְחַלְּלֻ֑הוּ אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה מְקַדְּשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: v'sham'rv et-mish'mar'tiy v'lo-yis'v 'alayv chet' vmetv vvo kiy y'chal'luhv aniy y'hvah m'kad'sham
translation: They shall keep My charge, lest they incur guilt thereby and die for it, having committed profanation: I the L<small>ORD</small> consecrate them.

hebrew: וְכָל־זָ֖ר לֹא־יֹ֣אכַל קֹ֑דֶשׁ תּוֹשַׁ֥ב כֹּהֵ֛ן וְשָׂכִ֖יר לֹא־יֹ֥אכַל קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: v'khal-zar lo-yokhal kodesh tvoshav kohen v'sakhiyr lo-yokhal kodesh
translation: No lay person shall eat of the sacred donations. No bound or hired laborer of a priest shall eat of the sacred donations;

hebrew: וְכֹהֵ֗ן כִּֽי־יִקְנֶ֥ה נֶ֙פֶשׁ֙ קִנְיַ֣ן כַּסְפּ֔וֹ ה֖וּא יֹ֣אכַל בּ֑וֹ וִילִ֣יד בֵּית֔וֹ הֵ֖ם יֹאכְל֥וּ בְלַחְמֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'khohen kiy-yik'neh nefesh kin'yan kas'pvo hv yokhal bvo viyliyd beytvo hem yokh'lv v'lach'mvo
translation: but a person who is a priest’s property by purchase may eat of them; and those that are born into his household may eat of his food.

hebrew: וּבַת־כֹּהֵ֔ן כִּ֥י תִהְיֶ֖ה לְאִ֣ישׁ זָ֑ר הִ֕וא בִּתְרוּמַ֥ת הַקֳּדָשִׁ֖ים לֹ֥א תֹאכֵֽל׃
transliteration: vvat-kohen kiy tih'yeh l'iysh zar hiv bit'rvmat hakodashiym lo tokhel
translation: If a priest’s daughter marries a layman, she may not eat of the sacred gifts;

hebrew: וּבַת־כֹּהֵן֩ כִּ֨י תִהְיֶ֜ה אַלְמָנָ֣ה וּגְרוּשָׁ֗ה וְזֶרַע֮ אֵ֣ין לָהּ֒ וְשָׁבָ֞ה אֶל־בֵּ֤ית אָבִ֙יהָ֙ כִּנְעוּרֶ֔יהָ מִלֶּ֥חֶם אָבִ֖יהָ תֹּאכֵ֑ל וְכָל־זָ֖ר לֹא־יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vvat-kohen kiy tih'yeh al'manah vg'rvshah v'zera' eyn lah v'shavah el-beyt aviyha kin'vreyha milechem aviyha tokhel v'khal-zar lo-yokhal bvo (s)
translation: but if the priest’s daughter is widowed or divorced and without offspring, and is back in her father’s house as in her youth, she may eat of her father’s food. No lay person may eat of it:

hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ כִּֽי־יֹאכַ֥ל קֹ֖דֶשׁ בִּשְׁגָגָ֑ה וְיָסַ֤ף חֲמִֽשִׁיתוֹ֙ עָלָ֔יו וְנָתַ֥ן לַכֹּהֵ֖ן אֶת־הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: v'iysh kiy-yokhal kodesh bish'gagah v'yasaf chamishiytvo 'alayv v'natan lakohen et-hakodesh
translation: but if a man eats of a sacred donation unwittingly, he shall pay the priest for the sacred donation, adding one-fifth of its value.

hebrew: וְלֹ֣א יְחַלְּל֔וּ אֶת־קָדְשֵׁ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־יָרִ֖ימוּ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'lo y'chal'lv et-kad'shey b'ney yis'rael et asher-yariymv layhvah
translation: But [the priests] must not allow the Israelites to profane the sacred donations that they set aside for the L<small>ORD</small>,

hebrew: וְהִשִּׂ֤יאוּ אוֹתָם֙ עֲוֺ֣ן אַשְׁמָ֔ה בְּאָכְלָ֖ם אֶת־קָדְשֵׁיהֶ֑ם כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה מְקַדְּשָֽׁם׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hisiyv votam 'avon ash'mah b'akh'lam et-kad'sheyhem kiy aniy y'hvah m'kad'sham (f)
translation: or to incur guilt requiring a penalty payment, by eating such sacred donations: for it is I the L<small>ORD</small> who make them sacred.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֨ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְאֶל־בָּנָ֗יו וְאֶל֙ כָּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אִ֣ישׁ אִישׁ֩ מִבֵּ֨ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל וּמִן־הַגֵּ֣ר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַקְרִ֤יב קָרְבָּנוֹ֙ לְכָל־נִדְרֵיהֶם֙ וּלְכָל־נִדְבוֹתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־יַקְרִ֥יבוּ לַיהוָ֖ה לְעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: daber el-aharon v'el-banayv v'el kal-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem iysh iysh mibeyt yis'rael vmin-hager b'yis'rael asher yak'riyv kar'banvo l'khal-nid'reyhem vl'khal-nid'vvotam asher-yak'riyvv layhvah l'olah
translation:
Speak to Aaron and his sons, and to all the Israelite people, and say to them:
When any man of the house of Israel or of the strangers in Israel presents a burnt offering as his offering for any of the votive or any of the freewill offerings that they offer to the LORD,

hebrew: לִֽרְצֹנְכֶ֑ם תָּמִ֣ים זָכָ֔ר בַּבָּקָ֕ר בַּכְּשָׂבִ֖ים וּבָֽעִזִּֽים׃
transliteration: lir'tzon'khem tamiym zakhar babakar bak'saviym vva'iziym
translation: it must, to be acceptable in your favor, be a male without blemish, from cattle or sheep or goats.

hebrew: כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־בּ֥וֹ מ֖וּם לֹ֣א תַקְרִ֑יבוּ כִּי־לֹ֥א לְרָצ֖וֹן יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: kol asher-bvo mvm lo tak'riyvv kiy-lo l'ratzvon yih'yeh lakhem
translation: You shall not offer any that has a defect, for it will not be accepted in your favor.

hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ כִּֽי־יַקְרִ֤יב זֶֽבַח־שְׁלָמִים֙ לַיהוָ֔ה לְפַלֵּא־נֶ֙דֶר֙ א֣וֹ לִנְדָבָ֔ה בַּבָּקָ֖ר א֣וֹ בַצֹּ֑אן תָּמִ֤ים יִֽהְיֶה֙ לְרָצ֔וֹן כָּל־מ֖וּם לֹ֥א יִהְיֶה־בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'iysh kiy-yak'riyv zevach-sh'lamiym layhvah l'fale-neder vo lin'davah babakar vo vatzon tamiym yih'yeh l'ratzvon kal-mvm lo yih'yeh-bvo
translation: And when a man offers, from the herd or the flock, a sacrifice of well-being to the LORD for an explicitbOr “unspecified” or “extraordinary” ; meaning of Heb. lephalle uncertain. vow or as a freewill offering, it must, to be acceptable, be without blemish; there must be no defect in it.

hebrew: עַוֶּרֶת֩ א֨וֹ שָׁב֜וּר אוֹ־חָר֣וּץ אֽוֹ־יַבֶּ֗לֶת א֤וֹ גָרָב֙ א֣וֹ יַלֶּ֔פֶת לֹא־תַקְרִ֥יבוּ אֵ֖לֶּה לַיהוָ֑ה וְאִשֶּׁ֗ה לֹא־תִתְּנ֥וּ מֵהֶ֛ם עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: 'averet vo shavvr vo-charvtz vo-yabelet vo garav vo yalefet lo-tak'riyvv eleh layhvah v'isheh lo-tit'nv mehem 'al-hamiz'becha layhvah
translation: Anything blind, or injured, or maimed, or with a wen, boil-scar, or scurvy—such you shall not offer to the L<small>ORD</small>; you shall not put any of them on the altar as offerings by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְשׁ֥וֹר וָשֶׂ֖ה שָׂר֣וּעַ וְקָל֑וּט נְדָבָה֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹת֔וֹ וּלְנֵ֖דֶר לֹ֥א יֵרָצֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'shvor vaseh sarv'a v'kalvt n'davah ta'aseh otvo vl'neder lo yeratzeh
translation: You may, however, present as a freewill offering an ox or a sheep with a limb extended or contracted; but it will not be accepted for a vow.

hebrew: וּמָע֤וּךְ וְכָתוּת֙ וְנָת֣וּק וְכָר֔וּת לֹ֥א תַקְרִ֖יבוּ לַֽיהוָ֑ה וּֽבְאַרְצְכֶ֖ם לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
transliteration: vma'vkh' v'khatvt v'natvk v'kharvt lo tak'riyvv layhvah vv'ar'tz'khem lo ta'asv
translation: You shall not offer to the LORD anything [with its testes] bruised or crushed or torn or cut. You shall have no such practicescI.e., mutilations. in your own land,

hebrew: וּמִיַּ֣ד בֶּן־נֵכָ֗ר לֹ֥א תַקְרִ֛יבוּ אֶת־לֶ֥חֶם אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם מִכָּל־אֵ֑לֶּה כִּ֣י מָשְׁחָתָ֤ם בָּהֶם֙ מ֣וּם בָּ֔ם לֹ֥א יֵרָצ֖וּ לָכֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vmiyad ben-nekhar lo tak'riyvv et-lechem eloheykhem mikal-eleh kiy mash'chatam bahem mvm bam lo yeratzv lakhem (f)
translation: nor shall you accept such [animals] from a foreigner for offering as food for your God, for they are mutilated, they have a defect; they shall not be accepted in your favor.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: שׁ֣וֹר אוֹ־כֶ֤שֶׂב אוֹ־עֵז֙ כִּ֣י יִוָּלֵ֔ד וְהָיָ֛ה שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים תַּ֣חַת אִמּ֑וֹ וּמִיּ֤וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי֙ וָהָ֔לְאָה יֵרָצֶ֕ה לְקָרְבַּ֥ן אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: shvor vo-khesev vo-'ez kiy yivaled v'hayah shiv'at yamiym tachat imvo vmiyvom hash'miyniy vahal'ah yeratzeh l'kar'ban isheh layhvah
translation: When an ox or a sheep or a goat is born, it shall stay seven days with its mother, and from the eighth day on it shall be acceptable as an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְשׁ֖וֹר אוֹ־שֶׂ֑ה אֹת֣וֹ וְאֶת־בְּנ֔וֹ לֹ֥א תִשְׁחֲט֖וּ בְּי֥וֹם אֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: v'shvor vo-seh otvo v'et-b'nvo lo tish'chatv b'yvom echad
translation: However, no animal from the herd or from the flock shall be slaughtered on the same day with its young.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־תִזְבְּח֥וּ זֶֽבַח־תּוֹדָ֖ה לַיהוָ֑ה לִֽרְצֹנְכֶ֖ם תִּזְבָּֽחוּ׃
transliteration: v'khiy-tiz'b'chv zevach-tvodah layhvah lir'tzon'khem tiz'bachv
translation: When you sacrifice a thanksgiving offering to the L<small>ORD</small>, sacrifice it so that it may be acceptable in your favor.

hebrew: בַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ יֵאָכֵ֔ל לֹֽא־תוֹתִ֥ירוּ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַד־בֹּ֑קֶר אֲנִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: bayvom hahv yeakhel lo-tvotiyrv mimenv 'ad-boker aniy y'hvah
translation: It shall be eaten on the same day; you shall not leave any of it until morning: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֙ מִצְוֺתַ֔י וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem mitz'votay va'asiytem otam aniy y'hvah
translation: You shall faithfully observe My commandments: I am the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְלֹ֤א תְחַלְּלוּ֙ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם קָדְשִׁ֔י וְנִ֨קְדַּשְׁתִּ֔י בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה מְקַדִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'lo t'chal'lv et-shem kad'shiy v'nik'dash'tiy b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael aniy y'hvah m'kadish'khem
translation: You shall not profane My holy name, that I may be sanctified in the midst of the Israelite people—I the L<small>ORD</small> who sanctify you,

hebrew: הַמּוֹצִ֤יא אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לִהְי֥וֹת לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִ֑ים אֲנִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: hamvotziy et'khem meeretz mitz'rayim lih'yvot lakhem lelohiym aniy y'hvah (f)
translation: I who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God, I the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם מוֹעֲדֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־תִּקְרְא֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם מִקְרָאֵ֣י קֹ֑דֶשׁ אֵ֥לֶּה הֵ֖ם מוֹעֲדָֽי׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem mvo'adey y'hvah asher-tik'r'v otam mik'raey kodesh eleh hem mvo'aday
translation:
Speak to the Israelite people and say to them:
These are My fixed times, the fixed times of the LORD, which you shall proclaim as sacred occasions.

hebrew: שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִים֮ תֵּעָשֶׂ֣ה מְלָאכָה֒ וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י שַׁבַּ֤ת שַׁבָּתוֹן֙ מִקְרָא־קֹ֔דֶשׁ כָּל־מְלָאכָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ שַׁבָּ֥ת הִוא֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה בְּכֹ֖ל מֽוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: sheshet yamiym te'aseh m'lakhah vvayvom hash'viy'iy shabat shabatvon mik'ra-kodesh kal-m'lakhah lo ta'asv shabat hiv layhvah b'khol mvosh'voteykhem (f)
translation: On six days work may be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a sabbath of complete rest, a sacred occasion. You shall do no work; it shall be a sabbath of the L<small>ORD</small> throughout your settlements.

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה מוֹעֲדֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה מִקְרָאֵ֖י קֹ֑דֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־תִּקְרְא֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם בְּמוֹעֲדָֽם׃
transliteration: eleh mvo'adey y'hvah mik'raey kodesh asher-tik'r'v otam b'mvo'adam
translation: These are the set times of the L<small>ORD</small>, the sacred occasions, which you shall celebrate each at its appointed time:

hebrew: בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֗וֹן בְּאַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר לַחֹ֖דֶשׁ בֵּ֣ין הָעַרְבָּ֑יִם פֶּ֖סַח לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: bachodesh harishvon b'ar'ba'ah 'asar lachodesh beyn ha'ar'bayim pesach layhvah
translation: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, there shall be a passover offering to the L<small>ORD</small>,

hebrew: וּבַחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר יוֹם֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֔ה חַ֥ג הַמַּצּ֖וֹת לַיהוָ֑ה שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים מַצּ֥וֹת תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: vvachamishah 'asar yvom lachodesh hazeh chag hamatzvot layhvah shiv'at yamiym matzvot tokhelv
translation: and on the fifteenth day of that month the L<small>ORD</small>’s Feast of Unleavened Bread. You shall eat unleavened bread for seven days.

hebrew: בַּיּוֹם֙ הָֽרִאשׁ֔וֹן מִקְרָא־קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם כָּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
transliteration: bayvom harishvon mik'ra-kodesh yih'yeh lakhem kal-m'lekhet 'avodah lo ta'asv
translation: On the first day you shall celebrate a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.

hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֥ם אִשֶּׁ֛ה לַיהוָ֖ה שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים בַּיּ֤וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי֙ מִקְרָא־קֹ֔דֶשׁ כָּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hik'rav'tem isheh layhvah shiv'at yamiym bayvom hash'viy'iy mik'ra-kodesh kal-m'lekhet 'avodah lo ta'asv (f)
translation: Seven days you shall make offerings by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>. The seventh day shall be a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־תָבֹ֣אוּ אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֲנִי֙ נֹתֵ֣ן לָכֶ֔ם וּקְצַרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־קְצִירָ֑הּ וַהֲבֵאתֶ֥ם אֶת־עֹ֛מֶר רֵאשִׁ֥ית קְצִירְכֶ֖ם אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem kiy-tavov el-haaretz asher aniy noten lakhem vk'tzar'tem et-k'tziyrah vahavetem et-'omer reshiyt k'tziyr'khem el-hakohen
translation:
Speak to the Israelite people and say to them:
When you enter the land that I am giving to you and you reap its harvest, you shall bring the first sheaf of your harvest to the priest.

hebrew: וְהֵנִ֧יף אֶת־הָעֹ֛מֶר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה לִֽרְצֹנְכֶ֑ם מִֽמָּחֳרַת֙ הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת יְנִיפֶ֖נּוּ הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'heniyf et-ha'omer lif'ney y'hvah lir'tzon'khem mimachorat hashabat y'niyfenv hakohen
translation: He shall elevate the sheaf before the L<small>ORD</small> for acceptance in your behalf; the priest shall elevate it on the day after the sabbath.

hebrew: וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֕ם בְּי֥וֹם הֲנִֽיפְכֶ֖ם אֶת־הָעֹ֑מֶר כֶּ֣בֶשׂ תָּמִ֧ים בֶּן־שְׁנָת֛וֹ לְעֹלָ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: va'asiytem b'yvom haniyf'khem et-ha'omer keves tamiym ben-sh'natvo l'olah layhvah
translation: On the day that you elevate the sheaf, you shall offer as a burnt offering to the L<small>ORD</small> a lamb of the first year without blemish.

hebrew: וּמִנְחָתוֹ֩ שְׁנֵ֨י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֜ים סֹ֣לֶת בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֛מֶן אִשֶּׁ֥ה לַיהוָ֖ה רֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֑חַ וְנִסְכֹּ֥ה יַ֖יִן רְבִיעִ֥ת הַהִֽין׃
transliteration: vmin'chatvo sh'ney 'es'roniym solet b'lvlah vashemen isheh layhvah reycha niychocha v'nis'koh yayin r'viy'it hahiyn
translation: The meal offering with it shall be two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD; and the libation with it shall be of wine, a quarter of a hin.

hebrew: וְלֶחֶם֩ וְקָלִ֨י וְכַרְמֶ֜ל לֹ֣א תֹֽאכְל֗וּ עַד־עֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה עַ֚ד הֲבִ֣יאֲכֶ֔ם אֶת־קָרְבַּ֖ן אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכֹ֖ל מֹשְׁבֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'lechem v'kaliy v'khar'mel lo tokh'lv 'ad-'etzem hayvom hazeh 'ad haviyakhem et-kar'ban eloheykhem chukat 'volam l'doroteykhem b'khol mosh'voteykhem (s)
translation: Until that very day, until you have brought the offering of your God, you shall eat no bread or parched grain or fresh ears;aI.e., of the new crop. it is a law for all time throughout the ages in all your settlements.

hebrew: וּסְפַרְתֶּ֤ם לָכֶם֙ מִמָּחֳרַ֣ת הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת מִיּוֹם֙ הֲבִ֣יאֲכֶ֔ם אֶת־עֹ֖מֶר הַתְּנוּפָ֑ה שֶׁ֥בַע שַׁבָּת֖וֹת תְּמִימֹ֥ת תִּהְיֶֽינָה׃
transliteration: vs'far'tem lakhem mimachorat hashabat miyvom haviyakhem et-'omer hat'nvfah sheva' shabatvot t'miymot tih'yeynah
translation: And from the day on which you bring the sheaf of elevation offering—the day after the sabbath—you shall count off seven weeks. They must be complete:

hebrew: עַ֣ד מִֽמָּחֳרַ֤ת הַשַּׁבָּת֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔ת תִּסְפְּר֖וּ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים י֑וֹם וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֛ם מִנְחָ֥ה חֲדָשָׁ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: 'ad mimachorat hashabat hash'viy'it tis'p'rv chamishiym yvom v'hik'rav'tem min'chah chadashah layhvah
translation: you must count until the day after the seventh week—fifty days; then you shall bring an offering of new grain to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: מִמּוֹשְׁבֹ֨תֵיכֶ֜ם תָּבִ֣יאּוּ ׀ לֶ֣חֶם תְּנוּפָ֗ה שְׁ֚תַּיִם שְׁנֵ֣י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֔ים סֹ֣לֶת תִּהְיֶ֔ינָה חָמֵ֖ץ תֵּאָפֶ֑ינָה בִּכּוּרִ֖ים לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: mimvosh'voteykhem taviyv  lechem t'nvfah sh'tayim sh'ney 'es'roniym solet tih'yeynah chametz teafeynah bikvriym layhvah
translation: You shall bring from your settlements two loaves of bread as an elevation offering; each shall be made of two-tenths of a measure of choice flour, baked after leavening, as first fruits to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֣ם עַל־הַלֶּ֗חֶם שִׁבְעַ֨ת כְּבָשִׂ֤ים תְּמִימִם֙ בְּנֵ֣י שָׁנָ֔ה וּפַ֧ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר אֶחָ֖ד וְאֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם יִהְי֤וּ עֹלָה֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה וּמִנְחָתָם֙ וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֔ם אִשֵּׁ֥ה רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hik'rav'tem 'al-halechem shiv'at k'vasiym t'miymim b'ney shanah vfar ben-bakar echad v'eylim sh'nayim yih'yv 'olah layhvah vmin'chatam v'nis'keyhem isheh reycha-niychocha layhvah
translation: With the bread you shall present, as burnt offerings to the L<small>ORD</small>, seven yearling lambs without blemish, one bull of the herd, and two rams, with their meal offerings and libations, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֛ם שְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד לְחַטָּ֑את וּשְׁנֵ֧י כְבָשִׂ֛ים בְּנֵ֥י שָׁנָ֖ה לְזֶ֥בַח שְׁלָמִֽים׃
transliteration: va'asiytem s'iyr-'iziym echad l'chatat vsh'ney kh'vasiym b'ney shanah l'zevach sh'lamiym
translation: You shall also offer one he-goat as a sin offering and two yearling lambs as a sacrifice of well-being.

hebrew: וְהֵנִ֣יף הַכֹּהֵ֣ן ׀ אֹתָ֡ם עַל֩ לֶ֨חֶם הַבִּכּוּרִ֤ים תְּנוּפָה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י כְּבָשִׂ֑ים קֹ֛דֶשׁ יִהְי֥וּ לַיהוָ֖ה לַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'heniyf hakohen  otam 'al lechem habikvriym t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah 'al-sh'ney k'vasiym kodesh yih'yv layhvah lakohen
translation: The priest shall elevate these—the two lambsbMeaning of Heb. uncertain.—together with the bread of first fruits as an elevation offering before the LORD; they shall be holy to the LORD, for the priest.

hebrew: וּקְרָאתֶ֞ם בְּעֶ֣צֶם ׀ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה מִֽקְרָא־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם כָּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֛ם בְּכָל־מוֹשְׁבֹ֥תֵיכֶ֖ם לְדֹרֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vk'ratem b'etzem  hayvom hazeh mik'ra-kodesh yih'yeh lakhem kal-m'lekhet 'avodah lo ta'asv chukat 'volam b'khal-mvosh'voteykhem l'doroteykhem
translation: On that same day you shall hold a celebration; it shall be a sacred occasion for you; you shall not work at your occupations. This is a law for all time in all your settlements, throughout the ages.

hebrew: וּֽבְקֻצְרְכֶ֞ם אֶת־קְצִ֣יר אַרְצְכֶ֗ם לֹֽא־תְכַלֶּ֞ה פְּאַ֤ת שָֽׂדְךָ֙ בְּקֻצְרֶ֔ךָ וְלֶ֥קֶט קְצִירְךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְלַקֵּ֑ט לֶֽעָנִ֤י וְלַגֵּר֙ תַּעֲזֹ֣ב אֹתָ֔ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: vv'kutz'r'khem et-k'tziyr ar'tz'khem lo-t'khaleh p'at sad'kha b'kutz'rekha v'leket k'tziyr'kha lo t'laket le'aniy v'lager ta'azov otam aniy y'hvah eloheykhem (s)
translation: And when you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap all the way to the edges of your field, or gather the gleanings of your harvest; you shall leave them for the poor and the stranger: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֛ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר בַּחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֜י בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֗דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֤ה לָכֶם֙ שַׁבָּת֔וֹן זִכְר֥וֹן תְּרוּעָ֖ה מִקְרָא־קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael lemor bachodesh hash'viy'iy b'echad lachodesh yih'yeh lakhem shabatvon zikh'rvon t'rv'ah mik'ra-kodesh
translation: Speak to the Israelite people thus: In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall observe complete rest, a sacred occasion commemorated with loud blasts.

hebrew: כָּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֥ם אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: kal-m'lekhet 'avodah lo ta'asv v'hik'rav'tem isheh layhvah (s)
translation: You shall not work at your occupations; and you shall bring an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: אַ֡ךְ בֶּעָשׂ֣וֹר לַחֹדֶשׁ֩ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֨י הַזֶּ֜ה י֧וֹם הַכִּפֻּרִ֣ים ה֗וּא מִֽקְרָא־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם וְעִנִּיתֶ֖ם אֶת־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶ֑ם וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֥ם אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: akh' be'asvor lachodesh hash'viy'iy hazeh yvom hakipuriym hv mik'ra-kodesh yih'yeh lakhem v'iniytem et-naf'shoteykhem v'hik'rav'tem isheh layhvah
translation: Mark, the tenth day of this seventh month is the Day of Atonement. It shall be a sacred occasion for you: you shall practice self-denial, and you shall bring an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>;

hebrew: וְכָל־מְלָאכָה֙ לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּ בְּעֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֣י י֤וֹם כִּפֻּרִים֙ ה֔וּא לְכַפֵּ֣ר עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם לִפְנֵ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'khal-m'lakhah lo ta'asv b'etzem hayvom hazeh kiy yvom kipuriym hv l'khaper 'aleykhem lif'ney y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: you shall do no work throughout that day. For it is a Day of Atonement, on which expiation is made on your behalf before the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: כִּ֤י כָל־הַנֶּ֙פֶשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־תְעֻנֶּ֔ה בְּעֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְנִכְרְתָ֖ה מֵֽעַמֶּֽיהָ׃
transliteration: kiy khal-hanefesh asher lo-t'uneh b'etzem hayvom hazeh v'nikh'r'tah me'ameyha
translation: Indeed, any person who does not practice self-denial throughout that day shall be cut off from his kin;

hebrew: וְכָל־הַנֶּ֗פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר תַּעֲשֶׂה֙ כָּל־מְלָאכָ֔ה בְּעֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְהַֽאֲבַדְתִּ֛י אֶת־הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'khal-hanefesh asher ta'aseh kal-m'lakhah b'etzem hayvom hazeh v'haavad'tiy et-hanefesh hahiv mikerev 'amah
translation: and whoever does any work throughout that day, I will cause that person to perish from among his people.

hebrew: כָּל־מְלָאכָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכֹ֖ל מֹֽשְׁבֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: kal-m'lakhah lo ta'asv chukat 'volam l'doroteykhem b'khol mosh'voteykhem
translation: Do no work whatever; it is a law for all time, throughout the ages in all your settlements.

hebrew: שַׁבַּ֨ת שַׁבָּת֥וֹן הוּא֙ לָכֶ֔ם וְעִנִּיתֶ֖ם אֶת־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶ֑ם בְּתִשְׁעָ֤ה לַחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ בָּעֶ֔רֶב מֵעֶ֣רֶב עַד־עֶ֔רֶב תִּשְׁבְּת֖וּ שַׁבַּתְּכֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: shabat shabatvon hv lakhem v'iniytem et-naf'shoteykhem b'tish'ah lachodesh ba'erev me'erev 'ad-'erev tish'b'tv shabat'khem (f)
translation: It shall be a sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall practice self-denial; on the ninth day of the month at evening, from evening to evening, you shall observe this your sabbath.
