hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֛ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֜ר י֗וֹם לַחֹ֤דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי֙ הַזֶּ֔ה חַ֧ג הַסֻּכּ֛וֹת שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים לַיהֹוָֽה׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael lemor bachamishah 'asar yvom lachodesh hash'viy'iy hazeh chag hasukvot shiv'at yamiym layhovah
translation:
Say to the Israelite people:
On the fifteenth day of this seventh month there shall be the Feast of BoothscOthers “Tabernacles.” to the LORD, [to last] seven days.

hebrew: בַּיּ֥וֹם הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן מִקְרָא־קֹ֑דֶשׁ כָּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
transliteration: bayvom harishvon mik'ra-kodesh kal-m'lekhet 'avodah lo ta'asv
translation: The first day shall be a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations;

hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים תַּקְרִ֥יבוּ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָ֑ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֡י מִקְרָא־קֹדֶשׁ֩ יִהְיֶ֨ה לָכֶ֜ם וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֨ם אִשֶּׁ֤ה לַֽיהוָה֙ עֲצֶ֣רֶת הִ֔וא כָּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
transliteration: shiv'at yamiym tak'riyvv isheh layhvah bayvom hash'miyniy mik'ra-kodesh yih'yeh lakhem v'hik'rav'tem isheh layhvah 'atzeret hiv kal-m'lekhet 'avodah lo ta'asv
translation: seven days you shall bring offerings by fire to the LORD. On the eighth day you shall observe a sacred occasion and bring an offering by fire to the LORD; it is a solemn gathering:dPrecise meaning of Heb. ‘aṣereth uncertain. you shall not work at your occupations.

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה מוֹעֲדֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־תִּקְרְא֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם מִקְרָאֵ֣י קֹ֑דֶשׁ לְהַקְרִ֨יב אִשֶּׁ֜ה לַיהוָ֗ה עֹלָ֧ה וּמִנְחָ֛ה זֶ֥בַח וּנְסָכִ֖ים דְּבַר־י֥וֹם בְּיוֹמֽוֹ׃
transliteration: eleh mvo'adey y'hvah asher-tik'r'v otam mik'raey kodesh l'hak'riyv isheh layhvah 'olah vmin'chah zevach vn'sakhiym d'var-yvom b'yvomvo
translation: Those are the set times of the L<small>ORD</small> that you shall celebrate as sacred occasions, bringing offerings by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>—burnt offerings, meal offerings, sacrifices, and libations, on each day what is proper to it—

hebrew: מִלְּבַ֖ד שַׁבְּתֹ֣ת יְּהוָ֑ה וּמִלְּבַ֣ד מַתְּנֽוֹתֵיכֶ֗ם וּמִלְּבַ֤ד כָּל־נִדְרֵיכֶם֙ וּמִלְּבַד֙ כָּל־נִדְב֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּתְּנ֖וּ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: mil'vad shab'tot y'hvah vmil'vad mat'nvoteykhem vmil'vad kal-nid'reykhem vmil'vad kal-nid'vvoteykhem asher tit'nv layhvah
translation: apart from the sabbaths of the L<small>ORD</small>, and apart from your gifts and from all your votive offerings and from all your freewill offerings that you give to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: אַ֡ךְ בַּחֲמִשָּׁה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר י֜וֹם לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י בְּאָסְפְּכֶם֙ אֶת־תְּבוּאַ֣ת הָאָ֔רֶץ תָּחֹ֥גּוּ אֶת־חַג־יְהוָ֖ה שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים בַּיּ֤וֹם הָֽרִאשׁוֹן֙ שַׁבָּת֔וֹן וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֖י שַׁבָּתֽוֹן׃
transliteration: akh' bachamishah 'asar yvom lachodesh hash'viy'iy b'as'p'khem et-t'vvat haaretz tachogv et-chag-y'hvah shiv'at yamiym bayvom harishvon shabatvon vvayvom hash'miyniy shabatvon
translation: Mark, on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the yield of your land, you shall observe the festival of the L<small>ORD</small> [to last] seven days: a complete rest on the first day, and a complete rest on the eighth day.

hebrew: וּלְקַחְתֶּ֨ם לָכֶ֜ם בַּיּ֣וֹם הָרִאשׁ֗וֹן פְּרִ֨י עֵ֤ץ הָדָר֙ כַּפֹּ֣ת תְּמָרִ֔ים וַעֲנַ֥ף עֵץ־עָבֹ֖ת וְעַרְבֵי־נָ֑חַל וּשְׂמַחְתֶּ֗ם לִפְנֵ֛י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: vl'kach'tem lakhem bayvom harishvon p'riy 'etz hadar kapot t'mariym va'anaf 'etz-'avot v'ar'vey-nachal vs'mach'tem lif'ney y'hvah eloheykhem shiv'at yamiym
translation: On the first day you shall take the product of hadareOthers “goodly”; exact meaning of Heb. hadar uncertain. Traditionally the product is understood as “citron.” trees, branches of palm trees, boughs of leafyfMeaning of Heb. aboth uncertain. trees, and willows of the brook, and you shall rejoice before the LORD your God seven days.

hebrew: וְחַגֹּתֶ֤ם אֹתוֹ֙ חַ֣ג לַֽיהוָ֔ה שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י תָּחֹ֥גּוּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'chagotem otvo chag layhvah shiv'at yamiym bashanah chukat 'volam l'doroteykhem bachodesh hash'viy'iy tachogv otvo
translation: You shall observe it as a festival of the L<small>ORD</small> for seven days in the year; you shall observe it in the seventh month as a law for all time, throughout the ages.

hebrew: בַּסֻּכֹּ֥ת תֵּשְׁב֖וּ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים כָּל־הָֽאֶזְרָח֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יֵשְׁב֖וּ בַּסֻּכֹּֽת׃
transliteration: basukot tesh'vv shiv'at yamiym kal-haez'rach b'yis'rael yesh'vv basukot
translation: You shall live in booths seven days; all citizens in Israel shall live in booths,

hebrew: לְמַעַן֮ יֵדְע֣וּ דֹרֹֽתֵיכֶם֒ כִּ֣י בַסֻּכּ֗וֹת הוֹשַׁ֙בְתִּי֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּהוֹצִיאִ֥י אוֹתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: l'ma'an yed'v doroteykhem kiy vasukvot hvoshav'tiy et-b'ney yis'rael b'hvotziyiy votam meeretz mitz'rayim aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: in order that future generations may know that I made the Israelite people live in booths when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, I the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־מֹעֲדֵ֖י יְהוָ֑ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh et-mo'adey y'hvah el-b'ney yis'rael (f)
translation: So Moses declared to the Israelites the set times of the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: צַ֞ו אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְיִקְח֨וּ אֵלֶ֜יךָ שֶׁ֣מֶן זַ֥יִת זָ֛ךְ כָּתִ֖ית לַמָּא֑וֹר לְהַעֲלֹ֥ת נֵ֖ר תָּמִֽיד׃
transliteration: tzav et-b'ney yis'rael v'yik'chv eleykha shemen zayit zakh' katiyt lamavor l'ha'alot ner tamiyd
translation: Command the Israelite people to bring you clear oil of beaten olives for lighting, for kindling lamps regularly.

hebrew: מִחוּץ֩ לְפָרֹ֨כֶת הָעֵדֻ֜ת בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֗ד יַעֲרֹךְ֩ אֹת֨וֹ אַהֲרֹ֜ן מֵעֶ֧רֶב עַד־בֹּ֛קֶר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה תָּמִ֑יד חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם לְדֹרֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: michvtz l'farokhet ha'edut b'ohel mvo'ed ya'arokh' otvo aharon me'erev 'ad-boker lif'ney y'hvah tamiyd chukat 'volam l'doroteykhem
translation: Aaron shall set them up in the Tent of Meeting outside the curtain of the Pact [to burn] from evening to morning before the L<small>ORD</small> regularly; it is a law for all time throughout the ages.

hebrew: עַ֚ל הַמְּנֹרָ֣ה הַטְּהֹרָ֔ה יַעֲרֹ֖ךְ אֶת־הַנֵּר֑וֹת לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה תָּמִֽיד׃ (פ)
transliteration: 'al ham'norah hat'horah ya'arokh' et-hanervot lif'ney y'hvah tamiyd (f)
translation: He shall set up the lamps on the pureaSee note at Exod. 31.8. lampstand before the LORD [to burn] regularly.

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ סֹ֔לֶת וְאָפִיתָ֣ אֹתָ֔הּ שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה חַלּ֑וֹת שְׁנֵי֙ עֶשְׂרֹנִ֔ים יִהְיֶ֖ה הַֽחַלָּ֥ה הָאֶחָֽת׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta solet v'afiyta otah sh'teym 'es'reh chalvot sh'ney 'es'roniym yih'yeh hachalah haechat
translation: You shall take choice flour and bake of it twelve loaves, two-tenths of a measure for each loaf.

hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ אוֹתָ֛ם שְׁתַּ֥יִם מַֽעֲרָכ֖וֹת שֵׁ֣שׁ הַֽמַּעֲרָ֑כֶת עַ֛ל הַשֻּׁלְחָ֥ן הַטָּהֹ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'sam'ta votam sh'tayim ma'arakhvot shesh hama'arakhet 'al hashul'chan hatahor lif'ney y'hvah
translation: Place them on the pureaSee note at Exod. 31.8. table before the LORD in two rows, six to a row.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֥ עַל־הַֽמַּעֲרֶ֖כֶת לְבֹנָ֣ה זַכָּ֑ה וְהָיְתָ֤ה לַלֶּ֙חֶם֙ לְאַזְכָּרָ֔ה אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'natata 'al-hama'arekhet l'vonah zakah v'hay'tah lalechem l'az'karah isheh layhvah
translation: With each row you shall place pure frankincense, which is to be a token offeringbSee Lev. 2.2. for the bread, as an offering by fire to the LORD.

hebrew: בְּי֨וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֜ת בְּי֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֗ת יַֽעַרְכֶ֛נּוּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה תָּמִ֑יד מֵאֵ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּרִ֥ית עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: b'yvom hashabat b'yvom hashabat ya'ar'khenv lif'ney y'hvah tamiyd meet b'ney-yis'rael b'riyt 'volam
translation: He shall arrange them before the L<small>ORD</small> regularly every sabbath day—it is a commitment for all time on the part of the Israelites.

hebrew: וְהָֽיְתָה֙ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן וּלְבָנָ֔יו וַאֲכָלֻ֖הוּ בְּמָק֣וֹם קָדֹ֑שׁ כִּ֡י קֹדֶשׁ֩ קָֽדָשִׁ֨ים ה֥וּא ל֛וֹ מֵאִשֵּׁ֥י יְהוָ֖ה חָק־עוֹלָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hay'tah l'aharon vl'vanayv vaakhaluhv b'makvom kadosh kiy kodesh kadashiym hv lvo meishey y'hvah chak-'volam (s)
translation: They shall belong to Aaron and his sons, who shall eat them in the sacred precinct; for they are his as most holy things from the L<small>ORD</small>’s offerings by fire, a due for all time.

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ בֶּן־אִשָּׁ֣ה יִשְׂרְאֵלִ֔ית וְהוּא֙ בֶּן־אִ֣ישׁ מִצְרִ֔י בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּנָּצוּ֙ בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה בֶּ֚ן הַיִּשְׂרְאֵלִ֔ית וְאִ֖ישׁ הַיִּשְׂרְאֵלִֽי׃
transliteration: vayetze ben-ishah yis'r'eliyt v'hv ben-iysh mitz'riy b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael vayinatzv bamachaneh ben hayis'r'eliyt v'iysh hayis'r'eliy
translation: There came out among the Israelites one whose mother was Israelite and whose father was Egyptian. And a fight broke out in the camp between that half-IsraelitecLit. “the son of an Israelite woman.” and a certain Israelite.

hebrew: וַ֠יִּקֹּב בֶּן־הָֽאִשָּׁ֨ה הַיִּשְׂרְאֵלִ֤ית אֶת־הַשֵּׁם֙ וַיְקַלֵּ֔ל וַיָּבִ֥יאוּ אֹת֖וֹ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וְשֵׁ֥ם אִמּ֛וֹ שְׁלֹמִ֥ית בַּת־דִּבְרִ֖י לְמַטֵּה־דָֽן׃
transliteration: vayikov ben-haishah hayis'r'eliyt et-hashem vay'kalel vayaviyv otvo el-mosheh v'shem imvo sh'lomiyt bat-div'riy l'mateh-dan
translation: The son of the Israelite woman pronounced the Name in blasphemy, and he was brought to Moses—now his mother’s name was Shelomith daughter of Dibri of the tribe of Dan—

hebrew: וַיַּנִּיחֻ֖הוּ בַּמִּשְׁמָ֑ר לִפְרֹ֥שׁ לָהֶ֖ם עַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayaniychuhv bamish'mar lif'rosh lahem 'al-piy y'hvah (f)
translation: and he was placed in custody, until the decision of the L<small>ORD</small> should be made clear to them.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: הוֹצֵ֣א אֶת־הַֽמְקַלֵּ֗ל אֶל־מִחוּץ֙ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְסָמְכ֧וּ כָֽל־הַשֹּׁמְעִ֛ים אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וְרָגְמ֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ כָּל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
transliteration: hvotze et-ham'kalel el-michvtz lamachaneh v'sam'khv khal-hashom'iym et-y'deyhem 'al-roshvo v'rag'mv otvo kal-ha'edah
translation: Take the blasphemer outside the camp; and let all who were within hearing lay their hands upon his head, and let the whole community stone him.

hebrew: וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תְּדַבֵּ֣ר לֵאמֹ֑ר אִ֥ישׁ אִ֛ישׁ כִּֽי־יְקַלֵּ֥ל אֱלֹהָ֖יו וְנָשָׂ֥א חֶטְאֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'el-b'ney yis'rael t'daber lemor iysh iysh kiy-y'kalel elohayv v'nasa chet'vo
translation: And to the Israelite people speak thus: Anyone who blasphemes his God shall bear his guilt;

hebrew: וְנֹקֵ֤ב שֵׁם־יְהוָה֙ מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֔ת רָג֥וֹם יִרְגְּמוּ־ב֖וֹ כָּל־הָעֵדָ֑ה כַּגֵּר֙ כָּֽאֶזְרָ֔ח בְּנָקְבוֹ־שֵׁ֖ם יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: v'nokev shem-y'hvah mvot yvmat ragvom yir'g'mv-vvo kal-ha'edah kager kaez'rach b'nak'vvo-shem yvmat
translation: if he also pronounces the name L<small>ORD</small>, he shall be put to death. The whole community shall stone him; stranger or citizen, if he has thus pronounced the Name, he shall be put to death.

hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ כִּ֥י יַכֶּ֖ה כָּל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֑ם מ֖וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: v'iysh kiy yakeh kal-nefesh adam mvot yvmat
translation: If anyone kills any human being, he shall be put to death.

hebrew: וּמַכֵּ֥ה נֶֽפֶשׁ־בְּהֵמָ֖ה יְשַׁלְּמֶ֑נָּה נֶ֖פֶשׁ תַּ֥חַת נָֽפֶשׁ׃
transliteration: vmakeh nefesh-b'hemah y'shal'menah nefesh tachat nafesh
translation: One who kills a beast shall make restitution for it: life for life.

hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ כִּֽי־יִתֵּ֥ן מ֖וּם בַּעֲמִית֑וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה כֵּ֖ן יֵעָ֥שֶׂה לּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'iysh kiy-yiten mvm ba'amiytvo kaasher 'asah ken ye'aseh lvo
translation: If anyone maims his fellow, as he has done so shall it be done to him:

hebrew: שֶׁ֚בֶר תַּ֣חַת שֶׁ֔בֶר עַ֚יִן תַּ֣חַת עַ֔יִן שֵׁ֖ן תַּ֣חַת שֵׁ֑ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֥ן מוּם֙ בָּֽאָדָ֔ם כֵּ֖ן יִנָּ֥תֶן בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: shever tachat shever 'ayin tachat 'ayin shen tachat shen kaasher yiten mvm baadam ken yinaten bvo
translation: fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth. The injury he inflicted on another shall be inflicted on him.

hebrew: וּמַכֵּ֥ה בְהֵמָ֖ה יְשַׁלְּמֶ֑נָּה וּמַכֵּ֥ה אָדָ֖ם יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: vmakeh v'hemah y'shal'menah vmakeh adam yvmat
translation: One who kills a beast shall make restitution for it; but one who kills a human being shall be put to death.

hebrew: מִשְׁפַּ֤ט אֶחָד֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם כַּגֵּ֥ר כָּאֶזְרָ֖ח יִהְיֶ֑ה כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: mish'pat echad yih'yeh lakhem kager kaez'rach yih'yeh kiy aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: You shall have one standard for stranger and citizen alike: for I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר מֹשֶׁה֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַיּוֹצִ֣יאוּ אֶת־הַֽמְקַלֵּ֗ל אֶל־מִחוּץ֙ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַיִּרְגְּמ֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ אָ֑בֶן וּבְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל עָשׂ֔וּ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh el-b'ney yis'rael vayvotziyv et-ham'kalel el-michvtz lamachaneh vayir'g'mv otvo aven vv'ney-yis'rael 'asv kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (f)
translation: Moses spoke thus to the Israelites. And they took the blasphemer outside the camp and pelted him with stones. The Israelites did as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בְּהַ֥ר סִינַ֖י לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh b'har siynay lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם כִּ֤י תָבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י נֹתֵ֣ן לָכֶ֑ם וְשָׁבְתָ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ שַׁבָּ֖ת לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem kiy tavov el-haaretz asher aniy noten lakhem v'shav'tah haaretz shabat layhvah
translation:
Speak to the Israelite people and say to them:
When you enter the land that I assign to you, the land shall observe a sabbath of the LORD.

hebrew: שֵׁ֤שׁ שָׁנִים֙ תִּזְרַ֣ע שָׂדֶ֔ךָ וְשֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים תִּזְמֹ֣ר כַּרְמֶ֑ךָ וְאָסַפְתָּ֖ אֶת־תְּבוּאָתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: shesh shaniym tiz'ra' sadekha v'shesh shaniym tiz'mor kar'mekha v'asaf'ta et-t'vvatah
translation: Six years you may sow your field and six years you may prune your vineyard and gather in the yield.

hebrew: וּבַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗ת שַׁבַּ֤ת שַׁבָּתוֹן֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָאָ֔רֶץ שַׁבָּ֖ת לַיהוָ֑ה שָֽׂדְךָ֙ לֹ֣א תִזְרָ֔ע וְכַרְמְךָ֖ לֹ֥א תִזְמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vvashanah hash'viy'it shabat shabatvon yih'yeh laaretz shabat layhvah sad'kha lo tiz'ra' v'khar'm'kha lo tiz'mor
translation: But in the seventh year the land shall have a sabbath of complete rest, a sabbath of the L<small>ORD</small>: you shall not sow your field or prune your vineyard.

hebrew: אֵ֣ת סְפִ֤יחַ קְצִֽירְךָ֙ לֹ֣א תִקְצ֔וֹר וְאֶת־עִנְּבֵ֥י נְזִירֶ֖ךָ לֹ֣א תִבְצֹ֑ר שְׁנַ֥ת שַׁבָּת֖וֹן יִהְיֶ֥ה לָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: et s'fiycha k'tziyr'kha lo tik'tzvor v'et-'in'vey n'ziyrekha lo tiv'tzor sh'nat shabatvon yih'yeh laaretz
translation: You shall not reap the aftergrowth of your harvest or gather the grapes of your untrimmed vines; it shall be a year of complete rest for the land.

hebrew: וְ֠הָיְתָה שַׁבַּ֨ת הָאָ֤רֶץ לָכֶם֙ לְאָכְלָ֔ה לְךָ֖ וּלְעַבְדְּךָ֣ וְלַאֲמָתֶ֑ךָ וְלִשְׂכִֽירְךָ֙ וּלְתוֹשָׁ֣בְךָ֔ הַגָּרִ֖ים עִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'hay'tah shabat haaretz lakhem l'akh'lah l'kha vl'av'd'kha v'laamatekha v'lis'khiyr'kha vl'tvoshav'kha hagariym 'imakh'
translation: But you may eat whatever the land during its sabbath will produce—you, your male and female slaves, the hired and bound laborers who live with you,

hebrew: וְלִ֨בְהֶמְתְּךָ֔ וְלַֽחַיָּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּאַרְצֶ֑ךָ תִּהְיֶ֥ה כָל־תְּבוּאָתָ֖הּ לֶאֱכֹֽל׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'liv'hem't'kha v'lachayah asher b'ar'tzekha tih'yeh khal-t'vvatah leekhol (s)
translation: and your cattle and the beasts in your land may eat all its yield.

hebrew: וְסָפַרְתָּ֣ לְךָ֗ שֶׁ֚בַע שַׁבְּתֹ֣ת שָׁנִ֔ים שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֑ים וְהָי֣וּ לְךָ֗ יְמֵי֙ שֶׁ֚בַע שַׁבְּתֹ֣ת הַשָּׁנִ֔ים תֵּ֥שַׁע וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: v'safar'ta l'kha sheva' shab'tot shaniym sheva' shaniym sheva' p'amiym v'hayv l'kha y'mey sheva' shab'tot hashaniym tesha' v'ar'ba'iym shanah
translation: You shall count off seven weeks of years—seven times seven years—so that the period of seven weeks of years gives you a total of forty-nine years.

hebrew: וְהַֽעֲבַרְתָּ֞ שׁוֹפַ֤ר תְּרוּעָה֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִעִ֔י בֶּעָשׂ֖וֹר לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ בְּיוֹם֙ הַכִּפֻּרִ֔ים תַּעֲבִ֥ירוּ שׁוֹפָ֖ר בְּכָל־אַרְצְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'ha'avar'ta shvofar t'rv'ah bachodesh hash'vi'iy be'asvor lachodesh b'yvom hakipuriym ta'aviyrv shvofar b'khal-ar'tz'khem
translation: Then you shall sound the horn loud; in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month—the Day of Atonement—you shall have the horn sounded throughout your land

hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתֶּ֗ם אֵ֣ת שְׁנַ֤ת הַחֲמִשִּׁים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּקְרָאתֶ֥ם דְּר֛וֹר בָּאָ֖רֶץ לְכָל־יֹשְׁבֶ֑יהָ יוֹבֵ֥ל הִוא֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם וְשַׁבְתֶּ֗ם אִ֚ישׁ אֶל־אֲחֻזָּת֔וֹ וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶל־מִשְׁפַּחְתּ֖וֹ תָּשֻֽׁבוּ׃
transliteration: v'kidash'tem et sh'nat hachamishiym shanah vk'ratem d'rvor baaretz l'khal-yosh'veyha yvovel hiv tih'yeh lakhem v'shav'tem iysh el-achuzatvo v'iysh el-mish'pach'tvo tashuvv
translation: and you shall hallow the fiftieth year. You shall proclaim releaseaOthers “liberty.” throughout the land for all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubileebHeb. yobel, “ram” or “ram’s horn.” for you: each of you shall return to his holding and each of you shall return to his family.

hebrew: יוֹבֵ֣ל הִ֗וא שְׁנַ֛ת הַחֲמִשִּׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה תִּהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם לֹ֣א תִזְרָ֔עוּ וְלֹ֤א תִקְצְרוּ֙ אֶת־סְפִיחֶ֔יהָ וְלֹ֥א תִבְצְר֖וּ אֶת־נְזִרֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: yvovel hiv sh'nat hachamishiym shanah tih'yeh lakhem lo tiz'ra'v v'lo tik'tz'rv et-s'fiycheyha v'lo tiv'tz'rv et-n'zireyha
translation: That fiftieth year shall be a jubilee for you: you shall not sow, neither shall you reap the aftergrowth or harvest the untrimmed vines,

hebrew: כִּ֚י יוֹבֵ֣ל הִ֔וא קֹ֖דֶשׁ תִּהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם מִן־הַ֨שָּׂדֶ֔ה תֹּאכְל֖וּ אֶת־תְּבוּאָתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: kiy yvovel hiv kodesh tih'yeh lakhem min-hasadeh tokh'lv et-t'vvatah
translation: for it is a jubilee. It shall be holy to you: you may only eat the growth direct from the field.

hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֥ת הַיּוֹבֵ֖ל הַזֹּ֑את תָּשֻׁ֕בוּ אִ֖ישׁ אֶל־אֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: bish'nat hayvovel hazot tashuvv iysh el-achuzatvo
translation: In this year of jubilee, each of you shall return to his holding.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־תִמְכְּר֤וּ מִמְכָּר֙ לַעֲמִיתֶ֔ךָ א֥וֹ קָנֹ֖ה מִיַּ֣ד עֲמִיתֶ֑ךָ אַל־תּוֹנ֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ אֶת־אָחִֽיו׃
transliteration: v'khiy-tim'k'rv mim'kar la'amiytekha vo kanoh miyad 'amiytekha al-tvonv iysh et-achiyv
translation: When you sell property to your neighbor,cI.e., fellow Israelite; see v. 46. or buy any from your neighbor, you shall not wrong one another.

hebrew: בְּמִסְפַּ֤ר שָׁנִים֙ אַחַ֣ר הַיּוֹבֵ֔ל תִּקְנֶ֖ה מֵאֵ֣ת עֲמִיתֶ֑ךָ בְּמִסְפַּ֥ר שְׁנֵֽי־תְבוּאֹ֖ת יִמְכָּר־לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: b'mis'par shaniym achar hayvovel tik'neh meet 'amiytekha b'mis'par sh'ney-t'vvot yim'kar-lakh'
translation: In buying from your neighbor, you shall deduct only for the number of years since the jubilee; and in selling to you, he shall charge you only for the remaining crop years:

hebrew: לְפִ֣י ׀ רֹ֣ב הַשָּׁנִ֗ים תַּרְבֶּה֙ מִקְנָת֔וֹ וּלְפִי֙ מְעֹ֣ט הַשָּׁנִ֔ים תַּמְעִ֖יט מִקְנָת֑וֹ כִּ֚י מִסְפַּ֣ר תְּבוּאֹ֔ת ה֥וּא מֹכֵ֖ר לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: l'fiy  rov hashaniym tar'beh mik'natvo vl'fiy m'ot hashaniym tam'iyt mik'natvo kiy mis'par t'vvot hv mokher lakh'
translation: the more such years, the higher the price you pay; the fewer such years, the lower the price; for what he is selling you is a number of harvests.

hebrew: וְלֹ֤א תוֹנוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־עֲמִית֔וֹ וְיָרֵ֖אתָ מֵֽאֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'lo tvonv iysh et-'amiytvo v'yareta meeloheykha kiy aniy y'hovah eloheykhem
translation: Do not wrong one another, but fear your God; for I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: וַעֲשִׂיתֶם֙ אֶת־חֻקֹּתַ֔י וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֥י תִּשְׁמְר֖וּ וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֣ם אֹתָ֑ם וִֽישַׁבְתֶּ֥ם עַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ לָבֶֽטַח׃
transliteration: va'asiytem et-chukotay v'et-mish'patay tish'm'rv va'asiytem otam viyshav'tem 'al-haaretz lavetach
translation: You shall observe My laws and faithfully keep My rules, that you may live upon the land in security;

hebrew: וְנָתְנָ֤ה הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ פִּרְיָ֔הּ וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֖ם לָשֹׂ֑בַע וִֽישַׁבְתֶּ֥ם לָבֶ֖טַח עָלֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: v'nat'nah haaretz pir'yah vaakhal'tem lasova' viyshav'tem lavetach 'aleyha
translation: the land shall yield its fruit and you shall eat your fill, and you shall live upon it in security.

hebrew: וְכִ֣י תֹאמְר֔וּ מַה־נֹּאכַ֤֖ל בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשְּׁבִיעִ֑ת הֵ֚ן לֹ֣א נִזְרָ֔ע וְלֹ֥א נֶאֱסֹ֖ף אֶת־תְּבוּאָתֵֽנוּ׃
transliteration: v'khiy tom'rv mah-nokhal bashanah hash'viy'it hen lo niz'ra' v'lo neesof et-t'vvatenv
translation: And should you ask, “What are we to eat in the seventh year, if we may neither sow nor gather in our crops?”

hebrew: וְצִוִּ֤יתִי אֶת־בִּרְכָתִי֙ לָכֶ֔ם בַּשָּׁנָ֖ה הַשִּׁשִּׁ֑ית וְעָשָׂת֙ אֶת־הַתְּבוּאָ֔ה לִשְׁלֹ֖שׁ הַשָּׁנִֽים׃
transliteration: v'tziviytiy et-bir'khatiy lakhem bashanah hashishiyt v'asat et-hat'vvah lish'losh hashaniym
translation: I will ordain My blessing for you in the sixth year, so that it shall yield a crop sufficient for three years.

hebrew: וּזְרַעְתֶּ֗ם אֵ֚ת הַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשְּׁמִינִ֔ת וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֖ם מִן־הַתְּבוּאָ֣ה יָשָׁ֑ן עַ֣ד ׀ הַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַתְּשִׁיעִ֗ת עַד־בּוֹא֙ תְּב֣וּאָתָ֔הּ תֹּאכְל֖וּ יָשָֽׁן׃
transliteration: vz'ra'tem et hashanah hash'miynit vaakhal'tem min-hat'vvah yashan 'ad  hashanah hat'shiy'it 'ad-bvo t'vvatah tokh'lv yashan
translation: When you sow in the eighth year, you will still be eating old grain of that crop; you will be eating the old until the ninth year, until its crops come in.

hebrew: וְהָאָ֗רֶץ לֹ֤א תִמָּכֵר֙ לִצְמִתֻ֔ת כִּי־לִ֖י הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּֽי־גֵרִ֧ים וְתוֹשָׁבִ֛ים אַתֶּ֖ם עִמָּדִֽי׃
transliteration: v'haaretz lo timakher litz'mitut kiy-liy haaretz kiy-geriym v'tvoshaviym atem 'imadiy
translation: But the land must not be sold beyond reclaim, for the land is Mine; you are but strangers resident with Me.

hebrew: וּבְכֹ֖ל אֶ֣רֶץ אֲחֻזַּתְכֶ֑ם גְּאֻלָּ֖ה תִּתְּנ֥וּ לָאָֽרֶץ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vv'khol eretz achuzat'khem g'ulah tit'nv laaretz (s)
translation: Throughout the land that you hold, you must provide for the redemption of the land.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יָמ֣וּךְ אָחִ֔יךָ וּמָכַ֖ר מֵאֲחֻזָּת֑וֹ וּבָ֤א גֹֽאֲלוֹ֙ הַקָּרֹ֣ב אֵלָ֔יו וְגָאַ֕ל אֵ֖ת מִמְכַּ֥ר אָחִֽיו׃
transliteration: kiy-yamvkh' achiykha vmakhar meachuzatvo vva goalvo hakarov elayv v'gaal et mim'kar achiyv
translation: If your kinsman is in straits and has to sell part of his holding, his nearest redeemerdI.e., the closest relative able to redeem the land. shall come and redeem what his kinsman has sold.

hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ כִּ֛י לֹ֥א יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֖וֹ גֹּאֵ֑ל וְהִשִּׂ֣יגָה יָד֔וֹ וּמָצָ֖א כְּדֵ֥י גְאֻלָּתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'iysh kiy lo yih'yeh-lvo goel v'hisiygah yadvo vmatza k'dey g'ulatvo
translation: If a man has no one to redeem for him, but prospers and acquires enough to redeem with,

hebrew: וְחִשַּׁב֙ אֶת־שְׁנֵ֣י מִמְכָּר֔וֹ וְהֵשִׁיב֙ אֶת־הָ֣עֹדֵ֔ף לָאִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָֽכַר־ל֑וֹ וְשָׁ֖ב לַאֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'chishav et-sh'ney mim'karvo v'heshiyv et-ha'odef laiysh asher makhar-lvo v'shav laachuzatvo
translation: he shall compute the years since its sale, refund the difference to the man to whom he sold it, and return to his holding.

hebrew: וְאִ֨ם לֹֽא־מָֽצְאָ֜ה יָד֗וֹ דֵּי֮ הָשִׁ֣יב לוֹ֒ וְהָיָ֣ה מִמְכָּר֗וֹ בְּיַד֙ הַקֹּנֶ֣ה אֹת֔וֹ עַ֖ד שְׁנַ֣ת הַיּוֹבֵ֑ל וְיָצָא֙ בַּיֹּבֵ֔ל וְשָׁ֖ב לַאֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im lo-matz'ah yadvo dey hashiyv lvo v'hayah mim'karvo b'yad hakoneh otvo 'ad sh'nat hayvovel v'yatza bayovel v'shav laachuzatvo
translation: If he lacks sufficient means to recover it, what he sold shall remain with the purchaser until the jubilee; in the jubilee year it shall be released, and he shall return to his holding.

hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ כִּֽי־יִמְכֹּ֤ר בֵּית־מוֹשַׁב֙ עִ֣יר חוֹמָ֔ה וְהָיְתָה֙ גְּאֻלָּת֔וֹ עַד־תֹּ֖ם שְׁנַ֣ת מִמְכָּר֑וֹ יָמִ֖ים תִּהְיֶ֥ה גְאֻלָּתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'iysh kiy-yim'kor beyt-mvoshav 'iyr chvomah v'hay'tah g'ulatvo 'ad-tom sh'nat mim'karvo yamiym tih'yeh g'ulatvo
translation: If a man sells a dwelling house in a walled city, it may be redeemed until a year has elapsed since its sale; the redemption period shall be a year.

hebrew: וְאִ֣ם לֹֽא־יִגָּאֵ֗ל עַד־מְלֹ֣את לוֹ֮ שָׁנָ֣ה תְמִימָה֒ וְ֠קָם הַבַּ֨יִת אֲשֶׁר־בָּעִ֜יר אֲשֶׁר־לא [ל֣וֹ] חֹמָ֗ה לַצְּמִיתֻ֛ת לַקֹּנֶ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ לְדֹרֹתָ֑יו לֹ֥א יֵצֵ֖א בַּיֹּבֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'im lo-yigael 'ad-m'lot lvo shanah t'miymah v'kam habayit asher-ba'iyr asher-l [lvo] chomah latz'miytut lakoneh otvo l'dorotayv lo yetze bayovel
translation: If it is not redeemed before a full year has elapsed, the house in the walled city shall pass to the purchaser beyond reclaim throughout the ages; it shall not be released in the jubilee.

hebrew: וּבָתֵּ֣י הַחֲצֵרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֵין־לָהֶ֤ם חֹמָה֙ סָבִ֔יב עַל־שְׂדֵ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ יֵחָשֵׁ֑ב גְּאֻלָּה֙ תִּהְיֶה־לּ֔וֹ וּבַיֹּבֵ֖ל יֵצֵֽא׃
transliteration: vvatey hachatzeriym asher eyn-lahem chomah saviyv 'al-s'deh haaretz yechashev g'ulah tih'yeh-lvo vvayovel yetze
translation: But houses in villages that have no encircling walls shall be classed as open country: they may be redeemed, and they shall be released through the jubilee.

hebrew: וְעָרֵי֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם בָּתֵּ֖י עָרֵ֣י אֲחֻזָּתָ֑ם גְּאֻלַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם תִּהְיֶ֥ה לַלְוִיִּֽם׃
transliteration: v'arey hal'viyim batey 'arey achuzatam g'ulat 'volam tih'yeh lal'viyim
translation: As for the cities of the Levites, the houses in the cities they hold—the Levites shall forever have the right of redemption.

hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר יִגְאַל֙ מִן־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם וְיָצָ֧א מִמְכַּר־בַּ֛יִת וְעִ֥יר אֲחֻזָּת֖וֹ בַּיֹּבֵ֑ל כִּ֣י בָתֵּ֞י עָרֵ֣י הַלְוִיִּ֗ם הִ֚וא אֲחֻזָּתָ֔ם בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vaasher yig'al min-hal'viyim v'yatza mim'kar-bayit v'iyr achuzatvo bayovel kiy vatey 'arey hal'viyim hiv achuzatam b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael
translation: eMeaning of first half of verse uncertain. Such property as may be redeemed from the Levites—houses sold in a city they hold—shall be released through the jubilee; for the houses in the cities of the Levites are their holding among the Israelites.

hebrew: וּֽשְׂדֵ֛ה מִגְרַ֥שׁ עָרֵיהֶ֖ם לֹ֣א יִמָּכֵ֑ר כִּֽי־אֲחֻזַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֛ם ה֖וּא לָהֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: vs'deh mig'rash 'areyhem lo yimakher kiy-achuzat 'volam hv lahem (s)
translation: But the unenclosed land about their cities cannot be sold, for that is their holding for all time.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָמ֣וּךְ אָחִ֔יךָ וּמָ֥טָה יָד֖וֹ עִמָּ֑ךְ וְהֶֽחֱזַ֣קְתָּ בּ֔וֹ גֵּ֧ר וְתוֹשָׁ֛ב וָחַ֖י עִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yamvkh' achiykha vmatah yadvo 'imakh' v'hechezak'ta bvo ger v'tvoshav vachay 'imakh'
translation: If your kinsman, being in straits, comes under your authority, and you hold him as though a resident alien, let him live by your side:

hebrew: אַל־תִּקַּ֤ח מֵֽאִתּוֹ֙ נֶ֣שֶׁךְ וְתַרְבִּ֔ית וְיָרֵ֖אתָ מֵֽאֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְחֵ֥י אָחִ֖יךָ עִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: al-tikach meitvo neshekh' v'tar'biyt v'yareta meeloheykha v'chey achiykha 'imakh'
translation: do not exact from him advance or accrued interest,fI.e., interest deducted in advance, or interest added at the time of repayment. but fear your God. Let him live by your side as your kinsman.

hebrew: אֶ֨ת־כַּסְפְּךָ֔ לֹֽא־תִתֵּ֥ן ל֖וֹ בְּנֶ֑שֶׁךְ וּבְמַרְבִּ֖ית לֹא־תִתֵּ֥ן אָכְלֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: et-kas'p'kha lo-titen lvo b'neshekh' vv'mar'biyt lo-titen akh'lekha
translation: Do not lend him your money at advance interest, or give him your food at accrued interest.

hebrew: אֲנִ֗י יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם לָתֵ֤ת לָכֶם֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן לִהְי֥וֹת לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃ (ס)
transliteration: aniy y'hvah eloheykhem asher-hvotzetiy et'khem meeretz mitz'rayim latet lakhem et-eretz k'na'an lih'yvot lakhem lelohiym (s)
translation: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan, to be your God.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָמ֥וּךְ אָחִ֛יךָ עִמָּ֖ךְ וְנִמְכַּר־לָ֑ךְ לֹא־תַעֲבֹ֥ד בּ֖וֹ עֲבֹ֥דַת עָֽבֶד׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yamvkh' achiykha 'imakh' v'nim'kar-lakh' lo-ta'avod bvo 'avodat 'aved
translation: If your kinsman under you continues in straits and must give himself over to you, do not subject him to the treatment of a slave.

hebrew: כְּשָׂכִ֥יר כְּתוֹשָׁ֖ב יִהְיֶ֣ה עִמָּ֑ךְ עַד־שְׁנַ֥ת הַיֹּבֵ֖ל יַעֲבֹ֥ד עִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: k'sakhiyr k'tvoshav yih'yeh 'imakh' 'ad-sh'nat hayovel ya'avod 'imakh'
translation: He shall remain with you as a hired or bound laborer; he shall serve with you only until the jubilee year.

hebrew: וְיָצָא֙ מֵֽעִמָּ֔ךְ ה֖וּא וּבָנָ֣יו עִמּ֑וֹ וְשָׁב֙ אֶל־מִשְׁפַּחְתּ֔וֹ וְאֶל־אֲחֻזַּ֥ת אֲבֹתָ֖יו יָשֽׁוּב׃
transliteration: v'yatza me'imakh' hv vvanayv 'imvo v'shav el-mish'pach'tvo v'el-achuzat avotayv yashvv
translation: Then he and his children with him shall be free of your authority; he shall go back to his family and return to his ancestral holding.—

hebrew: כִּֽי־עֲבָדַ֣י הֵ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אֹתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם לֹ֥א יִמָּכְר֖וּ מִמְכֶּ֥רֶת עָֽבֶד׃
transliteration: kiy-'avaday hem asher-hvotzetiy otam meeretz mitz'rayim lo yimakh'rv mim'keret 'aved
translation: For they are My servants, whom I freed from the land of Egypt; they may not give themselves over into servitude.—

hebrew: לֹא־תִרְדֶּ֥ה ב֖וֹ בְּפָ֑רֶךְ וְיָרֵ֖אתָ מֵאֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: lo-tir'deh vvo b'farekh' v'yareta meeloheykha
translation: You shall not rule over him ruthlessly; you shall fear your God.

hebrew: וְעַבְדְּךָ֥ וַאֲמָתְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִהְיוּ־לָ֑ךְ מֵאֵ֣ת הַגּוֹיִ֗ם אֲשֶׁר֙ סְבִיבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם מֵהֶ֥ם תִּקְנ֖וּ עֶ֥בֶד וְאָמָֽה׃
transliteration: v'av'd'kha vaamat'kha asher yih'yv-lakh' meet hagvoyim asher s'viyvoteykhem mehem tik'nv 'eved v'amah
translation: Such male and female slaves as you may have—it is from the nations round about you that you may acquire male and female slaves.

hebrew: וְ֠גַם מִבְּנֵ֨י הַתּוֹשָׁבִ֜ים הַגָּרִ֤ים עִמָּכֶם֙ מֵהֶ֣ם תִּקְנ֔וּ וּמִמִּשְׁפַּחְתָּם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמָּכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹלִ֖ידוּ בְּאַרְצְכֶ֑ם וְהָי֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם לַֽאֲחֻזָּֽה׃
transliteration: v'gam mib'ney hatvoshaviym hagariym 'imakhem mehem tik'nv vmimish'pach'tam asher 'imakhem asher hvoliydv b'ar'tz'khem v'hayv lakhem laachuzah
translation: You may also buy them from among the children of aliens resident among you, or from their families that are among you, whom they begot in your land. These shall become your property:

hebrew: וְהִתְנַחֲלְתֶּ֨ם אֹתָ֜ם לִבְנֵיכֶ֤ם אַחֲרֵיכֶם֙ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אֲחֻזָּ֔ה לְעֹלָ֖ם בָּהֶ֣ם תַּעֲבֹ֑דוּ וּבְאַ֨חֵיכֶ֤ם בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אִ֣ישׁ בְּאָחִ֔יו לֹא־תִרְדֶּ֥ה ב֖וֹ בְּפָֽרֶךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hit'nachal'tem otam liv'neykhem achareykhem lareshet achuzah l'olam bahem ta'avodv vv'acheykhem b'ney-yis'rael iysh b'achiyv lo-tir'deh vvo b'farekh' (s)
translation: you may keep them as a possession for your children after you, for them to inherit as property for all time. Such you may treat as slaves. But as for your Israelite kinsmen, no one shall rule ruthlessly over the other.

hebrew: וְכִ֣י תַשִּׂ֗יג יַ֣ד גֵּ֤ר וְתוֹשָׁב֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ וּמָ֥ךְ אָחִ֖יךָ עִמּ֑וֹ וְנִמְכַּ֗ר לְגֵ֤ר תּוֹשָׁב֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ א֥וֹ לְעֵ֖קֶר מִשְׁפַּ֥חַת גֵּֽר׃
transliteration: v'khiy tasiyg yad ger v'tvoshav 'imakh' vmakh' achiykha 'imvo v'nim'kar l'ger tvoshav 'imakh' vo l'eker mish'pachat ger
translation: If a resident alien among you has prospered, and your kinsman being in straits, comes under his authority and gives himself over to the resident alien among you, or to an offshoot of an alien’s family,

hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֣י נִמְכַּ֔ר גְּאֻלָּ֖ה תִּהְיֶה־לּ֑וֹ אֶחָ֥ד מֵאֶחָ֖יו יִגְאָלֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: acharey nim'kar g'ulah tih'yeh-lvo echad meechayv yig'alenv
translation: he shall have the right of redemption even after he has given himself over. One of his kinsmen shall redeem him,

hebrew: אוֹ־דֹד֞וֹ א֤וֹ בֶן־דֹּדוֹ֙ יִגְאָלֶ֔נּוּ אֽוֹ־מִשְּׁאֵ֧ר בְּשָׂר֛וֹ מִמִּשְׁפַּחְתּ֖וֹ יִגְאָלֶ֑נּוּ אֽוֹ־הִשִּׂ֥יגָה יָד֖וֹ וְנִגְאָֽל׃
transliteration: vo-dodvo vo ven-dodvo yig'alenv vo-mish'er b'sarvo mimish'pach'tvo yig'alenv vo-hisiygah yadvo v'nig'al
translation: or his uncle or his uncle’s son shall redeem him, or anyone of his family who is of his own flesh shall redeem him; or, if he prospers, he may redeem himself.

hebrew: וְחִשַּׁב֙ עִם־קֹנֵ֔הוּ מִשְּׁנַת֙ הִמָּ֣כְרוֹ ל֔וֹ עַ֖ד שְׁנַ֣ת הַיֹּבֵ֑ל וְהָיָ֞ה כֶּ֤סֶף מִמְכָּרוֹ֙ בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שָׁנִ֔ים כִּימֵ֥י שָׂכִ֖יר יִהְיֶ֥ה עִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'chishav 'im-konehv mish'nat himakh'rvo lvo 'ad sh'nat hayovel v'hayah kesef mim'karvo b'mis'par shaniym kiymey sakhiyr yih'yeh 'imvo
translation: He shall compute with his purchaser the total from the year he gave himself over to him until the jubilee year; the price of his sale shall be applied to the number of years, as though it were for a term as a hired laborer under the other’s authority.

hebrew: אִם־ע֥וֹד רַבּ֖וֹת בַּשָּׁנִ֑ים לְפִיהֶן֙ יָשִׁ֣יב גְּאֻלָּת֔וֹ מִכֶּ֖סֶף מִקְנָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: im-'vod rabvot bashaniym l'fiyhen yashiyv g'ulatvo mikesef mik'natvo
translation: If many years remain, he shall pay back for his redemption in proportion to his purchase price;

hebrew: וְאִם־מְעַ֞ט נִשְׁאַ֧ר בַּשָּׁנִ֛ים עַד־שְׁנַ֥ת הַיֹּבֵ֖ל וְחִשַּׁב־ל֑וֹ כְּפִ֣י שָׁנָ֔יו יָשִׁ֖יב אֶת־גְּאֻלָּתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im-m'at nish'ar bashaniym 'ad-sh'nat hayovel v'chishav-lvo k'fiy shanayv yashiyv et-g'ulatvo
translation: and if few years remain until the jubilee year, he shall so compute: he shall make payment for his redemption according to the years involved.

hebrew: כִּשְׂכִ֥יר שָׁנָ֛ה בְּשָׁנָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֣ה עִמּ֑וֹ לֹֽא־יִרְדֶּ֥נּֽוּ בְּפֶ֖רֶךְ לְעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: kis'khiyr shanah b'shanah yih'yeh 'imvo lo-yir'denv b'ferekh' l'eyneykha
translation: He shall be under his authority as a laborer hired by the year; he shall not rule ruthlessly over him in your sight.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֥א יִגָּאֵ֖ל בְּאֵ֑לֶּה וְיָצָא֙ בִּשְׁנַ֣ת הַיֹּבֵ֔ל ה֖וּא וּבָנָ֥יו עִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im-lo yigael b'eleh v'yatza bish'nat hayovel hv vvanayv 'imvo
translation: If he has not been redeemed in any of those ways, he and his children with him shall go free in the jubilee year.

hebrew: כִּֽי־לִ֤י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ עֲבָדִ֔ים עֲבָדַ֣י הֵ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אוֹתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: kiy-liy v'ney-yis'rael 'avadiym 'avaday hem asher-hvotzetiy votam meeretz mitz'rayim aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: For it is to Me that the Israelites are servants: they are My servants, whom I freed from the land of Egypt, I the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תַעֲשׂ֨וּ לָכֶ֜ם אֱלִילִ֗ם וּפֶ֤סֶל וּמַצֵּבָה֙ לֹֽא־תָקִ֣ימוּ לָכֶ֔ם וְאֶ֣בֶן מַשְׂכִּ֗ית לֹ֤א תִתְּנוּ֙ בְּאַרְצְכֶ֔ם לְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֖ת עָלֶ֑יהָ כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: lo-ta'asv lakhem eliylim vfesel vmatzevah lo-takiymv lakhem v'even mas'kiyt lo tit'nv b'ar'tz'khem l'hish'tachavot 'aleyha kiy aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: You shall not make idols for yourselves, or set up for yourselves carved images or pillars, or place figuredaMeaning of Heb. maskith uncertain. stones in your land to worship upon, for I the LORD am your God.

hebrew: אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתַ֣י תִּשְׁמֹ֔רוּ וּמִקְדָּשִׁ֖י תִּירָ֑אוּ אֲנִ֖י יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: et-shab'totay tish'morv vmik'dashiy tiyrav aniy y'hvah (s)
translation: You shall keep My sabbaths and venerate My sanctuary, Mine, the L<small>ORD</small>’s.

hebrew: אִם־בְּחֻקֹּתַ֖י תֵּלֵ֑כוּ וְאֶת־מִצְוֺתַ֣י תִּשְׁמְר֔וּ וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: im-b'chukotay telekhv v'et-mitz'votay tish'm'rv va'asiytem otam
translation: If you follow My laws and faithfully observe My commandments,

hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֥י גִשְׁמֵיכֶ֖ם בְּעִתָּ֑ם וְנָתְנָ֤ה הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ יְבוּלָ֔הּ וְעֵ֥ץ הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה יִתֵּ֥ן פִּרְיֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'natatiy gish'meykhem b'itam v'nat'nah haaretz y'vvlah v'etz hasadeh yiten pir'yvo
translation: I will grant your rains in their season, so that the earth shall yield its produce and the trees of the field their fruit.

hebrew: וְהִשִּׂ֨יג לָכֶ֥ם דַּ֙יִשׁ֙ אֶת־בָּצִ֔יר וּבָצִ֖יר יַשִּׂ֣יג אֶת־זָ֑רַע וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֤ם לַחְמְכֶם֙ לָשֹׂ֔בַע וִֽישַׁבְתֶּ֥ם לָבֶ֖טַח בְּאַרְצְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hisiyg lakhem dayish et-batziyr vvatziyr yasiyg et-zara' vaakhal'tem lach'm'khem lasova' viyshav'tem lavetach b'ar'tz'khem
translation: Your threshing shall overtake the vintage, and your vintage shall overtake the sowing; you shall eat your fill of bread and dwell securely in your land.

hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י שָׁלוֹם֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ וּשְׁכַבְתֶּ֖ם וְאֵ֣ין מַחֲרִ֑יד וְהִשְׁבַּתִּ֞י חַיָּ֤ה רָעָה֙ מִן־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְחֶ֖רֶב לֹא־תַעֲבֹ֥ר בְּאַרְצְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'natatiy shalvom baaretz vsh'khav'tem v'eyn machariyd v'hish'batiy chayah ra'ah min-haaretz v'cherev lo-ta'avor b'ar'tz'khem
translation: I will grant peace in the land, and you shall lie down untroubled by anyone; I will give the land respite from vicious beasts, and no sword shall cross your land.

hebrew: וּרְדַפְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־אֹיְבֵיכֶ֑ם וְנָפְל֥וּ לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם לֶחָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: vr'daf'tem et-oy'veykhem v'naf'lv lif'neykhem lecharev
translation: You shall give chase to your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword.

hebrew: וְרָדְפ֨וּ מִכֶּ֤ם חֲמִשָּׁה֙ מֵאָ֔ה וּמֵאָ֥ה מִכֶּ֖ם רְבָבָ֣ה יִרְדֹּ֑פוּ וְנָפְל֧וּ אֹיְבֵיכֶ֛ם לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם לֶחָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'rad'fv mikem chamishah meah vmeah mikem r'vavah yir'dofv v'naf'lv oy'veykhem lif'neykhem lecharev
translation: Five of you shall give chase to a hundred, and a hundred of you shall give chase to ten thousand; your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.

hebrew: וּפָנִ֣יתִי אֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וְהִפְרֵיתִ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֖י אֶתְכֶ֑ם וַהֲקִימֹתִ֥י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אִתְּכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vfaniytiy aleykhem v'hif'reytiy et'khem v'hir'beytiy et'khem vahakiymotiy et-b'riytiy it'khem
translation: I will look with favor upon you, and make you fertile and multiply you; and I will maintain My covenant with you.

hebrew: וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֥ם יָשָׁ֖ן נוֹשָׁ֑ן וְיָשָׁ֕ן מִפְּנֵ֥י חָדָ֖שׁ תּוֹצִֽיאוּ׃
transliteration: vaakhal'tem yashan nvoshan v'yashan mip'ney chadash tvotziyv
translation: You shall eat old grain long stored, and you shall have to clear out the old to make room for the new.

hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֥י מִשְׁכָּנִ֖י בְּתוֹכְכֶ֑ם וְלֹֽא־תִגְעַ֥ל נַפְשִׁ֖י אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'natatiy mish'kaniy b'tvokh'khem v'lo-tig'al naf'shiy et'khem
translation: I will establish My abode in your midst, and I will not spurn you.

hebrew: וְהִתְהַלַּכְתִּי֙ בְּת֣וֹכְכֶ֔ם וְהָיִ֥יתִי לָכֶ֖ם לֵֽאלֹהִ֑ים וְאַתֶּ֖ם תִּהְיוּ־לִ֥י לְעָֽם׃
transliteration: v'hit'halakh'tiy b'tvokh'khem v'hayiytiy lakhem lelohiym v'atem tih'yv-liy l'am
translation: I will be ever present in your midst: I will be your God, and you shall be My people.

hebrew: אֲנִ֞י יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצֵ֤אתִי אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מִֽהְיֹ֥ת לָהֶ֖ם עֲבָדִ֑ים וָאֶשְׁבֹּר֙ מֹטֹ֣ת עֻלְּכֶ֔ם וָאוֹלֵ֥ךְ אֶתְכֶ֖ם קֽוֹמְמִיּֽוּת׃ (פ)
transliteration: aniy y'hvah eloheykhem asher hvotzetiy et'khem meeretz mitz'rayim mih'yot lahem 'avadiym vaesh'bor motot 'ul'khem vavolekh' et'khem kvom'miyvt (f)
translation: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God who brought you out from the land of the Egyptians to be their slaves no more, who broke the bars of your yoke and made you walk erect.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֥א תִשְׁמְע֖וּ לִ֑י וְלֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּ אֵ֥ת כָּל־הַמִּצְוֺ֖ת הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: v'im-lo tish'm'v liy v'lo ta'asv et kal-hamitz'vot haeleh
translation: But if you do not obey Me and do not observe all these commandments,

hebrew: וְאִם־בְּחֻקֹּתַ֣י תִּמְאָ֔סוּ וְאִ֥ם אֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֖י תִּגְעַ֣ל נַפְשְׁכֶ֑ם לְבִלְתִּ֤י עֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כָּל־מִצְוֺתַ֔י לְהַפְרְכֶ֖ם אֶת־בְּרִיתִֽי׃
transliteration: v'im-b'chukotay tim'asv v'im et-mish'patay tig'al naf'sh'khem l'vil'tiy 'asvot et-kal-mitz'votay l'haf'r'khem et-b'riytiy
translation: if you reject My laws and spurn My rules, so that you do not observe all My commandments and you break My covenant,

hebrew: אַף־אֲנִ֞י אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־זֹּ֣את לָכֶ֗ם וְהִפְקַדְתִּ֨י עֲלֵיכֶ֤ם בֶּֽהָלָה֙ אֶת־הַשַּׁחֶ֣פֶת וְאֶת־הַקַּדַּ֔חַת מְכַלּ֥וֹת עֵינַ֖יִם וּמְדִיבֹ֣ת נָ֑פֶשׁ וּזְרַעְתֶּ֤ם לָרִיק֙ זַרְעֲכֶ֔ם וַאֲכָלֻ֖הוּ אֹיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: af-aniy e'eseh-zot lakhem v'hif'kad'tiy 'aleykhem behalah et-hashachefet v'et-hakadachat m'khalvot 'eynayim vm'diyvot nafesh vz'ra'tem lariyk zar'akhem vaakhaluhv oy'veykhem
translation: I in turn will do this to you: I will wreak misery upon you—bPrecise nature of these ills is uncertain.consumption and fever, which cause the eyes to pine and the body to languish; you shall sow your seed to no purpose, for your enemies shall eat it.

hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י פָנַי֙ בָּכֶ֔ם וְנִגַּפְתֶּ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י אֹיְבֵיכֶ֑ם וְרָד֤וּ בָכֶם֙ שֹֽׂנְאֵיכֶ֔ם וְנַסְתֶּ֖ם וְאֵין־רֹדֵ֥ף אֶתְכֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'natatiy fanay bakhem v'nigaf'tem lif'ney oy'veykhem v'radv vakhem son'eykhem v'nas'tem v'eyn-rodef et'khem (s)
translation: I will set My face against you: you shall be routed by your enemies, and your foes shall dominate you. You shall flee though none pursues.

hebrew: וְאִ֨ם־עַד־אֵ֔לֶּה לֹ֥א תִשְׁמְע֖וּ לִ֑י וְיָסַפְתִּי֙ לְיַסְּרָ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם שֶׁ֖בַע עַל־חַטֹּאתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'im-'ad-eleh lo tish'm'v liy v'yasaf'tiy l'yas'rah et'khem sheva' 'al-chatoteykhem
translation: And if, for all that, you do not obey Me, I will go on to discipline you sevenfold for your sins,

hebrew: וְשָׁבַרְתִּ֖י אֶת־גְּא֣וֹן עֻזְּכֶ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֤י אֶת־שְׁמֵיכֶם֙ כַּבַּרְזֶ֔ל וְאֶֽת־אַרְצְכֶ֖ם כַּנְּחֻשָֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'shavar'tiy et-g'von 'uz'khem v'natatiy et-sh'meykhem kabar'zel v'et-ar'tz'khem kan'chushah
translation: and I will break your proud glory. I will make your skies like iron and your earth like copper,

hebrew: וְתַ֥ם לָרִ֖יק כֹּחֲכֶ֑ם וְלֹֽא־תִתֵּ֤ן אַרְצְכֶם֙ אֶת־יְבוּלָ֔הּ וְעֵ֣ץ הָאָ֔רֶץ לֹ֥א יִתֵּ֖ן פִּרְיֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'tam lariyk kochakhem v'lo-titen ar'tz'khem et-y'vvlah v'etz haaretz lo yiten pir'yvo
translation: so that your strength shall be spent to no purpose. Your land shall not yield its produce, nor shall the trees of the land yield their fruit.

hebrew: וְאִם־תֵּֽלְכ֤וּ עִמִּי֙ קֶ֔רִי וְלֹ֥א תֹאב֖וּ לִשְׁמֹ֣עַֽ לִ֑י וְיָסַפְתִּ֤י עֲלֵיכֶם֙ מַכָּ֔ה שֶׁ֖בַע כְּחַטֹּאתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'im-tel'khv 'imiy keriy v'lo tovv lish'mo'a liy v'yasaf'tiy 'aleykhem makah sheva' k'chatoteykhem
translation: And if you remain hostile toward Me and refuse to obey Me, I will go on smiting you sevenfold for your sins.

hebrew: וְהִשְׁלַחְתִּ֨י בָכֶ֜ם אֶת־חַיַּ֤ת הַשָּׂדֶה֙ וְשִׁכְּלָ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְהִכְרִ֙יתָה֙ אֶת־בְּהֶמְתְּכֶ֔ם וְהִמְעִ֖יטָה אֶתְכֶ֑ם וְנָשַׁ֖מּוּ דַּרְכֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hish'lach'tiy vakhem et-chayat hasadeh v'shik'lah et'khem v'hikh'riytah et-b'hem't'khem v'him'iytah et'khem v'nashamv dar'kheykhem
translation: I will loose wild beasts against you, and they shall bereave you of your children and wipe out your cattle. They shall decimate you, and your roads shall be deserted.

hebrew: וְאִ֨ם־בְּאֵ֔לֶּה לֹ֥א תִוָּסְר֖וּ לִ֑י וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֥ם עִמִּ֖י קֶֽרִי׃
transliteration: v'im-b'eleh lo tivas'rv liy vahalakh'tem 'imiy keriy
translation: And if these things fail to discipline you for Me, and you remain hostile to Me,

hebrew: וְהָלַכְתִּ֧י אַף־אֲנִ֛י עִמָּכֶ֖ם בְּקֶ֑רִי וְהִכֵּיתִ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ גַּם־אָ֔נִי שֶׁ֖בַע עַל־חַטֹּאתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'halakh'tiy af-aniy 'imakhem b'keriy v'hikeytiy et'khem gam-aniy sheva' 'al-chatoteykhem
translation: I too will remain hostile to you: I in turn will smite you sevenfold for your sins.

hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתִ֨י עֲלֵיכֶ֜ם חֶ֗רֶב נֹקֶ֙מֶת֙ נְקַם־בְּרִ֔ית וְנֶאֱסַפְתֶּ֖ם אֶל־עָרֵיכֶ֑ם וְשִׁלַּ֤חְתִּי דֶ֙בֶר֙ בְּת֣וֹכְכֶ֔ם וְנִתַּתֶּ֖ם בְּיַד־אוֹיֵֽב׃
transliteration: v'hevetiy 'aleykhem cherev nokemet n'kam-b'riyt v'neesaf'tem el-'areykhem v'shilach'tiy dever b'tvokh'khem v'nitatem b'yad-voyev
translation: I will bring a sword against you to wreak vengeance for the covenant; and if you withdraw into your cities, I will send pestilence among you, and you shall be delivered into enemy hands.

hebrew: בְּשִׁבְרִ֣י לָכֶם֮ מַטֵּה־לֶחֶם֒ וְ֠אָפוּ עֶ֣שֶׂר נָשִׁ֤ים לַחְמְכֶם֙ בְּתַנּ֣וּר אֶחָ֔ד וְהֵשִׁ֥יבוּ לַחְמְכֶ֖ם בַּמִּשְׁקָ֑ל וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֖ם וְלֹ֥א תִשְׂבָּֽעוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: b'shiv'riy lakhem mateh-lechem v'afv 'eser nashiym lach'm'khem b'tanvr echad v'heshiyvv lach'm'khem bamish'kal vaakhal'tem v'lo tis'ba'v (s)
translation: When I break your staff of bread, ten women shall bake your bread in a single oven; they shall dole out your bread by weight, and though you eat, you shall not be satisfied.

hebrew: וְאִ֨ם־בְּזֹ֔את לֹ֥א תִשְׁמְע֖וּ לִ֑י וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֥ם עִמִּ֖י בְּקֶֽרִי׃
transliteration: v'im-b'zot lo tish'm'v liy vahalakh'tem 'imiy b'keriy
translation: But if, despite this, you disobey Me and remain hostile to Me,

hebrew: וְהָלַכְתִּ֥י עִמָּכֶ֖ם בַּחֲמַת־קֶ֑רִי וְיִסַּרְתִּ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ אַף־אָ֔נִי שֶׁ֖בַע עַל־חַטֹּאתֵיכֶם׃
transliteration: v'halakh'tiy 'imakhem bachamat-keriy v'yisar'tiy et'khem af-aniy sheva' 'al-chatoteykhem
translation: I will act against you in wrathful hostility; I, for My part, will discipline you sevenfold for your sins.

hebrew: וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֖ם בְּשַׂ֣ר בְּנֵיכֶ֑ם וּבְשַׂ֥ר בְּנֹתֵיכֶ֖ם תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: vaakhal'tem b'sar b'neykhem vv'sar b'noteykhem tokhelv
translation: You shall eat the flesh of your sons and the flesh of your daughters.

hebrew: וְהִשְׁמַדְתִּ֞י אֶת־בָּמֹֽתֵיכֶ֗ם וְהִכְרַתִּי֙ אֶת־חַמָּ֣נֵיכֶ֔ם וְנָֽתַתִּי֙ אֶת־פִּגְרֵיכֶ֔ם עַל־פִּגְרֵ֖י גִּלּוּלֵיכֶ֑ם וְגָעֲלָ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֖י אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hish'mad'tiy et-bamoteykhem v'hikh'ratiy et-chamaneykhem v'natatiy et-pig'reykhem 'al-pig'rey gilvleykhem v'ga'alah naf'shiy et'khem
translation:
I will destroy your cult places and cut down your incense stands, and I will heap your carcasses upon your lifeless fetishes.
I will spurn you.

hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י אֶת־עָֽרֵיכֶם֙ חָרְבָּ֔ה וַהֲשִׁמּוֹתִ֖י אֶת־מִקְדְּשֵׁיכֶ֑ם וְלֹ֣א אָרִ֔יחַ בְּרֵ֖יחַ נִיחֹֽחֲכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'natatiy et-'areykhem char'bah vahashimvotiy et-mik'd'sheykhem v'lo ariycha b'reycha niychochakhem
translation: I will lay your cities in ruin and make your sanctuaries desolate, and I will not savor your pleasing odors.

hebrew: וַהֲשִׁמֹּתִ֥י אֲנִ֖י אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְשָֽׁמְמ֤וּ עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ אֹֽיְבֵיכֶ֔ם הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vahashimotiy aniy et-haaretz v'sham'mv 'aleyha oy'veykhem hayosh'viym bah
translation: I will make the land desolate, so that your enemies who settle in it shall be appalled by it.

hebrew: וְאֶתְכֶם֙ אֱזָרֶ֣ה בַגּוֹיִ֔ם וַהֲרִיקֹתִ֥י אַחֲרֵיכֶ֖ם חָ֑רֶב וְהָיְתָ֤ה אַרְצְכֶם֙ שְׁמָמָ֔ה וְעָרֵיכֶ֖ם יִהְי֥וּ חָרְבָּֽה׃
transliteration: v'et'khem ezareh vagvoyim vahariykotiy achareykhem charev v'hay'tah ar'tz'khem sh'mamah v'areykhem yih'yv char'bah
translation: And you I will scatter among the nations, and I will unsheath the sword against you. Your land shall become a desolation and your cities a ruin.

hebrew: אָז֩ תִּרְצֶ֨ה הָאָ֜רֶץ אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתֶ֗יהָ כֹּ֚ל יְמֵ֣י הֳשַׁמָּ֔ה וְאַתֶּ֖ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֹיְבֵיכֶ֑ם אָ֚ז תִּשְׁבַּ֣ת הָאָ֔רֶץ וְהִרְצָ֖ת אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: az tir'tzeh haaretz et-shab'toteyha kol y'mey hoshamah v'atem b'eretz oy'veykhem az tish'bat haaretz v'hir'tzat et-shab'toteyha
translation: Then shall the land make up for its sabbath years throughout the time that it is desolate and you are in the land of your enemies; then shall the land rest and make up for its sabbath years.

hebrew: כָּל־יְמֵ֥י הָשַּׁמָּ֖ה תִּשְׁבֹּ֑ת אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹֽא־שָׁבְתָ֛ה בְּשַׁבְּתֹתֵיכֶ֖ם בְּשִׁבְתְּכֶ֥ם עָלֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: kal-y'mey hashamah tish'bot et asher lo-shav'tah b'shab'toteykhem b'shiv't'khem 'aleyha
translation: Throughout the time that it is desolate, it shall observe the rest that it did not observe in your sabbath years while you were dwelling upon it.

hebrew: וְהַנִּשְׁאָרִ֣ים בָּכֶ֔ם וְהֵבֵ֤אתִי מֹ֙רֶךְ֙ בִּלְבָבָ֔ם בְּאַרְצֹ֖ת אֹיְבֵיהֶ֑ם וְרָדַ֣ף אֹתָ֗ם ק֚וֹל עָלֶ֣ה נִדָּ֔ף וְנָס֧וּ מְנֻֽסַת־חֶ֛רֶב וְנָפְל֖וּ וְאֵ֥ין רֹדֵֽף׃
transliteration: v'hanish'ariym bakhem v'hevetiy morekh' bil'vavam b'ar'tzot oy'veyhem v'radaf otam kvol 'aleh nidaf v'nasv m'nusat-cherev v'naf'lv v'eyn rodef
translation: As for those of you who survive, I will cast a faintness into their hearts in the land of their enemies. The sound of a driven leaf shall put them to flight. Fleeing as though from the sword, they shall fall though none pursues.

hebrew: וְכָשְׁל֧וּ אִישׁ־בְּאָחִ֛יו כְּמִפְּנֵי־חֶ֖רֶב וְרֹדֵ֣ף אָ֑יִן וְלֹא־תִֽהְיֶ֤ה לָכֶם֙ תְּקוּמָ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י אֹֽיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'khash'lv iysh-b'achiyv k'mip'ney-cherev v'rodef ayin v'lo-tih'yeh lakhem t'kvmah lif'ney oy'veykhem
translation:
With no one pursuing, they shall stumble over one another as before the sword. You shall not be able to stand your ground before your en
emies,

hebrew: וַאֲבַדְתֶּ֖ם בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם וְאָכְלָ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֶ֖רֶץ אֹיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vaavad'tem bagvoyim v'akh'lah et'khem eretz oy'veykhem
translation: but shall perish among the nations; and the land of your enemies shall consume you.

hebrew: וְהַנִּשְׁאָרִ֣ים בָּכֶ֗ם יִמַּ֙קּוּ֙ בַּֽעֲוֺנָ֔ם בְּאַרְצֹ֖ת אֹיְבֵיכֶ֑ם וְאַ֛ף בַּעֲוֺנֹ֥ת אֲבֹתָ֖ם אִתָּ֥ם יִמָּֽקּוּ׃
transliteration: v'hanish'ariym bakhem yimakv ba'avonam b'ar'tzot oy'veykhem v'af ba'avonot avotam itam yimakv
translation: Those of you who survive shall be heartsick over their iniquity in the land of your enemies; more, they shall be heartsick over the iniquities of their fathers;

hebrew: וְהִתְוַדּ֤וּ אֶת־עֲוֺנָם֙ וְאֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן אֲבֹתָ֔ם בְּמַעֲלָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָֽעֲלוּ־בִ֑י וְאַ֕ף אֲשֶׁר־הָֽלְכ֥וּ עִמִּ֖י בְּקֶֽרִי׃
transliteration: v'hit'vadv et-'avonam v'et-'avon avotam b'ma'alam asher ma'alv-viy v'af asher-hal'khv 'imiy b'keriy
translation: and they shall confess their iniquity and the iniquity of their fathers, in that they trespassed against Me, yea, were hostile to Me.

hebrew: אַף־אֲנִ֗י אֵלֵ֤ךְ עִמָּם֙ בְּקֶ֔רִי וְהֵבֵאתִ֣י אֹתָ֔ם בְּאֶ֖רֶץ אֹיְבֵיהֶ֑ם אוֹ־אָ֣ז יִכָּנַ֗ע לְבָבָם֙ הֶֽעָרֵ֔ל וְאָ֖ז יִרְצ֥וּ אֶת־עֲוֺנָֽם׃
transliteration: af-aniy elekh' 'imam b'keriy v'hevetiy otam b'eretz oy'veyhem vo-az yikana' l'vavam he'arel v'az yir'tzv et-'avonam
translation: When I, in turn, have been hostile to them and have removed them into the land of their enemies, then at last shall their obduratecOthers “uncircumcised”; lit. “blocked.” heart humble itself, and they shall atone for their iniquity.

hebrew: וְזָכַרְתִּ֖י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֣י יַעֲק֑וֹב וְאַף֩ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֨י יִצְחָ֜ק וְאַ֨ף אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֧י אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֶזְכֹּ֖ר וְהָאָ֥רֶץ אֶזְכֹּֽר׃
transliteration: v'zakhar'tiy et-b'riytiy ya'akvov v'af et-b'riytiy yitz'chak v'af et-b'riytiy av'raham ez'kor v'haaretz ez'kor
translation: Then will I remember My covenant with Jacob; I will remember also My covenant with Isaac, and also My covenant with Abraham; and I will remember the land.

hebrew: וְהָאָרֶץ֩ תֵּעָזֵ֨ב מֵהֶ֜ם וְתִ֣רֶץ אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתֶ֗יהָ בָּהְשַׁמָּה֙ מֵהֶ֔ם וְהֵ֖ם יִרְצ֣וּ אֶת־עֲוֺנָ֑ם יַ֣עַן וּבְיַ֔עַן בְּמִשְׁפָּטַ֣י מָאָ֔סוּ וְאֶת־חֻקֹּתַ֖י גָּעֲלָ֥ה נַפְשָֽׁם׃
transliteration: v'haaretz te'azev mehem v'tiretz et-shab'toteyha bah'shamah mehem v'hem yir'tzv et-'avonam ya'an vv'ya'an b'mish'patay maasv v'et-chukotay ga'alah naf'sham
translation: For the land shall be forsaken of them, making up for its sabbath years by being desolate of them, while they atone for their iniquity; for the abundant reason that they rejected My rules and spurned My laws.

hebrew: וְאַף־גַּם־זֹ֠את בִּֽהְיוֹתָ֞ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֹֽיְבֵיהֶ֗ם לֹֽא־מְאַסְתִּ֤ים וְלֹֽא־גְעַלְתִּים֙ לְכַלֹּתָ֔ם לְהָפֵ֥ר בְּרִיתִ֖י אִתָּ֑ם כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'af-gam-zot bih'yvotam b'eretz oy'veyhem lo-m'as'tiym v'lo-g'al'tiym l'khalotam l'hafer b'riytiy itam kiy aniy y'hvah eloheyhem
translation: Yet, even then, when they are in the land of their enemies, I will not reject them or spurn them so as to destroy them, annulling My covenant with them: for I the L<small>ORD</small> am their God.

hebrew: וְזָכַרְתִּ֥י לָהֶ֖ם בְּרִ֣ית רִאשֹׁנִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר הוֹצֵֽאתִי־אֹתָם֩ מֵאֶ֨רֶץ מִצְרַ֜יִם לְעֵינֵ֣י הַגּוֹיִ֗ם לִהְיֹ֥ת לָהֶ֛ם לֵאלֹהִ֖ים אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'zakhar'tiy lahem b'riyt rishoniym asher hvotzetiy-otam meeretz mitz'rayim l'eyney hagvoyim lih'yot lahem lelohiym aniy y'hvah
translation: I will remember in their favor the covenant with the ancients, whom I freed from the land of Egypt in the sight of the nations to be their God: I, the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: אֵ֠לֶּה הַֽחֻקִּ֣ים וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִים֮ וְהַתּוֹרֹת֒ אֲשֶׁר֙ נָתַ֣ן יְהוָ֔ה בֵּינ֕וֹ וּבֵ֖ין בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּהַ֥ר סִינַ֖י בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: eleh hachukiym v'hamish'patiym v'hatvorot asher natan y'hvah beynvo vveyn b'ney yis'rael b'har siynay b'yad-mosheh (f)
translation: These are the laws, rules, and instructions that the L<small>ORD</small> established, through Moses on Mount Sinai, between Himself and the Israelite people.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אִ֕ישׁ כִּ֥י יַפְלִ֖א נֶ֑דֶר בְּעֶרְכְּךָ֥ נְפָשֹׁ֖ת לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem iysh kiy yaf'li neder b'er'k'kha n'fashot layhvah
translation: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When anyone explicitlyaCf. note at Lev. 22.21. vows to the LORD the equivalent for a human being,

hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה עֶרְכְּךָ֙ הַזָּכָ֔ר מִבֶּן֙ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְעַ֖ד בֶּן־שִׁשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וְהָיָ֣ה עֶרְכְּךָ֗ חֲמִשִּׁ֛ים שֶׁ֥קֶל כֶּ֖סֶף בְּשֶׁ֥קֶל הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: v'hayah 'er'k'kha hazakhar miben 'es'riym shanah v'ad ben-shishiym shanah v'hayah 'er'k'kha chamishiym shekel kesef b'shekel hakodesh
translation: the following scale shall apply: If it is a male from twenty to sixty years of age, the equivalent is fifty shekels of silver by the sanctuary weight;

hebrew: וְאִם־נְקֵבָ֖ה הִ֑וא וְהָיָ֥ה עֶרְכְּךָ֖ שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים שָֽׁקֶל׃
transliteration: v'im-n'kevah hiv v'hayah 'er'k'kha sh'loshiym shakel
translation: if it is a female, the equivalent is thirty shekels.

hebrew: וְאִ֨ם מִבֶּן־חָמֵ֜שׁ שָׁנִ֗ים וְעַד֙ בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְהָיָ֧ה עֶרְכְּךָ֛ הַזָּכָ֖ר עֶשְׂרִ֣ים שְׁקָלִ֑ים וְלַנְּקֵבָ֖ה עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת שְׁקָלִֽים׃
transliteration: v'im miben-chamesh shaniym v'ad ben-'es'riym shanah v'hayah 'er'k'kha hazakhar 'es'riym sh'kaliym v'lan'kevah 'aseret sh'kaliym
translation: If the age is from five years to twenty years, the equivalent is twenty shekels for a male and ten shekels for a female.

hebrew: וְאִ֣ם מִבֶּן־חֹ֗דֶשׁ וְעַד֙ בֶּן־חָמֵ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וְהָיָ֤ה עֶרְכְּךָ֙ הַזָּכָ֔ר חֲמִשָּׁ֥ה שְׁקָלִ֖ים כָּ֑סֶף וְלַנְּקֵבָ֣ה עֶרְכְּךָ֔ שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת שְׁקָלִ֖ים כָּֽסֶף׃
transliteration: v'im miben-chodesh v'ad ben-chamesh shaniym v'hayah 'er'k'kha hazakhar chamishah sh'kaliym kasef v'lan'kevah 'er'k'kha sh'loshet sh'kaliym kasef
translation: If the age is from one month to five years, the equivalent for a male is five shekels of silver, and the equivalent for a female is three shekels of silver.

hebrew: וְ֠אִם מִבֶּן־שִׁשִּׁ֨ים שָׁנָ֤ה וָמַ֙עְלָה֙ אִם־זָכָ֔ר וְהָיָ֣ה עֶרְכְּךָ֔ חֲמִשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר שָׁ֑קֶל וְלַנְּקֵבָ֖ה עֲשָׂרָ֥ה שְׁקָלִֽים׃
transliteration: v'im miben-shishiym shanah vama'lah im-zakhar v'hayah 'er'k'kha chamishah 'asar shakel v'lan'kevah 'asarah sh'kaliym
translation: If the age is sixty years or over, the equivalent is fifteen shekels in the case of a male and ten shekels for a female.

hebrew: וְאִם־מָ֥ךְ הוּא֙ מֵֽעֶרְכֶּ֔ךָ וְהֶֽעֱמִידוֹ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהֶעֱרִ֥יךְ אֹת֖וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֑ן עַל־פִּ֗י אֲשֶׁ֤ר תַּשִּׂיג֙ יַ֣ד הַנֹּדֵ֔ר יַעֲרִיכֶ֖נּוּ הַכֹּהֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'im-makh' hv me'er'kekha v'he'emiydvo lif'ney hakohen v'he'eriykh' otvo hakohen 'al-piy asher tasiyg yad hanoder ya'ariykhenv hakohen (s)
translation: But if one cannot afford the equivalent, he shall be presented before the priest, and the priest shall assess him; the priest shall assess him according to what the vower can afford.

hebrew: וְאִם־בְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַקְרִ֧יבוּ מִמֶּ֛נָּה קָרְבָּ֖ן לַֽיהוָ֑ה כֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֥ן מִמֶּ֛נּוּ לַיהוָ֖ה יִֽהְיֶה־קֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: v'im-b'hemah asher yak'riyvv mimenah kar'ban layhvah kol asher yiten mimenv layhvah yih'yeh-kodesh
translation: If [the vow concerns] any animal that may be brought as an offering to the L<small>ORD</small>, any such that may be given to the L<small>ORD</small> shall be holy.

hebrew: לֹ֣א יַחֲלִיפֶ֗נּוּ וְלֹֽא־יָמִ֥יר אֹת֛וֹ ט֥וֹב בְּרָ֖ע אוֹ־רַ֣ע בְּט֑וֹב וְאִם־הָמֵ֨ר יָמִ֤יר בְּהֵמָה֙ בִּבְהֵמָ֔ה וְהָֽיָה־ה֥וּא וּתְמוּרָת֖וֹ יִֽהְיֶה־קֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: lo yachaliyfenv v'lo-yamiyr otvo tvov b'ra' vo-ra' b'tvov v'im-hamer yamiyr b'hemah biv'hemah v'hayah-hv vt'mvratvo yih'yeh-kodesh
translation: One may not exchange or substitute another for it, either good for bad, or bad for good; if one does substitute one animal for another, the thing vowed and its substitute shall both be holy.

hebrew: וְאִם֙ כָּל־בְּהֵמָ֣ה טְמֵאָ֔ה אֲ֠שֶׁר לֹא־יַקְרִ֧יבוּ מִמֶּ֛נָּה קָרְבָּ֖ן לַֽיהוָ֑ה וְהֶֽעֱמִ֥יד אֶת־הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'im kal-b'hemah t'meah asher lo-yak'riyvv mimenah kar'ban layhvah v'he'emiyd et-hab'hemah lif'ney hakohen
translation: If [the vow concerns] any unclean animal that may not be brought as an offering to the L<small>ORD</small>, the animal shall be presented before the priest,

hebrew: וְהֶעֱרִ֤יךְ הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֹתָ֔הּ בֵּ֥ין ט֖וֹב וּבֵ֣ין רָ֑ע כְּעֶרְכְּךָ֥ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן כֵּ֥ן יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'he'eriykh' hakohen otah beyn tvov vveyn ra' k'er'k'kha hakohen ken yih'yeh
translation: and the priest shall assess it. Whether bLit. “good or bad.”high or low,-b whatever assessment is set by the priest shall stand;

hebrew: וְאִם־גָּאֹ֖ל יִגְאָלֶ֑נָּה וְיָסַ֥ף חֲמִישִׁת֖וֹ עַל־עֶרְכֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'im-gaol yig'alenah v'yasaf chamiyshitvo 'al-'er'kekha
translation: and if he wishes to redeem it, he must add one-fifth to its assessment.

hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ כִּֽי־יַקְדִּ֨שׁ אֶת־בֵּית֥וֹ קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה וְהֶעֱרִיכוֹ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן בֵּ֥ין ט֖וֹב וּבֵ֣ין רָ֑ע כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יַעֲרִ֥יךְ אֹת֛וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן כֵּ֥ן יָקֽוּם׃
transliteration: v'iysh kiy-yak'dish et-beytvo kodesh layhvah v'he'eriykhvo hakohen beyn tvov vveyn ra' kaasher ya'ariykh' otvo hakohen ken yakvm
translation: If anyone consecrates his house to the LORD, the priest shall assess it. Whether bLit. “good or bad.”high or low,-b as the priest assesses it, so it shall stand;

hebrew: וְאִ֨ם־הַמַּקְדִּ֔ישׁ יִגְאַ֖ל אֶת־בֵּית֑וֹ וְ֠יָסַף חֲמִישִׁ֧ית כֶּֽסֶף־עֶרְכְּךָ֛ עָלָ֖יו וְהָ֥יָה לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im-hamak'diysh yig'al et-beytvo v'yasaf chamiyshiyt kesef-'er'k'kha 'alayv v'hayah lvo
translation: and if he who has consecrated his house wishes to redeem it, he must add one-fifth to the sum at which it was assessed, and it shall be his.

hebrew: וְאִ֣ם ׀ מִשְּׂדֵ֣ה אֲחֻזָּת֗וֹ יַקְדִּ֥ישׁ אִישׁ֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה וְהָיָ֥ה עֶרְכְּךָ֖ לְפִ֣י זַרְע֑וֹ זֶ֚רַע חֹ֣מֶר שְׂעֹרִ֔ים בַּחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים שֶׁ֥קֶל כָּֽסֶף׃
transliteration: v'im  mis'deh achuzatvo yak'diysh iysh layhvah v'hayah 'er'k'kha l'fiy zar'vo zera' chomer s'oriym bachamishiym shekel kasef
translation: If anyone consecrates to the LORD any land that he holds, its assessment shall be in accordance with its seed requirement: fifty shekels of silver to a ḥomer of barley seed.

hebrew: אִם־מִשְּׁנַ֥ת הַיֹּבֵ֖ל יַקְדִּ֣ישׁ שָׂדֵ֑הוּ כְּעֶרְכְּךָ֖ יָקֽוּם׃
transliteration: im-mish'nat hayovel yak'diysh sadehv k'er'k'kha yakvm
translation: If he consecrates his land as of the jubilee year, its assessment stands.

hebrew: וְאִם־אַחַ֣ר הַיֹּבֵל֮ יַקְדִּ֣ישׁ שָׂדֵהוּ֒ וְחִשַּׁב־ל֨וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־הַכֶּ֗סֶף עַל־פִּ֤י הַשָּׁנִים֙ הַנּ֣וֹתָרֹ֔ת עַ֖ד שְׁנַ֣ת הַיֹּבֵ֑ל וְנִגְרַ֖ע מֵֽעֶרְכֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'im-achar hayovel yak'diysh sadehv v'chishav-lvo hakohen et-hakesef 'al-piy hashaniym hanvotarot 'ad sh'nat hayovel v'nig'ra' me'er'kekha
translation: But if he consecrates his land after the jubilee, the priest shall compute the price according to the years that are left until the jubilee year, and its assessment shall be so reduced;

hebrew: וְאִם־גָּאֹ֤ל יִגְאַל֙ אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה הַמַּקְדִּ֖ישׁ אֹת֑וֹ וְ֠יָסַף חֲמִשִׁ֧ית כֶּֽסֶף־עֶרְכְּךָ֛ עָלָ֖יו וְקָ֥ם לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im-gaol yig'al et-hasadeh hamak'diysh otvo v'yasaf chamishiyt kesef-'er'k'kha 'alayv v'kam lvo
translation: and if he who consecrated the land wishes to redeem it, he must add one-fifth to the sum at which it was assessed, and it shall pass to him.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֤א יִגְאַל֙ אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה וְאִם־מָכַ֥ר אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה לְאִ֣ישׁ אַחֵ֑ר לֹ֥א יִגָּאֵ֖ל עֽוֹד׃
transliteration: v'im-lo yig'al et-hasadeh v'im-makhar et-hasadeh l'iysh acher lo yigael 'vod
translation: But if he does not redeem the land, and the land is sold to another, it shall no longer be redeemable:

hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה הַשָּׂדֶ֜ה בְּצֵאת֣וֹ בַיֹּבֵ֗ל קֹ֛דֶשׁ לַֽיהוָ֖ה כִּשְׂדֵ֣ה הַחֵ֑רֶם לַכֹּהֵ֖ן תִּהְיֶ֥ה אֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'hayah hasadeh b'tzetvo vayovel kodesh layhvah kis'deh hacherem lakohen tih'yeh achuzatvo
translation: when it is released in the jubilee, the land shall be holy to the L<small>ORD</small>, as land proscribed; it becomes the priest’s holding.

hebrew: וְאִם֙ אֶת־שְׂדֵ֣ה מִקְנָת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֕ר לֹ֖א מִשְּׂדֵ֣ה אֲחֻזָּת֑וֹ יַקְדִּ֖ישׁ לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'im et-s'deh mik'natvo asher lo mis'deh achuzatvo yak'diysh layhvah
translation: If he consecrates to the L<small>ORD</small> land that he purchased, which is not land of his holding,

hebrew: וְחִשַּׁב־ל֣וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֗ן אֵ֚ת מִכְסַ֣ת הָֽעֶרְכְּךָ֔ עַ֖ד שְׁנַ֣ת הַיֹּבֵ֑ל וְנָתַ֤ן אֶת־הָעֶרְכְּךָ֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'chishav-lvo hakohen et mikh'sat ha'er'k'kha 'ad sh'nat hayovel v'natan et-ha'er'k'kha bayvom hahv kodesh layhvah
translation: the priest shall compute for him the proportionate assessment up to the jubilee year, and he shall pay the assessment as of that day, a sacred donation to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֤ת הַיּוֹבֵל֙ יָשׁ֣וּב הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר קָנָ֖הוּ מֵאִתּ֑וֹ לַאֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ אֲחֻזַּ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: bish'nat hayvovel yashvv hasadeh laasher kanahv meitvo laasher-lvo achuzat haaretz
translation: In the jubilee year the land shall revert to him from whom it was bought, whose holding the land is.

hebrew: וְכָל־עֶרְכְּךָ֔ יִהְיֶ֖ה בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים גֵּרָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֥ה הַשָּֽׁקֶל׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khal-'er'k'kha yih'yeh b'shekel hakodesh 'es'riym gerah yih'yeh hashakel (s)
translation: All assessments shall be by the sanctuary weight, the shekel being twenty gerahs.

hebrew: אַךְ־בְּכ֞וֹר אֲשֶׁר־יְבֻכַּ֤ר לַֽיהוָה֙ בִּבְהֵמָ֔ה לֹֽא־יַקְדִּ֥ישׁ אִ֖ישׁ אֹת֑וֹ אִם־שׁ֣וֹר אִם־שֶׂ֔ה לַֽיהוָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
transliteration: akh'-b'khvor asher-y'vukar layhvah biv'hemah lo-yak'diysh iysh otvo im-shvor im-seh layhvah hv
translation: A firstling of animals, however, which—as a firstling—is the L<small>ORD</small>’s, cannot be consecrated by anybody; whether ox or sheep, it is the L<small>ORD</small>’s.

hebrew: וְאִ֨ם בַּבְּהֵמָ֤ה הַטְּמֵאָה֙ וּפָדָ֣ה בְעֶרְכֶּ֔ךָ וְיָסַ֥ף חֲמִשִׁת֖וֹ עָלָ֑יו וְאִם־לֹ֥א יִגָּאֵ֖ל וְנִמְכַּ֥ר בְּעֶרְכֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'im bab'hemah hat'meah vfadah v'er'kekha v'yasaf chamishitvo 'alayv v'im-lo yigael v'nim'kar b'er'kekha
translation: But if it is of unclean animals, it may be ransomed at its assessment, with one-fifth added; if it is not redeemed, it shall be sold at its assessment.

hebrew: אַךְ־כָּל־חֵ֡רֶם אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַחֲרִם֩ אִ֨ישׁ לַֽיהוָ֜ה מִכָּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֗וֹ מֵאָדָ֤ם וּבְהֵמָה֙ וּמִשְּׂדֵ֣ה אֲחֻזָּת֔וֹ לֹ֥א יִמָּכֵ֖ר וְלֹ֣א יִגָּאֵ֑ל כָּל־חֵ֕רֶם קֹֽדֶשׁ־קָֽדָשִׁ֥ים ה֖וּא לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: akh'-kal-cherem asher yacharim iysh layhvah mikal-asher-lvo meadam vv'hemah vmis'deh achuzatvo lo yimakher v'lo yigael kal-cherem kodesh-kadashiym hv layhvah
translation: But of all that anyone owns, be it man or beast or land of his holding, nothing that he has proscribed for the L<small>ORD</small> may be sold or redeemed; every proscribed thing is totally consecrated to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: כָּל־חֵ֗רֶם אֲשֶׁ֧ר יָחֳרַ֛ם מִן־הָאָדָ֖ם לֹ֣א יִפָּדֶ֑ה מ֖וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: kal-cherem asher yachoram min-haadam lo yipadeh mvot yvmat
translation: No human being who has been proscribed can be ransomed: he shall be put to death.

hebrew: וְכָל־מַעְשַׂ֨ר הָאָ֜רֶץ מִזֶּ֤רַע הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ מִפְּרִ֣י הָעֵ֔ץ לַיהוָ֖ה ה֑וּא קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'khal-ma'sar haaretz mizera' haaretz mip'riy ha'etz layhvah hv kodesh layhvah
translation: All tithes from the land, whether seed from the ground or fruit from the tree, are the L<small>ORD</small>’s; they are holy to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְאִם־גָּאֹ֥ל יִגְאַ֛ל אִ֖ישׁ מִמַּֽעַשְׂר֑וֹ חֲמִשִׁית֖וֹ יֹסֵ֥ף עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'im-gaol yig'al iysh mima'as'rvo chamishiytvo yosef 'alayv
translation: If anyone wishes to redeem any of his tithes, he must add one-fifth to them.

hebrew: וְכָל־מַעְשַׂ֤ר בָּקָר֙ וָצֹ֔אן כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲבֹ֖ר תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑בֶט הָֽעֲשִׂירִ֕י יִֽהְיֶה־קֹּ֖דֶשׁ לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'khal-ma'sar bakar vatzon kol asher-ya'avor tachat hashavet ha'asiyriy yih'yeh-kodesh layhvah
translation: All tithes of the herd or flock—of all that passes under the shepherd’s staff, every tenth one—shall be holy to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: לֹ֧א יְבַקֵּ֛ר בֵּֽין־ט֥וֹב לָרַ֖ע וְלֹ֣א יְמִירֶ֑נּוּ וְאִם־הָמֵ֣ר יְמִירֶ֔נּוּ וְהָֽיָה־ה֧וּא וּתְמוּרָת֛וֹ יִֽהְיֶה־קֹ֖דֶשׁ לֹ֥א יִגָּאֵֽל׃
transliteration: lo y'vaker beyn-tvov lara' v'lo y'miyrenv v'im-hamer y'miyrenv v'hayah-hv vt'mvratvo yih'yeh-kodesh lo yigael
translation: He must not look out for good as against bad, or make substitution for it. If he does make substitution for it, then it and its substitute shall both be holy: it cannot be redeemed.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הַמִּצְוֺ֗ת אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּהַ֖ר סִינָֽי׃
transliteration: eleh hamitz'vot asher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh el-b'ney yis'rael b'har siynay
translation: These are the commandments that the LORD gave Moses for the Israelite people on Mount Sinai.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר יְהוָ֧ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֛ה בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר סִינַ֖י בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד בְּאֶחָד֩ לַחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֜י בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשֵּׁנִ֗ית לְצֵאתָ֛ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh b'mid'bar siynay b'ohel mvo'ed b'echad lachodesh hasheniy bashanah hasheniyt l'tzetam meeretz mitz'rayim lemor
translation: On the first day of the second month, in the second year following the exodus from the land of Egypt, the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the Tent of Meeting, saying:

hebrew: שְׂא֗וּ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֙ כָּל־עֲדַ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמ֔וֹת כָּל־זָכָ֖ר לְגֻלְגְּלֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: s'v et-rosh kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemvot kal-zakhar l'gul'g'lotam
translation: Take a census of the whole Israelite community by the clans of aI.e., its tribes.its ancestral houses,-a listing the names, every male, head by head.

hebrew: מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כָּל־יֹצֵ֥א צָבָ֖א בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל תִּפְקְד֥וּ אֹתָ֛ם לְצִבְאֹתָ֖ם אַתָּ֥ה וְאַהֲרֹֽן׃
transliteration: miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kal-yotze tzava b'yis'rael tif'k'dv otam l'tziv'otam atah v'aharon
translation: You and Aaron shall record them by their groups, from the age of twenty years up, all those in Israel who are able to bear arms.

hebrew: וְאִתְּכֶ֣ם יִהְי֔וּ אִ֥ישׁ אִ֖ישׁ לַמַּטֶּ֑ה אִ֛ישׁ רֹ֥אשׁ לְבֵית־אֲבֹתָ֖יו הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'it'khem yih'yv iysh iysh lamateh iysh rosh l'veyt-avotayv hv
translation: Associated with you shall be a man from each tribe, each one the head of his ancestral house.

hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ שְׁמ֣וֹת הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַֽעַמְד֖וּ אִתְּכֶ֑ם לִרְאוּבֵ֕ן אֱלִיצ֖וּר בֶּן־שְׁדֵיאֽוּר׃
transliteration: v'eleh sh'mvot haanashiym asher ya'am'dv it'khem lir'vven eliytzvr ben-sh'deyvr
translation:
These are the names of the men who shall assist you:
From Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur.

hebrew: לְשִׁמְע֕וֹן שְׁלֻמִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־צוּרִֽישַׁדָּֽי׃
transliteration: l'shim'von sh'lumiyel ben-tzvriyshaday
translation: From Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.

hebrew: לִֽיהוּדָ֕ה נַחְשׁ֖וֹן בֶּן־עַמִּינָדָֽב׃
transliteration: liyhvdah nach'shvon ben-'amiynadav
translation: From Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab.

hebrew: לְיִ֨שָּׂשכָ֔ר נְתַנְאֵ֖ל בֶּן־צוּעָֽר׃
transliteration: l'yisashkhar n'tan'el ben-tzv'ar
translation: From Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar.

hebrew: לִזְבוּלֻ֕ן אֱלִיאָ֖ב בֶּן־חֵלֹֽן׃
transliteration: liz'vvlun eliyav ben-chelon
translation: From Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף לְאֶפְרַ֕יִם אֱלִישָׁמָ֖ע בֶּן־עַמִּיה֑וּד לִמְנַשֶּׁ֕ה גַּמְלִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־פְּדָהצֽוּר׃
transliteration: liv'ney yvosef l'ef'rayim eliyshama' ben-'amiyhvd lim'nasheh gam'liyel ben-p'dahtzvr
translation:
From the sons of Joseph:
from Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud;
from Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

hebrew: לְבִ֨נְיָמִ֔ן אֲבִידָ֖ן בֶּן־גִּדְעֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: l'vin'yamin aviydan ben-gid'oniy
translation: From Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni.

hebrew: לְדָ֕ן אֲחִיעֶ֖זֶר בֶּן־עַמִּֽישַׁדָּֽי׃
transliteration: l'dan achiy'ezer ben-'amiyshaday
translation: From Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

hebrew: לְאָשֵׁ֕ר פַּגְעִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־עָכְרָֽן׃
transliteration: l'asher pag'iyel ben-'akh'ran
translation: From Asher, Pagiel son of Ochran.

hebrew: לְגָ֕ד אֶלְיָסָ֖ף בֶּן־דְּעוּאֵֽל׃
transliteration: l'gad el'yasaf ben-d'vel
translation: From Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel.

hebrew: לְנַ֨פְתָּלִ֔י אֲחִירַ֖ע בֶּן־עֵינָֽן׃
transliteration: l'naf'taliy achiyra' ben-'eynan
translation: From Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה קריאי [קְרוּאֵ֣י] הָעֵדָ֔ה נְשִׂיאֵ֖י מַטּ֣וֹת אֲבוֹתָ֑ם רָאשֵׁ֛י אַלְפֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הֵֽם׃
transliteration: eleh kryy [k'rvey] ha'edah n'siyey matvot avvotam rashey al'fey yis'rael hem
translation: Those are the elected of the assembly, the chieftains of their ancestral tribes: they are the heads of the contingents of Israel.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֑ן אֵ֚ת הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִקְּב֖וּ בְּשֵׁמֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh v'aharon et haanashiym haeleh asher nik'vv b'shemvot
translation: So Moses and Aaron took those men, who were designated by name,

hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת כָּל־הָעֵדָ֜ה הִקְהִ֗ילוּ בְּאֶחָד֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י וַיִּתְיַֽלְד֥וּ עַל־מִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמ֗וֹת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֛ה וָמַ֖עְלָה לְגֻלְגְּלֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'et kal-ha'edah hik'hiylv b'echad lachodesh hasheniy vayit'yal'dv 'al-mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemvot miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah l'gul'g'lotam
translation: and on the first day of the second month they convoked the whole community, who were registered by the clans of their ancestral houses—the names of those aged twenty years and over being listed head by head.

hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַֽיִּפְקְדֵ֖ם בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר סִינָֽי׃ (פ)
transliteration: kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh vayif'k'dem b'mid'bar siynay (f)
translation: As the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses, so he recorded them in the wilderness of Sinai.

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֤וּ בְנֵֽי־רְאוּבֵן֙ בְּכֹ֣ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֤ר שֵׁמוֹת֙ לְגֻלְגְּלֹתָ֔ם כָּל־זָכָ֗ר מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: vayih'yv v'ney-r'vven b'khor yis'rael tvol'dotam l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemvot l'gul'g'lotam kal-zakhar miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kol yotze tzava
translation:
They totaled as follows:
The descendants of Reuben, Israel’s first-born, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, head by head, all males aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה רְאוּבֵ֑ן שִׁשָּׁ֧ה וְאַרְבָּעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: p'kudeyhem l'mateh r'vven shishah v'ar'ba'iym elef vachamesh mevot (f)
translation: those enrolled from the tribe of Reuben: 46,500.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֔וֹן תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם פְּקֻדָ֗יו בְּמִסְפַּ֤ר שֵׁמוֹת֙ לְגֻלְגְּלֹתָ֔ם כָּל־זָכָ֗ר מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: liv'ney shim'von tvol'dotam l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam p'kudayv b'mis'par shemvot l'gul'g'lotam kal-zakhar miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kol yotze tzava
translation: Of the descendants of Simeon, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, their enrollment as listed by name, head by head, all males aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה שִׁמְע֑וֹן תִּשְׁעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: p'kudeyhem l'mateh shim'von tish'ah vachamishiym elef vsh'losh mevot (f)
translation: those enrolled from the tribe of Simeon: 59,300.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י גָ֔ד תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמ֗וֹת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: liv'ney gad tvol'dotam l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemvot miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kol yotze tzava
translation: Of the descendants of Gad, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה גָ֑ד חֲמִשָּׁ֤ה וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃ (פ)
transliteration: p'kudeyhem l'mateh gad chamishah v'ar'ba'iym elef v'shesh mevot vachamishiym (f)
translation: those enrolled from the tribe of Gad: 45,650.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: liv'ney y'hvdah tvol'dotam l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemot miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kol yotze tzava
translation: Of the descendants of Judah, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה יְהוּדָ֑ה אַרְבָּעָ֧ה וְשִׁבְעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: p'kudeyhem l'mateh y'hvdah ar'ba'ah v'shiv'iym elef v'shesh mevot (f)
translation: those enrolled from the tribe of Judah: 74,600.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י יִשָּׂשכָ֔ר תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: liv'ney yisashkhar tvol'dotam l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemot miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kol yotze tzava
translation: Of the descendants of Issachar, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה יִשָּׂשכָ֑ר אַרְבָּעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: p'kudeyhem l'mateh yisashkhar ar'ba'ah vachamishiym elef v'ar'ba' mevot (f)
translation: those enrolled from the tribe of Issachar: 54,400.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י זְבוּלֻ֔ן תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: liv'ney z'vvlun tvol'dotam l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemot miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kol yotze tzava
translation: Of the descendants of Zebulun, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה זְבוּלֻ֑ן שִׁבְעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: p'kudeyhem l'mateh z'vvlun shiv'ah vachamishiym elef v'ar'ba' mevot (f)
translation: those enrolled from the tribe of Zebulun: 57,400.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֤י יוֹסֵף֙ לִבְנֵ֣י אֶפְרַ֔יִם תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: liv'ney yvosef liv'ney ef'rayim tvol'dotam l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemot miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kol yotze tzava
translation:
Of the descendants of Joseph:
Of the descendants of Ephraim, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה אֶפְרָ֑יִם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: p'kudeyhem l'mateh ef'rayim ar'ba'iym elef vachamesh mevot (f)
translation: those enrolled from the tribe of Ephraim: 40,500.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמ֗וֹת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: liv'ney m'nasheh tvol'dotam l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemvot miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kol yotze tzava
translation: Of the descendants of Manasseh, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה שְׁנַ֧יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּמָאתָֽיִם׃ (פ)
transliteration: p'kudeyhem l'mateh m'nasheh sh'nayim vsh'loshiym elef vmatayim (f)
translation: those enrolled from the tribe of Manasseh: 32,200.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֔ן תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: liv'ney vin'yamin tvol'dotam l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemot miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kol yotze tzava
translation: Of the descendants of Benjamin, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה בִנְיָמִ֑ן חֲמִשָּׁ֧ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: p'kudeyhem l'mateh vin'yamin chamishah vsh'loshiym elef v'ar'ba' mevot (f)
translation: those enrolled from the tribe of Benjamin: 35,400.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י דָ֔ן תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: liv'ney dan tvol'dotam l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemot miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kol yotze tzava
translation: Of the descendants of Dan, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה דָ֑ן שְׁנַ֧יִם וְשִׁשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: p'kudeyhem l'mateh dan sh'nayim v'shishiym elef vsh'va' mevot (f)
translation: those enrolled from the tribe of Dan: 62,700.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י אָשֵׁ֔ר תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: liv'ney asher tvol'dotam l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemot miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kol yotze tzava
