translation: Of the descendants of Asher, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה אָשֵׁ֑ר אֶחָ֧ד וְאַרְבָּעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: p'kudeyhem l'mateh asher echad v'ar'ba'iym elef vachamesh mevot (f)
translation: those enrolled from the tribe of Asher: 41,500.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י נַפְתָּלִ֔י תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: b'ney naf'taliy tvol'dotam l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam b'mis'par shemot miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kol yotze tzava
translation: [Of] the descendants of Naphtali, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה נַפְתָּלִ֑י שְׁלֹשָׁ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: p'kudeyhem l'mateh naf'taliy sh'loshah vachamishiym elef v'ar'ba' mevot (f)
translation: those enrolled from the tribe of Naphtali: 53,400.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הַפְּקֻדִ֡ים אֲשֶׁר֩ פָּקַ֨ד מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְאַהֲרֹן֙ וּנְשִׂיאֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר אִ֑ישׁ אִישׁ־אֶחָ֥ד לְבֵית־אֲבֹתָ֖יו הָיֽוּ׃
transliteration: eleh hap'kudiym asher pakad mosheh v'aharon vn'siyey yis'rael sh'neym 'asar iysh iysh-echad l'veyt-avotayv hayv
translation: Those are the enrollments recorded by Moses and Aaron and by the chieftains of Israel, who were twelve in number, one man to each ancestral house.

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֛וּ כָּל־פְּקוּדֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כָּל־יֹצֵ֥א צָבָ֖א בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayih'yv kal-p'kvdey v'ney-yis'rael l'veyt avotam miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kal-yotze tzava b'yis'rael
translation: All the Israelites, aged twenty years and over, enrolled by ancestral houses, all those in Israel who were able to bear arms—

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כָּל־הַפְּקֻדִ֔ים שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֑ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃
transliteration: vayih'yv kal-hap'kudiym shesh-mevot elef vsh'loshet alafiym vachamesh mevot vachamishiym
translation: all who were enrolled came to 603,550.

hebrew: וְהַלְוִיִּ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה אֲבֹתָ֑ם לֹ֥א הָתְפָּקְד֖וּ בְּתוֹכָֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hal'viyim l'mateh avotam lo hat'pak'dv b'tvokham (f)
translation: The Levites, however, were not recorded among them by their ancestral tribe.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: For the L<small>ORD</small> had spoken to Moses, saying:

hebrew: אַ֣ךְ אֶת־מַטֵּ֤ה לֵוִי֙ לֹ֣א תִפְקֹ֔ד וְאֶת־רֹאשָׁ֖ם לֹ֣א תִשָּׂ֑א בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: akh' et-mateh leviy lo tif'kod v'et-rosham lo tisa b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael
translation: Do not on any account enroll the tribe of Levi or take a census of them with the Israelites.

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֡ה הַפְקֵ֣ד אֶת־הַלְוִיִּם֩ עַל־מִשְׁכַּ֨ן הָעֵדֻ֜ת וְעַ֣ל כָּל־כֵּלָיו֮ וְעַ֣ל כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֒ הֵ֜מָּה יִשְׂא֤וּ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְהֵ֖ם יְשָׁרְתֻ֑הוּ וְסָבִ֥יב לַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יַחֲנֽוּ׃
transliteration: v'atah haf'ked et-hal'viyim 'al-mish'kan ha'edut v'al kal-kelayv v'al kal-asher-lvo hemah yis'v et-hamish'kan v'et-kal-kelayv v'hem y'shar'tuhv v'saviyv lamish'kan yachanv
translation: You shall put the Levites in charge of the Tabernacle of the Pact, all its furnishings, and everything that pertains to it: they shall carry the Tabernacle and all its furnishings, and they shall tend it; and they shall camp around the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וּבִנְסֹ֣עַ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֗ן יוֹרִ֤ידוּ אֹתוֹ֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם וּבַחֲנֹת֙ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן יָקִ֥ימוּ אֹת֖וֹ הַלְוִיִּ֑ם וְהַזָּ֥ר הַקָּרֵ֖ב יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: vvin'so'a hamish'kan yvoriydv otvo hal'viyim vvachanot hamish'kan yakiymv otvo hal'viyim v'hazar hakarev yvmat
translation: When the Tabernacle is to set out, the Levites shall take it down, and when the Tabernacle is to be pitched, the Levites shall set it up; any outsider who encroaches shall be put to death.

hebrew: וְחָנ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אִ֧ישׁ עַֽל־מַחֲנֵ֛הוּ וְאִ֥ישׁ עַל־דִּגְל֖וֹ לְצִבְאֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'chanv b'ney yis'rael iysh 'al-machanehv v'iysh 'al-dig'lvo l'tziv'otam
translation: The Israelites shall encamp troop by troop, each man with his division and each under his standard.

hebrew: וְהַלְוִיִּ֞ם יַחֲנ֤וּ סָבִיב֙ לְמִשְׁכַּ֣ן הָעֵדֻ֔ת וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֣ה קֶ֔צֶף עַל־עֲדַ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְשָׁמְרוּ֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת מִשְׁכַּ֥ן הָעֵדֽוּת׃
transliteration: v'hal'viyim yachanv saviyv l'mish'kan ha'edut v'lo-yih'yeh ketzef 'al-'adat b'ney yis'rael v'sham'rv hal'viyim et-mish'meret mish'kan ha'edvt
translation: The Levites, however, shall camp around the Tabernacle of the Pact, that wrath may not strike the Israelite community; the Levites shall stand guard around the Tabernacle of the Pact.

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כְּ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vaya'asv b'ney yis'rael k'khol asher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh ken 'asv (f)
translation: The Israelites did accordingly; just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses, so they did.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ עַל־דִּגְל֤וֹ בְאֹתֹת֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֔ם יַחֲנ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִנֶּ֕גֶד סָבִ֥יב לְאֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד יַחֲנֽוּ׃
transliteration: iysh 'al-dig'lvo v'otot l'veyt avotam yachanv b'ney yis'rael mineged saviyv l'ohel-mvo'ed yachanv
translation: The Israelites shall camp each with his standard, under the banners of their ancestral house; they shall camp around the Tent of Meeting at a distance.

hebrew: וְהַחֹנִים֙ קֵ֣דְמָה מִזְרָ֔חָה דֶּ֛גֶל מַחֲנֵ֥ה יְהוּדָ֖ה לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה נַחְשׁ֖וֹן בֶּן־עַמִּינָדָֽב׃
transliteration: v'hachoniym ked'mah miz'rachah degel machaneh y'hvdah l'tziv'otam v'nasiy liv'ney y'hvdah nach'shvon ben-'amiynadav
translation:
Camped on the front, or east side: the standard of the division of Judah, troop by troop.
Chieftain of the Judites: Nahshon son of Amminadab.

hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם אַרְבָּעָ֧ה וְשִׁבְעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vtz'vavo vf'kudeyhem ar'ba'ah v'shiv'iym elef v'shesh mevot
translation: His troop, as enrolled: 74,600.

hebrew: וְהַחֹנִ֥ים עָלָ֖יו מַטֵּ֣ה יִשָּׂשכָ֑ר וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשָּׂשכָ֔ר נְתַנְאֵ֖ל בֶּן־צוּעָֽר׃
transliteration: v'hachoniym 'alayv mateh yisashkhar v'nasiy liv'ney yisashkhar n'tan'el ben-tzv'ar
translation:
Camping next to it:
The tribe of Issachar.
Chieftain of the Issacharites: Nethanel son of Zuar.

hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדָ֑יו אַרְבָּעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: vtz'vavo vf'kudayv ar'ba'ah vachamishiym elef v'ar'ba' mevot (s)
translation: His troop, as enrolled: 54,400.

hebrew: מַטֵּ֖ה זְבוּלֻ֑ן וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י זְבוּלֻ֔ן אֱלִיאָ֖ב בֶּן־חֵלֹֽן׃
transliteration: mateh z'vvlun v'nasiy liv'ney z'vvlun eliyav ben-chelon
translation:
The tribe of Zebulun.
Chieftain of the Zebulunites: Eliab son of Helon.

hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדָ֑יו שִׁבְעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vtz'vavo vf'kudayv shiv'ah vachamishiym elef v'ar'ba' mevot
translation: His troop, as enrolled: 57,400.

hebrew: כָּֽל־הַפְּקֻדִ֞ים לְמַחֲנֵ֣ה יְהוּדָ֗ה מְאַ֨ת אֶ֜לֶף וּשְׁמֹנִ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף וְשֵֽׁשֶׁת־אֲלָפִ֥ים וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֖וֹת לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם רִאשֹׁנָ֖ה יִסָּֽעוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kal-hap'kudiym l'machaneh y'hvdah m'at elef vsh'moniym elef v'sheshet-alafiym v'ar'ba'-mevot l'tziv'otam rishonah yisa'v (s)
translation: The total enrolled in the division of Judah: 186,400, for all troops. These shall march first.

hebrew: דֶּ֣גֶל מַחֲנֵ֧ה רְאוּבֵ֛ן תֵּימָ֖נָה לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י רְאוּבֵ֔ן אֱלִיצ֖וּר בֶּן־שְׁדֵיאֽוּר׃
transliteration: degel machaneh r'vven teymanah l'tziv'otam v'nasiy liv'ney r'vven eliytzvr ben-sh'deyvr
translation:
On the south: the standard of the division of Reuben, troop by troop.
Chieftain of the Reubenites: Elizur son of Shedeur.

hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדָ֑יו שִׁשָּׁ֧ה וְאַרְבָּעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vtz'vavo vf'kudayv shishah v'ar'ba'iym elef vachamesh mevot
translation: His troop, as enrolled: 46,500.

hebrew: וְהַחוֹנִ֥ם עָלָ֖יו מַטֵּ֣ה שִׁמְע֑וֹן וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֔וֹן שְׁלֻמִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־צוּרִֽי־שַׁדָּֽי׃
transliteration: v'hachvonim 'alayv mateh shim'von v'nasiy liv'ney shim'von sh'lumiyel ben-tzvriy-shaday
translation:
Camping next to it:
The tribe of Simeon.
Chieftain of the Simeonites: Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.

hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם תִּשְׁעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vtz'vavo vf'kudeyhem tish'ah vachamishiym elef vsh'losh mevot
translation: His troop, as enrolled: 59,300.

hebrew: וְמַטֵּ֖ה גָּ֑ד וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י גָ֔ד אֶלְיָסָ֖ף בֶּן־רְעוּאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'mateh gad v'nasiy liv'ney gad el'yasaf ben-r'vel
translation:
And the tribe of Gad.
Chieftain of the Gadites: Eliasaph son of Reuel.

hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם חֲמִשָּׁ֤ה וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃
transliteration: vtz'vavo vf'kudeyhem chamishah v'ar'ba'iym elef v'shesh mevot vachamishiym
translation: His troop, as enrolled: 45,650.

hebrew: כָּֽל־הַפְּקֻדִ֞ים לְמַחֲנֵ֣ה רְאוּבֵ֗ן מְאַ֨ת אֶ֜לֶף וְאֶחָ֨ד וַחֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֥וֹת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וּשְׁנִיִּ֖ם יִסָּֽעוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kal-hap'kudiym l'machaneh r'vven m'at elef v'echad vachamishiym elef v'ar'ba'-mevot vachamishiym l'tziv'otam vsh'niyim yisa'v (s)
translation: The total enrolled in the division of Reuben: 151,450, for all troops. These shall march second.

hebrew: וְנָסַ֧ע אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֛ד מַחֲנֵ֥ה הַלְוִיִּ֖ם בְּת֣וֹךְ הַֽמַּחֲנֹ֑ת כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר יַחֲנוּ֙ כֵּ֣ן יִסָּ֔עוּ אִ֥ישׁ עַל־יָד֖וֹ לְדִגְלֵיהֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'nasa' ohel-mvo'ed machaneh hal'viyim b'tvokh' hamachanot kaasher yachanv ken yisa'v iysh 'al-yadvo l'dig'leyhem (s)
translation: Then, midway between the divisions, the Tent of Meeting, the division of the Levites, shall move. As they camp, so they shall march, each in position, by their standards.

hebrew: דֶּ֣גֶל מַחֲנֵ֥ה אֶפְרַ֛יִם לְצִבְאֹתָ֖ם יָ֑מָּה וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י אֶפְרַ֔יִם אֱלִישָׁמָ֖ע בֶּן־עַמִּיהֽוּד׃
transliteration: degel machaneh ef'rayim l'tziv'otam yamah v'nasiy liv'ney ef'rayim eliyshama' ben-'amiyhvd
translation:
On the west: the standard of the division of Ephraim, troop by troop.
Chieftain of the Ephraimites: Elishama son of Ammihud.

hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vtz'vavo vf'kudeyhem ar'ba'iym elef vachamesh mevot
translation: His troop, as enrolled: 40,500.

hebrew: וְעָלָ֖יו מַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה גַּמְלִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־פְּדָהצֽוּר׃
transliteration: v'alayv mateh m'nasheh v'nasiy liv'ney m'nasheh gam'liyel ben-p'dahtzvr
translation:
Next to it:
The tribe of Manasseh.
Chieftain of the Manassites: Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁנַ֧יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vtz'vavo vf'kudeyhem sh'nayim vsh'loshiym elef vmatayim
translation: His troop, as enrolled: 32,200.

hebrew: וּמַטֵּ֖ה בִּנְיָמִ֑ן וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֔ן אֲבִידָ֖ן בֶּן־גִּדְעֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: vmateh bin'yamin v'nasiy liv'ney vin'yamin aviydan ben-gid'oniy
translation:
And the tribe of Benjamin.
Chieftain of the Benjaminites: Abidan son of Gideoni.

hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם חֲמִשָּׁ֧ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vtz'vavo vf'kudeyhem chamishah vsh'loshiym elef v'ar'ba' mevot
translation: His troop, as enrolled: 35,400.

hebrew: כָּֽל־הַפְּקֻדִ֞ים לְמַחֲנֵ֣ה אֶפְרַ֗יִם מְאַ֥ת אֶ֛לֶף וּשְׁמֹֽנַת־אֲלָפִ֥ים וּמֵאָ֖ה לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וּשְׁלִשִׁ֖ים יִסָּֽעוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kal-hap'kudiym l'machaneh ef'rayim m'at elef vsh'monat-alafiym vmeah l'tziv'otam vsh'lishiym yisa'v (s)
translation: The total enrolled in the division of Ephraim: 108,100 for all troops. These shall march third.

hebrew: דֶּ֣גֶל מַחֲנֵ֥ה דָ֛ן צָפֹ֖נָה לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י דָ֔ן אֲחִיעֶ֖זֶר בֶּן־עַמִּֽישַׁדָּֽי׃
transliteration: degel machaneh dan tzafonah l'tziv'otam v'nasiy liv'ney dan achiy'ezer ben-'amiyshaday
translation:
On the north: the standard of the division of Dan, troop by troop.
Chieftain of the Danites: Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁנַ֧יִם וְשִׁשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vtz'vavo vf'kudeyhem sh'nayim v'shishiym elef vsh'va' mevot
translation: His troop, as enrolled: 62,700.

hebrew: וְהַחֹנִ֥ים עָלָ֖יו מַטֵּ֣ה אָשֵׁ֑ר וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י אָשֵׁ֔ר פַּגְעִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־עָכְרָֽן׃
transliteration: v'hachoniym 'alayv mateh asher v'nasiy liv'ney asher pag'iyel ben-'akh'ran
translation:
Camping next to it:
The tribe of Asher.
Chieftain of the Asherites: Pagiel son of Ochran.

hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם אֶחָ֧ד וְאַרְבָּעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vtz'vavo vf'kudeyhem echad v'ar'ba'iym elef vachamesh mevot
translation: His troop, as enrolled: 41,500.

hebrew: וּמַטֵּ֖ה נַפְתָּלִ֑י וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י נַפְתָּלִ֔י אֲחִירַ֖ע בֶּן־עֵינָֽן׃
transliteration: vmateh naf'taliy v'nasiy liv'ney naf'taliy achiyra' ben-'eynan
translation:
And the tribe of Naphtali.
Chieftain of the Naphtalites: Ahira son of Enan.

hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vtz'vavo vf'kudeyhem sh'loshah vachamishiym elef v'ar'ba' mevot
translation: His troop, as enrolled: 53,400.

hebrew: כָּל־הַפְּקֻדִים֙ לְמַ֣חֲנֵה דָ֔ן מְאַ֣ת אֶ֗לֶף וְשִׁבְעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מֵא֑וֹת לָאַחֲרֹנָ֥ה יִסְע֖וּ לְדִגְלֵיהֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: kal-hap'kudiym l'machaneh dan m'at elef v'shiv'ah vachamishiym elef v'shesh mevot laacharonah yis'v l'dig'leyhem (f)
translation: The total enrolled in the division of Dan: 157,600. These shall march last, by their standards.

hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה פְּקוּדֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם כָּל־פְּקוּדֵ֤י הַֽמַּחֲנֹת֙ לְצִבְאֹתָ֔ם שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֙לֶף֙ וּשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֔ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃
transliteration: eleh p'kvdey v'ney-yis'rael l'veyt avotam kal-p'kvdey hamachanot l'tziv'otam shesh-mevot elef vsh'loshet alafiym vachamesh mevot vachamishiym
translation: Those are the enrollments of the Israelites by ancestral houses. The total enrolled in the divisions, for all troops: 603,550.

hebrew: וְהַ֨לְוִיִּ֔ם לֹ֣א הָתְפָּקְד֔וּ בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'hal'viyim lo hat'pak'dv b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: The Levites, however, were not recorded among the Israelites, as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כְּ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֨ה יְהוָ֜ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כֵּֽן־חָנ֤וּ לְדִגְלֵיהֶם֙ וְכֵ֣ן נָסָ֔עוּ אִ֥ישׁ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖יו עַל־בֵּ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: vaya'asv b'ney yis'rael k'khol asher-tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh ken-chanv l'dig'leyhem v'khen nasa'v iysh l'mish'p'chotayv 'al-beyt avotayv
translation: The Israelites did accordingly; just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses, so they camped by their standards, and so they marched, each with his clan according to his ancestral house.

hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֥ת אַהֲרֹ֖ן וּמֹשֶׁ֑ה בְּי֗וֹם דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּהַ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
transliteration: v'eleh tvol'dot aharon vmosheh b'yvom diber y'hvah et-mosheh b'har siynay
translation: This is the line of Aaron and Moses at the time that the L<small>ORD</small> spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.

hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה שְׁמ֥וֹת בְּֽנֵי־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַבְּכ֣וֹר ׀ נָדָ֑ב וַאֲבִיה֕וּא אֶלְעָזָ֖ר וְאִיתָמָֽר׃
transliteration: v'eleh sh'mvot b'ney-aharon hab'khvor  nadav vaaviyhv el'azar v'iytamar
translation: These were the names of Aaron’s sons: Nadab, the first-born, and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar;

hebrew: אֵ֗לֶּה שְׁמוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים הַמְּשֻׁחִ֑ים אֲשֶׁר־מִלֵּ֥א יָדָ֖ם לְכַהֵֽן׃
transliteration: eleh sh'mvot b'ney aharon hakohaniym ham'shuchiym asher-mile yadam l'khahen
translation: those were the names of Aaron’s sons, the anointed priests who were ordained for priesthood.

hebrew: וַיָּ֣מָת נָדָ֣ב וַאֲבִיה֣וּא לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֡ה בְּֽהַקְרִבָם֩ אֵ֨שׁ זָרָ֜ה לִפְנֵ֤י יְהוָה֙ בְּמִדְבַּ֣ר סִינַ֔י וּבָנִ֖ים לֹא־הָי֣וּ לָהֶ֑ם וַיְכַהֵ֤ן אֶלְעָזָר֙ וְאִ֣יתָמָ֔ר עַל־פְּנֵ֖י אַהֲרֹ֥ן אֲבִיהֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayamat nadav vaaviyhv lif'ney y'hvah b'hak'rivam esh zarah lif'ney y'hvah b'mid'bar siynay vvaniym lo-hayv lahem vay'khahen el'azar v'iytamar 'al-p'ney aharon aviyhem (f)
translation: But Nadab and Abihu died aOthers “before.”by the will of-a the LORD, when they offered alien fire before the LORD in the wilderness of Sinai; and they left no sons. So it was Eleazar and Ithamar who served as priests in the lifetime of their father Aaron.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: הַקְרֵב֙ אֶת־מַטֵּ֣ה לֵוִ֔י וְֽהַעֲמַדְתָּ֣ אֹת֔וֹ לִפְנֵ֖י אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְשֵׁרְת֖וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: hak'rev et-mateh leviy v'ha'amad'ta otvo lif'ney aharon hakohen v'sher'tv otvo
translation: Advance the tribe of Levi and place them in attendance upon Aaron the priest to serve him.

hebrew: וְשָׁמְר֣וּ אֶת־מִשְׁמַרְתּ֗וֹ וְאֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֙רֶת֙ כָּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד לַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֥ת הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
transliteration: v'sham'rv et-mish'mar'tvo v'et-mish'meret kal-ha'edah lif'ney ohel mvo'ed la'avod et-'avodat hamish'kan
translation: They shall perform duties for him and for the whole community before the Tent of Meeting, doing the work of the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וְשָׁמְר֗וּ אֶֽת־כָּל־כְּלֵי֙ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וְאֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֥ת הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
transliteration: v'sham'rv et-kal-k'ley ohel mvo'ed v'et-mish'meret b'ney yis'rael la'avod et-'avodat hamish'kan
translation: They shall take charge of all the furnishings of the Tent of Meeting—a duty on behalf of the Israelites—doing the work of the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּה֙ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָ֑יו נְתוּנִ֨ם נְתוּנִ֥ם הֵ֙מָּה֙ ל֔וֹ מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'natatah et-hal'viyim l'aharon vl'vanayv n'tvnim n'tvnim hemah lvo meet b'ney yis'rael
translation: You shall assign the Levites to Aaron and to his sons: they are formally assigned to him from among the Israelites.

hebrew: וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֤ן וְאֶת־בָּנָיו֙ תִּפְקֹ֔ד וְשָׁמְר֖וּ אֶת־כְּהֻנָּתָ֑ם וְהַזָּ֥ר הַקָּרֵ֖ב יוּמָֽת׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'et-aharon v'et-banayv tif'kod v'sham'rv et-k'hunatam v'hazar hakarev yvmat (f)
translation: You shall make Aaron and his sons responsible for observing their priestly duties; and any outsider who encroaches shall be put to death.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: וַאֲנִ֞י הִנֵּ֧ה לָקַ֣חְתִּי אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֗ם מִתּוֹךְ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל תַּ֧חַת כָּל־בְּכ֛וֹר פֶּ֥טֶר רֶ֖חֶם מִבְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהָ֥יוּ לִ֖י הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
transliteration: vaaniy hineh lakach'tiy et-hal'viyim mitvokh' b'ney yis'rael tachat kal-b'khvor peter rechem mib'ney yis'rael v'hayv liy hal'viyim
translation: I hereby take the Levites from among the Israelites in place of all the first-born, the first issue of the womb among the Israelites: the Levites shall be Mine.

hebrew: כִּ֣י לִי֮ כָּל־בְּכוֹר֒ בְּיוֹם֩ הַכֹּתִ֨י כָל־בְּכ֜וֹר בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֗יִם הִקְדַּ֨שְׁתִּי לִ֤י כָל־בְּכוֹר֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מֵאָדָ֖ם עַד־בְּהֵמָ֑ה לִ֥י יִהְי֖וּ אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy liy kal-b'khvor b'yvom hakotiy khal-b'khvor b'eretz mitz'rayim hik'dash'tiy liy khal-b'khvor b'yis'rael meadam 'ad-b'hemah liy yih'yv aniy y'hvah (s)
translation: For every first-born is Mine: at the time that I smote every first-born in the land of Egypt, I consecrated every first-born in Israel, man and beast, to Myself, to be Mine, the L<small>ORD</small>’s.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר סִינַ֖י לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh b'mid'bar siynay lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying:

hebrew: פְּקֹד֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י לֵוִ֔י לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָ֖ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם כָּל־זָכָ֛ר מִבֶּן־חֹ֥דֶשׁ וָמַ֖עְלָה תִּפְקְדֵֽם׃
transliteration: p'kod et-b'ney leviy l'veyt avotam l'mish'p'chotam kal-zakhar miben-chodesh vama'lah tif'k'dem
translation: Record the Levites by ancestral house and by clan; record every male among them from the age of one month up.

hebrew: וַיִּפְקֹ֥ד אֹתָ֛ם מֹשֶׁ֖ה עַל־פִּ֣י יְהוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צֻוָּֽה׃
transliteration: vayif'kod otam mosheh 'al-piy y'hvah kaasher tzuvah
translation: So Moses recorded them at the command of the L<small>ORD</small>, as he was bidden.

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ־אֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵֽי־לֵוִ֖י בִּשְׁמֹתָ֑ם גֵּרְשׁ֕וֹן וּקְהָ֖ת וּמְרָרִֽי׃
transliteration: vayih'yv-eleh v'ney-leviy bish'motam ger'shvon vk'hat vm'rariy
translation: These were the sons of Levi by name: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה שְׁמ֥וֹת בְּֽנֵי־גֵרְשׁ֖וֹן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם לִבְנִ֖י וְשִׁמְעִֽי׃
transliteration: v'eleh sh'mvot b'ney-ger'shvon l'mish'p'chotam liv'niy v'shim'iy
translation: These were the names of the sons of Gershon by clan: Libni and Shimei.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י קְהָ֖ת לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם עַמְרָ֣ם וְיִצְהָ֔ר חֶבְר֖וֹן וְעֻזִּיאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vv'ney k'hat l'mish'p'chotam 'am'ram v'yitz'har chev'rvon v'uziyel
translation: The sons of Kohath by clan: Amram and Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֧י מְרָרִ֛י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם מַחְלִ֣י וּמוּשִׁ֑י אֵ֥לֶּה הֵ֛ם מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הַלֵּוִ֖י לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vv'ney m'rariy l'mish'p'chotam mach'liy vmvshiy eleh hem mish'p'chot haleviy l'veyt avotam
translation:
The sons of Merari by clan: Mahli and Mushi.
These were the clans of the Levites within their ancestral houses:

hebrew: לְגֵ֣רְשׁ֔וֹן מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַלִּבְנִ֔י וּמִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשִּׁמְעִ֑י אֵ֣לֶּה הֵ֔ם מִשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּֽי׃
transliteration: l'ger'shvon mish'pachat haliv'niy vmish'pachat hashim'iy eleh hem mish'p'chot hager'shuniy
translation: To Gershon belonged the clan of the Libnites and the clan of the Shimeites; those were the clans of the Gershonites.

hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶם֙ בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר כָּל־זָכָ֔ר מִבֶּן־חֹ֖דֶשׁ וָמָ֑עְלָה פְּקֻ֣דֵיהֶ֔ם שִׁבְעַ֥ת אֲלָפִ֖ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: p'kudeyhem b'mis'par kal-zakhar miben-chodesh vama'lah p'kudeyhem shiv'at alafiym vachamesh mevot
translation: The recorded entries of all their males from the age of one month up, as recorded, came to 7,500.

hebrew: מִשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֑י אַחֲרֵ֧י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן יַחֲנ֖וּ יָֽמָּה׃
transliteration: mish'p'chot hager'shuniy acharey hamish'kan yachanv yamah
translation: The clans of the Gershonites were to camp behind the Tabernacle, to the west.

hebrew: וּנְשִׂ֥יא בֵֽית־אָ֖ב לַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֑י אֶלְיָסָ֖ף בֶּן־לָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vn'siy veyt-av lager'shuniy el'yasaf ben-lael
translation: The chieftain of the ancestral house of the Gershonites was Eliasaph son of Lael.

hebrew: וּמִשְׁמֶ֤רֶת בְּנֵֽי־גֵרְשׁוֹן֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן וְהָאֹ֑הֶל מִכְסֵ֕הוּ וּמָסַ֕ךְ פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: vmish'meret b'ney-ger'shvon b'ohel mvo'ed hamish'kan v'haohel mikh'sehv vmasakh' petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: The duties of the Gershonites in the Tent of Meeting comprised: the tabernacle,bSee note on Exod. 26.1. the tent, its covering, and the screen for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;

hebrew: וְקַלְעֵ֣י הֶֽחָצֵ֗ר וְאֶת־מָסַךְ֙ פֶּ֣תַח הֶֽחָצֵ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֧ר עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן וְעַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִ֑יב וְאֵת֙ מֵֽיתָרָ֔יו לְכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'kal'ey hechatzer v'et-masakh' petach hechatzer asher 'al-hamish'kan v'al-hamiz'becha saviyv v'et meytarayv l'khol 'avodatvo
translation: the hangings of the enclosure, the screen for the entrance of the enclosure which surrounds the Tabernacle, the cords thereof, and the altar—all the service connected with these.

hebrew: וְלִקְהָ֗ת מִשְׁפַּ֤חַת הַֽעַמְרָמִי֙ וּמִשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַיִּצְהָרִ֔י וּמִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַֽחֶבְרֹנִ֔י וּמִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָֽעָזִּיאֵלִ֑י אֵ֥לֶּה הֵ֖ם מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הַקְּהָתִֽי׃
transliteration: v'lik'hat mish'pachat ha'am'ramiy vmish'pachat hayitz'hariy vmish'pachat hachev'roniy vmish'pachat ha'aziyeliy eleh hem mish'p'chot hak'hatiy
translation: To Kohath belonged the clan of the Amramites, the clan of the Izharites, the clan of the Hebronites, and the clan of the Uzzielites; those were the clans of the Kohathites.

hebrew: בְּמִסְפַּר֙ כָּל־זָכָ֔ר מִבֶּן־חֹ֖דֶשׁ וָמָ֑עְלָה שְׁמֹנַ֤ת אֲלָפִים֙ וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת שֹׁמְרֵ֖י מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: b'mis'par kal-zakhar miben-chodesh vama'lah sh'monat alafiym v'shesh mevot shom'rey mish'meret hakodesh
translation: All the listed males from the age of one month up came to 8,600, attending to the duties of the sanctuary.

hebrew: מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת בְּנֵי־קְהָ֖ת יַחֲנ֑וּ עַ֛ל יֶ֥רֶךְ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן תֵּימָֽנָה׃
transliteration: mish'p'chot b'ney-k'hat yachanv 'al yerekh' hamish'kan teymanah
translation: The clans of the Kohathites were to camp along the south side of the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וּנְשִׂ֥יא בֵֽית־אָ֖ב לְמִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת הַקְּהָתִ֑י אֶלִיצָפָ֖ן בֶּן־עֻזִּיאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vn'siy veyt-av l'mish'p'chot hak'hatiy eliytzafan ben-'uziyel
translation: The chieftain of the ancestral house of the Kohathite clans was Elizaphan son of Uzziel.

hebrew: וּמִשְׁמַרְתָּ֗ם הָאָרֹ֤ן וְהַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ וְהַמְּנֹרָ֣ה וְהַֽמִּזְבְּחֹ֔ת וּכְלֵ֣י הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְשָׁרְת֖וּ בָּהֶ֑ם וְהַ֨מָּסָ֔ךְ וְכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vmish'mar'tam haaron v'hashul'chan v'ham'norah v'hamiz'b'chot vkh'ley hakodesh asher y'shar'tv bahem v'hamasakh' v'khol 'avodatvo
translation: Their duties comprised: the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, and the sacred utensils that were used with them, and the screencI.e., the screening curtain; cf. 4–5.—all the service connected with these.

hebrew: וּנְשִׂיא֙ נְשִׂיאֵ֣י הַלֵּוִ֔י אֶלְעָזָ֖ר בֶּן־אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֑ן פְּקֻדַּ֕ת שֹׁמְרֵ֖י מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: vn'siy n'siyey haleviy el'azar ben-aharon hakohen p'kudat shom'rey mish'meret hakodesh
translation: The head chieftain of the Levites was Eleazar son of Aaron the priest, in charge of those attending to the duties of the sanctuary.

hebrew: לִמְרָרִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַמַּחְלִ֔י וּמִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַמּוּשִׁ֑י אֵ֥לֶּה הֵ֖ם מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת מְרָרִֽי׃
transliteration: lim'rariy mish'pachat hamach'liy vmish'pachat hamvshiy eleh hem mish'p'chot m'rariy
translation: To Merari belonged the clan of the Mahlites and the clan of the Mushites; those were the clans of Merari.

hebrew: וּפְקֻדֵיהֶם֙ בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר כָּל־זָכָ֔ר מִבֶּן־חֹ֖דֶשׁ וָמָ֑עְלָה שֵׁ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vf'kudeyhem b'mis'par kal-zakhar miben-chodesh vama'lah sheshet alafiym vmatayim
translation: The recorded entries of all their males from the age of one month up came to 6,200.

hebrew: וּנְשִׂ֤יא בֵֽית־אָב֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת מְרָרִ֔י צוּרִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־אֲבִיחָ֑יִל עַ֣ל יֶ֧רֶךְ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן יַחֲנ֖וּ צָפֹֽנָה׃
transliteration: vn'siy veyt-av l'mish'p'chot m'rariy tzvriyel ben-aviychayil 'al yerekh' hamish'kan yachanv tzafonah
translation: The chieftain of the ancestral house of the clans of Merari was Zuriel son of Abihail. They were to camp along the north side of the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וּפְקֻדַּ֣ת מִשְׁמֶרֶת֮ בְּנֵ֣י מְרָרִי֒ קַרְשֵׁי֙ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן וּבְרִיחָ֖יו וְעַמֻּדָ֣יו וַאֲדָנָ֑יו וְכָל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vf'kudat mish'meret b'ney m'rariy kar'shey hamish'kan vv'riychayv v'amudayv vaadanayv v'khal-kelayv v'khol 'avodatvo
translation: The assigned duties of the Merarites comprised: the planks of the Tabernacle, its bars, posts, and sockets, and all its furnishings—all the service connected with these;

hebrew: וְעַמֻּדֵ֧י הֶחָצֵ֛ר סָבִ֖יב וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֑ם וִיתֵדֹתָ֖ם וּמֵֽיתְרֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'amudey hechatzer saviyv v'ad'neyhem viytedotam vmeyt'reyhem
translation: also the posts around the enclosure and their sockets, pegs, and cords.

hebrew: וְהַחֹנִ֣ים לִפְנֵ֣י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֡ן קֵ֣דְמָה לִפְנֵי֩ אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֨ד ׀ מִזְרָ֜חָה מֹשֶׁ֣ה ׀ וְאַהֲרֹ֣ן וּבָנָ֗יו שֹֽׁמְרִים֙ מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת הַמִּקְדָּ֔שׁ לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהַזָּ֥ר הַקָּרֵ֖ב יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: v'hachoniym lif'ney hamish'kan ked'mah lif'ney ohel-mvo'ed  miz'rachah mosheh  v'aharon vvanayv shom'riym mish'meret hamik'dash l'mish'meret b'ney yis'rael v'hazar hakarev yvmat
translation: Those who were to camp before the Tabernacle, in front—before the Tent of Meeting, on the east—were Moses and Aaron and his sons, attending to the duties of the sanctuary, as a duty on behalf of the Israelites; and any outsider who encroached was to be put to death.

hebrew: כָּל־פְּקוּדֵ֨י הַלְוִיִּ֜ם אֲשֶׁר֩ פָּקַ֨ד מֹשֶׁ֧ה וְׄאַׄהֲׄרֹ֛ׄןׄ עַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם כָּל־זָכָר֙ מִבֶּן־חֹ֣דֶשׁ וָמַ֔עְלָה שְׁנַ֥יִם וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃ (ס)
transliteration: kal-p'kvdey hal'viyim asher pakad mosheh v'aharon 'al-piy y'hvah l'mish'p'chotam kal-zakhar miben-chodesh vama'lah sh'nayim v'es'riym alef (s)
translation: All the Levites who were recorded, whom at the L<small>ORD</small>’s command Moses and Aaron recorded by their clans, all the males from the age of one month up, came to 22,000.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה פְּקֹ֨ד כָּל־בְּכֹ֤ר זָכָר֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִבֶּן־חֹ֖דֶשׁ וָמָ֑עְלָה וְשָׂ֕א אֵ֖ת מִסְפַּ֥ר שְׁמֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh p'kod kal-b'khor zakhar liv'ney yis'rael miben-chodesh vama'lah v'sa et mis'par sh'motam
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses: Record every first-born male of the Israelite people from the age of one month up, and make a list of their names;

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֨ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֥ם לִי֙ אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֔ה תַּ֥חַת כָּל־בְּכֹ֖ר בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְאֵת֙ בֶּהֱמַ֣ת הַלְוִיִּ֔ם תַּ֣חַת כָּל־בְּכ֔וֹר בְּבֶהֱמַ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta et-hal'viyim liy aniy y'hvah tachat kal-b'khor biv'ney yis'rael v'et behemat hal'viyim tachat kal-b'khvor b'vehemat b'ney yis'rael
translation: and take the Levites for Me, the L<small>ORD</small>, in place of every first-born among the Israelite people, and the cattle of the Levites in place of every first-born among the cattle of the Israelites.

hebrew: וַיִּפְקֹ֣ד מֹשֶׁ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ אֶֽת־כָּל־בְּכֹ֖ר בִּבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayif'kod mosheh kaasher tzivah y'hvah otvo et-kal-b'khor biv'ney yis'rael
translation: So Moses recorded all the first-born among the Israelites, as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded him.

hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כָל־בְּכ֨וֹר זָכָ֜ר בְּמִסְפַּ֥ר שֵׁמ֛וֹת מִבֶּן־חֹ֥דֶשׁ וָמַ֖עְלָה לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁנַ֤יִם וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים וּמָאתָֽיִם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'hiy khal-b'khvor zakhar b'mis'par shemvot miben-chodesh vama'lah lif'kudeyhem sh'nayim v'es'riym elef sh'loshah v'shiv'iym vmatayim (f)
translation: All the first-born males as listed by name, recorded from the age of one month up, came to 22,273.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: קַ֣ח אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֗ם תַּ֤חַת כָּל־בְּכוֹר֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֶת־בֶּהֱמַ֥ת הַלְוִיִּ֖ם תַּ֣חַת בְּהֶמְתָּ֑ם וְהָיוּ־לִ֥י הַלְוִיִּ֖ם אֲנִ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: kach et-hal'viyim tachat kal-b'khvor biv'ney yis'rael v'et-behemat hal'viyim tachat b'hem'tam v'hayv-liy hal'viyim aniy y'hvah
translation: Take the Levites in place of all the first-born among the Israelite people, and the cattle of the Levites in place of their cattle; and the Levites shall be Mine, the L<small>ORD</small>’s.

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ פְּדוּיֵ֣י הַשְּׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְהַשִּׁבְעִ֖ים וְהַמָּאתָ֑יִם הָעֹֽדְפִים֙ עַל־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם מִבְּכ֖וֹר בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'et p'dvyey hash'loshah v'hashiv'iym v'hamatayim ha'od'fiym 'al-hal'viyim mib'khvor b'ney yis'rael
translation: And as the redemption price of the 273 Israelite first-born over and above the number of the Levites,

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֗ חֲמֵ֧שֶׁת חֲמֵ֛שֶׁת שְׁקָלִ֖ים לַגֻּלְגֹּ֑לֶת בְּשֶׁ֤קֶל הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ תִּקָּ֔ח עֶשְׂרִ֥ים גֵּרָ֖ה הַשָּֽׁקֶל׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta chameshet chameshet sh'kaliym lagul'golet b'shekel hakodesh tikach 'es'riym gerah hashakel
translation: take five shekels per head—take this by the sanctuary weight, twenty gerahs to the shekel—

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה הַכֶּ֔סֶף לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָ֑יו פְּדוּיֵ֕י הָעֹדְפִ֖ים בָּהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'natatah hakesef l'aharon vl'vanayv p'dvyey ha'od'fiym bahem
translation: and give the money to Aaron and his sons as the redemption price for those who are in excess.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֵ֖ת כֶּ֣סֶף הַפִּדְי֑וֹם מֵאֵת֙ הָעֹ֣דְפִ֔ים עַ֖ל פְּדוּיֵ֥י הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh et kesef hapid'yvom meet ha'od'fiym 'al p'dvyey hal'viyim
translation: So Moses took the redemption money from those over and above the ones redeemed by the Levites;

hebrew: מֵאֵ֗ת בְּכ֛וֹר בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לָקַ֣ח אֶת־הַכָּ֑סֶף חֲמִשָּׁ֨ה וְשִׁשִּׁ֜ים וּשְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֛וֹת וָאֶ֖לֶף בְּשֶׁ֥קֶל הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: meet b'khvor b'ney yis'rael lakach et-hakasef chamishah v'shishiym vsh'losh mevot vaelef b'shekel hakodesh
translation: he took the money from the first-born of the Israelites, 1,365 sanctuary shekels.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־כֶּ֧סֶף הַפְּדֻיִ֛ם לְאַהֲרֹ֥ן וּלְבָנָ֖יו עַל־פִּ֣י יְהוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayiten mosheh et-kesef hap'duyim l'aharon vl'vanayv 'al-piy y'hvah kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (f)
translation: And Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and his sons at the L<small>ORD</small>’s bidding, as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

hebrew: נָשֹׂ֗א אֶת־רֹאשׁ֙ בְּנֵ֣י קְהָ֔ת מִתּ֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י לֵוִ֑י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: naso et-rosh b'ney k'hat mitvokh' b'ney leviy l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam
translation: Take a [separate] census of the Kohathites among the Levites, by the clans of their ancestral house,

hebrew: מִבֶּ֨ן שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה וְעַ֖ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה כָּל־בָּא֙ לַצָּבָ֔א לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת מְלָאכָ֖ה בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: miben sh'loshiym shanah vama'lah v'ad ben-chamishiym shanah kal-ba latzava la'asvot m'lakhah b'ohel mvo'ed
translation: from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who are subject to service, to perform tasks for the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: זֹ֛את עֲבֹדַ֥ת בְּנֵי־קְהָ֖ת בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד קֹ֖דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: zot 'avodat b'ney-k'hat b'ohel mvo'ed kodesh hakodashiym
translation: This is the responsibility of the Kohathites in the Tent of Meeting: the most sacred objects.

hebrew: וּבָ֨א אַהֲרֹ֤ן וּבָנָיו֙ בִּנְסֹ֣עַ הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְהוֹרִ֕דוּ אֵ֖ת פָּרֹ֣כֶת הַמָּסָ֑ךְ וְכִ֨סּוּ־בָ֔הּ אֵ֖ת אֲרֹ֥ן הָעֵדֻֽת׃
transliteration: vva aharon vvanayv bin'so'a hamachaneh v'hvoridv et parokhet hamasakh' v'khisv-vah et aron ha'edut
translation: At the breaking of camp, Aaron and his sons shall go in and take down the screening curtain and cover the Ark of the Pact with it.

hebrew: וְנָתְנ֣וּ עָלָ֗יו כְּסוּי֙ ע֣וֹר תַּ֔חַשׁ וּפָרְשׂ֧וּ בֶֽגֶד־כְּלִ֛יל תְּכֵ֖לֶת מִלְמָ֑עְלָה וְשָׂמ֖וּ בַּדָּֽיו׃
transliteration: v'nat'nv 'alayv k'svy 'vor tachash vfar'sv veged-k'liyl t'khelet mil'ma'lah v'samv badayv
translation: They shall lay a covering of dolphinaSee note at Exod. 25.5. skin over it and spread a cloth of pure blue on top; and they shall put its poles in place.

hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ שֻׁלְחַ֣ן הַפָּנִ֗ים יִפְרְשׂוּ֮ בֶּ֣גֶד תְּכֵלֶת֒ וְנָתְנ֣וּ עָ֠לָיו אֶת־הַקְּעָרֹ֤ת וְאֶת־הַכַּפֹּת֙ וְאֶת־הַמְּנַקִּיֹּ֔ת וְאֵ֖ת קְשׂ֣וֹת הַנָּ֑סֶךְ וְלֶ֥חֶם הַתָּמִ֖יד עָלָ֥יו יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'al  shul'chan hapaniym yif'r'sv beged t'khelet v'nat'nv 'alayv et-hak'arot v'et-hakapot v'et-ham'nakiyot v'et k'svot hanasekh' v'lechem hatamiyd 'alayv yih'yeh
translation: Over the table of display they shall spread a blue cloth; they shall place upon it the bowls, the ladles, the jars, and the libation jugs; and the regular bread shall rest upon it.

hebrew: וּפָרְשׂ֣וּ עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם בֶּ֚גֶד תּוֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י וְכִסּ֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ בְּמִכְסֵ֖ה ע֣וֹר תָּ֑חַשׁ וְשָׂמ֖וּ אֶת־בַּדָּֽיו׃
transliteration: vfar'sv 'aleyhem beged tvola'at shaniy v'khisv otvo b'mikh'seh 'vor tachash v'samv et-badayv
translation: They shall spread over these a crimson cloth which they shall cover with a covering of dolphin skin; and they shall put the poles in place.

hebrew: וְלָקְח֣וּ ׀ בֶּ֣גֶד תְּכֵ֗לֶת וְכִסּ֞וּ אֶת־מְנֹרַ֤ת הַמָּאוֹר֙ וְאֶת־נֵ֣רֹתֶ֔יהָ וְאֶת־מַלְקָחֶ֖יהָ וְאֶת־מַחְתֹּתֶ֑יהָ וְאֵת֙ כָּל־כְּלֵ֣י שַׁמְנָ֔הּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְשָׁרְתוּ־לָ֖הּ בָּהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'lak'chv  beged t'khelet v'khisv et-m'norat hamavor v'et-neroteyha v'et-mal'kacheyha v'et-mach'toteyha v'et kal-k'ley sham'nah asher y'shar'tv-lah bahem
translation: Then they shall take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand for lighting, with its lamps, its tongs, and its fire pans, as well as all the oil vessels that are used in its service.

hebrew: וְנָתְנ֤וּ אֹתָהּ֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלֶ֔יהָ אֶל־מִכְסֵ֖ה ע֣וֹר תָּ֑חַשׁ וְנָתְנ֖וּ עַל־הַמּֽוֹט׃
transliteration: v'nat'nv otah v'et-kal-keleyha el-mikh'seh 'vor tachash v'nat'nv 'al-hamvot
translation: They shall put it and all its furnishings into a covering of dolphin skin, which they shall then place on a carrying frame.

hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ מִזְבַּ֣ח הַזָּהָ֗ב יִפְרְשׂוּ֙ בֶּ֣גֶד תְּכֵ֔לֶת וְכִסּ֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ בְּמִכְסֵ֖ה ע֣וֹר תָּ֑חַשׁ וְשָׂמ֖וּ אֶת־בַּדָּֽיו׃
transliteration: v'al  miz'bach hazahav yif'r'sv beged t'khelet v'khisv otvo b'mikh'seh 'vor tachash v'samv et-badayv
translation: Next they shall spread a blue cloth over the altar of gold and cover it with a covering of dolphin skin; and they shall put its poles in place.

hebrew: וְלָקְחוּ֩ אֶת־כָּל־כְּלֵ֨י הַשָּׁרֵ֜ת אֲשֶׁ֧ר יְשָֽׁרְתוּ־בָ֣ם בַּקֹּ֗דֶשׁ וְנָֽתְנוּ֙ אֶל־בֶּ֣גֶד תְּכֵ֔לֶת וְכִסּ֣וּ אוֹתָ֔ם בְּמִכְסֵ֖ה ע֣וֹר תָּ֑חַשׁ וְנָתְנ֖וּ עַל־הַמּֽוֹט׃
transliteration: v'lak'chv et-kal-k'ley hasharet asher y'shar'tv-vam bakodesh v'nat'nv el-beged t'khelet v'khisv votam b'mikh'seh 'vor tachash v'nat'nv 'al-hamvot
translation: They shall take all the service vessels with which the service in the sanctuary is performed, put them into a blue cloth and cover them with a covering of dolphin skin, which they shall then place on a carrying frame.

hebrew: וְדִשְּׁנ֖וּ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וּפָרְשׂ֣וּ עָלָ֔יו בֶּ֖גֶד אַרְגָּמָֽן׃
transliteration: v'dish'nv et-hamiz'becha vfar'sv 'alayv beged ar'gaman
translation: They shall remove the ashes from the [copper] altar and spread a purple cloth over it.

hebrew: וְנָתְנ֣וּ עָ֠לָיו אֶֽת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֞יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְֽשָׁרְת֧וּ עָלָ֣יו בָּהֶ֗ם אֶת־הַמַּחְתֹּ֤ת אֶת־הַמִּזְלָגֹת֙ וְאֶת־הַיָּעִ֣ים וְאֶת־הַמִּזְרָקֹ֔ת כֹּ֖ל כְּלֵ֣י הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וּפָרְשׂ֣וּ עָלָ֗יו כְּס֛וּי ע֥וֹר תַּ֖חַשׁ וְשָׂמ֥וּ בַדָּֽיו׃
transliteration: v'nat'nv 'alayv et-kal-kelayv asher y'shar'tv 'alayv bahem et-hamach'tot et-hamiz'lagot v'et-haya'iym v'et-hamiz'rakot kol k'ley hamiz'becha vfar'sv 'alayv k'svy 'vor tachash v'samv vadayv
translation: Upon it they shall place all the vessels that are used in its service: the fire pans, the flesh hooks, the scrapers, and the basins—all the vessels of the altar—and over it they shall spread a covering of dolphin skin; and they shall put its poles in place.

hebrew: וְכִלָּ֣ה אַֽהֲרֹן־וּ֠בָנָיו לְכַסֹּ֨ת אֶת־הַקֹּ֜דֶשׁ וְאֶת־כָּל־כְּלֵ֣י הַקֹּדֶשׁ֮ בִּנְסֹ֣עַ הַֽמַּחֲנֶה֒ וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן יָבֹ֤אוּ בְנֵי־קְהָת֙ לָשֵׂ֔את וְלֹֽא־יִגְּע֥וּ אֶל־הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ וָמֵ֑תוּ אֵ֛לֶּה מַשָּׂ֥א בְנֵֽי־קְהָ֖ת בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'khilah aharon-vvanayv l'khasot et-hakodesh v'et-kal-k'ley hakodesh bin'so'a hamachaneh v'acharey-khen yavov v'ney-k'hat laset v'lo-yig'v el-hakodesh vametv eleh masa v'ney-k'hat b'ohel mvo'ed
translation: bContinuing v. 4.When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sacred objects and all the furnishings of the sacred objects at the breaking of camp, only then shall the Kohathites come and lift them, so that they do not come in contact with the sacred objects and die. These things in the Tent of Meeting shall be the porterage of the Kohathites.

hebrew: וּפְקֻדַּ֞ת אֶלְעָזָ֣ר ׀ בֶּן־אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֗ן שֶׁ֤מֶן הַמָּאוֹר֙ וּקְטֹ֣רֶת הַסַּמִּ֔ים וּמִנְחַ֥ת הַתָּמִ֖יד וְשֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֑ה פְּקֻדַּ֗ת כָּל־הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁר־בּ֔וֹ בְּקֹ֖דֶשׁ וּבְכֵלָֽיו׃ (ס)
transliteration: vf'kudat el'azar  ben-aharon hakohen shemen hamavor vk'toret hasamiym vmin'chat hatamiyd v'shemen hamish'chah p'kudat kal-hamish'kan v'khal-asher-bvo b'kodesh vv'khelayv (s)
translation: Responsibility shall rest with Eleazar son of Aaron the priest for the lighting oil, the aromatic incense, the regular meal offering, and the anointing oil—responsibility for the whole Tabernacle and for everything consecrated that is in it or in its vessels.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

hebrew: אַל־תַּכְרִ֕יתוּ אֶת־שֵׁ֖בֶט מִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת הַקְּהָתִ֑י מִתּ֖וֹךְ הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
transliteration: al-takh'riytv et-shevet mish'p'chot hak'hatiy mitvokh' hal'viyim
translation: Do not let the group of Kohathite clans be cut off from the Levites.

hebrew: וְזֹ֣את ׀ עֲשׂ֣וּ לָהֶ֗ם וְחָיוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א יָמֻ֔תוּ בְּגִשְׁתָּ֖ם אֶת־קֹ֣דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֑ים אַהֲרֹ֤ן וּבָנָיו֙ יָבֹ֔אוּ וְשָׂמ֣וּ אוֹתָ֗ם אִ֥ישׁ אִ֛ישׁ עַל־עֲבֹדָת֖וֹ וְאֶל־מַשָּׂאֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'zot  'asv lahem v'chayv v'lo yamutv b'gish'tam et-kodesh hakodashiym aharon vvanayv yavov v'samv votam iysh iysh 'al-'avodatvo v'el-masavo
translation: Do this with them, that they may live and not die when they approach the most sacred objects: let Aaron and his sons go in and assign each of them to his duties and to his porterage.

hebrew: וְלֹא־יָבֹ֧אוּ לִרְא֛וֹת כְּבַלַּ֥ע אֶת־הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ וָמֵֽתוּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'lo-yavov lir'vot k'vala' et-hakodesh vametv (f)
translation: But let not [the Kohathites] go inside and cOthers “look at the sacred objects even for a moment.”witness the dismantling of the sanctuary,-c lest they die.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses:

hebrew: נָשֹׂ֗א אֶת־רֹ֛אשׁ בְּנֵ֥י גֵרְשׁ֖וֹן גַּם־הֵ֑ם לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָ֖ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: naso et-rosh b'ney ger'shvon gam-hem l'veyt avotam l'mish'p'chotam
translation: Take a census of the Gershonites also, by their ancestral house and by their clans.

hebrew: מִבֶּן֩ שְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים שָׁנָ֜ה וָמַ֗עְלָה עַ֛ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה תִּפְקֹ֣ד אוֹתָ֑ם כָּל־הַבָּא֙ לִצְבֹ֣א צָבָ֔א לַעֲבֹ֥ד עֲבֹדָ֖ה בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: miben sh'loshiym shanah vama'lah 'ad ben-chamishiym shanah tif'kod votam kal-haba litz'vo tzava la'avod 'avodah b'ohel mvo'ed
translation: Record them from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who are subject to service in the performance of tasks for the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: זֹ֣את עֲבֹדַ֔ת מִשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֑י לַעֲבֹ֖ד וּלְמַשָּֽׂא׃
transliteration: zot 'avodat mish'p'chot hager'shuniy la'avod vl'masa
translation: These are the duties of the Gershonite clans as to labor and porterage:

hebrew: וְנָ֨שְׂא֜וּ אֶת־יְרִיעֹ֤ת הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ וְאֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד מִכְסֵ֕הוּ וּמִכְסֵ֛ה הַתַּ֥חַשׁ אֲשֶׁר־עָלָ֖יו מִלְמָ֑עְלָה וְאֶ֨ת־מָסַ֔ךְ פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'nas'v et-y'riy'ot hamish'kan v'et-ohel mvo'ed mikh'sehv vmikh'seh hatachash asher-'alayv mil'ma'lah v'et-masakh' petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: they shall carry the cloths of the Tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting with its covering, the covering of dolphin skin that is on top of it, and the screen for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;

hebrew: וְאֵת֩ קַלְעֵ֨י הֶֽחָצֵ֜ר וְאֶת־מָסַ֣ךְ ׀ פֶּ֣תַח ׀ שַׁ֣עַר הֶחָצֵ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֤ן וְעַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ סָבִ֔יב וְאֵת֙ מֵֽיתְרֵיהֶ֔ם וְאֶֽת־כָּל־כְּלֵ֖י עֲבֹדָתָ֑ם וְאֵ֨ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֧ר יֵעָשֶׂ֛ה לָהֶ֖ם וְעָבָֽדוּ׃
transliteration: v'et kal'ey hechatzer v'et-masakh'  petach  sha'ar hechatzer asher 'al-hamish'kan v'al-hamiz'becha saviyv v'et meyt'reyhem v'et-kal-k'ley 'avodatam v'et kal-asher ye'aseh lahem v'avadv
translation: the hangings of the enclosure, the screen at the entrance of the gate of the enclosure that surrounds the Tabernacle, the cords thereof, and the altar, and all their service equipment and all their accessories; and they shall perform the service.

hebrew: עַל־פִּי֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן וּבָנָ֜יו תִּהְיֶ֗ה כָּל־עֲבֹדַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֔י לְכָל־מַשָּׂאָ֔ם וּלְכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָתָ֑ם וּפְקַדְתֶּ֤ם עֲלֵהֶם֙ בְּמִשְׁמֶ֔רֶת אֵ֖ת כָּל־מַשָּׂאָֽם׃
transliteration: 'al-piy aharon vvanayv tih'yeh kal-'avodat b'ney hager'shuniy l'khal-masaam vl'khol 'avodatam vf'kad'tem 'alehem b'mish'meret et kal-masaam
translation: All the duties of the Gershonites, all their porterage and all their service, shall be performed on orders from Aaron and his sons; you shall make them responsible for attending to all their porterage.

hebrew: זֹ֣את עֲבֹדַ֗ת מִשְׁפְּחֹ֛ת בְּנֵ֥י הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֖י בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וּמִ֨שְׁמַרְתָּ֔ם בְּיַד֙ אִֽיתָמָ֔ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵֽן׃ (פ)
transliteration: zot 'avodat mish'p'chot b'ney hager'shuniy b'ohel mvo'ed vmish'mar'tam b'yad iytamar ben-aharon hakohen (f)
translation: Those are the duties of the Gershonite clans for the Tent of Meeting; they shall attend to them under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י מְרָרִ֑י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֥ם לְבֵית־אֲבֹתָ֖ם תִּפְקֹ֥ד אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: b'ney m'rariy l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt-avotam tif'kod otam
translation: As for the Merarites, you shall record them by the clans of their ancestral house;

hebrew: מִבֶּן֩ שְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים שָׁנָ֜ה וָמַ֗עְלָה וְעַ֛ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה תִּפְקְדֵ֑ם כָּל־הַבָּא֙ לַצָּבָ֔א לַעֲבֹ֕ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: miben sh'loshiym shanah vama'lah v'ad ben-chamishiym shanah tif'k'dem kal-haba latzava la'avod et-'avodat ohel mvo'ed
translation: you shall record them from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who are subject to service in the performance of the duties for the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְזֹאת֙ מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת מַשָּׂאָ֔ם לְכָל־עֲבֹדָתָ֖ם בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד קַרְשֵׁי֙ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן וּבְרִיחָ֖יו וְעַמּוּדָ֥יו וַאֲדָנָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'zot mish'meret masaam l'khal-'avodatam b'ohel mvo'ed kar'shey hamish'kan vv'riychayv v'amvdayv vaadanayv
translation: These are their porterage tasks in connection with their various duties for the Tent of Meeting: the planks, the bars, the posts, and the sockets of the Tabernacle;

hebrew: וְעַמּוּדֵי֩ הֶחָצֵ֨ר סָבִ֜יב וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֗ם וִֽיתֵדֹתָם֙ וּמֵ֣יתְרֵיהֶ֔ם לְכָל־כְּלֵיהֶ֔ם וּלְכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָתָ֑ם וּבְשֵׁמֹ֣ת תִּפְקְד֔וּ אֶת־כְּלֵ֖י מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת מַשָּׂאָֽם׃
transliteration: v'amvdey hechatzer saviyv v'ad'neyhem viytedotam vmeyt'reyhem l'khal-k'leyhem vl'khol 'avodatam vv'shemot tif'k'dv et-k'ley mish'meret masaam
translation: the posts around the enclosure and their sockets, pegs, and cords—all these furnishings and their service: you shall list by name the objects that are their porterage tasks.

hebrew: זֹ֣את עֲבֹדַ֗ת מִשְׁפְּחֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֔י לְכָל־עֲבֹדָתָ֖ם בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד בְּיַד֙ אִֽיתָמָ֔ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: zot 'avodat mish'p'chot b'ney m'rariy l'khal-'avodatam b'ohel mvo'ed b'yad iytamar ben-aharon hakohen
translation: Those are the duties of the Merarite clans, pertaining to their various duties in the Tent of Meeting under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.

hebrew: וַיִּפְקֹ֨ד מֹשֶׁ֧ה וְאַהֲרֹ֛ן וּנְשִׂיאֵ֥י הָעֵדָ֖ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י הַקְּהָתִ֑י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם וּלְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayif'kod mosheh v'aharon vn'siyey ha'edah et-b'ney hak'hatiy l'mish'p'chotam vl'veyt avotam
translation: So Moses, Aaron, and the chieftains of the community recorded the Kohathites by the clans of their ancestral house,

hebrew: מִבֶּ֨ן שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה וְעַ֖ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה כָּל־הַבָּא֙ לַצָּבָ֔א לַעֲבֹדָ֖ה בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: miben sh'loshiym shanah vama'lah v'ad ben-chamishiym shanah kal-haba latzava la'avodah b'ohel mvo'ed
translation: from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who were subject to service for work relating to the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ פְקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם אַלְפַּ֕יִם שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃
transliteration: vayih'yv f'kudeyhem l'mish'p'chotam al'payim sh'va' mevot vachamishiym
translation: Those recorded by their clans came to 2,750.

hebrew: אֵ֤לֶּה פְקוּדֵי֙ מִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת הַקְּהָתִ֔י כָּל־הָעֹבֵ֖ד בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד אֲשֶׁ֨ר פָּקַ֤ד מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן עַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh f'kvdey mish'p'chot hak'hatiy kal-ha'oved b'ohel mvo'ed asher pakad mosheh v'aharon 'al-piy y'hvah b'yad-mosheh (s)
translation: That was the enrollment of the Kohathite clans, all those who performed duties relating to the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron recorded at the command of the L<small>ORD</small> through Moses.

hebrew: וּפְקוּדֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י גֵרְשׁ֑וֹן לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָ֖ם וּלְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vf'kvdey b'ney ger'shvon l'mish'p'chvotam vl'veyt avotam
translation: The Gershonites who were recorded by the clans of their ancestral house,

hebrew: מִבֶּ֨ן שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה וְעַ֖ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה כָּל־הַבָּא֙ לַצָּבָ֔א לַעֲבֹדָ֖ה בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: miben sh'loshiym shanah vama'lah v'ad ben-chamishiym shanah kal-haba latzava la'avodah b'ohel mvo'ed
translation: from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who were subject to service for work relating to the Tent of Meeting—

hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ פְּקֻ֣דֵיהֶ֔ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם אַלְפַּ֕יִם וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וּשְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: vayih'yv p'kudeyhem l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam al'payim v'shesh mevot vsh'loshiym
translation: those recorded by the clans of their ancestral house came to 2,630.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה פְקוּדֵ֗י מִשְׁפְּחֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י גֵרְשׁ֔וֹן כָּל־הָעֹבֵ֖ד בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד אֲשֶׁ֨ר פָּקַ֥ד מֹשֶׁ֛ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן עַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: eleh f'kvdey mish'p'chot b'ney ger'shvon kal-ha'oved b'ohel mvo'ed asher pakad mosheh v'aharon 'al-piy y'hvah
translation: That was the enrollment of the Gershonite clans, all those performing duties relating to the Tent of Meeting whom Moses and Aaron recorded at the command of the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וּפְקוּדֵ֕י מִשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֑י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vf'kvdey mish'p'chot b'ney m'rariy l'mish'p'chotam l'veyt avotam
translation: The enrollment of the Merarite clans by the clans of their ancestral house,

hebrew: מִבֶּ֨ן שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה וְעַ֖ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה כָּל־הַבָּא֙ לַצָּבָ֔א לַעֲבֹדָ֖ה בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: miben sh'loshiym shanah vama'lah v'ad ben-chamishiym shanah kal-haba latzava la'avodah b'ohel mvo'ed
translation: from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who were subject to service for work relating to the Tent of Meeting—

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ פְקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayih'yv f'kudeyhem l'mish'p'chotam sh'loshet alafiym vmatayim
translation: those recorded by their clans came to 3,200.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה פְקוּדֵ֔י מִשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֑י אֲשֶׁ֨ר פָּקַ֤ד מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן עַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: eleh f'kvdey mish'p'chot b'ney m'rariy asher pakad mosheh v'aharon 'al-piy y'hvah b'yad-mosheh
translation: That was the enrollment of the Merarite clans which Moses and Aaron recorded at the command of the L<small>ORD</small> through Moses.

hebrew: כָּֽל־הַפְּקֻדִ֡ים אֲשֶׁר֩ פָּקַ֨ד מֹשֶׁ֧ה וְאַהֲרֹ֛ן וּנְשִׂיאֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֑ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם וּלְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: kal-hap'kudiym asher pakad mosheh v'aharon vn'siyey yis'rael et-hal'viyim l'mish'p'chotam vl'veyt avotam
translation: All the Levites whom Moses, Aaron, and the chieftains of Israel recorded by the clans of their ancestral houses,

hebrew: מִבֶּ֨ן שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה וְעַ֖ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה כָּל־הַבָּ֗א לַעֲבֹ֨ד עֲבֹדַ֧ת עֲבֹדָ֛ה וַעֲבֹדַ֥ת מַשָּׂ֖א בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: miben sh'loshiym shanah vama'lah v'ad ben-chamishiym shanah kal-haba la'avod 'avodat 'avodah va'avodat masa b'ohel mvo'ed
translation: from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who were subject to duties of service and porterage relating to the Tent of Meeting—

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֖וּ פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁמֹנַ֣ת אֲלָפִ֔ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וּשְׁמֹנִֽים׃
transliteration: vayih'yv p'kudeyhem sh'monat alafiym vachamesh mevot vsh'moniym
translation: those recorded came to 8,580.

hebrew: עַל־פִּ֨י יְהוָ֜ה פָּקַ֤ד אוֹתָם֙ בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אִ֥ישׁ אִ֛ישׁ עַל־עֲבֹדָת֖וֹ וְעַל־מַשָּׂא֑וֹ וּפְקֻדָ֕יו אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: 'al-piy y'hvah pakad votam b'yad-mosheh iysh iysh 'al-'avodatvo v'al-masavo vf'kudayv asher-tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (f)
translation: Each one was given responsibility for his service and porterage at the command of the L<small>ORD</small> through Moses, and each was recorded as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: צַ֚ו אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וִֽישַׁלְּחוּ֙ מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה כָּל־צָר֖וּעַ וְכָל־זָ֑ב וְכֹ֖ל טָמֵ֥א לָנָֽפֶשׁ׃
transliteration: tzav et-b'ney yis'rael viyshal'chv min-hamachaneh kal-tzarv'a v'khal-zav v'khol tame lanafesh
translation: Instruct the Israelites to remove from camp anyone with an aSee Lev. 13, 15.eruption or a discharge-a and anyone defiled by a corpse.

hebrew: מִזָּכָ֤ר עַד־נְקֵבָה֙ תְּשַׁלֵּ֔חוּ אֶל־מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה תְּשַׁלְּח֑וּם וְלֹ֤א יְטַמְּאוּ֙ אֶת־מַ֣חֲנֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י שֹׁכֵ֥ן בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
transliteration: mizakhar 'ad-n'kevah t'shalechv el-michvtz lamachaneh t'shal'chvm v'lo y'tam'v et-machaneyhem asher aniy shokhen b'tvokham
translation: Remove male and female alike; put them outside the camp so that they do not defile the camp of those in whose midst I dwell.

hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵן֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיְשַׁלְּח֣וּ אוֹתָ֔ם אֶל־מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֵּ֥ן עָשׂ֖וּ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (פ)
transliteration: vaya'asv-khen b'ney yis'rael vay'shal'chv votam el-michvtz lamachaneh kaasher diber y'hvah el-mosheh ken 'asv b'ney yis'rael (f)
translation: The Israelites did so, putting them outside the camp; as the L<small>ORD</small> had spoken to Moses, so the Israelites did.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּר֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ אִ֣ישׁ אֽוֹ־אִשָּׁ֗ה כִּ֤י יַעֲשׂוּ֙ מִכָּל־חַטֹּ֣את הָֽאָדָ֔ם לִמְעֹ֥ל מַ֖עַל בַּיהוָ֑ה וְאָֽשְׁמָ֖ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִֽוא׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael iysh vo-ishah kiy ya'asv mikal-chatot haadam lim'ol ma'al bayhvah v'ash'mah hanefesh hahiv
translation: Speak to the Israelites: When a man or woman commits any wrong toward a fellow man, thus breaking faith with the L<small>ORD</small>, and that person realizes his guilt,

hebrew: וְהִתְוַדּ֗וּ אֶֽת־חַטָּאתָם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשׂוּ֒ וְהֵשִׁ֤יב אֶת־אֲשָׁמוֹ֙ בְּרֹאשׁ֔וֹ וַחֲמִישִׁת֖וֹ יֹסֵ֣ף עָלָ֑יו וְנָתַ֕ן לַאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָשַׁ֥ם לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'hit'vadv et-chatatam asher 'asv v'heshiyv et-ashamvo b'roshvo vachamiyshitvo yosef 'alayv v'natan laasher asham lvo
translation: he shall confess the wrong that he has done. He shall make restitution in the principal amount and add one-fifth to it, giving it to him whom he has wronged.

hebrew: וְאִם־אֵ֨ין לָאִ֜ישׁ גֹּאֵ֗ל לְהָשִׁ֤יב הָאָשָׁם֙ אֵלָ֔יו הָאָשָׁ֛ם הַמּוּשָׁ֥ב לַיהוָ֖ה לַכֹּהֵ֑ן מִלְּבַ֗ד אֵ֚יל הַכִּפֻּרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְכַפֶּר־בּ֖וֹ עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'im-eyn laiysh goel l'hashiyv haasham elayv haasham hamvshav layhvah lakohen mil'vad eyl hakipuriym asher y'khaper-bvo 'alayv
translation: If the man has no kinsmanbLit. “redeemer.” to whom restitution can be made, the amount repaid shall go to the LORD for the priest—in addition to the ram of expiation with which expiation is made on his behalf.cCf. Lev. 5.15 f.

hebrew: וְכָל־תְּרוּמָ֞ה לְכָל־קָדְשֵׁ֧י בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יַקְרִ֥יבוּ לַכֹּהֵ֖ן ל֥וֹ יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'khal-t'rvmah l'khal-kad'shey v'ney-yis'rael asher-yak'riyvv lakohen lvo yih'yeh
translation: So, too, any gift among the sacred donations that the Israelites offer shall be the priest’s.

hebrew: וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶת־קֳדָשָׁ֖יו ל֣וֹ יִהְי֑וּ אִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִתֵּ֥ן לַכֹּהֵ֖ן ל֥וֹ יִהְיֶֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'iysh et-kodashayv lvo yih'yv iysh asher-yiten lakohen lvo yih'yeh (f)
translation: And each shall retain his sacred donations: each priest shall keep what is given to him.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אִ֥ישׁ אִישׁ֙ כִּֽי־תִשְׂטֶ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וּמָעֲלָ֥ה ב֖וֹ מָֽעַל׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem iysh iysh kiy-tis'teh ish'tvo vma'alah vvo ma'al
translation:
Speak to the Israelite people and say to them:
If any man’s wife has gone astray and broken faith with him

hebrew: וְשָׁכַ֨ב אִ֣ישׁ אֹתָהּ֮ שִׁכְבַת־זֶרַע֒ וְנֶעְלַם֙ מֵעֵינֵ֣י אִישָׁ֔הּ וְנִסְתְּרָ֖ה וְהִ֣יא נִטְמָ֑אָה וְעֵד֙ אֵ֣ין בָּ֔הּ וְהִ֖וא לֹ֥א נִתְפָּֽשָׂה׃
transliteration: v'shakhav iysh otah shikh'vat-zera' v'ne'lam me'eyney iyshah v'nis't'rah v'hiy nit'maah v'ed eyn bah v'hiv lo nit'pasah
translation: in that a man has had carnal relations with her unbeknown to her husband, and she keeps secret the fact that she has defiled herself without being forced, and there is no witness against her—

hebrew: וְעָבַ֨ר עָלָ֧יו רֽוּחַ־קִנְאָ֛ה וְקִנֵּ֥א אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ וְהִ֣וא נִטְמָ֑אָה אוֹ־עָבַ֨ר עָלָ֤יו רֽוּחַ־קִנְאָה֙ וְקִנֵּ֣א אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וְהִ֖יא לֹ֥א נִטְמָֽאָה׃
transliteration: v'avar 'alayv rvcha-kin'ah v'kine et-ish'tvo v'hiv nit'maah vo-'avar 'alayv rvcha-kin'ah v'kine et-ish'tvo v'hiy lo nit'maah
translation: but a fit of jealousy comes over him and he is wrought up about the wife who has defiled herself; or if a fit of jealousy comes over one and he is wrought up about his wife although she has not defiled herself—

hebrew: וְהֵבִ֨יא הָאִ֣ישׁ אֶת־אִשְׁתּוֹ֮ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵן֒ וְהֵבִ֤יא אֶת־קָרְבָּנָהּ֙ עָלֶ֔יהָ עֲשִׂירִ֥ת הָאֵיפָ֖ה קֶ֣מַח שְׂעֹרִ֑ים לֹֽא־יִצֹ֨ק עָלָ֜יו שֶׁ֗מֶן וְלֹֽא־יִתֵּ֤ן עָלָיו֙ לְבֹנָ֔ה כִּֽי־מִנְחַ֤ת קְנָאֹת֙ ה֔וּא מִנְחַ֥ת זִכָּר֖וֹן מַזְכֶּ֥רֶת עָוֺֽן׃
transliteration: v'heviy haiysh et-ish'tvo el-hakohen v'heviy et-kar'banah 'aleyha 'asiyrit haeyfah kemach s'oriym lo-yitzok 'alayv shemen v'lo-yiten 'alayv l'vonah kiy-min'chat k'naot hv min'chat zikarvon maz'keret 'avon
translation: the man shall bring his wife to the priest. And he shall bring as an offering for her one-tenth of an ephah of barley flour. No oil shall be poured upon it and no frankincense shall be laid on it, for it is a meal offering of jealousy, a meal offering of remembrance which recalls wrongdoing.

hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֥יב אֹתָ֖הּ הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְהֶֽעֱמִדָ֖הּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyv otah hakohen v'he'emidah lif'ney y'hvah
translation: The priest shall bring her forward and have her stand before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֧ח הַכֹּהֵ֛ן מַ֥יִם קְדֹשִׁ֖ים בִּכְלִי־חָ֑רֶשׂ וּמִן־הֶֽעָפָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִהְיֶה֙ בְּקַרְקַ֣ע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן יִקַּ֥ח הַכֹּהֵ֖ן וְנָתַ֥ן אֶל־הַמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen mayim k'doshiym bikh'liy-chares vmin-he'afar asher yih'yeh b'kar'ka' hamish'kan yikach hakohen v'natan el-hamayim
translation: The priest shall take sacral water in an earthen vessel and, taking some of the earth that is on the floor of the Tabernacle, the priest shall put it into the water.

hebrew: וְהֶעֱמִ֨יד הַכֹּהֵ֥ן אֶֽת־הָאִשָּׁה֮ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָה֒ וּפָרַע֙ אֶת־רֹ֣אשׁ הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וְנָתַ֣ן עַל־כַּפֶּ֗יהָ אֵ֚ת מִנְחַ֣ת הַזִּכָּר֔וֹן מִנְחַ֥ת קְנָאֹ֖ת הִ֑וא וּבְיַ֤ד הַכֹּהֵן֙ יִהְי֔וּ מֵ֥י הַמָּרִ֖ים הַמְאָֽרֲרִֽים׃
transliteration: v'he'emiyd hakohen et-haishah lif'ney y'hvah vfara' et-rosh haishah v'natan 'al-kapeyha et min'chat hazikarvon min'chat k'naot hiv vv'yad hakohen yih'yv mey hamariym ham'arariym
translation: After he has made the woman stand before the LORD, the priest shall bare the woman’s headdSee note at Lev. 10.6. and place upon her hands the meal offering of remembrance, which is a meal offering of jealousy. And in the priest’s hands shall be the water of bitterness eMeaning of Heb. uncertain.that induces the spell.-e

hebrew: וְהִשְׁבִּ֨יעַ אֹתָ֜הּ הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְאָמַ֤ר אֶל־הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ אִם־לֹ֨א שָׁכַ֥ב אִישׁ֙ אֹתָ֔ךְ וְאִם־לֹ֥א שָׂטִ֛ית טֻמְאָ֖ה תַּ֣חַת אִישֵׁ֑ךְ הִנָּקִ֕י מִמֵּ֛י הַמָּרִ֥ים הַֽמְאָרֲרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: v'hish'biy'a otah hakohen v'amar el-haishah im-lo shakhav iysh otakh' v'im-lo satiyt tum'ah tachat iyshekh' hinakiy mimey hamariym ham'arariym haeleh
translation: The priest shall adjure the woman, saying to her, “If no man has lain with you, if you have not gone astray in defilement while married to your husband, be immune to harm from this water of bitterness that induces the spell.

hebrew: וְאַ֗תְּ כִּ֥י שָׂטִ֛ית תַּ֥חַת אִישֵׁ֖ךְ וְכִ֣י נִטְמֵ֑את וַיִּתֵּ֨ן אִ֥ישׁ בָּךְ֙ אֶת־שְׁכָבְתּ֔וֹ מִֽבַּלְעֲדֵ֖י אִישֵֽׁךְ׃
transliteration: v'at' kiy satiyt tachat iyshekh' v'khiy nit'met vayiten iysh bakh' et-sh'khav'tvo mibal'adey iyshekh'
translation: But if you have gone astray while married to your husband and have defiled yourself, if a man other than your husband has had carnal relations with you”—

hebrew: וְהִשְׁבִּ֨יעַ הַכֹּהֵ֥ן אֶֽת־הָֽאִשָּׁה֮ בִּשְׁבֻעַ֣ת הָאָלָה֒ וְאָמַ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ לָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה יִתֵּ֨ן יְהוָ֥ה אוֹתָ֛ךְ לְאָלָ֥ה וְלִשְׁבֻעָ֖ה בְּת֣וֹךְ עַמֵּ֑ךְ בְּתֵ֨ת יְהוָ֤ה אֶת־יְרֵכֵךְ֙ נֹפֶ֔לֶת וְאֶת־בִּטְנֵ֖ךְ צָבָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hish'biy'a hakohen et-haishah bish'vu'at haalah v'amar hakohen laishah yiten y'hvah votakh' l'alah v'lish'vu'ah b'tvokh' 'amekh' b'tet y'hvah et-y'rekhekh' nofelet v'et-bit'nekh' tzavah
translation: here the priest shall administer the curse of adjuration to the woman, as the priest goes on to say to the woman—“may the LORD make you a curse and an imprecation among your people, as the LORD causes your thigh to sag and your belly to distend;fMeaning of Heb. uncertain.

hebrew: וּ֠בָאוּ הַמַּ֨יִם הַמְאָרְרִ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ בְּֽמֵעַ֔יִךְ לַצְבּ֥וֹת בֶּ֖טֶן וְלַנְפִּ֣ל יָרֵ֑ךְ וְאָמְרָ֥ה הָאִשָּׁ֖ה אָמֵ֥ן ׀ אָמֵֽן׃
transliteration: vvav hamayim ham'ar'riym haeleh b'me'ayikh' latz'bvot beten v'lan'pil yarekh' v'am'rah haishah amen  amen
translation: may this water that induces the spell enter your body, causing the belly to distend and the thigh to sag.” And the woman shall say, “Amen, amen!”

hebrew: וְ֠כָתַב אֶת־הָאָלֹ֥ת הָאֵ֛לֶּה הַכֹּהֵ֖ן בַּסֵּ֑פֶר וּמָחָ֖ה אֶל־מֵ֥י הַמָּרִֽים׃
transliteration: v'khatav et-haalot haeleh hakohen basefer vmachah el-mey hamariym
translation: The priest shall put these curses down in writing and rub it off into the water of bitterness.

hebrew: וְהִשְׁקָה֙ אֶת־הָ֣אִשָּׁ֔ה אֶת־מֵ֥י הַמָּרִ֖ים הַמְאָֽרֲרִ֑ים וּבָ֥אוּ בָ֛הּ הַמַּ֥יִם הַֽמְאָרֲרִ֖ים לְמָרִֽים׃
transliteration: v'hish'kah et-haishah et-mey hamariym ham'arariym vvav vah hamayim ham'arariym l'mariym
translation: He is to make the woman drink the water of bitterness that induces the spell, so that the spell-inducing water may enter into her to bring on bitterness.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֤ח הַכֹּהֵן֙ מִיַּ֣ד הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה אֵ֖ת מִנְחַ֣ת הַקְּנָאֹ֑ת וְהֵנִ֤יף אֶת־הַמִּנְחָה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וְהִקְרִ֥יב אֹתָ֖הּ אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen miyad haishah et min'chat hak'naot v'heniyf et-hamin'chah lif'ney y'hvah v'hik'riyv otah el-hamiz'becha
translation: Then the priest shall take from the woman’s hand the meal offering of jealousy, elevate the meal offering before the L<small>ORD</small>, and present it on the altar.

hebrew: וְקָמַ֨ץ הַכֹּהֵ֤ן מִן־הַמִּנְחָה֙ אֶת־אַזְכָּ֣רָתָ֔הּ וְהִקְטִ֖יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה וְאַחַ֛ר יַשְׁקֶ֥ה אֶת־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה אֶת־הַמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'kamatz hakohen min-hamin'chah et-az'karatah v'hik'tiyr hamiz'bechah v'achar yash'keh et-haishah et-hamayim
translation: The priest shall scoop out of the meal offering a token part of it and turn it into smoke on the altar. Last, he shall make the woman drink the water.

hebrew: וְהִשְׁקָ֣הּ אֶת־הַמַּ֗יִם וְהָיְתָ֣ה אִֽם־נִטְמְאָה֮ וַתִּמְעֹ֣ל מַ֣עַל בְּאִישָׁהּ֒ וּבָ֨אוּ בָ֜הּ הַמַּ֤יִם הַמְאָֽרֲרִים֙ לְמָרִ֔ים וְצָבְתָ֣ה בִטְנָ֔הּ וְנָפְלָ֖ה יְרֵכָ֑הּ וְהָיְתָ֧ה הָאִשָּׁ֛ה לְאָלָ֖ה בְּקֶ֥רֶב עַמָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'hish'kah et-hamayim v'hay'tah im-nit'm'ah vatim'ol ma'al b'iyshah vvav vah hamayim ham'arariym l'mariym v'tzav'tah vit'nah v'naf'lah y'rekhah v'hay'tah haishah l'alah b'kerev 'amah
translation: Once he has made her drink the water—if she has defiled herself by breaking faith with her husband, the spell-inducing water shall enter into her to bring on bitterness, so that her belly shall distend and her thigh shall sag; and the woman shall become a curse among her people.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֤א נִטְמְאָה֙ הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וּטְהֹרָ֖ה הִ֑וא וְנִקְּתָ֖ה וְנִזְרְעָ֥ה זָֽרַע׃
transliteration: v'im-lo nit'm'ah haishah vt'horah hiv v'nik'tah v'niz'r'ah zara'
translation: But if the woman has not defiled herself and is pure, she shall be unharmed and able to retain seed.

hebrew: זֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הַקְּנָאֹ֑ת אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּשְׂטֶ֥ה אִשָּׁ֛ה תַּ֥חַת אִישָׁ֖הּ וְנִטְמָֽאָה׃
transliteration: zot tvorat hak'naot asher tis'teh ishah tachat iyshah v'nit'maah
translation: This is the ritual in cases of jealousy, when a woman goes astray while married to her husband and defiles herself,

hebrew: א֣וֹ אִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תַּעֲבֹ֥ר עָלָ֛יו ר֥וּחַ קִנְאָ֖ה וְקִנֵּ֣א אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וְהֶעֱמִ֤יד אֶת־הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וְעָ֤שָׂה לָהּ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֵ֥ת כָּל־הַתּוֹרָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
transliteration: vo iysh asher ta'avor 'alayv rvcha kin'ah v'kine et-ish'tvo v'he'emiyd et-haishah lif'ney y'hvah v'asah lah hakohen et kal-hatvorah hazot
translation: or when a fit of jealousy comes over a man and he is wrought up over his wife: the woman shall be made to stand before the L<small>ORD</small> and the priest shall carry out all this ritual with her.

hebrew: וְנִקָּ֥ה הָאִ֖ישׁ מֵעָוֺ֑ן וְהָאִשָּׁ֣ה הַהִ֔וא תִּשָּׂ֖א אֶת־עֲוֺנָֽהּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'nikah haiysh me'avon v'haishah hahiv tisa et-'avonah (f)
translation: The man shall be clear of guilt; but that woman shall suffer for her guilt.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אִ֣ישׁ אֽוֹ־אִשָּׁ֗ה כִּ֤י יַפְלִא֙ לִנְדֹּר֙ נֶ֣דֶר נָזִ֔יר לְהַזִּ֖יר לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem iysh vo-ishah kiy yaf'li lin'dor neder naziyr l'haziyr layhvah
translation: Speak to the Israelites and say to them: If anyone, man or woman, explicitlyaSee note at Lev. 22.21. utters a nazirite’s vow, to set himself apart for the LORD,

hebrew: מִיַּ֤יִן וְשֵׁכָר֙ יַזִּ֔יר חֹ֥מֶץ יַ֛יִן וְחֹ֥מֶץ שֵׁכָ֖ר לֹ֣א יִשְׁתֶּ֑ה וְכָל־מִשְׁרַ֤ת עֲנָבִים֙ לֹ֣א יִשְׁתֶּ֔ה וַעֲנָבִ֛ים לַחִ֥ים וִיבֵשִׁ֖ים לֹ֥א יֹאכֵֽל׃
transliteration: miyayin v'shekhar yaziyr chometz yayin v'chometz shekhar lo yish'teh v'khal-mish'rat 'anaviym lo yish'teh va'anaviym lachiym viyveshiym lo yokhel
translation: he shall abstain from wine and any other intoxicant; he shall not drink vinegar of wine or of any other intoxicant, neither shall he drink anything in which grapes have been steeped, nor eat grapes fresh or dried.

hebrew: כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י נִזְר֑וֹ מִכֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֵעָשֶׂ֜ה מִגֶּ֣פֶן הַיַּ֗יִן מֵחַרְצַנִּ֛ים וְעַד־זָ֖ג לֹ֥א יֹאכֵֽל׃
transliteration: kol y'mey niz'rvo mikol asher ye'aseh migefen hayayin mechar'tzaniym v'ad-zag lo yokhel
translation: Throughout his term as nazirite, he may not eat anything that is obtained from the grapevine, even seeds or skin.bMeaning of Heb. ḥarṣannim and zag uncertain.

hebrew: כָּל־יְמֵי֙ נֶ֣דֶר נִזְר֔וֹ תַּ֖עַר לֹא־יַעֲבֹ֣ר עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ עַד־מְלֹ֨את הַיָּמִ֜ם אֲשֶׁר־יַזִּ֤יר לַיהוָה֙ קָדֹ֣שׁ יִהְיֶ֔ה גַּדֵּ֥ל פֶּ֖רַע שְׂעַ֥ר רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
transliteration: kal-y'mey neder niz'rvo ta'ar lo-ya'avor 'al-roshvo 'ad-m'lot hayamim asher-yaziyr layhvah kadosh yih'yeh gadel pera' s'ar roshvo
translation: Throughout the term of his vow as nazirite, no razor shall touch his head; it shall remain consecrated until the completion of his term as nazirite of the L<small>ORD</small>, the hair of his head being left to grow untrimmed.

hebrew: כָּל־יְמֵ֥י הַזִּיר֖וֹ לַיהוָ֑ה עַל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ מֵ֖ת לֹ֥א יָבֹֽא׃
transliteration: kal-y'mey haziyrvo layhvah 'al-nefesh met lo yavo
translation: Throughout the term that he has set apart for the L<small>ORD</small>, he shall not go in where there is a dead person.

hebrew: לְאָבִ֣יו וּלְאִמּ֗וֹ לְאָחִיו֙ וּלְאַ֣חֹת֔וֹ לֹא־יִטַּמָּ֥א לָהֶ֖ם בְּמֹתָ֑ם כִּ֛י נֵ֥זֶר אֱלֹהָ֖יו עַל־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
transliteration: l'aviyv vl'imvo l'achiyv vl'achotvo lo-yitama lahem b'motam kiy nezer elohayv 'al-roshvo
translation: Even if his father or mother, or his brother or sister should die, he must not defile himself for them, since cOthers “his consecration unto God.”hair set apart for his God-c is upon his head:

hebrew: כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י נִזְר֑וֹ קָדֹ֥שׁ ה֖וּא לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: kol y'mey niz'rvo kadosh hv layhvah
translation: throughout his term as nazirite he is consecrated to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָמ֨וּת מֵ֤ת עָלָיו֙ בְּפֶ֣תַע פִּתְאֹ֔ם וְטִמֵּ֖א רֹ֣אשׁ נִזְר֑וֹ וְגִלַּ֤ח רֹאשׁוֹ֙ בְּי֣וֹם טָהֳרָת֔וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י יְגַלְּחֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yamvt met 'alayv b'feta' pit'om v'time rosh niz'rvo v'gilach roshvo b'yvom tahoratvo bayvom hash'viy'iy y'gal'chenv
translation: If a person dies suddenly near him,dCf. Num. 19.14–16. defiling his consecrated hair, he shall shave his head on the day he becomes clean; he shall shave it on the seventh day.

hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֗י יָבִא֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י תֹרִ֔ים א֥וֹ שְׁנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יוֹנָ֑ה אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: vvayvom hash'miyniy yavi sh'tey toriym vo sh'ney b'ney yvonah el-hakohen el-petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: On the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two pigeons to the priest, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן אֶחָ֤ד לְחַטָּאת֙ וְאֶחָ֣ד לְעֹלָ֔ה וְכִפֶּ֣ר עָלָ֔יו מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטָ֖א עַל־הַנָּ֑פֶשׁ וְקִדַּ֥שׁ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֖וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'asah hakohen echad l'chatat v'echad l'olah v'khiper 'alayv measher chata 'al-hanafesh v'kidash et-roshvo bayvom hahv
translation: The priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and make expiation on his behalf for the guilt that he incurred through the corpse. That same day he shall reconsecrate his head

hebrew: וְהִזִּ֤יר לַֽיהוָה֙ אֶת־יְמֵ֣י נִזְר֔וֹ וְהֵבִ֛יא כֶּ֥בֶשׂ בֶּן־שְׁנָת֖וֹ לְאָשָׁ֑ם וְהַיָּמִ֤ים הָרִאשֹׁנִים֙ יִפְּל֔וּ כִּ֥י טָמֵ֖א נִזְרֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'hiziyr layhvah et-y'mey niz'rvo v'heviy keves ben-sh'natvo l'asham v'hayamiym harishoniym yip'lv kiy tame niz'rvo
translation: and rededicate to the L<small>ORD</small> his term as nazirite; and he shall bring a lamb in its first year as a penalty offering. The previous period shall be void, since his consecrated hair was defiled.

hebrew: וְזֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הַנָּזִ֑יר בְּי֗וֹם מְלֹאת֙ יְמֵ֣י נִזְר֔וֹ יָבִ֣יא אֹת֔וֹ אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'zot tvorat hanaziyr b'yvom m'lot y'mey niz'rvo yaviy otvo el-petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: This is the ritual for the nazirite: On the day that his term as nazirite is completed, heeOr “it,” i.e., the consecrated hair; cf. v. 19. shall be brought to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֣יב אֶת־קָרְבָּנ֣וֹ לַיהוָ֡ה כֶּבֶשׂ֩ בֶּן־שְׁנָת֨וֹ תָמִ֤ים אֶחָד֙ לְעֹלָ֔ה וְכַבְשָׂ֨ה אַחַ֧ת בַּת־שְׁנָתָ֛הּ תְּמִימָ֖ה לְחַטָּ֑את וְאַֽיִל־אֶחָ֥ד תָּמִ֖ים לִשְׁלָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyv et-kar'banvo layhvah keves ben-sh'natvo tamiym echad l'olah v'khav'sah achat bat-sh'natah t'miymah l'chatat v'ayil-echad tamiym lish'lamiym
translation: As his offering to the L<small>ORD</small> he shall present: one male lamb in its first year, without blemish, for a burnt offering; one ewe lamb in its first year, without blemish, for a sin offering; one ram without blemish for an offering of well-being;

hebrew: וְסַ֣ל מַצּ֗וֹת סֹ֤לֶת חַלֹּת֙ בְּלוּלֹ֣ת בַּשֶּׁ֔מֶן וּרְקִיקֵ֥י מַצּ֖וֹת מְשֻׁחִ֣ים בַּשָּׁ֑מֶן וּמִנְחָתָ֖ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'sal matzvot solet chalot b'lvlot bashemen vr'kiykey matzvot m'shuchiym bashamen vmin'chatam v'nis'keyhem
translation: a basket of unleavened cakes of choice flour with oil mixed in, and unleavened wafers spread with oil; and the proper meal offerings and libations.

hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֥יב הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְעָשָׂ֥ה אֶת־חַטָּאת֖וֹ וְאֶת־עֹלָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyv hakohen lif'ney y'hvah v'asah et-chatatvo v'et-'olatvo
translation: The priest shall present them before the L<small>ORD</small> and offer the sin offering and the burnt offering.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאַ֜יִל יַעֲשֶׂ֨ה זֶ֤בַח שְׁלָמִים֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה עַ֖ל סַ֣ל הַמַּצּ֑וֹת וְעָשָׂה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֶת־מִנְחָת֖וֹ וְאֶת־נִסְכּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'et-haayil ya'aseh zevach sh'lamiym layhvah 'al sal hamatzvot v'asah hakohen et-min'chatvo v'et-nis'kvo
translation: He shall offer the ram as a sacrifice of well-being to the L<small>ORD</small>, together with the basket of unleavened cakes; the priest shall also offer the meal offerings and the libations.

hebrew: וְגִלַּ֣ח הַנָּזִ֗יר פֶּ֛תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד אֶת־רֹ֣אשׁ נִזְר֑וֹ וְלָקַ֗ח אֶת־שְׂעַר֙ רֹ֣אשׁ נִזְר֔וֹ וְנָתַן֙ עַל־הָאֵ֔שׁ אֲשֶׁר־תַּ֖חַת זֶ֥בַח הַשְּׁלָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'gilach hanaziyr petach ohel mvo'ed et-rosh niz'rvo v'lakach et-s'ar rosh niz'rvo v'natan 'al-haesh asher-tachat zevach hash'lamiym
translation: The nazirite shall then shave his consecrated hair, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and take the locks of his consecrated hair and put them on the fire that is under the sacrifice of well-being.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֨ח הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־הַזְּרֹ֣עַ בְּשֵׁלָה֮ מִן־הָאַיִל֒ וְֽחַלַּ֨ת מַצָּ֤ה אַחַת֙ מִן־הַסַּ֔ל וּרְקִ֥יק מַצָּ֖ה אֶחָ֑ד וְנָתַן֙ עַל־כַּפֵּ֣י הַנָּזִ֔יר אַחַ֖ר הִֽתְגַּלְּח֥וֹ אֶת־נִזְרֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen et-haz'ro'a b'shelah min-haayil v'chalat matzah achat min-hasal vr'kiyk matzah echad v'natan 'al-kapey hanaziyr achar hit'gal'chvo et-niz'rvo
translation: The priest shall take the shoulder of the ram when it has been boiled, one unleavened cake from the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and place them on the hands of the nazirite after he has shaved his consecrated hair.

hebrew: וְהֵנִיף֩ אוֹתָ֨ם הַכֹּהֵ֥ן ׀ תְּנוּפָה֮ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָה֒ קֹ֤דֶשׁ הוּא֙ לַכֹּהֵ֔ן עַ֚ל חֲזֵ֣ה הַתְּנוּפָ֔ה וְעַ֖ל שׁ֣וֹק הַתְּרוּמָ֑ה וְאַחַ֛ר יִשְׁתֶּ֥ה הַנָּזִ֖יר יָֽיִן׃
transliteration: v'heniyf votam hakohen  t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah kodesh hv lakohen 'al chazeh hat'nvfah v'al shvok hat'rvmah v'achar yish'teh hanaziyr yayin
translation: The priest shall elevate them as an elevation offering before the L<small>ORD</small>; and this shall be a sacred donation for the priest, in addition to the breast of the elevation offering and the thigh of gift offering. After that the nazirite may drink wine.

hebrew: זֹ֣את תּוֹרַ֣ת הַנָּזִיר֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִדֹּר֒ קָרְבָּנ֤וֹ לַֽיהוָה֙ עַל־נִזְר֔וֹ מִלְּבַ֖ד אֲשֶׁר־תַּשִּׂ֣יג יָד֑וֹ כְּפִ֤י נִדְרוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִדֹּ֔ר כֵּ֣ן יַעֲשֶׂ֔ה עַ֖ל תּוֹרַ֥ת נִזְרֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: zot tvorat hanaziyr asher yidor kar'banvo layhvah 'al-niz'rvo mil'vad asher-tasiyg yadvo k'fiy nid'rvo asher yidor ken ya'aseh 'al tvorat niz'rvo (f)
translation: Such is the obligation of a nazirite; except that he who vows an offering to the L<small>ORD</small> of what he can afford, beyond his nazirite requirements, must do exactly according to the vow that he has made beyond his obligation as a nazirite.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֤ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶל־בָּנָ֣יו לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֥ה תְבָרֲכ֖וּ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אָמ֖וֹר לָהֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: daber el-aharon v'el-banayv lemor koh t'varakhv et-b'ney yis'rael amvor lahem (s)
translation: Speak to Aaron and his sons: Thus shall you bless the people of Israel. Say to them:

hebrew: יְבָרֶכְךָ֥ יְהוָ֖ה וְיִשְׁמְרֶֽךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: y'varekh'kha y'hvah v'yish'm'rekha (s)
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> bless you and protect you!

hebrew: יָאֵ֨ר יְהוָ֧ה ׀ פָּנָ֛יו אֵלֶ֖יךָ וִֽיחֻנֶּֽךָּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: yaer y'hvah  panayv eleykha viychuneka (s)
translation: The LORD fOthers “make His face to shine upon thee and be gracious to thee.”deal kindly and graciously with you!-f

hebrew: יִשָּׂ֨א יְהוָ֤ה ׀ פָּנָיו֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְיָשֵׂ֥ם לְךָ֖ שָׁלֽוֹם׃ (ס)
transliteration: yisa y'hvah  panayv eleykha v'yasem l'kha shalvom (s)
translation: The LORD gOthers “lift up His countenance.”bestow His favor-g upon you and grant you peace!hOr “friendship.”

hebrew: וְשָׂמ֥וּ אֶת־שְׁמִ֖י עַל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַאֲנִ֖י אֲבָרֲכֵֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'samv et-sh'miy 'al-b'ney yis'rael vaaniy avarakhem (f)
translation: Thus they shall link My name with the people of Israel, and I will bless them.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י בְּיוֹם֩ כַּלּ֨וֹת מֹשֶׁ֜ה לְהָקִ֣ים אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֗ן וַיִּמְשַׁ֨ח אֹת֜וֹ וַיְקַדֵּ֤שׁ אֹתוֹ֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וַיִּמְשָׁחֵ֖ם וַיְקַדֵּ֥שׁ אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy b'yvom kalvot mosheh l'hakiym et-hamish'kan vayim'shach otvo vay'kadesh otvo v'et-kal-kelayv v'et-hamiz'becha v'et-kal-kelayv vayim'shachem vay'kadesh otam
translation: On the day that Moses finished setting up the Tabernacle, he anointed and consecrated it and all its furnishings, as well as the altar and its utensils. When he had anointed and consecrated them,

hebrew: וַיַּקְרִ֙יבוּ֙ נְשִׂיאֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רָאשֵׁ֖י בֵּ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם הֵ֚ם נְשִׂיאֵ֣י הַמַּטֹּ֔ת הֵ֥ם הָעֹמְדִ֖ים עַל־הַפְּקֻדִֽים׃
transliteration: vayak'riyvv n'siyey yis'rael rashey beyt avotam hem n'siyey hamatot hem ha'om'diym 'al-hap'kudiym
translation: the chieftains of Israel, the heads of ancestral houses, namely, the chieftains of the tribes, those who were in charge of enrollment, drew nearaCf. Exod. 14.10.

hebrew: וַיָּבִ֨יאוּ אֶת־קָרְבָּנָ֜ם לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֗ה שֵׁשׁ־עֶגְלֹ֥ת צָב֙ וּשְׁנֵ֣י עָשָׂ֣ר בָּקָ֔ר עֲגָלָ֛ה עַל־שְׁנֵ֥י הַנְּשִׂאִ֖ים וְשׁ֣וֹר לְאֶחָ֑ד וַיַּקְרִ֥יבוּ אוֹתָ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
transliteration: vayaviyv et-kar'banam lif'ney y'hvah shesh-'eg'lot tzav vsh'ney 'asar bakar 'agalah 'al-sh'ney han'siiym v'shvor l'echad vayak'riyvv votam lif'ney hamish'kan
translation:
and brought their offering before the LORD: six draught carts and twelve oxen, a cart for every two chieftains and an ox for each one.
When they had brought them before the Tabernacle,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
