translation: the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses:

hebrew: קַ֚ח מֵֽאִתָּ֔ם וְהָי֕וּ לַעֲבֹ֕ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אוֹתָם֙ אֶל־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם אִ֖ישׁ כְּפִ֥י עֲבֹדָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kach meitam v'hayv la'avod et-'avodat ohel mvo'ed v'natatah votam el-hal'viyim iysh k'fiy 'avodatvo
translation: Accept these from them for use in the service of the Tent of Meeting, and give them to the Levites according to their respective services.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־הָעֲגָלֹ֖ת וְאֶת־הַבָּקָ֑ר וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אוֹתָ֖ם אֶל־הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-ha'agalot v'et-habakar vayiten votam el-hal'viyim
translation: Moses took the carts and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.

hebrew: אֵ֣ת ׀ שְׁתֵּ֣י הָעֲגָלֹ֗ת וְאֵת֙ אַרְבַּ֣עַת הַבָּקָ֔ר נָתַ֖ן לִבְנֵ֣י גֵרְשׁ֑וֹן כְּפִ֖י עֲבֹדָתָֽם׃
transliteration: et  sh'tey ha'agalot v'et ar'ba'at habakar natan liv'ney ger'shvon k'fiy 'avodatam
translation: Two carts and four oxen he gave to the Gershonites, as required for their service,

hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת ׀ אַרְבַּ֣ע הָעֲגָלֹ֗ת וְאֵת֙ שְׁמֹנַ֣ת הַבָּקָ֔ר נָתַ֖ן לִבְנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֑י כְּפִי֙ עֲבֹ֣דָתָ֔ם בְּיַד֙ אִֽיתָמָ֔ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'et  ar'ba' ha'agalot v'et sh'monat habakar natan liv'ney m'rariy k'fiy 'avodatam b'yad iytamar ben-aharon hakohen
translation: and four carts and eight oxen he gave to the Merarites, as required for their service—under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.

hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֥י קְהָ֖ת לֹ֣א נָתָ֑ן כִּֽי־עֲבֹדַ֤ת הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ עֲלֵהֶ֔ם בַּכָּתֵ֖ף יִשָּֽׂאוּ׃
transliteration: v'liv'ney k'hat lo natan kiy-'avodat hakodesh 'alehem bakatef yisav
translation: But to the Kohathites he did not give any; since theirs was the service of the [most] sacred objects, their porterage was by shoulder.

hebrew: וַיַּקְרִ֣יבוּ הַנְּשִׂאִ֗ים אֵ֚ת חֲנֻכַּ֣ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ בְּי֖וֹם הִמָּשַׁ֣ח אֹת֑וֹ וַיַּקְרִ֧יבוּ הַנְּשִׂיאִ֛ם אֶת־קָרְבָּנָ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: vayak'riyvv han'siiym et chanukat hamiz'becha b'yvom himashach otvo vayak'riyvv han'siyim et-kar'banam lif'ney hamiz'becha
translation: The chieftains also brought the dedication offering for the altar upon its being anointed. As the chieftains were presenting their offerings before the altar,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה נָשִׂ֨יא אֶחָ֜ד לַיּ֗וֹם נָשִׂ֤יא אֶחָד֙ לַיּ֔וֹם יַקְרִ֙יבוּ֙ אֶת־קָרְבָּנָ֔ם לַחֲנֻכַּ֖ת הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh nasiy echad layvom nasiy echad layvom yak'riyvv et-kar'banam lachanukat hamiz'becha (s)
translation: the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses: Let them present their offerings for the dedication of the altar, one chieftain each day.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י הַמַּקְרִ֛יב בַּיּ֥וֹם הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן אֶת־קָרְבָּנ֑וֹ נַחְשׁ֥וֹן בֶּן־עַמִּינָדָ֖ב לְמַטֵּ֥ה יְהוּדָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy hamak'riyv bayvom harishvon et-kar'banvo nach'shvon ben-'amiynadav l'mateh y'hvdah
translation: The one who presented his offering on the first day was Nahshon son of Amminadab of the tribe of Judah.

hebrew: וְקָרְבָּנ֞וֹ קַֽעֲרַת־כֶּ֣סֶף אַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וּמֵאָה֮ מִשְׁקָלָהּ֒ מִזְרָ֤ק אֶחָד֙ כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁבְעִ֥ים שֶׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ שְׁנֵיהֶ֣ם ׀ מְלֵאִ֗ים סֹ֛לֶת בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן לְמִנְחָֽה׃
transliteration: v'kar'banvo ka'arat-kesef achat sh'loshiym vmeah mish'kalah miz'rak echad kesef shiv'iym shekel b'shekel hakodesh sh'neyhem  m'leiym solet b'lvlah vashemen l'min'chah
translation: His offering: one silver bowl weighing 130 shekels and one silver basin of 70 shekels by the sanctuary weight, both filled with choice flour with oil mixed in, for a meal offering;

hebrew: כַּ֥ף אַחַ֛ת עֲשָׂרָ֥ה זָהָ֖ב מְלֵאָ֥ה קְטֹֽרֶת׃
transliteration: kaf achat 'asarah zahav m'leah k'toret
translation: one gold ladle of 10 shekels, filled with incense;

hebrew: פַּ֣ר אֶחָ֞ד בֶּן־בָּקָ֗ר אַ֧יִל אֶחָ֛ד כֶּֽבֶשׂ־אֶחָ֥ד בֶּן־שְׁנָת֖וֹ לְעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: par echad ben-bakar ayil echad keves-echad ben-sh'natvo l'olah
translation: one bull of the herd, one ram, and one lamb in its first year, for a burnt offering;

hebrew: שְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד לְחַטָּֽאת׃
transliteration: s'iyr-'iziym echad l'chatat
translation: one goat for a sin offering;

hebrew: וּלְזֶ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִים֮ בָּקָ֣ר שְׁנַיִם֒ אֵילִ֤ם חֲמִשָּׁה֙ עַתּוּדִ֣ים חֲמִשָּׁ֔ה כְּבָשִׂ֥ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֖ה חֲמִשָּׁ֑ה זֶ֛ה קָרְבַּ֥ן נַחְשׁ֖וֹן בֶּן־עַמִּינָדָֽב׃ (פ)
transliteration: vl'zevach hash'lamiym bakar sh'nayim eylim chamishah 'atvdiym chamishah k'vasiym b'ney-shanah chamishah zeh kar'ban nach'shvon ben-'amiynadav (f)
translation: and for his sacrifice of well-being: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five yearling lambs. That was the offering of Nahshon son of Amminadab.

hebrew: בַּיּוֹם֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י הִקְרִ֖יב נְתַנְאֵ֣ל בֶּן־צוּעָ֑ר נְשִׂ֖יא יִשָּׂשכָֽר׃
transliteration: bayvom hasheniy hik'riyv n'tan'el ben-tzv'ar n'siy yisashkhar
translation: On the second day, Nethanel son of Zuar, chieftain of Issachar, made his offering.

hebrew: הִקְרִ֨ב אֶת־קָרְבָּנ֜וֹ קַֽעֲרַת־כֶּ֣סֶף אַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וּמֵאָה֮ מִשְׁקָלָהּ֒ מִזְרָ֤ק אֶחָד֙ כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁבְעִ֥ים שֶׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ שְׁנֵיהֶ֣ם ׀ מְלֵאִ֗ים סֹ֛לֶת בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן לְמִנְחָֽה׃
transliteration: hik'riv et-kar'banvo ka'arat-kesef achat sh'loshiym vmeah mish'kalah miz'rak echad kesef shiv'iym shekel b'shekel hakodesh sh'neyhem  m'leiym solet b'lvlah vashemen l'min'chah
translation: He presented as his offering: one silver bowl weighing 130 shekels and one silver basin of 70 shekels by the sanctuary weight, both filled with choice flour with oil mixed in, for a meal offering;

hebrew: כַּ֥ף אַחַ֛ת עֲשָׂרָ֥ה זָהָ֖ב מְלֵאָ֥ה קְטֹֽרֶת׃
transliteration: kaf achat 'asarah zahav m'leah k'toret
translation: one gold ladle of 10 shekels, filled with incense;

hebrew: פַּ֣ר אֶחָ֞ד בֶּן־בָּקָ֗ר אַ֧יִל אֶחָ֛ד כֶּֽבֶשׂ־אֶחָ֥ד בֶּן־שְׁנָת֖וֹ לְעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: par echad ben-bakar ayil echad keves-echad ben-sh'natvo l'olah
translation: one bull of the herd, one ram, and one lamb in its first year, for a burnt offering;

hebrew: שְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד לְחַטָּֽאת׃
transliteration: s'iyr-'iziym echad l'chatat

translation: and for his sacrifice of well-being: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five yearling lambs. That was the offering of Nethanel son of Zuar.

hebrew: בַּיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁמִינִ֔י נָשִׂ֖יא לִבְנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה גַּמְלִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־פְּדָה־צֽוּר׃
transliteration: bayvom hash'miyniy nasiy liv'ney m'nasheh gam'liyel ben-p'dah-tzvr
translation: On the eighth day, it was the chieftain of the Manassites, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

hebrew: קָרְבָּנ֞וֹ קַֽעֲרַת־כֶּ֣סֶף אַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וּמֵאָה֮ מִשְׁקָלָהּ֒ מִזְרָ֤ק אֶחָד֙ כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁבְעִ֥ים שֶׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ שְׁנֵיהֶ֣ם ׀ מְלֵאִ֗ים סֹ֛לֶת בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן לְמִנְחָֽה
transliteration: kar'banvo ka'arat-kesef achat sh'loshiym vmeah mish'kalah miz'rak echad kesef shiv'iym shekel b'shekel hakodesh sh'neyhem  m'leiym solet b'lvlah vashemen l'min'chah
translation: His offering: one silver bowl weighing 130 shekels and one silver basin of 70 shekels by the sanctuary weight, both filled with choice flour with oil mixed in, for a meal offering;

hebrew: כַּ֥ף אַחַ֛ת עֲשָׂרָ֥ה זָהָ֖ב מְלֵאָ֥ה קְטֹֽרֶת׃
transliteration: kaf achat 'asarah zahav m'leah k'toret
translation: one gold ladle of 10 shekels, filled with incense;

hebrew: פַּ֣ר אֶחָ֞ד בֶּן־בָּקָ֗ר אַ֧יִל אֶחָ֛ד כֶּֽבֶשׂ־אֶחָ֥ד בֶּן־שְׁנָת֖וֹ לְעֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: par echad ben-bakar ayil echad keves-echad ben-sh'natvo l'olah
translation: one bull of the herd, one ram, and one lamb in its first year, for a burnt offering;

hebrew: שְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד לְחַטָּֽאת׃
transliteration: s'iyr-'iziym echad l'chatat
translation: one goat for a sin offering;

hebrew: וּלְזֶ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִים֮ בָּקָ֣ר שְׁנַיִם֒ אֵילִ֤ם חֲמִשָּׁה֙ עַתֻּדִ֣ים חֲמִשָּׁ֔ה כְּבָשִׂ֥ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֖ה חֲמִשָּׁ֑ה זֶ֛ה קָרְבַּ֥ן גַּמְלִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־פְּדָה צֽוּר׃ (פ)
transliteration: vl'zevach hash'lamiym bakar sh'nayim eylim chamishah 'atudiym chamishah k'vasiym b'ney-shanah chamishah zeh kar'ban gam'liyel ben-p'dah tzvr (f)
translation: and for his sacrifice of well-being: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five yearling lambs. That was the offering of Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

hebrew: בַּיּוֹם֙ הַתְּשִׁיעִ֔י נָשִׂ֖יא לִבְנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ן אֲבִידָ֖ן בֶּן־גִּדְעֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: bayvom hat'shiy'iy nasiy liv'ney vin'yamin aviydan ben-gid'oniy
translation: On the ninth day, it was the chieftain of the Benjaminites, Abidan son of Gideoni.

hebrew: קָרְבָּנ֞וֹ קַֽעֲרַת־כֶּ֣סֶף אַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וּמֵאָה֮ מִשְׁקָלָהּ֒ מִזְרָ֤ק אֶחָד֙ כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁבְעִ֥ים שֶׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ שְׁנֵיהֶ֣ם ׀ מְלֵאִ֗ים סֹ֛לֶת בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן לְמִנְחָֽה׃
transliteration: kar'banvo ka'arat-kesef achat sh'loshiym vmeah mish'kalah miz'rak echad kesef shiv'iym shekel b'shekel hakodesh sh'neyhem  m'leiym solet b'lvlah vashemen l'min'chah
translation: His offering: one silver bowl weighing 130 shekels and one silver basin of 70 shekels by the sanctuary weight, both filled with choice flour with oil mixed in, for a meal offering;

transliteration: kaf achat 'asarah zahav m'leah k'toret
translation: one gold ladle of 10 shekels, filled with incense;

transliteration: par echad ben-bakar ayil echad keves-echad ben-sh'natvo l'olah
translation: one bull of the herd, one ram, and one lamb in its first year, for a burnt offering;

transliteration: s'iyr-'iziym echad l'chatat

transliteration: vl'zevach hash'lamiym bakar sh'nayim eylim chamishah 'atudiym chamishah k'vasiym b'ney-shanah chamishah zeh kar'ban aviydan ben-gid'oniy (f)
translation: and for his sacrifice of well-being: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five yearling lambs. That was the offering of Abidan son of Gideoni.

hebrew: בַּיּוֹם֙ הָעֲשִׂירִ֔י נָשִׂ֖יא לִבְנֵ֣י דָ֑ן אֲחִיעֶ֖זֶר בֶּן־עַמִּישַׁדָּֽי׃
transliteration: bayvom ha'asiyriy nasiy liv'ney dan achiy'ezer ben-'amiyshaday
translation: On the tenth day, it was the chieftain of the Danites, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

transliteration: b'yvom 'ash'tey 'asar yvom nasiy liv'ney asher pag'iyel ben-'akh'ran
translation: On the eleventh day, it was the chieftain of the Asherites, Pagiel son of Ochran.

transliteration: b'yvom sh'neym 'asar yvom nasiy liv'ney naf'taliy achiyra' ben-'eynan
translation: On the twelfth day, it was the chieftain of the Naphtalites, Ahira son of Enan.

translation: and for his sacrifice of well-being: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five yearling lambs. That was the offering of Ahira son of Enan.

hebrew: זֹ֣את ׀ חֲנֻכַּ֣ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חַ בְּיוֹם֙ הִמָּשַׁ֣ח אֹת֔וֹ מֵאֵ֖ת נְשִׂיאֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל קַעֲרֹ֨ת כֶּ֜סֶף שְׁתֵּ֣ים עֶשְׂרֵ֗ה מִֽזְרְקֵי־כֶ֙סֶף֙ שְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂ֔ר כַּפּ֥וֹת זָהָ֖ב שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵֽה׃
transliteration: zot  chanukat hamiz'becha b'yvom himashach otvo meet n'siyey yis'rael ka'arot kesef sh'teym 'es'reh miz'r'key-khesef sh'neym 'asar kapvot zahav sh'teym 'es'reh
translation: This was the dedication offering for the altar from the chieftains of Israel upon its being anointed: silver bowls, 12; silver basins, 12; gold ladles, 12.

hebrew: שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וּמֵאָ֗ה הַקְּעָרָ֤ה הָֽאַחַת֙ כֶּ֔סֶף וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים הַמִּזְרָ֣ק הָאֶחָ֑ד כֹּ֚ל כֶּ֣סֶף הַכֵּלִ֔ים אַלְפַּ֥יִם וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֖וֹת בְּשֶׁ֥קֶל הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: sh'loshiym vmeah hak'arah haachat kesef v'shiv'iym hamiz'rak haechad kol kesef hakeliym al'payim v'ar'ba'-mevot b'shekel hakodesh
translation: Silver per bowl, 130; per basin, 70. Total silver of vessels, 2,400 sanctuary shekels.

hebrew: כַּפּ֨וֹת זָהָ֤ב שְׁתֵּים־עֶשְׂרֵה֙ מְלֵאֹ֣ת קְטֹ֔רֶת עֲשָׂרָ֧ה עֲשָׂרָ֛ה הַכַּ֖ף בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ כָּל־זְהַ֥ב הַכַּפּ֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּמֵאָֽה׃
transliteration: kapvot zahav sh'teym-'es'reh m'leot k'toret 'asarah 'asarah hakaf b'shekel hakodesh kal-z'hav hakapvot 'es'riym vmeah
translation: The 12 gold ladles filled with incense—10 sanctuary shekels per ladle—total gold of the ladles, 120.

hebrew: כָּל־הַבָּקָ֨ר לָעֹלָ֜ה שְׁנֵ֧ים עָשָׂ֣ר פָּרִ֗ים אֵילִ֤ם שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂר֙ כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֛ה שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר וּמִנְחָתָ֑ם וּשְׂעִירֵ֥י עִזִּ֛ים שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר לְחַטָּֽאת׃
transliteration: kal-habakar la'olah sh'neym 'asar pariym eylim sh'neym-'asar k'vasiym b'ney-shanah sh'neym 'asar vmin'chatam vs'iyrey 'iziym sh'neym 'asar l'chatat
translation: Total of herd animals for burnt offerings, 12 bulls; of rams, 12; of yearling lambs, 12—with their proper meal offerings; of goats for sin offerings, 12.

hebrew: וְכֹ֞ל בְּקַ֣ר ׀ זֶ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִ֗ים עֶשְׂרִ֣ים וְאַרְבָּעָה֮ פָּרִים֒ אֵילִ֤ם שִׁשִּׁים֙ עַתֻּדִ֣ים שִׁשִּׁ֔ים כְּבָשִׂ֥ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֖ה שִׁשִּׁ֑ים זֹ֚את חֲנֻכַּ֣ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ אַחֲרֵ֖י הִמָּשַׁ֥ח אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'khol b'kar  zevach hash'lamiym 'es'riym v'ar'ba'ah pariym eylim shishiym 'atudiym shishiym k'vasiym b'ney-shanah shishiym zot chanukat hamiz'becha acharey himashach otvo
translation: Total of herd animals for sacrifices of well-being, 24 bulls; of rams, 60; of he-goats, 60; of yearling lambs, 60. That was the dedication offering for the altar after its anointing.

hebrew: וּבְבֹ֨א מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵד֮ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אִתּוֹ֒ וַיִּשְׁמַ֨ע אֶת־הַקּ֜וֹל מִדַּבֵּ֣ר אֵלָ֗יו מֵעַ֤ל הַכַּפֹּ֙רֶת֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־אֲרֹ֣ן הָעֵדֻ֔ת מִבֵּ֖ין שְׁנֵ֣י הַכְּרֻבִ֑ים וַיְדַבֵּ֖ר אֵלָֽיו׃ (פ)
transliteration: vv'vo mosheh el-ohel mvo'ed l'daber itvo vayish'ma' et-hakvol midaber elayv me'al hakaporet asher 'al-aron ha'edut mibeyn sh'ney hak'ruviym vay'daber elayv (f)
translation: When Moses went into the Tent of Meeting to speak with Him, he would hear the Voice addressing him from above the cover that was on top of the Ark of the Pact between the two cherubim; thus He spoke to him.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֵלָ֑יו בְּהַעֲלֹֽתְךָ֙ אֶת־הַנֵּרֹ֔ת אֶל־מוּל֙ פְּנֵ֣י הַמְּנוֹרָ֔ה יָאִ֖ירוּ שִׁבְעַ֥ת הַנֵּרֽוֹת׃
transliteration: daber el-aharon v'amar'ta elayv b'ha'alot'kha et-hanerot el-mvl p'ney ham'nvorah yaiyrv shiv'at hanervot
translation: Speak to Aaron and say to him, “When you mountaCf. Exod. 25.37. the lamps, let the seven lamps give light at the front of the lampstand.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ כֵּן֙ אַהֲרֹ֔ן אֶל־מוּל֙ פְּנֵ֣י הַמְּנוֹרָ֔ה הֶעֱלָ֖ה נֵרֹתֶ֑יהָ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vaya'as ken aharon el-mvl p'ney ham'nvorah he'elah neroteyha kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: Aaron did so; he mounted the lamps at the front of the lampstand, as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.—

hebrew: וְזֶ֨ה מַעֲשֵׂ֤ה הַמְּנֹרָה֙ מִקְשָׁ֣ה זָהָ֔ב עַד־יְרֵכָ֥הּ עַד־פִּרְחָ֖הּ מִקְשָׁ֣ה הִ֑וא כַּמַּרְאֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶרְאָ֤ה יְהוָה֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֵּ֥ן עָשָׂ֖ה אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'zeh ma'aseh ham'norah mik'shah zahav 'ad-y'rekhah 'ad-pir'chah mik'shah hiv kamar'eh asher her'ah y'hvah et-mosheh ken 'asah et-ham'norah (f)
translation: Now this is how the lampstand was made: it was hammered work of gold, hammered from base to petal. According to the pattern that the L<small>ORD</small> had shown Moses, so was the lampstand made.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: קַ֚ח אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם מִתּ֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְטִהַרְתָּ֖ אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: kach et-hal'viyim mitvokh' b'ney yis'rael v'tihar'ta otam
translation: Take the Levites from among the Israelites and cleanse them.

hebrew: וְכֹֽה־תַעֲשֶׂ֤ה לָהֶם֙ לְטַֽהֲרָ֔ם הַזֵּ֥ה עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מֵ֣י חַטָּ֑את וְהֶעֱבִ֤ירוּ תַ֙עַר֙ עַל־כָּל־בְּשָׂרָ֔ם וְכִבְּס֥וּ בִגְדֵיהֶ֖ם וְהִטֶּהָֽרוּ׃
transliteration: v'khoh-ta'aseh lahem l'taharam hazeh 'aleyhem mey chatat v'he'eviyrv ta'ar 'al-kal-b'saram v'khib'sv vig'deyhem v'hiteharv
translation: This is what you shall do to them to cleanse them: sprinkle on them water of purification, and let them go over their whole body with a razor, and wash their clothes; thus they shall be cleansed.

hebrew: וְלָֽקְחוּ֙ פַּ֣ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֔ר וּמִנְחָת֔וֹ סֹ֖לֶת בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן וּפַר־שֵׁנִ֥י בֶן־בָּקָ֖ר תִּקַּ֥ח לְחַטָּֽאת׃
transliteration: v'lak'chv par ben-bakar vmin'chatvo solet b'lvlah vashamen vfar-sheniy ven-bakar tikach l'chatat
translation: Let them take a bull of the herd, and with it a meal offering of choice flour with oil mixed in, and you take a second bull of the herd for a sin offering.

hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהִ֨קְהַלְתָּ֔ אֶֽת־כָּל־עֲדַ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'hik'rav'ta et-hal'viyim lif'ney ohel mvo'ed v'hik'hal'ta et-kal-'adat b'ney yis'rael
translation: You shall bring the Levites forward before the Tent of Meeting. Assemble the whole Israelite community,

hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְסָמְכ֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
transliteration: v'hik'rav'ta et-hal'viyim lif'ney y'hvah v'sam'khv v'ney-yis'rael et-y'deyhem 'al-hal'viyim
translation: and bring the Levites forward before the L<small>ORD</small>. Let the Israelites lay their hands upon the Levites,

hebrew: וְהֵנִיף֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֤ם תְּנוּפָה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהָי֕וּ לַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֥ת יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'heniyf aharon et-hal'viyim t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah meet b'ney yis'rael v'hayv la'avod et-'avodat y'hvah
translation: and let Aaron designatebLit. “elevate.” the Levites before the LORD as an elevation offering from the Israelites, that they may perform the service of the LORD.

hebrew: וְהַלְוִיִּם֙ יִסְמְכ֣וּ אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֔ם עַ֖ל רֹ֣אשׁ הַפָּרִ֑ים וַ֠עֲשֵׂה אֶת־הָאֶחָ֨ד חַטָּ֜את וְאֶת־הָאֶחָ֤ד עֹלָה֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
transliteration: v'hal'viyim yis'm'khv et-y'deyhem 'al rosh hapariym va'aseh et-haechad chatat v'et-haechad 'olah layhvah l'khaper 'al-hal'viyim
translation: The Levites shall now lay their hands upon the heads of the bulls; one shall be offered to the L<small>ORD</small> as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, to make expiation for the Levites.

hebrew: וְהַֽעֲמַדְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם לִפְנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְלִפְנֵ֣י בָנָ֑יו וְהֵנַפְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'ha'amad'ta et-hal'viyim lif'ney aharon v'lif'ney vanayv v'henaf'ta otam t'nvfah layhvah
translation: You shall place the Levites in attendance upon Aaron and his sons, and designate them as an elevation offering to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְהִבְדַּלְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם מִתּ֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהָ֥יוּ לִ֖י הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
transliteration: v'hiv'dal'ta et-hal'viyim mitvokh' b'ney yis'rael v'hayv liy hal'viyim
translation: Thus you shall set the Levites apart from the Israelites, and the Levites shall be Mine.

hebrew: וְאַֽחֲרֵי־כֵן֙ יָבֹ֣אוּ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם לַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְטִֽהַרְתָּ֣ אֹתָ֔ם וְהֵנַפְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם תְּנוּפָֽה׃
transliteration: v'acharey-khen yavov hal'viyim la'avod et-ohel mvo'ed v'tihar'ta otam v'henaf'ta otam t'nvfah
translation: Thereafter the Levites shall be qualified for the service of the Tent of Meeting, once you have cleansed them and designated them as an elevation offering.

hebrew: כִּי֩ נְתֻנִ֨ים נְתֻנִ֥ים הֵ֙מָּה֙ לִ֔י מִתּ֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל תַּחַת֩ פִּטְרַ֨ת כָּל־רֶ֜חֶם בְּכ֥וֹר כֹּל֙ מִבְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לָקַ֥חְתִּי אֹתָ֖ם לִֽי׃
transliteration: kiy n'tuniym n'tuniym hemah liy mitvokh' b'ney yis'rael tachat pit'rat kal-rechem b'khvor kol mib'ney yis'rael lakach'tiy otam liy
translation: For they are formally assigned to Me from among the Israelites: I have taken them for Myself in place of all the first issue of the womb, of all the first-born of the Israelites.

hebrew: כִּ֣י לִ֤י כָל־בְּכוֹר֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָ֑ה בְּי֗וֹם הַכֹּתִ֤י כָל־בְּכוֹר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם הִקְדַּ֥שְׁתִּי אֹתָ֖ם לִֽי׃
transliteration: kiy liy khal-b'khvor biv'ney yis'rael baadam vvab'hemah b'yvom hakotiy khal-b'khvor b'eretz mitz'rayim hik'dash'tiy otam liy
translation: For every first-born among the Israelites, man as well as beast, is Mine; I consecrated them to Myself at the time that I smote every first-born in the land of Egypt.

hebrew: וָאֶקַּח֙ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם תַּ֥חַת כָּל־בְּכ֖וֹר בִּבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vaekach et-hal'viyim tachat kal-b'khvor biv'ney yis'rael
translation: Now I take the Levites instead of every first-born of the Israelites;

hebrew: וָאֶתְּנָ֨ה אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֜ם נְתֻנִ֣ים ׀ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן וּלְבָנָ֗יו מִתּוֹךְ֮ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ לַעֲבֹ֞ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וּלְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹ֨א יִהְיֶ֜ה בִּבְנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ נֶ֔גֶף בְּגֶ֥שֶׁת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: vaet'nah et-hal'viyim n'tuniym  l'aharon vl'vanayv mitvokh' b'ney yis'rael la'avod et-'avodat b'ney-yis'rael b'ohel mvo'ed vl'khaper 'al-b'ney yis'rael v'lo yih'yeh biv'ney yis'rael negef b'geshet b'ney-yis'rael el-hakodesh
translation: and from among the Israelites I formally assign the Levites to Aaron and his sons, to perform the service for the Israelites in the Tent of Meeting and to make expiation for the Israelites, so that no plague may afflict the Israelites cLit. “when the Israelites come.”for coming-c too near the sanctuary.

hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֧ה וְאַהֲרֹ֛ן וְכָל־עֲדַ֥ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לַלְוִיִּ֑ם כְּ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֨ה יְהוָ֤ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁה֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם כֵּן־עָשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vaya'as mosheh v'aharon v'khal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael lal'viyim k'khol asher-tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh lal'viyim ken-'asv lahem b'ney yis'rael
translation: Moses, Aaron, and the whole Israelite community did with the Levites accordingly; just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses in regard to the Levites, so the Israelites did with them.

hebrew: וַיִּֽתְחַטְּא֣וּ הַלְוִיִּ֗ם וַֽיְכַבְּסוּ֙ בִּגְדֵיהֶ֔ם וַיָּ֨נֶף אַהֲרֹ֥ן אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וַיְכַפֵּ֧ר עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם אַהֲרֹ֖ן לְטַהֲרָֽם׃
transliteration: vayit'chat'v hal'viyim vay'khab'sv big'deyhem vayanef aharon otam t'nvfah lif'ney y'hvah vay'khaper 'aleyhem aharon l'taharam
translation: The Levites purified themselves and washed their clothes; and Aaron designated them as an elevation offering before the L<small>ORD</small>, and Aaron made expiation for them to cleanse them.

hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֞ן בָּ֣אוּ הַלְוִיִּ֗ם לַעֲבֹ֤ד אֶת־עֲבֹֽדָתָם֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד לִפְנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְלִפְנֵ֣י בָנָ֑יו כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ צִוָּ֨ה יְהוָ֤ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁה֙ עַל־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם כֵּ֖ן עָשׂ֥וּ לָהֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'acharey-khen bav hal'viyim la'avod et-'avodatam b'ohel mvo'ed lif'ney aharon v'lif'ney vanayv kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh 'al-hal'viyim ken 'asv lahem (s)
translation: Thereafter the Levites were qualified to perform their service in the Tent of Meeting, under Aaron and his sons. As the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses in regard to the Levites, so they did to them.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: זֹ֖את אֲשֶׁ֣ר לַלְוִיִּ֑ם מִבֶּן֩ חָמֵ֨שׁ וְעֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה יָבוֹא֙ לִצְבֹ֣א צָבָ֔א בַּעֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: zot asher lal'viyim miben chamesh v'es'riym shanah vama'lah yavvo litz'vo tzava ba'avodat ohel mvo'ed
translation: This is the rule for the Levites. From twenty-five years of age up they shall participate in the work force in the service of the Tent of Meeting;

hebrew: וּמִבֶּן֙ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה יָשׁ֖וּב מִצְּבָ֣א הָעֲבֹדָ֑ה וְלֹ֥א יַעֲבֹ֖ד עֽוֹד׃
transliteration: vmiben chamishiym shanah yashvv mitz'va ha'avodah v'lo ya'avod 'vod
translation: but at the age of fifty they shall retire from the work force and shall serve no more.

hebrew: וְשֵׁרֵ֨ת אֶת־אֶחָ֜יו בְּאֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ לִשְׁמֹ֣ר מִשְׁמֶ֔רֶת וַעֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֣א יַעֲבֹ֑ד כָּ֛כָה תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לַלְוִיִּ֖ם בְּמִשְׁמְרֹתָֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'sheret et-echayv b'ohel mvo'ed lish'mor mish'meret va'avodah lo ya'avod kakhah ta'aseh lal'viyim b'mish'm'rotam (f)
translation: They may assist their brother Levites at the Tent of Meeting by standing guard, but they shall perform no labor. Thus you shall deal with the Levites in regard to their duties.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָ֣ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה בְמִדְבַּר־סִ֠ינַי בַּשָּׁנָ֨ה הַשֵּׁנִ֜ית לְצֵאתָ֨ם מֵאֶ֧רֶץ מִצְרַ֛יִם בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh v'mid'bar-siynay bashanah hasheniyt l'tzetam meeretz mitz'rayim bachodesh harishvon lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, on the first new moon of the second year following the exodus from the land of Egypt, saying:

hebrew: וְיַעֲשׂ֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־הַפָּ֖סַח בְּמוֹעֲדֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'ya'asv v'ney-yis'rael et-hapasach b'mvo'advo
translation: Let the Israelite people offer the passover sacrifice at its set time:

hebrew: בְּאַרְבָּעָ֣ה עָשָֽׂר־י֠וֹם בַּחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֜ה בֵּ֧ין הָֽעֲרְבַּ֛יִם תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ בְּמוֹעֲד֑וֹ כְּכָל־חֻקֹּתָ֥יו וּכְכָל־מִשְׁפָּטָ֖יו תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: b'ar'ba'ah 'asar-yvom bachodesh hazeh beyn ha'ar'bayim ta'asv otvo b'mvo'advo k'khal-chukotayv vkh'khal-mish'patayv ta'asv otvo
translation: you shall offer it on the fourteenth day of this month, at twilight, at its set time; you shall offer it in accordance with all its rules and rites.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת הַפָּֽסַח׃
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh el-b'ney yis'rael la'asot hapasach
translation: Moses instructed the Israelites to offer the passover sacrifice;

hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֣וּ אֶת־הַפֶּ֡סַח בָּרִאשׁ֡וֹן בְּאַרְבָּעָה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר י֥וֹם לַחֹ֛דֶשׁ בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבַּ֖יִם בְּמִדְבַּ֣ר סִינָ֑י כְּ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֤ה יְהוָה֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֵּ֥ן עָשׂ֖וּ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vaya'asv et-hapesach barishvon b'ar'ba'ah 'asar yvom lachodesh beyn ha'ar'bayim b'mid'bar siynay k'khol asher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh ken 'asv b'ney yis'rael
translation: and they offered the passover sacrifice in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, in the wilderness of Sinai. Just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses, so the Israelites did.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י אֲנָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָי֤וּ טְמֵאִים֙ לְנֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֔ם וְלֹא־יָכְל֥וּ לַעֲשֹׂת־הַפֶּ֖סַח בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַֽיִּקְרְב֞וּ לִפְנֵ֥י מֹשֶׁ֛ה וְלִפְנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹ֖ן בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
transliteration: vay'hiy anashiym asher hayv t'meiym l'nefesh adam v'lo-yakh'lv la'asot-hapesach bayvom hahv vayik'r'vv lif'ney mosheh v'lif'ney aharon bayvom hahv
translation: But there were some men who were unclean by reason of a corpse and could not offer the passover sacrifice on that day. Appearing that same day before Moses and Aaron,

hebrew: וַ֠יֹּאמְרוּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֤ים הָהֵ֙מָּה֙ אֵלָ֔יו אֲנַ֥חְנוּ טְמֵאִ֖ים לְנֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֑ם לָ֣מָּה נִגָּרַ֗ע לְבִלְתִּ֨י הַקְרִ֜ב אֶת־קָרְבַּ֤ן יְהוָה֙ בְּמֹ֣עֲד֔וֹ בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayom'rv haanashiym hahemah elayv anach'nv t'meiym l'nefesh adam lamah nigara' l'vil'tiy hak'riv et-kar'ban y'hvah b'mo'advo b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael
translation: those men said to them,aLit. “him.” “Unclean though we are by reason of a corpse, why must we be debarred from presenting the LORD’s offering at its set time with the rest of the Israelites?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֖ם מֹשֶׁ֑ה עִמְד֣וּ וְאֶשְׁמְעָ֔ה מַה־יְצַוֶּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה לָכֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayomer alehem mosheh 'im'dv v'esh'm'ah mah-y'tzaveh y'hvah lakhem (f)
translation: Moses said to them, “Stand by, and let me hear what instructions the L<small>ORD</small> gives about you.”

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֛ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר אִ֣ישׁ אִ֣ישׁ כִּי־יִהְיֶֽה־טָמֵ֣א ׀ לָנֶ֡פֶשׁ אוֹ֩ בְדֶ֨רֶךְ רְחֹקָ֜הׄ לָכֶ֗ם א֚וֹ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְעָ֥שָׂה פֶ֖סַח לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael lemor iysh iysh kiy-yih'yeh-tame  lanefesh vo v'derekh' r'chokah lakhem vo l'doroteykhem v'asah fesach layhvah
translation: Speak to the Israelite people, saying: When any of you or of your posterity who are defiled by a corpse or are on a long journey would offer a passover sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small>,

hebrew: בַּחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֜י בְּאַרְבָּעָ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר י֛וֹם בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבַּ֖יִם יַעֲשׂ֣וּ אֹת֑וֹ עַל־מַצּ֥וֹת וּמְרֹרִ֖ים יֹאכְלֻֽהוּ׃
transliteration: bachodesh hasheniy b'ar'ba'ah 'asar yvom beyn ha'ar'bayim ya'asv otvo 'al-matzvot vm'roriym yokh'luhv
translation: they shall offer it in the second month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight. They shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs,

hebrew: לֹֽא־יַשְׁאִ֤ירוּ מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ עַד־בֹּ֔קֶר וְעֶ֖צֶם לֹ֣א יִשְׁבְּרוּ־ב֑וֹ כְּכָל־חֻקַּ֥ת הַפֶּ֖סַח יַעֲשׂ֥וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: lo-yash'iyrv mimenv 'ad-boker v'etzem lo yish'b'rv-vvo k'khal-chukat hapesach ya'asv otvo
translation: and they shall not leave any of it over until morning. They shall not break a bone of it. They shall offer it in strict accord with the law of the passover sacrifice.

hebrew: וְהָאִישׁ֩ אֲשֶׁר־ה֨וּא טָה֜וֹר וּבְדֶ֣רֶךְ לֹא־הָיָ֗ה וְחָדַל֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת הַפֶּ֔סַח וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵֽעַמֶּ֑יהָ כִּ֣י ׀ קָרְבַּ֣ן יְהוָ֗ה לֹ֤א הִקְרִיב֙ בְּמֹ֣עֲד֔וֹ חֶטְא֥וֹ יִשָּׂ֖א הָאִ֥ישׁ הַהֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'haiysh asher-hv tahvor vv'derekh' lo-hayah v'chadal la'asvot hapesach v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv me'ameyha kiy  kar'ban y'hvah lo hik'riyv b'mo'advo chet'vo yisa haiysh hahv
translation: But if a man who is clean and not on a journey refrains from offering the passover sacrifice, that person shall be cut off from his kin, for he did not present the L<small>ORD</small>’s offering at its set time; that man shall bear his guilt.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָג֨וּר אִתְּכֶ֜ם גֵּ֗ר וְעָ֤שָֽׂה פֶ֙סַח֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה כְּחֻקַּ֥ת הַפֶּ֛סַח וּכְמִשְׁפָּט֖וֹ כֵּ֣ן יַעֲשֶׂ֑ה חֻקָּ֤ה אַחַת֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם וְלַגֵּ֖ר וּלְאֶזְרַ֥ח הָאָֽרֶץ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'khiy-yagvr it'khem ger v'asah fesach layhvah k'chukat hapesach vkh'mish'patvo ken ya'aseh chukah achat yih'yeh lakhem v'lager vl'ez'rach haaretz (f)
translation: And when a stranger who resides with you would offer a passover sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small>, he must offer it in accordance with the rules and rites of the passover sacrifice. There shall be one law for you, whether stranger or citizen of the country.

hebrew: וּבְיוֹם֙ הָקִ֣ים אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן כִּסָּ֤ה הֶֽעָנָן֙ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן לְאֹ֖הֶל הָעֵדֻ֑ת וּבָעֶ֜רֶב יִהְיֶ֧ה עַֽל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן כְּמַרְאֵה־אֵ֖שׁ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
transliteration: vv'yvom hakiym et-hamish'kan kisah he'anan et-hamish'kan l'ohel ha'edut vva'erev yih'yeh 'al-hamish'kan k'mar'eh-esh 'ad-boker
translation: On the day that the Tabernacle was set up, the cloud covered the Tabernacle, the Tent of the Pact; and in the evening it rested over the Tabernacle in the likeness of fire until morning.

hebrew: כֵּ֚ן יִהְיֶ֣ה תָמִ֔יד הֶעָנָ֖ן יְכַסֶּ֑נּוּ וּמַרְאֵה־אֵ֖שׁ לָֽיְלָה׃
transliteration: ken yih'yeh tamiyd he'anan y'khasenv vmar'eh-esh lay'lah
translation: It was always so: the cloud covered it, appearing as fire by night.

hebrew: וּלְפִ֞י הֵעָלֹ֤ת הֶֽעָנָן֙ מֵעַ֣ל הָאֹ֔הֶל וְאַ֣חֲרֵי־כֵ֔ן יִסְע֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּבִמְק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁכָּן־שָׁם֙ הֶֽעָנָ֔ן שָׁ֥ם יַחֲנ֖וּ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vl'fiy he'alot he'anan me'al haohel v'acharey-khen yis'v b'ney yis'rael vvim'kvom asher yish'kan-sham he'anan sham yachanv b'ney yis'rael
translation: And whenever the cloud lifted from the Tent, the Israelites would set out accordingly; and at the spot where the cloud settled, there the Israelites would make camp.

hebrew: עַל־פִּ֣י יְהוָ֗ה יִסְעוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְעַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה יַחֲנ֑וּ כָּל־יְמֵ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁכֹּ֧ן הֶעָנָ֛ן עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יַחֲנֽוּ׃
transliteration: 'al-piy y'hvah yis'v b'ney yis'rael v'al-piy y'hvah yachanv kal-y'mey asher yish'kon he'anan 'al-hamish'kan yachanv
translation: At a command of the L<small>ORD</small> the Israelites broke camp, and at a command of the L<small>ORD</small> they made camp: they remained encamped as long as the cloud stayed over the Tabernacle.

hebrew: וּבְהַאֲרִ֧יךְ הֶֽעָנָ֛ן עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וְשָׁמְר֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת יְהוָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א יִסָּֽעוּ׃
transliteration: vv'haariykh' he'anan 'al-hamish'kan yamiym rabiym v'sham'rv v'ney-yis'rael et-mish'meret y'hvah v'lo yisa'v
translation: When the cloud lingered over the Tabernacle many days, the Israelites observed the L<small>ORD</small>’s mandate and did not journey on.

hebrew: וְיֵ֞שׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֧ה הֶֽעָנָ֛ן יָמִ֥ים מִסְפָּ֖ר עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עַל־פִּ֤י יְהוָה֙ יַחֲנ֔וּ וְעַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה יִסָּֽעוּ׃
transliteration: v'yesh asher yih'yeh he'anan yamiym mis'par 'al-hamish'kan 'al-piy y'hvah yachanv v'al-piy y'hvah yisa'v
translation: At such times as the cloud rested over the Tabernacle for but a few days, they remained encamped at a command of the L<small>ORD</small>, and broke camp at a command of the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְיֵ֞שׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִהְיֶ֤ה הֶֽעָנָן֙ מֵעֶ֣רֶב עַד־בֹּ֔קֶר וְנַעֲלָ֧ה הֶֽעָנָ֛ן בַּבֹּ֖קֶר וְנָסָ֑עוּ א֚וֹ יוֹמָ֣ם וָלַ֔יְלָה וְנַעֲלָ֥ה הֶעָנָ֖ן וְנָסָֽעוּ׃
transliteration: v'yesh asher-yih'yeh he'anan me'erev 'ad-boker v'na'alah he'anan baboker v'nasa'v vo yvomam valay'lah v'na'alah he'anan v'nasa'v
translation: And at such times as the cloud stayed from evening until morning, they broke camp as soon as the cloud lifted in the morning. Day or night, whenever the cloud lifted, they would break camp.

hebrew: אֽוֹ־יֹמַ֜יִם אוֹ־חֹ֣דֶשׁ אוֹ־יָמִ֗ים בְּהַאֲרִ֨יךְ הֶעָנָ֤ן עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ לִשְׁכֹּ֣ן עָלָ֔יו יַחֲנ֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְלֹ֣א יִסָּ֑עוּ וּבְהֵעָלֹת֖וֹ יִסָּֽעוּ׃
transliteration: vo-yomayim vo-chodesh vo-yamiym b'haariykh' he'anan 'al-hamish'kan lish'kon 'alayv yachanv v'ney-yis'rael v'lo yisa'v vv'he'alotvo yisa'v
translation: Whether it was two days or a month or a year—however long the cloud lingered over the Tabernacle—the Israelites remained encamped and did not set out; only when it lifted did they break camp.

hebrew: עַל־פִּ֤י יְהוָה֙ יַחֲנ֔וּ וְעַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה יִסָּ֑עוּ אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֤רֶת יְהוָה֙ שָׁמָ֔רוּ עַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: 'al-piy y'hvah yachanv v'al-piy y'hvah yisa'v et-mish'meret y'hvah shamarv 'al-piy y'hvah b'yad-mosheh (f)
translation: On a sign from the L<small>ORD</small> they made camp and on a sign from the L<small>ORD</small> they broke camp; they observed the L<small>ORD</small>’s mandate at the L<small>ORD</small>’s bidding through Moses.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: עֲשֵׂ֣ה לְךָ֗ שְׁתֵּי֙ חֲצֽוֹצְרֹ֣ת כֶּ֔סֶף מִקְשָׁ֖ה תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹתָ֑ם וְהָי֤וּ לְךָ֙ לְמִקְרָ֣א הָֽעֵדָ֔ה וּלְמַסַּ֖ע אֶת־הַֽמַּחֲנֽוֹת׃
transliteration: 'aseh l'kha sh'tey chatzvotz'rot kesef mik'shah ta'aseh otam v'hayv l'kha l'mik'ra ha'edah vl'masa' et-hamachanvot
translation: Have two silver trumpets made; make them of hammered work. They shall serve you to summon the community and to set the divisions in motion.

hebrew: וְתָקְע֖וּ בָּהֵ֑ן וְנֽוֹעֲד֤וּ אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ כָּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'tak'v bahen v'nvo'adv eleykha kal-ha'edah el-petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: When both are blown in long blasts,aMeaning of Heb. uncertain. the whole community shall assemble before you at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;

hebrew: וְאִם־בְּאַחַ֖ת יִתְקָ֑עוּ וְנוֹעֲד֤וּ אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ הַנְּשִׂיאִ֔ים רָאשֵׁ֖י אַלְפֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'im-b'achat yit'ka'v v'nvo'adv eleykha han'siyiym rashey al'fey yis'rael
translation: and if only one is blown, the chieftains, heads of Israel’s contingents, shall assemble before you.

hebrew: וּתְקַעְתֶּ֖ם תְּרוּעָ֑ה וְנָֽסְעוּ֙ הַֽמַּחֲנ֔וֹת הַחֹנִ֖ים קֵֽדְמָה׃
transliteration: vt'ka'tem t'rv'ah v'nas'v hamachanvot hachoniym ked'mah
translation: But when you sound short blasts,aMeaning of Heb. uncertain. the divisions encamped on the east shall move forward;

hebrew: וּתְקַעְתֶּ֤ם תְּרוּעָה֙ שֵׁנִ֔ית וְנָֽסְעוּ֙ הַֽמַּחֲנ֔וֹת הַחֹנִ֖ים תֵּימָ֑נָה תְּרוּעָ֥ה יִתְקְע֖וּ לְמַסְעֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vt'ka'tem t'rv'ah sheniyt v'nas'v hamachanvot hachoniym teymanah t'rv'ah yit'k'v l'mas'eyhem
translation: and when you sound short blasts a second time, those encamped on the south shall move forward. Thus short blasts shall be blown for setting them in motion,

hebrew: וּבְהַקְהִ֖יל אֶת־הַקָּהָ֑ל תִּתְקְע֖וּ וְלֹ֥א תָרִֽיעוּ׃
transliteration: vv'hak'hiyl et-hakahal tit'k'v v'lo tariy'v
translation: while to convoke the congregation you shall blow long blasts, not short ones.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֤י אַהֲרֹן֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים יִתְקְע֖וּ בַּֽחֲצֹצְר֑וֹת וְהָי֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם לְחֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vv'ney aharon hakohaniym yit'k'v bachatzotz'rvot v'hayv lakhem l'chukat 'volam l'doroteykhem
translation: The trumpets shall be blown by Aaron’s sons, the priests; they shall be for you an institution for all time throughout the ages.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־תָבֹ֨אוּ מִלְחָמָ֜ה בְּאַרְצְכֶ֗ם עַל־הַצַּר֙ הַצֹּרֵ֣ר אֶתְכֶ֔ם וַהֲרֵעֹתֶ֖ם בַּחֲצֹצְר֑וֹת וֲנִזְכַּרְתֶּ֗ם לִפְנֵי֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם וְנוֹשַׁעְתֶּ֖ם מֵאֹיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'khiy-tavov mil'chamah b'ar'tz'khem 'al-hatzar hatzorer et'khem vahare'otem bachatzotz'rvot vaniz'kar'tem lif'ney y'hvah eloheykhem v'nvosha'tem meoy'veykhem
translation: aMeaning of Heb. uncertain. When you are at war-a in your land against an aggressor who attacks you, you shall sound short blasts on the trumpets, that you may be remembered before the LORD your God and be delivered from your enemies.

hebrew: וּבְי֨וֹם שִׂמְחַתְכֶ֥ם וּֽבְמוֹעֲדֵיכֶם֮ וּבְרָאשֵׁ֣י חָדְשֵׁיכֶם֒ וּתְקַעְתֶּ֣ם בַּחֲצֹֽצְרֹ֗ת עַ֚ל עֹלֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְעַ֖ל זִבְחֵ֣י שַׁלְמֵיכֶ֑ם וְהָי֨וּ לָכֶ֤ם לְזִכָּרוֹן֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vv'yvom sim'chat'khem vv'mvo'adeykhem vv'rashey chad'sheykhem vt'ka'tem bachatzotz'rot 'al 'oloteykhem v'al ziv'chey shal'meykhem v'hayv lakhem l'zikarvon lif'ney eloheykhem aniy y'hvah eloheykhem (f)
translation: And on your joyous occasions—your fixed festivals and new moon days—you shall sound the trumpets over your burnt offerings and your sacrifices of well-being. They shall be a reminder of you before your God: I, the L<small>ORD</small>, am your God.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י בַּשָּׁנָ֧ה הַשֵּׁנִ֛ית בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֖י בְּעֶשְׂרִ֣ים בַּחֹ֑דֶשׁ נַעֲלָה֙ הֶֽעָנָ֔ן מֵעַ֖ל מִשְׁכַּ֥ן הָעֵדֻֽת׃
transliteration: vay'hiy bashanah hasheniyt bachodesh hasheniy b'es'riym bachodesh na'alah he'anan me'al mish'kan ha'edut
translation: In the second year, on the twentieth day of the second month, the cloud lifted from the Tabernacle of the Pact

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל לְמַסְעֵיהֶ֖ם מִמִּדְבַּ֣ר סִינָ֑י וַיִּשְׁכֹּ֥ן הֶעָנָ֖ן בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר פָּארָֽן׃
transliteration: vayis'v v'ney-yis'rael l'mas'eyhem mimid'bar siynay vayish'kon he'anan b'mid'bar paran
translation: and the Israelites set out on their journeys from the wilderness of Sinai. The cloud came to rest in the wilderness of Paran.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ בָּרִאשֹׁנָ֑ה עַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayis'v barishonah 'al-piy y'hvah b'yad-mosheh
translation: When the march was to begin, at the L<small>ORD</small>’s command through Moses,

hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֞ע דֶּ֣גֶל מַחֲנֵ֧ה בְנֵֽי־יְהוּדָ֛ה בָּרִאשֹׁנָ֖ה לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְעַל־צְבָא֔וֹ נַחְשׁ֖וֹן בֶּן־עַמִּינָדָֽב׃
transliteration: vayisa' degel machaneh v'ney-y'hvdah barishonah l'tziv'otam v'al-tz'vavo nach'shvon ben-'amiynadav
translation: the first standard to set out, troop by troop, was the division of Judah. In command of its troops was Nahshon son of Amminadab;

hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י יִשָׂשכָ֑ר נְתַנְאֵ֖ל בֶּן־צוּעָֽר׃
transliteration: v'al-tz'va mateh b'ney yisashkhar n'tan'el ben-tzv'ar
translation: in command of the tribal troop of Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar;

hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י זְבוּלֻ֑ן אֱלִיאָ֖ב בֶּן־חֵלֽוֹן׃
transliteration: v'al-tz'va mateh b'ney z'vvlun eliyav ben-chelvon
translation: and in command of the tribal troop of Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon.

hebrew: וְהוּרַ֖ד הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן וְנָסְע֤וּ בְנֵֽי־גֵרְשׁוֹן֙ וּבְנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֔י נֹשְׂאֵ֖י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hvrad hamish'kan v'nas'v v'ney-ger'shvon vv'ney m'rariy nos'ey hamish'kan (s)
translation: Then the Tabernacle would be taken apart; and the Gershonites and the Merarites, who carried the Tabernacle, would set out.

hebrew: וְנָסַ֗ע דֶּ֛גֶל מַחֲנֵ֥ה רְאוּבֵ֖ן לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְעַל־צְבָא֔וֹ אֱלִיצ֖וּר בֶּן־שְׁדֵיאֽוּר׃
transliteration: v'nasa' degel machaneh r'vven l'tziv'otam v'al-tz'vavo eliytzvr ben-sh'deyvr
translation: The next standard to set out, troop by troop, was the division of Reuben. In command of its troop was Elizur son of Shedeur;

hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֑וֹן שְׁלֻֽמִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־צוּרִֽי שַׁדָּֽי׃
transliteration: v'al-tz'va mateh b'ney shim'von sh'lumiyel ben-tzvriy shaday
translation: in command of the tribal troop of Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;

hebrew: וְעַל־צְבָ֖א מַטֵּ֣ה בְנֵי־גָ֑ד אֶלְיָסָ֖ף בֶּן־דְּעוּאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'al-tz'va mateh v'ney-gad el'yasaf ben-d'vel
translation: and in command of the tribal troop of Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel.

hebrew: וְנָסְעוּ֙ הַקְּהָתִ֔ים נֹשְׂאֵ֖י הַמִּקְדָּ֑שׁ וְהֵקִ֥ימוּ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן עַד־בֹּאָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'nas'v hak'hatiym nos'ey hamik'dash v'hekiymv et-hamish'kan 'ad-boam (s)
translation: Then the Kohathites, who carried the sacred objects, would set out; and by the time they arrived, the Tabernacle would be set up again.

hebrew: וְנָסַ֗ע דֶּ֛גֶל מַחֲנֵ֥ה בְנֵֽי־אֶפְרַ֖יִם לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְעַל־צְבָא֔וֹ אֱלִישָׁמָ֖ע בֶּן־עַמִּיהֽוּד׃
transliteration: v'nasa' degel machaneh v'ney-ef'rayim l'tziv'otam v'al-tz'vavo eliyshama' ben-'amiyhvd
translation: The next standard to set out, troop by troop, was the division of Ephraim. In command of its troop was Elishama son of Ammihud;

hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה גַּמְלִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־פְּדָה־צֽוּר׃
transliteration: v'al-tz'va mateh b'ney m'nasheh gam'liyel ben-p'dah-tzvr
translation: in command of the tribal troop of Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur;

hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ן אֲבִידָ֖ן בֶּן־גִּדְעוֹנִֽי׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'al-tz'va mateh b'ney vin'yamin aviydan ben-gid'voniy (s)
translation: and in command of the tribal troop of Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni.

hebrew: וְנָסַ֗ע דֶּ֚גֶל מַחֲנֵ֣ה בְנֵי־דָ֔ן מְאַסֵּ֥ף לְכָל־הַֽמַּחֲנֹ֖ת לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְעַל־צְבָא֔וֹ אֲחִיעֶ֖זֶר בֶּן־עַמִּישַׁדָּֽי׃
transliteration: v'nasa' degel machaneh v'ney-dan m'asef l'khal-hamachanot l'tziv'otam v'al-tz'vavo achiy'ezer ben-'amiyshaday
translation: Then, as the rear guard of all the divisions, the standard of the division of Dan would set out, troop by troop. In command of its troop was Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;

hebrew: וְעַל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י אָשֵׁ֑ר פַּגְעִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־עָכְרָֽן׃
transliteration: v'al-tz'va mateh b'ney asher pag'iyel ben-'akh'ran
translation: in command of the tribal troop of Asher, Pagiel son of Ochran;

hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י נַפְתָּלִ֑י אֲחִירַ֖ע בֶּן־עֵינָֽן׃
transliteration: v'al-tz'va mateh b'ney naf'taliy achiyra' ben-'eynan
translation: and in command of the tribal troop of Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.

hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מַסְעֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וַיִּסָּֽעוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh mas'ey v'ney-yis'rael l'tziv'otam vayisa'v (s)
translation: Such was the order of march of the Israelites, as they marched troop by troop.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה לְ֠חֹבָב בֶּן־רְעוּאֵ֣ל הַמִּדְיָנִי֮ חֹתֵ֣ן מֹשֶׁה֒ נֹסְעִ֣ים ׀ אֲנַ֗חְנוּ אֶל־הַמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה אֹת֖וֹ אֶתֵּ֣ן לָכֶ֑ם לְכָ֤ה אִתָּ֙נוּ֙ וְהֵטַ֣בְנוּ לָ֔ךְ כִּֽי־יְהוָ֥ה דִּבֶּר־ט֖וֹב עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh l'chovav ben-r'vel hamid'yaniy choten mosheh nos'iym  anach'nv el-hamakvom asher amar y'hvah otvo eten lakhem l'khah itanv v'hetav'nv lakh' kiy-y'hvah diber-tvov 'al-yis'rael
translation: Moses said to Hobab son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are setting out for the place of which the L<small>ORD</small> has said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us and we will be generous with you; for the L<small>ORD</small> has promised to be generous to Israel.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו לֹ֣א אֵלֵ֑ךְ כִּ֧י אִם־אֶל־אַרְצִ֛י וְאֶל־מוֹלַדְתִּ֖י אֵלֵֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv lo elekh' kiy im-el-ar'tziy v'el-mvolad'tiy elekh'
translation: “I will not go,” he replied to him, “but will return to my native land.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אַל־נָ֖א תַּעֲזֹ֣ב אֹתָ֑נוּ כִּ֣י ׀ עַל־כֵּ֣ן יָדַ֗עְתָּ חֲנֹתֵ֙נוּ֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר וְהָיִ֥יתָ לָּ֖נוּ לְעֵינָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayomer al-na ta'azov otanv kiy  'al-ken yada'ta chanotenv bamid'bar v'hayiyta lanv l'eynayim
translation: He said, “Please do not leave us, inasmuch as you know where we should camp in the wilderness and can be our guide.bLit. “eyes.”

hebrew: וְהָיָ֖ה כִּי־תֵלֵ֣ךְ עִמָּ֑נוּ וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ הַטּ֣וֹב הַה֗וּא אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֵיטִ֧יב יְהוָ֛ה עִמָּ֖נוּ וְהֵטַ֥בְנוּ לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy-telekh' 'imanv v'hayah  hatvov hahv asher yeytiyv y'hvah 'imanv v'hetav'nv lakh'
translation: So if you come with us, we will extend to you the same bounty that the L<small>ORD</small> grants us.”

hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מֵהַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה דֶּ֖רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים וַאֲר֨וֹן בְּרִית־יְהוָ֜ה נֹסֵ֣עַ לִפְנֵיהֶ֗ם דֶּ֚רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים לָת֥וּר לָהֶ֖ם מְנוּחָֽה׃
transliteration: vayis'v mehar y'hvah derekh' sh'loshet yamiym vaarvon b'riyt-y'hvah nose'a lif'neyhem derekh' sh'loshet yamiym latvr lahem m'nvchah
translation: They marched from the mountain of the L<small>ORD</small> a distance of three days. The Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small> traveled in front of them on that three days’ journey to seek out a resting place for them;

hebrew: וַעֲנַ֧ן יְהוָ֛ה עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם יוֹמָ֑ם בְּנָסְעָ֖ם מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃ (׆) (ס)
transliteration: va'anan y'hvah 'aleyhem yvomam b'nas'am min-hamachaneh () (s)
translation: and the L<small>ORD</small>’s cloud kept above them by day, as they moved on from camp.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י בִּנְסֹ֥עַ הָאָרֹ֖ן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֑ה קוּמָ֣ה ׀ יְהוָ֗ה וְיָפֻ֙צוּ֙ אֹֽיְבֶ֔יךָ וְיָנֻ֥סוּ מְשַׂנְאֶ֖יךָ מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vay'hiy bin'so'a haaron vayomer mosheh kvmah  y'hvah v'yafutzv oy'veykha v'yanusv m'san'eykha mipaneykha
translation:
When the Ark was to set out, Moses would say:
Advance, O LORD!
May Your enemies be scattered,
And may Your foes flee before You!

hebrew: וּבְנֻחֹ֖ה יֹאמַ֑ר שׁוּבָ֣ה יְהוָ֔ה רִֽבְב֖וֹת אַלְפֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (׆) (ס)
transliteration: vv'nuchoh yomar shvvah y'hvah riv'vvot al'fey yis'rael () (s)
translation:
And when it halted, he would say:
cOthers “Return, O Lord, unto theReturn, O LORD,
You who are Israel’s myriads of thousands!-c

hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י הָעָם֙ כְּמִתְאֹ֣נְנִ֔ים רַ֖ע בְּאָזְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע יְהוָה֙ וַיִּ֣חַר אַפּ֔וֹ וַתִּבְעַר־בָּם֙ אֵ֣שׁ יְהוָ֔ה וַתֹּ֖אכַל בִּקְצֵ֥ה הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy ha'am k'mit'on'niym ra' b'az'ney y'hvah vayish'ma' y'hvah vayichar apvo vativ'ar-bam esh y'hvah vatokhal bik'tzeh hamachaneh
translation: The people took to complaining bitterly before the L<small>ORD</small>. The L<small>ORD</small> heard and was incensed: a fire of the L<small>ORD</small> broke out against them, ravaging the outskirts of the camp.

hebrew: וַיִּצְעַ֥ק הָעָ֖ם אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֤ל מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה וַתִּשְׁקַ֖ע הָאֵֽשׁ׃
transliteration: vayitz'ak ha'am el-mosheh vayit'palel mosheh el-y'hvah vatish'ka' haesh
translation: The people cried out to Moses. Moses prayed to the L<small>ORD</small>, and the fire died down.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֛א שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא תַּבְעֵרָ֑ה כִּֽי־בָעֲרָ֥ה בָ֖ם אֵ֥שׁ יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayik'ra shem-hamakvom hahv tav'erah kiy-va'arah vam esh y'hvah
translation: That place was named Taberah,aFrom root b‘r, “to burn.” because a fire of the LORD had broken out against them.

hebrew: וְהָֽאסַפְסֻף֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּקִרְבּ֔וֹ הִתְאַוּ֖וּ תַּאֲוָ֑ה וַיָּשֻׁ֣בוּ וַיִּבְכּ֗וּ גַּ֚ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מִ֥י יַאֲכִלֵ֖נוּ בָּשָֽׂר׃
transliteration: v'hasaf'suf asher b'kir'bvo hit'avv taavah vayashuvv vayiv'kv gam b'ney yis'rael vayom'rv miy yaakhilenv basar
translation: The riffraff in their midst felt a gluttonous craving; and then the Israelites wept and said, “If only we had meat to eat!

hebrew: זָכַ֙רְנוּ֙ אֶת־הַדָּגָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נֹאכַ֥ל בְּמִצְרַ֖יִם חִנָּ֑ם אֵ֣ת הַקִּשֻּׁאִ֗ים וְאֵת֙ הָֽאֲבַטִּחִ֔ים וְאֶת־הֶחָצִ֥יר וְאֶת־הַבְּצָלִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַשּׁוּמִֽים׃
transliteration: zakhar'nv et-hadagah asher-nokhal b'mitz'rayim chinam et hakishuiym v'et haavatichiym v'et-hechatziyr v'et-hab'tzaliym v'et-hashvmiym
translation: We remember the fish that we used to eat free in Egypt, the cucumbers, the melons, the leeks, the onions, and the garlic.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֛ה נַפְשֵׁ֥נוּ יְבֵשָׁ֖ה אֵ֣ין כֹּ֑ל בִּלְתִּ֖י אֶל־הַמָּ֥ן עֵינֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: v'atah naf'shenv y'veshah eyn kol bil'tiy el-haman 'eyneynv
translation: Now our gullets are shriveled. There is nothing at all! Nothing but this manna to look to!”

hebrew: וְהַמָּ֕ן כִּזְרַע־גַּ֖ד ה֑וּא וְעֵינ֖וֹ כְּעֵ֥ין הַבְּדֹֽלַח׃
transliteration: v'haman kiz'ra'-gad hv v'eynvo k'eyn hab'dolach
translation: Now the manna was like coriander seed, and in color it was like bdellium.

hebrew: שָׁטוּ֩ הָעָ֨ם וְלָֽקְט֜וּ וְטָחֲנ֣וּ בָרֵחַ֗יִם א֤וֹ דָכוּ֙ בַּמְּדֹכָ֔ה וּבִשְּׁלוּ֙ בַּפָּר֔וּר וְעָשׂ֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ עֻג֑וֹת וְהָיָ֣ה טַעְמ֔וֹ כְּטַ֖עַם לְשַׁ֥ד הַשָּֽׁמֶן׃
transliteration: shatv ha'am v'lak'tv v'tachanv varechayim vo dakhv bam'dokhah vvish'lv baparvr v'asv otvo 'ugvot v'hayah ta'mvo k'ta'am l'shad hashamen
translation: The people would go about and gather it, grind it between millstones or pound it in a mortar, boil it in a pot, and make it into cakes. It tasted like rich cream.bLit. “cream of oil (or, fat).”

hebrew: וּבְרֶ֧דֶת הַטַּ֛ל עַל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה לָ֑יְלָה יֵרֵ֥ד הַמָּ֖ן עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: vv'redet hatal 'al-hamachaneh lay'lah yered haman 'alayv
translation: When the dew fell on the camp at night, the manna would fall upon it.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֨ע מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־הָעָ֗ם בֹּכֶה֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔יו אִ֖ישׁ לְפֶ֣תַח אָהֳל֑וֹ וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֤ף יְהוָה֙ מְאֹ֔ד וּבְעֵינֵ֥י מֹשֶׁ֖ה רָֽע׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' mosheh et-ha'am bokheh l'mish'p'chotayv iysh l'fetach aholvo vayichar-af y'hvah m'od vv'eyney mosheh ra'
translation: Moses heard the people weeping, every clan apart, each person at the entrance of his tent. The L<small>ORD</small> was very angry, and Moses was distressed.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־יְהוָ֗ה לָמָ֤ה הֲרֵעֹ֙תָ֙ לְעַבְדֶּ֔ךָ וְלָ֛מָּה לֹא־מָצָ֥תִי חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ לָשׂ֗וּם אֶת־מַשָּׂ֛א כָּל־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה עָלָֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-y'hvah lamah hare'ota l'av'dekha v'lamah lo-matzatiy chen b'eyneykha lasvm et-masa kal-ha'am hazeh 'alay
translation: And Moses said to the L<small>ORD</small>, “Why have You dealt ill with Your servant, and why have I not enjoyed Your favor, that You have laid the burden of all this people upon me?

hebrew: הֶאָנֹכִ֣י הָרִ֗יתִי אֵ֚ת כָּל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אִם־אָנֹכִ֖י יְלִדְתִּ֑יהוּ כִּֽי־תֹאמַ֨ר אֵלַ֜י שָׂאֵ֣הוּ בְחֵיקֶ֗ךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשָּׂ֤א הָאֹמֵן֙ אֶת־הַיֹּנֵ֔ק עַ֚ל הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖עְתָּ לַאֲבֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: heanokhiy hariytiy et kal-ha'am hazeh im-anokhiy y'lid'tiyhv kiy-tomar elay saehv v'cheykekha kaasher yisa haomen et-hayonek 'al haadamah asher nish'ba'ta laavotayv
translation: Did I conceive all this people, did I bear them, that You should say to me, ‘Carry them in your bosom as a nurse carries an infant,’ to the land that You have promised on oath to their fathers?

hebrew: מֵאַ֤יִן לִי֙ בָּשָׂ֔ר לָתֵ֖ת לְכָל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּֽי־יִבְכּ֤וּ עָלַי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר תְּנָה־לָּ֥נוּ בָשָׂ֖ר וְנֹאכֵֽלָה׃
transliteration: meayin liy basar latet l'khal-ha'am hazeh kiy-yiv'kv 'alay lemor t'nah-lanv vasar v'nokhelah
translation: Where am I to get meat to give to all this people, when they whine before me and say, ‘Give us meat to eat!’

hebrew: לֹֽא־אוּכַ֤ל אָנֹכִי֙ לְבַדִּ֔י לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־כָּל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֥י כָבֵ֖ד מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
transliteration: lo-vkhal anokhiy l'vadiy laset et-kal-ha'am hazeh kiy khaved mimeniy
translation: I cannot carry all this people by myself, for it is too much for me.

hebrew: וְאִם־כָּ֣כָה ׀ אַתְּ־עֹ֣שֶׂה לִּ֗י הָרְגֵ֤נִי נָא֙ הָרֹ֔ג אִם־מָצָ֥אתִי חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ וְאַל־אֶרְאֶ֖ה בְּרָעָתִֽי׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'im-kakhah  at'-'oseh liy har'geniy na harog im-matzatiy chen b'eyneykha v'al-er'eh b'ra'atiy (f)
translation: If You would deal thus with me, kill me rather, I beg You, and let me see no more of my wretchedness!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶסְפָה־לִּ֞י שִׁבְעִ֣ים אִישׁ֮ מִזִּקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָדַ֔עְתָּ כִּי־הֵ֛ם זִקְנֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם וְשֹׁטְרָ֑יו וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ אֹתָם֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וְהִֽתְיַצְּב֥וּ שָׁ֖ם עִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh es'fah-liy shiv'iym iysh mizik'ney yis'rael asher yada'ta kiy-hem zik'ney ha'am v'shot'rayv v'lakach'ta otam el-ohel mvo'ed v'hit'yatz'vv sham 'imakh'
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Gather for Me seventy of Israel’s elders of whom you have experience as elders and officers of the people, and bring them to the Tent of Meeting and let them take their place there with you.

hebrew: וְיָרַדְתִּ֗י וְדִבַּרְתִּ֣י עִמְּךָ֮ שָׁם֒ וְאָצַלְתִּ֗י מִן־הָר֛וּחַ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָלֶ֖יךָ וְשַׂמְתִּ֣י עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְנָשְׂא֤וּ אִתְּךָ֙ בְּמַשָּׂ֣א הָעָ֔ם וְלֹא־תִשָּׂ֥א אַתָּ֖ה לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'yarad'tiy v'dibar'tiy 'im'kha sham v'atzal'tiy min-harvcha asher 'aleykha v'sam'tiy 'aleyhem v'nas'v it'kha b'masa ha'am v'lo-tisa atah l'vadekha
translation: I will come down and speak with you there, and I will draw upon the spirit that is on you and put it upon them; they shall share the burden of the people with you, and you shall not bear it alone.

hebrew: וְאֶל־הָעָ֨ם תֹּאמַ֜ר הִתְקַדְּשׁ֣וּ לְמָחָר֮ וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֣ם בָּשָׂר֒ כִּ֡י בְּכִיתֶם֩ בְּאָזְנֵ֨י יְהוָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר מִ֤י יַאֲכִלֵ֙נוּ֙ בָּשָׂ֔ר כִּי־ט֥וֹב לָ֖נוּ בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וְנָתַ֨ן יְהוָ֥ה לָכֶ֛ם בָּשָׂ֖ר וַאֲכַלְתֶּֽם׃
transliteration: v'el-ha'am tomar hit'kad'shv l'machar vaakhal'tem basar kiy b'khiytem b'az'ney y'hvah lemor miy yaakhilenv basar kiy-tvov lanv b'mitz'rayim v'natan y'hvah lakhem basar vaakhal'tem
translation: And say to the people: cI.e., as for a sacrificial meal.Purify yourselves-c for tomorrow and you shall eat meat, for you have kept whining before the LORD and saying, ‘If only we had meat to eat! Indeed, we were better off in Egypt!’ The LORD will give you meat and you shall eat.

hebrew: לֹ֣א י֥וֹם אֶחָ֛ד תֹּאכְל֖וּן וְלֹ֣א יוֹמָ֑יִם וְלֹ֣א ׀ חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה יָמִ֗ים וְלֹא֙ עֲשָׂרָ֣ה יָמִ֔ים וְלֹ֖א עֶשְׂרִ֥ים יֽוֹם׃
transliteration: lo yvom echad tokh'lvn v'lo yvomayim v'lo  chamishah yamiym v'lo 'asarah yamiym v'lo 'es'riym yvom
translation: You shall eat not one day, not two, not even five days or ten or twenty,

hebrew: עַ֣ד ׀ חֹ֣דֶשׁ יָמִ֗ים עַ֤ד אֲשֶׁר־יֵצֵא֙ מֵֽאַפְּכֶ֔ם וְהָיָ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם לְזָרָ֑א יַ֗עַן כִּֽי־מְאַסְתֶּ֤ם אֶת־יְהוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֔ם וַתִּבְכּ֤וּ לְפָנָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה יָצָ֥אנוּ מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: 'ad  chodesh yamiym 'ad asher-yetze meap'khem v'hayah lakhem l'zara ya'an kiy-m'as'tem et-y'hvah asher b'kir'b'khem vativ'kv l'fanayv lemor lamah zeh yatzanv mimitz'rayim
translation: but a whole month, until it comes out of your nostrils and becomes loathsome to you. For you have rejected the L<small>ORD</small> who is among you, by whining before Him and saying, ‘Oh, why did we ever leave Egypt!’”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֮ מֹשֶׁה֒ שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֙לֶף֙ רַגְלִ֔י הָעָ֕ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י בְּקִרְבּ֑וֹ וְאַתָּ֣ה אָמַ֗רְתָּ בָּשָׂר֙ אֶתֵּ֣ן לָהֶ֔ם וְאָכְל֖וּ חֹ֥דֶשׁ יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh shesh-mevot elef rag'liy ha'am asher anokhiy b'kir'bvo v'atah amar'ta basar eten lahem v'akh'lv chodesh yamiym
translation: But Moses said, “The people dLit. “in whose midst I am.”who are with me-d number six hundred thousand men; yet You say, ‘I will give them enough meat to eat for a whole month.’

hebrew: הֲצֹ֧אן וּבָקָ֛ר יִשָּׁחֵ֥ט לָהֶ֖ם וּמָצָ֣א לָהֶ֑ם אִ֣ם אֶֽת־כָּל־דְּגֵ֥י הַיָּ֛ם יֵאָסֵ֥ף לָהֶ֖ם וּמָצָ֥א לָהֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: hatzon vvakar yishachet lahem vmatza lahem im et-kal-d'gey hayam yeasef lahem vmatza lahem (f)
translation: Could enough flocks and herds be slaughtered to suffice them? Or could all the fish of the sea be gathered for them to suffice them?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה הֲיַ֥ד יְהוָ֖ה תִּקְצָ֑ר עַתָּ֥ה תִרְאֶ֛ה הֲיִקְרְךָ֥ דְבָרִ֖י אִם־לֹֽא׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh hayad y'hvah tik'tzar 'atah tir'eh hayik'r'kha d'variy im-lo
translation: And the LORD answered Moses, eLit. “Is the Lord’s hand too short?”“Is there a limit to the LORD’s power?-e You shall soon see whether what I have said happens to you or not!”

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיְדַבֵּר֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וַיֶּאֱסֹ֞ף שִׁבְעִ֥ים אִישׁ֙ מִזִּקְנֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם וַֽיַּעֲמֵ֥ד אֹתָ֖ם סְבִיבֹ֥ת הָאֹֽהֶל׃
transliteration: vayetze mosheh vay'daber el-ha'am et div'rey y'hvah vayeesof shiv'iym iysh mizik'ney ha'am vaya'amed otam s'viyvot haohel
translation: Moses went out and reported the words of the L<small>ORD</small> to the people. He gathered seventy of the people’s elders and stationed them around the Tent.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨רֶד יְהוָ֥ה ׀ בֶּעָנָן֮ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלָיו֒ וַיָּ֗אצֶל מִן־הָר֙וּחַ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֔יו וַיִּתֵּ֕ן עַל־שִׁבְעִ֥ים אִ֖ישׁ הַזְּקֵנִ֑ים וַיְהִ֗י כְּנ֤וֹחַ עֲלֵיהֶם֙ הָר֔וּחַ וַיִּֽתְנַבְּא֖וּ וְלֹ֥א יָסָֽפוּ׃
transliteration: vayered y'hvah  be'anan vay'daber elayv vayatzel min-harvcha asher 'alayv vayiten 'al-shiv'iym iysh haz'keniym vay'hiy k'nvocha 'aleyhem harvcha vayit'nab'v v'lo yasafv
translation: Then the LORD came down in a cloud and spoke to him; He drew upon the spirit that was on him and put it upon the seventy elders. And when the spirit rested upon them, they fOthers “prophesied.”spoke in ecstasy,-f but did not continue.

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׁאֲר֣וּ שְׁנֵֽי־אֲנָשִׁ֣ים ׀ בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֡ה שֵׁ֣ם הָאֶחָ֣ד ׀ אֶלְדָּ֡ד וְשֵׁם֩ הַשֵּׁנִ֨י מֵידָ֜ד וַתָּ֧נַח עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם הָר֗וּחַ וְהֵ֙מָּה֙ בַּכְּתֻבִ֔ים וְלֹ֥א יָצְא֖וּ הָאֹ֑הֱלָה וַיִּֽתְנַבְּא֖וּ בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vayishaarv sh'ney-anashiym  bamachaneh shem haechad  el'dad v'shem hasheniy meydad vatanach 'aleyhem harvcha v'hemah bak'tuviym v'lo yatz'v haohelah vayit'nab'v bamachaneh
translation: Two men, one named Eldad and the other Medad, had remained in camp; yet the spirit rested upon them—they were among those recorded, but they had not gone out to the Tent—and they fOthers “prophesied.”spoke in ecstasy-f in the camp.

hebrew: וַיָּ֣רָץ הַנַּ֔עַר וַיַּגֵּ֥ד לְמֹשֶׁ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֶלְדָּ֣ד וּמֵידָ֔ד מִֽתְנַבְּאִ֖ים בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vayaratz hana'ar vayaged l'mosheh vayomar el'dad vmeydad mit'nab'iym bamachaneh
translation: A youth ran out and told Moses, saying, “Eldad and Medad are acting the prophet in the camp!”

hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַן יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֗וּן מְשָׁרֵ֥ת מֹשֶׁ֛ה מִבְּחֻרָ֖יו וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנִ֥י מֹשֶׁ֖ה כְּלָאֵֽם׃
transliteration: vaya'an y'hvoshu'a bin-nvn m'sharet mosheh mib'churayv vayomar adoniy mosheh k'laem
translation: And Joshua son of Nun, Moses’ attendant from his youth, spoke up and said, “My lord Moses, restrain them!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה הַֽמְקַנֵּ֥א אַתָּ֖ה לִ֑י וּמִ֨י יִתֵּ֜ן כָּל־עַ֤ם יְהוָה֙ נְבִיאִ֔ים כִּי־יִתֵּ֧ן יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־רוּח֖וֹ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer lvo mosheh ham'kane atah liy vmiy yiten kal-'am y'hvah n'viyiym kiy-yiten y'hvah et-rvchvo 'aleyhem
translation: But Moses said to him, “Are you wrought up on my account? Would that all the L<small>ORD</small>’s people were prophets, that the L<small>ORD</small> put His spirit upon them!”

hebrew: וַיֵּאָסֵ֥ף מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה ה֖וּא וְזִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayeasef mosheh el-hamachaneh hv v'zik'ney yis'rael
translation: Moses then reentered the camp together with the elders of Israel.

hebrew: וְר֜וּחַ נָסַ֣ע ׀ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהוָ֗ה וַיָּ֣גָז שַׂלְוִים֮ מִן־הַיָּם֒ וַיִּטֹּ֨שׁ עַל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֜ה כְּדֶ֧רֶךְ י֣וֹם כֹּ֗ה וּכְדֶ֤רֶךְ יוֹם֙ כֹּ֔ה סְבִיב֖וֹת הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וּכְאַמָּתַ֖יִם עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'rvcha nasa'  meet y'hvah vayagaz sal'viym min-hayam vayitosh 'al-hamachaneh k'derekh' yvom koh vkh'derekh' yvom koh s'viyvvot hamachaneh vkh'amatayim 'al-p'ney haaretz
translation: A wind from the L<small>ORD</small> started up, swept quail from the sea and strewed them over the camp, about a day’s journey on this side and about a day’s journey on that side, all around the camp, and some two cubits deep on the ground.

hebrew: וַיָּ֣קָם הָעָ֡ם כָּל־הַיּוֹם֩ הַה֨וּא וְכָל־הַלַּ֜יְלָה וְכֹ֣ל ׀ י֣וֹם הַֽמָּחֳרָ֗ת וַיַּֽאַסְפוּ֙ אֶת־הַשְּׂלָ֔ו הַמַּמְעִ֕יט אָסַ֖ף עֲשָׂרָ֣ה חֳמָרִ֑ים וַיִּשְׁטְח֤וּ לָהֶם֙ שָׁט֔וֹחַ סְבִיב֖וֹת הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vayakam ha'am kal-hayvom hahv v'khal-halay'lah v'khol  yvom hamachorat vayaas'fv et-has'lav hamam'iyt asaf 'asarah chomariym vayish't'chv lahem shatvocha s'viyvvot hamachaneh
translation: The people set to gathering quail all that day and night and all the next day—even he who gathered least had ten ḥomers—and they spread them out all around the camp.

hebrew: הַבָּשָׂ֗ר עוֹדֶ֙נּוּ֙ בֵּ֣ין שִׁנֵּיהֶ֔ם טֶ֖רֶם יִכָּרֵ֑ת וְאַ֤ף יְהוָה֙ חָרָ֣ה בָעָ֔ם וַיַּ֤ךְ יְהוָה֙ בָּעָ֔ם מַכָּ֖ה רַבָּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: habasar 'vodenv beyn shineyhem terem yikaret v'af y'hvah charah va'am vayakh' y'hvah ba'am makah rabah m'od
translation: The meat was still between their teeth, not yet chewed,gMeaning of Heb. yikkareth uncertain. when the anger of the LORD blazed forth against the people and the LORD struck the people with a very severe plague.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֛א אֶת־שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא קִבְר֣וֹת הַֽתַּאֲוָ֑ה כִּי־שָׁם֙ קָֽבְר֔וּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם הַמִּתְאַוִּֽים׃
transliteration: vayik'ra et-shem-hamakvom hahv kiv'rvot hataavah kiy-sham kav'rv et-ha'am hamit'aviym
translation: That place was named Kibroth-hattaavah,hI.e., “the graves of craving.” because the people who had the craving were buried there.

hebrew: מִקִּבְר֧וֹת הַֽתַּאֲוָ֛ה נָסְע֥וּ הָעָ֖ם חֲצֵר֑וֹת וַיִּהְי֖וּ בַּחֲצֵרֽוֹת׃ (פ)
transliteration: mikiv'rvot hataavah nas'v ha'am chatzervot vayih'yv bachatzervot (f)
translation:
Then the people set out from Kibroth-hattaavah for Hazeroth.
When they were in Hazeroth,

hebrew: וַתְּדַבֵּ֨ר מִרְיָ֤ם וְאַהֲרֹן֙ בְּמֹשֶׁ֔ה עַל־אֹד֛וֹת הָאִשָּׁ֥ה הַכֻּשִׁ֖ית אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָקָ֑ח כִּֽי־אִשָּׁ֥ה כֻשִׁ֖ית לָקָֽח׃
transliteration: vat'daber mir'yam v'aharon b'mosheh 'al-odvot haishah hakushiyt asher lakach kiy-ishah khushiyt lakach
translation: Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman he had married: “He married a Cushite woman!”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ הֲרַ֤ק אַךְ־בְּמֹשֶׁה֙ דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה הֲלֹ֖א גַּם־בָּ֣נוּ דִבֵּ֑ר וַיִּשְׁמַ֖ע יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayom'rv harak akh'-b'mosheh diber y'hvah halo gam-banv diber vayish'ma' y'hvah
translation: They said, “Has the L<small>ORD</small> spoken only through Moses? Has He not spoken through us as well?” The L<small>ORD</small> heard it.

hebrew: וְהָאִ֥ישׁ מֹשֶׁ֖ה ענו [עָנָ֣יו] מְאֹ֑ד מִכֹּל֙ הָֽאָדָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'haiysh mosheh 'nv ['anayv] m'od mikol haadam asher 'al-p'ney haadamah (s)
translation: Now Moses was a very humble man, more so than any other man on earth.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה פִּתְאֹ֗ם אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶל־מִרְיָ֔ם צְא֥וּ שְׁלָשְׁתְּכֶ֖ם אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וַיֵּצְא֖וּ שְׁלָשְׁתָּֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah pit'om el-mosheh v'el-aharon v'el-mir'yam tz'v sh'lash't'khem el-ohel mvo'ed vayetz'v sh'lash'tam
translation: Suddenly the L<small>ORD</small> called to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, “Come out, you three, to the Tent of Meeting.” So the three of them went out.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֤רֶד יְהוָה֙ בְּעַמּ֣וּד עָנָ֔ן וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֖ד פֶּ֣תַח הָאֹ֑הֶל וַיִּקְרָא֙ אַהֲרֹ֣ן וּמִרְיָ֔ם וַיֵּצְא֖וּ שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayered y'hvah b'amvd 'anan vaya'amod petach haohel vayik'ra aharon vmir'yam vayetz'v sh'neyhem
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> came down in a pillar of cloud, stopped at the entrance of the Tent, and called out, “Aaron and Miriam!” The two of them came forward;

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֣א דְבָרָ֑י אִם־יִֽהְיֶה֙ נְבִ֣יאֲכֶ֔ם יְהוָ֗ה בַּמַּרְאָה֙ אֵלָ֣יו אֶתְוַדָּ֔ע בַּחֲל֖וֹם אֲדַבֶּר־בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer shim'v-na d'varay im-yih'yeh n'viyakhem y'hvah bamar'ah elayv et'vada' bachalvom adaber-bvo
translation: and He said, “Hear these My words: aMeaning of Heb. uncertain. Others “If there be a prophet among you, I the Lord.”When a prophet of the LORD arises among you, I-a make Myself known to him in a vision, I speak with him in a dream.

hebrew: לֹא־כֵ֖ן עַבְדִּ֣י מֹשֶׁ֑ה בְּכָל־בֵּיתִ֖י נֶאֱמָ֥ן הֽוּא׃
transliteration: lo-khen 'av'diy mosheh b'khal-beytiy neeman hv
translation: Not so with My servant Moses; he is trusted throughout My household.

hebrew: פֶּ֣ה אֶל־פֶּ֞ה אֲדַבֶּר־בּ֗וֹ וּמַרְאֶה֙ וְלֹ֣א בְחִידֹ֔ת וּתְמֻנַ֥ת יְהוָ֖ה יַבִּ֑יט וּמַדּ֙וּעַ֙ לֹ֣א יְרֵאתֶ֔ם לְדַבֵּ֖ר בְּעַבְדִּ֥י בְמֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: peh el-peh adaber-bvo vmar'eh v'lo v'chiydot vt'munat y'hvah yabiyt vmadv'a lo y'retem l'daber b'av'diy v'mosheh
translation: With him I speak mouth to mouth, plainly and not in riddles, and he beholds the likeness of the L<small>ORD</small>. How then did you not shrink from speaking against My servant Moses!”

hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר אַ֧ף יְהוָ֛ה בָּ֖ם וַיֵּלַֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayichar af y'hvah bam vayelakh'
translation: Still incensed with them, the L<small>ORD</small> departed.

hebrew: וְהֶעָנָ֗ן סָ֚ר מֵעַ֣ל הָאֹ֔הֶל וְהִנֵּ֥ה מִרְיָ֖ם מְצֹרַ֣עַת כַּשָּׁ֑לֶג וַיִּ֧פֶן אַהֲרֹ֛ן אֶל־מִרְיָ֖ם וְהִנֵּ֥ה מְצֹרָֽעַת׃
transliteration: v'he'anan sar me'al haohel v'hineh mir'yam m'tzora'at kashaleg vayifen aharon el-mir'yam v'hineh m'tzora'at
translation: As the cloud withdrew from the Tent, there was Miriam stricken with snow-white scales!bCf. Lev. 13.2–3. When Aaron turned toward Miriam, he saw that she was stricken with scales.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אַהֲרֹ֖ן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י אַל־נָ֨א תָשֵׁ֤ת עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ חַטָּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֥ר נוֹאַ֖לְנוּ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטָֽאנוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer aharon el-mosheh biy adoniy al-na tashet 'aleynv chatat asher nvoal'nv vaasher chatanv
translation: And Aaron said to Moses, “O my lord, account not to us the sin which we committed in our folly.

hebrew: אַל־נָ֥א תְהִ֖י כַּמֵּ֑ת אֲשֶׁ֤ר בְּצֵאתוֹ֙ מֵרֶ֣חֶם אִמּ֔וֹ וַיֵּאָכֵ֖ל חֲצִ֥י בְשָׂרֽוֹ׃
transliteration: al-na t'hiy kamet asher b'tzetvo merechem imvo vayeakhel chatziy v'sarvo
translation: Let her not be as one dead, who emerges from his mother’s womb with half his flesh eaten away.”

hebrew: וַיִּצְעַ֣ק מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־יְהוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר אֵ֕ל נָ֛א רְפָ֥א נָ֖א לָֽהּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayitz'ak mosheh el-y'hvah lemor el na r'fa na lah (f)
translation: So Moses cried out to the L<small>ORD</small>, saying, “O God, pray heal her!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה וְאָבִ֙יהָ֙ יָרֹ֤ק יָרַק֙ בְּפָנֶ֔יהָ הֲלֹ֥א תִכָּלֵ֖ם שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים תִּסָּגֵ֞ר שִׁבְעַ֤ת יָמִים֙ מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְאַחַ֖ר תֵּאָסֵֽף׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh v'aviyha yarok yarak b'faneyha halo tikalem shiv'at yamiym tisager shiv'at yamiym michvtz lamachaneh v'achar teasef
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “If her father spat in her face, would she not bear her shame for seven days? Let her be shut out of camp for seven days, and then let her be readmitted.”

hebrew: וַתִּסָּגֵ֥ר מִרְיָ֛ם מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים וְהָעָם֙ לֹ֣א נָסַ֔ע עַד־הֵאָסֵ֖ף מִרְיָֽם׃
transliteration: vatisager mir'yam michvtz lamachaneh shiv'at yamiym v'ha'am lo nasa' 'ad-heasef mir'yam
translation: So Miriam was shut out of camp seven days; and the people did not march on until Miriam was readmitted.

hebrew: וְאַחַ֛ר נָסְע֥וּ הָעָ֖ם מֵחֲצֵר֑וֹת וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר פָּארָֽן׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'achar nas'v ha'am mechatzervot vayachanv b'mid'bar paran (f)
translation: After that the people set out from Hazeroth and encamped in the wilderness of Paran.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying,

hebrew: שְׁלַח־לְךָ֣ אֲנָשִׁ֗ים וְיָתֻ֙רוּ֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י נֹתֵ֖ן לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אִ֣ישׁ אֶחָד֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶחָ֜ד לְמַטֵּ֤ה אֲבֹתָיו֙ תִּשְׁלָ֔חוּ כֹּ֖ל נָשִׂ֥יא בָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: sh'lach-l'kha anashiym v'yaturv et-eretz k'na'an asher-aniy noten liv'ney yis'rael iysh echad iysh echad l'mateh avotayv tish'lachv kol nasiy vahem
translation: “Send men to scout the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelite people; send one man from each of their ancestral tribes, each one a chieftain among them.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח אֹתָ֥ם מֹשֶׁ֛ה מִמִּדְבַּ֥ר פָּארָ֖ן עַל־פִּ֣י יְהוָ֑ה כֻּלָּ֣ם אֲנָשִׁ֔ים רָאשֵׁ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הֵֽמָּה׃
transliteration: vayish'lach otam mosheh mimid'bar paran 'al-piy y'hvah kulam anashiym rashey v'ney-yis'rael hemah
translation: So Moses, by the L<small>ORD</small>’s command, sent them out from the wilderness of Paran, all the men being leaders of the Israelites.

hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה שְׁמוֹתָ֑ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה רְאוּבֵ֔ן שַׁמּ֖וּעַ בֶּן־זַכּֽוּר׃
transliteration: v'eleh sh'mvotam l'mateh r'vven shamv'a ben-zakvr
translation:
And these were their names:
From the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur.

hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה שִׁמְע֔וֹן שָׁפָ֖ט בֶּן־חוֹרִֽי׃
transliteration: l'mateh shim'von shafat ben-chvoriy
translation: From the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori.

hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה יְהוּדָ֔ה כָּלֵ֖ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּֽה׃
transliteration: l'mateh y'hvdah kalev ben-y'funeh
translation: From the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh.

hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה יִשָּׂשכָ֔ר יִגְאָ֖ל בֶּן־יוֹסֵֽף׃
transliteration: l'mateh yisashkhar yig'al ben-yvosef
translation: From the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph.

hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֥ה אֶפְרָ֖יִם הוֹשֵׁ֥עַ בִּן־נֽוּן׃
transliteration: l'mateh ef'rayim hvoshe'a bin-nvn
translation: From the tribe of Ephraim, HoseaaOr “Hoshea.” son of Nun.

hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה בִנְיָמִ֔ן פַּלְטִ֖י בֶּן־רָפֽוּא׃
transliteration: l'mateh vin'yamin pal'tiy ben-rafv
translation: From the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Rafu.

hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה זְבוּלֻ֔ן גַּדִּיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־סוֹדִֽי׃
transliteration: l'mateh z'vvlun gadiyel ben-svodiy
translation: From the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi.

hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֥ה יוֹסֵ֖ף לְמַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה גַּדִּ֖י בֶּן־סוּסִֽי׃
transliteration: l'mateh yvosef l'mateh m'nasheh gadiy ben-svsiy
translation: From the tribe of Joseph, namely, the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi son of Susi.

hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה דָ֔ן עַמִּיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־גְּמַלִּֽי׃
transliteration: l'mateh dan 'amiyel ben-g'maliy
translation: From the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli.

hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה אָשֵׁ֔ר סְת֖וּר בֶּן־מִיכָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: l'mateh asher s'tvr ben-miykhael
translation: From the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael.

hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה נַפְתָּלִ֔י נַחְבִּ֖י בֶּן־וָפְסִֽי׃
transliteration: l'mateh naf'taliy nach'biy ben-vaf'siy
translation: From the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi.

hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה גָ֔ד גְּאוּאֵ֖ל בֶּן־מָכִֽי׃
transliteration: l'mateh gad g'vel ben-makhiy
translation: From the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Machi.

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה שְׁמ֣וֹת הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֖ה לָת֣וּר אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּקְרָ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה לְהוֹשֵׁ֥עַ בִּן־נ֖וּן יְהוֹשֻֽׁעַ׃
transliteration: eleh sh'mvot haanashiym asher-shalach mosheh latvr et-haaretz vayik'ra mosheh l'hvoshe'a bin-nvn y'hvoshu'a
translation: Those were the names of the men whom Moses sent to scout the land; but Moses changed the name of HoseaaOr “Hoshea.” son of Nun to Joshua.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח אֹתָם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה לָת֖וּר אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם עֲל֥וּ זֶה֙ בַּנֶּ֔גֶב וַעֲלִיתֶ֖ם אֶת־הָהָֽר׃
transliteration: vayish'lach otam mosheh latvr et-eretz k'na'an vayomer alehem 'alv zeh banegev va'aliytem et-hahar
translation: When Moses sent them to scout the land of Canaan, he said to them, “Go up there into the Negeb and on into the hill country,

hebrew: וּרְאִיתֶ֥ם אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ מַה־הִ֑וא וְאֶת־הָעָם֙ הַיֹּשֵׁ֣ב עָלֶ֔יהָ הֶחָזָ֥ק הוּא֙ הֲרָפֶ֔ה הַמְעַ֥ט ה֖וּא אִם־רָֽב׃
transliteration: vr'iytem et-haaretz mah-hiv v'et-ha'am hayoshev 'aleyha hechazak hv harafeh ham'at hv im-rav
translation: and see what kind of country it is. Are the people who dwell in it strong or weak, few or many?

hebrew: וּמָ֣ה הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־הוּא֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב בָּ֔הּ הֲטוֹבָ֥ה הִ֖וא אִם־רָעָ֑ה וּמָ֣ה הֶֽעָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁר־הוּא֙ יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בָּהֵ֔נָּה הַבְּמַֽחֲנִ֖ים אִ֥ם בְּמִבְצָרִֽים׃
transliteration: vmah haaretz asher-hv yoshev bah hatvovah hiv im-ra'ah vmah he'ariym asher-hv yvoshev bahenah hab'machaniym im b'miv'tzariym
translation: Is the country in which they dwell good or bad? Are the towns they live in open or fortified?

hebrew: וּמָ֣ה הָ֠אָרֶץ הַשְּׁמֵנָ֨ה הִ֜וא אִם־רָזָ֗ה הֲיֵֽשׁ־בָּ֥הּ עֵץ֙ אִם־אַ֔יִן וְהִ֨תְחַזַּקְתֶּ֔ם וּלְקַחְתֶּ֖ם מִפְּרִ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהַ֨יָּמִ֔ים יְמֵ֖י בִּכּוּרֵ֥י עֲנָבִֽים׃
transliteration: vmah haaretz hash'menah hiv im-razah hayesh-bah 'etz im-ayin v'hit'chazak'tem vl'kach'tem mip'riy haaretz v'hayamiym y'mey bikvrey 'anaviym
translation: Is the soil rich or poor? Is it wooded or not? And take pains to bring back some of the fruit of the land.”—Now it happened to be the season of the first ripe grapes.

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּ וַיָּתֻ֣רוּ אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ מִמִּדְבַּר־צִ֥ן עַד־רְחֹ֖ב לְבֹ֥א חֲמָֽת׃
transliteration: vaya'alv vayaturv et-haaretz mimid'bar-tzin 'ad-r'chov l'vo chamat
translation: They went up and scouted the land, from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, at Lebo-hamath.bOthers “the entrance to Hamath.”

hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֣וּ בַנֶּגֶב֮ וַיָּבֹ֣א עַד־חֶבְרוֹן֒ וְשָׁ֤ם אֲחִימַן֙ שֵׁשַׁ֣י וְתַלְמַ֔י יְלִידֵ֖י הָעֲנָ֑ק וְחֶבְר֗וֹן שֶׁ֤בַע שָׁנִים֙ נִבְנְתָ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י צֹ֥עַן מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vaya'alv vanegev vayavo 'ad-chev'rvon v'sham achiyman sheshay v'tal'may y'liydey ha'anak v'chev'rvon sheva' shaniym niv'n'tah lif'ney tzo'an mitz'rayim
translation: They went up into the Negeb and came to Hebron, where lived Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the Anakites.—Now Hebron was founded seven years before Zoan of Egypt.—

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ עַד־נַ֣חַל אֶשְׁכֹּ֗ל וַיִּכְרְת֨וּ מִשָּׁ֤ם זְמוֹרָה֙ וְאֶשְׁכּ֤וֹל עֲנָבִים֙ אֶחָ֔ד וַיִּשָּׂאֻ֥הוּ בַמּ֖וֹט בִּשְׁנָ֑יִם וּמִן־הָרִמֹּנִ֖ים וּמִן־הַתְּאֵנִֽים׃
transliteration: vayavov 'ad-nachal esh'kol vayikh'r'tv misham z'mvorah v'esh'kvol 'anaviym echad vayisauhv vamvot bish'nayim vmin-harimoniym vmin-hat'eniym
translation: They reached the wadi Eshcol, and there they cut down a branch with a single cluster of grapes—it had to be borne on a carrying frame by two of them—and some pomegranates and figs.

hebrew: לַמָּק֣וֹם הַה֔וּא קָרָ֖א נַ֣חַל אֶשְׁכּ֑וֹל עַ֚ל אֹד֣וֹת הָֽאֶשְׁכּ֔וֹל אֲשֶׁר־כָּרְת֥וּ מִשָּׁ֖ם בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: lamakvom hahv kara nachal esh'kvol 'al odvot haesh'kvol asher-kar'tv misham b'ney yis'rael
translation: That place was named the wadi EshcolcI.e., “cluster.” because of the cluster that the Israelites cut down there.

hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ מִתּ֣וּר הָאָ֑רֶץ מִקֵּ֖ץ אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayashuvv mitvr haaretz miketz ar'ba'iym yvom
translation: At the end of forty days they returned from scouting the land.

hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֡וּ וַיָּבֹאוּ֩ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֨ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְאֶל־כָּל־עֲדַ֧ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶל־מִדְבַּ֥ר פָּארָ֖ן קָדֵ֑שָׁה וַיָּשִׁ֨יבוּ אוֹתָ֤ם דָּבָר֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה וַיַּרְא֖וּם אֶת־פְּרִ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vayel'khv vayavov el-mosheh v'el-aharon v'el-kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael el-mid'bar paran kadeshah vayashiyvv votam davar v'et-kal-ha'edah vayar'vm et-p'riy haaretz
translation: They went straight to Moses and Aaron and the whole Israelite community at Kadesh in the wilderness of Paran, and they made their report to them and to the whole community, as they showed them the fruit of the land.

hebrew: וַיְסַפְּרוּ־לוֹ֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ בָּ֕אנוּ אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שְׁלַחְתָּ֑נוּ וְ֠גַם זָבַ֨ת חָלָ֥ב וּדְבַ֛שׁ הִ֖וא וְזֶה־פִּרְיָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vay'sap'rv-lvo vayom'rv banv el-haaretz asher sh'lach'tanv v'gam zavat chalav vd'vash hiv v'zeh-pir'yah
translation: This is what they told him: “We came to the land you sent us to; it does indeed flow with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.

hebrew: אֶ֚פֶס כִּֽי־עַ֣ז הָעָ֔ם הַיֹּשֵׁ֖ב בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְהֶֽעָרִ֗ים בְּצֻר֤וֹת גְּדֹלֹת֙ מְאֹ֔ד וְגַם־יְלִדֵ֥י הָֽעֲנָ֖ק רָאִ֥ינוּ שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: efes kiy-'az ha'am hayoshev baaretz v'he'ariym b'tzurvot g'dolot m'od v'gam-y'lidey ha'anak raiynv sham
translation: However, the people who inhabit the country are powerful, and the cities are fortified and very large; moreover, we saw the Anakites there.

hebrew: עֲמָלֵ֥ק יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּאֶ֣רֶץ הַנֶּ֑גֶב וְ֠הַֽחִתִּי וְהַיְבוּסִ֤י וְהָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בָּהָ֔ר וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב עַל־הַיָּ֔ם וְעַ֖ל יַ֥ד הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
transliteration: 'amalek yvoshev b'eretz hanegev v'hachitiy v'hay'vvsiy v'haemoriy yvoshev bahar v'hak'na'aniy yoshev 'al-hayam v'al yad hayar'den
translation: Amalekites dwell in the Negeb region; Hittites, Jebusites, and Amorites inhabit the hill country; and Canaanites dwell by the Sea and along the Jordan.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֧הַס כָּלֵ֛ב אֶת־הָעָ֖ם אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר עָלֹ֤ה נַעֲלֶה֙ וְיָרַ֣שְׁנוּ אֹתָ֔הּ כִּֽי־יָכ֥וֹל נוּכַ֖ל לָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayahas kalev et-ha'am el-mosheh vayomer 'aloh na'aleh v'yarash'nv otah kiy-yakhvol nvkhal lah
translation: Caleb hushed the people before Moses and said, “Let us by all means go up, and we shall gain possession of it, for we shall surely overcome it.”

hebrew: וְהָ֨אֲנָשִׁ֜ים אֲשֶׁר־עָל֤וּ עִמּוֹ֙ אָֽמְר֔וּ לֹ֥א נוּכַ֖ל לַעֲל֣וֹת אֶל־הָעָ֑ם כִּֽי־חָזָ֥ק ה֖וּא מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: v'haanashiym asher-'alv 'imvo am'rv lo nvkhal la'alvot el-ha'am kiy-chazak hv mimenv
translation: But the men who had gone up with him said, “We cannot attack that people, for it is stronger than we.”

hebrew: וַיּוֹצִ֜יאוּ דִּבַּ֤ת הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תָּר֣וּ אֹתָ֔הּ אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר הָאָ֡רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֩ עָבַ֨רְנוּ בָ֜הּ לָת֣וּר אֹתָ֗הּ אֶ֣רֶץ אֹכֶ֤לֶת יוֹשְׁבֶ֙יהָ֙ הִ֔וא וְכָל־הָעָ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־רָאִ֥ינוּ בְתוֹכָ֖הּ אַנְשֵׁ֥י מִדּֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayvotziyv dibat haaretz asher tarv otah el-b'ney yis'rael lemor haaretz asher 'avar'nv vah latvr otah eretz okhelet yvosh'veyha hiv v'khal-ha'am asher-raiynv v'tvokhah an'shey midvot
translation: Thus they spread calumnies among the Israelites about the land they had scouted, saying, “The country that we traversed and scouted is one that devours its settlers. All the people that we saw in it are men of great size;

hebrew: וְשָׁ֣ם רָאִ֗ינוּ אֶת־הַנְּפִילִ֛ים בְּנֵ֥י עֲנָ֖ק מִן־הַנְּפִלִ֑ים וַנְּהִ֤י בְעֵינֵ֙ינוּ֙ כַּֽחֲגָבִ֔ים וְכֵ֥ן הָיִ֖ינוּ בְּעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'sham raiynv et-han'fiyliym b'ney 'anak min-han'filiym van'hiy v'eyneynv kachagaviym v'khen hayiynv b'eyneyhem
translation: we saw the NephilimdSee Gen. 6.4. there—the Anakites are part of the Nephilim—and we looked like grasshoppers to ourselves, and so we must have looked to them.”

hebrew: וַתִּשָּׂא֙ כָּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה וַֽיִּתְּנ֖וּ אֶת־קוֹלָ֑ם וַיִּבְכּ֥וּ הָעָ֖ם בַּלַּ֥יְלָה הַהֽוּא׃
transliteration: vatisa kal-ha'edah vayit'nv et-kvolam vayiv'kv ha'am balay'lah hahv
translation: The whole community broke into loud cries, and the people wept that night.

hebrew: וַיִּלֹּ֙נוּ֙ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן כֹּ֖ל בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֲלֵהֶ֜ם כָּל־הָעֵדָ֗ה לוּ־מַ֙תְנוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם א֛וֹ בַּמִּדְבָּ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה לוּ־מָֽתְנוּ׃
transliteration: vayilonv 'al-mosheh v'al-aharon kol b'ney yis'rael vayom'rv alehem kal-ha'edah lv-mat'nv b'eretz mitz'rayim vo bamid'bar hazeh lv-mat'nv
