translation: All the Israelites railed against Moses and Aaron. “If only we had died in the land of Egypt,” the whole community shouted at them, “or if only we might die in this wilderness!

hebrew: וְלָמָ֣ה יְ֠הוָה מֵבִ֨יא אֹתָ֜נוּ אֶל־הָאָ֤רֶץ הַזֹּאת֙ לִנְפֹּ֣ל בַּחֶ֔רֶב נָשֵׁ֥ינוּ וְטַפֵּ֖נוּ יִהְי֣וּ לָבַ֑ז הֲל֧וֹא ט֦וֹב לָ֖נוּ שׁ֥וּב מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
transliteration: v'lamah y'hvah meviy otanv el-haaretz hazot lin'pol bacherev nasheynv v'tapenv yih'yv lavaz halvo tvov lanv shvv mitz'ray'mah
translation: Why is the L<small>ORD</small> taking us to that land to fall by the sword? Our wives and children will be carried off! It would be better for us to go back to Egypt!”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֑יו נִתְּנָ֥ה רֹ֖אשׁ וְנָשׁ֥וּבָה מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
transliteration: vayom'rv iysh el-achiyv nit'nah rosh v'nashvvah mitz'ray'mah
translation: And they said to one another, “Let us aLit. “set the head and return to”; cf. Neh. 9.17. Others “Let us make a captain and return to.”head back for-a Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֥ל מֹשֶׁ֛ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן עַל־פְּנֵיהֶ֑ם לִפְנֵ֕י כָּל־קְהַ֥ל עֲדַ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayipol mosheh v'aharon 'al-p'neyhem lif'ney kal-k'hal 'adat b'ney yis'rael
translation: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembled congregation of the Israelites.

hebrew: וִיהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֗וּן וְכָלֵב֙ בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֔ה מִן־הַתָּרִ֖ים אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ קָרְע֖וּ בִּגְדֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: viyhvoshu'a bin-nvn v'khalev ben-y'funeh min-hatariym et-haaretz kar'v big'deyhem
translation: And Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, of those who had scouted the land, rent their clothes

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֶל־כָּל־עֲדַ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָבַ֤רְנוּ בָהּ֙ לָת֣וּר אֹתָ֔הּ טוֹבָ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ מְאֹ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: vayom'rv el-kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael lemor haaretz asher 'avar'nv vah latvr otah tvovah haaretz m'od m'od
translation: and exhorted the whole Israelite community: “The land that we traversed and scouted is an exceedingly good land.

hebrew: אִם־חָפֵ֥ץ בָּ֙נוּ֙ יְהוָ֔ה וְהֵבִ֤יא אֹתָ֙נוּ֙ אֶל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את וּנְתָנָ֖הּ לָ֑נוּ אֶ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־הִ֛וא זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
transliteration: im-chafetz banv y'hvah v'heviy otanv el-haaretz hazot vn'tanah lanv eretz asher-hiv zavat chalav vd'vash
translation: If the L<small>ORD</small> is pleased with us, He will bring us into that land, a land that flows with milk and honey, and give it to us;

hebrew: אַ֣ךְ בַּֽיהוָה֮ אַל־תִּמְרֹדוּ֒ וְאַתֶּ֗ם אַל־תִּֽירְאוּ֙ אֶת־עַ֣ם הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֥י לַחְמֵ֖נוּ הֵ֑ם סָ֣ר צִלָּ֧ם מֵעֲלֵיהֶ֛ם וַֽיהוָ֥ה אִתָּ֖נוּ אַל־תִּירָאֻֽם׃
transliteration: akh' bayhvah al-tim'rodv v'atem al-tiyr'v et-'am haaretz kiy lach'menv hem sar tzilam me'aleyhem vayhvah itanv al-tiyraum
translation: only you must not rebel against the LORD. Have no fear then of the people of the country, for they are our prey:bLit. “food (or, bread).” their protection has departed from them, but the LORD is with us. Have no fear of them!”

hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ כָּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה לִרְגּ֥וֹם אֹתָ֖ם בָּאֲבָנִ֑ים וּכְב֣וֹד יְהוָ֗ה נִרְאָה֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד אֶֽל־כָּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayom'rv kal-ha'edah lir'gvom otam baavaniym vkh'vvod y'hvah nir'ah b'ohel mvo'ed el-kal-b'ney yis'rael (f)
translation: As the whole community threatened to pelt them with stones, the Presence of the L<small>ORD</small> appeared in the Tent of Meeting to all the Israelites.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה עַד־אָ֥נָה יְנַאֲצֻ֖נִי הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה וְעַד־אָ֙נָה֙ לֹא־יַאֲמִ֣ינוּ בִ֔י בְּכֹל֙ הָֽאֹת֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתִי בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh 'ad-anah y'naatzuniy ha'am hazeh v'ad-anah lo-yaamiynv viy b'khol haotvot asher 'asiytiy b'kir'bvo
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “How long will this people spurn Me, and how long will they have no faith in Me despite all the signs that I have performed in their midst?

hebrew: אַכֶּ֥נּוּ בַדֶּ֖בֶר וְאוֹרִשֶׁ֑נּוּ וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂה֙ אֹֽתְךָ֔ לְגוֹי־גָּד֥וֹל וְעָצ֖וּם מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: akenv vadever v'vorishenv v'e'eseh ot'kha l'gvoy-gadvol v'atzvm mimenv
translation: I will strike them with pestilence and disown them, and I will make of you a nation far more numerous than they!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־יְהוָ֑ה וְשָׁמְע֣וּ מִצְרַ֔יִם כִּֽי־הֶעֱלִ֧יתָ בְכֹחֲךָ֛ אֶת־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה מִקִּרְבּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-y'hvah v'sham'v mitz'rayim kiy-he'eliyta v'khochakha et-ha'am hazeh mikir'bvo
translation: But Moses said to the L<small>ORD</small>, “When the Egyptians, from whose midst You brought up this people in Your might, hear the news,

hebrew: וְאָמְר֗וּ אֶל־יוֹשֵׁב֮ הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּאת֒ שָֽׁמְעוּ֙ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה יְהוָ֔ה בְּקֶ֖רֶב הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־עַ֨יִן בְּעַ֜יִן נִרְאָ֣ה ׀ אַתָּ֣ה יְהוָ֗ה וַעֲנָֽנְךָ֙ עֹמֵ֣ד עֲלֵהֶ֔ם וּבְעַמֻּ֣ד עָנָ֗ן אַתָּ֨ה הֹלֵ֤ךְ לִפְנֵיהֶם֙ יוֹמָ֔ם וּבְעַמּ֥וּד אֵ֖שׁ לָֽיְלָה׃
transliteration: v'am'rv el-yvoshev haaretz hazot sham'v kiy-atah y'hvah b'kerev ha'am hazeh asher-'ayin b'ayin nir'ah  atah y'hvah va'anan'kha 'omed 'alehem vv'amud 'anan atah holekh' lif'neyhem yvomam vv'amvd esh lay'lah
translation: they will tell it to the inhabitants of that land. Now they have heard that You, O L<small>ORD</small>, are in the midst of this people; that You, O L<small>ORD</small>, appear in plain sight when Your cloud rests over them and when You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.

hebrew: וְהֵמַתָּ֛ה אֶת־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה כְּאִ֣ישׁ אֶחָ֑ד וְאָֽמְרוּ֙ הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־שָׁמְע֥וּ אֶֽת־שִׁמְעֲךָ֖ לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: v'hematah et-ha'am hazeh k'iysh echad v'am'rv hagvoyim asher-sham'v et-shim'akha lemor
translation: If then You slay this people to a man, the nations who have heard Your fame will say,

hebrew: מִבִּלְתִּ֞י יְכֹ֣לֶת יְהוָ֗ה לְהָבִיא֙ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֣ע לָהֶ֑ם וַיִּשְׁחָטֵ֖ם בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
transliteration: mibil'tiy y'kholet y'hvah l'haviy et-ha'am hazeh el-haaretz asher-nish'ba' lahem vayish'chatem bamid'bar
translation: ‘It must be because the L<small>ORD</small> was powerless to bring that people into the land He had promised them on oath that He slaughtered them in the wilderness.’

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה יִגְדַּל־נָ֖א כֹּ֣חַ אֲדֹנָ֑י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: v'atah yig'dal-na kocha adonay kaasher dibar'ta lemor
translation: Therefore, I pray, let my Lord’s forbearance be great, as You have declared, saying,cCf. Exod. 34.6–7.

hebrew: יְהוָ֗ה אֶ֤רֶךְ אַפַּ֙יִם֙ וְרַב־חֶ֔סֶד נֹשֵׂ֥א עָוֺ֖ן וָפָ֑שַׁע וְנַקֵּה֙ לֹ֣א יְנַקֶּ֔ה פֹּקֵ֞ד עֲוֺ֤ן אָבוֹת֙ עַל־בָּנִ֔ים עַל־שִׁלֵּשִׁ֖ים וְעַל־רִבֵּעִֽים׃
transliteration: y'hvah erekh' apayim v'rav-chesed nose 'avon vafasha' v'nakeh lo y'nakeh poked 'avon avvot 'al-baniym 'al-shileshiym v'al-ribe'iym
translation: ‘The L<small>ORD</small>! slow to anger and abounding in kindness; forgiving iniquity and transgression; yet not remitting all punishment, but visiting the iniquity of parents upon children, upon the third and fourth generations.’

hebrew: סְלַֽח־נָ֗א לַעֲוֺ֛ן הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה כְּגֹ֣דֶל חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וְכַאֲשֶׁ֤ר נָשָׂ֙אתָה֙ לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם וְעַד־הֵֽנָּה׃
transliteration: s'lach-na la'avon ha'am hazeh k'godel chas'dekha v'khaasher nasatah la'am hazeh mimitz'rayim v'ad-henah
translation: Pardon, I pray, the iniquity of this people according to Your great kindness, as You have forgiven this people ever since Egypt.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָ֔ה סָלַ֖חְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah salach'tiy kid'varekha
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said, “I pardon, as you have asked.

hebrew: וְאוּלָ֖ם חַי־אָ֑נִי וְיִמָּלֵ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־כָּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'vlam chay-aniy v'yimale kh'vvod-y'hvah et-kal-haaretz
translation: Nevertheless, as I live and as the L<small>ORD</small>’s Presence fills the whole world,

hebrew: כִּ֣י כָל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים הָרֹאִ֤ים אֶת־כְּבֹדִי֙ וְאֶת־אֹ֣תֹתַ֔י אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֥יתִי בְמִצְרַ֖יִם וּבַמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַיְנַסּ֣וּ אֹתִ֗י זֶ֚ה עֶ֣שֶׂר פְּעָמִ֔ים וְלֹ֥א שָׁמְע֖וּ בְּקוֹלִֽי׃
transliteration: kiy khal-haanashiym haroiym et-k'vodiy v'et-ototay asher-'asiytiy v'mitz'rayim vvamid'bar vay'nasv otiy zeh 'eser p'amiym v'lo sham'v b'kvoliy
translation: none of the men who have seen My Presence and the signs that I have performed in Egypt and in the wilderness, and who have tried Me these manydLit. “ten”; cf. note at Gen. 31.41. times and have disobeyed Me,

hebrew: אִם־יִרְאוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖עְתִּי לַאֲבֹתָ֑ם וְכָל־מְנַאֲצַ֖י לֹ֥א יִרְאֽוּהָ׃
transliteration: im-yir'v et-haaretz asher nish'ba'tiy laavotam v'khal-m'naatzay lo yir'vha
translation: shall see the land that I promised on oath to their fathers; none of those who spurn Me shall see it.

hebrew: וְעַבְדִּ֣י כָלֵ֗ב עֵ֣קֶב הָֽיְתָ֞ה ר֤וּחַ אַחֶ֙רֶת֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וַיְמַלֵּ֖א אַחֲרָ֑י וַהֲבִֽיאֹתִ֗יו אֶל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣א שָׁ֔מָּה וְזַרְע֖וֹ יוֹרִשֶֽׁנָּה׃
transliteration: v'av'diy khalev 'ekev hay'tah rvcha acheret 'imvo vay'male acharay vahaviyotiyv el-haaretz asher-ba shamah v'zar'vo yvorishenah
translation: But My servant Caleb, because he was imbued with a different spirit and remained loyal to Me—him will I bring into the land that he entered, and his offspring shall hold it as a possession.

hebrew: וְהָֽעֲמָלֵקִ֥י וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בָּעֵ֑מֶק מָחָ֗ר פְּנ֨וּ וּסְע֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר דֶּ֥רֶךְ יַם־סֽוּף׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'ha'amalekiy v'hak'na'aniy yvoshev ba'emek machar p'nv vs'v lakhem hamid'bar derekh' yam-svf (f)
translation: Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites occupy the valleys. Start out, then, tomorrow and march into the wilderness by way of the Sea of Reeds.”eSee note at Exod. 10.19.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke further to Moses and Aaron,

hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֗י לָעֵדָ֤ה הָֽרָעָה֙ הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֛ר הֵ֥מָּה מַלִּינִ֖ים עָלָ֑י אֶת־תְּלֻנּ֞וֹת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵ֧מָּה מַלִּינִ֛ים עָלַ֖י שָׁמָֽעְתִּי׃
transliteration: 'ad-matay la'edah hara'ah hazot asher hemah maliyniym 'alay et-t'lunvot b'ney yis'rael asher hemah maliyniym 'alay shama'tiy
translation: “How much longer shall that wicked community keep muttering against Me? Very well, I have heeded the incessant muttering of the Israelites against Me.

hebrew: אֱמֹ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם חַי־אָ֙נִי֙ נְאֻם־יְהוָ֔ה אִם־לֹ֕א כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּרְתֶּ֖ם בְּאָזְנָ֑י כֵּ֖ן אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: emor alehem chay-aniy n'um-y'hvah im-lo kaasher dibar'tem b'az'nay ken e'eseh lakhem
translation: Say to them: ‘As I live,’ says the L<small>ORD</small>, ‘I will do to you just as you have urged Me.

hebrew: בַּמִּדְבָּ֣ר הַ֠זֶּה יִפְּל֨וּ פִגְרֵיכֶ֜ם וְכָל־פְּקֻדֵיכֶם֙ לְכָל־מִסְפַּרְכֶ֔ם מִבֶּ֛ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וָמָ֑עְלָה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֲלִֽינֹתֶ֖ם עָלָֽי׃
transliteration: bamid'bar hazeh yip'lv fig'reykhem v'khal-p'kudeykhem l'khal-mis'par'khem miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah asher haliynotem 'alay
translation: In this very wilderness shall your carcasses drop. Of all of you who were recorded in your various lists from the age of twenty years up, you who have muttered against Me,

hebrew: אִם־אַתֶּם֙ תָּבֹ֣אוּ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָשָׂ֙אתִי֙ אֶת־יָדִ֔י לְשַׁכֵּ֥ן אֶתְכֶ֖ם בָּ֑הּ כִּ֚י אִם־כָּלֵ֣ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֔ה וִיהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בִּן־נֽוּן׃
transliteration: im-atem tavov el-haaretz asher nasatiy et-yadiy l'shaken et'khem bah kiy im-kalev ben-y'funeh viyhvoshu'a bin-nvn
translation: not one shall enter the land in which I sworefLit. “raised My hand.” to settle you—save Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.

hebrew: וְטַ֨פְּכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲמַרְתֶּ֖ם לָבַ֣ז יִהְיֶ֑ה וְהֵבֵיאתִ֣י אֹתָ֔ם וְיָֽדְעוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר מְאַסְתֶּ֖ם בָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'tap'khem asher amar'tem lavaz yih'yeh v'heveytiy otam v'yad'v et-haaretz asher m'as'tem bah
translation: Your children who, you said, would be carried off—these will I allow to enter; they shall know the land that you have rejected.

hebrew: וּפִגְרֵיכֶ֖ם אַתֶּ֑ם יִפְּל֖וּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vfig'reykhem atem yip'lv bamid'bar hazeh
translation: But your carcasses shall drop in this wilderness,

hebrew: וּ֠בְנֵיכֶם יִהְי֨וּ רֹעִ֤ים בַּמִּדְבָּר֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְנָשְׂא֖וּ אֶת־זְנוּתֵיכֶ֑ם עַד־תֹּ֥ם פִּגְרֵיכֶ֖ם בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
transliteration: vv'neykhem yih'yv ro'iym bamid'bar ar'ba'iym shanah v'nas'v et-z'nvteykhem 'ad-tom pig'reykhem bamid'bar
translation: while your children roam the wilderness for forty years, suffering for your faithlessness, until the last of your carcasses is down in the wilderness.

hebrew: בְּמִסְפַּ֨ר הַיָּמִ֜ים אֲשֶׁר־תַּרְתֶּ֣ם אֶת־הָאָרֶץ֮ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים יוֹם֒ י֣וֹם לַשָּׁנָ֞ה י֣וֹם לַשָּׁנָ֗ה תִּשְׂאוּ֙ אֶת־עֲוֺנֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אַרְבָּעִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וִֽידַעְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־תְּנוּאָתִֽי׃
transliteration: b'mis'par hayamiym asher-tar'tem et-haaretz ar'ba'iym yvom yvom lashanah yvom lashanah tis'v et-'avonoteykhem ar'ba'iym shanah viyda'tem et-t'nvatiy
translation: You shall bear your punishment for forty years, corresponding to the number of days—forty days—that you scouted the land: a year for each day. Thus you shall know what it means to thwart Me.

hebrew: אֲנִ֣י יְהוָה֮ דִּבַּרְתִּי֒ אִם־לֹ֣א ׀ זֹ֣את אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֗ה לְכָל־הָעֵדָ֤ה הָֽרָעָה֙ הַזֹּ֔את הַנּוֹעָדִ֖ים עָלָ֑י בַּמִּדְבָּ֥ר הַזֶּ֛ה יִתַּ֖מּוּ וְשָׁ֥ם יָמֻֽתוּ׃
transliteration: aniy y'hvah dibar'tiy im-lo  zot e'eseh l'khal-ha'edah hara'ah hazot hanvo'adiym 'alay bamid'bar hazeh yitamv v'sham yamutv
translation: I the L<small>ORD</small> have spoken: Thus will I do to all that wicked band that has banded together against Me: in this very wilderness they shall die to the last man.’”

hebrew: וְהָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֖ה לָת֣וּר אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיָּשֻׁ֗בוּ וילונו [וַיַּלִּ֤ינוּ] עָלָיו֙ אֶת־כָּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה לְהוֹצִ֥יא דִבָּ֖ה עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'haanashiym asher-shalach mosheh latvr et-haaretz vayashuvv vylvnv [vayaliynv] 'alayv et-kal-ha'edah l'hvotziy dibah 'al-haaretz
translation: As for the men whom Moses sent to scout the land, those who came back and caused the whole community to mutter against him by spreading calumnies about the land—

hebrew: וַיָּמֻ֙תוּ֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים מוֹצִאֵ֥י דִבַּת־הָאָ֖רֶץ רָעָ֑ה בַּמַּגֵּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayamutv haanashiym mvotziey dibat-haaretz ra'ah bamagefah lif'ney y'hvah
translation: those who spread such calumnies about the land died of plague, by the will of the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וִיהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֔וּן וְכָלֵ֖ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֑ה חָיוּ֙ מִן־הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם הַֽהֹלְכִ֖ים לָת֥וּר אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: viyhvoshu'a bin-nvn v'khalev ben-y'funeh chayv min-haanashiym hahem hahol'khiym latvr et-haaretz
translation: Of those men who had gone to scout the land, only Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh survived.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֶֽל־כָּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּֽתְאַבְּל֥וּ הָעָ֖ם מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh et-had'variym haeleh el-kal-b'ney yis'rael vayit'ab'lv ha'am m'od
translation: When Moses repeated these words to all the Israelites, the people were overcome by grief.

hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֣מוּ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיַּֽעֲל֥וּ אֶל־רֹאשׁ־הָהָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֶּ֗נּוּ וְעָלִ֛ינוּ אֶל־הַמָּק֛וֹם אֲשֶׁר־אָמַ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה כִּ֥י חָטָֽאנוּ׃
transliteration: vayash'kimv vaboker vaya'alv el-rosh-hahar lemor hinenv v'aliynv el-hamakvom asher-amar y'hvah kiy chatanv
translation: Early next morning they set out toward the crest of the hill country, saying, “We are prepared to go up to the place that the L<small>ORD</small> has spoken of, for we were wrong.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֛ה אַתֶּ֥ם עֹבְרִ֖ים אֶת־פִּ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְהִ֖וא לֹ֥א תִצְלָֽח׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh lamah zeh atem 'ov'riym et-piy y'hvah v'hiv lo titz'lach
translation: But Moses said, “Why do you transgress the L<small>ORD</small>’s command? This will not succeed.

hebrew: אַֽל־תַּעֲל֔וּ כִּ֛י אֵ֥ין יְהוָ֖ה בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֑ם וְלֹא֙ תִּנָּ֣גְפ֔וּ לִפְנֵ֖י אֹיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: al-ta'alv kiy eyn y'hvah b'kir'b'khem v'lo tinag'fv lif'ney oy'veykhem
translation: Do not go up, lest you be routed by your enemies, for the L<small>ORD</small> is not in your midst.

hebrew: כִּי֩ הָעֲמָלֵקִ֨י וְהַכְּנַעֲנִ֥י שָׁם֙ לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם וּנְפַלְתֶּ֖ם בֶּחָ֑רֶב כִּֽי־עַל־כֵּ֤ן שַׁבְתֶּם֙ מֵאַחֲרֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה עִמָּכֶֽם׃
transliteration: kiy ha'amalekiy v'hak'na'aniy sham lif'neykhem vn'fal'tem becharev kiy-'al-ken shav'tem meacharey y'hvah v'lo-yih'yeh y'hvah 'imakhem
translation: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites will be there to face you, and you will fall by the sword, inasmuch as you have turned from following the L<small>ORD</small> and the L<small>ORD</small> will not be with you.”

hebrew: וַיַּעְפִּ֕לוּ לַעֲל֖וֹת אֶל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֑ר וַאֲר֤וֹן בְּרִית־יְהוָה֙ וּמֹשֶׁ֔ה לֹא־מָ֖שׁוּ מִקֶּ֥רֶב הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'pilv la'alvot el-rosh hahar vaarvon b'riyt-y'hvah vmosheh lo-mashv mikerev hamachaneh
translation: Yet defiantlygMeaning of Heb. uncertain. they marched toward the crest of the hill country, though neither the LORD’s Ark of the Covenant nor Moses stirred from the camp.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֤רֶד הָעֲמָלֵקִי֙ וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י הַיֹּשֵׁ֖ב בָּהָ֣ר הַה֑וּא וַיַּכּ֥וּם וַֽיַּכְּת֖וּם עַד־הַֽחָרְמָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayered ha'amalekiy v'hak'na'aniy hayoshev bahar hahv vayakvm vayak'tvm 'ad-hachar'mah (f)
translation: And the Amalekites and the Canaanites who dwelt in that hill country came down and dealt them a shattering blow at Hormah.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם כִּ֣י תָבֹ֗אוּ אֶל־אֶ֙רֶץ֙ מוֹשְׁבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem kiy tavov el-eretz mvosh'voteykhem asher aniy noten lakhem
translation:
Speak to the Israelite people and say to them:
When you enter the land that I am giving you to settle in,

hebrew: וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֨ם אִשֶּׁ֤ה לַֽיהוָה֙ עֹלָ֣ה אוֹ־זֶ֔בַח לְפַלֵּא־נֶ֙דֶר֙ א֣וֹ בִנְדָבָ֔ה א֖וֹ בְּמֹעֲדֵיכֶ֑ם לַעֲשׂ֞וֹת רֵ֤יחַ נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה מִן־הַבָּקָ֖ר א֥וֹ מִן־הַצֹּֽאן׃
transliteration: va'asiytem isheh layhvah 'olah vo-zevach l'fale-neder vo vin'davah vo b'mo'adeykhem la'asvot reycha niychocha layhvah min-habakar vo min-hatzon
translation: and would present an offering by fire to the LORD from the herd or from the flock, be it burnt offering or sacrifice, in fulfillment of a vow explicitly uttered,aSee note at Lev. 22.21. or as a freewill offering, or at your fixed occasions, producing an odor pleasing to the LORD:

hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֛יב הַמַּקְרִ֥יב קָרְבָּנ֖וֹ לַֽיהוָ֑ה מִנְחָה֙ סֹ֣לֶת עִשָּׂר֔וֹן בָּל֕וּל בִּרְבִעִ֥ית הַהִ֖ין שָֽׁמֶן׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyv hamak'riyv kar'banvo layhvah min'chah solet 'isarvon balvl bir'vi'iyt hahiyn shamen
translation: The person who presents the offering to the LORD shall bring as a meal offering: a tenth of a measure of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of oil mixed in.

hebrew: וְיַ֤יִן לַנֶּ֙סֶךְ֙ רְבִיעִ֣ית הַהִ֔ין תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה עַל־הָעֹלָ֖ה א֣וֹ לַזָּ֑בַח לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: v'yayin lanesekh' r'viy'iyt hahiyn ta'aseh 'al-ha'olah vo lazavach lakeves haechad
translation: You shall also offer, with the burnt offering or the sacrifice, a quarter of a hin of wine as a libation for each sheep.

hebrew: א֤וֹ לָאַ֙יִל֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה מִנְחָ֔ה סֹ֖לֶת שְׁנֵ֣י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֑ים בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן שְׁלִשִׁ֥ית הַהִֽין׃
transliteration: vo laayil ta'aseh min'chah solet sh'ney 'es'roniym b'lvlah vashemen sh'lishiyt hahiyn
translation: In the case of a ram, you shall present as a meal offering: two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with a third of a hin of oil mixed in;

hebrew: וְיַ֥יִן לַנֶּ֖סֶךְ שְׁלִשִׁ֣ית הַהִ֑ין תַּקְרִ֥יב רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'yayin lanesekh' sh'lishiyt hahiyn tak'riyv reycha-niychocha layhvah
translation: and a third of a hin of wine as a libation—as an offering of pleasing odor to the LORD.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־תַעֲשֶׂ֥ה בֶן־בָּקָ֖ר עֹלָ֣ה אוֹ־זָ֑בַח לְפַלֵּא־נֶ֥דֶר אֽוֹ־שְׁלָמִ֖ים לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'khiy-ta'aseh ven-bakar 'olah vo-zavach l'fale-neder vo-sh'lamiym layhvah
translation: And if it is an animal from the herd that you offer to the L<small>ORD</small> as a burnt offering or as a sacrifice, in fulfillment of a vow explicitly uttered or as an offering of well-being,

hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֤יב עַל־בֶּן־הַבָּקָר֙ מִנְחָ֔ה סֹ֖לֶת שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה עֶשְׂרֹנִ֑ים בָּל֥וּל בַּשֶּׁ֖מֶן חֲצִ֥י הַהִֽין׃
transliteration: v'hik'riyv 'al-ben-habakar min'chah solet sh'loshah 'es'roniym balvl bashemen chatziy hahiyn
translation: there shall be offered a meal offering along with the animal: three-tenths of a measure of choice flour with half a hin of oil mixed in;

hebrew: וְיַ֛יִן תַּקְרִ֥יב לַנֶּ֖סֶךְ חֲצִ֣י הַהִ֑ין אִשֵּׁ֥ה רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'yayin tak'riyv lanesekh' chatziy hahiyn isheh reycha-niychocha layhvah
translation: and as libation you shall offer half a hin of wine—these being offerings by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD.

hebrew: כָּ֣כָה יֵעָשֶׂ֗ה לַשּׁוֹר֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ד א֖וֹ לָאַ֣יִל הָאֶחָ֑ד אֽוֹ־לַשֶּׂ֥ה בַכְּבָשִׂ֖ים א֥וֹ בָעִזִּֽים׃
transliteration: kakhah ye'aseh lashvor haechad vo laayil haechad vo-laseh vak'vasiym vo va'iziym
translation: Thus shall be done with each ox, with each ram, and with any sheep or goat,

hebrew: כַּמִּסְפָּ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשׂ֑וּ כָּ֛כָה תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ לָאֶחָ֖ד כְּמִסְפָּרָֽם׃
transliteration: kamis'par asher ta'asv kakhah ta'asv laechad k'mis'param
translation: as many as you offer; you shall do thus with each one, as many as there are.

hebrew: כָּל־הָאֶזְרָ֥ח יַעֲשֶׂה־כָּ֖כָה אֶת־אֵ֑לֶּה לְהַקְרִ֛יב אִשֵּׁ֥ה רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: kal-haez'rach ya'aseh-kakhah et-eleh l'hak'riyv isheh reycha-niychocha layhvah
translation: Every citizen, when presenting an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>, shall do so with them.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָגוּר֩ אִתְּכֶ֨ם גֵּ֜ר א֤וֹ אֲשֶֽׁר־בְּתֽוֹכְכֶם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְעָשָׂ֛ה אִשֵּׁ֥ה רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשׂ֖וּ כֵּ֥ן יַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yagvr it'khem ger vo asher-b'tvokh'khem l'doroteykhem v'asah isheh reycha-niychocha layhvah kaasher ta'asv ken ya'aseh
translation: And when, throughout the ages, a stranger who has taken up residence with you, or one who lives among you, would present an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD—as you do, so bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.shall it be done by

hebrew: הַקָּהָ֕ל חֻקָּ֥ה אַחַ֛ת לָכֶ֖ם וְלַגֵּ֣ר הַגָּ֑ר חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם כָּכֶ֛ם כַּגֵּ֥ר יִהְיֶ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: hakahal chukah achat lakhem v'lager hagar chukat 'volam l'doroteykhem kakhem kager yih'yeh lif'ney y'hvah
translation: the rest of the congregation.<sup class="endFootnote">-b</sup> There shall be one law for you and for the resident stranger; it shall be a law for all time throughout the ages. You and the stranger shall be alike before the L<small>ORD</small>;

hebrew: תּוֹרָ֥ה אַחַ֛ת וּמִשְׁפָּ֥ט אֶחָ֖ד יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם וְלַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֥ר אִתְּכֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: tvorah achat vmish'pat echad yih'yeh lakhem v'lager hagar it'khem (f)
translation: the same ritual and the same rule shall apply to you and to the stranger who resides among you.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם בְּבֹֽאֲכֶם֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֛י מֵבִ֥יא אֶתְכֶ֖ם שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem b'voakhem el-haaretz asher aniy meviy et'khem shamah
translation:
Speak to the Israelite people and say to them:
When you enter the land to which I am taking you

hebrew: וְהָיָ֕ה בַּאֲכָלְכֶ֖ם מִלֶּ֣חֶם הָאָ֑רֶץ תָּרִ֥ימוּ תְרוּמָ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hayah baakhal'khem milechem haaretz tariymv t'rvmah layhvah
translation: and you eat of the bread of the land, you shall set some aside as a gift to the L<small>ORD</small>:

hebrew: רֵאשִׁית֙ עֲרִסֹ֣תֵכֶ֔ם חַלָּ֖ה תָּרִ֣ימוּ תְרוּמָ֑ה כִּתְרוּמַ֣ת גֹּ֔רֶן כֵּ֖ן תָּרִ֥ימוּ אֹתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: reshiyt 'arisotekhem chalah tariymv t'rvmah kit'rvmat goren ken tariymv otah
translation: as the first yield of your baking,cMeaning of Heb. ‘arisah uncertain. you shall set aside a loaf as a gift; you shall set it aside as a gift like the gift from the threshing floor.

hebrew: מֵרֵאשִׁית֙ עֲרִסֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם תִּתְּנ֥וּ לַיהוָ֖ה תְּרוּמָ֑ה לְדֹרֹ֖תֵיכֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: mereshiyt 'arisoteykhem tit'nv layhvah t'rvmah l'doroteykhem (s)
translation: You shall make a gift to the L<small>ORD</small> from the first yield of your baking, throughout the ages.

hebrew: וְכִ֣י תִשְׁגּ֔וּ וְלֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּ אֵ֥ת כָּל־הַמִּצְוֺ֖ת הָאֵ֑לֶּה אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'khiy tish'gv v'lo ta'asv et kal-hamitz'vot haeleh asher-diber y'hvah el-mosheh
translation: If you unwittingly fail to observe any one of the commandments that the L<small>ORD</small> has declared to Moses—

hebrew: אֵת֩ כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֑ה מִן־הַיּ֞וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה וָהָ֖לְאָה לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: et kal-asher tzivah y'hvah aleykhem b'yad-mosheh min-hayvom asher tzivah y'hvah vahal'ah l'doroteykhem
translation: anything that the L<small>ORD</small> has enjoined upon you through Moses—from the day that the L<small>ORD</small> gave the commandment and on through the ages:

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִ֣ם מֵעֵינֵ֣י הָעֵדָה֮ נֶעֶשְׂתָ֣ה לִשְׁגָגָה֒ וְעָשׂ֣וּ כָל־הָעֵדָ֡ה פַּ֣ר בֶּן־בָּקָר֩ אֶחָ֨ד לְעֹלָ֜ה לְרֵ֤יחַ נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה וּמִנְחָת֥וֹ וְנִסְכּ֖וֹ כַּמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט וּשְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד לְחַטָּֽת׃
transliteration: v'hayah im me'eyney ha'edah ne'es'tah lish'gagah v'asv khal-ha'edah par ben-bakar echad l'olah l'reycha niychocha layhvah vmin'chatvo v'nis'kvo kamish'pat vs'iyr-'iziym echad l'chatat
translation: If this was done unwittingly, through the inadvertence of the community, the whole community shall present one bull of the herd as a burnt offering of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>, with its proper meal offering and libation, and one he-goat as a sin offering.

hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֗ן עַֽל־כָּל־עֲדַ֛ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְנִסְלַ֣ח לָהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־שְׁגָגָ֣ה הִ֔וא וְהֵם֩ הֵבִ֨יאוּ אֶת־קָרְבָּנָ֜ם אִשֶּׁ֣ה לַֽיהוָ֗ה וְחַטָּאתָ֛ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה עַל־שִׁגְגָתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'khiper hakohen 'al-kal-'adat b'ney yis'rael v'nis'lach lahem kiy-sh'gagah hiv v'hem heviyv et-kar'banam isheh layhvah v'chatatam lif'ney y'hvah 'al-shig'gatam
translation: The priest shall make expiation for the whole Israelite community and they shall be forgiven; for it was an error, and for their error they have brought their offering, an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small> and their sin offering before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְנִסְלַ֗ח לְכָל־עֲדַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֣ר בְּתוֹכָ֑ם כִּ֥י לְכָל־הָעָ֖ם בִּשְׁגָגָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'nis'lach l'khal-'adat b'ney yis'rael v'lager hagar b'tvokham kiy l'khal-ha'am bish'gagah (s)
translation: The whole Israelite community and the stranger residing among them shall be forgiven, for it happened to the entire people through error.

hebrew: וְאִם־נֶ֥פֶשׁ אַחַ֖ת תֶּחֱטָ֣א בִשְׁגָגָ֑ה וְהִקְרִ֛יבָה עֵ֥ז בַּת־שְׁנָתָ֖הּ לְחַטָּֽאת׃
transliteration: v'im-nefesh achat techeta vish'gagah v'hik'riyvah 'ez bat-sh'natah l'chatat
translation: In case it is an individual who has sinned unwittingly, he shall offer a she-goat in its first year as a sin offering.

hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֗ן עַל־הַנֶּ֧פֶשׁ הַשֹּׁגֶ֛גֶת בְּחֶטְאָ֥ה בִשְׁגָגָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה לְכַפֵּ֥ר עָלָ֖יו וְנִסְלַ֥ח לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'khiper hakohen 'al-hanefesh hashogeget b'chet'ah vish'gagah lif'ney y'hvah l'khaper 'alayv v'nis'lach lvo
translation: The priest shall make expiation before the L<small>ORD</small> on behalf of the person who erred, for he sinned unwittingly, making such expiation for him that he may be forgiven.

hebrew: הָֽאֶזְרָח֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֣ר בְּתוֹכָ֑ם תּוֹרָ֤ה אַחַת֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם לָעֹשֶׂ֖ה בִּשְׁגָגָֽה׃
transliteration: haez'rach biv'ney yis'rael v'lager hagar b'tvokham tvorah achat yih'yeh lakhem la'oseh bish'gagah
translation: For the citizen among the Israelites and for the stranger who resides among them—you shall have one ritual for anyone who acts in error.

hebrew: וְהַנֶּ֜פֶשׁ אֲשֶֽׁר־תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה ׀ בְּיָ֣ד רָמָ֗ה מִן־הָֽאֶזְרָח֙ וּמִן־הַגֵּ֔ר אֶת־יְהוָ֖ה ה֣וּא מְגַדֵּ֑ף וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'hanefesh asher-ta'aseh  b'yad ramah min-haez'rach vmin-hager et-y'hvah hv m'gadef v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv mikerev 'amah
translation: But the person, be he citizen or stranger, who acts defiantlydLit. “with upraised hand.” reviles the LORD; that person shall be cut off from among his people.

hebrew: כִּ֤י דְבַר־יְהוָה֙ בָּזָ֔ה וְאֶת־מִצְוָת֖וֹ הֵפַ֑ר הִכָּרֵ֧ת ׀ תִּכָּרֵ֛ת הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא עֲוֺנָ֥ה בָֽהּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: kiy d'var-y'hvah bazah v'et-mitz'vatvo hefar hikaret  tikaret hanefesh hahiv 'avonah vah (f)
translation: Because he has spurned the word of the L<small>ORD</small> and violated His commandment, that person shall be cut off—he bears his guilt.

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַֽיִּמְצְא֗וּ אִ֛ישׁ מְקֹשֵׁ֥שׁ עֵצִ֖ים בְּי֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּֽת׃
transliteration: vayih'yv v'ney-yis'rael bamid'bar vayim'tz'v iysh m'koshesh 'etziym b'yvom hashabat
translation: Once, when the Israelites were in the wilderness, they came upon a man gathering wood on the sabbath day.

hebrew: וַיַּקְרִ֣יבוּ אֹת֔וֹ הַמֹּצְאִ֥ים אֹת֖וֹ מְקֹשֵׁ֣שׁ עֵצִ֑ים אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְאֶ֖ל כָּל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
transliteration: vayak'riyvv otvo hamotz'iym otvo m'koshesh 'etziym el-mosheh v'el-aharon v'el kal-ha'edah
translation: Those who found him as he was gathering wood brought him before Moses, Aaron, and the whole community.

hebrew: וַיַּנִּ֥יחוּ אֹת֖וֹ בַּמִּשְׁמָ֑ר כִּ֚י לֹ֣א פֹרַ֔שׁ מַה־יֵּעָשֶׂ֖ה לֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayaniychv otvo bamish'mar kiy lo forash mah-ye'aseh lvo (s)
translation: He was placed in custody, for it had not been specified what should be done to him.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה מ֥וֹת יוּמַ֖ת הָאִ֑ישׁ רָג֨וֹם אֹת֤וֹ בָֽאֲבָנִים֙ כָּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh mvot yvmat haiysh ragvom otvo vaavaniym kal-ha'edah michvtz lamachaneh
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “The man shall be put to death: the whole community shall pelt him with stones outside the camp.”

hebrew: וַיֹּצִ֨יאוּ אֹת֜וֹ כָּל־הָעֵדָ֗ה אֶל־מִחוּץ֙ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַיִּרְגְּמ֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ בָּאֲבָנִ֖ים וַיָּמֹ֑ת כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayotziyv otvo kal-ha'edah el-michvtz lamachaneh vayir'g'mv otvo baavaniym vayamot kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (f)
translation: So the whole community took him outside the camp and stoned him to death—as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses as follows:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם וְעָשׂ֨וּ לָהֶ֥ם צִיצִ֛ת עַל־כַּנְפֵ֥י בִגְדֵיהֶ֖ם לְדֹרֹתָ֑ם וְנָֽתְנ֛וּ עַל־צִיצִ֥ת הַכָּנָ֖ף פְּתִ֥יל תְּכֵֽלֶת׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem v'asv lahem tziytzit 'al-kan'fey vig'deyhem l'dorotam v'nat'nv 'al-tziytzit hakanaf p'tiyl t'khelet
translation: Speak to the Israelite people and instruct them to make for themselves fringes on the corners of their garments throughout the ages; let them attach a cord of blue to the fringe at each corner.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה לָכֶם֮ לְצִיצִת֒ וּרְאִיתֶ֣ם אֹת֗וֹ וּזְכַרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־כָּל־מִצְוֺ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם וְלֹֽא־תָתֻ֜רוּ אַחֲרֵ֤י לְבַבְכֶם֙ וְאַחֲרֵ֣י עֵֽינֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֥ם זֹנִ֖ים אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hayah lakhem l'tziytzit vr'iytem otvo vz'khar'tem et-kal-mitz'vot y'hvah va'asiytem otam v'lo-taturv acharey l'vav'khem v'acharey 'eyneykhem asher-atem zoniym achareyhem
translation: That shall be your fringe; look at it and recall all the commandments of the L<small>ORD</small> and observe them, so that you do not follow your heart and eyes in your lustful urge.

hebrew: לְמַ֣עַן תִּזְכְּר֔וּ וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֶת־כָּל־מִצְוֺתָ֑י וִהְיִיתֶ֥ם קְדֹשִׁ֖ים לֵֽאלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: l'ma'an tiz'k'rv va'asiytem et-kal-mitz'votay vih'yiytem k'doshiym leloheykhem
translation: Thus you shall be reminded to observe all My commandments and to be holy to your God.

hebrew: אֲנִ֞י יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצֵ֤אתִי אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לִהְי֥וֹת לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִ֑ים אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: aniy y'hvah eloheykhem asher hvotzetiy et'khem meeretz mitz'rayim lih'yvot lakhem lelohiym aniy y'hvah eloheykhem (f)
translation: I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God: I, the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח קֹ֔רַח בֶּן־יִצְהָ֥ר בֶּן־קְהָ֖ת בֶּן־לֵוִ֑י וְדָתָ֨ן וַאֲבִירָ֜ם בְּנֵ֧י אֱלִיאָ֛ב וְא֥וֹן בֶּן־פֶּ֖לֶת בְּנֵ֥י רְאוּבֵֽן׃
transliteration: vayikach korach ben-yitz'har ben-k'hat ben-leviy v'datan vaaviyram b'ney eliyav v'von ben-pelet b'ney r'vven
translation: Now Korah, son of Izhar son of Kohath son of Levi, aLit. “took”; meaning of Heb. uncertain.betook himself,-a along with Dathan and Abiram sons of Eliab, bAccording to Num. 26.5, 8–9, Eliab was son of Pallu, son of Reuben.and On son of Peleth—descendants of Reuben-b—

hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֙מוּ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַאֲנָשִׁ֥ים מִבְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וּמָאתָ֑יִם נְשִׂיאֵ֥י עֵדָ֛ה קְרִאֵ֥י מוֹעֵ֖ד אַנְשֵׁי־שֵֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayakumv lif'ney mosheh vaanashiym mib'ney-yis'rael chamishiym vmatayim n'siyey 'edah k'riey mvo'ed an'shey-shem
translation: to rise up against Moses, together with two hundred and fifty Israelites, chieftains of the community, chosen in the assembly, men of repute.

hebrew: וַיִּֽקָּהֲל֞וּ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֲלֵהֶם֮ רַב־לָכֶם֒ כִּ֤י כָל־הָֽעֵדָה֙ כֻּלָּ֣ם קְדֹשִׁ֔ים וּבְתוֹכָ֖ם יְהוָ֑ה וּמַדּ֥וּעַ תִּֽתְנַשְּׂא֖וּ עַל־קְהַ֥ל יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayikahalv 'al-mosheh v'al-aharon vayom'rv alehem rav-lakhem kiy khal-ha'edah kulam k'doshiym vv'tvokham y'hvah vmadv'a tit'nas'v 'al-k'hal y'hvah
translation: They combined against Moses and Aaron and said to them, “You have gone too far! For all the community are holy, all of them, and the L<small>ORD</small> is in their midst. Why then do you raise yourselves above the L<small>ORD</small>’s congregation?”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיִּפֹּ֖ל עַל־פָּנָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' mosheh vayipol 'al-panayv
translation: When Moses heard this, he fell on his face.cPerhaps in the sense of “his face fell.”

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר אֶל־קֹ֜רַח וְאֶֽל־כָּל־עֲדָתוֹ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ בֹּ֠קֶר וְיֹדַ֨ע יְהוָ֧ה אֶת־אֲשֶׁר־ל֛וֹ וְאֶת־הַקָּד֖וֹשׁ וְהִקְרִ֣יב אֵלָ֑יו וְאֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִבְחַר־בּ֖וֹ יַקְרִ֥יב אֵלָֽיו׃
transliteration: vay'daber el-korach v'el-kal-'adatvo lemor boker v'yoda' y'hvah et-asher-lvo v'et-hakadvosh v'hik'riyv elayv v'et asher yiv'char-bvo yak'riyv elayv
translation: Then he spoke to Korah and all his company, saying, “Come morning, the L<small>ORD</small> will make known who is His and who is holy, and will grant him access to Himself; He will grant access to the one He has chosen.

hebrew: זֹ֖את עֲשׂ֑וּ קְחוּ־לָכֶ֣ם מַחְתּ֔וֹת קֹ֖רַח וְכָל־עֲדָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: zot 'asv k'chv-lakhem mach'tvot korach v'khal-'adatvo
translation: Do this: You, Korah and all yourdLit. “his.” band, take fire pans,

hebrew: וּתְנ֣וּ בָהֵ֣ן ׀ אֵ֡שׁ וְשִׂימוּ֩ עֲלֵיהֶ֨ן קְטֹ֜רֶת לִפְנֵ֤י יְהוָה֙ מָחָ֔ר וְהָיָ֗ה הָאִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה ה֣וּא הַקָּד֑וֹשׁ רַב־לָכֶ֖ם בְּנֵ֥י לֵוִֽי׃
transliteration: vt'nv vahen  esh v'siymv 'aleyhen k'toret lif'ney y'hvah machar v'hayah haiysh asher-yiv'char y'hvah hv hakadvosh rav-lakhem b'ney leviy
translation: and tomorrow put fire in them and lay incense on them before the L<small>ORD</small>. Then the man whom the L<small>ORD</small> chooses, he shall be the holy one. You have gone too far, sons of Levi!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־קֹ֑רַח שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י לֵוִֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-korach shim'v-na b'ney leviy
translation: Moses said further to Korah, “Hear me, sons of Levi.

hebrew: הַמְעַ֣ט מִכֶּ֗ם כִּֽי־הִבְדִּיל֩ אֱלֹהֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵעֲדַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְהַקְרִ֥יב אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֵלָ֑יו לַעֲבֹ֗ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַת֙ מִשְׁכַּ֣ן יְהוָ֔ה וְלַעֲמֹ֛ד לִפְנֵ֥י הָעֵדָ֖ה לְשָׁרְתָֽם׃
transliteration: ham'at mikem kiy-hiv'diyl elohey yis'rael et'khem me'adat yis'rael l'hak'riyv et'khem elayv la'avod et-'avodat mish'kan y'hvah v'la'amod lif'ney ha'edah l'shar'tam
translation: Is it not enough for you that the God of Israel has set you apart from the community of Israel and given you access to Him, to perform the duties of the L<small>ORD</small>’s Tabernacle and to minister to the community and serve them?

hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵב֙ אֹֽתְךָ֔ וְאֶת־כָּל־אַחֶ֥יךָ בְנֵי־לֵוִ֖י אִתָּ֑ךְ וּבִקַּשְׁתֶּ֖ם גַּם־כְּהֻנָּֽה׃
transliteration: vayak'rev ot'kha v'et-kal-acheykha v'ney-leviy itakh' vvikash'tem gam-k'hunah
translation: Now that He has advanced you and all your fellow Levites with you, do you seek the priesthood too?

hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן אַתָּה֙ וְכָל־עֲדָ֣תְךָ֔ הַנֹּעָדִ֖ים עַל־יְהוָ֑ה וְאַהֲרֹ֣ן מַה־ה֔וּא כִּ֥י תלונו [תַלִּ֖ינוּ] עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: lakhen atah v'khal-'adat'kha hano'adiym 'al-y'hvah v'aharon mah-hv kiy tlvnv [taliynv] 'alayv
translation: Truly, it is against the L<small>ORD</small> that you and all your company have banded together. For who is Aaron that you should rail against him?”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח מֹשֶׁ֔ה לִקְרֹ֛א לְדָתָ֥ן וְלַאֲבִירָ֖ם בְּנֵ֣י אֱלִיאָ֑ב וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ לֹ֥א נַעֲלֶֽה׃
transliteration: vayish'lach mosheh lik'ro l'datan v'laaviyram b'ney eliyav vayom'rv lo na'aleh
translation: Moses sent for Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab; but they said, “We will not come!

hebrew: הַמְעַ֗ט כִּ֤י הֶֽעֱלִיתָ֙נוּ֙ מֵאֶ֨רֶץ זָבַ֤ת חָלָב֙ וּדְבַ֔שׁ לַהֲמִיתֵ֖נוּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר כִּֽי־תִשְׂתָּרֵ֥ר עָלֵ֖ינוּ גַּם־הִשְׂתָּרֵֽר׃
transliteration: ham'at kiy he'eliytanv meeretz zavat chalav vd'vash lahamiytenv bamid'bar kiy-tis'tarer 'aleynv gam-his'tarer
translation: Is it not enough that you brought us from a land flowing with milk and honey to have us die in the wilderness, that you would also lord it over us?

hebrew: אַ֡ף לֹ֣א אֶל־אֶרֶץ֩ זָבַ֨ת חָלָ֤ב וּדְבַשׁ֙ הֲבִ֣יאֹתָ֔נוּ וַתִּ֨תֶּן־לָ֔נוּ נַחֲלַ֖ת שָׂדֶ֣ה וָכָ֑רֶם הַעֵינֵ֞י הָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים הָהֵ֛ם תְּנַקֵּ֖ר לֹ֥א נַעֲלֶֽה׃
transliteration: af lo el-eretz zavat chalav vd'vash haviyotanv vatiten-lanv nachalat sadeh vakharem ha'eyney haanashiym hahem t'naker lo na'aleh
translation: eLit. “You have not even.”Even if you had-e brought us to a land flowing with milk and honey, and given us possession of fields and vineyards, should you gouge out those men’s eyes?f“Those men’s” is a euphemism for “our”; cf. 1 Sam 29.4. Gouging out the eyes was punishment for runaway slaves and rebellious vassals; cf. 2 Kings 25.4–7; Jer. 39.4–7, 52.7–11. We will not come!”

hebrew: וַיִּ֤חַר לְמֹשֶׁה֙ מְאֹ֔ד וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה אַל־תֵּ֖פֶן אֶל־מִנְחָתָ֑ם לֹ֠א חֲמ֨וֹר אֶחָ֤ד מֵהֶם֙ נָשָׂ֔אתִי וְלֹ֥א הֲרֵעֹ֖תִי אֶת־אַחַ֥ד מֵהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayichar l'mosheh m'od vayomer el-y'hvah al-tefen el-min'chatam lo chamvor echad mehem nasatiy v'lo hare'otiy et-achad mehem
translation: Moses was much aggrieved and he said to the L<small>ORD</small>, “Pay no regard to their oblation. I have not taken the ass of any one of them, nor have I wronged any one of them.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־קֹ֔רַח אַתָּה֙ וְכָל־עֲדָ֣תְךָ֔ הֱי֖וּ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה אַתָּ֥ה וָהֵ֛ם וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן מָחָֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-korach atah v'khal-'adat'kha heyv lif'ney y'hvah atah vahem v'aharon machar
translation: And Moses said to Korah, “Tomorrow, you and all your company appear before the L<small>ORD</small>, you and they and Aaron.

hebrew: וּקְח֣וּ ׀ אִ֣ישׁ מַחְתָּת֗וֹ וּנְתַתֶּ֤ם עֲלֵיהֶם֙ קְטֹ֔רֶת וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֞ם לִפְנֵ֤י יְהוָה֙ אִ֣ישׁ מַחְתָּת֔וֹ חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמָאתַ֖יִם מַחְתֹּ֑ת וְאַתָּ֥ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן אִ֥ישׁ מַחְתָּתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vk'chv  iysh mach'tatvo vn'tatem 'aleyhem k'toret v'hik'rav'tem lif'ney y'hvah iysh mach'tatvo chamishiym vmatayim mach'tot v'atah v'aharon iysh mach'tatvo
translation: Each of you take his fire pan and lay incense on it, and each of you bring his fire pan before the L<small>ORD</small>, two hundred and fifty fire pans; you and Aaron also [bring] your fire pans.”

hebrew: וַיִּקְח֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ מַחְתָּת֗וֹ וַיִּתְּנ֤וּ עֲלֵיהֶם֙ אֵ֔שׁ וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם קְטֹ֑רֶת וַֽיַּעַמְד֗וּ פֶּ֛תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וּמֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאַהֲרֹֽן׃
transliteration: vayik'chv iysh mach'tatvo vayit'nv 'aleyhem esh vayasiymv 'aleyhem k'toret vaya'am'dv petach ohel mvo'ed vmosheh v'aharon
translation: Each of them took his fire pan, put fire in it, laid incense on it, and took his place at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, as did Moses and Aaron.

hebrew: וַיַּקְהֵ֨ל עֲלֵיהֶ֥ם קֹ֙רַח֙ אֶת־כָּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וַיֵּרָ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־כָּל־הָעֵדָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayak'hel 'aleyhem korach et-kal-ha'edah el-petach ohel mvo'ed vayera kh'vvod-y'hvah el-kal-ha'edah (f)
translation:
Korah gathered the whole community against them at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
Then the Presence of the LORD appeared to the whole community,

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon lemor
translation: and the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,

hebrew: הִבָּ֣דְל֔וּ מִתּ֖וֹךְ הָעֵדָ֣ה הַזֹּ֑את וַאַכַלֶּ֥ה אֹתָ֖ם כְּרָֽגַע׃
transliteration: hibad'lv mitvokh' ha'edah hazot vaakhaleh otam k'raga'
translation: “Stand back from this community that I may annihilate them in an instant!”

hebrew: וַיִּפְּל֤וּ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶם֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֵ֕ל אֱלֹהֵ֥י הָרוּחֹ֖ת לְכָל־בָּשָׂ֑ר הָאִ֤ישׁ אֶחָד֙ יֶחֱטָ֔א וְעַ֥ל כָּל־הָעֵדָ֖ה תִּקְצֹֽף׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayip'lv 'al-p'neyhem vayom'rv el elohey harvchot l'khal-basar haiysh echad yecheta v'al kal-ha'edah tik'tzof (f)
translation: But they fell on their faces and said, “O God, SourcegLit. “God.” of the breath of all flesh! When one man sins, will You be wrathful with the whole community?”

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying,

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֥ר אֶל־הָעֵדָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר הֵֽעָלוּ֙ מִסָּבִ֔יב לְמִשְׁכַּן־קֹ֖רַח דָּתָ֥ן וַאֲבִירָֽם׃
transliteration: daber el-ha'edah lemor he'alv misaviyv l'mish'kan-korach datan vaaviyram
translation: “Speak to the community and say: Withdraw from about the abodes of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֣קָם מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ אֶל־דָּתָ֣ן וַאֲבִירָ֑ם וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ אַחֲרָ֖יו זִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayakam mosheh vayelekh' el-datan vaaviyram vayel'khv acharayv zik'ney yis'rael
translation: Moses rose and went to Dathan and Abiram, the elders of Israel following him.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר אֶל־הָעֵדָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר ס֣וּרוּ נָ֡א מֵעַל֩ אָהֳלֵ֨י הָאֲנָשִׁ֤ים הָֽרְשָׁעִים֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה וְאַֽל־תִּגְּע֖וּ בְּכָל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם פֶּן־תִּסָּפ֖וּ בְּכָל־חַטֹּאתָֽם׃
transliteration: vay'daber el-ha'edah lemor svrv na me'al aholey haanashiym har'sha'iym haeleh v'al-tig'v b'khal-asher lahem pen-tisafv b'khal-chatotam
translation: He addressed the community, saying, “Move away from the tents of these wicked men and touch nothing that belongs to them, lest you be wiped out for all their sins.”

hebrew: וַיֵּעָל֗וּ מֵעַ֧ל מִשְׁכַּן־קֹ֛רֶח דָּתָ֥ן וַאֲבִירָ֖ם מִסָּבִ֑יב וְדָתָ֨ן וַאֲבִירָ֜ם יָצְא֣וּ נִצָּבִ֗ים פֶּ֚תַח אָֽהֳלֵיהֶ֔ם וּנְשֵׁיהֶ֥ם וּבְנֵיהֶ֖ם וְטַפָּֽם׃
transliteration: vaye'alv me'al mish'kan-korech datan vaaviyram misaviyv v'datan vaaviyram yatz'v nitzaviym petach aholeyhem vn'sheyhem vv'neyhem v'tapam
translation:
So they withdrew from about the abodes of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.
Now Dathan and Abiram had come out and they stood at the entrance of their tents, with their wives, their children, and their little ones.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֮ מֹשֶׁה֒ בְּזֹאת֙ תֵּֽדְע֔וּן כִּֽי־יְהוָ֣ה שְׁלָחַ֔נִי לַעֲשׂ֕וֹת אֵ֥ת כָּל־הַֽמַּעֲשִׂ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה כִּי־לֹ֖א מִלִּבִּֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh b'zot ted'vn kiy-y'hvah sh'lachaniy la'asvot et kal-hama'asiym haeleh kiy-lo milibiy
translation: And Moses said, “By this you shall know that it was the L<small>ORD</small> who sent me to do all these things; that they are not of my own devising:

hebrew: אִם־כְּמ֤וֹת כָּל־הָֽאָדָם֙ יְמֻת֣וּן אֵ֔לֶּה וּפְקֻדַּת֙ כָּל־הָ֣אָדָ֔ם יִפָּקֵ֖ד עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם לֹ֥א יְהוָ֖ה שְׁלָחָֽנִי׃
transliteration: im-k'mvot kal-haadam y'mutvn eleh vf'kudat kal-haadam yipaked 'aleyhem lo y'hvah sh'lachaniy
translation: if these men die as all men do, if their lot be the common fate of all mankind, it was not the L<small>ORD</small> who sent me.

hebrew: וְאִם־בְּרִיאָ֞ה יִבְרָ֣א יְהוָ֗ה וּפָצְתָ֨ה הָאֲדָמָ֤ה אֶת־פִּ֙יהָ֙ וּבָלְעָ֤ה אֹתָם֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָהֶ֔ם וְיָרְד֥וּ חַיִּ֖ים שְׁאֹ֑לָה וִֽידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֧י נִֽאֲצ֛וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה אֶת־יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'im-b'riyah yiv'ra y'hvah vfatz'tah haadamah et-piyha vval'ah otam v'et-kal-asher lahem v'yar'dv chayiym sh'olah viyda'tem kiy niatzv haanashiym haeleh et-y'hvah
translation: But if the L<small>ORD</small> brings about something unheard-of, so that the ground opens its mouth and swallows them up with all that belongs to them, and they go down alive into Sheol, you shall know that these men have spurned the L<small>ORD</small>.”

hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ כְּכַלֹּת֔וֹ לְדַבֵּ֕ר אֵ֥ת כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַתִּבָּקַ֥ע הָאֲדָמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּחְתֵּיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy k'khalotvo l'daber et kal-had'variym haeleh vatibaka' haadamah asher tach'teyhem
translation: Scarcely had he finished speaking all these words when the ground under them burst asunder,

hebrew: וַתִּפְתַּ֤ח הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֶת־פִּ֔יהָ וַתִּבְלַ֥ע אֹתָ֖ם וְאֶת־בָּתֵּיהֶ֑ם וְאֵ֤ת כָּל־הָאָדָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְקֹ֔רַח וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־הָרֲכֽוּשׁ׃
transliteration: vatif'tach haaretz et-piyha vativ'la' otam v'et-bateyhem v'et kal-haadam asher l'korach v'et kal-harakhvsh
translation: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up with their households, all Korah’s people and all their possessions.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨רְד֜וּ הֵ֣ם וְכָל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָהֶ֛ם חַיִּ֖ים שְׁאֹ֑לָה וַתְּכַ֤ס עֲלֵיהֶם֙ הָאָ֔רֶץ וַיֹּאבְד֖וּ מִתּ֥וֹךְ הַקָּהָֽל׃
transliteration: vayer'dv hem v'khal-asher lahem chayiym sh'olah vat'khas 'aleyhem haaretz vayov'dv mitvokh' hakahal
translation: They went down alive into Sheol, with all that belonged to them; the earth closed over them and they vanished from the midst of the congregation.

hebrew: וְכָל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֛ר סְבִיבֹתֵיהֶ֖ם נָ֣סוּ לְקֹלָ֑ם כִּ֣י אָֽמְר֔וּ פֶּן־תִּבְלָעֵ֖נוּ הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'khal-yis'rael asher s'viyvoteyhem nasv l'kolam kiy am'rv pen-tiv'la'env haaretz
translation: All Israel around them fled at their shrieks, for they said, “The earth might swallow us!”

hebrew: וְאֵ֥שׁ יָצְאָ֖ה מֵאֵ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה וַתֹּ֗אכַל אֵ֣ת הַחֲמִשִּׁ֤ים וּמָאתַ֙יִם֙ אִ֔ישׁ מַקְרִיבֵ֖י הַקְּטֹֽרֶת׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'esh yatz'ah meet y'hvah vatokhal et hachamishiym vmatayim iysh mak'riyvey hak'toret (f)
translation: And a fire went forth from the L<small>ORD</small> and consumed the two hundred and fifty men offering the incense.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: אֱמֹ֨ר אֶל־אֶלְעָזָ֜ר בֶּן־אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְיָרֵ֤ם אֶת־הַמַּחְתֹּת֙ מִבֵּ֣ין הַשְּׂרֵפָ֔ה וְאֶת־הָאֵ֖שׁ זְרֵה־הָ֑לְאָה כִּ֖י קָדֵֽשׁוּ׃
transliteration: emor el-el'azar ben-aharon hakohen v'yarem et-hamach'tot mibeyn has'refah v'et-haesh z'reh-hal'ah kiy kadeshv
translation: Order Eleazar son of Aaron the priest to remove the fire pans—for they have become sacred—from among the charred remains; and scatter the coals abroad.

hebrew: אֵ֡ת מַחְתּוֹת֩ הַֽחַטָּאִ֨ים הָאֵ֜לֶּה בְּנַפְשֹׁתָ֗ם וְעָשׂ֨וּ אֹתָ֜ם רִקֻּעֵ֤י פַחִים֙ צִפּ֣וּי לַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ כִּֽי־הִקְרִיבֻ֥ם לִפְנֵֽי־יְהוָ֖ה וַיִּקְדָּ֑שׁוּ וְיִֽהְי֥וּ לְא֖וֹת לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: et mach'tvot hachataiym haeleh b'naf'shotam v'asv otam riku'ey fachiym tzipvy lamiz'becha kiy-hik'riyvum lif'ney-y'hvah vayik'dashv v'yih'yv l'vot liv'ney yis'rael
translation: aMeaning of parts of verse uncertain.[Remove] the fire pans of those who have sinned at the cost of their lives, and let them be made into hammered sheets as plating for the altar—for once they have been used for offering to the LORD, they have become sacred—and let them serve as a warning to the people of Israel.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֗ן אֵ֚ת מַחְתּ֣וֹת הַנְּחֹ֔שֶׁת אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִקְרִ֖יבוּ הַשְּׂרֻפִ֑ים וַֽיְרַקְּע֖וּם צִפּ֥וּי לַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: vayikach el'azar hakohen et mach'tvot han'choshet asher hik'riyvv has'rufiym vay'rak'vm tzipvy lamiz'becha
translation: Eleazar the priest took the copper fire pans which had been used for offering by those who died in the fire; and they were hammered into plating for the altar,

hebrew: זִכָּר֞וֹן לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לְ֠מַעַן אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־יִקְרַ֜ב אִ֣ישׁ זָ֗ר אֲ֠שֶׁר לֹ֣א מִזֶּ֤רַע אַהֲרֹן֙ ה֔וּא לְהַקְטִ֥יר קְטֹ֖רֶת לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֤ה כְקֹ֙רַח֙ וְכַ֣עֲדָת֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֖ה לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: zikarvon liv'ney yis'rael l'ma'an asher lo-yik'rav iysh zar asher lo mizera' aharon hv l'hak'tiyr k'toret lif'ney y'hvah v'lo-yih'yeh kh'korach v'kha'adatvo kaasher diber y'hvah b'yad-mosheh lvo
translation: as the L<small>ORD</small> had ordered him through Moses. It was to be a reminder to the Israelites, so that no outsider—one not of Aaron’s offspring—should presume to offer incense before the L<small>ORD</small> and suffer the fate of Korah and his band.

hebrew: וַיִּלֹּ֜נוּ כָּל־עֲדַ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִֽמָּחֳרָ֔ת עַל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹ֑ר אַתֶּ֥ם הֲמִתֶּ֖ם אֶת־עַ֥ם יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayilonv kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael mimachorat 'al-mosheh v'al-aharon lemor atem hamitem et-'am y'hvah
translation: Next day the whole Israelite community railed against Moses and Aaron, saying, “You two have brought death upon the L<small>ORD</small>’s people!”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּהִקָּהֵ֤ל הָֽעֵדָה֙ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן וַיִּפְנוּ֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וְהִנֵּ֥ה כִסָּ֖הוּ הֶעָנָ֑ן וַיֵּרָ֖א כְּב֥וֹד יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'hiy b'hikahel ha'edah 'al-mosheh v'al-aharon vayif'nv el-ohel mvo'ed v'hineh khisahv he'anan vayera k'vvod y'hvah
translation: But as the community gathered against them, Moses and Aaron turned toward the Tent of Meeting; the cloud had covered it and the Presence of the L<small>ORD</small> appeared.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן אֶל־פְּנֵ֖י אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayavo mosheh v'aharon el-p'ney ohel mvo'ed (f)
translation: When Moses and Aaron reached the Tent of Meeting,

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying,

hebrew: הֵרֹ֗מּוּ מִתּוֹךְ֙ הָעֵדָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את וַאֲכַלֶּ֥ה אֹתָ֖ם כְּרָ֑גַע וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: heromv mitvokh' ha'edah hazot vaakhaleh otam k'raga' vayip'lv 'al-p'neyhem
translation: “Remove yourselves from this community, that I may annihilate them in an instant.” They fell on their faces.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן קַ֣ח אֶת־הַ֠מַּחְתָּה וְתֶן־עָלֶ֨יהָ אֵ֜שׁ מֵעַ֤ל הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ וְשִׂ֣ים קְטֹ֔רֶת וְהוֹלֵ֧ךְ מְהֵרָ֛ה אֶל־הָעֵדָ֖ה וְכַפֵּ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־יָצָ֥א הַקֶּ֛צֶף מִלִּפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה הֵחֵ֥ל הַנָּֽגֶף׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon kach et-hamach'tah v'ten-'aleyha esh me'al hamiz'becha v'siym k'toret v'hvolekh' m'herah el-ha'edah v'khaper 'aleyhem kiy-yatza haketzef milif'ney y'hvah hechel hanagef
translation: Then Moses said to Aaron, “Take the fire pan, and put on it fire from the altar. Add incense and take it quickly to the community and make expiation for them. For wrath has gone forth from the L<small>ORD</small>: the plague has begun!”

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַהֲרֹ֜ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ דִּבֶּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיָּ֙רָץ֙ אֶל־תּ֣וֹך הַקָּהָ֔ל וְהִנֵּ֛ה הֵחֵ֥ל הַנֶּ֖גֶף בָּעָ֑ם וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶֽת־הַקְּטֹ֔רֶת וַיְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־הָעָֽם׃
transliteration: vayikach aharon kaasher  diber mosheh vayaratz el-tvokh hakahal v'hineh hechel hanegef ba'am vayiten et-hak'toret vay'khaper 'al-ha'am
translation: Aaron took it, as Moses had ordered, and ran to the midst of the congregation, where the plague had begun among the people. He put on the incense and made expiation for the people;

hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֥ד בֵּֽין־הַמֵּתִ֖ים וּבֵ֣ין הַֽחַיִּ֑ים וַתֵּעָצַ֖ר הַמַּגֵּפָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'amod beyn-hametiym vveyn hachayiym vate'atzar hamagefah
translation: he stood between the dead and the living until the plague was checked.

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֗וּ הַמֵּתִים֙ בַּמַּגֵּפָ֔ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁבַ֣ע מֵא֑וֹת מִלְּבַ֥ד הַמֵּתִ֖ים עַל־דְּבַר־קֹֽרַח׃
transliteration: vayih'yv hametiym bamagefah ar'ba'ah 'asar elef vsh'va' mevot mil'vad hametiym 'al-d'var-korach
translation: Those who died of the plague came to fourteen thousand and seven hundred, aside from those who died on account of Korah.

hebrew: וַיָּ֤שָׁב אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהַמַּגֵּפָ֖ה נֶעֱצָֽרָה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayashav aharon el-mosheh el-petach ohel mvo'ed v'hamagefah ne'etzarah (f)
translation: Aaron then returned to Moses at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, since the plague was checked.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּ֣ר ׀ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְקַ֣ח מֵֽאִתָּ֡ם מַטֶּ֣ה מַטֶּה֩ לְבֵ֨ית אָ֜ב מֵאֵ֤ת כָּל־נְשִֽׂיאֵהֶם֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֔ם שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר מַטּ֑וֹת אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־שְׁמ֔וֹ תִּכְתֹּ֖ב עַל־מַטֵּֽהוּ׃
transliteration: daber  el-b'ney yis'rael v'kach meitam mateh mateh l'veyt av meet kal-n'siyehem l'veyt avotam sh'neym 'asar matvot iysh et-sh'mvo tikh'tov 'al-matehv
translation: Speak to the Israelite people and take from them—from the chieftains of their ancestral housesbI.e., of their tribes.—one staff for each chieftain of an ancestral house: twelve staffs in all. Inscribe each man’s name on his staff,

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ שֵׁ֣ם אַהֲרֹ֔ן תִּכְתֹּ֖ב עַל־מַטֵּ֣ה לֵוִ֑י כִּ֚י מַטֶּ֣ה אֶחָ֔ד לְרֹ֖אשׁ בֵּ֥ית אֲבוֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'et shem aharon tikh'tov 'al-mateh leviy kiy mateh echad l'rosh beyt avvotam
translation: there being one staff for each head of an ancestral house; also inscribe Aaron’s name on the staff of Levi.

hebrew: וְהִנַּחְתָּ֖ם בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד לִפְנֵי֙ הָֽעֵד֔וּת אֲשֶׁ֛ר אִוָּעֵ֥ד לָכֶ֖ם שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: v'hinach'tam b'ohel mvo'ed lif'ney ha'edvt asher iva'ed lakhem shamah
translation: Deposit them in the Tent of Meeting before the Pact, where I meet with you.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה הָאִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶבְחַר־בּ֖וֹ מַטֵּ֣הוּ יִפְרָ֑ח וַהֲשִׁכֹּתִ֣י מֵֽעָלַ֗י אֶת־תְּלֻנּוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֛ר הֵ֥ם מַלִּינִ֖ם עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hayah haiysh asher ev'char-bvo matehv yif'rach vahashikotiy me'alay et-t'lunvot b'ney yis'rael asher hem maliynim 'aleykhem
translation: The staff of the man whom I choose shall sprout, and I will ridcMeaning of Heb. wahashikkothi uncertain. Myself of the incessant mutterings of the Israelites against you.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיִּתְּנ֣וּ אֵלָ֣יו ׀ כָּֽל־נְשִֽׂיאֵיהֶ֡ם מַטֶּה֩ לְנָשִׂ֨יא אֶחָ֜ד מַטֶּ֨ה לְנָשִׂ֤יא אֶחָד֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֔ם שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר מַטּ֑וֹת וּמַטֵּ֥ה אַהֲרֹ֖ן בְּת֥וֹךְ מַטּוֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh el-b'ney yis'rael vayit'nv elayv  kal-n'siyeyhem mateh l'nasiy echad mateh l'nasiy echad l'veyt avotam sh'neym 'asar matvot vmateh aharon b'tvokh' matvotam
translation: Moses spoke thus to the Israelites. Their chieftains gave him a staff for each chieftain of an ancestral house, twelve staffs in all; among these staffs was that of Aaron.

hebrew: וַיַּנַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־הַמַּטֹּ֖ת לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה בְּאֹ֖הֶל הָעֵדֻֽת׃
transliteration: vayanach mosheh et-hamatot lif'ney y'hvah b'ohel ha'edut
translation: Moses deposited the staffs before the L<small>ORD</small>, in the Tent of the Pact.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י מִֽמָּחֳרָ֗ת וַיָּבֹ֤א מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל הָעֵד֔וּת וְהִנֵּ֛ה פָּרַ֥ח מַטֵּֽה־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לְבֵ֣ית לֵוִ֑י וַיֹּ֤צֵֽא פֶ֙רַח֙ וַיָּ֣צֵֽץ צִ֔יץ וַיִּגְמֹ֖ל שְׁקֵדִֽים׃
transliteration: vay'hiy mimachorat vayavo mosheh el-ohel ha'edvt v'hineh parach mateh-aharon l'veyt leviy vayotze ferach vayatzetz tziytz vayig'mol sh'kediym
translation: The next day Moses entered the Tent of the Pact, and there the staff of Aaron of the house of Levi had sprouted: it had brought forth sprouts, produced blossoms, and borne almonds.

hebrew: וַיֹּצֵ֨א מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶת־כָּל־הַמַּטֹּת֙ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה אֶֽל־כָּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּרְא֥וּ וַיִּקְח֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ מַטֵּֽהוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayotze mosheh et-kal-hamatot milif'ney y'hvah el-kal-b'ney yis'rael vayir'v vayik'chv iysh matehv (s)
translation: Moses then brought out all the staffs from before the L<small>ORD</small> to all the Israelites; each identified and recovered his staff.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה הָשֵׁ֞ב אֶת־מַטֵּ֤ה אַהֲרֹן֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הָעֵד֔וּת לְמִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת לְא֖וֹת לִבְנֵי־מֶ֑רִי וּתְכַ֧ל תְּלוּנֹּתָ֛ם מֵעָלַ֖י וְלֹ֥א יָמֻֽתוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh hashev et-mateh aharon lif'ney ha'edvt l'mish'meret l'vot liv'ney-meriy vt'khal t'lvnotam me'alay v'lo yamutv
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Put Aaron’s staff back before the Pact, to be kept as a lesson to rebels, so that their mutterings against Me may cease, lest they die.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֹת֖וֹ כֵּ֥ן עָשָֽׂה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vaya'as mosheh kaasher tzivah y'hvah otvo ken 'asah (s)
translation: This Moses did; just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded him, so he did.

hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר הֵ֥ן גָּוַ֛עְנוּ אָבַ֖דְנוּ כֻּלָּ֥נוּ אָבָֽדְנוּ׃
transliteration: vayom'rv b'ney yis'rael el-mosheh lemor hen gava'nv avad'nv kulanv avad'nv
translation: But the Israelites said to Moses, “Lo, we perish! We are lost, all of us lost!

hebrew: כֹּ֣ל הַקָּרֵ֧ב ׀ הַקָּרֵ֛ב אֶל־מִשְׁכַּ֥ן יְהוָ֖ה יָמ֑וּת הַאִ֥ם תַּ֖מְנוּ לִגְוֺֽעַ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kol hakarev  hakarev el-mish'kan y'hvah yamvt haim tam'nv lig'vo'a (s)
translation: Everyone who so much as ventures near the L<small>ORD</small>’s Tabernacle must die. Alas, we are doomed to perish!”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן אַתָּ֗ה וּבָנֶ֤יךָ וּבֵית־אָבִ֙יךָ֙ אִתָּ֔ךְ תִּשְׂא֖וּ אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן הַמִּקְדָּ֑שׁ וְאַתָּה֙ וּבָנֶ֣יךָ אִתָּ֔ךְ תִּשְׂא֖וּ אֶת־עֲוֺ֥ן כְּהֻנַּתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-aharon atah vvaneykha vveyt-aviykha itakh' tis'v et-'avon hamik'dash v'atah vvaneykha itakh' tis'v et-'avon k'hunat'khem
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Aaron: You and your sons and the ancestral house under your charge shall bear any guilt connected with the sanctuary; you and your sons alone shall bear any guilt connected with your priesthood.

hebrew: וְגַ֣ם אֶת־אַחֶיךָ֩ מַטֵּ֨ה לֵוִ֜י שֵׁ֤בֶט אָבִ֙יךָ֙ הַקְרֵ֣ב אִתָּ֔ךְ וְיִלָּו֥וּ עָלֶ֖יךָ וִֽישָׁרְת֑וּךָ וְאַתָּה֙ וּבָנֶ֣יךָ אִתָּ֔ךְ לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֥הֶל הָעֵדֻֽת׃
transliteration: v'gam et-acheykha mateh leviy shevet aviykha hak'rev itakh' v'yilavv 'aleykha viyshar'tvkha v'atah vvaneykha itakh' lif'ney ohel ha'edut
translation: You shall also associate with yourself your kinsmen the tribe of Levi, your ancestral tribe, to be attached to you and to minister to you, while you and your sons under your charge are before the Tent of the Pact.aMeaning of latter part of verse uncertain.

hebrew: וְשָֽׁמְרוּ֙ מִֽשְׁמַרְתְּךָ֔ וּמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת כָּל־הָאֹ֑הֶל אַךְ֩ אֶל־כְּלֵ֨י הַקֹּ֤דֶשׁ וְאֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לֹ֣א יִקְרָ֔בוּ וְלֹֽא־יָמֻ֥תוּ גַם־הֵ֖ם גַּם־אַתֶּֽם׃
transliteration: v'sham'rv mish'mar't'kha vmish'meret kal-haohel akh' el-k'ley hakodesh v'el-hamiz'becha lo yik'ravv v'lo-yamutv gam-hem gam-atem
translation: They shall discharge their duties to you and to the Tent as a whole, but they must not have any contact with the furnishings of the Shrine or with the altar, lest both they and you die.

hebrew: וְנִלְו֣וּ עָלֶ֔יךָ וְשָֽׁמְר֗וּ אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֙רֶת֙ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד לְכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדַ֣ת הָאֹ֑הֶל וְזָ֖ר לֹא־יִקְרַ֥ב אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'nil'vv 'aleykha v'sham'rv et-mish'meret ohel mvo'ed l'khol 'avodat haohel v'zar lo-yik'rav aleykhem
translation: They shall be attached to you and discharge the duties of the Tent of Meeting, all the service of the Tent; but no outsider shall intrude upon you

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֗ם אֵ֚ת מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וְאֵ֖ת מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֥ה ע֛וֹד קֶ֖צֶף עַל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem et mish'meret hakodesh v'et mish'meret hamiz'becha v'lo-yih'yeh 'vod ketzef 'al-b'ney yis'rael
translation: as you discharge the duties connected with the Shrine and the altar, that wrath may not again strike the Israelites.

hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י הִנֵּ֤ה לָקַ֙חְתִּי֙ אֶת־אֲחֵיכֶ֣ם הַלְוִיִּ֔ם מִתּ֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לָכֶ֞ם מַתָּנָ֤ה נְתֻנִים֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה לַעֲבֹ֕ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: vaaniy hineh lakach'tiy et-acheykhem hal'viyim mitvokh' b'ney yis'rael lakhem matanah n'tuniym layhvah la'avod et-'avodat ohel mvo'ed
translation: I hereby take your fellow Levites from among the Israelites; they are assigned to you in dedication to the L<small>ORD</small>, to do the work of the Tent of Meeting;

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה וּבָנֶ֣יךָ אִ֠תְּךָ תִּשְׁמְר֨וּ אֶת־כְּהֻנַּתְכֶ֜ם לְכָל־דְּבַ֧ר הַמִּזְבֵּ֛חַ וּלְמִבֵּ֥ית לַפָּרֹ֖כֶת וַעֲבַדְתֶּ֑ם עֲבֹדַ֣ת מַתָּנָ֗ה אֶתֵּן֙ אֶת־כְּהֻנַּתְכֶ֔ם וְהַזָּ֥ר הַקָּרֵ֖ב יוּמָֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'atah vvaneykha it'kha tish'm'rv et-k'hunat'khem l'khal-d'var hamiz'becha vl'mibeyt laparokhet va'avad'tem 'avodat matanah eten et-k'hunat'khem v'hazar hakarev yvmat (s)
translation: while you and your sons shall be careful to perform your priestly duties in everything pertaining to the altar and to what is behind the curtain. I make your priesthood a service of dedication; any outsider who encroaches shall be put to death.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָה֮ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֒ וַאֲנִי֙ הִנֵּ֣ה נָתַ֣תִּֽי לְךָ֔ אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת תְּרוּמֹתָ֑י לְכָל־קָדְשֵׁ֣י בְנֵֽי־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵל לְךָ֨ נְתַתִּ֧ים לְמָשְׁחָ֛ה וּלְבָנֶ֖יךָ לְחָק־עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-aharon vaaniy hineh natatiy l'kha et-mish'meret t'rvmotay l'khal-kad'shey v'ney-yis'rael l'kha n'tatiym l'mash'chah vl'vaneykha l'chak-'volam
translation: The LORD spoke further to Aaron: I hereby give you charge of My gifts, all the sacred donations of the Israelites; I grant them to you and to your sons as a perquisite,bSee note at Lev. 7.35. a due for all time.

hebrew: זֶֽה־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ מִקֹּ֥דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֖ים מִן־הָאֵ֑שׁ כָּל־קָ֠רְבָּנָם לְֽכָל־מִנְחָתָ֞ם וּלְכָל־חַטָּאתָ֗ם וּלְכָל־אֲשָׁמָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָשִׁ֣יבוּ לִ֔י קֹ֣דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֥ים לְךָ֛ ה֖וּא וּלְבָנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: zeh-yih'yeh l'kha mikodesh hakodashiym min-haesh kal-kar'banam l'khal-min'chatam vl'khal-chatatam vl'khal-ashamam asher yashiyvv liy kodesh kadashiym l'kha hv vl'vaneykha
translation: This shall be yours from the most holy sacrifices, cMeaning of Heb. uncertain; lit. “from the fire.”the offerings by fire:-c every such offering that they render to Me as most holy sacrifices, namely, every meal offering, sin offering, and guilt offering of theirs, shall belong to you and your sons.

hebrew: בְּקֹ֥דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֖ים תֹּאכֲלֶ֑נּוּ כָּל־זָכָר֙ יֹאכַ֣ל אֹת֔וֹ קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִֽהְיֶה־לָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: b'kodesh hakodashiym tokhalenv kal-zakhar yokhal otvo kodesh yih'yeh-lakh'
translation: You shall partake of them as most sacred donations: only males may eat them; you shall treat them as consecrated.dOr “they are consecrated for your use.”

hebrew: וְזֶה־לְּךָ֞ תְּרוּמַ֣ת מַתָּנָ֗ם לְכָל־תְּנוּפֹת֮ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ לְךָ֣ נְתַתִּ֗ים וּלְבָנֶ֧יךָ וְלִבְנֹתֶ֛יךָ אִתְּךָ֖ לְחָק־עוֹלָ֑ם כָּל־טָה֥וֹר בְּבֵיתְךָ֖ יֹאכַ֥ל אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'zeh-l'kha t'rvmat matanam l'khal-t'nvfot b'ney yis'rael l'kha n'tatiym vl'vaneykha v'liv'noteykha it'kha l'chak-'volam kal-tahvor b'veyt'kha yokhal otvo
translation: This, too, shall be yours: the gift offeringseCf. Lev. 7.29 ff. of their contributions, all the elevation offerings of the Israelites, I give to you, to your sons, and to the daughters that are with you, as a due for all time; everyone of your household who is clean may eat it.

hebrew: כֹּ֚ל חֵ֣לֶב יִצְהָ֔ר וְכָל־חֵ֖לֶב תִּיר֣וֹשׁ וְדָגָ֑ן רֵאשִׁיתָ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־יִתְּנ֥וּ לַֽיהוָ֖ה לְךָ֥ נְתַתִּֽים׃
transliteration: kol chelev yitz'har v'khal-chelev tiyrvosh v'dagan reshiytam asher-yit'nv layhvah l'kha n'tatiym
translation: All the best of the new oil, wine, and grain—the choice parts that they present to the L<small>ORD</small>—I give to you.

hebrew: בִּכּוּרֵ֞י כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֧ר בְּאַרְצָ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־יָבִ֥יאוּ לַיהוָ֖ה לְךָ֣ יִהְיֶ֑ה כָּל־טָה֥וֹר בְּבֵיתְךָ֖ יֹאכֲלֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: bikvrey kal-asher b'ar'tzam asher-yaviyv layhvah l'kha yih'yeh kal-tahvor b'veyt'kha yokhalenv
translation: The first fruits of everything in their land, that they bring to the L<small>ORD</small>, shall be yours; everyone of your household who is clean may eat them.

hebrew: כָּל־חֵ֥רֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְךָ֥ יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: kal-cherem b'yis'rael l'kha yih'yeh
translation: Everything that has been proscribed in IsraelfSee Lev. 27.28. shall be yours.

hebrew: כָּל־פֶּ֣טֶר רֶ֠חֶם לְֽכָל־בָּשָׂ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־יַקְרִ֧יבוּ לַֽיהוָ֛ה בָּאָדָ֥ם וּבַבְּהֵמָ֖ה יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֑ךְ אַ֣ךְ ׀ פָּדֹ֣ה תִפְדֶּ֗ה אֵ֚ת בְּכ֣וֹר הָֽאָדָ֔ם וְאֵ֛ת בְּכֽוֹר־הַבְּהֵמָ֥ה הַטְּמֵאָ֖ה תִּפְדֶּֽה׃
transliteration: kal-peter rechem l'khal-basar asher-yak'riyvv layhvah baadam vvab'hemah yih'yeh-lakh' akh'  padoh tif'deh et b'khvor haadam v'et b'khvor-hab'hemah hat'meah tif'deh
translation: The first issue of the womb of every being, man or beast, that is offered to the L<small>ORD</small>, shall be yours; but you shall have the first-born of man redeemed, and you shall also have the firstling of unclean animals redeemed.

hebrew: וּפְדוּיָו֙ מִבֶּן־חֹ֣דֶשׁ תִּפְדֶּ֔ה בְּעֶ֨רְכְּךָ֔ כֶּ֛סֶף חֲמֵ֥שֶׁת שְׁקָלִ֖ים בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים גֵּרָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vf'dvyav miben-chodesh tif'deh b'er'k'kha kesef chameshet sh'kaliym b'shekel hakodesh 'es'riym gerah hv
translation: Take as their redemption price,gI.e., for human first-born; cf. Num. 3.44 ff. For animals see Exod. 34.19 f. from the age of one month up, the money equivalent of five shekels by the sanctuary weight, which is twenty gerahs.

hebrew: אַ֣ךְ בְּֽכוֹר־שׁ֡וֹר אֽוֹ־בְכ֨וֹר כֶּ֜שֶׂב אֽוֹ־בְכ֥וֹר עֵ֛ז לֹ֥א תִפְדֶּ֖ה קֹ֣דֶשׁ הֵ֑ם אֶת־דָּמָ֞ם תִּזְרֹ֤ק עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ וְאֶת־חֶלְבָּ֣ם תַּקְטִ֔יר אִשֶּׁ֛ה לְרֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: akh' b'khvor-shvor vo-v'khvor kesev vo-v'khvor 'ez lo tif'deh kodesh hem et-damam tiz'rok 'al-hamiz'becha v'et-chel'bam tak'tiyr isheh l'reycha niychocha layhvah
translation: But the firstlings of cattle, sheep, or goats may not be redeemed; they are consecrated. You shall dash their blood against the altar, and turn their fat into smoke as an offering by fire for a pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וּבְשָׂרָ֖ם יִהְיֶה־לָּ֑ךְ כַּחֲזֵ֧ה הַתְּנוּפָ֛ה וּכְשׁ֥וֹק הַיָּמִ֖ין לְךָ֥ יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: vv'saram yih'yeh-lakh' kachazeh hat'nvfah vkh'shvok hayamiyn l'kha yih'yeh
translation: But their meat shall be yours: it shall be yours like the breast of elevation offering and like the right thigh.

hebrew: כֹּ֣ל ׀ תְּרוּמֹ֣ת הַקֳּדָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרִ֥ימוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ לַֽיהוָה֒ נָתַ֣תִּֽי לְךָ֗ וּלְבָנֶ֧יךָ וְלִבְנֹתֶ֛יךָ אִתְּךָ֖ לְחָק־עוֹלָ֑ם בְּרִית֩ מֶ֨לַח עוֹלָ֥ם הִוא֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה לְךָ֖ וּלְזַרְעֲךָ֥ אִתָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: kol  t'rvmot hakodashiym asher yariymv v'ney-yis'rael layhvah natatiy l'kha vl'vaneykha v'liv'noteykha it'kha l'chak-'volam b'riyt melach 'volam hiv lif'ney y'hvah l'kha vl'zar'akha itakh'
translation: All the sacred gifts that the Israelites set aside for the LORD I give to you, to your sons, and to the daughters that are with you, as a due for all time. It shall be an everlasting covenant of salthSee Lev. 2.13. before the LORD for you and for your offspring as well.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן בְּאַרְצָם֙ לֹ֣א תִנְחָ֔ל וְחֵ֕לֶק לֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ בְּתוֹכָ֑ם אֲנִ֤י חֶלְקְךָ֙ וְנַחֲלָ֣תְךָ֔ בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-aharon b'ar'tzam lo tin'chal v'chelek lo-yih'yeh l'kha b'tvokham aniy chel'k'kha v'nachalat'kha b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael (s)
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Aaron: You shall, however, have no territorial share among them or own any portion in their midst; I am your portion and your share among the Israelites.

hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֣י לֵוִ֔י הִנֵּ֥ה נָתַ֛תִּי כָּל־מַֽעֲשֵׂ֥ר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְנַחֲלָ֑ה חֵ֤לֶף עֲבֹֽדָתָם֙ אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֣ם עֹֽבְדִ֔ים אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'liv'ney leviy hineh natatiy kal-ma'aser b'yis'rael l'nachalah chelef 'avodatam asher-hem 'ov'diym et-'avodat ohel mvo'ed
translation: And to the Levites I hereby give all the tithes in Israel as their share in return for the services that they perform, the services of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְלֹא־יִקְרְב֥וּ ע֛וֹד בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד לָשֵׂ֥את חֵ֖טְא לָמֽוּת׃
transliteration: v'lo-yik'r'vv 'vod b'ney yis'rael el-ohel mvo'ed laset chet' lamvt
translation: Henceforth, Israelites shall not trespass on the Tent of Meeting, and thus incur guilt and die:

hebrew: וְעָבַ֨ד הַלֵּוִ֜י ה֗וּא אֶת־עֲבֹדַת֙ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וְהֵ֖ם יִשְׂא֣וּ עֲוֺנָ֑ם חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וּבְתוֹךְ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א יִנְחֲל֖וּ נַחֲלָֽה׃
transliteration: v'avad haleviy hv et-'avodat ohel mvo'ed v'hem yis'v 'avonam chukat 'volam l'doroteykhem vv'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael lo yin'chalv nachalah
translation: only Levites shall perform the services of the Tent of Meeting; othersiLit. “they.” would incur guilt. It is the law for all time throughout the ages. But they shall have no territorial share among the Israelites;

hebrew: כִּ֞י אֶת־מַעְשַׂ֣ר בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרִ֤ימוּ לַֽיהוָה֙ תְּרוּמָ֔ה נָתַ֥תִּי לַלְוִיִּ֖ם לְנַחֲלָ֑ה עַל־כֵּן֙ אָמַ֣רְתִּי לָהֶ֔ם בְּתוֹךְ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א יִנְחֲל֖וּ נַחֲלָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: kiy et-ma'sar b'ney-yis'rael asher yariymv layhvah t'rvmah natatiy lal'viyim l'nachalah 'al-ken amar'tiy lahem b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael lo yin'chalv nachalah (f)
translation: for it is the tithes set aside by the Israelites as a gift to the L<small>ORD</small> that I give to the Levites as their share. Therefore I have said concerning them: They shall have no territorial share among the Israelites.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: וְאֶל־הַלְוִיִּ֣ם תְּדַבֵּר֮ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶם֒ כִּֽי־תִ֠קְחוּ מֵאֵ֨ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־הַֽמַּעֲשֵׂ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧תִּי לָכֶ֛ם מֵאִתָּ֖ם בְּנַחֲלַתְכֶ֑ם וַהֲרֵמֹתֶ֤ם מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה מַעֲשֵׂ֖ר מִן־הַֽמַּעֲשֵֽׂר׃
transliteration: v'el-hal'viyim t'daber v'amar'ta alehem kiy-tik'chv meet b'ney-yis'rael et-hama'aser asher natatiy lakhem meitam b'nachalat'khem vaharemotem mimenv t'rvmat y'hvah ma'aser min-hama'aser
translation: Speak to the Levites and say to them: When you receive from the Israelites their tithes, which I have assigned to you as your share, you shall set aside from them one-tenth of the tithe as a gift to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְנֶחְשַׁ֥ב לָכֶ֖ם תְּרוּמַתְכֶ֑ם כַּדָּגָן֙ מִן־הַגֹּ֔רֶן וְכַֽמְלֵאָ֖ה מִן־הַיָּֽקֶב׃
transliteration: v'nech'shav lakhem t'rvmat'khem kadagan min-hagoren v'kham'leah min-hayakev
translation: This shall be accounted to you as your gift. As with the new grain from the threshing floor or the flow from the vat,

hebrew: כֵּ֣ן תָּרִ֤ימוּ גַם־אַתֶּם֙ תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה מִכֹּל֙ מַעְשְׂרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּקְח֔וּ מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּנְתַתֶּ֤ם מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ אֶת־תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: ken tariymv gam-atem t'rvmat y'hvah mikol ma's'roteykhem asher tik'chv meet b'ney yis'rael vn'tatem mimenv et-t'rvmat y'hvah l'aharon hakohen
translation: so shall you on your part set aside a gift for the L<small>ORD</small> from all the tithes that you receive from the Israelites; and from them you shall bring the gift for the L<small>ORD</small> to Aaron the priest.

hebrew: מִכֹּל֙ מַתְּנֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם תָּרִ֕ימוּ אֵ֖ת כָּל־תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה מִכָּל־חֶלְבּ֔וֹ אֶֽת־מִקְדְּשׁ֖וֹ מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: mikol mat'noteykhem tariymv et kal-t'rvmat y'hvah mikal-chel'bvo et-mik'd'shvo mimenv
translation: You shall set aside all gifts due to the L<small>ORD</small> from everything that is donated to you, from each thing its best portion, the part thereof that is to be consecrated.

hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם בַּהֲרִֽימְכֶ֤ם אֶת־חֶלְבּוֹ֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְנֶחְשַׁב֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם כִּתְבוּאַ֥ת גֹּ֖רֶן וְכִתְבוּאַ֥ת יָֽקֶב׃
transliteration: v'amar'ta alehem bahariym'khem et-chel'bvo mimenv v'nech'shav lal'viyim kit'vvat goren v'khit'vvat yakev
translation: Say to them further: When you have removed the best part from it, you Levites may consider it the same as the yield of threshing floor or vat.

hebrew: וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֤ם אֹתוֹ֙ בְּכָל־מָק֔וֹם אַתֶּ֖ם וּבֵֽיתְכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־שָׂכָ֥ר הוּא֙ לָכֶ֔ם חֵ֥לֶף עֲבֹֽדַתְכֶ֖ם בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: vaakhal'tem otvo b'khal-makvom atem vveyt'khem kiy-sakhar hv lakhem chelef 'avodat'khem b'ohel mvo'ed
translation: You and your households may eat it anywhere, for it is your recompense for your services in the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תִשְׂא֤וּ עָלָיו֙ חֵ֔טְא בַּהֲרִֽימְכֶ֥ם אֶת־חֶלְבּ֖וֹ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וְאֶת־קָדְשֵׁ֧י בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל לֹ֥א תְחַלְּל֖וּ וְלֹ֥א תָמֽוּתוּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'lo-tis'v 'alayv chet' bahariym'khem et-chel'bvo mimenv v'et-kad'shey v'ney-yis'rael lo t'chal'lv v'lo tamvtv (f)
translation: You will incur no guilt through it, once you have removed the best part from it; but you must not profane the sacred donations of the Israelites, lest you die.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:

hebrew: זֹ֚את חֻקַּ֣ת הַתּוֹרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר דַּבֵּ֣ר ׀ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְיִקְח֣וּ אֵלֶיךָ֩ פָרָ֨ה אֲדֻמָּ֜ה תְּמִימָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֵֽין־בָּהּ֙ מ֔וּם אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־עָלָ֥ה עָלֶ֖יהָ עֹֽל׃
transliteration: zot chukat hatvorah asher-tzivah y'hvah lemor daber  el-b'ney yis'rael v'yik'chv eleykha farah adumah t'miymah asher eyn-bah mvm asher lo-'alah 'aleyha 'ol
translation:
This is the ritual law that the LORD has commanded:
Instruct the Israelite people to bring you a red cow without blemish, in which there is no defect and on which no yoke has been laid.

hebrew: וּנְתַתֶּ֣ם אֹתָ֔הּ אֶל־אֶלְעָזָ֖ר הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְהוֹצִ֤יא אֹתָהּ֙ אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְשָׁחַ֥ט אֹתָ֖הּ לְפָנָֽיו׃
transliteration: vn'tatem otah el-el'azar hakohen v'hvotziy otah el-michvtz lamachaneh v'shachat otah l'fanayv
translation: You shall give it to Eleazar the priest. It shall be taken outside the camp and slaughtered in his presence.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֞ח אֶלְעָזָ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן מִדָּמָ֖הּ בְּאֶצְבָּע֑וֹ וְהִזָּ֞ה אֶל־נֹ֨כַח פְּנֵ֧י אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֛ד מִדָּמָ֖הּ שֶׁ֥בַע פְּעָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'lakach el'azar hakohen midamah b'etz'ba'vo v'hizah el-nokhach p'ney ohel-mvo'ed midamah sheva' p'amiym
translation: Eleazar the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger and sprinkle it seven times toward the front of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וְשָׂרַ֥ף אֶת־הַפָּרָ֖ה לְעֵינָ֑יו אֶת־עֹרָ֤הּ וְאֶת־בְּשָׂרָהּ֙ וְאֶת־דָּמָ֔הּ עַל־פִּרְשָׁ֖הּ יִשְׂרֹֽף׃
transliteration: v'saraf et-haparah l'eynayv et-'orah v'et-b'sarah v'et-damah 'al-pir'shah yis'rof
translation: The cow shall be burned in his sight—its hide, flesh, and blood shall be burned, its dung included—

hebrew: וְלָקַ֣ח הַכֹּהֵ֗ן עֵ֥ץ אֶ֛רֶז וְאֵז֖וֹב וּשְׁנִ֣י תוֹלָ֑עַת וְהִשְׁלִ֕יךְ אֶל־תּ֖וֹךְ שְׂרֵפַ֥ת הַפָּרָֽה׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen 'etz erez v'ezvov vsh'niy tvola'at v'hish'liykh' el-tvokh' s'refat haparah
translation: and the priest shall take cedar wood, hyssop, and crimson stuff, and throw them into the fire consuming the cow.

hebrew: וְכִבֶּ֨ס בְּגָדָ֜יו הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְרָחַ֤ץ בְּשָׂרוֹ֙ בַּמַּ֔יִם וְאַחַ֖ר יָב֣וֹא אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וְטָמֵ֥א הַכֹּהֵ֖ן עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'khibes b'gadayv hakohen v'rachatz b'sarvo bamayim v'achar yavvo el-hamachaneh v'tame hakohen 'ad-ha'arev
translation: The priest shall wash his garments and bathe his body in water; after that the priest may reenter the camp, but he shall be unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְהַשֹּׂרֵ֣ף אֹתָ֔הּ יְכַבֵּ֤ס בְּגָדָיו֙ בַּמַּ֔יִם וְרָחַ֥ץ בְּשָׂר֖וֹ בַּמָּ֑יִם וְטָמֵ֖א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'hasoref otah y'khabes b'gadayv bamayim v'rachatz b'sarvo bamayim v'tame 'ad-ha'arev
translation: He who performed the burning shall also wash his garments in water, bathe his body in water, and be unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְאָסַ֣ף ׀ אִ֣ישׁ טָה֗וֹר אֵ֚ת אֵ֣פֶר הַפָּרָ֔ה וְהִנִּ֛יחַ מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה בְּמָק֣וֹם טָה֑וֹר וְ֠הָיְתָה לַעֲדַ֨ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל לְמִשְׁמֶ֛רֶת לְמֵ֥י נִדָּ֖ה חַטָּ֥את הִֽוא׃
transliteration: v'asaf  iysh tahvor et efer haparah v'hiniycha michvtz lamachaneh b'makvom tahvor v'hay'tah la'adat b'ney-yis'rael l'mish'meret l'mey nidah chatat hiv
translation: A man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the cow and deposit them outside the camp in a clean place, to be kept for water of lustrationaLit. “water for impurity.” for the Israelite community. It is for cleansing.

hebrew: וְ֠כִבֶּס הָאֹסֵ֨ף אֶת־אֵ֤פֶר הַפָּרָה֙ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְטָמֵ֖א עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב וְֽהָיְתָ֞ה לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְלַגֵּ֛ר הַגָּ֥ר בְּתוֹכָ֖ם לְחֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: v'khibes haosef et-efer haparah et-b'gadayv v'tame 'ad-ha'arev v'hay'tah liv'ney yis'rael v'lager hagar b'tvokham l'chukat 'volam
translation:
He who gathers up the ashes of the cow shall also wash his clothes and be unclean until evening.
This shall be a permanent law for the Israelites and for the strangers who reside among you.

hebrew: הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בְּמֵ֖ת לְכָל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֑ם וְטָמֵ֖א שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: hanoge'a b'met l'khal-nefesh adam v'tame shiv'at yamiym
translation: He who touches the corpse of any human being shall be unclean for seven days.

hebrew: ה֣וּא יִתְחַטָּא־ב֞וֹ בַּיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֛י וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י יִטְהָ֑ר וְאִם־לֹ֨א יִתְחַטָּ֜א בַּיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֛י וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י לֹ֥א יִטְהָֽר׃
transliteration: hv yit'chata-vvo bayvom hash'liyshiy vvayvom hash'viy'iy yit'har v'im-lo yit'chata bayvom hash'liyshiy vvayvom hash'viy'iy lo yit'har
translation: He shall cleanse himself with itbI.e., the ashes, as in v. 9. on the third day and on the seventh day, and then be clean; if he fails to cleanse himself on the third and seventh days, he shall not be clean.

hebrew: כָּֽל־הַנֹּגֵ֡עַ בְּמֵ֣ת בְּנֶפֶשׁ֩ הָאָדָ֨ם אֲשֶׁר־יָמ֜וּת וְלֹ֣א יִתְחַטָּ֗א אֶת־מִשְׁכַּ֤ן יְהוָה֙ טִמֵּ֔א וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּי֩ מֵ֨י נִדָּ֜ה לֹא־זֹרַ֤ק עָלָיו֙ טָמֵ֣א יִהְיֶ֔ה ע֖וֹד טֻמְאָת֥וֹ בֽוֹ׃
