transliteration: kal-hanoge'a b'met b'nefesh haadam asher-yamvt v'lo yit'chata et-mish'kan y'hvah time v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv miyis'rael kiy mey nidah lo-zorak 'alayv tame yih'yeh 'vod tum'atvo vvo
translation: Whoever touches a corpse, the body of a person who has died, and does not cleanse himself, defiles the L<small>ORD</small>’s Tabernacle; that person shall be cut off from Israel. Since the water of lustration was not dashed on him, he remains unclean; his uncleanness is still upon him.

hebrew: זֹ֚את הַתּוֹרָ֔ה אָדָ֖ם כִּֽי־יָמ֣וּת בְּאֹ֑הֶל כָּל־הַבָּ֤א אֶל־הָאֹ֙הֶל֙ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּאֹ֔הֶל יִטְמָ֖א שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: zot hatvorah adam kiy-yamvt b'ohel kal-haba el-haohel v'khal-asher baohel yit'ma shiv'at yamiym
translation: This is the ritual: When a person dies in a tent, whoever enters the tent and whoever is in the tent shall be unclean seven days;

hebrew: וְכֹל֙ כְּלִ֣י פָת֔וּחַ אֲשֶׁ֛ר אֵין־צָמִ֥יד פָּתִ֖יל עָלָ֑יו טָמֵ֖א הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'khol k'liy fatvcha asher eyn-tzamiyd patiyl 'alayv tame hv
translation: and every open vessel, with no lid fastened down, shall be unclean.

hebrew: וְכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁר־יִגַּ֜ע עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה בַּֽחֲלַל־חֶ֙רֶב֙ א֣וֹ בְמֵ֔ת אֽוֹ־בְעֶ֥צֶם אָדָ֖ם א֣וֹ בְקָ֑בֶר יִטְמָ֖א שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'khol asher-yiga' 'al-p'ney hasadeh bachalal-cherev vo v'met vo-v'etzem adam vo v'kaver yit'ma shiv'at yamiym
translation: And in the open, anyone who touches a person who was killedcLit. “slain by the sword.” or who died naturally, or human bone, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.

hebrew: וְלָֽקְחוּ֙ לַטָּמֵ֔א מֵעֲפַ֖ר שְׂרֵפַ֣ת הַֽחַטָּ֑את וְנָתַ֥ן עָלָ֛יו מַ֥יִם חַיִּ֖ים אֶל־כֶּֽלִי׃
transliteration: v'lak'chv latame me'afar s'refat hachatat v'natan 'alayv mayim chayiym el-keliy
translation: Some of the ashesdLit. “earth” or “dust.” from the fire of cleansing shall be taken for the unclean person, and fresh water shall be added to them in a vessel.

hebrew: וְלָקַ֨ח אֵז֜וֹב וְטָבַ֣ל בַּמַּיִם֮ אִ֣ישׁ טָהוֹר֒ וְהִזָּ֤ה עַל־הָאֹ֙הֶל֙ וְעַל־כָּל־הַכֵּלִ֔ים וְעַל־הַנְּפָשׁ֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָֽיוּ־שָׁ֑ם וְעַל־הַנֹּגֵ֗עַ בַּעֶ֙צֶם֙ א֣וֹ בֶֽחָלָ֔ל א֥וֹ בַמֵּ֖ת א֥וֹ בַקָּֽבֶר׃
transliteration: v'lakach ezvov v'taval bamayim iysh tahvor v'hizah 'al-haohel v'al-kal-hakeliym v'al-han'fashvot asher hayv-sham v'al-hanoge'a ba'etzem vo vechalal vo vamet vo vakaver
translation: A person who is clean shall take hyssop, dip it in the water, and sprinkle on the tent and on all the vessels and people who were there, or on him who touched the bones or the person who was killed or died naturally or the grave.

hebrew: וְהִזָּ֤ה הַטָּהֹר֙ עַל־הַטָּמֵ֔א בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֖י וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֑י וְחִטְּאוֹ֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י וְכִבֶּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָהֵ֥ר בָּעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'hizah hatahor 'al-hatame bayvom hash'liyshiy vvayvom hash'viy'iy v'chit'vo bayvom hash'viy'iy v'khibes b'gadayv v'rachatz bamayim v'taher ba'arev
translation: The clean person shall sprinkle it upon the unclean person on the third day and on the seventh day, thus cleansing him by the seventh day. HeeI.e., the person being cleansed. shall then wash his clothes and bathe in water, and at nightfall he shall be clean.

hebrew: וְאִ֤ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִטְמָא֙ וְלֹ֣א יִתְחַטָּ֔א וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַקָּהָ֑ל כִּי֩ אֶת־מִקְדַּ֨שׁ יְהוָ֜ה טִמֵּ֗א מֵ֥י נִדָּ֛ה לֹא־זֹרַ֥ק עָלָ֖יו טָמֵ֥א הֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'iysh asher-yit'ma v'lo yit'chata v'nikh'r'tah hanefesh hahiv mitvokh' hakahal kiy et-mik'dash y'hvah time mey nidah lo-zorak 'alayv tame hv
translation: If anyone who has become unclean fails to cleanse himself, that person shall be cut off from the congregation, for he has defiled the L<small>ORD</small>’s sanctuary. The water of lustration was not dashed on him: he is unclean.

hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֥ה לָּהֶ֖ם לְחֻקַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם וּמַזֵּ֤ה מֵֽי־הַנִּדָּה֙ יְכַבֵּ֣ס בְּגָדָ֔יו וְהַנֹּגֵ֙עַ֙ בְּמֵ֣י הַנִּדָּ֔ה יִטְמָ֖א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'hay'tah lahem l'chukat 'volam vmazeh mey-hanidah y'khabes b'gadayv v'hanoge'a b'mey hanidah yit'ma 'ad-ha'arev
translation: That shall be for them a law for all time. Further, he who sprinkled the water of lustration shall wash his clothes; and whoever touches the water of lustration shall be unclean until evening.

hebrew: וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יִגַּע־בּ֥וֹ הַטָּמֵ֖א יִטְמָ֑א וְהַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַנֹּגַ֖עַת תִּטְמָ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'khol asher-yiga'-bvo hatame yit'ma v'hanefesh hanoga'at tit'ma 'ad-ha'arev (f)
translation: Whatever that unclean person touches shall be unclean; and the person who touches him shall be unclean until evening.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ בְנֵֽי־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵל כָּל־הָ֨עֵדָ֤ה מִדְבַּר־צִן֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽרִאשׁ֔וֹן וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב הָעָ֖ם בְּקָדֵ֑שׁ וַתָּ֤מָת שָׁם֙ מִרְיָ֔ם וַתִּקָּבֵ֖ר שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayavov v'ney-yis'rael kal-ha'edah mid'bar-tzin bachodesh harishvon vayeshev ha'am b'kadesh vatamat sham mir'yam vatikaver sham
translation: The Israelites arrived in a body at the wilderness of Zin on the first new moon,aOf the fortieth year; cf. Num. 33.36–38. and the people stayed at Kadesh. Miriam died there and was buried there.

hebrew: וְלֹא־הָ֥יָה מַ֖יִם לָעֵדָ֑ה וַיִּקָּ֣הֲל֔וּ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹֽן׃
transliteration: v'lo-hayah mayim la'edah vayikahalv 'al-mosheh v'al-aharon
translation: The community was without water, and they joined against Moses and Aaron.

hebrew: וַיָּ֥רֶב הָעָ֖ם עִם־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לֵאמֹ֔ר וְל֥וּ גָוַ֛עְנוּ בִּגְוַ֥ע אַחֵ֖ינוּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayarev ha'am 'im-mosheh vayom'rv lemor v'lv gava'nv big'va' acheynv lif'ney y'hvah
translation: The people quarreled with Moses, saying, “If only we had perished when our brothers perished at the instance of the L<small>ORD</small>!

hebrew: וְלָמָ֤ה הֲבֵאתֶם֙ אֶת־קְהַ֣ל יְהוָ֔ה אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה לָמ֣וּת שָׁ֔ם אֲנַ֖חְנוּ וּבְעִירֵֽנוּ׃
transliteration: v'lamah havetem et-k'hal y'hvah el-hamid'bar hazeh lamvt sham anach'nv vv'iyrenv
translation: Why have you brought the L<small>ORD</small>’s congregation into this wilderness for us and our beasts to die there?

hebrew: וְלָמָ֤ה הֶֽעֱלִיתֻ֙נוּ֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם לְהָבִ֣יא אֹתָ֔נוּ אֶל־הַמָּק֥וֹם הָרָ֖ע הַזֶּ֑ה לֹ֣א ׀ מְק֣וֹם זֶ֗רַע וּתְאֵנָ֤ה וְגֶ֙פֶן֙ וְרִמּ֔וֹן וּמַ֥יִם אַ֖יִן לִשְׁתּֽוֹת׃
transliteration: v'lamah he'eliytunv mimitz'rayim l'haviy otanv el-hamakvom hara' hazeh lo  m'kvom zera' vt'enah v'gefen v'rimvon vmayim ayin lish'tvot
translation: Why did you make us leave Egypt to bring us to this wretched place, a place with no grain or figs or vines or pomegranates? There is not even water to drink!”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה וְאַהֲרֹ֜ן מִפְּנֵ֣י הַקָּהָ֗ל אֶל־פֶּ֙תַח֙ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֵּרָ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהוָ֖ה אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayavo mosheh v'aharon mip'ney hakahal el-petach ohel mvo'ed vayip'lv 'al-p'neyhem vayera kh'vvod-y'hvah aleyhem (f)
translation: Moses and Aaron came away from the congregation to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and fell on their faces. The Presence of the L<small>ORD</small> appeared to them,

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: and the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying,

hebrew: קַ֣ח אֶת־הַמַּטֶּ֗ה וְהַקְהֵ֤ל אֶת־הָעֵדָה֙ אַתָּה֙ וְאַהֲרֹ֣ן אָחִ֔יךָ וְדִבַּרְתֶּ֧ם אֶל־הַסֶּ֛לַע לְעֵינֵיהֶ֖ם וְנָתַ֣ן מֵימָ֑יו וְהוֹצֵאתָ֨ לָהֶ֥ם מַ֙יִם֙ מִן־הַסֶּ֔לַע וְהִשְׁקִיתָ֥ אֶת־הָעֵדָ֖ה וְאֶת־בְּעִירָֽם׃
transliteration: kach et-hamateh v'hak'hel et-ha'edah atah v'aharon achiykha v'dibar'tem el-hasela' l'eyneyhem v'natan meymayv v'hvotzeta lahem mayim min-hasela' v'hish'kiyta et-ha'edah v'et-b'iyram
translation: “You and your brother Aaron take the rod and assemble the community, and before their very eyes order the rock to yield its water. Thus you shall produce water for them from the rock and provide drink for the congregation and their beasts.”

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־הַמַּטֶּ֖ה מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּֽהוּ׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-hamateh milif'ney y'hvah kaasher tzivahv
translation: Moses took the rod from before the L<small>ORD</small>, as He had commanded him.

hebrew: וַיַּקְהִ֜לוּ מֹשֶׁ֧ה וְאַהֲרֹ֛ן אֶת־הַקָּהָ֖ל אֶל־פְּנֵ֣י הַסָּ֑לַע וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ם שִׁמְעוּ־נָא֙ הַמֹּרִ֔ים הֲמִן־הַסֶּ֣לַע הַזֶּ֔ה נוֹצִ֥יא לָכֶ֖ם מָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayak'hilv mosheh v'aharon et-hakahal el-p'ney hasala' vayomer lahem shim'v-na hamoriym hamin-hasela' hazeh nvotziy lakhem mayim
translation: Moses and Aaron assembled the congregation in front of the rock; and he said to them, “Listen, you rebels, shall we get water for you out of this rock?”

hebrew: וַיָּ֨רֶם מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־יָד֗וֹ וַיַּ֧ךְ אֶת־הַסֶּ֛לַע בְּמַטֵּ֖הוּ פַּעֲמָ֑יִם וַיֵּצְאוּ֙ מַ֣יִם רַבִּ֔ים וַתֵּ֥שְׁתְּ הָעֵדָ֖ה וּבְעִירָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayarem mosheh et-yadvo vayakh' et-hasela' b'matehv pa'amayim vayetz'v mayim rabiym vatesh't' ha'edah vv'iyram (s)
translation: And Moses raised his hand and struck the rock twice with his rod. Out came copious water, and the community and their beasts drank.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֒ יַ֚עַן לֹא־הֶאֱמַנְתֶּ֣ם בִּ֔י לְהַ֨קְדִּישֵׁ֔נִי לְעֵינֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לָכֵ֗ן לֹ֤א תָבִ֙יאוּ֙ אֶת־הַקָּהָ֣ל הַזֶּ֔ה אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תִּי לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon ya'an lo-heeman'tem biy l'hak'diysheniy l'eyney b'ney yis'rael lakhen lo taviyv et-hakahal hazeh el-haaretz asher-natatiy lahem
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses and Aaron, “Because you did not trust Me enough to affirm My sanctity in the sight of the Israelite people, therefore you shall not lead this congregation into the land that I have given them.”

hebrew: הֵ֚מָּה מֵ֣י מְרִיבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־רָב֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶת־יְהוָ֑ה וַיִּקָּדֵ֖שׁ בָּֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: hemah mey m'riyvah asher-ravv v'ney-yis'rael et-y'hvah vayikadesh bam (s)
translation: Those are the Waters of MeribahbI.e., “Quarrel”; cf. Exod. 17.7 and note b there.—meaning that the Israelites quarrelled with the LORD—through which He affirmed His sanctity.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֧ה מַלְאָכִ֛ים מִקָּדֵ֖שׁ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ אֱד֑וֹם כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אָחִ֣יךָ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתָּ אֵ֥ת כָּל־הַתְּלָאָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר מְצָאָֽתְנוּ׃
transliteration: vayish'lach mosheh mal'akhiym mikadesh el-melekh' edvom koh amar achiykha yis'rael atah yada'ta et kal-hat'laah asher m'tzaat'nv
translation: From Kadesh, Moses sent messengers to the king of Edom: “Thus says your brother Israel: You know all the hardships that have befallen us;

hebrew: וַיֵּרְד֤וּ אֲבֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ מִצְרַ֔יְמָה וַנֵּ֥שֶׁב בְּמִצְרַ֖יִם יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וַיָּרֵ֥עוּ לָ֛נוּ מִצְרַ֖יִם וְלַאֲבֹתֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: vayer'dv avoteynv mitz'ray'mah vaneshev b'mitz'rayim yamiym rabiym vayare'v lanv mitz'rayim v'laavoteynv
translation: that our ancestors went down to Egypt, that we dwelt in Egypt a long time, and that the Egyptians dealt harshly with us and our ancestors.

hebrew: וַנִּצְעַ֤ק אֶל־יְהוָה֙ וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע קֹלֵ֔נוּ וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח מַלְאָ֔ךְ וַיֹּצִאֵ֖נוּ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וְהִנֵּה֙ אֲנַ֣חְנוּ בְקָדֵ֔שׁ עִ֖יר קְצֵ֥ה גְבוּלֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vanitz'ak el-y'hvah vayish'ma' kolenv vayish'lach mal'akh' vayotzienv mimitz'rayim v'hineh anach'nv v'kadesh 'iyr k'tzeh g'vvlekha
translation: We cried to the LORD and He heard our plea, and He sent a messengercOr “angel.” who freed us from Egypt. Now we are in Kadesh, the town on the border of your territory.

hebrew: נַעְבְּרָה־נָּ֣א בְאַרְצֶ֗ךָ לֹ֤א נַעֲבֹר֙ בְּשָׂדֶ֣ה וּבְכֶ֔רֶם וְלֹ֥א נִשְׁתֶּ֖ה מֵ֣י בְאֵ֑ר דֶּ֧רֶךְ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ נֵלֵ֗ךְ לֹ֤א נִטֶּה֙ יָמִ֣ין וּשְׂמֹ֔אול עַ֥ד אֲשֶֽׁר־נַעֲבֹ֖ר גְּבוּלֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: na'b'rah-na v'ar'tzekha lo na'avor b'sadeh vv'kherem v'lo nish'teh mey v'er derekh' hamelekh' nelekh' lo niteh yamiyn vs'movl 'ad asher-na'avor g'vvlekha
translation: Allow us, then, to cross your country. We will not pass through fields or vineyards, and we will not drink water from wells. We will follow the king’s highway, turning off neither to the right nor to the left until we have crossed your territory.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ אֱד֔וֹם לֹ֥א תַעֲבֹ֖ר בִּ֑י פֶּן־בַּחֶ֖רֶב אֵצֵ֥א לִקְרָאתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv edvom lo ta'avor biy pen-bacherev etze lik'ratekha
translation: But Edom answered him, “You shall not pass through us, else we will go out against you with the sword.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֵלָ֥יו בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֘ל בַּֽמְסִלָּ֣ה נַעֲלֶה֒ וְאִם־מֵימֶ֤יךָ נִשְׁתֶּה֙ אֲנִ֣י וּמִקְנַ֔י וְנָתַתִּ֖י מִכְרָ֑ם רַ֥ק אֵין־דָּבָ֖ר בְּרַגְלַ֥י אֶֽעֱבֹֽרָה׃
transliteration: vayom'rv elayv b'ney-yis'rael bam'silah na'aleh v'im-meymeykha nish'teh aniy vmik'nay v'natatiy mikh'ram rak eyn-davar b'rag'lay e'evorah
translation: “We will keep to the beaten track,” the Israelites said to them, “and if we or our cattle drink your water, we will pay for it. We ask only for passage on foot—it is but a small matter.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לֹ֣א תַעֲבֹ֑ר וַיֵּצֵ֤א אֱדוֹם֙ לִקְרָאת֔וֹ בְּעַ֥ם כָּבֵ֖ד וּבְיָ֥ד חֲזָקָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer lo ta'avor vayetze edvom lik'ratvo b'am kaved vv'yad chazakah
translation: But they replied, “You shall not pass through!” And Edom went out against them in heavy force, strongly armed.

hebrew: וַיְמָאֵ֣ן ׀ אֱד֗וֹם נְתֹן֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עֲבֹ֖ר בִּגְבֻל֑וֹ וַיֵּ֥ט יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵעָלָֽיו׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'maen  edvom n'ton et-yis'rael 'avor big'vulvo vayet yis'rael me'alayv (f)
translation: So Edom would not let Israel cross their territory, and Israel turned away from them.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִקָּדֵ֑שׁ וַיָּבֹ֧אוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל כָּל־הָעֵדָ֖ה הֹ֥ר הָהָֽר׃
transliteration: vayis'v mikadesh vayavov v'ney-yis'rael kal-ha'edah hor hahar
translation: Setting out from Kadesh, the Israelites arrived in a body at Mount Hor.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהוָ֛ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן בְּהֹ֣ר הָהָ֑ר עַל־גְּב֥וּל אֶֽרֶץ־אֱד֖וֹם לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh v'el-aharon b'hor hahar 'al-g'vvl eretz-edvom lemor
translation: At Mount Hor, on the boundary of the land of Edom, the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses and Aaron,

hebrew: יֵאָסֵ֤ף אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־עַמָּ֔יו כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָבֹא֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עַ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־מְרִיתֶ֥ם אֶת־פִּ֖י לְמֵ֥י מְרִיבָֽה׃
transliteration: yeasef aharon el-'amayv kiy lo yavo el-haaretz asher natatiy liv'ney yis'rael 'al asher-m'riytem et-piy l'mey m'riyvah
translation: “Let Aaron be gathered to his kin: he is not to enter the land that I have assigned to the Israelite people, because you disobeyed my command about the Waters of Meribah.

hebrew: קַ֚ח אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְאֶת־אֶלְעָזָ֖ר בְּנ֑וֹ וְהַ֥עַל אֹתָ֖ם הֹ֥ר הָהָֽר׃
transliteration: kach et-aharon v'et-el'azar b'nvo v'ha'al otam hor hahar
translation: Take Aaron and his son Eleazar and bring them up on Mount Hor.

hebrew: וְהַפְשֵׁ֤ט אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֖ם אֶת־אֶלְעָזָ֣ר בְּנ֑וֹ וְאַהֲרֹ֥ן יֵאָסֵ֖ף וּמֵ֥ת שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: v'haf'shet et-aharon et-b'gadayv v'hil'bash'tam et-el'azar b'nvo v'aharon yeasef vmet sham
translation: Strip Aaron of his vestments and put them on his son Eleazar. There Aaron shall be gathered dLit. “and die.”unto the dead.”-d

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהוָ֑ה וַֽיַּעֲלוּ֙ אֶל־הֹ֣ר הָהָ֔ר לְעֵינֵ֖י כָּל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'as mosheh kaasher tzivah y'hvah vaya'alv el-hor hahar l'eyney kal-ha'edah
translation: Moses did as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded. They ascended Mount Hor in the sight of the whole community.

hebrew: וַיַּפְשֵׁט֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־בְּגָדָ֗יו וַיַּלְבֵּ֤שׁ אֹתָם֙ אֶת־אֶלְעָזָ֣ר בְּנ֔וֹ וַיָּ֧מָת אַהֲרֹ֛ן שָׁ֖ם בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֑ר וַיֵּ֧רֶד מֹשֶׁ֛ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֖ר מִן־הָהָֽר׃
transliteration: vayaf'shet mosheh et-aharon et-b'gadayv vayal'besh otam et-el'azar b'nvo vayamat aharon sham b'rosh hahar vayered mosheh v'el'azar min-hahar
translation: Moses stripped Aaron of his vestments and put them on his son Eleazar, and Aaron died there on the summit of the mountain. When Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain,

hebrew: וַיִּרְאוּ֙ כָּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה כִּ֥י גָוַ֖ע אַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיִּבְכּ֤וּ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים י֔וֹם כֹּ֖ל בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayir'v kal-ha'edah kiy gava' aharon vayiv'kv et-aharon sh'loshiym yvom kol beyt yis'rael (s)
translation: the whole community knew that Aaron had breathed his last. All the house of Israel bewailed Aaron thirty days.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֞ע הַכְּנַעֲנִ֤י מֶֽלֶךְ־עֲרָד֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב הַנֶּ֔גֶב כִּ֚י בָּ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל דֶּ֖רֶךְ הָאֲתָרִ֑ים וַיִּלָּ֙חֶם֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּ֥שְׁבְּ ׀ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ שֶֽׁבִי׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' hak'na'aniy melekh'-'arad yoshev hanegev kiy ba yis'rael derekh' haatariym vayilachem b'yis'rael vayish'b'  mimenv sheviy
translation: When the Canaanite, king of Arad, who dwelt in the Negeb, learned that Israel was coming by the way of Atharim,aMeaning of Heb. ha-’atharim uncertain. Targum and other ancient versions render “the way [taken by] the scouts.” he engaged Israel in battle and took some of them captive.

hebrew: וַיִּדַּ֨ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל נֶ֛דֶר לַֽיהוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אִם־נָתֹ֨ן תִּתֵּ֜ן אֶת־הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ בְּיָדִ֔י וְהַֽחֲרַמְתִּ֖י אֶת־עָרֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayidar yis'rael neder layhvah vayomar im-naton titen et-ha'am hazeh b'yadiy v'hacharam'tiy et-'areyhem
translation: Then Israel made a vow to the LORD and said, “If You deliver this people into our hand, we will proscribebI.e., utterly destroy, reserving no booty except what is deposited in the Sanctuary; see Josh. 6.24. their towns.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֨ע יְהוָ֜ה בְּק֣וֹל יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י וַיַּחֲרֵ֥ם אֶתְהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־עָרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּקְרָ֥א שֵׁם־הַמָּק֖וֹם חָרְמָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayish'ma' y'hvah b'kvol yis'rael vayiten et-hak'na'aniy vayacharem et'hem v'et-'areyhem vayik'ra shem-hamakvom char'mah (f)
translation: The LORD heeded Israel’s plea and delivered up the Canaanites; and they and their cities were proscribed. So that place was named Hormah.cConnected with heḥerim “to proscribe.”

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֞וּ מֵהֹ֤ר הָהָר֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יַם־ס֔וּף לִסְבֹ֖ב אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ אֱד֑וֹם וַתִּקְצַ֥ר נֶֽפֶשׁ־הָעָ֖ם בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
transliteration: vayis'v mehor hahar derekh' yam-svf lis'vov et-eretz edvom vatik'tzar nefesh-ha'am badarekh'
translation: They set out from Mount Hor by way of the Sea of ReedsdSee Exod. 10.19 note. to skirt the land of Edom. But the people grew restive on the journey,

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר הָעָ֗ם בֵּֽאלֹהִים֮ וּבְמֹשֶׁה֒ לָמָ֤ה הֶֽעֱלִיתֻ֙נוּ֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם לָמ֖וּת בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין לֶ֙חֶם֙ וְאֵ֣ין מַ֔יִם וְנַפְשֵׁ֣נוּ קָ֔צָה בַּלֶּ֖חֶם הַקְּלֹקֵֽל׃
transliteration: vay'daber ha'am belohiym vv'mosheh lamah he'eliytunv mimitz'rayim lamvt bamid'bar kiy eyn lechem v'eyn mayim v'naf'shenv katzah balechem hak'lokel
translation: and the people spoke against God and against Moses, “Why did you make us leave Egypt to die in the wilderness? There is no bread and no water, and we have come to loathe this miserable food.”

hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֨ח יְהוָ֜ה בָּעָ֗ם אֵ֚ת הַנְּחָשִׁ֣ים הַשְּׂרָפִ֔ים וַֽיְנַשְּׁכ֖וּ אֶת־הָעָ֑ם וַיָּ֥מָת עַם־רָ֖ב מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vay'shalach y'hvah ba'am et han'chashiym has'rafiym vay'nash'khv et-ha'am vayamat 'am-rav miyis'rael
translation: The LORD sent serapheCf. Isa. 14.29; 30.6. Others “fiery”; exact meaning of Heb. saraph uncertain. serpents against the people. They bit the people and many of the Israelites died.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֩ הָעָ֨ם אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֜ה וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ חָטָ֗אנוּ כִּֽי־דִבַּ֤רְנוּ בַֽיהוָה֙ וָבָ֔ךְ הִתְפַּלֵּל֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה וְיָסֵ֥ר מֵעָלֵ֖ינוּ אֶת־הַנָּחָ֑שׁ וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֥ל מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּעַ֥ד הָעָֽם׃
transliteration: vayavo ha'am el-mosheh vayom'rv chatanv kiy-dibar'nv vayhvah vavakh' hit'palel el-y'hvah v'yaser me'aleynv et-hanachash vayit'palel mosheh b'ad ha'am
translation: The people came to Moses and said, “We sinned by speaking against the L<small>ORD</small> and against you. Intercede with the L<small>ORD</small> to take away the serpents from us!” And Moses interceded for the people.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה עֲשֵׂ֤ה לְךָ֙ שָׂרָ֔ף וְשִׂ֥ים אֹת֖וֹ עַל־נֵ֑ס וְהָיָה֙ כָּל־הַנָּשׁ֔וּךְ וְרָאָ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ וָחָֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh 'aseh l'kha saraf v'siym otvo 'al-nes v'hayah kal-hanashvkh' v'raah otvo vachay
translation: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Make a seraph figure and mount it on a standard. And if anyone who is bitten looks at it, he shall recover.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ מֹשֶׁה֙ נְחַ֣שׁ נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וַיְשִׂמֵ֖הוּ עַל־הַנֵּ֑ס וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־נָשַׁ֤ךְ הַנָּחָשׁ֙ אֶת־אִ֔ישׁ וְהִבִּ֛יט אֶל־נְחַ֥שׁ הַנְּחֹ֖שֶׁת וָחָֽי׃
transliteration: vaya'as mosheh n'chash n'choshet vay'simehv 'al-hanes v'hayah im-nashakh' hanachash et-iysh v'hibiyt el-n'chash han'choshet vachay
translation: Moses made a copper serpent and mounted it on a standard; and when anyone was bitten by a serpent, he would look at the copper serpent and recover.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּאֹבֹֽת׃
transliteration: vayis'v b'ney yis'rael vayachanv b'ovot
translation: The Israelites marched on and encamped at Oboth.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵאֹבֹ֑ת וַֽיַּחֲנ֞וּ בְּעִיֵּ֣י הָֽעֲבָרִ֗ים בַּמִּדְבָּר֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י מוֹאָ֔ב מִמִּזְרַ֖ח הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃
transliteration: vayis'v meovot vayachanv b'iyey ha'avariym bamid'bar asher 'al-p'ney mvoav mimiz'rach hashamesh
translation: They set out from Oboth and encamped at Iye-abarim, in the wilderness bordering on Moab to the east.

hebrew: מִשָּׁ֖ם נָסָ֑עוּ וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּנַ֥חַל זָֽרֶד׃
transliteration: misham nasa'v vayachanv b'nachal zared
translation: From there they set out and encamped at the wadi Zered.

hebrew: מִשָּׁם֮ נָסָעוּ֒ וַֽיַּחֲנ֗וּ מֵעֵ֤בֶר אַרְנוֹן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר הַיֹּצֵ֖א מִגְּב֣וּל הָֽאֱמֹרִ֑י כִּ֤י אַרְנוֹן֙ גְּב֣וּל מוֹאָ֔ב בֵּ֥ין מוֹאָ֖ב וּבֵ֥ין הָאֱמֹרִֽי׃
transliteration: misham nasa'v vayachanv me'ever ar'nvon asher bamid'bar hayotze mig'vvl haemoriy kiy ar'nvon g'vvl mvoav beyn mvoav vveyn haemoriy
translation: From there they set out and encamped beyond the Arnon, that is, in the wilderness that extends from the territory of the Amorites. For the Arnon is the boundary of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.

hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֙ יֵֽאָמַ֔ר בְּסֵ֖פֶר מִלְחֲמֹ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה אֶת־וָהֵ֣ב בְּסוּפָ֔ה וְאֶת־הַנְּחָלִ֖ים אַרְנֽוֹן׃
transliteration: 'al-ken yeamar b'sefer mil'chamot y'hvah et-vahev b'svfah v'et-han'chaliym ar'nvon
translation: Therefore the Book of the Wars of the LORD speaks of fThe quotation that follows is a fragment; text and meaning are uncertain.“…Waheb in Suphah, and the wadis: the Arnon

hebrew: וְאֶ֙שֶׁד֙ הַנְּחָלִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָטָ֖ה לְשֶׁ֣בֶת עָ֑ר וְנִשְׁעַ֖ן לִגְב֥וּל מוֹאָֽב׃
transliteration: v'eshed han'chaliym asher natah l'shevet 'ar v'nish'an lig'vvl mvoav
translation: with its tributary wadis, stretched along the settled country of Ar, hugging the territory of Moab…”

hebrew: וּמִשָּׁ֖ם בְּאֵ֑רָה הִ֣וא הַבְּאֵ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמַ֤ר יְהוָה֙ לְמֹשֶׁ֔ה אֱסֹף֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וְאֶתְּנָ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם מָֽיִם׃ (ס)
transliteration: vmisham b'erah hiv hab'er asher amar y'hvah l'mosheh esof et-ha'am v'et'nah lahem mayim (s)
translation: And from there to Beer,gLit. “well.” which is the well where the LORD said to Moses, “Assemble the people that I may give them water.”

hebrew: אָ֚ז יָשִׁ֣יר יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־הַשִּׁירָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את עֲלִ֥י בְאֵ֖ר עֱנוּ־לָֽהּ׃
transliteration: az yashiyr yis'rael et-hashiyrah hazot 'aliy v'er 'env-lah
translation:
Then Israel sang this song:
Spring up, O well—sing to it—

hebrew: בְּאֵ֞ר חֲפָר֣וּהָ שָׂרִ֗ים כָּר֙וּהָ֙ נְדִיבֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם בִּמְחֹקֵ֖ק בְּמִשְׁעֲנֹתָ֑ם וּמִמִּדְבָּ֖ר מַתָּנָֽה׃
transliteration: b'er chafarvha sariym karvha n'diyvey ha'am bim'chokek b'mish'anotam vmimid'bar matanah
translation:
The well which the chieftains dug,
Which the nobles of the people started
With maces, with their own staffs.
And from MidbarhSeptuagint “the well” (=Beer); cf. v. 16. to Mattanah,

hebrew: וּמִמַּתָּנָ֖ה נַחֲלִיאֵ֑ל וּמִנַּחֲלִיאֵ֖ל בָּמֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vmimatanah nachaliyel vminachaliyel bamvot
translation: and from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth,

hebrew: וּמִבָּמ֗וֹת הַגַּיְא֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ בִּשְׂדֵ֣ה מוֹאָ֔ב רֹ֖אשׁ הַפִּסְגָּ֑ה וְנִשְׁקָ֖פָה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַיְשִׁימֹֽן׃ (פ)
transliteration: vmibamvot hagay' asher bis'deh mvoav rosh hapis'gah v'nish'kafah 'al-p'ney hay'shiymon (f)
translation: and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the country of Moab, at the peak of Pisgah, overlooking the wasteland.iOr “Jeshimon.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מַלְאָכִ֔ים אֶל־סִיחֹ֥ן מֶֽלֶךְ־הָאֱמֹרִ֖י לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayish'lach yis'rael mal'akhiym el-siychon melekh'-haemoriy lemor
translation: Israel now sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,

hebrew: אֶעְבְּרָ֣ה בְאַרְצֶ֗ךָ לֹ֤א נִטֶּה֙ בְּשָׂדֶ֣ה וּבְכֶ֔רֶם לֹ֥א נִשְׁתֶּ֖ה מֵ֣י בְאֵ֑ר בְּדֶ֤רֶךְ הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ נֵלֵ֔ךְ עַ֥ד אֲשֶֽׁר־נַעֲבֹ֖ר גְּבֻלֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: e'b'rah v'ar'tzekha lo niteh b'sadeh vv'kherem lo nish'teh mey v'er b'derekh' hamelekh' nelekh' 'ad asher-na'avor g'vulekha
translation: “Let me pass through your country. We will not turn off into fields or vineyards, and we will not drink water from wells. We will follow the king’s highway until we have crossed your territory.”

hebrew: וְלֹא־נָתַ֨ן סִיחֹ֣ן אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ עֲבֹ֣ר בִּגְבֻלוֹ֒ וַיֶּאֱסֹ֨ף סִיחֹ֜ן אֶת־כָּל־עַמּ֗וֹ וַיֵּצֵ֞א לִקְרַ֤את יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ הַמִּדְבָּ֔רָה וַיָּבֹ֖א יָ֑הְצָה וַיִּלָּ֖חֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'lo-natan siychon et-yis'rael 'avor big'vulvo vayeesof siychon et-kal-'amvo vayetze lik'rat yis'rael hamid'barah vayavo yah'tzah vayilachem b'yis'rael
translation: But Sihon would not let Israel pass through his territory. Sihon gathered all his people and went out against Israel in the wilderness. He came to Jahaz and engaged Israel in battle.

hebrew: וַיַּכֵּ֥הוּ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וַיִּירַ֨שׁ אֶת־אַרְצ֜וֹ מֵֽאַרְנֹ֗ן עַד־יַבֹּק֙ עַד־בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן כִּ֣י עַ֔ז גְּב֖וּל בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
transliteration: vayakehv yis'rael l'fiy-charev vayiyrash et-ar'tzvo mear'non 'ad-yabok 'ad-b'ney 'amvon kiy 'az g'vvl b'ney 'amvon
translation: But Israel put them to the sword, and took possession of their land, from the Arnon to the Jabbok, as far as [Az] of the Ammonites, for AzjSeptuagint “Jazer,” cf. v. 32. Others “for the boundary of the Ammonites was strong.” marked the boundary of the Ammonites.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֥ת כָּל־הֶעָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּכָל־עָרֵ֣י הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י בְּחֶשְׁבּ֖וֹן וּבְכָל־בְּנֹתֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vayikach yis'rael et kal-he'ariym haeleh vayeshev yis'rael b'khal-'arey haemoriy b'chesh'bvon vv'khal-b'noteyha
translation: Israel took all those towns. And Israel settled in all the towns of the Amorites, in Heshbon and all its dependencies.

hebrew: כִּ֣י חֶשְׁבּ֔וֹן עִ֗יר סִיחֹ֛ן מֶ֥לֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִ֖י הִ֑וא וְה֣וּא נִלְחַ֗ם בְּמֶ֤לֶךְ מוֹאָב֙ הָֽרִאשׁ֔וֹן וַיִּקַּ֧ח אֶת־כָּל־אַרְצ֛וֹ מִיָּד֖וֹ עַד־אַרְנֹֽן׃
transliteration: kiy chesh'bvon 'iyr siychon melekh' haemoriy hiv v'hv nil'cham b'melekh' mvoav harishvon vayikach et-kal-ar'tzvo miyadvo 'ad-ar'non
translation: Now Heshbon was the city of Sihon king of the Amorites, who had fought against a former king of Moab and taken all his land from him as far as the Arnon.

hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֛ן יֹאמְר֥וּ הַמֹּשְׁלִ֖ים בֹּ֣אוּ חֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן תִּבָּנֶ֥ה וְתִכּוֹנֵ֖ן עִ֥יר סִיחֽוֹן׃
transliteration: 'al-ken yom'rv hamosh'liym bov chesh'bvon tibaneh v'tikvonen 'iyr siychvon
translation:
Therefore the bards would recite:
kThe meaning of several parts of this ancient poem is no longer certain.“Come to Heshbon; firmly built
And well founded is Sihon’s city.

hebrew: כִּי־אֵשׁ֙ יָֽצְאָ֣ה מֵֽחֶשְׁבּ֔וֹן לֶהָבָ֖ה מִקִּרְיַ֣ת סִיחֹ֑ן אָֽכְלָה֙ עָ֣ר מוֹאָ֔ב בַּעֲלֵ֖י בָּמ֥וֹת אַרְנֹֽן׃
transliteration: kiy-esh yatz'ah mechesh'bvon lehavah mikir'yat siychon akh'lah 'ar mvoav ba'aley bamvot ar'non
translation:
For fire went forth from Heshbon,
Flame from Sihon’s city,
Consuming Ar of Moab,
The lords of BamothlCf. vv. 19 and 20 and Num. 22.21. by the Arnon.

hebrew: אוֹי־לְךָ֣ מוֹאָ֔ב אָבַ֖דְתָּ עַם־כְּמ֑וֹשׁ נָתַ֨ן בָּנָ֤יו פְּלֵיטִם֙ וּבְנֹתָ֣יו בַּשְּׁבִ֔ית לְמֶ֥לֶךְ אֱמֹרִ֖י סִיחֽוֹן׃
transliteration: voy-l'kha mvoav avad'ta 'am-k'mvosh natan banayv p'leytim vv'notayv bash'viyt l'melekh' emoriy siychvon
translation:
Woe to you, O Moab!
You are undone, O people of Chemosh!
His sons are rendered fugitive
And his daughters captive
By an Amorite king, Sihon.”

hebrew: וַנִּירָ֛ם אָבַ֥ד חֶשְׁבּ֖וֹן עַד־דִּיב֑וֹן וַנַּשִּׁ֣ים עַד־נֹ֔פַח אֲשֶׁ֖רׄ עַד־מֵֽידְבָֽא׃
transliteration: vaniyram avad chesh'bvon 'ad-diyvvon vanashiym 'ad-nofach asher 'ad-meyd'va
translation:
mMeaning of verse uncertain. Alternatively:Yet we have cast them down utterly,
Heshbon along with Dibon;
We have wrought desolation at Nophah,
Which is hard by Medeba.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּאֶ֖רֶץ הָאֱמֹרִֽי׃
transliteration: vayeshev yis'rael b'eretz haemoriy
translation: So Israel occupied the land of the Amorites.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ לְרַגֵּ֣ל אֶת־יַעְזֵ֔ר וַֽיִּלְכְּד֖וּ בְּנֹתֶ֑יהָ ויירש [וַיּ֖וֹרֶשׁ] אֶת־הָאֱמֹרִ֥י אֲשֶׁר־שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayish'lach mosheh l'ragel et-ya'zer vayil'k'dv b'noteyha vyyrsh [vayvoresh] et-haemoriy asher-sham
translation: Then Moses sent to spy out Jazer, and they captured its dependencies and dispossessed the Amorites who were there.

hebrew: וַיִּפְנוּ֙ וַֽיַּעֲל֔וּ דֶּ֖רֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֑ן וַיֵּצֵ֣א עוֹג֩ מֶֽלֶךְ־הַבָּשָׁ֨ן לִקְרָאתָ֜ם ה֧וּא וְכָל־עַמּ֛וֹ לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה אֶדְרֶֽעִי׃
transliteration: vayif'nv vaya'alv derekh' habashan vayetze 'vog melekh'-habashan lik'ratam hv v'khal-'amvo lamil'chamah ed're'iy
translation: They marched on and went up the road to Bashan, and King Og of Bashan, with all his people, came out to Edrei to engage them in battle.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ אַל־תִּירָ֣א אֹת֔וֹ כִּ֣י בְיָדְךָ֞ נָתַ֧תִּי אֹת֛וֹ וְאֶת־כָּל־עַמּ֖וֹ וְאֶת־אַרְצ֑וֹ וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ לּ֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֗יתָ לְסִיחֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּחֶשְׁבּֽוֹן׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh al-tiyra otvo kiy v'yad'kha natatiy otvo v'et-kal-'amvo v'et-ar'tzvo v'asiyta lvo kaasher 'asiyta l'siychon melekh' haemoriy asher yvoshev b'chesh'bvon
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Do not fear him, for I give him and all his people and his land into your hand. You shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites who dwelt in Heshbon.”

hebrew: וַיַּכּ֨וּ אֹת֤וֹ וְאֶת־בָּנָיו֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־עַמּ֔וֹ עַד־בִּלְתִּ֥י הִשְׁאִֽיר־ל֖וֹ שָׂרִ֑יד וַיִּֽירְשׁ֖וּ אֶת־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayakv otvo v'et-banayv v'et-kal-'amvo 'ad-bil'tiy hish'iyr-lvo sariyd vayiyr'shv et-ar'tzvo
translation: They defeated him and his sons and all his people, until no remnant was left him; and they took possession of his country.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בְּעַֽרְב֣וֹת מוֹאָ֔ב מֵעֵ֖בֶר לְיַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵחֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayis'v b'ney yis'rael vayachanv b'ar'vvot mvoav me'ever l'yar'den y'rechvo (s)
translation: The Israelites then marched on and encamped in the steppes of Moab, across the Jordan from Jericho.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא בָּלָ֖ק בֶּן־צִפּ֑וֹר אֵ֛ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לָֽאֱמֹרִֽי׃
transliteration: vayar' balak ben-tzipvor et kal-asher-'asah yis'rael laemoriy
translation: Balak son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.

hebrew: וַיָּ֨גָר מוֹאָ֜ב מִפְּנֵ֥י הָעָ֛ם מְאֹ֖ד כִּ֣י רַב־ה֑וּא וַיָּ֣קָץ מוֹאָ֔ב מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayagar mvoav mip'ney ha'am m'od kiy rav-hv vayakatz mvoav mip'ney b'ney yis'rael
translation: Moab was alarmed because that people was so numerous. Moab dreaded the Israelites,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מוֹאָ֜ב אֶל־זִקְנֵ֣י מִדְיָ֗ן עַתָּ֞ה יְלַחֲכ֤וּ הַקָּהָל֙ אֶת־כָּל־סְבִ֣יבֹתֵ֔ינוּ כִּלְחֹ֣ךְ הַשּׁ֔וֹר אֵ֖ת יֶ֣רֶק הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וּבָלָ֧ק בֶּן־צִפּ֛וֹר מֶ֥לֶךְ לְמוֹאָ֖ב בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִֽוא׃
transliteration: vayomer mvoav el-zik'ney mid'yan 'atah y'lachakhv hakahal et-kal-s'viyvoteynv kil'chokh' hashvor et yerek hasadeh vvalak ben-tzipvor melekh' l'mvoav ba'et hahiv
translation:
and Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now this horde will lick clean all that is about us as an ox licks up the grass of the field.”
Balak son of Zippor, who was king of Moab at that time,

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח מַלְאָכִ֜ים אֶל־בִּלְעָ֣ם בֶּן־בְּע֗וֹר פְּ֠תוֹרָה אֲשֶׁ֧ר עַל־הַנָּהָ֛ר אֶ֥רֶץ בְּנֵי־עַמּ֖וֹ לִקְרֹא־ל֑וֹ לֵאמֹ֗ר הִ֠נֵּה עַ֣ם יָצָ֤א מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ הִנֵּ֤ה כִסָּה֙ אֶת־עֵ֣ין הָאָ֔רֶץ וְה֥וּא יֹשֵׁ֖ב מִמֻּלִֽי׃
transliteration: vayish'lach mal'akhiym el-bil'am ben-b'vor p'tvorah asher 'al-hanahar eretz b'ney-'amvo lik'ro-lvo lemor hineh 'am yatza mimitz'rayim hineh khisah et-'eyn haaretz v'hv yoshev mimuliy
translation: sent messengers to Balaam son of Beor in Pethor, which is by the Euphrates,aLit. “the River.” in the land of his kinsfolk, to invite him, saying, “There is a people that came out of Egypt; it hides the earth from view, and it is settled next to me.

hebrew: וְעַתָּה֩ לְכָה־נָּ֨א אָֽרָה־לִּ֜י אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֗ה כִּֽי־עָצ֥וּם הוּא֙ מִמֶּ֔נִּי אוּלַ֤י אוּכַל֙ נַכֶּה־בּ֔וֹ וַאֲגָרְשֶׁ֖נּוּ מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּ֣י יָדַ֗עְתִּי אֵ֤ת אֲשֶׁר־תְּבָרֵךְ֙ מְבֹרָ֔ךְ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּאֹ֖ר יוּאָֽר׃
transliteration: v'atah l'khah-na arah-liy et-ha'am hazeh kiy-'atzvm hv mimeniy vlay vkhal nakeh-bvo vaagar'shenv min-haaretz kiy yada'tiy et asher-t'varekh' m'vorakh' vaasher taor yvar
translation: Come then, put a curse upon this people for me, since they are too numerous for me; perhaps I can thus defeat them and drive them out of the land. For I know that he whom you bless is blessed indeed, and he whom you curse is cursed.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ זִקְנֵ֤י מוֹאָב֙ וְזִקְנֵ֣י מִדְיָ֔ן וּקְסָמִ֖ים בְּיָדָ֑ם וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיְדַבְּר֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו דִּבְרֵ֥י בָלָֽק׃
transliteration: vayel'khv zik'ney mvoav v'zik'ney mid'yan vk'samiym b'yadam vayavov el-bil'am vay'dab'rv elayv div'rey valak
translation: The elders of Moab and the elders of Midian, bLit. “with divination in their power (hand).”versed in divination,-b set out. They came to Balaam and gave him Balak’s message.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם לִ֤ינוּ פֹה֙ הַלַּ֔יְלָה וַהֲשִׁבֹתִ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ דָּבָ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י וַיֵּשְׁב֥וּ שָׂרֵֽי־מוֹאָ֖ב עִם־בִּלְעָֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer aleyhem liynv foh halay'lah vahashivotiy et'khem davar kaasher y'daber y'hvah elay vayesh'vv sarey-mvoav 'im-bil'am
translation: He said to them, “Spend the night here, and I shall reply to you as the L<small>ORD</small> may instruct me.” So the Moabite dignitaries stayed with Balaam.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־בִּלְעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מִ֛י הָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה עִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayavo elohiym el-bil'am vayomer miy haanashiym haeleh 'imakh'
translation: God came to Balaam and said, “What do these people want of you?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר בִּלְעָ֖ם אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים בָּלָ֧ק בֶּן־צִפֹּ֛ר מֶ֥לֶךְ מוֹאָ֖ב שָׁלַ֥ח אֵלָֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer bil'am el-haelohiym balak ben-tzipor melekh' mvoav shalach elay
translation: Balaam said to God, “Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, sent me this message:

hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה הָעָם֙ הַיֹּצֵ֣א מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם וַיְכַ֖ס אֶת־עֵ֣ין הָאָ֑רֶץ עַתָּ֗ה לְכָ֤ה קָֽבָה־לִּי֙ אֹת֔וֹ אוּלַ֥י אוּכַ֛ל לְהִלָּ֥חֶם בּ֖וֹ וְגֵרַשְׁתִּֽיו׃
transliteration: hineh ha'am hayotze mimitz'rayim vay'khas et-'eyn haaretz 'atah l'khah kavah-liy otvo vlay vkhal l'hilachem bvo v'gerash'tiyv
translation: Here is a people that came out from Egypt and hides the earth from view. Come now and curse them for me; perhaps I can engage them in battle and drive them off.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם לֹ֥א תֵלֵ֖ךְ עִמָּהֶ֑ם לֹ֤א תָאֹר֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם כִּ֥י בָר֖וּךְ הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vayomer elohiym el-bil'am lo telekh' 'imahem lo taor et-ha'am kiy varvkh' hv
translation: But God said to Balaam, “Do not go with them. You must not curse that people, for they are blessed.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֤קָם בִּלְעָם֙ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־שָׂרֵ֣י בָלָ֔ק לְכ֖וּ אֶֽל־אַרְצְכֶ֑ם כִּ֚י מֵאֵ֣ן יְהוָ֔ה לְתִתִּ֖י לַהֲלֹ֥ךְ עִמָּכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayakam bil'am baboker vayomer el-sarey valak l'khv el-ar'tz'khem kiy meen y'hvah l'titiy lahalokh' 'imakhem
translation: Balaam arose in the morning and said to Balak’s dignitaries, “Go back to your own country, for the L<small>ORD</small> will not let me go with you.”

hebrew: וַיָּק֙וּמוּ֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מוֹאָ֔ב וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אֶל־בָּלָ֑ק וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מֵאֵ֥ן בִּלְעָ֖ם הֲלֹ֥ךְ עִמָּֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vayakvmv sarey mvoav vayavov el-balak vayom'rv meen bil'am halokh' 'imanv
translation: The Moabite dignitaries left, and they came to Balak and said, “Balaam refused to come with us.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥סֶף ע֖וֹד בָּלָ֑ק שְׁלֹ֣חַ שָׂרִ֔ים רַבִּ֥ים וְנִכְבָּדִ֖ים מֵאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: vayosef 'vod balak sh'locha sariym rabiym v'nikh'badiym meeleh
translation: Then Balak sent other dignitaries, more numerous and distinguished than the first.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ ל֗וֹ כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ בָּלָ֣ק בֶּן־צִפּ֔וֹר אַל־נָ֥א תִמָּנַ֖ע מֵהֲלֹ֥ךְ אֵלָֽי׃
transliteration: vayavov el-bil'am vayom'rv lvo koh amar balak ben-tzipvor al-na timana' mehalokh' elay
translation: They came to Balaam and said to him, “Thus says Balak son of Zippor: Please do not refuse to come to me.

hebrew: כִּֽי־כַבֵּ֤ד אֲכַבֶּדְךָ֙ מְאֹ֔ד וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאמַ֥ר אֵלַ֖י אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֑ה וּלְכָה־נָּא֙ קָֽבָה־לִּ֔י אֵ֖ת הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: kiy-khabed akhabed'kha m'od v'khol asher-tomar elay e'eseh vl'khah-na kavah-liy et ha'am hazeh
translation: I will reward you richly and I will do anything you ask of me. Only come and damn this people for me.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַן בִּלְעָ֗ם וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־עַבְדֵ֣י בָלָ֔ק אִם־יִתֶּן־לִ֥י בָלָ֛ק מְלֹ֥א בֵית֖וֹ כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֑ב לֹ֣א אוּכַ֗ל לַעֲבֹר֙ אֶת־פִּי֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔י לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת קְטַנָּ֖ה א֥וֹ גְדוֹלָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'an bil'am vayomer el-'av'dey valak im-yiten-liy valak m'lo veytvo kesef v'zahav lo vkhal la'avor et-piy y'hvah elohay la'asvot k'tanah vo g'dvolah
translation: Balaam replied to Balak’s officials, “Though Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not do anything, big or little, contrary to the command of the L<small>ORD</small> my God.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה שְׁב֨וּ נָ֥א בָזֶ֛ה גַּם־אַתֶּ֖ם הַלָּ֑יְלָה וְאֵ֣דְעָ֔ה מַה־יֹּסֵ֥ף יְהוָ֖ה דַּבֵּ֥ר עִמִּֽי׃
transliteration: v'atah sh'vv na vazeh gam-atem halay'lah v'ed'ah mah-yosef y'hvah daber 'imiy
translation: So you, too, stay here overnight, and let me find out what else the L<small>ORD</small> may say to me.”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א אֱלֹהִ֥ים ׀ אֶל־בִּלְעָם֮ לַיְלָה֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ אִם־לִקְרֹ֤א לְךָ֙ בָּ֣אוּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֔ים ק֖וּם לֵ֣ךְ אִתָּ֑ם וְאַ֗ךְ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־אֲדַבֵּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ אֹת֥וֹ תַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: vayavo elohiym  el-bil'am lay'lah vayomer lvo im-lik'ro l'kha bav haanashiym kvm lekh' itam v'akh' et-hadavar asher-adaber eleykha otvo ta'aseh
translation: That night God came to Balaam and said to him, “If these men have come to invite you, you may go with them. But whatever I command you, that you shall do.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֤קָם בִּלְעָם֙ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וַֽיַּחֲבֹ֖שׁ אֶת־אֲתֹנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ עִם־שָׂרֵ֥י מוֹאָֽב׃
transliteration: vayakam bil'am baboker vayachavosh et-atonvo vayelekh' 'im-sarey mvoav
translation: When he arose in the morning, Balaam saddled his ass and departed with the Moabite dignitaries.

hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֣ף אֱלֹהִים֮ כִּֽי־הוֹלֵ֣ךְ הוּא֒ וַיִּתְיַצֵּ֞ב מַלְאַ֧ךְ יְהוָ֛ה בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ לְשָׂטָ֣ן ל֑וֹ וְהוּא֙ רֹכֵ֣ב עַל־אֲתֹנ֔וֹ וּשְׁנֵ֥י נְעָרָ֖יו עִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayichar-af elohiym kiy-hvolekh' hv vayit'yatzev mal'akh' y'hvah baderekh' l'satan lvo v'hv rokhev 'al-atonvo vsh'ney n'arayv 'imvo
translation:
But God was incensed at his going; so an angel of the LORD placed himself in his way as an adversary.
He was riding on his she-ass, with his two servants alongside,

hebrew: וַתֵּ֣רֶא הָאָתוֹן֩ אֶת־מַלְאַ֨ךְ יְהוָ֜ה נִצָּ֣ב בַּדֶּ֗רֶךְ וְחַרְבּ֤וֹ שְׁלוּפָה֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ וַתֵּ֤ט הָֽאָתוֹן֙ מִן־הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וַתֵּ֖לֶךְ בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וַיַּ֤ךְ בִּלְעָם֙ אֶת־הָ֣אָת֔וֹן לְהַטֹּתָ֖הּ הַדָּֽרֶךְ׃
transliteration: vatere haatvon et-mal'akh' y'hvah nitzav baderekh' v'char'bvo sh'lvfah b'yadvo vatet haatvon min-haderekh' vatelekh' basadeh vayakh' bil'am et-haatvon l'hatotah hadarekh'
translation: when the ass caught sight of the angel of the L<small>ORD</small> standing in the way, with his drawn sword in his hand. The ass swerved from the road and went into the fields; and Balaam beat the ass to turn her back onto the road.

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲמֹד֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהוָ֔ה בְּמִשְׁע֖וֹל הַכְּרָמִ֑ים גָּדֵ֥ר מִזֶּ֖ה וְגָדֵ֥ר מִזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'amod mal'akh' y'hvah b'mish'vol hak'ramiym gader mizeh v'gader mizeh
translation: The angel of the L<small>ORD</small> then stationed himself in a lane between the vineyards, with a fence on either side.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֨רֶא הָאָת֜וֹן אֶת־מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהוָ֗ה וַתִּלָּחֵץ֙ אֶל־הַקִּ֔יר וַתִּלְחַ֛ץ אֶת־רֶ֥גֶל בִּלְעָ֖ם אֶל־הַקִּ֑יר וַיֹּ֖סֶף לְהַכֹּתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vatere haatvon et-mal'akh' y'hvah vatilachetz el-hakiyr vatil'chatz et-regel bil'am el-hakiyr vayosef l'hakotah
translation: The ass, seeing the angel of the L<small>ORD</small>, pressed herself against the wall and squeezed Balaam’s foot against the wall; so he beat her again.

hebrew: וַיּ֥וֹסֶף מַלְאַךְ־יְהוָ֖ה עֲב֑וֹר וַֽיַּעֲמֹד֙ בְּמָק֣וֹם צָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֛ר אֵֽין־דֶּ֥רֶךְ לִנְט֖וֹת יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹֽאול׃
transliteration: vayvosef mal'akh'-y'hvah 'avvor vaya'amod b'makvom tzar asher eyn-derekh' lin'tvot yamiyn vs'movl
translation: Once more the angel of the L<small>ORD</small> moved forward and stationed himself on a spot so narrow that there was no room to swerve right or left.

hebrew: וַתֵּ֤רֶא הָֽאָתוֹן֙ אֶת־מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהוָ֔ה וַתִּרְבַּ֖ץ תַּ֣חַת בִּלְעָ֑ם וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֣ף בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיַּ֥ךְ אֶת־הָאָת֖וֹן בַּמַּקֵּֽל׃
transliteration: vatere haatvon et-mal'akh' y'hvah vatir'batz tachat bil'am vayichar-af bil'am vayakh' et-haatvon bamakel
translation: When the ass now saw the angel of the L<small>ORD</small>, she lay down under Balaam; and Balaam was furious and beat the ass with his stick.

hebrew: וַיִּפְתַּ֥ח יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־פִּ֣י הָאָת֑וֹן וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לְבִלְעָם֙ מֶה־עָשִׂ֣יתִֽי לְךָ֔ כִּ֣י הִכִּיתַ֔נִי זֶ֖ה שָׁלֹ֥שׁ רְגָלִֽים׃
transliteration: vayif'tach y'hvah et-piy haatvon vatomer l'vil'am meh-'asiytiy l'kha kiy hikiytaniy zeh shalosh r'galiym
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> opened the ass’s mouth, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you that you have beaten me these three times?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בִּלְעָם֙ לָֽאָת֔וֹן כִּ֥י הִתְעַלַּ֖לְתְּ בִּ֑י ל֤וּ יֶשׁ־חֶ֙רֶב֙ בְּיָדִ֔י כִּ֥י עַתָּ֖ה הֲרַגְתִּֽיךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer bil'am laatvon kiy hit'alal't' biy lv yesh-cherev b'yadiy kiy 'atah harag'tiykh'
translation: Balaam said to the ass, “You have made a mockery of me! If I had a sword with me, I’d kill you.”

hebrew: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר הָאָת֜וֹן אֶל־בִּלְעָ֗ם הֲלוֹא֩ אָנֹכִ֨י אֲתֹֽנְךָ֜ אֲשֶׁר־רָכַ֣בְתָּ עָלַ֗י מֵעֽוֹדְךָ֙ עַד־הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה הַֽהַסְכֵּ֣ן הִסְכַּ֔נְתִּי לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לְךָ֖ כֹּ֑ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לֹֽא׃
transliteration: vatomer haatvon el-bil'am halvo anokhiy aton'kha asher-rakhav'ta 'alay me'vod'kha 'ad-hayvom hazeh hahas'ken his'kan'tiy la'asvot l'kha koh vayomer lo
translation: The ass said to Balaam, “Look, I am the ass that you have been riding all along until this day! Have I been in the habit of doing thus to you?” And he answered, “No.”

hebrew: וַיְגַ֣ל יְהוָה֮ אֶת־עֵינֵ֣י בִלְעָם֒ וַיַּ֞רְא אֶת־מַלְאַ֤ךְ יְהוָה֙ נִצָּ֣ב בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְחַרְבּ֥וֹ שְׁלֻפָ֖ה בְּיָד֑וֹ וַיִּקֹּ֥ד וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ לְאַפָּֽיו׃
transliteration: vay'gal y'hvah et-'eyney vil'am vayar' et-mal'akh' y'hvah nitzav baderekh' v'char'bvo sh'lufah b'yadvo vayikod vayish'tachv l'apayv
translation: Then the LORD uncovered Balaam’s eyes, and he saw the angel of the LORD standing in the way, his drawn sword in his hand; thereupon he bowed cLit. “and prostrated himself to his nostrils.”right down to the ground.-c

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהוָ֔ה עַל־מָ֗ה הִכִּ֙יתָ֙ אֶת־אֲתֹ֣נְךָ֔ זֶ֖ה שָׁל֣וֹשׁ רְגָלִ֑ים הִנֵּ֤ה אָנֹכִי֙ יָצָ֣אתִי לְשָׂטָ֔ן כִּֽי־יָרַ֥ט הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ לְנֶגְדִּֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv mal'akh' y'hvah 'al-mah hikiyta et-aton'kha zeh shalvosh r'galiym hineh anokhiy yatzatiy l'satan kiy-yarat haderekh' l'neg'diy
translation: The angel of the LORD said to him, “Why have you beaten your ass these three times? It is I who came out as an adversary, for the errand is obnoxiousdPrecise meaning of Heb. uncertain. to me.

hebrew: וַתִּרְאַ֙נִי֙ הָֽאָת֔וֹן וַתֵּ֣ט לְפָנַ֔י זֶ֖ה שָׁלֹ֣שׁ רְגָלִ֑ים אוּלַי֙ נָטְתָ֣ה מִפָּנַ֔י כִּ֥י עַתָּ֛ה גַּם־אֹתְכָ֥ה הָרַ֖גְתִּי וְאוֹתָ֥הּ הֶחֱיֵֽיתִי׃
transliteration: vatir'aniy haatvon vatet l'fanay zeh shalosh r'galiym vlay nat'tah mipanay kiy 'atah gam-ot'khah harag'tiy v'votah hecheyeytiy
translation: And when the ass saw me, she shied away because of me those three times. If she had not shied away from me, you are the one I should have killed, while sparing her.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר בִּלְעָ֜ם אֶל־מַלְאַ֤ךְ יְהוָה֙ חָטָ֔אתִי כִּ֚י לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֥י אַתָּ֛ה נִצָּ֥ב לִקְרָאתִ֖י בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ וְעַתָּ֛ה אִם־רַ֥ע בְּעֵינֶ֖יךָ אָשׁ֥וּבָה לִּֽי׃
transliteration: vayomer bil'am el-mal'akh' y'hvah chatatiy kiy lo yada'tiy kiy atah nitzav lik'ratiy badarekh' v'atah im-ra' b'eyneykha ashvvah liy
translation: Balaam said to the angel of the L<small>ORD</small>, “I erred because I did not know that you were standing in my way. If you still disapprove, I will turn back.”

hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֩ מַלְאַ֨ךְ יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־בִּלְעָ֗ם לֵ֚ךְ עִם־הָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְאֶ֗פֶס אֶת־הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־אֲדַבֵּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ אֹת֣וֹ תְדַבֵּ֑ר וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ בִּלְעָ֖ם עִם־שָׂרֵ֥י בָלָֽק׃
transliteration: vayomer mal'akh' y'hvah el-bil'am lekh' 'im-haanashiym v'efes et-hadavar asher-adaber eleykha otvo t'daber vayelekh' bil'am 'im-sarey valak
translation: But the angel of the L<small>ORD</small> said to Balaam, “Go with the men. But you must say nothing except what I tell you.” So Balaam went on with Balak’s dignitaries.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע בָּלָ֖ק כִּ֣י בָ֣א בִלְעָ֑ם וַיֵּצֵ֨א לִקְרָאת֜וֹ אֶל־עִ֣יר מוֹאָ֗ב אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־גְּב֣וּל אַרְנֹ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּקְצֵ֥ה הַגְּבֽוּל׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' balak kiy va vil'am vayetze lik'ratvo el-'iyr mvoav asher 'al-g'vvl ar'non asher bik'tzeh hag'vvl
translation: When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at Ir-moab, which is on the Arnon border, at its farthest point.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר בָּלָ֜ק אֶל־בִּלְעָ֗ם הֲלֹא֩ שָׁלֹ֨חַ שָׁלַ֤חְתִּי אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ לִקְרֹא־לָ֔ךְ לָ֥מָּה לֹא־הָלַ֖כְתָּ אֵלָ֑י הַֽאֻמְנָ֔ם לֹ֥א אוּכַ֖ל כַּבְּדֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayomer balak el-bil'am halo shalocha shalach'tiy eleykha lik'ro-lakh' lamah lo-halakh'ta elay haum'nam lo vkhal kab'dekha
translation: Balak said to Balaam, “When I first sent to invite you, why didn’t you come to me? Am I really unable to reward you?”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר בִּלְעָ֜ם אֶל־בָּלָ֗ק הִֽנֵּה־בָ֙אתִי֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ עַתָּ֕ה הֲיָכ֥וֹל אוּכַ֖ל דַּבֵּ֣ר מְא֑וּמָה הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָשִׂ֧ים אֱלֹהִ֛ים בְּפִ֖י אֹת֥וֹ אֲדַבֵּֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer bil'am el-balak hineh-vatiy eleykha 'atah hayakhvol vkhal daber m'vmah hadavar asher yasiym elohiym b'fiy otvo adaber
translation: But Balaam said to Balak, “And now that I have come to you, have I the power to speak freely? I can utter only the word that God puts into my mouth.”

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ בִּלְעָ֖ם עִם־בָּלָ֑ק וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ קִרְיַ֥ת חֻצֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayelekh' bil'am 'im-balak vayavov kir'yat chutzvot
translation: Balaam went with Balak and they came to Kiriath-huzoth.

hebrew: וַיִּזְבַּ֥ח בָּלָ֖ק בָּקָ֣ר וָצֹ֑אן וַיְשַׁלַּ֣ח לְבִלְעָ֔ם וְלַשָּׂרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayiz'bach balak bakar vatzon vay'shalach l'vil'am v'lasariym asher itvo
translation: Balak sacrificed oxen and sheep, and had them served to Balaam and the dignitaries with him.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיִּקַּ֤ח בָּלָק֙ אֶת־בִּלְעָ֔ם וַֽיַּעֲלֵ֖הוּ בָּמ֣וֹת בָּ֑עַל וַיַּ֥רְא מִשָּׁ֖ם קְצֵ֥ה הָעָֽם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy vaboker vayikach balak et-bil'am vaya'alehv bamvot ba'al vayar' misham k'tzeh ha'am
translation: In the morning Balak took Balaam up to Bamoth-baal. From there he could see a portion of the people.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בִּלְעָם֙ אֶל־בָּלָ֔ק בְּנֵה־לִ֥י בָזֶ֖ה שִׁבְעָ֣ה מִזְבְּחֹ֑ת וְהָכֵ֥ן לִי֙ בָּזֶ֔ה שִׁבְעָ֥ה פָרִ֖ים וְשִׁבְעָ֥ה אֵילִֽים׃
transliteration: vayomer bil'am el-balak b'neh-liy vazeh shiv'ah miz'b'chot v'hakhen liy bazeh shiv'ah fariym v'shiv'ah eyliym
translation: Balaam said to Balak, “Build me seven altars here and have seven bulls and seven rams ready here for me.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ בָּלָ֔ק כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֣ר בִּלְעָ֑ם וַיַּ֨עַל בָּלָ֧ק וּבִלְעָ֛ם פָּ֥ר וָאַ֖יִל בַּמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: vaya'as balak kaasher diber bil'am vaya'al balak vvil'am par vaayil bamiz'becha
translation: Balak did as Balaam directed; and Balak and Balaam offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר בִּלְעָ֜ם לְבָלָ֗ק הִתְיַצֵּב֮ עַל־עֹלָתֶךָ֒ וְאֵֽלְכָ֗ה אוּלַ֞י יִקָּרֵ֤ה יְהוָה֙ לִקְרָאתִ֔י וּדְבַ֥ר מַה־יַּרְאֵ֖נִי וְהִגַּ֣דְתִּי לָ֑ךְ וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ שֶֽׁפִי׃
transliteration: vayomer bil'am l'valak hit'yatzev 'al-'olatekha v'el'khah vlay yikareh y'hvah lik'ratiy vd'var mah-yar'eniy v'higad'tiy lakh' vayelekh' shefiy
translation: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here beside your offerings while I am gone. Perhaps the LORD will grant me a manifestation, and whatever He reveals to me I will tell you.” And he went off alone.aOthers “to a bare height”; exact meaning of Heb. shephi uncertain.

hebrew: וַיִּקָּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־בִּלְעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו אֶת־שִׁבְעַ֤ת הַֽמִּזְבְּחֹת֙ עָרַ֔כְתִּי וָאַ֛עַל פָּ֥ר וָאַ֖יִל בַּמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: vayikar elohiym el-bil'am vayomer elayv et-shiv'at hamiz'b'chot 'arakh'tiy vaa'al par vaayil bamiz'becha
translation: God manifested Himself to Balaam, who said to Him, “I have set up the seven altars and offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֧שֶׂם יְהוָ֛ה דָּבָ֖ר בְּפִ֣י בִלְעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֛אמֶר שׁ֥וּב אֶל־בָּלָ֖ק וְכֹ֥ה תְדַבֵּֽר׃
transliteration: vayasem y'hvah davar b'fiy vil'am vayomer shvv el-balak v'khoh t'daber
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> put a word in Balaam’s mouth and said, “Return to Balak and speak thus.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֣שָׁב אֵלָ֔יו וְהִנֵּ֥ה נִצָּ֖ב עַל־עֹלָת֑וֹ ה֖וּא וְכָל־שָׂרֵ֥י מוֹאָֽב׃
transliteration: vayashav elayv v'hineh nitzav 'al-'olatvo hv v'khal-sarey mvoav
translation: So he returned to him and found him standing beside his offerings, and all the Moabite dignitaries with him.

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר מִן־אֲ֠רָם יַנְחֵ֨נִי בָלָ֤ק מֶֽלֶךְ־מוֹאָב֙ מֵֽהַרְרֵי־קֶ֔דֶם לְכָה֙ אָֽרָה־לִּ֣י יַעֲקֹ֔ב וּלְכָ֖ה זֹעֲמָ֥ה יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayisa m'shalvo vayomar min-aram yan'cheniy valak melekh'-mvoav mehar'rey-kedem l'khah arah-liy ya'akov vl'khah zo'amah yis'rael
translation:
He took up his theme, and said:
From Aram has Balak brought me,
Moab’s king from the hills of the East:
Come, curse me Jacob,
Come, tell Israel’s doom!

hebrew: מָ֣ה אֶקֹּ֔ב לֹ֥א קַבֹּ֖ה אֵ֑ל וּמָ֣ה אֶזְעֹ֔ם לֹ֥א זָעַ֖ם יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: mah ekov lo kaboh el vmah ez'om lo za'am y'hvah
translation:
How can I damn whom GodbHeb. El, as often in these poems. has not damned,
How doom when the LORD has not doomed?

hebrew: כִּֽי־מֵרֹ֤אשׁ צֻרִים֙ אֶרְאֶ֔נּוּ וּמִגְּבָע֖וֹת אֲשׁוּרֶ֑נּוּ הֶן־עָם֙ לְבָדָ֣ד יִשְׁכֹּ֔ן וּבַגּוֹיִ֖ם לֹ֥א יִתְחַשָּֽׁב׃
transliteration: kiy-merosh tzuriym er'env vmig'va'vot ashvrenv hen-'am l'vadad yish'kon vvagvoyim lo yit'chashav
translation:
As I see them from the mountain tops,
Gaze on them from the heights,
There is a people that dwells apart,
Not reckoned among the nations,

hebrew: מִ֤י מָנָה֙ עֲפַ֣ר יַעֲקֹ֔ב וּמִסְפָּ֖ר אֶת־רֹ֣בַע יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל תָּמֹ֤ת נַפְשִׁי֙ מ֣וֹת יְשָׁרִ֔ים וּתְהִ֥י אַחֲרִיתִ֖י כָּמֹֽהוּ׃
transliteration: miy manah 'afar ya'akov vmis'par et-rova' yis'rael tamot naf'shiy mvot y'shariym vt'hiy achariytiy kamohv
translation:
Who can count the dustcCf. Gen. 13.16. of Jacob,
NumberdLit. “and the number of.” the dust-cloud of Israel?
May I die the death of the upright,eHeb. yesharim, a play on yeshurun (Jeshurun in Deut. 32.15), a name for Israel.
May my fate be like theirs!

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בָּלָק֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם מֶ֥ה עָשִׂ֖יתָ לִ֑י לָקֹ֤ב אֹיְבַי֙ לְקַחְתִּ֔יךָ וְהִנֵּ֖ה בֵּרַ֥כְתָּ בָרֵֽךְ׃
transliteration: vayomer balak el-bil'am meh 'asiyta liy lakov oy'vay l'kach'tiykha v'hineh berakh'ta varekh'
translation: Then Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? Here I brought you to damn my enemies, and instead you have blessed them!”

hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַן וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הֲלֹ֗א אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָשִׂ֤ים יְהוָה֙ בְּפִ֔י אֹת֥וֹ אֶשְׁמֹ֖ר לְדַבֵּֽר׃
transliteration: vaya'an vayomar halo et asher yasiym y'hvah b'fiy otvo esh'mor l'daber
translation: He replied, “I can only repeat faithfully what the L<small>ORD</small> puts in my mouth.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו בָּלָ֗ק לך־[לְכָה־] נָּ֨א אִתִּ֜י אֶל־מָק֤וֹם אַחֵר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּרְאֶ֣נּוּ מִשָּׁ֔ם אֶ֚פֶס קָצֵ֣הוּ תִרְאֶ֔ה וְכֻלּ֖וֹ לֹ֣א תִרְאֶ֑ה וְקָבְנוֹ־לִ֖י מִשָּֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayomer elayv balak lkh-[l'khah-] na itiy el-makvom acher asher tir'env misham efes katzehv tir'eh v'khulvo lo tir'eh v'kav'nvo-liy misham
translation: Then Balak said to him, “Come with me to another place from which you can see them—you will see only a portion of them; you will not see all of them—and damn them for me from there.”

hebrew: וַיִּקָּחֵ֙הוּ֙ שְׂדֵ֣ה צֹפִ֔ים אֶל־רֹ֖אשׁ הַפִּסְגָּ֑ה וַיִּ֙בֶן֙ שִׁבְעָ֣ה מִזְבְּחֹ֔ת וַיַּ֛עַל פָּ֥ר וָאַ֖יִל בַּמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: vayikachehv s'deh tzofiym el-rosh hapis'gah vayiven shiv'ah miz'b'chot vaya'al par vaayil bamiz'becha
translation: With that, he took him to Sedehzophim,fOr “Lookout Point.” on the summit of Pisgah. He built seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־בָּלָ֔ק הִתְיַצֵּ֥ב כֹּ֖ה עַל־עֹלָתֶ֑ךָ וְאָנֹכִ֖י אִקָּ֥רֶה כֹּֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer el-balak hit'yatzev koh 'al-'olatekha v'anokhiy ikareh koh
translation: And [Balaam] said to Balak, “Stay here beside your offerings, while I seek a manifestation yonder.”

hebrew: וַיִּקָּ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיָּ֥שֶׂם דָּבָ֖ר בְּפִ֑יו וַיֹּ֛אמֶר שׁ֥וּב אֶל־בָּלָ֖ק וְכֹ֥ה תְדַבֵּֽר׃
transliteration: vayikar y'hvah el-bil'am vayasem davar b'fiyv vayomer shvv el-balak v'khoh t'daber
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> manifested Himself to Balaam and put a word in his mouth, saying, “Return to Balak and speak thus.”

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א אֵלָ֗יו וְהִנּ֤וֹ נִצָּב֙ עַל־עֹ֣לָת֔וֹ וְשָׂרֵ֥י מוֹאָ֖ב אִתּ֑וֹ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ בָּלָ֔ק מַה־דִּבֶּ֖ר יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayavo elayv v'hinvo nitzav 'al-'olatvo v'sarey mvoav itvo vayomer lvo balak mah-diber y'hvah
translation: He went to him and found him standing beside his offerings, and the Moabite dignitaries with him. Balak asked him, “What did the L<small>ORD</small> say?”

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר ק֤וּם בָּלָק֙ וּֽשֲׁמָ֔ע הַאֲזִ֥ינָה עָדַ֖י בְּנ֥וֹ צִפֹּֽר׃
transliteration: vayisa m'shalvo vayomar kvm balak vshama' haaziynah 'aday b'nvo tzipor
translation:
And he took up his theme, and said:
Up, Balak, attend,
Give ear unto me, son of Zippor!

hebrew: לֹ֣א אִ֥ישׁ אֵל֙ וִֽיכַזֵּ֔ב וּבֶן־אָדָ֖ם וְיִתְנֶחָ֑ם הַה֤וּא אָמַר֙ וְלֹ֣א יַעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְדִבֶּ֖ר וְלֹ֥א יְקִימֶֽנָּה׃
transliteration: lo iysh el viykhazev vven-adam v'yit'necham hahv amar v'lo ya'aseh v'diber v'lo y'kiymenah
translation:
God is not man to be capricious,
Or mortal to change His mind.
Would He speak and not act,
Promise and not fulfill?

hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה בָרֵ֖ךְ לָקָ֑חְתִּי וּבֵרֵ֖ךְ וְלֹ֥א אֲשִׁיבֶֽנָּה׃
transliteration: hineh varekh' lakach'tiy vverekh' v'lo ashiyvenah
translation:
My message was to bless:
When He blesses, I cannot reverse it.

hebrew: לֹֽא־הִבִּ֥יט אָ֙וֶן֙ בְּיַעֲקֹ֔ב וְלֹא־רָאָ֥ה עָמָ֖ל בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהָיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וּתְרוּעַ֥ת מֶ֖לֶךְ בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: lo-hibiyt aven b'ya'akov v'lo-raah 'amal b'yis'rael y'hvah elohayv 'imvo vt'rv'at melekh' bvo
translation:
No harm is in sight for Jacob,
No woe in view for Israel.
The LORD their God is with them,
And their King’s acclaim in their midst.

hebrew: אֵ֖ל מוֹצִיאָ֣ם מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם כְּתוֹעֲפֹ֥ת רְאֵ֖ם לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: el mvotziyam mimitz'rayim k'tvo'afot r'em lvo
translation:
God who freed them from Egypt
Is for them like the hornsgLit. “eminences,” used figuratively. of the wild ox.

hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹא־נַ֙חַשׁ֙ בְּיַעֲקֹ֔ב וְלֹא־קֶ֖סֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כָּעֵ֗ת יֵאָמֵ֤ר לְיַעֲקֹב֙ וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מַה־פָּ֖עַל אֵֽל׃
transliteration: kiy lo-nachash b'ya'akov v'lo-kesem b'yis'rael ka'et yeamer l'ya'akov vl'yis'rael mah-pa'al el
translation:
Lo, there is no augury in Jacob,
No divining in Israel:hCf. Deut. 18.10–15.
Jacob is told at once,
Yea Israel, what God has planned.iOr, “Else would it be told to Jacob, / Yea to Israel, what God has planned.”

hebrew: הֶן־עָם֙ כְּלָבִ֣יא יָק֔וּם וְכַאֲרִ֖י יִתְנַשָּׂ֑א לֹ֤א יִשְׁכַּב֙ עַד־יֹ֣אכַל טֶ֔רֶף וְדַם־חֲלָלִ֖ים יִשְׁתֶּֽה׃
transliteration: hen-'am k'laviy yakvm v'khaariy yit'nasa lo yish'kav 'ad-yokhal teref v'dam-chalaliym yish'teh
translation:
Lo, a people that rises like a lion,
Leaps up like the jHeb. ’ari, another term for “lion.”king of beasts,-j
Rests not till it has feasted on prey
And drunk the blood of the slain.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בָּלָק֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם גַּם־קֹ֖ב לֹ֣א תִקֳּבֶ֑נּוּ גַּם־בָּרֵ֖ךְ לֹ֥א תְבָרֲכֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer balak el-bil'am gam-kov lo tikovenv gam-barekh' lo t'varakhenv
translation: Thereupon Balak said to Balaam, “Don’t curse them and don’t bless them!”

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַן בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֶל־בָּלָ֑ק הֲלֹ֗א דִּבַּ֤רְתִּי אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֹת֥וֹ אֶֽעֱשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: vaya'an bil'am vayomer el-balak halo dibar'tiy eleykha lemor kol asher-y'daber y'hvah otvo e'eseh
translation: In reply, Balaam said to Balak, “But I told you: Whatever the L<small>ORD</small> says, that I must do.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בָּלָק֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם לְכָה־נָּא֙ אֶקָּ֣חֲךָ֔ אֶל־מָק֖וֹם אַחֵ֑ר אוּלַ֤י יִישַׁר֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וְקַבֹּ֥תוֹ לִ֖י מִשָּֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayomer balak el-bil'am l'khah-na ekachakha el-makvom acher vlay yiyshar b'eyney haelohiym v'kabotvo liy misham
translation: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Come now, I will take you to another place. Perhaps God will deem it right that you damn them for me there.”

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֥ח בָּלָ֖ק אֶת־בִּלְעָ֑ם רֹ֣אשׁ הַפְּע֔וֹר הַנִּשְׁקָ֖ף עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַיְשִׁימֹֽן׃
transliteration: vayikach balak et-bil'am rosh hap'vor hanish'kaf 'al-p'ney hay'shiymon
translation: Balak took Balaam to the peak of Peor, which overlooks the wasteland.kCf. note on 21.20.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בִּלְעָם֙ אֶל־בָּלָ֔ק בְּנֵה־לִ֥י בָזֶ֖ה שִׁבְעָ֣ה מִזְבְּחֹ֑ת וְהָכֵ֥ן לִי֙ בָּזֶ֔ה שִׁבְעָ֥ה פָרִ֖ים וְשִׁבְעָ֥ה אֵילִֽים׃
transliteration: vayomer bil'am el-balak b'neh-liy vazeh shiv'ah miz'b'chot v'hakhen liy bazeh shiv'ah fariym v'shiv'ah eyliym
translation: Balaam said to Balak, “Build me here seven altars, and have seven bulls and seven rams ready for me here.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ בָּלָ֔ק כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָמַ֣ר בִּלְעָ֑ם וַיַּ֛עַל פָּ֥ר וָאַ֖יִל בַּמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
transliteration: vaya'as balak kaasher amar bil'am vaya'al par vaayil bamiz'becha
translation: Balak did as Balaam said: he offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.

hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא בִּלְעָ֗ם כִּ֣י ט֞וֹב בְּעֵינֵ֤י יְהוָה֙ לְבָרֵ֣ךְ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלֹא־הָלַ֥ךְ כְּפַֽעַם־בְּפַ֖עַם לִקְרַ֣את נְחָשִׁ֑ים וַיָּ֥שֶׁת אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר פָּנָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayar' bil'am kiy tvov b'eyney y'hvah l'varekh' et-yis'rael v'lo-halakh' k'fa'am-b'fa'am lik'rat n'chashiym vayashet el-hamid'bar panayv
translation: Now Balaam, seeing that it pleased the L<small>ORD</small> to bless Israel, did not, as on previous occasions, go in search of omens, but turned his face toward the wilderness.

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א בִלְעָ֜ם אֶת־עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שֹׁכֵ֖ן לִשְׁבָטָ֑יו וַתְּהִ֥י עָלָ֖יו ר֥וּחַ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: vayisa vil'am et-'eynayv vayar' et-yis'rael shokhen lish'vatayv vat'hiy 'alayv rvcha elohiym
translation: As Balaam looked up and saw Israel encamped tribe by tribe, the spirit of God came upon him.

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר נְאֻ֤ם בִּלְעָם֙ בְּנ֣וֹ בְעֹ֔ר וּנְאֻ֥ם הַגֶּ֖בֶר שְׁתֻ֥ם הָעָֽיִן׃
transliteration: vayisa m'shalvo vayomar n'um bil'am b'nvo v'or vn'um hagever sh'tum ha'ayin
translation:
Taking up his theme, he said:
aSome of the poetic portions of this chapter are unclear.Word of Balaam son of Beor,
Word of the man whose eye is true,bOthers “whose eye is (or, eyes are) open”; meaning of Heb. uncertain.

hebrew: נְאֻ֕ם שֹׁמֵ֖עַ אִמְרֵי־אֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר מַחֲזֵ֤ה שַׁדַּי֙ יֶֽחֱזֶ֔ה נֹפֵ֖ל וּגְל֥וּי עֵינָֽיִם׃
transliteration: n'um shome'a im'rey-el asher machazeh shaday yechezeh nofel vg'lvy 'eynayim
translation:
Word of him who hears God’s speech,
Who beholds visions from the Almighty,
Prostrate, but with eyes unveiled:

hebrew: מַה־טֹּ֥בוּ אֹהָלֶ֖יךָ יַעֲקֹ֑ב מִשְׁכְּנֹתֶ֖יךָ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: mah-tovv ohaleykha ya'akov mish'k'noteykha yis'rael
translation:
How fair are your tents, O Jacob,
Your dwellings, O Israel!

hebrew: כִּנְחָלִ֣ים נִטָּ֔יוּ כְּגַנֹּ֖ת עֲלֵ֣י נָהָ֑ר כַּאֲהָלִים֙ נָטַ֣ע יְהוָ֔ה כַּאֲרָזִ֖ים עֲלֵי־מָֽיִם׃
transliteration: kin'chaliym nitayv k'ganot 'aley nahar kaahaliym nata' y'hvah kaaraziym 'aley-mayim
translation:
Like palm-groves that stretch out,
Like gardens beside a river,
Like aloes planted by the LORD,
Like cedars beside the water;

hebrew: יִֽזַּל־מַ֙יִם֙ מִדָּ֣לְיָ֔ו וְזַרְע֖וֹ בְּמַ֣יִם רַבִּ֑ים וְיָרֹ֤ם מֵֽאֲגַג֙ מַלְכּ֔וֹ וְתִנַּשֵּׂ֖א מַלְכֻתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: yizal-mayim midal'yav v'zar'vo b'mayim rabiym v'yarom meagag mal'kvo v'tinase mal'khutvo
translation:
Their boughs drip with moisture,
Their rootscLit. “and its seed.” have abundant water.
Their king shall rise above Agag,
Their kingdom shall be exalted.

hebrew: אֵ֚ל מוֹצִיא֣וֹ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם כְּתוֹעֲפֹ֥ת רְאֵ֖ם ל֑וֹ יֹאכַ֞ל גּוֹיִ֣ם צָרָ֗יו וְעַצְמֹתֵיהֶ֛ם יְגָרֵ֖ם וְחִצָּ֥יו יִמְחָֽץ׃
transliteration: el mvotziyvo mimitz'rayim k'tvo'afot r'em lvo yokhal gvoyim tzarayv v'atz'moteyhem y'garem v'chitzayv yim'chatz
translation:
God who freed them from Egypt
Is for them like the hornsdSee note at 23.22. of the wild ox.
They shall devour enemy nations,
Crush their bones,
And smash their arrows.

hebrew: כָּרַ֨ע שָׁכַ֧ב כַּאֲרִ֛י וּכְלָבִ֖יא מִ֣י יְקִימֶ֑נּוּ מְבָרֲכֶ֣יךָ בָר֔וּךְ וְאֹרְרֶ֖יךָ אָרֽוּר׃
transliteration: kara' shakhav kaariy vkh'laviy miy y'kiymenv m'varakheykha varvkh' v'or'reykha arvr
translation:
They crouch, they lie down like a lion,
Like the king of beasts;eHeb. labi, another word for “lion”; cf. note at 23.24. who dare rouse them?
Blessed are they who bless you,
Accursed they who curse you!

hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֤ף בָּלָק֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיִּסְפֹּ֖ק אֶת־כַּפָּ֑יו וַיֹּ֨אמֶר בָּלָ֜ק אֶל־בִּלְעָ֗ם לָקֹ֤ב אֹֽיְבַי֙ קְרָאתִ֔יךָ וְהִנֵּה֙ בֵּרַ֣כְתָּ בָרֵ֔ךְ זֶ֖ה שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִֽים׃
transliteration: vayichar-af balak el-bil'am vayis'pok et-kapayv vayomer balak el-bil'am lakov oy'vay k'ratiykha v'hineh berakh'ta varekh' zeh shalosh p'amiym
translation: Enraged at Balaam, Balak struck his hands together. “I called you,” Balak said to Balaam, “to damn my enemies, and instead you have blessed them these three times!

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה בְּרַח־לְךָ֣ אֶל־מְקוֹמֶ֑ךָ אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ כַּבֵּ֣ד אֲכַבֶּדְךָ֔ וְהִנֵּ֛ה מְנָעֲךָ֥ יְהוָ֖ה מִכָּבֽוֹד׃
transliteration: v'atah b'rach-l'kha el-m'kvomekha amar'tiy kabed akhabed'kha v'hineh m'na'akha y'hvah mikavvod
translation: Back with you at once to your own place! I was going to reward you richly, but the L<small>ORD</small> has denied you the reward.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר בִּלְעָ֖ם אֶל־בָּלָ֑ק הֲלֹ֗א גַּ֧ם אֶל־מַלְאָכֶ֛יךָ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥חְתָּ אֵלַ֖י דִּבַּ֥רְתִּי לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer bil'am el-balak halo gam el-mal'akheykha asher-shalach'ta elay dibar'tiy lemor
translation: Balaam replied to Balak, “But I even told the messengers you sent to me,

hebrew: אִם־יִתֶּן־לִ֨י בָלָ֜ק מְלֹ֣א בֵיתוֹ֮ כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָב֒ לֹ֣א אוּכַ֗ל לַעֲבֹר֙ אֶת־פִּ֣י יְהוָ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת טוֹבָ֛ה א֥וֹ רָעָ֖ה מִלִּבִּ֑י אֲשֶׁר־יְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֹת֥וֹ אֲדַבֵּֽר׃
transliteration: im-yiten-liy valak m'lo veytvo kesef v'zahav lo vkhal la'avor et-piy y'hvah la'asvot tvovah vo ra'ah milibiy asher-y'daber y'hvah otvo adaber
translation: ‘Though Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not of my own accord do anything good or bad contrary to the L<small>ORD</small>’s command. What the L<small>ORD</small> says, that I must say.’

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה הִנְנִ֥י הוֹלֵ֖ךְ לְעַמִּ֑י לְכָה֙ אִיעָ֣צְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַעֲשֶׂ֜ה הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֛ה לְעַמְּךָ֖ בְּאַחֲרִ֥ית הַיָּמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'atah hin'niy hvolekh' l'amiy l'khah iy'atz'kha asher ya'aseh ha'am hazeh l'am'kha b'achariyt hayamiym
translation: And now, as I go back to my people, let me inform you of what this people will do to your people in days to come.”

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר נְאֻ֤ם בִּלְעָם֙ בְּנ֣וֹ בְעֹ֔ר וּנְאֻ֥ם הַגֶּ֖בֶר שְׁתֻ֥ם הָעָֽיִן׃
transliteration: vayisa m'shalvo vayomar n'um bil'am b'nvo v'or vn'um hagever sh'tum ha'ayin
translation:
He took up his theme, and said:
Word of Balaam son of Beor,
Word of the man whose eye is true,

hebrew: נְאֻ֗ם שֹׁמֵ֙עַ֙ אִמְרֵי־אֵ֔ל וְיֹדֵ֖עַ דַּ֣עַת עֶלְי֑וֹן מַחֲזֵ֤ה שַׁדַּי֙ יֶֽחֱזֶ֔ה נֹפֵ֖ל וּגְל֥וּי עֵינָֽיִם׃
transliteration: n'um shome'a im'rey-el v'yode'a da'at 'el'yvon machazeh shaday yechezeh nofel vg'lvy 'eynayim
translation:
Word of him who hears God’s speech,
Who obtains knowledge from the Most High,
And beholds visions from the Almighty,
Prostrate, but with eyes unveiled:

hebrew: אֶרְאֶ֙נּוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א עַתָּ֔ה אֲשׁוּרֶ֖נּוּ וְלֹ֣א קָר֑וֹב דָּרַ֨ךְ כּוֹכָ֜ב מִֽיַּעֲקֹ֗ב וְקָ֥ם שֵׁ֙בֶט֙ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּמָחַץ֙ פַּאֲתֵ֣י מוֹאָ֔ב וְקַרְקַ֖ר כָּל־בְּנֵי־שֵֽׁת׃
transliteration: er'env v'lo 'atah ashvrenv v'lo karvov darakh' kvokhav miya'akov v'kam shevet miyis'rael vmachatz paatey mvoav v'kar'kar kal-b'ney-shet
translation:
What I see for them is not yet,
What I behold will not be soon:
A star rises from Jacob,
A scepter comes forth from Israel;
It smashes the brow of Moab,
The foundation offSamaritan “the pate of,” cf. Jer. 48.45; others “breaks down.” all children of Seth.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה אֱד֜וֹם יְרֵשָׁ֗ה וְהָיָ֧ה יְרֵשָׁ֛ה שֵׂעִ֖יר אֹיְבָ֑יו וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עֹ֥שֶׂה חָֽיִל׃
transliteration: v'hayah edvom y'reshah v'hayah y'reshah se'iyr oy'vayv v'yis'rael 'oseh chayil
translation:
Edom becomes a possession,
Yea, Seir a possession of its enemies;
But Israel is triumphant.

hebrew: וְיֵ֖רְדְּ מִֽיַּעֲקֹ֑ב וְהֶֽאֱבִ֥יד שָׂרִ֖יד מֵעִֽיר׃
transliteration: v'yer'd' miya'akov v'heeviyd sariyd me'iyr
translation:
A victor issues from Jacob
To wipe out what is left of Ir.

hebrew: וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־עֲמָלֵ֔ק וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר רֵאשִׁ֤ית גּוֹיִם֙ עֲמָלֵ֔ק וְאַחֲרִית֖וֹ עֲדֵ֥י אֹבֵֽד׃
transliteration: vayar' et-'amalek vayisa m'shalvo vayomar reshiyt gvoyim 'amalek v'achariytvo 'adey oved
translation:
He saw Amalek and, taking up his theme, he said:
A leading nation is Amalek;
But its fate is to perish forever.

hebrew: וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־הַקֵּינִ֔י וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֵיתָן֙ מֽוֹשָׁבֶ֔ךָ וְשִׂ֥ים בַּסֶּ֖לַע קִנֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: vayar' et-hakeyniy vayisa m'shalvo vayomar eytan mvoshavekha v'siym basela' kinekha
translation:
He saw the Kenites and, taking up his theme, he said:
Though your abode be secure,
And your nest be set among cliffs,

hebrew: כִּ֥י אִם־יִהְיֶ֖ה לְבָ֣עֵֽר קָ֑יִן עַד־מָ֖ה אַשּׁ֥וּר תִּשְׁבֶּֽךָּ׃
transliteration: kiy im-yih'yeh l'va'er kayin 'ad-mah ashvr tish'beka
translation:
Yet shall KaingI.e., the Kenites. be consumed,
When Asshur takes you captive.

hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר א֕וֹי מִ֥י יִחְיֶ֖ה מִשֻּׂמ֥וֹ אֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayisa m'shalvo vayomar voy miy yich'yeh misumvo el
translation:
He took up his theme and said:
Alas, who can survive except God has willed it!

hebrew: וְצִים֙ מִיַּ֣ד כִּתִּ֔ים וְעִנּ֥וּ אַשּׁ֖וּר וְעִנּוּ־עֵ֑בֶר וְגַם־ה֖וּא עֲדֵ֥י אֹבֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'tziym miyad kitiym v'inv ashvr v'inv-'ever v'gam-hv 'adey oved
translation:
Ships come from the quarter of Kittim;
They subject Asshur, subject Eber.
They, too, shall perish forever.

hebrew: וַיָּ֣קָם בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ וַיָּ֣שָׁב לִמְקֹמ֑וֹ וְגַם־בָּלָ֖ק הָלַ֥ךְ לְדַרְכּֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayakam bil'am vayelekh' vayashav lim'komvo v'gam-balak halakh' l'dar'kvo (f)
translation: Then Balaam set out on his journey back home; and Balak also went his way.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּשִּׁטִּ֑ים וַיָּ֣חֶל הָעָ֔ם לִזְנ֖וֹת אֶל־בְּנ֥וֹת מוֹאָֽב׃
transliteration: vayeshev yis'rael bashitiym vayachel ha'am liz'nvot el-b'nvot mvoav
translation: While Israel was staying at Shittim, the people aOthers “began to commit harlotry.”profaned themselves by whoring-a with the Moabite women,

hebrew: וַתִּקְרֶ֣אןָ לָעָ֔ם לְזִבְחֵ֖י אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ן וַיֹּ֣אכַל הָעָ֔ם וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוּ֖וּ לֵֽאלֹהֵיהֶֽן׃
transliteration: vatik'rena la'am l'ziv'chey eloheyhen vayokhal ha'am vayish'tachavv leloheyhen
translation: who invited the people to the sacrifices for their god. The people partook of them and worshiped that god.

hebrew: וַיִּצָּ֥מֶד יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְבַ֣עַל פְּע֑וֹר וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יְהוָ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayitzamed yis'rael l'va'al p'vor vayichar-af y'hvah b'yis'rael
translation: Thus Israel attached itself to Baal-peor, and the L<small>ORD</small> was incensed with Israel.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה קַ֚ח אֶת־כָּל־רָאשֵׁ֣י הָעָ֔ם וְהוֹקַ֥ע אוֹתָ֛ם לַיהוָ֖ה נֶ֣גֶד הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ וְיָשֹׁ֛ב חֲר֥וֹן אַף־יְהוָ֖ה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh kach et-kal-rashey ha'am v'hvoka' votam layhvah neged hashamesh v'yashov charvon af-y'hvah miyis'rael
translation: The LORD said to Moses, “Take all the ringleadersbLit. “heads of the people.” and have them publiclycOthers “in face of the sun.” impaled before the LORD, so that the LORD’s wrath may turn away from Israel.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־שֹׁפְטֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הִרְגוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֲנָשָׁ֔יו הַנִּצְמָדִ֖ים לְבַ֥עַל פְּעֽוֹר׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-shof'tey yis'rael hir'gv iysh anashayv hanitz'madiym l'va'al p'vor
translation: So Moses said to Israel’s officials, “Each of you slay those of his men who attached themselves to Baal-peor.”

hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֡ה אִישׁ֩ מִבְּנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל בָּ֗א וַיַּקְרֵ֤ב אֶל־אֶחָיו֙ אֶת־הַמִּדְיָנִ֔ית לְעֵינֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה וּלְעֵינֵ֖י כָּל־עֲדַ֣ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהֵ֣מָּה בֹכִ֔ים פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: v'hineh iysh mib'ney yis'rael ba vayak'rev el-echayv et-hamid'yaniyt l'eyney mosheh vl'eyney kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael v'hemah vokhiym petach ohel mvo'ed
translation: Just then one of the Israelites came and brought a Midianite woman over to his companions, in the sight of Moses and of the whole Israelite community who were weeping at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וַיַּ֗רְא פִּֽינְחָס֙ בֶּן־אֶלְעָזָ֔ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וַיָּ֙קָם֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הָֽעֵדָ֔ה וַיִּקַּ֥ח רֹ֖מַח בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayar' piyn'chas ben-el'azar ben-aharon hakohen vayakam mitvokh' ha'edah vayikach romach b'yadvo
translation: When Phinehas, son of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest, saw this, he left the assembly and, taking a spear in his hand,

hebrew: וַ֠יָּבֹא אַחַ֨ר אִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶל־הַקֻּבָּ֗ה וַיִּדְקֹר֙ אֶת־שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם אֵ֚ת אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֶת־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־קֳבָתָ֑הּ וַתֵּֽעָצַר֙ הַמַּגֵּפָ֔ה מֵעַ֖ל בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayavo achar iysh-yis'rael el-hakubah vayid'kor et-sh'neyhem et iysh yis'rael v'et-haishah el-kovatah vate'atzar hamagefah me'al b'ney yis'rael
translation: he followed the Israelite into the chamber and stabbed both of them, the Israelite and the woman, through the belly. Then the plague against the Israelites was checked.

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֕וּ הַמֵּתִ֖ים בַּמַּגֵּפָ֑ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayih'yv hametiym bamagefah ar'ba'ah v'es'riym alef (f)
translation: Those who died of the plague numbered twenty-four thousand.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying,

hebrew: פִּֽינְחָ֨ס בֶּן־אֶלְעָזָ֜ר בֶּן־אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֗ן הֵשִׁ֤יב אֶת־חֲמָתִי֙ מֵעַ֣ל בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּקַנְא֥וֹ אֶת־קִנְאָתִ֖י בְּתוֹכָ֑ם וְלֹא־כִלִּ֥יתִי אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּקִנְאָתִֽי׃
transliteration: piyn'chas ben-el'azar ben-aharon hakohen heshiyv et-chamatiy me'al b'ney-yis'rael b'kan'vo et-kin'atiy b'tvokham v'lo-khiliytiy et-b'ney-yis'rael b'kin'atiy
translation: “Phinehas, son of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest, has turned back My wrath from the Israelites by displaying among them his passion for Me, so that I did not wipe out the Israelite people in My passion.

hebrew: לָכֵ֖ן אֱמֹ֑ר הִנְנִ֨י נֹתֵ֥ן ל֛וֹ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י שָׁלֽוֹם׃
transliteration: lakhen emor hin'niy noten lvo et-b'riytiy shalvom
translation: Say, therefore, ‘I grant him My pact of friendship.

hebrew: וְהָ֤יְתָה לּוֹ֙ וּלְזַרְע֣וֹ אַחֲרָ֔יו בְּרִ֖ית כְּהֻנַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם תַּ֗חַת אֲשֶׁ֤ר קִנֵּא֙ לֵֽאלֹהָ֔יו וַיְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'hay'tah lvo vl'zar'vo acharayv b'riyt k'hunat 'volam tachat asher kine lelohayv vay'khaper 'al-b'ney yis'rael
translation: It shall be for him and his descendants after him a pact of priesthood for all time, because he took impassioned action for his God, thus making expiation for the Israelites.’”

hebrew: וְשֵׁם֩ אִ֨ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל הַמֻּכֶּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֻכָּה֙ אֶת־הַמִּדְיָנִ֔ית זִמְרִ֖י בֶּן־סָל֑וּא נְשִׂ֥יא בֵֽית־אָ֖ב לַשִּׁמְעֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: v'shem iysh yis'rael hamukeh asher hukah et-hamid'yaniyt zim'riy ben-salv n'siy veyt-av lashim'oniy
translation: The name of the Israelite who was killed, the one who was killed with the Midianite woman, was Zimri son of Salu, chieftain of a Simeonite ancestral house.

hebrew: וְשֵׁ֨ם הָֽאִשָּׁ֧ה הַמֻּכָּ֛ה הַמִּדְיָנִ֖ית כָּזְבִּ֣י בַת־צ֑וּר רֹ֣אשׁ אֻמּ֥וֹת בֵּֽית־אָ֛ב בְּמִדְיָ֖ן הֽוּא׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'shem haishah hamukah hamid'yaniyt kaz'biy vat-tzvr rosh umvot beyt-av b'mid'yan hv (f)
translation: The name of the Midianite woman who was killed was Cozbi daughter of Zur; he was the tribal head of an ancestral house in Midian.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying,

hebrew: צָר֖וֹר אֶת־הַמִּדְיָנִ֑ים וְהִכִּיתֶ֖ם אוֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: tzarvor et-hamid'yaniym v'hikiytem votam
translation: “Assail the Midianites and defeat them—

hebrew: כִּ֣י צֹרְרִ֥ים הֵם֙ לָכֶ֔ם בְּנִכְלֵיהֶ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־נִכְּל֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם עַל־דְּבַר־פְּע֑וֹר וְעַל־דְּבַ֞ר כָּזְבִּ֨י בַת־נְשִׂ֤יא מִדְיָן֙ אֲחֹתָ֔ם הַמֻּכָּ֥ה בְיוֹם־הַמַּגֵּפָ֖ה עַל־דְּבַר־פְּעֽוֹר׃
transliteration: kiy tzor'riym hem lakhem b'nikh'leyhem asher-nik'lv lakhem 'al-d'var-p'vor v'al-d'var kaz'biy vat-n'siy mid'yan achotam hamukah v'yvom-hamagefah 'al-d'var-p'vor
translation: for they assailed you by the trickery they practiced against you—because of the affair of Peor and because of the affair of their kinswoman Cozbi, daughter of the Midianite chieftain, who was killed at the time of the plague on account of Peor.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י אַחֲרֵ֣י הַמַּגֵּפָ֑ה (פ) וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְאֶ֧ל אֶלְעָזָ֛ר בֶּן־אַהֲרֹ֥ן הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'hiy acharey hamagefah (f) vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh v'el el'azar ben-aharon hakohen lemor
translation: When the plague was over, the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses and to Eleazar son of Aaron the priest,

hebrew: שְׂא֞וּ אֶת־רֹ֣אשׁ ׀ כָּל־עֲדַ֣ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֛ה וָמַ֖עְלָה לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם כָּל־יֹצֵ֥א צָבָ֖א בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: s'v et-rosh  kal-'adat b'ney-yis'rael miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah l'veyt avotam kal-yotze tzava b'yis'rael
translation: “Take a census of the whole Israelite community from the age of twenty years up, by their ancestral houses, all Israelites able to bear arms.”

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר מֹשֶׁ֜ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֹתָ֖ם בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֑ב עַל־יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵח֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh v'el'azar hakohen otam b'ar'vot mvoav 'al-yar'den y'rechvo lemor
translation: aMeaning of parts of vv. 3 and 4 uncertain.So Moses and Eleazar the priest, on the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho, gave instructions about them, namely,

hebrew: מִבֶּ֛ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וָמָ֑עְלָה כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ צִוָּ֨ה יְהוָ֤ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁה֙ וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh vv'ney yis'rael hayotz'iym meeretz mitz'rayim
translation:
those from twenty years up, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
The descendants of the Israelites who came out of the land of Egypt were:

hebrew: רְאוּבֵ֖ן בְּכ֣וֹר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּנֵ֣י רְאוּבֵ֗ן חֲנוֹךְ֙ מִשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַחֲנֹכִ֔י לְפַלּ֕וּא מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַפַּלֻּאִֽי׃
transliteration: r'vven b'khvor yis'rael b'ney r'vven chanvokh' mish'pachat hachanokhiy l'falv mish'pachat hapaluiy
translation: Reuben, Israel’s first-born. Descendants of Reuben: [Of] Enoch,bOr “Hanoch.” the clan of the Enochites; of Pallu, the clan of the Palluites;

hebrew: לְחֶצְרֹ֕ן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽחֶצְרוֹנִ֑י לְכַרְמִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַכַּרְמִֽי׃
transliteration: l'chetz'ron mish'pachat hachetz'rvoniy l'khar'miy mish'pachat hakar'miy
translation: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronites; of Carmi, the clan of the Carmites.

hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת הָרֻֽאוּבֵנִ֑י וַיִּהְי֣וּ פְקֻדֵיהֶ֗ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וּשְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: eleh mish'p'chot haruvveniy vayih'yv f'kudeyhem sh'loshah v'ar'ba'iym elef vsh'va' mevot vsh'loshiym
translation: Those are the clans of the Reubenites. The persons enrolled came to 43,730.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י פַלּ֖וּא אֱלִיאָֽב׃
transliteration: vv'ney falv eliyav
translation: cOr “descendants of.”Born to-c Pallu: Eliab.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י אֱלִיאָ֔ב נְמוּאֵ֖ל וְדָתָ֣ן וַאֲבִירָ֑ם הֽוּא־דָתָ֨ן וַאֲבִירָ֜ם קרואי [קְרִיאֵ֣י] הָעֵדָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִצּ֜וּ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ בַּעֲדַת־קֹ֔רַח בְּהַצֹּתָ֖ם עַל־יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vv'ney eliyav n'mvel v'datan vaaviyram hv-datan vaaviyram krvy [k'riyey] ha'edah asher hitzv 'al-mosheh v'al-aharon ba'adat-korach b'hatzotam 'al-y'hvah
translation: The sons of Eliab were Nemuel, and Dathan and Abiram. These are the same Dathan and Abiram, chosen in the assembly, who agitated against Moses and Aaron as part of Korah’s band when they agitated against the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַתִּפְתַּ֨ח הָאָ֜רֶץ אֶת־פִּ֗יהָ וַתִּבְלַ֥ע אֹתָ֛ם וְאֶת־קֹ֖רַח בְּמ֣וֹת הָעֵדָ֑ה בַּאֲכֹ֣ל הָאֵ֗שׁ אֵ֣ת חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים וּמָאתַ֙יִם֙ אִ֔ישׁ וַיִּהְי֖וּ לְנֵֽס׃
transliteration: vatif'tach haaretz et-piyha vativ'la' otam v'et-korach b'mvot ha'edah baakhol haesh et chamishiym vmatayim iysh vayih'yv l'nes
translation: Whereupon the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up with Korah—when that band died, when the fire consumed the two hundred and fifty men—and they became an example.

hebrew: וּבְנֵי־קֹ֖רַח לֹא־מֵֽתוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vv'ney-korach lo-metv (s)
translation: The sons of Korah, however, did not die.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י שִׁמְעוֹן֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לִנְמוּאֵ֗ל מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַנְּמ֣וּאֵלִ֔י לְיָמִ֕ין מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיָּמִינִ֑י לְיָכִ֕ין מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיָּכִינִֽי׃
transliteration: b'ney shim'von l'mish'p'chotam lin'mvel mish'pachat han'mveliy l'yamiyn mish'pachat hayamiyniy l'yakhiyn mish'pachat hayakhiyniy
translation: Descendants of Simeon by their clans: Of Nemuel, the clan of the Nemuelites; of Jamin, the clan of the Jaminites; of Jachin, the clan of the Jachinites;

hebrew: לְזֶ֕רַח מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַזַּרְחִ֑י לְשָׁא֕וּל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁאוּלִֽי׃
transliteration: l'zerach mish'pachat hazar'chiy l'shavl mish'pachat hashavliy
