translation: of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahites; of Saul,dOr “Shaul.” the clan of the Saulites.

hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת הַשִּׁמְעֹנִ֑י שְׁנַ֧יִם וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּמָאתָֽיִם׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh mish'p'chot hashim'oniy sh'nayim v'es'riym elef vmatayim (s)
translation: Those are the clans of the Simeonites; [persons enrolled:] 22,200.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י גָד֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לִצְפ֗וֹן מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַצְּפוֹנִ֔י לְחַגִּ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽחַגִּ֑י לְשׁוּנִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשּׁוּנִֽי׃
transliteration: b'ney gad l'mish'p'chotam litz'fvon mish'pachat hatz'fvoniy l'chagiy mish'pachat hachagiy l'shvniy mish'pachat hashvniy
translation: Descendants of Gad by their clans: Of Zephon, the clan of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the clan of the Haggites; of Shuni, the clan of the Shunites;

hebrew: לְאָזְנִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאָזְנִ֑י לְעֵרִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָעֵרִֽי׃
transliteration: l'az'niy mish'pachat haaz'niy l'eriy mish'pachat ha'eriy
translation: of Ozni, the clan of the Oznites; of Eri, the clan of the Erites;

hebrew: לַאֲר֕וֹד מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאֲרוֹדִ֑י לְאַ֨רְאֵלִ֔י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאַרְאֵלִֽי׃
transliteration: laarvod mish'pachat haarvodiy l'ar'eliy mish'pachat haar'eliy
translation: of Arod, the clan of the Arodites; of Areli, the clan of the Arelites.

hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־גָ֖ד לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh mish'p'chot b'ney-gad lif'kudeyhem ar'ba'iym elef vachamesh mevot (s)
translation: Those are the clans of Gad’s descendants; persons enrolled: 40,500.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה עֵ֣ר וְאוֹנָ֑ן וַיָּ֥מָת עֵ֛ר וְאוֹנָ֖ן בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: b'ney y'hvdah 'er v'vonan vayamat 'er v'vonan b'eretz k'na'an
translation: cOr “descendants of.”Born to-c Judah: Er and Onan. Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ בְנֵי־יְהוּדָה֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לְשֵׁלָ֗ה מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַשֵּׁ֣לָנִ֔י לְפֶ֕רֶץ מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַפַּרְצִ֑י לְזֶ֕רַח מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַזַּרְחִֽי׃
transliteration: vayih'yv v'ney-y'hvdah l'mish'p'chotam l'shelah mish'pachat hashelaniy l'feretz mish'pachat hapar'tziy l'zerach mish'pachat hazar'chiy
translation: Descendants of Judah by their clans: Of Shelah, the clan of the Shelanites; of Perez, the clan of the Perezites; of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahites.

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ בְנֵי־פֶ֔רֶץ לְחֶצְרֹ֕ן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽחֶצְרֹנִ֑י לְחָמ֕וּל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הֶחָמוּלִֽי׃
transliteration: vayih'yv v'ney-feretz l'chetz'ron mish'pachat hachetz'roniy l'chamvl mish'pachat hechamvliy
translation: Descendants of Perez: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronites; of Hamul, the clan of the Hamulites.

hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת יְהוּדָ֖ה לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שִׁשָּׁ֧ה וְשִׁבְעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh mish'p'chot y'hvdah lif'kudeyhem shishah v'shiv'iym elef vachamesh mevot (s)
translation: Those are the clans of Judah; persons enrolled: 76,500.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י יִשָּׂשכָר֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔ם תּוֹלָ֕ע מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַתּוֹלָעִ֑י לְפֻוָ֕ה מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַפּוּנִֽי׃
transliteration: b'ney yisashkhar l'mish'p'chotam tvola' mish'pachat hatvola'iy l'fuvah mish'pachat hapvniy
translation: Descendants of Issachar by their clans: [Of] Tola, the clan of the Tolaites; of Puvah, the clan of the Punites;

hebrew: לְיָשׁ֕וּב מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיָּשׁוּבִ֑י לְשִׁמְרֹ֕ן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשִּׁמְרֹנִֽי׃
transliteration: l'yashvv mish'pachat hayashvviy l'shim'ron mish'pachat hashim'roniy
translation: of Jashub, the clan of the Jashubites; of Shimron, the clan of the Shimronites.

hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת יִשָּׂשכָ֖ר לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם אַרְבָּעָ֧ה וְשִׁשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh mish'p'chot yisashkhar lif'kudeyhem ar'ba'ah v'shishiym elef vsh'losh mevot (s)
translation: Those are the clans of Issachar; persons enrolled: 64,300.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י זְבוּלֻן֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לְסֶ֗רֶד מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַסַּרְדִּ֔י לְאֵל֕וֹן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאֵלֹנִ֑י לְיַ֨חְלְאֵ֔ל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיַּחְלְאֵלִֽי׃
transliteration: b'ney z'vvlun l'mish'p'chotam l'sered mish'pachat hasar'diy l'elvon mish'pachat haeloniy l'yach'l'el mish'pachat hayach'l'eliy
translation: Descendants of Zebulun by their clans: Of Sered, the clan of the Seredites; of Elon, the clan of the Elonites; of Jahleel, the clan of the Jahleelites.

hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הַזְּבוּלֹנִ֖י לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שִׁשִּׁ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh mish'p'chot haz'vvloniy lif'kudeyhem shishiym elef vachamesh mevot (s)
translation: Those are the clans of the Zebulunites; persons enrolled: 60,500.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י יוֹסֵ֖ף לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה וְאֶפְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: b'ney yvosef l'mish'p'chotam m'nasheh v'ef'rayim
translation: The sons of Joseph were Manasseh and Ephraim—by their clans.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה לְמָכִיר֙ מִשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַמָּכִירִ֔י וּמָכִ֖יר הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־גִּלְעָ֑ד לְגִלְעָ֕ד מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַגִּלְעָדִֽי׃
transliteration: b'ney m'nasheh l'makhiyr mish'pachat hamakhiyriy vmakhiyr hvoliyd et-gil'ad l'gil'ad mish'pachat hagil'adiy
translation: Descendants of Manasseh: Of Machir, the clan of the Machirites.—Machir begot Gilead.—Of Gilead, the clan of the Gileadites.

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י גִלְעָ֔ד אִיעֶ֕זֶר מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאִֽיעֶזְרִ֑י לְחֵ֕לֶק מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽחֶלְקִֽי׃
transliteration: eleh b'ney gil'ad iy'ezer mish'pachat haiy'ez'riy l'chelek mish'pachat hachel'kiy
translation: These were the descendants of Gilead: [Of] Iezer, the clan of the Iezerites; of Helek, the clan of the Helekites;

hebrew: וְאַ֨שְׂרִיאֵ֔ל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָֽאַשְׂרִֽאֵלִ֑י וְשֶׁ֕כֶם מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשִּׁכְמִֽי׃
transliteration: v'as'riyel mish'pachat haas'rieliy v'shekhem mish'pachat hashikh'miy
translation: [of] Asriel, the clan of the Asrielites; [of] Shechem, the clan of the Shechemites;

hebrew: וּשְׁמִידָ֕ע מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשְּׁמִידָעִ֑י וְחֵ֕פֶר מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽחֶפְרִֽי׃
transliteration: vsh'miyda' mish'pachat hash'miyda'iy v'chefer mish'pachat hachef'riy
translation: [of] Shemida, the clan of the Shemidaites; [of] Hepher, the clan of the Hepherites.—

hebrew: וּצְלָפְחָ֣ד בֶּן־חֵ֗פֶר לֹא־הָ֥יוּ ל֛וֹ בָּנִ֖ים כִּ֣י אִם־בָּנ֑וֹת וְשֵׁם֙ בְּנ֣וֹת צְלָפְחָ֔ד מַחְלָ֣ה וְנֹעָ֔ה חָגְלָ֥ה מִלְכָּ֖ה וְתִרְצָֽה׃
transliteration: vtz'laf'chad ben-chefer lo-hayv lvo baniym kiy im-banvot v'shem b'nvot tz'laf'chad mach'lah v'no'ah chag'lah mil'kah v'tir'tzah
translation: Now Zelophehad son of Hepher had no sons, only daughters. The names of Zelophehad’s daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.—

hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וּפְקֻ֣דֵיהֶ֔ם שְׁנַ֧יִם וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh mish'p'chot m'nasheh vf'kudeyhem sh'nayim vachamishiym elef vsh'va' mevot (s)
translation: Those are the clans of Manasseh; persons enrolled: 52,700.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה בְנֵי־אֶפְרַיִם֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לְשׁוּתֶ֗לַח מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַשֻּׁ֣תַלְחִ֔י לְבֶ֕כֶר מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַבַּכְרִ֑י לְתַ֕חַן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽתַּחֲנִֽי׃
transliteration: eleh v'ney-ef'rayim l'mish'p'chotam l'shvtelach mish'pachat hashutal'chiy l'vekher mish'pachat habakh'riy l'tachan mish'pachat hatachaniy
translation: These are the descendants of Ephraim by their clans: Of Shuthelah, the clan of the Shuthelahites; of Becher, the clan of the Becherites; of Tahan, the clan of the Tahanites.

hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י שׁוּתָ֑לַח לְעֵרָ֕ן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָעֵרָנִֽי׃
transliteration: v'eleh b'ney shvtalach l'eran mish'pachat ha'eraniy
translation: These are the descendants of Shuthelah: Of Eran, the clan of the Eranites.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֤ת בְּנֵי־אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ לִפְקֻ֣דֵיהֶ֔ם שְׁנַ֧יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֑וֹת אֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵי־יוֹסֵ֖ף לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh mish'p'chot b'ney-ef'rayim lif'kudeyhem sh'nayim vsh'loshiym elef vachamesh mevot eleh v'ney-yvosef l'mish'p'chotam (s)
translation:
Those are the clans of Ephraim’s descendants; persons enrolled: 32,500.
Those are the descendants of Joseph by their clans.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִן֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לְבֶ֗לַע מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַבַּלְעִ֔י לְאַשְׁבֵּ֕ל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָֽאַשְׁבֵּלִ֑י לַאֲחִירָ֕ם מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאֲחִירָמִֽי׃
transliteration: b'ney vin'yamin l'mish'p'chotam l'vela' mish'pachat habal'iy l'ash'bel mish'pachat haash'beliy laachiyram mish'pachat haachiyramiy
translation: The descendants of Benjamin by their clans: Of Bela, the clan of the Belaites; of Ashbel, the clan of the Ashbelites; of Ahiram, the clan of the Ahiramites;

hebrew: לִשְׁפוּפָ֕ם מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשּׁוּפָמִ֑י לְחוּפָ֕ם מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַחוּפָמִֽי׃
transliteration: lish'fvfam mish'pachat hashvfamiy l'chvfam mish'pachat hachvfamiy
translation: of Shephupham, the clan of the Shuphamites; of Hupham, the clan of the Huphamites.

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ בְנֵי־בֶ֖לַע אַ֣רְדְּ וְנַעֲמָ֑ן מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הָֽאַרְדִּ֔י לְנַֽעֲמָ֔ן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽנַּעֲמִֽי׃
transliteration: vayih'yv v'ney-vela' ar'd' v'na'aman mish'pachat haar'diy l'na'aman mish'pachat hana'amiy
translation: The sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: [Of Ard,] the clan of the Ardites; of Naaman, the clan of the Naamanites.

hebrew: אֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵי־בִנְיָמִ֖ן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם וּפְקֻ֣דֵיהֶ֔ם חֲמִשָּׁ֧ה וְאַרְבָּעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh v'ney-vin'yamin l'mish'p'chotam vf'kudeyhem chamishah v'ar'ba'iym elef v'shesh mevot (s)
translation: Those are the descendants of Benjamin by their clans; persons enrolled: 45,600.

hebrew: אֵ֤לֶּה בְנֵי־דָן֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔ם לְשׁוּחָ֕ם מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשּׁוּחָמִ֑י אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת דָּ֖ן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: eleh v'ney-dan l'mish'p'chotam l'shvcham mish'pachat hashvchamiy eleh mish'p'chot dan l'mish'p'chotam
translation: These are the descendants of Dan by their clans: Of Shuham, the clan of the Shuhamites. Those are the clans of Dan,eMeaning of parts of vv. 42 and 43 uncertain. by their clans.

hebrew: כָּל־מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הַשּׁוּחָמִ֖י לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם אַרְבָּעָ֧ה וְשִׁשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: kal-mish'p'chot hashvchamiy lif'kudeyhem ar'ba'ah v'shishiym elef v'ar'ba' mevot (s)
translation: All the clans of the Shuhamites; persons enrolled: 64,400.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י אָשֵׁר֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לְיִמְנָ֗ה מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַיִּמְנָ֔ה לְיִשְׁוִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיִּשְׁוִ֑י לִבְרִיעָ֕ה מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַבְּרִיעִֽי׃
transliteration: b'ney asher l'mish'p'chotam l'yim'nah mish'pachat hayim'nah l'yish'viy mish'pachat hayish'viy liv'riy'ah mish'pachat hab'riy'iy
translation: Descendants of Asher by their clans: Of Imnah, the clan of the Imnites; of Ishvi, the clan of the Ishvites; of Beriah, the clan of the Beriites.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י בְרִיעָ֔ה לְחֶ֕בֶר מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽחֶבְרִ֑י לְמַ֨לְכִּיאֵ֔ל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַמַּלְכִּיאֵלִֽי׃
transliteration: liv'ney v'riy'ah l'chever mish'pachat hachev'riy l'mal'kiyel mish'pachat hamal'kiyeliy
translation: Of the descendants of Beriah: Of Heber, the clan of the Heberites; of Malchiel, the clan of the Malchielites.—

hebrew: וְשֵׁ֥ם בַּת־אָשֵׁ֖ר שָֽׂרַח׃
transliteration: v'shem bat-asher sarach
translation: The name of Asher’s daughter was Serah.—

hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת בְּנֵי־אָשֵׁ֖ר לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: eleh mish'p'chot b'ney-asher lif'kudeyhem sh'loshah vachamishiym elef v'ar'ba' mevot (s)
translation: These are the clans of Asher’s descendants; persons enrolled: 53,400.

hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י נַפְתָּלִי֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔ם לְיַ֨חְצְאֵ֔ל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיַּחְצְאֵלִ֑י לְגוּנִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַגּוּנִֽי׃
transliteration: b'ney naf'taliy l'mish'p'chotam l'yach'tz'el mish'pachat hayach'tz'eliy l'gvniy mish'pachat hagvniy
translation: Descendants of Naphtali by their clans: Of Jahzeel, the clan of the Jahzeelites; of Guni, the clan of the Gunites;

hebrew: לְיֵ֕צֶר מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיִּצְרִ֑י לְשִׁלֵּ֕ם מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשִּׁלֵּמִֽי׃
transliteration: l'yetzer mish'pachat hayitz'riy l'shilem mish'pachat hashilemiy
translation: of Jezer, the clan of the Jezerites; of Shillem, the clan of the Shillemites.

hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת נַפְתָּלִ֖י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם וּפְקֻ֣דֵיהֶ֔ם חֲמִשָּׁ֧ה וְאַרְבָּעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: eleh mish'p'chot naf'taliy l'mish'p'chotam vf'kudeyhem chamishah v'ar'ba'iym elef v'ar'ba' mevot
translation: Those are the clans of the Naphtalites, clan by clan; persons enrolled: 45,400.

hebrew: אֵ֗לֶּה פְּקוּדֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֖לֶף וָאָ֑לֶף שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וּשְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃ (פ)
transliteration: eleh p'kvdey b'ney yis'rael shesh-mevot elef vaalef sh'va' mevot vsh'loshiym (f)
translation: This is the enrollment of the Israelites: 601,730.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying,

hebrew: לָאֵ֗לֶּה תֵּחָלֵ֥ק הָאָ֛רֶץ בְּנַחֲלָ֖ה בְּמִסְפַּ֥ר שֵׁמֽוֹת׃
transliteration: laeleh techalek haaretz b'nachalah b'mis'par shemvot
translation: “Among these shall the land be apportioned as shares, according to the listed names:

hebrew: לָרַ֗ב תַּרְבֶּה֙ נַחֲלָת֔וֹ וְלַמְעַ֕ט תַּמְעִ֖יט נַחֲלָת֑וֹ אִ֚ישׁ לְפִ֣י פְקֻדָ֔יו יֻתַּ֖ן נַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: larav tar'beh nachalatvo v'lam'at tam'iyt nachalatvo iysh l'fiy f'kudayv yutan nachalatvo
translation: with larger groups increase the share, with smaller groups reduce the share. Each is to be assigned its share according to its enrollment.

hebrew: אַךְ־בְּגוֹרָ֕ל יֵחָלֵ֖ק אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ לִשְׁמ֥וֹת מַטּוֹת־אֲבֹתָ֖ם יִנְחָֽלוּ׃
transliteration: akh'-b'gvoral yechalek et-haaretz lish'mvot matvot-avotam yin'chalv
translation: The land, moreover, is to be apportioned by lot; and the allotment shall be made according to the listings of their ancestral tribes.

hebrew: עַל־פִּי֙ הַגּוֹרָ֔ל תֵּחָלֵ֖ק נַחֲלָת֑וֹ בֵּ֥ין רַ֖ב לִמְעָֽט׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'al-piy hagvoral techalek nachalatvo beyn rav lim'at (s)
translation: Each portion shall be assigned by lot, whether for larger or smaller groups.”

hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה פְקוּדֵ֣י הַלֵּוִי֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לְגֵרְשׁ֗וֹן מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַגֵּ֣רְשֻׁנִּ֔י לִקְהָ֕ת מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַקְּהָתִ֑י לִמְרָרִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַמְּרָרִֽי׃
transliteration: v'eleh f'kvdey haleviy l'mish'p'chotam l'ger'shvon mish'pachat hager'shuniy lik'hat mish'pachat hak'hatiy lim'rariy mish'pachat ham'rariy
translation: This is the enrollment of the Levites by their clans: Of Gershon, the clan of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the clan of the Kohathites; of Merari, the clan of the Merarites.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה ׀ מִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת לֵוִ֗י מִשְׁפַּ֨חַת הַלִּבְנִ֜י מִשְׁפַּ֤חַת הַֽחֶבְרֹנִי֙ מִשְׁפַּ֤חַת הַמַּחְלִי֙ מִשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַמּוּשִׁ֔י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַקָּרְחִ֑י וּקְהָ֖ת הוֹלִ֥ד אֶת־עַמְרָֽם׃
transliteration: eleh  mish'p'chot leviy mish'pachat haliv'niy mish'pachat hachev'roniy mish'pachat hamach'liy mish'pachat hamvshiy mish'pachat hakar'chiy vk'hat hvolid et-'am'ram
translation: These are the clans of Levi: The clan of the Libnites, the clan of the Hebronites, the clan of the Mahlites, the clan of the Mushites, the clan of the Korahites.—Kohath begot Amram.

hebrew: וְשֵׁ֣ם ׀ אֵ֣שֶׁת עַמְרָ֗ם יוֹכֶ֙בֶד֙ בַּת־לֵוִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָלְדָ֥ה אֹתָ֛הּ לְלֵוִ֖י בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וַתֵּ֣לֶד לְעַמְרָ֗ם אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת מִרְיָ֥ם אֲחֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'shem  eshet 'am'ram yvokheved bat-leviy asher yal'dah otah l'leviy b'mitz'rayim vateled l'am'ram et-aharon v'et-mosheh v'et mir'yam achotam
translation: The name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt; she bore to Amram Aaron and Moses and their sister Miriam.

hebrew: וַיִּוָּלֵ֣ד לְאַהֲרֹ֔ן אֶת־נָדָ֖ב וְאֶת־אֲבִיה֑וּא אֶת־אֶלְעָזָ֖ר וְאֶת־אִיתָמָֽר׃
transliteration: vayivaled l'aharon et-nadav v'et-aviyhv et-el'azar v'et-iytamar
translation: To Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

hebrew: וַיָּ֥מָת נָדָ֖ב וַאֲבִיה֑וּא בְּהַקְרִיבָ֥ם אֵשׁ־זָרָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayamat nadav vaaviyhv b'hak'riyvam esh-zarah lif'ney y'hvah
translation: Nadab and Abihu died when they offered alien fire before the L<small>ORD</small>.—

hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ פְקֻדֵיהֶ֗ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף כָּל־זָכָ֖ר מִבֶּן־חֹ֣דֶשׁ וָמָ֑עְלָה כִּ֣י ׀ לֹ֣א הָתְפָּקְד֗וּ בְּתוֹךְ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֠י לֹא־נִתַּ֤ן לָהֶם֙ נַחֲלָ֔ה בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayih'yv f'kudeyhem sh'loshah v'es'riym elef kal-zakhar miben-chodesh vama'lah kiy  lo hat'pak'dv b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael kiy lo-nitan lahem nachalah b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael
translation: Their enrollment of 23,000 comprised all males from a month up. They were not part of the regular enrollment of the Israelites, since no share was assigned to them among the Israelites.

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה פְּקוּדֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֖ר הַכֹּהֵ֑ן אֲשֶׁ֨ר פָּֽקְד֜וּ אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֔ב עַ֖ל יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵחֽוֹ׃
transliteration: eleh p'kvdey mosheh v'el'azar hakohen asher pak'dv et-b'ney yis'rael b'ar'vot mvoav 'al yar'den y'rechvo
translation: These are the persons enrolled by Moses and Eleazar the priest who registered the Israelites on the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho.

hebrew: וּבְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ לֹא־הָ֣יָה אִ֔ישׁ מִפְּקוּדֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵ֑ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּקְד֛וּ אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
transliteration: vv'eleh lo-hayah iysh mip'kvdey mosheh v'aharon hakohen asher pak'dv et-b'ney yis'rael b'mid'bar siynay
translation: Among these there was not one of those enrolled by Moses and Aaron the priest when they recorded the Israelites in the wilderness of Sinai.

hebrew: כִּֽי־אָמַ֤ר יְהוָה֙ לָהֶ֔ם מ֥וֹת יָמֻ֖תוּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְלֹא־נוֹתַ֤ר מֵהֶם֙ אִ֔ישׁ כִּ֚י אִם־כָּלֵ֣ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֔ה וִיהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בִּן־נֽוּן׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy-amar y'hvah lahem mvot yamutv bamid'bar v'lo-nvotar mehem iysh kiy im-kalev ben-y'funeh viyhvoshu'a bin-nvn (s)
translation: For the L<small>ORD</small> had said of them, “They shall die in the wilderness.” Not one of them survived, except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.

hebrew: וַתִּקְרַ֜בְנָה בְּנ֣וֹת צְלָפְחָ֗ד בֶּן־חֵ֤פֶר בֶּן־גִּלְעָד֙ בֶּן־מָכִ֣יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה לְמִשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת מְנַשֶּׁ֣ה בֶן־יוֹסֵ֑ף וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ שְׁמ֣וֹת בְּנֹתָ֔יו מַחְלָ֣ה נֹעָ֔ה וְחָגְלָ֥ה וּמִלְכָּ֖ה וְתִרְצָֽה׃
transliteration: vatik'rav'nah b'nvot tz'laf'chad ben-chefer ben-gil'ad ben-makhiyr ben-m'nasheh l'mish'p'chot m'nasheh ven-yvosef v'eleh sh'mvot b'notayv mach'lah no'ah v'chag'lah vmil'kah v'tir'tzah
translation: The daughters of Zelophehad, of Manassite family—son of Hepher son of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh son of Joseph—came forward. The names of the daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

hebrew: וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֜דְנָה לִפְנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֗ה וְלִפְנֵי֙ אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְלִפְנֵ֥י הַנְּשִׂיאִ֖ם וְכָל־הָעֵדָ֑ה פֶּ֥תַח אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vata'amod'nah lif'ney mosheh v'lif'ney el'azar hakohen v'lif'ney han'siyim v'khal-ha'edah petach ohel-mvo'ed lemor
translation: They stood before Moses, Eleazar the priest, the chieftains, and the whole assembly, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and they said,

hebrew: אָבִינוּ֮ מֵ֣ת בַּמִּדְבָּר֒ וְה֨וּא לֹא־הָיָ֜ה בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעֵדָ֗ה הַנּוֹעָדִ֛ים עַל־יְהוָ֖ה בַּעֲדַת־קֹ֑רַח כִּֽי־בְחֶטְא֣וֹ מֵ֔ת וּבָנִ֖ים לֹא־הָ֥יוּ לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: aviynv met bamid'bar v'hv lo-hayah b'tvokh' ha'edah hanvo'adiym 'al-y'hvah ba'adat-korach kiy-v'chet'vo met vvaniym lo-hayv lvo
translation: “Our father died in the wilderness. He was not one of the faction, Korah’s faction, which banded together against the L<small>ORD</small>, but died for his own sin; and he has left no sons.

hebrew: לָ֣מָּה יִגָּרַ֤ע שֵׁם־אָבִ֙ינוּ֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ מִשְׁפַּחְתּ֔וֹ כִּ֛י אֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ בֵּ֑ן תְּנָה־לָּ֣נוּ אֲחֻזָּ֔ה בְּת֖וֹךְ אֲחֵ֥י אָבִֽינוּ׃
transliteration: lamah yigara' shem-aviynv mitvokh' mish'pach'tvo kiy eyn lvo ben t'nah-lanv achuzah b'tvokh' achey aviynv
translation: Let not our father’s name be lost to his clan just because he had no son! Give us a holding among our father’s kinsmen!”

hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֥ב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־מִשְׁפָּטָ֖ן לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayak'rev mosheh et-mish'patan lif'ney y'hvah (s)
translation: Moses brought their case before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses,

hebrew: כֵּ֗ן בְּנ֣וֹת צְלָפְחָד֮ דֹּבְרֹת֒ נָתֹ֨ן תִּתֵּ֤ן לָהֶם֙ אֲחֻזַּ֣ת נַחֲלָ֔ה בְּת֖וֹךְ אֲחֵ֣י אֲבִיהֶ֑ם וְהַֽעֲבַרְתָּ֛ אֶת־נַחֲלַ֥ת אֲבִיהֶ֖ן לָהֶֽן׃
transliteration: ken b'nvot tz'laf'chad dov'rot naton titen lahem achuzat nachalah b'tvokh' achey aviyhem v'ha'avar'ta et-nachalat aviyhen lahen
translation: “The plea of Zelophehad’s daughters is just: you should give them a hereditary holding among their father’s kinsmen; transfer their father’s share to them.

hebrew: וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תְּדַבֵּ֣ר לֵאמֹ֑ר אִ֣ישׁ כִּֽי־יָמ֗וּת וּבֵן֙ אֵ֣ין ל֔וֹ וְהַֽעֲבַרְתֶּ֥ם אֶת־נַחֲלָת֖וֹ לְבִתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'el-b'ney yis'rael t'daber lemor iysh kiy-yamvt vven eyn lvo v'ha'avar'tem et-nachalatvo l'vitvo
translation: “Further, speak to the Israelite people as follows: ‘If a man dies without leaving a son, you shall transfer his property to his daughter.

hebrew: וְאִם־אֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ בַּ֑ת וּנְתַתֶּ֥ם אֶת־נַחֲלָת֖וֹ לְאֶחָיו׃
transliteration: v'im-eyn lvo bat vn'tatem et-nachalatvo l'echayv
translation: If he has no daughter, you shall assign his property to his brothers.

hebrew: וְאִם־אֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ אַחִ֑ים וּנְתַתֶּ֥ם אֶת־נַחֲלָת֖וֹ לַאֲחֵ֥י אָבִֽיו׃
transliteration: v'im-eyn lvo achiym vn'tatem et-nachalatvo laachey aviyv
translation: If he has no brothers, you shall assign his property to his father’s brothers.

hebrew: וְאִם־אֵ֣ין אַחִים֮ לְאָבִיו֒ וּנְתַתֶּ֣ם אֶת־נַחֲלָת֗וֹ לִשְׁאֵר֞וֹ הַקָּרֹ֥ב אֵלָ֛יו מִמִּשְׁפַּחְתּ֖וֹ וְיָרַ֣שׁ אֹתָ֑הּ וְֽהָ֨יְתָ֜ה לִבְנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לְחֻקַּ֣ת מִשְׁפָּ֔ט כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'im-eyn achiym l'aviyv vn'tatem et-nachalatvo lish'ervo hakarov elayv mimish'pach'tvo v'yarash otah v'hay'tah liv'ney yis'rael l'chukat mish'pat kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (s)
translation: If his father had no brothers, you shall assign his property to his nearest relative in his own clan, and he shall inherit it.’ This shall be the law of procedure for the Israelites, in accordance with the L<small>ORD</small>’s command to Moses.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה עֲלֵ֛ה אֶל־הַ֥ר הָעֲבָרִ֖ים הַזֶּ֑ה וּרְאֵה֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh 'aleh el-har ha'avariym hazeh vr'eh et-haaretz asher natatiy liv'ney yis'rael
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses, “Ascend these heights of Abarim and view the land that I have given to the Israelite people.

hebrew: וְרָאִ֣יתָה אֹתָ֔הּ וְנֶאֱסַפְתָּ֥ אֶל־עַמֶּ֖יךָ גַּם־אָ֑תָּה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר נֶאֱסַ֖ף אַהֲרֹ֥ן אָחִֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'raiytah otah v'neesaf'ta el-'ameykha gam-atah kaasher neesaf aharon achiykha
translation: When you have seen it, you too shall be gathered to your kin, just as your brother Aaron was.

hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ מְרִיתֶ֨ם פִּ֜י בְּמִדְבַּר־צִ֗ן בִּמְרִיבַת֙ הָֽעֵדָ֔ה לְהַקְדִּישֵׁ֥נִי בַמַּ֖יִם לְעֵינֵיהֶ֑ם הֵ֛ם מֵֽי־מְרִיבַ֥ת קָדֵ֖שׁ מִדְבַּר־צִֽן׃ (פ)
transliteration: kaasher m'riytem piy b'mid'bar-tzin bim'riyvat ha'edah l'hak'diysheniy vamayim l'eyneyhem hem mey-m'riyvat kadesh mid'bar-tzin (f)
translation: For, in the wilderness of Zin, when the community was contentious, you disobeyed My command to uphold My sanctity in their sight by means of the water.” Those are the Waters of Meribath-kadesh,aSee note at 20.13. in the wilderness of Zin.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־יְהוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh el-y'hvah lemor
translation: Moses spoke to the L<small>ORD</small>, saying,

hebrew: יִפְקֹ֣ד יְהוָ֔ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י הָרוּחֹ֖ת לְכָל־בָּשָׂ֑ר אִ֖ישׁ עַל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
transliteration: yif'kod y'hvah elohey harvchot l'khal-basar iysh 'al-ha'edah
translation: “Let the L<small>ORD</small>, Source of the breath of all flesh, appoint someone over the community

hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־יֵצֵ֣א לִפְנֵיהֶ֗ם וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר יָבֹא֙ לִפְנֵיהֶ֔ם וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹצִיאֵ֖ם וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר יְבִיאֵ֑ם וְלֹ֤א תִהְיֶה֙ עֲדַ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה כַּצֹּ֕אן אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵין־לָהֶ֖ם רֹעֶֽה׃
transliteration: asher-yetze lif'neyhem vaasher yavo lif'neyhem vaasher yvotziyem vaasher y'viyem v'lo tih'yeh 'adat y'hvah katzon asher eyn-lahem ro'eh
translation: bI.e., who shall lead them in all matters and whom they shall follow in all matters.who shall go out before them and come in before them, and who shall take them out and bring them in,-b so that the LORD’s community may not be like sheep that have no shepherd.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה קַח־לְךָ֙ אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֔וּן אִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־ר֣וּחַ בּ֑וֹ וְסָמַכְתָּ֥ אֶת־יָדְךָ֖ עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh kach-l'kha et-y'hvoshu'a bin-nvn iysh asher-rvcha bvo v'samakh'ta et-yad'kha 'alayv
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> answered Moses, “Single out Joshua son of Nun, an inspired man, and lay your hand upon him.

hebrew: וְהַֽעֲמַדְתָּ֣ אֹת֗וֹ לִפְנֵי֙ אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְלִפְנֵ֖י כָּל־הָעֵדָ֑ה וְצִוִּיתָ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'ha'amad'ta otvo lif'ney el'azar hakohen v'lif'ney kal-ha'edah v'tziviytah otvo l'eyneyhem
translation: Have him stand before Eleazar the priest and before the whole community, and commission him in their sight.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֥ה מֵהֽוֹדְךָ֖ עָלָ֑יו לְמַ֣עַן יִשְׁמְע֔וּ כָּל־עֲדַ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'natatah mehvod'kha 'alayv l'ma'an yish'm'v kal-'adat b'ney yis'rael
translation: Invest him with some of your authority, so that the whole Israelite community may obey.

hebrew: וְלִפְנֵ֨י אֶלְעָזָ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ יַעֲמֹ֔ד וְשָׁ֥אַל ל֛וֹ בְּמִשְׁפַּ֥ט הָאוּרִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה עַל־פִּ֨יו יֵצְא֜וּ וְעַל־פִּ֣יו יָבֹ֗אוּ ה֛וּא וְכָל־בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל אִתּ֖וֹ וְכָל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
transliteration: v'lif'ney el'azar hakohen ya'amod v'shaal lvo b'mish'pat havriym lif'ney y'hvah 'al-piyv yetz'v v'al-piyv yavov hv v'khal-b'ney-yis'rael itvo v'khal-ha'edah
translation: But he shall present himself to Eleazar the priest, who shall on his behalf seek the decision of the Urim before the L<small>ORD</small>. By such instruction they shall go out and by such instruction they shall come in, he and all the Israelites, the whole community.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ וַיַּֽעֲמִדֵ֙הוּ֙ לִפְנֵי֙ אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְלִפְנֵ֖י כָּל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'as mosheh kaasher tzivah y'hvah otvo vayikach et-y'hvoshu'a vaya'amidehv lif'ney el'azar hakohen v'lif'ney kal-ha'edah
translation: Moses did as the L<small>ORD</small> commanded him. He took Joshua and had him stand before Eleazar the priest and before the whole community.

hebrew: וַיִּסְמֹ֧ךְ אֶת־יָדָ֛יו עָלָ֖יו וַיְצַוֵּ֑הוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayis'mokh' et-yadayv 'alayv vay'tzavehv kaasher diber y'hvah b'yad-mosheh (f)
translation: He laid his hands upon him and commissioned him—as the L<small>ORD</small> had spoken through Moses.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: צַ֚ו אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אֶת־קָרְבָּנִ֨י לַחְמִ֜י לְאִשַּׁ֗י רֵ֚יחַ נִֽיחֹחִ֔י תִּשְׁמְר֕וּ לְהַקְרִ֥יב לִ֖י בְּמוֹעֲדֽוֹ׃
transliteration: tzav et-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem et-kar'baniy lach'miy l'ishay reycha niychochiy tish'm'rv l'hak'riyv liy b'mvo'advo
translation: Command the Israelite people and say to them: Be punctilious in presenting to Me at stated times aLit. “My offering, My food.”the offerings of food due Me,-a as offerings by fire of pleasing odor to Me.

hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ לָהֶ֔ם זֶ֚ה הָֽאִשֶּׁ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּקְרִ֖יבוּ לַיהוָ֑ה כְּבָשִׂ֨ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֧ה תְמִימִ֛ם שְׁנַ֥יִם לַיּ֖וֹם עֹלָ֥ה תָמִֽיד׃
transliteration: v'amar'ta lahem zeh haisheh asher tak'riyvv layhvah k'vasiym b'ney-shanah t'miymim sh'nayim layvom 'olah tamiyd
translation:
Say to them: These are the offerings by fire that you are to present to the LORD:
As a regular burnt offering every day, two yearling lambs without blemish.

hebrew: אֶת־הַכֶּ֥בֶשׂ אֶחָ֖ד תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה בַבֹּ֑קֶר וְאֵת֙ הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֥ין הָֽעַרְבָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: et-hakeves echad ta'aseh vaboker v'et hakeves hasheniy ta'aseh beyn ha'ar'bayim
translation: You shall offer one lamb in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight.

hebrew: וַעֲשִׂירִ֧ית הָאֵיפָ֛ה סֹ֖לֶת לְמִנְחָ֑ה בְּלוּלָ֛ה בְּשֶׁ֥מֶן כָּתִ֖ית רְבִיעִ֥ת הַהִֽין׃
transliteration: va'asiyriyt haeyfah solet l'min'chah b'lvlah b'shemen katiyt r'viy'it hahiyn
translation: And as a meal offering, there shall be a tenth of an ephah of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil mixed in—

hebrew: עֹלַ֖ת תָּמִ֑יד הָעֲשֻׂיָה֙ בְּהַ֣ר סִינַ֔י לְרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: 'olat tamiyd ha'asuyah b'har siynay l'reycha niychocha isheh layhvah
translation: the regular burnt offering instituted at Mount SinaibExod. 29.38–41.—an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the LORD.

hebrew: וְנִסְכּוֹ֙ רְבִיעִ֣ת הַהִ֔ין לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד בַּקֹּ֗דֶשׁ הַסֵּ֛ךְ נֶ֥סֶךְ שֵׁכָ֖ר לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'nis'kvo r'viy'it hahiyn lakeves haechad bakodesh hasekh' nesekh' shekhar layhvah
translation: The libation with it shall be a quarter of a hin for each lamb, to be poured in the sacred precinct as an offering of fermented drinkcI.e., wine. to the LORD.

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֣ין הָֽעַרְבָּ֑יִם כְּמִנְחַ֨ת הַבֹּ֤קֶר וּכְנִסְכּוֹ֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה אִשֵּׁ֛ה רֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'et hakeves hasheniy ta'aseh beyn ha'ar'bayim k'min'chat haboker vkh'nis'kvo ta'aseh isheh reycha niychocha layhvah (f)
translation: The other lamb you shall offer at twilight, preparing the same meal offering and libation as in the morning—an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וּבְיוֹם֙ הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת שְׁנֵֽי־כְבָשִׂ֥ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֖ה תְּמִימִ֑ם וּשְׁנֵ֣י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֗ים סֹ֧לֶת מִנְחָ֛ה בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן וְנִסְכּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vv'yvom hashabat sh'ney-kh'vasiym b'ney-shanah t'miymim vsh'ney 'es'roniym solet min'chah b'lvlah vashemen v'nis'kvo
translation: On the sabbath day: two yearling lambs without blemish, together with two-tenths of a measuredI.e., of an ephah. of choice flour with oil mixed in as a meal offering, and with the proper libation—

hebrew: עֹלַ֥ת שַׁבַּ֖ת בְּשַׁבַּתּ֑וֹ עַל־עֹלַ֥ת הַתָּמִ֖יד וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'olat shabat b'shabatvo 'al-'olat hatamiyd v'nis'kah (s)
translation: a burnt offering for every sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its libation.

hebrew: וּבְרָאשֵׁי֙ חָדְשֵׁיכֶ֔ם תַּקְרִ֥יבוּ עֹלָ֖ה לַיהוָ֑ה פָּרִ֨ים בְּנֵֽי־בָקָ֤ר שְׁנַ֙יִם֙ וְאַ֣יִל אֶחָ֔ד כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה שִׁבְעָ֖ה תְּמִימִֽם׃
transliteration: vv'rashey chad'sheykhem tak'riyvv 'olah layhvah pariym b'ney-vakar sh'nayim v'ayil echad k'vasiym b'ney-shanah shiv'ah t'miymim
translation: On your new moons you shall present a burnt offering to the L<small>ORD</small>: two bulls of the herd, one ram, and seven yearling lambs, without blemish.

hebrew: וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה עֶשְׂרֹנִ֗ים סֹ֤לֶת מִנְחָה֙ בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשֶּׁ֔מֶן לַפָּ֖ר הָאֶחָ֑ד וּשְׁנֵ֣י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֗ים סֹ֤לֶת מִנְחָה֙ בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשֶּׁ֔מֶן לָאַ֖יִל הָֽאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: vsh'loshah 'es'roniym solet min'chah b'lvlah vashemen lapar haechad vsh'ney 'es'roniym solet min'chah b'lvlah vashemen laayil haechad
translation: As meal offering for each bull: three-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in. As meal offering for each ram: two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in.

hebrew: וְעִשָּׂרֹ֣ן עִשָּׂר֗וֹן סֹ֤לֶת מִנְחָה֙ בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשֶּׁ֔מֶן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד עֹלָה֙ רֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'isaron 'isarvon solet min'chah b'lvlah vashemen lakeves haechad 'olah reycha niychocha isheh layhvah
translation: As meal offering for each lamb: a tenth of a measure of fine flour with oil mixed in. Such shall be the burnt offering of pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֗ם חֲצִ֣י הַהִין֩ יִהְיֶ֨ה לַפָּ֜ר וּשְׁלִישִׁ֧ת הַהִ֣ין לָאַ֗יִל וּרְבִיעִ֥ת הַהִ֛ין לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ יָ֑יִן זֹ֣את עֹלַ֥ת חֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ בְּחָדְשׁ֔וֹ לְחָדְשֵׁ֖י הַשָּׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: v'nis'keyhem chatziy hahiyn yih'yeh lapar vsh'liyshit hahiyn laayil vr'viy'it hahiyn lakeves yayin zot 'olat chodesh b'chad'shvo l'chad'shey hashanah
translation: Their libations shall be: half a hin of wine for a bull, a third of a hin for a ram, and a quarter of a hin for a lamb. That shall be the monthly burnt offering for each new moon of the year.

hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֨יר עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֛ד לְחַטָּ֖את לַיהוָ֑ה עַל־עֹלַ֧ת הַתָּמִ֛יד יֵעָשֶׂ֖ה וְנִסְכּֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vs'iyr 'iziym echad l'chatat layhvah 'al-'olat hatamiyd ye'aseh v'nis'kvo (s)
translation: And there shall be one goat as a sin offering to the L<small>ORD</small>, to be offered in addition to the regular burnt offering and its libation.

hebrew: וּבַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֗וֹן בְּאַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ פֶּ֖סַח לַיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vvachodesh harishvon b'ar'ba'ah 'asar yvom lachodesh pesach layhvah
translation: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, there shall be a passover sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small>,

hebrew: וּבַחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר י֛וֹם לַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֖ה חָ֑ג שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים מַצּ֖וֹת יֵאָכֵֽל׃
transliteration: vvachamishah 'asar yvom lachodesh hazeh chag shiv'at yamiym matzvot yeakhel
translation: and on the fifteenth day of that month a festival. Unleavened bread shall be eaten for seven days.

hebrew: בַּיּ֥וֹם הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן מִקְרָא־קֹ֑דֶשׁ כָּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
transliteration: bayvom harishvon mik'ra-kodesh kal-m'lekhet 'avodah lo ta'asv
translation: The first day shall be a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.

hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֨ם אִשֶּׁ֤ה עֹלָה֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה פָּרִ֧ים בְּנֵי־בָקָ֛ר שְׁנַ֖יִם וְאַ֣יִל אֶחָ֑ד וְשִׁבְעָ֤ה כְבָשִׂים֙ בְּנֵ֣י שָׁנָ֔ה תְּמִימִ֖ם יִהְי֥וּ לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hik'rav'tem isheh 'olah layhvah pariym b'ney-vakar sh'nayim v'ayil echad v'shiv'ah kh'vasiym b'ney shanah t'miymim yih'yv lakhem
translation: You shall present an offering by fire, a burnt offering, to the LORD: two bulls of the herd, one ram, and seven yearling lambs—eLit. “they shall be to you.”see that they are-e without blemish.

hebrew: וּמִ֨נְחָתָ֔ם סֹ֖לֶת בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֨ה עֶשְׂרֹנִ֜ים לַפָּ֗ר וּשְׁנֵ֧י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֛ים לָאַ֖יִל תַּעֲשֽׂוּ׃
transliteration: vmin'chatam solet b'lvlah vashamen sh'loshah 'es'roniym lapar vsh'ney 'es'roniym laayil ta'asv
translation: The meal offering with them shall be of choice flour with oil mixed in: prepare three-tenths of a measure for a bull, two-tenths for a ram;

hebrew: עִשָּׂר֤וֹן עִשָּׂרוֹן֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד לְשִׁבְעַ֖ת הַכְּבָשִֽׂים׃
transliteration: 'isarvon 'isarvon ta'aseh lakeves haechad l'shiv'at hak'vasiym
translation: and for each of the seven lambs prepare one-tenth of a measure.

hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֥יר חַטָּ֖את אֶחָ֑ד לְכַפֵּ֖ר עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vs'iyr chatat echad l'khaper 'aleykhem
translation: And there shall be one goat for a sin offering, to make expiation in your behalf.

hebrew: מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַבֹּ֔קֶר אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְעֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֑יד תַּעֲשׂ֖וּ אֶת־אֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: mil'vad 'olat haboker asher l'olat hatamiyd ta'asv et-eleh
translation: You shall present these in addition to the morning portion of the regular burnt offering.

hebrew: כָּאֵ֜לֶּה תַּעֲשׂ֤וּ לַיּוֹם֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים לֶ֛חֶם אִשֵּׁ֥ה רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָ֑ה עַל־עוֹלַ֧ת הַתָּמִ֛יד יֵעָשֶׂ֖ה וְנִסְכּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kaeleh ta'asv layvom shiv'at yamiym lechem isheh reycha-niychocha layhvah 'al-'volat hatamiyd ye'aseh v'nis'kvo
translation: You shall offer the like daily for seven days as food, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>; they shall be offered, with their libations, in addition to the regular burnt offering.

hebrew: וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י מִקְרָא־קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם כָּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vvayvom hash'viy'iy mik'ra-kodesh yih'yeh lakhem kal-m'lekhet 'avodah lo ta'asv (s)
translation: And the seventh day shall be a sacred occasion for you: you shall not work at your occupations.

hebrew: וּבְי֣וֹם הַבִּכּוּרִ֗ים בְּהַקְרִ֨יבְכֶ֜ם מִנְחָ֤ה חֲדָשָׁה֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה בְּשָׁבֻעֹ֖תֵיכֶ֑ם מִֽקְרָא־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם כָּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
transliteration: vv'yvom habikvriym b'hak'riyv'khem min'chah chadashah layhvah b'shavu'oteykhem mik'ra-kodesh yih'yeh lakhem kal-m'lekhet 'avodah lo ta'asv
translation: On the day of the first fruits, your Feast of Weeks, when you bring an offering of new grain to the L<small>ORD</small>, you shall observe a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.

hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֨ם עוֹלָ֜ה לְרֵ֤יחַ נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה פָּרִ֧ים בְּנֵי־בָקָ֛ר שְׁנַ֖יִם אַ֣יִל אֶחָ֑ד שִׁבְעָ֥ה כְבָשִׂ֖ים בְּנֵ֥י שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hik'rav'tem 'volah l'reycha niychocha layhvah pariym b'ney-vakar sh'nayim ayil echad shiv'ah kh'vasiym b'ney shanah
translation: You shall present a burnt offering of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>: two bulls of the herd, one ram, seven yearling lambs.

hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֔ם סֹ֖לֶת בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה עֶשְׂרֹנִים֙ לַפָּ֣ר הָֽאֶחָ֔ד שְׁנֵי֙ עֶשְׂרֹנִ֔ים לָאַ֖יִל הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: vmin'chatam solet b'lvlah vashamen sh'loshah 'es'roniym lapar haechad sh'ney 'es'roniym laayil haechad
translation: The meal offering with them shall be of choice flour with oil mixed in, three-tenths of a measure for a bull, two-tenths for a ram,

hebrew: עִשָּׂרוֹן֙ עִשָּׂר֔וֹן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד לְשִׁבְעַ֖ת הַכְּבָשִֽׂים׃
transliteration: 'isarvon 'isarvon lakeves haechad l'shiv'at hak'vasiym
translation: and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs.

hebrew: שְׂעִ֥יר עִזִּ֖ים אֶחָ֑ד לְכַפֵּ֖ר עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: s'iyr 'iziym echad l'khaper 'aleykhem
translation: And there shall be one goat for expiation in your behalf.

hebrew: מִלְּבַ֞ד עֹלַ֧ת הַתָּמִ֛יד וּמִנְחָת֖וֹ תַּעֲשׂ֑וּ תְּמִימִ֥ם יִהְיוּ־לָכֶ֖ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: mil'vad 'olat hatamiyd vmin'chatvo ta'asv t'miymim yih'yv-lakhem v'nis'keyhem (f)
translation: You shall present them—eLit. “they shall be to you.”see that they are-e without blemish—with their libations, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its meal offering.

hebrew: וּבַחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֜י בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֗דֶשׁ מִֽקְרָא־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם כָּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ י֥וֹם תְּרוּעָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vvachodesh hash'viy'iy b'echad lachodesh mik'ra-kodesh yih'yeh lakhem kal-m'lekhet 'avodah lo ta'asv yvom t'rv'ah yih'yeh lakhem
translation: In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall observe a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations. You shall observe it as aOr “a day of festivity.”a day when the horn is sounded.-a

hebrew: וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֨ם עֹלָ֜ה לְרֵ֤יחַ נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה פַּ֧ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר אֶחָ֖ד אַ֣יִל אֶחָ֑ד כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה שִׁבְעָ֖ה תְּמִימִֽם׃
transliteration: va'asiytem 'olah l'reycha niychocha layhvah par ben-bakar echad ayil echad k'vasiym b'ney-shanah shiv'ah t'miymim
translation: You shall present a burnt offering of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>: one bull of the herd, one ram, and seven yearling lambs, without blemish.

hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֔ם סֹ֖לֶת בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה עֶשְׂרֹנִים֙ לַפָּ֔ר שְׁנֵ֥י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֖ים לָאָֽיִל׃
transliteration: vmin'chatam solet b'lvlah vashamen sh'loshah 'es'roniym lapar sh'ney 'es'roniym laayil
translation: The meal offering with them—choice flour with oil mixed in—shall be: three-tenths of a measure for a bull, two-tenths for a ram,

hebrew: וְעִשָּׂר֣וֹן אֶחָ֔ד לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד לְשִׁבְעַ֖ת הַכְּבָשִֽׂים׃
transliteration: v'isarvon echad lakeves haechad l'shiv'at hak'vasiym
translation: and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs.

hebrew: וּשְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד חַטָּ֑את לְכַפֵּ֖ר עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vs'iyr-'iziym echad chatat l'khaper 'aleykhem
translation: And there shall be one goat for a sin offering, to make expiation in your behalf—

hebrew: מִלְּבַד֩ עֹלַ֨ת הַחֹ֜דֶשׁ וּמִנְחָתָ֗הּ וְעֹלַ֤ת הַתָּמִיד֙ וּמִנְחָתָ֔הּ וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֖ם כְּמִשְׁפָּטָ֑ם לְרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: mil'vad 'olat hachodesh vmin'chatah v'olat hatamiyd vmin'chatah v'nis'keyhem k'mish'patam l'reycha niychocha isheh layhvah (s)
translation: in addition to the burnt offering of the new moon with its meal offering and the regular burnt offering with its meal offering, each with its libation as prescribed, offerings by fire of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וּבֶעָשׂוֹר֩ לַחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֜י הַזֶּ֗ה מִֽקְרָא־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם וְעִנִּיתֶ֖ם אֶת־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶ֑ם כָּל־מְלָאכָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
transliteration: vve'asvor lachodesh hash'viy'iy hazeh mik'ra-kodesh yih'yeh lakhem v'iniytem et-naf'shoteykhem kal-m'lakhah lo ta'asv
translation: On the tenth day of the same seventh month you shall observe a sacred occasion when you shall practice self-denial. You shall do no work.

hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֨ם עֹלָ֤ה לַֽיהוָה֙ רֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ פַּ֧ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר אֶחָ֖ד אַ֣יִל אֶחָ֑ד כְּבָשִׂ֤ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָה֙ שִׁבְעָ֔ה תְּמִימִ֖ם יִהְי֥וּ לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hik'rav'tem 'olah layhvah reycha niychocha par ben-bakar echad ayil echad k'vasiym b'ney-shanah shiv'ah t'miymim yih'yv lakhem
translation: You shall present to the LORD a burnt offering of pleasing odor: one bull of the herd, one ram, seven yearling lambs; see that they arebSee note at 28.19. without blemish.

hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֔ם סֹ֖לֶת בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה עֶשְׂרֹנִים֙ לַפָּ֔ר שְׁנֵי֙ עֶשְׂרֹנִ֔ים לָאַ֖יִל הָאֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: vmin'chatam solet b'lvlah vashamen sh'loshah 'es'roniym lapar sh'ney 'es'roniym laayil haechad
translation: The meal offering with them—of choice flour with oil mixed in—shall be: three-tenths of a measure for a bull, two-tenths for the one ram,

hebrew: עִשָּׂרוֹן֙ עִשָּׂר֔וֹן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד לְשִׁבְעַ֖ת הַכְּבָשִֽׂים׃
transliteration: 'isarvon 'isarvon lakeves haechad l'shiv'at hak'vasiym
translation: one-tenth for each of the seven lambs.

hebrew: שְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד חַטָּ֑את מִלְּבַ֞ד חַטַּ֤את הַכִּפֻּרִים֙ וְעֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד וּמִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכֵּיהֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: s'iyr-'iziym echad chatat mil'vad chatat hakipuriym v'olat hatamiyd vmin'chatah v'nis'keyhem (f)
translation: And there shall be one goat for a sin offering, in addition to the sin offering of expiation and the regular burnt offering with its meal offering, each with its libation.

hebrew: וּבַחֲמִשָּׁה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר י֜וֹם לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י מִֽקְרָא־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם כָּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ וְחַגֹּתֶ֥ם חַ֛ג לַיהוָ֖ה שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
transliteration: vvachamishah 'asar yvom lachodesh hash'viy'iy mik'ra-kodesh yih'yeh lakhem kal-m'lekhet 'avodah lo ta'asv v'chagotem chag layhvah shiv'at yamiym
translation: On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, you shall observe a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.—Seven days you shall observe a festival of the L<small>ORD</small>.—

hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֨ם עֹלָ֜ה אִשֵּׁ֨ה רֵ֤יחַ נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה פָּרִ֧ים בְּנֵי־בָקָ֛ר שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִ֥ם יִהְיֽוּ׃
transliteration: v'hik'rav'tem 'olah isheh reycha niychocha layhvah pariym b'ney-vakar sh'loshah 'asar eylim sh'nayim k'vasiym b'ney-shanah ar'ba'ah 'asar t'miymim yih'yv
translation: You shall present a burnt offering, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>: Thirteen bulls of the herd, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs; they shall be without blemish.

hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֔ם סֹ֖לֶת בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֨ה עֶשְׂרֹנִ֜ים לַפָּ֣ר הָֽאֶחָ֗ד לִשְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ פָּרִ֔ים שְׁנֵ֤י עֶשְׂרֹנִים֙ לָאַ֣יִל הָֽאֶחָ֔ד לִשְׁנֵ֖י הָאֵילִֽם׃
transliteration: vmin'chatam solet b'lvlah vashamen sh'loshah 'es'roniym lapar haechad lish'loshah 'asar pariym sh'ney 'es'roniym laayil haechad lish'ney haeylim
translation: The meal offerings with them—of choice flour with oil mixed in—shall be: three-tenths of a measure for each of the thirteen bulls, two-tenths for each of the two rams,

hebrew: וְעִשָּׂרׄוֹן֙ עִשָּׂר֔וֹן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד לְאַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר כְּבָשִֽׂים׃
transliteration: v'isarvon 'isarvon lakeves haechad l'ar'ba'ah 'asar k'vasiym
translation: and one-tenth for each of the fourteen lambs.

hebrew: וּשְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד חַטָּ֑את מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד מִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vs'iyr-'iziym echad chatat mil'vad 'olat hatamiyd min'chatah v'nis'kah (s)
translation: And there shall be one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libation.

hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשֵּׁנִ֗י פָּרִ֧ים בְּנֵי־בָקָ֛ר שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִֽם׃
transliteration: vvayvom hasheniy pariym b'ney-vakar sh'neym 'asar eylim sh'nayim k'vasiym b'ney-shanah ar'ba'ah 'asar t'miymim
translation: Second day: Twelve bulls of the herd, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs, without blemish;

hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֡ם לַ֠פָּרִים לָאֵילִ֧ם וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
transliteration: vmin'chatam v'nis'keyhem lapariym laeylim v'lak'vasiym b'mis'param kamish'pat
translation: the meal offerings and libations for the bulls, rams, and lambs, in the quantities prescribed;

hebrew: וּשְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד חַטָּ֑את מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד וּמִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכֵּיהֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: vs'iyr-'iziym echad chatat mil'vad 'olat hatamiyd vmin'chatah v'nis'keyhem (s)
translation: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libations.

hebrew: וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֛י פָּרִ֥ים עַשְׁתֵּי־עָשָׂ֖ר אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִֽם׃
transliteration: vvayvom hash'liyshiy pariym 'ash'tey-'asar eylim sh'nayim k'vasiym b'ney-shanah ar'ba'ah 'asar t'miymim
translation: Third day: Eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs, without blemish;

hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֡ם לַ֠פָּרִים לָאֵילִ֧ם וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
transliteration: vmin'chatam v'nis'keyhem lapariym laeylim v'lak'vasiym b'mis'param kamish'pat
translation: the meal offerings and libations for the bulls, rams, and lambs, in the quantities prescribed;

hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֥יר חַטָּ֖את אֶחָ֑ד מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד וּמִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vs'iyr chatat echad mil'vad 'olat hatamiyd vmin'chatah v'nis'kah (s)
translation: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libation.

hebrew: וּבַיּ֧וֹם הָרְבִיעִ֛י פָּרִ֥ים עֲשָׂרָ֖ה אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִֽם׃
transliteration: vvayvom har'viy'iy pariym 'asarah eylim sh'nayim k'vasiym b'ney-shanah ar'ba'ah 'asar t'miymim
translation: Fourth day: Ten bulls, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs, without blemish;

hebrew: מִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֡ם לַ֠פָּרִים לָאֵילִ֧ם וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
transliteration: min'chatam v'nis'keyhem lapariym laeylim v'lak'vasiym b'mis'param kamish'pat
translation: the meal offerings and libations for the bulls, rams, and lambs, in the quantities prescribed;

hebrew: וּשְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד חַטָּ֑את מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד מִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vs'iyr-'iziym echad chatat mil'vad 'olat hatamiyd min'chatah v'nis'kah (s)
translation: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libation.

hebrew: וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַחֲמִישִׁ֛י פָּרִ֥ים תִּשְׁעָ֖ה אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִֽם׃
transliteration: vvayvom hachamiyshiy pariym tish'ah eylim sh'nayim k'vasiym b'ney-shanah ar'ba'ah 'asar t'miymim
translation: Fifth day: Nine bulls, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs, without blemish;

hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֡ם לַ֠פָּרִים לָאֵילִ֧ם וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
transliteration: vmin'chatam v'nis'keyhem lapariym laeylim v'lak'vasiym b'mis'param kamish'pat
translation: the meal offerings and libations for the bulls, rams, and lambs, in the quantities prescribed;

hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֥יר חַטָּ֖את אֶחָ֑ד מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד וּמִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vs'iyr chatat echad mil'vad 'olat hatamiyd vmin'chatah v'nis'kah (s)
translation: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libation.

hebrew: וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֛י פָּרִ֥ים שְׁמֹנָ֖ה אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִֽם׃
transliteration: vvayvom hashishiy pariym sh'monah eylim sh'nayim k'vasiym b'ney-shanah ar'ba'ah 'asar t'miymim
translation: Sixth day: Eight bulls, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs, without blemish;

hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֡ם לַ֠פָּרִים לָאֵילִ֧ם וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
transliteration: vmin'chatam v'nis'keyhem lapariym laeylim v'lak'vasiym b'mis'param kamish'pat
translation: the meal offerings and libations for the bulls, rams, and lambs, in the quantities prescribed;

hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֥יר חַטָּ֖את אֶחָ֑ד מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד מִנְחָתָ֖הּ וּנְסָכֶֽיהָ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vs'iyr chatat echad mil'vad 'olat hatamiyd min'chatah vn'sakheyha (f)
translation: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libations.

hebrew: וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֛י פָּרִ֥ים שִׁבְעָ֖ה אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִֽם׃
transliteration: vvayvom hash'viy'iy pariym shiv'ah eylim sh'nayim k'vasiym b'ney-shanah ar'ba'ah 'asar t'miymim
translation: Seventh day: Seven bulls, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs, without blemish;

hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּהֶ֡ם לַ֠פָּרִים לָאֵילִ֧ם וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כְּמִשְׁפָּטָֽם׃
transliteration: vmin'chatam v'nis'kehem lapariym laeylim v'lak'vasiym b'mis'param k'mish'patam
translation: the meal offerings and libations for the bulls, rams, and lambs, in the quantities prescribed;

hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֥יר חַטָּ֖את אֶחָ֑ד מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד מִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vs'iyr chatat echad mil'vad 'olat hatamiyd min'chatah v'nis'kah (f)
translation: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libation.

hebrew: בַּיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁמִינִ֔י עֲצֶ֖רֶת תִּהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם כָּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
transliteration: bayvom hash'miyniy 'atzeret tih'yeh lakhem kal-m'lekhet 'avodah lo ta'asv
translation: On the eighth day you shall hold a solemn gathering;cSee note at Lev. 23.36. you shall not work at your occupations.

hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֨ם עֹלָ֜ה אִשֵּׁ֨ה רֵ֤יחַ נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה פַּ֥ר אֶחָ֖ד אַ֣יִל אֶחָ֑ד כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה שִׁבְעָ֖ה תְּמִימִֽם׃
transliteration: v'hik'rav'tem 'olah isheh reycha niychocha layhvah par echad ayil echad k'vasiym b'ney-shanah shiv'ah t'miymim
translation: You shall present a burnt offering, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to the L<small>ORD</small>; one bull, one ram, seven yearling lambs, without blemish;

hebrew: מִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֗ם לַפָּ֨ר לָאַ֧יִל וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
transliteration: min'chatam v'nis'keyhem lapar laayil v'lak'vasiym b'mis'param kamish'pat
translation: the meal offerings and libations for the bull, the ram, and the lambs, in the quantities prescribed;

hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֥יר חַטָּ֖את אֶחָ֑ד מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד וּמִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vs'iyr chatat echad mil'vad 'olat hatamiyd vmin'chatah v'nis'kah
translation: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libation.

hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ לַיהוָ֖ה בְּמוֹעֲדֵיכֶ֑ם לְבַ֨ד מִנִּדְרֵיכֶ֜ם וְנִדְבֹתֵיכֶ֗ם לְעֹלֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ וּלְמִנְחֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וּלְנִסְכֵּיכֶ֖ם וּלְשַׁלְמֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: eleh ta'asv layhvah b'mvo'adeykhem l'vad minid'reykhem v'nid'voteykhem l'oloteykhem vl'min'choteykhem vl'nis'keykhem vl'shal'meykhem
translation: All these you shall offer to the L<small>ORD</small> at the stated times, in addition to your votive and freewill offerings, be they burnt offerings, meal offerings, libations, or offerings of well-being.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כְּכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-b'ney yis'rael k'khol asher-tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh (f)
translation: So Moses spoke to the Israelites just as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־רָאשֵׁ֣י הַמַּטּ֔וֹת לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh el-rashey hamatvot liv'ney yis'rael lemor zeh hadavar asher tzivah y'hvah
translation: Moses spoke to the heads of the Israelite tribes, saying: This is what the L<small>ORD</small> has commanded:

hebrew: אִישׁ֩ כִּֽי־יִדֹּ֨ר נֶ֜דֶר לַֽיהוָ֗ה אֽוֹ־הִשָּׁ֤בַע שְׁבֻעָה֙ לֶאְסֹ֤ר אִסָּר֙ עַל־נַפְשׁ֔וֹ לֹ֥א יַחֵ֖ל דְּבָר֑וֹ כְּכָל־הַיֹּצֵ֥א מִפִּ֖יו יַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: iysh kiy-yidor neder layhvah vo-hishava' sh'vu'ah le'sor isar 'al-naf'shvo lo yachel d'varvo k'khal-hayotze mipiyv ya'aseh
translation: If a man makes a vow to the LORD or takes an oath imposing an obligationaOr “a prohibition.” on himself, he shall not break his pledge; he must carry out all that has bLit. “come out of his mouth.”crossed his lips.-b

hebrew: וְאִשָּׁ֕ה כִּֽי־תִדֹּ֥ר נֶ֖דֶר לַיהוָ֑ה וְאָסְרָ֥ה אִסָּ֛ר בְּבֵ֥ית אָבִ֖יהָ בִּנְעֻרֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: v'ishah kiy-tidor neder layhvah v'as'rah isar b'veyt aviyha bin'ureyha
translation: If a woman makes a vow to the L<small>ORD</small> or assumes an obligation while still in her father’s household by reason of her youth,

hebrew: וְשָׁמַ֨ע אָבִ֜יהָ אֶת־נִדְרָ֗הּ וֶֽאֱסָרָהּ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָֽסְרָ֣ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֔הּ וְהֶחֱרִ֥ישׁ לָ֖הּ אָבִ֑יהָ וְקָ֙מוּ֙ כָּל־נְדָרֶ֔יהָ וְכָל־אִסָּ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־אָסְרָ֥ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֖הּ יָקֽוּם׃
transliteration: v'shama' aviyha et-nid'rah veesarah asher as'rah 'al-naf'shah v'hecheriysh lah aviyha v'kamv kal-n'dareyha v'khal-isar asher-as'rah 'al-naf'shah yakvm
translation: and her father learns of her vow or her self-imposed obligation and offers no objection, all her vows shall stand and every self-imposed obligation shall stand.

hebrew: וְאִם־הֵנִ֨יא אָבִ֣יהָ אֹתָהּ֮ בְּי֣וֹם שָׁמְעוֹ֒ כָּל־נְדָרֶ֗יהָ וֶֽאֱסָרֶ֛יהָ אֲשֶׁר־אָסְרָ֥ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֖הּ לֹ֣א יָק֑וּם וַֽיהוָה֙ יִֽסְלַח־לָ֔הּ כִּי־הֵנִ֥יא אָבִ֖יהָ אֹתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'im-heniy aviyha otah b'yvom sham'vo kal-n'dareyha veesareyha asher-as'rah 'al-naf'shah lo yakvm vayhvah yis'lach-lah kiy-heniy aviyha otah
translation: But if her father restrains her on the day he finds out, none of her vows or self-imposed obligations shall stand; and the L<small>ORD</small> will forgive her, since her father restrained her.

hebrew: וְאִם־הָי֤וֹ תִֽהְיֶה֙ לְאִ֔ישׁ וּנְדָרֶ֖יהָ עָלֶ֑יהָ א֚וֹ מִבְטָ֣א שְׂפָתֶ֔יהָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָסְרָ֖ה עַל־נַפְשָֽׁהּ׃
transliteration: v'im-hayvo tih'yeh l'iysh vn'dareyha 'aleyha vo miv'ta s'fateyha asher as'rah 'al-naf'shah
translation: If she should marry while her vow or the commitmentcLit. “utterance of her lips.” to which she bound herself is still in force,

hebrew: וְשָׁמַ֥ע אִישָׁ֛הּ בְּי֥וֹם שָׁמְע֖וֹ וְהֶחֱרִ֣ישׁ לָ֑הּ וְקָ֣מוּ נְדָרֶ֗יהָ וֶֽאֱסָרֶ֛הָ אֲשֶׁר־אָסְרָ֥ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֖הּ יָקֻֽמוּ׃
transliteration: v'shama' iyshah b'yvom sham'vo v'hecheriysh lah v'kamv n'dareyha veesareha asher-as'rah 'al-naf'shah yakumv
translation: and her husband learns of it and offers no objection on the day he finds out, her vows shall stand and her self-imposed obligations shall stand.

hebrew: וְ֠אִם בְּי֨וֹם שְׁמֹ֣עַ אִישָׁהּ֮ יָנִ֣יא אוֹתָהּ֒ וְהֵפֵ֗ר אֶת־נִדְרָהּ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלֶ֔יהָ וְאֵת֙ מִבְטָ֣א שְׂפָתֶ֔יהָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָסְרָ֖ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֑הּ וַיהוָ֖ה יִֽסְלַֽח־לָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'im b'yvom sh'mo'a iyshah yaniy votah v'hefer et-nid'rah asher 'aleyha v'et miv'ta s'fateyha asher as'rah 'al-naf'shah vayhvah yis'lach-lah
translation: But if her husband restrains her on the day that he learns of it, he thereby annuls her vow which was in force or the commitmentcLit. “utterance of her lips.” to which she bound herself; and the LORD will forgive her.—

hebrew: וְנֵ֥דֶר אַלְמָנָ֖ה וּגְרוּשָׁ֑ה כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־אָסְרָ֥ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֖הּ יָק֥וּם עָלֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: v'neder al'manah vg'rvshah kol asher-as'rah 'al-naf'shah yakvm 'aleyha
translation: The vow of a widow or of a divorced woman, however, whatever she has imposed on herself, shall be binding upon her.—

hebrew: וְאִם־בֵּ֥ית אִישָׁ֖הּ נָדָ֑רָה אֽוֹ־אָסְרָ֥ה אִסָּ֛ר עַל־נַפְשָׁ֖הּ בִּשְׁבֻעָֽה׃
transliteration: v'im-beyt iyshah nadarah vo-as'rah isar 'al-naf'shah bish'vu'ah
translation: So, too, if, while in her husband’s household, she makes a vow or imposes an obligation on herself by oath,

hebrew: וְשָׁמַ֤ע אִישָׁהּ֙ וְהֶחֱרִ֣שׁ לָ֔הּ לֹ֥א הֵנִ֖יא אֹתָ֑הּ וְקָ֙מוּ֙ כָּל־נְדָרֶ֔יהָ וְכָל־אִסָּ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־אָסְרָ֥ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֖הּ יָקֽוּם׃
transliteration: v'shama' iyshah v'hecherish lah lo heniy otah v'kamv kal-n'dareyha v'khal-isar asher-as'rah 'al-naf'shah yakvm
translation: and her husband learns of it, yet offers no objection—thus failing to restrain her—all her vows shall stand and all her self-imposed obligations shall stand.

hebrew: וְאִם־הָפֵר֩ יָפֵ֨ר אֹתָ֥ם ׀ אִישָׁהּ֮ בְּי֣וֹם שָׁמְעוֹ֒ כָּל־מוֹצָ֨א שְׂפָתֶ֧יהָ לִנְדָרֶ֛יהָ וּלְאִסַּ֥ר נַפְשָׁ֖הּ לֹ֣א יָק֑וּם אִישָׁ֣הּ הֲפֵרָ֔ם וַיהוָ֖ה יִֽסְלַֽח־לָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'im-hafer yafer otam  iyshah b'yvom sham'vo kal-mvotza s'fateyha lin'dareyha vl'isar naf'shah lo yakvm iyshah haferam vayhvah yis'lach-lah
translation: But if her husband does annul them on the day he finds out, then nothing that has crossed her lips shall stand, whether vows or self-imposed obligations. Her husband has annulled them, and the L<small>ORD</small> will forgive her.

hebrew: כָּל־נֵ֛דֶר וְכָל־שְׁבֻעַ֥ת אִסָּ֖ר לְעַנֹּ֣ת נָ֑פֶשׁ אִישָׁ֥הּ יְקִימֶ֖נּוּ וְאִישָׁ֥הּ יְפֵרֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: kal-neder v'khal-sh'vu'at isar l'anot nafesh iyshah y'kiymenv v'iyshah y'ferenv
translation: Every vow and every sworn obligation of self-denial may be upheld by her husband or annulled by her husband.

hebrew: וְאִם־הַחֲרֵשׁ֩ יַחֲרִ֨ישׁ לָ֥הּ אִישָׁהּ֮ מִיּ֣וֹם אֶל־יוֹם֒ וְהֵקִים֙ אֶת־כָּל־נְדָרֶ֔יהָ א֥וֹ אֶת־כָּל־אֱסָרֶ֖יהָ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלֶ֑יהָ הֵקִ֣ים אֹתָ֔ם כִּי־הֶחֱרִ֥שׁ לָ֖הּ בְּי֥וֹם שָׁמְעֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im-hacharesh yachariysh lah iyshah miyvom el-yvom v'hekiym et-kal-n'dareyha vo et-kal-esareyha asher 'aleyha hekiym otam kiy-hecherish lah b'yvom sham'vo
translation: If her husband offers no objection from that day to the next, he has upheld all the vows or obligations she has assumed: he has upheld them by offering no objection on the day he found out.

hebrew: וְאִם־הָפֵ֥ר יָפֵ֛ר אֹתָ֖ם אַחֲרֵ֣י שָׁמְע֑וֹ וְנָשָׂ֖א אֶת־עֲוֺנָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'im-hafer yafer otam acharey sham'vo v'nasa et-'avonah
translation: But if he annuls them after [the day] he finds out, he shall bear her guilt.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הַֽחֻקִּ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֤ה יְהוָה֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בֵּ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ לְאִשְׁתּ֑וֹ בֵּֽין־אָ֣ב לְבִתּ֔וֹ בִּנְעֻרֶ֖יהָ בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽיהָ׃ (פ)
transliteration: eleh hachukiym asher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh beyn iysh l'ish'tvo beyn-av l'vitvo bin'ureyha beyt aviyha (f)
translation: Those are the laws that the L<small>ORD</small> enjoined upon Moses between a man and his wife, and as between a father and his daughter while in her father’s household by reason of her youth.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying,

hebrew: נְקֹ֗ם נִקְמַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מֵאֵ֖ת הַמִּדְיָנִ֑ים אַחַ֖ר תֵּאָסֵ֥ף אֶל־עַמֶּֽיךָ׃
transliteration: n'kom nik'mat b'ney yis'rael meet hamid'yaniym achar teasef el-'ameykha
translation: “Avenge the Israelite people on the Midianites; then you shall be gathered to your kin.”

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־הָעָ֣ם לֵאמֹ֔ר הֵחָלְצ֧וּ מֵאִתְּכֶ֛ם אֲנָשִׁ֖ים לַצָּבָ֑א וְיִהְיוּ֙ עַל־מִדְיָ֔ן לָתֵ֥ת נִקְמַת־יְהוָ֖ה בְּמִדְיָֽן׃
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh el-ha'am lemor hechal'tzv meit'khem anashiym latzava v'yih'yv 'al-mid'yan latet nik'mat-y'hvah b'mid'yan
translation: Moses spoke to the people, saying, “Let men be picked out from among you for a campaign, and let them fall upon Midian to wreak the L<small>ORD</small>’s vengeance on Midian.

hebrew: אֶ֚לֶף לַמַּטֶּ֔ה אֶ֖לֶף לַמַּטֶּ֑ה לְכֹל֙ מַטּ֣וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל תִּשְׁלְח֖וּ לַצָּבָֽא׃
transliteration: elef lamateh elef lamateh l'khol matvot yis'rael tish'l'chv latzava
translation: You shall dispatch on the campaign a thousand from every one of the tribes of Israel.”

hebrew: וַיִּמָּֽסְרוּ֙ מֵאַלְפֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶ֖לֶף לַמַּטֶּ֑ה שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֖לֶף חֲלוּצֵ֥י צָבָֽא׃
transliteration: vayimas'rv meal'fey yis'rael elef lamateh sh'neym-'asar elef chalvtzey tzava
translation: So a thousand from each tribe were furnished from the divisions of Israel, twelve thousand picked for the campaign.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח אֹתָ֥ם מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶ֥לֶף לַמַּטֶּ֖ה לַצָּבָ֑א אֹ֠תָם וְאֶת־פִּ֨ינְחָ֜ס בֶּן־אֶלְעָזָ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ לַצָּבָ֔א וּכְלֵ֥י הַקֹּ֛דֶשׁ וַחֲצֹצְר֥וֹת הַתְּרוּעָ֖ה בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayish'lach otam mosheh elef lamateh latzava otam v'et-piyn'chas ben-el'azar hakohen latzava vkh'ley hakodesh vachatzotz'rvot hat'rv'ah b'yadvo
translation: Moses dispatched them on the campaign, a thousand from each tribe, with Phinehas son of Eleazar serving as a priest on the campaign, equipped with the sacred utensilsaPerhaps the Urim; cf. 27.21. and the trumpets for sounding the blasts.

hebrew: וַֽיִּצְבְּאוּ֙ עַל־מִדְיָ֔ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיַּֽהַרְג֖וּ כָּל־זָכָֽר׃
transliteration: vayitz'b'v 'al-mid'yan kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh vayahar'gv kal-zakhar
translation: They took the field against Midian, as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses, and slew every male.

hebrew: וְאֶת־מַלְכֵ֨י מִדְיָ֜ן הָרְג֣וּ עַל־חַלְלֵיהֶ֗ם אֶת־אֱוִ֤י וְאֶת־רֶ֙קֶם֙ וְאֶת־צ֤וּר וְאֶת־חוּר֙ וְאֶת־רֶ֔בַע חֲמֵ֖שֶׁת מַלְכֵ֣י מִדְיָ֑ן וְאֵת֙ בִּלְעָ֣ם בֶּן־בְּע֔וֹר הָרְג֖וּ בֶּחָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: v'et-mal'khey mid'yan har'gv 'al-chal'leyhem et-eviy v'et-rekem v'et-tzvr v'et-chvr v'et-reva' chameshet mal'khey mid'yan v'et bil'am ben-b'vor har'gv becharev
translation: Along with their other victims, they slew the kings of Midian: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, the five kings of Midian. They also put Balaam son of Beor to the sword.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁבּ֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־נְשֵׁ֥י מִדְיָ֖ן וְאֶת־טַפָּ֑ם וְאֵ֨ת כָּל־בְּהֶמְתָּ֧ם וְאֶת־כָּל־מִקְנֵהֶ֛ם וְאֶת־כָּל־חֵילָ֖ם בָּזָֽזוּ׃
transliteration: vayish'bv v'ney-yis'rael et-n'shey mid'yan v'et-tapam v'et kal-b'hem'tam v'et-kal-mik'nehem v'et-kal-cheylam bazazv
translation: The Israelites took the women and children of the Midianites captive, and seized as booty all their beasts, all their herds, and all their wealth.

hebrew: וְאֵ֤ת כָּל־עָרֵיהֶם֙ בְּמ֣וֹשְׁבֹתָ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־טִֽירֹתָ֑ם שָׂרְפ֖וּ בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
transliteration: v'et kal-'areyhem b'mvosh'votam v'et kal-tiyrotam sar'fv baesh
translation: And they destroyed by fire all the towns in which they were settled, and their encampments.

hebrew: וַיִּקְחוּ֙ אֶת־כָּל־הַשָּׁלָ֔ל וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־הַמַּלְק֑וֹחַ בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָֽה׃
transliteration: vayik'chv et-kal-hashalal v'et kal-hamal'kvocha baadam vvab'hemah
translation: They gathered all the spoil and all the booty, man and beast,

hebrew: וַיָּבִ֡אוּ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֩ וְאֶל־אֶלְעָזָ֨ר הַכֹּהֵ֜ן וְאֶל־עֲדַ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶת־הַשְּׁבִ֧י וְאֶת־הַמַּלְק֛וֹחַ וְאֶת־הַשָּׁלָ֖ל אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה אֶל־עַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵחֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayaviv el-mosheh v'el-el'azar hakohen v'el-'adat b'ney-yis'rael et-hash'viy v'et-hamal'kvocha v'et-hashalal el-hamachaneh el-'ar'vot mvoav asher 'al-yar'den y'rechvo (s)
translation: and they brought the captives, the booty, and the spoil to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the whole Israelite community, at the camp in the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨צְא֜וּ מֹשֶׁ֨ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן וְכָל־נְשִׂיאֵ֥י הָעֵדָ֖ה לִקְרָאתָ֑ם אֶל־מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vayetz'v mosheh v'el'azar hakohen v'khal-n'siyey ha'edah lik'ratam el-michvtz lamachaneh
translation: Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the chieftains of the community came out to meet them outside the camp.

hebrew: וַיִּקְצֹ֣ף מֹשֶׁ֔ה עַ֖ל פְּקוּדֵ֣י הֶחָ֑יִל שָׂרֵ֤י הָאֲלָפִים֙ וְשָׂרֵ֣י הַמֵּא֔וֹת הַבָּאִ֖ים מִצְּבָ֥א הַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
transliteration: vayik'tzof mosheh 'al p'kvdey hechayil sarey haalafiym v'sarey hamevot habaiym mitz'va hamil'chamah
translation: Moses became angry with the commanders of the army, the officers of thousands and the officers of hundreds, who had come back from the military campaign.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מֹשֶׁ֑ה הַֽחִיִּיתֶ֖ם כָּל־נְקֵבָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer aleyhem mosheh hachiyiytem kal-n'kevah
translation: Moses said to them, “You have spared every female!

hebrew: הֵ֣ן הֵ֜נָּה הָי֨וּ לִבְנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בִּדְבַ֣ר בִּלְעָ֔ם לִמְסָר־מַ֥עַל בַּיהוָ֖ה עַל־דְּבַר־פְּע֑וֹר וַתְּהִ֥י הַמַּגֵּפָ֖ה בַּעֲדַ֥ת יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: hen henah hayv liv'ney yis'rael bid'var bil'am lim'sar-ma'al bayhvah 'al-d'var-p'vor vat'hiy hamagefah ba'adat y'hvah
translation: Yet they are the very ones who, at the bidding of Balaam, inducedbMeaning of Heb. hayu…limsor uncertain. the Israelites to trespass against the LORD in the matter of Peor, so that the LORD’s community was struck by the plague.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה הִרְג֥וּ כָל־זָכָ֖ר בַּטָּ֑ף וְכָל־אִשָּׁ֗ה יֹדַ֥עַת אִ֛ישׁ לְמִשְׁכַּ֥ב זָכָ֖ר הֲרֹֽגוּ׃
transliteration: v'atah hir'gv khal-zakhar bataf v'khal-ishah yoda'at iysh l'mish'kav zakhar harogv
translation: Now, therefore, slay every male among the children, and slay also every woman who has known a man carnally;

hebrew: וְכֹל֙ הַטַּ֣ף בַּנָּשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יָדְע֖וּ מִשְׁכַּ֣ב זָכָ֑ר הַחֲי֖וּ לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'khol hataf banashiym asher lo-yad'v mish'kav zakhar hachayv lakhem
translation: but spare every young woman who has not had carnal relations with a man.

hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֗ם חֲנ֛וּ מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים כֹּל֩ הֹרֵ֨ג נֶ֜פֶשׁ וְכֹ֣ל ׀ נֹגֵ֣עַ בֶּֽחָלָ֗ל תִּֽתְחַטְּא֞וּ בַּיּ֤וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי֙ וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י אַתֶּ֖ם וּשְׁבִיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'atem chanv michvtz lamachaneh shiv'at yamiym kol horeg nefesh v'khol  noge'a bechalal tit'chat'v bayvom hash'liyshiy vvayvom hash'viy'iy atem vsh'viykhem
translation: “You shall then stay outside the camp seven days; every one among you or among your captives who has slain a person or touched a corpse shall cleanse himself on the third and seventh days.

hebrew: וְכָל־בֶּ֧גֶד וְכָל־כְּלִי־ע֛וֹר וְכָל־מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה עִזִּ֖ים וְכָל־כְּלִי־עֵ֑ץ תִּתְחַטָּֽאוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khal-beged v'khal-k'liy-'vor v'khal-ma'aseh 'iziym v'khal-k'liy-'etz tit'chatav (s)
translation: You shall also cleanse every cloth, every article of skin, everything made of goats’ hair, and every object of wood.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֶלְעָזָ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶל־אַנְשֵׁ֣י הַצָּבָ֔א הַבָּאִ֖ים לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה זֹ֚את חֻקַּ֣ת הַתּוֹרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayomer el'azar hakohen el-an'shey hatzava habaiym lamil'chamah zot chukat hatvorah asher-tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: Eleazar the priest said to the troops who had taken part in the fighting, “This is the ritual law that the L<small>ORD</small> has enjoined upon Moses:

hebrew: אַ֥ךְ אֶת־הַזָּהָ֖ב וְאֶת־הַכָּ֑סֶף אֶֽת־הַנְּחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ אֶת־הַבַּרְזֶ֔ל אֶֽת־הַבְּדִ֖יל וְאֶת־הָעֹפָֽרֶת׃
transliteration: akh' et-hazahav v'et-hakasef et-han'choshet et-habar'zel et-hab'diyl v'et-ha'ofaret
translation: Gold and silver, copper, iron, tin, and lead—

hebrew: כָּל־דָּבָ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־יָבֹ֣א בָאֵ֗שׁ תַּעֲבִ֤ירוּ בָאֵשׁ֙ וְטָהֵ֔ר אַ֕ךְ בְּמֵ֥י נִדָּ֖ה יִתְחַטָּ֑א וְכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹֽא־יָבֹ֛א בָּאֵ֖שׁ תַּעֲבִ֥ירוּ בַמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: kal-davar asher-yavo vaesh ta'aviyrv vaesh v'taher akh' b'mey nidah yit'chata v'khol asher lo-yavo baesh ta'aviyrv vamayim
translation: any article that can withstand fire—these you shall pass through fire and they shall be clean, except that they must be cleansed with water of lustration; and anything that cannot withstand fire you must pass through water.

hebrew: וְכִבַּסְתֶּ֧ם בִּגְדֵיכֶ֛ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י וּטְהַרְתֶּ֑ם וְאַחַ֖ר תָּבֹ֥אוּ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'khibas'tem big'deykhem bayvom hash'viy'iy vt'har'tem v'achar tavov el-hamachaneh (f)
translation: On the seventh day you shall wash your clothes and be clean, and after that you may enter the camp.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses:

hebrew: שָׂ֗א אֵ֣ת רֹ֤אשׁ מַלְק֙וֹחַ֙ הַשְּׁבִ֔י בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָ֑ה אַתָּה֙ וְאֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְרָאשֵׁ֖י אֲב֥וֹת הָעֵדָֽה׃
transliteration: sa et rosh mal'kvocha hash'viy baadam vvab'hemah atah v'el'azar hakohen v'rashey avvot ha'edah
translation: “You and Eleazar the priest and the family heads of the community take an inventory of the booty that was captured, man and beast,

hebrew: וְחָצִ֙יתָ֙ אֶת־הַמַּלְק֔וֹחַ בֵּ֚ין תֹּפְשֵׂ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים לַצָּבָ֑א וּבֵ֖ין כָּל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
transliteration: v'chatziyta et-hamal'kvocha beyn tof'sey hamil'chamah hayotz'iym latzava vveyn kal-ha'edah
translation: and divide the booty equally between the combatants who engaged in the campaign and the rest of the community.

hebrew: וַהֲרֵמֹתָ֨ מֶ֜כֶס לַֽיהוָ֗ה מֵאֵ֞ת אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ הַיֹּצְאִ֣ים לַצָּבָ֔א אֶחָ֣ד נֶ֔פֶשׁ מֵחֲמֵ֖שׁ הַמֵּא֑וֹת מִן־הָאָדָם֙ וּמִן־הַבָּקָ֔ר וּמִן־הַחֲמֹרִ֖ים וּמִן־הַצֹּֽאן׃
transliteration: vaharemota mekhes layhvah meet an'shey hamil'chamah hayotz'iym latzava echad nefesh mechamesh hamevot min-haadam vmin-habakar vmin-hachamoriym vmin-hatzon
translation: You shall exact a levy for the L<small>ORD</small>: in the case of the warriors who engaged in the campaign, one item in five hundred, of persons, oxen, asses, and sheep,

hebrew: מִמַּֽחֲצִיתָ֖ם תִּקָּ֑חוּ וְנָתַתָּ֛ה לְאֶלְעָזָ֥ר הַכֹּהֵ֖ן תְּרוּמַ֥ת יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: mimachatziytam tikachv v'natatah l'el'azar hakohen t'rvmat y'hvah
translation: shall be taken from their half-share and given to Eleazar the priest as a contribution to the L<small>ORD</small>;

hebrew: וּמִמַּחֲצִ֨ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל תִּקַּ֣ח ׀ אֶחָ֣ד ׀ אָחֻ֣ז מִן־הַחֲמִשִּׁ֗ים מִן־הָאָדָ֧ם מִן־הַבָּקָ֛ר מִן־הַחֲמֹרִ֥ים וּמִן־הַצֹּ֖אן מִכָּל־הַבְּהֵמָ֑ה וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אֹתָם֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם שֹׁמְרֵ֕י מִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת מִשְׁכַּ֥ן יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vmimachatzit b'ney-yis'rael tikach  echad  achuz min-hachamishiym min-haadam min-habakar min-hachamoriym vmin-hatzon mikal-hab'hemah v'natatah otam lal'viyim shom'rey mish'meret mish'kan y'hvah
translation: and from the half-share of the other Israelites you shall withhold one in every fifty human beings as well as cattle, asses, and sheep—all the animals—and give them to the Levites, who attend to the duties of the L<small>ORD</small>’s Tabernacle.”

hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֖ר הַכֹּהֵ֑ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vaya'as mosheh v'el'azar hakohen kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the L<small>ORD</small> commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ הַמַּלְק֔וֹחַ יֶ֣תֶר הַבָּ֔ז אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּזְז֖וּ עַ֣ם הַצָּבָ֑א צֹ֗אן שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֛לֶף וְשִׁבְעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵֽשֶׁת־אֲלָפִֽים׃
transliteration: vay'hiy hamal'kvocha yeter habaz asher baz'zv 'am hatzava tzon shesh-mevot elef v'shiv'iym elef vachameshet-alafiym
translation: The amount of booty, other than the spoil that the troops had plundered, came to 675,000 sheep,

hebrew: וּבָקָ֕ר שְׁנַ֥יִם וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃
transliteration: vvakar sh'nayim v'shiv'iym alef
translation: 72,000 head of cattle,

hebrew: וַחֲמֹרִ֕ים אֶחָ֥ד וְשִׁשִּׁ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃
transliteration: vachamoriym echad v'shishiym alef
translation: 61,000 asses,

hebrew: וְנֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֔ם מִן־הַ֨נָּשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יָדְע֖וּ מִשְׁכַּ֣ב זָכָ֑ר כָּל־נֶ֕פֶשׁ שְׁנַ֥יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃
transliteration: v'nefesh adam min-hanashiym asher lo-yad'v mish'kav zakhar kal-nefesh sh'nayim vsh'loshiym alef
translation: and a total of 32,000 human beings, namely, the women who had not had carnal relations.

hebrew: וַתְּהִי֙ הַֽמֶּחֱצָ֔ה חֵ֕לֶק הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים בַּצָּבָ֑א מִסְפַּ֣ר הַצֹּ֗אן שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֙לֶף֙ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים אֶ֔לֶף וְשִׁבְעַ֥ת אֲלָפִ֖ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vat'hiy hamechetzah chelek hayotz'iym batzava mis'par hatzon sh'losh-mevot elef vsh'loshiym elef v'shiv'at alafiym vachamesh mevot
translation: Thus, the half-share of those who had engaged in the campaign [was as follows]: The number of sheep was 337,500,

hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י הַמֶּ֥כֶס לַֽיהוָ֖ה מִן־הַצֹּ֑אן שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת חָמֵ֥שׁ וְשִׁבְעִֽים׃
transliteration: vay'hiy hamekhes layhvah min-hatzon shesh mevot chamesh v'shiv'iym
translation: and the L<small>ORD</small>’s levy from the sheep was 675;

hebrew: וְהַ֨בָּקָ֔ר שִׁשָּׁ֥ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים אָ֑לֶף וּמִכְסָ֥ם לַיהוָ֖ה שְׁנַ֥יִם וְשִׁבְעִֽים׃
transliteration: v'habakar shishah vsh'loshiym alef vmikh'sam layhvah sh'nayim v'shiv'iym
translation: the cattle came to 36,000, from which the L<small>ORD</small>’s levy was 72;

hebrew: וַחֲמֹרִ֕ים שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֑וֹת וּמִכְסָ֥ם לַֽיהוָ֖ה אֶחָ֥ד וְשִׁשִּֽׁים׃
transliteration: vachamoriym sh'loshiym elef vachamesh mevot vmikh'sam layhvah echad v'shishiym
translation: the asses came to 30,500, from which the L<small>ORD</small>’s levy was 61.

hebrew: וְנֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֔ם שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אָ֑לֶף וּמִכְסָם֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה שְׁנַ֥יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים נָֽפֶשׁ׃
transliteration: v'nefesh adam shishah 'asar alef vmikh'sam layhvah sh'nayim vsh'loshiym nafesh
translation: And the number of human beings was 16,000, from which the L<small>ORD</small>’s levy was 32.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶת־מֶ֙כֶס֙ תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה לְאֶלְעָזָ֖ר הַכֹּהֵ֑ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayiten mosheh et-mekhes t'rvmat y'hvah l'el'azar hakohen kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: Moses gave the contributions levied for the L<small>ORD</small> to Eleazar the priest, as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וּמִֽמַּחֲצִ֖ית בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁר֙ חָצָ֣ה מֹשֶׁ֔ה מִן־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים הַצֹּבְאִֽים׃
transliteration: vmimachatziyt b'ney yis'rael asher chatzah mosheh min-haanashiym hatzov'iym
translation: As for the half-share of the other Israelites, which Moses withdrew from the men who had taken the field,

hebrew: וַתְּהִ֛י מֶחֱצַ֥ת הָעֵדָ֖ה מִן־הַצֹּ֑אן שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֙לֶף֙ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים אֶ֔לֶף שִׁבְעַ֥ת אֲלָפִ֖ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vat'hiy mechetzat ha'edah min-hatzon sh'losh-mevot elef vsh'loshiym elef shiv'at alafiym vachamesh mevot
translation: that half-share of the community consisted of 337,500 sheep,

hebrew: וּבָקָ֕ר שִׁשָּׁ֥ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃
transliteration: vvakar shishah vsh'loshiym alef
translation: 36,000 head of cattle,

hebrew: וַחֲמֹרִ֕ים שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vachamoriym sh'loshiym elef vachamesh mevot
translation: 30,500 asses,

hebrew: וְנֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֔ם שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אָֽלֶף׃
transliteration: v'nefesh adam shishah 'asar alef
translation: and 16,000 human beings.

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה מִמַּחֲצִ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶת־הָֽאָחֻז֙ אֶחָ֣ד מִן־הַחֲמִשִּׁ֔ים מִן־הָאָדָ֖ם וּמִן־הַבְּהֵמָ֑ה וַיִּתֵּ֨ן אֹתָ֜ם לַלְוִיִּ֗ם שֹֽׁמְרֵי֙ מִשְׁמֶ֙רֶת֙ מִשְׁכַּ֣ן יְהוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh mimachatzit b'ney-yis'rael et-haachuz echad min-hachamishiym min-haadam vmin-hab'hemah vayiten otam lal'viyim shom'rey mish'meret mish'kan y'hvah kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: From this half-share of the Israelites, Moses withheld one in every fifty humans and animals; and he gave them to the Levites, who attended to the duties of the L<small>ORD</small>’s Tabernacle, as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְבוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה הַפְּקֻדִ֕ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְאַלְפֵ֣י הַצָּבָ֑א שָׂרֵ֥י הָאֲלָפִ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֥י הַמֵּאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayik'r'vv el-mosheh hap'kudiym asher l'al'fey hatzava sarey haalafiym v'sarey hamevot
translation: The commanders of the troop divisions, the officers of thousands and the officers of hundreds, approached Moses.

hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה עֲבָדֶ֣יךָ נָֽשְׂא֗וּ אֶת־רֹ֛אשׁ אַנְשֵׁ֥י הַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיָדֵ֑נוּ וְלֹא־נִפְקַ֥ד מִמֶּ֖נּוּ אִֽישׁ׃
transliteration: vayom'rv el-mosheh 'avadeykha nas'v et-rosh an'shey hamil'chamah asher b'yadenv v'lo-nif'kad mimenv iysh
translation: They said to Moses, “Your servants have made a check of the warriors in our charge, and not one of us is missing.

hebrew: וַנַּקְרֵ֞ב אֶת־קָרְבַּ֣ן יְהוָ֗ה אִישׁ֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר מָצָ֤א כְלִֽי־זָהָב֙ אֶצְעָדָ֣ה וְצָמִ֔יד טַבַּ֖עַת עָגִ֣יל וְכוּמָ֑ז לְכַפֵּ֥ר עַל־נַפְשֹׁתֵ֖ינוּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vanak'rev et-kar'ban y'hvah iysh asher matza kh'liy-zahav etz'adah v'tzamiyd taba'at 'agiyl v'khvmaz l'khaper 'al-naf'shoteynv lif'ney y'hvah
translation: So we have brought as an offering to the LORD such articles of gold as each of us came upon: armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and pendants,cSee note at Exod. 35.22. that expiation may be made for our persons before the LORD.”

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־הַזָּהָ֖ב מֵֽאִתָּ֑ם כֹּ֖ל כְּלִ֥י מַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: vayikach mosheh v'el'azar hakohen et-hazahav meitam kol k'liy ma'aseh
translation: Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted the gold from them, all kinds of wrought articles.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כָּל־זְהַ֣ב הַתְּרוּמָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֵרִ֙ימוּ֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה שִׁשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֛לֶף שְׁבַע־מֵא֥וֹת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים שָׁ֑קֶל מֵאֵת֙ שָׂרֵ֣י הָֽאֲלָפִ֔ים וּמֵאֵ֖ת שָׂרֵ֥י הַמֵּאֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vay'hiy  kal-z'hav hat'rvmah asher heriymv layhvah shishah 'asar elef sh'va'-mevot vachamishiym shakel meet sarey haalafiym vmeet sarey hamevot
translation: All the gold that was offered by the officers of thousands and the officers of hundreds as a contribution to the L<small>ORD</small> came to 16,750 shekels.—

hebrew: אַנְשֵׁי֙ הַצָּבָ֔א בָּזְז֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: an'shey hatzava baz'zv iysh lvo
translation: But in the ranks, everyone kept his booty for himself.—

hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶת־הַזָּהָ֔ב מֵאֵ֛ת שָׂרֵ֥י הָאֲלָפִ֖ים וְהַמֵּא֑וֹת וַיָּבִ֤אוּ אֹתוֹ֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד זִכָּר֥וֹן לִבְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayikach mosheh v'el'azar hakohen et-hazahav meet sarey haalafiym v'hamevot vayaviv otvo el-ohel mvo'ed zikarvon liv'ney-yis'rael lif'ney y'hvah (f)
translation: So Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted the gold from the officers of thousands and the officers of hundreds and brought it to the Tent of Meeting, as a reminder in behalf of the Israelites before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וּמִקְנֶ֣ה ׀ רַ֗ב הָיָ֞ה לִבְנֵ֧י רְאוּבֵ֛ן וְלִבְנֵי־גָ֖ד עָצ֣וּם מְאֹ֑ד וַיִּרְא֞וּ אֶת־אֶ֤רֶץ יַעְזֵר֙ וְאֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ גִּלְעָ֔ד וְהִנֵּ֥ה הַמָּק֖וֹם מְק֥וֹם מִקְנֶֽה׃
transliteration: vmik'neh  rav hayah liv'ney r'vven v'liv'ney-gad 'atzvm m'od vayir'v et-eretz ya'zer v'et-eretz gil'ad v'hineh hamakvom m'kvom mik'neh
translation: The Reubenites and the Gadites owned cattle in very great numbers. Noting that the lands of Jazer and Gilead were a region suitable for cattle,
