hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ בְנֵֽי־גָ֖ד וּבְנֵ֣י רְאוּבֵ֑ן וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאֶל־אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶל־נְשִׂיאֵ֥י הָעֵדָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayavov v'ney-gad vv'ney r'vven vayom'rv el-mosheh v'el-el'azar hakohen v'el-n'siyey ha'edah lemor
translation: the Gadites and the Reubenites came to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the chieftains of the community, and said,

hebrew: עֲטָר֤וֹת וְדִיבֹן֙ וְיַעְזֵ֣ר וְנִמְרָ֔ה וְחֶשְׁבּ֖וֹן וְאֶלְעָלֵ֑ה וּשְׂבָ֥ם וּנְב֖וֹ וּבְעֹֽן׃
transliteration: 'atarvot v'diyvon v'ya'zer v'nim'rah v'chesh'bvon v'el'aleh vs'vam vn'vvo vv'on
translation: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon—

hebrew: הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִכָּ֤ה יְהוָה֙ לִפְנֵי֙ עֲדַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶ֥רֶץ מִקְנֶ֖ה הִ֑וא וְלַֽעֲבָדֶ֖יךָ מִקְנֶֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: haaretz asher hikah y'hvah lif'ney 'adat yis'rael eretz mik'neh hiv v'la'avadeykha mik'neh (s)
translation: the land that the L<small>ORD</small> has conquered for the community of Israel is cattle country, and your servants have cattle.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ אִם־מָצָ֤אנוּ חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ יֻתַּ֞ן אֶת־הָאָ֧רֶץ הַזֹּ֛את לַעֲבָדֶ֖יךָ לַאֲחֻזָּ֑ה אַל־תַּעֲבִרֵ֖נוּ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
transliteration: vayom'rv im-matzanv chen b'eyneykha yutan et-haaretz hazot la'avadeykha laachuzah al-ta'avirenv et-hayar'den
translation: It would be a favor to us,” they continued, “if this land were given to your servants as a holding; do not move us across the Jordan.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה לִבְנֵי־גָ֖ד וְלִבְנֵ֣י רְאוּבֵ֑ן הַאַֽחֵיכֶ֗ם יָבֹ֙אוּ֙ לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְאַתֶּ֖ם תֵּ֥שְׁבוּ פֹֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh liv'ney-gad v'liv'ney r'vven haacheykhem yavov lamil'chamah v'atem tesh'vv foh
translation: Moses replied to the Gadites and the Reubenites, “Are your brothers to go to war while you stay here?

hebrew: וְלָ֣מָּה תנואון [תְנִיא֔וּן] אֶת־לֵ֖ב בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מֵֽעֲבֹר֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן לָהֶ֖ם יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'lamah tnvvn [t'niyvn] et-lev b'ney yis'rael me'avor el-haaretz asher-natan lahem y'hvah
translation: Why will you turn the minds of the Israelites from crossing into the land that the L<small>ORD</small> has given them?

hebrew: כֹּ֥ה עָשׂ֖וּ אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֑ם בְּשָׁלְחִ֥י אֹתָ֛ם מִקָּדֵ֥שׁ בַּרְנֵ֖עַ לִרְא֥וֹת אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: koh 'asv avoteykhem b'shal'chiy otam mikadesh bar'ne'a lir'vot et-haaretz
translation: That is what your fathers did when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to survey the land.

hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲל֞וּ עַד־נַ֣חַל אֶשְׁכּ֗וֹל וַיִּרְאוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וַיָּנִ֕יאוּ אֶת־לֵ֖ב בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לְבִלְתִּי־בֹא֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן לָהֶ֖ם יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vaya'alv 'ad-nachal esh'kvol vayir'v et-haaretz vayaniyv et-lev b'ney yis'rael l'vil'tiy-vo el-haaretz asher-natan lahem y'hvah
translation: After going up to the wadi Eshcol and surveying the land, they turned the minds of the Israelites from invading the land that the L<small>ORD</small> had given them.

hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יְהוָ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַיִּשָּׁבַ֖ע לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayichar-af y'hvah bayvom hahv vayishava' lemor
translation: Thereupon the L<small>ORD</small> was incensed and He swore,

hebrew: אִם־יִרְא֨וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֜ים הָעֹלִ֣ים מִמִּצְרַ֗יִם מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה אֵ֚ת הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֛עְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹ֑ב כִּ֥י לֹא־מִלְא֖וּ אַחֲרָֽי׃
transliteration: im-yir'v haanashiym ha'oliym mimitz'rayim miben 'es'riym shanah vama'lah et haadamah asher nish'ba'tiy l'av'raham l'yitz'chak vl'ya'akov kiy lo-mil'v acharay
translation: ‘None of the men from twenty years up who came out of Egypt shall see the land that I promised on oath to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, for they did not remain loyal to Me—

hebrew: בִּלְתִּ֞י כָּלֵ֤ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּה֙ הַקְּנִזִּ֔י וִיהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בִּן־נ֑וּן כִּ֥י מִלְא֖וּ אַחֲרֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: bil'tiy kalev ben-y'funeh hak'niziy viyhvoshu'a bin-nvn kiy mil'v acharey y'hvah
translation: none except Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua son of Nun, for they remained loyal to the L<small>ORD</small>.’

hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֤ף יְהוָה֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיְנִעֵם֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר אַרְבָּעִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה עַד־תֹּם֙ כָּל־הַדּ֔וֹר הָעֹשֶׂ֥ה הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayichar-af y'hvah b'yis'rael vay'ni'em bamid'bar ar'ba'iym shanah 'ad-tom kal-hadvor ha'oseh hara' b'eyney y'hvah
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> was incensed at Israel, and for forty years He made them wander in the wilderness, until the whole generation that had provoked the L<small>ORD</small>’s displeasure was gone.

hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה קַמְתֶּ֗ם תַּ֚חַת אֲבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם תַּרְבּ֖וּת אֲנָשִׁ֣ים חַטָּאִ֑ים לִסְפּ֣וֹת ע֗וֹד עַ֛ל חֲר֥וֹן אַף־יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'hineh kam'tem tachat avoteykhem tar'bvt anashiym chataiym lis'pvot 'vod 'al charvon af-y'hvah el-yis'rael
translation: And now you, a breed of sinful men, have replaced your fathers, to add still further to the L<small>ORD</small>’s wrath against Israel.

hebrew: כִּ֤י תְשׁוּבֻן֙ מֵֽאַחֲרָ֔יו וְיָסַ֣ף ע֔וֹד לְהַנִּיח֖וֹ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְשִֽׁחַתֶּ֖ם לְכָל־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy t'shvvun meacharayv v'yasaf 'vod l'haniychvo bamid'bar v'shichatem l'khal-ha'am hazeh (s)
translation: If you turn away from Him and He abandons them once more in the wilderness, you will bring calamity upon all this people.”

hebrew: וַיִּגְּשׁ֤וּ אֵלָיו֙ וַ֣יֹּאמְר֔וּ גִּדְרֹ֥ת צֹ֛אן נִבְנֶ֥ה לְמִקְנֵ֖נוּ פֹּ֑ה וְעָרִ֖ים לְטַפֵּֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vayig'shv elayv vayom'rv gid'rot tzon niv'neh l'mik'nenv poh v'ariym l'tapenv
translation: Then they stepped up to him and said, “We will build here sheepfolds for our flocks and towns for our children.

hebrew: וַאֲנַ֜חְנוּ נֵחָלֵ֣ץ חֻשִׁ֗ים לִפְנֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַ֛ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִם־הֲבִֽיאֹנֻ֖ם אֶל־מְקוֹמָ֑ם וְיָשַׁ֤ב טַפֵּ֙נוּ֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י הַמִּבְצָ֔ר מִפְּנֵ֖י יֹשְׁבֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vaanach'nv nechaletz chushiym lif'ney b'ney yis'rael 'ad asher im-haviyonum el-m'kvomam v'yashav tapenv b'arey hamiv'tzar mip'ney yosh'vey haaretz
translation: And we will hastenaMeaning of Heb. hushim uncertain. as shock-troops in the van of the Israelites until we have established them in their home, while our children stay in the fortified towns because of the inhabitants of the land.

hebrew: לֹ֥א נָשׁ֖וּב אֶל־בָּתֵּ֑ינוּ עַ֗ד הִתְנַחֵל֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אִ֖ישׁ נַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: lo nashvv el-bateynv 'ad hit'nachel b'ney yis'rael iysh nachalatvo
translation: We will not return to our homes until every one of the Israelites is in possession of his portion.

hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֤א נִנְחַל֙ אִתָּ֔ם מֵעֵ֥בֶר לַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן וָהָ֑לְאָה כִּ֣י בָ֤אָה נַחֲלָתֵ֙נוּ֙ אֵלֵ֔ינוּ מֵעֵ֥בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן מִזְרָֽחָה׃ (פ)
transliteration: kiy lo nin'chal itam me'ever layar'den vahal'ah kiy vaah nachalatenv eleynv me'ever hayar'den miz'rachah (f)
translation: But we will not have a share with them in the territory beyond the Jordan, for we have received our share on the east side of the Jordan.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה אִֽם־תַּעֲשׂ֖וּן אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה אִם־תֵּחָֽלְצ֛וּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה לַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer aleyhem mosheh im-ta'asvn et-hadavar hazeh im-techal'tzv lif'ney y'hvah lamil'chamah
translation: Moses said to them, “If you do this, if you go to battle as shock-troops, at the instance of the L<small>ORD</small>,

hebrew: וְעָבַ֨ר לָכֶ֧ם כָּל־חָל֛וּץ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה עַ֧ד הוֹרִישׁ֛וֹ אֶת־אֹיְבָ֖יו מִפָּנָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'avar lakhem kal-chalvtz et-hayar'den lif'ney y'hvah 'ad hvoriyshvo et-oy'vayv mipanayv
translation: and every shock-fighter among you crosses the Jordan, at the instance of the L<small>ORD</small>, until He has dispossessed His enemies before Him,

hebrew: וְנִכְבְּשָׁ֨ה הָאָ֜רֶץ לִפְנֵ֤י יְהוָה֙ וְאַחַ֣ר תָּשֻׁ֔בוּ וִהְיִיתֶ֧ם נְקִיִּ֛ים מֵיְהוָ֖ה וּמִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְ֠הָיְתָה הָאָ֨רֶץ הַזֹּ֥את לָכֶ֛ם לַאֲחֻזָּ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'nikh'b'shah haaretz lif'ney y'hvah v'achar tashuvv vih'yiytem n'kiyiym mey'hvah vmiyis'rael v'hay'tah haaretz hazot lakhem laachuzah lif'ney y'hvah
translation: and the land has been subdued, at the instance of the L<small>ORD</small>, and then you return—you shall be clear before the L<small>ORD</small> and before Israel; and this land shall be your holding under the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֤א תַעֲשׂוּן֙ כֵּ֔ן הִנֵּ֥ה חֲטָאתֶ֖ם לַיהוָ֑ה וּדְעוּ֙ חַטַּאתְכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּמְצָ֖א אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'im-lo ta'asvn ken hineh chatatem layhvah vd'v chatat'khem asher tim'tza et'khem
translation: But if you do not do so, you will have sinned against the L<small>ORD</small>; and know that your sin will overtake you.

hebrew: בְּנֽוּ־לָכֶ֤ם עָרִים֙ לְטַפְּכֶ֔ם וּגְדֵרֹ֖ת לְצֹנַאֲכֶ֑ם וְהַיֹּצֵ֥א מִפִּיכֶ֖ם תַּעֲשֽׂוּ׃
transliteration: b'nv-lakhem 'ariym l'tap'khem vg'derot l'tzonaakhem v'hayotze mipiykhem ta'asv
translation: Build towns for your children and sheepfolds for your flocks, but do what you have promised.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בְּנֵי־גָד֙ וּבְנֵ֣י רְאוּבֵ֔ן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר עֲבָדֶ֣יךָ יַעֲשׂ֔וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲדֹנִ֖י מְצַוֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer b'ney-gad vv'ney r'vven el-mosheh lemor 'avadeykha ya'asv kaasher adoniy m'tzaveh
translation: The Gadites and the Reubenites answered Moses, “Your servants will do as my lord commands.

hebrew: טַפֵּ֣נוּ נָשֵׁ֔ינוּ מִקְנֵ֖נוּ וְכָל־בְּהֶמְתֵּ֑נוּ יִֽהְיוּ־שָׁ֖ם בְּעָרֵ֥י הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
transliteration: tapenv nasheynv mik'nenv v'khal-b'hem'tenv yih'yv-sham b'arey hagil'ad
translation: Our children, our wives, our flocks, and all our other livestock will stay behindbLit. “there.” in the towns of Gilead;

hebrew: וַעֲבָדֶ֨יךָ יַֽעַבְר֜וּ כָּל־חֲל֥וּץ צָבָ֛א לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲדֹנִ֖י דֹּבֵֽר׃
transliteration: va'avadeykha ya'av'rv kal-chalvtz tzava lif'ney y'hvah lamil'chamah kaasher adoniy dover
translation: while your servants, all those recruited for war, cross over, at the instance of the L<small>ORD</small>, to engage in battle—as my lord orders.”

hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו לָהֶם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֵ֚ת אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֑וּן וְאֶת־רָאשֵׁ֛י אֲב֥וֹת הַמַּטּ֖וֹת לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vay'tzav lahem mosheh et el'azar hakohen v'et y'hvoshu'a bin-nvn v'et-rashey avvot hamatvot liv'ney yis'rael
translation: Then Moses gave instructions concerning them to Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the family heads of the Israelite tribes.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֲלֵהֶ֗ם אִם־יַעַבְר֣וּ בְנֵי־גָ֣ד וּבְנֵי־רְאוּבֵ֣ן ׀ אִ֠תְּכֶם אֶֽת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֞ן כָּל־חָל֤וּץ לַמִּלְחָמָה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וְנִכְבְּשָׁ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ לִפְנֵיכֶ֑ם וּנְתַתֶּ֥ם לָהֶ֛ם אֶת־אֶ֥רֶץ הַגִּלְעָ֖ד לַאֲחֻזָּֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer mosheh alehem im-ya'av'rv v'ney-gad vv'ney-r'vven  it'khem et-hayar'den kal-chalvtz lamil'chamah lif'ney y'hvah v'nikh'b'shah haaretz lif'neykhem vn'tatem lahem et-eretz hagil'ad laachuzah
translation: Moses said to them, “If every shock-fighter among the Gadites and the Reubenites crosses the Jordan with you to do battle, at the instance of the L<small>ORD</small>, and the land is subdued before you, you shall give them the land of Gilead as a holding.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֧א יַֽעַבְר֛וּ חֲלוּצִ֖ים אִתְּכֶ֑ם וְנֹֽאחֲז֥וּ בְתֹכְכֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: v'im-lo ya'av'rv chalvtziym it'khem v'nochazv v'tokh'khem b'eretz k'na'an
translation: But if they do not cross over with you as shock-troops, they shall receive holdings among you in the land of Canaan.”

hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲנ֧וּ בְנֵי־גָ֛ד וּבְנֵ֥י רְאוּבֵ֖ן לֵאמֹ֑ר אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֖יךָ כֵּ֥ן נַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
transliteration: vaya'anv v'ney-gad vv'ney r'vven lemor et asher diber y'hvah el-'avadeykha ken na'aseh
translation: The Gadites and the Reubenites said in reply, “Whatever the L<small>ORD</small> has spoken concerning your servants, that we will do.

hebrew: נַ֣חְנוּ נַעֲבֹ֧ר חֲלוּצִ֛ים לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְאִתָּ֙נוּ֙ אֲחֻזַּ֣ת נַחֲלָתֵ֔נוּ מֵעֵ֖בֶר לַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
transliteration: nach'nv na'avor chalvtziym lif'ney y'hvah eretz k'na'an v'itanv achuzat nachalatenv me'ever layar'den
translation: We ourselves will cross over as shock-troops, at the instance of the LORD, into the land of Canaan; and we shall keep our hereditary holding across the Jordan.”cI.e., in Transjordan.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לָהֶ֣ם ׀ מֹשֶׁ֡ה לִבְנֵי־גָד֩ וְלִבְנֵ֨י רְאוּבֵ֜ן וְלַחֲצִ֣י ׀ שֵׁ֣בֶט ׀ מְנַשֶּׁ֣ה בֶן־יוֹסֵ֗ף אֶת־מַמְלֶ֙כֶת֙ סִיחֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י וְאֶת־מַמְלֶ֔כֶת ע֖וֹג מֶ֣לֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֑ן הָאָ֗רֶץ לְעָרֶ֙יהָ֙ בִּגְבֻלֹ֔ת עָרֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: vayiten lahem  mosheh liv'ney-gad v'liv'ney r'vven v'lachatziy  shevet  m'nasheh ven-yvosef et-mam'lekhet siychon melekh' haemoriy v'et-mam'lekhet 'vog melekh' habashan haaretz l'areyha big'vulot 'arey haaretz saviyv
translation: So Moses assigned to them—to the Gadites, the Reubenites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph—the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of King Og of Bashan, the land with its various cities and the territories of their surrounding towns.

hebrew: וַיִּבְנ֣וּ בְנֵי־גָ֔ד אֶת־דִּיבֹ֖ן וְאֶת־עֲטָרֹ֑ת וְאֵ֖ת עֲרֹעֵֽר׃
transliteration: vayiv'nv v'ney-gad et-diyvon v'et-'atarot v'et 'aro'er
translation: The Gadites rebuilt Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,

hebrew: וְאֶת־עַטְרֹ֥ת שׁוֹפָ֛ן וְאֶת־יַעְזֵ֖ר וְיָגְבֳּהָֽה׃
transliteration: v'et-'at'rot shvofan v'et-ya'zer v'yag'bohah
translation: Atroth-shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,

hebrew: וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית נִמְרָ֖ה וְאֶת־בֵּ֣ית הָרָ֑ן עָרֵ֥י מִבְצָ֖ר וְגִדְרֹ֥ת צֹֽאן׃
transliteration: v'et-beyt nim'rah v'et-beyt haran 'arey miv'tzar v'gid'rot tzon
translation: Beth-nimrah, and Beth-haran as fortified towns or as enclosures for flocks.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֤י רְאוּבֵן֙ בָּנ֔וּ אֶת־חֶשְׁבּ֖וֹן וְאֶת־אֶלְעָלֵ֑א וְאֵ֖ת קִרְיָתָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vv'ney r'vven banv et-chesh'bvon v'et-el'ale v'et kir'yatayim
translation: The Reubenites rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,

hebrew: וְאֶת־נְב֞וֹ וְאֶת־בַּ֧עַל מְע֛וֹן מֽוּסַבֹּ֥ת שֵׁ֖ם וְאֶת־שִׂבְמָ֑ה וַיִּקְרְא֣וּ בְשֵׁמֹ֔ת אֶת־שְׁמ֥וֹת הֶעָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנֽוּ׃
transliteration: v'et-n'vvo v'et-ba'al m'von mvsabot shem v'et-siv'mah vayik'r'v v'shemot et-sh'mvot he'ariym asher banv
translation: Nebo, Baal-meon—some names being changed—and Sibmah; they gave [their own] names to towns that they rebuilt.dCf. vv. 41, 42.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ בְּנֵ֨י מָכִ֧יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֛ה גִּלְעָ֖דָה וַֽיִּלְכְּדֻ֑הָ וַיּ֖וֹרֶשׁ אֶת־הָאֱמֹרִ֥י אֲשֶׁר־בָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayel'khv b'ney makhiyr ben-m'nasheh gil'adah vayil'k'duha vayvoresh et-haemoriy asher-bah
translation: The descendants of Machir son of Manasseh went to Gilead and captured it, dispossessing the Amorites who were there;

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הַגִּלְעָ֔ד לְמָכִ֖יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayiten mosheh et-hagil'ad l'makhiyr ben-m'nasheh vayeshev bah
translation: so Moses gave Gilead to Machir son of Manasseh, and he settled there.

hebrew: וְיָאִ֤יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁה֙ הָלַ֔ךְ וַיִּלְכֹּ֖ד אֶת־חַוֺּתֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶתְהֶ֖ן חַוֺּ֥ת יָאִֽיר׃
transliteration: v'yaiyr ben-m'nasheh halakh' vayil'kod et-chavoteyhem vayik'ra et'hen chavot yaiyr
translation: Jair son of Manasseh went and captured eOr “the villages of Ham”; cf. Gen. 14.5.their villages,-e which he renamed Havvoth-jair.fI.e., “the villages of Jair.”

hebrew: וְנֹ֣בַח הָלַ֔ךְ וַיִּלְכֹּ֥ד אֶת־קְנָ֖ת וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֶ֑יהָ וַיִּקְרָ֧א לָ֦ה נֹ֖בַח בִּשְׁמֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'novach halakh' vayil'kod et-k'nat v'et-b'noteyha vayik'ra lah novach bish'mvo (f)
translation: And Nobah went and captured Kenath and its dependencies, renaming it Nobah after himself.

hebrew: אֵ֜לֶּה מַסְעֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָצְא֛וּ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹֽן׃
transliteration: eleh mas'ey v'ney-yis'rael asher yatz'v meeretz mitz'rayim l'tziv'otam b'yad-mosheh v'aharon
translation: These were the marches of the Israelites who started out from the land of Egypt, troop by troop, in the charge of Moses and Aaron.

hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֨ב מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־מוֹצָאֵיהֶ֛ם לְמַסְעֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־פִּ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְאֵ֥לֶּה מַסְעֵיהֶ֖ם לְמוֹצָאֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayikh'tov mosheh et-mvotzaeyhem l'mas'eyhem 'al-piy y'hvah v'eleh mas'eyhem l'mvotzaeyhem
translation: Moses recorded the starting points of their various marches as directed by the L<small>ORD</small>. Their marches, by starting points, were as follows:

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֤וּ מֵֽרַעְמְסֵס֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽרִאשׁ֔וֹן בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֑וֹן מִֽמָּחֳרַ֣ת הַפֶּ֗סַח יָצְא֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּיָ֣ד רָמָ֔ה לְעֵינֵ֖י כָּל־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vayis'v mera'm'ses bachodesh harishvon bachamishah 'asar yvom lachodesh harishvon mimachorat hapesach yatz'v v'ney-yis'rael b'yad ramah l'eyney kal-mitz'rayim
translation: They set out from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month. It was on the morrow of the passover offering that the Israelites started out defiantly,aSee note at Exod. 14.8. in plain view of all the Egyptians.

hebrew: וּמִצְרַ֣יִם מְקַבְּרִ֗ים אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִכָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה בָּהֶ֖ם כָּל־בְּכ֑וֹר וּבֵאלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם עָשָׂ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה שְׁפָטִֽים׃
transliteration: vmitz'rayim m'kab'riym et asher hikah y'hvah bahem kal-b'khvor vveloheyhem 'asah y'hvah sh'fatiym
translation: The Egyptians meanwhile were burying those among them whom the L<small>ORD</small> had struck down, every first-born—whereby the L<small>ORD</small> executed judgment on their gods.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵרַעְמְסֵ֑ס וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּסֻכֹּֽת׃
transliteration: vayis'v v'ney-yis'rael mera'm'ses vayachanv b'sukot
translation: The Israelites set out from Rameses and encamped at Succoth.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִסֻּכֹּ֑ת וַיַּחֲנ֣וּ בְאֵתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּקְצֵ֥ה הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
transliteration: vayis'v misukot vayachanv v'etam asher bik'tzeh hamid'bar
translation: They set out from Succoth and encamped at Etham, which is on the edge of the wilderness.

hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מֵֽאֵתָ֔ם וַיָּ֙שָׁב֙ עַל־פִּ֣י הַחִירֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־פְּנֵ֖י בַּ֣עַל צְפ֑וֹן וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ לִפְנֵ֥י מִגְדֹּֽל׃
transliteration: vayis'v meetam vayashav 'al-piy hachiyrot asher 'al-p'ney ba'al tz'fvon vayachanv lif'ney mig'dol
translation: They set out from Etham and turned about toward Pi-hahiroth, which faces Baal-zephon, and they encamped before Migdol.

hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י הַֽחִירֹ֔ת וַיַּֽעַבְר֥וּ בְתוֹךְ־הַיָּ֖ם הַמִּדְבָּ֑רָה וַיֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ דֶּ֣רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ בְּמִדְבַּ֣ר אֵתָ֔ם וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמָרָֽה׃
transliteration: vayis'v mip'ney hachiyrot vaya'av'rv v'tvokh'-hayam hamid'barah vayel'khv derekh' sh'loshet yamiym b'mid'bar etam vayachanv b'marah
translation: They set out from PenebMany Hebrew manuscripts and ancient versions read “Pi.”-hahiroth and passed through the sea into the wilderness; and they made a three-days’ journey in the wilderness of Etham and encamped at Marah.

hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מִמָּרָ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אֵילִ֑מָה וּ֠בְאֵילִם שְׁתֵּ֣ים עֶשְׂרֵ֞ה עֵינֹ֥ת מַ֛יִם וְשִׁבְעִ֥ים תְּמָרִ֖ים וַיַּחֲנוּ־שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: vayis'v mimarah vayavov eylimah vv'eylim sh'teym 'es'reh 'eynot mayim v'shiv'iym t'mariym vayachanv-sham
translation: They set out from Marah and came to Elim. There were twelve springs in Elim and seventy palm trees, so they encamped there.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵאֵילִ֑ם וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ עַל־יַם־סֽוּף׃
transliteration: vayis'v meeylim vayachanv 'al-yam-svf
translation: They set out from Elim and encamped by the Sea of Reeds.cSee note at Exod. 10.19.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִיַּם־ס֑וּף וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמִדְבַּר־סִֽין׃
transliteration: vayis'v miyam-svf vayachanv b'mid'bar-siyn
translation: They set out from the Sea of Reeds and encamped in the wilderness of Sin.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִמִּדְבַּר־סִ֑ין וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּדָפְקָֽה׃
transliteration: vayis'v mimid'bar-siyn vayachanv b'daf'kah
translation: They set out from the wilderness of Sin and encamped at Dophkah.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִדָּפְקָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּאָלֽוּשׁ׃
transliteration: vayis'v midaf'kah vayachanv b'alvsh
translation: They set out from Dophkah and encamped at Alush.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵאָל֑וּשׁ וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בִּרְפִידִ֔ם וְלֹא־הָ֨יָה שָׁ֥ם מַ֛יִם לָעָ֖ם לִשְׁתּֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayis'v mealvsh vayachanv bir'fiydim v'lo-hayah sham mayim la'am lish'tvot
translation: They set out from Alush and encamped at Rephidim; it was there that the people had no water to drink.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵרְפִידִ֑ם וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
transliteration: vayis'v mer'fiydim vayachanv b'mid'bar siynay
translation: They set out from Rephidim and encamped in the wilderness of Sinai.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִמִּדְבַּ֣ר סִינָ֑י וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּקִבְרֹ֥ת הַֽתַּאֲוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayis'v mimid'bar siynay vayachanv b'kiv'rot hataavah
translation: They set out from the wilderness of Sinai and encamped at Kibroth-hattaavah.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִקִּבְרֹ֣ת הַֽתַּאֲוָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בַּחֲצֵרֹֽת׃
transliteration: vayis'v mikiv'rot hataavah vayachanv bachatzerot
translation: They set out from Kibroth-hattaavah and encamped at Hazeroth.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵחֲצֵרֹ֑ת וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּרִתְמָֽה׃
transliteration: vayis'v mechatzerot vayachanv b'rit'mah
translation: They set out from Hazeroth and encamped at Rithmah.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵרִתְמָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּרִמֹּ֥ן פָּֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: vayis'v merit'mah vayachanv b'rimon paretz
translation: They set out from Rithmah and encamped at Rimmon-perez.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵרִמֹּ֣ן פָּ֑רֶץ וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּלִבְנָֽה׃
transliteration: vayis'v merimon paretz vayachanv b'liv'nah
translation: They set out from Rimmon-perez and encamped at Libnah.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִלִּבְנָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּרִסָּֽה׃
transliteration: vayis'v miliv'nah vayachanv b'risah
translation: They set out from Libnah and encamped at Rissah.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵרִסָּ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בִּקְהֵלָֽתָה׃
transliteration: vayis'v merisah vayachanv bik'helatah
translation: They set out from Rissah and encamped at Kehelath.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִקְּהֵלָ֑תָה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּהַר־שָֽׁפֶר׃
transliteration: vayis'v mik'helatah vayachanv b'har-shafer
translation: They set out from Kehelath and encamped at Mount Shepher.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵֽהַר־שָׁ֑פֶר וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בַּחֲרָדָֽה׃
transliteration: vayis'v mehar-shafer vayachanv bacharadah
translation: They set out from Mount Shepher and encamped at Haradah.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵחֲרָדָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמַקְהֵלֹֽת׃
transliteration: vayis'v mecharadah vayachanv b'mak'helot
translation: They set out from Haradah and encamped at Makheloth.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִמַּקְהֵלֹ֑ת וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּתָֽחַת׃
transliteration: vayis'v mimak'helot vayachanv b'tachat
translation: They set out from Makheloth and encamped at Tahath.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִתָּ֑חַת וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּתָֽרַח׃
transliteration: vayis'v mitachat vayachanv b'tarach
translation: They set out from Tahath and encamped at Terah.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִתָּ֑רַח וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמִתְקָֽה׃
transliteration: vayis'v mitarach vayachanv b'mit'kah
translation: They set out from Terah and encamped at Mithkah.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִמִּתְקָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּחַשְׁמֹנָֽה׃
transliteration: vayis'v mimit'kah vayachanv b'chash'monah
translation: They set out from Mithkah and encamped at Hashmonah.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵֽחַשְׁמֹנָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמֹסֵרֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vayis'v mechash'monah vayachanv b'moservot
translation: They set out from Hashmonah and encamped at Moseroth.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִמֹּסֵר֑וֹת וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בִּבְנֵ֥י יַעֲקָֽן׃
transliteration: vayis'v mimoservot vayachanv biv'ney ya'akan
translation: They set out from Moseroth and encamped at Bene-jaakan.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִבְּנֵ֣י יַעֲקָ֑ן וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּחֹ֥ר הַגִּדְגָּֽד׃
transliteration: vayis'v mib'ney ya'akan vayachanv b'chor hagid'gad
translation: They set out from Bene-jaakan and encamped at Hor-haggidgad.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵחֹ֣ר הַגִּדְגָּ֑ד וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּיָטְבָֽתָה׃
transliteration: vayis'v mechor hagid'gad vayachanv b'yat'vatah
translation: They set out from Hor-haggidgad and encamped at Jotbath.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִיָּטְבָ֑תָה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּעַבְרֹנָֽה׃
transliteration: vayis'v miyat'vatah vayachanv b'av'ronah
translation: They set out from Jotbath and encamped at Abronah.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵֽעַבְרֹנָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּעֶצְי֥וֹן גָּֽבֶר׃
transliteration: vayis'v me'av'ronah vayachanv b'etz'yvon gaver
translation: They set out from Abronah and encamped at Ezion-geber.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵעֶצְי֣וֹן גָּ֑בֶר וַיַּחֲנ֥וּ בְמִדְבַּר־צִ֖ן הִ֥וא קָדֵֽשׁ׃
transliteration: vayis'v me'etz'yvon gaver vayachanv v'mid'bar-tzin hiv kadesh
translation: They set out from Ezion-geber and encamped in the wilderness of Zin, that is, Kadesh.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִקָּדֵ֑שׁ וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בְּהֹ֣ר הָהָ֔ר בִּקְצֵ֖ה אֶ֥רֶץ אֱדֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vayis'v mikadesh vayachanv b'hor hahar bik'tzeh eretz edvom
translation: They set out from Kadesh and encamped at Mount Hor, on the edge of the land of Edom.

hebrew: וַיַּעַל֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶל־הֹ֥ר הָהָ֛ר עַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה וַיָּ֣מָת שָׁ֑ם בִּשְׁנַ֣ת הָֽאַרְבָּעִ֗ים לְצֵ֤את בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁ֖י בְּאֶחָ֥ד לַחֹֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: vaya'al aharon hakohen el-hor hahar 'al-piy y'hvah vayamat sham bish'nat haar'ba'iym l'tzet b'ney-yis'rael meeretz mitz'rayim bachodesh hachamiyshiy b'echad lachodesh
translation: Aaron the priest ascended Mount Hor at the command of the L<small>ORD</small> and died there, in the fortieth year after the Israelites had left the land of Egypt, on the first day of the fifth month.

hebrew: וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן בֶּן־שָׁלֹ֧שׁ וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָ֑ה בְּמֹת֖וֹ בְּהֹ֥ר הָהָֽר׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'aharon ben-shalosh v'es'riym vm'at shanah b'motvo b'hor hahar (s)
translation: Aaron was a hundred and twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֗ע הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ עֲרָ֔ד וְהֽוּא־יֹשֵׁ֥ב בַּנֶּ֖גֶב בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן בְּבֹ֖א בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' hak'na'aniy melekh' 'arad v'hv-yoshev banegev b'eretz k'na'an b'vo b'ney yis'rael
translation: And the Canaanite, king of Arad, who dwelt in the Negeb, in the land of Canaan, learned of the coming of the Israelites.dSee 21.1–3.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵהֹ֣ר הָהָ֑ר וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּצַלְמֹנָֽה׃
transliteration: vayis'v mehor hahar vayachanv b'tzal'monah
translation: They set out from Mount Hor and encamped at Zalmonah.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִצַּלְמֹנָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּפוּנֹֽן׃
transliteration: vayis'v mitzal'monah vayachanv b'fvnon
translation: They set out from Zalmonah and encamped at Punon.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִפּוּנֹ֑ן וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּאֹבֹֽת׃
transliteration: vayis'v mipvnon vayachanv b'ovot
translation: They set out from Punon and encamped at Oboth.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵאֹבֹ֑ת וַֽיַּחֲנ֛וּ בְּעִיֵּ֥י הָעֲבָרִ֖ים בִּגְב֥וּל מוֹאָֽב׃
transliteration: vayis'v meovot vayachanv b'iyey ha'avariym big'vvl mvoav
translation: They set out from Oboth and encamped at Iye-abarim, in the territory of Moab.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵעִיִּ֑ים וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּדִיבֹ֥ן גָּֽד׃
transliteration: vayis'v me'iyiym vayachanv b'diyvon gad
translation: They set out from Iyim and encamped at Dibon-gad.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִדִּיבֹ֣ן גָּ֑ד וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּעַלְמֹ֥ן דִּבְלָתָֽיְמָה׃
transliteration: vayis'v midiyvon gad vayachanv b'al'mon div'latay'mah
translation: They set out from Dibon-gad and encamped at Almon-diblathaim.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵעַלְמֹ֣ן דִּבְלָתָ֑יְמָה וַֽיַּחֲנ֛וּ בְּהָרֵ֥י הָעֲבָרִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֥י נְבֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayis'v me'al'mon div'latay'mah vayachanv b'harey ha'avariym lif'ney n'vvo
translation: They set out from Almon-diblathaim and encamped in the hills of Abarim, before Nebo.

hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵהָרֵ֣י הָעֲבָרִ֑ים וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֔ב עַ֖ל יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵחֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayis'v meharey ha'avariym vayachanv b'ar'vot mvoav 'al yar'den y'rechvo
translation: They set out from the hills of Abarim and encamped in the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho;

hebrew: וַיַּחֲנ֤וּ עַל־הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ מִבֵּ֣ית הַיְשִׁמֹ֔ת עַ֖ד אָבֵ֣ל הַשִּׁטִּ֑ים בְּעַֽרְבֹ֖ת מוֹאָֽב׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayachanv 'al-hayar'den mibeyt hay'shimot 'ad avel hashitiym b'ar'vot mvoav (s)
translation: they encamped by the Jordan from Beth-jeshimoth as far as Abel-shittim, in the steppes of Moab.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֑ב עַל־יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵח֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh b'ar'vot mvoav 'al-yar'den y'rechvo lemor
translation: In the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho, the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם כִּ֥י אַתֶּ֛ם עֹבְרִ֥ים אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem kiy atem 'ov'riym et-hayar'den el-eretz k'na'an
translation: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,

hebrew: וְה֨וֹרַשְׁתֶּ֜ם אֶת־כָּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֤י הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ מִפְּנֵיכֶ֔ם וְאִ֨בַּדְתֶּ֔ם אֵ֖ת כָּל־מַשְׂכִּיֹּתָ֑ם וְאֵ֨ת כָּל־צַלְמֵ֤י מַסֵּֽכֹתָם֙ תְּאַבֵּ֔דוּ וְאֵ֥ת כָּל־בָּמֹתָ֖ם תַּשְׁמִֽידוּ׃
transliteration: v'hvorash'tem et-kal-yosh'vey haaretz mip'neykhem v'ibad'tem et kal-mas'kiyotam v'et kal-tzal'mey masekhotam t'abedv v'et kal-bamotam tash'miydv
translation: you shall dispossess all the inhabitants of the land; you shall destroy all their figuredeSee note at Lev. 26.1. objects; you shall destroy all their molten images, and you shall demolish all their cult places.

hebrew: וְהוֹרַשְׁתֶּ֥ם אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וִֽישַׁבְתֶּם־בָּ֑הּ כִּ֥י לָכֶ֛ם נָתַ֥תִּי אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ לָרֶ֥שֶׁת אֹתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'hvorash'tem et-haaretz viyshav'tem-bah kiy lakhem natatiy et-haaretz lareshet otah
translation: And you shall take possession of the land and settle in it, for I have assigned the land to you to possess.

hebrew: וְהִתְנַחַלְתֶּם֩ אֶת־הָאָ֨רֶץ בְּגוֹרָ֜ל לְמִשְׁפְּחֹֽתֵיכֶ֗ם לָרַ֞ב תַּרְבּ֤וּ אֶת־נַחֲלָתוֹ֙ וְלַמְעַט֙ תַּמְעִ֣יט אֶת־נַחֲלָת֔וֹ אֶל֩ אֲשֶׁר־יֵ֨צֵא ל֥וֹ שָׁ֛מָּה הַגּוֹרָ֖ל ל֣וֹ יִהְיֶ֑ה לְמַטּ֥וֹת אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֖ם תִּתְנֶחָֽלוּ׃
transliteration: v'hit'nachal'tem et-haaretz b'gvoral l'mish'p'choteykhem larav tar'bv et-nachalatvo v'lam'at tam'iyt et-nachalatvo el asher-yetze lvo shamah hagvoral lvo yih'yeh l'matvot avoteykhem tit'nechalv
translation: You shall apportion the land among yourselves by lot, clan by clan: with larger groups increase the share, with smaller groups reduce the share. Wherever the lot falls for anyone, that shall be his. You shall have your portions according to your ancestral tribes.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֨א תוֹרִ֜ישׁוּ אֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָרֶץ֮ מִפְּנֵיכֶם֒ וְהָיָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תּוֹתִ֣ירוּ מֵהֶ֔ם לְשִׂכִּים֙ בְּעֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם וְלִצְנִינִ֖ם בְּצִדֵּיכֶ֑ם וְצָרֲר֣וּ אֶתְכֶ֔ם עַל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֖ם יֹשְׁבִ֥ים בָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'im-lo tvoriyshv et-yosh'vey haaretz mip'neykhem v'hayah asher tvotiyrv mehem l'sikiym b'eyneykhem v'litz'niynim b'tzideykhem v'tzararv et'khem 'al-haaretz asher atem yosh'viym bah
translation: But if you do not dispossess the inhabitants of the land, those whom you allow to remain shall be stings in your eyes and thorns in your sides, and they shall harass you in the land in which you live;

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּמִּ֛יתִי לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לָהֶ֖ם אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hayah kaasher dimiytiy la'asvot lahem e'eseh lakhem (f)
translation: so that I will do to you what I planned to do to them.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: צַ֞ו אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־אַתֶּ֥ם בָּאִ֖ים אֶל־הָאָ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן זֹ֣את הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּפֹּ֤ל לָכֶם֙ בְּֽנַחֲלָ֔ה אֶ֥רֶץ כְּנַ֖עַן לִגְבֻלֹתֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: tzav et-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem kiy-atem baiym el-haaretz k'na'an zot haaretz asher tipol lakhem b'nachalah eretz k'na'an lig'vuloteyha
translation: Instruct the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land of Canaan, this is the land that shall fall to you as your portion, the land of Canaan with its various boundaries:

hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה לָכֶ֧ם פְּאַת־נֶ֛גֶב מִמִּדְבַּר־צִ֖ן עַל־יְדֵ֣י אֱד֑וֹם וְהָיָ֤ה לָכֶם֙ גְּב֣וּל נֶ֔גֶב מִקְצֵ֥ה יָם־הַמֶּ֖לַח קֵֽדְמָה׃
transliteration: v'hayah lakhem p'at-negev mimid'bar-tzin 'al-y'dey edvom v'hayah lakhem g'vvl negev mik'tzeh yam-hamelach ked'mah
translation: Your southern sector shall extend from the wilderness of Zin alongside Edom. Your southern boundary shall start on the east from the tip of the Dead Sea.

hebrew: וְנָסַ֣ב לָכֶם֩ הַגְּב֨וּל מִנֶּ֜גֶב לְמַעֲלֵ֤ה עַקְרַבִּים֙ וְעָ֣בַר צִ֔נָה והיה [וְהָיוּ֙] תּֽוֹצְאֹתָ֔יו מִנֶּ֖גֶב לְקָדֵ֣שׁ בַּרְנֵ֑עַ וְיָצָ֥א חֲצַר־אַדָּ֖ר וְעָבַ֥ר עַצְמֹֽנָה׃
transliteration: v'nasav lakhem hag'vvl minegev l'ma'aleh 'ak'rabiym v'avar tzinah vhyh [v'hayv] tvotz'otayv minegev l'kadesh bar'ne'a v'yatza chatzar-adar v'avar 'atz'monah
translation: Your boundary shall then turn to pass south of the ascent of Akrabbim and continue to Zin, and its limits shall be south of Kadesh-barnea, reaching Hazar-addar and continuing to Azmon.

hebrew: וְנָסַ֧ב הַגְּב֛וּל מֵעַצְמ֖וֹן נַ֣חְלָה מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהָי֥וּ תוֹצְאֹתָ֖יו הַיָּֽמָּה׃
transliteration: v'nasav hag'vvl me'atz'mvon nach'lah mitz'rayim v'hayv tvotz'otayv hayamah
translation: From Azmon the boundary shall turn toward the Wadi of Egypt and terminate at the Sea.aI.e., the Mediterranean Sea.

hebrew: וּגְב֣וּל יָ֔ם וְהָיָ֥ה לָכֶ֛ם הַיָּ֥ם הַגָּד֖וֹל וּגְב֑וּל זֶֽה־יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם גְּב֥וּל יָֽם׃
transliteration: vg'vvl yam v'hayah lakhem hayam hagadvol vg'vvl zeh-yih'yeh lakhem g'vvl yam
translation: For the western boundary you shall have the coast of the Great Sea;aI.e., the Mediterranean Sea. that shall serve as your western boundary.

hebrew: וְזֶֽה־יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם גְּב֣וּל צָפ֑וֹן מִן־הַיָּם֙ הַגָּדֹ֔ל תְּתָא֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם הֹ֥ר הָהָֽר׃
transliteration: v'zeh-yih'yeh lakhem g'vvl tzafvon min-hayam hagadol t'tav lakhem hor hahar
translation: This shall be your northern boundary: Draw a line from the Great Sea to Mount Hor;

hebrew: מֵהֹ֣ר הָהָ֔ר תְּתָא֖וּ לְבֹ֣א חֲמָ֑ת וְהָי֛וּ תּוֹצְאֹ֥ת הַגְּבֻ֖ל צְדָֽדָה׃
transliteration: mehor hahar t'tav l'vo chamat v'hayv tvotz'ot hag'vul tz'dadah
translation: from Mount Hor draw a line to Lebo-hamath,bSee note at 13.21. and let the boundary reach Zedad.

hebrew: וְיָצָ֤א הַגְּבֻל֙ זִפְרֹ֔נָה וְהָי֥וּ תוֹצְאֹתָ֖יו חֲצַ֣ר עֵינָ֑ן זֶֽה־יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם גְּב֥וּל צָפֽוֹן׃
transliteration: v'yatza hag'vul zif'ronah v'hayv tvotz'otayv chatzar 'eynan zeh-yih'yeh lakhem g'vvl tzafvon
translation: The boundary shall then run to Ziphron and terminate at Hazar-enan. That shall be your northern boundary.

hebrew: וְהִתְאַוִּיתֶ֥ם לָכֶ֖ם לִגְב֣וּל קֵ֑דְמָה מֵחֲצַ֥ר עֵינָ֖ן שְׁפָֽמָה׃
transliteration: v'hit'aviytem lakhem lig'vvl ked'mah mechatzar 'eynan sh'famah
translation: For your eastern boundary you shall draw a line from Hazar-enan to Shepham.

hebrew: וְיָרַ֨ד הַגְּבֻ֧ל מִשְּׁפָ֛ם הָרִבְלָ֖ה מִקֶּ֣דֶם לָעָ֑יִן וְיָרַ֣ד הַגְּב֔וּל וּמָחָ֛ה עַל־כֶּ֥תֶף יָם־כִּנֶּ֖רֶת קֵֽדְמָה׃
transliteration: v'yarad hag'vul mish'fam hariv'lah mikedem la'ayin v'yarad hag'vvl vmachah 'al-ketef yam-kineret ked'mah
translation: From Shepham the boundary shall descend to Riblah on the east side of Ain; from there the boundary shall continue downward and abut on the eastern slopes of the Sea of Chinnereth.cI.e., the Sea (or Lake) of Galilee.

hebrew: וְיָרַ֤ד הַגְּבוּל֙ הַיַּרְדֵּ֔נָה וְהָי֥וּ תוֹצְאֹתָ֖יו יָ֣ם הַמֶּ֑לַח זֹאת֩ תִּהְיֶ֨ה לָכֶ֥ם הָאָ֛רֶץ לִגְבֻלֹתֶ֖יהָ סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: v'yarad hag'vvl hayar'denah v'hayv tvotz'otayv yam hamelach zot tih'yeh lakhem haaretz lig'vuloteyha saviyv
translation:
The boundary shall then descend along the Jordan and terminate at the Dead Sea.
That shall be your land as defined by its boundaries on all sides.

hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר זֹ֣את הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּתְנַחֲל֤וּ אֹתָהּ֙ בְּגוֹרָ֔ל אֲשֶׁר֙ צִוָּ֣ה יְהוָ֔ה לָתֵ֛ת לְתִשְׁעַ֥ת הַמַּטּ֖וֹת וַחֲצִ֥י הַמַּטֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vay'tzav mosheh et-b'ney yis'rael lemor zot haaretz asher tit'nachalv otah b'gvoral asher tzivah y'hvah latet l'tish'at hamatvot vachatziy hamateh
translation: Moses instructed the Israelites, saying: This is the land you are to receive by lot as your hereditary portion, which the L<small>ORD</small> has commanded to be given to the nine and a half tribes.

hebrew: כִּ֣י לָקְח֞וּ מַטֵּ֨ה בְנֵ֤י הָראוּבֵנִי֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֔ם וּמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־הַגָּדִ֖י לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם וַחֲצִי֙ מַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה לָקְח֖וּ נַחֲלָתָֽם׃
transliteration: kiy lak'chv mateh v'ney harvveniy l'veyt avotam vmateh v'ney-hagadiy l'veyt avotam vachatziy mateh m'nasheh lak'chv nachalatam
translation: For the Reubenite tribe by its ancestral houses, the Gadite tribe by its ancestral houses, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have already received their portions:

hebrew: שְׁנֵ֥י הַמַּטּ֖וֹת וַחֲצִ֣י הַמַּטֶּ֑ה לָקְח֣וּ נַחֲלָתָ֗ם מֵעֵ֛בֶר לְיַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵח֖וֹ קֵ֥דְמָה מִזְרָֽחָה׃ (פ)
transliteration: sh'ney hamatvot vachatziy hamateh lak'chv nachalatam me'ever l'yar'den y'rechvo ked'mah miz'rachah (f)
translation: those two and a half tribes have received their portions across the Jordan, opposite Jericho, on the east, the orient side.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses, saying:

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה שְׁמ֣וֹת הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־יִנְחֲל֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ אֶלְעָזָר֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וִיהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בִּן־נֽוּן׃
transliteration: eleh sh'mvot haanashiym asher-yin'chalv lakhem et-haaretz el'azar hakohen viyhvoshu'a bin-nvn
translation: These are the names of the men through whom the land shall be apportioned for you: Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun.

hebrew: וְנָשִׂ֥יא אֶחָ֛ד נָשִׂ֥יא אֶחָ֖ד מִמַּטֶּ֑ה תִּקְח֖וּ לִנְחֹ֥ל אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'nasiy echad nasiy echad mimateh tik'chv lin'chol et-haaretz
translation: And you shall also take a chieftain from each tribe through whom the land shall be apportioned.

hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה שְׁמ֣וֹת הָאֲנָשִׁ֑ים לְמַטֵּ֣ה יְהוּדָ֔ה כָּלֵ֖ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּֽה׃
transliteration: v'eleh sh'mvot haanashiym l'mateh y'hvdah kalev ben-y'funeh
translation: These are the names of the men: from the tribe of Judah: Caleb son of Jephunneh.

hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּה֙ בְּנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֔וֹן שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל בֶּן־עַמִּיהֽוּד׃
transliteration: vl'mateh b'ney shim'von sh'mvel ben-'amiyhvd
translation: From the Simeonite tribe: SamueldOr “Shemuel.” son of Ammihud.

hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה בִנְיָמִ֔ן אֱלִידָ֖ד בֶּן־כִּסְלֽוֹן׃
transliteration: l'mateh vin'yamin eliydad ben-kis'lvon
translation: From the tribe of Benjamin: Elidad son of Chislon.

hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵי־דָ֖ן נָשִׂ֑יא בֻּקִּ֖י בֶּן־יָגְלִֽי׃
transliteration: vl'mateh v'ney-dan nasiy bukiy ben-yag'liy
translation: From the Danite tribe: a chieftain, Bukki son of Jogli.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף לְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה נָשִׂ֑יא חַנִּיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־אֵפֹֽד׃
transliteration: liv'ney yvosef l'mateh v'ney-m'nasheh nasiy chaniyel ben-efod
translation: For the descendants of Joseph: from the Manassite tribe: a chieftain, Hanniel son of Ephod;

hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־אֶפְרַ֖יִם נָשִׂ֑יא קְמוּאֵ֖ל בֶּן־שִׁפְטָֽן׃
transliteration: vl'mateh v'ney-ef'rayim nasiy k'mvel ben-shif'tan
translation: and from the Ephraimite tribe: a chieftain, Kemuel son of Shiphtan.

hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־זְבוּלֻ֖ן נָשִׂ֑יא אֱלִיצָפָ֖ן בֶּן־פַּרְנָֽךְ׃
transliteration: vl'mateh v'ney-z'vvlun nasiy eliytzafan ben-par'nakh'
translation: From the Zebulunite tribe: a chieftain, Elizaphan son of Parnach.

hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־יִשָׂשכָ֖ר נָשִׂ֑יא פַּלְטִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־עַזָּֽן׃
transliteration: vl'mateh v'ney-yisashkhar nasiy pal'tiyel ben-'azan
translation: From the Issacharite tribe: a chieftain, Paltiel son of Azzan.

hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵי־אָשֵׁ֖ר נָשִׂ֑יא אֲחִיה֖וּד בֶּן־שְׁלֹמִֽי׃
transliteration: vl'mateh v'ney-asher nasiy achiyhvd ben-sh'lomiy
translation: From the Asherite tribe: a chieftain, Ahihud son of Shelomi.

hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־נַפְתָּלִ֖י נָשִׂ֑יא פְּדַהְאֵ֖ל בֶּן־עַמִּיהֽוּד׃
transliteration: vl'mateh v'ney-naf'taliy nasiy p'dah'el ben-'amiyhvd
translation: From the Naphtalite tribe: a chieftain, Pedahel son of Ammihud.

hebrew: אֵ֕לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהוָ֑ה לְנַחֵ֥ל אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃ (פ)
transliteration: eleh asher tzivah y'hvah l'nachel et-b'ney-yis'rael b'eretz k'na'an (f)
translation: It was these whom the L<small>ORD</small> designated to allot portions to the Israelites in the land of Canaan.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֑ב עַל־יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵח֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh b'ar'vot mvoav 'al-yar'den y'rechvo lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses in the steppes of Moab at the Jordan near Jericho, saying:

hebrew: צַו֮ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וְנָתְנ֣וּ לַלְוִיִּ֗ם מִֽנַּחֲלַ֛ת אֲחֻזָּתָ֖ם עָרִ֣ים לָשָׁ֑בֶת וּמִגְרָ֗שׁ לֶֽעָרִים֙ סְבִיבֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם תִּתְּנ֖וּ לַלְוִיִּֽם׃
transliteration: tzav et-b'ney yis'rael v'nat'nv lal'viyim minachalat achuzatam 'ariym lashavet vmig'rash le'ariym s'viyvoteyhem tit'nv lal'viyim
translation: Instruct the Israelite people to assign, out of the holdings apportioned to them, towns for the Levites to dwell in; you shall also assign to the Levites pasture land around their towns.

hebrew: וְהָי֧וּ הֶֽעָרִ֛ים לָהֶ֖ם לָשָׁ֑בֶת וּמִגְרְשֵׁיהֶ֗ם יִהְי֤וּ לִבְהֶמְתָּם֙ וְלִרְכֻשָׁ֔ם וּלְכֹ֖ל חַיָּתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'hayv he'ariym lahem lashavet vmig'r'sheyhem yih'yv liv'hem'tam v'lir'khusham vl'khol chayatam
translation: The towns shall be theirs to dwell in, and the pasture shall be for the cattle they own and all their other beasts.

hebrew: וּמִגְרְשֵׁי֙ הֶֽעָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּתְּנ֖וּ לַלְוִיִּ֑ם מִקִּ֤יר הָעִיר֙ וָח֔וּצָה אֶ֥לֶף אַמָּ֖ה סָבִֽיב׃
transliteration: vmig'r'shey he'ariym asher tit'nv lal'viyim mikiyr ha'iyr vachvtzah elef amah saviyv
translation: The town pasture that you are to assign to the Levites shall extend a thousand cubits outside the town wall all around.

hebrew: וּמַדֹּתֶ֞ם מִח֣וּץ לָעִ֗יר אֶת־פְּאַת־קֵ֣דְמָה אַלְפַּ֪יִם בָּֽאַמָּ֟ה וְאֶת־פְּאַת־נֶגֶב֩ אַלְפַּ֨יִם בָּאַמָּ֜ה וְאֶת־פְּאַת־יָ֣ם ׀ אַלְפַּ֣יִם בָּֽאַמָּ֗ה וְאֵ֨ת פְּאַ֥ת צָפ֛וֹן אַלְפַּ֥יִם בָּאַמָּ֖ה וְהָעִ֣יר בַּתָּ֑וֶךְ זֶ֚ה יִהְיֶ֣ה לָהֶ֔ם מִגְרְשֵׁ֖י הֶעָרִֽים׃
transliteration: vmadotem michvtz la'iyr et-p'at-ked'mah al'payim baamah v'et-p'at-negev al'payim baamah v'et-p'at-yam  al'payim baamah v'et p'at tzafvon al'payim baamah v'ha'iyr batavekh' zeh yih'yeh lahem mig'r'shey he'ariym
translation: You shall measure off two thousand cubits outside the town on the east side, two thousand on the south side, two thousand on the west side, and two thousand on the north side, with the town in the center. That shall be the pasture for their towns.

hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת הֶֽעָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר תִּתְּנוּ֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם אֵ֚ת שֵׁשׁ־עָרֵ֣י הַמִּקְלָ֔ט אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּתְּנ֔וּ לָנֻ֥ס שָׁ֖מָּה הָרֹצֵ֑חַ וַעֲלֵיהֶ֣ם תִּתְּנ֔וּ אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁתַּ֖יִם עִֽיר׃
transliteration: v'et he'ariym asher tit'nv lal'viyim et shesh-'arey hamik'lat asher tit'nv lanus shamah harotzecha va'aleyhem tit'nv ar'ba'iym vsh'tayim 'iyr
translation: The towns that you assign to the Levites shall comprise the six cities of refuge that you are to designate for a manslayer to flee to, to which you shall add forty-two towns.

hebrew: כָּל־הֶעָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר תִּתְּנוּ֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנֶ֖ה עִ֑יר אֶתְהֶ֖ן וְאֶת־מִגְרְשֵׁיהֶֽן׃
transliteration: kal-he'ariym asher tit'nv lal'viyim ar'ba'iym vsh'moneh 'iyr et'hen v'et-mig'r'sheyhen
translation: Thus the total of the towns that you assign to the Levites shall be forty-eight towns, with their pasture.

hebrew: וְהֶֽעָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר תִּתְּנוּ֙ מֵאֲחֻזַּ֣ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מֵאֵ֤ת הָרַב֙ תַּרְבּ֔וּ וּמֵאֵ֥ת הַמְעַ֖ט תַּמְעִ֑יטוּ אִ֗ישׁ כְּפִ֤י נַחֲלָתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִנְחָ֔לוּ יִתֵּ֥ן מֵעָרָ֖יו לַלְוִיִּֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'he'ariym asher tit'nv meachuzat b'ney-yis'rael meet harav tar'bv vmeet ham'at tam'iytv iysh k'fiy nachalatvo asher yin'chalv yiten me'arayv lal'viyim (f)
translation: In assigning towns from the holdings of the Israelites, take more from the larger groups and less from the smaller, so that each assigns towns to the Levites in proportion to the share it receives.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh lemor
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke further to Moses:

hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם כִּ֥י אַתֶּ֛ם עֹבְרִ֥ים אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן אַ֥רְצָה כְּנָֽעַן׃
transliteration: daber el-b'ney yis'rael v'amar'ta alehem kiy atem 'ov'riym et-hayar'den ar'tzah k'na'an
translation: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,

hebrew: וְהִקְרִיתֶ֤ם לָכֶם֙ עָרִ֔ים עָרֵ֥י מִקְלָ֖ט תִּהְיֶ֣ינָה לָכֶ֑ם וְנָ֥ס שָׁ֙מָּה֙ רֹצֵ֔חַ מַכֵּה־נֶ֖פֶשׁ בִּשְׁגָגָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hik'riytem lakhem 'ariym 'arey mik'lat tih'yeynah lakhem v'nas shamah rotzecha makeh-nefesh bish'gagah
translation: you shall provide yourselves with places to serve you as cities of refuge to which a manslayer who has killed a person unintentionally may flee.

hebrew: וְהָי֨וּ לָכֶ֧ם הֶעָרִ֛ים לְמִקְלָ֖ט מִגֹּאֵ֑ל וְלֹ֤א יָמוּת֙ הָרֹצֵ֔חַ עַד־עָמְד֛וֹ לִפְנֵ֥י הָעֵדָ֖ה לַמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
transliteration: v'hayv lakhem he'ariym l'mik'lat migoel v'lo yamvt harotzecha 'ad-'am'dvo lif'ney ha'edah lamish'pat
translation: The cities shall serve you as a refuge from the avenger,aLit. “redeemer,” i.e., next of kin; cf. note at Lev. 25.25. so that the manslayer may not die unless he has stood trial before the assembly.

hebrew: וְהֶעָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּתֵּ֑נוּ שֵׁשׁ־עָרֵ֥י מִקְלָ֖ט תִּהְיֶ֥ינָה לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'he'ariym asher titenv shesh-'arey mik'lat tih'yeynah lakhem
translation: The towns that you thus assign shall be six cities of refuge in all.

hebrew: אֵ֣ת ׀ שְׁלֹ֣שׁ הֶעָרִ֗ים תִּתְּנוּ֙ מֵעֵ֣בֶר לַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וְאֵת֙ שְׁלֹ֣שׁ הֶֽעָרִ֔ים תִּתְּנ֖וּ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן עָרֵ֥י מִקְלָ֖ט תִּהְיֶֽינָה׃
transliteration: et  sh'losh he'ariym tit'nv me'ever layar'den v'et sh'losh he'ariym tit'nv b'eretz k'na'an 'arey mik'lat tih'yeynah
translation: Three cities shall be designated beyond the Jordan, and the other three shall be designated in the land of Canaan: they shall serve as cities of refuge.

hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְלַגֵּ֤ר וְלַתּוֹשָׁב֙ בְּתוֹכָ֔ם תִּהְיֶ֛ינָה שֵׁשׁ־הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לְמִקְלָ֑ט לָנ֣וּס שָׁ֔מָּה כָּל־מַכֵּה־נֶ֖פֶשׁ בִּשְׁגָגָֽה׃
transliteration: liv'ney yis'rael v'lager v'latvoshav b'tvokham tih'yeynah shesh-he'ariym haeleh l'mik'lat lanvs shamah kal-makeh-nefesh bish'gagah
translation: These six cities shall serve the Israelites and the resident aliens among them for refuge, so that anyone who kills a person unintentionally may flee there.

hebrew: וְאִם־בִּכְלִ֨י בַרְזֶ֧ל ׀ הִכָּ֛הוּ וַיָּמֹ֖ת רֹצֵ֣חַֽ ה֑וּא מ֥וֹת יוּמַ֖ת הָרֹצֵֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'im-bikh'liy var'zel  hikahv vayamot rotzecha hv mvot yvmat harotzecha
translation: Anyone, however, who strikes another with an iron object so that death results is a murderer; the murderer must be put to death.

hebrew: וְאִ֡ם בְּאֶ֣בֶן יָד֩ אֲשֶׁר־יָמ֨וּת בָּ֥הּ הִכָּ֛הוּ וַיָּמֹ֖ת רֹצֵ֣חַֽ ה֑וּא מ֥וֹת יוּמַ֖ת הָרֹצֵֽחַ׃
transliteration: v'im b'even yad asher-yamvt bah hikahv vayamot rotzecha hv mvot yvmat harotzecha
translation: If he struck him with a stone toolbLit. “of the hand.” that could cause death, and death resulted, he is a murderer; the murderer must be put to death.

hebrew: א֡וֹ בִּכְלִ֣י עֵֽץ־יָד֩ אֲשֶׁר־יָמ֨וּת בּ֥וֹ הִכָּ֛הוּ וַיָּמֹ֖ת רֹצֵ֣חַֽ ה֑וּא מ֥וֹת יוּמַ֖ת הָרֹצֵֽחַ׃
transliteration: vo bikh'liy 'etz-yad asher-yamvt bvo hikahv vayamot rotzecha hv mvot yvmat harotzecha
translation: Similarly, if the object with which he struck him was a wooden toolbLit. “of the hand.” that could cause death, and death resulted, he is a murderer; the murderer must be put to death.

hebrew: גֹּאֵ֣ל הַדָּ֔ם ה֥וּא יָמִ֖ית אֶת־הָרֹצֵ֑חַ בְּפִגְעוֹ־ב֖וֹ ה֥וּא יְמִיתֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: goel hadam hv yamiyt et-harotzecha b'fig'vo-vvo hv y'miytenv
translation: The blood-avenger himself shall put the murderer to death; it is he who shall put him to death upon encounter.

hebrew: וְאִם־בְּשִׂנְאָ֖ה יֶהְדָּפֶ֑נּוּ אֽוֹ־הִשְׁלִ֥יךְ עָלָ֛יו בִּצְדִיָּ֖ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃
transliteration: v'im-b'sin'ah yeh'dafenv vo-hish'liykh' 'alayv bitz'diyah vayamot
translation: So, too, if he pushed him in hate or hurled something at him on purpose and death resulted,

hebrew: א֣וֹ בְאֵיבָ֞ה הִכָּ֤הוּ בְיָדוֹ֙ וַיָּמֹ֔ת מֽוֹת־יוּמַ֥ת הַמַּכֶּ֖ה רֹצֵ֣חַֽ ה֑וּא גֹּאֵ֣ל הַדָּ֗ם יָמִ֛ית אֶת־הָרֹצֵ֖חַ בְּפִגְעוֹ־בֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vo v'eyvah hikahv v'yadvo vayamot mvot-yvmat hamakeh rotzecha hv goel hadam yamiyt et-harotzecha b'fig'vo-vvo
translation: or if he struck him with his hand in enmity and death resulted, the assailant shall be put to death; he is a murderer. The blood-avenger shall put the murderer to death upon encounter.

hebrew: וְאִם־בְּפֶ֥תַע בְּלֹא־אֵיבָ֖ה הֲדָפ֑וֹ אוֹ־הִשְׁלִ֥יךְ עָלָ֛יו כָּל־כְּלִ֖י בְּלֹ֥א צְדִיָּֽה׃
transliteration: v'im-b'feta' b'lo-eyvah hadafvo vo-hish'liykh' 'alayv kal-k'liy b'lo tz'diyah
translation: But if he pushed him without malice aforethought or hurled any object at him unintentionally,

hebrew: א֣וֹ בְכָל־אֶ֜בֶן אֲשֶׁר־יָמ֥וּת בָּהּ֙ בְּלֹ֣א רְא֔וֹת וַיַּפֵּ֥ל עָלָ֖יו וַיָּמֹ֑ת וְהוּא֙ לֹא־אוֹיֵ֣ב ל֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א מְבַקֵּ֖שׁ רָעָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vo v'khal-even asher-yamvt bah b'lo r'vot vayapel 'alayv vayamot v'hv lo-voyev lvo v'lo m'vakesh ra'atvo
translation: or inadvertentlycLit. “without seeing.” dropped upon him any deadly object of stone, and death resulted—though he was not an enemy of his and did not seek his harm—

hebrew: וְשָֽׁפְטוּ֙ הָֽעֵדָ֔ה בֵּ֚ין הַמַּכֶּ֔ה וּבֵ֖ין גֹּאֵ֣ל הַדָּ֑ם עַ֥ל הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: v'shaf'tv ha'edah beyn hamakeh vveyn goel hadam 'al hamish'patiym haeleh
translation: in such cases the assembly shall decide between the slayer and the blood-avenger.

hebrew: וְהִצִּ֨ילוּ הָעֵדָ֜ה אֶת־הָרֹצֵ֗חַ מִיַּד֮ גֹּאֵ֣ל הַדָּם֒ וְהֵשִׁ֤יבוּ אֹתוֹ֙ הָֽעֵדָ֔ה אֶל־עִ֥יר מִקְלָט֖וֹ אֲשֶׁר־נָ֣ס שָׁ֑מָּה וְיָ֣שַׁב בָּ֗הּ עַד־מוֹת֙ הַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַגָּדֹ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־מָשַׁ֥ח אֹת֖וֹ בְּשֶׁ֥מֶן הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
transliteration: v'hitziylv ha'edah et-harotzecha miyad goel hadam v'heshiyvv otvo ha'edah el-'iyr mik'latvo asher-nas shamah v'yashav bah 'ad-mvot hakohen hagadol asher-mashach otvo b'shemen hakodesh
translation: The assembly shall protect the manslayer from the blood-avenger, and the assembly shall restore him to the city of refuge to which he fled, and there he shall remain until the death of the high priest who was anointed with the sacred oil.

hebrew: וְאִם־יָצֹ֥א יֵצֵ֖א הָרֹצֵ֑חַ אֶת־גְּבוּל֙ עִ֣יר מִקְלָט֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָנ֖וּס שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: v'im-yatzo yetze harotzecha et-g'vvl 'iyr mik'latvo asher yanvs shamah
translation: But if the manslayer ever goes outside the limits of the city of refuge to which he has fled,

hebrew: וּמָצָ֤א אֹתוֹ֙ גֹּאֵ֣ל הַדָּ֔ם מִח֕וּץ לִגְב֖וּל עִ֣יר מִקְלָט֑וֹ וְרָצַ֞ח גֹּאֵ֤ל הַדָּם֙ אֶת־הָ֣רֹצֵ֔חַ אֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ דָּֽם׃
transliteration: vmatza otvo goel hadam michvtz lig'vvl 'iyr mik'latvo v'ratzach goel hadam et-harotzecha eyn lvo dam
translation: and the blood-avenger comes upon him outside the limits of his city of refuge, and the blood-avenger kills the manslayer, there is no bloodguilt on his account.

hebrew: כִּ֣י בְעִ֤יר מִקְלָטוֹ֙ יֵשֵׁ֔ב עַד־מ֖וֹת הַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַגָּדֹ֑ל וְאַחֲרֵ֥י מוֹת֙ הַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַגָּדֹ֔ל יָשׁוּב֙ הָרֹצֵ֔חַ אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ אֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kiy v'iyr mik'latvo yeshev 'ad-mvot hakohen hagadol v'acharey mvot hakohen hagadol yashvv harotzecha el-eretz achuzatvo
translation: For he must remain inside his city of refuge until the death of the high priest; after the death of the high priest, the manslayer may return to his land holding.

hebrew: וְהָי֨וּ אֵ֧לֶּה לָכֶ֛ם לְחֻקַּ֥ת מִשְׁפָּ֖ט לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶ֑ם בְּכֹ֖ל מוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hayv eleh lakhem l'chukat mish'pat l'doroteykhem b'khol mvosh'voteykhem
translation: Such shall be your law of procedure throughout the ages in all your settlements.

hebrew: כָּל־מַ֨כֵּה־נֶ֔פֶשׁ לְפִ֣י עֵדִ֔ים יִרְצַ֖ח אֶת־הָרֹצֵ֑חַ וְעֵ֣ד אֶחָ֔ד לֹא־יַעֲנֶ֥ה בְנֶ֖פֶשׁ לָמֽוּת׃
transliteration: kal-makeh-nefesh l'fiy 'ediym yir'tzach et-harotzecha v'ed echad lo-ya'aneh v'nefesh lamvt
translation: If anyone kills a person, the manslayer may be executed only on the evidence of witnesses; the testimony of a single witness against a person shall not suffice for a sentence of death.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תִקְח֥וּ כֹ֙פֶר֙ לְנֶ֣פֶשׁ רֹצֵ֔חַ אֲשֶׁר־ה֥וּא רָשָׁ֖ע לָמ֑וּת כִּי־מ֖וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
transliteration: v'lo-tik'chv khofer l'nefesh rotzecha asher-hv rasha' lamvt kiy-mvot yvmat
translation: You may not accept a ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of a capital crime; he must be put to death.

hebrew: וְלֹא־תִקְח֣וּ כֹ֔פֶר לָנ֖וּס אֶל־עִ֣יר מִקְלָט֑וֹ לָשׁוּב֙ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת בָּאָ֔רֶץ עַד־מ֖וֹת הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
transliteration: v'lo-tik'chv khofer lanvs el-'iyr mik'latvo lashvv lashevet baaretz 'ad-mvot hakohen
translation: Nor may you accept ransom in lieu of flight to a city of refuge, enabling one to return to live on his land before the death of the priest.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תַחֲנִ֣יפוּ אֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתֶּם֙ בָּ֔הּ כִּ֣י הַדָּ֔ם ה֥וּא יַחֲנִ֖יף אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְלָאָ֣רֶץ לֹֽא־יְכֻפַּ֗ר לַדָּם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שֻׁפַּךְ־בָּ֔הּ כִּי־אִ֖ם בְּדַ֥ם שֹׁפְכֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'lo-tachaniyfv et-haaretz asher atem bah kiy hadam hv yachaniyf et-haaretz v'laaretz lo-y'khupar ladam asher shupakh'-bah kiy-im b'dam shof'khvo
translation: You shall not pollute the land in which you live; for blood pollutes the land, and the land can have no expiation for blood that is shed on it, except by the blood of him who shed it.

hebrew: וְלֹ֧א תְטַמֵּ֣א אֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתֶּם֙ יֹשְׁבִ֣ים בָּ֔הּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י שֹׁכֵ֣ן בְּתוֹכָ֑הּ כִּ֚י אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֔ה שֹׁכֵ֕ן בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'lo t'tame et-haaretz asher atem yosh'viym bah asher aniy shokhen b'tvokhah kiy aniy y'hvah shokhen b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael (f)
translation: You shall not defile the land in which you live, in which I Myself abide, for I the L<small>ORD</small> abide among the Israelite people.

hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְב֞וּ רָאשֵׁ֣י הָֽאָב֗וֹת לְמִשְׁפַּ֤חַת בְּנֵֽי־גִלְעָד֙ בֶּן־מָכִ֣יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה מִֽמִּשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֑ף וַֽיְדַבְּר֞וּ לִפְנֵ֤י מֹשֶׁה֙ וְלִפְנֵ֣י הַנְּשִׂאִ֔ים רָאשֵׁ֥י אָב֖וֹת לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayik'r'vv rashey haavvot l'mish'pachat b'ney-gil'ad ben-makhiyr ben-m'nasheh mimish'p'chot b'ney yvosef vay'dab'rv lif'ney mosheh v'lif'ney han'siiym rashey avvot liv'ney yis'rael
translation: The family heads in the clan of the descendants of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh, one of the Josephite clans, came forward and appealed to Moses and the chieftains, family headsaI.e., tribal heads. of the Israelites.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ אֶת־אֲדֹנִי֙ צִוָּ֣ה יְהוָ֔ה לָתֵ֨ת אֶת־הָאָ֧רֶץ בְּנַחֲלָ֛ה בְּגוֹרָ֖ל לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽאדֹנִי֙ צֻוָּ֣ה בַֽיהוָ֔ה לָתֵ֗ת אֶֽת־נַחֲלַ֛ת צְלָפְחָ֥ד אָחִ֖ינוּ לִבְנֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayom'rv et-adoniy tzivah y'hvah latet et-haaretz b'nachalah b'gvoral liv'ney yis'rael vadoniy tzuvah vayhvah latet et-nachalat tz'laf'chad achiynv liv'notayv
translation: They said, “The L<small>ORD</small> commanded my lord to assign the land to the Israelites as shares by lot, and my lord was further commanded by the L<small>ORD</small> to assign the share of our kinsman Zelophehad to his daughters.

hebrew: וְ֠הָיוּ לְאֶחָ֞ד מִבְּנֵ֨י שִׁבְטֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ לְנָשִׁים֒ וְנִגְרְעָ֤ה נַחֲלָתָן֙ מִנַּחֲלַ֣ת אֲבֹתֵ֔ינוּ וְנוֹסַ֕ף עַ֚ל נַחֲלַ֣ת הַמַּטֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּהְיֶ֖ינָה לָהֶ֑ם וּמִגֹּרַ֥ל נַחֲלָתֵ֖נוּ יִגָּרֵֽעַ׃
transliteration: v'hayv l'echad mib'ney shiv'tey v'ney-yis'rael l'nashiym v'nig'r'ah nachalatan minachalat avoteynv v'nvosaf 'al nachalat hamateh asher tih'yeynah lahem vmigoral nachalatenv yigare'a
translation: Now, if they marry persons from another Israelite tribe, their share will be cut off from our ancestral portion and be added to the portion of the tribe into which they marry; thus our allotted portion will be diminished.

hebrew: וְאִם־יִהְיֶ֣ה הַיֹּבֵל֮ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וְנֽוֹסְפָה֙ נַחֲלָתָ֔ן עַ֚ל נַחֲלַ֣ת הַמַּטֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּהְיֶ֖ינָה לָהֶ֑ם וּמִֽנַּחֲלַת֙ מַטֵּ֣ה אֲבֹתֵ֔ינוּ יִגָּרַ֖ע נַחֲלָתָֽן׃
transliteration: v'im-yih'yeh hayovel liv'ney yis'rael v'nvos'fah nachalatan 'al nachalat hamateh asher tih'yeynah lahem vminachalat mateh avoteynv yigara' nachalatan
translation: And even when the Israelites observe the jubilee, their share will be added to that of the tribe into which they marry, and their share will be cut off from the ancestral portion of our tribe.”

hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר כֵּ֛ן מַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־יוֹסֵ֖ף דֹּבְרִֽים׃
transliteration: vay'tzav mosheh et-b'ney yis'rael 'al-piy y'hvah lemor ken mateh v'ney-yvosef dov'riym
translation: So Moses, at the L<small>ORD</small>’s bidding, instructed the Israelites, saying: “The plea of the Josephite tribe is just.

hebrew: זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֣ה יְהוָ֗ה לִבְנ֤וֹת צְלָפְחָד֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לַטּ֥וֹב בְּעֵינֵיהֶ֖ם תִּהְיֶ֣ינָה לְנָשִׁ֑ים אַ֗ךְ לְמִשְׁפַּ֛חַת מַטֵּ֥ה אֲבִיהֶ֖ם תִּהְיֶ֥ינָה לְנָשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: zeh hadavar asher-tzivah y'hvah liv'nvot tz'laf'chad lemor latvov b'eyneyhem tih'yeynah l'nashiym akh' l'mish'pachat mateh aviyhem tih'yeynah l'nashiym
translation: This is what the L<small>ORD</small> has commanded concerning the daughters of Zelophehad: They may marry anyone they wish, provided they marry into a clan of their father’s tribe.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תִסֹּ֤ב נַחֲלָה֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִמַּטֶּ֖ה אֶל־מַטֶּ֑ה כִּ֣י אִ֗ישׁ בְּנַחֲלַת֙ מַטֵּ֣ה אֲבֹתָ֔יו יִדְבְּק֖וּ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'lo-tisov nachalah liv'ney yis'rael mimateh el-mateh kiy iysh b'nachalat mateh avotayv yid'b'kv b'ney yis'rael
translation: No inheritance of the Israelites may pass over from one tribe to another, but the Israelites must remain bound each to the ancestral portion of his tribe.

hebrew: וְכָל־בַּ֞ת יֹרֶ֣שֶׁת נַחֲלָ֗ה מִמַּטּוֹת֮ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ לְאֶחָ֗ד מִמִּשְׁפַּ֛חַת מַטֵּ֥ה אָבִ֖יהָ תִּהְיֶ֣ה לְאִשָּׁ֑ה לְמַ֗עַן יִֽירְשׁוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אִ֖ישׁ נַחֲלַ֥ת אֲבֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: v'khal-bat yoreshet nachalah mimatvot b'ney yis'rael l'echad mimish'pachat mateh aviyha tih'yeh l'ishah l'ma'an yiyr'shv b'ney yis'rael iysh nachalat avotayv
translation: Every daughter among the Israelite tribes who inherits a share must marry someone from a clan of her father’s tribe, in order that every Israelite may keep his ancestral share.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תִסֹּ֧ב נַחֲלָ֛ה מִמַּטֶּ֖ה לְמַטֶּ֣ה אַחֵ֑ר כִּי־אִישׁ֙ בְּנַ֣חֲלָת֔וֹ יִדְבְּק֕וּ מַטּ֖וֹת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'lo-tisov nachalah mimateh l'mateh acher kiy-iysh b'nachalatvo yid'b'kv matvot b'ney yis'rael
translation: Thus no inheritance shall pass over from one tribe to another, but the Israelite tribes shall remain bound each to its portion.”

hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה כֵּ֥ן עָשׂ֖וּ בְּנ֥וֹת צְלָפְחָֽד׃
transliteration: kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh ken 'asv b'nvot tz'laf'chad
translation: The daughters of Zelophehad did as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses:

hebrew: וַתִּהְיֶ֜ינָה מַחְלָ֣ה תִרְצָ֗ה וְחָגְלָ֧ה וּמִלְכָּ֛ה וְנֹעָ֖ה בְּנ֣וֹת צְלָפְחָ֑ד לִבְנֵ֥י דֹדֵיהֶ֖ן לְנָשִֽׁים׃
transliteration: vatih'yeynah mach'lah tir'tzah v'chag'lah vmil'kah v'no'ah b'nvot tz'laf'chad liv'ney dodeyhen l'nashiym
translation: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, Zelophehad’s daughters, were married to sons of their uncles,

hebrew: מִֽמִּשְׁפְּחֹ֛ת בְּנֵֽי־מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה בֶן־יוֹסֵ֖ף הָי֣וּ לְנָשִׁ֑ים וַתְּהִי֙ נַחֲלָתָ֔ן עַל־מַטֵּ֖ה מִשְׁפַּ֥חַת אֲבִיהֶֽן׃
transliteration: mimish'p'chot b'ney-m'nasheh ven-yvosef hayv l'nashiym vat'hiy nachalatan 'al-mateh mish'pachat aviyhen
translation: marrying into clans of descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph; and so their share remained in the tribe of their father’s clan.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הַמִּצְוֺ֞ת וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֔ב עַ֖ל יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵחֽוֹ׃
transliteration: eleh hamitz'vot v'hamish'patiym asher tzivah y'hvah b'yad-mosheh el-b'ney yis'rael b'ar'vot mvoav 'al yar'den y'rechvo
translation: These are the commandments and regulations that the LORD enjoined upon the Israelites, through Moses, on the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho.

hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הַדְּבָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־כָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּעֵ֖בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן בַּמִּדְבָּ֡ר בָּֽעֲרָבָה֩ מ֨וֹל ס֜וּף בֵּֽין־פָּארָ֧ן וּבֵֽין־תֹּ֛פֶל וְלָבָ֥ן וַחֲצֵרֹ֖ת וְדִ֥י זָהָֽב׃
transliteration: eleh had'variym asher diber mosheh el-kal-yis'rael b'ever hayar'den bamid'bar ba'aravah mvol svf beyn-paran vveyn-tofel v'lavan vachatzerot v'diy zahav
translation: These are the words that Moses addressed to all Israel on the other side of the Jordan.—aThe rest of this verse and v. 2 are unclear; cf. v. 19 and Num. 33.16–36.Through the wilderness, in the Arabah near Suph, between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Di-zahab,

hebrew: אַחַ֨ד עָשָׂ֥ר יוֹם֙ מֵֽחֹרֵ֔ב דֶּ֖רֶךְ הַר־שֵׂעִ֑יר עַ֖ד קָדֵ֥שׁ בַּרְנֵֽעַ׃
transliteration: achad 'asar yvom mechorev derekh' har-se'iyr 'ad kadesh bar'ne'a
translation: it is eleven days from Horeb to Kadesh-barnea by the Mount Seir route.—

hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ בְּאַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּעַשְׁתֵּֽי־עָשָׂ֥ר חֹ֖דֶשׁ בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ דִּבֶּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כְּ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֹת֖וֹ אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy b'ar'ba'iym shanah b'ash'tey-'asar chodesh b'echad lachodesh diber mosheh el-b'ney yis'rael k'khol asher tzivah y'hvah otvo alehem
translation: It was in the fortieth year, on the first day of the eleventh month, that Moses addressed the Israelites in accordance with the instructions that the L<small>ORD</small> had given him for them,

hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֣י הַכֹּת֗וֹ אֵ֚ת סִיחֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּחֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן וְאֵ֗ת ע֚וֹג מֶ֣לֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֔ן אֲשֶׁר־יוֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּעַשְׁתָּרֹ֖ת בְּאֶדְרֶֽעִי׃
transliteration: acharey hakotvo et siychon melekh' haemoriy asher yvoshev b'chesh'bvon v'et 'vog melekh' habashan asher-yvoshev b'ash'tarot b'ed're'iy
translation: after he had defeated Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, and King Og of Bashan, who dwelt at Ashtaroth [andbCf. Josh. 12.4; 13.12, 31.] Edrei.

hebrew: בְּעֵ֥בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֑ב הוֹאִ֣יל מֹשֶׁ֔ה בֵּאֵ֛ר אֶת־הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: b'ever hayar'den b'eretz mvoav hvoiyl mosheh beer et-hatvorah hazot lemor
translation: On the other side of the Jordan, in the land of Moab, Moses undertook to expound this Teaching. He said:

hebrew: יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵ֛ינוּ דִּבֶּ֥ר אֵלֵ֖ינוּ בְּחֹרֵ֣ב לֵאמֹ֑ר רַב־לָכֶ֥ם שֶׁ֖בֶת בָּהָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: y'hvah eloheynv diber eleynv b'chorev lemor rav-lakhem shevet bahar hazeh
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> our God spoke to us at Horeb, saying: You have stayed long enough at this mountain.

hebrew: פְּנ֣וּ ׀ וּסְע֣וּ לָכֶ֗ם וּבֹ֨אוּ הַ֥ר הָֽאֱמֹרִי֮ וְאֶל־כָּל־שְׁכֵנָיו֒ בָּעֲרָבָ֥ה בָהָ֛ר וּבַשְּׁפֵלָ֥ה וּבַנֶּ֖גֶב וּבְח֣וֹף הַיָּ֑ם אֶ֤רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ וְהַלְּבָנ֔וֹן עַד־הַנָּהָ֥ר הַגָּדֹ֖ל נְהַר־פְּרָֽת׃
transliteration: p'nv  vs'v lakhem vvov har haemoriy v'el-kal-sh'khenayv ba'aravah vahar vvash'felah vvanegev vv'chvof hayam eretz hak'na'aniy v'hal'vanvon 'ad-hanahar hagadol n'har-p'rat
translation: Start out and make your way to the hill country of the Amorites and to all their neighbors in the Arabah, the hill country, the Shephelah,cOthers “Lowland.” the Negeb, the seacoast, the land of the Canaanites,dI.e., Phoenicia. and the Lebanon, as far as the Great River, the river Euphrates.

hebrew: רְאֵ֛ה נָתַ֥תִּי לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ בֹּ֚אוּ וּרְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁבַּ֣ע יְ֠הוָה לַאֲבֹ֨תֵיכֶ֜ם לְאַבְרָהָ֨ם לְיִצְחָ֤ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹב֙ לָתֵ֣ת לָהֶ֔ם וּלְזַרְעָ֖ם אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: r'eh natatiy lif'neykhem et-haaretz bov vr'shv et-haaretz asher nish'ba' y'hvah laavoteykhem l'av'raham l'yitz'chak vl'ya'akov latet lahem vl'zar'am achareyhem
translation: See, I place the land at your disposal. Go, take possession of the land that the L<small>ORD</small> swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to assign to them and to their heirs after them.

hebrew: וָאֹמַ֣ר אֲלֵכֶ֔ם בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖וא לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹא־אוּכַ֥ל לְבַדִּ֖י שְׂאֵ֥ת אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vaomar alekhem ba'et hahiv lemor lo-vkhal l'vadiy s'et et'khem
translation: Thereupon I said to you, “I cannot bear the burden of you by myself.

hebrew: יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם הִרְבָּ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֑ם וְהִנְּכֶ֣ם הַיּ֔וֹם כְּכוֹכְבֵ֥י הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לָרֹֽב׃
transliteration: y'hvah eloheykhem hir'bah et'khem v'hin'khem hayvom k'khvokh'vey hashamayim larov
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> your God has multiplied you until you are today as numerous as the stars in the sky.—

hebrew: יְהוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֽוֹתֵכֶ֗ם יֹסֵ֧ף עֲלֵיכֶ֛ם כָּכֶ֖ם אֶ֣לֶף פְּעָמִ֑ים וִיבָרֵ֣ךְ אֶתְכֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: y'hvah elohey avvotekhem yosef 'aleykhem kakhem elef p'amiym viyvarekh' et'khem kaasher diber lakhem
translation: May the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of your fathers, increase your numbers a thousandfold, and bless you as He promised you.—

hebrew: אֵיכָ֥ה אֶשָּׂ֖א לְבַדִּ֑י טָרְחֲכֶ֥ם וּמַֽשַּׂאֲכֶ֖ם וְרִֽיבְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: eykhah esa l'vadiy tar'chakhem vmasaakhem v'riyv'khem
translation: How can I bear unaided the trouble of you, and the burden, and the bickering!

hebrew: הָב֣וּ לָ֠כֶם אֲנָשִׁ֨ים חֲכָמִ֧ים וּנְבֹנִ֛ים וִידֻעִ֖ים לְשִׁבְטֵיכֶ֑ם וַאֲשִׂימֵ֖ם בְּרָאשֵׁיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: havv lakhem anashiym chakhamiym vn'voniym viydu'iym l'shiv'teykhem vaasiymem b'rasheykhem
translation: Pick from each of your tribes men who are wise, discerning, and experienced, and I will appoint them as your heads.”

hebrew: וַֽתַּעֲנ֖וּ אֹתִ֑י וַתֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ טֽוֹב־הַדָּבָ֥ר אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
transliteration: vata'anv otiy vatom'rv tvov-hadavar asher-dibar'ta la'asvot
translation: You answered me and said, “What you propose to do is good.”

hebrew: וָאֶקַּ֞ח אֶת־רָאשֵׁ֣י שִׁבְטֵיכֶ֗ם אֲנָשִׁ֤ים חֲכָמִים֙ וִֽידֻעִ֔ים וָאֶתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛ם רָאשִׁ֖ים עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם שָׂרֵ֨י אֲלָפִ֜ים וְשָׂרֵ֣י מֵא֗וֹת וְשָׂרֵ֤י חֲמִשִּׁים֙ וְשָׂרֵ֣י עֲשָׂרֹ֔ת וְשֹׁטְרִ֖ים לְשִׁבְטֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vaekach et-rashey shiv'teykhem anashiym chakhamiym viydu'iym vaeten otam rashiym 'aleykhem sarey alafiym v'sarey mevot v'sarey chamishiym v'sarey 'asarot v'shot'riym l'shiv'teykhem
translation: So I took your tribal leaders, wise and experienced men, and appointed them heads over you: chiefs of thousands, chiefs of hundreds, chiefs of fifties, and chiefs of tens, and officials for your tribes.

hebrew: וָאֲצַוֶּה֙ אֶת־שֹׁ֣פְטֵיכֶ֔ם בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖וא לֵאמֹ֑ר שָׁמֹ֤עַ בֵּין־אֲחֵיכֶם֙ וּשְׁפַטְתֶּ֣ם צֶ֔דֶק בֵּֽין־אִ֥ישׁ וּבֵין־אָחִ֖יו וּבֵ֥ין גֵּרֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaatzaveh et-shof'teykhem ba'et hahiv lemor shamo'a beyn-acheykhem vsh'fat'tem tzedek beyn-iysh vveyn-achiyv vveyn gervo
translation: I charged your magistrates at that time as follows, “Hear out your fellow men, and decide justly between any man and a fellow Israelite or a stranger.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תַכִּ֨ירוּ פָנִ֜ים בַּמִּשְׁפָּ֗ט כַּקָּטֹ֤ן כַּגָּדֹל֙ תִּשְׁמָע֔וּן לֹ֤א תָג֙וּרוּ֙ מִפְּנֵי־אִ֔ישׁ כִּ֥י הַמִּשְׁפָּ֖ט לֵאלֹהִ֣ים ה֑וּא וְהַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִקְשֶׁ֣ה מִכֶּ֔ם תַּקְרִב֥וּן אֵלַ֖י וּשְׁמַעְתִּֽיו׃
transliteration: lo-takiyrv faniym bamish'pat kakaton kagadol tish'ma'vn lo tagvrv mip'ney-iysh kiy hamish'pat lelohiym hv v'hadavar asher yik'sheh mikem tak'rivvn elay vsh'ma'tiyv
translation: You shall not be partial in judgment: hear out low and high alike. Fear no man, for judgment is God’s. And any matter that is too difficult for you, you shall bring to me and I will hear it.”

hebrew: וָאֲצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֑וא אֵ֥ת כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֽׂוּן׃
transliteration: vaatzaveh et'khem ba'et hahiv et kal-had'variym asher ta'asvn
translation: Thus I instructed you, at that time, about the various things that you should do.

hebrew: וַנִּסַּ֣ע מֵחֹרֵ֗ב וַנֵּ֡לֶךְ אֵ֣ת כָּל־הַמִּדְבָּ֣ר הַגָּדוֹל֩ וְהַנּוֹרָ֨א הַה֜וּא אֲשֶׁ֣ר רְאִיתֶ֗ם דֶּ֚רֶךְ הַ֣ר הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֛ה יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ אֹתָ֑נוּ וַנָּבֹ֕א עַ֖ד קָדֵ֥שׁ בַּרְנֵֽעַ׃
transliteration: vanisa' mechorev vanelekh' et kal-hamid'bar hagadvol v'hanvora hahv asher r'iytem derekh' har haemoriy kaasher tzivah y'hvah eloheynv otanv vanavo 'ad kadesh bar'ne'a
translation: We set out from Horeb and traveled the great and terrible wilderness that you saw, along the road to the hill country of the Amorites, as the L<small>ORD</small> our God had commanded us. When we reached Kadesh-barnea,

hebrew: וָאֹמַ֖ר אֲלֵכֶ֑ם בָּאתֶם֙ עַד־הַ֣ר הָאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vaomar alekhem batem 'ad-har haemoriy asher-y'hvah eloheynv noten lanv
translation: I said to you, “You have come to the hill country of the Amorites which the L<small>ORD</small> our God is giving to us.

hebrew: רְ֠אֵה נָתַ֨ן יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ לְפָנֶ֖יךָ אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ עֲלֵ֣ה רֵ֗שׁ כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י אֲבֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ לָ֔ךְ אַל־תִּירָ֖א וְאַל־תֵּחָֽת׃
transliteration: r'eh natan y'hvah eloheykha l'faneykha et-haaretz 'aleh resh kaasher diber y'hvah elohey avoteykha lakh' al-tiyra v'al-techat
translation: See, the L<small>ORD</small> your God has placed the land at your disposal. Go up, take possession, as the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of your fathers, promised you. Fear not and be not dismayed.”

hebrew: וַתִּקְרְב֣וּן אֵלַי֮ כֻּלְּכֶם֒ וַתֹּאמְר֗וּ נִשְׁלְחָ֤ה אֲנָשִׁים֙ לְפָנֵ֔ינוּ וְיַחְפְּרוּ־לָ֖נוּ אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְיָשִׁ֤בוּ אֹתָ֙נוּ֙ דָּבָ֔ר אֶת־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נַעֲלֶה־בָּ֔הּ וְאֵת֙ הֶֽעָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָבֹ֖א אֲלֵיהֶֽן׃
transliteration: vatik'r'vvn elay kul'khem vatom'rv nish'l'chah anashiym l'faneynv v'yach'p'rv-lanv et-haaretz v'yashivv otanv davar et-haderekh' asher na'aleh-bah v'et he'ariym asher navo aleyhen
translation: Then all of you came to me and said, “Let us send men ahead to reconnoiter the land for us and bring back word on the route we shall follow and the cities we shall come to.”

hebrew: וַיִּיטַ֥ב בְּעֵינַ֖י הַדָּבָ֑ר וָאֶקַּ֤ח מִכֶּם֙ שְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂ֣ר אֲנָשִׁ֔ים אִ֥ישׁ אֶחָ֖ד לַשָּֽׁבֶט׃
transliteration: vayiytav b'eynay hadavar vaekach mikem sh'neym 'asar anashiym iysh echad lashavet
translation: I approved of the plan, and so I selected twelve of your men, one from each tribe.

hebrew: וַיִּפְנוּ֙ וַיַּעֲל֣וּ הָהָ֔רָה וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ עַד־נַ֣חַל אֶשְׁכֹּ֑ל וַֽיְרַגְּל֖וּ אֹתָֽהּ׃
transliteration: vayif'nv vaya'alv haharah vayavov 'ad-nachal esh'kol vay'rag'lv otah
translation: They made for the hill country, came to the wadi Eshcol, and spied it out.

hebrew: וַיִּקְח֤וּ בְיָדָם֙ מִפְּרִ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ וַיּוֹרִ֖דוּ אֵלֵ֑ינוּ וַיָּשִׁ֨בוּ אֹתָ֤נוּ דָבָר֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ טוֹבָ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vayik'chv v'yadam mip'riy haaretz vayvoridv eleynv vayashivv otanv davar vayom'rv tvovah haaretz asher-y'hvah eloheynv noten lanv
translation: They took some of the fruit of the land with them and brought it down to us. And they gave us this report: “It is a good land that the L<small>ORD</small> our God is giving to us.”

hebrew: וְלֹ֥א אֲבִיתֶ֖ם לַעֲלֹ֑ת וַתַּמְר֕וּ אֶת־פִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'lo aviytem la'alot vatam'rv et-piy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: Yet you refused to go up, and flouted the command of the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: וַתֵּרָגְנ֤וּ בְאָהֳלֵיכֶם֙ וַתֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ בְּשִׂנְאַ֤ת יְהוָה֙ אֹתָ֔נוּ הוֹצִיאָ֖נוּ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם לָתֵ֥ת אֹתָ֛נוּ בְּיַ֥ד הָאֱמֹרִ֖י לְהַשְׁמִידֵֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vaterag'nv v'aholeykhem vatom'rv b'sin'at y'hvah otanv hvotziyanv meeretz mitz'rayim latet otanv b'yad haemoriy l'hash'miydenv
translation: You sulkedePrecise meaning of Heb. uncertain. in your tents and said, “It is because the LORD hates us that He brought us out of the land of Egypt, to hand us over to the Amorites to wipe us out.

hebrew: אָנָ֣ה ׀ אֲנַ֣חְנוּ עֹלִ֗ים אַחֵינוּ֩ הֵמַ֨סּוּ אֶת־לְבָבֵ֜נוּ לֵאמֹ֗ר עַ֣ם גָּד֤וֹל וָרָם֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ עָרִ֛ים גְּדֹלֹ֥ת וּבְצוּרֹ֖ת בַּשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְגַם־בְּנֵ֥י עֲנָקִ֖ים רָאִ֥ינוּ שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: anah  anach'nv 'oliym acheynv hemasv et-l'vavenv lemor 'am gadvol varam mimenv 'ariym g'dolot vv'tzvrot bashamayim v'gam-b'ney 'anakiym raiynv sham
translation: fLit. “Where.”What kind of place-f are we going to? Our kinsmen have taken the heart out of us, saying, ‘We saw there a people stronger and taller than we, large cities with walls sky-high, and even Anakites.’”

hebrew: וָאֹמַ֖ר אֲלֵכֶ֑ם לֹא־תַֽעַרְצ֥וּן וְֽלֹא־תִֽירְא֖וּן מֵהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vaomar alekhem lo-ta'ar'tzvn v'lo-tiyr'vn mehem
translation: I said to you, “Have no dread or fear of them.

hebrew: יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ הַהֹלֵ֣ךְ לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם ה֖וּא יִלָּחֵ֣ם לָכֶ֑ם כְּ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֧ה אִתְּכֶ֛ם בְּמִצְרַ֖יִם לְעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: y'hvah eloheykhem haholekh' lif'neykhem hv yilachem lakhem k'khol asher 'asah it'khem b'mitz'rayim l'eyneykhem
translation: None other than the L<small>ORD</small> your God, who goes before you, will fight for you, just as He did for you in Egypt before your very eyes,

hebrew: וּבַמִּדְבָּר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָאִ֔יתָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נְשָׂאֲךָ֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יִשָׂא־אִ֖ישׁ אֶת־בְּנ֑וֹ בְּכָל־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֲלַכְתֶּ֔ם עַד־בֹּאֲכֶ֖ם עַד־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vvamid'bar asher raiyta asher n'saakha y'hvah eloheykha kaasher yisa-iysh et-b'nvo b'khal-haderekh' asher halakh'tem 'ad-boakhem 'ad-hamakvom hazeh
translation: and in the wilderness, where you saw how the L<small>ORD</small> your God carried you, as a man carries his son, all the way that you traveled until you came to this place.

hebrew: וּבַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה אֵֽינְכֶם֙ מַאֲמִינִ֔ם בַּיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vvadavar hazeh eyn'khem maamiynim bayhvah eloheykhem
translation: Yet for all that, you have no faith in the L<small>ORD</small> your God,

hebrew: הַהֹלֵ֨ךְ לִפְנֵיכֶ֜ם בַּדֶּ֗רֶךְ לָת֥וּר לָכֶ֛ם מָק֖וֹם לַֽחֲנֹֽתְכֶ֑ם בָּאֵ֣שׁ ׀ לַ֗יְלָה לַרְאֹֽתְכֶם֙ בַּדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּֽלְכוּ־בָ֔הּ וּבֶעָנָ֖ן יוֹמָֽם׃
transliteration: haholekh' lif'neykhem baderekh' latvr lakhem makvom lachanot'khem baesh  lay'lah lar'ot'khem baderekh' asher tel'khv-vah vve'anan yvomam
translation: who goes before you on your journeys—to scout the place where you are to encamp—in fire by night and in cloud by day, in order to guide you on the route you are to follow.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־ק֣וֹל דִּבְרֵיכֶ֑ם וַיִּקְצֹ֖ף וַיִּשָּׁבַ֥ע לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' y'hvah et-kvol div'reykhem vayik'tzof vayishava' lemor
translation: When the L<small>ORD</small> heard your loud complaint, He was angry. He vowed:

hebrew: אִם־יִרְאֶ֥ה אִישׁ֙ בָּאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה הַדּ֥וֹר הָרָ֖ע הַזֶּ֑ה אֵ֚ת הָאָ֣רֶץ הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁבַּ֔עְתִּי לָתֵ֖ת לַאֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: im-yir'eh iysh baanashiym haeleh hadvor hara' hazeh et haaretz hatvovah asher nish'ba'tiy latet laavoteykhem
translation: Not one of these men, this evil generation, shall see the good land that I swore to give to your fathers—

hebrew: זֽוּלָתִ֞י כָּלֵ֤ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּה֙ ה֣וּא יִרְאֶ֔נָּה וְלֽוֹ־אֶתֵּ֧ן אֶת־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר דָּֽרַךְ־בָּ֖הּ וּלְבָנָ֑יו יַ֕עַן אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִלֵּ֖א אַחֲרֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: zvlatiy kalev ben-y'funeh hv yir'enah v'lvo-eten et-haaretz asher darakh'-bah vl'vanayv ya'an asher mile acharey y'hvah
translation: none except Caleb son of Jephunneh; he shall see it, and to him and his descendants will I give the land on which he set foot, because he remained loyal to the L<small>ORD</small>.—

hebrew: גַּם־בִּי֙ הִתְאַנַּ֣ף יְהוָ֔ה בִּגְלַלְכֶ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר גַּם־אַתָּ֖ה לֹא־תָבֹ֥א שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: gam-biy hit'anaf y'hvah big'lal'khem lemor gam-atah lo-tavo sham
translation: Because of you the L<small>ORD</small> was incensed with me too, and He said: You shall not enter it either.

hebrew: יְהוֹשֻׁ֤עַ בִּן נוּן֙ הָעֹמֵ֣ד לְפָנֶ֔יךָ ה֖וּא יָ֣בֹא שָׁ֑מָּה אֹת֣וֹ חַזֵּ֔ק כִּי־ה֖וּא יַנְחִלֶ֥נָּה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: y'hvoshu'a bin nvn ha'omed l'faneykha hv yavo shamah otvo chazek kiy-hv yan'chilenah et-yis'rael
translation: Joshua son of Nun, who attends you, he shall enter it. Imbue him with strength, for he shall allot it to Israel.—

hebrew: וְטַפְּכֶם֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲמַרְתֶּ֜ם לָבַ֣ז יִהְיֶ֗ה וּ֠בְנֵיכֶם אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־יָדְע֤וּ הַיּוֹם֙ ט֣וֹב וָרָ֔ע הֵ֖מָּה יָבֹ֣אוּ שָׁ֑מָּה וְלָהֶ֣ם אֶתְּנֶ֔נָּה וְהֵ֖ם יִירָשֽׁוּהָּ׃
transliteration: v'tap'khem asher amar'tem lavaz yih'yeh vv'neykhem asher lo-yad'v hayvom tvov vara' hemah yavov shamah v'lahem et'nenah v'hem yiyrashvha
translation: Moreover, your little ones who you said would be carried off, your children who do not yet know good from bad, they shall enter it; to them will I give it and they shall possess it.

hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֖ם פְּנ֣וּ לָכֶ֑ם וּסְע֥וּ הַמִּדְבָּ֖רָה דֶּ֥רֶךְ יַם־סֽוּף׃
transliteration: v'atem p'nv lakhem vs'v hamid'barah derekh' yam-svf
translation: As for you, turn about and march into the wilderness by the way of the Sea of Reeds.

hebrew: וַֽתַּעֲנ֣וּ ׀ וַתֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלַ֗י חָטָאנוּ֮ לַֽיהוָה֒ אֲנַ֤חְנוּ נַעֲלֶה֙ וְנִלְחַ֔מְנוּ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖נוּ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וַֽתַּחְגְּר֗וּ אִ֚ישׁ אֶת־כְּלֵ֣י מִלְחַמְתּ֔וֹ וַתָּהִ֖ינוּ לַעֲלֹ֥ת הָהָֽרָה׃
transliteration: vata'anv  vatom'rv elay chatanv layhvah anach'nv na'aleh v'nil'cham'nv k'khol asher-tzivanv y'hvah eloheynv vatach'g'rv iysh et-k'ley mil'cham'tvo vatahiynv la'alot haharah
translation: You replied to me, saying, “We stand guilty before the LORD. We will go up now and fight, just as the LORD our God commanded us.” And you all girded yourselves with war gear and recklesslygMeaning of Heb. uncertain. started for the hill country.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י אֱמֹ֤ר לָהֶם֙ לֹ֤א תַֽעֲלוּ֙ וְלֹא־תִלָּ֣חֲמ֔וּ כִּ֥י אֵינֶ֖נִּי בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֑ם וְלֹא֙ תִּנָּֽגְפ֔וּ לִפְנֵ֖י אֹיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elay emor lahem lo ta'alv v'lo-tilachamv kiy eyneniy b'kir'b'khem v'lo tinag'fv lif'ney oy'veykhem
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> said to me, “Warn them: Do not go up and do not fight, since I am not in your midst; else you will be routed by your enemies.”

hebrew: וָאֲדַבֵּ֥ר אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם וְלֹ֣א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֑ם וַתַּמְרוּ֙ אֶת־פִּ֣י יְהוָ֔ה וַתָּזִ֖דוּ וַתַּעֲל֥וּ הָהָֽרָה׃
transliteration: vaadaber aleykhem v'lo sh'ma'tem vatam'rv et-piy y'hvah vatazidv vata'alv haharah
translation: I spoke to you, but you would not listen; you flouted the L<small>ORD</small>’s command and willfully marched into the hill country.

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א הָאֱמֹרִ֜י הַיֹּשֵׁ֨ב בָּהָ֤ר הַהוּא֙ לִקְרַאתְכֶ֔ם וַיִּרְדְּפ֣וּ אֶתְכֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ינָה הַדְּבֹרִ֑ים וַֽיַּכְּת֥וּ אֶתְכֶ֛ם בְּשֵׂעִ֖יר עַד־חָרְמָֽה׃
transliteration: vayetze haemoriy hayoshev bahar hahv lik'rat'khem vayir'd'fv et'khem kaasher ta'aseynah had'voriym vayak'tv et'khem b'se'iyr 'ad-char'mah
translation: Then the Amorites who lived in those hills came out against you like so many bees and chased you, and they crushed you at Hormah in Seir.

hebrew: וַתָּשֻׁ֥בוּ וַתִּבְכּ֖וּ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְלֹֽא־שָׁמַ֤ע יְהוָה֙ בְּקֹ֣לְכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א הֶאֱזִ֖ין אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vatashuvv vativ'kv lif'ney y'hvah v'lo-shama' y'hvah b'kol'khem v'lo heeziyn aleykhem
translation: Again you wept before the L<small>ORD</small>; but the L<small>ORD</small> would not heed your cry or give ear to you.

hebrew: וַתֵּשְׁב֥וּ בְקָדֵ֖שׁ יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים כַּיָּמִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְשַׁבְתֶּֽם׃
