transliteration: vatesh'vv v'kadesh yamiym rabiym kayamiym asher y'shav'tem
translation: Thus, after you had remained at Kadesh hLit. “many days, like the days that you remained.”all that long time,-h

hebrew: וַנֵּ֜פֶן וַנִּסַּ֤ע הַמִּדְבָּ֙רָה֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יַם־ס֔וּף כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י וַנָּ֥סָב אֶת־הַר־שֵׂעִ֖יר יָמִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃ (ס)
transliteration: vanefen vanisa' hamid'barah derekh' yam-svf kaasher diber y'hvah elay vanasav et-har-se'iyr yamiym rabiym (s)
translation: we marched back into the wilderness by the way of the Sea of Reeds, as the L<small>ORD</small> had spoken to me, and skirted the hill country of Seir a long time.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elay lemor
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> said to me:

hebrew: רַב־לָכֶ֕ם סֹ֖ב אֶת־הָהָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה פְּנ֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם צָפֹֽנָה׃
transliteration: rav-lakhem sov et-hahar hazeh p'nv lakhem tzafonah
translation: You have been skirting this hill country long enough; now turn north.

hebrew: וְאֶת־הָעָם֮ צַ֣ו לֵאמֹר֒ אַתֶּ֣ם עֹֽבְרִ֗ים בִּגְבוּל֙ אֲחֵיכֶ֣ם בְּנֵי־עֵשָׂ֔ו הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בְּשֵׂעִ֑יר וְיִֽירְא֣וּ מִכֶּ֔ם וְנִשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: v'et-ha'am tzav lemor atem 'ov'riym big'vvl acheykhem b'ney-'esav hayosh'viym b'se'iyr v'yiyr'v mikem v'nish'mar'tem m'od
translation: And charge the people as follows: You will be passing through the territory of your kinsmen, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir. Though they will be afraid of you, be very careful

hebrew: אַל־תִּתְגָּר֣וּ בָ֔ם כִּ֠י לֹֽא־אֶתֵּ֤ן לָכֶם֙ מֵֽאַרְצָ֔ם עַ֖ד מִדְרַ֣ךְ כַּף־רָ֑גֶל כִּֽי־יְרֻשָּׁ֣ה לְעֵשָׂ֔ו נָתַ֖תִּי אֶת־הַ֥ר שֵׂעִֽיר׃
transliteration: al-tit'garv vam kiy lo-eten lakhem mear'tzam 'ad mid'rakh' kaf-ragel kiy-y'rushah l'esav natatiy et-har se'iyr
translation: not to provoke them. For I will not give you of their land so much as a foot can tread on; I have given the hill country of Seir as a possession to Esau.

hebrew: אֹ֣כֶל תִּשְׁבְּר֧וּ מֵֽאִתָּ֛ם בַּכֶּ֖סֶף וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֑ם וְגַם־מַ֜יִם תִּכְר֧וּ מֵאִתָּ֛ם בַּכֶּ֖סֶף וּשְׁתִיתֶֽם׃
transliteration: okhel tish'b'rv meitam bakesef vaakhal'tem v'gam-mayim tikh'rv meitam bakesef vsh'tiytem
translation: aOr “You may obtain food from them to eat for money; and you may also procure water from them to drink for money.”What food you eat you shall obtain from them for money; even the water you drink you shall procure from them for money.-a

hebrew: כִּי֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ בֵּֽרַכְךָ֗ בְּכֹל֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֶ֔ךָ יָדַ֣ע לֶכְתְּךָ֔ אֶת־הַמִּדְבָּ֥ר הַגָּדֹ֖ל הַזֶּ֑ה זֶ֣ה ׀ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֗ה יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ לֹ֥א חָסַ֖רְתָּ דָּבָֽר׃
transliteration: kiy y'hvah eloheykha berakh'kha b'khol ma'aseh yadekha yada' lekh't'kha et-hamid'bar hagadol hazeh zeh  ar'ba'iym shanah y'hvah eloheykha 'imakh' lo chasar'ta davar
translation: Indeed, the L<small>ORD</small> your God has blessed you in all your undertakings. He has watched over your wanderings through this great wilderness; the L<small>ORD</small> your God has been with you these past forty years: you have lacked nothing.

hebrew: וַֽנַּעֲבֹ֞ר מֵאֵ֧ת אַחֵ֣ינוּ בְנֵי־עֵשָׂ֗ו הַיֹּֽשְׁבִים֙ בְּשֵׂעִ֔יר מִדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ הָֽעֲרָבָ֔ה מֵאֵילַ֖ת וּמֵעֶצְיֹ֣ן גָּ֑בֶר (ס) וַנֵּ֙פֶן֙ וַֽנַּעֲבֹ֔ר דֶּ֖רֶךְ מִדְבַּ֥ר מוֹאָֽב׃
transliteration: vana'avor meet acheynv v'ney-'esav hayosh'viym b'se'iyr miderekh' ha'aravah meeylat vme'etz'yon gaver (s) vanefen vana'avor derekh' mid'bar mvoav
translation: We then moved on, away from our kinsmen, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, away from the road of the Arabah, away from Elath and Ezion-geber; and we marched on in the direction of the wilderness of Moab.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י אֶל־תָּ֙צַר֙ אֶת־מוֹאָ֔ב וְאַל־תִּתְגָּ֥ר בָּ֖ם מִלְחָמָ֑ה כִּ֠י לֹֽא־אֶתֵּ֨ן לְךָ֤ מֵֽאַרְצוֹ֙ יְרֻשָּׁ֔ה כִּ֣י לִבְנֵי־ל֔וֹט נָתַ֥תִּי אֶת־עָ֖ר יְרֻשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elay el-tatzar et-mvoav v'al-tit'gar bam mil'chamah kiy lo-eten l'kha mear'tzvo y'rushah kiy liv'ney-lvot natatiy et-'ar y'rushah
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to me: Do not harass the Moabites or provoke them to war. For I will not give you any of their land as a possession; I have assigned Ar as a possession to the descendants of Lot.—

hebrew: הָאֵמִ֥ים לְפָנִ֖ים יָ֣שְׁבוּ בָ֑הּ עַ֣ם גָּד֥וֹל וְרַ֛ב וָרָ֖ם כָּעֲנָקִֽים׃
transliteration: haemiym l'faniym yash'vv vah 'am gadvol v'rav varam ka'anakiym
translation: It was formerly inhabited by the Emim, a people great and numerous, and as tall as the Anakites.

hebrew: רְפָאִ֛ים יֵחָשְׁב֥וּ אַף־הֵ֖ם כָּעֲנָקִ֑ים וְהַמֹּ֣אָבִ֔ים יִקְרְא֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם אֵמִֽים׃
transliteration: r'faiym yechash'vv af-hem ka'anakiym v'hamoaviym yik'r'v lahem emiym
translation: Like the Anakites, they are counted as Rephaim; but the Moabites call them Emim.

hebrew: וּבְשֵׂעִ֞יר יָשְׁב֣וּ הַחֹרִים֮ לְפָנִים֒ וּבְנֵ֧י עֵשָׂ֣ו יִֽירָשׁ֗וּם וַיַּשְׁמִידוּם֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ תַּחְתָּ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֧ר עָשָׂ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לְאֶ֙רֶץ֙ יְרֻשָּׁת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן יְהוָ֖ה לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vv'se'iyr yash'vv hachoriym l'faniym vv'ney 'esav yiyrashvm vayash'miydvm mip'neyhem vayesh'vv tach'tam kaasher 'asah yis'rael l'eretz y'rushatvo asher-natan y'hvah lahem
translation: Similarly, Seir was formerly inhabited by the Horites; but the descendants of Esau dispossessed them, wiping them out and settling in their place, just as Israel did in the land they were to possess, which the L<small>ORD</small> had given to them.—

hebrew: עַתָּ֗ה קֻ֛מוּ וְעִבְר֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־נַ֣חַל זָ֑רֶד וַֽנַּעֲבֹ֖ר אֶת־נַ֥חַל זָֽרֶד׃
transliteration: 'atah kumv v'iv'rv lakhem et-nachal zared vana'avor et-nachal zared
translation:
Up now! Cross the wadi Zered!
So we crossed the wadi Zered.

hebrew: וְהַיָּמִ֞ים אֲשֶׁר־הָלַ֣כְנוּ ׀ מִקָּדֵ֣שׁ בַּרְנֵ֗עַ עַ֤ד אֲשֶׁר־עָבַ֙רְנוּ֙ אֶת־נַ֣חַל זֶ֔רֶד שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנֶ֖ה שָׁנָ֑ה עַד־תֹּ֨ם כָּל־הַדּ֜וֹר אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ מִקֶּ֣רֶב הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר נִשְׁבַּ֥ע יְהוָ֖ה לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hayamiym asher-halakh'nv  mikadesh bar'ne'a 'ad asher-'avar'nv et-nachal zered sh'loshiym vsh'moneh shanah 'ad-tom kal-hadvor an'shey hamil'chamah mikerev hamachaneh kaasher nish'ba' y'hvah lahem
translation: The time that we spent in travel from Kadesh-barnea until we crossed the wadi Zered was thirty-eight years, until that whole generation of warriors had perished from the camp, as the L<small>ORD</small> had sworn concerning them.

hebrew: וְגַ֤ם יַד־יְהוָה֙ הָ֣יְתָה בָּ֔ם לְהֻמָּ֖ם מִקֶּ֣רֶב הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה עַ֖ד תֻּמָּֽם׃
transliteration: v'gam yad-y'hvah hay'tah bam l'humam mikerev hamachaneh 'ad tumam
translation: Indeed, the hand of the L<small>ORD</small> struck them, to root them out from the camp to the last man.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י כַאֲשֶׁר־תַּ֜מּוּ כָּל־אַנְשֵׁ֧י הַמִּלְחָמָ֛ה לָמ֖וּת מִקֶּ֥רֶב הָעָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: vay'hiy khaasher-tamv kal-an'shey hamil'chamah lamvt mikerev ha'am (s)
translation: When all the warriors among the people had died off,

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah elay lemor
translation: the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to me, saying:

hebrew: אַתָּ֨ה עֹבֵ֥ר הַיּ֛וֹם אֶת־גְּב֥וּל מוֹאָ֖ב אֶת־עָֽר׃
transliteration: atah 'over hayvom et-g'vvl mvoav et-'ar
translation: You are now passing through the territory of Moab, through Ar.

hebrew: וְקָרַבְתָּ֗ מ֚וּל בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן אַל־תְּצֻרֵ֖ם וְאַל־תִּתְגָּ֣ר בָּ֑ם כִּ֣י לֹֽא־אֶ֠תֵּן מֵאֶ֨רֶץ בְּנֵי־עַמּ֤וֹן לְךָ֙ יְרֻשָּׁ֔ה כִּ֥י לִבְנֵי־ל֖וֹט נְתַתִּ֥יהָ יְרֻשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'karav'ta mvl b'ney 'amvon al-t'tzurem v'al-tit'gar bam kiy lo-eten meeretz b'ney-'amvon l'kha y'rushah kiy liv'ney-lvot n'tatiyha y'rushah
translation: You will then be close to the Ammonites; do not harass them or start a fight with them. For I will not give any part of the land of the Ammonites to you as a possession; I have assigned it as a possession to the descendants of Lot.—

hebrew: אֶֽרֶץ־רְפָאִ֥ים תֵּחָשֵׁ֖ב אַף־הִ֑וא רְפָאִ֤ים יָֽשְׁבוּ־בָהּ֙ לְפָנִ֔ים וְהָֽעַמֹּנִ֔ים יִקְרְא֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם זַמְזֻמִּֽים׃
transliteration: eretz-r'faiym techashev af-hiv r'faiym yash'vv-vah l'faniym v'ha'amoniym yik'r'v lahem zam'zumiym
translation: It, too, is counted as Rephaim country. It was formerly inhabited by Rephaim, whom the Ammonites call Zamzummim,

hebrew: עַ֣ם גָּד֥וֹל וְרַ֛ב וָרָ֖ם כָּעֲנָקִ֑ים וַיַּשְׁמִידֵ֤ם יְהוָה֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּירָשֻׁ֖ם וַיֵּשְׁב֥וּ תַחְתָּֽם׃
transliteration: 'am gadvol v'rav varam ka'anakiym vayash'miydem y'hvah mip'neyhem vayiyrashum vayesh'vv tach'tam
translation: a people great and numerous and as tall as the Anakites. The L<small>ORD</small> wiped them out, so that [the Ammonites] dispossessed them and settled in their place,

hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ לִבְנֵ֣י עֵשָׂ֔ו הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בְּשֵׂעִ֑יר אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִשְׁמִ֤יד אֶת־הַחֹרִי֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּֽירָשֻׁם֙ וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ תַחְתָּ֔ם עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: kaasher 'asah liv'ney 'esav hayosh'viym b'se'iyr asher hish'miyd et-hachoriy mip'neyhem vayiyrashum vayesh'vv tach'tam 'ad hayvom hazeh
translation: as He did for the descendants of Esau who live in Seir, when He wiped out the Horites before them, so that they dispossessed them and settled in their place, as is still the case.bLit. “until this day.”

hebrew: וְהָֽעַוִּ֛ים הַיֹּשְׁבִ֥ים בַּחֲצֵרִ֖ים עַד־עַזָּ֑ה כַּפְתֹּרִים֙ הַיֹּצְאִ֣ים מִכַּפְתּ֔וֹר הִשְׁמִידֻ֖ם וַיֵּשְׁב֥וּ תַחְתָּֽם׃
transliteration: v'ha'aviym hayosh'viym bachatzeriym 'ad-'azah kaf'toriym hayotz'iym mikaf'tvor hish'miydum vayesh'vv tach'tam
translation: So, too, with the Avvim who dwelt in villages in the vicinity of Gaza: the Caphtorim, who came from Crete,cHeb. “Caphtor.” wiped them out and settled in their place.—

hebrew: ק֣וּמוּ סְּע֗וּ וְעִבְרוּ֮ אֶת־נַ֣חַל אַרְנֹן֒ רְאֵ֣ה נָתַ֣תִּי בְ֠יָדְךָ אֶת־סִיחֹ֨ן מֶֽלֶךְ־חֶשְׁבּ֧וֹן הָֽאֱמֹרִ֛י וְאֶת־אַרְצ֖וֹ הָחֵ֣ל רָ֑שׁ וְהִתְגָּ֥ר בּ֖וֹ מִלְחָמָֽה׃
transliteration: kvmv s'v v'iv'rv et-nachal ar'non r'eh natatiy v'yad'kha et-siychon melekh'-chesh'bvon haemoriy v'et-ar'tzvo hachel rash v'hit'gar bvo mil'chamah
translation: Up! Set out across the wadi Arnon! See, I give into your power Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land. Begin the occupation: engage him in battle.

hebrew: הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה אָחֵל֙ תֵּ֤ת פַּחְדְּךָ֙ וְיִרְאָ֣תְךָ֔ עַל־פְּנֵי֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים תַּ֖חַת כָּל־הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁמְעוּן֙ שִׁמְעֲךָ֔ וְרָגְז֥וּ וְחָל֖וּ מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: hayvom hazeh achel tet pach'd'kha v'yir'at'kha 'al-p'ney ha'amiym tachat kal-hashamayim asher yish'm'vn shim'akha v'rag'zv v'chalv mipaneykha
translation: This day I begin to put the dread and fear of you upon the peoples everywhere under heaven, so that they shall tremble and quake because of you whenever they hear you mentioned.

hebrew: וָאֶשְׁלַ֤ח מַלְאָכִים֙ מִמִּדְבַּ֣ר קְדֵמ֔וֹת אֶל־סִיח֖וֹן מֶ֣לֶךְ חֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן דִּבְרֵ֥י שָׁל֖וֹם לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vaesh'lach mal'akhiym mimid'bar k'demvot el-siychvon melekh' chesh'bvon div'rey shalvom lemor
translation: Then I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to King Sihon of Heshbon with an offer of peace, as follows,

hebrew: אֶעְבְּרָ֣ה בְאַרְצֶ֔ךָ בַּדֶּ֥רֶךְ בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֵלֵ֑ךְ לֹ֥א אָס֖וּר יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹֽאול׃
transliteration: e'b'rah v'ar'tzekha baderekh' baderekh' elekh' lo asvr yamiyn vs'movl
translation: “Let me pass through your country. I will keep strictly to the highway, turning off neither to the right nor to the left.

hebrew: אֹ֣כֶל בַּכֶּ֤סֶף תַּשְׁבִּרֵ֙נִי֙ וְאָכַ֔לְתִּי וּמַ֛יִם בַּכֶּ֥סֶף תִּתֶּן־לִ֖י וְשָׁתִ֑יתִי רַ֖ק אֶעְבְּרָ֥ה בְרַגְלָֽי׃
transliteration: okhel bakesef tash'bireniy v'akhal'tiy vmayim bakesef titen-liy v'shatiytiy rak e'b'rah v'rag'lay
translation: What food I eat you will supply for money, and what water I drink you will furnish for money; just let me pass throughdLit. “with my feet.”—

hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָֽשׂוּ־לִ֜י בְּנֵ֣י עֵשָׂ֗ו הַיֹּֽשְׁבִים֙ בְּשֵׂעִ֔יר וְהַמּ֣וֹאָבִ֔ים הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בְּעָ֑ר עַ֤ד אֲשֶֽׁר־אֶֽעֱבֹר֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽנוּ׃
transliteration: kaasher 'asv-liy b'ney 'esav hayosh'viym b'se'iyr v'hamvoaviym hayosh'viym b'ar 'ad asher-e'evor et-hayar'den el-haaretz asher-y'hvah eloheynv noten lanv
translation: as the descendants of Esau who dwell in Seir did for me, and the Moabites who dwell in Ar—that I may cross the Jordan into the land that the L<small>ORD</small> our God is giving us.”

hebrew: וְלֹ֣א אָבָ֗ה סִיחֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ חֶשְׁבּ֔וֹן הַעֲבִרֵ֖נוּ בּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־הִקְשָׁה֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ אֶת־רוּח֗וֹ וְאִמֵּץ֙ אֶת־לְבָב֔וֹ לְמַ֛עַן תִּתּ֥וֹ בְיָדְךָ֖ כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'lo avah siychon melekh' chesh'bvon ha'avirenv bvo kiy-hik'shah y'hvah eloheykha et-rvchvo v'imetz et-l'vavvo l'ma'an titvo v'yad'kha kayvom hazeh (s)
translation: But King Sihon of Heshbon refused to let us pass through, because the L<small>ORD</small> had stiffened his will and hardened his heart in order to deliver him into your power—as is now the case.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י רְאֵ֗ה הַֽחִלֹּ֙תִי֙ תֵּ֣ת לְפָנֶ֔יךָ אֶת־סִיחֹ֖ן וְאֶת־אַרְצ֑וֹ הָחֵ֣ל רָ֔שׁ לָרֶ֖שֶׁת אֶת־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elay r'eh hachilotiy tet l'faneykha et-siychon v'et-ar'tzvo hachel rash lareshet et-ar'tzvo
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to me: See, I begin by placing Sihon and his land at your disposal. Begin the occupation; take possession of his land.

hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֩ סִיחֹ֨ן לִקְרָאתֵ֜נוּ ה֧וּא וְכָל־עַמּ֛וֹ לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה יָֽהְצָה׃
transliteration: vayetze siychon lik'ratenv hv v'khal-'amvo lamil'chamah yah'tzah
translation: Sihon with all his men took the field against us at Jahaz,

hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֛הוּ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ לְפָנֵ֑ינוּ וַנַּ֥ךְ אֹת֛וֹ וְאֶת־בנו [בָּנָ֖יו] וְאֶת־כָּל־עַמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayit'nehv y'hvah eloheynv l'faneynv vanakh' otvo v'et-vnv [banayv] v'et-kal-'amvo
translation: and the L<small>ORD</small> our God delivered him to us and we defeated him and his sons and all his men.

hebrew: וַנִּלְכֹּ֤ד אֶת־כָּל־עָרָיו֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא וַֽנַּחֲרֵם֙ אֶת־כָּל־עִ֣יר מְתִ֔ם וְהַנָּשִׁ֖ים וְהַטָּ֑ף לֹ֥א הִשְׁאַ֖רְנוּ שָׂרִֽיד׃
transliteration: vanil'kod et-kal-'arayv ba'et hahiv vanacharem et-kal-'iyr m'tim v'hanashiym v'hataf lo hish'ar'nv sariyd
translation: At that time we captured all his towns, and we doomedeI.e., placed under ḥerem, which meant the annihilation of the population. Cf. note b at Num. 21.2; Josh. 6.24. every town—men, women, and children—leaving no survivor.

hebrew: רַ֥ק הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה בָּזַ֣זְנוּ לָ֑נוּ וּשְׁלַ֥ל הֶעָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָכָֽדְנוּ׃
transliteration: rak hab'hemah bazaz'nv lanv vsh'lal he'ariym asher lakhad'nv
translation: We retained as booty only the cattle and the spoil of the cities that we captured.

hebrew: מֵֽעֲרֹעֵ֡ר אֲשֶׁר֩ עַל־שְׂפַת־נַ֨חַל אַרְנֹ֜ן וְהָעִ֨יר אֲשֶׁ֤ר בַּנַּ֙חַל֙ וְעַד־הַגִּלְעָ֔ד לֹ֤א הָֽיְתָה֙ קִרְיָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׂגְבָ֖ה מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אֶת־הַכֹּ֕ל נָתַ֛ן יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ לְפָנֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: me'aro'er asher 'al-s'fat-nachal ar'non v'ha'iyr asher banachal v'ad-hagil'ad lo hay'tah kir'yah asher sag'vah mimenv et-hakol natan y'hvah eloheynv l'faneynv
translation: From Aroer on the edge of the Arnon valley, including the townfMeaning of Heb. uncertain. in the valley itself, to Gilead, not a city was too mighty for us; the LORD our God delivered everything to us.

hebrew: רַ֛ק אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ בְּנֵי־עַמּ֖וֹן לֹ֣א קָרָ֑בְתָּ כָּל־יַ֞ד נַ֤חַל יַבֹּק֙ וְעָרֵ֣י הָהָ֔ר וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖ה יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: rak el-eretz b'ney-'amvon lo karav'ta kal-yad nachal yabok v'arey hahar v'khol asher-tzivah y'hvah eloheynv
translation: But you did not encroach upon the land of the Ammonites, all along the wadi Jabbok and the towns of the hill country, just as the L<small>ORD</small> our God had commanded.

hebrew: וַנֵּ֣פֶן וַנַּ֔עַל דֶּ֖רֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֑ן וַיֵּצֵ֣א עוֹג֩ מֶֽלֶךְ־הַבָּשָׁ֨ן לִקְרָאתֵ֜נוּ ה֧וּא וְכָל־עַמּ֛וֹ לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה אֶדְרֶֽעִי׃
transliteration: vanefen vana'al derekh' habashan vayetze 'vog melekh'-habashan lik'ratenv hv v'khal-'amvo lamil'chamah ed're'iy
translation: We made our way up the road toward Bashan, and King Og of Bashan with all his men took the field against us at Edrei.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֤ה אֵלַי֙ אַל־תִּירָ֣א אֹת֔וֹ כִּ֣י בְיָדְךָ֞ נָתַ֧תִּי אֹת֛וֹ וְאֶת־כָּל־עַמּ֖וֹ וְאֶת־אַרְצ֑וֹ וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ לּ֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֗יתָ לְסִיחֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּחֶשְׁבּֽוֹן׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elay al-tiyra otvo kiy v'yad'kha natatiy otvo v'et-kal-'amvo v'et-ar'tzvo v'asiyta lvo kaasher 'asiyta l'siychon melekh' haemoriy asher yvoshev b'chesh'bvon
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> said to me: Do not fear him, for I am delivering him and all his men and his country into your power, and you will do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּן֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵ֜ינוּ בְּיָדֵ֗נוּ גַּ֛ם אֶת־ע֥וֹג מֶֽלֶךְ־הַבָּשָׁ֖ן וְאֶת־כָּל־עַמּ֑וֹ וַנַּכֵּ֕הוּ עַד־בִּלְתִּ֥י הִשְׁאִֽיר־ל֖וֹ שָׂרִֽיד׃
transliteration: vayiten y'hvah eloheynv b'yadenv gam et-'vog melekh'-habashan v'et-kal-'amvo vanakehv 'ad-bil'tiy hish'iyr-lvo sariyd
translation: So the L<small>ORD</small> our God also delivered into our power King Og of Bashan, with all his men, and we dealt them such a blow that no survivor was left.

hebrew: וַנִּלְכֹּ֤ד אֶת־כָּל־עָרָיו֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא לֹ֤א הָֽיְתָה֙ קִרְיָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־לָקַ֖חְנוּ מֵֽאִתָּ֑ם שִׁשִּׁ֥ים עִיר֙ כָּל־חֶ֣בֶל אַרְגֹּ֔ב מַמְלֶ֥כֶת ע֖וֹג בַּבָּשָֽׁן׃
transliteration: vanil'kod et-kal-'arayv ba'et hahiv lo hay'tah kir'yah asher lo-lakach'nv meitam shishiym 'iyr kal-chevel ar'gov mam'lekhet 'vog babashan
translation: At that time we captured all his towns; there was not a town that we did not take from them: sixty towns, the whole district of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan—

hebrew: כָּל־אֵ֜לֶּה עָרִ֧ים בְּצֻר֛וֹת חוֹמָ֥ה גְבֹהָ֖ה דְּלָתַ֣יִם וּבְרִ֑יחַ לְבַ֛ד מֵעָרֵ֥י הַפְּרָזִ֖י הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: kal-eleh 'ariym b'tzurvot chvomah g'vohah d'latayim vv'riycha l'vad me'arey hap'raziy har'beh m'od
translation: all those towns were fortified with high walls, gates,aI.e., two-leaf doors. and bars—apart from a great number of unwalled towns.

hebrew: וַנַּחֲרֵ֣ם אוֹתָ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔ינוּ לְסִיחֹ֖ן מֶ֣לֶךְ חֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן הַחֲרֵם֙ כָּל־עִ֣יר מְתִ֔ם הַנָּשִׁ֖ים וְהַטָּֽף׃
transliteration: vanacharem votam kaasher 'asiynv l'siychon melekh' chesh'bvon hacharem kal-'iyr m'tim hanashiym v'hataf
translation: We doomed them as we had done in the case of King Sihon of Heshbon; we doomed every town—men, women, and children—

hebrew: וְכָל־הַבְּהֵמָ֛ה וּשְׁלַ֥ל הֶעָרִ֖ים בַּזּ֥וֹנוּ לָֽנוּ׃
transliteration: v'khal-hab'hemah vsh'lal he'ariym bazvonv lanv
translation: and retained as booty all the cattle and the spoil of the towns.

hebrew: וַנִּקַּ֞ח בָּעֵ֤ת הַהִוא֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ מִיַּ֗ד שְׁנֵי֙ מַלְכֵ֣י הָאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן מִנַּ֥חַל אַרְנֹ֖ן עַד־הַ֥ר חֶרְמֽוֹן׃
transliteration: vanikach ba'et hahiv et-haaretz miyad sh'ney mal'khey haemoriy asher b'ever hayar'den minachal ar'non 'ad-har cher'mvon
translation: Thus we seized, at that time, from the two Amorite kings, the country beyond the Jordan, from the wadi Arnon to Mount Hermon—

hebrew: צִידֹנִ֛ים יִקְרְא֥וּ לְחֶרְמ֖וֹן שִׂרְיֹ֑ן וְהָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י יִקְרְאוּ־ל֖וֹ שְׂנִֽיר׃
transliteration: tziydoniym yik'r'v l'cher'mvon sir'yon v'haemoriy yik'r'v-lvo s'niyr
translation: Sidonians called Hermon Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir—

hebrew: כֹּ֣ל ׀ עָרֵ֣י הַמִּישֹׁ֗ר וְכָל־הַגִּלְעָד֙ וְכָל־הַבָּשָׁ֔ן עַד־סַלְכָ֖ה וְאֶדְרֶ֑עִי עָרֵ֛י מַמְלֶ֥כֶת ע֖וֹג בַּבָּשָֽׁן׃
transliteration: kol  'arey hamiyshor v'khal-hagil'ad v'khal-habashan 'ad-sal'khah v'ed're'iy 'arey mam'lekhet 'vog babashan
translation: all the towns of the Tableland and the whole of Gilead and Bashan as far as SalcahbOthers “Salecah” or “Salchah.” and Edrei, the towns of Og’s kingdom in Bashan.

hebrew: כִּ֣י רַק־ע֞וֹג מֶ֣לֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֗ן נִשְׁאַר֮ מִיֶּ֣תֶר הָרְפָאִים֒ הִנֵּ֤ה עַרְשׂוֹ֙ עֶ֣רֶשׂ בַּרְזֶ֔ל הֲלֹ֣ה הִ֔וא בְּרַבַּ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֑וֹן תֵּ֧שַׁע אַמּ֣וֹת אָרְכָּ֗הּ וְאַרְבַּ֥ע אַמּ֛וֹת רָחְבָּ֖הּ בְּאַמַּת־אִֽישׁ׃
transliteration: kiy rak-'vog melekh' habashan nish'ar miyeter har'faiym hineh 'ar'svo 'eres bar'zel haloh hiv b'rabat b'ney 'amvon tesha' amvot ar'kah v'ar'ba' amvot rach'bah b'amat-iysh
translation: Only King Og of Bashan was left of the remaining Rephaim. His bedstead, an iron bedstead, is now in Rabbah of the Ammonites; it is nine cubits long and four cubits wide, by cLit. “by a man’s forearm.”the standard cubit!-c

hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאָ֧רֶץ הַזֹּ֛את יָרַ֖שְׁנוּ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֑וא מֵעֲרֹעֵ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־עַל־נַ֣חַל אַרְנֹ֗ן וַחֲצִ֤י הַֽר־הַגִּלְעָד֙ וְעָרָ֔יו נָתַ֕תִּי לָרֻֽאוּבֵנִ֖י וְלַגָּדִֽי׃
transliteration: v'et-haaretz hazot yarash'nv ba'et hahiv me'aro'er asher-'al-nachal ar'non vachatziy har-hagil'ad v'arayv natatiy laruvveniy v'lagadiy
translation: dVv. 12–13 proceed from south to north; vv. 14–16 from north to south.And this is the land which we apportioned at that time: The part from Aroer along the wadi Arnon, with part of the hill country of Gilead and its towns, I assigned to the Reubenites and the Gadites.

hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר הַגִּלְעָ֤ד וְכָל־הַבָּשָׁן֙ מַמְלֶ֣כֶת ע֔וֹג נָתַ֕תִּי לַחֲצִ֖י שֵׁ֣בֶט הַֽמְנַשֶּׁ֑ה כֹּ֣ל חֶ֤בֶל הָֽאַרְגֹּב֙ לְכָל־הַבָּשָׁ֔ן הַה֥וּא יִקָּרֵ֖א אֶ֥רֶץ רְפָאִֽים׃
transliteration: v'yeter hagil'ad v'khal-habashan mam'lekhet 'vog natatiy lachatziy shevet ham'nasheh kol chevel haar'gov l'khal-habashan hahv yikare eretz r'faiym
translation: The rest of Gilead, and all of Bashan under Og’s rule—the whole Argob district, all that part of Bashan which is called Rephaim country—I assigned to the half-tribe of Manasseh.

hebrew: יָאִ֣יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה לָקַח֙ אֶת־כָּל־חֶ֣בֶל אַרְגֹּ֔ב עַד־גְּב֥וּל הַגְּשׁוּרִ֖י וְהַמַּֽעֲכָתִ֑י וַיִּקְרָא֩ אֹתָ֨ם עַל־שְׁמ֤וֹ אֶת־הַבָּשָׁן֙ חַוֺּ֣ת יָאִ֔יר עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: yaiyr ben-m'nasheh lakach et-kal-chevel ar'gov 'ad-g'vvl hag'shvriy v'hama'akhatiy vayik'ra otam 'al-sh'mvo et-habashan chavot yaiyr 'ad hayvom hazeh
translation: Jair son of Manasseh received the whole Argob district (that is, Bashan) as far as the boundary of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and named it after himself: Havvoth-jaireI.e., “villages of Jair.”—as is still the case.

hebrew: וּלְמָכִ֖יר נָתַ֥תִּי אֶת־הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
transliteration: vl'makhiyr natatiy et-hagil'ad
translation: To Machir I assigned Gilead.

hebrew: וְלָרֻאוּבֵנִ֨י וְלַגָּדִ֜י נָתַ֤תִּי מִן־הַגִּלְעָד֙ וְעַד־נַ֣חַל אַרְנֹ֔ן תּ֥וֹךְ הַנַּ֖חַל וּגְבֻ֑ל וְעַד֙ יַבֹּ֣ק הַנַּ֔חַל גְּב֖וּל בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
transliteration: v'laruvveniy v'lagadiy natatiy min-hagil'ad v'ad-nachal ar'non tvokh' hanachal vg'vul v'ad yabok hanachal g'vvl b'ney 'amvon
translation: And to the Reubenites and the Gadites I assigned the part from Gilead down to the wadi Arnon, the middle of the wadi being the boundary, and up to the wadi Jabbok, the boundary of the Ammonites.

hebrew: וְהָֽעֲרָבָ֖ה וְהַיַּרְדֵּ֣ן וּגְבֻ֑ל מִכִּנֶּ֗רֶת וְעַ֨ד יָ֤ם הָֽעֲרָבָה֙ יָ֣ם הַמֶּ֔לַח תַּ֛חַת אַשְׁדֹּ֥ת הַפִּסְגָּ֖ה מִזְרָֽחָה׃
transliteration: v'ha'aravah v'hayar'den vg'vul mikineret v'ad yam ha'aravah yam hamelach tachat ash'dot hapis'gah miz'rachah
translation: fContinuing vv. 8–10; cf. 4.47–49. [We also seized] the Arabah, from the foot of the slopes of Pisgah on the east, to the edge of the Jordan, and from Chinnereth down to the sea of the Arabah, the Dead Sea.

hebrew: וָאֲצַ֣ו אֶתְכֶ֔ם בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖וא לֵאמֹ֑ר יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֗ם נָתַ֨ן לָכֶ֜ם אֶת־הָאָ֤רֶץ הַזֹּאת֙ לְרִשְׁתָּ֔הּ חֲלוּצִ֣ים תַּֽעַבְר֗וּ לִפְנֵ֛י אֲחֵיכֶ֥ם בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כָּל־בְּנֵי־חָֽיִל׃
transliteration: vaatzav et'khem ba'et hahiv lemor y'hvah eloheykhem natan lakhem et-haaretz hazot l'rish'tah chalvtziym ta'av'rv lif'ney acheykhem b'ney-yis'rael kal-b'ney-chayil
translation: At that time I charged you,gI.e., the two and a half tribes. saying, “The LORD your God has given you this country to possess. You must go as shock-troops, warriors all, at the head of your Israelite kinsmen.

hebrew: רַ֠ק נְשֵׁיכֶ֣ם וְטַפְּכֶם֮ וּמִקְנֵכֶם֒ יָדַ֕עְתִּי כִּֽי־מִקְנֶ֥ה רַ֖ב לָכֶ֑ם יֵֽשְׁבוּ֙ בְּעָ֣רֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: rak n'sheykhem v'tap'khem vmik'nekhem yada'tiy kiy-mik'neh rav lakhem yesh'vv b'areykhem asher natatiy lakhem
translation: Only your wives, children, and livestock—I know that you have much livestock—shall be left in the towns I have assigned to you,

hebrew: עַ֠ד אֲשֶׁר־יָנִ֨יחַ יְהוָ֥ה ׀ לַֽאֲחֵיכֶם֮ כָּכֶם֒ וְיָרְשׁ֣וּ גַם־הֵ֔ם אֶת־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֛ם נֹתֵ֥ן לָהֶ֖ם בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וְשַׁבְתֶּ֗ם אִ֚ישׁ לִֽירֻשָּׁת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: 'ad asher-yaniycha y'hvah  laacheykhem kakhem v'yar'shv gam-hem et-haaretz asher y'hvah eloheykhem noten lahem b'ever hayar'den v'shav'tem iysh liyrushatvo asher natatiy lakhem
translation: until the L<small>ORD</small> has granted your kinsmen a haven such as you have, and they too have taken possession of the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is assigning them, beyond the Jordan. Then you may return each to the homestead that I have assigned to him.”

hebrew: וְאֶת־יְהוֹשׁ֣וּעַ צִוֵּ֔יתִי בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖וא לֵאמֹ֑ר עֵינֶ֣יךָ הָרֹאֹ֗ת אֵת֩ כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֜ה יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶם֙ לִשְׁנֵי֙ הַמְּלָכִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה כֵּֽן־יַעֲשֶׂ֤ה יְהוָה֙ לְכָל־הַמַּמְלָכ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֖ה עֹבֵ֥ר שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: v'et-y'hvoshv'a tziveytiy ba'et hahiv lemor 'eyneykha haroot et kal-asher 'asah y'hvah eloheykhem lish'ney ham'lakhiym haeleh ken-ya'aseh y'hvah l'khal-hamam'lakhvot asher atah 'over shamah
translation: I also charged Joshua at that time, saying, “You have seen with your own eyes all that the L<small>ORD</small> your God has done to these two kings; so shall the L<small>ORD</small> do to all the kingdoms into which you shall cross over.

hebrew: לֹ֖א תְִּירָא֑וּם כִּ֚י יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם ה֖וּא הַנִּלְחָ֥ם לָכֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo tiyravm kiy y'hvah eloheykhem hv hanil'cham lakhem (s)
translation: Do not fear them, for it is the L<small>ORD</small> your God who will battle for you.”

hebrew: וָאֶתְחַנַּ֖ן אֶל־יְהוָ֑ה בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖וא לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vaet'chanan el-y'hvah ba'et hahiv lemor
translation: I pleaded with the L<small>ORD</small> at that time, saying,

hebrew: אֲדֹנָ֣י יְהוִ֗ה אַתָּ֤ה הַֽחִלּ֙וֹתָ֙ לְהַרְא֣וֹת אֶֽת־עַבְדְּךָ֔ אֶ֨ת־גָּדְלְךָ֔ וְאֶת־יָדְךָ֖ הַחֲזָקָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר מִי־אֵל֙ בַּשָּׁמַ֣יִם וּבָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה כְמַעֲשֶׂ֖יךָ וְכִגְבוּרֹתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: adonay y'hvih atah hachilvota l'har'vot et-'av'd'kha et-gad'l'kha v'et-yad'kha hachazakah asher miy-el bashamayim vvaaretz asher-ya'aseh kh'ma'aseykha v'khig'vvrotekha
translation: “O Lord G<small>OD</small>, You who let Your servant see the first works of Your greatness and Your mighty hand, You whose powerful deeds no god in heaven or on earth can equal!

hebrew: אֶעְבְּרָה־נָּ֗א וְאֶרְאֶה֙ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן הָהָ֥ר הַטּ֛וֹב הַזֶּ֖ה וְהַלְּבָנֽוֹן׃
transliteration: e'b'rah-na v'er'eh et-haaretz hatvovah asher b'ever hayar'den hahar hatvov hazeh v'hal'vanvon
translation: Let me, I pray, cross over and see the good land on the other side of the Jordan, that good hill country, and the Lebanon.”

hebrew: וַיִּתְעַבֵּ֨ר יְהוָ֥ה בִּי֙ לְמַ֣עַנְכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖ע אֵלָ֑י וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֤ה אֵלַי֙ רַב־לָ֔ךְ אַל־תּ֗וֹסֶף דַּבֵּ֥ר אֵלַ֛י ע֖וֹד בַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayit'aber y'hvah biy l'ma'an'khem v'lo shama' elay vayomer y'hvah elay rav-lakh' al-tvosef daber elay 'vod badavar hazeh
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> was wrathful with me on your account and would not listen to me. The L<small>ORD</small> said to me, “Enough! Never speak to Me of this matter again!

hebrew: עֲלֵ֣ה ׀ רֹ֣אשׁ הַפִּסְגָּ֗ה וְשָׂ֥א עֵינֶ֛יךָ יָ֧מָּה וְצָפֹ֛נָה וְתֵימָ֥נָה וּמִזְרָ֖חָה וּרְאֵ֣ה בְעֵינֶ֑יךָ כִּי־לֹ֥א תַעֲבֹ֖ר אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֥ן הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: 'aleh  rosh hapis'gah v'sa 'eyneykha yamah v'tzafonah v'teymanah vmiz'rachah vr'eh v'eyneykha kiy-lo ta'avor et-hayar'den hazeh
translation: Go up to the summit of Pisgah and gaze about, to the west, the north, the south, and the east. Look at it well, for you shall not go across yonder Jordan.

hebrew: וְצַ֥ו אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ וְחַזְּקֵ֣הוּ וְאַמְּצֵ֑הוּ כִּי־ה֣וּא יַעֲבֹ֗ר לִפְנֵי֙ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְהוּא֙ יַנְחִ֣יל אוֹתָ֔ם אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּרְאֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'tzav et-y'hvoshu'a v'chaz'kehv v'am'tzehv kiy-hv ya'avor lif'ney ha'am hazeh v'hv yan'chiyl votam et-haaretz asher tir'eh
translation: Give Joshua his instructions, and imbue him with strength and courage, for he shall go across at the head of this people, and he shall allot to them the land that you may only see.”

hebrew: וַנֵּ֣שֶׁב בַּגָּ֔יְא מ֖וּל בֵּ֥ית פְּעֽוֹר׃ (פ)
transliteration: vaneshev bagay' mvl beyt p'vor (f)
translation: Meanwhile we stayed on in the valley near Beth-peor.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל שְׁמַ֤ע אֶל־הַֽחֻקִּים֙ וְאֶל־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָֽנֹכִ֛י מְלַמֵּ֥ד אֶתְכֶ֖ם לַעֲשׂ֑וֹת לְמַ֣עַן תִּֽחְי֗וּ וּבָאתֶם֙ וִֽירִשְׁתֶּ֣ם אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֖ם נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'atah yis'rael sh'ma' el-hachukiym v'el-hamish'patiym asher anokhiy m'lamed et'khem la'asvot l'ma'an tich'yv vvatem viyrish'tem et-haaretz asher y'hvah elohey avoteykhem noten lakhem
translation: And now, O Israel, give heed to the laws and rules that I am instructing you to observe, so that you may live to enter and occupy the land that the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of your fathers, is giving you.

hebrew: לֹ֣א תֹסִ֗פוּ עַל־הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אָנֹכִי֙ מְצַוֶּ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תִגְרְע֖וּ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ לִשְׁמֹ֗ר אֶת־מִצְוֺת֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: lo tosifv 'al-hadavar asher anokhiy m'tzaveh et'khem v'lo tig'r'v mimenv lish'mor et-mitz'vot y'hvah eloheykhem asher anokhiy m'tzaveh et'khem
translation: You shall not add anything to what I command you or take anything away from it, but keep the commandments of the L<small>ORD</small> your God that I enjoin upon you.

hebrew: עֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ הָֽרֹאֹ֔ת אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה בְּבַ֣עַל פְּע֑וֹר כִּ֣י כָל־הָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הָלַךְ֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י בַֽעַל־פְּע֔וֹר הִשְׁמִיד֛וֹ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: 'eyneykhem haroot et asher-'asah y'hvah b'va'al p'vor kiy khal-haiysh asher halakh' acharey va'al-p'vor hish'miydvo y'hvah eloheykha mikir'bekha
translation: You saw with your own eyes what the L<small>ORD</small> did in the matter of Baal-peor, that the L<small>ORD</small> your God wiped out from among you every person who followed Baal-peor;

hebrew: וְאַתֶּם֙ הַדְּבֵקִ֔ים בַּיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם חַיִּ֥ים כֻּלְּכֶ֖ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: v'atem had'vekiym bayhvah eloheykhem chayiym kul'khem hayvom
translation: while you, who held fast to the L<small>ORD</small> your God, are all alive today.

hebrew: רְאֵ֣ה ׀ לִמַּ֣דְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֗ם חֻקִּים֙ וּמִשְׁפָּטִ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוַּ֖נִי יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑י לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת כֵּ֔ן בְּקֶ֣רֶב הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֛ם בָּאִ֥ים שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: r'eh  limad'tiy et'khem chukiym vmish'patiym kaasher tzivaniy y'hvah elohay la'asvot ken b'kerev haaretz asher atem baiym shamah l'rish'tah
translation: See, I have imparted to you laws and rules, as the L<small>ORD</small> my God has commanded me, for you to abide by in the land that you are about to enter and occupy.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֮ וַעֲשִׂיתֶם֒ כִּ֣י הִ֤וא חָכְמַתְכֶם֙ וּבִ֣ינַתְכֶ֔ם לְעֵינֵ֖י הָעַמִּ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִשְׁמְע֗וּן אֵ֚ת כָּל־הַחֻקִּ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וְאָמְר֗וּ רַ֚ק עַם־חָכָ֣ם וְנָב֔וֹן הַגּ֥וֹי הַגָּד֖וֹל הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem va'asiytem kiy hiv chakh'mat'khem vviynat'khem l'eyney ha'amiym asher yish'm'vn et kal-hachukiym haeleh v'am'rv rak 'am-chakham v'navvon hagvoy hagadvol hazeh
translation: Observe them faithfully, for that will be proof of your wisdom and discernment to other peoples, who on hearing of all these laws will say, “Surely, that great nation is a wise and discerning people.”

hebrew: כִּ֚י מִי־ג֣וֹי גָּד֔וֹל אֲשֶׁר־ל֥וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים קְרֹבִ֣ים אֵלָ֑יו כַּיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ בְּכָּל־קָרְאֵ֖נוּ אֵלָֽיו׃
transliteration: kiy miy-gvoy gadvol asher-lvo elohiym k'roviym elayv kayhvah eloheynv b'kal-kar'env elayv
translation: For what great nation is there that has a god so close at hand as is the L<small>ORD</small> our God whenever we call upon Him?

hebrew: וּמִי֙ גּ֣וֹי גָּד֔וֹל אֲשֶׁר־ל֛וֹ חֻקִּ֥ים וּמִשְׁפָּטִ֖ים צַדִּיקִ֑ם כְּכֹל֙ הַתּוֹרָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י נֹתֵ֥ן לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vmiy gvoy gadvol asher-lvo chukiym vmish'patiym tzadiykim k'khol hatvorah hazot asher anokhiy noten lif'neykhem hayvom
translation: Or what great nation has laws and rules as perfect as all this Teaching that I set before you this day?

hebrew: רַ֡ק הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֩ וּשְׁמֹ֨ר נַפְשְׁךָ֜ מְאֹ֗ד פֶּן־תִּשְׁכַּ֨ח אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֜ים אֲשֶׁר־רָא֣וּ עֵינֶ֗יךָ וּפֶן־יָס֙וּרוּ֙ מִלְּבָ֣בְךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י חַיֶּ֑יךָ וְהוֹדַעְתָּ֥ם לְבָנֶ֖יךָ וְלִבְנֵ֥י בָנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: rak hishamer l'kha vsh'mor naf'sh'kha m'od pen-tish'kach et-had'variym asher-rav 'eyneykha vfen-yasvrv mil'vav'kha kol y'mey chayeykha v'hvoda'tam l'vaneykha v'liv'ney vaneykha
translation: But take utmost care and watch yourselves scrupulously, so that you do not forget the things that you saw with your own eyes and so that they do not fade from your mind as long as you live. And make them known to your children and to your children’s children:

hebrew: י֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָמַ֜דְתָּ לִפְנֵ֨י יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶיךָ֮ בְּחֹרֵב֒ בֶּאֱמֹ֨ר יְהוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י הַקְהֶל־לִי֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וְאַשְׁמִעֵ֖ם אֶת־דְּבָרָ֑י אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִלְמְד֜וּן לְיִרְאָ֣ה אֹתִ֗י כָּל־הַיָּמִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵ֤ם חַיִּים֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה וְאֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֖ם יְלַמֵּדֽוּן׃
transliteration: yvom asher 'amad'ta lif'ney y'hvah eloheykha b'chorev beemor y'hvah elay hak'hel-liy et-ha'am v'ash'mi'em et-d'varay asher yil'm'dvn l'yir'ah otiy kal-hayamiym asher hem chayiym 'al-haadamah v'et-b'neyhem y'lamedvn
translation: The day you stood before the L<small>ORD</small> your God at Horeb, when the L<small>ORD</small> said to me, “Gather the people to Me that I may let them hear My words, in order that they may learn to revere Me as long as they live on earth, and may so teach their children.”

hebrew: וַתִּקְרְב֥וּן וַתַּֽעַמְד֖וּן תַּ֣חַת הָהָ֑ר וְהָהָ֞ר בֹּעֵ֤ר בָּאֵשׁ֙ עַד־לֵ֣ב הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם חֹ֖שֶׁךְ עָנָ֥ן וַעֲרָפֶֽל׃
transliteration: vatik'r'vvn vata'am'dvn tachat hahar v'hahar bo'er baesh 'ad-lev hashamayim choshekh' 'anan va'arafel
translation: You came forward and stood at the foot of the mountain. The mountain was ablaze with flames to the very skies, dark with densest clouds.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם מִתּ֣וֹךְ הָאֵ֑שׁ ק֤וֹל דְּבָרִים֙ אַתֶּ֣ם שֹׁמְעִ֔ים וּתְמוּנָ֛ה אֵינְכֶ֥ם רֹאִ֖ים זוּלָתִ֥י קֽוֹל׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah aleykhem mitvokh' haesh kvol d'variym atem shom'iym vt'mvnah eyn'khem roiym zvlatiy kvol
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to you out of the fire; you heard the sound of words but perceived no shape—nothing but a voice.

hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֨ד לָכֶ֜ם אֶת־בְּרִית֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֤ה אֶתְכֶם֙ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת עֲשֶׂ֖רֶת הַדְּבָרִ֑ים וַֽיִּכְתְּבֵ֔ם עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י לֻח֥וֹת אֲבָנִֽים׃
transliteration: vayaged lakhem et-b'riytvo asher tzivah et'khem la'asvot 'aseret had'variym vayikh't'vem 'al-sh'ney luchvot avaniym
translation: He declared to you the covenant that He commanded you to observe, the Ten Commandments; and He inscribed them on two tablets of stone.

hebrew: וְאֹתִ֞י צִוָּ֤ה יְהוָה֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא לְלַמֵּ֣ד אֶתְכֶ֔ם חֻקִּ֖ים וּמִשְׁפָּטִ֑ים לַעֲשֹׂתְכֶ֣ם אֹתָ֔ם בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֛ם עֹבְרִ֥ים שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'otiy tzivah y'hvah ba'et hahiv l'lamed et'khem chukiym vmish'patiym la'asot'khem otam baaretz asher atem 'ov'riym shamah l'rish'tah
translation: At the same time the L<small>ORD</small> commanded me to impart to you laws and rules for you to observe in the land that you are about to cross into and occupy.

hebrew: וְנִשְׁמַרְתֶּ֥ם מְאֹ֖ד לְנַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֣י לֹ֤א רְאִיתֶם֙ כָּל־תְּמוּנָ֔ה בְּי֗וֹם דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהוָ֧ה אֲלֵיכֶ֛ם בְּחֹרֵ֖ב מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֵֽשׁ׃
transliteration: v'nish'mar'tem m'od l'naf'shoteykhem kiy lo r'iytem kal-t'mvnah b'yvom diber y'hvah aleykhem b'chorev mitvokh' haesh
translation: For your own sake, therefore, be most careful—since you saw no shape when the L<small>ORD</small> your God spoke to you at Horeb out of the fire—

hebrew: פֶּ֨ן־תַּשְׁחִת֔וּן וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֥ם לָכֶ֛ם פֶּ֖סֶל תְּמוּנַ֣ת כָּל־סָ֑מֶל תַּבְנִ֥ית זָכָ֖ר א֥וֹ נְקֵבָֽה׃
transliteration: pen-tash'chitvn va'asiytem lakhem pesel t'mvnat kal-samel tav'niyt zakhar vo n'kevah
translation: not to act wickedly and make for yourselves a sculptured image in any likeness whatever: the form of a man or a woman,

hebrew: תַּבְנִ֕ית כָּל־בְּהֵמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּאָ֑רֶץ תַּבְנִית֙ כָּל־צִפּ֣וֹר כָּנָ֔ף אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּע֖וּף בַּשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: tav'niyt kal-b'hemah asher baaretz tav'niyt kal-tzipvor kanaf asher ta'vf bashamayim
translation: the form of any beast on earth, the form of any winged bird that flies in the sky,

hebrew: תַּבְנִ֕ית כָּל־רֹמֵ֖שׂ בָּאֲדָמָ֑ה תַּבְנִ֛ית כָּל־דָּגָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־בַּמַּ֖יִם מִתַּ֥חַת לָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: tav'niyt kal-romes baadamah tav'niyt kal-dagah asher-bamayim mitachat laaretz
translation: the form of anything that creeps on the ground, the form of any fish that is in the waters below the earth.—

hebrew: וּפֶן־תִּשָּׂ֨א עֵינֶ֜יךָ הַשָּׁמַ֗יְמָה וְֽ֠רָאִיתָ אֶת־הַשֶּׁ֨מֶשׁ וְאֶת־הַיָּרֵ֜חַ וְאֶת־הַכּֽוֹכָבִ֗ים כֹּ֚ל צְבָ֣א הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְנִדַּחְתָּ֛ וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִ֥יתָ לָהֶ֖ם וַעֲבַדְתָּ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר חָלַ֜ק יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֹתָ֔ם לְכֹל֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים תַּ֖חַת כָּל־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vfen-tisa 'eyneykha hashamay'mah v'raiyta et-hashemesh v'et-hayarecha v'et-hakvokhaviym kol tz'va hashamayim v'nidach'ta v'hish'tachaviyta lahem va'avad'tam asher chalak y'hvah eloheykha otam l'khol ha'amiym tachat kal-hashamayim
translation: And when you look up to the sky and behold the sun and the moon and the stars, the whole heavenly host, you must not be lured into bowing down to them or serving them. These the L<small>ORD</small> your God allotted to other peoples everywhere under heaven;

hebrew: וְאֶתְכֶם֙ לָקַ֣ח יְהוָ֔ה וַיּוֹצִ֥א אֶתְכֶ֛ם מִכּ֥וּר הַבַּרְזֶ֖ל מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם לִהְי֥וֹת ל֛וֹ לְעַ֥ם נַחֲלָ֖ה כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: v'et'khem lakach y'hvah vayvotzi et'khem mikvr habar'zel mimitz'rayim lih'yvot lvo l'am nachalah kayvom hazeh
translation: but you the L<small>ORD</small> took and brought out of Egypt, that iron blast furnace, to be His very own people, as is now the case.

hebrew: וַֽיהוָ֥ה הִתְאַנֶּף־בִּ֖י עַל־דִּבְרֵיכֶ֑ם וַיִּשָּׁבַ֗ע לְבִלְתִּ֤י עָבְרִי֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וּלְבִלְתִּי־בֹא֙ אֶל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ נַחֲלָֽה׃
transliteration: vayhvah hit'anef-biy 'al-div'reykhem vayishava' l'vil'tiy 'av'riy et-hayar'den vl'vil'tiy-vo el-haaretz hatvovah asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha nachalah
translation: Now the L<small>ORD</small> was angry with me on your account and swore that I should not cross the Jordan and enter the good land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is assigning you as a heritage.

hebrew: כִּ֣י אָנֹכִ֥י מֵת֙ בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את אֵינֶ֥נִּי עֹבֵ֖ר אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וְאַתֶּם֙ עֹֽבְרִ֔ים וִֽירִשְׁתֶּ֕ם אֶת־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַטּוֹבָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
transliteration: kiy anokhiy met baaretz hazot eyneniy 'over et-hayar'den v'atem 'ov'riym viyrish'tem et-haaretz hatvovah hazot
translation: For I must die in this land; I shall not cross the Jordan. But you will cross and take possession of that good land.

hebrew: הִשָּׁמְר֣וּ לָכֶ֗ם פֶּֽן־תִּשְׁכְּחוּ֙ אֶת־בְּרִ֤ית יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּרַ֖ת עִמָּכֶ֑ם וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֨ם לָכֶ֥ם פֶּ֙סֶל֙ תְּמ֣וּנַת כֹּ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוְּךָ֖ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: hisham'rv lakhem pen-tish'k'chv et-b'riyt y'hvah eloheykhem asher karat 'imakhem va'asiytem lakhem pesel t'mvnat kol asher tziv'kha y'hvah eloheykha
translation: Take care, then, not to forget the covenant that the L<small>ORD</small> your God concluded with you, and not to make for yourselves a sculptured image in any likeness, against which the L<small>ORD</small> your God has enjoined you.

hebrew: כִּ֚י יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֵ֥שׁ אֹכְלָ֖ה ה֑וּא אֵ֖ל קַנָּֽא׃ (פ)
transliteration: kiy y'hvah eloheykha esh okh'lah hv el kana (f)
translation: For the L<small>ORD</small> your God is a consuming fire, an impassioned God.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תוֹלִ֤יד בָּנִים֙ וּבְנֵ֣י בָנִ֔ים וְנוֹשַׁנְתֶּ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְהִשְׁחַתֶּ֗ם וַעֲשִׂ֤יתֶם פֶּ֙סֶל֙ תְּמ֣וּנַת כֹּ֔ל וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֥ם הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהוָֽה־אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לְהַכְעִיסֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kiy-tvoliyd baniym vv'ney vaniym v'nvoshan'tem baaretz v'hish'chatem va'asiytem pesel t'mvnat kol va'asiytem hara' b'eyney y'hvah-eloheykha l'hakh'iysvo
translation: When you have begotten children and children’s children and are long established in the land, should you act wickedly and make for yourselves a sculptured image in any likeness, causing the L<small>ORD</small> your God displeasure and vexation,

hebrew: הַעִידֹתִי֩ בָכֶ֨ם הַיּ֜וֹם אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם וְאֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ כִּֽי־אָבֹ֣ד תֹּאבֵדוּן֮ מַהֵר֒ מֵעַ֣ל הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֜ם עֹבְרִ֧ים אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֛ן שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּ֑הּ לֹֽא־תַאֲרִיכֻ֤ן יָמִים֙ עָלֶ֔יהָ כִּ֥י הִשָּׁמֵ֖ד תִּשָּׁמֵדֽוּן׃
transliteration: ha'iydotiy vakhem hayvom et-hashamayim v'et-haaretz kiy-avod tovedvn maher me'al haaretz asher atem 'ov'riym et-hayar'den shamah l'rish'tah lo-taariykhun yamiym 'aleyha kiy hishamed tishamedvn
translation: I call heaven and earth this day to witness against you that you shall soon perish from the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess; you shall not long endure in it, but shall be utterly wiped out.

hebrew: וְהֵפִ֧יץ יְהוָ֛ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם בָּעַמִּ֑ים וְנִשְׁאַרְתֶּם֙ מְתֵ֣י מִסְפָּ֔ר בַּגּוֹיִ֕ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְנַהֵ֧ג יְהוָ֛ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: v'hefiytz y'hvah et'khem ba'amiym v'nish'ar'tem m'tey mis'par bagvoyim asher y'naheg y'hvah et'khem shamah
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will scatter you among the peoples, and only a scant few of you shall be left among the nations to which the L<small>ORD</small> will drive you.

hebrew: וַעֲבַדְתֶּם־שָׁ֣ם אֱלֹהִ֔ים מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יְדֵ֣י אָדָ֑ם עֵ֣ץ וָאֶ֔בֶן אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יִרְאוּן֙ וְלֹ֣א יִשְׁמְע֔וּן וְלֹ֥א יֹֽאכְל֖וּן וְלֹ֥א יְרִיחֻֽן׃
transliteration: va'avad'tem-sham elohiym ma'aseh y'dey adam 'etz vaeven asher lo-yir'vn v'lo yish'm'vn v'lo yokh'lvn v'lo y'riychun
translation: There you will serve man-made gods of wood and stone, that cannot see or hear or eat or smell.

hebrew: וּבִקַּשְׁתֶּ֥ם מִשָּׁ֛ם אֶת־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ וּמָצָ֑אתָ כִּ֣י תִדְרְשֶׁ֔נּוּ בְּכָל־לְבָבְךָ֖ וּבְכָל־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
transliteration: vvikash'tem misham et-y'hvah eloheykha vmatzata kiy tid'r'shenv b'khal-l'vav'kha vv'khal-naf'shekha
translation: But if you search there for the L<small>ORD</small> your God, you will find Him, if only you seek Him with all your heart and soul—

hebrew: בַּצַּ֣ר לְךָ֔ וּמְצָא֕וּךָ כֹּ֖ל הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה בְּאַחֲרִית֙ הַיָּמִ֔ים וְשַׁבְתָּ֙ עַד־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֖ בְּקֹלֽוֹ׃
transliteration: batzar l'kha vm'tzavkha kol had'variym haeleh b'achariyt hayamiym v'shav'ta 'ad-y'hvah eloheykha v'shama'ta b'kolvo
translation: when you are in distress because all these things have befallen you and, in the end, return to the L<small>ORD</small> your God and obey Him.

hebrew: כִּ֣י אֵ֤ל רַחוּם֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לֹ֥א יַרְפְּךָ֖ וְלֹ֣א יַשְׁחִיתֶ֑ךָ וְלֹ֤א יִשְׁכַּח֙ אֶת־בְּרִ֣ית אֲבֹתֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖ע לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: kiy el rachvm y'hvah eloheykha lo yar'p'kha v'lo yash'chiytekha v'lo yish'kach et-b'riyt avoteykha asher nish'ba' lahem
translation: For the L<small>ORD</small> your God is a compassionate God: He will not fail you nor will He let you perish; He will not forget the covenant which He made on oath with your fathers.

hebrew: כִּ֣י שְׁאַל־נָא֩ לְיָמִ֨ים רִֽאשֹׁנִ֜ים אֲשֶׁר־הָי֣וּ לְפָנֶ֗יךָ לְמִן־הַיּוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁר֩ בָּרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ אָדָם֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וּלְמִקְצֵ֥ה הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וְעַד־קְצֵ֣ה הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם הֲנִֽהְיָ֗ה כַּדָּבָ֤ר הַגָּדוֹל֙ הַזֶּ֔ה א֖וֹ הֲנִשְׁמַ֥ע כָּמֹֽהוּ׃
transliteration: kiy sh'al-na l'yamiym rishoniym asher-hayv l'faneykha l'min-hayvom asher bara elohiym  adam 'al-haaretz vl'mik'tzeh hashamayim v'ad-k'tzeh hashamayim hanih'yah kadavar hagadvol hazeh vo hanish'ma' kamohv
translation: You have but to inquire about bygone ages that came before you, ever since God created man on earth, from one end of heaven to the other: has anything as grand as this ever happened, or has its like ever been known?

hebrew: הֲשָׁ֣מַֽע עָם֩ ק֨וֹל אֱלֹהִ֜ים מְדַבֵּ֧ר מִתּוֹךְ־הָאֵ֛שׁ כַּאֲשֶׁר־שָׁמַ֥עְתָּ אַתָּ֖ה וַיֶּֽחִי׃
transliteration: hashama' 'am kvol elohiym m'daber mitvokh'-haesh kaasher-shama'ta atah vayechiy
translation: Has any people heard the voice of a god speaking out of a fire, as you have, and survived?

hebrew: א֣וֹ ׀ הֲנִסָּ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֗ים לָ֠בוֹא לָקַ֨חַת ל֣וֹ גוֹי֮ מִקֶּ֣רֶב גּוֹי֒ בְּמַסֹּת֩ בְּאֹתֹ֨ת וּבְמוֹפְתִ֜ים וּבְמִלְחָמָ֗ה וּבְיָ֤ד חֲזָקָה֙ וּבִזְר֣וֹעַ נְטוּיָ֔ה וּבְמוֹרָאִ֖ים גְּדֹלִ֑ים כְּ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֨ה לָכֶ֜ם יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֛ם בְּמִצְרַ֖יִם לְעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vo  hanisah elohiym lavvo lakachat lvo gvoy mikerev gvoy b'masot b'otot vv'mvof'tiym vv'mil'chamah vv'yad chazakah vviz'rvo'a n'tvyah vv'mvoraiym g'doliym k'khol asher-'asah lakhem y'hvah eloheykhem b'mitz'rayim l'eyneykha
translation: Or has any god ventured to go and take for himself one nation from the midst of another by prodigious acts, by signs and portents, by war, by a mighty and an outstretched arm and awesome power, as the L<small>ORD</small> your God did for you in Egypt before your very eyes?

hebrew: אַתָּה֙ הָרְאֵ֣תָ לָדַ֔עַת כִּ֥י יְהוָ֖ה ה֣וּא הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים אֵ֥ין ע֖וֹד מִלְבַדּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: atah har'eta lada'at kiy y'hvah hv haelohiym eyn 'vod mil'vadvo
translation: aLit. “You have been shown to know.”It has been clearly demonstrated to you-a that the LORD alone is God; there is none beside Him.

hebrew: מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם הִשְׁמִֽיעֲךָ֥ אֶת־קֹל֖וֹ לְיַסְּרֶ֑ךָּ וְעַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ הֶרְאֲךָ֙ אֶת־אִשּׁ֣וֹ הַגְּדוֹלָ֔ה וּדְבָרָ֥יו שָׁמַ֖עְתָּ מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֵֽשׁ׃
transliteration: min-hashamayim hish'miy'akha et-kolvo l'yas'reka v'al-haaretz her'akha et-ishvo hag'dvolah vd'varayv shama'ta mitvokh' haesh
translation: From the heavens He let you hear His voice to discipline you; on earth He let you see His great fire; and from amidst that fire you heard His words.

hebrew: וְתַ֗חַת כִּ֤י אָהַב֙ אֶת־אֲבֹתֶ֔יךָ וַיִּבְחַ֥ר בְּזַרְע֖וֹ אַחֲרָ֑יו וַיּוֹצִֽאֲךָ֧ בְּפָנָ֛יו בְּכֹח֥וֹ הַגָּדֹ֖ל מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'tachat kiy ahav et-avoteykha vayiv'char b'zar'vo acharayv vayvotziakha b'fanayv b'khochvo hagadol mimitz'rayim
translation: And because He loved your fathers, He chose their heirs after them; He Himself,bLit. “With His face (or Presence)”; cf. note at Exod. 33.14. in His great might, led you out of Egypt,

hebrew: לְהוֹרִ֗ישׁ גּוֹיִ֛ם גְּדֹלִ֧ים וַעֲצֻמִ֛ים מִמְּךָ֖ מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ לַהֲבִֽיאֲךָ֗ לָֽתֶת־לְךָ֧ אֶת־אַרְצָ֛ם נַחֲלָ֖ה כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: l'hvoriysh gvoyim g'doliym va'atzumiym mim'kha mipaneykha lahaviyakha latet-l'kha et-ar'tzam nachalah kayvom hazeh
translation: to drive from your path nations greater and more populous than you, to take you into their land and assign it to you as a heritage, as is still the case.

hebrew: וְיָדַעְתָּ֣ הַיּ֗וֹם וַהֲשֵׁבֹתָ֮ אֶל־לְבָבֶךָ֒ כִּ֤י יְהוָה֙ ה֣וּא הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים בַּשָּׁמַ֣יִם מִמַּ֔עַל וְעַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ מִתָּ֑חַת אֵ֖ין עֽוֹד׃
transliteration: v'yada'ta hayvom vahashevota el-l'vavekha kiy y'hvah hv haelohiym bashamayim mima'al v'al-haaretz mitachat eyn 'vod
translation: Know therefore this day and keep in mind that the L<small>ORD</small> alone is God in heaven above and on earth below; there is no other.

hebrew: וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֞ אֶת־חֻקָּ֣יו וְאֶת־מִצְוֺתָ֗יו אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֤י מְצַוְּךָ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם אֲשֶׁר֙ יִיטַ֣ב לְךָ֔ וּלְבָנֶ֖יךָ אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ וּלְמַ֨עַן תַּאֲרִ֤יךְ יָמִים֙ עַל־הַ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ כָּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'shamar'ta et-chukayv v'et-mitz'votayv asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom asher yiytav l'kha vl'vaneykha achareykha vl'ma'an taariykh' yamiym 'al-haadamah asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha kal-hayamiym (f)
translation: Observe His laws and commandments, which I enjoin upon you this day, that it may go well with you and your children after you, and that you may long remain in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is assigning to you for all time.

hebrew: אָ֣ז יַבְדִּ֤יל מֹשֶׁה֙ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ עָרִ֔ים בְּעֵ֖בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן מִזְרְחָ֖ה שָֽׁמֶשׁ׃
transliteration: az yav'diyl mosheh shalosh 'ariym b'ever hayar'den miz'r'chah shamesh
translation: Then Moses set aside three cities on the east side of the Jordan

hebrew: לָנֻ֨ס שָׁ֜מָּה רוֹצֵ֗חַ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִרְצַ֤ח אֶת־רֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ בִּבְלִי־דַ֔עַת וְה֛וּא לֹא־שֹׂנֵ֥א ל֖וֹ מִתְּמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשׁ֑וֹם וְנָ֗ס אֶל־אַחַ֛ת מִן־הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖ל וָחָֽי׃
transliteration: lanus shamah rvotzecha asher yir'tzach et-re'ehv biv'liy-da'at v'hv lo-sone lvo mit'mvol shil'shvom v'nas el-achat min-he'ariym hael vachay
translation: to which a manslayer could escape, one who unwittingly slew a fellow man without having been his enemy in the past; he could flee to one of these cities and live:

hebrew: אֶת־בֶּ֧צֶר בַּמִּדְבָּ֛ר בְּאֶ֥רֶץ הַמִּישֹׁ֖ר לָרֻֽאוּבֵנִ֑י וְאֶת־רָאמֹ֤ת בַּגִּלְעָד֙ לַגָּדִ֔י וְאֶת־גּוֹלָ֥ן בַּבָּשָׁ֖ן לַֽמְנַשִּֽׁי׃
transliteration: et-betzer bamid'bar b'eretz hamiyshor laruvveniy v'et-ramot bagil'ad lagadiy v'et-gvolan babashan lam'nashiy
translation: Bezer, in the wilderness in the Tableland, belonging to the Reubenites; Ramoth, in Gilead, belonging to the Gadites; and Golan, in Bashan, belonging to the Manassites.

hebrew: וְזֹ֖את הַתּוֹרָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣ם מֹשֶׁ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'zot hatvorah asher-sam mosheh lif'ney b'ney yis'rael
translation: This is the Teaching that Moses set before the Israelites:

hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה הָֽעֵדֹ֔ת וְהַֽחֻקִּ֖ים וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּצֵאתָ֖ם מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: eleh ha'edot v'hachukiym v'hamish'patiym asher diber mosheh el-b'ney yis'rael b'tzetam mimitz'rayim
translation: these are the decrees, laws, and rules that Moses addressed to the people of Israel, after they had left Egypt,

hebrew: בְּעֵ֨בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֜ן בַּגַּ֗יְא מ֚וּל בֵּ֣ית פְּע֔וֹר בְּאֶ֗רֶץ סִיחֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּחֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִכָּ֤ה מֹשֶׁה֙ וּבְנֵֽי יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּצֵאתָ֖ם מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: b'ever hayar'den bagay' mvl beyt p'vor b'eretz siychon melekh' haemoriy asher yvoshev b'chesh'bvon asher hikah mosheh vv'ney yis'rael b'tzetam mimitz'rayim
translation: beyond the Jordan, in the valley at Beth-peor, in the land of King Sihon of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, whom Moses and the Israelites defeated after they had left Egypt.

hebrew: וַיִּֽירְשׁ֨וּ אֶת־אַרְצ֜וֹ וְאֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ ׀ ע֣וֹג מֶֽלֶךְ־הַבָּשָׁ֗ן שְׁנֵי֙ מַלְכֵ֣י הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן מִזְרַ֖ח שָֽׁמֶשׁ׃
transliteration: vayiyr'shv et-ar'tzvo v'et-eretz  'vog melekh'-habashan sh'ney mal'khey haemoriy asher b'ever hayar'den miz'rach shamesh
translation: They had taken possession of his country and that of King Og of Bashan—the two kings of the Amorites—which were on the east side of the Jordan

hebrew: מֵעֲרֹעֵ֞ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר עַל־שְׂפַת־נַ֧חַל אַרְנֹ֛ן וְעַד־הַ֥ר שִׂיאֹ֖ן ה֥וּא חֶרְמֽוֹן׃
transliteration: me'aro'er asher 'al-s'fat-nachal ar'non v'ad-har siyon hv cher'mvon
translation: from Aroer on the banks of the wadi Arnon, as far as Mount Sion,cCf. “Sirion,” 3.9. that is, Hermon;

hebrew: וְכָל־הָ֨עֲרָבָ֜ה עֵ֤בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ מִזְרָ֔חָה וְעַ֖ד יָ֣ם הָעֲרָבָ֑ה תַּ֖חַת אַשְׁדֹּ֥ת הַפִּסְגָּֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'khal-ha'aravah 'ever hayar'den miz'rachah v'ad yam ha'aravah tachat ash'dot hapis'gah (f)
translation: also the whole Arabah on the east side of the Jordan, as far as the Sea of the Arabah, at the foot of the slopes of Pisgah.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א מֹשֶׁה֮ אֶל־כָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם שְׁמַ֤ע יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־הַחֻקִּ֣ים וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י דֹּבֵ֥ר בְּאָזְנֵיכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם וּלְמַדְתֶּ֣ם אֹתָ֔ם וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם לַעֲשֹׂתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayik'ra mosheh el-kal-yis'rael vayomer alehem sh'ma' yis'rael et-hachukiym v'et-hamish'patiym asher anokhiy dover b'az'neykhem hayvom vl'mad'tem otam vsh'mar'tem la'asotam
translation: Moses summoned all the Israelites and said to them: Hear, O Israel, the laws and rules that I proclaim to you this day! Study them and observe them faithfully!

hebrew: יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ כָּרַ֥ת עִמָּ֛נוּ בְּרִ֖ית בְּחֹרֵֽב׃
transliteration: y'hvah eloheynv karat 'imanv b'riyt b'chorev
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> our God made a covenant with us at Horeb.

hebrew: לֹ֣א אֶת־אֲבֹתֵ֔ינוּ כָּרַ֥ת יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־הַבְּרִ֣ית הַזֹּ֑את כִּ֣י אִתָּ֗נוּ אֲנַ֨חְנוּ אֵ֥לֶּה פֹ֛ה הַיּ֖וֹם כֻּלָּ֥נוּ חַיִּֽים׃
transliteration: lo et-avoteynv karat y'hvah et-hab'riyt hazot kiy itanv anach'nv eleh foh hayvom kulanv chayiym
translation: It was not with our fathers that the L<small>ORD</small> made this covenant, but with us, the living, every one of us who is here today.

hebrew: פָּנִ֣ים ׀ בְּפָנִ֗ים דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהוָ֧ה עִמָּכֶ֛ם בָּהָ֖ר מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֵֽשׁ׃
transliteration: paniym  b'faniym diber y'hvah 'imakhem bahar mitvokh' haesh
translation: Face to face the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to you on the mountain out of the fire—

hebrew: אָ֠נֹכִי עֹמֵ֨ד בֵּין־יְהוָ֤ה וּבֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא לְהַגִּ֥יד לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר יְהוָ֑ה כִּ֤י יְרֵאתֶם֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י הָאֵ֔שׁ וְלֹֽא־עֲלִיתֶ֥ם בָּהָ֖ר לֵאמֹֽר׃ (ס)
transliteration: anokhiy 'omed beyn-y'hvah vveyneykhem ba'et hahiv l'hagiyd lakhem et-d'var y'hvah kiy y'retem mip'ney haesh v'lo-'aliytem bahar lemor (s)
translation: I stood between the L<small>ORD</small> and you at that time to convey the L<small>ORD</small>’s words to you, for you were afraid of the fire and did not go up the mountain—saying:

hebrew: אָֽנֹכִי֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֧ר הוֹצֵאתִ֛יךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֣֥ית עֲבָדִֽ֑ים׃
transliteration: anokhiy y'hvah eloheykha asher hvotzetiykha meeretz mitz'rayim mibeyt 'avadiym
translation: aTradition varies as to the divisions of the Commandments in vv. 6–18 and the numbering of the verses. Cf. Exod. 20, note a.I the LORD am your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, the house of bondage:

hebrew: לֹ֣א יִהְיֶ֥ה־לְךָ֛֩ אֱלֹהִ֥֨ים אֲחֵרִ֖֜ים עַל־פָּנָֽ֗יַ׃
transliteration: lo yih'yeh-l'kha elohiym acheriym 'al-panaya
translation: You shall have no other gods beside Me.

transliteration: lo-ta'aseh-l'kha fesel  kal-t'mvnah asher bashamayim  mima'al vaasher baaretz mitachat vaasher bamayim  mitachat laaretz
translation: You shall not make for yourself a sculptured image, any likeness of what is in the heavens above, or on the earth below, or in the waters below the earth.

hebrew: לֹא־תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֥֣ה לָהֶ֖ם֮ וְלֹ֣א תָעָבְדֵ֑ם֒ כִּ֣י אָנֹכִ֞י יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֵ֣ל קַנָּ֔א פֹּ֠קֵד עֲוֺ֨ן אָב֧וֹת עַל־בָּנִ֛ים וְעַל־שִׁלֵּשִׁ֥ים וְעַל־רִבֵּעִ֖ים לְשֹׂנְאָֽ֑י׃
transliteration: lo-tish'tachaveh lahem v'lo ta'av'dem kiy anokhiy y'hvah eloheykha el kana poked 'avon avvot 'al-baniym v'al-shileshiym v'al-ribe'iym l'son'ay
translation: You shall not bow down to them or serve them. For I the L<small>ORD</small> your God am an impassioned God, visiting the guilt of the parents upon the children, upon the third and upon the fourth generations of those who reject Me,

hebrew: וְעֹ֤֥שֶׂה חֶ֖֙סֶד֙ לַֽאֲלָפִ֑֔ים לְאֹהֲבַ֖י וּלְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י מצותו [מִצְוֺתָֽי׃] (ס)
transliteration: v'oseh chesed laalafiym l'ohavay vl'shom'rey mtzvtv [mitz'votay] (s)
translation: but showing kindness to the thousandth generation of those who love Me and keep My commandments.

hebrew: לֹ֥א תִשָּׂ֛א אֶת־שֵֽׁם־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לַשָּׁ֑וְא כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יְנַקֶּה֙ יְהוָ֔ה אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־יִשָּׂ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ לַשָּֽׁוְא׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo tisa et-shem-y'hvah eloheykha lashav' kiy lo y'nakeh y'hvah et asher-yisa et-sh'mvo lashav' (s)
translation: You shall not swear falsely by the name of the L<small>ORD</small> your God; for the L<small>ORD</small> will not clear one who swears falsely by His name.

hebrew: שָׁמ֣֛וֹר אֶת־י֥וֹם֩ הַשַׁבָּ֖֨ת לְקַדְּשׁ֑֜וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוְּךָ֖֣ ׀ יְהוָ֥֣ה אֱלֹהֶֽ֗יךָ
transliteration: shamvor et-yvom hashabat l'kad'shvo kaasher tziv'kha  y'hvah eloheykha
translation: Observe the sabbath day and keep it holy, as the L<small>ORD</small> your God has commanded you.

transliteration: sheshet yamiym ta'avod v'asiyta kal-m'lakh'tekha
translation: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,

hebrew: וְי֙וֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֜֔י שַׁבָּ֖֣ת ׀ לַיהוָ֖֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑֗יךָ לֹ֣א תַעֲשֶׂ֣ה כָל־מְלָאכָ֡ה אַתָּ֣ה וּבִנְךָֽ־וּבִתֶּ֣ךָ וְעַבְדְּךָֽ־וַ֠אֲמָתֶךָ וְשׁוֹרְךָ֨ וַחֲמֹֽרְךָ֜ וְכָל־בְּהֶמְתֶּ֗ךָ וְגֵֽרְךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּשְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ לְמַ֗עַן יָנ֛וּחַ עַבְדְּךָ֥ וַאֲמָתְךָ֖ כָּמֽ֑וֹךָ׃
transliteration: v'yvom hash'viy'iy shabat  layhvah eloheykha lo ta'aseh khal-m'lakhah atah vvin'kha-vvitekha v'av'd'kha-vaamatekha v'shvor'kha vachamor'kha v'khal-b'hem'tekha v'ger'kha asher bish'areykha l'ma'an yanvcha 'av'd'kha vaamat'kha kamvokha
translation: but the seventh day is a sabbath of the L<small>ORD</small> your God; you shall not do any work—you, your son or your daughter, your male or female slave, your ox or your ass, or any of your cattle, or the stranger in your settlements, so that your male and female slave may rest as you do.

hebrew: וְזָכַרְתָּ֞֗ כִּ֣י־עֶ֤֥בֶד הָיִ֣֙יתָ֙ ׀ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔֗יִם וַיֹּצִ֨אֲךָ֜֩ יְהוָ֤֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֤֙יךָ֙ מִשָּׁ֔ם֙ בְּיָ֤֥ד חֲזָקָ֖ה֙ וּבִזְרֹ֣עַ נְטוּיָ֑֔ה עַל־כֵּ֗ן צִוְּךָ֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת אֶת־י֥וֹם הַשַׁבָּֽת׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'zakhar'ta kiy-'eved hayiyta  b'eretz mitz'rayim vayotziakha y'hvah eloheykha misham b'yad chazakah vviz'ro'a n'tvyah 'al-ken tziv'kha y'hvah eloheykha la'asvot et-yvom hashabat (s)
translation: Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt and the L<small>ORD</small> your God freed you from there with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm; therefore the L<small>ORD</small> your God has commanded you to observe the sabbath day.

hebrew: כַּבֵּ֤ד אֶת־אָבִ֙יךָ֙ וְאֶת־אִמֶּ֔ךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוְּךָ֖ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לְמַ֣עַן ׀ יַאֲרִיכֻ֣ן יָמֶ֗יךָ וּלְמַ֙עַן֙ יִ֣יטַב לָ֔ךְ עַ֚ל הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kabed et-aviykha v'et-imekha kaasher tziv'kha y'hvah eloheykha l'ma'an  yaariykhun yameykha vl'ma'an yiytav lakh' 'al haadamah asher-y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh' (s)
translation: Honor your father and your mother, as the L<small>ORD</small> your God has commanded you, that you may long endure, and that you may fare well, in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is assigning to you.

transliteration: lo tir'tzach (s) v'lo tin'af (s) v'lo tig'nov (s) v'lo-ta'aneh v're'akha 'ed shav' (s)
translation:
You shall not murder.
You shall not commit adultery.
You shall not steal.
You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.

hebrew: וְלֹ֥א תַחְמֹ֖ד אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֶ֑ךָ (ס) וְלֹ֨א תִתְאַוֶּ֜ה בֵּ֣ית רֵעֶ֗ךָ שָׂדֵ֜הוּ וְעַבְדּ֤וֹ וַאֲמָתוֹ֙ שׁוֹר֣וֹ וַחֲמֹר֔וֹ וְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְרֵעֶֽךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'lo tach'mod eshet re'ekha (s) v'lo tit'aveh beyt re'ekha sadehv v'av'dvo vaamatvo shvorvo vachamorvo v'khol asher l're'ekha (s)
translation: You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife. You shall not crave your neighbor’s house, or his field, or his male or female slave, or his ox, or his ass, or anything that is your neighbor’s.

hebrew: אֶֽת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֡לֶּה דִּבֶּר֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֶל־כָּל־קְהַלְכֶ֜ם בָּהָ֗ר מִתּ֤וֹךְ הָאֵשׁ֙ הֶֽעָנָ֣ן וְהָֽעֲרָפֶ֔ל ק֥וֹל גָּד֖וֹל וְלֹ֣א יָסָ֑ף וַֽיִּכְתְּבֵ֗ם עַל־שְׁנֵי֙ לֻחֹ֣ת אֲבָנִ֔ים וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃
transliteration: et-had'variym haeleh diber y'hvah el-kal-k'hal'khem bahar mitvokh' haesh he'anan v'ha'arafel kvol gadvol v'lo yasaf vayikh't'vem 'al-sh'ney luchot avaniym vayit'nem elay
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke those words—those and no more—to your whole congregation at the mountain, with a mighty voice out of the fire and the dense clouds. He inscribed them on two tablets of stone, which He gave to me.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּשָׁמְעֲכֶ֤ם אֶת־הַקּוֹל֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַחֹ֔שֶׁךְ וְהָהָ֖ר בֹּעֵ֣ר בָּאֵ֑שׁ וַתִּקְרְב֣וּן אֵלַ֔י כָּל־רָאשֵׁ֥י שִׁבְטֵיכֶ֖ם וְזִקְנֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy k'sham'akhem et-hakvol mitvokh' hachoshekh' v'hahar bo'er baesh vatik'r'vvn elay kal-rashey shiv'teykhem v'zik'neykhem
translation: When you heard the voice out of the darkness, while the mountain was ablaze with fire, you came up to me, all your tribal heads and elders,

hebrew: וַתֹּאמְר֗וּ הֵ֣ן הֶרְאָ֜נוּ יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ אֶת־כְּבֹד֣וֹ וְאֶת־גָּדְל֔וֹ וְאֶת־קֹל֥וֹ שָׁמַ֖עְנוּ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הָאֵ֑שׁ הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ רָאִ֔ינוּ כִּֽי־יְדַבֵּ֧ר אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֖ם וָחָֽי׃
transliteration: vatom'rv hen her'anv y'hvah eloheynv et-k'vodvo v'et-gad'lvo v'et-kolvo shama'nv mitvokh' haesh hayvom hazeh raiynv kiy-y'daber elohiym et-haadam vachay
translation: and said, “The L<small>ORD</small> our God has just shown us His majestic Presence, and we have heard His voice out of the fire; we have seen this day that man may live though God has spoken to him.

hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ לָ֣מָּה נָמ֔וּת כִּ֣י תֹֽאכְלֵ֔נוּ הָאֵ֥שׁ הַגְּדֹלָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את אִם־יֹסְפִ֣ים ׀ אֲנַ֗חְנוּ לִ֠שְׁמֹעַ אֶת־ק֨וֹל יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵ֛ינוּ ע֖וֹד וָמָֽתְנוּ׃
transliteration: v'atah lamah namvt kiy tokh'lenv haesh hag'dolah hazot im-yos'fiym  anach'nv lish'mo'a et-kvol y'hvah eloheynv 'vod vamat'nv
translation: Let us not die, then, for this fearsome fire will consume us; if we hear the voice of the L<small>ORD</small> our God any longer, we shall die.

hebrew: כִּ֣י מִ֣י כָל־בָּשָׂ֡ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁמַ֣ע קוֹל֩ אֱלֹהִ֨ים חַיִּ֜ים מְדַבֵּ֧ר מִתּוֹךְ־הָאֵ֛שׁ כָּמֹ֖נוּ וַיֶּֽחִי׃
transliteration: kiy miy khal-basar asher shama' kvol elohiym chayiym m'daber mitvokh'-haesh kamonv vayechiy
translation: For what mortal ever heard the voice of the living God speak out of the fire, as we did, and lived?

hebrew: קְרַ֤ב אַתָּה֙ וּֽשֲׁמָ֔ע אֵ֛ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֹאמַ֖ר יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְאַ֣תְּ ׀ תְּדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלֵ֗ינוּ אֵת֩ כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְדַבֵּ֜ר יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵ֛ינוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ וְשָׁמַ֥עְנוּ וְעָשִֽׂינוּ׃
transliteration: k'rav atah vshama' et kal-asher yomar y'hvah eloheynv v'at'  t'daber eleynv et kal-asher y'daber y'hvah eloheynv eleykha v'shama'nv v'asiynv
translation: You go closer and hear all that the L<small>ORD</small> our God says, and then you tell us everything that the L<small>ORD</small> our God tells you, and we will willingly do it.”

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע יְהוָה֙ אֶת־ק֣וֹל דִּבְרֵיכֶ֔ם בְּדַבֶּרְכֶ֖ם אֵלָ֑י וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י שָׁ֠מַעְתִּי אֶת־ק֨וֹל דִּבְרֵ֜י הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבְּר֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ הֵיטִ֖יבוּ כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽרוּ׃
transliteration: vayish'ma' y'hvah et-kvol div'reykhem b'daber'khem elay vayomer y'hvah elay shama'tiy et-kvol div'rey ha'am hazeh asher dib'rv eleykha heytiyvv kal-asher diberv
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> heard the plea that you made to me, and the L<small>ORD</small> said to me, “I have heard the plea that this people made to you; they did well to speak thus.

hebrew: מִֽי־יִתֵּ֡ן וְהָיָה֩ לְבָבָ֨ם זֶ֜ה לָהֶ֗ם לְיִרְאָ֥ה אֹתִ֛י וְלִשְׁמֹ֥ר אֶת־כָּל־מִצְוֺתַ֖י כָּל־הַיָּמִ֑ים לְמַ֨עַן יִיטַ֥ב לָהֶ֛ם וְלִבְנֵיהֶ֖ם לְעֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: miy-yiten v'hayah l'vavam zeh lahem l'yir'ah otiy v'lish'mor et-kal-mitz'votay kal-hayamiym l'ma'an yiytav lahem v'liv'neyhem l'olam
translation: May they always be of such mind, to revere Me and follow all My commandments, that it may go well with them and with their children forever!

hebrew: לֵ֖ךְ אֱמֹ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם שׁ֥וּבוּ לָכֶ֖ם לְאָהֳלֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: lekh' emor lahem shvvv lakhem l'aholeykhem
translation: Go, say to them, ‘Return to your tents.’

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֗ה פֹּה֮ עֲמֹ֣ד עִמָּדִי֒ וַאֲדַבְּרָ֣ה אֵלֶ֗יךָ אֵ֧ת כָּל־הַמִּצְוָ֛ה וְהַחֻקִּ֥ים וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר תְּלַמְּדֵ֑ם וְעָשׂ֣וּ בָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י נֹתֵ֥ן לָהֶ֖ם לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'atah poh 'amod 'imadiy vaadab'rah eleykha et kal-hamitz'vah v'hachukiym v'hamish'patiym asher t'lam'dem v'asv vaaretz asher anokhiy noten lahem l'rish'tah
translation: But you remain here with Me, and I will give you the whole Instruction—the laws and the rules—that you shall impart to them, for them to observe in the land that I am giving them to possess.”

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֣ם לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֛ה יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם אֶתְכֶ֑ם לֹ֥א תָסֻ֖רוּ יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹֽאל׃
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem la'asvot kaasher tzivah y'hvah eloheykhem et'khem lo tasurv yamiyn vs'mol
translation: Be careful, then, to do as the L<small>ORD</small> your God has commanded you. Do not turn aside to the right or to the left:

hebrew: בְּכָל־הַדֶּ֗רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֜ה יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֛ם אֶתְכֶ֖ם תֵּלֵ֑כוּ לְמַ֤עַן תִּֽחְיוּן֙ וְט֣וֹב לָכֶ֔ם וְהַאֲרַכְתֶּ֣ם יָמִ֔ים בָּאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּֽירָשֽׁוּן׃
transliteration: b'khal-haderekh' asher tzivah y'hvah eloheykhem et'khem telekhv l'ma'an tich'yvn v'tvov lakhem v'haarakh'tem yamiym baaretz asher tiyrashvn
translation: follow only the path that the L<small>ORD</small> your God has enjoined upon you, so that you may thrive and that it may go well with you, and that you may long endure in the land you are to possess.

hebrew: וְזֹ֣את הַמִּצְוָ֗ה הַֽחֻקִּים֙ וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֛ה יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם לְלַמֵּ֣ד אֶתְכֶ֑ם לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת בָּאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֛ם עֹבְרִ֥ים שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'zot hamitz'vah hachukiym v'hamish'patiym asher tzivah y'hvah eloheykhem l'lamed et'khem la'asvot baaretz asher atem 'ov'riym shamah l'rish'tah
translation: And this is the Instruction—the laws and the rules—that the L<small>ORD</small> your God has commanded [me] to impart to you, to be observed in the land that you are about to cross into and occupy,

hebrew: לְמַ֨עַן תִּירָ֜א אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ לִ֠שְׁמֹר אֶת־כָּל־חֻקֹּתָ֣יו וּמִצְוֺתָיו֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָנֹכִ֣י מְצַוֶּךָ֒ אַתָּה֙ וּבִנְךָ֣ וּבֶן־בִּנְךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י חַיֶּ֑יךָ וּלְמַ֖עַן יַאֲרִכֻ֥ן יָמֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: l'ma'an tiyra et-y'hvah eloheykha lish'mor et-kal-chukotayv vmitz'votayv asher anokhiy m'tzavekha atah vvin'kha vven-bin'kha kol y'mey chayeykha vl'ma'an yaarikhun yameykha
translation: so that you, your children, and your children’s children may revere the L<small>ORD</small> your God and follow, as long as you live, all His laws and commandments that I enjoin upon you, to the end that you may long endure.

hebrew: וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֤ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֣ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר֙ יִיטַ֣ב לְךָ֔ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּרְבּ֖וּן מְאֹ֑ד כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י אֲבֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ לָ֔ךְ אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'shama'ta yis'rael v'shamar'ta la'asvot asher yiytav l'kha vaasher tir'bvn m'od kaasher diber y'hvah elohey avoteykha lakh' eretz zavat chalav vd'vash (f)
translation: Obey, O Israel, willingly and faithfully, that it may go well with you and that you may increase greatly [in] aAccording to Ibn Ezra this phrase connects with the end of v. 1.a land flowing with milk and honey,-a as the LORD, the God of your fathers, spoke to you.

hebrew: שְׁמַ֖ע יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ יְהוָ֥ה ׀ אֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: sh'ma' yis'rael y'hvah eloheynv y'hvah  echad
translation: Hear, O Israel! The LORD is our God, the LORD alone.bCf. Rashbam and Ibn Ezra; see Zech. 14.9. Others “The Lord our God, the Lord is one.”

hebrew: וְאָ֣הַבְתָּ֔ אֵ֖ת יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ בְּכָל־לְבָבְךָ֥ וּבְכָל־נַפְשְׁךָ֖ וּבְכָל־מְאֹדֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'ahav'ta et y'hvah eloheykha b'khal-l'vav'kha vv'khal-naf'sh'kha vv'khal-m'odekha
translation: You shall love the L<small>ORD</small> your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might.

hebrew: וְהָי֞וּ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֧י מְצַוְּךָ֛ הַיּ֖וֹם עַל־לְבָבֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'hayv had'variym haeleh asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom 'al-l'vavekha
translation: Take to heart these instructions with which I charge you this day.

hebrew: וְשִׁנַּנְתָּ֣ם לְבָנֶ֔יךָ וְדִבַּרְתָּ֖ בָּ֑ם בְּשִׁבְתְּךָ֤ בְּבֵיתֶ֙ךָ֙ וּבְלֶכְתְּךָ֣ בַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וּֽבְשָׁכְבְּךָ֖ וּבְקוּמֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'shinan'tam l'vaneykha v'dibar'ta bam b'shiv't'kha b'veytekha vv'lekh't'kha vaderekh' vv'shakh'b'kha vv'kvmekha
translation: Impress them upon your children. Recite them when you stay at home and when you are away, when you lie down and when you get up.

hebrew: וּקְשַׁרְתָּ֥ם לְא֖וֹת עַל־יָדֶ֑ךָ וְהָי֥וּ לְטֹטָפֹ֖ת בֵּ֥ין עֵינֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vk'shar'tam l'vot 'al-yadekha v'hayv l'totafot beyn 'eyneykha
translation: Bind them as a sign on your hand and let them serve as a symbolcOthers “frontlet”; cf. Exod. 13.16. on your forehead;dLit. “between your eyes”; cf. Exod. 13.9.

hebrew: וּכְתַבְתָּ֛ם עַל־מְזוּזֹ֥ת בֵּיתֶ֖ךָ וּבִשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vkh'tav'tam 'al-m'zvzot beytekha vvish'areykha (s)
translation: inscribe them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּ֥י יְבִיאֲךָ֣ ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ אֶל־הָאָ֜רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֧ע לַאֲבֹתֶ֛יךָ לְאַבְרָהָ֛ם לְיִצְחָ֥ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹ֖ב לָ֣תֶת לָ֑ךְ עָרִ֛ים גְּדֹלֹ֥ת וְטֹבֹ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־בָנִֽיתָ׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy y'viyakha  y'hvah eloheykha el-haaretz asher nish'ba' laavoteykha l'av'raham l'yitz'chak vl'ya'akov latet lakh' 'ariym g'dolot v'tovot asher lo-vaniyta
translation: When the L<small>ORD</small> your God brings you into the land that He swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to assign to you—great and flourishing cities that you did not build,

hebrew: וּבָ֨תִּ֜ים מְלֵאִ֣ים כָּל־טוּב֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־מִלֵּאתָ֒ וּבֹרֹ֤ת חֲצוּבִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־חָצַ֔בְתָּ כְּרָמִ֥ים וְזֵיתִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־נָטָ֑עְתָּ וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ וְשָׂבָֽעְתָּ׃
transliteration: vvatiym m'leiym kal-tvv asher lo-mileta vvorot chatzvviym asher lo-chatzav'ta k'ramiym v'zeytiym asher lo-nata'ta v'akhal'ta v'sava'ta
translation: houses full of all good things that you did not fill, hewn cisterns that you did not hew, vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant—and you eat your fill,

hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֔ פֶּן־תִּשְׁכַּ֖ח אֶת־יְהוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר הוֹצִֽיאֲךָ֛ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים׃
transliteration: hishamer l'kha pen-tish'kach et-y'hvah asher hvotziyakha meeretz mitz'rayim mibeyt 'avadiym
translation: take heed that you do not forget the L<small>ORD</small> who freed you from the land of Egypt, the house of bondage.

hebrew: אֶת־יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ תִּירָ֖א וְאֹת֣וֹ תַעֲבֹ֑ד וּבִשְׁמ֖וֹ תִּשָּׁבֵֽעַ׃
transliteration: et-y'hvah eloheykha tiyra v'otvo ta'avod vvish'mvo tishave'a
translation: Revere only the L<small>ORD</small> your God and worship Him alone, and swear only by His name.

hebrew: לֹ֣א תֵֽלְכ֔וּן אַחֲרֵ֖י אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים מֵאֱלֹהֵי֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר סְבִיבוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: lo tel'khvn acharey elohiym acheriym meelohey ha'amiym asher s'viyvvoteykhem
translation: Do not follow other gods, any gods of the peoples about you—

hebrew: כִּ֣י אֵ֥ל קַנָּ֛א יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בְּקִרְבֶּ֑ךָ פֶּן־יֶ֠חֱרֶה אַף־יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ בָּ֔ךְ וְהִשְׁמִ֣ידְךָ֔ מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy el kana y'hvah eloheykha b'kir'bekha pen-yechereh af-y'hvah eloheykha bakh' v'hish'miyd'kha me'al p'ney haadamah (s)
translation: for the L<small>ORD</small> your God in your midst is an impassioned God—lest the anger of the L<small>ORD</small> your God blaze forth against you and He wipe you off the face of the earth.

hebrew: לֹ֣א תְנַסּ֔וּ אֶת־יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר נִסִּיתֶ֖ם בַּמַּסָּֽה׃
transliteration: lo t'nasv et-y'hvah eloheykhem kaasher nisiytem bamasah
translation: Do not try the LORD your God, as you did at Massah.eCf. Exod. 17.1–7.

hebrew: שָׁמ֣וֹר תִּשְׁמְר֔וּן אֶת־מִצְוֺ֖ת יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם וְעֵדֹתָ֥יו וְחֻקָּ֖יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: shamvor tish'm'rvn et-mitz'vot y'hvah eloheykhem v'edotayv v'chukayv asher tzivakh'
translation: Be sure to keep the commandments, decrees, and laws that the L<small>ORD</small> your God has enjoined upon you.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֛יתָ הַיָּשָׁ֥ר וְהַטּ֖וֹב בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה לְמַ֙עַן֙ יִ֣יטַב לָ֔ךְ וּבָ֗אתָ וְיָֽרַשְׁתָּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַטֹּבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥ע יְהוָ֖ה לַאֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'asiyta hayashar v'hatvov b'eyney y'hvah l'ma'an yiytav lakh' vvata v'yarash'ta et-haaretz hatovah asher-nish'ba' y'hvah laavoteykha
translation: Do what is right and good in the sight of the L<small>ORD</small>, that it may go well with you and that you may be able to possess the good land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God promised on oath to your fathers,

hebrew: לַהֲדֹ֥ף אֶת־כָּל־אֹיְבֶ֖יךָ מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: lahadof et-kal-oy'veykha mipaneykha kaasher diber y'hvah (s)
translation: and that all your enemies may be driven out before you, as the L<small>ORD</small> has spoken.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִשְׁאָלְךָ֥ בִנְךָ֛ מָחָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֑ר מָ֣ה הָעֵדֹ֗ת וְהַֽחֻקִּים֙ וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֛ה יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: kiy-yish'al'kha vin'kha machar lemor mah ha'edot v'hachukiym v'hamish'patiym asher tzivah y'hvah eloheynv et'khem
translation: When, in time to come, your children ask you, “What mean the decrees, laws, and rules that the LORD our God has enjoined upon you?”fSeptuagint and rabbinic quotations read “us.”

hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ לְבִנְךָ֔ עֲבָדִ֛ים הָיִ֥ינוּ לְפַרְעֹ֖ה בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וַיּוֹצִיאֵ֧נוּ יְהוָ֛ה מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם בְּיָ֥ד חֲזָקָֽה׃
transliteration: v'amar'ta l'vin'kha 'avadiym hayiynv l'far'oh b'mitz'rayim vayvotziyenv y'hvah mimitz'rayim b'yad chazakah
translation: you shall say to your children, “We were slaves to Pharaoh in Egypt and the L<small>ORD</small> freed us from Egypt with a mighty hand.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן יְהוָ֡ה אוֹתֹ֣ת וּ֠מֹפְתִים גְּדֹלִ֨ים וְרָעִ֧ים ׀ בְּמִצְרַ֛יִם בְּפַרְעֹ֥ה וּבְכָל־בֵּית֖וֹ לְעֵינֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: vayiten y'hvah votot vmof'tiym g'doliym v'ra'iym  b'mitz'rayim b'far'oh vv'khal-beytvo l'eyneynv
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> wrought before our eyes marvelous and destructive signs and portents in Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his household;

hebrew: וְאוֹתָ֖נוּ הוֹצִ֣יא מִשָּׁ֑ם לְמַ֙עַן֙ הָבִ֣יא אֹתָ֔נוּ לָ֤תֶת לָ֙נוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖ע לַאֲבֹתֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: v'votanv hvotziy misham l'ma'an haviy otanv latet lanv et-haaretz asher nish'ba' laavoteynv
translation: and us He freed from there, that He might take us and give us the land that He had promised on oath to our fathers.

hebrew: וַיְצַוֵּ֣נוּ יְהוָ֗ה לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כָּל־הַחֻקִּ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה לְיִרְאָ֖ה אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ לְט֥וֹב לָ֙נוּ֙ כָּל־הַיָּמִ֔ים לְחַיֹּתֵ֖נוּ כְּהַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vay'tzavenv y'hvah la'asvot et-kal-hachukiym haeleh l'yir'ah et-y'hvah eloheynv l'tvov lanv kal-hayamiym l'chayotenv k'hayvom hazeh
translation: Then the L<small>ORD</small> commanded us to observe all these laws, to revere the L<small>ORD</small> our God, for our lasting good and for our survival, as is now the case.

hebrew: וּצְדָקָ֖ה תִּֽהְיֶה־לָּ֑נוּ כִּֽי־נִשְׁמֹ֨ר לַעֲשׂ֜וֹת אֶת־כָּל־הַמִּצְוָ֣ה הַזֹּ֗את לִפְנֵ֛י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽנוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vtz'dakah tih'yeh-lanv kiy-nish'mor la'asvot et-kal-hamitz'vah hazot lif'ney y'hvah eloheynv kaasher tzivanv (s)
translation: It will be therefore to our merit before the L<small>ORD</small> our God to observe faithfully this whole Instruction, as He has commanded us.”

hebrew: כִּ֤י יְבִֽיאֲךָ֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּ֑הּ וְנָשַׁ֣ל גּֽוֹיִם־רַבִּ֣ים ׀ מִפָּנֶ֡יךָ הַֽחִתִּי֩ וְהַגִּרְגָּשִׁ֨י וְהָאֱמֹרִ֜י וְהַכְּנַעֲנִ֣י וְהַפְּרִזִּ֗י וְהַֽחִוִּי֙ וְהַיְבוּסִ֔י שִׁבְעָ֣ה גוֹיִ֔ם רַבִּ֥ים וַעֲצוּמִ֖ים מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
transliteration: kiy y'viyakha y'hvah eloheykha el-haaretz asher-atah va-shamah l'rish'tah v'nashal gvoyim-rabiym  mipaneykha hachitiy v'hagir'gashiy v'haemoriy v'hak'na'aniy v'hap'riziy v'hachiviy v'hay'vvsiy shiv'ah gvoyim rabiym va'atzvmiym mimeka
translation: When the L<small>ORD</small> your God brings you to the land that you are about to enter and possess, and He dislodges many nations before you—the Hittites, Girgashites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, seven nations much larger than you—

hebrew: וּנְתָנָ֞ם יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ לְפָנֶ֖יךָ וְהִכִּיתָ֑ם הַחֲרֵ֤ם תַּחֲרִים֙ אֹתָ֔ם לֹא־תִכְרֹ֥ת לָהֶ֛ם בְּרִ֖ית וְלֹ֥א תְחָנֵּֽם׃
transliteration: vn'tanam y'hvah eloheykha l'faneykha v'hikiytam hacharem tachariym otam lo-tikh'rot lahem b'riyt v'lo t'chanem
translation: and the L<small>ORD</small> your God delivers them to you and you defeat them, you must doom them to destruction: grant them no terms and give them no quarter.

hebrew: וְלֹ֥א תִתְחַתֵּ֖ן בָּ֑ם בִּתְּךָ֙ לֹא־תִתֵּ֣ן לִבְנ֔וֹ וּבִתּ֖וֹ לֹא־תִקַּ֥ח לִבְנֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'lo tit'chaten bam bit'kha lo-titen liv'nvo vvitvo lo-tikach liv'nekha
translation: You shall not intermarry with them: do not give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יָסִ֤יר אֶת־בִּנְךָ֙ מֵֽאַחֲרַ֔י וְעָבְד֖וּ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וְחָרָ֤ה אַף־יְהוָה֙ בָּכֶ֔ם וְהִשְׁמִידְךָ֖ מַהֵֽר׃
transliteration: kiy-yasiyr et-bin'kha meacharay v'av'dv elohiym acheriym v'charah af-y'hvah bakhem v'hish'miyd'kha maher
translation: For they will turn your children away from Me to worship other gods, and the L<small>ORD</small>’s anger will blaze forth against you and He will promptly wipe you out.

hebrew: כִּֽי־אִם־כֹּ֤ה תַעֲשׂוּ֙ לָהֶ֔ם מִזְבְּחֹתֵיהֶ֣ם תִּתֹּ֔צוּ וּמַצֵּבֹתָ֖ם תְּשַׁבֵּ֑רוּ וַאֲשֵֽׁירֵהֶם֙ תְּגַדֵּע֔וּן וּפְסִילֵיהֶ֖ם תִּשְׂרְפ֥וּן בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
transliteration: kiy-im-koh ta'asv lahem miz'b'choteyhem titotzv vmatzevotam t'shaberv vaasheyrehem t'gade'vn vf'siyleyhem tis'r'fvn baesh
translation: Instead, this is what you shall do to them: you shall tear down their altars, smash their pillars, cut down their sacred posts, and consign their images to the fire.

hebrew: כִּ֣י עַ֤ם קָדוֹשׁ֙ אַתָּ֔ה לַיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ בְּךָ֞ בָּחַ֣ר ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ לִהְי֥וֹת לוֹ֙ לְעַ֣ם סְגֻלָּ֔ה מִכֹּל֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy 'am kadvosh atah layhvah eloheykha b'kha bachar  y'hvah eloheykha lih'yvot lvo l'am s'gulah mikol ha'amiym asher 'al-p'ney haadamah (s)
translation: For you are a people consecrated to the L<small>ORD</small> your God: of all the peoples on earth the L<small>ORD</small> your God chose you to be His treasured people.

hebrew: לֹ֣א מֵֽרֻבְּכֶ֞ם מִכָּל־הָֽעַמִּ֗ים חָשַׁ֧ק יְהוָ֛ה בָּכֶ֖ם וַיִּבְחַ֣ר בָּכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־אַתֶּ֥ם הַמְעַ֖ט מִכָּל־הָעַמִּֽים׃
transliteration: lo merub'khem mikal-ha'amiym chashak y'hvah bakhem vayiv'char bakhem kiy-atem ham'at mikal-ha'amiym
translation: It is not because you are the most numerous of peoples that the L<small>ORD</small> set His heart on you and chose you—indeed, you are the smallest of peoples;

hebrew: כִּי֩ מֵֽאַהֲבַ֨ת יְהוָ֜ה אֶתְכֶ֗ם וּמִשָּׁמְר֤וּ אֶת־הַשְּׁבֻעָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נִשְׁבַּע֙ לַאֲבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם הוֹצִ֧יא יְהוָ֛ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם בְּיָ֣ד חֲזָקָ֑ה וַֽיִּפְדְּךָ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית עֲבָדִ֔ים מִיַּ֖ד פַּרְעֹ֥ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: kiy meahavat y'hvah et'khem vmisham'rv et-hash'vu'ah asher nish'ba' laavoteykhem hvotziy y'hvah et'khem b'yad chazakah vayif'd'kha mibeyt 'avadiym miyad par'oh melekh'-mitz'rayim
translation: but it was because the L<small>ORD</small> favored you and kept the oath He made to your fathers that the L<small>ORD</small> freed you with a mighty hand and rescued you from the house of bondage, from the power of Pharaoh king of Egypt.

hebrew: וְיָ֣דַעְתָּ֔ כִּֽי־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ ה֣וּא הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים הָאֵל֙ הַֽנֶּאֱמָ֔ן שֹׁמֵ֧ר הַבְּרִ֣ית וְהַחֶ֗סֶד לְאֹהֲבָ֛יו וּלְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י מצותו [מִצְוֺתָ֖יו] לְאֶ֥לֶף דּֽוֹר׃
