transliteration: v'yada'ta kiy-y'hvah eloheykha hv haelohiym hael haneeman shomer hab'riyt v'hachesed l'ohavayv vl'shom'rey mtzvtv [mitz'votayv] l'elef dvor
translation: Know, therefore, that only the L<small>ORD</small> your God is God, the steadfast God who keeps His covenant faithfully to the thousandth generation of those who love Him and keep His commandments,

hebrew: וּמְשַׁלֵּ֧ם לְשֹׂנְאָ֛יו אֶל־פָּנָ֖יו לְהַאֲבִיד֑וֹ לֹ֤א יְאַחֵר֙ לְשֹׂ֣נְא֔וֹ אֶל־פָּנָ֖יו יְשַׁלֶּם־לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vm'shalem l'son'ayv el-panayv l'haaviydvo lo y'acher l'son'vo el-panayv y'shalem-lvo
translation: but who instantly requites with destruction those who reject Him—never slow with those who reject Him, but requiting them instantly.

hebrew: וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֨ אֶת־הַמִּצְוָ֜ה וְאֶת־הַֽחֻקִּ֣ים וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֧י מְצַוְּךָ֛ הַיּ֖וֹם לַעֲשׂוֹתָֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'shamar'ta et-hamitz'vah v'et-hachukiym v'et-hamish'patiym asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom la'asvotam (f)
translation: Therefore, observe faithfully the Instruction—the laws and the rules—with which I charge you today.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ עֵ֣קֶב תִּשְׁמְע֗וּן אֵ֤ת הַמִּשְׁפָּטִים֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֥ם וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם וְשָׁמַר֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ לְךָ֗ אֶֽת־הַבְּרִית֙ וְאֶת־הַחֶ֔סֶד אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖ע לַאֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'hayah  'ekev tish'm'vn et hamish'patiym haeleh vsh'mar'tem va'asiytem otam v'shamar y'hvah eloheykha l'kha et-hab'riyt v'et-hachesed asher nish'ba' laavoteykha
translation: And if you do obey these rules and observe them carefully, the L<small>ORD</small> your God will maintain faithfully for you the covenant that He made on oath with your fathers:

hebrew: וַאֲהֵ֣בְךָ֔ וּבֵרַכְךָ֖ וְהִרְבֶּ֑ךָ וּבֵרַ֣ךְ פְּרִֽי־בִטְנְךָ֣ וּפְרִֽי־אַ֠דְמָתֶךָ דְּגָ֨נְךָ֜ וְתִֽירֹשְׁךָ֣ וְיִצְהָרֶ֗ךָ שְׁגַר־אֲלָפֶ֙יךָ֙ וְעַשְׁתְּרֹ֣ת צֹאנֶ֔ךָ עַ֚ל הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥ע לַאֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ לָ֥תֶת לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: vaahev'kha vverakh'kha v'hir'bekha vverakh' p'riy-vit'n'kha vf'riy-ad'matekha d'gan'kha v'tiyrosh'kha v'yitz'harekha sh'gar-alafeykha v'ash't'rot tzonekha 'al haadamah asher-nish'ba' laavoteykha latet lakh'
translation: He will favor you and bless you and multiply you; He will bless the issue of your womb and the produce of your soil, your new grain and wine and oil, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock, in the land that He swore to your fathers to assign to you.

hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ תִּֽהְיֶ֖ה מִכָּל־הָעַמִּ֑ים לֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה בְךָ֛ עָקָ֥ר וַֽעֲקָרָ֖ה וּבִבְהֶמְתֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: barvkh' tih'yeh mikal-ha'amiym lo-yih'yeh v'kha 'akar va'akarah vviv'hem'tekha
translation: You shall be blessed above all other peoples: there shall be no sterile male or female among you or among your livestock.

hebrew: וְהֵסִ֧יר יְהוָ֛ה מִמְּךָ֖ כָּל־חֹ֑לִי וְכָל־מַדְוֵי֩ מִצְרַ֨יִם הָרָעִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָדַ֗עְתָּ לֹ֤א יְשִׂימָם֙ בָּ֔ךְ וּנְתָנָ֖ם בְּכָל־שֹׂנְאֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'hesiyr y'hvah mim'kha kal-choliy v'khal-mad'vey mitz'rayim hara'iym asher yada'ta lo y'siymam bakh' vn'tanam b'khal-son'eykha
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will ward off from you all sickness; He will not bring upon you any of the dreadful diseases of Egypt, about which you know, but will inflict them upon all your enemies.

hebrew: וְאָכַלְתָּ֣ אֶת־כָּל־הָֽעַמִּ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֔ךְ לֹא־תָחֹ֥ס עֵֽינְךָ֖ עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְלֹ֤א תַעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־מוֹקֵ֥שׁ ה֖וּא לָֽךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'akhal'ta et-kal-ha'amiym asher y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh' lo-tachos 'eyn'kha 'aleyhem v'lo ta'avod et-eloheyhem kiy-mvokesh hv lakh' (s)
translation: You shall destroy all the peoples that the L<small>ORD</small> your God delivers to you, showing them no pity. And you shall not worship their gods, for that would be a snare to you.

hebrew: כִּ֤י תֹאמַר֙ בִּלְבָ֣בְךָ֔ רַבִּ֛ים הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָאֵ֖לֶּה מִמֶּ֑נִּי אֵיכָ֥ה אוּכַ֖ל לְהוֹרִישָֽׁם׃
transliteration: kiy tomar bil'vav'kha rabiym hagvoyim haeleh mimeniy eykhah vkhal l'hvoriysham
translation: Should you say to yourselves, “These nations are more numerous than we; how can we dispossess them?”

hebrew: לֹ֥א תִירָ֖א מֵהֶ֑ם זָכֹ֣ר תִּזְכֹּ֗ר אֵ֤ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂה֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לְפַרְעֹ֖ה וּלְכָל־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: lo tiyra mehem zakhor tiz'kor et asher-'asah y'hvah eloheykha l'far'oh vl'khal-mitz'rayim
translation: You need have no fear of them. You have but to bear in mind what the L<small>ORD</small> your God did to Pharaoh and all the Egyptians:

hebrew: הַמַּסֹּ֨ת הַגְּדֹלֹ֜ת אֲשֶׁר־רָא֣וּ עֵינֶ֗יךָ וְהָאֹתֹ֤ת וְהַמֹּֽפְתִים֙ וְהַיָּ֤ד הַחֲזָקָה֙ וְהַזְּרֹ֣עַ הַנְּטוּיָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹצִֽאֲךָ֖ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ כֵּֽן־יַעֲשֶׂ֞ה יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ לְכָל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה יָרֵ֖א מִפְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: hamasot hag'dolot asher-rav 'eyneykha v'haotot v'hamof'tiym v'hayad hachazakah v'haz'ro'a han'tvyah asher hvotziakha y'hvah eloheykha ken-ya'aseh y'hvah eloheykha l'khal-ha'amiym asher-atah yare mip'neyhem
translation: the wondrous acts that you saw with your own eyes, the signs and the portents, the mighty hand, and the outstretched arm by which the L<small>ORD</small> your God liberated you. Thus will the L<small>ORD</small> your God do to all the peoples you now fear.

hebrew: וְגַם֙ אֶת־הַצִּרְעָ֔ה יְשַׁלַּ֛ח יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בָּ֑ם עַד־אֲבֹ֗ד הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֛ים וְהַנִּסְתָּרִ֖ים מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'gam et-hatzir'ah y'shalach y'hvah eloheykha bam 'ad-avod hanish'ariym v'hanis'tariym mipaneykha
translation: The LORD your God will also send a plagueaOthers “hornet”; meaning of Heb. uncertain. Cf. note at Exod. 23.28. against them, until those who are left in hiding perish before you.

hebrew: לֹ֥א תַעֲרֹ֖ץ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ בְּקִרְבֶּ֔ךָ אֵ֥ל גָּד֖וֹל וְנוֹרָֽא׃
transliteration: lo ta'arotz mip'neyhem kiy-y'hvah eloheykha b'kir'bekha el gadvol v'nvora
translation: Do not stand in dread of them, for the L<small>ORD</small> your God is in your midst, a great and awesome God.

hebrew: וְנָשַׁל֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָאֵ֛ל מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ מְעַ֣ט מְעָ֑ט לֹ֤א תוּכַל֙ כַּלֹּתָ֣ם מַהֵ֔ר פֶּן־תִּרְבֶּ֥ה עָלֶ֖יךָ חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'nashal y'hvah eloheykha et-hagvoyim hael mipaneykha m'at m'at lo tvkhal kalotam maher pen-tir'beh 'aleykha chayat hasadeh
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> your God will dislodge those peoples before you little by little; you will not be able to put an end to them at once, else the wild beasts would multiply to your hurt.

hebrew: וּנְתָנָ֛ם יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְהָמָם֙ מְהוּמָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֔ה עַ֖ד הִשָּׁמְדָֽם׃
transliteration: vn'tanam y'hvah eloheykha l'faneykha v'hamam m'hvmah g'dolah 'ad hisham'dam
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> your God will deliver them up to you, throwing them into utter panic until they are wiped out.

hebrew: וְנָתַ֤ן מַלְכֵיהֶם֙ בְּיָדֶ֔ךָ וְהַאֲבַדְתָּ֣ אֶת־שְׁמָ֔ם מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם לֹֽא־יִתְיַצֵּ֥ב אִישׁ֙ בְּפָנֶ֔יךָ עַ֥ד הִשְׁמִֽדְךָ֖ אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'natan mal'kheyhem b'yadekha v'haavad'ta et-sh'mam mitachat hashamayim lo-yit'yatzev iysh b'faneykha 'ad hish'mid'kha otam
translation: He will deliver their kings into your hand, and you shall obliterate their name from under the heavens; no man shall stand up to you, until you have wiped them out.

hebrew: פְּסִילֵ֥י אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֖ם תִּשְׂרְפ֣וּן בָּאֵ֑שׁ לֹֽא־תַחְמֹד֩ כֶּ֨סֶף וְזָהָ֤ב עֲלֵיהֶם֙ וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ לָ֔ךְ פֶּ֚ן תִּוָּקֵ֣שׁ בּ֔וֹ כִּ֧י תוֹעֲבַ֛ת יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ הֽוּא׃
transliteration: p'siyley eloheyhem tis'r'fvn baesh lo-tach'mod kesef v'zahav 'aleyhem v'lakach'ta lakh' pen tivakesh bvo kiy tvo'avat y'hvah eloheykha hv
translation: You shall consign the images of their gods to the fire; you shall not covet the silver and gold on them and keep it for yourselves, lest you be ensnared thereby; for that is abhorrent to the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: וְלֹא־תָבִ֤יא תֽוֹעֵבָה֙ אֶל־בֵּיתֶ֔ךָ וְהָיִ֥יתָ חֵ֖רֶם כָּמֹ֑הוּ שַׁקֵּ֧ץ ׀ תְּשַׁקְּצֶ֛נּוּ וְתַעֵ֥ב ׀ תְּֽתַעֲבֶ֖נּוּ כִּי־חֵ֥רֶם הֽוּא׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'lo-taviy tvo'evah el-beytekha v'hayiyta cherem kamohv shaketz  t'shak'tzenv v'ta'ev  t'ta'avenv kiy-cherem hv (f)
translation: You must not bring an abhorrent thing into your house, or you will be proscribed like it; you must reject it as abominable and abhorrent, for it is proscribed.

hebrew: כָּל־הַמִּצְוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֧י מְצַוְּךָ֛ הַיּ֖וֹם תִּשְׁמְר֣וּן לַעֲשׂ֑וֹת לְמַ֨עַן תִּֽחְי֜וּן וּרְבִיתֶ֗ם וּבָאתֶם֙ וִֽירִשְׁתֶּ֣ם אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥ע יְהוָ֖ה לַאֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: kal-hamitz'vah asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom tish'm'rvn la'asvot l'ma'an tich'yvn vr'viytem vvatem viyrish'tem et-haaretz asher-nish'ba' y'hvah laavoteykhem
translation: You shall faithfully observe all the Instruction that I enjoin upon you today, that you may thrive and increase and be able to possess the land that the L<small>ORD</small> promised on oath to your fathers.

hebrew: וְזָכַרְתָּ֣ אֶת־כָּל־הַדֶּ֗רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֹלִֽיכֲךָ֜ יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ זֶ֛ה אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר לְמַ֨עַן עַנֹּֽתְךָ֜ לְנַסֹּֽתְךָ֗ לָדַ֜עַת אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֧ר בִּֽלְבָבְךָ֛ הֲתִשְׁמֹ֥ר מצותו [מִצְוֺתָ֖יו] אִם־לֹֽא׃
transliteration: v'zakhar'ta et-kal-haderekh' asher holiykhakha y'hvah eloheykha zeh ar'ba'iym shanah bamid'bar l'ma'an 'anot'kha l'nasot'kha lada'at et-asher bil'vav'kha hatish'mor mtzvtv [mitz'votayv] im-lo
translation: Remember the long way that the L<small>ORD</small> your God has made you travel in the wilderness these past forty years, that He might test you by hardships to learn what was in your hearts: whether you would keep His commandments or not.

hebrew: וַֽיְעַנְּךָ֮ וַיַּרְעִבֶךָ֒ וַיַּֽאֲכִֽלְךָ֤ אֶת הַמָּן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יָדַ֔עְתָּ וְלֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּן אֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ לְמַ֣עַן הוֹדִֽעֲךָ֗ כִּ֠י לֹ֣א עַל־הַלֶּ֤חֶם לְבַדּוֹ֙ יִחְיֶ֣ה הָֽאָדָ֔ם כִּ֛י עַל־כָּל־מוֹצָ֥א פִֽי־יְהוָ֖ה יִחְיֶ֥ה הָאָדָֽם׃
transliteration: vay'an'kha vayar'ivekha vayaakhil'kha et haman asher lo-yada'ta v'lo yad'vn avoteykha l'ma'an hvodi'akha kiy lo 'al-halechem l'vadvo yich'yeh haadam kiy 'al-kal-mvotza fiy-y'hvah yich'yeh haadam
translation: He subjected you to the hardship of hunger and then gave you manna to eat, which neither you nor your fathers had ever known, in order to teach you that man does not live on bread alone, but that man may live on anything that the L<small>ORD</small> decrees.

hebrew: שִׂמְלָ֨תְךָ֜ לֹ֤א בָֽלְתָה֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יךָ וְרַגְלְךָ֖ לֹ֣א בָצֵ֑קָה זֶ֖ה אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: sim'lat'kha lo val'tah me'aleykha v'rag'l'kha lo vatzekah zeh ar'ba'iym shanah
translation: The clothes upon you did not wear out, nor did your feet swell these forty years.

hebrew: וְיָדַעְתָּ֖ עִם־לְבָבֶ֑ךָ כִּ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יְיַסֵּ֥ר אִישׁ֙ אֶת־בְּנ֔וֹ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מְיַסְּרֶֽךָּ׃
transliteration: v'yada'ta 'im-l'vavekha kiy kaasher y'yaser iysh et-b'nvo y'hvah eloheykha m'yas'reka
translation: Bear in mind that the L<small>ORD</small> your God disciplines you just as a man disciplines his son.

hebrew: וְשָׁ֣מַרְתָּ֔ אֶת־מִצְוֺ֖ת יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לָלֶ֥כֶת בִּדְרָכָ֖יו וּלְיִרְאָ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'shamar'ta et-mitz'vot y'hvah eloheykha lalekhet bid'rakhayv vl'yir'ah otvo
translation: Therefore keep the commandments of the L<small>ORD</small> your God: walk in His ways and revere Him.

hebrew: כִּ֚י יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ מְבִֽיאֲךָ֖ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ טוֹבָ֑ה אֶ֚רֶץ נַ֣חֲלֵי מָ֔יִם עֲיָנֹת֙ וּתְהֹמֹ֔ת יֹצְאִ֥ים בַּבִּקְעָ֖ה וּבָהָֽר׃
transliteration: kiy y'hvah eloheykha m'viyakha el-eretz tvovah eretz nachaley mayim 'ayanot vt'homot yotz'iym babik'ah vvahar
translation: For the L<small>ORD</small> your God is bringing you into a good land, a land with streams and springs and fountains issuing from plain and hill;

hebrew: אֶ֤רֶץ חִטָּה֙ וּשְׂעֹרָ֔ה וְגֶ֥פֶן וּתְאֵנָ֖ה וְרִמּ֑וֹן אֶֽרֶץ־זֵ֥ית שֶׁ֖מֶן וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
transliteration: eretz chitah vs'orah v'gefen vt'enah v'rimvon eretz-zeyt shemen vd'vash
translation: a land of wheat and barley, of vines, figs, and pomegranates, a land of olive trees and honey;

hebrew: אֶ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹ֤א בְמִסְכֵּנֻת֙ תֹּֽאכַל־בָּ֣הּ לֶ֔חֶם לֹֽא־תֶחְסַ֥ר כֹּ֖ל בָּ֑הּ אֶ֚רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲבָנֶ֣יהָ בַרְזֶ֔ל וּמֵהֲרָרֶ֖יהָ תַּחְצֹ֥ב נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
transliteration: eretz asher lo v'mis'kenut tokhal-bah lechem lo-tech'sar kol bah eretz asher avaneyha var'zel vmeharareyha tach'tzov n'choshet
translation: a land where you may eat food without stint, where you will lack nothing; a land whose rocks are iron and from whose hills you can mine copper.

hebrew: וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ וְשָׂבָ֑עְתָּ וּבֵֽרַכְתָּ֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ עַל־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַטֹּבָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָֽתַן־לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'akhal'ta v'sava'ta vverakh'ta et-y'hvah eloheykha 'al-haaretz hatovah asher natan-lakh'
translation: When you have eaten your fill, give thanks to the L<small>ORD</small> your God for the good land which He has given you.

hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֔ פֶּן־תִּשְׁכַּ֖ח אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לְבִלְתִּ֨י שְׁמֹ֤ר מִצְוֺתָיו֙ וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֣יו וְחֻקֹּתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: hishamer l'kha pen-tish'kach et-y'hvah eloheykha l'vil'tiy sh'mor mitz'votayv vmish'patayv v'chukotayv asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom
translation: Take care lest you forget the L<small>ORD</small> your God and fail to keep His commandments, His rules, and His laws, which I enjoin upon you today.

hebrew: פֶּן־תֹּאכַ֖ל וְשָׂבָ֑עְתָּ וּבָתִּ֥ים טוֹבִ֛ים תִּבְנֶ֖ה וְיָשָֽׁבְתָּ׃
transliteration: pen-tokhal v'sava'ta vvatiym tvoviym tiv'neh v'yashav'ta
translation: When you have eaten your fill, and have built fine houses to live in,

hebrew: וּבְקָֽרְךָ֤ וְצֹֽאנְךָ֙ יִרְבְּיֻ֔ן וְכֶ֥סֶף וְזָהָ֖ב יִרְבֶּה־לָּ֑ךְ וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־לְךָ֖ יִרְבֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vv'kar'kha v'tzon'kha yir'b'yun v'khesef v'zahav yir'beh-lakh' v'khol asher-l'kha yir'beh
translation: and your herds and flocks have multiplied, and your silver and gold have increased, and everything you own has prospered,

hebrew: וְרָ֖ם לְבָבֶ֑ךָ וְשָֽׁכַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ הַמּוֹצִיאֲךָ֛ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים׃
transliteration: v'ram l'vavekha v'shakhach'ta et-y'hvah eloheykha hamvotziyakha meeretz mitz'rayim mibeyt 'avadiym
translation: beware lestaHeb. pen moved down from v. 12 for clarity. your heart grow haughty and you forget the LORD your God—who freed you from the land of Egypt, the house of bondage;

hebrew: הַמּוֹלִ֨יכֲךָ֜ בַּמִּדְבָּ֣ר ׀ הַגָּדֹ֣ל וְהַנּוֹרָ֗א נָחָ֤שׁ ׀ שָׂרָף֙ וְעַקְרָ֔ב וְצִמָּא֖וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֵֽין־מָ֑יִם הַמּוֹצִ֤יא לְךָ֙ מַ֔יִם מִצּ֖וּר הַֽחַלָּמִֽישׁ׃
transliteration: hamvoliykhakha bamid'bar  hagadol v'hanvora nachash  saraf v'ak'rav v'tzimavon asher eyn-mayim hamvotziy l'kha mayim mitzvr hachalamiysh
translation: who led you through the great and terrible wilderness with its seraphbSee note at Num. 21.6. serpents and scorpions, a parched land with no water in it, who brought forth water for you from the flinty rock;

hebrew: הַמַּֽאֲכִ֨לְךָ֥ מָן֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יָדְע֖וּן אֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ לְמַ֣עַן עַנֹּֽתְךָ֗ וּלְמַ֙עַן֙ נַסֹּתֶ֔ךָ לְהֵיטִֽבְךָ֖ בְּאַחֲרִיתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: hamaakhil'kha man bamid'bar asher lo-yad'vn avoteykha l'ma'an 'anot'kha vl'ma'an nasotekha l'heytiv'kha b'achariytekha
translation: who fed you in the wilderness with manna, which your fathers had never known, in order to test you by hardships only to benefit you in the end—

hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ בִּלְבָבֶ֑ךָ כֹּחִי֙ וְעֹ֣צֶם יָדִ֔י עָ֥שָׂה לִ֖י אֶת־הַחַ֥יִל הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: v'amar'ta bil'vavekha kochiy v'otzem yadiy 'asah liy et-hachayil hazeh
translation: and you say to yourselves, “My own power and the might of my own hand have won this wealth for me.”

hebrew: וְזָֽכַרְתָּ֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ כִּ֣י ה֗וּא הַנֹּתֵ֥ן לְךָ֛ כֹּ֖חַ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת חָ֑יִל לְמַ֨עַן הָקִ֧ים אֶת־בְּרִית֛וֹ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥ע לַאֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'zakhar'ta et-y'hvah eloheykha kiy hv hanoten l'kha kocha la'asvot chayil l'ma'an hakiym et-b'riytvo asher-nish'ba' laavoteykha kayvom hazeh (f)
translation: Remember that it is the L<small>ORD</small> your God who gives you the power to get wealth, in fulfillment of the covenant that He made on oath with your fathers, as is still the case.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־שָׁכֹ֤חַ תִּשְׁכַּח֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְהָֽלַכְתָּ֗ אַחֲרֵי֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וַעֲבַדְתָּ֖ם וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִ֣יתָ לָהֶ֑ם הַעִדֹ֤תִי בָכֶם֙ הַיּ֔וֹם כִּ֥י אָבֹ֖ד תֹּאבֵדֽוּן׃
transliteration: v'hayah im-shakhocha tish'kach et-y'hvah eloheykha v'halakh'ta acharey elohiym acheriym va'avad'tam v'hish'tachaviyta lahem ha'idotiy vakhem hayvom kiy avod tovedvn
translation: If you do forget the L<small>ORD</small> your God and follow other gods to serve them or bow down to them, I warn you this day that you shall certainly perish;

hebrew: כַּגּוֹיִ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יְהוָה֙ מַאֲבִ֣יד מִפְּנֵיכֶ֔ם כֵּ֖ן תֹאבֵד֑וּן עֵ֚קֶב לֹ֣א תִשְׁמְע֔וּן בְּק֖וֹל יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: kagvoyim asher y'hvah maaviyd mip'neykhem ken tovedvn 'ekev lo tish'm'vn b'kvol y'hvah eloheykhem (f)
translation: like the nations that the L<small>ORD</small> will cause to perish before you, so shall you perish—because you did not heed the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: שְׁמַ֣ע יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אַתָּ֨ה עֹבֵ֤ר הַיּוֹם֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן לָבֹא֙ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת גּוֹיִ֔ם גְּדֹלִ֥ים וַעֲצֻמִ֖ים מִמֶּ֑ךָּ עָרִ֛ים גְּדֹלֹ֥ת וּבְצֻרֹ֖ת בַּשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: sh'ma' yis'rael atah 'over hayvom et-hayar'den lavo lareshet gvoyim g'doliym va'atzumiym mimeka 'ariym g'dolot vv'tzurot bashamayim
translation: Hear, O Israel! You are about to cross the Jordan to go in and dispossess nations greater and more populous than you: great cities with walls sky-high;

hebrew: עַֽם־גָּד֥וֹל וָרָ֖ם בְּנֵ֣י עֲנָקִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתָּ֤ה יָדַ֙עְתָּ֙ וְאַתָּ֣ה שָׁמַ֔עְתָּ מִ֣י יִתְיַצֵּ֔ב לִפְנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י עֲנָֽק׃
transliteration: 'am-gadvol varam b'ney 'anakiym asher atah yada'ta v'atah shama'ta miy yit'yatzev lif'ney b'ney 'anak
translation: a people great and tall, the Anakites, of whom you have knowledge; for you have heard it said, “Who can stand up to the children of Anak?”

hebrew: וְיָדַעְתָּ֣ הַיּ֗וֹם כִּי֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ הֽוּא־הָעֹבֵ֤ר לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ אֵ֣שׁ אֹֽכְלָ֔ה ה֧וּא יַשְׁמִידֵ֛ם וְה֥וּא יַכְנִיעֵ֖ם לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְהֽוֹרַשְׁתָּ֤ם וְהַֽאַבַדְתָּם֙ מַהֵ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'yada'ta hayvom kiy y'hvah eloheykha hv-ha'over l'faneykha esh okh'lah hv yash'miydem v'hv yakh'niy'em l'faneykha v'hvorash'tam v'haavad'tam maher kaasher diber y'hvah lakh'
translation: Know then this day that none other than the L<small>ORD</small> your God is crossing at your head, a devouring fire; it is He who will wipe them out. He will subdue them before you, that you may quickly dispossess and destroy them, as the L<small>ORD</small> promised you.

hebrew: אַל־תֹּאמַ֣ר בִּלְבָבְךָ֗ בַּהֲדֹ֣ף יְהוָה֩ אֱלֹהֶ֨יךָ אֹתָ֥ם ׀ מִלְּפָנֶיךָ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ בְּצִדְקָתִי֙ הֱבִיאַ֣נִי יְהוָ֔ה לָרֶ֖שֶׁת אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את וּבְרִשְׁעַת֙ הַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָאֵ֔לֶּה יְהוָ֖ה מוֹרִישָׁ֥ם מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: al-tomar bil'vav'kha bahadof y'hvah eloheykha otam  mil'faneykha lemor b'tzid'katiy heviyaniy y'hvah lareshet et-haaretz hazot vv'rish'at hagvoyim haeleh y'hvah mvoriysham mipaneykha
translation: And when the L<small>ORD</small> your God has thrust them from your path, say not to yourselves, “The L<small>ORD</small> has enabled us to possess this land because of our virtues”; it is rather because of the wickedness of those nations that the L<small>ORD</small> is dispossessing them before you.

hebrew: לֹ֣א בְצִדְקָתְךָ֗ וּבְיֹ֙שֶׁר֙ לְבָ֣בְךָ֔ אַתָּ֥ה בָ֖א לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אֶת־אַרְצָ֑ם כִּ֞י בְּרִשְׁעַ֣ת ׀ הַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָאֵ֗לֶּה יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ מוֹרִישָׁ֣ם מִפָּנֶ֔יךָ וּלְמַ֜עַן הָקִ֣ים אֶת־הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֤ע יְהוָה֙ לַאֲבֹתֶ֔יךָ לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: lo v'tzid'kat'kha vv'yosher l'vav'kha atah va lareshet et-ar'tzam kiy b'rish'at  hagvoyim haeleh y'hvah eloheykha mvoriysham mipaneykha vl'ma'an hakiym et-hadavar asher nish'ba' y'hvah laavoteykha l'av'raham l'yitz'chak vl'ya'akov
translation: It is not because of your virtues and your rectitude that you will be able to possess their country; but it is because of their wickedness that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is dispossessing those nations before you, and in order to fulfill the oath that the L<small>ORD</small> made to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

hebrew: וְיָדַעְתָּ֗ כִּ֠י לֹ֤א בְצִדְקָֽתְךָ֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱ֠לֹהֶיךָ נֹתֵ֨ן לְךָ֜ אֶת־הָאָ֧רֶץ הַטּוֹבָ֛ה הַזֹּ֖את לְרִשְׁתָּ֑הּ כִּ֥י עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֖רֶף אָֽתָּה׃
transliteration: v'yada'ta kiy lo v'tzid'kat'kha y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha et-haaretz hatvovah hazot l'rish'tah kiy 'am-k'sheh-'oref atah
translation: Know, then, that it is not for any virtue of yours that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you this good land to possess; for you are a stiffnecked people.

hebrew: זְכֹר֙ אַל־תִּשְׁכַּ֔ח אֵ֧ת אֲשֶׁר־הִקְצַ֛פְתָּ אֶת־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר לְמִן־הַיּ֞וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יָצָ֣אתָ ׀ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֗יִם עַד־בֹּֽאֲכֶם֙ עַד־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה מַמְרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם עִם־יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: z'khor al-tish'kach et asher-hik'tzaf'ta et-y'hvah eloheykha bamid'bar l'min-hayvom asher-yatzata  meeretz mitz'rayim 'ad-boakhem 'ad-hamakvom hazeh mam'riym heyiytem 'im-y'hvah
translation: Remember, never forget, how you provoked the L<small>ORD</small> your God to anger in the wilderness: from the day that you left the land of Egypt until you reached this place, you have continued defiant toward the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וּבְחֹרֵ֥ב הִקְצַפְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־יְהוָ֑ה וַיִּתְאַנַּ֧ף יְהוָ֛ה בָּכֶ֖ם לְהַשְׁמִ֥יד אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vv'chorev hik'tzaf'tem et-y'hvah vayit'anaf y'hvah bakhem l'hash'miyd et'khem
translation: At Horeb you so provoked the L<small>ORD</small> that the L<small>ORD</small> was angry enough with you to have destroyed you.

hebrew: בַּעֲלֹתִ֣י הָהָ֗רָה לָקַ֜חַת לוּחֹ֤ת הָֽאֲבָנִים֙ לוּחֹ֣ת הַבְּרִ֔ית אֲשֶׁר־כָּרַ֥ת יְהוָ֖ה עִמָּכֶ֑ם וָאֵשֵׁ֣ב בָּהָ֗ר אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יוֹם֙ וְאַרְבָּעִ֣ים לַ֔יְלָה לֶ֚חֶם לֹ֣א אָכַ֔לְתִּי וּמַ֖יִם לֹ֥א שָׁתִֽיתִי׃
transliteration: ba'alotiy haharah lakachat lvchot haavaniym lvchot hab'riyt asher-karat y'hvah 'imakhem vaeshev bahar ar'ba'iym yvom v'ar'ba'iym lay'lah lechem lo akhal'tiy vmayim lo shatiytiy
translation: I had ascended the mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the Tablets of the Covenant that the L<small>ORD</small> had made with you, and I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights, eating no bread and drinking no water.

hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן יְהוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י אֶת־שְׁנֵי֙ לוּחֹ֣ת הָֽאֲבָנִ֔ים כְּתֻבִ֖ים בְּאֶצְבַּ֣ע אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַעֲלֵיהֶ֗ם כְּֽכָל־הַדְּבָרִ֡ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּר֩ יְהוָ֨ה עִמָּכֶ֥ם בָּהָ֛ר מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֵ֖שׁ בְּי֥וֹם הַקָּהָֽל׃
transliteration: vayiten y'hvah elay et-sh'ney lvchot haavaniym k'tuviym b'etz'ba' elohiym va'aleyhem k'khal-had'variym asher diber y'hvah 'imakhem bahar mitvokh' haesh b'yvom hakahal
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> gave me the two tablets of stone inscribed by the finger of God, with the exact words that the L<small>ORD</small> had addressed to you on the mountain out of the fire on the day of the Assembly.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מִקֵּץ֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָ֑יְלָה נָתַ֨ן יְהוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י אֶת־שְׁנֵ֛י לֻחֹ֥ת הָאֲבָנִ֖ים לֻח֥וֹת הַבְּרִֽית׃
transliteration: vay'hiy miketz ar'ba'iym yvom v'ar'ba'iym lay'lah natan y'hvah elay et-sh'ney luchot haavaniym luchvot hab'riyt
translation: At the end of those forty days and forty nights, the L<small>ORD</small> gave me the two tablets of stone, the Tablets of the Covenant.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י ק֣וּם רֵ֤ד מַהֵר֙ מִזֶּ֔ה כִּ֚י שִׁחֵ֣ת עַמְּךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹצֵ֖אתָ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם סָ֣רוּ מַהֵ֗ר מִן־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֔ם עָשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם מַסֵּכָֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elay kvm red maher mizeh kiy shichet 'am'kha asher hvotzeta mimitz'rayim sarv maher min-haderekh' asher tziviytim 'asv lahem masekhah
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to me, “Hurry, go down from here at once, for the people whom you brought out of Egypt have acted wickedly; they have been quick to stray from the path that I enjoined upon them; they have made themselves a molten image.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֵלַ֣י לֵאמֹ֑ר רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֖רֶף הֽוּא׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elay lemor raiytiy et-ha'am hazeh v'hineh 'am-k'sheh-'oref hv
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> further said to me, “I see that this is a stiffnecked people.

hebrew: הֶ֤רֶף מִמֶּ֙נִּי֙ וְאַשְׁמִידֵ֔ם וְאֶמְחֶ֣ה אֶת־שְׁמָ֔ם מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂה֙ אֽוֹתְךָ֔ לְגוֹי־עָצ֥וּם וָרָ֖ב מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: heref mimeniy v'ash'miydem v'em'cheh et-sh'mam mitachat hashamayim v'e'eseh vot'kha l'gvoy-'atzvm varav mimenv
translation: Let Me alone and I will destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven, and I will make you a nation far more numerous than they.”

hebrew: וָאֵ֗פֶן וָֽאֵרֵד֙ מִן־הָהָ֔ר וְהָהָ֖ר בֹּעֵ֣ר בָּאֵ֑שׁ וּשְׁנֵי֙ לֻחֹ֣ת הַבְּרִ֔ית עַ֖ל שְׁתֵּ֥י יָדָֽי׃
transliteration: vaefen vaered min-hahar v'hahar bo'er baesh vsh'ney luchot hab'riyt 'al sh'tey yaday
translation: I started down the mountain, a mountain ablaze with fire, the two Tablets of the Covenant in my two hands.

hebrew: וָאֵ֗רֶא וְהִנֵּ֤ה חֲטָאתֶם֙ לַיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם עֲשִׂיתֶ֣ם לָכֶ֔ם עֵ֖גֶל מַסֵּכָ֑ה סַרְתֶּ֣ם מַהֵ֔ר מִן־הַדֶּ֕רֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vaere v'hineh chatatem layhvah eloheykhem 'asiytem lakhem 'egel masekhah sar'tem maher min-haderekh' asher-tzivah y'hvah et'khem
translation: I saw how you had sinned against the L<small>ORD</small> your God: you had made yourselves a molten calf; you had been quick to stray from the path that the L<small>ORD</small> had enjoined upon you.

hebrew: וָאֶתְפֹּשׂ֙ בִּשְׁנֵ֣י הַלֻּחֹ֔ת וָֽאַשְׁלִכֵ֔ם מֵעַ֖ל שְׁתֵּ֣י יָדָ֑י וָאֲשַׁבְּרֵ֖ם לְעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vaet'pos bish'ney haluchot vaash'likhem me'al sh'tey yaday vaashab'rem l'eyneykhem
translation: Thereupon I gripped the two tablets and flung them away with both my hands, smashing them before your eyes.

hebrew: וָֽאֶתְנַפַּל֩ לִפְנֵ֨י יְהוָ֜ה כָּרִאשֹׁנָ֗ה אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יוֹם֙ וְאַרְבָּעִ֣ים לַ֔יְלָה לֶ֚חֶם לֹ֣א אָכַ֔לְתִּי וּמַ֖יִם לֹ֣א שָׁתִ֑יתִי עַ֤ל כָּל־חַטַּאתְכֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חֲטָאתֶ֔ם לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה לְהַכְעִיסֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vaet'napal lif'ney y'hvah karishonah ar'ba'iym yvom v'ar'ba'iym lay'lah lechem lo akhal'tiy vmayim lo shatiytiy 'al kal-chatat'khem asher chatatem la'asvot hara' b'eyney y'hvah l'hakh'iysvo
translation: I threw myself down before the L<small>ORD</small>—eating no bread and drinking no water forty days and forty nights, as before—because of the great wrong you had committed, doing what displeased the L<small>ORD</small> and vexing Him.

hebrew: כִּ֣י יָגֹ֗רְתִּי מִפְּנֵ֤י הָאַף֙ וְהַ֣חֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר קָצַ֧ף יְהוָ֛ה עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם לְהַשְׁמִ֣יד אֶתְכֶ֑ם וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע יְהוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י גַּ֖ם בַּפַּ֥עַם הַהִֽוא׃
transliteration: kiy yagor'tiy mip'ney haaf v'hachemah asher katzaf y'hvah 'aleykhem l'hash'miyd et'khem vayish'ma' y'hvah elay gam bapa'am hahiv
translation: For I was in dread of the L<small>ORD</small>’s fierce anger against you, which moved Him to wipe you out. And that time, too, the L<small>ORD</small> gave heed to me.—

hebrew: וּֽבְאַהֲרֹ֗ן הִתְאַנַּ֧ף יְהוָ֛ה מְאֹ֖ד לְהַשְׁמִיד֑וֹ וָֽאֶתְפַּלֵּ֛ל גַּם־בְּעַ֥ד אַהֲרֹ֖ן בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִֽוא
transliteration: vv'aharon hit'anaf y'hvah m'od l'hash'miydvo vaet'palel gam-b'ad aharon ba'et hahiv
translation: Moreover, the L<small>ORD</small> was angry enough with Aaron to have destroyed him; so I also interceded for Aaron at that time.—

hebrew: וְֽאֶת־חַטַּאתְכֶ֞ם אֲשֶׁר־עֲשִׂיתֶ֣ם אֶת־הָעֵ֗גֶל לָקַחְתִּי֮ וָאֶשְׂרֹ֣ף אֹת֣וֹ ׀ בָּאֵשׁ֒ וָאֶכֹּ֨ת אֹת֤וֹ טָחוֹן֙ הֵיטֵ֔ב עַ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־דַּ֖ק לְעָפָ֑ר וָֽאַשְׁלִךְ֙ אֶת־עֲפָר֔וֹ אֶל־הַנַּ֖חַל הַיֹּרֵ֥ד מִן־הָהָֽר׃
transliteration: v'et-chatat'khem asher-'asiytem et-ha'egel lakach'tiy vaes'rof otvo  baesh vaekot otvo tachvon heytev 'ad asher-dak l'afar vaash'likh' et-'afarvo el-hanachal hayored min-hahar
translation: As for that sinful thing you had made, the calf, I took it and put it to the fire; I broke it to bits and ground it thoroughly until it was fine as dust, and I threw its dust into the brook that comes down from the mountain.

hebrew: וּבְתַבְעֵרָה֙ וּבְמַסָּ֔ה וּבְקִבְרֹ֖ת הַֽתַּאֲוָ֑ה מַקְצִפִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם אֶת־יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vv'tav'erah vv'masah vv'kiv'rot hataavah mak'tzifiym heyiytem et-y'hvah
translation: Again you provoked the L<small>ORD</small> at Taberah, and at Massah, and at Kibroth-hattaavah.

hebrew: וּבִשְׁלֹ֨חַ יְהוָ֜ה אֶתְכֶ֗ם מִקָּדֵ֤שׁ בַּרְנֵ֙עַ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר עֲלוּ֙ וּרְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לָכֶ֑ם וַתַּמְר֗וּ אֶת־פִּ֤י יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֤א הֶֽאֱמַנְתֶּם֙ ל֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֖ם בְּקֹלֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vvish'locha y'hvah et'khem mikadesh bar'ne'a lemor 'alv vr'shv et-haaretz asher natatiy lakhem vatam'rv et-piy y'hvah eloheykhem v'lo heeman'tem lvo v'lo sh'ma'tem b'kolvo
translation: And when the L<small>ORD</small> sent you on from Kadesh-barnea, saying, “Go up and take possession of the land that I am giving you,” you flouted the command of the L<small>ORD</small> your God; you did not put your trust in Him and did not obey Him.

hebrew: מַמְרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם עִם־יְהוָ֑ה מִיּ֖וֹם דַּעְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: mam'riym heyiytem 'im-y'hvah miyvom da'tiy et'khem
translation: As long as I have known you, you have been defiant toward the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וָֽאֶתְנַפַּ֞ל לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֗ה אֵ֣ת אַרְבָּעִ֥ים הַיּ֛וֹם וְאֶת־אַרְבָּעִ֥ים הַלַּ֖יְלָה אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִתְנַפָּ֑לְתִּי כִּֽי־אָמַ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה לְהַשְׁמִ֥יד אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vaet'napal lif'ney y'hvah et ar'ba'iym hayvom v'et-ar'ba'iym halay'lah asher hit'napal'tiy kiy-amar y'hvah l'hash'miyd et'khem
translation: When I lay prostrate before the LORD aLit. “the forty days and forty nights that I lay prostrate.”those forty days and forty nights,-a because the LORD was determined to destroy you,

hebrew: וָאֶתְפַּלֵּ֣ל אֶל־יְהוָה֮ וָאֹמַר֒ אֲדֹנָ֣י יְהוִ֗ה אַל־תַּשְׁחֵ֤ת עַמְּךָ֙ וְנַחֲלָ֣תְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּדִ֖יתָ בְּגָדְלֶ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁר־הוֹצֵ֥אתָ מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם בְּיָ֥ד חֲזָקָֽה׃
transliteration: vaet'palel el-y'hvah vaomar adonay y'hvih al-tash'chet 'am'kha v'nachalat'kha asher padiyta b'gad'lekha asher-hvotzeta mimitz'rayim b'yad chazakah
translation: I prayed to the L<small>ORD</small> and said, “O Lord G<small>OD</small>, do not annihilate Your very own people, whom You redeemed in Your majesty and whom You freed from Egypt with a mighty hand.

hebrew: זְכֹר֙ לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹ֑ב אַל־תֵּ֗פֶן אֶל־קְשִׁי֙ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְאֶל־רִשְׁע֖וֹ וְאֶל־חַטָּאתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: z'khor la'avadeykha l'av'raham l'yitz'chak vl'ya'akov al-tefen el-k'shiy ha'am hazeh v'el-rish'vo v'el-chatatvo
translation: Give thought to Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and pay no heed to the stubbornness of this people, its wickedness, and its sinfulness.

hebrew: פֶּן־יֹאמְר֗וּ הָאָרֶץ֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הוֹצֵאתָ֣נוּ מִשָּׁם֒ מִבְּלִי֙ יְכֹ֣לֶת יְהוָ֔ה לַהֲבִיאָ֕ם אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם וּמִשִּׂנְאָת֣וֹ אוֹתָ֔ם הוֹצִיאָ֖ם לַהֲמִתָ֥ם בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
transliteration: pen-yom'rv haaretz asher hvotzetanv misham mib'liy y'kholet y'hvah lahaviyam el-haaretz asher-diber lahem vmisin'atvo votam hvotziyam lahamitam bamid'bar
translation: Else the country from which You freed us will say, ‘It was because the L<small>ORD</small> was powerless to bring them into the land that He had promised them, and because He rejected them, that He brought them out to have them die in the wilderness.’

hebrew: וְהֵ֥ם עַמְּךָ֖ וְנַחֲלָתֶ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הוֹצֵ֙אתָ֙ בְּכֹחֲךָ֣ הַגָּדֹ֔ל וּבִֽזְרֹעֲךָ֖ הַנְּטוּיָֽה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hem 'am'kha v'nachalatekha asher hvotzeta b'khochakha hagadol vviz'ro'akha han'tvyah (f)
translation: Yet they are Your very own people, whom You freed with Your great might and Your outstretched arm.”

hebrew: בָּעֵ֨ת הַהִ֜וא אָמַ֧ר יְהוָ֣ה אֵלַ֗י פְּסָל־לְךָ֞ שְׁנֵֽי־לֻוחֹ֤ת אֲבָנִים֙ כָּרִ֣אשֹׁנִ֔ים וַעֲלֵ֥ה אֵלַ֖י הָהָ֑רָה וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לְּךָ֖ אֲר֥וֹן עֵֽץ׃
transliteration: ba'et hahiv amar y'hvah elay p'sal-l'kha sh'ney-luvchot avaniym karishoniym va'aleh elay haharah v'asiyta l'kha arvon 'etz
translation: Thereupon the L<small>ORD</small> said to me, “Carve out two tablets of stone like the first, and come up to Me on the mountain; and make an ark of wood.

hebrew: וְאֶכְתֹּב֙ עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֔ת אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָי֛וּ עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֥ת הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר שִׁבַּ֑רְתָּ וְשַׂמְתָּ֖ם בָּאָרֽוֹן׃
transliteration: v'ekh'tov 'al-haluchot et-had'variym asher hayv 'al-haluchot harishoniym asher shibar'ta v'sam'tam baarvon
translation: I will inscribe on the tablets the commandments that were on the first tablets that you smashed, and you shall deposit them in the ark.”

hebrew: וָאַ֤עַשׂ אֲרוֹן֙ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וָאֶפְסֹ֛ל שְׁנֵי־לֻחֹ֥ת אֲבָנִ֖ים כָּרִאשֹׁנִ֑ים וָאַ֣עַל הָהָ֔רָה וּשְׁנֵ֥י הַלֻּחֹ֖ת בְּיָדִֽי׃
transliteration: vaa'as arvon 'atzey shitiym vaef'sol sh'ney-luchot avaniym karishoniym vaa'al haharah vsh'ney haluchot b'yadiy
translation: I made an ark of acacia wood and carved out two tablets of stone like the first; I took the two tablets with me and went up the mountain.

hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֨ב עַֽל־הַלֻּחֹ֜ת כַּמִּכְתָּ֣ב הָרִאשׁ֗וֹן אֵ֚ת עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּר֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֲלֵיכֶ֥ם בָּהָ֛ר מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֵ֖שׁ בְּי֣וֹם הַקָּהָ֑ל וַיִּתְּנֵ֥ם יְהוָ֖ה אֵלָֽי׃
transliteration: vayikh'tov 'al-haluchot kamikh'tav harishvon et 'aseret had'variym asher diber y'hvah aleykhem bahar mitvokh' haesh b'yvom hakahal vayit'nem y'hvah elay
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> inscribed on the tablets the same text as on the first, the Ten Commandments that He addressed to you on the mountain out of the fire on the day of the Assembly; and the L<small>ORD</small> gave them to me.

hebrew: וָאֵ֗פֶן וָֽאֵרֵד֙ מִן־הָהָ֔ר וָֽאָשִׂם֙ אֶת־הַלֻּחֹ֔ת בָּאָר֖וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֑יתִי וַיִּ֣הְיוּ שָׁ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוַּ֖נִי יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vaefen vaered min-hahar vaasim et-haluchot baarvon asher 'asiytiy vayih'yv sham kaasher tzivaniy y'hvah
translation: Then I left and went down from the mountain, and I deposited the tablets in the ark that I had made, where they still are, as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded me.

hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל נָֽסְע֛וּ מִבְּאֵרֹ֥ת בְּנֵי־יַעֲקָ֖ן מוֹסֵרָ֑ה שָׁ֣ם מֵ֤ת אַהֲרֹן֙ וַיִּקָּבֵ֣ר שָׁ֔ם וַיְכַהֵ֛ן אֶלְעָזָ֥ר בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
transliteration: vv'ney yis'rael nas'v mib'erot b'ney-ya'akan mvoserah sham met aharon vayikaver sham vay'khahen el'azar b'nvo tach'tayv
translation: From Beeroth-bene-jaakanaLit. “wells of Bene-jaakan”; cf. Num. 33.31–32. the Israelites marched to Moserah. Aaron died there and was buried there; and his son Eleazar became priest in his stead.

hebrew: מִשָּׁ֥ם נָסְע֖וּ הַגֻּדְגֹּ֑דָה וּמִן־הַגֻּדְגֹּ֣דָה יָטְבָ֔תָה אֶ֖רֶץ נַ֥חֲלֵי מָֽיִם׃
transliteration: misham nas'v hagud'godah vmin-hagud'godah yat'vatah eretz nachaley mayim
translation: From there they marched to Gudgod,b“Hor-haggidgad” in Num. 33.32–33. and from Gudgod to Jotbath, a region of running brooks.

hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֗וא הִבְדִּ֤יל יְהוָה֙ אֶת־שֵׁ֣בֶט הַלֵּוִ֔י לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן בְּרִית־יְהוָ֑ה לַעֲמֹד֩ לִפְנֵ֨י יְהוָ֤ה לְשָֽׁרְתוֹ֙ וּלְבָרֵ֣ךְ בִּשְׁמ֔וֹ עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: ba'et hahiv hiv'diyl y'hvah et-shevet haleviy laset et-arvon b'riyt-y'hvah la'amod lif'ney y'hvah l'shar'tvo vl'varekh' bish'mvo 'ad hayvom hazeh
translation: At that time the L<small>ORD</small> set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the Ark of the L<small>ORD</small>’s Covenant, to stand in attendance upon the L<small>ORD</small>, and to bless in His name, as is still the case.

hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֞ן לֹֽא־הָיָ֧ה לְלֵוִ֛י חֵ֥לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֖ה עִם־אֶחָ֑יו יְהוָה֙ ה֣וּא נַחֲלָת֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֛ר יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: 'al-ken lo-hayah l'leviy chelek v'nachalah 'im-echayv y'hvah hv nachalatvo kaasher diber y'hvah eloheykha lvo
translation: That is why the Levites have received no hereditary portion along with their kinsmen: the L<small>ORD</small> is their portion, as the L<small>ORD</small> your God spoke concerning them.

hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֞י עָמַ֣דְתִּי בָהָ֗ר כַּיָּמִים֙ הָרִ֣אשֹׁנִ֔ים אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָ֑יְלָה וַיִּשְׁמַ֨ע יְהוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י גַּ֚ם בַּפַּ֣עַם הַהִ֔וא לֹא־אָבָ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה הַשְׁחִיתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'anokhiy 'amad'tiy vahar kayamiym harishoniym ar'ba'iym yvom v'ar'ba'iym lay'lah vayish'ma' y'hvah elay gam bapa'am hahiv lo-avah y'hvah hash'chiytekha
translation: I had stayed on the mountain, as I did the first time, forty days and forty nights; and the L<small>ORD</small> heeded me once again: the L<small>ORD</small> agreed not to destroy you.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י ק֛וּם לֵ֥ךְ לְמַסַּ֖ע לִפְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וְיָבֹ֙אוּ֙ וְיִֽרְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥עְתִּי לַאֲבֹתָ֖ם לָתֵ֥ת לָהֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elay kvm lekh' l'masa' lif'ney ha'am v'yavov v'yir'shv et-haaretz asher-nish'ba'tiy laavotam latet lahem (f)
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to me, “Up, resume the march at the head of the people, that they may go in and possess the land that I swore to their fathers to give them.”

hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מָ֚ה יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ שֹׁאֵ֖ל מֵעִמָּ֑ךְ כִּ֣י אִם־לְ֠יִרְאָה אֶת־יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ לָלֶ֤כֶת בְּכָל־דְּרָכָיו֙ וּלְאַהֲבָ֣ה אֹת֔וֹ וְלַֽעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכָל־לְבָבְךָ֖ וּבְכָל־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
transliteration: v'atah yis'rael mah y'hvah eloheykha shoel me'imakh' kiy im-l'yir'ah et-y'hvah eloheykha lalekhet b'khal-d'rakhayv vl'ahavah otvo v'la'avod et-y'hvah eloheykha b'khal-l'vav'kha vv'khal-naf'shekha
translation: And now, O Israel, what does the L<small>ORD</small> your God demand of you? Only this: to revere the L<small>ORD</small> your God, to walk only in His paths, to love Him, and to serve the L<small>ORD</small> your God with all your heart and soul,

hebrew: לִשְׁמֹ֞ר אֶת־מִצְוֺ֤ת יְהוָה֙ וְאֶת־חֻקֹּתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם לְט֖וֹב לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: lish'mor et-mitz'vot y'hvah v'et-chukotayv asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom l'tvov lakh'
translation: keeping the L<small>ORD</small>’s commandments and laws, which I enjoin upon you today, for your good.

hebrew: הֵ֚ן לַיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּשְׁמֵ֣י הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם הָאָ֖רֶץ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: hen layhvah eloheykha hashamayim vsh'mey hashamayim haaretz v'khal-asher-bah
translation: Mark, the heavens cLit. “and the heaven of heavens.”to their uttermost reaches-c belong to the LORD your God, the earth and all that is on it!

hebrew: רַ֧ק בַּאֲבֹתֶ֛יךָ חָשַׁ֥ק יְהוָ֖ה לְאַהֲבָ֣ה אוֹתָ֑ם וַיִּבְחַ֞ר בְּזַרְעָ֣ם אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם בָּכֶ֛ם מִכָּל־הָעַמִּ֖ים כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּה׃
transliteration: rak baavoteykha chashak y'hvah l'ahavah votam vayiv'char b'zar'am achareyhem bakhem mikal-ha'amiym kayvom hazeh
translation: Yet it was to your fathers that the L<small>ORD</small> was drawn in His love for them, so that He chose you, their lineal descendants, from among all peoples—as is now the case.

hebrew: וּמַלְתֶּ֕ם אֵ֖ת עָרְלַ֣ת לְבַבְכֶ֑ם וְעָ֨רְפְּכֶ֔ם לֹ֥א תַקְשׁ֖וּ עֽוֹד׃
transliteration: vmal'tem et 'ar'lat l'vav'khem v'ar'p'khem lo tak'shv 'vod
translation: Cut away, therefore, the thickening about your hearts and stiffen your necks no more.

hebrew: כִּ֚י יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם ה֚וּא אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַאֲדֹנֵ֖י הָאֲדֹנִ֑ים הָאֵ֨ל הַגָּדֹ֤ל הַגִּבֹּר֙ וְהַנּוֹרָ֔א אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹא־יִשָּׂ֣א פָנִ֔ים וְלֹ֥א יִקַּ֖ח שֹֽׁחַד׃
transliteration: kiy y'hvah eloheykhem hv elohey haelohiym vaadoney haadoniym hael hagadol hagibor v'hanvora asher lo-yisa faniym v'lo yikach shochad
translation: For the LORD your God is dLit. “the God of gods and the Lord of lords.”God supreme and Lord supreme,-d the great, the mighty, and the awesome God, who shows no favor and takes no bribe,

hebrew: עֹשֶׂ֛ה מִשְׁפַּ֥ט יָת֖וֹם וְאַלְמָנָ֑ה וְאֹהֵ֣ב גֵּ֔ר לָ֥תֶת ל֖וֹ לֶ֥חֶם וְשִׂמְלָֽה׃
transliteration: 'oseh mish'pat yatvom v'al'manah v'ohev ger latet lvo lechem v'sim'lah
translation: but upholds the cause of the fatherless and the widow, and befriends the stranger, providing him with food and clothing.—

hebrew: וַאֲהַבְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הַגֵּ֑ר כִּֽי־גֵרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: vaahav'tem et-hager kiy-geriym heyiytem b'eretz mitz'rayim
translation: You too must befriend the stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.

hebrew: אֶת־יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ תִּירָ֖א אֹת֣וֹ תַעֲבֹ֑ד וּב֣וֹ תִדְבָּ֔ק וּבִשְׁמ֖וֹ תִּשָּׁבֵֽעַ׃
transliteration: et-y'hvah eloheykha tiyra otvo ta'avod vvvo tid'bak vvish'mvo tishave'a
translation: You must revere the L<small>ORD</small> your God: only Him shall you worship, to Him shall you hold fast, and by His name shall you swear.

hebrew: ה֥וּא תְהִלָּתְךָ֖ וְה֣וּא אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֣ה אִתְּךָ֗ אֶת־הַגְּדֹלֹ֤ת וְאֶת־הַנּֽוֹרָאֹת֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָא֖וּ עֵינֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: hv t'hilat'kha v'hv eloheykha asher-'asah it'kha et-hag'dolot v'et-hanvoraot haeleh asher rav 'eyneykha
translation: He is your glory and He is your God, who wrought for you those marvelous, awesome deeds that you saw with your own eyes.

hebrew: בְּשִׁבְעִ֣ים נֶ֔פֶשׁ יָרְד֥וּ אֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ מִצְרָ֑יְמָהּ וְעַתָּ֗ה שָֽׂמְךָ֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ כְּכוֹכְבֵ֥י הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לָרֹֽב׃
transliteration: b'shiv'iym nefesh yar'dv avoteykha mitz'ray'mah v'atah sam'kha y'hvah eloheykha k'khvokh'vey hashamayim larov
translation: Your ancestors went down to Egypt seventy persons in all; and now the L<small>ORD</small> your God has made you as numerous as the stars of heaven.

hebrew: וְאָ֣הַבְתָּ֔ אֵ֖ת יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֣ מִשְׁמַרְתּ֗וֹ וְחֻקֹּתָ֧יו וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֛יו וּמִצְוֺתָ֖יו כָּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'ahav'ta et y'hvah eloheykha v'shamar'ta mish'mar'tvo v'chukotayv vmish'patayv vmitz'votayv kal-hayamiym
translation: Love, therefore, the L<small>ORD</small> your God, and always keep His charge, His laws, His rules, and His commandments.

hebrew: וִֽידַעְתֶּם֮ הַיּוֹם֒ כִּ֣י ׀ לֹ֣א אֶת־בְּנֵיכֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יָדְעוּ֙ וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־רָא֔וּ אֶת־מוּסַ֖ר יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם אֶת־גָּדְל֕וֹ אֶת־יָדוֹ֙ הַחֲזָקָ֔ה וּזְרֹע֖וֹ הַנְּטוּיָֽה׃
transliteration: viyda'tem hayvom kiy  lo et-b'neykhem asher lo-yad'v vaasher lo-rav et-mvsar y'hvah eloheykhem et-gad'lvo et-yadvo hachazakah vz'ro'vo han'tvyah
translation:
aSyntax of Heb. uncertain.Take thought this day that it was not your children, who neither experienced nor witnessed the lesson of the LORD your God—
His majesty, His mighty hand, His outstretched arm;

hebrew: וְאֶת־אֹֽתֹתָיו֙ וְאֶֽת־מַעֲשָׂ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה בְּת֣וֹךְ מִצְרָ֑יִם לְפַרְעֹ֥ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֖יִם וּלְכָל־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'et-ototayv v'et-ma'asayv asher 'asah b'tvokh' mitz'rayim l'far'oh melekh'-mitz'rayim vl'khal-ar'tzvo
translation: the signs and the deeds that He performed in Egypt against Pharaoh king of Egypt and all his land;

hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂה֩ לְחֵ֨יל מִצְרַ֜יִם לְסוּסָ֣יו וּלְרִכְבּ֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵצִ֜יף אֶת־מֵ֤י יַם־סוּף֙ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶ֔ם בְּרָדְפָ֖ם אַחֲרֵיכֶ֑ם וַיְאַבְּדֵ֣ם יְהוָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vaasher 'asah l'cheyl mitz'rayim l'svsayv vl'rikh'bvo asher hetziyf et-mey yam-svf 'al-p'neyhem b'rad'fam achareykhem vay'ab'dem y'hvah 'ad hayvom hazeh
translation: what He did to Egypt’s army, its horses and chariots; how the LORD rolled back upon them the waters of the Sea of Reeds when they were pursuing you, thus destroying them bLit. “to this day.”once and for all;-b

hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר עַד־בֹּאֲכֶ֖ם עַד־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vaasher 'asah lakhem bamid'bar 'ad-boakhem 'ad-hamakvom hazeh
translation: what He did for you in the wilderness before you arrived in this place;

hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֜ה לְדָתָ֣ן וְלַאֲבִירָ֗ם בְּנֵ֣י אֱלִיאָב֮ בֶּן־רְאוּבֵן֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר פָּצְתָ֤ה הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֶת־פִּ֔יהָ וַתִּבְלָעֵ֥ם וְאֶת־בָּתֵּיהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־אָהֳלֵיהֶ֑ם וְאֵ֤ת כָּל־הַיְקוּם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּרַגְלֵיהֶ֔ם בְּקֶ֖רֶב כָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vaasher 'asah l'datan v'laaviyram b'ney eliyav ben-r'vven asher patz'tah haaretz et-piyha vativ'la'em v'et-bateyhem v'et-aholeyhem v'et kal-hay'kvm asher b'rag'leyhem b'kerev kal-yis'rael
translation: and what He did to Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab son of Reuben, when the earth opened her mouth and swallowed them, along with their households, their tents, and every living thing in their train, from amidst all Israel—

hebrew: כִּ֤י עֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ הָֽרֹאֹ֔ת אֶת־כָּל־מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה הַגָּדֹ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֖ר עָשָֽׂה׃
transliteration: kiy 'eyneykhem haroot et-kal-ma'aseh y'hvah hagadol asher 'asah
translation: but that it was you who saw with your own eyes all the marvelous deeds that the L<small>ORD</small> performed.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־כָּל־הַמִּצְוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם לְמַ֣עַן תֶּחֶזְק֗וּ וּבָאתֶם֙ וִֽירִשְׁתֶּ֣ם אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֛ם עֹבְרִ֥ים שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem et-kal-hamitz'vah asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom l'ma'an techez'kv vvatem viyrish'tem et-haaretz asher atem 'ov'riym shamah l'rish'tah
translation: Keep, therefore, all the Instruction that I enjoin upon you today, so that you may have the strength to enter and take possession of the land that you are about to cross into and possess,

hebrew: וּלְמַ֨עַן תַּאֲרִ֤יכוּ יָמִים֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר֩ נִשְׁבַּ֨ע יְהוָ֧ה לַאֲבֹתֵיכֶ֛ם לָתֵ֥ת לָהֶ֖ם וּלְזַרְעָ֑ם אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vl'ma'an taariykhv yamiym 'al-haadamah asher nish'ba' y'hvah laavoteykhem latet lahem vl'zar'am eretz zavat chalav vd'vash (s)
translation: and that you may long endure upon the soil that the L<small>ORD</small> swore to your fathers to assign to them and to their heirs, a land flowing with milk and honey.

hebrew: כִּ֣י הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתָּ֤ה בָא־שָׁ֙מָּה֙ לְרִשְׁתָּ֔הּ לֹ֣א כְאֶ֤רֶץ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ הִ֔וא אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְצָאתֶ֖ם מִשָּׁ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר תִּזְרַע֙ אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֔ וְהִשְׁקִ֥יתָ בְרַגְלְךָ֖ כְּגַ֥ן הַיָּרָֽק׃
transliteration: kiy haaretz asher atah va-shamah l'rish'tah lo kh'eretz mitz'rayim hiv asher y'tzatem misham asher tiz'ra' et-zar'akha v'hish'kiyta v'rag'l'kha k'gan hayarak
translation: For the land that you are about to enter and possess is not like the land of Egypt from which you have come. There the grain you sowed had to be watered by your own labors,cLit. “by your foot.” like a vegetable garden;

hebrew: וְהָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֜ם עֹבְרִ֥ים שָׁ֙מָּה֙ לְרִשְׁתָּ֔הּ אֶ֥רֶץ הָרִ֖ים וּבְקָעֹ֑ת לִמְטַ֥ר הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם תִּשְׁתֶּה־מָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'haaretz asher atem 'ov'riym shamah l'rish'tah eretz hariym vv'ka'ot lim'tar hashamayim tish'teh-mayim
translation: but the land you are about to cross into and possess, a land of hills and valleys, soaks up its water from the rains of heaven.

hebrew: אֶ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ דֹּרֵ֣שׁ אֹתָ֑הּ תָּמִ֗יד עֵינֵ֨י יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ בָּ֔הּ מֵֽרֵשִׁית֙ הַשָּׁנָ֔ה וְעַ֖ד אַחֲרִ֥ית שָׁנָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: eretz asher-y'hvah eloheykha doresh otah tamiyd 'eyney y'hvah eloheykha bah mereshiyt hashanah v'ad achariyt shanah (s)
translation: It is a land which the L<small>ORD</small> your God looks after, on which the L<small>ORD</small> your God always keeps His eye, from year’s beginning to year’s end.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־שָׁמֹ֤עַ תִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ אֶל־מִצְוֺתַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם לְאַהֲבָ֞ה אֶת־יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ וּלְעָבְד֔וֹ בְּכָל־לְבַבְכֶ֖ם וּבְכָל־נַפְשְׁכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'hayah im-shamo'a tish'm'v el-mitz'votay asher anokhiy m'tzaveh et'khem hayvom l'ahavah et-y'hvah eloheykhem vl'av'dvo b'khal-l'vav'khem vv'khal-naf'sh'khem
translation: If, then, you obey the commandments that I enjoin upon you this day, loving the L<small>ORD</small> your God and serving Him with all your heart and soul,

hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֧י מְטַֽר־אַרְצְכֶ֛ם בְּעִתּ֖וֹ יוֹרֶ֣ה וּמַלְק֑וֹשׁ וְאָסַפְתָּ֣ דְגָנֶ֔ךָ וְתִֽירֹשְׁךָ֖ וְיִצְהָרֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'natatiy m'tar-ar'tz'khem b'itvo yvoreh vmal'kvosh v'asaf'ta d'ganekha v'tiyrosh'kha v'yitz'harekha
translation: IdI.e., the Lord; Samaritan reads “He.” will grant the rain for your land in season, the early rain and the late. You shall gather in your new grain and wine and oil—

hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֛י עֵ֥שֶׂב בְּשָׂדְךָ֖ לִבְהֶמְתֶּ֑ךָ וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ וְשָׂבָֽעְתָּ׃
transliteration: v'natatiy 'esev b'sad'kha liv'hem'tekha v'akhal'ta v'sava'ta
translation: IdI.e., the Lord; Samaritan reads “He.” will also provide grass in the fields for your cattle—and thus you shall eat your fill.

hebrew: הִשָּֽׁמְר֣וּ לָכֶ֔ם פֶּ֥ן יִפְתֶּ֖ה לְבַבְכֶ֑ם וְסַרְתֶּ֗ם וַעֲבַדְתֶּם֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִיתֶ֖ם לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: hisham'rv lakhem pen yif'teh l'vav'khem v'sar'tem va'avad'tem elohiym acheriym v'hish'tachaviytem lahem
translation: Take care not to be lured away to serve other gods and bow to them.

hebrew: וְחָרָ֨ה אַף־יְהוָ֜ה בָּכֶ֗ם וְעָצַ֤ר אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֣ה מָטָ֔ר וְהָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה לֹ֥א תִתֵּ֖ן אֶת־יְבוּלָ֑הּ וַאֲבַדְתֶּ֣ם מְהֵרָ֗ה מֵעַל֙ הָאָ֣רֶץ הַטֹּבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'charah af-y'hvah bakhem v'atzar et-hashamayim v'lo-yih'yeh matar v'haadamah lo titen et-y'vvlah vaavad'tem m'herah me'al haaretz hatovah asher y'hvah noten lakhem
translation: For the L<small>ORD</small>’s anger will flare up against you, and He will shut up the skies so that there will be no rain and the ground will not yield its produce; and you will soon perish from the good land that the L<small>ORD</small> is assigning to you.

hebrew: וְשַׂמְתֶּם֙ אֶת־דְּבָרַ֣י אֵ֔לֶּה עַל־לְבַבְכֶ֖ם וְעַֽל־נַפְשְׁכֶ֑ם וּקְשַׁרְתֶּ֨ם אֹתָ֤ם לְאוֹת֙ עַל־יֶדְכֶ֔ם וְהָי֥וּ לְטוֹטָפֹ֖ת בֵּ֥ין עֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'sam'tem et-d'varay eleh 'al-l'vav'khem v'al-naf'sh'khem vk'shar'tem otam l'vot 'al-yed'khem v'hayv l'tvotafot beyn 'eyneykhem
translation: Therefore impress these My words upon your eLit. “heart and self.”very heart:-e bind them as a sign on your hand and let them serve as a fSee notes on 6.8.symbol on your forehead,-f

hebrew: וְלִמַּדְתֶּ֥ם אֹתָ֛ם אֶת־בְּנֵיכֶ֖ם לְדַבֵּ֣ר בָּ֑ם בְּשִׁבְתְּךָ֤ בְּבֵיתֶ֙ךָ֙ וּבְלֶכְתְּךָ֣ בַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וּֽבְשָׁכְבְּךָ֖ וּבְקוּמֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'limad'tem otam et-b'neykhem l'daber bam b'shiv't'kha b'veytekha vv'lekh't'kha vaderekh' vv'shakh'b'kha vv'kvmekha
translation: and teach them to your children—reciting them when you stay at home and when you are away, when you lie down and when you get up;

hebrew: וּכְתַבְתָּ֛ם עַל־מְזוּז֥וֹת בֵּיתֶ֖ךָ וּבִשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vkh'tav'tam 'al-m'zvzvot beytekha vvish'areykha
translation: and inscribe them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates—

hebrew: לְמַ֨עַן יִרְבּ֤וּ יְמֵיכֶם֙ וִימֵ֣י בְנֵיכֶ֔ם עַ֚ל הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֧ע יְהוָ֛ה לַאֲבֹתֵיכֶ֖ם לָתֵ֣ת לָהֶ֑ם כִּימֵ֥י הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ (ס)
transliteration: l'ma'an yir'bv y'meykhem viymey v'neykhem 'al haadamah asher nish'ba' y'hvah laavoteykhem latet lahem kiymey hashamayim 'al-haaretz (s)
translation: to the end that you and your children may endure, in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> swore to your fathers to assign to them, as long as there is a heaven over the earth.

hebrew: כִּי֩ אִם־שָׁמֹ֨ר תִּשְׁמְר֜וּן אֶת־כָּל־הַמִּצְוָ֣ה הַזֹּ֗את אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם לַעֲשֹׂתָ֑הּ לְאַהֲבָ֞ה אֶת־יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֛ם לָלֶ֥כֶת בְּכָל־דְּרָכָ֖יו וּלְדָבְקָה־בֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kiy im-shamor tish'm'rvn et-kal-hamitz'vah hazot asher anokhiy m'tzaveh et'khem la'asotah l'ahavah et-y'hvah eloheykhem lalekhet b'khal-d'rakhayv vl'dav'kah-vvo
translation: If, then, you faithfully keep all this Instruction that I command you, loving the L<small>ORD</small> your God, walking in all His ways, and holding fast to Him,

hebrew: וְהוֹרִ֧ישׁ יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־כָּל־הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָאֵ֖לֶּה מִלִּפְנֵיכֶ֑ם וִֽירִשְׁתֶּ֣ם גּוֹיִ֔ם גְּדֹלִ֥ים וַעֲצֻמִ֖ים מִכֶּֽם׃
transliteration: v'hvoriysh y'hvah et-kal-hagvoyim haeleh milif'neykhem viyrish'tem gvoyim g'doliym va'atzumiym mikem
translation: the L<small>ORD</small> will dislodge before you all these nations: you will dispossess nations greater and more numerous than you.

hebrew: כָּל־הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּדְרֹ֧ךְ כַּֽף־רַגְלְכֶ֛ם בּ֖וֹ לָכֶ֣ם יִהְיֶ֑ה מִן־הַמִּדְבָּ֨ר וְהַלְּבָנ֜וֹן מִן־הַנָּהָ֣ר נְהַר־פְּרָ֗ת וְעַד֙ הַיָּ֣ם הָֽאַחֲר֔וֹן יִהְיֶ֖ה גְּבֻלְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: kal-hamakvom asher tid'rokh' kaf-rag'l'khem bvo lakhem yih'yeh min-hamid'bar v'hal'vanvon min-hanahar n'har-p'rat v'ad hayam haacharvon yih'yeh g'vul'khem
translation: Every spot on which your foot treads shall be yours; your territory shall extend from the wilderness to the Lebanon and from the River—the Euphrates—to the WesterngI.e., Mediterranean. Sea.

hebrew: לֹא־יִתְיַצֵּ֥ב אִ֖ישׁ בִּפְנֵיכֶ֑ם פַּחְדְּכֶ֨ם וּמֽוֹרַאֲכֶ֜ם יִתֵּ֣ן ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֗ם עַל־פְּנֵ֤י כָל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּדְרְכוּ־בָ֔הּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר לָכֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-yit'yatzev iysh bif'neykhem pach'd'khem vmvoraakhem yiten  y'hvah eloheykhem 'al-p'ney khal-haaretz asher tid'r'khv-vah kaasher diber lakhem (s)
translation: No man shall stand up to you: the L<small>ORD</small> your God will put the dread and the fear of you over the whole land in which you set foot, as He promised you.

hebrew: רְאֵ֗ה אָנֹכִ֛י נֹתֵ֥ן לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם בְּרָכָ֖ה וּקְלָלָֽה׃
transliteration: r'eh anokhiy noten lif'neykhem hayvom b'rakhah vk'lalah
translation: See, this day I set before you blessing and curse:

hebrew: אֶֽת־הַבְּרָכָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּשְׁמְע֗וּ אֶל־מִצְוֺת֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: et-hab'rakhah asher tish'm'v el-mitz'vot y'hvah eloheykhem asher anokhiy m'tzaveh et'khem hayvom
translation: blessing, if you obey the commandments of the L<small>ORD</small> your God that I enjoin upon you this day;

hebrew: וְהַקְּלָלָ֗ה אִם־לֹ֤א תִשְׁמְעוּ֙ אֶל־מִצְוֺת֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם וְסַרְתֶּ֣ם מִן־הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם לָלֶ֗כֶת אַחֲרֵ֛י אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יְדַעְתֶּֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hak'lalah im-lo tish'm'v el-mitz'vot y'hvah eloheykhem v'sar'tem min-haderekh' asher anokhiy m'tzaveh et'khem hayvom lalekhet acharey elohiym acheriym asher lo-y'da'tem (s)
translation: and curse, if you do not obey the commandments of the LORD your God, but turn away from the path that I enjoin upon you this day and follow other gods, hI.e., who have not proved themselves to you; cf. Hos. 13.4.whom you have not experienced.-h

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּ֤י יְבִֽיאֲךָ֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּ֑הּ וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אֶת־הַבְּרָכָה֙ עַל־הַ֣ר גְּרִזִ֔ים וְאֶת־הַקְּלָלָ֖ה עַל־הַ֥ר עֵיבָֽל׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy y'viyakha y'hvah eloheykha el-haaretz asher-atah va-shamah l'rish'tah v'natatah et-hab'rakhah 'al-har g'riziym v'et-hak'lalah 'al-har 'eyval
translation: When the L<small>ORD</small> your God brings you into the land that you are about to enter and possess, you shall pronounce the blessing at Mount Gerizim and the curse at Mount Ebal.—

hebrew: הֲלֹא־הֵ֜מָּה בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֗ן אַֽחֲרֵי֙ דֶּ֚רֶךְ מְב֣וֹא הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ בְּאֶ֙רֶץ֙ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י הַיֹּשֵׁ֖ב בָּעֲרָבָ֑ה מ֚וּל הַגִּלְגָּ֔ל אֵ֖צֶל אֵלוֹנֵ֥י מֹרֶֽה׃
transliteration: halo-hemah b'ever hayar'den acharey derekh' m'vvo hashemesh b'eretz hak'na'aniy hayoshev ba'aravah mvl hagil'gal etzel elvoney moreh
translation: Both are on the other side of the Jordan, beyond the west road that is in the land of the Canaanites who dwell in the Arabah—near Gilgal, by the terebinths of Moreh.

hebrew: כִּ֤י אַתֶּם֙ עֹבְרִ֣ים אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן לָבֹא֙ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם נֹתֵ֣ן לָכֶ֑ם וִֽירִשְׁתֶּ֥ם אֹתָ֖הּ וִֽישַׁבְתֶּם־בָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: kiy atem 'ov'riym et-hayar'den lavo lareshet et-haaretz asher-y'hvah eloheykhem noten lakhem viyrish'tem otah viyshav'tem-bah
translation: For you are about to cross the Jordan to enter and possess the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is assigning to you. When you have occupied it and are settled in it,

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֣ם לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֵ֥ת כָּל־הַֽחֻקִּ֖ים וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י נֹתֵ֥ן לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem la'asvot et kal-hachukiym v'et-hamish'patiym asher anokhiy noten lif'neykhem hayvom
translation: take care to observe all the laws and rules that I have set before you this day.

hebrew: אֵ֠לֶּה הַֽחֻקִּ֣ים וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִים֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּשְׁמְר֣וּן לַעֲשׂוֹת֒ בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֩ נָתַ֨ן יְהוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֧י אֲבֹתֶ֛יךָ לְךָ֖ לְרִשְׁתָּ֑הּ כָּל־הַיָּמִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֥ם חַיִּ֖ים עַל־הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
transliteration: eleh hachukiym v'hamish'patiym asher tish'm'rvn la'asvot baaretz asher natan y'hvah elohey avoteykha l'kha l'rish'tah kal-hayamiym asher-atem chayiym 'al-haadamah
translation: These are the laws and rules that you must carefully observe in the land that the L<small>ORD</small>, God of your fathers, is giving you to possess, as long as you live on earth.

hebrew: אַבֵּ֣ד תְּ֠אַבְּדוּן אֶֽת־כָּל־הַמְּקֹמ֞וֹת אֲשֶׁ֧ר עָֽבְדוּ־שָׁ֣ם הַגּוֹיִ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֛ם יֹרְשִׁ֥ים אֹתָ֖ם אֶת־אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם עַל־הֶהָרִ֤ים הָֽרָמִים֙ וְעַל־הַגְּבָע֔וֹת וְתַ֖חַת כָּל־עֵ֥ץ רַעֲנָן׃
transliteration: abed t'ab'dvn et-kal-ham'komvot asher 'av'dv-sham hagvoyim asher atem yor'shiym otam et-eloheyhem 'al-hehariym haramiym v'al-hag'va'vot v'tachat kal-'etz ra'anan
translation: You must destroy all the sites at which the nations you are to dispossess worshiped their gods, whether on lofty mountains and on hills or under any luxuriant tree.

hebrew: וְנִתַּצְתֶּ֣ם אֶת־מִזְבּחֹתָ֗ם וְשִׁבַּרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־מַצֵּ֣בֹתָ֔ם וַאֲשֵֽׁרֵיהֶם֙ תִּשְׂרְפ֣וּן בָּאֵ֔שׁ וּפְסִילֵ֥י אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶ֖ם תְּגַדֵּע֑וּן וְאִבַּדְתֶּ֣ם אֶת־שְׁמָ֔ם מִן־הַמָּק֖וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
transliteration: v'nitatz'tem et-miz'bchotam v'shibar'tem et-matzevotam vaashereyhem tis'r'fvn baesh vf'siyley eloheyhem t'gade'vn v'ibad'tem et-sh'mam min-hamakvom hahv
translation: Tear down their altars, smash their pillars, put their sacred posts to the fire, and cut down the images of their gods, obliterating their name from that site.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תַעֲשׂ֣וּן כֵּ֔ן לַיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: lo-ta'asvn ken layhvah eloheykhem
translation: Do not worship the L<small>ORD</small> your God in like manner,

hebrew: כִּ֠י אִֽם־אֶל־הַמָּק֞וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֨ר יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ מִכָּל־שִׁבְטֵיכֶ֔ם לָשׂ֥וּם אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ שָׁ֑ם לְשִׁכְנ֥וֹ תִדְרְשׁ֖וּ וּבָ֥אתָ שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: kiy im-el-hamakvom asher-yiv'char y'hvah eloheykhem mikal-shiv'teykhem lasvm et-sh'mvo sham l'shikh'nvo tid'r'shv vvata shamah
translation: but look only to the site that the L<small>ORD</small> your God will choose amidst all your tribes as His habitation, to establish His name there. There you are to go,

hebrew: וַהֲבֵאתֶ֣ם שָׁ֗מָּה עֹלֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ וְזִבְחֵיכֶ֔ם וְאֵת֙ מַעְשְׂרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת תְּרוּמַ֣ת יֶדְכֶ֑ם וְנִדְרֵיכֶם֙ וְנִדְבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וּבְכֹרֹ֥ת בְּקַרְכֶ֖ם וְצֹאנְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vahavetem shamah 'oloteykhem v'ziv'cheykhem v'et ma's'roteykhem v'et t'rvmat yed'khem v'nid'reykhem v'nid'voteykhem vv'khorot b'kar'khem v'tzon'khem
translation: and there you are to bring your burnt offerings and other sacrifices, your tithes and contributions,aLit. “the contribution(s) of your hands.” your votive and freewill offerings, and the firstlings of your herds and flocks.

hebrew: וַאֲכַלְתֶּם־שָׁ֗ם לִפְנֵי֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם וּשְׂמַחְתֶּ֗ם בְּכֹל֙ מִשְׁלַ֣ח יֶדְכֶ֔ם אַתֶּ֖ם וּבָתֵּיכֶ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּֽרַכְךָ֖ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vaakhal'tem-sham lif'ney y'hvah eloheykhem vs'mach'tem b'khol mish'lach yed'khem atem vvateykhem asher berakh'kha y'hvah eloheykha
translation: Together with your households, you shall feast there before the L<small>ORD</small> your God, happy in all the undertakings in which the L<small>ORD</small> your God has blessed you.

hebrew: לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּן כְּ֠כֹל אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲנַ֧חְנוּ עֹשִׂ֛ים פֹּ֖ה הַיּ֑וֹם אִ֖ישׁ כָּל־הַיָּשָׁ֥ר בְּעֵינָֽיו׃
transliteration: lo ta'asvn k'khol asher anach'nv 'osiym poh hayvom iysh kal-hayashar b'eynayv
translation: You shall not act at all as we now act here, every man as he pleases,

hebrew: כִּ֥י לֹא־בָּאתֶ֖ם עַד־עָ֑תָּה אֶל־הַמְּנוּחָה֙ וְאֶל־הַֽנַּחֲלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: kiy lo-batem 'ad-'atah el-ham'nvchah v'el-hanachalah asher-y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh'
translation: because you have not yet come to the allotted haven that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you.

hebrew: וַעֲבַרְתֶּם֮ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּן֒ וִֽישַׁבְתֶּ֣ם בָּאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם מַנְחִ֣יל אֶתְכֶ֑ם וְהֵנִ֨יחַ לָכֶ֧ם מִכָּל־אֹיְבֵיכֶ֛ם מִסָּבִ֖יב וִֽישַׁבְתֶּם־בֶּֽטַח׃
transliteration: va'avar'tem et-hayar'den viyshav'tem baaretz asher-y'hvah eloheykhem man'chiyl et'khem v'heniycha lakhem mikal-oy'veykhem misaviyv viyshav'tem-betach
translation: When you cross the Jordan and settle in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is allotting to you, and He grants you safety from all your enemies around you and you live in security,

hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַר֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֥ם בּוֹ֙ לְשַׁכֵּ֤ן שְׁמוֹ֙ שָׁ֔ם שָׁ֣מָּה תָבִ֔יאוּ אֵ֛ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י מְצַוֶּ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֑ם עוֹלֹתֵיכֶ֣ם וְזִבְחֵיכֶ֗ם מַעְשְׂרֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ וּתְרֻמַ֣ת יֶדְכֶ֔ם וְכֹל֙ מִבְחַ֣ר נִדְרֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּדְּר֖וּ לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hayah hamakvom asher-yiv'char y'hvah eloheykhem bvo l'shaken sh'mvo sham shamah taviyv et kal-asher anokhiy m'tzaveh et'khem 'voloteykhem v'ziv'cheykhem ma's'roteykhem vt'rumat yed'khem v'khol miv'char nid'reykhem asher tid'rv layhvah
translation: then you must bring everything that I command you to the site where the LORD your God will choose to establish His name: your burnt offerings and other sacrifices, your tithes and contributions,aLit. “the contribution(s) of your hands.” and all the choice votive offerings that you vow to the LORD.

hebrew: וּשְׂמַחְתֶּ֗ם לִפְנֵי֮ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֒ אַתֶּ֗ם וּבְנֵיכֶם֙ וּבְנֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְעַבְדֵיכֶ֖ם וְאַמְהֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וְהַלֵּוִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּשַֽׁעֲרֵיכֶ֔ם כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין ל֛וֹ חֵ֥לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֖ה אִתְּכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vs'mach'tem lif'ney y'hvah eloheykhem atem vv'neykhem vv'noteykhem v'av'deykhem v'am'hoteykhem v'haleviy asher b'sha'areykhem kiy eyn lvo chelek v'nachalah it'khem
translation: And you shall rejoice before the L<small>ORD</small> your God with your sons and daughters and with your male and female slaves, along with the Levite in your settlements, for he has no territorial allotment among you.

hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֔ פֶּֽן־תַּעֲלֶ֖ה עֹלֹתֶ֑יךָ בְּכָל־מָק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּרְאֶֽה׃
transliteration: hishamer l'kha pen-ta'aleh 'oloteykha b'khal-makvom asher tir'eh
translation: Take care not to sacrifice your burnt offerings in any place you like,

hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־בַּמָּק֞וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֤ר יְהוָה֙ בְּאַחַ֣ד שְׁבָטֶ֔יךָ שָׁ֖ם תַּעֲלֶ֣ה עֹלֹתֶ֑יךָ וְשָׁ֣ם תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י מְצַוֶּֽךָּ׃
transliteration: kiy im-bamakvom asher-yiv'char y'hvah b'achad sh'vateykha sham ta'aleh 'oloteykha v'sham ta'aseh kol asher anokhiy m'tzaveka
translation: but only in the place that the L<small>ORD</small> will choose in one of your tribal territories. There you shall sacrifice your burnt offerings and there you shall observe all that I enjoin upon you.

hebrew: רַק֩ בְּכָל־אַוַּ֨ת נַפְשְׁךָ֜ תִּזְבַּ֣ח ׀ וְאָכַלְתָּ֣ בָשָׂ֗ר כְּבִרְכַּ֨ת יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָֽתַן־לְךָ֖ בְּכָל־שְׁעָרֶ֑יךָ הַטָּמֵ֤א וְהַטָּהוֹר֙ יֹאכְלֶ֔נּוּ כַּצְּבִ֖י וְכָאַיָּֽל׃
transliteration: rak b'khal-avat naf'sh'kha tiz'bach  v'akhal'ta vasar k'vir'kat y'hvah eloheykha asher natan-l'kha b'khal-sh'areykha hatame v'hatahvor yokh'lenv katz'viy v'khaayal
translation: But whenever you desire, you may slaughter and eat meat in any of your settlements, according to the blessing that the LORD your God has granted you. The unclean and the clean alike may partake of it, as of the gazelle and the deer.bI.e., animals that may be eaten (cf. 14.5; Lev. 11.1 ff.), but not specified (Lev. 1.1 ff.).

hebrew: רַ֥ק הַדָּ֖ם לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֑לוּ עַל־הָאָ֥רֶץ תִּשְׁפְּכֶ֖נּוּ כַּמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: rak hadam lo tokhelv 'al-haaretz tish'p'khenv kamayim
translation: But you must not partake of the blood; you shall pour it out on the ground like water.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תוּכַ֞ל לֶאֱכֹ֣ל בִּשְׁעָרֶ֗יךָ מַעְשַׂ֤ר דְּגָֽנְךָ֙ וְתִֽירֹשְׁךָ֣ וְיִצְהָרֶ֔ךָ וּבְכֹרֹ֥ת בְּקָרְךָ֖ וְצֹאנֶ֑ךָ וְכָל־נְדָרֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּדֹּ֔ר וְנִדְבֹתֶ֖יךָ וּתְרוּמַ֥ת יָדֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: lo-tvkhal leekhol bish'areykha ma'sar d'gan'kha v'tiyrosh'kha v'yitz'harekha vv'khorot b'kar'kha v'tzonekha v'khal-n'dareykha asher tidor v'nid'voteykha vt'rvmat yadekha
translation: You may not partake in your settlements of the tithes of your new grain or wine or oil, or of the firstlings of your herds and flocks, or of any of the votive offerings that you vow, or of your freewill offerings, or of your contributions.aLit. “the contribution(s) of your hands.”

hebrew: כִּ֡י אִם־לִפְנֵי֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ תֹּאכְלֶ֗נּוּ בַּמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִבְחַ֜ר יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶיךָ֮ בּוֹ֒ אַתָּ֨ה וּבִנְךָ֤ וּבִתֶּ֙ךָ֙ וְעַבְדְּךָ֣ וַאֲמָתֶ֔ךָ וְהַלֵּוִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּשְׁעָרֶ֑יךָ וְשָׂמַחְתָּ֗ לִפְנֵי֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכֹ֖ל מִשְׁלַ֥ח יָדֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: kiy im-lif'ney y'hvah eloheykha tokh'lenv bamakvom asher yiv'char y'hvah eloheykha bvo atah vvin'kha vvitekha v'av'd'kha vaamatekha v'haleviy asher bish'areykha v'samach'ta lif'ney y'hvah eloheykha b'khol mish'lach yadekha
translation: These you must consume before the L<small>ORD</small> your God in the place that the L<small>ORD</small> your God will choose—you and your sons and your daughters, your male and female slaves, and the Levite in your settlements—happy before the L<small>ORD</small> your God in all your undertakings.

hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֔ פֶּֽן־תַּעֲזֹ֖ב אֶת־הַלֵּוִ֑י כָּל־יָמֶ֖יךָ עַל־אַדְמָתֶֽךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: hishamer l'kha pen-ta'azov et-haleviy kal-yameykha 'al-ad'matekha (s)
translation: Be sure not to neglect the Levite as long as you live in your land.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יַרְחִיב֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֥יךָ אֶֽת־גְּבֽוּלְךָ֮ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּר־לָךְ֒ וְאָמַרְתָּ֙ אֹכְלָ֣ה בָשָׂ֔ר כִּֽי־תְאַוֶּ֥ה נַפְשְׁךָ֖ לֶאֱכֹ֣ל בָּשָׂ֑ר בְּכָל־אַוַּ֥ת נַפְשְׁךָ֖ תֹּאכַ֥ל בָּשָֽׂר׃
transliteration: kiy-yar'chiyv y'hvah eloheykha et-g'vvl'kha kaasher diber-lakh' v'amar'ta okh'lah vasar kiy-t'aveh naf'sh'kha leekhol basar b'khal-avat naf'sh'kha tokhal basar
translation: When the L<small>ORD</small> enlarges your territory, as He has promised you, and you say, “I shall eat some meat,” for you have the urge to eat meat, you may eat meat whenever you wish.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִרְחַ֨ק מִמְּךָ֜ הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִבְחַ֜ר יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶיךָ֮ לָשׂ֣וּם שְׁמ֣וֹ שָׁם֒ וְזָבַחְתָּ֞ מִבְּקָרְךָ֣ וּמִצֹּֽאנְךָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֤ן יְהוָה֙ לְךָ֔ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוִּיתִ֑ךָ וְאָֽכַלְתָּ֙ בִּשְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ בְּכֹ֖ל אַוַּ֥ת נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
transliteration: kiy-yir'chak mim'kha hamakvom asher yiv'char y'hvah eloheykha lasvm sh'mvo sham v'zavach'ta mib'kar'kha vmitzon'kha asher natan y'hvah l'kha kaasher tziviytikha v'akhal'ta bish'areykha b'khol avat naf'shekha
translation: If the place where the L<small>ORD</small> has chosen to establish His name is too far from you, you may slaughter any of the cattle or sheep that the L<small>ORD</small> gives you, as I have instructed you; and you may eat to your heart’s content in your settlements.

hebrew: אַ֗ךְ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יֵאָכֵ֤ל אֶֽת־הַצְּבִי֙ וְאֶת־הָ֣אַיָּ֔ל כֵּ֖ן תֹּאכְלֶ֑נּוּ הַטָּמֵא֙ וְהַטָּה֔וֹר יַחְדָּ֖ו יֹאכְלֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: akh' kaasher yeakhel et-hatz'viy v'et-haayal ken tokh'lenv hatame v'hatahvor yach'dav yokh'lenv
translation: Eat it, however, as the gazelle and the deer are eaten: the unclean may eat it together with the clean.

hebrew: רַ֣ק חֲזַ֗ק לְבִלְתִּי֙ אֲכֹ֣ל הַדָּ֔ם כִּ֥י הַדָּ֖ם ה֣וּא הַנָּ֑פֶשׁ וְלֹא־תֹאכַ֥ל הַנֶּ֖פֶשׁ עִם־הַבָּשָֽׂר׃
transliteration: rak chazak l'vil'tiy akhol hadam kiy hadam hv hanafesh v'lo-tokhal hanefesh 'im-habasar
translation: But make sure that you do not partake of the blood; for the blood is the life, and you must not consume the life with the flesh.

hebrew: לֹ֖א תֹּאכְלֶ֑נּוּ עַל־הָאָ֥רֶץ תִּשְׁפְּכֶ֖נּוּ כַּמָּֽיִם׃
transliteration: lo tokh'lenv 'al-haaretz tish'p'khenv kamayim
translation: You must not partake of it; you must pour it out on the ground like water:

hebrew: לֹ֖א תֹּאכְלֶ֑נּוּ לְמַ֨עַן יִיטַ֤ב לְךָ֙ וּלְבָנֶ֣יךָ אַחֲרֶ֔יךָ כִּֽי־תַעֲשֶׂ֥ה הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: lo tokh'lenv l'ma'an yiytav l'kha vl'vaneykha achareykha kiy-ta'aseh hayashar b'eyney y'hvah
translation: you must not partake of it, in order that it may go well with you and with your descendants to come, for you will be doing what is right in the sight of the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: רַ֧ק קָֽדָשֶׁ֛יךָ אֲשֶׁר־יִהְי֥וּ לְךָ֖ וּנְדָרֶ֑יךָ תִּשָּׂ֣א וּבָ֔אתָ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֥ר יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: rak kadasheykha asher-yih'yv l'kha vn'dareykha tisa vvata el-hamakvom asher-yiv'char y'hvah
translation: But such sacred and votive donations as you may have cLit. “you shall pick up and come.”shall be taken by you-c to the site that the LORD will choose.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ עֹלֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ הַבָּשָׂ֣ר וְהַדָּ֔ם עַל־מִזְבַּ֖ח יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְדַם־זְבָחֶ֗יךָ יִשָּׁפֵךְ֙ עַל־מִזְבַּח֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְהַבָּשָׂ֖ר תֹּאכֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'asiyta 'oloteykha habasar v'hadam 'al-miz'bach y'hvah eloheykha v'dam-z'vacheykha yishafekh' 'al-miz'bach y'hvah eloheykha v'habasar tokhel
translation: You shall offer your burnt offerings, both the flesh and the blood, on the altar of the L<small>ORD</small> your God; and of your other sacrifices, the blood shall be poured out on the altar of the L<small>ORD</small> your God, and you shall eat the flesh.

hebrew: שְׁמֹ֣ר וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֗ אֵ֚ת כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י מְצַוֶּ֑ךָּ לְמַעַן֩ יִיטַ֨ב לְךָ֜ וּלְבָנֶ֤יךָ אַחֲרֶ֙יךָ֙ עַד־עוֹלָ֔ם כִּ֤י תַעֲשֶׂה֙ הַטּ֣וֹב וְהַיָּשָׁ֔ר בְּעֵינֵ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: sh'mor v'shama'ta et kal-had'variym haeleh asher anokhiy m'tzaveka l'ma'an yiytav l'kha vl'vaneykha achareykha 'ad-'volam kiy ta'aseh hatvov v'hayashar b'eyney y'hvah eloheykha (s)
translation: Be careful to heed all these commandments that I enjoin upon you; thus it will go well with you and with your descendants after you forever, for you will be doing what is good and right in the sight of the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יַכְרִית֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֛מָּה לָרֶ֥שֶׁת אוֹתָ֖ם מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ וְיָרַשְׁתָּ֣ אֹתָ֔ם וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֖ בְּאַרְצָֽם׃
transliteration: kiy-yakh'riyt y'hvah eloheykha et-hagvoyim asher atah va-shamah lareshet votam mipaneykha v'yarash'ta otam v'yashav'ta b'ar'tzam
translation: When the L<small>ORD</small> your God has cut down before you the nations that you are about to enter and dispossess, and you have dispossessed them and settled in their land,

hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֗ פֶּן־תִּנָּקֵשׁ֙ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ם אַחֲרֵ֖י הִשָּׁמְדָ֣ם מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ וּפֶן־תִּדְרֹ֨שׁ לֵֽאלֹהֵיהֶ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר אֵיכָ֨ה יַעַבְד֜וּ הַגּוֹיִ֤ם הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ אֶת־אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם וְאֶעֱשֶׂה־כֵּ֖ן גַּם־אָֽנִי׃
transliteration: hishamer l'kha pen-tinakesh achareyhem acharey hisham'dam mipaneykha vfen-tid'rosh leloheyhem lemor eykhah ya'av'dv hagvoyim haeleh et-eloheyhem v'e'eseh-ken gam-aniy
translation: beware of being lured into their ways after they have been wiped out before you! Do not inquire about their gods, saying, “How did those nations worship their gods? I too will follow those practices.”

hebrew: לֹא־תַעֲשֶׂ֣ה כֵ֔ן לַיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ כִּי֩ כָּל־תּוֹעֲבַ֨ת יְהוָ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׂנֵ֗א עָשׂוּ֙ לֵאלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם כִּ֣י גַ֤ם אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶם֙ וְאֶת־בְּנֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם יִשְׂרְפ֥וּ בָאֵ֖שׁ לֵֽאלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: lo-ta'aseh khen layhvah eloheykha kiy kal-tvo'avat y'hvah asher sane 'asv leloheyhem kiy gam et-b'neyhem v'et-b'noteyhem yis'r'fv vaesh leloheyhem
translation: You shall not act thus toward the L<small>ORD</small> your God, for they perform for their gods every abhorrent act that the L<small>ORD</small> detests; they even offer up their sons and daughters in fire to their gods.

hebrew: אֵ֣ת כָּל־הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֤ר אָנֹכִי֙ מְצַוֶּ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֹת֥וֹ תִשְׁמְר֖וּ לַעֲשׂ֑וֹת לֹא־תֹסֵ֣ף עָלָ֔יו וְלֹ֥א תִגְרַ֖ע מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: et kal-hadavar asher anokhiy m'tzaveh et'khem otvo tish'm'rv la'asvot lo-tosef 'alayv v'lo tig'ra' mimenv (f)
translation: Be careful to observe only that which I enjoin upon you: neither add to it nor take away from it.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יָק֤וּם בְּקִרְבְּךָ֙ נָבִ֔יא א֖וֹ חֹלֵ֣ם חֲל֑וֹם וְנָתַ֥ן אֵלֶ֛יךָ א֖וֹת א֥וֹ מוֹפֵֽת׃
transliteration: kiy-yakvm b'kir'b'kha naviy vo cholem chalvom v'natan eleykha vot vo mvofet
translation: If there appears among you a prophet or a dream-diviner and he gives you a sign or a portent,

hebrew: וּבָ֤א הָאוֹת֙ וְהַמּוֹפֵ֔ת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ לֵאמֹ֑ר נֵֽלְכָ֞ה אַחֲרֵ֨י אֱלֹהִ֧ים אֲחֵרִ֛ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יְדַעְתָּ֖ם וְנָֽעָבְדֵֽם׃
transliteration: vva havot v'hamvofet asher-diber eleykha lemor nel'khah acharey elohiym acheriym asher lo-y'da'tam v'na'av'dem
translation: saying, “Let us follow and worship another god”—whom you have not experiencedaSee note on 11.28.—even if the sign or portent that he named to you comes true,

hebrew: לֹ֣א תִשְׁמַ֗ע אֶל־דִּבְרֵי֙ הַנָּבִ֣יא הַה֔וּא א֛וֹ אֶל־חוֹלֵ֥ם הַחֲל֖וֹם הַה֑וּא כִּ֣י מְנַסֶּ֞ה יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם לָדַ֗עַת הֲיִשְׁכֶ֤ם אֹֽהֲבִים֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכָל־לְבַבְכֶ֖ם וּבְכָל־נַפְשְׁכֶֽם׃
transliteration: lo tish'ma' el-div'rey hanaviy hahv vo el-chvolem hachalvom hahv kiy m'naseh y'hvah eloheykhem et'khem lada'at hayish'khem ohaviym et-y'hvah eloheykhem b'khal-l'vav'khem vv'khal-naf'sh'khem
translation: do not heed the words of that prophet or that dream-diviner. For the L<small>ORD</small> your God is testing you to see whether you really love the L<small>ORD</small> your God with all your heart and soul.

hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֨י יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֛ם תֵּלֵ֖כוּ וְאֹת֣וֹ תִירָ֑אוּ וְאֶת־מִצְוֺתָ֤יו תִּשְׁמֹ֙רוּ֙ וּבְקֹל֣וֹ תִשְׁמָ֔עוּ וְאֹת֥וֹ תַעֲבֹ֖דוּ וּב֥וֹ תִדְבָּקֽוּן׃
transliteration: acharey y'hvah eloheykhem telekhv v'otvo tiyrav v'et-mitz'votayv tish'morv vv'kolvo tish'ma'v v'otvo ta'avodv vvvo tid'bakvn
translation: Follow none but the L<small>ORD</small> your God, and revere none but Him; observe His commandments alone, and heed only His orders; worship none but Him, and hold fast to Him.

hebrew: וְהַנָּבִ֣יא הַה֡וּא א֣וֹ חֹלֵם֩ הַחֲל֨וֹם הַה֜וּא יוּמָ֗ת כִּ֣י דִבֶּר־סָ֠רָה עַל־יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֜ם הַמּוֹצִ֥יא אֶתְכֶ֣ם ׀ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֗יִם וְהַפֹּֽדְךָ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית עֲבָדִ֔ים לְהַדִּֽיחֲךָ֙ מִן־הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֧ר צִוְּךָ֛ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לָלֶ֣כֶת בָּ֑הּ וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'hanaviy hahv vo cholem hachalvom hahv yvmat kiy diber-sarah 'al-y'hvah eloheykhem hamvotziy et'khem  meeretz mitz'rayim v'hapod'kha mibeyt 'avadiym l'hadiychakha min-haderekh' asher tziv'kha y'hvah eloheykha lalekhet bah vvi'ar'ta hara' mikir'bekha
translation: As for that prophet or dream-diviner, he shall be put to death; for he urged disloyalty to the L<small>ORD</small> your God—who freed you from the land of Egypt and who redeemed you from the house of bondage—to make you stray from the path that the L<small>ORD</small> your God commanded you to follow. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst.

hebrew: כִּ֣י יְסִֽיתְךָ֡ אָחִ֣יךָ בֶן־אִ֠מֶּךָ אֽוֹ־בִנְךָ֨ אֽוֹ־בִתְּךָ֜ א֣וֹ ׀ אֵ֣שֶׁת חֵיקֶ֗ךָ א֧וֹ רֵֽעֲךָ֛ אֲשֶׁ֥ר כְּנַפְשְׁךָ֖ בַּסֵּ֣תֶר לֵאמֹ֑ר נֵֽלְכָ֗ה וְנַֽעַבְדָה֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתָּ אַתָּ֖ה וַאֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: kiy y'siyt'kha achiykha ven-imekha vo-vin'kha vo-vit'kha vo  eshet cheykekha vo re'akha asher k'naf'sh'kha baseter lemor nel'khah v'na'av'dah elohiym acheriym asher lo yada'ta atah vaavoteykha
translation: If your brother, bSamaritan reads, “the son of your father or the son of your mother.”your own mother’s son,-b or your son or daughter, or the wife of your bosom, or your cLit. “your friend who is as yourself.”closest friend-c entices you in secret, saying, “Come let us worship other gods”—whom neither you nor your fathers have experiencedaSee note on 11.28.—

hebrew: מֵאֱלֹהֵ֣י הָֽעַמִּ֗ים אֲשֶׁר֙ סְבִיבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם הַקְּרֹבִ֣ים אֵלֶ֔יךָ א֖וֹ הָרְחֹקִ֣ים מִמֶּ֑ךָּ מִקְצֵ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ וְעַד־קְצֵ֥ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: meelohey ha'amiym asher s'viyvoteykhem hak'roviym eleykha vo har'chokiym mimeka mik'tzeh haaretz v'ad-k'tzeh haaretz
translation: from among the gods of the peoples around you, either near to you or distant, anywhere from one end of the earth to the other:

hebrew: לֹא־תֹאבֶ֣ה ל֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א תִשְׁמַ֖ע אֵלָ֑יו וְלֹא־תָח֤וֹס עֵֽינְךָ֙ עָלָ֔יו וְלֹֽא־תַחְמֹ֥ל וְלֹֽא־תְכַסֶּ֖ה עָלָֽיו׃
transliteration: lo-toveh lvo v'lo tish'ma' elayv v'lo-tachvos 'eyn'kha 'alayv v'lo-tach'mol v'lo-t'khaseh 'alayv
translation: do not assent or give heed to him. Show him no pity or compassion, and do not shield him;

hebrew: כִּ֤י הָרֹג֙ תַּֽהַרְגֶ֔נּוּ יָֽדְךָ֛ תִּֽהְיֶה־בּ֥וֹ בָרִֽאשׁוֹנָ֖ה לַהֲמִית֑וֹ וְיַ֥ד כָּל־הָעָ֖ם בָּאַחֲרֹנָֽה׃
transliteration: kiy harog tahar'genv yad'kha tih'yeh-bvo varishvonah lahamiytvo v'yad kal-ha'am baacharonah
translation: but take his life. Let your hand be the first against him to put him to death, and the hand of the rest of the people thereafter.

hebrew: וּסְקַלְתּ֥וֹ בָאֲבָנִ֖ים וָמֵ֑ת כִּ֣י בִקֵּ֗שׁ לְהַדִּֽיחֲךָ֙ מֵעַל֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ הַמּוֹצִיאֲךָ֛ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים׃
transliteration: vs'kal'tvo vaavaniym vamet kiy vikesh l'hadiychakha me'al y'hvah eloheykha hamvotziyakha meeretz mitz'rayim mibeyt 'avadiym
translation: Stone him to death, for he sought to make you stray from the L<small>ORD</small> your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

hebrew: וְכָל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יִשְׁמְע֖וּ וְיִֽרָא֑וּן וְלֹֽא־יוֹסִ֣פוּ לַעֲשׂ֗וֹת כַּדָּבָ֥ר הָרָ֛ע הַזֶּ֖ה בְּקִרְבֶּֽךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khal-yis'rael yish'm'v v'yiravn v'lo-yvosifv la'asvot kadavar hara' hazeh b'kir'bekha (s)
translation: Thus all Israel will hear and be afraid, and such evil things will not be done again in your midst.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תִשְׁמַ֞ע בְּאַחַ֣ת עָרֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁר֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֛ לָשֶׁ֥בֶת שָׁ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: kiy-tish'ma' b'achat 'areykha asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha lashevet sham lemor
translation: If you hear it said, of one of the towns that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you to dwell in,

hebrew: יָצְא֞וּ אֲנָשִׁ֤ים בְּנֵֽי־בְלִיַּ֙עַל֙ מִקִּרְבֶּ֔ךָ וַיַּדִּ֛יחוּ אֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י עִירָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר נֵלְכָ֗ה וְנַעַבְדָ֛ה אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יְדַעְתֶּֽם׃
transliteration: yatz'v anashiym b'ney-v'liya'al mikir'bekha vayadiychv et-yosh'vey 'iyram lemor nel'khah v'na'av'dah elohiym acheriym asher lo-y'da'tem
translation: that some scoundrels from among you have gone and subverted the inhabitants of their town, saying, “Come let us worship other gods”—whom you have not experienced—

hebrew: וְדָרַשְׁתָּ֧ וְחָקַרְתָּ֧ וְשָׁאַלְתָּ֖ הֵיטֵ֑ב וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֱמֶת֙ נָכ֣וֹן הַדָּבָ֔ר נֶעֶשְׂתָ֛ה הַתּוֹעֵבָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בְּקִרְבֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'darash'ta v'chakar'ta v'shaal'ta heytev v'hineh emet nakhvon hadavar ne'es'tah hatvo'evah hazot b'kir'bekha
translation: you shall investigate and inquire and interrogate thoroughly. If it is true, the fact is established—that abhorrent thing was perpetrated in your midst—

hebrew: הַכֵּ֣ה תַכֶּ֗ה אֶת־יֹֽשְׁבֵ֛י הָעִ֥יר ההוא [הַהִ֖יא] לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב הַחֲרֵ֨ם אֹתָ֧הּ וְאֶת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֛הּ וְאֶת־בְּהֶמְתָּ֖הּ לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: hakeh takeh et-yosh'vey ha'iyr hhv [hahiy] l'fiy-charev hacharem otah v'et-kal-asher-bah v'et-b'hem'tah l'fiy-charev
translation: put the inhabitants of that town to the sword and put its cattle to the sword. Doom it and all that is in it to destruction:
