hebrew: וְאֶת־כָּל־שְׁלָלָ֗הּ תִּקְבֹּץ֮ אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ רְחֹבָהּ֒ וְשָׂרַפְתָּ֨ בָאֵ֜שׁ אֶת־הָעִ֤יר וְאֶת־כָּל־שְׁלָלָהּ֙ כָּלִ֔יל לַיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְהָיְתָה֙ תֵּ֣ל עוֹלָ֔ם לֹ֥א תִבָּנֶ֖ה עֽוֹד׃
transliteration: v'et-kal-sh'lalah tik'botz el-tvokh' r'chovah v'saraf'ta vaesh et-ha'iyr v'et-kal-sh'lalah kaliyl layhvah eloheykha v'hay'tah tel 'volam lo tibaneh 'vod
translation: gather all its spoil into the open square, and burn the town and all its spoil as a holocaust to the L<small>ORD</small> your God. And it shall remain an everlasting ruin, never to be rebuilt.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יִדְבַּ֧ק בְּיָדְךָ֛ מְא֖וּמָה מִן־הַחֵ֑רֶם לְמַעַן֩ יָשׁ֨וּב יְהוָ֜ה מֵחֲר֣וֹן אַפּ֗וֹ וְנָֽתַן־לְךָ֤ רַחֲמִים֙ וְרִֽחַמְךָ֣ וְהִרְבֶּ֔ךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖ע לַאֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'lo-yid'bak b'yad'kha m'vmah min-hacherem l'ma'an yashvv y'hvah mecharvon apvo v'natan-l'kha rachamiym v'richam'kha v'hir'bekha kaasher nish'ba' laavoteykha
translation: Let nothing that has been doomed stick to your hand, in order that the L<small>ORD</small> may turn from His blazing anger and show you compassion, and in His compassion increase you as He promised your fathers on oath—

hebrew: כִּ֣י תִשְׁמַ֗ע בְּקוֹל֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹר֙ אֶת־כָּל־מִצְוֺתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ הַיָּשָׁ֔ר בְּעֵינֵ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy tish'ma' b'kvol y'hvah eloheykha lish'mor et-kal-mitz'votayv asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom la'asvot hayashar b'eyney y'hvah eloheykha (s)
translation: for you will be heeding the L<small>ORD</small> your God, obeying all His commandments that I enjoin upon you this day, doing what is right in the sight of the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: בָּנִ֣ים אַתֶּ֔ם לַֽיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם לֹ֣א תִתְגֹּֽדְד֗וּ וְלֹֽא־תָשִׂ֧ימוּ קָרְחָ֛ה בֵּ֥ין עֵינֵיכֶ֖ם לָמֵֽת׃
transliteration: baniym atem layhvah eloheykhem lo tit'god'dv v'lo-tasiymv kar'chah beyn 'eyneykhem lamet
translation: You are children of the L<small>ORD</small> your God. You shall not gash yourselves or shave the front of your heads because of the dead.

hebrew: כִּ֣י עַ֤ם קָדוֹשׁ֙ אַתָּ֔ה לַיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וּבְךָ֞ בָּחַ֣ר יְהוָ֗ה לִֽהְי֥וֹת לוֹ֙ לְעַ֣ם סְגֻלָּ֔ה מִכֹּל֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy 'am kadvosh atah layhvah eloheykha vv'kha bachar y'hvah lih'yvot lvo l'am s'gulah mikol ha'amiym asher 'al-p'ney haadamah (s)
translation: For you are a people consecrated to the L<small>ORD</small> your God: the L<small>ORD</small> your God chose you from among all other peoples on earth to be His treasured people.

hebrew: לֹ֥א תֹאכַ֖ל כָּל־תּוֹעֵבָֽה׃
transliteration: lo tokhal kal-tvo'evah
translation: You shall not eat anything abhorrent.

hebrew: זֹ֥את הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֹּאכֵ֑לוּ שׁ֕וֹר שֵׂ֥ה כְשָׂבִ֖ים וְשֵׂ֥ה עִזִּֽים׃
transliteration: zot hab'hemah asher tokhelv shvor seh kh'saviym v'seh 'iziym
translation: These are the animals that you may eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat;

hebrew: אַיָּ֥ל וּצְבִ֖י וְיַחְמ֑וּר וְאַקּ֥וֹ וְדִישֹׁ֖ן וּתְא֥וֹ וָזָֽמֶר׃
transliteration: ayal vtz'viy v'yach'mvr v'akvo v'diyshon vt'vo vazamer
translation: aA number of these creatures cannot be identified with certainty. the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, the mountain sheep,

hebrew: וְכָל־בְּהֵמָ֞ה מַפְרֶ֣סֶת פַּרְסָ֗ה וְשֹׁסַ֤עַת שֶׁ֙סַע֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י פְרָס֔וֹת מַעֲלַ֥ת גֵּרָ֖ה בַּבְּהֵמָ֑ה אֹתָ֖הּ תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: v'khal-b'hemah maf'reset par'sah v'shosa'at shesa' sh'tey f'rasvot ma'alat gerah bab'hemah otah tokhelv
translation: and any other animal that has true hoofs which are cleft in two and brings up the cud—such you may eat.

hebrew: אַ֣ךְ אֶת־זֶ֞ה לֹ֤א תֹֽאכְלוּ֙ מִמַּֽעֲלֵ֣י הַגֵּרָ֔ה וּמִמַּפְרִיסֵ֥י הַפַּרְסָ֖ה הַשְּׁסוּעָ֑ה אֶֽת־הַ֠גָּמָל וְאֶת־הָאַרְנֶ֨בֶת וְאֶת־הַשָּׁפָ֜ן כִּֽי־מַעֲלֵ֧ה גֵרָ֣ה הֵ֗מָּה וּפַרְסָה֙ לֹ֣א הִפְרִ֔יסוּ טְמֵאִ֥ים הֵ֖ם לָכֶֽם׃
transliteration: akh' et-zeh lo tokh'lv mima'aley hagerah vmimaf'riysey hapar'sah hash'sv'ah et-hagamal v'et-haar'nevet v'et-hashafan kiy-ma'aleh gerah hemah vfar'sah lo hif'riysv t'meiym hem lakhem
translation: But the following, which do bring up the cud or have true hoofs which are cleft through, you may not eat: the camel, the hare, and the daman—for although they bring up the cud, they have no true hoofs—they are unclean for you;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַ֠חֲזִיר כִּֽי־מַפְרִ֨יס פַּרְסָ֥ה הוּא֙ וְלֹ֣א גֵרָ֔ה טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶ֑ם מִבְּשָׂרָם֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֔לוּ וּבְנִבְלָתָ֖ם לֹ֥א תִגָּֽעוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'et-hachaziyr kiy-maf'riys par'sah hv v'lo gerah tame hv lakhem mib'saram lo tokhelv vv'niv'latam lo tiga'v (s)
translation: also the swine—for although it has true hoofs, it does not bring up the cud—is unclean for you. You shall not eat of their flesh or touch their carcasses.

hebrew: אֶת־זֶה֙ תֹּֽאכְל֔וּ מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּמָּ֑יִם כֹּ֧ל אֲשֶׁר־ל֛וֹ סְנַפִּ֥יר וְקַשְׂקֶ֖שֶׂת תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: et-zeh tokh'lv mikol asher bamayim kol asher-lvo s'napiyr v'kas'keset tokhelv
translation: These you may eat of all that live in water: you may eat anything that has fins and scales.

hebrew: וְכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁ֧ר אֵֽין־ל֛וֹ סְנַפִּ֥יר וְקַשְׂקֶ֖שֶׂת לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֑לוּ טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khol asher eyn-lvo s'napiyr v'kas'keset lo tokhelv tame hv lakhem (s)
translation: But you may not eat anything that has no fins and scales: it is unclean for you.

hebrew: כָּל־צִפּ֥וֹר טְהֹרָ֖ה תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: kal-tzipvor t'horah tokhelv
translation: You may eat any clean bird.

hebrew: וְזֶ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־תֹאכְל֖וּ מֵהֶ֑ם הַנֶּ֥שֶׁר וְהַפֶּ֖רֶס וְהָֽעָזְנִיָּֽה׃
transliteration: v'zeh asher lo-tokh'lv mehem hanesher v'haperes v'ha'az'niyah
translation: The following you may not eat: aA number of these creatures cannot be identified with certainty.the eagle, the vulture, and the black vulture;

hebrew: וְהָרָאָה֙ וְאֶת־הָ֣אַיָּ֔ה וְהַדַּיָּ֖ה לְמִינָֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'haraah v'et-haayah v'hadayah l'miynah
translation: the kite, the falcon, and the buzzard of any variety;

hebrew: וְאֵ֥ת כָּל־עֹרֵ֖ב לְמִינֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'et kal-'orev l'miynvo
translation: every variety of raven;

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ בַּ֣ת הַֽיַּעֲנָ֔ה וְאֶת־הַתַּחְמָ֖ס וְאֶת־הַשָּׁ֑חַף וְאֶת־הַנֵּ֖ץ לְמִינֵֽהוּ׃
transliteration: v'et bat haya'anah v'et-hatach'mas v'et-hashachaf v'et-hanetz l'miynehv
translation: the ostrich, the nighthawk, the sea gull, and the hawk of any variety;

hebrew: אֶת־הַכּ֥וֹס וְאֶת־הַיַּנְשׁ֖וּף וְהַתִּנְשָֽׁמֶת׃
transliteration: et-hakvos v'et-hayan'shvf v'hatin'shamet
translation: the little owl, the great owl, and the white owl;

hebrew: וְהַקָּאָ֥ת וְאֶֽת־הָרָחָ֖מָה וְאֶת־הַשָּׁלָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'hakaat v'et-harachamah v'et-hashalakh'
translation: the pelican, the bustard, and the cormorant;

hebrew: וְהַ֣חֲסִידָ֔ה וְהָאֲנָפָ֖ה לְמִינָ֑הּ וְהַדּוּכִיפַ֖ת וְהָעֲטַלֵּֽף׃
transliteration: v'hachasiydah v'haanafah l'miynah v'hadvkhiyfat v'ha'atalef
translation: the stork, any variety of heron, the hoopoe, and the bat.

hebrew: וְכֹל֙ שֶׁ֣רֶץ הָע֔וֹף טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶ֑ם לֹ֖א יֵאָכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: v'khol sheretz ha'vof tame hv lakhem lo yeakhelv
translation: All winged swarming things are unclean for you: they may not be eaten.

hebrew: כָּל־ע֥וֹף טָה֖וֹר תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
transliteration: kal-'vof tahvor tokhelv
translation: You may eat only clean winged creatures.

hebrew: לֹ֣א תֹאכְל֣וּ כָל־נְ֠בֵלָה לַגֵּ֨ר אֲשֶׁר־בִּשְׁעָרֶ֜יךָ תִּתְּנֶ֣נָּה וַאֲכָלָ֗הּ א֤וֹ מָכֹר֙ לְנָכְרִ֔י כִּ֣י עַ֤ם קָדוֹשׁ֙ אַתָּ֔ה לַיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לֹֽא־תְבַשֵּׁ֥ל גְּדִ֖י בַּחֲלֵ֥ב אִמּֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: lo tokh'lv khal-n'velah lager asher-bish'areykha tit'nenah vaakhalah vo makhor l'nakh'riy kiy 'am kadvosh atah layhvah eloheykha lo-t'vashel g'diy bachalev imvo (f)
translation:
You shall not eat anything that has died a natural death; give it to the stranger in your community to eat, or you may sell it to a foreigner. For you are a people consecrated to the LORD your God.
You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.

hebrew: עַשֵּׂ֣ר תְּעַשֵּׂ֔ר אֵ֖ת כָּל־תְּבוּאַ֣ת זַרְעֶ֑ךָ הַיֹּצֵ֥א הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה שָׁנָ֥ה שָׁנָֽה׃
transliteration: 'aser t'aser et kal-t'vvat zar'ekha hayotze hasadeh shanah shanah
translation: You shall set aside every year a tenth part of all the yield of your sowing that is brought from the field.

hebrew: וְאָכַלְתָּ֞ לִפְנֵ֣י ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ בַּמָּק֣וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַר֮ לְשַׁכֵּ֣ן שְׁמ֣וֹ שָׁם֒ מַעְשַׂ֤ר דְּגָֽנְךָ֙ תִּֽירֹשְׁךָ֣ וְיִצְהָרֶ֔ךָ וּבְכֹרֹ֥ת בְּקָרְךָ֖ וְצֹאנֶ֑ךָ לְמַ֣עַן תִּלְמַ֗ד לְיִרְאָ֛ה אֶת־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ כָּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
transliteration: v'akhal'ta lif'ney  y'hvah eloheykha bamakvom asher-yiv'char l'shaken sh'mvo sham ma'sar d'gan'kha tiyrosh'kha v'yitz'harekha vv'khorot b'kar'kha v'tzonekha l'ma'an til'mad l'yir'ah et-y'hvah eloheykha kal-hayamiym
translation: You shall consume the tithes of your new grain and wine and oil, and the firstlings of your herds and flocks, in the presence of the L<small>ORD</small> your God, in the place where He will choose to establish His name, so that you may learn to revere the L<small>ORD</small> your God forever.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִרְבֶּ֨ה מִמְּךָ֜ הַדֶּ֗רֶךְ כִּ֣י לֹ֣א תוּכַ֘ל שְׂאֵתוֹ֒ כִּֽי־יִרְחַ֤ק מִמְּךָ֙ הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִבְחַר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לָשׂ֥וּם שְׁמ֖וֹ שָׁ֑ם כִּ֥י יְבָרֶכְךָ֖ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yir'beh mim'kha haderekh' kiy lo tvkhal s'etvo kiy-yir'chak mim'kha hamakvom asher yiv'char y'hvah eloheykha lasvm sh'mvo sham kiy y'varekh'kha y'hvah eloheykha
translation: Should the distance be too great for you, should you be unable to transport them, because the place where the LORD your God has chosen to establish His name is far from you and because the LORD your God has blessed you,bI.e., with abundant crops.

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֖ה בַּכָּ֑סֶף וְצַרְתָּ֤ הַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ בְּיָ֣דְךָ֔ וְהָֽלַכְתָּ֙ אֶל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִבְחַ֛ר יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'natatah bakasef v'tzar'ta hakesef b'yad'kha v'halakh'ta el-hamakvom asher yiv'char y'hvah eloheykha bvo
translation: you may convert them into money. Wrap up the money and take it with you to the place that the L<small>ORD</small> your God has chosen,

hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה הַכֶּ֡סֶף בְּכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁר־תְּאַוֶּ֨ה נַפְשְׁךָ֜ בַּבָּקָ֣ר וּבַצֹּ֗אן וּבַיַּ֙יִן֙ וּבַשֵּׁכָ֔ר וּבְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּֽשְׁאָלְךָ֖ נַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ וְאָכַ֣לְתָּ שָּׁ֗ם לִפְנֵי֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְשָׂמַחְתָּ֖ אַתָּ֥ה וּבֵיתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'natatah hakesef b'khol asher-t'aveh naf'sh'kha babakar vvatzon vvayayin vvashekhar vv'khol asher tish'al'kha naf'shekha v'akhal'ta sham lif'ney y'hvah eloheykha v'samach'ta atah vveytekha
translation: and spend the money on anything you want—cattle, sheep, wine, or other intoxicant, or anything you may desire. And you shall feast there, in the presence of the L<small>ORD</small> your God, and rejoice with your household.

hebrew: וְהַלֵּוִ֥י אֲשֶׁר־בִּשְׁעָרֶ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תַֽעַזְבֶ֑נּוּ כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין ל֛וֹ חֵ֥לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֖ה עִמָּֽךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'haleviy asher-bish'areykha lo ta'az'venv kiy eyn lvo chelek v'nachalah 'imakh' (s)
translation: But do not neglect the Levite in your community, for he has no hereditary portion as you have.

hebrew: מִקְצֵ֣ה ׀ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֗ים תּוֹצִיא֙ אֶת־כָּל־מַעְשַׂר֙ תְּבוּאָ֣תְךָ֔ בַּשָּׁנָ֖ה הַהִ֑וא וְהִנַּחְתָּ֖ בִּשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: mik'tzeh  shalosh shaniym tvotziy et-kal-ma'sar t'vvat'kha bashanah hahiv v'hinach'ta bish'areykha
translation: cLit. “After a period of three years”; cf. Deut. 26.12.Every third year-c you shall bring out the full tithe of your yield of that year, but leave it within your settlements.

hebrew: וּבָ֣א הַלֵּוִ֡י כִּ֣י אֵֽין־לוֹ֩ חֵ֨לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֜ה עִמָּ֗ךְ וְ֠הַגֵּר וְהַיָּת֤וֹם וְהָֽאַלְמָנָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּשְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ וְאָכְל֖וּ וְשָׂבֵ֑עוּ לְמַ֤עַן יְבָרֶכְךָ֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכָל־מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָדְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶֽׂה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vva haleviy kiy eyn-lvo chelek v'nachalah 'imakh' v'hager v'hayatvom v'haal'manah asher bish'areykha v'akh'lv v'save'v l'ma'an y'varekh'kha y'hvah eloheykha b'khal-ma'aseh yad'kha asher ta'aseh (s)
translation: Then the Levite, who has no hereditary portion as you have, and the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow in your settlements shall come and eat their fill, so that the L<small>ORD</small> your God may bless you in all the enterprises you undertake.

hebrew: מִקֵּ֥ץ שֶֽׁבַע־שָׁנִ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה שְׁמִטָּֽה׃
transliteration: miketz sheva'-shaniym ta'aseh sh'mitah
translation: aCf. 14.28.Every seventh year-a you shall practice remission of debts.

hebrew: וְזֶה֮ דְּבַ֣ר הַשְּׁמִטָּה֒ שָׁמ֗וֹט כָּל־בַּ֙עַל֙ מַשֵּׁ֣ה יָד֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַשֶּׁ֖ה בְּרֵעֵ֑הוּ לֹֽא־יִגֹּ֤שׂ אֶת־רֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ וְאֶת־אָחִ֔יו כִּֽי־קָרָ֥א שְׁמִטָּ֖ה לַֽיהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'zeh d'var hash'mitah shamvot kal-ba'al masheh yadvo asher yasheh b're'ehv lo-yigos et-re'ehv v'et-achiyv kiy-kara sh'mitah layhvah
translation: This shall be the nature of the remission: every creditor shall remit the due that he claims from his fellow; he shall not dun his fellow or kinsman, for the remission proclaimed is of the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: אֶת־הַנָּכְרִ֖י תִּגֹּ֑שׂ וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ אֶת־אָחִ֖יךָ תַּשְׁמֵ֥ט יָדֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: et-hanakh'riy tigos vaasher yih'yeh l'kha et-achiykha tash'met yadekha
translation: You may dun the foreigner; but you must remit whatever is due you from your kinsmen.

hebrew: אֶ֕פֶס כִּ֛י לֹ֥א יִֽהְיֶה־בְּךָ֖ אֶבְי֑וֹן כִּֽי־בָרֵ֤ךְ יְבָֽרֶכְךָ֙ יְהוָ֔ה בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹֽתֵן־לְךָ֥ נַחֲלָ֖ה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: efes kiy lo yih'yeh-b'kha ev'yvon kiy-varekh' y'varekh'kha y'hvah baaretz asher y'hvah eloheykha noten-l'kha nachalah l'rish'tah
translation: There shall be no needy among you—since the L<small>ORD</small> your God will bless you in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you as a hereditary portion—

hebrew: רַ֚ק אִם־שָׁמ֣וֹעַ תִּשְׁמַ֔ע בְּק֖וֹל יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֤ר לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כָּל־הַמִּצְוָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: rak im-shamvo'a tish'ma' b'kvol y'hvah eloheykha lish'mor la'asvot et-kal-hamitz'vah hazot asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom
translation: if only you heed the L<small>ORD</small> your God and take care to keep all this Instruction that I enjoin upon you this day.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ בֵּֽרַכְךָ֔ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּר־לָ֑ךְ וְהַֽעֲבַטְתָּ֞ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֗ים וְאַתָּה֙ לֹ֣א תַעֲבֹ֔ט וּמָֽשַׁלְתָּ֙ בְּגוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֔ים וּבְךָ֖ לֹ֥א יִמְשֹֽׁלוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy-y'hvah eloheykha berakh'kha kaasher diber-lakh' v'ha'avat'ta gvoyim rabiym v'atah lo ta'avot vmashal'ta b'gvoyim rabiym vv'kha lo yim'sholv (s)
translation: For the L<small>ORD</small> your God will bless you as He has promised you: you will extend loans to many nations, but require none yourself; you will dominate many nations, but they will not dominate you.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִהְיֶה֩ בְךָ֨ אֶבְי֜וֹן מֵאַחַ֤ד אַחֶ֙יךָ֙ בְּאַחַ֣ד שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ בְּאַ֨רְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֑ךְ לֹ֧א תְאַמֵּ֣ץ אֶת־לְבָבְךָ֗ וְלֹ֤א תִקְפֹּץ֙ אֶת־יָ֣דְךָ֔ מֵאָחִ֖יךָ הָאֶבְיֽוֹן׃
transliteration: kiy-yih'yeh v'kha ev'yvon meachad acheykha b'achad sh'areykha b'ar'tz'kha asher-y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh' lo t'ametz et-l'vav'kha v'lo tik'potz et-yad'kha meachiykha haev'yvon
translation: If, however, there is a needy person among you, one of your kinsmen in any of your settlements in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you, do not harden your heart and shut your hand against your needy kinsman.

hebrew: כִּֽי־פָתֹ֧חַ תִּפְתַּ֛ח אֶת־יָדְךָ֖ ל֑וֹ וְהַעֲבֵט֙ תַּעֲבִיטֶ֔נּוּ דֵּ֚י מַחְסֹר֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֶחְסַ֖ר לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kiy-fatocha tif'tach et-yad'kha lvo v'ha'avet ta'aviytenv dey mach'sorvo asher yech'sar lvo
translation: Rather, you must open your hand and lend him sufficient for whatever he needs.

hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֡ פֶּן־יִהְיֶ֣ה דָבָר֩ עִם־לְבָבְךָ֨ בְלִיַּ֜עַל לֵאמֹ֗ר קָֽרְבָ֣ה שְׁנַֽת־הַשֶּׁבַע֮ שְׁנַ֣ת הַשְּׁמִטָּה֒ וְרָעָ֣ה עֵֽינְךָ֗ בְּאָחִ֙יךָ֙ הָֽאֶבְי֔וֹן וְלֹ֥א תִתֵּ֖ן ל֑וֹ וְקָרָ֤א עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה וְהָיָ֥ה בְךָ֖ חֵֽטְא׃
transliteration: hishamer l'kha pen-yih'yeh davar 'im-l'vav'kha v'liya'al lemor kar'vah sh'nat-hasheva' sh'nat hash'mitah v'ra'ah 'eyn'kha b'achiykha haev'yvon v'lo titen lvo v'kara 'aleykha el-y'hvah v'hayah v'kha chet'
translation: Beware lest you harbor the base thought, “The seventh year, the year of remission, is approaching,” so that you are mean to your needy kinsman and give him nothing. He will cry out to the L<small>ORD</small> against you, and you will incur guilt.

hebrew: נָת֤וֹן תִּתֵּן֙ ל֔וֹ וְלֹא־יֵרַ֥ע לְבָבְךָ֖ בְּתִתְּךָ֣ ל֑וֹ כִּ֞י בִּגְלַ֣ל ׀ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה יְבָרֶכְךָ֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכָֽל־מַעֲשֶׂ֔ךָ וּבְכֹ֖ל מִשְׁלַ֥ח יָדֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: natvon titen lvo v'lo-yera' l'vav'kha b'tit'kha lvo kiy big'lal  hadavar hazeh y'varekh'kha y'hvah eloheykha b'khal-ma'asekha vv'khol mish'lach yadekha
translation: Give to him readily and have no regrets when you do so, for in return the L<small>ORD</small> your God will bless you in all your efforts and in all your undertakings.

hebrew: כִּ֛י לֹא־יֶחְדַּ֥ל אֶבְי֖וֹן מִקֶּ֣רֶב הָאָ֑רֶץ עַל־כֵּ֞ן אָנֹכִ֤י מְצַוְּךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר פָּ֠תֹחַ תִּפְתַּ֨ח אֶת־יָדְךָ֜ לְאָחִ֧יךָ לַעֲנִיֶּ֛ךָ וּלְאֶבְיֹנְךָ֖ בְּאַרְצֶֽךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy lo-yech'dal ev'yvon mikerev haaretz 'al-ken anokhiy m'tzav'kha lemor patocha tif'tach et-yad'kha l'achiykha la'aniyekha vl'ev'yon'kha b'ar'tzekha (s)
translation: For there will never cease to be needy ones in your land, which is why I command you: open your hand to the poor and needy kinsman in your land.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִמָּכֵ֨ר לְךָ֜ אָחִ֣יךָ הָֽעִבְרִ֗י א֚וֹ הָֽעִבְרִיָּ֔ה וַעֲבָֽדְךָ֖ שֵׁ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֑ים וּבַשָּׁנָה֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔ת תְּשַׁלְּחֶ֥נּוּ חָפְשִׁ֖י מֵעִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: kiy-yimakher l'kha achiykha ha'iv'riy vo ha'iv'riyah va'avad'kha shesh shaniym vvashanah hash'viy'it t'shal'chenv chaf'shiy me'imakh'
translation: If a fellow Hebrew, man or woman, is sold to you, he shall serve you six years, and in the seventh year you shall set him free.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־תְשַׁלְּחֶ֥נּוּ חָפְשִׁ֖י מֵֽעִמָּ֑ךְ לֹ֥א תְשַׁלְּחֶ֖נּוּ רֵיקָֽם׃
transliteration: v'khiy-t'shal'chenv chaf'shiy me'imakh' lo t'shal'chenv reykam
translation: When you set him free, do not let him go empty-handed:

hebrew: הַעֲנֵ֤יק תַּעֲנִיק֙ ל֔וֹ מִצֹּ֣אנְךָ֔ וּמִֽגָּרְנְךָ֖ וּמִיִּקְבֶ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁ֧ר בֵּרַכְךָ֛ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ תִּתֶּן־לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: ha'aneyk ta'aniyk lvo mitzon'kha vmigar'n'kha vmiyik'vekha asher berakh'kha y'hvah eloheykha titen-lvo
translation: Furnish him out of the flock, threshing floor, and vat, with which the L<small>ORD</small> your God has blessed you.

hebrew: וְזָכַרְתָּ֗ כִּ֣י עֶ֤בֶד הָיִ֙יתָ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַֽיִּפְדְּךָ֖ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ עַל־כֵּ֞ן אָנֹכִ֧י מְצַוְּךָ֛ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: v'zakhar'ta kiy 'eved hayiyta b'eretz mitz'rayim vayif'd'kha y'hvah eloheykha 'al-ken anokhiy m'tzav'kha et-hadavar hazeh hayvom
translation: Bear in mind that you were slaves in the land of Egypt and the L<small>ORD</small> your God redeemed you; therefore I enjoin this commandment upon you today.

hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ כִּֽי־יֹאמַ֣ר אֵלֶ֔יךָ לֹ֥א אֵצֵ֖א מֵעִמָּ֑ךְ כִּ֤י אֲהֵֽבְךָ֙ וְאֶת־בֵּיתֶ֔ךָ כִּי־ט֥וֹב ל֖וֹ עִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy-yomar eleykha lo etze me'imakh' kiy ahev'kha v'et-beytekha kiy-tvov lvo 'imakh'
translation: But should he say to you, “I do not want to leave you”—for he loves you and your household and is happy with you—

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ אֶת־הַמַּרְצֵ֗עַ וְנָתַתָּ֤ה בְאָזְנוֹ֙ וּבַדֶּ֔לֶת וְהָיָ֥ה לְךָ֖ עֶ֣בֶד עוֹלָ֑ם וְאַ֥ף לַאֲמָתְךָ֖ תַּעֲשֶׂה־כֵּֽן׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta et-hamar'tze'a v'natatah v'az'nvo vvadelet v'hayah l'kha 'eved 'volam v'af laamat'kha ta'aseh-ken
translation: you shall take an awl and put it through his ear into the door, and he shall become your slave in perpetuity. Do the same with your female slave.

hebrew: לֹא־יִקְשֶׁ֣ה בְעֵינֶ֗ךָ בְּשַׁלֵּֽחֲךָ֙ אֹת֤וֹ חָפְשִׁי֙ מֵֽעִמָּ֔ךְ כִּ֗י מִשְׁנֶה֙ שְׂכַ֣ר שָׂכִ֔יר עֲבָֽדְךָ֖ שֵׁ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֑ים וּבֵֽרַכְךָ֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶֽׂה׃ (פ)
transliteration: lo-yik'sheh v'eynekha b'shalechakha otvo chaf'shiy me'imakh' kiy mish'neh s'khar sakhiyr 'avad'kha shesh shaniym vverakh'kha y'hvah eloheykha b'khol asher ta'aseh (f)
translation: When you do set him free, do not feel aggrieved; for in the six years he has given you double the service of a hired man. Moreover, the L<small>ORD</small> your God will bless you in all you do.

hebrew: כָּֽל־הַבְּכ֡וֹר אֲשֶׁר֩ יִוָּלֵ֨ד בִּבְקָרְךָ֤ וּבְצֹֽאנְךָ֙ הַזָּכָ֔ר תַּקְדִּ֖ישׁ לַיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לֹ֤א תַעֲבֹד֙ בִּבְכֹ֣ר שׁוֹרֶ֔ךָ וְלֹ֥א תָגֹ֖ז בְּכ֥וֹר צֹאנֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: kal-hab'khvor asher yivaled biv'kar'kha vv'tzon'kha hazakhar tak'diysh layhvah eloheykha lo ta'avod biv'khor shvorekha v'lo tagoz b'khvor tzonekha
translation: You shall consecrate to the L<small>ORD</small> your God all male firstlings that are born in your herd and in your flock: you must not work your firstling ox or shear your firstling sheep.

hebrew: לִפְנֵי֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֤יךָ תֹאכֲלֶ֙נּוּ֙ שָׁנָ֣ה בְשָׁנָ֔ה בַּמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֣ר יְהוָ֑ה אַתָּ֖ה וּבֵיתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: lif'ney y'hvah eloheykha tokhalenv shanah v'shanah bamakvom asher-yiv'char y'hvah atah vveytekha
translation: You and your household shall eat it annually before the L<small>ORD</small> your God in the place that the L<small>ORD</small> will choose.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִהְיֶ֨ה ב֜וֹ מ֗וּם פִּסֵּ֙חַ֙ א֣וֹ עִוֵּ֔ר כֹּ֖ל מ֣וּם רָ֑ע לֹ֣א תִזְבָּחֶ֔נּוּ לַיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yih'yeh vvo mvm pisecha vo 'iver kol mvm ra' lo tiz'bachenv layhvah eloheykha
translation: But if it has a defect, lameness or blindness, any serious defect, you shall not sacrifice it to the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: בִּשְׁעָרֶ֖יךָ תֹּאכֲלֶ֑נּוּ הַטָּמֵ֤א וְהַטָּהוֹר֙ יַחְדָּ֔ו כַּצְּבִ֖י וְכָאַיָּֽל׃
transliteration: bish'areykha tokhalenv hatame v'hatahvor yach'dav katz'viy v'khaayal
translation: Eat it in your settlements, the unclean among you no less than the clean, just like the gazelle and the deer.

hebrew: רַ֥ק אֶת־דָּמ֖וֹ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֑ל עַל־הָאָ֥רֶץ תִּשְׁפְּכֶ֖נּוּ כַּמָּֽיִם׃ (פ)
transliteration: rak et-damvo lo tokhel 'al-haaretz tish'p'khenv kamayim (f)
translation: Only you must not partake of its blood; you shall pour it out on the ground like water.

hebrew: שָׁמוֹר֙ אֶת־חֹ֣דֶשׁ הָאָבִ֔יב וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ פֶּ֔סַח לַיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ כִּ֞י בְּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽאָבִ֗יב הוֹצִ֨יאֲךָ֜ יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם לָֽיְלָה׃
transliteration: shamvor et-chodesh haaviyv v'asiyta pesach layhvah eloheykha kiy b'chodesh haaviyv hvotziyakha y'hvah eloheykha mimitz'rayim lay'lah
translation: Observe the monthaCf. Exod. 13.4; 23.15; 34.18. of Abib and offer a passover sacrifice to the LORD your God, for it was in the month-a of Abib, at night, that the LORD your God freed you from Egypt.

hebrew: וְזָבַ֥חְתָּ פֶּ֛סַח לַיהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ צֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֑ר בַּמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה לְשַׁכֵּ֥ן שְׁמ֖וֹ שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: v'zavach'ta pesach layhvah eloheykha tzon vvakar bamakvom asher-yiv'char y'hvah l'shaken sh'mvo sham
translation: You shall slaughter the passover sacrifice for the L<small>ORD</small> your God, from the flock and the herd, in the place where the L<small>ORD</small> will choose to establish His name.

hebrew: לֹא־תֹאכַ֤ל עָלָיו֙ חָמֵ֔ץ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֛ים תֹּֽאכַל־עָלָ֥יו מַצּ֖וֹת לֶ֣חֶם עֹ֑נִי כִּ֣י בְחִפָּז֗וֹן יָצָ֙אתָ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לְמַ֣עַן תִּזְכֹּר֔ אֶת־י֤וֹם צֵֽאתְךָ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
transliteration: lo-tokhal 'alayv chametz shiv'at yamiym tokhal-'alayv matzvot lechem 'oniy kiy v'chipazvon yatzata meeretz mitz'rayim l'ma'an tiz'kor et-yvom tzet'kha meeretz mitz'rayim kol y'mey chayeykha
translation: You shall not eat anything leavened with it; for seven days thereafterbLit. “upon it.” you shall eat unleavened bread, bread of distress—for you departed from the land of Egypt hurriedly—so that you may remember the day of your departure from the land of Egypt as long as you live.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יֵרָאֶ֨ה לְךָ֥ שְׂאֹ֛ר בְּכָל־גְּבֻלְךָ֖ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים וְלֹא־יָלִ֣ין מִן־הַבָּשָׂ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּזְבַּ֥ח בָּעֶ֛רֶב בַּיּ֥וֹם הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן לַבֹּֽקֶר׃
transliteration: v'lo-yeraeh l'kha s'or b'khal-g'vul'kha shiv'at yamiym v'lo-yaliyn min-habasar asher tiz'bach ba'erev bayvom harishvon laboker
translation: For seven days no leaven shall be found with you in all your territory, and none of the flesh of what you slaughter on the evening of the first day shall be left until morning.

hebrew: לֹ֥א תוּכַ֖ל לִזְבֹּ֣חַ אֶת־הַפָּ֑סַח בְּאַחַ֣ד שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: lo tvkhal liz'bocha et-hapasach b'achad sh'areykha asher-y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh'
translation: You are not permitted to slaughter the passover sacrifice in any of the settlements that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you;

hebrew: כִּ֠י אִֽם־אֶל־הַמָּק֞וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֨ר יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ לְשַׁכֵּ֣ן שְׁמ֔וֹ שָׁ֛ם תִּזְבַּ֥ח אֶת־הַפֶּ֖סַח בָּעָ֑רֶב כְּב֣וֹא הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ מוֹעֵ֖ד צֵֽאתְךָ֥ מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: kiy im-el-hamakvom asher-yiv'char y'hvah eloheykha l'shaken sh'mvo sham tiz'bach et-hapesach ba'arev k'vvo hashemesh mvo'ed tzet'kha mimitz'rayim
translation: but at the place where the L<small>ORD</small> your God will choose to establish His name, there alone shall you slaughter the passover sacrifice, in the evening, at sundown, the time of day when you departed from Egypt.

hebrew: וּבִשַּׁלְתָּ֙ וְאָ֣כַלְתָּ֔ בַּמָּק֕וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִבְחַ֛ר יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בּ֑וֹ וּפָנִ֣יתָ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וְהָלַכְתָּ֖ לְאֹהָלֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vvishal'ta v'akhal'ta bamakvom asher yiv'char y'hvah eloheykha bvo vfaniyta vaboker v'halakh'ta l'ohaleykha
translation: You shall cook and eat it at the place that the L<small>ORD</small> your God will choose; and in the morning you may start back on your journey home.

hebrew: שֵׁ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים תֹּאכַ֣ל מַצּ֑וֹת וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י עֲצֶ֙רֶת֙ לַיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לֹ֥א תַעֲשֶׂ֖ה מְלָאכָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: sheshet yamiym tokhal matzvot vvayvom hash'viy'iy 'atzeret layhvah eloheykha lo ta'aseh m'lakhah (s)
translation: After eating unleavened bread six days, you shall hold a solemn gatheringcSee note at Lev. 23.36. for the LORD your God on the seventh day: you shall do no work.

hebrew: שִׁבְעָ֥ה שָׁבֻעֹ֖ת תִּסְפָּר־לָ֑ךְ מֵהָחֵ֤ל חֶרְמֵשׁ֙ בַּקָּמָ֔ה תָּחֵ֣ל לִסְפֹּ֔ר שִׁבְעָ֖ה שָׁבֻעֽוֹת׃
transliteration: shiv'ah shavu'ot tis'par-lakh' mehachel cher'mesh bakamah tachel lis'por shiv'ah shavu'vot
translation: You shall count off seven weeks; start to count the seven weeks when the sickle is first put to the standing grain.

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ חַ֤ג שָׁבֻעוֹת֙ לַיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ מִסַּ֛ת נִדְבַ֥ת יָדְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּתֵּ֑ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יְבָרֶכְךָ֖ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'asiyta chag shavu'vot layhvah eloheykha misat nid'vat yad'kha asher titen kaasher y'varekh'kha y'hvah eloheykha
translation: Then you shall observe the Feast of Weeks for the L<small>ORD</small> your God, offering your freewill contribution according as the L<small>ORD</small> your God has blessed you.

hebrew: וְשָׂמַחְתָּ֞ לִפְנֵ֣י ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ אַתָּ֨ה וּבִנְךָ֣ וּבִתֶּךָ֮ וְעַבְדְּךָ֣ וַאֲמָתֶךָ֒ וְהַלֵּוִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּשְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ וְהַגֵּ֛ר וְהַיָּת֥וֹם וְהָאַלְמָנָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּקִרְבֶּ֑ךָ בַּמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִבְחַר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לְשַׁכֵּ֥ן שְׁמ֖וֹ שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: v'samach'ta lif'ney  y'hvah eloheykha atah vvin'kha vvitekha v'av'd'kha vaamatekha v'haleviy asher bish'areykha v'hager v'hayatvom v'haal'manah asher b'kir'bekha bamakvom asher yiv'char y'hvah eloheykha l'shaken sh'mvo sham
translation: You shall rejoice before the L<small>ORD</small> your God with your son and daughter, your male and female slave, the Levite in your communities, and the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow in your midst, at the place where the L<small>ORD</small> your God will choose to establish His name.

hebrew: וְזָ֣כַרְתָּ֔ כִּי־עֶ֥בֶד הָיִ֖יתָ בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֣ וְעָשִׂ֔יתָ אֶת־הַֽחֻקִּ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'zakhar'ta kiy-'eved hayiyta b'mitz'rayim v'shamar'ta v'asiyta et-hachukiym haeleh (f)
translation: Bear in mind that you were slaves in Egypt, and take care to obey these laws.

hebrew: חַ֧ג הַסֻּכֹּ֛ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לְךָ֖ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים בְּאָ֨סְפְּךָ֔ מִֽגָּרְנְךָ֖ וּמִיִּקְבֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: chag hasukot ta'aseh l'kha shiv'at yamiym b'as'p'kha migar'n'kha vmiyik'vekha
translation: After the ingathering from your threshing floor and your vat, you shall hold the Feast of Booths for seven days.

hebrew: וְשָׂמַחְתָּ֖ בְּחַגֶּ֑ךָ אַתָּ֨ה וּבִנְךָ֤ וּבִתֶּ֙ךָ֙ וְעַבְדְּךָ֣ וַאֲמָתֶ֔ךָ וְהַלֵּוִ֗י וְהַגֵּ֛ר וְהַיָּת֥וֹם וְהָאַלְמָנָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'samach'ta b'chagekha atah vvin'kha vvitekha v'av'd'kha vaamatekha v'haleviy v'hager v'hayatvom v'haal'manah asher bish'areykha
translation: You shall rejoice in your festival, with your son and daughter, your male and female slave, the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow in your communities.

hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים תָּחֹג֙ לַיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בַּמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֣ר יְהוָ֑ה כִּ֣י יְבָרֶכְךָ֞ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ בְּכֹ֤ל תְּבוּאָֽתְךָ֙ וּבְכֹל֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֶ֔יךָ וְהָיִ֖יתָ אַ֥ךְ שָׂמֵֽחַ׃
transliteration: shiv'at yamiym tachog layhvah eloheykha bamakvom asher-yiv'char y'hvah kiy y'varekh'kha y'hvah eloheykha b'khol t'vvat'kha vv'khol ma'aseh yadeykha v'hayiyta akh' samecha
translation: You shall hold a festival for the LORD your God seven days, in the place that the LORD will choose; for the LORD your God will bless alldLit. “you in all.” your crops and all your undertakings, and you shall have nothing but joy.

hebrew: שָׁל֣וֹשׁ פְּעָמִ֣ים ׀ בַּשָּׁנָ֡ה יֵרָאֶ֨ה כָל־זְכוּרְךָ֜ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ בַּמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִבְחָ֔ר בְּחַ֧ג הַמַּצּ֛וֹת וּבְחַ֥ג הַשָּׁבֻע֖וֹת וּבְחַ֣ג הַסֻּכּ֑וֹת וְלֹ֧א יֵרָאֶ֛ה אֶת־פְּנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה רֵיקָֽם׃
transliteration: shalvosh p'amiym  bashanah yeraeh khal-z'khvr'kha et-p'ney  y'hvah eloheykha bamakvom asher yiv'char b'chag hamatzvot vv'chag hashavu'vot vv'chag hasukvot v'lo yeraeh et-p'ney y'hvah reykam
translation: Three times a year—on the Feast of Unleavened Bread, on the Feast of Weeks, and on the Feast of Booths—all your males shall appear before the L<small>ORD</small> your God in the place that He will choose. They shall not appear before the L<small>ORD</small> empty-handed,

hebrew: אִ֖ישׁ כְּמַתְּנַ֣ת יָד֑וֹ כְּבִרְכַּ֛ת יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָֽתַן־לָֽךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: iysh k'mat'nat yadvo k'vir'kat y'hvah eloheykha asher natan-lakh' (s)
translation: but each with his own gift, according to the blessing that the L<small>ORD</small> your God has bestowed upon you.

hebrew: שֹׁפְטִ֣ים וְשֹֽׁטְרִ֗ים תִּֽתֶּן־לְךָ֙ בְּכָל־שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ לִשְׁבָטֶ֑יךָ וְשָׁפְט֥וּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם מִשְׁפַּט־צֶֽדֶק׃
transliteration: shof'tiym v'shot'riym titen-l'kha b'khal-sh'areykha asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha lish'vateykha v'shaf'tv et-ha'am mish'pat-tzedek
translation: You shall appoint magistrates and officials for your tribes, in all the settlements that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you, and they shall govern the people with due justice.

hebrew: לֹא־תַטֶּ֣ה מִשְׁפָּ֔ט לֹ֥א תַכִּ֖יר פָּנִ֑ים וְלֹא־תִקַּ֣ח שֹׁ֔חַד כִּ֣י הַשֹּׁ֗חַד יְעַוֵּר֙ עֵינֵ֣י חֲכָמִ֔ים וִֽיסַלֵּ֖ף דִּבְרֵ֥י צַדִּיקִֽם׃
transliteration: lo-tateh mish'pat lo takiyr paniym v'lo-tikach shochad kiy hashochad y'aver 'eyney chakhamiym viysalef div'rey tzadiykim
translation: You shall not judge unfairly: you shall show no partiality; you shall not take bribes, for bribes blind the eyes of the discerning and upset the plea of the just.

hebrew: צֶ֥דֶק צֶ֖דֶק תִּרְדֹּ֑ף לְמַ֤עַן תִּֽחְיֶה֙ וְיָרַשְׁתָּ֣ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: tzedek tzedek tir'dof l'ma'an tich'yeh v'yarash'ta et-haaretz asher-y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh' (s)
translation: Justice, justice shall you pursue, that you may thrive and occupy the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תִטַּ֥ע לְךָ֛ אֲשֵׁרָ֖ה כָּל־עֵ֑ץ אֵ֗צֶל מִזְבַּ֛ח יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-tita' l'kha asherah kal-'etz etzel miz'bach y'hvah eloheykha asher ta'aseh-lakh' (s)
translation: You shall not set up a sacred post—any kind of pole beside the altar of the L<small>ORD</small> your God that you may make—

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תָקִ֥ים לְךָ֖ מַצֵּבָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׂנֵ֖א יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'lo-takiym l'kha matzevah asher sane y'hvah eloheykha (s)
translation: or erect a stone pillar; for such the L<small>ORD</small> your God detests.

hebrew: לֹא־תִזְבַּח֩ לַיהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ שׁ֣וֹר וָשֶׂ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֥ה בוֹ֙ מ֔וּם כֹּ֖ל דָּבָ֣ר רָ֑ע כִּ֧י תוֹעֲבַ֛ת יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ הֽוּא׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-tiz'bach layhvah eloheykha shvor vaseh asher yih'yeh vvo mvm kol davar ra' kiy tvo'avat y'hvah eloheykha hv (s)
translation: You shall not sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small> your God an ox or a sheep that has any defect of a serious kind, for that is abhorrent to the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִמָּצֵ֤א בְקִרְבְּךָ֙ בְּאַחַ֣ד שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֑ךְ אִ֣ישׁ אוֹ־אִשָּׁ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַעֲשֶׂ֧ה אֶת־הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהוָֽה־אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לַעֲבֹ֥ר בְּרִיתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kiy-yimatze v'kir'b'kha b'achad sh'areykha asher-y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh' iysh vo-ishah asher ya'aseh et-hara' b'eyney y'hvah-eloheykha la'avor b'riytvo
translation: If there is found among you, in one of the settlements that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you, a man or woman who has affronted the L<small>ORD</small> your God and transgressed His covenant—

hebrew: וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ וַֽיַּעֲבֹד֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ לָהֶ֑ם וְלַשֶּׁ֣מֶשׁ ׀ א֣וֹ לַיָּרֵ֗חַ א֛וֹ לְכָל־צְבָ֥א הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־צִוִּֽיתִי׃
transliteration: vayelekh' vaya'avod elohiym acheriym vayish'tachv lahem v'lashemesh  vo layarecha vo l'khal-tz'va hashamayim asher lo-tziviytiy
translation: turning to the worship of other gods and bowing down to them, to the sun or the moon or any of the heavenly host, something I never commanded—

hebrew: וְהֻֽגַּד־לְךָ֖ וְשָׁמָ֑עְתָּ וְדָרַשְׁתָּ֣ הֵיטֵ֔ב וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֱמֶת֙ נָכ֣וֹן הַדָּבָ֔ר נֶעֶשְׂתָ֛ה הַתּוֹעֵבָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'hugad-l'kha v'shama'ta v'darash'ta heytev v'hineh emet nakhvon hadavar ne'es'tah hatvo'evah hazot b'yis'rael
translation: and you have been informed or have learned of it, then you shall make a thorough inquiry. If it is true, the fact is established, that abhorrent thing was perpetrated in Israel,

hebrew: וְהֽוֹצֵאתָ֣ אֶת־הָאִ֣ישׁ הַה֡וּא אוֹ֩ אֶת־הָאִשָּׁ֨ה הַהִ֜וא אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָ֠שׂוּ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֨ר הָרָ֤ע הַזֶּה֙ אֶל־שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ אֶת־הָאִ֕ישׁ א֖וֹ אֶת־הָאִשָּׁ֑ה וּסְקַלְתָּ֥ם בָּאֲבָנִ֖ים וָמֵֽתוּ׃
transliteration: v'hvotzeta et-haiysh hahv vo et-haishah hahiv asher 'asv et-hadavar hara' hazeh el-sh'areykha et-haiysh vo et-haishah vs'kal'tam baavaniym vametv
translation: you shall take the man or the woman who did that wicked thing out to the public place, and you shall stone them, man or woman, to death.—

hebrew: עַל־פִּ֣י ׀ שְׁנַ֣יִם עֵדִ֗ים א֛וֹ שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה עֵדִ֖ים יוּמַ֣ת הַמֵּ֑ת לֹ֣א יוּמַ֔ת עַל־פִּ֖י עֵ֥ד אֶחָֽד׃
transliteration: 'al-piy  sh'nayim 'ediym vo sh'loshah 'ediym yvmat hamet lo yvmat 'al-piy 'ed echad
translation: A person shall be put to death only on the testimony of two or moreaLit. “three.” witnesses; he must not be put to death on the testimony of a single witness.—

hebrew: יַ֣ד הָעֵדִ֞ים תִּֽהְיֶה־בּ֤וֹ בָרִאשֹׁנָה֙ לַהֲמִית֔וֹ וְיַ֥ד כָּל־הָעָ֖ם בָּאַחֲרֹנָ֑ה וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃ (פ)
transliteration: yad ha'ediym tih'yeh-bvo varishonah lahamiytvo v'yad kal-ha'am baacharonah vvi'ar'ta hara' mikir'bekha (f)
translation: Let the hands of the witnesses be the first against him to put him to death, and the hands of the rest of the people thereafter. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst.

hebrew: כִּ֣י יִפָּלֵא֩ מִמְּךָ֨ דָבָ֜ר לַמִּשְׁפָּ֗ט בֵּֽין־דָּ֨ם ׀ לְדָ֜ם בֵּֽין־דִּ֣ין לְדִ֗ין וּבֵ֥ין נֶ֙גַע֙ לָנֶ֔גַע דִּבְרֵ֥י רִיבֹ֖ת בִּשְׁעָרֶ֑יךָ וְקַמְתָּ֣ וְעָלִ֔יתָ אֶל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִבְחַ֛ר יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kiy yipale mim'kha davar lamish'pat beyn-dam  l'dam beyn-diyn l'diyn vveyn nega' lanega' div'rey riyvot bish'areykha v'kam'ta v'aliyta el-hamakvom asher yiv'char y'hvah eloheykha bvo
translation: If a case is too baffling for you to decide, be it a controversy over homicide, civil law, or assault—matters of dispute in your courts—you shall promptly repair to the place that the L<small>ORD</small> your God will have chosen,

hebrew: וּבָאתָ֗ אֶל־הַכֹּהֲנִים֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם וְאֶל־הַשֹּׁפֵ֔ט אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִהְיֶ֖ה בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֑ם וְדָרַשְׁתָּ֙ וְהִגִּ֣ידוּ לְךָ֔ אֵ֖ת דְּבַ֥ר הַמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
transliteration: vvata el-hakohaniym hal'viyim v'el-hashofet asher yih'yeh bayamiym hahem v'darash'ta v'higiydv l'kha et d'var hamish'pat
translation: and appear before the levitical priests, or the magistrate in charge at the time, and present your problem. When they have announced to you the verdict in the case,

hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֗יתָ עַל־פִּ֤י הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַגִּ֣ידֽוּ לְךָ֔ מִן־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַה֔וּא אֲשֶׁ֖ר יִבְחַ֣ר יְהוָ֑ה וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֣ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת כְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹרֽוּךָ׃
transliteration: v'asiyta 'al-piy hadavar asher yagiydv l'kha min-hamakvom hahv asher yiv'char y'hvah v'shamar'ta la'asvot k'khol asher yvorvkha
translation: you shall carry out the verdict that is announced to you from that place that the L<small>ORD</small> chose, observing scrupulously all their instructions to you.

hebrew: עַל־פִּ֨י הַתּוֹרָ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר יוֹר֗וּךָ וְעַל־הַמִּשְׁפָּ֛ט אֲשֶׁר־יֹאמְר֥וּ לְךָ֖ תַּעֲשֶׂ֑ה לֹ֣א תָס֗וּר מִן־הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־יַגִּ֥ידֽוּ לְךָ֖ יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹֽאל׃
transliteration: 'al-piy hatvorah asher yvorvkha v'al-hamish'pat asher-yom'rv l'kha ta'aseh lo tasvr min-hadavar asher-yagiydv l'kha yamiyn vs'mol
translation: You shall act in accordance with the instructions given you and the ruling handed down to you; you must not deviate from the verdict that they announce to you either to the right or to the left.

hebrew: וְהָאִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה בְזָד֗וֹן לְבִלְתִּ֨י שְׁמֹ֤עַ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵן֙ הָעֹמֵ֞ד לְשָׁ֤רֶת שָׁם֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ א֖וֹ אֶל־הַשֹּׁפֵ֑ט וּמֵת֙ הָאִ֣ישׁ הַה֔וּא וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'haiysh asher-ya'aseh v'zadvon l'vil'tiy sh'mo'a el-hakohen ha'omed l'sharet sham et-y'hvah eloheykha vo el-hashofet vmet haiysh hahv vvi'ar'ta hara' miyis'rael
translation: Should a man act presumptuously and disregard the priest charged with serving there the L<small>ORD</small> your God, or the magistrate, that man shall die. Thus you will sweep out evil from Israel:

hebrew: וְכָל־הָעָ֖ם יִשְׁמְע֣וּ וְיִרָ֑אוּ וְלֹ֥א יְזִיד֖וּן עֽוֹד׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khal-ha'am yish'm'v v'yirav v'lo y'ziydvn 'vod (s)
translation: all the people will hear and be afraid and will not act presumptuously again.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תָבֹ֣א אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֔ךְ וִֽירִשְׁתָּ֖הּ וְיָשַׁ֣בְתָּה בָּ֑הּ וְאָמַרְתָּ֗ אָשִׂ֤ימָה עָלַי֙ מֶ֔לֶךְ כְּכָל־הַגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר סְבִיבֹתָֽי׃
transliteration: kiy-tavo el-haaretz asher y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh' viyrish'tah v'yashav'tah bah v'amar'ta asiymah 'alay melekh' k'khal-hagvoyim asher s'viyvotay
translation: If, after you have entered the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God has assigned to you, and taken possession of it and settled in it, you decide, “I will set a king over me, as do all the nations about me,”

hebrew: שׂ֣וֹם תָּשִׂ֤ים עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ מֶ֔לֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִבְחַ֛ר יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בּ֑וֹ מִקֶּ֣רֶב אַחֶ֗יךָ תָּשִׂ֤ים עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ מֶ֔לֶךְ לֹ֣א תוּכַ֗ל לָתֵ֤ת עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ אִ֣ישׁ נָכְרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־אָחִ֖יךָ הֽוּא׃
transliteration: svom tasiym 'aleykha melekh' asher yiv'char y'hvah eloheykha bvo mikerev acheykha tasiym 'aleykha melekh' lo tvkhal latet 'aleykha iysh nakh'riy asher lo-achiykha hv
translation: you shall be free to set a king over yourself, one chosen by the L<small>ORD</small> your God. Be sure to set as king over yourself one of your own people; you must not set a foreigner over you, one who is not your kinsman.

hebrew: רַק֮ לֹא־יַרְבֶּה־לּ֣וֹ סוּסִים֒ וְלֹֽא־יָשִׁ֤יב אֶת־הָעָם֙ מִצְרַ֔יְמָה לְמַ֖עַן הַרְבּ֣וֹת ס֑וּס וַֽיהוָה֙ אָמַ֣ר לָכֶ֔ם לֹ֣א תֹסִפ֗וּן לָשׁ֛וּב בַּדֶּ֥רֶךְ הַזֶּ֖ה עֽוֹד׃
transliteration: rak lo-yar'beh-lvo svsiym v'lo-yashiyv et-ha'am mitz'ray'mah l'ma'an har'bvot svs vayhvah amar lakhem lo tosifvn lashvv baderekh' hazeh 'vod
translation: Moreover, he shall not keep many horses or send people back to Egypt to add to his horses, since the L<small>ORD</small> has warned you, “You must not go back that way again.”

hebrew: וְלֹ֤א יַרְבֶּה־לּוֹ֙ נָשִׁ֔ים וְלֹ֥א יָס֖וּר לְבָב֑וֹ וְכֶ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֔ב לֹ֥א יַרְבֶּה־לּ֖וֹ מְאֹֽד׃
transliteration: v'lo yar'beh-lvo nashiym v'lo yasvr l'vavvo v'khesef v'zahav lo yar'beh-lvo m'od
translation: And he shall not have many wives, lest his heart go astray; nor shall he amass silver and gold to excess.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה כְשִׁבְתּ֔וֹ עַ֖ל כִּסֵּ֣א מַמְלַכְתּ֑וֹ וְכָ֨תַב ל֜וֹ אֶת־מִשְׁנֵ֨ה הַתּוֹרָ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ עַל־סֵ֔פֶר מִלִּפְנֵ֥י הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
transliteration: v'hayah kh'shiv'tvo 'al kise mam'lakh'tvo v'khatav lvo et-mish'neh hatvorah hazot 'al-sefer milif'ney hakohaniym hal'viyim
translation: When he is seated on his royal throne, he shall have a copy of this Teaching written for him on a scroll bybNuance of Heb. milliphne uncertain. the levitical priests.

hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֣ה עִמּ֔וֹ וְקָ֥רָא ב֖וֹ כָּל־יְמֵ֣י חַיָּ֑יו לְמַ֣עַן יִלְמַ֗ד לְיִרְאָה֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔יו לִ֠שְׁמֹר אֶֽת־כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֞י הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּ֛את וְאֶת־הַחֻקִּ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לַעֲשֹׂתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'hay'tah 'imvo v'kara vvo kal-y'mey chayayv l'ma'an yil'mad l'yir'ah et-y'hvah elohayv lish'mor et-kal-div'rey hatvorah hazot v'et-hachukiym haeleh la'asotam
translation: Let it remain with him and let him read in it all his life, so that he may learn to revere the L<small>ORD</small> his God, to observe faithfully every word of this Teaching as well as these laws.

hebrew: לְבִלְתִּ֤י רוּם־לְבָבוֹ֙ מֵֽאֶחָ֔יו וּלְבִלְתִּ֛י ס֥וּר מִן־הַמִּצְוָ֖ה יָמִ֣ין וּשְׂמֹ֑אול לְמַעַן֩ יַאֲרִ֨יךְ יָמִ֧ים עַל־מַמְלַכְתּ֛וֹ ה֥וּא וּבָנָ֖יו בְּקֶ֥רֶב יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (ס)
transliteration: l'vil'tiy rvm-l'vavvo meechayv vl'vil'tiy svr min-hamitz'vah yamiyn vs'movl l'ma'an yaariykh' yamiym 'al-mam'lakh'tvo hv vvanayv b'kerev yis'rael (s)
translation: Thus he will not act haughtily toward his fellows or deviate from the Instruction to the right or to the left, to the end that he and his descendants may reign long in the midst of Israel.

hebrew: לֹֽא־יִ֠הְיֶה לַכֹּהֲנִ֨ים הַלְוִיִּ֜ם כָּל־שֵׁ֧בֶט לֵוִ֛י חֵ֥לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֖ה עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אִשֵּׁ֧י יְהוָ֛ה וְנַחֲלָת֖וֹ יֹאכֵלֽוּן׃
transliteration: lo-yih'yeh lakohaniym hal'viyim kal-shevet leviy chelek v'nachalah 'im-yis'rael ishey y'hvah v'nachalatvo yokhelvn
translation: The levitical priests, the whole tribe of Levi, shall have no territorial portion with Israel. They shall live only off the LORD’s offerings by fire as theiraLit. “its,” i.e., the tribe’s. portion,

hebrew: וְנַחֲלָ֥ה לֹא־יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֖וֹ בְּקֶ֣רֶב אֶחָ֑יו יְהוָה֙ ה֣וּא נַחֲלָת֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּר־לֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'nachalah lo-yih'yeh-lvo b'kerev echayv y'hvah hv nachalatvo kaasher diber-lvo (s)
translation: and shall have no portion among their brother tribes: the L<small>ORD</small> is their portion, as He promised them.

hebrew: וְזֶ֡ה יִהְיֶה֩ מִשְׁפַּ֨ט הַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים מֵאֵ֣ת הָעָ֗ם מֵאֵ֛ת זֹבְחֵ֥י הַזֶּ֖בַח אִם־שׁ֣וֹר אִם־שֶׂ֑ה וְנָתַן֙ לַכֹּהֵ֔ן הַזְּרֹ֥עַ וְהַלְּחָיַ֖יִם וְהַקֵּבָֽה׃
transliteration: v'zeh yih'yeh mish'pat hakohaniym meet ha'am meet zov'chey hazevach im-shvor im-seh v'natan lakohen haz'ro'a v'hal'chayayim v'hakevah
translation: This then shall be the priests’ due from the people: Everyone who offers a sacrifice, whether an ox or a sheep, must give the shoulder, the cheeks, and the stomach to the priest.

hebrew: רֵאשִׁ֨ית דְּגָֽנְךָ֜ תִּֽירֹשְׁךָ֣ וְיִצְהָרֶ֗ךָ וְרֵאשִׁ֛ית גֵּ֥ז צֹאנְךָ֖ תִּתֶּן־לּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: reshiyt d'gan'kha tiyrosh'kha v'yitz'harekha v'reshiyt gez tzon'kha titen-lvo
translation: You shall also give him the first fruits of your new grain and wine and oil, and the first shearing of your sheep.

hebrew: כִּ֣י ב֗וֹ בָּחַ֛ר יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מִכָּל־שְׁבָטֶ֑יךָ לַעֲמֹ֨ד לְשָׁרֵ֧ת בְּשֵׁם־יְהוָ֛ה ה֥וּא וּבָנָ֖יו כָּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy vvo bachar y'hvah eloheykha mikal-sh'vateykha la'amod l'sharet b'shem-y'hvah hv vvanayv kal-hayamiym (s)
translation: For the L<small>ORD</small> your God has chosen him and his descendants, out of all your tribes, to be in attendance for service in the name of the L<small>ORD</small> for all time.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָבֹ֨א הַלֵּוִ֜י מֵאַחַ֤ד שְׁעָרֶ֙יךָ֙ מִכָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־ה֖וּא גָּ֣ר שָׁ֑ם וּבָא֙ בְּכָל־אַוַּ֣ת נַפְשׁ֔וֹ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֥ר יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yavo haleviy meachad sh'areykha mikal-yis'rael asher-hv gar sham vva b'khal-avat naf'shvo el-hamakvom asher-yiv'char y'hvah
translation: If a Levite would go, from any of the settlements throughout Israel where he has been residing, to the place that the L<small>ORD</small> has chosen, he may do so whenever he pleases.

hebrew: וְשֵׁרֵ֕ת בְּשֵׁ֖ם יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יו כְּכָל־אֶחָיו֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם הָעֹמְדִ֥ים שָׁ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'sheret b'shem y'hvah elohayv k'khal-echayv hal'viyim ha'om'diym sham lif'ney y'hvah
translation: He may serve in the name of the L<small>ORD</small> his God like all his fellow Levites who are there in attendance before the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: חֵ֥לֶק כְּחֵ֖לֶק יֹאכֵ֑לוּ לְבַ֥ד מִמְכָּרָ֖יו עַל־הָאָבֽוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: chelek k'chelek yokhelv l'vad mim'karayv 'al-haavvot (s)
translation: They shall receive equal shares of the dues, bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.without regard to personal gifts or patrimonies.-b

hebrew: כִּ֤י אַתָּה֙ בָּ֣א אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֑ךְ לֹֽא־תִלְמַ֣ד לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת כְּתוֹעֲבֹ֖ת הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָהֵֽם׃
transliteration: kiy atah ba el-haaretz asher-y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh' lo-til'mad la'asvot k'tvo'avot hagvoyim hahem
translation: When you enter the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you, you shall not learn to imitate the abhorrent practices of those nations.

hebrew: לֹֽא־יִמָּצֵ֣א בְךָ֔ מַעֲבִ֥יר בְּנֽוֹ־וּבִתּ֖וֹ בָּאֵ֑שׁ קֹסֵ֣ם קְסָמִ֔ים מְעוֹנֵ֥ן וּמְנַחֵ֖שׁ וּמְכַשֵּֽׁף׃
transliteration: lo-yimatze v'kha ma'aviyr b'nvo-vvitvo baesh kosem k'samiym m'vonen vm'nachesh vm'khashef
translation: Let no one be found among you who consigns his son or daughter to the fire, or who is an augur, a soothsayer, a diviner, a sorcerer,

hebrew: וְחֹבֵ֖ר חָ֑בֶר וְשֹׁאֵ֥ל אוֹב֙ וְיִדְּעֹנִ֔י וְדֹרֵ֖שׁ אֶל־הַמֵּתִֽים׃
transliteration: v'chover chaver v'shoel vov v'yid'oniy v'doresh el-hametiym
translation: one who casts spells, or one who consults ghosts or familiar spirits, or one who inquires of the dead.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תוֹעֲבַ֥ת יְהוָ֖ה כָּל־עֹ֣שֵׂה אֵ֑לֶּה וּבִגְלַל֙ הַתּוֹעֵבֹ֣ת הָאֵ֔לֶּה יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ מוֹרִ֥ישׁ אוֹתָ֖ם מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: kiy-tvo'avat y'hvah kal-'oseh eleh vvig'lal hatvo'evot haeleh y'hvah eloheykha mvoriysh votam mipaneykha
translation: For anyone who does such things is abhorrent to the L<small>ORD</small>, and it is because of these abhorrent things that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is dispossessing them before you.

hebrew: תָּמִ֣ים תִּֽהְיֶ֔ה עִ֖ם יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: tamiym tih'yeh 'im y'hvah eloheykha (s)
translation: You must be wholehearted with the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ הַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָאֵ֗לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ יוֹרֵ֣שׁ אוֹתָ֔ם אֶל־מְעֹנְנִ֥ים וְאֶל־קֹסְמִ֖ים יִשְׁמָ֑עוּ וְאַתָּ֕ה לֹ֣א כֵ֔ן נָ֛תַן לְךָ֖ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: kiy  hagvoyim haeleh asher atah yvoresh votam el-m'on'niym v'el-kos'miym yish'ma'v v'atah lo khen natan l'kha y'hvah eloheykha
translation: Those nations that you are about to dispossess do indeed resort to soothsayers and augurs; to you, however, the L<small>ORD</small> your God has not assigned the like.

hebrew: נָבִ֨יא מִקִּרְבְּךָ֤ מֵאַחֶ֙יךָ֙ כָּמֹ֔נִי יָקִ֥ים לְךָ֖ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ אֵלָ֖יו תִּשְׁמָעֽוּן׃
transliteration: naviy mikir'b'kha meacheykha kamoniy yakiym l'kha y'hvah eloheykha elayv tish'ma'vn
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> your God will raise up for you a prophet from among your own people, like myself; him you shall heed.

hebrew: כְּכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁאַ֜לְתָּ מֵעִ֨ם יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ בְּחֹרֵ֔ב בְּי֥וֹם הַקָּהָ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹ֣א אֹסֵ֗ף לִשְׁמֹ֙עַ֙ אֶת־קוֹל֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔י וְאֶת־הָאֵ֨שׁ הַגְּדֹלָ֥ה הַזֹּ֛את לֹֽא־אֶרְאֶ֥ה ע֖וֹד וְלֹ֥א אָמֽוּת׃
transliteration: k'khol asher-shaal'ta me'im y'hvah eloheykha b'chorev b'yvom hakahal lemor lo osef lish'mo'a et-kvol y'hvah elohay v'et-haesh hag'dolah hazot lo-er'eh 'vod v'lo amvt
translation: This is just what you asked of the L<small>ORD</small> your God at Horeb, on the day of the Assembly, saying, “Let me not hear the voice of the L<small>ORD</small> my God any longer or see this wondrous fire any more, lest I die.”

hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י הֵיטִ֖יבוּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽרוּ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elay heytiyvv asher diberv
translation: Whereupon the L<small>ORD</small> said to me, “They have done well in speaking thus.

hebrew: נָבִ֨יא אָקִ֥ים לָהֶ֛ם מִקֶּ֥רֶב אֲחֵיהֶ֖ם כָּמ֑וֹךָ וְנָתַתִּ֤י דְבָרַי֙ בְּפִ֔יו וְדִבֶּ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אֵ֖ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲצַוֶּֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: naviy akiym lahem mikerev acheyhem kamvokha v'natatiy d'varay b'fiyv v'diber aleyhem et kal-asher atzavenv
translation: I will raise up a prophet for them from among their own people, like yourself: I will put My words in his mouth and he will speak to them all that I command him;

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה הָאִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יִשְׁמַע֙ אֶל־דְּבָרַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְדַבֵּ֖ר בִּשְׁמִ֑י אָנֹכִ֖י אֶדְרֹ֥שׁ מֵעִמּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'hayah haiysh asher lo-yish'ma' el-d'varay asher y'daber bish'miy anokhiy ed'rosh me'imvo
translation: and if anybody fails to heed the words he speaks in My name, I Myself will call him to account.

hebrew: אַ֣ךְ הַנָּבִ֡יא אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָזִיד֩ לְדַבֵּ֨ר דָּבָ֜ר בִּשְׁמִ֗י אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־צִוִּיתִיו֙ לְדַבֵּ֔ר וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר יְדַבֵּ֔ר בְּשֵׁ֖ם אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וּמֵ֖ת הַנָּבִ֥יא הַהֽוּא׃
transliteration: akh' hanaviy asher yaziyd l'daber davar bish'miy et asher lo-tziviytiyv l'daber vaasher y'daber b'shem elohiym acheriym vmet hanaviy hahv
translation: But any prophet who presumes to speak in My name an oracle that I did not command him to utter, or who speaks in the name of other gods—that prophet shall die.”

hebrew: וְכִ֥י תֹאמַ֖ר בִּלְבָבֶ֑ךָ אֵיכָה֙ נֵדַ֣ע אֶת־הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־דִבְּר֖וֹ יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: v'khiy tomar bil'vavekha eykhah neda' et-hadavar asher lo-dib'rvo y'hvah
translation: And should you ask yourselves, “How can we know that the oracle was not spoken by the L<small>ORD</small>?”—

hebrew: אֲשֶׁר֩ יְדַבֵּ֨ר הַנָּבִ֜יא בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהוָ֗ה וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֤ה הַדָּבָר֙ וְלֹ֣א יָב֔וֹא ה֣וּא הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־דִבְּר֖וֹ יְהוָ֑ה בְּזָדוֹן֙ דִּבְּר֣וֹ הַנָּבִ֔יא לֹ֥א תָג֖וּר מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: asher y'daber hanaviy b'shem y'hvah v'lo-yih'yeh hadavar v'lo yavvo hv hadavar asher lo-dib'rvo y'hvah b'zadvon dib'rvo hanaviy lo tagvr mimenv (s)
translation: if the prophet speaks in the name of the L<small>ORD</small> and the oracle does not come true, that oracle was not spoken by the L<small>ORD</small>; the prophet has uttered it presumptuously: do not stand in dread of him.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יַכְרִ֞ית יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ אֶת־אַרְצָ֑ם וִֽירִשְׁתָּ֕ם וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֥ בְעָרֵיהֶ֖ם וּבְבָתֵּיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: kiy-yakh'riyt y'hvah eloheykha et-hagvoyim asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha et-ar'tzam viyrish'tam v'yashav'ta v'areyhem vv'vateyhem
translation: When the L<small>ORD</small> your God has cut down the nations whose land the L<small>ORD</small> your God is assigning to you, and you have dispossessed them and settled in their towns and homes,

hebrew: שָׁל֥וֹשׁ עָרִ֖ים תַּבְדִּ֣יל לָ֑ךְ בְּת֣וֹךְ אַרְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: shalvosh 'ariym tav'diyl lakh' b'tvokh' ar'tz'kha asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha l'rish'tah
translation: you shall set aside three cities in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you to possess.

hebrew: תָּכִ֣ין לְךָ֮ הַדֶּרֶךְ֒ וְשִׁלַּשְׁתָּ֙ אֶת־גְּב֣וּל אַרְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַנְחִֽילְךָ֖ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְהָיָ֕ה לָנ֥וּס שָׁ֖מָּה כָּל־רֹצֵֽחַ׃
transliteration: takhiyn l'kha haderekh' v'shilash'ta et-g'vvl ar'tz'kha asher yan'chiyl'kha y'hvah eloheykha v'hayah lanvs shamah kal-rotzecha
translation: You shall survey the distances, and divide into three parts the territory of the country that the L<small>ORD</small> your God has allotted to you, so that any manslayer may have a place to flee to.—

hebrew: וְזֶה֙ דְּבַ֣ר הָרֹצֵ֔חַ אֲשֶׁר־יָנ֥וּס שָׁ֖מָּה וָחָ֑י אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַכֶּ֤ה אֶת־רֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ בִּבְלִי־דַ֔עַת וְה֛וּא לֹא־שֹׂנֵ֥א ל֖וֹ מִתְּמֹ֥ל שִׁלְשֹֽׁם׃
transliteration: v'zeh d'var harotzecha asher-yanvs shamah vachay asher yakeh et-re'ehv biv'liy-da'at v'hv lo-sone lvo mit'mol shil'shom
translation: Now this is the case of the manslayer who may flee there and live: one who has killed another unwittingly, without having been his enemy in the past.

hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁר֩ יָבֹ֨א אֶת־רֵעֵ֥הוּ בַיַּעַר֮ לַחְטֹ֣ב עֵצִים֒ וְנִדְּחָ֨ה יָד֤וֹ בַגַּרְזֶן֙ לִכְרֹ֣ת הָעֵ֔ץ וְנָשַׁ֤ל הַבַּרְזֶל֙ מִן־הָעֵ֔ץ וּמָצָ֥א אֶת־רֵעֵ֖הוּ וָמֵ֑ת ה֗וּא יָנ֛וּס אֶל־אַחַ֥ת הֶעָרִים־הָאֵ֖לֶּה וָחָֽי׃
transliteration: vaasher yavo et-re'ehv vaya'ar lach'tov 'etziym v'nid'chah yadvo vagar'zen likh'rot ha'etz v'nashal habar'zel min-ha'etz vmatza et-re'ehv vamet hv yanvs el-achat he'ariym-haeleh vachay
translation: For instance, a man goes with his neighbor into a grove to cut wood; as his hand swings the ax to cut down a tree, the ax-head flies off the handle and strikes the other so that he dies. That man shall flee to one of these cities and live.—

hebrew: פֶּן־יִרְדֹּף֩ גֹּאֵ֨ל הַדָּ֜ם אַחֲרֵ֣י הָרֹצֵ֗חַ כִּי־יֵחַם֮ לְבָבוֹ֒ וְהִשִּׂיג֛וֹ כִּֽי־יִרְבֶּ֥ה הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ וְהִכָּ֣הוּ נָ֑פֶשׁ וְלוֹ֙ אֵ֣ין מִשְׁפַּט־מָ֔וֶת כִּ֠י לֹ֣א שֹׂנֵ֥א ה֛וּא ל֖וֹ מִתְּמ֥וֹל שִׁלְשֽׁוֹם׃
transliteration: pen-yir'dof goel hadam acharey harotzecha kiy-yecham l'vavvo v'hisiygvo kiy-yir'beh haderekh' v'hikahv nafesh v'lvo eyn mish'pat-mavet kiy lo sone hv lvo mit'mvol shil'shvom
translation: Otherwise, when the distance is great, the blood-avenger, pursuing the manslayer in hot anger, may overtake him and kill him; yet he did not incur the death penalty, since he had never been the other’s enemy.

hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֛ן אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ לֵאמֹ֑ר שָׁלֹ֥שׁ עָרִ֖ים תַּבְדִּ֥יל לָֽךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'al-ken anokhiy m'tzav'kha lemor shalosh 'ariym tav'diyl lakh' (s)
translation: That is why I command you: set aside three cities.

hebrew: וְאִם־יַרְחִ֞יב יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־גְּבֻ֣לְךָ֔ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖ע לַאֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ וְנָ֤תַן לְךָ֙ אֶת־כָּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר לָתֵ֥ת לַאֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'im-yar'chiyv y'hvah eloheykha et-g'vul'kha kaasher nish'ba' laavoteykha v'natan l'kha et-kal-haaretz asher diber latet laavoteykha
translation: And when the L<small>ORD</small> your God enlarges your territory, as He swore to your fathers, and gives you all the land that He promised to give your fathers—

hebrew: כִּֽי־תִשְׁמֹר֩ אֶת־כָּל־הַמִּצְוָ֨ה הַזֹּ֜את לַעֲשֹׂתָ֗הּ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֣י מְצַוְּךָ֮ הַיּוֹם֒ לְאַהֲבָ֞ה אֶת־יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ וְלָלֶ֥כֶת בִּדְרָכָ֖יו כָּל־הַיָּמִ֑ים וְיָסַפְתָּ֨ לְךָ֥ עוֹד֙ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ עָרִ֔ים עַ֖ל הַשָּׁלֹ֥שׁ הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: kiy-tish'mor et-kal-hamitz'vah hazot la'asotah asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom l'ahavah et-y'hvah eloheykha v'lalekhet bid'rakhayv kal-hayamiym v'yasaf'ta l'kha 'vod shalosh 'ariym 'al hashalosh haeleh
translation: if you faithfully observe all this Instruction that I enjoin upon you this day, to love the L<small>ORD</small> your God and to walk in His ways at all times—then you shall add three more towns to those three.

hebrew: וְלֹ֤א יִשָּׁפֵךְ֙ דָּ֣ם נָקִ֔י בְּקֶ֣רֶב אַרְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ נַחֲלָ֑ה וְהָיָ֥ה עָלֶ֖יךָ דָּמִֽים׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'lo yishafekh' dam nakiy b'kerev ar'tz'kha asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha nachalah v'hayah 'aleykha damiym (s)
translation: Thus blood of the innocent will not be shed, bringing bloodguilt upon you in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is allotting to you.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה אִישׁ֙ שֹׂנֵ֣א לְרֵעֵ֔הוּ וְאָ֤רַב לוֹ֙ וְקָ֣ם עָלָ֔יו וְהִכָּ֥הוּ נֶ֖פֶשׁ וָמֵ֑ת וְנָ֕ס אֶל־אַחַ֖ת הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yih'yeh iysh sone l're'ehv v'arav lvo v'kam 'alayv v'hikahv nefesh vamet v'nas el-achat he'ariym hael
translation: If, however, a person who is the enemy of another lies in wait for him and sets upon him and strikes him a fatal blow and then flees to one of these towns,

hebrew: וְשָֽׁלְחוּ֙ זִקְנֵ֣י עִיר֔וֹ וְלָקְח֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ מִשָּׁ֑ם וְנָתְנ֣וּ אֹת֗וֹ בְּיַ֛ד גֹּאֵ֥ל הַדָּ֖ם וָמֵֽת׃
transliteration: v'shal'chv zik'ney 'iyrvo v'lak'chv otvo misham v'nat'nv otvo b'yad goel hadam vamet
translation: the elders of his town shall have him brought back from there and shall hand him over to the blood-avenger to be put to death;

hebrew: לֹא־תָח֥וֹס עֵֽינְךָ֖ עָלָ֑יו וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֧ דַֽם־הַנָּקִ֛י מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְט֥וֹב לָֽךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-tachvos 'eyn'kha 'alayv vvi'ar'ta dam-hanakiy miyis'rael v'tvov lakh' (s)
translation: you must show him no pity. Thus you will purge Israel of the blood of the innocent,aCf. Num. 35.33–34. and it will go well with you.

hebrew: לֹ֤א תַסִּיג֙ גְּב֣וּל רֵֽעֲךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר גָּבְל֖וּ רִאשֹׁנִ֑ים בְּנַחֲלָֽתְךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּנְחַ֔ל בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo tasiyg g'vvl re'akha asher gav'lv rishoniym b'nachalat'kha asher tin'chal baaretz asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha l'rish'tah (s)
translation: You shall not move your countryman’s landmarks, set up by previous generations, in the property that will be allotted to you in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you to possess.

hebrew: לֹֽא־יָקוּם֩ עֵ֨ד אֶחָ֜ד בְּאִ֗ישׁ לְכָל־עָוֺן֙ וּלְכָל־חַטָּ֔את בְּכָל־חֵ֖טְא אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֶֽחֱטָ֑א עַל־פִּ֣י ׀ שְׁנֵ֣י עֵדִ֗ים א֛וֹ עַל־פִּ֥י שְׁלֹשָֽׁה־עֵדִ֖ים יָק֥וּם דָּבָֽר׃
transliteration: lo-yakvm 'ed echad b'iysh l'khal-'avon vl'khal-chatat b'khal-chet' asher yecheta 'al-piy  sh'ney 'ediym vo 'al-piy sh'loshah-'ediym yakvm davar
translation: A single witness may not validate against a person any guilt or blame for any offense that may be committed; a case can be valid only on the testimony of two witnesses or more.bSee note at 17.6.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יָק֥וּם עֵד־חָמָ֖ס בְּאִ֑ישׁ לַעֲנ֥וֹת בּ֖וֹ סָרָֽה׃
transliteration: kiy-yakvm 'ed-chamas b'iysh la'anvot bvo sarah
translation: If a man appears against another to testify maliciously and gives false testimony against him,

hebrew: וְעָמְד֧וּ שְׁנֵֽי־הָאֲנָשִׁ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־לָהֶ֥ם הָרִ֖יב לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה לִפְנֵ֤י הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ וְהַשֹּׁ֣פְטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִהְי֖וּ בַּיָּמִ֥ים הָהֵֽם׃
transliteration: v'am'dv sh'ney-haanashiym asher-lahem hariyv lif'ney y'hvah lif'ney hakohaniym v'hashof'tiym asher yih'yv bayamiym hahem
translation: the two parties to the dispute shall appear before the L<small>ORD</small>, before the priests or magistrates in authority at the time,

hebrew: וְדָרְשׁ֥וּ הַשֹּׁפְטִ֖ים הֵיטֵ֑ב וְהִנֵּ֤ה עֵֽד־שֶׁ֙קֶר֙ הָעֵ֔ד שֶׁ֖קֶר עָנָ֥ה בְאָחִֽיו׃
transliteration: v'dar'shv hashof'tiym heytev v'hineh 'ed-sheker ha'ed sheker 'anah v'achiyv
translation: and the magistrates shall make a thorough investigation. If the man who testified is a false witness, if he has testified falsely against his fellow,

hebrew: וַעֲשִׂ֣יתֶם ל֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר זָמַ֖ם לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת לְאָחִ֑יו וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: va'asiytem lvo kaasher zamam la'asvot l'achiyv vvi'ar'ta hara' mikir'bekha
translation: you shall do to him as he schemed to do to his fellow. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst;

hebrew: וְהַנִּשְׁאָרִ֖ים יִשְׁמְע֣וּ וְיִרָ֑אוּ וְלֹֽא־יֹסִ֨פוּ לַעֲשׂ֜וֹת ע֗וֹד כַּדָּבָ֥ר הָרָ֛ע הַזֶּ֖ה בְּקִרְבֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'hanish'ariym yish'm'v v'yirav v'lo-yosifv la'asvot 'vod kadavar hara' hazeh b'kir'bekha
translation: others will hear and be afraid, and such evil things will not again be done in your midst.

hebrew: וְלֹ֥א תָח֖וֹס עֵינֶ֑ךָ נֶ֣פֶשׁ בְּנֶ֗פֶשׁ עַ֤יִן בְּעַ֙יִן֙ שֵׁ֣ן בְּשֵׁ֔ן יָ֥ד בְּיָ֖ד רֶ֥גֶל בְּרָֽגֶל׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'lo tachvos 'eynekha nefesh b'nefesh 'ayin b'ayin shen b'shen yad b'yad regel b'ragel (s)
translation: Nor must you show pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תֵצֵ֨א לַמִּלְחָמָ֜ה עַל־אֹיְבֶ֗יךָ וְֽרָאִ֜יתָ ס֤וּס וָרֶ֙כֶב֙ עַ֚ם רַ֣ב מִמְּךָ֔ לֹ֥א תִירָ֖א מֵהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ הַמַּֽעַלְךָ֖ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: kiy-tetze lamil'chamah 'al-oy'veykha v'raiyta svs varekhev 'am rav mim'kha lo tiyra mehem kiy-y'hvah eloheykha 'imakh' hama'al'kha meeretz mitz'rayim
translation: When you take the field against your enemies, and see horses and chariots—forces larger than yours—have no fear of them, for the L<small>ORD</small> your God, who brought you from the land of Egypt, is with you.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֕ה כְּקָֽרָבְכֶ֖ם אֶל־הַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וְנִגַּ֥שׁ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן וְדִבֶּ֥ר אֶל־הָעָֽם׃
transliteration: v'hayah k'karav'khem el-hamil'chamah v'nigash hakohen v'diber el-ha'am
translation: Before you join battle, the priest shall come forward and address the troops.

hebrew: וְאָמַ֤ר אֲלֵהֶם֙ שְׁמַ֣ע יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַתֶּ֨ם קְרֵבִ֥ים הַיּ֛וֹם לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה עַל־אֹיְבֵיכֶ֑ם אַל־יֵרַ֣ךְ לְבַבְכֶ֗ם אַל־תִּֽירְא֧וּ וְאַֽל־תַּחְפְּז֛וּ וְאַל־תַּֽעַרְצ֖וּ מִפְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: v'amar alehem sh'ma' yis'rael atem k'reviym hayvom lamil'chamah 'al-oy'veykhem al-yerakh' l'vav'khem al-tiyr'v v'al-tach'p'zv v'al-ta'ar'tzv mip'neyhem
translation: He shall say to them, “Hear, O Israel! You are about to join battle with your enemy. Let not your courage falter. Do not be in fear, or in panic, or in dread of them.

hebrew: כִּ֚י יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם הַהֹלֵ֖ךְ עִמָּכֶ֑ם לְהִלָּחֵ֥ם לָכֶ֛ם עִם־אֹיְבֵיכֶ֖ם לְהוֹשִׁ֥יעַ אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: kiy y'hvah eloheykhem haholekh' 'imakhem l'hilachem lakhem 'im-oy'veykhem l'hvoshiy'a et'khem
translation: For it is the L<small>ORD</small> your God who marches with you to do battle for you against your enemy, to bring you victory.”

hebrew: וְדִבְּר֣וּ הַשֹּֽׁטְרִים֮ אֶל־הָעָ֣ם לֵאמֹר֒ מִֽי־הָאִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר בָּנָ֤ה בַֽיִת־חָדָשׁ֙ וְלֹ֣א חֲנָכ֔וֹ יֵלֵ֖ךְ וְיָשֹׁ֣ב לְבֵית֑וֹ פֶּן־יָמוּת֙ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְאִ֥ישׁ אַחֵ֖ר יַחְנְכֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: v'dib'rv hashot'riym el-ha'am lemor miy-haiysh asher banah vayit-chadash v'lo chanakhvo yelekh' v'yashov l'veytvo pen-yamvt bamil'chamah v'iysh acher yach'n'khenv
translation: Then the officials shall address the troops, as follows: “Is there anyone who has built a new house but has not dedicated it? Let him go back to his home, lest he die in battle and another dedicate it.

hebrew: וּמִֽי־הָאִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־נָטַ֥ע כֶּ֙רֶם֙ וְלֹ֣א חִלְּל֔וֹ יֵלֵ֖ךְ וְיָשֹׁ֣ב לְבֵית֑וֹ פֶּן־יָמוּת֙ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְאִ֥ישׁ אַחֵ֖ר יְחַלְּלֶֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: vmiy-haiysh asher-nata' kerem v'lo chil'lvo yelekh' v'yashov l'veytvo pen-yamvt bamil'chamah v'iysh acher y'chal'lenv
translation: Is there anyone who has planted a vineyard but has never harvested it? Let him go back to his home, lest he die in battle and another harvest it.

hebrew: וּמִֽי־הָאִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־אֵרַ֤שׂ אִשָּׁה֙ וְלֹ֣א לְקָחָ֔הּ יֵלֵ֖ךְ וְיָשֹׁ֣ב לְבֵית֑וֹ פֶּן־יָמוּת֙ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְאִ֥ישׁ אַחֵ֖ר יִקָּחֶֽנָּה׃
transliteration: vmiy-haiysh asher-eras ishah v'lo l'kachah yelekh' v'yashov l'veytvo pen-yamvt bamil'chamah v'iysh acher yikachenah
translation: Is there anyone who has paid the bride-price for a wife,aThereby making her his wife legally, even though the marriage has not yet taken place. but who has not yet married her? Let him go back to his home, lest he die in battle and another marry her.”

hebrew: וְיָסְפ֣וּ הַשֹּׁטְרִים֮ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־הָעָם֒ וְאָמְר֗וּ מִי־הָאִ֤ישׁ הַיָּרֵא֙ וְרַ֣ךְ הַלֵּבָ֔ב יֵלֵ֖ךְ וְיָשֹׁ֣ב לְבֵית֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א יִמַּ֛ס אֶת־לְבַ֥ב אֶחָ֖יו כִּלְבָבֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'yas'fv hashot'riym l'daber el-ha'am v'am'rv miy-haiysh hayare v'rakh' halevav yelekh' v'yashov l'veytvo v'lo yimas et-l'vav echayv kil'vavvo
translation: The officials shall go on addressing the troops and say, “Is there anyone afraid and disheartened? Let him go back to his home, lest the courage of his comrades flag like his.”

hebrew: וְהָיָ֛ה כְּכַלֹּ֥ת הַשֹּׁטְרִ֖ים לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וּפָֽקְד֛וּ שָׂרֵ֥י צְבָא֖וֹת בְּרֹ֥אשׁ הָעָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hayah k'khalot hashot'riym l'daber el-ha'am vfak'dv sarey tz'vavot b'rosh ha'am (s)
translation: When the officials have finished addressing the troops, army commanders shall assume command of the troops.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תִקְרַ֣ב אֶל־עִ֔יר לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם עָלֶ֑יהָ וְקָרָ֥אתָ אֵלֶ֖יהָ לְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
transliteration: kiy-tik'rav el-'iyr l'hilachem 'aleyha v'karata eleyha l'shalvom
translation: When you approach a town to attack it, you shall bOr “call on it to surrender.”offer it terms of peace.-b

hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ אִם־שָׁל֣וֹם תַּֽעַנְךָ֔ וּפָתְחָ֖ה לָ֑ךְ וְהָיָ֞ה כָּל־הָעָ֣ם הַנִּמְצָא־בָ֗הּ יִהְי֥וּ לְךָ֛ לָמַ֖ס וַעֲבָדֽוּךָ׃
transliteration: v'hayah im-shalvom ta'an'kha vfat'chah lakh' v'hayah kal-ha'am hanim'tza-vah yih'yv l'kha lamas va'avadvkha
translation: If it responds peaceably and lets you in, all the people present there shall serve you at forced labor.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֤א תַשְׁלִים֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ וְעָשְׂתָ֥ה עִמְּךָ֖ מִלְחָמָ֑ה וְצַרְתָּ֖ עָלֶֽיהָּ׃
transliteration: v'im-lo tash'liym 'imakh' v'as'tah 'im'kha mil'chamah v'tzar'ta 'aleyha
translation: If it does not surrender to you, but would join battle with you, you shall lay siege to it;

hebrew: וּנְתָנָ֛הּ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וְהִכִּיתָ֥ אֶת־כָּל־זְכוּרָ֖הּ לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃
transliteration: vn'tanah y'hvah eloheykha b'yadekha v'hikiyta et-kal-z'khvrah l'fiy-charev
translation: and when the L<small>ORD</small> your God delivers it into your hand, you shall put all its males to the sword.

hebrew: רַ֣ק הַ֠נָּשִׁים וְהַטַּ֨ף וְהַבְּהֵמָ֜ה וְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֥ה בָעִ֛יר כָּל־שְׁלָלָ֖הּ תָּבֹ֣ז לָ֑ךְ וְאָֽכַלְתָּ֙ אֶת־שְׁלַ֣ל אֹיְבֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֛ן יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: rak hanashiym v'hataf v'hab'hemah v'khol asher yih'yeh va'iyr kal-sh'lalah tavoz lakh' v'akhal'ta et-sh'lal oy'veykha asher natan y'hvah eloheykha lakh'
translation: You may, however, take as your booty the women, the children, the livestock, and everything in the town—all its spoil—and enjoy the use of the spoil of your enemy, which the L<small>ORD</small> your God gives you.

hebrew: כֵּ֤ן תַּעֲשֶׂה֙ לְכָל־הֶ֣עָרִ֔ים הָרְחֹקֹ֥ת מִמְּךָ֖ מְאֹ֑ד אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־מֵעָרֵ֥י הַגּֽוֹיִם־הָאֵ֖לֶּה הֵֽנָּה׃
transliteration: ken ta'aseh l'khal-he'ariym har'chokot mim'kha m'od asher lo-me'arey hagvoyim-haeleh henah
translation: Thus you shall deal with all towns that lie very far from you, towns that do not belong to nations hereabout.

hebrew: רַ֗ק מֵעָרֵ֤י הָֽעַמִּים֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ נַחֲלָ֑ה לֹ֥א תְחַיֶּ֖ה כָּל־נְשָׁמָֽה׃
transliteration: rak me'arey ha'amiym haeleh asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha nachalah lo t'chayeh kal-n'shamah
translation: In the towns of the latter peoples, however, which the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you as a heritage, you shall not let a soul remain alive.

hebrew: כִּֽי־הַחֲרֵ֣ם תַּחֲרִימֵ֗ם הַחִתִּ֤י וְהָאֱמֹרִי֙ הַכְּנַעֲנִ֣י וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִ֑י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוְּךָ֖ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: kiy-hacharem tachariymem hachitiy v'haemoriy hak'na'aniy v'hap'riziy hachiviy v'hay'vvsiy kaasher tziv'kha y'hvah eloheykha
translation: No, you must proscribecSee Lev. 27.29. them—the Hittites and the Amorites, the Canaanites and the Perizzites, the Hivites and the Jebusites—as the LORD your God has commanded you,

hebrew: לְמַ֗עַן אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־יְלַמְּד֤וּ אֶתְכֶם֙ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת כְּכֹל֙ תּֽוֹעֲבֹתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשׂ֖וּ לֵֽאלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם וַחֲטָאתֶ֖ם לַיהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: l'ma'an asher lo-y'lam'dv et'khem la'asvot k'khol tvo'avotam asher 'asv leloheyhem vachatatem layhvah eloheykhem (s)
translation: lest they lead you into doing all the abhorrent things that they have done for their gods and you stand guilty before the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תָצ֣וּר אֶל־עִיר֩ יָמִ֨ים רַבִּ֜ים לְֽהִלָּחֵ֧ם עָלֶ֣יהָ לְתָפְשָׂ֗הּ לֹֽא־תַשְׁחִ֤ית אֶת־עֵצָהּ֙ לִנְדֹּ֤חַ עָלָיו֙ גַּרְזֶ֔ן כִּ֚י מִמֶּ֣נּוּ תֹאכֵ֔ל וְאֹת֖וֹ לֹ֣א תִכְרֹ֑ת כִּ֤י הָֽאָדָם֙ עֵ֣ץ הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה לָבֹ֥א מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ בַּמָּצֽוֹר׃
transliteration: kiy-tatzvr el-'iyr yamiym rabiym l'hilachem 'aleyha l'taf'sah lo-tash'chiyt et-'etzah lin'docha 'alayv gar'zen kiy mimenv tokhel v'otvo lo tikh'rot kiy haadam 'etz hasadeh lavo mipaneykha bamatzvor
translation: When in your war against a city you have to besiege it a long time in order to capture it, you must not destroy its trees, wielding the ax against them. You may eat of them, but you must not cut them down. Are trees of the field human to withdraw before you into the besieged city?

hebrew: רַ֞ק עֵ֣ץ אֲשֶׁר־תֵּדַ֗ע כִּֽי־לֹא־עֵ֤ץ מַאֲכָל֙ ה֔וּא אֹת֥וֹ תַשְׁחִ֖ית וְכָרָ֑תָּ וּבָנִ֣יתָ מָצ֗וֹר עַל־הָעִיר֙ אֲשֶׁר־הִ֨וא עֹשָׂ֧ה עִמְּךָ֛ מִלְחָמָ֖ה עַ֥ד רִדְתָּֽהּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: rak 'etz asher-teda' kiy-lo-'etz maakhal hv otvo tash'chiyt v'kharata vvaniyta matzvor 'al-ha'iyr asher-hiv 'osah 'im'kha mil'chamah 'ad rid'tah (f)
translation: Only trees that you know do not yield food may be destroyed; you may cut them down for constructing siegeworks against the city that is waging war on you, until it has been reduced.

hebrew: כִּי־יִמָּצֵ֣א חָלָ֗ל בָּאֲדָמָה֙ אֲשֶׁר֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ נֹתֵ֤ן לְךָ֙ לְרִשְׁתָּ֔הּ נֹפֵ֖ל בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה לֹ֥א נוֹדַ֖ע מִ֥י הִכָּֽהוּ׃
transliteration: kiy-yimatze chalal baadamah asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha l'rish'tah nofel basadeh lo nvoda' miy hikahv
translation: If, in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is assigning you to possess, someone slain is found lying in the open, the identity of the slayer not being known,

hebrew: וְיָצְא֥וּ זְקֵנֶ֖יךָ וְשֹׁפְטֶ֑יךָ וּמָדְדוּ֙ אֶל־הֶ֣עָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר סְבִיבֹ֥ת הֶחָלָֽל׃
transliteration: v'yatz'v z'keneykha v'shof'teykha vmad'dv el-he'ariym asher s'viyvot hechalal
translation: your elders and magistrates shall go out and measure the distances from the corpse to the nearby towns.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה הָעִ֔יר הַקְּרֹבָ֖ה אֶל־הֶחָלָ֑ל וְלָֽקְח֡וּ זִקְנֵי֩ הָעִ֨יר הַהִ֜וא עֶגְלַ֣ת בָּקָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־עֻבַּד֙ בָּ֔הּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־מָשְׁכָ֖ה בְּעֹֽל׃
transliteration: v'hayah ha'iyr hak'rovah el-hechalal v'lak'chv zik'ney ha'iyr hahiv 'eg'lat bakar asher lo-'ubad bah asher lo-mash'khah b'ol
translation: The elders of the town nearest to the corpse shall then take a heifer which has never been worked, which has never pulled in a yoke;

hebrew: וְהוֹרִ֡דוּ זִקְנֵי֩ הָעִ֨יר הַהִ֤וא אֶת־הָֽעֶגְלָה֙ אֶל־נַ֣חַל אֵיתָ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־יֵעָבֵ֥ד בּ֖וֹ וְלֹ֣א יִזָּרֵ֑עַ וְעָֽרְפוּ־שָׁ֥ם אֶת־הָעֶגְלָ֖ה בַּנָּֽחַל׃
transliteration: v'hvoridv zik'ney ha'iyr hahiv et-ha'eg'lah el-nachal eytan asher lo-ye'aved bvo v'lo yizare'a v'ar'fv-sham et-ha'eg'lah banachal
translation: and the elders of that town shall bring the heifer down to an everflowing wadi, which is not tilled or sown. There, in the wadi, they shall break the heifer’s neck.

hebrew: וְנִגְּשׁ֣וּ הַכֹּהֲנִים֮ בְּנֵ֣י לֵוִי֒ כִּ֣י בָ֗ם בָּחַ֞ר יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ לְשָׁ֣רְת֔וֹ וּלְבָרֵ֖ךְ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהוָ֑ה וְעַל־פִּיהֶ֥ם יִהְיֶ֖ה כָּל־רִ֥יב וְכָל־נָֽגַע׃
transliteration: v'nig'shv hakohaniym b'ney leviy kiy vam bachar y'hvah eloheykha l'shar'tvo vl'varekh' b'shem y'hvah v'al-piyhem yih'yeh kal-riyv v'khal-naga'
translation: The priests, sons of Levi, shall come forward; for the LORD your God has chosen them to minister to Him and to pronounce blessing in the name of the LORD, and every lawsuit and case of assaultaCf. 17.8. Or “skin affection”; cf. 24.8. is subject to their ruling.

hebrew: וְכֹ֗ל זִקְנֵי֙ הָעִ֣יר הַהִ֔וא הַקְּרֹבִ֖ים אֶל־הֶחָלָ֑ל יִרְחֲצוּ֙ אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֔ם עַל־הָעֶגְלָ֖ה הָעֲרוּפָ֥ה בַנָּֽחַל׃
transliteration: v'khol zik'ney ha'iyr hahiv hak'roviym el-hechalal yir'chatzv et-y'deyhem 'al-ha'eg'lah ha'arvfah vanachal
translation: Then all the elders of the town nearest to the corpse shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the wadi.

hebrew: וְעָנ֖וּ וְאָמְר֑וּ יָדֵ֗ינוּ לֹ֤א שפכה [שָֽׁפְכוּ֙] אֶת־הַדָּ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְעֵינֵ֖ינוּ לֹ֥א רָאֽוּ׃
transliteration: v'anv v'am'rv yadeynv lo shfkhh [shaf'khv] et-hadam hazeh v'eyneynv lo rav
translation: And they shall make this declaration: “Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes see it done.

hebrew: כַּפֵּר֩ לְעַמְּךָ֨ יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־פָּדִ֙יתָ֙ יְהוָ֔ה וְאַל־תִּתֵּן֙ דָּ֣ם נָקִ֔י בְּקֶ֖רֶב עַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְנִכַּפֵּ֥ר לָהֶ֖ם הַדָּֽם׃
transliteration: kaper l'am'kha yis'rael asher-padiyta y'hvah v'al-titen dam nakiy b'kerev 'am'kha yis'rael v'nikaper lahem hadam
translation: Absolve, O L<small>ORD</small>, Your people Israel whom You redeemed, and do not let guilt for the blood of the innocent remain among Your people Israel.” And they will be absolved of bloodguilt.

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֗ה תְּבַעֵ֛ר הַדָּ֥ם הַנָּקִ֖י מִקִּרְבֶּ֑ךָ כִּֽי־תַעֲשֶׂ֥ה הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'atah t'va'er hadam hanakiy mikir'bekha kiy-ta'aseh hayashar b'eyney y'hvah (s)
translation: Thus you will remove from your midst guilt for the blood of the innocent, for you will be doing what is right in the sight of the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תֵצֵ֥א לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה עַל־אֹיְבֶ֑יךָ וּנְתָנ֞וֹ יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ בְּיָדֶ֖ךָ וְשָׁבִ֥יתָ שִׁבְיֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kiy-tetze lamil'chamah 'al-oy'veykha vn'tanvo y'hvah eloheykha b'yadekha v'shaviyta shiv'yvo
translation: When you take the field against your enemies, and the L<small>ORD</small> your God delivers them into your power and you take some of them captive,

hebrew: וְרָאִיתָ֙ בַּשִּׁבְיָ֔ה אֵ֖שֶׁת יְפַת־תֹּ֑אַר וְחָשַׁקְתָּ֣ בָ֔הּ וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ לְךָ֖ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'raiyta bashiv'yah eshet y'fat-toar v'chashak'ta vah v'lakach'ta l'kha l'ishah
translation: and you see among the captives a beautiful woman and you desire her and would take her to wife,

hebrew: וַהֲבֵאתָ֖הּ אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ וְגִלְּחָה֙ אֶת־רֹאשָׁ֔הּ וְעָשְׂתָ֖ה אֶת־צִפָּרְנֶֽיהָ׃
transliteration: vahavetah el-tvokh' beytekha v'gil'chah et-roshah v'as'tah et-tzipar'neyha
translation: you shall bring her into your house, and she shall trim her hair, pare her nails,

hebrew: וְהֵסִ֩ירָה֩ אֶת־שִׂמְלַ֨ת שִׁבְיָ֜הּ מֵעָלֶ֗יהָ וְיָֽשְׁבָה֙ בְּבֵיתֶ֔ךָ וּבָֽכְתָ֛ה אֶת־אָבִ֥יהָ וְאֶת־אִמָּ֖הּ יֶ֣רַח יָמִ֑ים וְאַ֨חַר כֵּ֜ן תָּב֤וֹא אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ וּבְעַלְתָּ֔הּ וְהָיְתָ֥ה לְךָ֖ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: v'hesiyrah et-sim'lat shiv'yah me'aleyha v'yash'vah b'veytekha vvakh'tah et-aviyha v'et-imah yerach yamiym v'achar ken tavvo eleyha vv'al'tah v'hay'tah l'kha l'ishah
translation: and discard her captive’s garb. She shall spend a month’s time in your house lamenting her father and mother; after that you may come to her and possess her, and she shall be your wife.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה אִם־לֹ֧א חָפַ֣צְתָּ בָּ֗הּ וְשִׁלַּחְתָּהּ֙ לְנַפְשָׁ֔הּ וּמָכֹ֥ר לֹא־תִמְכְּרֶ֖נָּה בַּכָּ֑סֶף לֹא־תִתְעַמֵּ֣ר בָּ֔הּ תַּ֖חַת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עִנִּיתָֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hayah im-lo chafatz'ta bah v'shilach'tah l'naf'shah vmakhor lo-tim'k'renah bakasef lo-tit'amer bah tachat asher 'iniytah (s)
translation: Then, should you no longer want her, you must release her outright. You must not sell her for money: since you had your will of her, you must not enslave her.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תִהְיֶ֨יןָ לְאִ֜ישׁ שְׁתֵּ֣י נָשִׁ֗ים הָאַחַ֤ת אֲהוּבָה֙ וְהָאַחַ֣ת שְׂנוּאָ֔ה וְיָֽלְדוּ־ל֣וֹ בָנִ֔ים הָאֲהוּבָ֖ה וְהַשְּׂנוּאָ֑ה וְהָיָ֛ה הַבֵּ֥ן הַבְּכ֖וֹר לַשְּׂנִיאָֽה׃
transliteration: kiy-tih'yeyna l'iysh sh'tey nashiym haachat ahvvah v'haachat s'nvah v'yal'dv-lvo vaniym haahvvah v'has'nvah v'hayah haben hab'khvor las'niyah
translation: If a man has two wives, one loved and the other unloved, and both the loved and the unloved have borne him sons, but the first-born is the son of the unloved one—

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה בְּיוֹם֙ הַנְחִיל֣וֹ אֶת־בָּנָ֔יו אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־יִהְיֶ֖ה ל֑וֹ לֹ֣א יוּכַ֗ל לְבַכֵּר֙ אֶת־בֶּן־הָ֣אֲהוּבָ֔ה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י בֶן־הַשְּׂנוּאָ֖ה הַבְּכֹֽר׃
transliteration: v'hayah b'yvom han'chiylvo et-banayv et asher-yih'yeh lvo lo yvkhal l'vaker et-ben-haahvvah 'al-p'ney ven-has'nvah hab'khor
translation: when he wills his property to his sons, he may not treat as first-born the son of the loved one in disregard of the son of the unloved one who is older.

hebrew: כִּי֩ אֶת־הַבְּכֹ֨ר בֶּן־הַשְּׂנוּאָ֜ה יַכִּ֗יר לָ֤תֶת לוֹ֙ פִּ֣י שְׁנַ֔יִם בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יִמָּצֵ֖א ל֑וֹ כִּי־הוּא֙ רֵאשִׁ֣ית אֹנ֔וֹ ל֖וֹ מִשְׁפַּ֥ט הַבְּכֹרָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy et-hab'khor ben-has'nvah yakiyr latet lvo piy sh'nayim b'khol asher-yimatze lvo kiy-hv reshiyt onvo lvo mish'pat hab'khorah (s)
translation: Instead, he must accept the first-born, the son of the unloved one, and allot to him a double portionbLit. two-thirds. of all he possesses; since he is the first fruit of his vigor, the birthright is his due.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֣ה לְאִ֗ישׁ בֵּ֚ן סוֹרֵ֣ר וּמוֹרֶ֔ה אֵינֶ֣נּוּ שֹׁמֵ֔עַ בְּק֥וֹל אָבִ֖יו וּבְק֣וֹל אִמּ֑וֹ וְיסְּר֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א יִשְׁמַ֖ע אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: kiy-yih'yeh l'iysh ben svorer vmvoreh eynenv shome'a b'kvol aviyv vv'kvol imvo v'ys'rv otvo v'lo yish'ma' aleyhem
translation: If a man has a wayward and defiant son, who does not heed his father or mother and does not obey them even after they discipline him,

hebrew: וְתָ֥פְשׂוּ ב֖וֹ אָבִ֣יו וְאִמּ֑וֹ וְהוֹצִ֧יאוּ אֹת֛וֹ אֶל־זִקְנֵ֥י עִיר֖וֹ וְאֶל־שַׁ֥עַר מְקֹמֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'taf'sv vvo aviyv v'imvo v'hvotziyv otvo el-zik'ney 'iyrvo v'el-sha'ar m'komvo
translation: his father and mother shall take hold of him and bring him out to the elders of his town at the public place of his community.

hebrew: וְאָמְר֞וּ אֶל־זִקְנֵ֣י עִיר֗וֹ בְּנֵ֤נוּ זֶה֙ סוֹרֵ֣ר וּמֹרֶ֔ה אֵינֶ֥נּוּ שֹׁמֵ֖עַ בְּקֹלֵ֑נוּ זוֹלֵ֖ל וְסֹבֵֽא׃
transliteration: v'am'rv el-zik'ney 'iyrvo b'nenv zeh svorer vmoreh eynenv shome'a b'kolenv zvolel v'sove
translation: They shall say to the elders of his town, “This son of ours is disloyal and defiant; he does not heed us. He is a glutton and a drunkard.”

hebrew: וּ֠רְגָמֻהוּ כָּל־אַנְשֵׁ֨י עִיר֤וֹ בָֽאֲבָנִים֙ וָמֵ֔ת וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּ֑ךָ וְכָל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יִשְׁמְע֥וּ וְיִרָֽאוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: vr'gamuhv kal-an'shey 'iyrvo vaavaniym vamet vvi'ar'ta hara' mikir'bekha v'khal-yis'rael yish'm'v v'yirav (s)
translation: Thereupon the men of his town shall stone him to death. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst: all Israel will hear and be afraid.

hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִהְיֶ֣ה בְאִ֗ישׁ חֵ֛טְא מִשְׁפַּט־מָ֖וֶת וְהוּמָ֑ת וְתָלִ֥יתָ אֹת֖וֹ עַל־עֵֽץ׃
transliteration: v'khiy-yih'yeh v'iysh chet' mish'pat-mavet v'hvmat v'taliyta otvo 'al-'etz
translation: If a man is guilty of a capital offense and is put to death, and you impale him on a stake,

hebrew: לֹא־תָלִ֨ין נִבְלָת֜וֹ עַל־הָעֵ֗ץ כִּֽי־קָב֤וֹר תִּקְבְּרֶ֙נּוּ֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא כִּֽי־קִלְלַ֥ת אֱלֹהִ֖ים תָּל֑וּי וְלֹ֤א תְטַמֵּא֙ אֶת־אַדְמָ֣תְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ נַחֲלָֽה׃ (ס)
