transliteration: lo-taliyn niv'latvo 'al-ha'etz kiy-kavvor tik'b'renv bayvom hahv kiy-kil'lat elohiym talvy v'lo t'tame et-ad'mat'kha asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha nachalah (s)
translation: you must not let his corpse remain on the stake overnight, but must bury him the same day. For an impaled body is an affront to God: you shall not defile the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you to possess.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תִרְאֶה֩ אֶת־שׁ֨וֹר אָחִ֜יךָ א֤וֹ אֶת־שֵׂיוֹ֙ נִדָּחִ֔ים וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ֖ מֵהֶ֑ם הָשֵׁ֥ב תְּשִׁיבֵ֖ם לְאָחִֽיךָ׃
transliteration: lo-tir'eh et-shvor achiykha vo et-seyvo nidachiym v'hit'alam'ta mehem hashev t'shiyvem l'achiykha
translation: If you see your fellow’s ox or sheep gone astray, do not ignore it; you must take it back to your fellow.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֨א קָר֥וֹב אָחִ֛יךָ אֵלֶ֖יךָ וְלֹ֣א יְדַעְתּ֑וֹ וַאֲסַפְתּוֹ֙ אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ בֵּיתֶ֔ךָ וְהָיָ֣ה עִמְּךָ֗ עַ֣ד דְּרֹ֤שׁ אָחִ֙יךָ֙ אֹת֔וֹ וַהֲשֵׁבֹת֖וֹ לֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im-lo karvov achiykha eleykha v'lo y'da'tvo vaasaf'tvo el-tvokh' beytekha v'hayah 'im'kha 'ad d'rosh achiykha otvo vahashevotvo lvo
translation: If your fellow does not live near you or you do not know who he is, you shall bring it home and it shall remain with you until your fellow claims it; then you shall give it back to him.

hebrew: וְכֵ֧ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה לַחֲמֹר֗וֹ וְכֵ֣ן תַּעֲשֶׂה֮ לְשִׂמְלָתוֹ֒ וְכֵ֣ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֜ה לְכָל־אֲבֵדַ֥ת אָחִ֛יךָ אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאבַ֥ד מִמֶּ֖נּוּ וּמְצָאתָ֑הּ לֹ֥א תוּכַ֖ל לְהִתְעַלֵּֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khen ta'aseh lachamorvo v'khen ta'aseh l'sim'latvo v'khen ta'aseh l'khal-avedat achiykha asher-tovad mimenv vm'tzatah lo tvkhal l'hit'alem (s)
translation: You shall do the same with his ass; you shall do the same with his garment; and so too shall you do with anything that your fellow loses and you find: you must not remain indifferent.

hebrew: לֹא־תִרְאֶה֩ אֶת־חֲמ֨וֹר אָחִ֜יךָ א֤וֹ שׁוֹרוֹ֙ נֹפְלִ֣ים בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ֖ מֵהֶ֑ם הָקֵ֥ם תָּקִ֖ים עִמּֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-tir'eh et-chamvor achiykha vo shvorvo nof'liym baderekh' v'hit'alam'ta mehem hakem takiym 'imvo (s)
translation: If you see your fellow’s ass or ox fallen on the road, do not ignore it; you must help him raise it.

hebrew: לֹא־יִהְיֶ֤ה כְלִי־גֶ֙בֶר֙ עַל־אִשָּׁ֔ה וְלֹא־יִלְבַּ֥שׁ גֶּ֖בֶר שִׂמְלַ֣ת אִשָּׁ֑ה כִּ֧י תוֹעֲבַ֛ת יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ כָּל־עֹ֥שֵׂה אֵֽלֶּה׃ (פ)
transliteration: lo-yih'yeh kh'liy-gever 'al-ishah v'lo-yil'bash gever sim'lat ishah kiy tvo'avat y'hvah eloheykha kal-'oseh eleh (f)
translation: A woman must not put on man’s apparel, nor shall a man wear woman’s clothing; for whoever does these things is abhorrent to the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: כִּ֣י יִקָּרֵ֣א קַן־צִפּ֣וֹר ׀ לְפָנֶ֡יךָ בַּדֶּ֜רֶךְ בְּכָל־עֵ֣ץ ׀ א֣וֹ עַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֶפְרֹחִים֙ א֣וֹ בֵיצִ֔ים וְהָאֵ֤ם רֹבֶ֙צֶת֙ עַל־הָֽאֶפְרֹחִ֔ים א֖וֹ עַל־הַבֵּיצִ֑ים לֹא־תִקַּ֥ח הָאֵ֖ם עַל־הַבָּנִֽים׃
transliteration: kiy yikare kan-tzipvor  l'faneykha baderekh' b'khal-'etz  vo 'al-haaretz ef'rochiym vo veytziym v'haem rovetzet 'al-haef'rochiym vo 'al-habeytziym lo-tikach haem 'al-habaniym
translation: If, along the road, you chance upon a bird’s nest, in any tree or on the ground, with fledglings or eggs and the mother sitting over the fledglings or on the eggs, do not take the mother together with her young.

hebrew: שַׁלֵּ֤חַ תְּשַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־הָאֵ֔ם וְאֶת־הַבָּנִ֖ים תִּֽקַּֽח־לָ֑ךְ לְמַ֙עַן֙ יִ֣יטַב לָ֔ךְ וְהַאֲרַכְתָּ֖ יָמִֽים׃ (ס)
transliteration: shalecha t'shalach et-haem v'et-habaniym tikach-lakh' l'ma'an yiytav lakh' v'haarakh'ta yamiym (s)
translation: Let the mother go, and take only the young, in order that you may fare well and have a long life.

hebrew: כִּ֤י תִבְנֶה֙ בַּ֣יִת חָדָ֔שׁ וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מַעֲקֶ֖ה לְגַגֶּ֑ךָ וְלֹֽא־תָשִׂ֤ים דָּמִים֙ בְּבֵיתֶ֔ךָ כִּֽי־יִפֹּ֥ל הַנֹּפֵ֖ל מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy tiv'neh bayit chadash v'asiyta ma'akeh l'gagekha v'lo-tasiym damiym b'veytekha kiy-yipol hanofel mimenv (s)
translation: When you build a new house, you shall make a parapet for your roof, so that you do not bring bloodguilt on your house if anyone should fall from it.

hebrew: לֹא־תִזְרַ֥ע כַּרְמְךָ֖ כִּלְאָ֑יִם פֶּן־תִּקְדַּ֗שׁ הַֽמְלֵאָ֤ה הַזֶּ֙רַע֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּזְרָ֔ע וּתְבוּאַ֖ת הַכָּֽרֶם׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-tiz'ra' kar'm'kha kil'ayim pen-tik'dash ham'leah hazera' asher tiz'ra' vt'vvat hakarem (s)
translation: You shall not sow your vineyard with a second kind of seed, else the crop—from the seed you have sown—and the yield of the vineyard may not be used.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תַחֲרֹ֥שׁ בְּשׁוֹר־וּבַחֲמֹ֖ר יַחְדָּֽו׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-tacharosh b'shvor-vvachamor yach'dav (s)
translation: You shall not plow with an ox and an ass together.

hebrew: לֹ֤א תִלְבַּשׁ֙ שַֽׁעַטְנֵ֔ז צֶ֥מֶר וּפִשְׁתִּ֖ים יַחְדָּֽו׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo til'bash sha'at'nez tzemer vfish'tiym yach'dav (s)
translation: You shall not wear cloth combining wool and linen.

hebrew: גְּדִלִ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂה־לָּ֑ךְ עַל־אַרְבַּ֛ע כַּנְפ֥וֹת כְּסוּתְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּכַסֶּה־בָּֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: g'diliym ta'aseh-lakh' 'al-ar'ba' kan'fvot k'svt'kha asher t'khaseh-bah (s)
translation: You shall make tassels on the four corners of the garment with which you cover yourself.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִקַּ֥ח אִ֖ישׁ אִשָּׁ֑ה וּבָ֥א אֵלֶ֖יהָ וּשְׂנֵאָֽהּ׃
transliteration: kiy-yikach iysh ishah vva eleyha vs'neah
translation: A man marries a woman and cohabits with her. Then he takes an aversion to her

hebrew: וְשָׂ֥ם לָהּ֙ עֲלִילֹ֣ת דְּבָרִ֔ים וְהוֹצִ֥יא עָלֶ֖יהָ שֵׁ֣ם רָ֑ע וְאָמַ֗ר אֶת־הָאִשָּׁ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ לָקַ֔חְתִּי וָאֶקְרַ֣ב אֵלֶ֔יהָ וְלֹא־מָצָ֥אתִי לָ֖הּ בְּתוּלִֽים׃
transliteration: v'sam lah 'aliylot d'variym v'hvotziy 'aleyha shem ra' v'amar et-haishah hazot lakach'tiy vaek'rav eleyha v'lo-matzatiy lah b'tvliym
translation: and makes up charges against her and defames her, saying, “I married this woman; but when I approached her, I found that she was not a virgin.”

hebrew: וְלָקַ֛ח אֲבִ֥י הנער [הַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ה] וְאִמָּ֑הּ וְהוֹצִ֜יאוּ אֶת־בְּתוּלֵ֧י הנער [הַֽנַּעֲרָ֛ה] אֶל־זִקְנֵ֥י הָעִ֖יר הַשָּֽׁעְרָה׃
transliteration: v'lakach aviy hn'r [hana'arah] v'imah v'hvotziyv et-b'tvley hn'r [hana'arah] el-zik'ney ha'iyr hasha'rah
translation: In such a case, the girl’s father and mother shall produce the evidence of the girl’s virginity before the elders of the town at the gate.

hebrew: וְאָמַ֛ר אֲבִ֥י הנער [הַֽנַּעַרָ֖ה] אֶל־הַזְּקֵנִ֑ים אֶת־בִּתִּ֗י נָתַ֜תִּי לָאִ֥ישׁ הַזֶּ֛ה לְאִשָּׁ֖ה וַיִּשְׂנָאֶֽהָ׃
transliteration: v'amar aviy hn'r [hana'arah] el-haz'keniym et-bitiy natatiy laiysh hazeh l'ishah vayis'naeha
translation: And the girl’s father shall say to the elders, “I gave this man my daughter to wife, but he has taken an aversion to her;

hebrew: וְהִנֵּה־ה֡וּא שָׂם֩ עֲלִילֹ֨ת דְּבָרִ֜ים לֵאמֹ֗ר לֹֽא־מָצָ֤אתִי לְבִתְּךָ֙ בְּתוּלִ֔ים וְאֵ֖לֶּה בְּתוּלֵ֣י בִתִּ֑י וּפָֽרְשׂוּ֙ הַשִּׂמְלָ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י זִקְנֵ֥י הָעִֽיר׃
transliteration: v'hineh-hv sam 'aliylot d'variym lemor lo-matzatiy l'vit'kha b'tvliym v'eleh b'tvley vitiy vfar'sv hasim'lah lif'ney zik'ney ha'iyr
translation: so he has made up charges, saying, ‘I did not find your daughter a virgin.’ But here is the evidence of my daughter’s virginity!” And they shall spread out the cloth before the elders of the town.

hebrew: וְלָֽקְח֛וּ זִקְנֵ֥י הָֽעִיר־הַהִ֖וא אֶת־הָאִ֑ישׁ וְיִסְּר֖וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'lak'chv zik'ney ha'iyr-hahiv et-haiysh v'yis'rv otvo
translation: The elders of that town shall then take the man and flog him,

hebrew: וְעָנְשׁ֨וּ אֹת֜וֹ מֵ֣אָה כֶ֗סֶף וְנָתְנוּ֙ לַאֲבִ֣י הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ה כִּ֤י הוֹצִיא֙ שֵׁ֣ם רָ֔ע עַ֖ל בְּתוּלַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֽוֹ־תִהְיֶ֣ה לְאִשָּׁ֔ה לֹא־יוּכַ֥ל לְשַּׁלְּחָ֖הּ כָּל־יָמָֽיו׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'an'shv otvo meah khesef v'nat'nv laaviy hana'arah kiy hvotziy shem ra' 'al b'tvlat yis'rael v'lvo-tih'yeh l'ishah lo-yvkhal l'shal'chah kal-yamayv (s)
translation: and they shall fine him a hundred [shekels of] silver and give it to the girl’s father; for the man has defamed a virgin in Israel. Moreover, she shall remain his wife; he shall never have the right to divorce her.

hebrew: וְאִם־אֱמֶ֣ת הָיָ֔ה הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה לֹא־נִמְצְא֥וּ בְתוּלִ֖ים לנער [לַֽנַּעֲרָֽה׃]
transliteration: v'im-emet hayah hadavar hazeh lo-nim'tz'v v'tvliym ln'r [lana'arah]
translation: But if the charge proves true, the girl was found not to have been a virgin,

hebrew: וְהוֹצִ֨יאוּ אֶת־הנער [הַֽנַּעֲרָ֜ה] אֶל־פֶּ֣תַח בֵּית־אָבִ֗יהָ וּסְקָלוּהָ֩ אַנְשֵׁ֨י עִירָ֤הּ בָּאֲבָנִים֙ וָמֵ֔תָה כִּֽי־עָשְׂתָ֤ה נְבָלָה֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִזְנ֖וֹת בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑יהָ וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hvotziyv et-hn'r [hana'arah] el-petach beyt-aviyha vs'kalvha an'shey 'iyrah baavaniym vametah kiy-'as'tah n'valah b'yis'rael liz'nvot beyt aviyha vvi'ar'ta hara' mikir'bekha (s)
translation: then the girl shall be brought out to the entrance of her father’s house, and the men of her town shall stone her to death; for she did a shameful thing in Israel, committing fornication while under her father’s authority. Thus you will sweep away evil from your midst.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִמָּצֵ֨א אִ֜ישׁ שֹׁכֵ֣ב ׀ עִם־אִשָּׁ֣ה בְעֻֽלַת־בַּ֗עַל וּמֵ֙תוּ֙ גַּם־שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם הָאִ֛ישׁ הַשֹּׁכֵ֥ב עִם־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה וְהָאִשָּׁ֑ה וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy-yimatze iysh shokhev  'im-ishah v'ulat-ba'al vmetv gam-sh'neyhem haiysh hashokhev 'im-haishah v'haishah vvi'ar'ta hara' miyis'rael (s)
translation: If a man is found lying with another man’s wife, both of them—the man and the woman with whom he lay—shall die. Thus you will sweep away evil from Israel.

hebrew: כִּ֤י יִהְיֶה֙ נער [נַעֲרָ֣ה] בְתוּלָ֔ה מְאֹרָשָׂ֖ה לְאִ֑ישׁ וּמְצָאָ֥הּ אִ֛ישׁ בָּעִ֖יר וְשָׁכַ֥ב עִמָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: kiy yih'yeh n'r [na'arah] v'tvlah m'orasah l'iysh vm'tzaah iysh ba'iyr v'shakhav 'imah
translation: In the case of a virgin who is aI.e., for whom a bride-price has been paid; see 20.7.engaged to a man-a—if a man comes upon her in town and lies with her,

hebrew: וְהוֹצֵאתֶ֨ם אֶת־שְׁנֵיהֶ֜ם אֶל־שַׁ֣עַר ׀ הָעִ֣יר הַהִ֗וא וּסְקַלְתֶּ֨ם אֹתָ֥ם בָּאֲבָנִים֮ וָמֵתוּ֒ אֶת־הנער [הַֽנַּעֲרָ֗ה] עַל־דְּבַר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־צָעֲקָ֣ה בָעִ֔יר וְאֶ֨ת־הָאִ֔ישׁ עַל־דְּבַ֥ר אֲשֶׁר־עִנָּ֖ה אֶת־אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֵ֑הוּ וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'hvotzetem et-sh'neyhem el-sha'ar  ha'iyr hahiv vs'kal'tem otam baavaniym vametv et-hn'r [hana'arah] 'al-d'var asher lo-tza'akah va'iyr v'et-haiysh 'al-d'var asher-'inah et-eshet re'ehv vvi'ar'ta hara' mikir'bekha (s)
translation: you shall take the two of them out to the gate of that town and stone them to death: the girl because she did not cry for help in the town, and the man because he violated another man’s wife. Thus you will sweep away evil from your midst.

hebrew: וְֽאִם־בַּשָּׂדֶ֞ה יִמְצָ֣א הָאִ֗ישׁ אֶת־הנער [הַֽנַּעֲרָה֙] הַמְאֹ֣רָשָׂ֔ה וְהֶחֱזִֽיק־בָּ֥הּ הָאִ֖ישׁ וְשָׁכַ֣ב עִמָּ֑הּ וּמֵ֗ת הָאִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁכַ֥ב עִמָּ֖הּ לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im-basadeh yim'tza haiysh et-hn'r [hana'arah] ham'orasah v'hecheziyk-bah haiysh v'shakhav 'imah vmet haiysh asher-shakhav 'imah l'vadvo
translation: But if the man comes upon the engaged girl in the open country, and the man lies with her by force, only the man who lay with her shall die,

hebrew: ולנער [וְלַֽנַּעֲרָה֙] לֹא־תַעֲשֶׂ֣ה דָבָ֔ר אֵ֥ין לנער [לַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ה] חֵ֣טְא מָ֑וֶת כִּ֡י כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ יָק֨וּם אִ֤ישׁ עַל־רֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ וּרְצָח֣וֹ נֶ֔פֶשׁ כֵּ֖ן הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vln'r [v'lana'arah] lo-ta'aseh davar eyn ln'r [lana'arah] chet' mavet kiy kaasher yakvm iysh 'al-re'ehv vr'tzachvo nefesh ken hadavar hazeh
translation: but you shall do nothing to the girl. The girl did not incur the death penalty, for this case is like that of a man attacking another and murdering him.

hebrew: כִּ֥י בַשָּׂדֶ֖ה מְצָאָ֑הּ צָעֲקָ֗ה הנער [הַֽנַּעֲרָה֙] הַמְאֹ֣רָשָׂ֔ה וְאֵ֥ין מוֹשִׁ֖יעַ לָֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy vasadeh m'tzaah tza'akah hn'r [hana'arah] ham'orasah v'eyn mvoshiy'a lah (s)
translation: He came upon her in the open; though the engaged girl cried for help, there was no one to save her.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִמְצָ֣א אִ֗ישׁ נער [נַעֲרָ֤ה] בְתוּלָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־אֹרָ֔שָׂה וּתְפָשָׂ֖הּ וְשָׁכַ֣ב עִמָּ֑הּ וְנִמְצָֽאוּ׃
transliteration: kiy-yim'tza iysh n'r [na'arah] v'tvlah asher lo-orasah vt'fasah v'shakhav 'imah v'nim'tzav
translation: If a man comes upon a virgin who is not engaged and he seizes her and lies with her, and they are discovered,

hebrew: וְ֠נָתַן הָאִ֨ישׁ הַשֹּׁכֵ֥ב עִמָּ֛הּ לַאֲבִ֥י הנער [הַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ה] חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים כָּ֑סֶף וְלֽוֹ־תִהְיֶ֣ה לְאִשָּׁ֗ה תַּ֚חַת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִנָּ֔הּ לֹא־יוּכַ֥ל שַׁלְּחָ֖ה כָּל־יָמָֽיו׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'natan haiysh hashokhev 'imah laaviy hn'r [hana'arah] chamishiym kasef v'lvo-tih'yeh l'ishah tachat asher 'inah lo-yvkhal shal'chah kal-yamayv (s)
translation: the man who lay with her shall pay the girl’s father fifty [shekels of] silver, and she shall be his wife. Because he has violated her, he can never have the right to divorce her.

hebrew: לֹא־יִקַּ֥ח אִ֖ישׁ אֶת־אֵ֣שֶׁת אָבִ֑יו וְלֹ֥א יְגַלֶּ֖ה כְּנַ֥ף אָבִֽיו׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-yikach iysh et-eshet aviyv v'lo y'galeh k'naf aviyv (s)
translation: No man shall marry his father’s former wife, so as aI.e., lay claim to what his father had possessed. Cf. Lev. 18.8, 20.11; Ezek. 16.8; Ruth 3.9.to remove his father’s garment.-a

hebrew: לֹֽא־יָבֹ֧א פְצֽוּעַ־דַּכָּ֛א וּכְר֥וּת שָׁפְכָ֖ה בִּקְהַ֥ל יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-yavo f'tzv'a-daka vkh'rvt shaf'khah bik'hal y'hvah (s)
translation: No one whose testes are crushed or whose member is cut off shall be admitted into the congregation of the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: לֹא־יָבֹ֥א מַמְזֵ֖ר בִּקְהַ֣ל יְהוָ֑ה גַּ֚ם דּ֣וֹר עֲשִׂירִ֔י לֹא־יָ֥בֹא ל֖וֹ בִּקְהַ֥ל יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-yavo mam'zer bik'hal y'hvah gam dvor 'asiyriy lo-yavo lvo bik'hal y'hvah (s)
translation: No one misbegottenbMeaning of Heb. mamzer uncertain; in Jewish law, the offspring of adultery or incest between Jews. shall be admitted into the congregation of the LORD; none of his descendants, even in the tenth generation, shall be admitted into the congregation of the LORD.

hebrew: לֹֽא־יָבֹ֧א עַמּוֹנִ֛י וּמוֹאָבִ֖י בִּקְהַ֣ל יְהוָ֑ה גַּ֚ם דּ֣וֹר עֲשִׂירִ֔י לֹא־יָבֹ֥א לָהֶ֛ם בִּקְהַ֥ל יְהוָ֖ה עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: lo-yavo 'amvoniy vmvoaviy bik'hal y'hvah gam dvor 'asiyriy lo-yavo lahem bik'hal y'hvah 'ad-'volam
translation: No Ammonite or Moabite shall be admitted into the congregation of the L<small>ORD</small>; none of their descendants, even in the tenth generation, shall ever be admitted into the congregation of the L<small>ORD</small>,

hebrew: עַל־דְּבַ֞ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־קִדְּמ֤וּ אֶתְכֶם֙ בַּלֶּ֣חֶם וּבַמַּ֔יִם בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ בְּצֵאתְכֶ֣ם מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַאֲשֶׁר֩ שָׂכַ֨ר עָלֶ֜יךָ אֶת־בִּלְעָ֣ם בֶּן־בְּע֗וֹר מִפְּת֛וֹר אֲרַ֥ם נַהֲרַ֖יִם לְקַֽלְלֶֽךָּ׃
transliteration: 'al-d'var asher lo-kid'mv et'khem balechem vvamayim baderekh' b'tzet'khem mimitz'rayim vaasher sakhar 'aleykha et-bil'am ben-b'vor mip'tvor aram naharayim l'kal'leka
translation: because they did not meet you with food and water on your journey after you left Egypt, and because they hired Balaam son of Beor, from Pethor of Aram-naharaim, to curse you.—

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־אָבָ֞ה יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיַּהֲפֹךְ֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֧יךָ לְּךָ֛ אֶת־הַקְּלָלָ֖ה לִבְרָכָ֑ה כִּ֥י אֲהֵֽבְךָ֖ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'lo-avah y'hvah eloheykha lish'mo'a el-bil'am vayahafokh' y'hvah eloheykha l'kha et-hak'lalah liv'rakhah kiy ahev'kha y'hvah eloheykha
translation: But the L<small>ORD</small> your God refused to heed Balaam; instead, the L<small>ORD</small> your God turned the curse into a blessing for you, for the L<small>ORD</small> your God loves you.—

hebrew: לֹא־תִדְרֹ֥שׁ שְׁלֹמָ֖ם וְטֹבָתָ֑ם כָּל־יָמֶ֖יךָ לְעוֹלָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-tid'rosh sh'lomam v'tovatam kal-yameykha l'volam (s)
translation: You shall never concern yourself with their welfare or benefit as long as you live.

hebrew: לֹֽא־תְתַעֵ֣ב אֲדֹמִ֔י כִּ֥י אָחִ֖יךָ ה֑וּא (ס) לֹא־תְתַעֵ֣ב מִצְרִ֔י כִּי־גֵ֖ר הָיִ֥יתָ בְאַרְצֽוֹ׃
transliteration: lo-t'ta'ev adomiy kiy achiykha hv (s) lo-t'ta'ev mitz'riy kiy-ger hayiyta v'ar'tzvo
translation: You shall not abhor an Edomite, for he is your kinsman. You shall not abhor an Egyptian, for you were a stranger in his land.

hebrew: בָּנִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־יִוָּלְד֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם דּ֣וֹר שְׁלִישִׁ֑י יָבֹ֥א לָהֶ֖ם בִּקְהַ֥ל יְהוָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: baniym asher-yival'dv lahem dvor sh'liyshiy yavo lahem bik'hal y'hvah (s)
translation: Children born to them may be admitted into the congregation of the LORD in the third generation.cI.e., of residence in Israel’s territory.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תֵצֵ֥א מַחֲנֶ֖ה עַל־אֹיְבֶ֑יךָ וְנִ֨שְׁמַרְתָּ֔ מִכֹּ֖ל דָּבָ֥ר רָֽע׃
transliteration: kiy-tetze machaneh 'al-oy'veykha v'nish'mar'ta mikol davar ra'
translation: When you go out as a troop against your enemies, be on your guard against anything untoward.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֤ה בְךָ֙ אִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה טָה֖וֹר מִקְּרֵה־לָ֑יְלָה וְיָצָא֙ אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה לֹ֥א יָבֹ֖א אֶל־תּ֥וֹךְ הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
transliteration: kiy-yih'yeh v'kha iysh asher lo-yih'yeh tahvor mik'reh-lay'lah v'yatza el-michvtz lamachaneh lo yavo el-tvokh' hamachaneh
translation: If anyone among you has been rendered unclean by a nocturnal emission, he must leave the camp, and he must not reenter the camp.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה לִפְנֽוֹת־עֶ֖רֶב יִרְחַ֣ץ בַּמָּ֑יִם וּכְבֹ֣א הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ יָבֹ֖א אֶל־תּ֥וֹךְ הַֽמַּחֲנֶה׃
transliteration: v'hayah lif'nvot-'erev yir'chatz bamayim vkh'vo hashemesh yavo el-tvokh' hamachaneh
translation: Toward evening he shall bathe in water, and at sundown he may reenter the camp.

hebrew: וְיָד֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה לְךָ֔ מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וְיָצָ֥אתָ שָׁ֖מָּה חֽוּץ׃
transliteration: v'yad tih'yeh l'kha michvtz lamachaneh v'yatzata shamah chvtz
translation: Further, there shall be an area for you outside the camp, where you may relieve yourself.

hebrew: וְיָתֵ֛ד תִּהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ עַל־אֲזֵנֶ֑ךָ וְהָיָה֙ בְּשִׁבְתְּךָ֣ ח֔וּץ וְחָפַרְתָּ֣ה בָ֔הּ וְשַׁבְתָּ֖ וְכִסִּ֥יתָ אֶת־צֵאָתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'yated tih'yeh l'kha 'al-azenekha v'hayah b'shiv't'kha chvtz v'chafar'tah vah v'shav'ta v'khisiyta et-tzeatekha
translation: With your gear you shall have a spike, and when you have squatted you shall dig a hole with it and cover up your excrement.

hebrew: כִּי֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ מִתְהַלֵּ֣ךְ ׀ בְּקֶ֣רֶב מַחֲנֶ֗ךָ לְהַצִּֽילְךָ֙ וְלָתֵ֤ת אֹיְבֶ֙יךָ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְהָיָ֥ה מַחֲנֶ֖יךָ קָד֑וֹשׁ וְלֹֽא־יִרְאֶ֤ה בְךָ֙ עֶרְוַ֣ת דָּבָ֔ר וְשָׁ֖ב מֵאַחֲרֶֽיךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy y'hvah eloheykha mit'halekh'  b'kerev machanekha l'hatziyl'kha v'latet oy'veykha l'faneykha v'hayah machaneykha kadvosh v'lo-yir'eh v'kha 'er'vat davar v'shav meachareykha (s)
translation: Since the L<small>ORD</small> your God moves about in your camp to protect you and to deliver your enemies to you, let your camp be holy; let Him not find anything unseemly among you and turn away from you.

hebrew: לֹא־תַסְגִּ֥יר עֶ֖בֶד אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֑יו אֲשֶׁר־יִנָּצֵ֥ל אֵלֶ֖יךָ מֵעִ֥ם אֲדֹנָֽיו׃
transliteration: lo-tas'giyr 'eved el-adonayv asher-yinatzel eleykha me'im adonayv
translation: You shall not turn over to his master a slave who seeks refuge with you from his master.

hebrew: עִמְּךָ֞ יֵשֵׁ֣ב בְּקִרְבְּךָ֗ בַּמָּק֧וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֛ר בְּאַחַ֥ד שְׁעָרֶ֖יךָ בַּטּ֣וֹב ל֑וֹ לֹ֖א תּוֹנֶֽנּוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'im'kha yeshev b'kir'b'kha bamakvom asher-yiv'char b'achad sh'areykha batvov lvo lo tvonenv (s)
translation: He shall live with you in any place he may choose among the settlements in your midst, wherever he pleases; you must not ill-treat him.

hebrew: לֹא־תִהְיֶ֥ה קְדֵשָׁ֖ה מִבְּנ֣וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֥ה קָדֵ֖שׁ מִבְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵל׃
transliteration: lo-tih'yeh k'deshah mib'nvot yis'rael v'lo-yih'yeh kadesh mib'ney yis'rael
translation: No Israelite woman shall be a cult prostitute, nor shall any Israelite man be a cult prostitute.

hebrew: לֹא־תָבִיא֩ אֶתְנַ֨ן זוֹנָ֜ה וּמְחִ֣יר כֶּ֗לֶב בֵּ֛ית יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לְכָל־נֶ֑דֶר כִּ֧י תוֹעֲבַ֛ת יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ גַּם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: lo-taviy et'nan zvonah vm'chiyr kelev beyt y'hvah eloheykha l'khal-neder kiy tvo'avat y'hvah eloheykha gam-sh'neyhem
translation: You shall not bring the fee of a whore or the pay of a dogdI.e., a male prostitute. into the house of the LORD your God in fulfillment of any vow, for both are abhorrent to the LORD your God.

hebrew: לֹא־תַשִּׁ֣יךְ לְאָחִ֔יךָ נֶ֥שֶׁךְ כֶּ֖סֶף נֶ֣שֶׁךְ אֹ֑כֶל נֶ֕שֶׁךְ כָּל־דָּבָ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִשָּֽׁךְ׃
transliteration: lo-tashiykh' l'achiykha neshekh' kesef neshekh' okhel neshekh' kal-davar asher yishakh'
translation: You shall not deduct interest from loans to your countrymen, whether in money or food or anything else that can be deducted as interest;

hebrew: לַנָּכְרִ֣י תַשִּׁ֔יךְ וּלְאָחִ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תַשִּׁ֑יךְ לְמַ֨עַן יְבָרֶכְךָ֜ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ בְּכֹל֙ מִשְׁלַ֣ח יָדֶ֔ךָ עַל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: lanakh'riy tashiykh' vl'achiykha lo tashiykh' l'ma'an y'varekh'kha y'hvah eloheykha b'khol mish'lach yadekha 'al-haaretz asher-atah va-shamah l'rish'tah (s)
translation: but you may deduct interest from loans to foreigners. Do not deduct interest from loans to your countrymen, so that the L<small>ORD</small> your God may bless you in all your undertakings in the land that you are about to enter and possess.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תִדֹּ֥ר נֶ֙דֶר֙ לַיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לֹ֥א תְאַחֵ֖ר לְשַׁלְּמ֑וֹ כִּֽי־דָּרֹ֨שׁ יִדְרְשֶׁ֜נּוּ יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ מֵֽעִמָּ֔ךְ וְהָיָ֥ה בְךָ֖ חֵֽטְא׃
transliteration: kiy-tidor neder layhvah eloheykha lo t'acher l'shal'mvo kiy-darosh yid'r'shenv y'hvah eloheykha me'imakh' v'hayah v'kha chet'
translation: When you make a vow to the L<small>ORD</small> your God, do not put off fulfilling it, for the L<small>ORD</small> your God will require it of you, and you will have incurred guilt;

hebrew: וְכִ֥י תֶחְדַּ֖ל לִנְדֹּ֑ר לֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֥ה בְךָ֖ חֵֽטְא׃
transliteration: v'khiy tech'dal lin'dor lo-yih'yeh v'kha chet'
translation: whereas you incur no guilt if you refrain from vowing.

hebrew: מוֹצָ֥א שְׂפָתֶ֖יךָ תִּשְׁמֹ֣ר וְעָשִׂ֑יתָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר נָדַ֜רְתָּ לַיהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ נְדָבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ בְּפִֽיךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: mvotza s'fateykha tish'mor v'asiyta kaasher nadar'ta layhvah eloheykha n'davah asher dibar'ta b'fiykha (s)
translation: You must fulfill what has crossed your lips and perform what you have voluntarily vowed to the L<small>ORD</small> your God, having made the promise with your own mouth.

hebrew: כִּ֤י תָבֹא֙ בְּכֶ֣רֶם רֵעֶ֔ךָ וְאָכַלְתָּ֧ עֲנָבִ֛ים כְּנַפְשְׁךָ֖ שָׂבְעֶ֑ךָ וְאֶֽל־כֶּלְיְךָ֖ לֹ֥א תִתֵּֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy tavo b'kherem re'ekha v'akhal'ta 'anaviym k'naf'sh'kha sav'ekha v'el-kel'y'kha lo titen (s)
translation: When you enter another man’s vineyard, you may eat as many grapes as you want, until you are full, but you must not put any in your vessel.

hebrew: כִּ֤י תָבֹא֙ בְּקָמַ֣ת רֵעֶ֔ךָ וְקָטַפְתָּ֥ מְלִילֹ֖ת בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וְחֶרְמֵשׁ֙ לֹ֣א תָנִ֔יף עַ֖ל קָמַ֥ת רֵעֶֽךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy tavo b'kamat re'ekha v'kataf'ta m'liylot b'yadekha v'cher'mesh lo taniyf 'al kamat re'ekha (s)
translation: When you enter another man’s field of standing grain, you may pluck ears with your hand; but you must not put a sickle to your neighbor’s grain.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִקַּ֥ח אִ֛ישׁ אִשָּׁ֖ה וּבְעָלָ֑הּ וְהָיָ֞ה אִם־לֹ֧א תִמְצָא־חֵ֣ן בְּעֵינָ֗יו כִּי־מָ֤צָא בָהּ֙ עֶרְוַ֣ת דָּבָ֔ר וְכָ֨תַב לָ֜הּ סֵ֤פֶר כְּרִיתֻת֙ וְנָתַ֣ן בְּיָדָ֔הּ וְשִׁלְּחָ֖הּ מִבֵּיתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kiy-yikach iysh ishah vv'alah v'hayah im-lo tim'tza-chen b'eynayv kiy-matza vah 'er'vat davar v'khatav lah sefer k'riytut v'natan b'yadah v'shil'chah mibeytvo
translation: A man takes a wife and possesses her. She fails to please him because he finds something obnoxious about her, and he writes her a bill of divorcement, hands it to her, and sends her away from his house;

hebrew: וְיָצְאָ֖ה מִבֵּית֑וֹ וְהָלְכָ֖ה וְהָיְתָ֥ה לְאִישׁ־אַחֵֽר׃
transliteration: v'yatz'ah mibeytvo v'hal'khah v'hay'tah l'iysh-acher
translation: she leaves his household and becomes the wife of another man;

hebrew: וּשְׂנֵאָהּ֮ הָאִ֣ישׁ הָאַחֲרוֹן֒ וְכָ֨תַב לָ֜הּ סֵ֤פֶר כְּרִיתֻת֙ וְנָתַ֣ן בְּיָדָ֔הּ וְשִׁלְּחָ֖הּ מִבֵּית֑וֹ א֣וֹ כִ֤י יָמוּת֙ הָאִ֣ישׁ הָאַחֲר֔וֹן אֲשֶׁר־לְקָחָ֥הּ ל֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
transliteration: vs'neah haiysh haacharvon v'khatav lah sefer k'riytut v'natan b'yadah v'shil'chah mibeytvo vo khiy yamvt haiysh haacharvon asher-l'kachah lvo l'ishah
translation: then this latter man rejects her, writes her a bill of divorcement, hands it to her, and sends her away from his house; or the man who married her last dies.

hebrew: לֹא־יוּכַ֣ל בַּעְלָ֣הּ הָרִאשׁ֣וֹן אֲשֶֽׁר־שִׁ֠לְּחָהּ לָשׁ֨וּב לְקַחְתָּ֜הּ לִהְי֧וֹת ל֣וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֗ה אַחֲרֵי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֻטַּמָּ֔אָה כִּֽי־תוֹעֵבָ֥ה הִ֖וא לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְלֹ֤א תַחֲטִיא֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ נַחֲלָֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-yvkhal ba'lah harishvon asher-shil'chah lashvv l'kach'tah lih'yvot lvo l'ishah acharey asher hutamaah kiy-tvo'evah hiv lif'ney y'hvah v'lo tachatiy et-haaretz asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha nachalah (s)
translation: Then the first husband who divorced her shall not take her to wife again, since she has been defiledaI.e., disqualified for him.—for that would be abhorrent to the LORD. You must not bring sin upon the land that the LORD your God is giving you as a heritage.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִקַּ֥ח אִישׁ֙ אִשָּׁ֣ה חֲדָשָׁ֔ה לֹ֤א יֵצֵא֙ בַּצָּבָ֔א וְלֹא־יַעֲבֹ֥ר עָלָ֖יו לְכָל־דָּבָ֑ר נָקִ֞י יִהְיֶ֤ה לְבֵיתוֹ֙ שָׁנָ֣ה אֶחָ֔ת וְשִׂמַּ֖ח אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֥וֹ אֲשֶׁר־לָקָֽח׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy-yikach iysh ishah chadashah lo yetze batzava v'lo-ya'avor 'alayv l'khal-davar nakiy yih'yeh l'veytvo shanah echat v'simach et-ish'tvo asher-lakach (s)
translation: When a man has taken a bride, he shall not go out with the army or be assigned to it for any purpose; he shall be exempt one year for the sake of his household, to give happiness to the woman he has married.

hebrew: לֹא־יַחֲבֹ֥ל רֵחַ֖יִם וָרָ֑כֶב כִּי־נֶ֖פֶשׁ ה֥וּא חֹבֵֽל׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-yachavol rechayim varakhev kiy-nefesh hv chovel (s)
translation: A handmill or an upper millstone shall not be taken in pawn, for that would be taking someone’s life in pawn.

hebrew: כִּי־יִמָּצֵ֣א אִ֗ישׁ גֹּנֵ֨ב נֶ֤פֶשׁ מֵאֶחָיו֙ מִבְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְהִתְעַמֶּר־בּ֖וֹ וּמְכָר֑וֹ וּמֵת֙ הַגַּנָּ֣ב הַה֔וּא וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: kiy-yimatze iysh gonev nefesh meechayv mib'ney yis'rael v'hit'amer-bvo vm'kharvo vmet haganav hahv vvi'ar'ta hara' mikir'bekha
translation: If a man is found to have kidnapped a fellow Israelite, enslaving him or selling him, that kidnapper shall die; thus you will sweep out evil from your midst.

hebrew: הִשָּׁ֧מֶר בְּנֶֽגַע־הַצָּרַ֛עַת לִשְׁמֹ֥ר מְאֹ֖ד וְלַעֲשׂ֑וֹת כְּכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁר־יוֹר֨וּ אֶתְכֶ֜ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֧ים הַלְוִיִּ֛ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּיתִ֖ם תִּשְׁמְר֥וּ לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃ (ס)
transliteration: hishamer b'nega'-hatzara'at lish'mor m'od v'la'asvot k'khol asher-yvorv et'khem hakohaniym hal'viyim kaasher tziviytim tish'm'rv la'asvot (s)
translation: In cases of a skin affectionbCf. Lev. 13.1 ff. be most careful to do exactly as the levitical priests instruct you. Take care to do as I have commanded them.

hebrew: זָכ֕וֹר אֵ֧ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֛ה יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לְמִרְיָ֑ם בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ בְּצֵאתְכֶ֥ם מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃ (ס)
transliteration: zakhvor et asher-'asah y'hvah eloheykha l'mir'yam baderekh' b'tzet'khem mimitz'rayim (s)
translation: Remember what the LORD your God did to Miriam on the journey after you left Egypt.cSee Num. 12.10 ff.

hebrew: כִּֽי־תַשֶּׁ֥ה בְרֵֽעֲךָ מַשַּׁ֣את מְא֑וּמָה לֹא־תָבֹ֥א אֶל־בֵּית֖וֹ לַעֲבֹ֥ט עֲבֹטֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kiy-tasheh v're'akha mashat m'vmah lo-tavo el-beytvo la'avot 'avotvo
translation: When you make a loan of any sort to your countryman, you must not enter his house to seize his pledge.

hebrew: בַּח֖וּץ תַּעֲמֹ֑ד וְהָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ נֹשֶׁ֣ה ב֔וֹ יוֹצִ֥יא אֵלֶ֛יךָ אֶֽת־הַעֲב֖וֹט הַחֽוּצָה׃
transliteration: bachvtz ta'amod v'haiysh asher atah nosheh vvo yvotziy eleykha et-ha'avvot hachvtzah
translation: You must remain outside, while the man to whom you made the loan brings the pledge out to you.

hebrew: וְאִם־אִ֥ישׁ עָנִ֖י ה֑וּא לֹ֥א תִשְׁכַּ֖ב בַּעֲבֹטֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'im-iysh 'aniy hv lo tish'kav ba'avotvo
translation: If he is a needy man, you shall not go to sleep in his pledge;

hebrew: הָשֵׁב֩ תָּשִׁ֨יב ל֤וֹ אֶֽת־הַעֲבוֹט֙ כְּבֹ֣א הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ וְשָׁכַ֥ב בְּשַׂלְמָת֖וֹ וּבֵֽרֲכֶ֑ךָּ וּלְךָ֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה צְדָקָ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: hashev tashiyv lvo et-ha'avvot k'vo hashemesh v'shakhav b'sal'matvo vverakheka vl'kha tih'yeh tz'dakah lif'ney y'hvah eloheykha (s)
translation: you must return the pledge to him at sundown, that he may sleep in his cloth and bless you; and it will be to your merit before the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: לֹא־תַעֲשֹׁ֥ק שָׂכִ֖יר עָנִ֣י וְאֶבְי֑וֹן מֵאַחֶ֕יךָ א֧וֹ מִגֵּרְךָ֛ אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּאַרְצְךָ֖ בִּשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: lo-ta'ashok sakhiyr 'aniy v'ev'yvon meacheykha vo miger'kha asher b'ar'tz'kha bish'areykha
translation: You shall not abuse a needy and destitute laborer, whether a fellow countryman or a stranger in one of the communities of your land.

hebrew: בְּיוֹמוֹ֩ תִתֵּ֨ן שְׂכָר֜וֹ וְֽלֹא־תָב֧וֹא עָלָ֣יו הַשֶּׁ֗מֶשׁ כִּ֤י עָנִי֙ ה֔וּא וְאֵלָ֕יו ה֥וּא נֹשֵׂ֖א אֶת־נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וְלֹֽא־יִקְרָ֤א עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה וְהָיָ֥ה בְךָ֖ חֵֽטְא׃ (ס)
transliteration: b'yvomvo titen s'kharvo v'lo-tavvo 'alayv hashemesh kiy 'aniy hv v'elayv hv nose et-naf'shvo v'lo-yik'ra 'aleykha el-y'hvah v'hayah v'kha chet' (s)
translation: You must pay him his wages on the same day, before the sun sets, for he is needy and urgently depends on it; else he will cry to the L<small>ORD</small> against you and you will incur guilt.

hebrew: לֹֽא־יוּמְת֤וּ אָבוֹת֙ עַל־בָּנִ֔ים וּבָנִ֖ים לֹא־יוּמְת֣וּ עַל־אָב֑וֹת אִ֥יש בְּחֶטְא֖וֹ יוּמָֽתוּ׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-yvm'tv avvot 'al-baniym vvaniym lo-yvm'tv 'al-avvot iysh b'chet'vo yvmatv (s)
translation: Parents shall not be put to death for children, nor children be put to death for parents: a person shall be put to death only for his own crime.

hebrew: לֹ֣א תַטֶּ֔ה מִשְׁפַּ֖ט גֵּ֣ר יָת֑וֹם וְלֹ֣א תַחֲבֹ֔ל בֶּ֖גֶד אַלְמָנָֽה׃
transliteration: lo tateh mish'pat ger yatvom v'lo tachavol beged al'manah
translation: You shall not subvert the rights of the stranger or the fatherless; you shall not take a widow’s garment in pawn.

hebrew: וְזָכַרְתָּ֗ כִּ֣י עֶ֤בֶד הָיִ֙יתָ֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וַֽיִּפְדְּךָ֛ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מִשָּׁ֑ם עַל־כֵּ֞ן אָנֹכִ֤י מְצַוְּךָ֙ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֶת־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'zakhar'ta kiy 'eved hayiyta b'mitz'rayim vayif'd'kha y'hvah eloheykha misham 'al-ken anokhiy m'tzav'kha la'asvot et-hadavar hazeh (s)
translation: Remember that you were a slave in Egypt and that the L<small>ORD</small> your God redeemed you from there; therefore do I enjoin you to observe this commandment.

hebrew: כִּ֣י תִקְצֹר֩ קְצִֽירְךָ֨ בְשָׂדֶ֜ךָ וְשָֽׁכַחְתָּ֧ עֹ֣מֶר בַּשָּׂדֶ֗ה לֹ֤א תָשׁוּב֙ לְקַחְתּ֔וֹ לַגֵּ֛ר לַיָּת֥וֹם וְלָאַלְמָנָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֑ה לְמַ֤עַן יְבָרֶכְךָ֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכֹ֖ל מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָדֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: kiy tik'tzor k'tziyr'kha v'sadekha v'shakhach'ta 'omer basadeh lo tashvv l'kach'tvo lager layatvom v'laal'manah yih'yeh l'ma'an y'varekh'kha y'hvah eloheykha b'khol ma'aseh yadeykha
translation: When you reap the harvest in your field and overlook a sheaf in the field, do not turn back to get it; it shall go to the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow—in order that the L<small>ORD</small> your God may bless you in all your undertakings.

hebrew: כִּ֤י תַחְבֹּט֙ זֵֽיתְךָ֔ לֹ֥א תְפָאֵ֖ר אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ לַגֵּ֛ר לַיָּת֥וֹם וְלָאַלְמָנָ֖ה יִהְיֶֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy tach'bot zeyt'kha lo t'faer achareykha lager layatvom v'laal'manah yih'yeh (s)
translation: When you beat down the fruit of your olive trees, do not go over them again; that shall go to the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.

hebrew: כִּ֤י תִבְצֹר֙ כַּרְמְךָ֔ לֹ֥א תְעוֹלֵ֖ל אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ לַגֵּ֛ר לַיָּת֥וֹם וְלָאַלְמָנָ֖ה יִהְיֶֽה׃
transliteration: kiy tiv'tzor kar'm'kha lo t'volel achareykha lager layatvom v'laal'manah yih'yeh
translation: When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, do not pick it over again; that shall go to the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.

hebrew: וְזָ֣כַרְתָּ֔ כִּי־עֶ֥בֶד הָיִ֖יתָ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם עַל־כֵּ֞ן אָנֹכִ֤י מְצַוְּךָ֙ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֶת־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'zakhar'ta kiy-'eved hayiyta b'eretz mitz'rayim 'al-ken anokhiy m'tzav'kha la'asvot et-hadavar hazeh (s)
translation: Always remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt; therefore do I enjoin you to observe this commandment.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה רִיב֙ בֵּ֣ין אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְנִגְּשׁ֥וּ אֶל־הַמִּשְׁפָּ֖ט וּשְׁפָט֑וּם וְהִצְדִּ֙יקוּ֙ אֶת־הַצַּדִּ֔יק וְהִרְשִׁ֖יעוּ אֶת־הָרָשָֽׁע׃
transliteration: kiy-yih'yeh riyv beyn anashiym v'nig'shv el-hamish'pat vsh'fatvm v'hitz'diykv et-hatzadiyk v'hir'shiy'v et-harasha'
translation: When there is a dispute between men and they go to law, and a decision is rendered declaring the one in the right and the other in the wrong—

hebrew: וְהָיָ֛ה אִם־בִּ֥ן הַכּ֖וֹת הָרָשָׁ֑ע וְהִפִּיל֤וֹ הַשֹּׁפֵט֙ וְהִכָּ֣הוּ לְפָנָ֔יו כְּדֵ֥י רִשְׁעָת֖וֹ בְּמִסְפָּֽר׃
transliteration: v'hayah im-bin hakvot harasha' v'hipiylvo hashofet v'hikahv l'fanayv k'dey rish'atvo b'mis'par
translation: if the guilty one is to be flogged, the magistrate shall have him lie down and be given lashes in his presence, by count, as his guilt warrants.

hebrew: אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יַכֶּ֖נּוּ לֹ֣א יֹסִ֑יף פֶּן־יֹסִ֨יף לְהַכֹּת֤וֹ עַל־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ מַכָּ֣ה רַבָּ֔ה וְנִקְלָ֥ה אָחִ֖יךָ לְעֵינֶֽיךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: ar'ba'iym yakenv lo yosiyf pen-yosiyf l'hakotvo 'al-eleh makah rabah v'nik'lah achiykha l'eyneykha (s)
translation: He may be given up to forty lashes, but not more, lest being flogged further, to excess, your brother be degraded before your eyes.

hebrew: לֹא־תַחְסֹ֥ם שׁ֖וֹר בְּדִישֽׁוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-tach'som shvor b'diyshvo (s)
translation: You shall not muzzle an ox while it is threshing.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יֵשְׁב֨וּ אַחִ֜ים יַחְדָּ֗ו וּמֵ֨ת אַחַ֤ד מֵהֶם֙ וּבֵ֣ן אֵֽין־ל֔וֹ לֹֽא־תִהְיֶ֧ה אֵֽשֶׁת־הַמֵּ֛ת הַח֖וּצָה לְאִ֣ישׁ זָ֑ר יְבָמָהּ֙ יָבֹ֣א עָלֶ֔יהָ וּלְקָחָ֥הּ ל֛וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֖ה וְיִבְּמָֽהּ׃
transliteration: kiy-yesh'vv achiym yach'dav vmet achad mehem vven eyn-lvo lo-tih'yeh eshet-hamet hachvtzah l'iysh zar y'vamah yavo 'aleyha vl'kachah lvo l'ishah v'yib'mah
translation: When brothers dwell together and one of them dies and leaves no son, the wife of the deceased shall not be married to a stranger, outside the family. Her husband’s brother shall unite with her: he shall take her as his wife and perform the levir’s duty.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה הַבְּכוֹר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּלֵ֔ד יָק֕וּם עַל־שֵׁ֥ם אָחִ֖יו הַמֵּ֑ת וְלֹֽא־יִמָּחֶ֥ה שְׁמ֖וֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'hayah hab'khvor asher teled yakvm 'al-shem achiyv hamet v'lo-yimacheh sh'mvo miyis'rael
translation: The first son that she bears shall be accounted to the dead brother, that his name may not be blotted out in Israel.

hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֤א יַחְפֹּץ֙ הָאִ֔ישׁ לָקַ֖חַת אֶת־יְבִמְתּ֑וֹ וְעָלְתָה֩ יְבִמְתּ֨וֹ הַשַּׁ֜עְרָה אֶל־הַזְּקֵנִ֗ים וְאָֽמְרָה֙ מֵאֵ֨ין יְבָמִ֜י לְהָקִ֨ים לְאָחִ֥יו שֵׁם֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א אָבָ֖ה יַבְּמִֽי׃
transliteration: v'im-lo yach'potz haiysh lakachat et-y'vim'tvo v'al'tah y'vim'tvo hasha'rah el-haz'keniym v'am'rah meeyn y'vamiy l'hakiym l'achiyv shem b'yis'rael lo avah yab'miy
translation: But if the man does not want to marry his brother’s widow, his brother’s widow shall appear before the elders in the gate and declare, “My husband’s brother refuses to establish a name in Israel for his brother; he will not perform the duty of a levir.”

hebrew: וְקָֽרְאוּ־ל֥וֹ זִקְנֵי־עִיר֖וֹ וְדִבְּר֣וּ אֵלָ֑יו וְעָמַ֣ד וְאָמַ֔ר לֹ֥א חָפַ֖צְתִּי לְקַחְתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'kar'v-lvo zik'ney-'iyrvo v'dib'rv elayv v'amad v'amar lo chafatz'tiy l'kach'tah
translation: The elders of his town shall then summon him and talk to him. If he insists, saying, “I do not want to marry her,”

hebrew: וְנִגְּשָׁ֨ה יְבִמְתּ֣וֹ אֵלָיו֮ לְעֵינֵ֣י הַזְּקֵנִים֒ וְחָלְצָ֤ה נַעֲלוֹ֙ מֵעַ֣ל רַגְל֔וֹ וְיָרְקָ֖ה בְּפָנָ֑יו וְעָֽנְתָה֙ וְאָ֣מְרָ֔ה כָּ֚כָה יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה לָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יִבְנֶ֖ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית אָחִֽיו
transliteration: v'nig'shah y'vim'tvo elayv l'eyney haz'keniym v'chal'tzah na'alvo me'al rag'lvo v'yar'kah b'fanayv v'an'tah v'am'rah kakhah ye'aseh laiysh asher lo-yiv'neh et-beyt achiyv
translation: his brother’s widow shall go up to him in the presence of the elders, pull the sandal off his foot, spit in his face, and make this declaration: Thus shall be done to the man who will not build up his brother’s house!

hebrew: וְנִקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בֵּ֖ית חֲל֥וּץ הַנָּֽעַל׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'nik'ra sh'mvo b'yis'rael beyt chalvtz hana'al (s)
translation: And he shall go in Israel by the name of “the family of the unsandaled one.”

hebrew: כִּֽי־יִנָּצ֨וּ אֲנָשִׁ֤ים יַחְדָּו֙ אִ֣ישׁ וְאָחִ֔יו וְקָֽרְבָה֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת הָֽאֶחָ֔ד לְהַצִּ֥יל אֶת־אִישָׁ֖הּ מִיַּ֣ד מַכֵּ֑הוּ וְשָׁלְחָ֣ה יָדָ֔הּ וְהֶחֱזִ֖יקָה בִּמְבֻשָֽׁיו׃
transliteration: kiy-yinatzv anashiym yach'dav iysh v'achiyv v'kar'vah eshet haechad l'hatziyl et-iyshah miyad makehv v'shal'chah yadah v'hecheziykah bim'vushayv
translation: If two men get into a fight with each other, and the wife of one comes up to save her husband from his antagonist and puts out her hand and seizes him by his genitals,

hebrew: וְקַצֹּתָ֖ה אֶת־כַּפָּ֑הּ לֹ֥א תָח֖וֹס עֵינֶֽךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'katzotah et-kapah lo tachvos 'eynekha (s)
translation: you shall cut off her hand; show no pity.

hebrew: לֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ בְּכִֽיסְךָ֖ אֶ֣בֶן וָאָ֑בֶן גְּדוֹלָ֖ה וּקְטַנָּֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: lo-yih'yeh l'kha b'khiys'kha even vaaven g'dvolah vk'tanah (s)
translation: You shall not have in your pouch alternate weights, larger and smaller.

hebrew: לֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ בְּבֵיתְךָ֖ אֵיפָ֣ה וְאֵיפָ֑ה גְּדוֹלָ֖ה וּקְטַנָּֽה׃
transliteration: lo-yih'yeh l'kha b'veyt'kha eyfah v'eyfah g'dvolah vk'tanah
translation: You shall not have in your house alternate measures, a larger and a smaller.

hebrew: אֶ֣בֶן שְׁלֵמָ֤ה וָצֶ֙דֶק֙ יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֔ךְ אֵיפָ֧ה שְׁלֵמָ֛ה וָצֶ֖דֶק יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֑ךְ לְמַ֙עַן֙ יַאֲרִ֣יכוּ יָמֶ֔יךָ עַ֚ל הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: even sh'lemah vatzedek yih'yeh-lakh' eyfah sh'lemah vatzedek yih'yeh-lakh' l'ma'an yaariykhv yameykha 'al haadamah asher-y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh'
translation: You must have completely honest weights and completely honest measures, if you are to endure long on the soil that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you.

hebrew: כִּ֧י תוֹעֲבַ֛ת יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ כָּל־עֹ֣שֵׂה אֵ֑לֶּה כֹּ֖ל עֹ֥שֵׂה עָֽוֶל׃ (פ)
transliteration: kiy tvo'avat y'hvah eloheykha kal-'oseh eleh kol 'oseh 'avel (f)
translation: For everyone who does those things, everyone who deals dishonestly, is abhorrent to the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: זָכ֕וֹר אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה לְךָ֖ עֲמָלֵ֑ק בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ בְּצֵאתְכֶ֥ם מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: zakhvor et asher-'asah l'kha 'amalek baderekh' b'tzet'khem mimitz'rayim
translation: Remember what Amalek did to you on your journey, after you left Egypt—

hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר קָֽרְךָ֜ בַּדֶּ֗רֶךְ וַיְזַנֵּ֤ב בְּךָ֙ כָּל־הַנֶּחֱשָׁלִ֣ים אַֽחַרֶ֔יךָ וְאַתָּ֖ה עָיֵ֣ף וְיָגֵ֑עַ וְלֹ֥א יָרֵ֖א אֱלֹהִֽים׃
transliteration: asher kar'kha baderekh' vay'zanev b'kha kal-hanecheshaliym achareykha v'atah 'ayef v'yage'a v'lo yare elohiym
translation: how, undeterred by fear of God, he surprised you on the march, when you were famished and weary, and cut down all the stragglers in your rear.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֡ה בְּהָנִ֣יחַ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֣יךָ ׀ לְ֠ךָ מִכָּל־אֹ֨יְבֶ֜יךָ מִסָּבִ֗יב בָּאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְהוָֽה־אֱ֠לֹהֶיךָ נֹתֵ֨ן לְךָ֤ נַחֲלָה֙ לְרִשְׁתָּ֔הּ תִּמְחֶה֙ אֶת־זֵ֣כֶר עֲמָלֵ֔ק מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם לֹ֖א תִּשְׁכָּֽח׃ (פ)
transliteration: v'hayah b'haniycha y'hvah eloheykha  l'kha mikal-oy'veykha misaviyv baaretz asher y'hvah-eloheykha noten l'kha nachalah l'rish'tah tim'cheh et-zekher 'amalek mitachat hashamayim lo tish'kach (f)
translation: Therefore, when the L<small>ORD</small> your God grants you safety from all your enemies around you, in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you as a hereditary portion, you shall blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven. Do not forget!

hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ כִּֽי־תָב֣וֹא אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ נַחֲלָ֑ה וִֽירִשְׁתָּ֖הּ וְיָשַׁ֥בְתָּ בָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy-tavvo el-haaretz asher y'hvah eloheykha noten l'kha nachalah viyrish'tah v'yashav'ta bah
translation: When you enter the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you as a heritage, and you possess it and settle in it,

hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֞ מֵרֵאשִׁ֣ית ׀ כָּל־פְּרִ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר תָּבִ֧יא מֵֽאַרְצְךָ֛ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָ֖ךְ וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ בַטֶּ֑נֶא וְהָֽלַכְתָּ֙ אֶל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִבְחַר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לְשַׁכֵּ֥ן שְׁמ֖וֹ שָֽׁם׃
transliteration: v'lakach'ta mereshiyt  kal-p'riy haadamah asher taviy mear'tz'kha asher y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh' v'sam'ta vatene v'halakh'ta el-hamakvom asher yiv'char y'hvah eloheykha l'shaken sh'mvo sham
translation: you shall take some of every first fruit of the soil, which you harvest from the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you, put it in a basket and go to the place where the L<small>ORD</small> your God will choose to establish His name.

hebrew: וּבָאתָ֙ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִהְיֶ֖ה בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֑ם וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו הִגַּ֤דְתִּי הַיּוֹם֙ לַיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ כִּי־בָ֙אתִי֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֧ע יְהוָ֛ה לַאֲבֹתֵ֖ינוּ לָ֥תֶת לָֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vvata el-hakohen asher yih'yeh bayamiym hahem v'amar'ta elayv higad'tiy hayvom layhvah eloheykha kiy-vatiy el-haaretz asher nish'ba' y'hvah laavoteynv latet lanv
translation: You shall go to the priest in charge at that time and say to him, “I acknowledge this day before the L<small>ORD</small> your God that I have entered the land that the L<small>ORD</small> swore to our fathers to assign us.”

hebrew: וְלָקַ֧ח הַכֹּהֵ֛ן הַטֶּ֖נֶא מִיָּדֶ֑ךָ וְהִ֨נִּיח֔וֹ לִפְנֵ֕י מִזְבַּ֖ח יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'lakach hakohen hatene miyadekha v'hiniychvo lif'ney miz'bach y'hvah eloheykha
translation: The priest shall take the basket from your hand and set it down in front of the altar of the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: וְעָנִ֨יתָ וְאָמַרְתָּ֜ לִפְנֵ֣י ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ אֲרַמִּי֙ אֹבֵ֣ד אָבִ֔י וַיֵּ֣רֶד מִצְרַ֔יְמָה וַיָּ֥גָר שָׁ֖ם בִּמְתֵ֣י מְעָ֑ט וַֽיְהִי־שָׁ֕ם לְג֥וֹי גָּד֖וֹל עָצ֥וּם וָרָֽב׃
transliteration: v'aniyta v'amar'ta lif'ney  y'hvah eloheykha aramiy oved aviy vayered mitz'ray'mah vayagar sham bim'tey m'at vay'hiy-sham l'gvoy gadvol 'atzvm varav
translation: You shall then recite as follows before the L<small>ORD</small> your God: “My father was a fugitive Aramean. He went down to Egypt with meager numbers and sojourned there; but there he became a great and very populous nation.

hebrew: וַיָּרֵ֧עוּ אֹתָ֛נוּ הַמִּצְרִ֖ים וַיְעַנּ֑וּנוּ וַיִּתְּנ֥וּ עָלֵ֖ינוּ עֲבֹדָ֥ה קָשָֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayare'v otanv hamitz'riym vay'anvnv vayit'nv 'aleynv 'avodah kashah
translation: The Egyptians dealt harshly with us and oppressed us; they imposed heavy labor upon us.

hebrew: וַנִּצְעַ֕ק אֶל־יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתֵ֑ינוּ וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע יְהוָה֙ אֶת־קֹלֵ֔נוּ וַיַּ֧רְא אֶת־עָנְיֵ֛נוּ וְאֶת־עֲמָלֵ֖נוּ וְאֶת־לַחֲצֵֽנוּ׃
transliteration: vanitz'ak el-y'hvah elohey avoteynv vayish'ma' y'hvah et-kolenv vayar' et-'an'yenv v'et-'amalenv v'et-lachatzenv
translation: We cried to the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of our fathers, and the L<small>ORD</small> heard our plea and saw our plight, our misery, and our oppression.

hebrew: וַיּוֹצִאֵ֤נוּ יְהוָה֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם בְּיָ֤ד חֲזָקָה֙ וּבִזְרֹ֣עַ נְטוּיָ֔ה וּבְמֹרָ֖א גָּדֹ֑ל וּבְאֹת֖וֹת וּבְמֹפְתִֽים׃
transliteration: vayvotzienv y'hvah mimitz'rayim b'yad chazakah vviz'ro'a n'tvyah vv'mora gadol vv'otvot vv'mof'tiym
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> freed us from Egypt by a mighty hand, by an outstretched arm and awesome power, and by signs and portents.

hebrew: וַיְבִאֵ֖נוּ אֶל־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַיִּתֶּן־לָ֙נוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
transliteration: vay'vienv el-hamakvom hazeh vayiten-lanv et-haaretz hazot eretz zavat chalav vd'vash
translation: He brought us to this place and gave us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הִנֵּ֤ה הֵבֵ֙אתִי֙ אֶת־רֵאשִׁית֙ פְּרִ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תָּה לִּ֖י יְהוָ֑ה וְהִנַּחְתּ֗וֹ לִפְנֵי֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוִ֔יתָ לִפְנֵ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'atah hineh hevetiy et-reshiyt p'riy haadamah asher-natatah liy y'hvah v'hinach'tvo lif'ney y'hvah eloheykha v'hish'tachaviyta lif'ney y'hvah eloheykha
translation:
Wherefore I now bring the first fruits of the soil which You, O LORD, have given me.”
You shall leave itaI.e., the basket of v. 4. before the LORD your God and bow low before the LORD your God.

hebrew: וְשָׂמַחְתָּ֣ בְכָל־הַטּ֗וֹב אֲשֶׁ֧ר נָֽתַן־לְךָ֛ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ וּלְבֵיתֶ֑ךָ אַתָּה֙ וְהַלֵּוִ֔י וְהַגֵּ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּקִרְבֶּֽךָ׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'samach'ta v'khal-hatvov asher natan-l'kha y'hvah eloheykha vl'veytekha atah v'haleviy v'hager asher b'kir'bekha (s)
translation: And you shall enjoy, together with the Levite and the stranger in your midst, all the bounty that the L<small>ORD</small> your God has bestowed upon you and your household.

hebrew: כִּ֣י תְכַלֶּ֞ה לַ֠עְשֵׂר אֶת־כָּל־מַעְשַׂ֧ר תְּבוּאָתְךָ֛ בַּשָּׁנָ֥ה הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֖ת שְׁנַ֣ת הַֽמַּעֲשֵׂ֑ר וְנָתַתָּ֣ה לַלֵּוִ֗י לַגֵּר֙ לַיָּת֣וֹם וְלָֽאַלְמָנָ֔ה וְאָכְל֥וּ בִשְׁעָרֶ֖יךָ וְשָׂבֵֽעוּ׃
transliteration: kiy t'khaleh la'ser et-kal-ma'sar t'vvat'kha bashanah hash'liyshit sh'nat hama'aser v'natatah laleviy lager layatvom v'laal'manah v'akh'lv vish'areykha v'save'v
translation: When you have set aside in full the tenth part of your yield—in the third year, the year of the tithebSee Deut. 14.28–29.—and have given it to the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, that they may eat their fill in your settlements,

hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֡ לִפְנֵי֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ בִּעַ֧רְתִּי הַקֹּ֣דֶשׁ מִן־הַבַּ֗יִת וְגַ֨ם נְתַתִּ֤יו לַלֵּוִי֙ וְלַגֵּר֙ לַיָּת֣וֹם וְלָאַלְמָנָ֔ה כְּכָל־מִצְוָתְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתָ֑נִי לֹֽא־עָבַ֥רְתִּי מִמִּצְוֺתֶ֖יךָ וְלֹ֥א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
transliteration: v'amar'ta lif'ney y'hvah eloheykha bi'ar'tiy hakodesh min-habayit v'gam n'tatiyv laleviy v'lager layatvom v'laal'manah k'khal-mitz'vat'kha asher tziviytaniy lo-'avar'tiy mimitz'voteykha v'lo shakhach'tiy
translation: you shall declare before the L<small>ORD</small> your God: “I have cleared out the consecrated portion from the house; and I have given it to the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, just as You commanded me; I have neither transgressed nor neglected any of Your commandments:

hebrew: לֹא־אָכַ֨לְתִּי בְאֹנִ֜י מִמֶּ֗נּוּ וְלֹא־בִעַ֤רְתִּי מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ בְּטָמֵ֔א וְלֹא־נָתַ֥תִּי מִמֶּ֖נּוּ לְמֵ֑ת שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי בְּקוֹל֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔י עָשִׂ֕יתִי כְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּיתָֽנִי׃
transliteration: lo-akhal'tiy v'oniy mimenv v'lo-vi'ar'tiy mimenv b'tame v'lo-natatiy mimenv l'met shama'tiy b'kvol y'hvah elohay 'asiytiy k'khol asher tziviytaniy
translation: cMeaning of first part of verse uncertain. I have not eaten of it while in mourning, I have not cleared out any of it while I was unclean, and I have not deposited any of it with the dead.dNo part of the tithe may be left as food for the dead. I have obeyed the LORD my God; I have done just as You commanded me.

hebrew: הַשְׁקִיפָה֩ מִמְּע֨וֹן קָדְשְׁךָ֜ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם וּבָרֵ֤ךְ אֶֽת־עַמְּךָ֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֵת֙ הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תָּה לָ֑נוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר נִשְׁבַּ֙עְתָּ֙ לַאֲבֹתֵ֔ינוּ אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃ (ס)
transliteration: hash'kiyfah mim'von kad'sh'kha min-hashamayim vvarekh' et-'am'kha et-yis'rael v'et haadamah asher natatah lanv kaasher nish'ba'ta laavoteynv eretz zavat chalav vd'vash (s)
translation: Look down from Your holy abode, from heaven, and bless Your people Israel and the soil You have given us, a land flowing with milk and honey, as You swore to our fathers.”

hebrew: הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ מְצַוְּךָ֧ לַעֲשׂ֛וֹת אֶת־הַחֻקִּ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֑ים וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֤ וְעָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ אוֹתָ֔ם בְּכָל־לְבָבְךָ֖ וּבְכָל־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
transliteration: hayvom hazeh y'hvah eloheykha m'tzav'kha la'asvot et-hachukiym haeleh v'et-hamish'patiym v'shamar'ta v'asiyta votam b'khal-l'vav'kha vv'khal-naf'shekha
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> your God commands you this day to observe these laws and rules; observe them faithfully with all your heart and soul.

hebrew: אֶת־יְהוָ֥ה הֶאֱמַ֖רְתָּ הַיּ֑וֹם לִהְיוֹת֩ לְךָ֨ לֵֽאלֹהִ֜ים וְלָלֶ֣כֶת בִּדְרָכָ֗יו וְלִשְׁמֹ֨ר חֻקָּ֧יו וּמִצְוֺתָ֛יו וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֖יו וְלִשְׁמֹ֥עַ בְּקֹלֽוֹ׃
transliteration: et-y'hvah heemar'ta hayvom lih'yvot l'kha lelohiym v'lalekhet bid'rakhayv v'lish'mor chukayv vmitz'votayv vmish'patayv v'lish'mo'a b'kolvo
translation: You have affirmedeExact nuance of Heb. uncertain. this day that the LORD is your God, that you will walk in His ways, that you will observe His laws and commandments and rules, and that you will obey Him.

hebrew: וַֽיהוָ֞ה הֶאֱמִֽירְךָ֣ הַיּ֗וֹם לִהְי֥וֹת לוֹ֙ לְעַ֣ם סְגֻלָּ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּר־לָ֑ךְ וְלִשְׁמֹ֖ר כָּל־מִצְוֺתָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayhvah heemiyr'kha hayvom lih'yvot lvo l'am s'gulah kaasher diber-lakh' v'lish'mor kal-mitz'votayv
translation: And the LORD has affirmedeExact nuance of Heb. uncertain. this day that you are, as He promised you, His treasured people who shall observe all His commandments,

hebrew: וּֽלְתִתְּךָ֣ עֶלְי֗וֹן עַ֤ל כָּל־הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה לִתְהִלָּ֖ה וּלְשֵׁ֣ם וּלְתִפְאָ֑רֶת וְלִֽהְיֹתְךָ֧ עַם־קָדֹ֛שׁ לַיהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃ (ס)
transliteration: vl'tit'kha 'el'yvon 'al kal-hagvoyim asher 'asah lit'hilah vl'shem vl'tif'aret v'lih'yot'kha 'am-kadosh layhvah eloheykha kaasher diber (s)
translation: and that He will set you, in fame and renown and glory, high above all the nations that He has made; and that you shall be, as He promised, a holy people to the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו מֹשֶׁה֙ וְזִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר שָׁמֹר֙ אֶת־כָּל־הַמִּצְוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: vay'tzav mosheh v'zik'ney yis'rael et-ha'am lemor shamor et-kal-hamitz'vah asher anokhiy m'tzaveh et'khem hayvom
translation: Moses and the elders of Israel charged the people, saying: Observe all the Instruction that I enjoin upon you this day.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה בַּיּוֹם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעַבְר֣וּ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּן֒ אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֑ךְ וַהֲקֵמֹתָ֤ לְךָ֙ אֲבָנִ֣ים גְּדֹל֔וֹת וְשַׂדְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בַּשִּֽׂיד׃
transliteration: v'hayah bayvom asher ta'av'rv et-hayar'den el-haaretz asher-y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh' vahakemota l'kha avaniym g'dolvot v'sad'ta otam basiyd
translation: aConstruction of vv. 2–4 uncertain.As soon as you have crossed the Jordan into the land that the LORD your God is giving you, you shall set up large stones. Coat them with plaster

hebrew: וְכָתַבְתָּ֣ עֲלֵיהֶ֗ן אֶֽת־כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֛י הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בְּעָבְרֶ֑ךָ לְמַ֡עַן אֲשֶׁר֩ תָּבֹ֨א אֶל־הָאָ֜רֶץ אֲ‍ֽשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֣יךָ ׀ נֹתֵ֣ן לְךָ֗ אֶ֣רֶץ זָבַ֤ת חָלָב֙ וּדְבַ֔שׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֛ר יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־אֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'khatav'ta 'aleyhen et-kal-div'rey hatvorah hazot b'av'rekha l'ma'an asher tavo el-haaretz a‍sher-y'hvah eloheykha  noten l'kha eretz zavat chalav vd'vash kaasher diber y'hvah elohey-avoteykha lakh'
translation: and inscribe upon them all the words of this Teaching. When you cross over to enter the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey, as the L<small>ORD</small>, the God of your fathers, promised you—

hebrew: וְהָיָה֮ בְּעָבְרְכֶ֣ם אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּן֒ תָּקִ֜ימוּ אֶת־הָאֲבָנִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֜י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֛ם הַיּ֖וֹם בְּהַ֣ר עֵיבָ֑ל וְשַׂדְתָּ֥ אוֹתָ֖ם בַּשִּֽׂיד׃
transliteration: v'hayah b'av'r'khem et-hayar'den takiymv et-haavaniym haeleh asher anokhiy m'tzaveh et'khem hayvom b'har 'eyval v'sad'ta votam basiyd
translation: upon crossing the Jordan, you shall set up these stones, about which I charge you this day, on Mount Ebal, and coat them with plaster.

hebrew: וּבָנִ֤יתָ שָּׁם֙ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ לַיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ מִזְבַּ֣ח אֲבָנִ֔ים לֹא־תָנִ֥יף עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם בַּרְזֶֽל׃
transliteration: vvaniyta sham miz'becha layhvah eloheykha miz'bach avaniym lo-taniyf 'aleyhem bar'zel
translation: There, too, you shall build an altar to the L<small>ORD</small> your God, an altar of stones. Do not wield an iron tool over them;

hebrew: אֲבָנִ֤ים שְׁלֵמוֹת֙ תִּבְנֶ֔ה אֶת־מִזְבַּ֖ח יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְהַעֲלִ֤יתָ עָלָיו֙ עוֹלֹ֔ת לַיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: avaniym sh'lemvot tiv'neh et-miz'bach y'hvah eloheykha v'ha'aliyta 'alayv 'volot layhvah eloheykha
translation: you must build the altar of the LORD your God of unhewnbLit. “whole.” stones. You shall offer on it burnt offerings to the LORD your God,

hebrew: וְזָבַחְתָּ֥ שְׁלָמִ֖ים וְאָכַ֣לְתָּ שָּׁ֑ם וְשָׂ֣מַחְתָּ֔ לִפְנֵ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'zavach'ta sh'lamiym v'akhal'ta sham v'samach'ta lif'ney y'hvah eloheykha
translation: and you shall sacrifice there offerings of well-being and eat them, rejoicing before the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: וְכָתַבְתָּ֣ עַל־הָאֲבָנִ֗ים אֶֽת־כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֛י הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בַּאֵ֥ר הֵיטֵֽב׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'khatav'ta 'al-haavaniym et-kal-div'rey hatvorah hazot baer heytev (s)
translation: And on those stones you shall inscribe every word of this Teaching most distinctly.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים הַלְוִיִּ֔ם אֶ֥ל כָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר הַסְכֵּ֤ת ׀ וּשְׁמַע֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ נִהְיֵ֣יתָֽ לְעָ֔ם לַיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh v'hakohaniym hal'viyim el kal-yis'rael lemor has'ket  vsh'ma' yis'rael hayvom hazeh nih'yeyta l'am layhvah eloheykha
translation: Moses and the levitical priests spoke to all Israel, saying: Silence! Hear, O Israel! Today you have become the people of the L<small>ORD</small> your God:

hebrew: וְשָׁ֣מַעְתָּ֔ בְּק֖וֹל יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ אֶת־מִצְוֺתָו֙ וְאֶת־חֻקָּ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּֽוֹם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'shama'ta b'kvol y'hvah eloheykha v'asiyta et-mitz'votav v'et-chukayv asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom (s)
translation: Heed the L<small>ORD</small> your God and observe His commandments and His laws, which I enjoin upon you this day.

hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'tzav mosheh et-ha'am bayvom hahv lemor
translation: Thereupon Moses charged the people, saying:

hebrew: אֵ֠לֶּה יַֽעַמְד֞וּ לְבָרֵ֤ךְ אֶת־הָעָם֙ עַל־הַ֣ר גְּרִזִ֔ים בְּעָבְרְכֶ֖ם אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן שִׁמְעוֹן֙ וְלֵוִ֣י וִֽיהוּדָ֔ה וְיִשָּׂשכָ֖ר וְיוֹסֵ֥ף וּבִנְיָמִֽן׃
transliteration: eleh ya'am'dv l'varekh' et-ha'am 'al-har g'riziym b'av'r'khem et-hayar'den shim'von v'leviy viyhvdah v'yisashkhar v'yvosef vvin'yamin
translation: cConstruction of vv. 12–13 uncertain.After you have crossed the Jordan, the following shall stand on Mount Gerizim when the blessing for the people is spoken: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.

hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה יַֽעַמְד֥וּ עַל־הַקְּלָלָ֖ה בְּהַ֣ר עֵיבָ֑ל רְאוּבֵן֙ גָּ֣ד וְאָשֵׁ֔ר וּזְבוּלֻ֖ן דָּ֥ן וְנַפְתָּלִֽי׃
transliteration: v'eleh ya'am'dv 'al-hak'lalah b'har 'eyval r'vven gad v'asher vz'vvlun dan v'naf'taliy
translation: And for the curse, the following shall stand on Mount Ebal: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.

hebrew: וְעָנ֣וּ הַלְוִיִּ֗ם וְאָֽמְר֛וּ אֶל־כָּל־אִ֥ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל ק֥וֹל רָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'anv hal'viyim v'am'rv el-kal-iysh yis'rael kvol ram (s)
translation: The Levites shall then proclaim in a loud voice to all the people of Israel:

hebrew: אָר֣וּר הָאִ֡ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַעֲשֶׂה֩ פֶ֨סֶל וּמַסֵּכָ֜ה תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְהוָ֗ה מַעֲשֵׂ֛ה יְדֵ֥י חָרָ֖שׁ וְשָׂ֣ם בַּסָּ֑תֶר וְעָנ֧וּ כָל־הָעָ֛ם וְאָמְר֖וּ אָמֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: arvr haiysh asher ya'aseh fesel vmasekhah tvo'avat y'hvah ma'aseh y'dey charash v'sam basater v'anv khal-ha'am v'am'rv amen (s)
translation: Cursed be anyone who makes a sculptured or molten image, abhorred by the L<small>ORD</small>, a craftsman’s handiwork, and sets it up in secret.—And all the people shall respond, Amen.

hebrew: אָר֕וּר מַקְלֶ֥ה אָבִ֖יו וְאִמּ֑וֹ וְאָמַ֥ר כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: arvr mak'leh aviyv v'imvo v'amar kal-ha'am amen (s)
translation: Cursed be he who insults his father or mother.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

hebrew: אָר֕וּר מַסִּ֖יג גְּב֣וּל רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְאָמַ֥ר כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: arvr masiyg g'vvl re'ehv v'amar kal-ha'am amen (s)
translation: Cursed be he who moves his fellow countryman’s landmark.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

hebrew: אָר֕וּר מַשְׁגֶּ֥ה עִוֵּ֖ר בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ וְאָמַ֥ר כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: arvr mash'geh 'iver badarekh' v'amar kal-ha'am amen (s)
translation: Cursed be he who misdirects a blind person on his way.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

hebrew: אָר֗וּר מַטֶּ֛ה מִשְׁפַּ֥ט גֵּר־יָת֖וֹם וְאַלְמָנָ֑ה וְאָמַ֥ר כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: arvr mateh mish'pat ger-yatvom v'al'manah v'amar kal-ha'am amen (s)
translation: Cursed be he who subverts the rights of the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

hebrew: אָר֗וּר שֹׁכֵב֙ עִם־אֵ֣שֶׁת אָבִ֔יו כִּ֥י גִלָּ֖ה כְּנַ֣ף אָבִ֑יו וְאָמַ֥ר כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: arvr shokhev 'im-eshet aviyv kiy gilah k'naf aviyv v'amar kal-ha'am amen (s)
translation: Cursed be he who lies with his father’s wife, for he has removed his father’s garment.dSee note at 23.1.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

hebrew: אָר֕וּר שֹׁכֵ֖ב עִם־כָּל־בְּהֵמָ֑ה וְאָמַ֥ר כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: arvr shokhev 'im-kal-b'hemah v'amar kal-ha'am amen (s)
translation: Cursed be he who lies with any beast.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

hebrew: אָר֗וּר שֹׁכֵב֙ עִם־אֲחֹת֔וֹ בַּת־אָבִ֖יו א֣וֹ בַת־אִמּ֑וֹ וְאָמַ֥ר כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: arvr shokhev 'im-achotvo bat-aviyv vo vat-imvo v'amar kal-ha'am amen (s)
translation: Cursed be he who lies with his sister, whether daughter of his father or of his mother.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

hebrew: אָר֕וּר שֹׁכֵ֖ב עִם־חֹֽתַנְתּ֑וֹ וְאָמַ֥ר כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: arvr shokhev 'im-chotan'tvo v'amar kal-ha'am amen (s)
translation: Cursed be he who lies with his mother-in-law.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

hebrew: אָר֕וּר מַכֵּ֥ה רֵעֵ֖הוּ בַּסָּ֑תֶר וְאָמַ֥ר כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: arvr makeh re'ehv basater v'amar kal-ha'am amen (s)
translation: Cursed be he who strikes down his fellow countryman in secret.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

hebrew: אָרוּר֙ לֹקֵ֣חַ שֹׁ֔חַד לְהַכּ֥וֹת נֶ֖פֶשׁ דָּ֣ם נָקִ֑י וְאָמַ֥ר כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: arvr lokecha shochad l'hakvot nefesh dam nakiy v'amar kal-ha'am amen (s)
translation: Cursed be he who accepts a bribe eI.e., to acquit the murderer; others “to slay.”in the case of the murder of-e an innocent person.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

hebrew: אָר֗וּר אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹא־יָקִ֛ים אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַתּוֹרָֽה־הַזֹּ֖את לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת אוֹתָ֑ם וְאָמַ֥ר כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ (פ)
transliteration: arvr asher lo-yakiym et-div'rey hatvorah-hazot la'asvot votam v'amar kal-ha'am amen (f)
translation: Cursed be he who will not uphold the terms of this Teaching and observe them.—And all the people shall say, Amen.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־שָׁמ֤וֹעַ תִּשְׁמַע֙ בְּקוֹל֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֤ר לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כָּל־מִצְוֺתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם וּנְתָ֨נְךָ֜ יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ עֶלְי֔וֹן עַ֖ל כָּל־גּוֹיֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: v'hayah im-shamvo'a tish'ma' b'kvol y'hvah eloheykha lish'mor la'asvot et-kal-mitz'votayv asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom vn'tan'kha y'hvah eloheykha 'el'yvon 'al kal-gvoyey haaretz
translation: Now, if you obey the L<small>ORD</small> your God, to observe faithfully all His commandments which I enjoin upon you this day, the L<small>ORD</small> your God will set you high above all the nations of the earth.

hebrew: וּבָ֧אוּ עָלֶ֛יךָ כָּל־הַבְּרָכ֥וֹת הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְהִשִּׂיגֻ֑ךָ כִּ֣י תִשְׁמַ֔ע בְּק֖וֹל יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vvav 'aleykha kal-hab'rakhvot haeleh v'hisiygukha kiy tish'ma' b'kvol y'hvah eloheykha
translation: All these blessings shall come upon you and take effect, if you will but heed the word of the L<small>ORD</small> your God:

hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ אַתָּ֖ה בָּעִ֑יר וּבָר֥וּךְ אַתָּ֖ה בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
transliteration: barvkh' atah ba'iyr vvarvkh' atah basadeh
translation: Blessed shall you be in the city and blessed shall you be in the country.

hebrew: בָּר֧וּךְ פְּרִֽי־בִטְנְךָ֛ וּפְרִ֥י אַדְמָתְךָ֖ וּפְרִ֣י בְהֶמְתֶּ֑ךָ שְׁגַ֥ר אֲלָפֶ֖יךָ וְעַשְׁתְּר֥וֹת צֹאנֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: barvkh' p'riy-vit'n'kha vf'riy ad'mat'kha vf'riy v'hem'tekha sh'gar alafeykha v'ash't'rvot tzonekha
translation: Blessed shall be the issue of your womb, the produce of your soil, and the offspring of your cattle, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock.

hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ טַנְאֲךָ֖ וּמִשְׁאַרְתֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: barvkh' tan'akha vmish'ar'tekha
translation: Blessed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.

hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ אַתָּ֖ה בְּבֹאֶ֑ךָ וּבָר֥וּךְ אַתָּ֖ה בְּצֵאתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: barvkh' atah b'voekha vvarvkh' atah b'tzetekha
translation: Blessed shall you be in your comings and blessed shall you be in your goings.

hebrew: יִתֵּ֨ן יְהוָ֤ה אֶת־אֹיְבֶ֙יךָ֙ הַקָּמִ֣ים עָלֶ֔יךָ נִגָּפִ֖ים לְפָנֶ֑יךָ בְּדֶ֤רֶךְ אֶחָד֙ יֵצְא֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וּבְשִׁבְעָ֥ה דְרָכִ֖ים יָנ֥וּסוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: yiten y'hvah et-oy'veykha hakamiym 'aleykha nigafiym l'faneykha b'derekh' echad yetz'v eleykha vv'shiv'ah d'rakhiym yanvsv l'faneykha
translation: The LORD will put to rout before you the enemies who attack you; they will march out against you by a single road, but flee from you by manyaLit. “seven.” roads.

hebrew: יְצַ֨ו יְהוָ֤ה אִתְּךָ֙ אֶת־הַבְּרָכָ֔ה בַּאֲסָמֶ֕יךָ וּבְכֹ֖ל מִשְׁלַ֣ח יָדֶ֑ךָ וּבֵ֣רַכְךָ֔ בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: y'tzav y'hvah it'kha et-hab'rakhah baasameykha vv'khol mish'lach yadekha vverakh'kha baaretz asher-y'hvah eloheykha noten lakh'
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will ordain blessings for you upon your barns and upon all your undertakings: He will bless you in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God is giving you.

hebrew: יְקִֽימְךָ֨ יְהוָ֥ה לוֹ֙ לְעַ֣ם קָד֔וֹשׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר נִֽשְׁבַּֽע־לָ֑ךְ כִּ֣י תִשְׁמֹ֗ר אֶת־מִצְוֺת֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְהָלַכְתָּ֖ בִּדְרָכָֽיו׃
transliteration: y'kiym'kha y'hvah lvo l'am kadvosh kaasher nish'ba'-lakh' kiy tish'mor et-mitz'vot y'hvah eloheykha v'halakh'ta bid'rakhayv
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will establish you as His holy people, as He swore to you, if you keep the commandments of the L<small>ORD</small> your God and walk in His ways.

hebrew: וְרָאוּ֙ כָּל־עַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֛י שֵׁ֥ם יְהוָ֖ה נִקְרָ֣א עָלֶ֑יךָ וְיָֽרְא֖וּ מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
transliteration: v'rav kal-'amey haaretz kiy shem y'hvah nik'ra 'aleykha v'yar'v mimeka
translation: And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the LORD’s name is proclaimed over you,bI.e., the Lord recognizes you as His own; cf. Isa. 4.1. and they shall stand in fear of you.

hebrew: וְהוֹתִֽרְךָ֤ יְהוָה֙ לְטוֹבָ֔ה בִּפְרִ֧י בִטְנְךָ֛ וּבִפְרִ֥י בְהַמְתְּךָ֖ וּבִפְרִ֣י אַדְמָתֶ֑ךָ עַ֚ל הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֧ע יְהוָ֛ה לַאֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ לָ֥תֶת לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'hvotir'kha y'hvah l'tvovah bif'riy vit'n'kha vvif'riy v'ham't'kha vvif'riy ad'matekha 'al haadamah asher nish'ba' y'hvah laavoteykha latet lakh'
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will give you abounding prosperity in the issue of your womb, the offspring of your cattle, and the produce of your soil in the land that the L<small>ORD</small> swore to your fathers to assign to you.

hebrew: יִפְתַּ֣ח יְהוָ֣ה ׀ לְ֠ךָ אֶת־אוֹצָר֨וֹ הַטּ֜וֹב אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם לָתֵ֤ת מְטַֽר־אַרְצְךָ֙ בְּעִתּ֔וֹ וּלְבָרֵ֕ךְ אֵ֖ת כָּל־מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֶ֑ךָ וְהִלְוִ֙יתָ֙ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֔ים וְאַתָּ֖ה לֹ֥א תִלְוֶֽה׃
transliteration: yif'tach y'hvah  l'kha et-votzarvo hatvov et-hashamayim latet m'tar-ar'tz'kha b'itvo vl'varekh' et kal-ma'aseh yadekha v'hil'viyta gvoyim rabiym v'atah lo til'veh
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will open for you His bounteous store, the heavens, to provide rain for your land in season and to bless all your undertakings. You will be creditor to many nations, but debtor to none.

hebrew: וּנְתָֽנְךָ֨ יְהוָ֤ה לְרֹאשׁ֙ וְלֹ֣א לְזָנָ֔ב וְהָיִ֙יתָ֙ רַ֣ק לְמַ֔עְלָה וְלֹ֥א תִהְיֶ֖ה לְמָ֑טָּה כִּֽי־תִשְׁמַ֞ע אֶל־מִצְוֺ֣ת ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֧י מְצַוְּךָ֛ הַיּ֖וֹם לִשְׁמֹ֥ר וְלַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
transliteration: vn'tan'kha y'hvah l'rosh v'lo l'zanav v'hayiyta rak l'ma'lah v'lo tih'yeh l'matah kiy-tish'ma' el-mitz'vot  y'hvah eloheykha asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom lish'mor v'la'asvot
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will make you the head, not the tail; you will always be at the top and never at the bottom—if only you obey and faithfully observe the commandments of the L<small>ORD</small> your God that I enjoin upon you this day,

hebrew: וְלֹ֣א תָס֗וּר מִכָּל־הַדְּבָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֜י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֛ם הַיּ֖וֹם יָמִ֣ין וּשְׂמֹ֑אול לָלֶ֗כֶת אַחֲרֵ֛י אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים לְעָבְדָֽם׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'lo tasvr mikal-had'variym asher anokhiy m'tzaveh et'khem hayvom yamiyn vs'movl lalekhet acharey elohiym acheriym l'av'dam (s)
translation: and do not deviate to the right or to the left from any of the commandments that I enjoin upon you this day and turn to the worship of other gods.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־לֹ֤א תִשְׁמַע֙ בְּקוֹל֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֤ר לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כָּל־מִצְוֺתָ֣יו וְחֻקֹּתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם וּבָ֧אוּ עָלֶ֛יךָ כָּל־הַקְּלָל֥וֹת הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְהִשִּׂיגֽוּךָ׃
transliteration: v'hayah im-lo tish'ma' b'kvol y'hvah eloheykha lish'mor la'asvot et-kal-mitz'votayv v'chukotayv asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom vvav 'aleykha kal-hak'lalvot haeleh v'hisiygvkha
translation: But if you do not obey the L<small>ORD</small> your God to observe faithfully all His commandments and laws which I enjoin upon you this day, all these curses shall come upon you and take effect:

hebrew: אָר֥וּר אַתָּ֖ה בָּעִ֑יר וְאָר֥וּר אַתָּ֖ה בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
transliteration: arvr atah ba'iyr v'arvr atah basadeh
translation: Cursed shall you be in the city and cursed shall you be in the country.

hebrew: אָר֥וּר טַנְאֲךָ֖ וּמִשְׁאַרְתֶּֽךָ׃
transliteration: arvr tan'akha vmish'ar'tekha
translation: Cursed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.

hebrew: אָר֥וּר פְּרִֽי־בִטְנְךָ֖ וּפְרִ֣י אַדְמָתֶ֑ךָ שְׁגַ֥ר אֲלָפֶ֖יךָ וְעַשְׁתְּר֥וֹת צֹאנֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: arvr p'riy-vit'n'kha vf'riy ad'matekha sh'gar alafeykha v'ash't'rvot tzonekha
translation: Cursed shall be the issue of your womb and the produce of your soil, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock.

hebrew: אָר֥וּר אַתָּ֖ה בְּבֹאֶ֑ךָ וְאָר֥וּר אַתָּ֖ה בְּצֵאתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: arvr atah b'voekha v'arvr atah b'tzetekha
translation: Cursed shall you be in your comings and cursed shall you be in your goings.

hebrew: יְשַׁלַּ֣ח יְהוָ֣ה ׀ בְּ֠ךָ אֶת־הַמְּאֵרָ֤ה אֶת־הַמְּהוּמָה֙ וְאֶת־הַמִּגְעֶ֔רֶת בְּכָל־מִשְׁלַ֥ח יָדְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֑ה עַ֣ד הִשָּֽׁמֶדְךָ֤ וְעַד־אֲבָדְךָ֙ מַהֵ֔ר מִפְּנֵ֛י רֹ֥עַ מַֽעֲלָלֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲזַבְתָּֽנִי׃
transliteration: y'shalach y'hvah  b'kha et-ham'erah et-ham'hvmah v'et-hamig'eret b'khal-mish'lach yad'kha asher ta'aseh 'ad hishamed'kha v'ad-avad'kha maher mip'ney ro'a ma'alaleykha asher 'azav'taniy
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will let loose against you calamity, panic, and frustration in all the enterprises you undertake, so that you shall soon be utterly wiped out because of your evildoing in forsaking Me.

hebrew: יַדְבֵּ֧ק יְהוָ֛ה בְּךָ֖ אֶת־הַדָּ֑בֶר עַ֚ד כַּלֹּת֣וֹ אֹֽתְךָ֔ מֵעַל֙ הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: yad'bek y'hvah b'kha et-hadaver 'ad kalotvo ot'kha me'al haadamah asher-atah va-shamah l'rish'tah
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will make pestilence cling to you, until He has put an end to you in the land that you are entering to possess.

hebrew: יַכְּכָ֣ה יְ֠הוָה בַּשַּׁחֶ֨פֶת וּבַקַּדַּ֜חַת וּבַדַּלֶּ֗קֶת וּבַֽחַרְחֻר֙ וּבַחֶ֔רֶב וּבַשִּׁדָּפ֖וֹן וּבַיֵּרָק֑וֹן וּרְדָפ֖וּךָ עַ֥ד אָבְדֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: yak'khah y'hvah bashachefet vvakadachat vvadaleket vvachar'chur vvacherev vvashidafvon vvayerakvon vr'dafvkha 'ad av'dekha
translation: The LORD will strike you with cExact nature of these afflictions uncertain.consumption, fever, and inflammation, with scorching heat and drought, with blight and mildew; they shall hound you until you perish.

hebrew: וְהָי֥וּ שָׁמֶ֛יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־רֹאשְׁךָ֖ נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וְהָאָ֥רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־תַּחְתֶּ֖יךָ בַּרְזֶֽל׃
transliteration: v'hayv shameykha asher 'al-rosh'kha n'choshet v'haaretz asher-tach'teykha bar'zel
translation: The skies above your head shall be copper and the earth under you iron.

hebrew: יִתֵּ֧ן יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מְטַ֥ר אַרְצְךָ֖ אָבָ֣ק וְעָפָ֑ר מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ יֵרֵ֣ד עָלֶ֔יךָ עַ֖ד הִשָּׁמְדָֽךְ׃
transliteration: yiten y'hvah et-m'tar ar'tz'kha avak v'afar min-hashamayim yered 'aleykha 'ad hisham'dakh'
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will make the rain of your land dust, and sand shall drop on you from the sky, until you are wiped out.

hebrew: יִתֶּנְךָ֨ יְהוָ֥ה ׀ נִגָּף֮ לִפְנֵ֣י אֹיְבֶיךָ֒ בְּדֶ֤רֶךְ אֶחָד֙ תֵּצֵ֣א אֵלָ֔יו וּבְשִׁבְעָ֥ה דְרָכִ֖ים תָּנ֣וּס לְפָנָ֑יו וְהָיִ֣יתָ לְזַעֲוָ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל מַמְלְכ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: yiten'kha y'hvah  nigaf lif'ney oy'veykha b'derekh' echad tetze elayv vv'shiv'ah d'rakhiym tanvs l'fanayv v'hayiyta l'za'avah l'khol mam'l'khvot haaretz
translation: The LORD will put you to rout before your enemies; you shall march out against them by a single road, but flee from them by manyaLit. “seven.” roads; and you shall become a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.

hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֤ה נִבְלָֽתְךָ֙ לְמַאֲכָ֔ל לְכָל־ע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּלְבֶהֱמַ֣ת הָאָ֑רֶץ וְאֵ֖ין מַחֲרִֽיד׃
transliteration: v'hay'tah niv'lat'kha l'maakhal l'khal-'vof hashamayim vl'vehemat haaretz v'eyn machariyd
translation: Your carcasses shall become food for all the birds of the sky and all the beasts of the earth, with none to frighten them off.

hebrew: יַכְּכָ֨ה יְהוָ֜ה בִּשְׁחִ֤ין מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ ובעפלים [וּבַטְּחֹרִ֔ים] וּבַגָּרָ֖ב וּבֶחָ֑רֶס אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תוּכַ֖ל לְהֵרָפֵֽא׃
transliteration: yak'khah y'hvah bish'chiyn mitz'rayim vv'flym [vvat'choriym] vvagarav vvechares asher lo-tvkhal l'herafe
translation: The LORD will strike you with the Egyptian inflammation,dSee Exod. 9.9–10. with hemorrhoids, boil-scars, and itch, from which you shall never recover.

hebrew: יַכְּכָ֣ה יְהוָ֔ה בְּשִׁגָּע֖וֹן וּבְעִוָּר֑וֹן וּבְתִמְה֖וֹן לֵבָֽב׃
transliteration: yak'khah y'hvah b'shiga'von vv'ivarvon vv'tim'hvon levav
translation: The LORD will strike you with madness, blindness, and dismay.eLit. “numbness of heart.”

hebrew: וְהָיִ֜יתָ מְמַשֵּׁ֣שׁ בַּֽצָּהֳרַ֗יִם כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יְמַשֵּׁ֤שׁ הָעִוֵּר֙ בָּאֲפֵלָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א תַצְלִ֖יחַ אֶת־דְּרָכֶ֑יךָ וְהָיִ֜יתָ אַ֣ךְ עָשׁ֧וּק וְגָז֛וּל כָּל־הַיָּמִ֖ים וְאֵ֥ין מוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
transliteration: v'hayiyta m'mashesh batzahorayim kaasher y'mashesh ha'iver baafelah v'lo tatz'liycha et-d'rakheykha v'hayiyta akh' 'ashvk v'gazvl kal-hayamiym v'eyn mvoshiy'a
translation: You shall grope at noon as a blind man gropes in the dark; you shall not prosper in your ventures, but shall be constantly abused and robbed, with none to give help.

hebrew: אִשָּׁ֣ה תְאָרֵ֗שׂ וְאִ֤ישׁ אַחֵר֙ ישגלנה [יִשְׁכָּבֶ֔נָּה] בַּ֥יִת תִּבְנֶ֖ה וְלֹא־תֵשֵׁ֣ב בּ֑וֹ כֶּ֥רֶם תִּטַּ֖ע וְלֹ֥א תְחַלְּלֶּֽנּוּ׃
transliteration: ishah t'ares v'iysh acher yshglnh [yish'kavenah] bayit tiv'neh v'lo-teshev bvo kerem tita' v'lo t'chal'lenv
translation: If you pay the bride-price for a wife, another man shall enjoy her. If you build a house, you shall not live in it. If you plant a vineyard, you shall not harvest it.fCf. 20.6.

hebrew: שׁוֹרְךָ֞ טָב֣וּחַ לְעֵינֶ֗יךָ וְלֹ֣א תֹאכַל֮ מִמֶּנּוּ֒ חֲמֹֽרְךָ֙ גָּז֣וּל מִלְּפָנֶ֔יךָ וְלֹ֥א יָשׁ֖וּב לָ֑ךְ צֹֽאנְךָ֙ נְתֻנ֣וֹת לְאֹיְבֶ֔יךָ וְאֵ֥ין לְךָ֖ מוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
transliteration: shvor'kha tavvcha l'eyneykha v'lo tokhal mimenv chamor'kha gazvl mil'faneykha v'lo yashvv lakh' tzon'kha n'tunvot l'oy'veykha v'eyn l'kha mvoshiy'a
translation: Your ox shall be slaughtered before your eyes, but you shall not eat of it; your ass shall be seized in front of you, and it shall not be returned to you; your flock shall be delivered to your enemies, with none to help you.

hebrew: בָּנֶ֨יךָ וּבְנֹתֶ֜יךָ נְתֻנִ֨ים לְעַ֤ם אַחֵר֙ וְעֵינֶ֣יךָ רֹא֔וֹת וְכָל֥וֹת אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם כָּל־הַיּ֑וֹם וְאֵ֥ין לְאֵ֖ל יָדֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: baneykha vv'noteykha n'tuniym l'am acher v'eyneykha rovot v'khalvot aleyhem kal-hayvom v'eyn l'el yadekha
translation: Your sons and daughters shall be delivered to another people, while you look on; and your eyes shall strain for them constantly, but you shall be helpless.

hebrew: פְּרִ֤י אַדְמָֽתְךָ֙ וְכָל־יְגִ֣יעֲךָ֔ יֹאכַ֥ל עַ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יָדָ֑עְתָּ וְהָיִ֗יתָ רַ֛ק עָשׁ֥וּק וְרָצ֖וּץ כָּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
transliteration: p'riy ad'mat'kha v'khal-y'giy'akha yokhal 'am asher lo-yada'ta v'hayiyta rak 'ashvk v'ratzvtz kal-hayamiym
translation: A people you do not know shall eat up the produce of your soil and all your gains; you shall be abused and downtrodden continually,

hebrew: וְהָיִ֖יתָ מְשֻׁגָּ֑ע מִמַּרְאֵ֥ה עֵינֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּרְאֶֽה׃
transliteration: v'hayiyta m'shuga' mimar'eh 'eyneykha asher tir'eh
translation: until you are driven mad by what your eyes behold.

hebrew: יַכְּכָ֨ה יְהוָ֜ה בִּשְׁחִ֣ין רָ֗ע עַל־הַבִּרְכַּ֙יִם֙ וְעַל־הַשֹּׁקַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תוּכַ֖ל לְהֵרָפֵ֑א מִכַּ֥ף רַגְלְךָ֖ וְעַ֥ד קָדְקֳדֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: yak'khah y'hvah bish'chiyn ra' 'al-habir'kayim v'al-hashokayim asher lo-tvkhal l'herafe mikaf rag'l'kha v'ad kad'kodekha
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will afflict you at the knees and thighs with a severe inflammation, from which you shall never recover—from the sole of your foot to the crown of your head.

hebrew: יוֹלֵ֨ךְ יְהוָ֜ה אֹֽתְךָ֗ וְאֶֽת־מַלְכְּךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תָּקִ֣ים עָלֶ֔יךָ אֶל־גּ֕וֹי אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יָדַ֖עְתָּ אַתָּ֣ה וַאֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ וְעָבַ֥דְתָּ שָּׁ֛ם אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים עֵ֥ץ וָאָֽבֶן׃
transliteration: yvolekh' y'hvah ot'kha v'et-mal'k'kha asher takiym 'aleykha el-gvoy asher lo-yada'ta atah vaavoteykha v'avad'ta sham elohiym acheriym 'etz vaaven
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will drive you, and the king you have set over you, to a nation unknown to you or your fathers, where you shall serve other gods, of wood and stone.

hebrew: וְהָיִ֣יתָ לְשַׁמָּ֔ה לְמָשָׁ֖ל וְלִשְׁנִינָ֑ה בְּכֹל֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־יְנַהֶגְךָ֥ יְהוָ֖ה שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: v'hayiyta l'shamah l'mashal v'lish'niynah b'khol ha'amiym asher-y'naheg'kha y'hvah shamah
translation: You shall be a consternation, a proverb, and a byword among all the peoples to which the L<small>ORD</small> will drive you.

hebrew: זֶ֥רַע רַ֖ב תּוֹצִ֣יא הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וּמְעַ֣ט תֶּאֱסֹ֔ף כִּ֥י יַחְסְלֶ֖נּוּ הָאַרְבֶּֽה׃
transliteration: zera' rav tvotziy hasadeh vm'at teesof kiy yach's'lenv haar'beh
translation: Though you take much seed out to the field, you shall gather in little, for the locust shall consume it.

hebrew: כְּרָמִ֥ים תִּטַּ֖ע וְעָבָ֑דְתָּ וְיַ֤יִן לֹֽא־תִשְׁתֶּה֙ וְלֹ֣א תֶאֱגֹ֔ר כִּ֥י תֹאכְלֶ֖נּוּ הַתֹּלָֽעַת׃
transliteration: k'ramiym tita' v'avad'ta v'yayin lo-tish'teh v'lo teegor kiy tokh'lenv hatola'at
translation: Though you plant vineyards and till them, you shall have no wine to drink or store, for the worm shall devour them.

hebrew: זֵיתִ֛ים יִהְי֥וּ לְךָ֖ בְּכָל־גְּבוּלֶ֑ךָ וְשֶׁ֙מֶן֙ לֹ֣א תָס֔וּךְ כִּ֥י יִשַּׁ֖ל זֵיתֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: zeytiym yih'yv l'kha b'khal-g'vvlekha v'shemen lo tasvkh' kiy yishal zeytekha
translation: Though you have olive trees throughout your territory, you shall have no oil for anointment, for your olives shall drop off.

hebrew: בָּנִ֥ים וּבָנ֖וֹת תּוֹלִ֑יד וְלֹא־יִהְי֣וּ לָ֔ךְ כִּ֥י יֵלְכ֖וּ בַּשֶּֽׁבִי׃
transliteration: baniym vvanvot tvoliyd v'lo-yih'yv lakh' kiy yel'khv basheviy
translation: Though you beget sons and daughters, they shall not remain with you, for they shall go into captivity.

hebrew: כָּל־עֵצְךָ֖ וּפְרִ֣י אַדְמָתֶ֑ךָ יְיָרֵ֖שׁ הַצְּלָצַֽל׃
transliteration: kal-'etz'kha vf'riy ad'matekha y'yaresh hatz'latzal
translation: The cricket shall take over all the trees and produce of your land.

hebrew: הַגֵּר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּקִרְבְּךָ֔ יַעֲלֶ֥ה עָלֶ֖יךָ מַ֣עְלָה מָּ֑עְלָה וְאַתָּ֥ה תֵרֵ֖ד מַ֥טָּה מָּֽטָּה׃
transliteration: hager asher b'kir'b'kha ya'aleh 'aleykha ma'lah ma'lah v'atah tered matah matah
translation: The stranger in your midst shall rise above you higher and higher, while you sink lower and lower:

hebrew: ה֣וּא יַלְוְךָ֔ וְאַתָּ֖ה לֹ֣א תַלְוֶ֑נּוּ ה֚וּא יִהְיֶ֣ה לְרֹ֔אשׁ וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּֽהְיֶ֥ה לְזָנָֽב׃
transliteration: hv yal'v'kha v'atah lo tal'venv hv yih'yeh l'rosh v'atah tih'yeh l'zanav
translation: he shall be your creditor, but you shall not be his; he shall be the head and you the tail.

hebrew: וּבָ֨אוּ עָלֶ֜יךָ כָּל־הַקְּלָל֣וֹת הָאֵ֗לֶּה וּרְדָפ֙וּךָ֙ וְהִשִּׂיג֔וּךָ עַ֖ד הִשָּֽׁמְדָ֑ךְ כִּי־לֹ֣א שָׁמַ֗עְתָּ בְּקוֹל֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֛ר מִצְוֺתָ֥יו וְחֻקֹּתָ֖יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: vvav 'aleykha kal-hak'lalvot haeleh vr'dafvkha v'hisiygvkha 'ad hisham'dakh' kiy-lo shama'ta b'kvol y'hvah eloheykha lish'mor mitz'votayv v'chukotayv asher tzivakh'
translation: All these curses shall befall you; they shall pursue you and overtake you, until you are wiped out, because you did not heed the L<small>ORD</small> your God and keep the commandments and laws that He enjoined upon you.

hebrew: וְהָי֣וּ בְךָ֔ לְא֖וֹת וּלְמוֹפֵ֑ת וּֽבְזַרְעֲךָ֖ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: v'hayv v'kha l'vot vl'mvofet vv'zar'akha 'ad-'volam
translation: They shall serve as signs and proofs against you and your offspring for all time.

hebrew: תַּ֗חַת אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹא־עָבַ֙דְתָּ֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּשִׂמְחָ֖ה וּבְט֣וּב לֵבָ֑ב מֵרֹ֖ב כֹּֽל׃
transliteration: tachat asher lo-'avad'ta et-y'hvah eloheykha b'sim'chah vv'tvv levav merov kol
translation: Because you would not serve the L<small>ORD</small> your God in joy and gladness over the abundance of everything,

hebrew: וְעָבַדְתָּ֣ אֶת־אֹיְבֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְשַׁלְּחֶ֤נּוּ יְהוָה֙ בָּ֔ךְ בְּרָעָ֧ב וּבְצָמָ֛א וּבְעֵירֹ֖ם וּבְחֹ֣סֶר כֹּ֑ל וְנָתַ֞ן עֹ֤ל בַּרְזֶל֙ עַל־צַוָּארֶ֔ךָ עַ֥ד הִשְׁמִיד֖וֹ אֹתָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'avad'ta et-oy'veykha asher y'shal'chenv y'hvah bakh' b'ra'av vv'tzama vv'eyrom vv'choser kol v'natan 'ol bar'zel 'al-tzavarekha 'ad hish'miydvo otakh'
translation: you shall have to serve—in hunger and thirst, naked and lacking everything—the enemies whom the L<small>ORD</small> will let loose against you. He will put an iron yoke upon your neck until He has wiped you out.

hebrew: יִשָּׂ֣א יְהוָה֩ עָלֶ֨יךָ גּ֤וֹי מֵרָחוֹק֙ מִקְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יִדְאֶ֖ה הַנָּ֑שֶׁר גּ֕וֹי אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תִשְׁמַ֖ע לְשֹׁנֽוֹ׃
transliteration: yisa y'hvah 'aleykha gvoy merachvok mik'tzeh haaretz kaasher yid'eh hanasher gvoy asher lo-tish'ma' l'shonvo
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will bring a nation against you from afar, from the end of the earth, which will swoop down like the eagle—a nation whose language you do not understand,

hebrew: גּ֖וֹי עַ֣ז פָּנִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־יִשָּׂ֤א פָנִים֙ לְזָקֵ֔ן וְנַ֖עַר לֹ֥א יָחֹֽן׃
transliteration: gvoy 'az paniym asher lo-yisa faniym l'zaken v'na'ar lo yachon
translation: a ruthless nation, that will show the old no regard and the young no mercy.
