hebrew: וְ֠אָכַל פְּרִ֨י בְהֶמְתְּךָ֥ וּפְרִֽי־אַדְמָתְךָ֮ עַ֣ד הִשָּֽׁמְדָךְ֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־יַשְׁאִ֜יר לְךָ֗ דָּגָן֙ תִּיר֣וֹשׁ וְיִצְהָ֔ר שְׁגַ֥ר אֲלָפֶ֖יךָ וְעַשְׁתְּרֹ֣ת צֹאנֶ֑ךָ עַ֥ד הַאֲבִיד֖וֹ אֹתָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'akhal p'riy v'hem't'kha vf'riy-ad'mat'kha 'ad hisham'dakh' asher lo-yash'iyr l'kha dagan tiyrvosh v'yitz'har sh'gar alafeykha v'ash't'rot tzonekha 'ad haaviydvo otakh'
translation: It shall devour the offspring of your cattle and the produce of your soil, until you have been wiped out, leaving you nothing of new grain, wine, or oil, of the calving of your herds and the lambing of your flocks, until it has brought you to ruin.

hebrew: וְהֵצַ֨ר לְךָ֜ בְּכָל־שְׁעָרֶ֗יךָ עַ֣ד רֶ֤דֶת חֹמֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ הַגְּבֹה֣וֹת וְהַבְּצֻר֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֛ה בֹּטֵ֥חַ בָּהֵ֖ן בְּכָל־אַרְצֶ֑ךָ וְהֵצַ֤ר לְךָ֙ בְּכָל־שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ בְּכָ֨ל־אַרְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֛ן יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'hetzar l'kha b'khal-sh'areykha 'ad redet chomoteykha hag'vohvot v'hab'tzurvot asher atah botecha bahen b'khal-ar'tzekha v'hetzar l'kha b'khal-sh'areykha b'khal-ar'tz'kha asher natan y'hvah eloheykha lakh'
translation: It shall shut you up in all your towns throughout your land until every mighty, towering wall in which you trust has come down. And when you are shut up in all your towns throughout your land that the L<small>ORD</small> your God has assigned to you,

hebrew: וְאָכַלְתָּ֣ פְרִֽי־בִטְנְךָ֗ בְּשַׂ֤ר בָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ וּבְנֹתֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָֽתַן־לְךָ֖ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ בְּמָצוֹר֙ וּבְמָצ֔וֹק אֲשֶׁר־יָצִ֥יק לְךָ֖ אֹיְבֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: v'akhal'ta f'riy-vit'n'kha b'sar baneykha vv'noteykha asher natan-l'kha y'hvah eloheykha b'matzvor vv'matzvok asher-yatziyk l'kha oy'vekha
translation: you shall eat your own issue, the flesh of your sons and daughters that the L<small>ORD</small> your God has assigned to you, because of the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you.

hebrew: הָאִישׁ֙ הָרַ֣ךְ בְּךָ֔ וְהֶעָנֹ֖ג מְאֹ֑ד תֵּרַ֨ע עֵינ֤וֹ בְאָחִיו֙ וּבְאֵ֣שֶׁת חֵיק֔וֹ וּבְיֶ֥תֶר בָּנָ֖יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹתִֽיר׃
transliteration: haiysh harakh' b'kha v'he'anog m'od tera' 'eynvo v'achiyv vv'eshet cheykvo vv'yeter banayv asher yvotiyr
translation: He who is most tender and fastidious among you shall be too mean to his brother and the wife of his bosom and the children he has spared

hebrew: מִתֵּ֣ת ׀ לְאַחַ֣ד מֵהֶ֗ם מִבְּשַׂ֤ר בָּנָיו֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֹאכֵ֔ל מִבְּלִ֥י הִשְׁאִֽיר־ל֖וֹ כֹּ֑ל בְּמָצוֹר֙ וּבְמָצ֔וֹק אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצִ֥יק לְךָ֛ אֹיִבְךָ֖ בְּכָל־שְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: mitet  l'achad mehem mib'sar banayv asher yokhel mib'liy hish'iyr-lvo kol b'matzvor vv'matzvok asher yatziyk l'kha oyiv'kha b'khal-sh'areykha
translation: to share with any of them the flesh of the children that he eats, because he has nothing else left as a result of the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you in all your towns.

hebrew: הָרַכָּ֨ה בְךָ֜ וְהָעֲנֻגָּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־נִסְּתָ֤ה כַף־רַגְלָהּ֙ הַצֵּ֣ג עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ מֵהִתְעַנֵּ֖ג וּמֵרֹ֑ךְ תֵּרַ֤ע עֵינָהּ֙ בְּאִ֣ישׁ חֵיקָ֔הּ וּבִבְנָ֖הּ וּבְבִתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: harakah v'kha v'ha'anugah asher lo-nis'tah khaf-rag'lah hatzeg 'al-haaretz mehit'aneg vmerokh' tera' 'eynah b'iysh cheykah vviv'nah vv'vitah
translation: And she who is most tender and dainty among you, so tender and dainty that she would never venture to set a foot on the ground, shall begrudge the husband of her bosom, and her son and her daughter,

hebrew: וּֽבְשִׁלְיָתָ֞הּ הַיּוֹצֵ֣ת ׀ מִבֵּ֣ין רַגְלֶ֗יהָ וּבְבָנֶ֙יהָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּלֵ֔ד כִּֽי־תֹאכְלֵ֥ם בְּחֹֽסֶר־כֹּ֖ל בַּסָּ֑תֶר בְּמָצוֹר֙ וּבְמָצ֔וֹק אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצִ֥יק לְךָ֛ אֹיִבְךָ֖ בִּשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vv'shil'yatah hayvotzet  mibeyn rag'leyha vv'vaneyha asher teled kiy-tokh'lem b'choser-kol basater b'matzvor vv'matzvok asher yatziyk l'kha oyiv'kha bish'areykha
translation: the afterbirth that issues from between her legs and the babies she bears; she shall eat them secretly, because of utter want, in the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you in your towns.

hebrew: אִם־לֹ֨א תִשְׁמֹ֜ר לַעֲשׂ֗וֹת אֶת־כָּל־דִּבְרֵי֙ הַתּוֹרָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את הַכְּתוּבִ֖ים בַּסֵּ֣פֶר הַזֶּ֑ה לְ֠יִרְאָה אֶת־הַשֵּׁ֞ם הַנִּכְבָּ֤ד וְהַנּוֹרָא֙ הַזֶּ֔ה אֵ֖ת יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: im-lo tish'mor la'asvot et-kal-div'rey hatvorah hazot hak'tvviym basefer hazeh l'yir'ah et-hashem hanikh'bad v'hanvora hazeh et y'hvah eloheykha
translation: If you fail to observe faithfully all the terms of this Teaching that are written in this book, to reverence this honored and awesome Name, the L<small>ORD</small> your God,

hebrew: וְהִפְלָ֤א יְהוָה֙ אֶת־מַכֹּ֣תְךָ֔ וְאֵ֖ת מַכּ֣וֹת זַרְעֶ֑ךָ מַכּ֤וֹת גְּדֹלוֹת֙ וְנֶ֣אֱמָנ֔וֹת וָחֳלָיִ֥ם רָעִ֖ים וְנֶאֱמָנִֽים׃
transliteration: v'hif'la y'hvah et-makot'kha v'et makvot zar'ekha makvot g'dolvot v'neemanvot vacholayim ra'iym v'neemaniym
translation: the L<small>ORD</small> will inflict extraordinary plagues upon you and your offspring, strange and lasting plagues, malignant and chronic diseases.

hebrew: וְהֵשִׁ֣יב בְּךָ֗ אֵ֚ת כָּל־מַדְוֵ֣ה מִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָגֹ֖רְתָּ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וְדָבְק֖וּ בָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: v'heshiyv b'kha et kal-mad'veh mitz'rayim asher yagor'ta mip'neyhem v'dav'kv bakh'
translation: He will bring back upon you all the sicknesses of Egypt that you dreaded so, and they shall cling to you.

hebrew: גַּ֤ם כָּל־חֳלִי֙ וְכָל־מַכָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א כָת֔וּב בְּסֵ֖פֶר הַתּוֹרָ֣ה הַזֹּ֑את יַעְלֵ֤ם יְהוָה֙ עָלֶ֔יךָ עַ֖ד הִשָּׁמְדָֽךְ׃
transliteration: gam kal-choliy v'khal-makah asher lo khatvv b'sefer hatvorah hazot ya'lem y'hvah 'aleykha 'ad hisham'dakh'
translation: Moreover, the L<small>ORD</small> will bring upon you all the other diseases and plagues that are not mentioned in this book of Teaching, until you are wiped out.

hebrew: וְנִשְׁאַרְתֶּם֙ בִּמְתֵ֣י מְעָ֔ט תַּ֚חַת אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֱיִיתֶ֔ם כְּכוֹכְבֵ֥י הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לָרֹ֑ב כִּי־לֹ֣א שָׁמַ֔עְתָּ בְּק֖וֹל יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'nish'ar'tem bim'tey m'at tachat asher heyiytem k'khvokh'vey hashamayim larov kiy-lo shama'ta b'kvol y'hvah eloheykha
translation: You shall be left a scant few, after having been as numerous as the stars in the skies, because you did not heed the command of the L<small>ORD</small> your God.

hebrew: וְ֠הָיָה כַּאֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֨שׂ יְהוָ֜ה עֲלֵיכֶ֗ם לְהֵיטִ֣יב אֶתְכֶם֮ וּלְהַרְבּ֣וֹת אֶתְכֶם֒ כֵּ֣ן יָשִׂ֤ישׂ יְהוָה֙ עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם לְהַאֲבִ֥יד אֶתְכֶ֖ם וּלְהַשְׁמִ֣יד אֶתְכֶ֑ם וְנִסַּחְתֶּם֙ מֵעַ֣ל הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'hayah kaasher-sas y'hvah 'aleykhem l'heytiyv et'khem vl'har'bvot et'khem ken yasiys y'hvah 'aleykhem l'haaviyd et'khem vl'hash'miyd et'khem v'nisach'tem me'al haadamah asher-atah va-shamah l'rish'tah
translation: And as the L<small>ORD</small> once delighted in making you prosperous and many, so will the L<small>ORD</small> now delight in causing you to perish and in wiping you out; you shall be torn from the land that you are about to enter and possess.

hebrew: וֶהֱפִֽיצְךָ֤ יְהוָה֙ בְּכָל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים מִקְצֵ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ וְעַד־קְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ וְעָבַ֨דְתָּ שָּׁ֜ם אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹא־יָדַ֛עְתָּ אַתָּ֥ה וַאֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ עֵ֥ץ וָאָֽבֶן׃
transliteration: vehefiytz'kha y'hvah b'khal-ha'amiym mik'tzeh haaretz v'ad-k'tzeh haaretz v'avad'ta sham elohiym acheriym asher lo-yada'ta atah vaavoteykha 'etz vaaven
translation: The LORD will scatter you among all the peoples from one end of the earth to the other, and there you shall serve other gods, wood and stone, whom neither you nor your ancestors have experienced.gSee note at 11.28.

hebrew: וּבַגּוֹיִ֤ם הָהֵם֙ לֹ֣א תַרְגִּ֔יעַ וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה מָנ֖וֹחַ לְכַף־רַגְלֶ֑ךָ וְנָתַן֩ יְהוָ֨ה לְךָ֥ שָׁם֙ לֵ֣ב רַגָּ֔ז וְכִלְי֥וֹן עֵינַ֖יִם וְדַֽאֲב֥וֹן נָֽפֶשׁ׃
transliteration: vvagvoyim hahem lo tar'giy'a v'lo-yih'yeh manvocha l'khaf-rag'lekha v'natan y'hvah l'kha sham lev ragaz v'khil'yvon 'eynayim v'daavvon nafesh
translation: Yet even among those nations you shall find no peace, nor shall your foot find a place to rest. The L<small>ORD</small> will give you there an anguished heart and eyes that pine and a despondent spirit.

hebrew: וְהָי֣וּ חַיֶּ֔יךָ תְּלֻאִ֥ים לְךָ֖ מִנֶּ֑גֶד וּפָֽחַדְתָּ֙ לַ֣יְלָה וְיוֹמָ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תַאֲמִ֖ין בְּחַיֶּֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'hayv chayeykha t'luiym l'kha mineged vfachad'ta lay'lah v'yvomam v'lo taamiyn b'chayeykha
translation: The life you face shall be precarious; you shall be in terror, night and day, with no assurance of survival.

hebrew: בַּבֹּ֤קֶר תֹּאמַר֙ מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן עֶ֔רֶב וּבָעֶ֥רֶב תֹּאמַ֖ר מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן בֹּ֑קֶר מִפַּ֤חַד לְבָֽבְךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּפְחָ֔ד וּמִמַּרְאֵ֥ה עֵינֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּרְאֶֽה׃
transliteration: baboker tomar miy-yiten 'erev vva'erev tomar miy-yiten boker mipachad l'vav'kha asher tif'chad vmimar'eh 'eyneykha asher tir'eh
translation: In the morning you shall say, “If only it were evening!” and in the evening you shall say, “If only it were morning!”—because of what your heart shall dread and your eyes shall see.

hebrew: וֶֽהֱשִֽׁיבְךָ֨ יְהוָ֥ה ׀ מִצְרַיִם֮ בָּאֳנִיּוֹת֒ בַּדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֣רְתִּֽי לְךָ֔ לֹא־תֹסִ֥יף ע֖וֹד לִרְאֹתָ֑הּ וְהִתְמַכַּרְתֶּ֨ם שָׁ֧ם לְאֹיְבֶ֛יךָ לַעֲבָדִ֥ים וְלִשְׁפָח֖וֹת וְאֵ֥ין קֹנֶֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: veheshiyv'kha y'hvah  mitz'rayim baoniyvot baderekh' asher amar'tiy l'kha lo-tosiyf 'vod lir'otah v'hit'makar'tem sham l'oy'veykha la'avadiym v'lish'fachvot v'eyn koneh (s)
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will send you back to Egypt in galleys, by a route which I told you you should not see again. There you shall offer yourselves for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but none will buy.

hebrew: אֵלֶּה֩ דִבְרֵ֨י הַבְּרִ֜ית אֲ‍ֽשֶׁר־צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֣ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֗ה לִכְרֹ֛ת אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֑ב מִלְּבַ֣ד הַבְּרִ֔ית אֲשֶׁר־כָּרַ֥ת אִתָּ֖ם בְּחֹרֵֽב׃ (פ)
transliteration: eleh div'rey hab'riyt a‍sher-tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh likh'rot et-b'ney yis'rael b'eretz mvoav mil'vad hab'riyt asher-karat itam b'chorev (f)
translation: These are the terms of the covenant which the L<small>ORD</small> commanded Moses to conclude with the Israelites in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant which He had made with them at Horeb.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־כָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אַתֶּ֣ם רְאִיתֶ֗ם אֵ֣ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁר֩ עָשָׂ֨ה יְהוָ֤ה לְעֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לְפַרְעֹ֥ה וּלְכָל־עֲבָדָ֖יו וּלְכָל־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayik'ra mosheh el-kal-yis'rael vayomer alehem atem r'iytem et kal-asher 'asah y'hvah l'eyneykhem b'eretz mitz'rayim l'far'oh vl'khal-'avadayv vl'khal-ar'tzvo
translation:
Moses summoned all Israel and said to them:
You have seen all that the LORD did before your very eyes in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh and to all his courtiers and to his whole country:

hebrew: הַמַּסּוֹת֙ הַגְּדֹלֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָא֖וּ עֵינֶ֑יךָ הָאֹתֹ֧ת וְהַמֹּפְתִ֛ים הַגְּדֹלִ֖ים הָהֵֽם׃
transliteration: hamasvot hag'dolot asher rav 'eyneykha haotot v'hamof'tiym hag'doliym hahem
translation: the wondrous feats that you saw with your own eyes, those prodigious signs and marvels.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־נָתַן֩ יְהוָ֨ה לָכֶ֥ם לֵב֙ לָדַ֔עַת וְעֵינַ֥יִם לִרְא֖וֹת וְאָזְנַ֣יִם לִשְׁמֹ֑עַ עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: v'lo-natan y'hvah lakhem lev lada'at v'eynayim lir'vot v'az'nayim lish'mo'a 'ad hayvom hazeh
translation: Yet to this day the L<small>ORD</small> has not given you a mind to understand or eyes to see or ears to hear.

hebrew: וָאוֹלֵ֥ךְ אֶתְכֶ֛ם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר לֹֽא־בָל֤וּ שַׂלְמֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ מֵעֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וְנַֽעַלְךָ֥ לֹֽא־בָלְתָ֖ה מֵעַ֥ל רַגְלֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: vavolekh' et'khem ar'ba'iym shanah bamid'bar lo-valv sal'moteykhem me'aleykhem v'na'al'kha lo-val'tah me'al rag'lekha
translation: I led you through the wilderness forty years; the clothes on your back did not wear out, nor did the sandals on your feet;

hebrew: לֶ֚חֶם לֹ֣א אֲכַלְתֶּ֔ם וְיַ֥יִן וְשֵׁכָ֖ר לֹ֣א שְׁתִיתֶ֑ם לְמַ֙עַן֙ תֵּֽדְע֔וּ כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: lechem lo akhal'tem v'yayin v'shekhar lo sh'tiytem l'ma'an ted'v kiy aniy y'hvah eloheykhem
translation: you had no bread to eat and no wine or other intoxicant to drink—that you might know that I the L<small>ORD</small> am your God.

hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֖אוּ אֶל־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַיֵּצֵ֣א סִיחֹ֣ן מֶֽלֶךְ־חֶ֠שְׁבּוֹן וְע֨וֹג מֶֽלֶךְ־הַבָּשָׁ֧ן לִקְרָאתֵ֛נוּ לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה וַנַּכֵּֽם׃
transliteration: vatavov el-hamakvom hazeh vayetze siychon melekh'-chesh'bvon v'vog melekh'-habashan lik'ratenv lamil'chamah vanakem
translation: When you reached this place, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan came out to engage us in battle, but we defeated them.

hebrew: וַנִּקַּח֙ אֶת־אַרְצָ֔ם וַנִּתְּנָ֣הּ לְנַחֲלָ֔ה לָרֽאוּבֵנִ֖י וְלַגָּדִ֑י וְלַחֲצִ֖י שֵׁ֥בֶט הַֽמְנַשִּֽׁי׃
transliteration: vanikach et-ar'tzam vanit'nah l'nachalah larvveniy v'lagadiy v'lachatziy shevet ham'nashiy
translation: We took their land and gave it to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh as their heritage.

hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֗ם אֶת־דִּבְרֵי֙ הַבְּרִ֣ית הַזֹּ֔את וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם לְמַ֣עַן תַּשְׂכִּ֔ילוּ אֵ֖ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֽׂוּן׃ (פ)
transliteration: vsh'mar'tem et-div'rey hab'riyt hazot va'asiytem otam l'ma'an tas'kiylv et kal-asher ta'asvn (f)
translation: Therefore observe faithfully all the terms of this covenant, that you may succeed in all that you undertake.

hebrew: אַתֶּ֨ם נִצָּבִ֤ים הַיּוֹם֙ כֻּלְּכֶ֔ם לִפְנֵ֖י יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם רָאשֵׁיכֶ֣ם שִׁבְטֵיכֶ֗ם זִקְנֵיכֶם֙ וְשֹׁ֣טְרֵיכֶ֔ם כֹּ֖ל אִ֥ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: atem nitzaviym hayvom kul'khem lif'ney y'hvah eloheykhem rasheykhem shiv'teykhem zik'neykhem v'shot'reykhem kol iysh yis'rael
translation: You stand this day, all of you, before the L<small>ORD</small> your God—your tribal heads, your elders and your officials, all the men of Israel,

hebrew: טַפְּכֶ֣ם נְשֵׁיכֶ֔ם וְגֵ֣רְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּקֶ֣רֶב מַחֲנֶ֑יךָ מֵחֹטֵ֣ב עֵצֶ֔יךָ עַ֖ד שֹׁאֵ֥ב מֵימֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: tap'khem n'sheykhem v'ger'kha asher b'kerev machaneykha mechotev 'etzeykha 'ad shoev meymeykha
translation: your children, your wives, even the stranger within your camp, from woodchopper to waterdrawer—

hebrew: לְעָבְרְךָ֗ בִּבְרִ֛ית יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ וּבְאָלָת֑וֹ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ כֹּרֵ֥ת עִמְּךָ֖ הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: l'av'r'kha biv'riyt y'hvah eloheykha vv'alatvo asher y'hvah eloheykha koret 'im'kha hayvom
translation: to enter into the covenant of the LORD your God, which the LORD your God is concluding with you this day, with its sanctions;aI.e., the curses that violations of the covenant will entail.

hebrew: לְמַ֣עַן הָקִֽים־אֹתְךָ֩ הַיּ֨וֹם ׀ ל֜וֹ לְעָ֗ם וְה֤וּא יִֽהְיֶה־לְּךָ֙ לֵֽאלֹהִ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּר־לָ֑ךְ וְכַאֲשֶׁ֤ר נִשְׁבַּע֙ לַאֲבֹתֶ֔יךָ לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: l'ma'an hakiym-ot'kha hayvom  lvo l'am v'hv yih'yeh-l'kha lelohiym kaasher diber-lakh' v'khaasher nish'ba' laavoteykha l'av'raham l'yitz'chak vl'ya'akov
translation: to the end that He may establish you this day as His people and be your God, as He promised you and as He swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

hebrew: וְלֹ֥א אִתְּכֶ֖ם לְבַדְּכֶ֑ם אָנֹכִ֗י כֹּרֵת֙ אֶת־הַבְּרִ֣ית הַזֹּ֔את וְאֶת־הָאָלָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
transliteration: v'lo it'khem l'vad'khem anokhiy koret et-hab'riyt hazot v'et-haalah hazot
translation: I make this covenant, with its sanctions, not with you alone,

hebrew: כִּי֩ אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֶשְׁנ֜וֹ פֹּ֗ה עִמָּ֙נוּ֙ עֹמֵ֣ד הַיּ֔וֹם לִפְנֵ֖י יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְאֵ֨ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵינֶ֛נּוּ פֹּ֖ה עִמָּ֥נוּ הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: kiy et-asher yesh'nvo poh 'imanv 'omed hayvom lif'ney y'hvah eloheynv v'et asher eynenv poh 'imanv hayvom
translation: but both with those who are standing here with us this day before the L<small>ORD</small> our God and with those who are not with us here this day.

hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתֶּ֣ם יְדַעְתֶּ֔ם אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־יָשַׁ֖בְנוּ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְאֵ֧ת אֲשֶׁר־עָבַ֛רְנוּ בְּקֶ֥רֶב הַגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲבַרְתֶּֽם׃
transliteration: kiy-atem y'da'tem et asher-yashav'nv b'eretz mitz'rayim v'et asher-'avar'nv b'kerev hagvoyim asher 'avar'tem
translation: Well you know that we dwelt in the land of Egypt and that we passed through the midst of various other nations;

hebrew: וַתִּרְאוּ֙ אֶת־שִׁקּ֣וּצֵיהֶ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת גִּלֻּלֵיהֶ֑ם עֵ֣ץ וָאֶ֔בֶן כֶּ֥סֶף וְזָהָ֖ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר עִמָּהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vatir'v et-shikvtzeyhem v'et giluleyhem 'etz vaeven kesef v'zahav asher 'imahem
translation: and you have seen the detestable things and the fetishes of wood and stone, silver and gold, that they keep.

hebrew: פֶּן־יֵ֣שׁ בָּ֠כֶם אִ֣ישׁ אוֹ־אִשָּׁ֞ה א֧וֹ מִשְׁפָּחָ֣ה אוֹ־שֵׁ֗בֶט אֲשֶׁר֩ לְבָב֨וֹ פֹנֶ֤ה הַיּוֹם֙ מֵעִם֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ לָלֶ֣כֶת לַעֲבֹ֔ד אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֖י הַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָהֵ֑ם פֶּן־יֵ֣שׁ בָּכֶ֗ם שֹׁ֛רֶשׁ פֹּרֶ֥ה רֹ֖אשׁ וְלַעֲנָֽה׃
transliteration: pen-yesh bakhem iysh vo-ishah vo mish'pachah vo-shevet asher l'vavvo foneh hayvom me'im y'hvah eloheynv lalekhet la'avod et-elohey hagvoyim hahem pen-yesh bakhem shoresh poreh rosh v'la'anah
translation: Perchance there is among you some man or woman, or some clan or tribe, whose heart is even now turning away from the L<small>ORD</small> our God to go and worship the gods of those nations—perchance there is among you a stock sprouting poison weed and wormwood.

hebrew: וְהָיָ֡ה בְּשָׁמְעוֹ֩ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֨י הָֽאָלָ֜ה הַזֹּ֗את וְהִתְבָּרֵ֨ךְ בִּלְבָב֤וֹ לֵאמֹר֙ שָׁל֣וֹם יִֽהְיֶה־לִּ֔י כִּ֛י בִּשְׁרִר֥וּת לִבִּ֖י אֵלֵ֑ךְ לְמַ֛עַן סְפ֥וֹת הָרָוָ֖ה אֶת־הַצְּמֵאָֽה׃
transliteration: v'hayah b'sham'vo et-div'rey haalah hazot v'hit'barekh' bil'vavvo lemor shalvom yih'yeh-liy kiy bish'rirvt libiy elekh' l'ma'an s'fvot haravah et-hatz'meah
translation: When such a one hears the words of these sanctions, he may fancy himself immune, thinking, “I shall be safe, though I follow my own willful heart”—to the utter ruin of moist and dry alike.bI.e., everything.

hebrew: לֹא־יֹאבֶ֣ה יְהוָה֮ סְלֹ֣חַֽ לוֹ֒ כִּ֣י אָ֠ז יֶעְשַׁ֨ן אַף־יְהוָ֤ה וְקִנְאָתוֹ֙ בָּאִ֣ישׁ הַה֔וּא וְרָ֤בְצָה בּוֹ֙ כָּל־הָ֣אָלָ֔ה הַכְּתוּבָ֖ה בַּסֵּ֣פֶר הַזֶּ֑ה וּמָחָ֤ה יְהוָה֙ אֶת־שְׁמ֔וֹ מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
transliteration: lo-yoveh y'hvah s'locha lvo kiy az ye'shan af-y'hvah v'kin'atvo baiysh hahv v'rav'tzah bvo kal-haalah hak'tvvah basefer hazeh vmachah y'hvah et-sh'mvo mitachat hashamayim
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will never forgive him; rather will the L<small>ORD</small>’s anger and passion rage against that man, till every sanction recorded in this book comes down upon him, and the L<small>ORD</small> blots out his name from under heaven.

hebrew: וְהִבְדִּיל֤וֹ יְהוָה֙ לְרָעָ֔ה מִכֹּ֖ל שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כְּכֹל֙ אָל֣וֹת הַבְּרִ֔ית הַכְּתוּבָ֕ה בְּסֵ֥פֶר הַתּוֹרָ֖ה הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: v'hiv'diylvo y'hvah l'ra'ah mikol shiv'tey yis'rael k'khol alvot hab'riyt hak'tvvah b'sefer hatvorah hazeh
translation: The LORD will single themcI.e., clan or tribe, v. 17. out from all the tribes of Israel for misfortune, in accordance with all the sanctions of the covenant recorded in this book of Teaching.

hebrew: וְאָמַ֞ר הַדּ֣וֹר הָֽאַחֲר֗וֹן בְּנֵיכֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָק֙וּמוּ֙ מֵאַ֣חֲרֵיכֶ֔ם וְהַ֨נָּכְרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָבֹ֖א מֵאֶ֣רֶץ רְחוֹקָ֑ה וְ֠רָאוּ אֶת־מַכּ֞וֹת הָאָ֤רֶץ הַהִוא֙ וְאֶת־תַּ֣חֲלֻאֶ֔יהָ אֲשֶׁר־חִלָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה בָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: v'amar hadvor haacharvon b'neykhem asher yakvmv meachareykhem v'hanakh'riy asher yavo meeretz r'chvokah v'rav et-makvot haaretz hahiv v'et-tachalueyha asher-chilah y'hvah bah
translation: And later generations will ask—the children who succeed you, and foreigners who come from distant lands and see the plagues and diseases that the L<small>ORD</small> has inflicted upon that land,

hebrew: גָּפְרִ֣ית וָמֶלַח֮ שְׂרֵפָ֣ה כָל־אַרְצָהּ֒ לֹ֤א תִזָּרַע֙ וְלֹ֣א תַצְמִ֔חַ וְלֹֽא־יַעֲלֶ֥ה בָ֖הּ כָּל־עֵ֑שֶׂב כְּֽמַהְפֵּכַ֞ת סְדֹ֤ם וַעֲמֹרָה֙ אַדְמָ֣ה וצביים [וּצְבוֹיִ֔ם] אֲשֶׁר֙ הָפַ֣ךְ יְהוָ֔ה בְּאַפּ֖וֹ וּבַחֲמָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: gaf'riyt vamelach s'refah khal-ar'tzah lo tizara' v'lo tatz'micha v'lo-ya'aleh vah kal-'esev k'mah'pekhat s'dom va'amorah ad'mah vtzvyym [vtz'vvoyim] asher hafakh' y'hvah b'apvo vvachamatvo
translation: all its soil devastated by sulfur and salt, beyond sowing and producing, no grass growing in it, just like the upheaval of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which the L<small>ORD</small> overthrew in His fierce anger—

hebrew: וְאָֽמְרוּ֙ כָּל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם עַל־מֶ֨ה עָשָׂ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה כָּ֖כָה לָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את מֶ֥ה חֳרִ֛י הָאַ֥ף הַגָּד֖וֹל הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: v'am'rv kal-hagvoyim 'al-meh 'asah y'hvah kakhah laaretz hazot meh choriy haaf hagadvol hazeh
translation: all nations will ask, “Why did the L<small>ORD</small> do thus to this land? Wherefore that awful wrath?”

hebrew: וְאָ֣מְר֔וּ עַ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָֽזְב֔וּ אֶת־בְּרִ֥ית יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתָ֑ם אֲשֶׁר֙ כָּרַ֣ת עִמָּ֔ם בְּהוֹצִיא֥וֹ אֹתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
transliteration: v'am'rv 'al asher 'az'vv et-b'riyt y'hvah elohey avotam asher karat 'imam b'hvotziyvo otam meeretz mitz'rayim
translation: They will be told, “Because they forsook the covenant that the L<small>ORD</small>, God of their fathers, made with them when He freed them from the land of Egypt;

hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֗וּ וַיַּֽעַבְדוּ֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוּ֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם אֱלֹהִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־יְדָע֔וּם וְלֹ֥א חָלַ֖ק לָהֶֽם׃
transliteration: vayel'khv vaya'av'dv elohiym acheriym vayish'tachavv lahem elohiym asher lo-y'da'vm v'lo chalak lahem
translation: they turned to the service of other gods and worshiped them, gods whom they had not experienceddSee note at 11.28. and whom He had not allottedeSee 4.19–20. to them.

hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יְהוָ֖ה בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַהִ֑וא לְהָבִ֤יא עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ אֶת־כָּל־הַקְּלָלָ֔ה הַכְּתוּבָ֖ה בַּסֵּ֥פֶר הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayichar-af y'hvah baaretz hahiv l'haviy 'aleyha et-kal-hak'lalah hak'tvvah basefer hazeh
translation: So the L<small>ORD</small> was incensed at that land and brought upon it all the curses recorded in this book.

hebrew: וַיִּתְּשֵׁ֤ם יְהוָה֙ מֵעַ֣ל אַדְמָתָ֔ם בְּאַ֥ף וּבְחֵמָ֖ה וּבְקֶ֣צֶף גָּד֑וֹל וַיַּשְׁלִכֵ֛ם אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ אַחֶ֖רֶת כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayit'shem y'hvah me'al ad'matam b'af vv'chemah vv'ketzef gadvol vayash'likhem el-eretz acheret kayvom hazeh
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> uprooted them from their soil in anger, fury, and great wrath, and cast them into another land, as is still the case.”

hebrew: הַ֨נִּסְתָּרֹ֔ת לַיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְהַנִּגְלֹ֞ת לָ֤ׄנׄוּׄ וּׄלְׄבָׄנֵׄ֙יׄנׄוּׄ֙ עַד־עוֹלָ֔ם לַעֲשׂ֕וֹת אֶת־כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֖י הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃ (ס)
transliteration: hanis'tarot layhvah eloheynv v'hanig'lot lanv vl'vaneynv 'ad-'volam la'asvot et-kal-div'rey hatvorah hazot (s)
translation: Concealed acts concern the L<small>ORD</small> our God; but with overt acts, it is for us and our children ever to apply all the provisions of this Teaching.

hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ כִֽי־יָבֹ֨אוּ עָלֶ֜יךָ כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה הַבְּרָכָה֙ וְהַקְּלָלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וַהֲשֵׁבֹתָ֙ אֶל־לְבָבֶ֔ךָ בְּכָל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֧ר הִדִּיחֲךָ֛ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: v'hayah khiy-yavov 'aleykha kal-had'variym haeleh hab'rakhah v'hak'lalah asher natatiy l'faneykha vahashevota el-l'vavekha b'khal-hagvoyim asher hidiychakha y'hvah eloheykha shamah
translation: When all these things befall you—the blessing and the curse that I have set before you—and you take them to heart amidst the various nations to which the L<small>ORD</small> your God has banished you,

hebrew: וְשַׁבְתָּ֞ עַד־יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֣ בְקֹל֔וֹ כְּכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם אַתָּ֣ה וּבָנֶ֔יךָ בְּכָל־לְבָבְךָ֖ וּבְכָל־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
transliteration: v'shav'ta 'ad-y'hvah eloheykha v'shama'ta v'kolvo k'khol asher-anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom atah vvaneykha b'khal-l'vav'kha vv'khal-naf'shekha
translation: and you return to the L<small>ORD</small> your God, and you and your children heed His command with all your heart and soul, just as I enjoin upon you this day,

hebrew: וְשָׁ֨ב יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ אֶת־שְׁבוּתְךָ֖ וְרִחֲמֶ֑ךָ וְשָׁ֗ב וְקִבֶּצְךָ֙ מִכָּל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר הֱפִֽיצְךָ֛ יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ שָֽׁמָּה׃
transliteration: v'shav y'hvah eloheykha et-sh'vvt'kha v'richamekha v'shav v'kibetz'kha mikal-ha'amiym asher hefiytz'kha y'hvah eloheykha shamah
translation: then the LORD your God will restore your fortunesaOthers “captivity.” and take you back in love. He will bring you together again from all the peoples where the LORD your God has scattered you.

hebrew: אִם־יִהְיֶ֥ה נִֽדַּחֲךָ֖ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם מִשָּׁ֗ם יְקַבֶּצְךָ֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וּמִשָּׁ֖ם יִקָּחֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: im-yih'yeh nidachakha bik'tzeh hashamayim misham y'kabetz'kha y'hvah eloheykha vmisham yikachekha
translation: Even if your outcasts are at the ends of the world,bLit. “sky.” from there the LORD your God will gather you, from there He will fetch you.

hebrew: וֶהֱבִֽיאֲךָ֞ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ אֶל־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יָרְשׁ֥וּ אֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ וִֽירִשְׁתָּ֑הּ וְהֵיטִֽבְךָ֥ וְהִרְבְּךָ֖ מֵאֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: veheviyakha y'hvah eloheykha el-haaretz asher-yar'shv avoteykha viyrish'tah v'heytiv'kha v'hir'b'kha meavoteykha
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> your God will bring you to the land that your fathers possessed, and you shall possess it; and He will make you more prosperous and more numerous than your fathers.

hebrew: וּמָ֨ל יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ אֶת־לְבָבְךָ֖ וְאֶת־לְבַ֣ב זַרְעֶ֑ךָ לְאַהֲבָ֞ה אֶת־יְהוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ בְּכָל־לְבָבְךָ֥ וּבְכָל־נַפְשְׁךָ֖ לְמַ֥עַן חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
transliteration: vmal y'hvah eloheykha et-l'vav'kha v'et-l'vav zar'ekha l'ahavah et-y'hvah eloheykha b'khal-l'vav'kha vv'khal-naf'sh'kha l'ma'an chayeykha
translation: Then the LORD your God will open upcOthers “circumcise.” your heart and the hearts of your offspring to love the LORD your God with all your heart and soul, in order that you may live.

hebrew: וְנָתַן֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֵ֥ת כָּל־הָאָל֖וֹת הָאֵ֑לֶּה עַל־אֹיְבֶ֥יךָ וְעַל־שֹׂנְאֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר רְדָפֽוּךָ׃
transliteration: v'natan y'hvah eloheykha et kal-haalvot haeleh 'al-oy'veykha v'al-son'eykha asher r'dafvkha
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> your God will inflict all those curses upon the enemies and foes who persecuted you.

hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה תָשׁ֔וּב וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֖ בְּק֣וֹל יְהוָ֑ה וְעָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ אֶת־כָּל־מִצְוֺתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּֽוֹם׃
transliteration: v'atah tashvv v'shama'ta b'kvol y'hvah v'asiyta et-kal-mitz'votayv asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom
translation: You, however, will again heed the L<small>ORD</small> and obey all His commandments that I enjoin upon you this day.

hebrew: וְהוֹתִֽירְךָ֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ בְּכֹ֣ל ׀ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֶ֗ךָ בִּפְרִ֨י בִטְנְךָ֜ וּבִפְרִ֧י בְהֶמְתְּךָ֛ וּבִפְרִ֥י אַדְמָתְךָ֖ לְטוֹבָ֑ה כִּ֣י ׀ יָשׁ֣וּב יְהוָ֗ה לָשׂ֤וּשׂ עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ לְט֔וֹב כַּאֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֖שׂ עַל־אֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'hvotiyr'kha y'hvah eloheykha b'khol  ma'aseh yadekha bif'riy vit'n'kha vvif'riy v'hem't'kha vvif'riy ad'mat'kha l'tvovah kiy  yashvv y'hvah lasvs 'aleykha l'tvov kaasher-sas 'al-avoteykha
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> your God will grant you abounding prosperity in all your undertakings, in the issue of your womb, the offspring of your cattle, and the produce of your soil. For the L<small>ORD</small> will again delight in your well-being, as He did in that of your fathers,

hebrew: כִּ֣י תִשְׁמַ֗ע בְּקוֹל֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֤ר מִצְוֺתָיו֙ וְחֻקֹּתָ֔יו הַכְּתוּבָ֕ה בְּסֵ֥פֶר הַתּוֹרָ֖ה הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֤י תָשׁוּב֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכָל־לְבָבְךָ֖ וּבְכָל־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃ (פ)
transliteration: kiy tish'ma' b'kvol y'hvah eloheykha lish'mor mitz'votayv v'chukotayv hak'tvvah b'sefer hatvorah hazeh kiy tashvv el-y'hvah eloheykha b'khal-l'vav'kha vv'khal-naf'shekha (f)
translation: since you will be heeding the L<small>ORD</small> your God and keeping His commandments and laws that are recorded in this book of the Teaching—once you return to the L<small>ORD</small> your God with all your heart and soul.

hebrew: כִּ֚י הַמִּצְוָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם לֹֽא־נִפְלֵ֥את הִוא֙ מִמְּךָ֔ וְלֹ֥א רְחֹקָ֖ה הִֽוא׃
transliteration: kiy hamitz'vah hazot asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom lo-nif'let hiv mim'kha v'lo r'chokah hiv
translation: Surely, this Instruction which I enjoin upon you this day is not too baffling for you, nor is it beyond reach.

hebrew: לֹ֥א בַשָּׁמַ֖יִם הִ֑וא לֵאמֹ֗ר מִ֣י יַעֲלֶה־לָּ֤נוּ הַשָּׁמַ֙יְמָה֙ וְיִקָּחֶ֣הָ לָּ֔נוּ וְיַשְׁמִעֵ֥נוּ אֹתָ֖הּ וְנַעֲשֶֽׂנָּה׃
transliteration: lo vashamayim hiv lemor miy ya'aleh-lanv hashamay'mah v'yikacheha lanv v'yash'mi'env otah v'na'asenah
translation: It is not in the heavens, that you should say, “Who among us can go up to the heavens and get it for us and impart it to us, that we may observe it?”

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־מֵעֵ֥בֶר לַיָּ֖ם הִ֑וא לֵאמֹ֗ר מִ֣י יַעֲבָר־לָ֜נוּ אֶל־עֵ֤בֶר הַיָּם֙ וְיִקָּחֶ֣הָ לָּ֔נוּ וְיַשְׁמִעֵ֥נוּ אֹתָ֖הּ וְנַעֲשֶֽׂנָּה׃
transliteration: v'lo-me'ever layam hiv lemor miy ya'avar-lanv el-'ever hayam v'yikacheha lanv v'yash'mi'env otah v'na'asenah
translation: Neither is it beyond the sea, that you should say, “Who among us can cross to the other side of the sea and get it for us and impart it to us, that we may observe it?”

hebrew: כִּֽי־קָר֥וֹב אֵלֶ֛יךָ הַדָּבָ֖ר מְאֹ֑ד בְּפִ֥יךָ וּבִֽלְבָבְךָ֖ לַעֲשֹׂתֽוֹ׃ (ס)
transliteration: kiy-karvov eleykha hadavar m'od b'fiykha vvil'vav'kha la'asotvo (s)
translation: No, the thing is very close to you, in your mouth and in your heart, to observe it.

hebrew: רְאֵ֨ה נָתַ֤תִּי לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם אֶת־הַֽחַיִּ֖ים וְאֶת־הַטּ֑וֹב וְאֶת־הַמָּ֖וֶת וְאֶת־הָרָֽע׃
transliteration: r'eh natatiy l'faneykha hayvom et-hachayiym v'et-hatvov v'et-hamavet v'et-hara'
translation: See, I set before you this day life and prosperity, death and adversity.

hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֣י מְצַוְּךָ֮ הַיּוֹם֒ לְאַהֲבָ֞ה אֶת־יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ לָלֶ֣כֶת בִּדְרָכָ֔יו וְלִשְׁמֹ֛ר מִצְוֺתָ֥יו וְחֻקֹּתָ֖יו וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֑יו וְחָיִ֣יתָ וְרָבִ֔יתָ וּבֵֽרַכְךָ֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: asher anokhiy m'tzav'kha hayvom l'ahavah et-y'hvah eloheykha lalekhet bid'rakhayv v'lish'mor mitz'votayv v'chukotayv vmish'patayv v'chayiyta v'raviyta vverakh'kha y'hvah eloheykha baaretz asher-atah va-shamah l'rish'tah
translation: FordSeptuagint reads “If you obey the commandments of the Lord your God, which.” I command you this day, to love the LORD your God, to walk in His ways, and to keep His commandments, His laws, and His rules, that you may thrive and increase, and that the LORD your God may bless you in the land that you are about to enter and possess.

hebrew: וְאִם־יִפְנֶ֥ה לְבָבְךָ֖ וְלֹ֣א תִשְׁמָ֑ע וְנִדַּחְתָּ֗ וְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוִ֛יתָ לֵאלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים וַעֲבַדְתָּֽם׃
transliteration: v'im-yif'neh l'vav'kha v'lo tish'ma' v'nidach'ta v'hish'tachaviyta lelohiym acheriym va'avad'tam
translation: But if your heart turns away and you give no heed, and are lured into the worship and service of other gods,

hebrew: הִגַּ֤דְתִּי לָכֶם֙ הַיּ֔וֹם כִּ֥י אָבֹ֖ד תֹּאבֵד֑וּן לֹא־תַאֲרִיכֻ֤ן יָמִים֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתָּ֤ה עֹבֵר֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן לָבֹ֥א שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
transliteration: higad'tiy lakhem hayvom kiy avod tovedvn lo-taariykhun yamiym 'al-haadamah asher atah 'over et-hayar'den lavo shamah l'rish'tah
translation: I declare to you this day that you shall certainly perish; you shall not long endure on the soil that you are crossing the Jordan to enter and possess.

hebrew: הַעִידֹ֨תִי בָכֶ֣ם הַיּוֹם֮ אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם וְאֶת־הָאָרֶץ֒ הַחַיִּ֤ים וְהַמָּ֙וֶת֙ נָתַ֣תִּי לְפָנֶ֔יךָ הַבְּרָכָ֖ה וְהַקְּלָלָ֑ה וּבָֽחַרְתָּ֙ בַּֽחַיִּ֔ים לְמַ֥עַן תִּחְיֶ֖ה אַתָּ֥ה וְזַרְעֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: ha'iydotiy vakhem hayvom et-hashamayim v'et-haaretz hachayiym v'hamavet natatiy l'faneykha hab'rakhah v'hak'lalah vvachar'ta bachayiym l'ma'an tich'yeh atah v'zar'ekha
translation: I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day: I have put before you life and death, blessing and curse. Choose life—if you and your offspring would live—

hebrew: לְאַֽהֲבָה֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֥עַ בְּקֹל֖וֹ וּלְדָבְקָה־ב֑וֹ כִּ֣י ה֤וּא חַיֶּ֙יךָ֙ וְאֹ֣רֶךְ יָמֶ֔יךָ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת עַל־הָאֲדָמָ֗ה אֲשֶׁר֩ נִשְׁבַּ֨ע יְהוָ֧ה לַאֲבֹתֶ֛יךָ לְאַבְרָהָ֛ם לְיִצְחָ֥ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹ֖ב לָתֵ֥ת לָהֶֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: l'ahavah et-y'hvah eloheykha lish'mo'a b'kolvo vl'dav'kah-vvo kiy hv chayeykha v'orekh' yameykha lashevet 'al-haadamah asher nish'ba' y'hvah laavoteykha l'av'raham l'yitz'chak vl'ya'akov latet lahem (f)
translation: by loving the L<small>ORD</small> your God, heeding His commands, and holding fast to Him. For thereby you shall have life and shall long endure upon the soil that the L<small>ORD</small> swore to your ancestors, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give to them.

hebrew: וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה אֶל־כָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayelekh' mosheh vay'daber et-had'variym haeleh el-kal-yis'rael
translation: aAn ancient Heb. ms. and the Septuagint read: “When Moses had finished speaking …”; cf. 29.1.Moses went and spoke-a these things to all Israel.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם בֶּן־מֵאָה֩ וְעֶשְׂרִ֨ים שָׁנָ֤ה אָנֹכִי֙ הַיּ֔וֹם לֹא־אוּכַ֥ל ע֖וֹד לָצֵ֣את וְלָב֑וֹא וַֽיהוָה֙ אָמַ֣ר אֵלַ֔י לֹ֥א תַעֲבֹ֖ר אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֥ן הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem ben-meah v'es'riym shanah anokhiy hayvom lo-vkhal 'vod latzet v'lavvo vayhvah amar elay lo ta'avor et-hayar'den hazeh
translation:
He said to them:
I am now one hundred and twenty years old, I can no longer bLit. “come and go.”be active.-b Moreover, the LORD has said to me, “You shall not go across yonder Jordan.”

hebrew: יְהוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ ה֣וּא ׀ עֹבֵ֣ר לְפָנֶ֗יךָ הֽוּא־יַשְׁמִ֞יד אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָאֵ֛לֶּה מִלְּפָנֶ֖יךָ וִֽירִשְׁתָּ֑ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ ה֚וּא עֹבֵ֣ר לְפָנֶ֔יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: y'hvah eloheykha hv  'over l'faneykha hv-yash'miyd et-hagvoyim haeleh mil'faneykha viyrish'tam y'hvoshu'a hv 'over l'faneykha kaasher diber y'hvah
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> your God Himself will cross over before you; and He Himself will wipe out those nations from your path and you shall dispossess them.—Joshua is the one who shall cross before you, as the L<small>ORD</small> has spoken.—

hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֤ה יְהוָה֙ לָהֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֗ה לְסִיח֥וֹן וּלְע֛וֹג מַלְכֵ֥י הָאֱמֹרִ֖י וּלְאַרְצָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִשְׁמִ֖יד אֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: v'asah y'hvah lahem kaasher 'asah l'siychvon vl'vog mal'khey haemoriy vl'ar'tzam asher hish'miyd otam
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will do to them as He did to Sihon and Og, kings of the Amorites, and to their countries, when He wiped them out.

hebrew: וּנְתָנָ֥ם יְהוָ֖ה לִפְנֵיכֶ֑ם וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֣ם לָהֶ֔ם כְּכָל־הַמִּצְוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּ֖יתִי אֶתְכֶֽם׃
transliteration: vn'tanam y'hvah lif'neykhem va'asiytem lahem k'khal-hamitz'vah asher tziviytiy et'khem
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> will deliver them up to you, and you shall deal with them in full accordance with the Instruction that I have enjoined upon you.

hebrew: חִזְק֣וּ וְאִמְצ֔וּ אַל־תִּֽירְא֥וּ וְאַל־תַּעַרְצ֖וּ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם כִּ֣י ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ ה֚וּא הַהֹלֵ֣ךְ עִמָּ֔ךְ לֹ֥א יַרְפְּךָ֖ וְלֹ֥א יַעַזְבֶֽךָּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: chiz'kv v'im'tzv al-tiyr'v v'al-ta'ar'tzv mip'neyhem kiy  y'hvah eloheykha hv haholekh' 'imakh' lo yar'p'kha v'lo ya'az'veka (f)
translation: Be strong and resolute, be not in fear or in dread of them; for the L<small>ORD</small> your God Himself marches with you: He will not fail you or forsake you.

hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א מֹשֶׁ֜ה לִֽיהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו לְעֵינֵ֣י כָל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֘ל חֲזַ֣ק וֶאֱמָץ֒ כִּ֣י אַתָּ֗ה תָּבוֹא֙ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֧ע יְהוָ֛ה לַאֲבֹתָ֖ם לָתֵ֣ת לָהֶ֑ם וְאַתָּ֖ה תַּנְחִילֶ֥נָּה אוֹתָֽם׃
transliteration: vayik'ra mosheh liyhvoshu'a vayomer elayv l'eyney khal-yis'rael chazak veematz kiy atah tavvo et-ha'am hazeh el-haaretz asher nish'ba' y'hvah laavotam latet lahem v'atah tan'chiylenah votam
translation: Then Moses called Joshua and said to him in the sight of all Israel: “Be strong and resolute, for it is you who shall go with this people into the land that the L<small>ORD</small> swore to their fathers to give them, and it is you who shall apportion it to them.

hebrew: וַֽיהוָ֞ה ה֣וּא ׀ הַהֹלֵ֣ךְ לְפָנֶ֗יךָ ה֚וּא יִהְיֶ֣ה עִמָּ֔ךְ לֹ֥א יַרְפְּךָ֖ וְלֹ֣א יַֽעַזְבֶ֑ךָּ לֹ֥א תִירָ֖א וְלֹ֥א תֵחָֽת׃
transliteration: vayhvah hv  haholekh' l'faneykha hv yih'yeh 'imakh' lo yar'p'kha v'lo ya'az'veka lo tiyra v'lo techat
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> Himself will go before you. He will be with you; He will not fail you or forsake you. Fear not and be not dismayed!”

hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֣ב מֹשֶׁה֮ אֶת־הַתּוֹרָ֣ה הַזֹּאת֒ וַֽיִּתְּנָ֗הּ אֶל־הַכֹּהֲנִים֙ בְּנֵ֣י לֵוִ֔י הַנֹּ֣שְׂאִ֔ים אֶת־אֲר֖וֹן בְּרִ֣ית יְהוָ֑ה וְאֶל־כָּל־זִקְנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayikh'tov mosheh et-hatvorah hazot vayit'nah el-hakohaniym b'ney leviy hanos'iym et-arvon b'riyt y'hvah v'el-kal-zik'ney yis'rael
translation: Moses wrote down this Teaching and gave it to the priests, sons of Levi, who carried the Ark of the L<small>ORD</small>’s Covenant, and to all the elders of Israel.

hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ו מֹשֶׁ֖ה אוֹתָ֣ם לֵאמֹ֑ר מִקֵּ֣ץ ׀ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֗ים בְּמֹעֵ֛ד שְׁנַ֥ת הַשְּׁמִטָּ֖ה בְּחַ֥ג הַסֻּכּֽוֹת׃
transliteration: vay'tzav mosheh votam lemor miketz  sheva' shaniym b'mo'ed sh'nat hash'mitah b'chag hasukvot
translation: And Moses instructed them as follows: Every seventh year,cSee note at 15.1. the year set for remission, at the Feast of Booths,

hebrew: בְּב֣וֹא כָל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֵרָאוֹת֙ אֶת־פְּנֵי֙ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בַּמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִבְחָ֑ר תִּקְרָ֞א אֶת־הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּ֛את נֶ֥גֶד כָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּאָזְנֵיהֶֽם׃
transliteration: b'vvo khal-yis'rael leravot et-p'ney y'hvah eloheykha bamakvom asher yiv'char tik'ra et-hatvorah hazot neged kal-yis'rael b'az'neyhem
translation: when all Israel comes to appear before the L<small>ORD</small> your God in the place that He will choose, you shall read this Teaching aloud in the presence of all Israel.

hebrew: הַקְהֵ֣ל אֶת־הָעָ֗ם הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֤ים וְהַנָּשִׁים֙ וְהַטַּ֔ף וְגֵרְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּשְׁעָרֶ֑יךָ לְמַ֨עַן יִשְׁמְע֜וּ וּלְמַ֣עַן יִלְמְד֗וּ וְיָֽרְאוּ֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם וְשָֽׁמְר֣וּ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֶת־כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֖י הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
transliteration: hak'hel et-ha'am haanashiym v'hanashiym v'hataf v'ger'kha asher bish'areykha l'ma'an yish'm'v vl'ma'an yil'm'dv v'yar'v et-y'hvah eloheykhem v'sham'rv la'asvot et-kal-div'rey hatvorah hazot
translation: Gather the people—men, women, children, and the strangers in your communities—that they may hear and so learn to revere the L<small>ORD</small> your God and to observe faithfully every word of this Teaching.

hebrew: וּבְנֵיהֶ֞ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־יָדְע֗וּ יִשְׁמְעוּ֙ וְלָ֣מְד֔וּ לְיִרְאָ֖ה אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם כָּל־הַיָּמִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֤ם חַיִּים֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֜ם עֹבְרִ֧ים אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֛ן שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: vv'neyhem asher lo-yad'v yish'm'v v'lam'dv l'yir'ah et-y'hvah eloheykhem kal-hayamiym asher atem chayiym 'al-haadamah asher atem 'ov'riym et-hayar'den shamah l'rish'tah (f)
translation: Their children, too, who have not had the experience, shall hear and learn to revere the L<small>ORD</small> your God as long as they live in the land that you are about to cross the Jordan to possess.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה הֵ֣ן קָרְב֣וּ יָמֶיךָ֮ לָמוּת֒ קְרָ֣א אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ וְהִֽתְיַצְּב֛וּ בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וַאֲצַוֶּ֑נּוּ וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ מֹשֶׁה֙ וִֽיהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ וַיִּֽתְיַצְּב֖וּ בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh hen kar'vv yameykha lamvt k'ra et-y'hvoshu'a v'hit'yatz'vv b'ohel mvo'ed vaatzavenv vayelekh' mosheh viyhvoshu'a vayit'yatz'vv b'ohel mvo'ed
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses: The time is drawing near for you to die. Call Joshua and present yourselves in the Tent of Meeting, that I may instruct him. Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves in the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֧א יְהוָ֛ה בָּאֹ֖הֶל בְּעַמּ֣וּד עָנָ֑ן וַיַּעֲמֹ֛ד עַמּ֥וּד הֶעָנָ֖ן עַל־פֶּ֥תַח הָאֹֽהֶל׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayera y'hvah baohel b'amvd 'anan vaya'amod 'amvd he'anan 'al-petach haohel (s)
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> appeared in the Tent, in a pillar of cloud, the pillar of cloud having come to rest at the entrance of the tent.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה הִנְּךָ֥ שֹׁכֵ֖ב עִם־אֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ וְקָם֩ הָעָ֨ם הַזֶּ֜ה וְזָנָ֣ה ׀ אַחֲרֵ֣י ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י נֵֽכַר־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר ה֤וּא בָא־שָׁ֙מָּה֙ בְּקִרְבּ֔וֹ וַעֲזָבַ֕נִי וְהֵפֵר֙ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּרַ֖תִּי אִתּֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah el-mosheh hin'kha shokhev 'im-avoteykha v'kam ha'am hazeh v'zanah  acharey  elohey nekhar-haaretz asher hv va-shamah b'kir'bvo va'azavaniy v'hefer et-b'riytiy asher karatiy itvo
translation: The L<small>ORD</small> said to Moses: You are soon to lie with your fathers. This people will thereupon go astray after the alien gods in their midst, in the land that they are about to enter; they will forsake Me and break My covenant that I made with them.

hebrew: וְחָרָ֣ה אַפִּ֣י ב֣וֹ בַיּוֹם־הַ֠הוּא וַעֲזַבְתִּ֞ים וְהִסְתַּרְתִּ֨י פָנַ֤י מֵהֶם֙ וְהָיָ֣ה לֶֽאֱכֹ֔ל וּמְצָאֻ֛הוּ רָע֥וֹת רַבּ֖וֹת וְצָר֑וֹת וְאָמַר֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא הֲלֹ֗א עַ֣ל כִּֽי־אֵ֤ין אֱלֹהַי֙ בְּקִרְבִּ֔י מְצָא֖וּנִי הָרָע֥וֹת הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
transliteration: v'charah apiy vvo vayvom-hahv va'azav'tiym v'his'tar'tiy fanay mehem v'hayah leekhol vm'tzauhv ra'vot rabvot v'tzarvot v'amar bayvom hahv halo 'al kiy-eyn elohay b'kir'biy m'tzavniy hara'vot haeleh
translation: Then My anger will flare up against them, and I will abandon them and hide My countenance from them. They shall be ready prey; and many evils and troubles shall befall them. And they shall say on that day, “Surely it is because our God is not in our midst that these evils have befallen us.”

hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֗י הַסְתֵּ֨ר אַסְתִּ֤יר פָּנַי֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא עַ֥ל כָּל־הָרָעָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה כִּ֣י פָנָ֔ה אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֲחֵרִֽים׃
transliteration: v'anokhiy has'ter as'tiyr panay bayvom hahv 'al kal-hara'ah asher 'asah kiy fanah el-elohiym acheriym
translation: Yet I will keep My countenance hidden on that day, because of all the evil they have done in turning to other gods.

hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה כִּתְב֤וּ לָכֶם֙ אֶת־הַשִּׁירָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את וְלַמְּדָ֥הּ אֶת־בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שִׂימָ֣הּ בְּפִיהֶ֑ם לְמַ֨עַן תִּהְיֶה־לִּ֜י הַשִּׁירָ֥ה הַזֹּ֛את לְעֵ֖ד בִּבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: v'atah kit'vv lakhem et-hashiyrah hazot v'lam'dah et-b'ney-yis'rael siymah b'fiyhem l'ma'an tih'yeh-liy hashiyrah hazot l'ed biv'ney yis'rael
translation: Therefore, write down this poem and teach it to the people of Israel; put it in their mouths, in order that this poem may be My witness against the people of Israel.

hebrew: כִּֽי־אֲבִיאֶ֜נּוּ אֶֽל־הָאֲדָמָ֣ה ׀ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֣עְתִּי לַאֲבֹתָ֗יו זָבַ֤ת חָלָב֙ וּדְבַ֔שׁ וְאָכַ֥ל וְשָׂבַ֖ע וְדָשֵׁ֑ן וּפָנָ֞ה אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֤ים אֲחֵרִים֙ וַעֲבָד֔וּם וְנִ֣אֲצ֔וּנִי וְהֵפֵ֖ר אֶת־בְּרִיתִֽי׃
transliteration: kiy-aviyenv el-haadamah  asher-nish'ba'tiy laavotayv zavat chalav vd'vash v'akhal v'sava' v'dashen vfanah el-elohiym acheriym va'avadvm v'niatzvniy v'hefer et-b'riytiy
translation: When I bring them into the land flowing with milk and honey that I promised on oath to their fathers, and they eat their fill and grow fat and turn to other gods and serve them, spurning Me and breaking My covenant,

hebrew: וְ֠הָיָה כִּֽי־תִמְצֶ֨אןָ אֹת֜וֹ רָע֣וֹת רַבּוֹת֮ וְצָרוֹת֒ וְ֠עָנְתָה הַשִּׁירָ֨ה הַזֹּ֤את לְפָנָיו֙ לְעֵ֔ד כִּ֛י לֹ֥א תִשָּׁכַ֖ח מִפִּ֣י זַרְע֑וֹ כִּ֧י יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֶת־יִצְר֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר ה֤וּא עֹשֶׂה֙ הַיּ֔וֹם בְּטֶ֣רֶם אֲבִיאֶ֔נּוּ אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבָּֽעְתִּי׃
transliteration: v'hayah kiy-tim'tzena otvo ra'vot rabvot v'tzarvot v'an'tah hashiyrah hazot l'fanayv l'ed kiy lo tishakhach mipiy zar'vo kiy yada'tiy et-yitz'rvo asher hv 'oseh hayvom b'terem aviyenv el-haaretz asher nish'ba'tiy
translation: and the many evils and troubles befall them—then this poem shall confront them as a witness, since it will never be lost from the mouth of their offspring. For I know what plans they are devising even now, before I bring them into the land that I promised on oath.

hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֥ב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־הַשִּׁירָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַֽיְלַמְּדָ֖הּ אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vayikh'tov mosheh et-hashiyrah hazot bayvom hahv vay'lam'dah et-b'ney yis'rael
translation: That day, Moses wrote down this poem and taught it to the Israelites.

hebrew: וַיְצַ֞ו אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֗וּן וַיֹּאמֶר֮ חֲזַ֣ק וֶֽאֱמָץ֒ כִּ֣י אַתָּ֗ה תָּבִיא֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֣עְתִּי לָהֶ֑ם וְאָנֹכִ֖י אֶֽהְיֶ֥ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
transliteration: vay'tzav et-y'hvoshu'a bin-nvn vayomer chazak veematz kiy atah taviy et-b'ney yis'rael el-haaretz asher-nish'ba'tiy lahem v'anokhiy eh'yeh 'imakh'
translation: And He charged Joshua son of Nun: “Be strong and resolute: for you shall bring the Israelites into the land that I promised them on oath, and I will be with you.”

hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כְּכַלּ֣וֹת מֹשֶׁ֗ה לִכְתֹּ֛ב אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַתּוֹרָֽה־הַזֹּ֖את עַל־סֵ֑פֶר עַ֖ד תֻּמָּֽם׃
transliteration: vay'hiy  k'khalvot mosheh likh'tov et-div'rey hatvorah-hazot 'al-sefer 'ad tumam
translation: When Moses had put down in writing the words of this Teaching to the very end,

hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם נֹ֥שְׂאֵ֛י אֲר֥וֹן בְּרִית־יְהוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'tzav mosheh et-hal'viyim nos'ey arvon b'riyt-y'hvah lemor
translation: Moses charged the Levites who carried the Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small>, saying:

hebrew: לָקֹ֗חַ אֵ֣ת סֵ֤פֶר הַתּוֹרָה֙ הַזֶּ֔ה וְשַׂמְתֶּ֣ם אֹת֔וֹ מִצַּ֛ד אֲר֥וֹן בְּרִית־יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם וְהָֽיָה־שָׁ֥ם בְּךָ֖ לְעֵֽד׃
transliteration: lakocha et sefer hatvorah hazeh v'sam'tem otvo mitzad arvon b'riyt-y'hvah eloheykhem v'hayah-sham b'kha l'ed
translation: Take this book of Teaching and place it beside the Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small> your God, and let it remain there as a witness against you.

hebrew: כִּ֣י אָנֹכִ֤י יָדַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֶֽת־מֶרְיְךָ֔ וְאֶֽת־עָרְפְּךָ֖ הַקָּשֶׁ֑ה הֵ֣ן בְּעוֹדֶנִּי֩ חַ֨י עִמָּכֶ֜ם הַיּ֗וֹם מַמְרִ֤ים הֱיִתֶם֙ עִם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאַ֖ף כִּי־אַחֲרֵ֥י מוֹתִֽי׃
transliteration: kiy anokhiy yada'tiy et-mer'y'kha v'et-'ar'p'kha hakasheh hen b'vodeniy chay 'imakhem hayvom mam'riym heyitem 'im-y'hovah v'af kiy-acharey mvotiy
translation: Well I know how defiant and stiffnecked you are: even now, while I am still alive in your midst, you have been defiant toward the L<small>ORD</small>; how much more, then, when I am dead!

hebrew: הַקְהִ֧ילוּ אֵלַ֛י אֶת־כָּל־זִקְנֵ֥י שִׁבְטֵיכֶ֖ם וְשֹׁטְרֵיכֶ֑ם וַאֲדַבְּרָ֣ה בְאָזְנֵיהֶ֗ם אֵ֚ת הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וְאָעִ֣ידָה בָּ֔ם אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וְאֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
transliteration: hak'hiylv elay et-kal-zik'ney shiv'teykhem v'shot'reykhem vaadab'rah v'az'neyhem et had'variym haeleh v'a'iydah bam et-hashamayim v'et-haaretz
translation: Gather to me all the elders of your tribes and your officials, that I may speak all these words to them and that I may call heaven and earth to witness against them.

hebrew: כִּ֣י יָדַ֗עְתִּי אַחֲרֵ֤י מוֹתִי֙ כִּֽי־הַשְׁחֵ֣ת תַּשְׁחִת֔וּן וְסַרְתֶּ֣ם מִן־הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּ֖יתִי אֶתְכֶ֑ם וְקָרָ֨את אֶתְכֶ֤ם הָֽרָעָה֙ בְּאַחֲרִ֣ית הַיָּמִ֔ים כִּֽי־תַעֲשׂ֤וּ אֶת־הָרַע֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה לְהַכְעִיס֖וֹ בְּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יְדֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: kiy yada'tiy acharey mvotiy kiy-hash'chet tash'chitvn v'sar'tem min-haderekh' asher tziviytiy et'khem v'karat et'khem hara'ah b'achariyt hayamiym kiy-ta'asv et-hara' b'eyney y'hvah l'hakh'iysvo b'ma'aseh y'deykhem
translation: For I know that, when I am dead, you will act wickedly and turn away from the path that I enjoined upon you, and that in time to come misfortune will befall you for having done evil in the sight of the L<small>ORD</small> and vexed Him by your deeds.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֗ה בְּאָזְנֵי֙ כָּל־קְהַ֣ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַשִּׁירָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את עַ֖ד תֻּמָּֽם׃ (פ)
transliteration: vay'daber mosheh b'az'ney kal-k'hal yis'rael et-div'rey hashiyrah hazot 'ad tumam (f)
translation: Then Moses recited the words of this poem to the very end, in the hearing of the whole congregation of Israel:

hebrew: הַאֲזִ֥ינוּ הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וַאֲדַבֵּ֑רָה וְתִשְׁמַ֥ע הָאָ֖רֶץ אִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃
transliteration: haaziynv hashamayim vaadaberah v'tish'ma' haaretz im'rey-fiy
translation:
Give ear, O heavens, let me speak;
Let the earth hear the words I utter!

hebrew: יַעֲרֹ֤ף כַּמָּטָר֙ לִקְחִ֔י תִּזַּ֥ל כַּטַּ֖ל אִמְרָתִ֑י כִּשְׂעִירִ֣ם עֲלֵי־דֶ֔שֶׁא וְכִרְבִיבִ֖ים עֲלֵי־עֵֽשֶׂב׃
transliteration: ya'arof kamatar lik'chiy tizal katal im'ratiy kis'iyrim 'aley-deshe v'khir'viyviym 'aley-'esev
translation:
May my discourse come down as the rain,
My speech distill as the dew,
Like showers on young growth,
Like droplets on the grass.aI.e., may my words be received eagerly; cf. Job 29.22–23.

hebrew: כִּ֛י שֵׁ֥ם יְהוָ֖ה אֶקְרָ֑א הָב֥וּ גֹ֖דֶל לֵאלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
transliteration: kiy shem y'hvah ek'ra havv godel leloheynv
translation:
For the name of the LORD I proclaim;
Give glory to our God!

hebrew: הַצּוּר֙ תָּמִ֣ים פָּעֳל֔וֹ כִּ֥י כָל־דְּרָכָ֖יו מִשְׁפָּ֑ט אֵ֤ל אֱמוּנָה֙ וְאֵ֣ין עָ֔וֶל צַדִּ֥יק וְיָשָׁ֖ר הֽוּא׃
transliteration: hatzvr tamiym pa'olvo kiy khal-d'rakhayv mish'pat el emvnah v'eyn 'avel tzadiyk v'yashar hv
translation:
The Rock!—His deeds are perfect,
Yea, all His ways are just;
A faithful God, never false,
True and upright is He.

hebrew: שִׁחֵ֥ת ל֛וֹ לֹ֖א בָּנָ֣יו מוּמָ֑ם דּ֥וֹר עִקֵּ֖שׁ וּפְתַלְתֹּֽל׃
transliteration: shichet lvo lo banayv mvmam dvor 'ikesh vf'tal'tol
translation:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Children unworthy of Him—
That crooked, perverse generation—
Their baseness has played Him false.

hebrew: הֲ־לַיְהוָה֙ תִּגְמְלוּ־זֹ֔את עַ֥ם נָבָ֖ל וְלֹ֣א חָכָ֑ם הֲלוֹא־הוּא֙ אָבִ֣יךָ קָּנֶ֔ךָ ה֥וּא עָֽשְׂךָ֖ וַֽיְכֹנְנֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: ha-lay'hvah tig'm'lv-zot 'am naval v'lo chakham halvo-hv aviykha kanekha hv 'as'kha vay'khon'nekha
translation:
Do you thus requite the LORD,
O dull and witless people?
Is not He the Father who created you—
Fashioned you and made you endure!

hebrew: זְכֹר֙ יְמ֣וֹת עוֹלָ֔ם בִּ֖ינוּ שְׁנ֣וֹת דּוֹר־וָד֑וֹר שְׁאַ֤ל אָבִ֙יךָ֙ וְיַגֵּ֔דְךָ זְקֵנֶ֖יךָ וְיֹ֥אמְרוּ לָֽךְ׃
transliteration: z'khor y'mvot 'volam biynv sh'nvot dvor-vadvor sh'al aviykha v'yaged'kha z'keneykha v'yom'rv lakh'
translation:
Remember the days of old,
Consider the years of ages past;
Ask your father, he will inform you,
Your elders, they will tell you:

hebrew: בְּהַנְחֵ֤ל עֶלְיוֹן֙ גּוֹיִ֔ם בְּהַפְרִיד֖וֹ בְּנֵ֣י אָדָ֑ם יַצֵּב֙ גְּבֻלֹ֣ת עַמִּ֔ים לְמִסְפַּ֖ר בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: b'han'chel 'el'yvon gvoyim b'haf'riydvo b'ney adam yatzev g'vulot 'amiym l'mis'par b'ney yis'rael
translation:
When the Most High gave nations their homes
And set the divisions of man,
He fixed the boundaries of peoples
In relation to Israel’s numbers.

hebrew: כִּ֛י חֵ֥לֶק יְהֹוָ֖ה עַמּ֑וֹ יַעֲקֹ֖ב חֶ֥בֶל נַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: kiy chelek y'hovah 'amvo ya'akov chevel nachalatvo
translation:
For the LORD’s portion is His people,
Jacob His own allotment.

hebrew: יִמְצָאֵ֙הוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִדְבָּ֔ר וּבְתֹ֖הוּ יְלֵ֣ל יְשִׁמֹ֑ן יְסֹֽבְבֶ֙נְהוּ֙ יְב֣וֹנְנֵ֔הוּ יִצְּרֶ֖נְהוּ כְּאִישׁ֥וֹן עֵינֽוֹ׃
transliteration: yim'tzaehv b'eretz mid'bar vv'tohv y'lel y'shimon y'sov'ven'hv y'vvon'nehv yitz'ren'hv k'iyshvon 'eynvo
translation:
He found him in a desert region,
In an empty howling waste.
He engirded him, watched over him,
Guarded him as the pupil of His eye.

hebrew: כְּנֶ֙שֶׁר֙ יָעִ֣יר קִנּ֔וֹ עַל־גּוֹזָלָ֖יו יְרַחֵ֑ף יִפְרֹ֤שׂ כְּנָפָיו֙ יִקָּחֵ֔הוּ יִשָּׂאֵ֖הוּ עַל־אֶבְרָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: k'nesher ya'iyr kinvo 'al-gvozalayv y'rachef yif'ros k'nafayv yikachehv yisaehv 'al-ev'ratvo
translation:
Like an eagle who rouses his nestlings,
Gliding down to his young,
So did He spread His wings and take him,
Bear him along on His pinions;

hebrew: יְהוָ֖ה בָּדָ֣ד יַנְחֶ֑נּוּ וְאֵ֥ין עִמּ֖וֹ אֵ֥ל נֵכָֽר׃
transliteration: y'hvah badad yan'chenv v'eyn 'imvo el nekhar
translation:
The LORD alone did guide him,
No alien god at His side.

hebrew: יַרְכִּבֵ֙הוּ֙ עַל־במותי [בָּ֣מֳתֵי] אָ֔רֶץ וַיֹּאכַ֖ל תְּנוּבֹ֣ת שָׂדָ֑י וַיֵּנִקֵ֤הֽוּ דְבַשׁ֙ מִסֶּ֔לַע וְשֶׁ֖מֶן מֵחַלְמִ֥ישׁ צֽוּר׃
transliteration: yar'kivehv 'al-vmvty [bamotey] aretz vayokhal t'nvvot saday vayenikehv d'vash misela' v'shemen mechal'miysh tzvr
translation:
He set him atop the highlands,
To feast on the yield of the earth;
He fed him honey from the crag,
And oil from the flinty rock,

hebrew: חֶמְאַ֨ת בָּקָ֜ר וַחֲלֵ֣ב צֹ֗אן עִם־חֵ֨לֶב כָּרִ֜ים וְאֵילִ֤ים בְּנֵֽי־בָשָׁן֙ וְעַתּוּדִ֔ים עִם־חֵ֖לֶב כִּלְי֣וֹת חִטָּ֑ה וְדַם־עֵנָ֖ב תִּשְׁתֶּה־חָֽמֶר׃
transliteration: chem'at bakar vachalev tzon 'im-chelev kariym v'eyliym b'ney-vashan v'atvdiym 'im-chelev kil'yvot chitah v'dam-'enav tish'teh-chamer
translation:
Curd of kine and milk of flocks;
With the bestcLit. “fat.” of lambs,
And rams of Bashan, and he-goats;
With the d“kidney fat of.”very finest-d wheat—
And foaming grape-blood was your drink.

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ן יְשֻׁרוּן֙ וַיִּבְעָ֔ט שָׁמַ֖נְתָּ עָבִ֣יתָ כָּשִׂ֑יתָ וַיִּטֹּשׁ֙ אֱל֣וֹהַ עָשָׂ֔הוּ וַיְנַבֵּ֖ל צ֥וּר יְשֻׁעָתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vayish'man y'shurvn vayiv'at shaman'ta 'aviyta kasiyta vayitosh elvoha 'asahv vay'nabel tzvr y'shu'atvo
translation:
So Jeshurun grew fat and kicked—
You grew fat and gross and coarseeMeaning of Heb. uncertain.—
He forsook the God who made him
And spurned the Rock of his support.

hebrew: יַקְנִאֻ֖הוּ בְּזָרִ֑ים בְּתוֹעֵבֹ֖ת יַכְעִיסֻֽהוּ׃
transliteration: yak'niuhv b'zariym b'tvo'evot yakh'iysuhv
translation:
They incensed Him with alien things,
Vexed Him with abominations.

hebrew: יִזְבְּח֗וּ לַשֵּׁדִים֙ לֹ֣א אֱלֹ֔הַ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֹ֣א יְדָע֑וּם חֲדָשִׁים֙ מִקָּרֹ֣ב בָּ֔אוּ לֹ֥א שְׂעָר֖וּם אֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
transliteration: yiz'b'chv lashediym lo eloha elohiym lo y'da'vm chadashiym mikarov bav lo s'arvm avoteykhem
translation:
They sacrificed to demons, no-gods,
Gods they had never known,
New ones, who came but lately,
fMeaning of Heb. uncertain; Arabic sha‘ara suggests the rendering “Whom your fathers did not know.”Who stirred not your fathers’ fears.-f

hebrew: צ֥וּר יְלָדְךָ֖ תֶּ֑שִׁי וַתִּשְׁכַּ֖ח אֵ֥ל מְחֹלְלֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: tzvr y'lad'kha teshiy vatish'kach el m'chol'lekha
translation:
You neglected the Rock that begot you,
Forgot the God who brought you forth.

hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא יְהוָ֖ה וַיִּנְאָ֑ץ מִכַּ֥עַס בָּנָ֖יו וּבְנֹתָֽיו׃
transliteration: vayar' y'hvah vayin'atz mika'as banayv vv'notayv
translation:
The LORD saw and was vexed
And spurned His sons and His daughters.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אַסְתִּ֤ירָה פָנַי֙ מֵהֶ֔ם אֶרְאֶ֖ה מָ֣ה אַחֲרִיתָ֑ם כִּ֣י ד֤וֹר תַּהְפֻּכֹת֙ הֵ֔מָּה בָּנִ֖ים לֹא־אֵמֻ֥ן בָּֽם׃
transliteration: vayomer as'tiyrah fanay mehem er'eh mah achariytam kiy dvor tah'pukhot hemah baniym lo-emun bam
translation:
He said:
I will hide My countenance from them,
And see how they fare in the end.
For they are a treacherous breed,
Children with no loyalty in them.

hebrew: הֵ֚ם קִנְא֣וּנִי בְלֹא־אֵ֔ל כִּעֲס֖וּנִי בְּהַבְלֵיהֶ֑ם וַאֲנִי֙ אַקְנִיאֵ֣ם בְּלֹא־עָ֔ם בְּג֥וֹי נָבָ֖ל אַכְעִיסֵֽם׃
transliteration: hem kin'vniy v'lo-el ki'asvniy b'hav'leyhem vaaniy ak'niyem b'lo-'am b'gvoy naval akh'iysem
translation:
They incensed Me with no-gods,
Vexed Me with their futilities;gI.e., idols.
I’ll incense them with a no-folk,
Vex them with a nation of fools.

hebrew: כִּי־אֵשׁ֙ קָדְחָ֣ה בְאַפִּ֔י וַתִּיקַ֖ד עַד־שְׁא֣וֹל תַּחְתִּ֑ית וַתֹּ֤אכַל אֶ֙רֶץ֙ וִֽיבֻלָ֔הּ וַתְּלַהֵ֖ט מוֹסְדֵ֥י הָרִֽים׃
transliteration: kiy-esh kad'chah v'apiy vatiykad 'ad-sh'vol tach'tiyt vatokhal eretz viyvulah vat'lahet mvos'dey hariym
translation:
For a fire has flared in My wrath
And burned to the bottom of Sheol,
Has consumed the earth and its increase,
Eaten down to the base of the hills.

hebrew: אַסְפֶּ֥ה עָלֵ֖ימוֹ רָע֑וֹת חִצַּ֖י אֲכַלֶּה־בָּֽם׃
transliteration: as'peh 'aleymvo ra'vot chitzay akhaleh-bam
translation:
I will sweepeMeaning of Heb. uncertain. misfortunes on them,
Use up My arrows on them:

hebrew: מְזֵ֥י רָעָ֛ב וּלְחֻ֥מֵי רֶ֖שֶׁף וְקֶ֣טֶב מְרִירִ֑י וְשֶׁן־בְּהֵמוֹת֙ אֲשַׁלַּח־בָּ֔ם עִם־חֲמַ֖ת זֹחֲלֵ֥י עָפָֽר׃
transliteration: m'zey ra'av vl'chumey reshef v'ketev m'riyriy v'shen-b'hemvot ashalach-bam 'im-chamat zochaley 'afar
translation:
Wasting famine, ravaging plague,
Deadly pestilence, and fanged beasts
Will I let loose against them,
With venomous creepers in dust.

hebrew: מִחוּץ֙ תְּשַׁכֶּל־חֶ֔רֶב וּמֵחֲדָרִ֖ים אֵימָ֑ה גַּם־בָּחוּר֙ גַּם־בְּתוּלָ֔ה יוֹנֵ֖ק עִם־אִ֥ישׁ שֵׂיבָֽה׃
transliteration: michvtz t'shakel-cherev vmechadariym eymah gam-bachvr gam-b'tvlah yvonek 'im-iysh seyvah
translation:
The sword shall deal death without,
As shall the terror within,
To youth and maiden alike,
The suckling as well as the aged.

hebrew: אָמַ֖רְתִּי אַפְאֵיהֶ֑ם אַשְׁבִּ֥יתָה מֵאֱנ֖וֹשׁ זִכְרָֽם׃
transliteration: amar'tiy af'eyhem ash'biytah meenvosh zikh'ram
translation:
hLit. “I said, I will reduce…”; meaning of Heb. ’aph’ehem uncertain.I might have reduced them to naught,-h
Made their memory cease among men,

hebrew: לוּלֵ֗י כַּ֤עַס אוֹיֵב֙ אָג֔וּר פֶּֽן־יְנַכְּר֖וּ צָרֵ֑ימוֹ פֶּן־יֹֽאמְרוּ֙ יָדֵ֣ינוּ רָ֔מָה וְלֹ֥א יְהוָ֖ה פָּעַ֥ל כָּל־זֹֽאת׃
transliteration: lvley ka'as voyev agvr pen-y'nak'rv tzareymvo pen-yom'rv yadeynv ramah v'lo y'hvah pa'al kal-zot
translation:
But for fear of the taunts of the foe,
Their enemies who might misjudge
And say, “Our own hand has prevailed;
None of this was wrought by the LORD!”

hebrew: כִּי־ג֛וֹי אֹבַ֥ד עֵצ֖וֹת הֵ֑מָּה וְאֵ֥ין בָּהֶ֖ם תְּבוּנָֽה׃
transliteration: kiy-gvoy ovad 'etzvot hemah v'eyn bahem t'vvnah
translation:
iHere, apparently, Moses is the speaker; God resumes in v. 32.For they are a folk void of sense,
Lacking in all discernment.

hebrew: ל֥וּ חָכְמ֖וּ יַשְׂכִּ֣ילוּ זֹ֑את יָבִ֖ינוּ לְאַחֲרִיתָֽם׃
transliteration: lv chakh'mv yas'kiylv zot yaviynv l'achariytam
translation:
Were they wise, they would think upon this,
Gain insight into their future:

hebrew: אֵיכָ֞ה יִרְדֹּ֤ף אֶחָד֙ אֶ֔לֶף וּשְׁנַ֖יִם יָנִ֣יסוּ רְבָבָ֑ה אִם־לֹא֙ כִּי־צוּרָ֣ם מְכָרָ֔ם וַֽיהוָ֖ה הִסְגִּירָֽם׃
transliteration: eykhah yir'dof echad elef vsh'nayim yaniysv r'vavah im-lo kiy-tzvram m'kharam vayhvah his'giyram
translation:
“How could one have routed a thousand,
Or two put ten thousand to flight,
Unless their Rock had sold them,
The LORD had given them up?”

hebrew: כִּ֛י לֹ֥א כְצוּרֵ֖נוּ צוּרָ֑ם וְאֹיְבֵ֖ינוּ פְּלִילִֽים׃
transliteration: kiy lo kh'tzvrenv tzvram v'oy'veynv p'liyliym
translation:
For their rock is not like our Rock,
jI.e., as everyone must admit.In our enemies’ ownkFor Heb. pelilim see Exod. 21.22; cf. Gen. 48.11. estimation.-j

hebrew: כִּֽי־מִגֶּ֤פֶן סְדֹם֙ גַּפְנָ֔ם וּמִשַּׁדְמֹ֖ת עֲמֹרָ֑ה עֲנָבֵ֙מוֹ֙ עִנְּבֵי־ר֔וֹשׁ אַשְׁכְּלֹ֥ת מְרֹרֹ֖ת לָֽמוֹ׃
transliteration: kiy-migefen s'dom gaf'nam vmishad'mot 'amorah 'anavemvo 'in'vey-rvosh ash'k'lot m'rorot lamvo
translation:
Ah! The vine for them is from Sodom,
From the vineyards of Gomorrah;
The grapes for them are poison,
A bitter growth their clusters.

hebrew: חֲמַ֥ת תַּנִּינִ֖ם יֵינָ֑ם וְרֹ֥אשׁ פְּתָנִ֖ים אַכְזָֽר׃
transliteration: chamat taniynim yeynam v'rosh p'taniym akh'zar
translation:
Their wine is the venom of asps,
The pitiless poison of vipers.

hebrew: הֲלֹא־ה֖וּא כָּמֻ֣ס עִמָּדִ֑י חָתֻ֖ם בְּאוֹצְרֹתָֽי׃
transliteration: halo-hv kamus 'imadiy chatum b'votz'rotay
translation:
Lo, I have it all put away,
Sealed up in My storehouses,

hebrew: לִ֤י נָקָם֙ וְשִׁלֵּ֔ם לְעֵ֖ת תָּמ֣וּט רַגְלָ֑ם כִּ֤י קָרוֹב֙ י֣וֹם אֵידָ֔ם וְחָ֖שׁ עֲתִדֹ֥ת לָֽמוֹ׃
transliteration: liy nakam v'shilem l'et tamvt rag'lam kiy karvov yvom eydam v'chash 'atidot lamvo
translation:
To be My vengeance and recompense,
At the time that their foot falters.
Yea, their day of disaster is near,
And destiny rushes upon them.

hebrew: כִּֽי־יָדִ֤ין יְהוָה֙ עַמּ֔וֹ וְעַל־עֲבָדָ֖יו יִתְנֶחָ֑ם כִּ֤י יִרְאֶה֙ כִּי־אָ֣זְלַת יָ֔ד וְאֶ֖פֶס עָצ֥וּר וְעָזֽוּב׃
transliteration: kiy-yadiyn y'hvah 'amvo v'al-'avadayv yit'necham kiy yir'eh kiy-az'lat yad v'efes 'atzvr v'azvv
translation:
For the LORD will vindicate His people
lCf. Isa. 1.24. Others “and repent Himself concerning.”And take revenge for-l His servants,
When He sees that their might is gone,
And neither bond nor free is left.

hebrew: וְאָמַ֖ר אֵ֣י אֱלֹהֵ֑ימוֹ צ֖וּר חָסָ֥יוּ בֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'amar ey eloheymvo tzvr chasayv vvo
translation:
He will say: Where are their gods,
The rock in whom they sought refuge,

hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר חֵ֤לֶב זְבָחֵ֙ימוֹ֙ יֹאכֵ֔לוּ יִשְׁתּ֖וּ יֵ֣ין נְסִיכָ֑ם יָק֙וּמוּ֙ וְיַעְזְרֻכֶ֔ם יְהִ֥י עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם סִתְרָֽה׃
transliteration: asher chelev z'vacheymvo yokhelv yish'tv yeyn n'siykham yakvmv v'ya'z'rukhem y'hiy 'aleykhem sit'rah
translation:
Who ate the fat of their offerings
And drank their libation wine?
Let them rise up to your help,
And let them be a shield unto you!

hebrew: רְא֣וּ ׀ עַתָּ֗ה כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י אֲנִי֙ ה֔וּא וְאֵ֥ין אֱלֹהִ֖ים עִמָּדִ֑י אֲנִ֧י אָמִ֣ית וַאֲחַיֶּ֗ה מָחַ֙צְתִּי֙ וַאֲנִ֣י אֶרְפָּ֔א וְאֵ֥ין מִיָּדִ֖י מַצִּֽיל׃
transliteration: r'v  'atah kiy aniy aniy hv v'eyn elohiym 'imadiy aniy amiyt vaachayeh machatz'tiy vaaniy er'pa v'eyn miyadiy matziyl
translation:
See, then, that I, I am He;
There is no god beside Me.
I deal death and give life;
I wounded and I will heal:
None can deliver from My hand.

hebrew: כִּֽי־אֶשָּׂ֥א אֶל־שָׁמַ֖יִם יָדִ֑י וְאָמַ֕רְתִּי חַ֥י אָנֹכִ֖י לְעֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: kiy-esa el-shamayim yadiy v'amar'tiy chay anokhiy l'olam
translation:
Lo, I raise My hand to heaven
And say: As I live forever,

hebrew: אִם־שַׁנּוֹתִי֙ בְּרַ֣ק חַרְבִּ֔י וְתֹאחֵ֥ז בְּמִשְׁפָּ֖ט יָדִ֑י אָשִׁ֤יב נָקָם֙ לְצָרָ֔י וְלִמְשַׂנְאַ֖י אֲשַׁלֵּֽם׃
transliteration: im-shanvotiy b'rak char'biy v'tochez b'mish'pat yadiy ashiyv nakam l'tzaray v'lim'san'ay ashalem
translation:
When I whet My flashing blade
And My hand lays hold on judgment,
Vengeance will I wreak on My foes,
Will I deal to those who reject Me.

hebrew: אַשְׁכִּ֤יר חִצַּי֙ מִדָּ֔ם וְחַרְבִּ֖י תֹּאכַ֣ל בָּשָׂ֑ר מִדַּ֤ם חָלָל֙ וְשִׁבְיָ֔ה מֵרֹ֖אשׁ פַּרְע֥וֹת אוֹיֵֽב׃
transliteration: ash'kiyr chitzay midam v'char'biy tokhal basar midam chalal v'shiv'yah merosh par'vot voyev
translation:
I will make My arrows drunk with blood—
As My sword devours flesh—
Blood of the slain and the captive
From the long-haired enemy chiefs.

hebrew: הַרְנִ֤ינוּ גוֹיִם֙ עַמּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י דַם־עֲבָדָ֖יו יִקּ֑וֹם וְנָקָם֙ יָשִׁ֣יב לְצָרָ֔יו וְכִפֶּ֥ר אַדְמָת֖וֹ עַמּֽוֹ׃ (פ)
transliteration: har'niynv gvoyim 'amvo kiy dam-'avadayv yikvom v'nakam yashiyv l'tzarayv v'khiper ad'matvo 'amvo (f)
translation:
O nations, acclaim His people!
For He’ll avenge the blood of His servants,
Wreak vengeance on His foes,
And cleanse the land of His people.mCf. Num. 35.33. Meaning of Heb. uncertain; Ugaritic ’udm‘t “tears” suggests the rendering “And wipe away His people’s tears.” Cf. Isa. 25.8.

hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַשִּׁירָֽה־הַזֹּ֖את בְּאָזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם ה֖וּא וְהוֹשֵׁ֥עַ בִּן־נֽוּן׃
transliteration: vayavo mosheh vay'daber et-kal-div'rey hashiyrah-hazot b'az'ney ha'am hv v'hvoshe'a bin-nvn
translation: Moses came, together with Hosea son of Nun, and recited all the words of this poem in the hearing of the people.

hebrew: וַיְכַ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֗ה לְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה אֶל־כָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vay'khal mosheh l'daber et-kal-had'variym haeleh el-kal-yis'rael
translation: And when Moses finished reciting all these words to all Israel,

hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ שִׂ֣ימוּ לְבַבְכֶ֔ם לְכָל־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מֵעִ֥יד בָּכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר תְּצַוֻּם֙ אֶת־בְּנֵיכֶ֔ם לִשְׁמֹ֣ר לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֶת־כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֖י הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
transliteration: vayomer alehem siymv l'vav'khem l'khal-had'variym asher anokhiy me'iyd bakhem hayvom asher t'tzaum et-b'neykhem lish'mor la'asvot et-kal-div'rey hatvorah hazot
translation: he said to them: Take to heart all the words with which I have warned you this day. Enjoin them upon your children, that they may observe faithfully all the terms of this Teaching.

hebrew: כִּ֠י לֹֽא־דָבָ֨ר רֵ֥ק הוּא֙ מִכֶּ֔ם כִּי־ה֖וּא חַיֵּיכֶ֑ם וּבַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה תַּאֲרִ֤יכוּ יָמִים֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֜ם עֹבְרִ֧ים אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֛ן שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃ (פ)
transliteration: kiy lo-davar rek hv mikem kiy-hv chayeykhem vvadavar hazeh taariykhv yamiym 'al-haadamah asher atem 'ov'riym et-hayar'den shamah l'rish'tah (f)
translation: For this is not a trifling thing for you: it is your very life; through it you shall long endure on the land that you are to possess upon crossing the Jordan.

hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בְּעֶ֛צֶם הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
transliteration: vay'daber y'hvah el-mosheh b'etzem hayvom hazeh lemor
translation: That very day the L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Moses:

hebrew: עֲלֵ֡ה אֶל־הַר֩ הָעֲבָרִ֨ים הַזֶּ֜ה הַר־נְב֗וֹ אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֣י יְרֵח֑וֹ וּרְאֵה֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲנִ֥י נֹתֵ֛ן לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לַאֲחֻזָּֽה׃
transliteration: 'aleh el-har ha'avariym hazeh har-n'vvo asher b'eretz mvoav asher 'al-p'ney y'rechvo vr'eh et-eretz k'na'an asher aniy noten liv'ney yis'rael laachuzah
translation: Ascend these heights of Abarim to Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab facing Jericho, and view the land of Canaan, which I am giving the Israelites as their holding.

hebrew: וּמֻ֗ת בָּהָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ עֹלֶ֣ה שָׁ֔מָּה וְהֵאָסֵ֖ף אֶל־עַמֶּ֑יךָ כַּֽאֲשֶׁר־מֵ֞ת אַהֲרֹ֤ן אָחִ֙יךָ֙ בְּהֹ֣ר הָהָ֔ר וַיֵּאָ֖סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
transliteration: vmut bahar asher atah 'oleh shamah v'heasef el-'ameykha kaasher-met aharon achiykha b'hor hahar vayeasef el-'amayv
translation: You shall die on the mountain that you are about to ascend, and shall be gathered to your kin, as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his kin;

hebrew: עַל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר מְעַלְתֶּ֜ם בִּ֗י בְּתוֹךְ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּמֵֽי־מְרִיבַ֥ת קָדֵ֖שׁ מִדְבַּר־צִ֑ן עַ֣ל אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־קִדַּשְׁתֶּם֙ אוֹתִ֔י בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: 'al asher m'al'tem biy b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael b'mey-m'riyvat kadesh mid'bar-tzin 'al asher lo-kidash'tem votiy b'tvokh' b'ney yis'rael
translation: for you both broke faith with Me among the Israelite people, at the waters of Meribath-kadesh in the wilderness of Zin, by failing to uphold My sanctity among the Israelite people.

hebrew: כִּ֥י מִנֶּ֖גֶד תִּרְאֶ֣ה אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְשָׁ֙מָּה֙ לֹ֣א תָב֔וֹא אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י נֹתֵ֖ן לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (פ)
transliteration: kiy mineged tir'eh et-haaretz v'shamah lo tavvo el-haaretz asher-aniy noten liv'ney yis'rael (f)
translation: You may view the land from a distance, but you shall not enter it—the land that I am giving to the Israelite people.

hebrew: וְזֹ֣את הַבְּרָכָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר בֵּרַ֥ךְ מֹשֶׁ֛ה אִ֥ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לִפְנֵ֖י מוֹתֽוֹ׃
transliteration: v'zot hab'rakhah asher berakh' mosheh iysh haelohiym et-b'ney yis'rael lif'ney mvotvo
translation: This is the blessing with which Moses, the man of God, bade the Israelites farewell before he died.

hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֗ר יְהוָ֞ה מִסִּינַ֥י בָּא֙ וְזָרַ֤ח מִשֵּׂעִיר֙ לָ֔מוֹ הוֹפִ֙יעַ֙ מֵהַ֣ר פָּארָ֔ן וְאָתָ֖ה מֵרִבְבֹ֣ת קֹ֑דֶשׁ מִֽימִינ֕וֹ אשדת [אֵ֥שׁ] [דָּ֖ת] לָֽמוֹ׃
transliteration: vayomar y'hvah misiynay ba v'zarach mise'iyr lamvo hvofiy'a mehar paran v'atah meriv'vot kodesh miymiynvo shdt [esh] [dat] lamvo
translation:
He said:
The LORD came from Sinai;
He shone upon them from Seir;
He appeared from Mount Paran,
And approached from Ribeboth-kodesh,aCf. Meribath-kadesh, 32.51.
Lightning flashing at them from His right.bMeaning of Heb. mimino ’eshdath uncertain, perhaps a place name.

hebrew: אַ֚ף חֹבֵ֣ב עַמִּ֔ים כָּל־קְדֹשָׁ֖יו בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וְהֵם֙ תֻּכּ֣וּ לְרַגְלֶ֔ךָ יִשָּׂ֖א מִדַּבְּרֹתֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: af chovev 'amiym kal-k'doshayv b'yadekha v'hem tukv l'rag'lekha yisa midab'roteykha
translation:
cThe meaning of vv. 3–5 is uncertain. An alternative rendering, with v. 3 apostrophizing Moses, is: 3Then were, O lover of the people, / All His worshipers in your care; / They followed your lead, / Accepted your precepts. / 4Moses charged us with the Teaching / As the heritage of the congregation of Jacob. / 5Thus was he king in Jeshurun…Lover, indeed, of the people,
Their hallowed are all in Your hand.
They followed in Your steps,
Accepting Your pronouncements,

hebrew: תּוֹרָ֥ה צִוָּה־לָ֖נוּ מֹשֶׁ֑ה מוֹרָשָׁ֖ה קְהִלַּ֥ת יַעֲקֹֽב׃
transliteration: tvorah tzivah-lanv mosheh mvorashah k'hilat ya'akov
translation:
When Moses charged us with the Teaching
As the heritage of the congregation of Jacob.

hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י בִישֻׁר֖וּן מֶ֑לֶךְ בְּהִתְאַסֵּף֙ רָ֣אשֵׁי עָ֔ם יַ֖חַד שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vay'hiy viyshurvn melekh' b'hit'asef rashey 'am yachad shiv'tey yis'rael
translation:
Then He became King in Jeshurun,
When the heads of the people assembled,
The tribes of Israel together.

hebrew: יְחִ֥י רְאוּבֵ֖ן וְאַל־יָמֹ֑ת וִיהִ֥י מְתָ֖יו מִסְפָּֽר׃ (ס)
transliteration: y'chiy r'vven v'al-yamot viyhiy m'tayv mis'par (s)
translation:
May Reuben live and not die,
Though few be his numbers.

hebrew: וְזֹ֣את לִֽיהוּדָה֮ וַיֹּאמַר֒ שְׁמַ֤ע יְהוָה֙ ק֣וֹל יְהוּדָ֔ה וְאֶל־עַמּ֖וֹ תְּבִיאֶ֑נּוּ יָדָיו֙ רָ֣ב ל֔וֹ וְעֵ֥זֶר מִצָּרָ֖יו תִּהְיֶֽה׃ (ס)
transliteration: v'zot liyhvdah vayomar sh'ma' y'hvah kvol y'hvdah v'el-'amvo t'viyenv yadayv rav lvo v'ezer mitzarayv tih'yeh (s)
translation:
And this he said of Judah:
Hear, O LORD, the voice of Judah
And restore him to his people.
dBetter (vocalizing rab with pathaḥ)“Make his hands strong for him.” Cf. rabbeh, Judg. 9.29.Though his own hands strive for him,-d
Help him against his foes.

hebrew: וּלְלֵוִ֣י אָמַ֔ר תֻּמֶּ֥יךָ וְאוּרֶ֖יךָ לְאִ֣ישׁ חֲסִידֶ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נִסִּיתוֹ֙ בְּמַסָּ֔ה תְּרִיבֵ֖הוּ עַל־מֵ֥י מְרִיבָֽה׃
transliteration: vl'leviy amar tumeykha v'vreykha l'iysh chasiydekha asher nisiytvo b'masah t'riyvehv 'al-mey m'riyvah
translation:
And of Levi he said:
Let Your Thummim and Urim
Be with Your faithful one,
Whom You tested at Massah,
Challenged at the waters of Meribah;

hebrew: הָאֹמֵ֞ר לְאָבִ֤יו וּלְאִמּוֹ֙ לֹ֣א רְאִיתִ֔יו וְאֶת־אֶחָיו֙ לֹ֣א הִכִּ֔יר וְאֶת־בנו [בָּנָ֖יו] לֹ֣א יָדָ֑ע כִּ֤י שָֽׁמְרוּ֙ אִמְרָתֶ֔ךָ וּבְרִֽיתְךָ֖ יִנְצֹֽרוּ׃
transliteration: haomer l'aviyv vl'imvo lo r'iytiyv v'et-echayv lo hikiyr v'et-vnv [banayv] lo yada' kiy sham'rv im'ratekha vv'riyt'kha yin'tzorv
translation:
Who said of his father and mother,
“I consider them not.”
His brothers he disregarded,
Ignored his own children.
Your precepts alone they observed,
And kept Your covenant.

hebrew: יוֹר֤וּ מִשְׁפָּטֶ֙יךָ֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב וְתוֹרָתְךָ֖ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל יָשִׂ֤ימוּ קְטוֹרָה֙ בְּאַפֶּ֔ךָ וְכָלִ֖יל עַֽל־מִזְבְּחֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: yvorv mish'pateykha l'ya'akov v'tvorat'kha l'yis'rael yasiymv k'tvorah b'apekha v'khaliyl 'al-miz'b'chekha
translation:
They shall teach Your laws to Jacob
And Your instructions to Israel.
eLit. “They shall place incense in Your nostril.”They shall offer You incense to savor-e
And whole-offerings on Your altar.

hebrew: בָּרֵ֤ךְ יְהוָה֙ חֵיל֔וֹ וּפֹ֥עַל יָדָ֖יו תִּרְצֶ֑ה מְחַ֨ץ מָתְנַ֧יִם קָמָ֛יו וּמְשַׂנְאָ֖יו מִן־יְקוּמֽוּן׃ (ס)
transliteration: barekh' y'hvah cheylvo vfo'al yadayv tir'tzeh m'chatz mat'nayim kamayv vm'san'ayv min-y'kvmvn (s)
translation:
Bless, O LORD, his substance,
And favor his undertakings.
Smite the loins of his foes;
Let his enemies rise no more.

hebrew: לְבִנְיָמִ֣ן אָמַ֔ר יְדִ֣יד יְהֹוָ֔ה יִשְׁכֹּ֥ן לָבֶ֖טַח עָלָ֑יו חֹפֵ֤ף עָלָיו֙ כָּל־הַיּ֔וֹם וּבֵ֥ין כְּתֵיפָ֖יו שָׁכֵֽן׃ (ס)
transliteration: l'vin'yamin amar y'diyd y'hovah yish'kon lavetach 'alayv chofef 'alayv kal-hayvom vveyn k'teyfayv shakhen (s)
translation:
Of Benjamin he said:
Beloved of the LORD,
He rests securely beside Him;
Ever does He protect him,
fOr “He dwells amid his slopes.”As he rests between His shoulders.-f

hebrew: וּלְיוֹסֵ֣ף אָמַ֔ר מְבֹרֶ֥כֶת יְהֹוָ֖ה אַרְצ֑וֹ מִמֶּ֤גֶד שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ מִטָּ֔ל וּמִתְּה֖וֹם רֹבֶ֥צֶת תָּֽחַת׃
transliteration: vl'yvosef amar m'vorekhet y'hovah ar'tzvo mimeged shamayim mital vmit'hvom rovetzet tachat
translation:
And of Joseph he said:
Blessed of the LORD be his land
With the bounty of dewgTargum Onkelos and two Hebrew manuscripts read: “With the bounty of heaven above” (me‘al for mit·t·al, cf. Gen. 49.25). from heaven,
And of the deep that couches below;

hebrew: וּמִמֶּ֖גֶד תְּבוּאֹ֣ת שָׁ֑מֶשׁ וּמִמֶּ֖גֶד גֶּ֥רֶשׁ יְרָחִֽים׃
transliteration: vmimeged t'vvot shamesh vmimeged geresh y'rachiym
translation:
With the bounteous yield of the sun,
And the bounteous crop of the moons;

hebrew: וּמֵרֹ֖אשׁ הַרְרֵי־קֶ֑דֶם וּמִמֶּ֖גֶד גִּבְע֥וֹת עוֹלָֽם׃
transliteration: vmerosh har'rey-kedem vmimeged giv'vot 'volam
translation:
With the best from the ancient mountains,
And the bounty of hills immemorial;

hebrew: וּמִמֶּ֗גֶד אֶ֚רֶץ וּמְלֹאָ֔הּ וּרְצ֥וֹן שֹׁכְנִ֖י סְנֶ֑ה תָּב֙וֹאתָה֙ לְרֹ֣אשׁ יוֹסֵ֔ף וּלְקָדְקֹ֖ד נְזִ֥יר אֶחָֽיו׃
transliteration: vmimeged eretz vm'loah vr'tzvon shokh'niy s'neh tavvotah l'rosh yvosef vl'kad'kod n'ziyr echayv
translation:
With the bounty of earth and its fullness,
And the favor of the PresencehLit. “Dweller”; cf. Exod. 3.1 ff. in the Bush.
May these rest on the head of Joseph,
On the crown of the elect of his brothers.

hebrew: בְּכ֨וֹר שׁוֹר֜וֹ הָדָ֣ר ל֗וֹ וְקַרְנֵ֤י רְאֵם֙ קַרְנָ֔יו בָּהֶ֗ם עַמִּ֛ים יְנַגַּ֥ח יַחְדָּ֖ו אַפְסֵי־אָ֑רֶץ וְהֵם֙ רִבְב֣וֹת אֶפְרַ֔יִם וְהֵ֖ם אַלְפֵ֥י מְנַשֶּֽׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: b'khvor shvorvo hadar lvo v'kar'ney r'em kar'nayv bahem 'amiym y'nagach yach'dav af'sey-aretz v'hem riv'vvot ef'rayim v'hem al'fey m'nasheh (s)
translation:
Like a firstling bull in his majesty,
He has horns like the horns of the wild-ox;
With them he gores the peoples,
The ends of the earth one and all.
TheseiI.e., the one horn. are the myriads of Ephraim,
ThosejI.e., the other horn. are the thousands of Manasseh.

hebrew: וְלִזְבוּלֻ֣ן אָמַ֔ר שְׂמַ֥ח זְבוּלֻ֖ן בְּצֵאתֶ֑ךָ וְיִשָּׂשכָ֖ר בְּאֹהָלֶֽיךָ׃
transliteration: v'liz'vvlun amar s'mach z'vvlun b'tzetekha v'yisashkhar b'ohaleykha
translation:
And of Zebulun he said:
Rejoice, O Zebulun, on your journeys,
And Issachar, in your tents.

hebrew: עַמִּים֙ הַר־יִקְרָ֔אוּ שָׁ֖ם יִזְבְּח֣וּ זִבְחֵי־צֶ֑דֶק כִּ֣י שֶׁ֤פַע יַמִּים֙ יִינָ֔קוּ וּשְׂפוּנֵ֖י טְמ֥וּנֵי חֽוֹל׃ (ס)
transliteration: 'amiym har-yik'rav sham yiz'b'chv ziv'chey-tzedek kiy shefa' yamiym yiynakv vs'fvney t'mvney chvol (s)
translation:
They invite their kin to the mountain,
Where they offer sacrifices of success.
For they draw from the riches of the sea
And the hidden hoards of the sand.

hebrew: וּלְגָ֣ד אָמַ֔ר בָּר֖וּךְ מַרְחִ֣יב גָּ֑ד כְּלָבִ֣יא שָׁכֵ֔ן וְטָרַ֥ף זְר֖וֹעַ אַף־קָדְקֹֽד׃
transliteration: vl'gad amar barvkh' mar'chiyv gad k'laviy shakhen v'taraf z'rvo'a af-kad'kod
translation:
And of Gad he said:
Blessed be He who enlarges Gad!
Poised is he like a lion
To tear off arm and scalp.

hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא רֵאשִׁית֙ ל֔וֹ כִּי־שָׁ֛ם חֶלְקַ֥ת מְחֹקֵ֖ק סָפ֑וּן וַיֵּתֵא֙ רָ֣אשֵׁי עָ֔ם צִדְקַ֤ת יְהוָה֙ עָשָׂ֔ה וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֖יו עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ (ס)
transliteration: vayar' reshiyt lvo kiy-sham chel'kat m'chokek safvn vayete rashey 'am tzid'kat y'hvah 'asah vmish'patayv 'im-yis'rael (s)
translation:
kMeaning of Heb. uncertain; cf. vv. 3–5 (with note c) above, and saphun “esteemed” in post-biblical Heb.He chose for himself the best,
For there is the portion of the revered chieftain,
Where the heads of the people come.
He executed the LORD’s judgments
And His decisions for Israel.-k

hebrew: וּלְדָ֣ן אָמַ֔ר דָּ֖ן גּ֣וּר אַרְיֵ֑ה יְזַנֵּ֖ק מִן־הַבָּשָֽׁן׃
transliteration: vl'dan amar dan gvr ar'yeh y'zanek min-habashan
translation:
And of Dan he said:
Dan is a lion’s whelp
That leaps forth from Bashan.

hebrew: וּלְנַפְתָּלִ֣י אָמַ֔ר נַפְתָּלִי֙ שְׂבַ֣ע רָצ֔וֹן וּמָלֵ֖א בִּרְכַּ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה יָ֥ם וְדָר֖וֹם יְרָֽשָׁה׃ (ס)
transliteration: vl'naf'taliy amar naf'taliy s'va' ratzvon vmale bir'kat y'hvah yam v'darvom y'rashah (s)
translation:
And of Naphtali he said:
O Naphtali, sated with favor
And full of the LORD’s blessing,
Take possession on the west and south.

hebrew: וּלְאָשֵׁ֣ר אָמַ֔ר בָּר֥וּךְ מִבָּנִ֖ים אָשֵׁ֑ר יְהִ֤י רְצוּי֙ אֶחָ֔יו וְטֹבֵ֥ל בַּשֶּׁ֖מֶן רַגְלֽוֹ׃
transliteration: vl'asher amar barvkh' mibaniym asher y'hiy r'tzvy echayv v'tovel bashemen rag'lvo
translation:
And of Asher he said:
Most blessed of sons be Asher;
May he be the favorite of his brothers,
May he dip his foot in oil.

hebrew: בַּרְזֶ֥ל וּנְחֹ֖שֶׁת מִנְעָלֶ֑יךָ וּכְיָמֶ֖יךָ דָּבְאֶֽךָ׃
transliteration: bar'zel vn'choshet min'aleykha vkh'yameykha dav'ekha
translation:
lMeaning of Heb. uncertain.May your doorbolts be iron and copper,
And your security last all your days.

hebrew: אֵ֥ין כָּאֵ֖ל יְשֻׁר֑וּן רֹכֵ֤ב שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ בְעֶזְרֶ֔ךָ וּבְגַאֲוָת֖וֹ שְׁחָקִֽים׃
transliteration: eyn kael y'shurvn rokhev shamayim v'ez'rekha vv'gaavatvo sh'chakiym
translation:
O Jeshurun, there is none like God,
Riding through the heavens to help you,
Through the skies in His majesty.

hebrew: מְעֹנָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵי קֶ֔דֶם וּמִתַּ֖חַת זְרֹעֹ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם וַיְגָ֧רֶשׁ מִפָּנֶ֛יךָ אוֹיֵ֖ב וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַשְׁמֵֽד׃
transliteration: m'onah elohey kedem vmitachat z'ro'ot 'volam vay'garesh mipaneykha voyev vayomer hash'med
translation:
lMeaning of Heb. uncertain.The ancient God is a refuge,
A support are the arms everlasting.
He drove out the enemy before you
By His command: Destroy!

hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכֹּן֩ יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל בֶּ֤טַח בָּדָד֙ עֵ֣ין יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ דָּגָ֣ן וְתִיר֑וֹשׁ אַף־שָׁמָ֖יו יַֽעַרְפוּ טָֽל׃
transliteration: vayish'kon yis'rael betach badad 'eyn ya'akov el-eretz dagan v'tiyrvosh af-shamayv ya'ar'fv tal
translation:
Thus Israel dwells in safety,
Untroubled is Jacob’s abode,mOthers “fountain.”
In a land of grain and wine,
Under heavens dripping dew.

hebrew: אַשְׁרֶ֨יךָ יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל מִ֣י כָמ֗וֹךָ עַ֚ם נוֹשַׁ֣ע בַּֽיהוָ֔ה מָגֵ֣ן עֶזְרֶ֔ךָ וַאֲשֶׁר־חֶ֖רֶב גַּאֲוָתֶ֑ךָ וְיִכָּֽחֲשׁ֤וּ אֹיְבֶ֙יךָ֙ לָ֔ךְ וְאַתָּ֖ה עַל־בָּמוֹתֵ֥ימוֹ תִדְרֹֽךְ׃ (ס)
transliteration: ash'reykha yis'rael miy khamvokha 'am nvosha' bayhvah magen 'ez'rekha vaasher-cherev gaavatekha v'yikachashv oy'veykha lakh' v'atah 'al-bamvoteymvo tid'rokh' (s)
translation:
O happy Israel! Who is like you,
A people delivered by the LORD,
Your protecting Shield, your Sword triumphant!
Your enemies shall come cringing before you,
And you shall tread on their backs.

hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַל מֹשֶׁ֜ה מֵֽעַרְבֹ֤ת מוֹאָב֙ אֶל־הַ֣ר נְב֔וֹ רֹ֚אשׁ הַפִּסְגָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֣י יְרֵח֑וֹ וַיַּרְאֵ֨הוּ יְהוָ֧ה אֶת־כָּל־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֶת־הַגִּלְעָ֖ד עַד־דָּֽן׃
transliteration: vaya'al mosheh me'ar'vot mvoav el-har n'vvo rosh hapis'gah asher 'al-p'ney y'rechvo vayar'ehv y'hvah et-kal-haaretz et-hagil'ad 'ad-dan
translation: Moses went up from the steppes of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the summit of Pisgah, opposite Jericho, and the L<small>ORD</small> showed him the whole land: Gilead as far as Dan;

hebrew: וְאֵת֙ כָּל־נַפְתָּלִ֔י וְאֶת־אֶ֥רֶץ אֶפְרַ֖יִם וּמְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וְאֵת֙ כָּל־אֶ֣רֶץ יְהוּדָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיָּ֥ם הָאַחֲרֽוֹן׃
transliteration: v'et kal-naf'taliy v'et-eretz ef'rayim vm'nasheh v'et kal-eretz y'hvdah 'ad hayam haacharvon
translation: all Naphtali; the land of Ephraim and Manasseh; the whole land of Judah as far as the WesternaI.e., Mediterranean; cf. note at 11.24. Sea;

hebrew: וְאֶת־הַנֶּ֗גֶב וְֽאֶת־הַכִּכָּ֞ר בִּקְעַ֧ת יְרֵח֛וֹ עִ֥יר הַתְּמָרִ֖ים עַד־צֹֽעַר׃
transliteration: v'et-hanegev v'et-hakikar bik'at y'rechvo 'iyr hat'mariym 'ad-tzo'ar
translation: the Negeb; and the Plain—the Valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees—as far as Zoar.

hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֵלָ֗יו זֹ֤את הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִ֠שְׁבַּעְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֨ם לְיִצְחָ֤ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹב֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְזַרְעֲךָ֖ אֶתְּנֶ֑נָּה הֶרְאִיתִ֣יךָ בְעֵינֶ֔יךָ וְשָׁ֖מָּה לֹ֥א תַעֲבֹֽר׃
transliteration: vayomer y'hvah elayv zot haaretz asher nish'ba'tiy l'av'raham l'yitz'chak vl'ya'akov lemor l'zar'akha et'nenah her'iytiykha v'eyneykha v'shamah lo ta'avor
translation: And the L<small>ORD</small> said to him, “This is the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, ‘I will assign it to your offspring.’ I have let you see it with your own eyes, but you shall not cross there.”

hebrew: וַיָּ֨מָת שָׁ֜ם מֹשֶׁ֧ה עֶֽבֶד־יְהוָ֛ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מוֹאָ֖ב עַל־פִּ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
transliteration: vayamat sham mosheh 'eved-y'hvah b'eretz mvoav 'al-piy y'hvah
translation: So Moses the servant of the L<small>ORD</small> died there, in the land of Moab, at the command of the L<small>ORD</small>.

hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּ֨ר אֹת֤וֹ בַגַּיְ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֔ב מ֖וּל בֵּ֣ית פְּע֑וֹר וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֥ע אִישׁ֙ אֶת־קְבֻ֣רָת֔וֹ עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
transliteration: vayik'bor otvo vagay' b'eretz mvoav mvl beyt p'vor v'lo-yada' iysh et-k'vuratvo 'ad hayvom hazeh
translation: He buried him in the valley in the land of Moab, near Beth-peor; and no one knows his burial place to this day.

hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁ֗ה בֶּן־מֵאָ֧ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה בְּמֹת֑וֹ לֹֽא־כָהֲתָ֥ה עֵינ֖וֹ וְלֹא־נָ֥ס לֵחֹֽה׃
transliteration: vmosheh ben-meah v'es'riym shanah b'motvo lo-khahatah 'eynvo v'lo-nas lechoh
translation: Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died; his eyes were undimmed and his vigor unabated.

hebrew: וַיִּבְכּוּ֩ בְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֛ה בְּעַֽרְבֹ֥ת מוֹאָ֖ב שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים י֑וֹם וַֽיִּתְּמ֔וּ יְמֵ֥י בְכִ֖י אֵ֥בֶל מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: vayiv'kv v'ney yis'rael et-mosheh b'ar'vot mvoav sh'loshiym yvom vayit'mv y'mey v'khiy evel mosheh
translation:
And the Israelites bewailed Moses in the steppes of Moab for thirty days.
The period of wailing and mourning for Moses came to an end.

hebrew: וִֽיהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֗וּן מָלֵא֙ ר֣וּחַ חָכְמָ֔ה כִּֽי־סָמַ֥ךְ מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־יָדָ֖יו עָלָ֑יו וַיִּשְׁמְע֨וּ אֵלָ֤יו בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֔וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
transliteration: viyhvoshu'a bin-nvn male rvcha chakh'mah kiy-samakh' mosheh et-yadayv 'alayv vayish'm'v elayv b'ney-yis'rael vaya'asv kaasher tzivah y'hvah et-mosheh
translation: Now Joshua son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom because Moses had laid his hands upon him; and the Israelites heeded him, doing as the L<small>ORD</small> had commanded Moses.

hebrew: וְלֹֽא־קָ֨ם נָבִ֥יא ע֛וֹד בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כְּמֹשֶׁ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֙ יְדָע֣וֹ יְהוָ֔ה פָּנִ֖ים אֶל־פָּנִֽים׃
transliteration: v'lo-kam naviy 'vod b'yis'rael k'mosheh asher y'da'vo y'hvah paniym el-paniym
translation: Never again did there arise in Israel a prophet like Moses—whom the L<small>ORD</small> singled out, face to face,

hebrew: לְכָל־הָ֨אֹת֜וֹת וְהַמּוֹפְתִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר שְׁלָחוֹ֙ יְהוָ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם לְפַרְעֹ֥ה וּלְכָל־עֲבָדָ֖יו וּלְכָל־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
transliteration: l'khal-haotvot v'hamvof'tiym asher sh'lachvo y'hvah la'asvot b'eretz mitz'rayim l'far'oh vl'khal-'avadayv vl'khal-ar'tzvo
translation: for the various signs and portents that the L<small>ORD</small> sent him to display in the land of Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his courtiers and his whole country,

hebrew: וּלְכֹל֙ הַיָּ֣ד הַחֲזָקָ֔ה וּלְכֹ֖ל הַמּוֹרָ֣א הַגָּד֑וֹל אֲשֶׁר֙ עָשָׂ֣ה מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְעֵינֵ֖י כָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
transliteration: vl'khol hayad hachazakah vl'khol hamvora hagadvol asher 'asah mosheh l'eyney kal-yis'rael
translation: and for all the great might and awesome power that Moses displayed before all Israel.
